s4WXZa5r7mzEt5xve_etFQ.text: Pros: The staff is cordial, clean restaurant, short wait time, and the bartender knows how to make a vodka gimlet - the right way.  Cons: The food. I ordered salmon and it was flavorless and the salmon was tiny tiny on a huge plate for $40. My friend ordered chicken and he said it was dry and again..flavorless.  I'd only come back to get a well made vodka gimlet but not for the food.

56kHf03HU34G-mta8UXp2w.text: Tables are a little worn, server poured water and touched all the glasses with the bottle he should learn how to pour some water. People know you never touch the bottle to the glasses in case someone was sick. Then he poured  the women last and the men first, kind of weird. We placed our lunch order at 1:00 and food arrived at 1:46 I think for the wait time the food was ok. Nachos were just ok nothing fancy. I guarantee if Gordon Ramsey wasn't on the cover no one would be here. I would not come back. $21.00 for a burger that is just ok not worth it.

cBQrMdicaehaIhFUo6nugQ.text: After an exhausting day of travel and business meetings, I ended up here at Caesar's Palace.  Prices are Vegas-esque, with pretty decent food.  I had the Hell's Kitchen burger, which was an above average gastropub style meal served with pretty good fries.  My coworker had the lobster mac and cheese, which while decadent and creamy, wasn't really that much of a standout.  Take it or leave it.  There are better and worse choices in this price range at Caesar's.

nI9Bj4g_ozVDnMCsXlrDIg.text: The service was atrociously slow: waited for 10 min for a dessert. The table stayed littered with food bits after they picked up our plates, until we finally asked to have it cleaned up. The food is underwhelming: over salted soggy calamari, very mediocre Caesar salad...

NqUgzEnvv95yFK0495Hpqw.text: IV been wanting to come here for a while... and finally made it in last night.  I love love love the warm cozy ambiance and feel of the place.  The staffs uniforms from hostess to server to server assistants are all very hip and professional .  Damn wish I could remember our servers name... I can only describe that he reminded me of the character Kevin from the show Shameless.. hahah.... great server and personality!  We had the kettle nachos which were rediculously amaze balls!... both soups(fantastic) burger and fish and chips- hell to the yes on those ... and ended with the mother effing toffee pudding (shut up!!)... I never knew such a breath taking dessert existed, my life is now not the same as before... I dreamt about it again last night in my sleep.  Aaaaaanyway ya... we will be back yumm yumm... peace out

7eNtyhspgyf2Vo4iD_jkJg.text: This was good, had hamburgers and they were great. Good service. On a second visit, I had the signature beef Wellington, which is not always available and it was bad. Did not taste good and was over cooked and touch with no flavor. I am not downgrading the rating for that, get a burger!

n4eEjDp6L-pjkKJIcRHYRQ.text: There are a lot of things to love about Vegas (how could you not love Vegas?!), but one of the biggest reasons is how there's bound to be something for everyone. Gambling, drinking, shopping, shows, good looking girls (and guys I suppose...), eating...the list goes on! So on a Saturday afternoon, with the girls ditching us to spend the afternoon shopping at the Forum, the rest of us decided to have a boys afternoon out with snacks and beer. Sure, it might not be something unique to Vegas, but it is when it's Gordon Ramsay's cooking! Or perhaps, his most recent Hell's Kitchen winner, Ja'nel Witt? (yelp.com/biz_photos/gord...) -- DUCK CONFIT POUTINE - Hand-Cut French Fries, Duck Gravy, and Duck Confit...$13/$12** (yelp.com/biz_photos/gord...) It may not have been the most authentic poutine (no cheese curds), but it was really good. Though the fires could have been crispier, the cheese and duck formed this gooey deliciousness and the gravy added a ton of flavor. -- PUB "SPOTS" - Three Mini House Blend Pub Burgers, Wood-Grilled, Pub Burger Sauce, Welsh Cheddar Cheese 15/14** (yelp.com/biz_photos/gord...) Based strictly on taste, it was pretty solid. The patty had a nice char and the blend of meat was terrific. We forgot to add the smoked applewood bacon, but it wasn't necessary. That said, I wouldn't get this again simply because of price - essentially $5 per half dollar sized slider and the bacon would have been $3.00 more overall. **NOTE: Menu prices are slightly cheaper if you have a Total Rewards player's card. Despite the hefty price tag on the Pub Spots (pricey even for Vegas), I'd certainly come back to try an actual entree and to get another order of the Poutine. And who knows, maybe I'll see Gordon Ramsay there...yelling about something.

JWHgJAoK_XHogeuTpXtoXQ.text: Wow!  Great place.  Great food and great staff!  Make sure you get Heather as your waitress. She really took care of us.  We had a time crunch for a concert; food came out in record time and she made sure we were out on time.

adkPlhZqKlCLhoLh1OstZw.text: I am not a fan of pub food but would return back here. This is not your typical  in menu. Great selection. Management and servers were above and beyond friendly and ensured we enjoyed our experience. The fish and chips servings were enough for 2 people to share. Gorgeous presentation. I would of liked to have the shepherds pie and other dinner options available at lunch. I tried the lamb burger. Flavor was great, lamb was drier than I expected but still delicious. great ambiance. Highly recommend.

7qOkfjpnqJwO65NjIgLGHw.text: Truffle fries were fragrant and delicious.  Also ordered the forest mushrooms- hefty serving.  The hamburger sliders were pretty tasty, though the bun was slightly on the stale side.  Service was friendly.  We enjoyed a delicious and generous portion of sticky toffee pudding for checking in!  The rose cider was delish and refreshing.

6ZImpLivb3AesRptvs_NPg.text: This is the second time our family has been to this restaurant and each and every time they have exceeded our expectations. The service here is exceptional and they treat you like royalty. The food is delicious! The Beef Wellington is melt in your mouth tender and the  prime rib is well seasoned and tender. Best of all, the desserts are to die for! The signature sticky toffee pudding is heaven on earth! You definitely won't be disappointed when you eat at Gordon Ramsay's Pub and Grill!

4UbdTRkgpSaGAdI8Wm0y-g.text: Came here after dinner for drinks and the staff at the bar were very welcoming. It's nice to see all male bartenders behind the bar. And their outfits are cute! Great service! Thanks Ronnie, Evan and Dave!

ttZw5v2Cn9uWK9Hph8-w0A.text: This is my first time to Las Vegas.  I am a HUGE fan of Gordon Ramsey and I have always wanted to try his food.  All I have to say is that, in no way was I disappointed.  I got the scallops with a side of grilled asparagus.  The scallops were buttery and they melted in your mouth.  The sweet corn spread that was on the plate gave them the best compliment.   There was nothing small about the food either.  The asparagus was the same size as full sized thing of mascara.  The scallops were half dollar sized. My fiance got the salmon and it was juicy and the skin was nice and crisp. Our friend got the fish and chips.  He said that they were good.  He gave them a 7 out of 10.  My fiance's dad got the Hell's Kitchen burger and he couldn't point out anything wrong with it.  I have to say, I will be back to Vegas, even if it is just to stop long enough for this food.

Kvkac806tmjO32gBvzPK8g.text: My dad and I went. We ordered the Deviled eggs, fish n'chips, and the lamb burger.  Deviled eggs were great. I've never had yoke filling be so light and delicious. Solid snack starter. The fish n' chips were cooked perfectly!! The fish flakey and tender inside and batter crispy on the outside. The execution was so good it seemed as if they were independently cooked. Only qualm is that it was under seasoned.  The lamb burger was pleasant. You can taste the slight distinctiveness of the lamb without it being overwhelming. The burger was also flawlessly cooked to a MedRare. Although the burger was cooked perfectly, the portion of condiments inside (goat cheese and slaw) could have been been bigger because the burger was also slightly dry due to an over toasted bun. Good food all around with the exception of a couple of misses.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lamb burger
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fish &#39;n chips
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Deviled eggs starter

bMuKZ4UMGVopvA5l4FxqUQ.text: Our family decided to visit one of Gordon Ramsey's restaurants in Las Vegas for Christmas Eve and this one was more on the casual side.  We are local to Las Vegas, so it was fun to visit the strip for dinner.  We had 6:30 reservations but arrived at around 6 and was taken to our table without a wait.  The table and chairs were very comfortable and the big screens located throughout the restaurant provided for a fun, pub-style atmosphere.  Our waiter was very friendly and attentive and made our experience enjoyable.   I had the fish and chips, my wife had the shephard's pie, my son the lamb burger and my daughter the butter curry.  All dishes were very tasty and met our expectations.  I paired by fish and chips with an Innus & Gunn beer which hit the spot.  We all shared a sticky toffee pudding for dessert - also tasty.  The only thing that was a disappointment was the fact that they discontinued the Total Rewards discount and they have nothing in place for locals (as many other restaurants in tourist areas do).  Nonetheless, I was expecting to pay Gordon Ramsey prices, so it was not a shock.  The food was good, service great and overall experience was fantastic.  Definitely a once-in-a-while only type of experience for us given the cost, but worthwhile!

l5Q-spvGCxm-uEmkcvQwjA.text: I have been wanting to dine at a Gordon Ramsay restaurant for years. We wanted to try his steak house but they were booked. So we decided with the Pub and Grill. We were not disappointed at all. Not only was our server Daisy AMAZING, we went with every one of her selections from drinks to appetizers to dinner and dessert.   We had the Maine lobster and shrimp rolls on brioche for an appetizer and holy moly was it delicious. The bread was crispy and the fish was amazing. We had the short ribs and I swear it melted in our mouths!!! We also had the lobster mac and cheese and it was to die for!!! Now for dessert you must get the sticky toffee pudding!! Omgeeeeeee it was so amazing!! Our drinks were amazing,  the service was amazing!!! We loved this restaurant and will definitely be back for more!!! Thank you!!!

vc37iYbX8M6xI0YiQx484Q.text: David from the bar is the man to go to. Nachos are not ordinary and should be tasted! The lobster tacos are bomb as well! Remember to get a drink with your meal

GZ0YcEthJ6OzRHQh6s4D_g.text: We were trying to find a place for dinner but knew Serendipity was our choice for dessert. Since we were at Caesar's Palace, we decided to try Gordon Ramsey's Pub & Grill. I'm obsessed with the food network channel so of course I automatically assume Gordon Ramsey's restaurants will be good.   SERVICE - Our waitress was very nice but incredibly slow. We wanted extra dipping sauce for our wings but by the time she came around, we had about 4 left so it wasn't worth it.   FOOD  Mini Lobster Rolls - These came filled with lobster. So much flavor. The buns were toasty and delicious. They definitely didn't short us on meat.   Wings - Spicy and sweet. My fiance thought they were really spicy but I thought they had the perfect amount of kick. I usually don't like blue cheese but the blue cheese dipping sauce it came with were a perfect match for the wings!   Brussel Sprouts - Nicely caramelized.  Tender with a crunch. Had pieces of meat and apricot throughout as well. Very enjoyable!  Overall, a great meal. We would come back! Main complaint is that the items were pretty pricey.

uD4C93c7ORdH4ZaKywRcRw.text: First off. Food was fantastic. No complaints!  Roger, our server... was another story...  We arrive and are promptly seated with menus.  While my girlfriend and I have been sitting for 10 minutes reviewing the menu, in comes Roger. Speed talking through his introduction, then proceeds to YANK the menu out of my girlfriends hands, flips it over and says "Drink menu is here, I'll be back in 5 minutes when you decide" and hurries off...   Meanwhile we decided on what to eat and drink about 9 minutes earlier.   He comes back after being away for 10 minutes. We both oder our drinks. Then he tries to rush off again. We say, "Wait, we're ready to order our food, also". He looks inconvenienced about this...   Girlfriend orders the braised short ribs. No issues there.  I order the 10oz Prime Flat Iron.   Roger proceeded to chime in: "If you want a steak, stay away from that one. It's poor quality and a bad cut of meat. You should really oder the 14oz Ribeye" -- this is $6 more...   Obviously if I wanted a ribeye I'd order a ribeye....  Anyway, I saw right through his up-sell, and kept my order.  As expected, the steak was fantastic.   When he comes to clear we say no dessert, thanks. He says "you're no fun", in a non-jovial tone, and walks off. We request the bill. Get ignored for a good 10 minutes -- meanwhile the place is barely 1/4 capacity...  I expected more from a Ramsay restaurant. Quality of food (which was A+) and server experience go hand in hand.  Would definitely not return here... I was very disappointed.  We saved up for this meal and booked it weeks in advance and were really looking forward to the experience as a whole. We're Gordon Ramsay fans, and this was our one 'nice' dinner out together. Our expectations were certainly not met.

-aAu_3D47cYGsVXgZU4rhw.text: We stoped in for a late lunch and we had the best service. Our waiter was amazing and Manny the manager came over and chatted with us making us feel like family. The food was amazing and the overall experience was the best. Thanks! We are coming back for sure!

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Menu is awesome looking!

nxxDQ1FrHp7177IxdM_CwA.text: Had a dinner date here with my boyfriend  It was amazing worth the price of everything we got. The short rib nachos are the best!!!!!  The sliders are good too!  My boyfriend had the pork rib and he said it was the best pork rib he has ever had.  I had the chicken was delicious all the flavors are delicious.   We usually don't drink but we had there #1 drink which was Bye Blue Sky and it doesn't disappoint perfect drink for sliders and nachos.  The atmosphere inside so much fun makes you feel like your in a pub.  One of the greatest experience ever!!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States

LvZpGtIFeOf29IbT3wa7zw.text: Took a little longer than we'd like to have our waiter come back so we could ask for a box and dessert. They did come back to check on us once and to be fair we may have just ate fast.   The restaurant is clean and everyone was so friendly. We'd been here two years ago and I was honestly disappointed. I had a burger that was at least $20 and lacked flavor so I sighed when my husband wanted to come try it again today. Luckily there has been some significant changes made because the only sigh today was one of nothing but satisfaction.   I tried the Shepherds Pie and found it came with a tiny salad and a pretzel stick. The plating was beautiful. The pie itself was phenomenal and super filling. As someone that hates to waste money, I'd spend $25 bucks again any day for a pie from here. My husband got the Banger & Mash which I saw on the menu and didn't think it would be something I'd care too much for. I took a spoonful off his plate though and serious self control was needed to not take another (even though he kept picking at my pie). It's fancy enough to make you feel cool and sophisticated but not so fancy that you (me) feel out of place showing up in converse and jeans. We got a free dessert! The sticky toffee pudding which was BLISS and a piece of art with ice cream served in a small chocolate bowl. I highly recommend.

fKrLhzIiIyoUWtFgfCnh2w.text: Amazing food! Did not disappoint one bit. We had the chip nachos, the butter chicken, and the fish and chips. This was our first Ramsay restaurant experience after been fans for a whole, and we were very happy we gave it a try! We will definitely be back!

txxGilWwESDzvrlWFSTM3w.text: Honestly, I was very disappointed. We ordered the fish and chips, and the braised beef stew/pie.  Sighs and chips were just ok. There is a pub in San Diego with better fish & chips.   The braised beef stew was horrible. There were three tiny pieces of beef all smaller than a nickel!  For $30!  It was mostly gravy with a side hard piece if pretzel bread.   The last comment was on the smell of their hallway. It's that musty/moldy mop water smell. Come on, for what we paid for lunch, everything should have been a lot better.   This place is all hype, don't bother.

yEL2uzKTxIyNXofYzmPS8w.text: There's a group of us that saw the golden nights play on 3 /29/19 and we stayed at the MGM PARK is the worst place to still FYI -- any ways we all went  to dinner at Gordon's Pub the next night and all 12 of us all thought the  food was great , kinda cool watching March Madness and having steak house quality food , was it loud in there yes it's a PUB  very good place

D8maE-ap3fZhJI3jCbIgUA.text: We always stop here when we visit Vegas. Sit at the bar, the bartenders are so sweet and take great care of you. The steak and ale pie is fantastic. Thanks Werner for being so rad and taking great care of us

fB9DeZsHjaU8nvBuzy3EIA.text: An unexpected finding in caesars palace. We were initially planning to go to Bacchanal Buffet at first but due to our time limit and the long line we chose to come here instead. The food was actually better than we expected. I ordered the braised short rib as entree and lobster roll which was shared with my friend. The short rib was tender and flavorful, not to mention their mashed potato. The lobster roll is a must try too if you are a seafood lover but don't want too much before enjoying your entree. As for service, our waiter is Rodney and he is very nice. We had a group of 6 and he was very patient with each of us when ordering. He also frequently refilled our water. Definitely worth a try here

ebXWvmz9jqYsTYz61vM-1Q.text: We visit Las Vegas about 3 to 4 times a year and have eaten at The Gordon Ramsey Pub & Grill 3 times over the last year. The selection of this restaurant is mainly based on convenience, as we usually stay at Caesar's. This review is also limited with regard to food, as we normally get a hamburger and a salad. Service has been excellent, as all three times the servers were friendly, pleasant, and very accommodating. The hamburger is cooked as ordered, Caesar salad fine (dressing a little bland) and the French fries are particularly enjoyable. Prices are on the high side (1 burger, 1 caesars salad, 2 coffees - about $50, incl tax) but about what is expected for Caesar's Palace in Las Vegas.

Dd8hg4060oLzEZqVuK9OWw.text: The fish and chips was ok but ended up getting a stomach ache afterward. The side dishes were strange and didn't eat them. My husband got the burger and really enjoyed it. The burger here is definitely better than Gordon's burger place at planet hollywood.

iN7IG_MLJ1XPkm1N35QcrQ.text: Beef Wellington was perfection.  Literally wouldn't change a thing about it.  I had it another Ramsay spot and it was significantly better here.  Ramsay comes in and teaches the chefs how to do it.

_RdZOuXUomdp_MLGZT4XlQ.text: Ordered the burger with cheddar. It was excellent!   Ordered the Summer Slaw. The slaw was good but it came in a small bowl it was a third the size of salad but cost about the same. Really... its just cabbage!   Oh and a little finely shredded carrot. The salads had lots of ingredients.  So get a salad.

tMrbP7O1vDOQ7sm4X6LQdg.text: Came here with friends and family for dinner and I can't not describe with words on how good the food was and especially our waiter Slajan, he was very energetic and made us laugh , he came constantly to make sure we were doing good!! Top of the line service from the waiter l!!   We all ordered Bacon Hamburger and it was 10/10 the meat was cooked to perfection and the fries were awesome!!   I will defiantly be stopping here again when I visit Vegas for the food and for Slajan  Thank you For your great service Slajan

-k6wesRxdv3PYRsaLaMnfw.text: I ordered the shrimp and crab roll and truffle fries.  The bread was very crisp and lobster and crab were fresh.  It was delicious!  We also got free dessert with a yelp checking offer!

WTq9OigHeiwU1yQ-YyBjjA.text: Nong and Christian are dope -- great service, cool hair and delicious food. They were very attentive to our beverage needs and filled us up with some fantastic dessert. We definitely recommend the bar. Truly made our experience an unforgettable one.

jLpRJLR2P2sjBDZ1AZUX9A.text: Came here for dinner around 8pm on a Thursday night, party of 5, and got seated almost immediately. I was super excited to try a Gordon Ramsay restaurant, and my expectations were met by this lovely dinner. You should try this place!  Starters: Crispy Calamari, Maine Lobster & Shrimp Rolls. The calamari was perfectly cooked and such a nice portion, perfect crisp coating, with a great twist with the pickled peppers, highly recommend getting this to start. The main lobster and shrimp rolls were good, but something I could have skipped. The bread roll was really buttery, too buttery and that's coming from someone that loves butter on bread. The filling was tasty, good ratio of filling to bread, just wish it wasn't overly buttered.  Mains: Fish & Chips, Braised Short Rib, Grilled Bacon Burger, Grilled Lamb Burger, Prime Flat Iron. Best Fish & Chips ever! Super crisp thin coating, perfectly cooked and seasoned fish on the inside. The Braised Short Rib was delicious, fell apart beautifully. The Grilled Bacon Burger was alright, better than your average burger but there are better menu options (but the fries were so good). Grilled Lamb Burger I didn't try, but my mom really enjoyed. Prime Flat Iron, such a perfectly seasoned steak, and with the peppercorn brandy sauce it was truly an experience.   Sides: Lobster Mac n Cheese. As if we didn't order enough food, had to try the lobster mac n cheese. It was a massive portion, but unfortunately it didn't have enough salt. Nice creamy texture with generous amounts of lobster, just wish it was seasoned more.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. lobster mac n cheese
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. grilled lamb burger

zQXMJWBy7YozA95PM_IQ4A.text: I ordered the Short rib kettle chip nachos....Bomb! When I had them, they came loaded with 2-3 different types of meat, cheese sauce & cheddar cheese, green onions, tomatoes, sour cream, etc. Best nachos on potato chips I've ever tasted.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States

JetQRTTMG1iQGtQkxDSdCw.text: Great food but the best part was our server Rodney. Super efficient and funny!!!! Made the meal for sure!!!! Gordon give that dude a raise!!!!

44bOpRmxB_9pXneMeIfsHA.text: My wife and I are from Windsor Ontario Canada and were celebrating our 20th anniversary in Vegas on a four day trip. One of our most memorable dining experiences was at the Gordon Ramsey Pub and Grill. We loved the food which was very tasty. I had the beef tenderloin with the brandy dipping sauce and my wife had the beef Wellington. However it was the service that made this dining experience extra special. Our waiter Rodney was the best. Not only did he make some good recommendations but he also suggested the sticky toffee pudding for us to share in celebration of our anniversary trip. If you are ever in Vegas and in Caesars Palace Forum shops, go to the Gordon Ramsey's Pub and Grill for some great food. If you want to make it extra special, ask for Rodney, you will not be disappointed.

sDfB9_45_3DsUxZfT3fx6g.text: Excellent service by Juice and Keith.  Gotta have the Beef Wellington for myself and not share a bite.  Scallops w the corn puree and succotash is another fabulous choice.  I liked my  Goodbye Blue Sky and Ramsey's Mule cocktails.   And these fellas timed dinner just right even though the kitchen forgot one of our orders.  We had to come back for our toffee pudding!  Job welll done!

rpuYEnJv-hMDEp3as3EavA.text: I think this was a bit overrated. Good bar food is how I would describe it. The lobster roll was probably the best part!

FVFiXidlRApNNaetHzypIw.text: Wow Gordon you really need to do a field trip visit to your Pub so disappointed I don't know where to begin.  Firstly hubby  and friends ordered the fish and chips I had the butternut squash soup.  Within in four minutes of ordering our food even before out drinks showed up out comes our food.  So hear we go  you can't call garden peas bashed with a spoon mushy peas anyone who knows anything about British food knows mushy peas have to go through a process to be entitled to that name.  The food tasted reheated which it had to be unless they have the fastest deep fat fryer known to man.  Chips were soggy French fries and I won't even try to describe the tasteless mushy Cod (peas mushy fish not is a good way to go.  Soup was ok just ok but for $13 I was expecting some flavour.  Thought I would mention to the manager how disappointed we were and not Yelp.  He was so not bothered and I was very diplomatic he said he would look into and just walked back to the front desk.  Come on people show you at least care and Gordon if you are going to put your name to something please at least check they are doing your name some favours I am a huge fan but not of this place.  We sat at 8.15 and were out of there by 8.50 these guys make MacDonalds look slow.  Give it a miss folks.

NCg5dMHLo5SjvU2aHzofVQ.text: Can't select zero stars so I give it 1. I'm a huge fan of Gordon Ramsey. I read many of the less than stellar reviews and decided they were likely posted when they first opened and that by now they have the kinks worked out. This was a horrible experience riddled with questionable food and terrible service. When you pay $27 for fish and chips you want it to be the best or very close to it. The batter on the fish was way to heavy and thick. The fries were limp. They'd been sitting in a warmer way too long. They were almost soggy. My daughter could even eat her burger. I thought it was funny they didn't even ask about the burger when 3/4 of it is left our her plate when we finally got our bill. I also didn't get the chilled water and no ice in the glass thing. I asked if we could get ice and they brought me ice, not the rest of the table. Then every time we needed a refill we had to ask for it. Gordon Ramsey, maybe you could sign this place up for Kitchen Nightmares. Then you could go in a fix it.

RJFYi5UTO-LTi2IJUpQLxQ.text: horrible place not worth the money. I just went there this past weekend and had a server named mike who was the rudest server i have ever had in my life and when I bought it to the manager's attention he did not seem to care much DO NOT GO THERE!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

IAZ53uScQeYqUmOWmyXYbg.text: The food was good ....not overly traditional British food and  alcoholic drinks were extremely over priced....we did it. Two out of the 3 Gordon Ramsay's tried....not sure if I would be back

a3ISM4g4P2IAHP2bc6pwvQ.text: A good-sized restaurant, full, busy, lively & noisy.  The shepherd's pie was absolutely delicious.  With the first taste of the mashed potatoes on top, I knew instantly.  Quality of food is outstanding.

p0szpybTTXRi-RHMaBLvLQ.text: My husband and I celebrated my birthday at the Pub and Grill today. We didn't have reservations and did not have to wait for a table ( we arrived about  12pm) . Our water glasses were filled right after we were seated and our waiter came in less than five minutes to show us the drink menu on the I Pad. Joe ( our waiter) suggested a beer for my husband who is not a beer drinker and he made an excellent choice. I had a Salted Caramel apple martini which was delicious. The drinks came promptly. Joe then came back and took our order remembering I was talking about having the fish and chips. The food came sooner than I expected. My husbands mussels and clams were done to perfection! My order of fish and chips was soooo good I ate everything! I even would have enjoyed a bigger portion of the mushy peas. Our table was bussed promptly and Joe asked if we wanted the Sticky toffe pudding for dessert......ummm YES! I even got a candle to blow out!   Overall I would recommend trying this place out. Our waiter was attentive and made great suggestions...I am not a drinker by any means and I am usually too full to finish my dinner let alone have dessert....everything about our lunch was a wonderful experience! Chef would be pleased!

S_Erst_XHDpuyhU8JBsl1A.text: We were passing through Ceasars palace and saw Ramsey's place and decided to try it for lunch.  I give it 4 stars but be advised its based only on what we ate - the burger.  I can't speak for any of the other food.   The burger is really good!  Perfectly seasoned, moist and the smokieness of the smoked apple bacon was perfect.  Fries are amazing too.  Thick, fresh cut, and potatoey.  If you want a good burger, this is the place.  Service is excellent too.  My wife and I shared the burger and the waiter kindly had it split up for us.  He was honest up front and told us it was big enough to share.  Give it a try for lunch if you are there.

Jf7w91SuGP9uOo_SGsLgGA.text: Food is average, service is slow, way overpriced. Waited 20 minutes to be seated, waited another 15 minutes for anyone to come for a drink order. People that were seated after us had already ordered food, before we even spoke to a waiter.  Burger was average, fries were cold. Fish and chips, fish was overcooked and dry. One piece was so salty, couldn't eat. I have had better food at a fast food joint, and paid ALOT less. It's obvious Ramsay cares only about the money he makes. If this restaurant had to rely on repeat business, it would be closed in a year. Only bright spot was sticky toffee desert.

Bcnf-lvu3OCDpkisk6yZWA.text: Great shep pie. Burgers are very juicy. Great atmosphere.

Go5hvcmNtRRUoxa5z0SdYg.text: As a Brit I take issue with their claim to be all things British - this is definitely an Americanised view of what British pub food would be.  American sports playing on the TVs, American decor etc.  That said, the music was certainly British and the food was top notch.  Very good service and good wine suggestions at decent prices, only minor criticism on the service being that we hadn't fished our starter by the time the main came out - they certainly like to move people in and out quickly.  We'd come again but not before we tried out other equivalent experiences.

BHKilZFrrSgn6J_ULmApUQ.text: This place was terrible. We came in for lunch, wanting cheeseburger, and  decided to splurge on Gordon Ramsay. Gotta be good, right? NOT. The fries were so soggy I would venture to call them wet, and cold. and flavorless. The cheeseburger was dry, boring, and also flavorless. We actually did complain (which we never do) and the waiter made some very lame excuses. I wish I could upload a photo here. Go to any other place in Vegas if you are looking for a cheeseburger and fries. and do not spent 60 bucks on this crap.

w6TJQi8H8r-aNq2jPVH9aA.text: This place fills up quick, so if you don't have a reservation either get here early or plan to wait - or both.  It's also very loud once you do get seated, having a conversation is nearly impossible.  Add to that the fact that I was sitting at a small table for two in an arm chair that belongs next to a fireplace putting the table at approximately the height of my armpits, it made for an uncomfortable dining experience logistically speaking.  Once I resigned myself to the fact that I could not fit in a booster seat and who has phone books to sit on anymore,  the food was really quite good.  I ordered the salmon which was cooked to perfection and my husband ordered the burger which was also very good.  The real star, however, was dessert.  We shared the pumpkin bread caramel layered thing (I cannot remember what it was called) and savored every last morsel.  Just don't order the cucumber vodka drink - it's not even worth remembering what it's called.  The Ramsay something-or-other.  That was $15 I'll never get back.

w7so-uwq_MXeKH2V0yMJOg.text: this is review for the lamb burger only. really enjoyed it, not greasy but juicy. cooked to near perfection.

WZskMnItugr7DHZ37NM_RQ.text: Oh, I do adore an authentic British pub and grill! Sadly, it would appear that rather than pay homage to all things British, Gordon Ramsay has chosen for his new pub at Caesars Las Vegas to be decidedly, well, "Vegas." There are some delightful menu items that you would find in a typical pub, however, the decor is a confusing mix of casino tackiness and partially abandoned distillery. Much of the restaurant is open to the casino and the rest is a hodgepodge of randomly selected items any Anglophile would order from Amazon. The only part of the restaurant that harkened toward anything truly 'pub-like" was the bar. Ray-Ray, the bartender on staff, was a hoot and I'd probably go back just to chat with him again. (We left him a tip double the cost of our meal partly because of his compassionate care of an elderly couple we assume must be regulars). Much of the wait staff is also typical Vegas, so you may or may not be concerned about strange bosoms falling out as they deliver your meal. We really only wanted a light nosh and a cocktail, so thought sticking with appetizers and salads was the best way to sample the fare. I must admit that I broke a cardinal rule in straying from "typical" pub fare and ordered the lobster roll, simply because I am desperate to have at least one great one each year. (For any who've read any of my reviews on Tripadvisor, you'll note I made the same mistake at Hilton Head Island in March, 2015.) I should have listened to my husband! He ordered the Wedge Salad and he truly enjoyed the Shropshire bleu cheese paired with the bacon vinaigrette, I ordered a Maine Lobster roll on lemon poppy seed brioche. (I know!) I was so anticipating that first, delightful bite of buttery richness from the roll that looked as if it was lovingly slathered and grilled face down, anticipating it would complement the rich, slightly sweet creaminess of the lobster salad. And then, the music died. As I deconstructed the roll, I noticed that the butter was probably brushed across the top, then the bread was slid through a pizza oven so that only the bare top was toasted. The rest was a fairly dry, barely lemon or poppy seed flavored brioche. Disappointed again. I'd like to say that maybe they were having an off day since it was shortly before Las Vegas' annual Bon Appetite event that was being held at Caesars, but would have to make plans to visit again when we return in June. This time, I'll try the Frog in a hole or the Bangers and Mash. With so many other places to try on the Strip, a restaurant can't just be okay; it has to rock your socks off. We travel to Las Vegas multiple times a year, and consider ourselves to be "foodies," and will normally give a place two bites of the apple so to speak. If we are disappointed again; we won't be back.

2mrvcJPk_Uytwq8GsE1VRw.text: We went there for lunch, figured it would be nice to eat in one of Gordon Ramsay's restaurants, even if it's a cheaper one (well, not really, let's say cheap for Vegas...). So, right off the bat, looking at the menu, I knew there was no way I was going to pay 27$ for fish and chips. Maybe they're really good, but like most things in Vegas I'm sure they're not worth the price. And the same can be said for most of the menu, like 22$ for bangers and mash or for a chicken pot pie. I don't think so.   So we went for less expensive items: Deviled eggs, Mac & cheese and Duck confit poutine. The deviled eggs (2) we're tasty, but not worth the 8$. They were my idea; my girlfriend didn't see anything special about them. She enjoyed her mac & cheese but it was too salty. Now the duck confit poutine, oh boy... First off, my poutine had very little of everything, very little duck, very little cheese, and very little sauce in the little cup on the side. So, it's mostly just 12$ for fries with a bit of toppings on them. The fries themselves? Not even very good, a good fry you can taste the potato still, not these. They didn't even seem homemade.   Mr. Ramsay, if you're going to serve poutine in one of your restaurants, I'd suggest coming here, to Quebec City, and seeing what real poutine is. I can take you to a few dozen places, easily, that serve better poutine, and I'm talking anything from little shacks on the side of the road serving the traditionnal kind, to french bistros with a delicious twist on this classic. In fact, I could take you about an hour and a half outside QC city, to a small roadside restaurant where a culinary trained couple is doing lobster poutine, bison burgers, and more, oh and the best duck confit poutine anywhere. Tons of really good duck, tons of very fresh cheese curds, an amazing sauce and some of the best fries you'll ever eat. And it's definitely less than 12$US. Of course, for us the drive there ends up raising the price of that poutine somewhat, still worth every penny though. Unfortunately I can't say the same about the Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill. I sincerely doubt you can get your money's worth for anything there.

svaQage1kj2EldDJfALMeA.text: We were thrilled to WIN a dinner at a Gordon Ramsay restaurant. We watch his shows and thought dinner would be amazing. The first two items we ordered were "86ed". We said that was too bad since we really wanted to have them and the waiter replied that it was "good" since they were busy that night.  Good for him, bad for us,  but it didn't occur to him to think that way.  My husband ordered rack of lamb, and since the apps we wanted were not available he asked about the portion size and was told it was " three bones". When  the dish came with two, he asked the waiter about it and the waiter said he would check with the kitchen, then came back and told us he was misinformed  and the serving  went by weight. However, he agreed that it looked like a double cut chop, not a rack of lamb for $38. The meat was chewy,had no sauce, & needed seasoning. My  scallops, a dish Ramsay routinely dumps in the trash on his show, were nicely browned but served in a tasteless broth that made them a soggy mess. Although our waiter became more apologetic when the table next to us also complained about their lamb, and brought us a complimentary dessert, it was a really disappointing meal. Like the woman at the table next to us said, " This restaurant is a Kitchen Nightmare and needs fixing."

5hgpdl5jTm8DM8kAXlRsXg.text: I can't review the food because after an hour at our table, ours never arrived. Even after I spoke to the manager and he promised it would be out in 5 minutes, no dinner....and no explanation or apology from our server.   Run, do not walk, away from this rude and loud establishment.  Watching my 85 year old dad storm out in disgust is a memory I will never forget!

RaKoAWHnctOlVAv13Z9LLw.text: We ate the fried oysters, bread sticks with cheese dip, salmon, cornish chicken and chips.  All food arrived as ordered, hot and delicious.  The service was slow and we did not have wine or dessert.  1.5 hours from being seated to check payment.  No biggie, most people are eating at a leisurely pace, but its not a quick meal.

M_F22x9LR_Tcm8FowKL24g.text: I was so excited to finally eat at GR restaurant, 3 are open in Vegas but I wanted something low key, Pub and Grill is just that! The food was amazing we had sliders and something I can't pronounce a steak and fish and chips. I found the fish a little salty but very good, we had the pudding cake and it was incredible. I agree with others that the hostess were full of themselves but the server was more then helpful. I can not wait to eat there again!

nOURgzn1XkpI-XAKiL1Wgw.text: Took one of my clients here for lunch yesterday. What a huge disappointment. Fish N Chips were some of the worst I've ever had. Totally overrated and overpriced. Wait staff was as mediocre as the food (and their outfits are totally ridiculous!) You can get a much better meal and professional service at Cheesecake Factory, Grand Lux Cafe, The Yardhouse, RM Seafood, McMullin's and they all have better Fish N Chips than this place. I won't be going back. So many other places to take people to lunch here and have a really decent meal, better staff, and better atmosphere.

JNLJ79EFJ0lvcwBHwJmw0g.text: Came here late one night right after a show at The Mirage. We had made reservations earlier in the day and were immediately seated upon arrival. Our waiter was very attentive knowledgeable about the menu and made a point to really engage with us during our time there. My father and I both had the Beef Wellington, the special that night. I cannot put in to words how amazing it was, by far the best I have had outside of England. Overall the dining experience here was fantastic and I would highly recommend this restaurant to anyone looking for fantastic "pub-like" food.

Ikvv2gDdVvR4zxY-kY2uUw.text: Best chicken tikka masala saffron rice,Scottish salmon and toffee pudding . The staff was very knowledgeable about the dishes and provided recommendations on dishes on the menu on our request.

PnZCDl1o9m4nA0ZCk_cKSw.text: The food was delicious! I ate the rib eye steak with mashed potatoes and asparagus. Also a bottle of Pinot G. Our waiter was awesome. Very funny and sweet! Made me smile. Forgive me if i spell his name wrong. Sladvyn??? I loved the ambiance of the restaurant.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Delicious rib eye steak
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Delicious calamari
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Good wine

yFoc13Vf6t6DR_i9UAh7pQ.text: Always awesome ! Best food hands down!  Lobster Rolls and Beef Wellington - gotta have it when at Caesars ...

pwVO6YMutn1WSWfp3Rykng.text: Love this place. Great food but the service is what makes this place extra special...especially Rodney. Thanks Rodney for making this a memorable experience and recommending a couple of great dishes.

6HLYmpxPL38t-buukGiQag.text: This was a fantastic meal I had.  I had a 14 ounce ny strip with a side Caesar salad, a Guinness to drink and had the sticky toffee pudding to top it off at the end.  I'm a steak lover and the cut was just right for me.  I highly recommend this one to anyone visiting Vegas.

XFnKLkhl2X6Bfi9xnvZMAQ.text: *UPDATE* After my first review the general manager Joe quickly messaged me to apologize for our bad experience of running out of the beef wellington and invited us back. Since we were back in Vegas to celebrate our wedding anniversary we decided to go back because my kids really still wanted to try the beef wellington. The hostess quickly seated us after checking in. We were greeted by our nice waitress Stacy. The manager Joe came to our table with glasses of champagne. He wished us a happy anniversary and apologized and explained how they made changes so the restaurant can make more beef wellingtons. He even gave my kids limited edition Gordon Ramsay Uncharted National Geographic magazines. He always came by our table to make sure everything was perfect. As expected we absolutely LOVED the Beef Wellington, divers scallops, fish & chips, and the burger.  Everything was cooked perfectly! Joe went above and beyond our expectations by even serving our food to the table and explaining each dish. He even had cool Gordon Ramsay stories to share with us. He even brought us some amazing desserts! The chocolate wellington was to die for!!! My family once again wants to thank Joe & Stacy for the awesome dinner experience that my family will never forget. We can't wait to come back when we're back in Vegas!

B3TiE4DQegyr6ixXIu3rqQ.text: I liked but wanted to love.  My husband had the price fix meal - scallops, beef Wellington, pudding.  I had the burger, my kids mini burgers and Mac and cheese. My daughter loved the Mac and cheese.  The burger was good a little rare for me but it was too crowded to send back.  My husband enjoyed his meal.  The only down part of the meal was the weird piece of something found in the mini burger.  Pretty much ruined the meal for my 12 year old.  The waitress didn't seem to care. Not sure if we would go back.

QOEtCksxgegj3Szm8GzFdg.text: Make sure you reserve a table- at least a few hours ahead if possible. My family of three got in that way without waiting too long but other restaurants we looked into required reservations at least a month in advance. Kid friendly- our eleven year old was the one who pushed to dine here. We were all pretty happy- lamb and pork shanks, fish and chips and chocolate pudding for dessert. Simple and truly delicious. The service was great, our waiter was attentive but not in our face and that takes skill. We plan to be back but we're going to try all the Ramsay spots in Vegas at the request of our son.

4DQl-uHRzlR6uudFEVv1Iw.text: I went here a while back with no reservation on a busy Thursday night and they were able to seat our party of 9 within 15 minutes. After reading mixed reviews of the place my expectations weren't very high. But, I walked away impressed with several of the dishes. Crispy calamari was mixed with pickled peppers and dill, their Hellfire chicken wings had a decent amount of heat but wasn't overpowering, and the kettle chip nachos were a great rendition topped with corned beef, short rib, and covered in an English cheddar cheese sauce.  Entrees didn't disappoint either. The fish in the Yorkshire ale batter fish and chips were tender and flaky with a crispy, light exterior that provided a nice contrast. My favorite dish of the night was the grilled lamb burger. An excellent burger cooked to medium as ordered with bold flavors from the curry onions, goat cheese and feta spread that topped it.

kerMbLAg0nwuZO-tdcyHJg.text: Juice & Cristina were the best with helpig us choose our order super friendly and helpful! Great food too

7bi9dn1td2lVk1WL7L0Skg.text: Eh, I'm pretty disappointed. Huge Gordon Ramsay fan, but the food and service here was sub-par. Service was slow. Fish and chips were greasy. I would've rather spent that $140 elsewhere.

w7Y-w_OZljdFPc38gDrPUw.text: Bartender was very attentive told us if we did a yelp review we get a free dessert thank you Ronnie !!!

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. So good !

j7yUEtqbuBzSMNVYPoxeAw.text: Our server was Rodney and he was amazing!! The food at the pub is wonderful. It's great food with a relaxed vibe. We started with both the scotch egg and deviled eggs. Then, we had the fish and chips and short rib, based on Rodney's suggestion. We finished with the sticky toffee pudding, which is to die for. We will definitely be coming back and hope to have Rodney again! If you come to Vegas, eat here.

q_tni1eB8LvphjLvZf3BMw.text: I ordered the grilled chicken on zucchini bread, it was really really good! I took a chance with this Gordon's menu and was not disappointed. Gordon's is pretty pricey although. But if you're staying in Caesars Palace, it's worth the stop!

lWjLJoiSEDzLkg7N7RAuyg.text: I love writing reviews on places that are everything I want them to be. So here we go, the restaurant is located in Cesar's Palace so if you're coming here come early so you can park and find the place. We both got burgers and truffle fries and it was amazing. Then for dessert we had the sticky toffee pudding and it was the most amazing treat ever. I'd come here again in a heart beat.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States

NP72cwZyY_RmP8kuZcaI_w.text: This is the last Ramsey restaurant in Vegas that we went to and I've enjoyed them all but this one was the cherry on top my whole table got the fish and chips and I got the braised beef. At first I was scared I would regret it but when I took my first bite it was amazing I regret nothing!!! Definitely get the sticky pudding it's to die for!! To top it off our waiter was on top of everything and he was so knowledgeable and helpful!   Adam if your reading this your the best don't ever change they are soooo lucky to have you!!!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States

jhYBO9O6799Qe536dLTBHg.text: This is a pretty decent place to eat if you are at Caesars Palace. I was a little underwhelmed by some of the food this visit though. As an appetizer I ordered the pretzel sticks.  They came out cold and hard which is a shame because they are one of my favorite items.  I did not complain because everything else was great. I am sure if I had, they would have fixed it. The truffle fries were absolutely delicious and the house burger was good.  The sticky toffee pudding was yummy too. The best part of my visit though was the bartenders! They were super friendly, very attentive and fun.  Actually the entire staff that I interacted with was friendly. I watched them deal with a very rude customer  and they handled it like pros! Definitely worth a visit!

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States

BBI0CRQxRHd2hwzL9gXJyg.text: This is probably the worst $100 dinner I've ever had in my life. We went there mainly because of the Gordon Ramsey name (and because Hell's kitchen was booked up) and gosh were we disappointed! I suspect Gordon Ramsey has never tasted anything there, or else he would have taken his name off immediately! The fish and chips we ordered were dry, greasy, and overcooked. The fries were slightly more edible than the fish. And the side of split peas mush? I had to spit it out immediately to avoid extensive retching. The prime rib would have been passable for a $20 dish, but for a $55 dish, I would have expected much more than a meh. All in all, this was the worst dinner we had during our three-day weekend in Vegas. And can Gordon please visit this place? I would like to see the chef's apron taken away.

akUKk73qdl1GYzqbuedXbg.text: We come here every time we are in Las Vegas. The food is amazing and the ambiance is wonderful. Our server, Rodney, was fantastic!   They have great happy hour specials for food and drinks are excellent.  Don't miss it!

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dessert menu
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States

I5bonKKa9ebQt6y2T1paNw.text: Looking forward to eating at a Ramsey restaurant and not at all worth the hype or cost. The draft beer had an inch head which was about a tenth of the volume.  The price was higher than most other places and only got 20oz, less than most places.  Bangers and mash was very good. It was the only item worth the price.  The shaved vegetable salad had 4 shavings of carrot and snow peas and too little arugula.  The truffle  fries were extremely salty, very small portion and the oil was all on a few fries at the bottom. This restaurant did not provide taste or value.

_NBSDgoIFxuF2VDwBkVY2Q.text: First, the beer on tap is amazing.  They tap only half-kegs, thus assuring freshness.  They also chill the lines and clean them every day.  Seriously, the beer taste like no other place.  The food is the perfect pub food, gourmet without being pretentious.

jmSxhR6gH5T-rYaXL2BUiQ.text: Food was good but I was quite surprised when my Gin Martini got delivered and the lemon twist floating in it still had the sticker from the grocery store/orchard...clearly the bartender that peeled the twist and rimmed the glass with it, as well as the server that brought it didn't think twice about the fact that there was blatantly a large sticker that said, "Sunkist" floating in the drink as well

DKiX_cFO8WAJLHMWqEe_0g.text: Overall great experience at Caesars Palace in general but really enjoyed dinner here at the Pub & Grill on August 10, 2013.  Taylor was our waiter and he was knowledgeable and friendly.  We appreciated his recommendation help.  I had the most delicious salmon I've ever had.  Tender, well seasoned and cooked to perfection.  The accompanying vegetables were a bit sparse but everything was delicious. For dessert the sticky pudding was AMAZING.  Perfect.  Nice atmosphere and great people watching.  Hope to return someday!

coQsQHyUK9iTLj4M_KXMjg.text: Let me begin by pointing out we had lunch at GRP&G. A dinner experience is most likely different. The atmosphere definitively rings pub. Kegs are used in lieu of wall separations and the table we were seated at was really "homey" This was my first Ramsey experience so I was anxious to see if his establishments could hold up to the cartoon scrutiny he puts the contestants through on his over wrought Hell's Kitchen show. Are his restaurants held to the same standard? I would have to say GRP&G is up to snuff. The menu is interesting but smallish even for a lunch but it certainly does not lack variety. Chicken pot pie and a beef pot pie are available as well as the expected Shepard's pie. .We saw several burgers being served and they were huge! Nice touch adding beer suggestions with each dish. I did not partake but thought the beer pairing idea was genius. We choose to start with a Scotch Egg that was delightful but the chipotle and mustard sauce took took it to another level, We also tried the shrimp cocktail that was ....a shrimp cocktail...Not bad, just not special. I tried the braised beef rib and it was very good.It was served over a risotto (and no...I heard no screaming coming from the kitchen) that was nice. Desert however went to a new level of decadence. A brownie, topped with cheesecake, topped with Rocky Road ice cream, covered in chocolate and to add to the party a magnificent caramel sauce on the side. No fellow Yelpers, this is not Gordon Ramsey light! Service was ...interesting. Good, fast, ..really spot on with the timing ....but...well..leave it to say our server was ....interesting. I've seen a few trash reviews here complaining about 12 dollar fish and chips? Come on ...it's a celebrity chef venue inside Caesar's Palace! Were you looking for a Denny's? All in all a pretty nice experience and I would try dinner next time. ...If you do get the same sever we got ...and you will know if you do ...Let me know if the word interesting applies!

aBZTANPB5KJB_aeML_mCOw.text: Back in January, when this restaurant had been opened for a few weeks, the service was excellent. Fun vibe and I really could've stayed all night! Just recently headed back and my server was less than stellar. The food and the atmosphere was still wonderful, but the server was superficial and more concerned about the table of bachelors and trying to work her tip that our table lacked the attention we should've received. As Ramsay would say, "Such a shame."

tK9hAS3BwW5ULlT3F2GyyA.text: Maybe I'm giving the poor review because I went to BurGR the night before and had such a great dining experience. Food and service were mediocre. After eating at BurGR I was motivated to try all of Gordon's pubs. Disappointed. Appetizers were good.

zxVd-f9JulIUlqQ_N-JVEQ.text: Well, I have learned a few things from watching Gordon's reality TV shows... When food comes out within 5 minutes, that should be a red flag. Also, serving frozen, not fresh or per cooked food is also a no-no. I paid $ 70 for shepherd's, fish and chips, and one drink. And I hate to say it came out within 5 minutes. The food beat the drink to the table. The drink was delicious and very freshly made. The service was impeccable. My girlfriend's fish had bones in it and it tasted frozen. The fries also tasted frozen. My Shepherd's pie was OK but could of been better. My expectations were very high and I am quite disappointed.

5E98_LCnjldUJAd_HrGpCg.text: I was there around 5 -6 month and we have the fried oyster, Caesar salad, pork chop and his famous Shepherd's Pie and everything was delicious.  If you want to hang out with your friend this is the place to be.  The food was kind of slow because they just open not to long ago, but when it come out it worth the wait.  The waiter was very friendly and keep checking on us if everything is ok.  I will check this place out again in a couple of month when in in Vegas.

1q1fM4Ytji7fcwPiKCF6ew.text: I'm surprised this only has a 3-star average. I thought the food was great. We went for dinner, and they brought us pretzel breadsticks and seeded bread to start. I got the steak with onion marmalade  and he got the chicken. Both were delicious and well done. The fingerling potato side wasn't so good though, and overpriced at $12. The decor is cute but the outfits they make the servers wear is god awful--skintight newspaper print rubber? No one looks good in that, and it certainly isn't appetizing.

rXf_qsO-traRpMB2OgMGWQ.text: Scallops, Fish/Chips,  Irish Onion Soup, Sticky Pudding, bread and drinks...worth every cent.  One of the best meals I've ever had.  Always have been a big fan of GR and especially the F Word...bigger fan now.

bwJ64BXvj6Lt3WVBNnhW7A.text: I was invited for dinner. I watched his show so I was in fact curious to try. when I arrived the one hostess told another to take me there but she was doing her own thing with her bag facing her back toward me and then another guy came so the first hostess asked him to take me to table. He was not really greeting me and I kinda just follow him. Then he seemed lost and didn't know which number is located where. He showed me to a wrong table and asked if I know how they looked. Fortunately for him, I knew I was supposed to meet all Koreans so I could locate my own table. When they brought appetizers, they didn't bring extra spoons or forks so I had to use my personal fork to get food from the plate which was supposed to be shared with others. And then the main dish was not really more than average. Most dishes were too salty. He shouldn't expand fast and big if he can't find right management to control the quality. What a shame. I will never go back. Over priced. Dreadful food. Bad and unprofessional service. Food is too salty or too sweet.

3KghDX0Ab-UVodgVclAofA.text: Stopped here on a Saturday afternoon in early October for a beer and a snack.  We were impressed with the tap beer selection and ordered a Boddington's and Fuller's ESB.  Both were poured well and were great.  The beers were a bit cold for these types of beers.  It was nice to find these on tap in Las Vegas!  We decided to get a snack and ordered the crispy bait (some name like that).  The small fish were perfectly fried and had a crispy, light breading.  We changed from the standard lemon aioli to the curry aioli served with a separate menu item and really enjoyed that with the fish.  Maybe they could make an aioli choice with these standard on the menu.  Bar service was perfect and we appreciated bartender Rains work.  We will definitely stop in again next time we are in Vegas!

U-2JxW5YOg2qBUL9zVukzA.text: We sat in the bar area and the food and service were amazing!  Tom the bartender was great - friendly and made amazing drinks!  The servers were really friendly even though it was really crowded with the playoff football crowd.  The sticky toffee pudding is the best.  A great experience.

vvehMGMoytts4N6GJzMa7A.text: Waited and hour for average food. Or maybe my expectations are a tad bit high for a celebrity chef...

ffVQm5kR0vCDUm0ZMlynpg.text: Were do I start let's start with the service. It could not have been better. We sat at the bar and Adam took care of us. We had a great time with Adam who guided us through an awesome dining experience. If you go to the bar ask for Adam. However there is one problem virtually all the bar tenders are named Adam. But no worries it seems they are all above average. Ok now the important part the food. It having Ramsey's name carries high expectations. I am happy to say they were meet. I need to particularly point out the Shepherd's Pie. This is something I would normally avoid because of my stepfather's failed attempts. His was the worst thing I ever ate. Gordon's was the best thing I have ever had.  I will be back again and again. Finally a famous chief opens a very approachable place and blows away expectations. Good Job!!!

gNq9_2CtUa9qGxagVqqUiA.text: Went in for dinner with friends on September 12 at Gordon Ramsay.  Service was horrible.  Our waiter didn't really give a damn about servicing our group.  No matter what we asked for it didn't come.  We actually got up from the table to get what we wanted from the bar.  Same issue with the food, 5 of 6 entrees came out but the 6th seemed to be MIA.

HL0u5-FV1Gn0dee_KGN1Lw.text: I went to Gordon Ramsay's Pub with a large group on a weekday night.  The restaurant was partially full but it took almost two hours from the time we ordered to when received our food!  The waiter that was in charge of our party of 18 could not keep up and they asked a waiter with a bad attitude to help with the order taking.  The food was good but not great and we had to endure a long wait and poor service!  My last time at this place!

sd1kO2XNFRfvkG0A3v6V6Q.text: Horrible. Greasy, flavorless and overpriced. Captain D's makes better fish than this place. Don't waste your money.

moJykEgAAqJeZ8-prNM80A.text: Overall, this was a very disappointing experience. We were in town for my husband's birthday and wanted to try something fun and unique. Ambience was crowded and noisy, not what we were hoping for but understandable due to location (open walls inside Caesar's palace) and the pub theme. Service was friendly and prompt. We ordered chicken kale and bacon pot pie and the kettle nachos. The nachos were delicious. Thick, crispy potato chips with an English cheddar cheese sauce, braised beef and sweet peppers. They're were surprisingly filling, but there were only peppers and meat on the top, not layered it's the chips. Since we got them during happy hour, the price was reasonable for what we received, but we would have felt robbed if we'd paid full price. The pot pie was under seasoned, and there was no salt or pepper at the table. The waitress came to ask if we wanted any halfway through the meal. The bacon pieces in it were fatty and limp, the crust was soggy, and there were maybe 5 pieces of kale in the whole thing. Portion was small by American standards, which was what I expected and would have been fine except that it didn't come with any sides. Odd for a dinner entree, and really ridiculous for the $24 price. To cap it off, I informed the waitress that we were celebrating my husbands birthday at the start of the meal, and other than a "oh happy birthday!" nothing was done. Maybe it's just the restaurant policy, but really, would it break the bank to bring out a scoop of ice cream or something? Overall the meal and experience were a huge let down.

ROSnKVHPQd1lj0t3plTMGg.text: Ordinary food at extraordinary prices.  Service was pretty slow.  Nothing was particularly bad, but nothing was memorable either, except the bill.  Maybe I am spoiled by NYC's dining scene, but I expect much better food at these prices.  There are far better places in Vegas. I expected much better from a Gordon Ramsey restaurant.  .

27I4TXq98tHPe21GrH9PTQ.text: Had the mini pub burgers which were really tasty and plenty of food. Juice and Christian behind the bar were awesome, great service and food recommendations.

VaKZPX1Qrry4kOXJFSZ3wA.text: Excellent food. Hot and quick but tastes like they slaved over it. Shepherds pie was excellent and I recommend it.

7GaZjClpFUFKyhVe8AKBKA.text: My favorite restaurant in Vegas by far!  My favorites are the Scottish eggs and then the lobster rolls! My mouth waters all the way from Florida waiting to come here for the food! Then the best is the sticky toffee pudding! Absolutely unreal! Then to go along with the best food in Vegas is the amazing atmosphere and the very friendly and great service! When you come to Vegas you have to come here! I have only been in town for 3 hours and I'm here ready to eat!!!!!

Sq4O_jAFeGNUZCsREzwCpg.text: It was a 45 min wait for a table, which I didn't mind... but we got a table at 3:30. Sat down and ordered... It's already 4:10 and we still haven't gotten our food! Waiter says that the tickets are backed up so a few more minutes... Whatever that means. An hour and a half for food... This better be worth it  Edit! OK food wasn't bad. We like the chicken pesto sandwich. Also order the salmon appetizer and a lobster mac & cheese. My daughter love the mac & cheese. The manager actually came out and apologized and offered a discount - which was nice of them. Don't know how much discount. But giving them another two stars. Lol

q1GxGU_yN8_wBNQFxu_ggQ.text: Sorry Gordon, your English Fish and Chips didn't impress. Small portions for the price, paired with regular cut American 'Fries'.  This was our first visit, and it was pleasant, but not up to the level of BURGR. While not really an English pub, it met our needs on the way to The Who concert in the Colosseum .  I was looking forward to the Fish and Chips, even the mushy peas, which arrived in a bite size condiment dish beside the tartare sauce and ketchup.

C3wDCIsGw4e3gXkdMc8IoQ.text: Party of 8, we made reservations and were seated immediately.  Some of the best service I've ever had in a restaurant.  Food was excellent. First Gordon restaurant I've been to, but he seems to practice what he preaches on shows like kitchen nightmares etc.

5dKWvscbGfsCV3ZHlayorA.text: We have always enjoyed the Gordon Ramsay restaurants in Las Vegas. Usually we have gone to Gordon Ramsay Pub for happy hour to enjoy the excellent beer selection (Mike makes a very good Black and Tan) and the happy hour menu (the Pigs in a Blanket and Truffle Fries are fantastic).  On our last visit we decided to have dinner and it didn't disappoint. The meal was absolutely great. The Beef Wellington was classic Ramsay and as good as any we have had at any of his restaurants. The lobster Mac and cheese was perfect, better than we have had anywhere in Las Vegas. But the star of the night was the Seared Diver Scallops.  Absolutely incredible. Not small scallop portions but large perfectly cooked sea scallops with an incredible corn puree. It immediately became one of my wife's favorites of any restaurant in Las Vegas, and an excellent value. The entire staff and management are professional,  and go above and beyond to insure a great experience. Add a great wine selection and first class service from our server Mike, and you have the recipe for a fantastic evening. We will continue to go to the other Gordon Ramsay restaurants in Las Vegas but Gordon Ramsay Pub is now a must for Dinner on each trip.

Peb4X5ZpSf24U2PevMPbYw.text: Great atmosphere! We had the ribeye and it was delicious however ridiculously overpriced. The cocktails were also amazing and strong. Very good service and we didn't wait long for our dinner. Overall the experience was great but the prices even for Vegas seem inflated.

y3MX1yFVq84-aY4lXi7puA.text: The food was excellent.  A bit pricey, but I've seriously never had a better wedge salad.  It's just a basic go to for me when I want a light lunch.  I don't know if it was the dressing that made it, but the blue cheese was top quality too and the bacon was crispy and the fried onions put it over the top.  My son got the hells fire wings.  He is into spicy food and they were so hot he could only handle 4 of them but that's ok because he was loving the heat.  The service was extremely quick - less than 10 minutes after we ordered everything was served.  We will be back. Great quality great taste, but definitely a bit pricy.

mEX7h8lasJAVPWADN-FPAg.text: My friends and I came in for a snack after lunch and we ordered the pretzel sticks, the infamous nachos, the onion rings and the truffle fries! Everything tasted amazing and food came out immediately. Our servers name was Rodney. He had us laughing the entire time and helped us navigate the strip. He kept drinks refilled and he checked up on us repeatedly! Definitely will be coming back!

rcQqsv7OLTDOebDABpZIJA.text: Micheal, was by far the best server I have had in a long time! Appreciate his knowledge of beer, and his recommendation oh the Beef Wellington!

0xnR1B3oHeYn0XvSkkLptw.text: Good for good service! Our server Joe was very pleasant and great! It was very easy to be seated, food was well presented and good. The toffee pudding was AMAZING!!

oIEf-_ue0BkIbEIQ4j1h_w.text: Being Gordan Ramsey the food guru on tv, I would expect way more from his place. Service was good the food was nothing more then going to Apple bees . We ordered the salmon ,steak and Brussels sprouts.  Salmon was fair steak was overcooked asked for medium rare came to be well done. Brussels sprouts were cooked in a steak sauce. Eh. I'm not the best cook but my girlfriend says mine were better. I don't know if she was trying to make  me feel good but I would also would have to agree.  We didn't finish them and we love Brussel sprouts.   Definitely if you're going to order steak go to Ruth's Chris or another place known for their steaks.

Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States

huwoZ7mDUkHiMF9EkE1llA.text: Amazing place to hang out and chill with friends and family while watching sports.  The appetizers, food, and dessert menu are amazing.  Special thanks to our waiter  Sladjan and rest of the staff who made it even more memorable to eat here.

sqH8fi8c6H8_NzM6jmYZMg.text: Just seemed like an overpriced tourist trap. The name gets you in but the food just didn't live up to the price tag. The crispy calamari came burnt and the 2nd round soggy. Just not their best dish... I really only enjoyed the lobster mac & cheese. Didn't stick around for dessert or drinks.

qp8LFo-C5yGbWX-D8_QKbQ.text: I watch people on tv take a bite and say how delicious things are and now I get it. Ordered the Wellington and it was amazing. Service was top notch. Despite the fact that I sat at the edge of a casino it was surprisingly easy to not feel like I was in the middle of one. I would definitely eat here again. Exceeded expectations.

yWcnAgxulfv0tGL4hV437g.text: "Great food."  "Fun atmosphere." "Perfect preparation."  These are all words one would expect to use to describe a $130 meal for their self and a 5 year old girl. My ribeye was both undercooked and over cooked (generally indicative of cheap equipment), it was a terrible and inconsistent cut, my asparagus was not appropriately trimmed (ends were tough), the presentation was off (drippy steak completely covering whipped potatoes and 2 halves of s small carrot and 2 2" pieces of asparagus, the mushrooms were cold. My daughter did enjoy her Sprite.  The server was fine, but nothing special.  I know better than to go to a restaurant with a chefs name on it, but it was the only place that had steak and mushrooms and that's what we wanted.  on the Strip, you get what you settle for--never what you pay for.

hCqkk7kcL_6DrfUewMTdhA.text: Best bar food on our trip!  Lobster roll, short rib nachos and wings were amazing and bartenders Christian and Juice are AWESOME!!

fW_jhB3XvrKlMdLZ3fJkUg.text: Great burger in toasted bun, full of flavor. Tons of fries come with a nice truffle. Also recommend the nachos. They taste fresh and are loaded with cheese and beef. There are other Gordon Ramsey restaurants on the strip but I don't know if they all have equivalent burgers.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Great burger!

j07UQr7h8mFbnubbiBclEQ.text: I wasn't that impressed. We ordered truffle fries and the 3 sliders. The sliders weren't that great, but the fries were. Service can improve especially since it wasn't crazy busy. This place wouldn't be my top

utT-LqoOx1e1LAxV-RtfUw.text: We came here because we were in the casino. I normally go to Halal Guys or Earl's, but today I was with my girlfriend, so you know it's not my choice. But I was not disappointed, the food was superb.  We got the Lobster & Shrimp roll, Hellfire Wings, Crispy Pork Belly, and the Sticky Toffee Pudding. I don't know what else I can say about the food other than I was not disappointed one bit.   What really made the experience better was the service. It is EDC week, but the restaurant was not too busy. We did get seated right away and was attended to almost immediately. Our server Rodney was simply amazing. He checked up on us from time to time, filled our waters, and was very courteous. You know how servers always come when you have food in your mouth? No, this was not the case.

hMeg5kYfN3IeJ4JDN4XDxw.text: I was very underwhelmed with this restaurant.  Food was not that great.  It's average and a bit expensive.  The Calamari was so dry. The Salmon was good but the vegetables side tasted bland. Service was ok.  I found a Yelp check-in for a free Sticky Toffee Pudding and I thought it was the best part of the meal. Toffee taste soo good. From all the 5 other Gordon Ramsey restaurants I've been to this would be the worst and Hell's Kitchen currently the best.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States

SPtOouacFD8IB36k9hMi1g.text: Cristina is a wonderful bartender! Food was really good and delivered quickly. We were pleasantly surprised that they got our food order out so quickly!

ENIr-KVBhQGbbDJoTmzKnA.text: I'm not a fan of Gordon Ramsey, but dang does he hire talented people to run his restaurants. From the beginning to the end of our meal we were treated royally.   We started with a gargantuan 35 ounce mug of Guinness that was fresh from the draft - smooth and complex flavors without being bitter. Guinness in bottles is a pale reflection of the draft version.  The entrees were just flat out excellent - the shepherd's pie was comfort food perfection. The lamb shank was wonderful, slow cooked till tender with peas in a sumptuous sauce. The lamb flavor is smooth and clean without the off putting smell or strong taste that some people associate with lamb.   The dessert was a warm toffee pudding a la mode. I've had toffee pudding in England, Scotland, and Ireland and this was one of the best. Subtle and spicy with a sweet (but not overly sweet) buttery taste. By the way the toffee pudding was free courtesy of checking in, and not toned down or cut in half as many restaurants grudgingly provide check in perks. Service was outstanding our server, Carl, frequently checked and anticipated our needs in a friendly and knowledgeable manner.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Toffee Pudding Incredible!
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lamb Shank an Shepherds Pie
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Gargantuan Guinness!

BWcUNB-Yrq0XxBRD8Nd3bw.text: Wow wow wow! I've eaten at a few of Ramsey's restaurants and this one is my fave by far!  John was our server and was so patient and really knew what to recommend on the menu! He offered great drinks, apps, and our main course! Get the lobster rolls, don't think about it just order them. Also the flat iron steak was cooked to perfection! We also have the fish and chips and the white cheddar Mac, both solid choices as well. We topped it off with dessert and loved it! If you are looking for a Ramsey restaurant come here! The only thing that could have made this better is if Gordon himself was here!

-YcpqZxWyTYitkqgQ8ARUw.text: It's a really cool bar and my family and me enjoyed the atmosphere and the quality of service. We ordered the lamb burger, regular bacon cheese burgers, some pastrami, I think. My nephew and his wife loved the Mac and cheese with lobster. We all truly enjoyed the lobster rolls as they were very tasty.   This place is very trendy and it made for a perfect spot for us to talk the afternoon away. We loved our servers and it was very sweet for him to interact with Mom in Spanish.   So why 3 stars? I've been watching Gordon sell his restaurants on tv and on YouTube for years. I think I expected the burgers to be beyond delicious. I don't eat regularly at fine restaurants, but, I know a $5.00 burger when I eat one. The truffle fries were delicious and worth the visit.   The next time we visit, and we will, I will try some English dishes instead and I know I won't be as critical as I am today. Gordon is a great chef, but, a $20.00 burger should taste superior in my opinion.   When you go, because it's a great place visually, try the lobster rolls. They offer a great selection of beers and Mom loved their take on a very tasty margarita.

F4MnhLrkiGPH2nhi3FDyGw.text: This is the second Gordon Ramsay restaurant that we've been to and I have to say that it was better than the one in NYC that we went to.  Our server, Tim, was very attentive and super friendly.   We started out with the corned beef poutine and it was great. The corned beef was shredded out and was in good supply.   We had the steak and ale pie and braised short rib along with a side of their mac and cheese. The portions were the perfect size. Too bad there was no rom for dessert because the sticky toffee pudding sounded great. It's a little pricey but I expect that in Vegas. We just call it the casino tax. :)

nQEpbFF3DRXHmoFwU2AXUg.text: Reuben was outta this world!  And the fish and chips was phenomenal as well.  A must have when in vegas.  Our server rodney was great!  Will eat here again several times!
