Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States

amo0E1QjPML2aZoaIFruhQ.text: This place was great! Only one small hiccup, but I wont hold that against them.  The restraunt was easy enough to find, you do have to walk through the casino a bit if you come through the front lobby area, but it is close to the forum tower, if you are staying at this hotel.  I had made a reservation on open table, so it was not difficult to get in at the time. My only hiccup- is that I showed up a bit early, and was told rather rudely by the hostess to come back later. Just a tip: a smile goes a long way. Whatever, people have bad days, and I am not going to let hers get to me. All the other hostesses I interacted with after this interaction were find and pleasant.   Once we were seated, we were given our menus and shown the special by our waiter, taylor (I believe). He was fantastic. A+ for him.  We ordered an glass of wine, an appetizer, two mains,  and a side to start. The appetizer was taking quite a bit of time to come out, and shockingly our waiter brought us a half order of wings while we were waiting. Great Service! Also- those wings are magic. I would order those.   Shortly after our appetizer arrived. I had ordered the poutine. It was great. the cheese curds were gooey and stringy, and the meat was fall apart good. I would order this as a main.   For our mains we ordered the short rib and the fish and chips. We also ordered the lobster mac and cheese as a side. All of them were amazing. I was so impressed (minus the mashed peas served with the fish and chips, but that is not the restaurant's fault- I just though they were nasty).  I also ordered the toffee bread pudding to go that you get here for your first yelp check in, and it was MAGICAL. I ate it back in our room and it was so good I didn't even offer any to my other half. :)  I was a little worried coming in here, because the reviews are not all that great, but I thought the experience and decor was great, the food was great, and our waiter was great. Overall, I would come back here, and recommend it!

8eQ98YrUQPQwZqk51N0lzg.text: Food is okay.  Service is great.  Located inside the casino.  Michelada wasn't a michelada.   Brussel sprouts were good but nothing to rave about.   Mac and cheese was plain.  There's better spots to hit up.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mediocre meal on such an amazing day.

ga8EZA7JUIPSRv6CFvNq_g.text: Friendly staff the the food was delicious! Best dessert I've ever had! The braised beef was really delicious and it's really tender! No knife needed to cut the meat. I will definitely come back here again! I highly recommend this place!

onThOKSGm8gwKKv3Z7KdIg.text: Always Always Always wanted to eat at a Gordon Ramasy resturant... One word for over-all experince SPECTACULAR... That's why hes the MAN!!! Our waiter Rodney was amazing, food was quick and the best chicken sandwich I have ever tasted. Juicy and tender. We are going back to Vegas in August to get married and we will are 100% coming back with our guest!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States

c_EuUsYCCAjXOne1atMmyg.text: I hosted a business dinner at your restaurant.  The food was absolutely amazing and the drinks were great as well.  My team and my client were having a great time there and definitely thought the restaurant was a place to go back to the future.   But then it was all ruined because of one thing, the customer service of our waitress.  We had finished eating and were actually waiting for a couple of people to join us for drinks and more desert.  When our waitress, Stacy, came up to us and ask us to move to bar because there was "a private party waiting."  We politely got up and left the restaurant, where there was no line waiting outside.    I had already spent over $300 in your restaurant.  Because we were kicked out we had to go spend the additional $500 at a competitor.  I have never been kicked out of a restaurant for waiting for other people to join us, especially after spending $300.  Let's just say I won't be back to your location or recommend it to anyone.  You have a lot of work to do with customer service there.

X0EyTIOlD8gd8PvED12_dg.text: I am consistently impressed by how amazing Gordon Ramsay's restaurants are. Not just the food, but the amount of attention to detail is mindblowing. No wonder his rise to fame is partly based on yelling at people to get their shit together. It's a gift that must be shared with the less fortunate.  While pricier than other pubs, this is Gordon Ramsay's pub and it's apparently the only one styled in such a blatantly English manner. For a Vegas restaurant, it's on par with a decent dinner place at $20-$30 for entrees. But I doubt you'll find any other restaurant that makes you feel so darn British and serves up such tasty meat pies.  While we missed the glorious $5 truffle fries happy hour special, we came around dinner time and were treated to a short wait and excellent service.  Speaking of the servers, I learned that the uniforms were specially designed by some fashion designer, which is so extra. I love it. You know what else is lovably extra? The corgis and pugs printed on the chairs.   We were seated next to a giant, glaring portrait of Gordon Ramsay. As we ate our food, his face stared down as if to say, "Go on, I dare you to say you don't enjoy my food". But we couldn't. Everything was great. The difference it makes to use lamb meat in the shepherd's pie is amazing. So tender and flavourful. And I don't even particularly like lamb or shepherd's pie. The chicken, bacon, and kale pie was a deliciously complete meal, all encompassed in flaky pie crust.   While the food didn't make me collapse in sheer bliss like Hell's Kitchen, those were still some damn good pies. And they were so filling, I couldn't even eat the cute bread stick that came along on the wooden serving boards. And if all that wasn't interesting enough, the bill came with an iPod attached for feedback. So extra. So English. Truly smashing experience.  (44/100) - 2018

M27a-JHrSESfd4tgin7gcw.text: My favorite item to eat when I come to Vegas is Gordon Ramsay's Shepherd's Pie. It's awesome. The old fashions are great. I highly suggest coming here

FuLPXnTQtRwGLbupfOOTdw.text: Tonight we tried Gordon's Pub and Grill. We have tried all 4 Gordon restaurants in Vegas: Hells Ktichen, Steak, and Burger previously.  This was hands down the best meal we have ever had at any of Gordon Ramsay's Ramsay's restaurants. Shrimp cocktail, solid. Pigs in a blanket, jesus they were good. Then came the Japanese pork chop with chimichurri (with apples), life changing. Mash and mac, always on point but somehow better than previous. Then the chocolate wellington...Holy fuck...To top it all off our server was world class as well as world traveled. He was more than happy to put up with all our questions about recommendations...and the "what the fuck was in this sauce" questions. Epic meal and we will be back!

vF7A1TTey-V_gVPNOW4GTw.text: I booked a reservation to try their special Beef Wellington but unfortunately they were out :( I'm from Texas so this was something I was really looking forward to! Started with their Lobster MAC and Cheese, enough for two people to share, and it was quite delicious. We then decided to stay to try his famous Scallops, the dish looked small but quite filling, done just right! We also ordered Wagyu Fillet, and again don't underestimate the size; it was filled with more flavor than you could imagine. Overall great food and great service!

mtDe7dqja0GpJv25Pgs1Pw.text: Hello Gordon,   We came here yesterday afternoon (our first time), and it was amazing. We are huge fans of yours and watch a LOT of Master Chef.   We got the sticky toffee pudding which we'd only heard/dreamt about, and completely exceeded our expectations. Best cake ever. We also got the Belgian margaritas and the lobster macaroni and cheese (A-MAZ-ING). Rodney was our server and he was really on top of everything. Plus had a great attitude!! Food came out quick.   We ate at Burgr the night before (Monday) as it is our usual go-to spot, fantastic as always.   My boyfriend (recently turned fiance) is turning 35 so this was a great start to his bday week!   If we come back to Vegas to get married by an Elvis impersonator soon ;), we'll def be eating at your restaurants! Top notch.

0NgcZX5YD-UDbXcRF2j88A.text: Price is similar to Hell's Kitchen for Beef Wellington and Sticky Toffee Pudding but the service is much faster here. Can't wait to go back since the food and service was wonderful. Plus they are open late which is perfect for Las Vegas shenanigans;)

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Can you say free sticky toffee pudding? Check in to grab yours.
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beef Wellington done wonderfully. Perfect temperature inside on a great cut of meat.
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Biggest burger with bacon and warm brioche bun.

vHJjxmEtyRVVXq9nN8gXpA.text: I will review this place in the order in which we experienced it:  First we arrived at the establishment to be greeted by the unfriendly hostess who had a nasty little attitude. She asked us what our last name was, in which my fiance replied: "I will just tell you my first name, because my last name is very long, and hard to pronounce." So he told her his first name, and she preceded to still ask for his last name. My fiance repeated his reason for not giving it to her, to which she replied with a roll of the eyes and a "Well, it's a 45 minute wait." I think she misunderstood the favor that we were doing her by not having to go through the trouble of spelling, and pronouncing our last name; which she would have butchered if left to her.   After that, we went to the bar. I am not a fan at sitting at the bar, but the bartenders were very animated and friendly. They served us our drinks and food quickly. The bartenders were also very helpful on helping us make selections. We ordered (I don't remember the exact names) the pub sliders, pretzel sticks, and the fish and chips. Me and my fiance share food a lot, and it is a wise idea to do that here,because the portions are large.   I thought that the food was presented beautifully, and that it tasted good. The pub sliders were juicy and came with a side of garlic mayo, loved it. The pretzel sticks came with a side of spicy mustard (VERY SPICY AND AWESOME), and the fish and chips were tasty and not too greasy.   While we were eating at the bar and enjoying ourselves, we noticed the beauty queen hostesses up front flipping their hair and snapping their gum. We also noticed a ton of empty tables in the establishment. Clearly, doing their job is so exasperating for them. Gosh, they should take a break.   I would come here again, and I would recommend it to a friend. I took off a star because of the rude introduction we got from the hostesses. Ramsay above all people should know that first impressions mean a lot, and that those ladies up front gave us, and from what I'm reading most people, a bad taste in their mouth.

wTL527xnT9obrqjdha0V2Q.text: excellent service and the food is done fast. had the amazing tomato soup which I recommend, which tastes like home-made soup.  we had the steak, medium done, and it was perfect, pink on the inside and just right on the outside. the place aired of a modern UK, loved.the utensils.

Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yummy steak

-WKBj6su6myI6oQmfZyOyg.text: They get a half start for their beer selection.  Ordered the onion soup and it was a flavorless broth with untrusted bread and an enormous flop of cheese that was like bubble gum   The truffle Mac & Chee had overcooked pasta and the small amount of actual truffles were overpowered by the chemical truffle oil.

IM0YdfOQoDPiHpn4GpveIg.text: We were recommended to try this place by a friend and it didn't disappoint! We had the awesome beer cheese dip with the pretzels for an appetizer... omg! To. Die. For. And even though the burger was the most expensive burger I've ever had... it was freaking amazing! So where the fries! The place looms awesome, the staff we helpful and super attentive too. Can't wait to go back and try their fish & chips... and I was told they have great drinks too!

-K0Jt4w2eF-kqvlIngzuIQ.text: I had checked out of the hotel and had a bit of time before I had to head to the airport so I was thinking of grabbing a quick bite for lunch. There is a food court in Caesars that has what you would find at most mall food courts with a higher price. Seeing as I had done pretty well during my stay I decided instead to try something more substantial. SO I selected the Pub and Grill. I was more than pleased with my selection. Being a big fan of a the traditional Reuben Sandwich I jumped at the bartenders recommendation of the Dubliner. yelp.com/biz_photos/gord... They basically chop the well seasoned corned beef into small bite sized cubes and layer them with the sauerkraut and the cheese inside an awesome toasty bread bowl. HOLY CRAP, it was delicious. It was paired with a delicious thousand island dressing and some "Chips" that were out of this world. I will admit that by Vegas Haute Cuisine standards this lunch was fairly pedestrian but it gets a five from me for creativity, taste, preparation, and out standing service. A special shout out to Bartender/ server Ray Ray, Dude your recommendation rocked.

4TVjBkI2Uwafg0vb3B_Qlg.text: Yeesh, like another reviewer has mentioned I am also surprised by the average reviews.   I came here in the off season (early December) for lunch and we were promptly seated at some high tops. Our server was very attentive and the menu offered typical British pub food that I'm familiar with.   I ordered the onion soup which was wonderful, not overly salty or oily and full of flavor. A great soup for the cold weather. My husband had ordered a lamb burger with goat cheese and it was fantastic! Absolutely delicious! My other lunch guest ordered mussels but wasn't pleased with them since they were cooked in a type broth that I couldn't identify but he wasn't familiar with (I liked it). I would definitely return but probably avoid the dinner hour based on the lackluster reviews.

Y8FuyNgz5Utk7alVJ70MuA.text: Recommend this place. Good beef burger and the wife had the pub salad. IPA was in order and the service great. Come check out.

iGQG8HVHlS7eaEaS8dMsiQ.text: Maybe we ordered the right things. Maybe people are too harsh because it's Gordon Ramsey's restaurant so they hold it to an unobtainable level. Who knows??  Our server was very friendly and was able to get everything out in an hour on a Friday night. We let him know we had a show to catch and he put a rush on everything. Was very friendly as well.   Apps we had the mini lobster rolls and the truffle chips. Lobster was very good. Chips were a waste of money. I'm sure my wife got them since a friend of hers got truffle popcorn at Hearthstone last week and they were awesome.   I had read enough reviews to make me nervous of some items so I ordered a burger, my wife ordered the lamb burger and my buddy had salmon. The burger was excellent. My wife said her lamb burger was great. And, every bite was gone from my friends salmon so pretty sure he was happy.   For dessert we had to try it. We ordered the "spotted dick", jokes and all. It was excellent. Described by the waiter as similar to bread pudding but steamed. It came out, and was a warm sugary bread pudding in a liquor cream sauce with ice cream. It was surprisingly good.   All in all a very good meal. Good food, good service. Any complaints on price hasn't eaten on the strip. It was in line with anywhere else on the strip. At $80 a foot in rent and 10-25% of sales to boot going to landlord, what do you expect?

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spotted Dick

WyTdb5KRLFbCUmPOomZ2AA.text: Tried the lamb burger and didn't like it at all, the flavor of the lamb combined with the goat cheese wasn't good. On the other hand loved the tortilla chips.

mPaoNkyQw7ybSS7FsrTx9Q.text: Food was ok, but the service was awful. We asked for lemon with our water on the first and infrequent visit by our server and asked again at water delivery only to wait 10 minutes more. My wife is pregnant and when ordering a lemonade he actually chuckled. Entrees arrived and the server was no where to be found to see if we had what we needed. Turns out my steak wasn't delivered with a steak knife so I asked the guy who I'd seen make 4 rounds and figured was the manager, even though he never actually talked to any of the tables, for a knife since I couldn't seem to find my actual server. 5 minutes later I had what I needed to eat my meal. No doubt that the lack of service starts at the top.   Like I said, food was ok, but way overshadowed by the lack of service. I would figure that a Ramsey restaurant would pride themselves on that front but i figure Gordon is too busy with TV shows and opening a plethora of joints while his stock is worth anything. Great corn soup with crab, smashed fingerlings are awesome, just wish the staff wasn't disaffected like their attire.

Abypcyu0-N-Fbpuqp7PqQA.text: I came here with high expectations, as this is a Gordon Ramsey restaurant and he seems to talk a big game on those shows especially on Hell's Kitchen.   I ordered a soup to start then has the fish and chips, the fish was not bad , but may be I am just used to crispy fries "chips" that I really did not like the soggy taste of the chips. For a main course I decided to get the t-bone lamb, why not right?!  Well I got it done medium, as I remember Gordon Ramsey going off one time on Hell's Kitchen about it being better, for him may be. Medium done must mean something different in The UK then it does here as it was not really eatable in my opinion. The meat was really raw in the centre, I could not eat it!   I really expected so mush more, I thought I would be wowed, I that it was going to be an over the top dinning experience. May be its m fault I came here expecting fire works and I got sparkles at best. The chef my be a celebrity but the food is defiantly not! Gordon Ramsey's restaurant is really not different than any other, I'm going to eat at the Buffet in my hotel tonight - it's really all the same!

uZGyLjsH_0_24wolY41dVg.text: Went there last Thursday for dinner. We didn't make reservations and just happened to pass by and decided to eat there since we are both fans of Gordon Ramsey. We were seated immediately.  I ordered the Caesar salad and the salmon. Salad was nice and fresh. The salmon originally was undercooked and was sent back. The next serving was delicious, just wish it was a bit bigger. The wife ordered the fish and chips. It was excellent. A lot of fish and the chips were good just needed a few more seconds in the grill.  Our waitress was very courteous and apologetic about my dinner dish. We would recommend the restaurant but if your hungry then don't get the salmon you will leave still hungry.

13cBBuARKorWTmKNzRZ9fg.text: We only had to wait 20 minutes to be seated for dinner which I figured wasn't bad for as crowded as the place looked. They send you a text when your table is ready which was better than having to sit around and wait or carry a pager, so we were able to play some slots while we waited.  The atmosphere is a little different, you feel more like you are in someone's house for dinner rather than a restaurant, it's a little odd, but it works. Something I have noticed in Gordon Ramsay's restaurants is that the servers all seem a little, under dressed, but our server was attentive and knew all about the menu.  We tried the pretzel bread that came before the meal and the cheese sauce it came with was great. A nice blend of cheese and spice, it really worked. We ordered the Shepard's pie and the mac and cheese which was not on the dinner menu, but if you ask for it, you can have it. Both dishes were delicious! My husband said it was the best Shepard's pie he ever had and the mac and cheese was amazing! It was creamy and had many levels of flavor, definitely the most complex mac and cheese that I had ever eaten. Also, don't be fooled by what appear to be small portion sizes, they are actually quite filling.  For dessert we had to try the much talked about sticky toffee pudding and it did not disappoint. The cake was warm and soft, paired perfectly with creamy ice cream and caramel. It was enough to share for two people.  The service overall wasn't quick, but it wasn't bad either. The couple behind us were waiting for their food when we got there and still didn't have it when we were done. I don't know what they ordered, but they seemed to be waiting a long time for it. Overall I would definitely come back to try more of the menu, it was a nice experience.

h52yj9aRNpBii8tRMAv2-A.text: We took my daughter here last month and over the nascar weekend. Decided to splurge on the rib eyes because I figured we could not go wrong with watching all his cooking shows, plus it was her birthday weekend. At 45 bucks a piece it was one of the worst rib eyes I have ever had. The outside rim of this thin steak was cooked decent, but the middle was inedible, not only because it was over cooked, but there was so much gristle i ended up spitting most of it out. My daughter got one of the burgers which was good and we discovered the best tasting root beer we have ever had. Very disappointed as we were very pleased with his other place burgr on the strip.

235DyCqz0tVxrXmN3wybeA.text: We enjoyed this restaurant very much and actually ate there twice during our recent visit to Las Vegas. We found the staff to be fantastic and the service was great.  The scallops were fantastic and the fish and chips were good (but nothing to write home about and it was recommended by waiter).    I would recommend this place and the atmosphere is fun, like a neighborhood pub.   We're Gordon Ramsey fans and we're not disappointed.

JSQse6j08Pp7Rr0fwJ_IVA.text: Walked in for lunch on a whim while in Ceasars palace. Ordered a burger and scotch egg. The burger was of high quality but it wasn't anything that great. The scotch egg was just ok. They also have a very nice beer menu. Service was fast and friendly. Nice place to grab lunch and sit watching the people in the casino go by. I would drop in again to try something else sometime. Exact three star place.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cheese burger

cYnv5Vch8wKhydn1_6bPdw.text: Love love loved this restaurant! The food was fantastic and the desserts were out of this world amazing! The manager, Randy, was incredibly welcoming, friendly, helpful and made it our favorite restaurant to visit on the strip!!

FMyyCJaTYKLEVqM867Lmrw.text: In brief, it was very good, but I wasn't wowed by it.  My expectations were set too high because of Gordon Ramsay's name attached to it.    The ambiance, the atmosphere and the decor were absolutely gorgeous.  The service was impeccable, although some of the staff were having a bit too much fun at the bar, which was a bit distracting.  If I was basing my review solely on these factors, I would give it 4 and a half stars.  The food was good, not great, but very good.  I had the English Ale Onion Soup, which I liked, but thought it lacked.  The onions were gorgeous, the cheddar crustinis were good, but the broth didn't have it.  My main was the filet platter.  The steak was nice, the pork belly was a bit boring and the shrimp were not hot enough.  My friends had similar complaints and compliments.  All in all, not a bad choice, just not as good as I would have expected!

p0S0TNvo2pnixICq7Z8A0g.text: I wanted to give these guys a higher rating and if it was based on the server, they'd get 5 stars. The food was nothing better than basic bar food. The fries were cold (fish and chips) and chewy. The salmon was good but lacked the 'umph' to make it great.  The desert ( toffee bread pudding) was the highlight of the meal. For the price I felt I could have done MUCH better.

HBA_YMZb22S9oIr2JTT1VA.text: I was here last night with two friends. Two of us ordered a New York steak one rare one medium well. They mixed up our order he got mine I got his. After 2 bites we realize the mistake so we bring it to the attention of our server. She takes them in the back and reappeared 3 min later with new steaks. That was a little quick. The steak was cold. So we send it back. Now on our third steak I get a rare when I wanted medium well. Sooo back it goes on my fourth steak. My friend on his third. The other person at the table finished eating 20 min ago. Bill comes full price on all plates and drinks. Absolutely terrible service and food! Never eat here!

FgPL2UG0cYk3PWGLDq1WXg.text: This place is so good!  I got the beef Wellington and my friend got the wagyu beef. Both were excellent. Hard to say what was better!  We also got Brussel Sprouts and the sticky toffee pudding. 100% recommended!

1rXu7CT6jrPhzk-N0UU__A.text: Food was incredible. Adam our waiter provided us with impeccable service. Gordon Ramsay's Pub and Grill are very lucky to have him. Would highly recommend to anyone looking for some good comfort food!

1m0ympoTFlxWf73yQX8C2Q.text: TLDR; great staff, avoid the chicken.  Establishment: Clean, well organized and taken care of.  Great layout, stylish and comfortable.  Staff: Excellent! They really were awesome. Super friendly, attentive & prompt. Woo!  Food:  I ordered a chicken sandwich, well, apparently I ordered a quite dry chicken sandwich. My friends got the fish & chips, which was apparently pretty delicious!  My experience foodwise was meh, but others enjoyed. Give it a shot.

xawups-CI_Xcrd0OIJmA8g.text: Delicious food and a great ambiance at this iconic chef's restaurant inside of The Mirage hotel and casino. The seating and decor transport you to a tucked away London bistro. The staff is very friendly and the service is phenomenally fast!  We came in on a Saturday night and were seated within about 5 minutes of arrival. Our server, Stacy, was a doll and did a fantastic job of making us feel right at home. While we loved how amazingly comfortable our seats were, they were a little low to the ground relative to our table, which made dining slightly awkward (but not overly problematic).   For our first course, we chose from their impressive selection of draft beers and appetizers. I went with a pint of the delicious Scottish Ale by Innis and Gunn. It was very tasty with a dark golden color, light body, crisp mouthfeel and subtle whisky/vanilla notes. We also ordered Chef Ramsay's special kettle chip nachos, which were incredible and lasted maybe 5 minutes. The crispy potato chips were generously dressed with a cheesy mornay-like sauce, peppers, green onion and lots of tender beef. Absolutely superb!  For our entrees, we tried the fish n chips and shepherd's pie, both of which were excellent. The cod was fresh and flaky and the batter was perfectly light and crispy, yet firm enough to hold up to the thick cut of fish. My only critique is that it was somewhat lacking salt. The chips were perfect as was the housemade tartar.   The Shepherd's pie was also fabulous, with mounds of fluffy mashed potatoes elegantly piped atop a generous helping of savory lamb stew. It was packed full of flavor!  Finally, for dessert, we used the Yelp check-in coupon and tried the Sticky Toffee Pudding. It was just superb. The flavor profile was so complex with the delicious flavor imparted by the dates really shining through. The salted caramel ice cream that crowned the dish made the flavor even more sophisticated and incredibly addicting!  Overall, this is a great place to stop in for a nice, slightly upscale, yet comfortable dining experience. A must-see for any Gordon Ramsay fan.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lots of great brews on tap!
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sticky Toffee Pudding = SO GOOD! And free with check in!
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chef Ramsay&#39;s watching!

7dXvISODakyIHs_3DzP51Q.text: Came here because Hell's Kitchen was sold out. We've had the beef Wellington and the sticky toffee pudding before and the quality at this pub and grill cannot even compare. The beef Wellington was about a size of a tennis ball and was the same price as Hell's Kitchen. Not to mention the inside looked completely raw and the outside looked well done. We overlooked the entree and looked forward to dessert, but the sticky toffee pudding was soggy. It pretty much just melted with the ice cream. The service is also quite slow. We waited for at least 30-40min for our app and entree and another 20min for the dessert.

p3TQdEDVcyBycba7W-zeKQ.text: Came here Sunday night with a party of 10. It was busy busy..but expected. I had the ribeye steak and bacon burger. The steak was cooked to rare as I requested, nice and red. However, it was too salty for my liking. I ordered my burger medium. It was literally a hit and miss. Half of the patty was medium and half was well done (seemingly split down the middle). The half that was medium was juicy and the half that was well done was dry. We also checked in on yelp and got a free sticky toffee pudding. It was delicious and the best item I tried. It's a big dessert that should be shared with another person. Food wise I would give this place 2.5 stars. However, the reason I'm giving it 4 stars is because of the service. Michelle, our waitress, was so accommodating and very nice. It was  busy last night but each time we stopped her for a question or request, she responded with a big smile and had such a lovely demeanor. Props to Michelle for making the experience at this establishment a better one when the food couldn't.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States

204wge6gdCPPc3HMNXMjxQ.text: My first experience with Gordon Ramsay's cooking was in one of his restaurants in London called the Narrow and was fortunate enough to have tried a really spectaculr Dover sole dish.   As years go by, Gordon Ramsay seemed to have really made a name for himself. His public persona  might appear pretty harsh but one has gotta admit that he is truly one of best chefs in the world and one of the savvyist restauranteurs. His "direct-in-your-face", "tell-it-like-it-is" zero sugarcoating demoneanor  can make some cringe but also makes him a showbiz personality.  Our small party decided to go to GR's Pub & Grill at the the Caesars Palace and we ordered the following:  - Shepherd's pie made with stewed lamb with root vegetables topped with a cheddar mashed potatoes. Very aromatic and herbaceous. This was a good tasting pie. - Pan-roasted airline chicken which is beer brined on a bed of white beans with some kale and carrots. The chicken had a nice, crispy skin and seemed very moist and tender.  - Grilled bacon burger - Burger was juicy and well-received. - Grilled lamb burger - Meeh from the person who had it said that it wasn't anything special. - Pub chopped salad sans chicken - This was ordered by someone who wasn't very hungry. - Truffle chips - Everyone loved these truffle fries. - Hellfire wings - Chile beer glazed and quite flavorful with a kick. - Crispy calamari - okay. - GR's Sticky toffee pudding - THIS IS SOOO GOOD! Absolutely decadent, unctuous and delicious. I was already full but couldn't stop eating this. I would just return for the sticky toffee pudding!  All in all, we had a good meal and a great time! Trying to get a reservation an be easily done through Open Table.  My next stop would be GR's Hell's Kitchen but getting a reservation on short notice is always tricky.

pI6eMeWyOlV_Z_-r__TEdg.text: It was truly an amazing experience with great good and knowledgeable staff. I can't keep raving about this place since I left.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States

l05Ke1zDlA2i-GAAaqy1_g.text: My husband and I were contemplating on a dinner spot, and we were able to locate this place as we were walking around the hotel.   We did not make reservations for dinner on Saturday, so I was worried about the wait. However, I was told it would be a 15 minute wait and was told that I would get a text message once our table was ready. To my surprise, I got notified in exactly 15 minutes and got seated right away.   Our server was awesome. I don't recall her name, but she was so sweet and kind. She made our experience here worthwhile.   My husband and I were starving and were looking forward to our dinner. We were both very pleased with the food.   *Calamari was crispy and flavorful. It came with two sauces. My favorite was the cocktail sauce.   *Lobster roll was amazing!! The bread was so buttery and perfectly toasted. This is the perfect dish to share. It comes in two small pieces, which was the perfect appetizer.   *Chopped salad was fresh and light. I loved the dressing. It did not feel heavy nor unhealthy. It included tons of chicken/salami and other fresh veggies. I'd definitely get this again.   *Buttered Chicken Curry was what my husband got. He's a huge fan of Indian food, and it definitely did not disappoint. There was a good spicy kick to the curry, and it was served with rice and naan.   *Sticky Toffee Pudding was SOOO amazing. It's FREE with a yelp check-in and SO worth the calories. My husband is not a big dessert guy, and he could not stop eating it. The bread was warm and not too sweet. The ice cream was the perfect complement to the bread.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sticky toffee pudding....and it&#39;s one of the best desserts. Free with check in
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Garlic butter chicken
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chopped salad

MkCIGRquS_g5Z1jJW68bCw.text: Excellent service, the lobster shrimp roll and the calamari were tasty starters .  The salmon dish, the fish and chips and the short rib dinners were all excellent. The desserts were the bomb, loved the potted chocolate trifle and the stickey toffee pudding. Drinks were pretty decent too. The music is loud but creates a nice energy.

Cz2XzEyT5jwr_Eb9OD9F2Q.text: This is Steve from Casino Player magazine. I am looking for for contact info for the General Manager my wife and I spoke to during our lunch a few days ago.  He gave me his buisness card but it was lost on way home.  Thanks.

QasZeNLF7lzIkLLJZoIXCQ.text: The Scottish Salmon phooey!  More like farm-raised salmon that had been frozen. Oven baked not pan-seared and they forgot to turn it. My husband came back to the room and was violently sick. My daughter had Beouf Wellington - the dough was raw. Beef undercooked. Outside was over cooked and inside was raw. Vegetables were undercooked. Green beans with salmon and carrots with Wellington were raw. Table next to us had the same problem with Wellington and their rotisserie chicken was dry.   Gordon, you need to pull a  24-Hours show on THIS restaurant.

6uwwCRGHnJdHmkCXRKCoqQ.text: For our last night in Vegas we decided to ditch the crowd & venture out on our own. Me, I wanted to go casual & eat with my hands. I saw this place on the way to & from the Forum Shops so we made a reservation. This place does not look like an English Pub more like a microbrewery with tables & booths scattered about in a couple of rooms. We were seated at an intimate table for two with comfy wing back chairs. Once seated, I felt like an 8 year old as the table was a bit high or was it the chair was a bit low?  Service was very good & the food came out hot & in a timely manner. We started off with the lobster rolls. Toasted mini-loaves of brioche stuffed with lobster. While very good, the lobster was not swimming in mayo I found this a bit on the bland side. I was smart enough not to eat much as I ordered the cheeseburger. The burger was really, really tasty. Super fresh bread, crisp veggies on a slab of premium beef. Cooked medium this baby was a winner. The fries were very crispy & went well with the garlic mayo that was served on the side. The burger is huge so I didn't eat it all, H was kind enough to finish it off for me.  Being Vegas, you will spend a pretty penny here but it's worth it.

J2zTwCa-sI0UOsG2JbYVkw.text: I would like to start off by saying a huge thank you to our server Jon W.  My mom flew in from San Antonio to celebrate her birthday and his service sure made this a memorable visit.  Not only was the food delicious, but he also surprised us with an extra sticky toffee pudding for her bday.  Thank you for your top notch service Jon

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Steak and ale pie
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fish n chips
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sticky toffee pudding

Js0qoDPG_UHpmBxgOFglSw.text: We picked this restaurant because of its owner's name: Gordon Ramsay. We made the reservation at opentable. And we were seated promptly.   The restaurant is nice and a typical English pub setting. Our servers are fast and nice. We orders fish and chips, salad, pork belly and calamari. All were good except the calamari which I think should be a bit crisper. Overall a nice dinner. And the price is very reasonable for a nice sit down dinner.

953tj-pMLQxSbpmUIa1c6w.text: We have been here multiple times over the years.  Service is consistent. Drinks are amazing and the food is good. Deviled eggs, poutine and cocktail god save the queen are my favorite.  Love the atmosphere and convenience to the casino as well.  It's a fun night out

NAss70u4r5q9iBnFR_UMlQ.text: Came here for the Fish and Fries for my husband. He loved it!  He thought the fish was fresh and tasty.  Hellfire Chicken wings were also delish. I had the sliders and asparagus and they were both good.  While checking in we also got an offer for a free dessert!  I think it is a bit expensive, but so are many other things in Vegas. I also love in general food with more flavor, but my husband lived in the UK and this place reminded him of his time there.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Free dessert!
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States

h1d9jiq4oeJzaQHy3-q9Cw.text: This is absolutely one of my top three places to eat in Las Vegas. It's a cool atmosphere that's still fancy but not overly. It's located in the beautiful Caesar's Palace. My favorite dish here is the Lamb Shepherds Pie and I tried the Corned Beef Poutine for the first time and it was amazing! The service is great as well. It isn't a super quiet place, as it is in the casino and a pub, but it's not too loud either. We also really enjoyed the sticky toffee pudding! I would recommend this to anyone looking for a quality place to eat on the strip.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Y3MwMzsO8SNTEvweD3LzvQ.text: We always drop in for an Innis & Gunn on tap. Always consistent on their food and service. Their cheese tray, lobster Mac and nachos are great. If you are stopping by for just a snack try the English sticky pudding. Best dessert ever!!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States

J9C0qqEMICHu9tKtK2V-xw.text: came here for happy hour because we wanted to try a Gordon restaurant while we were in town! It did not disappoint! We got seated right away and ordered within a couple minutes!  We got the nachos (great deal during happy hour) Which were really good and loads of meat. Would definitely get again.   Got a mini slider (my gf said it was a good size for her as she could eat other things!)   Also got a Hell's Kitchen burger and this was GREAT. Has a little kick to it and the beef is tender and juicy. Comes with an option of upgrading to truffle fries with a bunch of sauces you can dip em in.   Another tip if it's your first time be sure to check in and you get a free desert which was so good!

Gg-6X8H1gGobavFUhMUHqQ.text: Fish and chips was great, even the peas!! Lol drinks were spot on.  Order the Spotted dic for dessert!  Servers are very good and friendly.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Jyb_agqb0zy81XzaCx2EMA.text: There is nothing special about this restaurant.  I'd actually give it 1 1/2 stars if I could.    First, the only appetizer they were out of was the pot pie sampler - our server only told us that when I attempted to order it.  Oops - it would have been nice to be told that before getting my heart set on it.    We ordered the chicken pesto sandwich, which came with french fries. and the lobster roll.  The highlight of the meal were the fries, very crispy and served with a ketchup/horseradish condiment.  The sandwich was dry and not very flavorful.  The lobster roll had more roll than I would have hoped for and more mayo than needed.    The service was merely adequate - our server took the order, delivered the order and then brought the check.  Hmmm... as a local, you kinda expect at least a check-in by your server to find out if you need anything else.    I guess Mr. Ramsay figures that tourists will eat at his restaurant because of his fame and then, who cares.

DvCqW-Sq5lxOqDfn2ftJKg.text: Sat at the bar for a quick dinner.  Got really quick and attentive service at the bar.  Butter Chicken Curry was out very quickly and was so very good.  Wasn't pushed to keep re-upping drinks and everyone was very pleasant.   Food was really amazing - tender and greatly flavored chicken.

-7F6VfM0O4YfQVI1a-l3VQ.text: Great experience. We were celebrating a birthday. Our waiter went above and beyond when we told him we were fans if Hells Kitchen we got to meet the head chef. The food was amazing!!!  A must have is the Sticky Pudding dessert!!    Service was slow but we weren't in a hurry. We loved the miss matched decor.   Little pricey but the quality of the is why.

1IniCHq4nfsGf8ZqFM5DIw.text: It's pretty obvious Gordon Ramsey has never been to his own restaurant (or has not for sometime), because if he did--I don't think he'd be very happy.   Eclectically designed in pub fashion, its vibe and energy is right on point to what you'd imagine for a celebrity chef's venue. However, the menu choices and cooking execution is no where near what'd you imagine.   Let's be real: it's a pub. And the menu greatly reflects that. I think I just hoped for a better culinary experience than traditional burgers and fries or a turkey pesto on wheat.   I will say that it was extremely nice that they seated a group of 5 right away without a reservation, considering that's often a rarity on the Strip. But our food took over an hour and a half to come out, and our server seemed really flustered that we asked him to split the bill.   I'll give Ramsey the benefit of the doubt; I'm certain he's an amazing chef. I just wish that he'd put some TLC into his restaurants. That's all.

S15_1b4nYFKY2bG8mF7Kww.text: I gave this 4 stars on the food and service. As with all places in LV I think it is over priced for what you are getting.   We went with 6 people and were seated on time.  Everyone enjoyed their meals. I started with the fried calamari and it was excellent.  For dinner I had the short ribs over risotto. The risotto was a little under cooked for my taste.   All and all it was a good time for a group of people.

-t0imv73_zA7Wi0Z55wuOA.text: Came here for dinner. Had the truffle chips (fries), fish & chips and a Crispin cider. The truffle chips were good before the meal. The fish & chips had a nice crispy outside that stayed crispy even after putting malt vinegar on it (Must be sorcery). The flavor was good but not the best that I've had. The Crispin cider is good for anyone that doesn't drink beer, like me. The food was fine but the thing that was a shame was our server. He wasn't bad, but he wasn't that good either. He was fine, but he seemed a bit robotic. He didn't have much of a personality and would give very short answers. He checked on us and made sure we were ok, so I guess that's what is really important. Don't need to come back on my own, but if my friends want to come back, I wouldn't refuse.

xd1HyCOV9_tQZvWDyWpVeg.text: The manager Manny Ramirez was very helpful and he hooked us with the best service possible. Gordon Ramsey hires the right people. That's for sure.

asfV_ZXBWxd_3EiaGjOj7w.text: Stopped in here for dinner before a show. This place is decorated in English pub style. A wall of beer barrels is kind of a cool look. Now onto the food...... Ordered their wedge style salad and a BLT. The salad was awful and I sent it back. You could tell right away that this salad was pre-made and had been sitting around way past it's sell-by date. Lettuce was wilted and rubbery. Ugh. Told the waitress that it was not acceptable and she took it away. Here comes the manager to apologize and to ensure that it will not happen on my next visit and he would remove it from the bill. Fine. Now onto the BLT. This sandwich had a maple flavored bacon that just overpowered the sandwich. It was not good at all. The only thing I enjoyed was the cold pint of Heineken that I had with my meal.  Here comes the bill and guess what. The salad was still there. I flagged down the waitress who was surprised that it was on it. How about checking it before you hand it to me?  I have seen Kitchen Nightmares where Gordon Ramsay shreds every dish he tastes as awful. Hey Gordon, why don't you check out your namesake restaurant and see what you think of it.  Will not return. Vegas has much better places than this money grab.  Cheers to all

NVKDcjr_JokQZepOYCHlow.text: Having watched a lot of Kitchen Nightmare shows that Gordon Ramsay host, he always talks about standards of the food served at restaurants. My wife and I ordered the Yorkshire Ale Batter Fish and Chips, Chicken Lollipops, and the English Ale Onion Soup. The names were very creative, but unfortunately, the food was not all that great. The fish for the fish and chips were NOT hot and flaky like you'd expect on a fresh battered fish. It came off like frozen fish. The fries were not quite as crunchy as you'd expect. It was slightly soggy and the standards just were not there. Definitely not what you would expect when paying for a $28 fish and chip basket. The onion soup was just another french onion soup in the guise of great marketing. As for the chicken lollipops, they tasted like frozen wings that were not fried crispy and the wing sauce was super salty. I had to drown the wings' saltiness with a good helping of the bleu cheese sauce and the peeled veggies next to it.   The decor was a mixed bag. There was nothing all that special about the decor. They had stacked beer kegs and chairs with his dogs on them. I would've expected a little more wood to make it look a little more authentic pub and modernize the furnishings.  At the end of our dinner service, our tab came out to about $110, and we gave the server a $100 VISA gift card and a $20 bill and explained to him to only charge a $100 and take the rest, The guy clearly understood what I told him, and came back saying he tried charging $100 and then $90 but it declined. LIES! I checked my balance on the card when I got back to my hotel room later, and he had charged $120 the first time, and then $115 just to make me use another form of payment. I gave him my regular credit card, but that was just poor service, and didn't appreciate the lying from the server.  All in all, dinner service from the food to the service was subpar. I was really disappointed going into what I thought would be an enjoyable experience. Even if the experience was not the best, I wouldn't give a star on here, but the subpar food, and the server being dishonest just killed it for me at the end of it all. Look through the rest of the reviews for this place. The reviews speak for themselves as to the disappointment from many diners. I can't in good conscience recommend this place, and I can't believe that Gordon Ramsay would appreciate what's going on at this restaurant with his branding on it.

QqoodD-FtnTZa1V24ONTCQ.text: I found this place to be pretty average. Went in on a Monday afternoon about three o'clock and it was nearly completely full. We squeezed in at the bar and had the lamb burger and a beer. It was all perfectly fine, but there wasn't anything special about it. Plus, I had a far superior lamb burger the next day at Ri-Ra in Mandalay Place. And it came with sweet potato tots!  Gordon Ramsay was packed with conventioneers and as a result, the service was a little slow and it took the food a while to come out. Plus the outfits the servers wear are a little ridiculous. So if you can deal with the crowds, GR's is OK enough. But it sure makes you miss Bradley Ogden, which used to occupy this space.

W07pBphI4qBcoWdPFRZOWA.text: Not what you'd expect from a Ramsey restaurant. Slow service and overpriced very average food.

Z7LQ7Ph1-xrQJWrrm7gePA.text: Our server Christopher Lee did not disappoint, with excellent recommendations from the drinks to the food. A Fantastic location with great cuisine(especially the Salmon!)

_TrsGn9-bizt7el8qdmNVQ.text: Ray Ray literally made my Vegas experience the best trip I've ever had. He makes the best drinks and has the best attitude. He made our whole group feel extremely special! We had a birthday girl with us and he went out of his way to make her experience the best! Ray Ray was funny, thoughtful, and went out of his way to take a picture of our group with Hell's Kitchen finalist And head chef Kristen. Greatest experience ever. Thank you Ray Ray for making this trip unforgettable.

4c1puyM3gA1jjMqlEMMipQ.text: Waited 35 minutes for my order and the food was subpar. To make things worse, getting water was a mission because our waiter was nowhere to be seen. Ordered medium well... my burger was basically rare. At least the fries were good. Wouldnt recommend.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Does this look medium well to you? No? It looks rare to me. Not coming back.

KP8Oisn66-WC_lP6xpOZLQ.text: Though there were some really great things about Gordon Ramsay's Pub and Grill in Caesar's Palace, I left feeling like something was missing.  This is the second Gordon Ramsay restaurant I've been to, the other one was in London and wasn't the best experience.  The atmosphere at this pub was nice... lots of TVs and the room was huge.  We sat in the bar area and had to wait quite awhile for service and our food.  I also found what the waitresses were wearing to be a bit much... but to each their own.  As far as the food goes, I tried the pretzels, pub nachos, sliders, and sticky toffee pudding.  The pretzels were amazing, especially the cheese sauce they were served with.  I only wish this has been a bigger portion.  The nachos were good... loved the kettle chips and sauce, but there were WAY too many jalapenos - jeez does anyone like them that much?  The sliders were standard... way over cooked.  As others have said the sticky toffee pudding is delicious... this is a MUST have at this restaurant.  All in all, I would go back and try some different things.  They do have some happy hour specials, which is nice... especially in Vegas.

zUhomMD08t9-sRLnNPdG5Q.text: I loved the idea of this place, I was stationed in England for a few years and love fish and chips. The three of us were greater by 5-6 hostesses that was a little awkward. All bored and chatting it up. We asked for a place next to the bar TVs however they seated us towards the back of the bar next to one TV. That was mildly frustrating as the place was dead for a labor day weekend at lunch rush. I'm guessing people are intimidated by the prices but we had cash to blow.  When the waitress addressed us she apologized for the wait as it was 10 minutes into being seated, she said she was the only server and someone called in. This was sad Bc there was 5-6 hostesses and a manager in a suit watching this whole ordeal and not doing anything about it. I wanted him to approach us and ask about the experience but he skipped our table.   Long story summed up, the craft cocktail (Mr Tokyo or something) was like a pink lemonade with egg white froth, not good but the waitress didn't explain what it entailed.. My friend loved the blt. Other friend loved the lamb burger. The fish and chips was the biggest let down. $30 bucks for HUGE chunks of cod.. They state how awesome the batter KS but with peices so large you miss out.   Long story short, I'd rather fly to England for $1,000 bucks, take a 40 pound cab ride to Mildenhall Village and eat at the dog track than to recommend anyone eating here.   I'm a Vegas local and I only write reviews if I love or hate a place. The two stars is Bc I like the mushy peas

lEnu55P0ZMoX51rfePf4PA.text: G hooked up my hot & dirty martini custom made! Rodney was a phenomenal waiter!! Awesome place!

woG3cZgR_rysRIUYbjuucw.text: I am confused! Came in without a reservation so waiting was not unexpected, but waiting 2 hours was not in my plans. Reconsidered my decision so i called to try to make a reservation for later in the night but was told that they were accepting only walk ins starting at 10. Showed up at 10:05 and was then told only accepting walk ins after 11 by an uninterested hostess. Told them i spoke to Nina who was right next to her and she said that these were just guideline responses. Nana acknowledged that she had spoken to me but both answers were accurate. Wtf! They said there was no specific wait time but i could wait at the bar. If Chef Ramsey ever walk through here he we would have a field day.  After a while of waiting i went a few doors down to the Palms Restaurant and had a great meal. Gotta go where im wanted!

0r_VF1JVr6uEVWVf1oXOdA.text: this place is such a mood killer...the name is the best thing about this place...bad service...the burger was so ordinary...please go to ur tgif...u will get a better burger in half the price...these big chiefs sell their name...with no control or care about the taste of food or their customers...i guess having a big name...location in caesar palace...will run the place to tourists in vegas...who cares about taste...gord ramsey does not....not recommended...

QIxSCXhuLJexIN3vGTmFjg.text: Beer selection is fantastic for Vegas, especially on draft and they offer flights!   The mini pub burgers are perfect. So much flavor in a tiny package. I can only imagine what the big burgers taste like.  Get their version of nachos. Not spicy but full of flavor. They use kettle chips instead of typical nacho chips and its ingenious.  The pretzels are ok, but the horseradish mustard is sinus clearing magic sauce.   Would definitely go back and try other menu items. Happy hour is from 2-5pm and the apps and beers are cheaper which makes Vegas eating a bit more affordable.

xb12Omje9Kd3WiKq6ExwAQ.text: Visiting Vegas for a pool tournament we had to make the trek over to check out Gordon Ramsey's pub. Being a big fan of Hell's Kitchen and Master Chef we decided to do lunch.  We started with the calamari appetizer. We then ordered three different entrees. One of us got the lamb burger with blue cheese, sauteed onions and fries, another got the fish and chips and I did the beef burger with smoked applewood bacon. Even though we were full we had to try a dessert so we shared the snicker doodle dessert. All of the food was great. The server MJ was very helpful making suggestions. The atmosphere was warm and inviting. It is a must do if you're in Vegas you won't be disappointed.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lamb burger with goat cheese and sautéed onions .... Yum!
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. MJ assisting in a group photo, which he photo bombed :) great guy pleasant and friendly

zbNBVjX28KvvIiGgJ0D-Iw.text: Wedge salad was great. Roasted tomato soup with basil cheese bread was amazing! Fish and chips-wonderful. We will be back. BIG servings enough to share.

jtd0xbbMKrvJLU-UUBltXw.text: I love all the little details that Gordon Ramsay restaurants have. Every piece of furniture and the outfits of the employees make the experience what it is. The food was better than decent and service was great. I know this place only has 3 stars but it's honestly at least 3.5 stars. I would recommend coming here if you're in the area but I wouldn't say this is a place you need to go out of your way for.

YbowScnDGyE9h1yd-R3yEQ.text: Our server Micheal was awesome . We were one of the first tables in there at 11 am , he was patient with my in laws, who were celebrating over 30 years of marriage and a birthday too. He was helpful with suggestions . Food was great , pesto chicken sandwich , truffle fries and fish and chips . Great service and good food. Thank you .

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ramsey&#39;s signature dessert !

HcSuK8Sg6prJZl5C4D4Htw.text: they have the best kettle chips nachos, I've had so far and of course the house special dessert is delicious!!!! our server tonight, Sarah, was very welcoming and bubbly. great customer service!!!! two thumbs up for her!

WDu6ltrWirZUu8tR5JGOgw.text: I'm a huge fan of Gordon Ramsey's shows so I was of course excited to check out his Pub and Grill! I was a little sad to find out Hell's Kitchen winner Janel didn't actually end up being the chef...and maybe that explained why I wasn't super blown away...  I do admit I did a bad job ordering...I went against my gut and ordered an open-faced ham and cheese sandwich...which was really too heavy for my mood at the time. I barely touched it and regretted my order; I was originally torn about ordering one of the three salads they had on the menu and I realize it would have probably been the better decision.  Everyone I was with seemed to have ordered better than I did...I got to try the French Onion Soup which was amazing (really hit the spot) as well as the Shepherd's Pie which was good too (just heavy).   So I guess my conclusion is their menu didn't seem very "light"  so if you're in a light mood it may not give you the best options...but I probably would give the place another try and order better next time!

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States

bopDAvrlUMarP6_khlCpVA.text: We are in Vegas for a week and want to get as much variety as we can. We went to the Pub our second night and had a great time. Signature cocktails were great and I had the Bay Scallops. They were prepared to perfection. There were so many I didn't need a salad or appetizer. The Beef pot pie that my wife had was tender and delicious not mention the richness and savory flavor of the gravy.  We had such a great experience with food and the service that we decided to go back on Wednesday before we went to the Celine Dion concert. The second time was better than the first. Our waiter, Michael, was the epitome of service. Totally engaging but not obtrusive. We did a repeat of the scallops and a grilled Ribeye. Again both were prepared to perfection.  Michael picked out a dessert that was awesome. We highly recommend you go there should you be staying at Cesar's Palace or any place while on the strip, we will be back!

LQGwXisFoj6UYSpBSm5W2w.text: I recommend the salmon with fennel, asparagus, and mushroom, "Nicely seared with the right amount of crisp on the skin and well seasoned!" :-) cocktails here are great I had the Goodbye Blue Sky (I believe it was called that) cocktail....."Two!" Lol. The truffle fries are delicious and "WHATEVER" they give you in  that bread basket is delicious! :-) This restaurant is a "MUST TRY!"

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. An Idea of the bill for three.
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bread and Cheese Dip assortment you get while seated.

rbqIkRUtgNgfzPYk4zHvGA.text: I was there with a large group and we were seated quickly.  I ordered the chicken pesto sandwich, which was pretty tasty, but the chicken was cut into small pieces so the pieces kept falling out of the sandwich.  The bread was very greasy.  The sandwich came with chips, rather than fries, which I wasn't a fan of.  Service was quick, friendly, and good for the quick lunch we wanted.

aIB4nLdaE3nDbxpEf6Yq6g.text: The restaurant was too dark. The waiter was a snob and kept walking away when we were trying to order. Also, my husband and I both had stomach issues after eating here. I would not recommend this place.

2g5VWWptr7b5iUanogLDkQ.text: Amazing service! We had Sara, who is hands-down one of the most attentive and friendly servers I've ever had. The food was pretty decent (a little pricey by Vegas standards imo), although in my opinion the best part of the meal was the sticky toffee pudding we had for dessert!

SBM41FU400UBSvQwklC6DQ.text: This is a super mixed review. Our waitress Sarah was super sweet, she learned our names, had great timing and was probably the most pleasant person I've ever seen. The food wasn't amazing and presentation wasn't good. We had burgers $23 burgers. There wasn't anything super special about the burgers and they served them on a cutting board which made them awkward to eat. The fries were seasoned but there again nothing wow. For the money there are better places to eat. Nothing was gross, it just wasn't a great meal like you would expect. The decor was ok. Gordon really needs to work on the food.

wEzJd5a_pB0IvmG0kOVO1g.text: GordonRamsay we went to your restaurant at Caesars and the food and the service wasnt very good at all. My friend has to reorder her food cuz it wasnt prepared very well. Over priced and bad service. Will not return and will tell friends as well not worth visiting

bOrIaI-SyU_rbeWAoYLccg.text: Don't even think about eating here without a reservation! Although Gordon Ramsay has several restaurants in Las Vegas, they're all super packed as everyone anticipates to dine at the hyped up establishment of Hell's Kitchen's superstar.  Located inside the Caesar's Palace casino, you may be tempted to put some bills into those slot machines while waiting for your table. Thankfully, our wait (with reservation) wasn't too long and we were seated near the kitchen that had a huge painting of Gordon's menacing face.   I'm sure if Gordon was there in person, the employees would have provided better service. Our waiter did not appear too happy about doing separate bills, even though we advised prior to ordering our meals. He said the best he can do is separate our table of 11 into four separate bills, so we gotta partner up with someone..   I have no complaints about the food, but it wasn't so amazing I would go back and try other items. I ordered the pork belly - the serving size looks small but because of how fatty the meat was, the dish was actually very filling. We weren't allowed to substitute the sides - but if I could, I would have gotten the mac and cheese, which according to my coworkers are amazing.   The ambience was a little like a jazz bar, except that it was extremely loud - you'd be shouting all night long. So would I come back? Probably not.   My tummy deserves better than an A-OK when in sin city.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Toffee pudding
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pork belly

4qeAh3iaQsPgcF_neVpA5A.text: Came here on my recent trip to Vegas and although my previous experience with another Gordon Ramsay restaurant in Vegas was superbly disappointing, this place exceed my low expectations. I'm sorry, I can't help it. I have low expectations when it comes to fine dining in Vegas.  However, I was super pleased with the menu here! The food was heavy and featured a lot of different dishes that enticed you to try them all. Also a great place to order a few casual beers.  TO GET: Scotch Eggs Lobster Mac N Cheese  3 stars because the price is ridiculous. Just ridiculous.

Yca-tCa3Nlu2QJZDAcXBzA.text: This place is nothing to rave about. Typical bar food, extremely slow service and ok service. We had a group of five and it took forever for our food to come and it didn't come out all together so some of us were eating while others were still waiting. I had the club sandwich and it was ok, my husband has the fish and chips which was alright, others in our group had the ceasar salad which was horrible and a burger that was good.

ppq9ke_KJ1wH7J1smT29oA.text: This place was just ok. There were four of us and we walked up around 9:30 and were seated within 10 minutes as they were not very busy. At first the service was great, but then after we ordered our food we could not find our server anywhere. We ended up waiting until 10:45ish to get our food and the place closed at 11pm. Our server never showed up again and we were given a new server after being left without one for a good 30-45 minutes. Our new server also was never seen until we asked for the bill. We were never offered refills on our drinks but luckily the bus girl kept refilling our water.  As far as the food goes it was also just OK. If it had come out in a timely matter I probably would have enjoyed it more. We had three burgers (two of the bacon and one hell's kichen) and the fourth person had the sliders and wings. The wings were actually pretty good and the burgers were cooked to our specifications, however our buns were soaked through with grease and everything was luke warm. I would not go back here when I am in Vegas again next year.

wJYz97slfTHxVfESuYReYg.text: My fiance and I are fans of Hells Kitchen. So when we walked past this place and saw a sign for "Hells Kitchen Happy Hour," we had to stop and try it out. We ordered a bunch of awesome happy hour small plates including chicken wings, nachos and a toad-in-the-hole plus two incredible cocktails. The nachos were INSANE: fresh, homemmade potato chips slathered in the most flavorful beer-based cheese sauce I've ever nommed. When I die, I don't want to be embalmed. I just want to be covered in that cheese and put in the ground. Also: in Vegas, you cannot beat the value of this happy hour with a stick.  Shout out to our waiter, Dave. Dave provided the best, most attentive and polite service ever. He had excellent recommendations on food and drink AND he was kind enough to offer some tourist-y suggestions to me and my man. Not only did he stand at our table and tell us about a bunch of cool things to see downtown, but he even grabbed a piece of paper from the bar and wrote down a ton of stuff for us.   Attention, management: Dave is awesome. Give that guy a raise. Or a high five. Or something. Cause he's awesome.

GW9qkZfBMovP29zj1MVaZw.text: My friends and I came by last Wednesday and immediately loved the atmosphere and feel. My friends sipped on delicious Bloody Mary's while I enjoyed a Black Velvet. The tomato soup was delicious as was the fish and chips. We sensed a special vibe throughout the restaurant. Randy, the restaurant manager came by our table to see how we were doing. this surprised us, as one doesn't often get a visit by restaurant management. He told us that he hoped we would enjoy our time here and that they had a "little surprise for us". Well of course we wondered what that could be as we became intrigued.....so we stayed on.   The restaurant had a surprise visitor, none other than Mr. Gordon Ramsay himself!!! He was there for the restaurants 3rd anniversary and surprised all his guests with free dessert. Spotted Dick, Sticky Toffee and Creme Brule shake, all of the above were orgasmic, especially the Spotted Dick.   It was a complete joy meeting this brilliant chef and not to mention a handsome one too! Thank you Mr. Ramsay for the surprise visit. My friends and I were impressed as to how friendly and polite you were with everyone. You were not hurried in the least and took your time with the guests. And by the way, we want to know what cologne were you wearing?? it was divine We look forward to another visit.

ytFvDYfjEn8q_haZ6eUVWg.text: We absolutely loved our meal here. Our waitress was super friendly and attentive and the food was really, really delicious.   We ordered some non-alcoholic drinks to start (I like to call them mocktails). I got the London Breeze and my husband got the Goodbye Blue Sky. We were both really, really happy with our mocktails.   We also ordered the pesto parmesan mac and cheese as an appetizer. It was so good! Just the right amount of cheesy and the flavors were impeccable.   My husband got the chicken fried steak sandwich and I got the pesto chicken sandwich. We were both satisfied with our orders and cleaned off our plates quite quickly.  My favorite part of the meal though was the dessert. We got sticky toffee pudding, which is my favorite dessert, and it did not disappoint in the least bit. It was gooey, moist, and absolutely satisfying.

Hnnpqbx0MUcfkZjq28jGfA.text: Very over priced for the portion sizes. The food was luke-warm and honestly everything about it was a big let down. There are plenty of better options in the area, I would highly recommend going elsewhere.

yXkf6njvaXmJgqi6BzZZTA.text: This is a pretty good place. I've eaten there a couple of times and recommend the Steak and Ale Pie or the Shepherds Pie. Truffle fries are outstanding! I did have a problem with the Yukon Gold Mashed Potato's (dry) but it was handled promptly and professionally without question. Brussel Sprouts are also good. I'd give five stars but I think it could use some improvement. Food could be hotter when it arrives for one. Rodney is a great waiter and I'd ask for him. Very welcoming and takes care of you!

niZWu3WVX1DqUABa9GzXJQ.text: We had a fabulous time at the Pub. I highly recommend this venue. We had the Fish and Chips and ordered the Boddington beer and a flight. Both orders were really delicious.

0sjK0wBty3vss_KJZwVhjw.text: Gordon Ramsay is an interesting sort of celebrity chef on TV. On Hells kitchen he's rude and curse yelling and swearing while people make mistakes. It's not really my favourite show as I don't subscribe to that form of people treatment.   Had a fantastic group dinner on the evening I visited.  Everything here has a fine British pub touch. It's charming, different!  This is the third time I've eaten here. We had ordered some appetizers calamari and the devilled eggs. Both were above average.  For my main course I had selected the Scottish salmon which I had eaten two years ago. It came with a crispy skin and was succulent and served with some potatoes and greens on top. Really it was a very high quality meal. As a side we had some lobster Mac and cheese which was very tasty and brussell sprouts (nicely done). For dessert we ordered the trifle and also the sticky toffee pudding. I had a small serving of each and it was tasty and nice in presentation.   We ate in the private room in the back. Service was very good and of no issue.  My only interesting semi-negative is I had ordered a Sam Adams on tap and it tasted nothing like a Sam. I should have ordered an Innis and Gunn.   I've seen some negative complaints on Yelp. Sure it's expensive, maybe you had bad or rude service.  Many restaurants on the strip and in hotels are pricey. Complain all you want, we enjoyed a great meal with old friends and new!

atFsJkDocIZZXbmzEjyqOg.text: Adorable atmosphere, complete with houndstooth chairs and a fireplace. The lamb burger was delicious and the wedge was really good too!
