UhxI_lt-qkD5_Zs6vOkPiA.text: Fish and chips...I ordered house specialty and thought I was in for a treat.  It was ok but not a treat.  My stone is still a little upset from this place.   The sticky toffee dessert was A+++++.   Like anyplace that has a celebrity name it was over priced.   Very average.

NQUYpvXC0156Naaih0Nv3w.text: Service was great. We had two wonderful servers.  Ordered: 1) Nonalcoholic drink that had blackberry puree, simple syrup, ginger ale and sierra mist that was delicious. 2) Lobster, shrimp rolls were fresh and tasty, great buttery brioche bun 3) Butter chicken with saffron rice and naan. It tasted more like chicken curry than butter chicken, but still good.  4) Fish and chips - nice hot and cripsy chips and the fish was flaky and light. Overall good and I really loved the mushy peas and you can taste the mint. 5) Sticky toffee pudding - must have must have must have. the best part! the warm caramel over the ice cream made the cake taste even better.

0I7fLprn7G7vHByjyNVQ-w.text: Stayed at Caesar's Palace for a 4 day conference. I ate a meal at Gordon Ramsay's Pub & Grill 3x. Everything I ordered was fantastic, and servers/bartenders provided great service and were all very nice. Will definitely be coming back to this restaurant during my next trip to Vegas!

-Hc4-1tOItFh07M4FJyaGw.text: Amazing!! The service and food are great! I had the chicken curry, wedge salad and toffee pudding.

YMkfrzHQZUFsk29tvVqgNA.text: Went in for dinner last night and was greeted warmly by the host Jennifer. We asked for her opinion on getting something quick and tasty. She directed us to the bar and recommended the nachos. She had such a positive and upbeat attitude it really did enhance my experience. Oh and the restaurant WOW is all I can say. Friendly staff and food came out in a timely manner. The kettle chip nachos were amazing as well as the hellfire wings omg I love those wings! Overall an amazing experience! 10/10

9q3KnAOO0wNJj-X1RWAL4g.text: Decent food, service was fast once seated. My only issue was the managing of tables at fort door. We just ate at bar with very friendly staff.

3tnWeyLdJGY6DoXmsqGgPg.text: We've been personally invited back and hope to update our experience and review. Thank you Randy G and Louie.

RyC5C8ju7d3nZFAGtN67xw.text: I think i have just had the best truffle chips ever. I order everything on the Happy Hour food, and its all great! The beef in the nachos is so tender and tasty. The faux-itto is so refreshing, the service was awesome, the server Joe S was friendly, helpful with suggestions and funny!  My experience at this place met my expectations if not more!! Try it!

6XrOKwSSDjtOSw4yOmmHOw.text: Awesome! Great food, great server.! Thanks Nicole!  Make sure you try the Toffee dessert!

ErvKis42ZCdi3OIMUcgC6Q.text: We had a great time. Just popped in with minimal wait time on a Sunday evening. The food was absolutely amazing!!! The lobster Mac and cheese is always a crowd pleaser. Our server, Chris P., was a gem. Overall great experience. Will definitely make time to come back whenever we are in Vegas.

o8lBhbflx791XF_GNH8u5g.text: So my daughter and I came here Two nights ago expecting to have some great dessert.  We decided to share that lobster and crab rolls on the menu under pub bites. These were really amazing! We then ordered dessert... Mum's apple tarts and The sticky toffee pudding. The sticky toffee pudding was amazing! Unfortunately we had that second. The puff pastry on moms apple tart was more like a pancake. Not only that, it was Raw inside! Extremely disappointing. I expected much more from a Chef's restaurant who does kitchen nightmares. This one is definitely a nightmare! Better to just leave that one off the menu all together! Our waitress left a bit to be desired also. We sat for over ten minutes after we were finished while she stood at the waiters station and chatted with, at first, another waitress for over five minutes. Then with a waiter without paying attention to any of their customers. Finally, when someone came to remove our plates did she finally take notice and came to bring our check. I don't mind slow service when it's busy, understandable, but chatting and not paying attention to customers seemed rude and made us feel ignored.

_uqe7OMzRp_v1CmSwiWbmg.text: Seated fast. Good service (Made great recommendations). Water never needed to be asked for refill. Had the Braised Short Rib (so soft it fell off my fork) and my husband had the Shepherds Pie (topping texture was fantastic, mash very creamy). Both very flavorful and filling. Not disappointed at all.

rYg2VY7obeWK_kw-96NR4g.text: Loved it!!!  As a huge Hell's Kitchen/Master Chef fan I was very excited!! So I got the famous shepherds pie, my friends got the lobster roll and bacon burger, and we got the sticky toffee pudding!  FOOD WAS SO GOOD! We loved the ambiance the waiter, (daisy, YOURE AMAZING)  Also the toffee pudding was the most INCREDIBLE cake I've ever had

_aF-shQUug66-bJDzA6e4g.text: Went last Thursday afternoon around 4:00. Party of 4. Enjoyed deviled eggs, sliders, nachos & lobster roll. Bread pudding was incredible! Excellent service & very tasty food!

fSwaCId6mPC3Jt8kDO9RgA.text: Great food and Great Service.  Rodney was our waiter and he walked us through their wine list and explained what their signature dishes were.  His recommendations were perfect.  Fish and Chips were great and the Lobster Mac n cheese was incredible.  when it came for the desert....Rodney again explained all of our options with great detail and we went with the Sticky Toffee Pudding.  Simply amazing food and service.  Will eat there every time I return to Las Vegas.

0Bq4OG84sJJUnkekbDRbQA.text: Solid choice for snacks and a beer. I highly recommend the Nachos as well as the Grilled Cheese and Tomato soup combo.

dtRCM_f9CYvQnZsWnr771w.text: Very matter of fact service, and pretty slow at that.  Bartender made the wrong drink, and they did not offer to replace it.  Drinks were strange tasting in general.  Ridiculously expensive, even for the strip.  Pot pie was just okay, but very small.  I ended up feeling sick for 4 hours  after eating this food. I would love to swear at Gordon Ramsey about his meal and restaurant, kind of like he loves to do to other people.

7erFQqTFy0vtWD3_MCVkNg.text: Grilled beef burger was honesty the best damn burger I have ever had. Can't even describe it!

DhlXOdmw48Im6MkV0uiAJw.text: Just had dinner here with 5 others and each meal was nothing but disgusting. The burgers were under cooked and so greasy. The steak was hard as a hockey puck...when asked for medium well. Worst steak ever. The lollipop chicken wings were so rubbery and not lollipops in any way shape or form. The only positive is that the water was outstanding. And the fries weren't too bad. The whole experience was just extremely disappointing. Has Gordon Ramsey ever stepped foot in this place?!

S_iOPuHnk8oShL-_Z10mSg.text: I hate to give this two stars.  I went in really wanting to like it, but between the slow service and the food I just cant give it anymore.  I like Gordon's shows,  I like shepherds pie, but Gordon' shephard's pie  was far too rich.  The potatoes were  thick and sticky, filled with butter to the point where it was overwhelming.  The sticky gooey potatoes were like wall pasty  gluttonous mess. The stew portion was very rich very condensed, but fine enough.  As a meal it failed, there was nothing to offset the sticky congealing potatoes and stew.  I felt like I was eating a stick of butter seasoned with potatoes.  In short in an effort to make a stand out shephards pie, Gordon and his crew have grossly over done it.  Gordon, go back to the UK tour some pubs and try some pie,  there are plenty them serving much better fare.  Sure some nasty pubs serve your idea  of shephards pie, but many serve pies that don't leave you feeling like you just ate a pound of butter.

7iojZJoLoVTyvLQ1e4TnUQ.text: First off, the husband and I are Vegas locals, so we have come to expect a certain "service level" when we head out on the town for a show or even dinner.  This Saturday night we decided to try the new Ramsay place, being we are both long time fans, and we were dying for some good ol pub food.  First off, when we approached the place, they said it was a 25 minute wait (which for Saturday night at Caesar's, not much of an issue)-although there WERE so many hostesses up front it didn't really give off the idea that they were too busy, even though some tables were full.  We walked around waiting for our table, and once we were notified we were ready, we returned to the front.  The gaggle of hostesses tried to take our names again, then finally realized we'd already waited our turn.  One stepped forward to walk us to our table, and as we asked twice to be sat a lower table in front, she continued to ignore us and tried to put us at some high up table in the back.  We asked AGAIN to sit at a different table, and the response was a little "hee hee, I didn't even see that one!!" (She walked right by it!) Finally, we sit.  And sit.  Annnnnnnd sit.  After a good 20 minutes someone came by with water in a bottle, explained they were our server's "assistant" and the server would be "right back" to take our order.  Yeah...Ok....I guess not!  We continued to sit by ourselves and drink our plain water, with STILL no sign of our server-FINALLY FINALLY a manager saw us sitting there with nothing, and asked if we'd been helped, or if there was anything he could bring us.  We were, of course, about two items short of memorizing the ENTIRE menu at this point (quiz me, I dare you!), so we placed our drink AND food order with the manager.  He wisked off, all apologies, and was back in a flash with our drinks, which he thoughtfully comped for us (which was nice, they were $15 each!).  STILL don't know who our server is, and very shortly we had someone ELSE (a THIRD different person, mind you) deliver our food, which once it was ordered came out QUICKLY. (Which makes it even MORE aggravating!) The two pies we ordered were tasty, I got the Steak N' Ale Pie, and my husband had the Shepard's Pie; however we were BOTH left wanting some veggies in the pies with the huge amount of meats (totally backwards, I know, but that WAS the case!)  The price point for the pies was a little steep, at $24 each.  At this point, we'd been there about an hour, and FINALLY we meet our server-he came over (WITH NO SIGN OF AN APOLOGY or ANYTHING), never introduced himself, and asked if we wanted desert.  We decided to order the Brownie Cheesecake-which don't be fooled, it's NOT a Brownie Cheesecake, it's a piece of Brownie, a piece of Cheesecake and some ice cream-was tasty, BUT BUT....JUST WAIT-- Since we'd been at this experience for a VERY long time, we wanted a smoke-we waited to see our waiter again, and told him we would be RIGHT BACK and we were NOT FINISHED....went out in front of the restaurant, and proceeded to endure SEVERAL dirty looks from the server while we each had only 1/2 a cigarette.  We decided we better go back in, and the server had COMPLETELY cleaned off our table; desert, forks, spoons, MY drink (which was still pretty full, it didn't taste very good)...even the crumbs from our pies were washed away.  Needless to say, MOST ESPECIALLY due to the price point, this has GOT TO BE the WORST EXAMPLE OF SERVICE we have ever endured, and I DOUBT we will return.  To Gordon Ramsay: I'm sure if you REALLY knew how much in profits you were missing out on due to managers comping alcohol and food because of SLOW TERRIBLE SERVICE, you would quickly do a "Kitchen Nightmares" episode on your own place-and there would be plates and knives galore thrown and broken all over the spot.  We were VERY DISAPPOINTED to be sure.  The only reason for the stars at all is the food we received was good.

h_enVPaOfZ7QKI5RPHwlRg.text: A big let down for me.  I ordered the burger with bacon.  The only thing good on that was the bacon.  Very little fat and crispy.  The burger was tasteless.  No spices at all.  Just meat flavoring.  Like buying some ground beef at the store.  Form it into a patty and cook it.  BLAH  I thought the drinks might be better but also a disappointment.  I ordered a COKE and got a flat Pepsi.  Where is the Gordon Ramsay standard?  Really wanted to slam my plate on the floor and say F&$# it!  At least the food wasn't RAW!  The fries that came with the burger are giants size and thick.  But why do I only get 3 sticks?

h3Ocu72pZVDPsFBq6qQ93A.text: The specialty drinks are delicious, especially when followed by the fish and chips. Our server Nicole was awesome...knowing with just a glance whether we needed attention or a few minutes to peruse the menu.  The brussel sprouts were delectable...a perfect complement to the meal. Dont forget dessert!  It was jard to decide between bread pudding and sticky toffee pudding, so we had both.  And we were not sorry. Our only suggested improvement is purse hooks for the high top tables.  We look forward to our next visit.

hSzwgjbrzhxwREdhYA8akw.text: Had lunch and tried fish n chips. Portion was huge and flavor was amazing. Great job Gordon!!!

YKXTu2l5ORrT0-Pzxskr9A.text: I can't believe the negative reviews on here. We just finished lunch and the fish and chips blew my mind. Hands down the best I've ever had including England, and that is seriously saying something. I don't know what kind of voodoo they used to to make that breading but it was light and crispy and shattered like glass when you cut it.   As for service, impeccable. Our water was filled so smoothly my husband commented that he hadn't even noticed it happening. It was like a well practiced production where everything appears and disappears seamlessly.  You will spend $100. It isn't fancy food it is straightforward and done really well. If you are looking for something fancy then it isn't the right place. If you appreciate food done right then here is your place.

PNwNZwYhZeUCq9hLYuVT-A.text: The food tasted alright, but I'm not sure if that burger is really worth a whole $20. The following day I ate at Smash Burger, and that tasted as good, for less than half the cost. Given that Gordon Ramsey's name is attached to this place, I came in with higher than normal expectations and came out feeling that there was more to be desired. Excellent service though.

wxJ6Lbm5RfhlsX3zJhnJtg.text: The food was pretty solid but the beer selection was a little disappointing. The dishes were flavorful but rather small. All in all a decent place to eat if you're stuck on the strip but if you can get out into town there are better options.

d8VO6VdRAlMxNUZGhKseRA.text: I saw this place while exploring the casino and realized that it just opened earlier this month. I decided to take my sister here for a belated Christmas gift (she, like many others, is a Gordan Ramsey fan and aspires to also cook amazing food one day). Luckily, there was no need to physically stand in line - we placed our name on the waitlist and roamed around until the estimated time that that gave us to return, by which they had our table ready.  After we sat down, we had to wait several minutes before the server came to us, but the staff and food more than made up for it. Our waitress, Elyse, was very sociable when she arrived, chatting with us for a while before taking our order. Because of our time constraint, my sister decided to settle for dessert only. We were debating between the sticky toffee pudding and potted triple chocolate trifle (both $9-10) and Elyse highly recommended the sticky toffee pudding, so we decided to go with that. Not disappointed with the overall selection at all!  Sticky Toffee Pudding: The combination of toffee "pudding" (it's actually a cake in Britain) with toffee syrup (wasn't too sweet, which balances out the cake), and vanilla bean ice cream (made fresh daily and gives a nice balance between hot and cold) is heavenly!  Overall: Con: Not getting the waiter right away when we sat down Pro: Not needing to physically wait in line, friendly staff, quality dessert  Will come here next time (over buffets) to try the rest of the menu!

m24vHRVhAOgk5FFlB7EaVw.text: I don't write many reviews but I do it's because they are definitely worth it! Came here for dinner last night with the lady and like usual we were well taken care of. Our server was so nice and she was extremely personable. I'm just a hard ass when it comes to service because I work in the industry, so it was nice having great service. Our food was top notch and I glad that this is going to be one of our regular places to go. Staff just went above and beyond to make us feel unique and the experience was amazing.

IlPrCFdOMkdLumS8yb7V9A.text: We came for dinner. We ate the filet and lobster tail. It was the most delicious food we have tasted in a very long time and we like to think we're aficionados on food. Our server Aris was very knowledgeable about the menu and a joy to have. Pricey but we knew that. We will return.

1-O8p4ARa_HKTwkfOdc0fQ.text: We had a wobbly table, the truffle aioli tasted like mayo and the fries were cold. Calamari was okay, the sticky toffee pudding issueonly reason for the one star. The waitress was friendly but nowhere to be found when we were ready for her.

cP9O2yNZ66ovMEKbAvEE6A.text: This place is great! The service was wonderful, had a tasting of quite a few items - everything was perfectly executed. Meat pies were ridiculously good, chicken pesto sandwich was my favorite, but prime rib was perfect, lobster Mac was incredible, lamb burger was awesome, sliders were great - everything was perfect in great portion sizes, nothing greasy, messy, etc. Wait staff had great attitudes; met Scott Cummings and he was taking time to greet guests. Just an overall wonderful atmosphere. Did not disappoint!

08pp5S1yUzlXETaNhxpSyg.text: My husband and I came for our 9th anniversary after renewing our vows a few nights ago. We loved it so much we came back again tonight and it definitely did not disappoint. Except, we heard that Gordon Ramsay himself had made an appearance while we were there and missed him. I have been a huge fan for years! I highly recommend the Fish and Chips. Rodney was our server, and he was OUTSTANDING as well. We will absolutely be back on our next trip!!!

oS8bIKYJIEQ9K-Jg458saA.text: Pricy pub food that doesn't stand out from the rest besides their lobster roll appetizer and sticky toffee pudding which was amazing.

1IzqnPEc2P9a827XWP7oug.text: The food and atmosphere were good, but it took 15 min after sitting down for our waiter to greet us. The food came out really quickly. When we finished our food, we still had to wait another 20 minutes for him to acknowledge us and take our plates away. We were very disappointed by the time we had to spend waiting on our waiter.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beef Burger

c3vkO56gqCUjijbF8NyyAg.text: My fiance and I came during happy hour, and it did not disappoint. The food was a bit expensive, although some of the happy hour deals were pretty good. Nice atmosphere, good menu selection, would definitely recommend!!

Ze6tB7Ym4JIPfVF40hEPuw.text: Came here for lunch, was pretty good but nothing special. Had the wings for an appetizer to share (good flavored sauce not too spicy) and had the chopped salad for my meal. Salad was a big portion, ingredients tasted fresh, but nothing blew me away. Small menu. Service was so so.

LiCA789uRurxqy4BPwkaSQ.text: Went back this trip as I had to try the steak & ale pie. It was really good. My wife said her salad was really good too. Great atmosphere. Told our server we were going to a concert & were in a bit of a hurry so he did a good job of getting us taken care of quickly. Highly recommend. Next time I want to try the fish & chips.

N82zpSEvxePUPIW22bo-_w.text: I come to Vegas a couple times a year on business and this place is usually on my regular rotation of restaurants because we stay in Caesars.  The food is not bad, not great.  It's somewhat overpriced for what it is but it's Vegas so what do you expect!  I have to say that I've had great service every time I've been here.  So far, my favorite bartender is David.  He's a big bear of a guy who could look scary but he's actually lots of fun and makes a good drink.  He kept me and my group very entertained!  For servers, we LOVE Adam R.  So sweet, so helpful, soooo easy on the eyes!!  We'll be back for more!!!

HMrCjbkXb51v7FTkQC6RSA.text: Amazing Flavors!!   Great service! Perfect place to people watch!  Truffles fries and Brussels sprouts are a must. Pretty much everything you order will be amazing!!

B8d-hF_XfixY9oKKWvrgpQ.text: I really wasn't too impressed. I didn't feel like the menu was very diverse, but even then - what we did order was just OK. I ordered the sliders with fries and the group I was with all tried other parts of the menu: salad, salmon, burger...  Would I give it another chance? Maybe if a friend really wanted to try it, or there wasn't much else open. A visiting friend asked if they should try it recently and I suggested other places with more flavor and a better menu.

OdMROXzVPNY4iEKDRRLq1Q.text: Food and drinks are overpriced and the service was terrible! The staff are indifferent, unfriendly and don't appear to realize they are working in the hospitality industry!  Don't waste your time or money here, there are so many better options in Vegas that are a much more pleasant experience!

905dEzTRM9FBawNB8AH9PA.text: It pains me to write this--as I was expecting so much more after years of watching Chef Ramsay making fish and chips on various shows. Yes--I realize he is not there personally making every order--but I was hoping for much more--particularly at this price point. As I mentioned--I went for the fish and chips, anticipating authenticity and flavor. Unfortunately, the fish was very bland, and had a very strong, oily taste that I could not quite figure out. I've eaten my share of fried foods--and know what overused oil tastes like--but this was something different. The chips were also less than impressive, and the portion was rather small. All in all--very disappointing. The other two diners in my party felt the same way about the caesar salad and club sandwich, respectively. This is the type of place that you walk into with ultra-high expectations--so when you are let down, it is even more frustrating.

FHETjchg3fNzORNSz4w6Jw.text: Great beer selection for a Vegas restaurant. Tried the UK flight, all very tasty. The atmosphere is great, plenty of TVs for watching sports - so the pub feel is legit. Tried the fish and chips, despite the $30 price tag. (oh yeah this is Vegas) Pleasantly surprised, fish was fresh and breaded and fried to order. Bland flavor but sauce and vinegar were provided with so no biggie. The chips (fries) were delicious. Big on flavor. Great experience would recommend to others!

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The UK beer flight - phenomenal! Generous size tasters ($15 though)

GzmroCrAa7jtp39h5b-48Q.text: If you can AVOID this place. The staff were disgusting. I could smell the dirty rag they were using to wipe the tables with. I wondered why and it was because they were so lazy to rinse the rag under running water. They had a bucket stored under a table and were using the same water over again. And their cups were so dirty also. It makes you wonder how clean can their kitchen be.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. I dont think they even wash the bases of the cups. Fingerprints and stain all over their water cup
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Washed their rags over and over again in that same bucket. The smell was horrific

opBaO9NJyCUA0AS0Ix3VLQ.text: Love coming here!! Ask for Adam to serve you bc he is the best. Love all the food especially the herb salad. The burgers here are also yummy!! Try out next time your in Vegas

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Love coming here

liDzDgNFW6b7p9i8UcLYhw.text: Here with Rodney with Gordon's biggest fans.  Perfect food, perfect Staff, perfect night.  Thanks for making it special.

UEK9uofXdzCutAG_5Dp5AQ.text: Gordon: I must say this is the best meal I have eaten in Las Vegas. Your staff is great. Your food is fantastic. I will recommend you to everyone I know.  Hats off to your fantastic team and manager.what a great experience. Michael W is the best. He is definitely very passionate. We will be back.  Respectfully yours, Dr Teresa Wagner

bFM9lDqFP6LxlFtxtm_NGw.text: No no no. This goes on the skip it list.  This is the second GR place I have been and had bad food and experience. And I'm a fan! Maybe I was hoping for too much??? The food, just burgers and salad took forever to come out. The staff was confused and seemed disoriented. Plenty of other places to eat at...move on...nothing to see here.

VdamB2Qp6EZsgY0PEhxySw.text: Would never come back! Prawns were chewy, filet was sweet and wine has things floating in it. The only reason why I even gave it 2 stars is because the potatoes were good. Oh and our server was non existent.

4Yuab6P3qbakLWP0YoVd5Q.text: Long wait ofcourse. I had the scallops it was good. My sister was satisfied with her burger. My brother didn't like the lamb but he liked the dessert, spotted dog and chocolate trifle. We expected better.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Scallops and Brussels sprouts.
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spotted dog and chocolate trifle.
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States

fmrYnPIj2XbAxM03BcMA0A.text: The restaurant is very nice inside* The staff was very courteous and attentive. I had the sirloin steak... Perfectly seasoned , quality beef flavor,awesome asparagus and mashed potatoes. The dish was excellent and all balanced out great. I tried the lollipop chicken drummets and they were great* nice bleu cheese sauce . The sticky toffee pudding was amazing as well. I sampled some beef sliders, and they were also very good

yEySwTB5hC0BsKAAj6UVkQ.text: Gordon Ramsay's Pub is a nice restaurant for a lunch or a quick meal. We ordered the shrimp cocktail (chopped up shrimp that was marinated in lemon mixed with cocktail sauce), warm salty pretzels with queso dip and horseradish dip and the BLT with Pulled Pork. The pulled pork is the consistency of chicken salad not pulled BBQ pork. Overall, the good was good but the process were a little more than they should have been.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Warm salty pretzels

xXK1LWrFIqnxISHgko6dOQ.text: Best chicken wings in town. Great beers on tap an burgers looked good too. But prefer the ones at brgr

xVFhh17FVerWUbsx2knBsg.text: Place was good , great ambience and fast service, but the food was mediocre. Nothing special just plain expensive food

iC3CtTfmB5fIhuiSBiQDaQ.text: First of all I ordered the Pigs in Blanket for appetizer, although plain was quite good. My wife and her friend ordered Scotch Eggs and Deviled Eggs which were better than my app.   We were only half way through the appetizer when our main course arrived. Myself and my wife's friend had ordered the Fish & Chips. Her chips were cold so got sent back, the waiter was laughing at us as we complained. I ate about half of mine before I could eat no more as it was very greasy. This got sent back also which got taken off the bill which is the least I would expect.   The only good things about the meal was the beer and the Mushy Peas. So overall Mr Ramsay, if this was supposed to be British Fish & Chips, your chef failed.

nm6H-veSGzA4UG6p_HeleQ.text: I wanted to love this restaurant as much as I do Gordon Ramsay, but alas, nope! The service was pretty pathetic and the food was just alright. Surprisingly, as a pea hater, the English pea cold side was good. The ale battered cod was good but not awesome, as expected. I prefer Cheesecake Factory if that tells you anything. The fries were gross.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States

FZxg5DZ1xufIe2CQUi6MPA.text: Budweiser is an American institution. Any restaurant who doesn't serve this American beer on the Vegas Strip is not a restaurant I will ever visit again.

t3M_xmn9q42QaAIt9xlSNQ.text: Nothing to write home about! Waited a long time before service. Waitress was pleasant. Placed order and food was out in five-minutes! Wow!!  Had the fish & chips; no flavor. Bacon burger; no seasoning on the burger but cooked perfectly medium.  Underwhelmed.Won't come back, there are far better dining experiences to have here in Las Vegas!

kCeG2ZMExMzwOGv0SUHlPQ.text: Food is incredibly overpriced! Went to experience a Ramsey restaurant, he would be furious if he was involved with this place. $30 bucks for fish and chips... 2 pcs and fries. Came out like warm, fries soggy. $225 for 3 people, 2 meals as couple shared a dish! All of us ended up sick also, suspect it was the fish. Overpriced, unimpressed and will NEVER go back, nor visit any of his other restaurants in town now. Too busy with his shows I guess to make sure the places with his name on them are run correctly!!!

Keeping it brief, Caesar salad was soggy and drenched in a thick dressing, deviled eggs came and the server tipped the plate and all the eggs rolled over.  Then they ran out of a desert we wanted.  Service was much to be desired.

J-bOjLLZaKUK-MvFEva66g.text: Heather, was fantastic.  The food was awesome, the service was better!   Ask for Heather, be sure she gets a 2 dollar bill, hilarious story to follow!

dBLgEriRCsjr7NWMDHWExw.text: Had a solo dinner here, I ordered a lamb burger because I'm a sucker for lamb burgers. I had high expectations since Gordon Ramsey's name is attached to this place but I was so underwhelmed. The burger was good but it's not something I'd go back for.   The service, on the other hand, is exceptional!! My server was very gracious (sorry to say I cannot remember her name!) and the manager came twice to check up on me throughout the night.  Food is OK, wifi connection is great and if you like to people watch, grab a spot by the "patio" railing. Yes it's noisy but it's also very entertaining watching the people who pass by.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The lamb burger. Fries were good!!
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. I asked for hot water with lemon...I wasn&#39;t expecting this level of fancy.

JyDQdqCUAwlXqzUr0SN7eA.text: To start off I'd like to say that I have been dying to try a Gordon Ramsay restaurant for a while! So, going in to the restaurant, I had mammoth expectations of the quality of Ramsay's restaurants after watching his shows.   What I received far exceeded my expectations.  **it is very pricey, but trust me, you get what you pay for here. A burger is like 21-25...but very very worth it.***  A+ on the service: The waiter (sorry, I forgot his name) was very attentive, funny, and friendly!! Also, my water never went under halfway full, which I loved since I was parched. The manager was very on top of things, too, constantly flowing through the aisles, just keeping watch.  A++ on the App: For an app, my Dad and I split the White Bean Hummus...now I've had delicious hummus before, but this, let me tell you, was eyeballs rolling into the back of my head amazing. It was absolutely sensational...a must if you go here!   A+ on the burger and fries: I got the Grilled Beef Burger. ABSOLUTELY DELICIOUS. It looked smaller and I was like okay I can totally finish this burger...no biggie. But, by the last bite, I was ready to explode. It was melt in your mouth and juicy and perfect. After the burger, I could barely eat my fries and left a lot of those sadly....THOSE were amazing.   Overall, this truly is a 5/5 restaurant.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Grilled beef burger....best burger I&#39;ve ever tasted!

qiozlTD4EMQVdk_g07zOsg.text: After checking-in at Caesars, the GF's family and I was hungry for some lunch. We were all in the mood for some simple pub fare so after stepping off the elevators, we went straight to Gordon Ramsay's Pub & Grill.  It seems to be the perfect venue for sports fans as there were a myriad of TVs around the surrounding bar and dining room, with plenty of soccer (excuse me, "football") fans watching what seemed to be a fairly important match. Color me clueless because I can't watch a sport that doesn't count down to the end of a match or doesn't always end with a winner. But on to the food!  Warm Salty Pretzels [$8 / $7 Total Rewards] Innis & Gunn Beer-Cheddar sauce, English granary mustard   Make sure you get a Total Rewards card from Caesars because you get a dollar knocked off most menu items. We started off with the pretzels, which came warm and salty indeed. But fair warning, you only get three! The accompanying beer-cheddar sauce was nicely sharp with depth from the beer. The English granary mustard was great, with a sinus-clearing horseradish kick that was highly reminiscent of my favorite Holman's.   Dublin Corned Beef Brisket Sandwich [$18 / $17 Total Rewards] Dark caraway rye, Gruyere cheese, sauerkraut, pickled onion and cucumber dressing  The corned beef brisket sandwich featured great rye, with a nice heft of corned beef brisket that was balanced by the tangy sauerkraut and pickled onion and cucumber dressing within. The Guyere imparted a nice nuttiness that melded the flavors together nicely.  Yorkshire Ale Batter Fish & Chips [$30 / $29 Total Rewards]  Cod, fresh dill tartar sauce, minted mushy peas, lemon  The fish and chips featured moist and flaky cod without its skin (luckily for the GF). The batter was crisp and light. The thick steak fried were not crisp, but came with more of a roasted texture. The minted mushy peas were light on mint and were a bit watery.  Grilled Lamb Burger [$21 / $20 Total Rewards] 8 oz, caramelized onions, goat cheese-feta spread, rosemary brioche bun  I went with the stellar lamb burger, which was cooked to a nice medium and housed within a perfectly proportioned brioche bun. The grassiness of the lamb was accented by the goat-cheese and feta spread, with the caramelized onions adding a nice richness to each bite.   So if you're looking to indulge in proper gastropub fare while watching a game with some friends, Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill will set you right.

pxtjnOqqbLPgyzjkz_i0hg.text: Such a Ripoff... The food here sucks.. Definitely not what I was expecting. We complained to the manager because not even a single entree we ordered was good. He gave us a discount initially but because the food and service was of such bad quality he assured us we would not be charged for the lunch. The next day there was a charge on my card which returned my money back to my account. I was Happy at least they are considerate about their customers  but no they charged me back the same amount week later and when chase disputed my charge they denied they had allowed a refund... What a bunch of D!%ks  And isn't Gordon Ramsey British ??? I guess fish and chips is their only Specialty......How can you fuck that up so royally ???? I think all that shouting on his shows has messed up the recipe for his Lamb Burger and the Pathetic dish which he assumes is Butter chicken (My Dog could cook better than that )  I rather eat on a Taco Stand in Vegas than come back here again .... Stay Away Guys ...

JRqAalwTZ3PUiUllMw44_g.text: I give this place 5 stars for 2 main reasons: Service and their calamari  We dined here on one of the busiest day of the year...New Year's Eve. While all the restaurants at Cesars Palace were fully booked as expected (even the food court line was up the wall), we were seated within 10 minutes at this restaurant. They were also extremely busy yet they were able to accommodate a family of 6 at the peak of their dinner time which was 7:30 pm. We were never rushed, server was very knowledgable of the menu and specials, our water was refilled constantly, and when they made a mistake with the way one of the burgers were cooked, they replaced it within minutes. They even gave complimentary truffle fries.   Now for the calamari, it is by far the best I have ever had! And I've had a ton in my lifetime.  It was so tender and fried to perfection! Great portions too. I would come back over and over just to have it. We could've had a lousy take out or room service for our New Year's Eve dinner but Gordon Ramsay staff turned it all around. Keep up the good work!!!

PEcxQgzjJTjzvlU_hfV8Ug.text: First time at the Pub & Grill and we loved it! Took my girlfriend there for her birthday and we had a great time. I  had the the lamb burger and she had the salmon. Lamb burger was awesome with goat cheese and feta, and the salmon was cooked perfect! They brought us out the sticky toffee desert with a candle for my GF's birthday and it was amazing! You can easily split it between 2 people. Our waiter Scott was on it, and the Manager Randy even came by to check on us. If your a Ramsay fan and you want a check out a fun place with some of his signature dishes, definitely check it out.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sticky Toffee Pudding!
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lamb burger!

eXCpwIzdh9FhTr4NVvA6XA.text: Loved it! My husband and I made reservations to celebrate our anniversary. We were seated after a 5 minute wait. Our waiter, Ali, was awesome. Knew the menu, shared interesting factoids about our beer and appetizer choices, and the food was served fairly quickly (the restaurant is huge). We had the Toad in the Hole (appetizer), Shepherd's Pie, and Bangers and Mash. All of it was delicious. The Dijon mustard/horeradish combo were tasty with the appetizer, the Shepherd's Pie was the perfect comfort food, and you'll want to mainline the onion gravy on the B&M. We also had the Butterscotch Madeleine for dessert. It's perfect for two and was delicious.    All in all, we had a great time and will definitely be making an effort to visit the other Ramsay restaurants in Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States

QyIf_l1u3yrhTlRJbWgXqA.text: Gordon ramsey lives up to his reputation! Food was of course from scratch. .. nothing frozen or purchased and reheated like many restaurants.  The lamb shanks is absolutely the best we've ever had!  The salad dressing was so different and so good. The brussel sprouts was fantastic!  For dessert, highly recommend the English sticky toffee pudding!  Most restaurants dont make their desserts. . they buy the typical cheesecakes, brownies,  etc...but here... they actually make their own!!  Service was excellent.

fxaF_dQUuFohpWV_Dd41Ew.text: How a cranberry vodka drink can taste so special is beyond me! The bartenders here are ridiculously good at what they do. They take their s*** seriously.  Everyone around us was in OOOHS and AHHS over the sheer perfection of their drink.  I had a moment (maybe a buzzed one) where I thought "Wow.... mixed drinks are an art".  I like it.    And since I didn't want to eat a full meal, I decided to splurge on a few appetizers to share.   Deviled eggs (with bacon), pretzel, and olives. All fantastic - particularly the eggs; they got a little creative with them (but nothing too far out there!).    Will be back!

fAvjwfvl6X7vToTfqaYOMg.text: If you're looking for some good food, this is the place to go. My friend and I went during happy hour, so we got a couple bucks off of our drinks (Angry Orchard & Goodbye Blue Sky cocktail) and got a $7 app (mini corn dogs). Be prepared for how strong the cocktails are! Super worth trying one though! Anyways, we got mini corn dogs, oven roasted Scottish salmon, lobster Mac and cheese, and the pesto chicken sandwich with kettle chips. I don't have one bad thing to say about this place. Our food was PHENOMENAL and the service was fantastic! 10/10 will be coming here again the next time I'm in Vegas.

cg2nQHZgnqhUVVJtJfF8rQ.text: Service was great as was the food. The only complaint was the  food was a little too greasy for my liking but very flavorful. I would definitely stop by again if I'm ever in town.

ywbC66paTXmy8m2M-nyClQ.text: Bday "weekend" in AC. The man wanted that Beef Wellington more than anything and he enjoyed it fully. Overdid it adding lobster Mac n cheese but he said that wasn't bad either. I had the Shepherds Pie (lamb)... OMG! SO... The next day he wants the beef Wellington again.. Sans appetizer and side (grown men groaning from over eating is so ridiculous) and again.. Loved it (veggies were salty but...). I had The Dublin and fries A+++. Sidebar, saw Milly Medley when we were walking in..

zJq4SCva3eyBDmkwJotkdw.text: After going to Hell's Kitchen the night before, we decided to come here for another round of Chef Ramsay greatness! Well....it was not the same, sad to say. The only great part was the fish and chips, without the chips. The chips were soft, and taste frozen. We expected it to taste like blow your mind kind of chips, like how you would see them made in his show. Nope, the chips were just soggy fries. The fish was great thought. They used fresh fish and it was a good size, enough to share between you and a child. The batter was nice and crispy and not oily at all. We also had the lobster roll, which was also pretty good, but we've had better elsewhere. The cost was expensive, even if she shared an entree with shared appetizer. Would we come here again? Probably not. Would we go to Hell's Kitchen? Hell yeh!

Xq-dkscsA_yU7nY173F9Qg.text: I go to Gordon Ramsey pub and grill with a friend for lunch. I order the grill beef burger and my friend order Caesar salad with chicken breast. I like my beef burger very much. The beef is soft but with a little crispy edge, very well grilled. It comes with French fries, ketchup and garlic creamy sauce on the side. I think the tasty level of the burger is around the same as holy chuck. So if u love holy chuck (like me!) you will love this place too. My friend's chicken breast is also very tender, not over cooked at all. Overall if only considering the taste I will give them 4 star. Why I give 5 star then? Their service is great! My friend thinks her salad has a little bit too much sauce which makes it taste a little too salty. The server insisted on change a new one for us even though we said it is ok. So the server gave us a new salad with all request my friend wanted. And then the floor manager came short afterwards to apologize for our "unpleasant" experience and offer to provide us a makeup desert (although we refused since we were reeeeeeeally full!).   Overall, it's a great restaurant to try. We had a good time here!

LxLwxWWnf8Fr_XdQURwtkw.text: Overpriced but what did I expect, I'm in Vegas! I had the fish and chips which were great but portion size (3pc with fries) for $30 was a bit much. The atmosphere was cool but they could have either had a larger portion or lesser charge for what was offered. TV's throughout the restaurant was great as we were hungry and looking for a place to watch the game.

GNuDmZVSlUQ9_xzcHVs9vw.text: Usually I don't like to give poor reviews but this needs to be addressed. Before I even read any prior Yelp reviews about this place, we had a discrepancy with our check. Once we got our check, we took notice that the amount charged for each item (Calamari, Salmon, and Chicken lollipops) were higher than what was stated on the menu. Because, we already received a discount with our comps we decided not to complain about the issue. However, I was informed by  my friend that another guest had experiences the same problem in which she read on Yelp.  Food - it was actually above mediocre for bar food! I especially liked the French Onion! The decor was trendy and meshed well together, all the way down to the silverware. Kudos to the interior designer and restaurant consultant that created the vision and theme. Even the music, Depeche Mode and The Clash, was on point!   Service - Disappointing. Server is on his phone in clear sight of guests. The table behind us actually had to get up and tap a server on the shoulder to get assistance. The server, in turns, mocks the guest to another co-worker a few minutes later. Although, the server and server assistant were cordial to us and even doing their touch backs, professionalism lacked. Hostess did do the initial verbal greet and eye contact but lacked personality.

i30vKmheXaZCQGUoWlKVww.text: I love the Ramsey's burger place at Planet Hollywood, so I tried the pub one at Cesear's Palace this time.  Comparing the 2, the burger one at Planet Hollywood is definitely better.  The truffles chips (fries) are great, but you get a lot more at their burger restaurant than at the pub.  I had the salmon.  The sauce was too rich so I couldn't finish it.  Overall, it was expensive and not worth it.  Lunch was over $40/person---no alcohol.  I will go back to the Ramsey Burger next time.

y2BSHj802rR4V64oDkndfQ.text: So disappointed with my experience! The night before going here I was on a Gordon Ramsay high from BURGR and expected the same experience but I was sadly mistaken. Service sucked off the bat... Waited 10 minutes to just get tap water another 10 for our actual drinks.   The nachos were the only redeeming thing the restaurant had to offer.  I had the fish and chips which was bland and $30?? No value whatsoever.   My boyfriend had the bangers and mash.. Which he says was underwhelming and the sausage was overcooked and leathery.   I usually give my server the benefit of the doubt if it was busy I get it things happen... But there was no excuse for the negligence and lack of customer service

yzixQ9e7OBLU4f6qy06EKQ.text: The order is as follows: Scotch egg as starter, Pan seared Scottish salmon as main and the dessert is Sticky Toffee Pudding.  Salmon was amazing and crispy. Other two did not dissapoint also.   The Columbia Valley Riesling was great with fish and dessert.
