cSJO173AgfSU0CHqZyxySg.text: I would give this restaurant 10 stars if I could. We were visiting Las Vegas and tried to get into Hells Kitchen but settled for the Pub & Grill. What a lucky turn of events! First we were early for our reservation and the front desk could not have been nicer. Then the waiter Carl was knowledgeable and efficient.  Now to the food and drink! The drinks were great. A blackberry vodka concoction which was very tasty! The kettle chip nachos combined so many basic flavors in an awesome way!! No getting to the bottom of the plate and all the toppings were gone.  Then the French Onion Soup was the best I have ever had and I love french onion soup and have tried it everywhere! The salmon was moist and cooked to perfection and the lemon mash potatoes complemented the fish. The sticky toffee pudding was so good we wanted lick the plate...in fact I did lick the Carmel container.  Outstanding experience all the way around!

x8dIBQLsnTbB5N2aiG6hCA.text: Really poor experience tonight in Gordon's pub and grill at Ceasars. The food has taken a nose dive since the last time we came here in July. The french fries were old, the steak and ale pie pastry was also old and had obviously been either standing for a few hours before it was served to my wife. Sausage and mash - mash was really dry and hard. The scotch eggs appetizer was pathetic. The only savior for the experience was our server who was excellent, otherwise it would be a two star rating. I hope someone from Gordon Ramsey's staff reads this and takes some action, but I'm sorry to say I wouldn't take the risk of going to this particular restaurant again. I'm sure If Gordon ate what we did tonight, he would be ashamed.

nnYsbPqmgF3210LE8eSJig.text: Seated quickly, but restaurant was relatively empty on that day of week. Service was great, quick to take our order and service our needs, but the waiter telling me his favorites while ordering each & every course was somewhat unnecessary. I ordered fish & chips and my friend ordered shepherds pie. Both were good, but definitely not the best I've had. I expected the cost to be on the high end based on it was a GR restaurant, but the portion sizes were relatively small for their costs. We basically felt like we needed to order dessert just to fill our bellies.  I wasn't crazy disappointed, but I suppose I expected more from a Gordon Ramsay branded establishment. My friend whom I went with had been to his other new spot BURGR and enjoyed it, and I've been to the other one STEAK and enjoyed that, so I guess I had higher expectations for this one as well.

6ttRzfs2jDuPqpxEdVdwvA.text: We went for dinner to celebrate my niece's 21st birthday with our family of 12. Our food was excellent, and waiter, Chris, was outstanding! Great atmosphere and comfy chairs. And I was delighted they provided me with a gluten free menu. I highly recommend this restaurant.

EPxy9dShEw_tAvQ0Pm9WQA.text: Worst experience in Vegas ever. Horrible wait staff, sub par food, hey Gordon why don't you actually inspect the place once in a while...to top it off my phone was stolen right off the table, manager useless. I would sooner starve to death than return.

OQiheLUVIvfJdwZAhxafyQ.text: We came here on a very busy Sunday afternoon. There was a huge crowd in front of the restaurant and people were being told it was about a twenty minute wait. I was glad we made reservations on Opentable along the way. We were seated right away in the back of the restaurant where it was more quiet. Our waiter's name was Adam and he was very friendly and helpful. We ordered the deviled eggs, corn soup, baby greens salad, and the ham and cheese sandwich, all of which I would highly recommend. Everything was very fresh looking and tasting as well as perfectly prepared. I am really looking forward to returning here for another casual but delicious meal. My only complaint is they marked us as a no show on Opentable, but hopefully this will be resolved on their end, as we have already taken it up with Opentable.

fPAxuvEGg9umFpZU7UXEZw.text: Way overrated burger. Hard to believe when paying 21$. The service was good it's a shame the food didn't match.

d7YhKLZPfatwlR5noqVNLQ.text: My wife and I dined at this Ramsay restaurant on June 3rd for lunch.  The hostess and wait staff were excellent.  However, if the food was on a scale from 1 to 10 it was a 5 or 6 at best.  I understand that Gordon Ramsay is not back in the kitchen personally and I understand none of his top Chefs are back there as well.  But I was shocked that he would put his name on the mediocre food that is served there.   I ordered the Onion Soup and my wife ordered the Duck Confit Poutine for our lunch starters.  The Onion soup was good, it had a different after taste but it was a good soup.  My wife was not fond of the flavor of the soup.  Her Duck Confit Poutine was tasteless and was a slightly warm glob of a mess and again it was really tasteless.    For our main dish I had the Traditional Sheppard's Pie and she had the Pub "Spots" (3 mini-house blend pub burgers.)  My Sheppard's pie was ok, not great but not horrible, I was shocked that it came out of a Gordon Ramsay kitchen.  It was bland and a bit greasy, it tasted like pot roast  that was served in my elementary school which I was not a fan of.   I have had much better Sheppard's Pie at Walt Disney World's EPCOT.   My wife's the Pub "Spots" (3 mini-house blend pub burgers.) were ordered Med Rare and came out over well done.  The overcooked burgers were taken off the bill, not by our request but by the server who agreed that they were not cooked properly and were way over cooked.   The wait staff again was excellent and I tipped her approx 30 percent because she and the rest of the staff were excellent.     I am a big Gordon Ramsay fan and really enjoy reading his cookbooks and his television shows.  However, after the let down at Gordon Ramsay Steak and now at the Pub.    I just don't think I can spend our money on a product that is supposed to be top quality in all aspects and falls short, but you never know what the future brings..  I may go back..

9QkuV3i--ODhLgv52NuH1A.text: for a chefs restaurant it was incredibly disappointing. Horrible service-it took the food 45 minutes in an empty restaurant, and when we finally received our food it was mediocre at best. I won't make the mistake of thinking that a Gordon Ramsay restaurant will be good based on the name again.

_bx4nybesdUpURxWTDYYNA.text: Made reservations in advance to try and get good seating and they threw us in the aisle! The waitress had to check to see if the chips portion of fish and chips was made from "real potatoes"! They weren't even chips they were cheap frozen fries! Not British at all! My wife was sorely disappointed as for me I was talked into a $35 ny strip steak, very very small and very very dry I would have sent it back but that would have meant we had seen our waitress again! The table next to us was having similar problems! Oh yeah and they were out of scotch eggs! Not what you would expect from chef Gordon Ramsay. The service was equally as bad as the food by far the worst $100 I ever spent! And I left hungry! Thanks for ruining me and my wife's ten year anniversary Gordon!

-2dAEewwM66InWsPNVAong.text: Family trip to Vegas, quite a few Ramsey fans amongst us.  Total of 8 diners off of the grill menu.  We made a reservation and our table was ready for us.  Service - Solid.  Our waiter was friendly and knowledgable.  The staff was attentive to our needs with regard to keeping water full and table clear.  My only complaint would be the drink menu.  I can dig conserving paper and flashy electronics, but passing a couple iPads around to place drink orders was a bit of a hassle.  Ambiance - I liked it.  I wouldn't call it a traditional pub, but the feel is there.  The noise level is moderate, with an eclectic mix of British rock/pop on the playlist.  The uniforms fit with the theme.  I work with beer for a living and I am without a doubt overly anal retentive with regards to it.  So, a wall made of kegs in a British themed pub didn't sit right with me.  Casks would have been much more appropriate.  Speaking of casks . . .  Beverages - Admittedly, we were all looking at beer, it's a pub after all.  For everyday beer selection, I'd give it a big thumbs up.  Lots of imported and expected domestic draft options, and a more craft friendly bottle selection.  I got a Union Jack, brother got a Sculpin, mom got a SNPA.  Their's was fresh, mine wasn't.  Que Sera, at least the options were there.  I would say this is more disappointing after visiting BURGR this afternoon and being offered a much more impressive beer list.  Lastly, it is a Pub, how is there nothing on cask?  If you are an avid beer advocate temper your expectations.  Food - Not one of the 8 off us left disappointed or hungry.  Between the 8 of us we tried the Pork and Lamb Rillettes appetizer, Lamb T-bone, Shepard's Pie, Brick Pressed Cornish Hen, Clams and Mussels, Pork Belly and sides of Brusselspouts and Fingerling Potatoes.  Bread and starters: The bread, holy geez the bread.  A selection of pretzel breads and a beer roll served with Devonshire butter and a Welsh cheddar spread with horseradish.  I can't believe they don't charge for this, it is easily one of the best things that was put on our table.  The Rillettes were excellent as well.  I favored the pork over the duck, which admittedly was a bit bland for duck.  It comes with a fabulous horseradish infused mustard, crispy acidic house made pickles of carrot and radish.  Mains - I am going to jump right to it.  Everything was at least good, but the Shepard's Pie is absolutely astounding and I would say the best thing we had on the table.  The pork belly, which I ordered was very good, crispy and fatty just as it should be.  It has a pea puree with it that is hardly noticeable and tiny chippolini(sp?) onions for sweetness.  All together great dish I wouldn't hesitate to order again.  I did not try a clam, but the mussels were great.  They were massive and came swimming in a delicious broth and a few heels of bread to drag through it.  The hen we a little dry but, my goodness, was the skin crispy.  The lamb was well prepared, perfectly cooked.  It is topped with Stilton, which I find to be a relatively medium flavored blue cheese, but in this situation it surprisingly dominated the lamb.  It was good to be sure, but could be better.  Sides:  The brusselsprouts were outstanding, simply prepared with bacon and apples.  Cooked perfectly, flavorful and a great compliment to the fatty pork.  The potatoes were potatoes.  They are tough to screw up and were not here.  Overall - For the 8 of us it came to just under $50/person, but I'd say that is a comfortable number for the experience we had. I wouldn't hesitate to come back.

GYEx1b4U4pK-E1WDK7w6Lg.text: Place looked interesting and there was not much of a wait to be seated so my family and I ate there.  We were seated in these tall backed seats that seemed in natural and difficult to sit on while eating.  The seats are meant more for watching tv with your feet up.  I'm a big boy and 6'2", my son is an average 10 yo boy. Between us and everyone else in between we couldn't find it comfortable.  It took a while for someone to tend to us.  All the waiters were walking fast back n forth like chickens without heads.  And we're trying to figure out which one was our waiter.  When he finally showed up we ordered.  We didn't see him again until he brought our food.  Meanwhile our drinks took forever to be refilled.  When the food came out we all thought it was mediocre. Burger, chicken dish, salad andI can't even remember what I got cause it probably wasn't much to remember.  Between the uncomfortable seating arrangement, non enthusiastic waiter and barely  edible food this is the last time I go there and has now made me question Gordon Ramsay as a chef.  Seeing his shows, how strict and tough he is, I couldn't believe this guy owned this establishment.  He would flip if he experienced what we experienced.  I expected a lot more, and when you put your name behind something, you better make sure they represent you accurately.

JcdX2133Zu9euLVtCEdaTQ.text: Lamb Burger with goat cheese! yes yes yes! The fries were good too. Great beer selection... that's all I remember! Convenient location if you're staying at the Caesar's palace. It's Vegas baby!!!

VzTR3l5OWQNZW4p_d7ELDA.text: I came here with a group for drinks before a group dinner...didn't like that you couldn't seat yourself at the bar without the hostess helping you.  We tried some drinks and french fries...all were good, albeit overpriced, but nothing to rush back for!

gTTXYBDaqeat1dULDiKoDA.text: Terrible service, food was over priced and bland. Manager was an A hole. Will not go back nor will I recommend this place to anyone. The worst restaurant experience I have ever had. If I was Ramsay I would be ashamed to have my name on this place.

8794B-oSo-Sv1zIPSH5Ekg.text: First off, the nachos will be the only reason why I come back. The burgers were average and the corned beef sandwich...lets just say I had much better at a local deli for a third of the price. The staff was friendly and the atmosphere was pretty cool, but overall, take your money elsewhere EXCEPT if you're going for the nachos. Disappointed in Gordon

oQJV6xjQJCBJRPVgxugMMA.text: I was here a week ago for dinner. The food was good. I have the brick braised chicken and my girlfriend had the mussels. The drinks tasted good but I didn't feel like there was enough alcohol in them for the price they charged. My main problem with this restaurant is the speed of service. When you're in Vegas, you don't want to be wasting time waiting for a server to come take your order or bring your food. You want to be in and out and on the way to the tables, clubs, shows, or whatever else you're planning on doing. We were seated quickly but then had to wait nearly 15 minutes before our waitress came to the table. After she finally made an appearance, service speed improved but when it came time to pay, we had to wait again. After giving her my credit card, it took her nearly 15 minutes to bring it back. The restaurant wasn't that busy and it seemed to be fairly standard as other tables had to wait for their server to arrive as well.   Other than the speed of service, the food was delicious and the atmosphere fun and lively. I would definitely return, just wished the service was faster.

rbA91Z0xuPfwZ33cVvzbPg.text: Very disappointed, food lacks seasoning. From the start hostess was not friendly, we ordered hamburgers one medium and one medium rare; both were very dry and un interesting just not flavorful. I make turkey burgers at home that are tastier than that, the fries were not fresh just not good quality food . Very disappointed for a 19 dollar burger it just not worth it :( sorry don't care how famous Ramsey is.

0nDoJYAm3xnwMr07AP65Cg.text: This place is good! Chef Ramsay's restaurant was solid! I'm sorry but I really couldnt find anything to talk badly about it. The boyfriend and I made reservations for Valentine's day. We got there 15 minutes early and got seated right away...surprisingly the place wasn't crazy busy. Drinks were very good...had the Belgian margarita and a 20 oz pint of innis and gunn. Both drinks rocked! Started with a scotch egg appetizer..then had bangers and mash as my main. The boyfriend had fish and chips. Both dishes were solid! Very tasty! I wish I had that fish batter recipe! Soo good! Bangers were tasty as well! Finished with sticky toffee! Very good! Service was definitely on point. We had a great experience and don't understand why yelpers don't want to give this place more stars! Come on people! Yes, its pricey..but its Vegas and a celebrity chefs restaurant! So you should know the drill! Good place!!

bs1FDIDtzbN-nBctmuCyuw.text: My husband and I were pleased with finding this place. We stopped in because they had good craft beer on tap and ended up eating dinner here. Beer selection is good for Vegas. Service is good too. We ended up getting the beef burger with bacon and it was fantastic. A little small to split but good none the less. Very juicy, great bread and thick pieces of bacon. We were very pleased. The fries were delicious too. On another occasion, we stopped in for another beer and the pretzel. Having been to Germany, our pretzel standards are high and this pretzel was average. There are three "sticks" instead of one large one. The accompanying mustard is good; beer cheese is ok. I'm not certain we'd order it again. We did end up ordering the nachos that time after seeing another patron's order. They were pretty good! Made of (homemade?) potato chips instead of tortilla chips, the meat was good and the cheese was better than most other (fake cheese) nachos we've ordered. We'd probably get these again.

JXvRRUesdMlYAIZP6mnqaA.text: I had a great expierence here, given that my earlier expierence at another restaraunt was horrible. So I got on Yelp! to find an other place that was somewhat close to where I was and this place showed up. so i headed over, hoping I could get something to eat even with out a reservation. I walked up and was greeted by a lovely hostess. I explained that I didn't have a reservation and told her briefly about what happened at another restaraunt. Thankfully, she said don't worry and follow me. I sat down and glanced at the menu. My server came over and asked what I'd like to drink? I ordered a beer. He returned quickly and asked if i was ready to order. I said yes and I'll have the fish and chips. OMG! the fish was so yummy and the chips were divine. the mushy peas that came with it were better than I thought they would be. I will be back the next time I'm in Las Vegas.

qYUki9RO7XwmQWxL6ycuog.text: For the price, which was extravagant, I expected better.  The burgers weren't seasoned well, the fries were blah and gooey.  It was expensive and they squished us into a table that was so uncomfortable we asked to move.  Not worth the money.  Shame, Gordon, shame.  Makes me want to use your "f-word".  Come fix this place before it ruins you.

5nyp74iPuOjC5SxKe1oOuw.text: Great food and service for a awesome price on prime real estate.  My new go to in Vegas.  Curry was awesome!  Cocktails were well thought out!

DLakVUuy6a1EU-iY25wq4Q.text: Great experience, incredibly personable and attentive staff.  The food was very good.  Nacho appetizer was fantastic and addictive.  We enjoyed the burgers, corned beef sandwich and lobster Mac and cheese.  Drinks were unique and very tasty.  The atmosphere was fun and relaxing.  To cap off a very good experience, we received a thank you for dining with us email.  All in all, highly recommended.

pVShFX25cl6BlvUPnSVDDQ.text: Being a fan of Gordon Ramsay I had to try one of his restaurants while in Vegas.  We had dinner the other night and everything we ordered was phenomenal.   For apps we had Pretzel Sticks and Onion Rings.  My ten year old, who doesn't eat onions, tried an onion ring and gave a thumbs up.  The pretzel sticks were soft on the inside with a dark, chewy exterior.  Delicious! Our main courses were the Fish and Chips, Hell's Kitchen Ghost Pepper Burger and a Chicken Pesto Sandwich.  The light crispy batter on the fish was out of this world.  Chips were seasoned wedge-ish shapes, crispy outside and soft inside, yum.  I had the Ghost Pepper burger and was delightfully pleased with the heat level, knowing it wouldn't be crazy hot for the masses and hopeful it would have a nice bite.  The after-burn was perfect.  Chicken Pesto was delicious as well. Dessert we had to try the Sticky Toffee Pudding at the suggestion of the waiter, knowing full well they push certain dishes but he didn't steer us wrong with the appetizers.  OMG!!!  When we got back to our room I immediately began searching for recipes (still haven't tried it though).  The Sticky Toffee Pudding is to DIE for, I have no more words.  Just thinking about makes my mouth water.  Ok. Our waiter was great, staff makes the experience.  He took our order with no notes and we all received exactly what we ordered.  I was in the mood for a cocktail and asked for his recommendation and he brought me a drink with blackberry and something else.  I don't remember, but it was super tasty.  Not too sweet with whatever alcohol in the background. If we lived closer I would definitely go back and tell all my friends about it (I'll do that anyway).  Two thumbs WAY up!

diCrNBQbZxa9YZKb8Bi4tw.text: If you are expecting good food across the board, this is not your restaurant.  I had a red wine that was barely okay and the burger was not seasoned well at all - A little salt and pepper made it better.  There was  too much garlic for my taste and it actually overpowered the rest of the meal.  Fries were like any other place you get fries.  However, a great pub atmosphere for sure.  The servers were professional but clearly not enough of them for the volume of people in the place.   Overall it was just okay.

Hcy51Ex0NOJY5bKVIlIdIA.text: WE enjoyed our lunch. WE had a Beet salad and chicken salad sandwich. Food was fresh and the salad was great. Wish there would have been a but more goat cheese on the salad. IT was so creamy and good. Prices were a but steep for what you get, but my guess it is all because of Gordon's name. I love him so I will be back. :)

n2X0p_tbHFg0qZWP-oKEOg.text: We ate here for the first time last weekend and really enjoyed it!   We started with drinks and they were excellent.    We had the clams for an appetizer and they were the best clams I had ever eaten.  I had the fish and chips.  The fish was awesome, the chips just so-so.  My wife had the chicken pot pie and somehow it was very good.  I would have never thought chicken pot pie could  have been so tasty!  My son had the bangers and mash and he is a foodie and loved his entree!  My wife's friend had the rib and loved it also.  The sticky toffee pudding was insanely great!  Best dessert ever!!!  Service was good.

Bu38k9WeBF0PN8g5mn3UZg.text: Zero stars if possible. Service is horrible. Way overpriced. Food came out either extremely burnt or cold. When I returned the lamb burger(because it was completely black), they sent me back a beef burger. Do yourself a favor and never come here.

FzAZWjqRPVuG8J5L4WjsvA.text: I loved this restaurant the first time I went in 2013 and was excited to return. The last two visits have been such a huge disappointment that I will not be coming back.  The first time I visited the menu was much more expansive, they had iPads with endless craft beer and wine selections and the food was delicious. When I came back a year later the iPads were gone, the menu items were different and there were less of them.  The food was greasy, bland, and spectacularly over priced for the quality. On my latest visit in July 2015 I ordered the short ribs, which turned out to be only one piece and boneless. Not what I expected, but at least it will taste good, right? Well actually, it didn't taste like anything at all. The meat was tender but had no flavor or sauce to help support it. The barley risotto had zero salt and was reminiscent of plain oatmeal. For a $40 plate I expected much more.  I gave my review two stars because the pretzels and cheese sauce were good enough, my glass of wine came in a small carafe so it felt like a generous amount for the price and the service was ok. Not enough positives to come back again, too bad.

yHE6XvobQPu5HCGfXn1_zw.text: Had the crispy salmon, it was easily the best piece of fish I have ever had.  Started with the lamb lollipops which were also great. Going to schedule my next vacation in an area that has a Gordon Ramsay establishment.

DN-4P_7WMnJWmSx_OpCrvg.text: We came here for a team dinner expecting decent food and service. We got neither. Service was completely inattentive and not very friendly- not rude but not friendly. Our meal took forever. Nearly 20 minutes to even order a drink. The food was only fair. Skip this one and go elsewhere. I guess Ramsay is too busy yelling on TV to run his own restaurants well.

ZrjdR75U_zp7S6tYasUZ4w.text: Had the bacon cheeseburger was really really good! In fact enjoyed it so much came back the next morning for breakfast. Had corned beef skillet which was amazing but really filling.

3SBhLG9vYV6aeXwXYcTcDg.text: Request a booth on the right with a TV.  The warm pretzel bread with cheese sauce was amazing. We ordered Sheppard's Pie and Flank Steak and shared. The Flank steak was one of the top steaks ever ordered in a restaurant, so tender and perfect. Loved the cocktails. The Sheppard's Pie looked smaller than it was - very filling, even for two, if you get another plate too.  It's shredded beef and was so tender. We couldn't finish it all.  The onion soup was great - a little sweeter and less salty than the french version.  My husband wanted to add salt, but there's none of that on the table. Without reservations, we'd have waited a while. It's only steps away from the concert venue, Elton John, so perfect place for dinner if you plan to see that show. The service was good - four or five hostesses to greet you - which one do I choose. The bartender was swamped, so took a while for drinks.  The manager came by several times and walked the restaurant a lot.  The guy who dropped off our food asked if we would be sharing and offered to bring sharing plates.  I loved the initiative of that. We never had to wait for plates to be cleared - they were picked up right away.  Definitely allow 2 hours for your dining experience.  It's not a fast-food restaurant.  This is a place to come and savor your meal, the company, and the ambiance.  Nothing is rushed, which I loved.  The table was never crowded and plates weren't coming out on top of each other.  The entire staff was pleasant and enjoyable - contrary to the punk get-up.    I read the reviews prior to coming and almost went somewhere else.  Geez, you guys are hard to please.  I LOVED my experience!  it was pricey, but the special occassion warranted the splurge.  And it's Vegas.  You expect that there.  Glad I decided to take a risk and find out for myself.  I hope others can take these reviews with a grain of salt too.  My only regret was that we were too full for dessert.   Oh, also regret not ordering the deviled eggs at the bar while we waited for our reservation.  Certain menu items in the bar are not available at the table.   Will definitely go back!  Suggestion:  If you plan to have a full dinner, make reservations and request a booth or a high table.  A lot of the tables are low, better for drinks and appetizers, but not a meal.  And also request the back of the restaurant.  I also didn't like the fishbowl effect of the front of the restaurant.  Once you're well inside the restaurant, you feel more cozy and intimate.

3IgTsXZ145kYq-XV79UrZw.text: My husband and I dined at this restaurant last night while we were in Vegas and have nothing but good to say about the restaurant, the service, the food, the drinks and most if all the compassion of all of the staff that were working last night.  We had a very unusual experience and the entire staff came together to help us out.   It was our last night and we wanted to ensure that we dined at one of Gordon Ramsay's restaurants before returning home. We are huge fans of Gordon Ramsay.  We had just selected our food and drinks when my husband had a sudden nosebleed and had to leave to go to the washroom.  The drinks came.... I placed our order........the food came.......I tried to eat  my chopped pub salad (which was delicious).....and my husband still wasn't back.  Our server VERY discretely asked if everything was ok and when I explained the situation he offered to go check on him.  He alerted his Supervisor who also discreetly offered assistance.  After 45 minutes, when the medical situation was under control we thanked our server and as we were getting ready to leave the Manager also came by to ensure that everything was under control before we left.  The restaurant was very busy but the Manager spent considerable time to make us feel comfortable and valued.    Everyone in this establishment went above and beyond during a very busy time.  Gordon Ramsay should be very proud of his staff (in addition to his great food)!!!!!  We will definitely return when we are in Vegas next year.

VtjzbedZs7lZEWCsGu_aOw.text: The spotted dick served here is great, along with the horseradish and garlic ketchup. I usually don't put a lot of stock into the ketchup, but this unique blend was phenomenal.

ecsUlVdMkxG44sos-2Qd9w.text: I had the lobster rolls which was technically an appetizer. Very good! Bread was drenched in butter. My only complaint was it was 2 rolls the size of your index finger for $18. When you haven't ate at all that day and it is 4pm that was kind of a rude awakening. Had to get a slice of pizza from another joint a few hours later. But, the food was very good.

TQy8MtIZgzAkj7tLcCRwXw.text: This restaurant rocks. Best calamari and Ramsay tonic ever! Randy took care of us and we will be coming back for more!!!

tua5bkKA-j83DqcidOxKpw.text: Went to Gordon Ramsey Pub about 6 months ago. I was not overly impressed, but thought I would try it again. I am in Vegas often and was looking for a decent casual place. Mini burgers were dry and cold. Lobster Mac and Cheese was good, but not great. I told the waitress of my burger complaint and she did not seem interested.   Apparently the standard that Chef Ramsey has on his television shows are not the same in his restaurants. It seems to me if you put your name to something and profess excellence, it should be excellent; not just alright.

eYK980s4ogK5o7DVLEVCag.text: We walked up, were told a 45 minute wait, then were seated in 10 minutes. So far so good. Our waiter was..enthusiastic, to say the least. Regardless, we got our beers (HIGHLY recommend Innis & Gunn) within 5 minutes of ordering, which was quick considering there were no empty tables. The food came about a half hour later. The fish and chips were excellent- great flavor, crisp, and hot as they should be served. Based on the food and beer alone, I'd give 5 stars.  Unfortunately, this place is dishonest in marketing. Signs everywhere in the hotel advertised happy hour Monday-Friday 2-5PM in the bar. We went at 4:40PM in the bar, yet we were told no happy hour existed for that Friday due to the 4th of July weekend. Don't advertise happy hour when you're not having it. It's sad this restaurant wanted to rake in even more profits and didn't let people enjoy beer at a lower price to celebrate the weekend. 3 stars.

f2_oNe00GXlPDj8PK20m_A.text: Updated to a 3-star for the prompt response from the restaurant manager who promised to look into the service we received that night, extended his apologies, as well as an invitation to try them out again... I look forward to taking up on his offer when I'm in LV next.

TPwasYImPuqixf4ygpOQiQ.text: I would say the food was very good. On par with one of my fave pub places in LV - Todd English's at Aria -- and the thing that made it 5 stars was service.  Ate at the bar.  Very friendly but not overbearing staff and quick food.  Though quick the shrimp cocktail was crisp and cold and just enough bite in the sauce and the steak was done perfectly.  The fingerling potatoes were a welcome small side to the good size steak.  Fed recommend if you are at Caesars.

7pNAE6zvZFqB61XUi1fh1w.text: Fantastic food, on par with anything vegas has to offer. The 'authentic English Pub experience' is no-nonsense quick service and seriously tasty offerings! The dining area does sort of have a pub feel with sports games showing and a lively but not terribly loud environment. My wife had the salmon on our visit, I went for the ny strip; both were really fantastic but the star of the show was our appetizer: the kettle chip nachos which we shared but still had some to take home. The beef on those was simply melt in your mouth delicious, instantly one of my favorite dishes ever!

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Kettle Chip Nachos

D1uR3kO3MF_nb2AZxuRL9Q.text: This is one of my favorite places to eat in Caesars Palace. The service is always good and the place is decorated in a manner that gives you a True "pub" feeling. I'd recommend the scotch egg, onion soup, the wedge (it's unlike any other) and their Bloody Mary. Their fish n chips are excellent as well. If I go into Caesar's I eat here, always.

QOoqSDEDmoyxpQxYToCdpg.text: Definetly went 24 hours to heaven and back! No, a camera crew didnt show up with Gordon Ramsay. Instead, I had an awesome meal. I had a Beer Braised Chicken and it was amazing! The chicken tasted amazing with the sauce and beans. I would deffinetly reccomend this restaurant to anyone going to Vegas. Hells Kitchen overbooked? Then come here and get an unforgettable meal, you wont regret it trust me.

7gJnppYub-gzXIttI0kC9g.text: Gordon Ramsay strikes again!!  We got here and the place was packed.  We had a reservation, which was a smart move because we practically walked right in.  I had to have the fish and chips since he is always talking about them.  She had Butter Chicken Curry.  And I'll just say that the fish and chips was actually the best I've ever had!  Her chicken was incredible as well.  Not all hype!  And here, the service from Chris was spot on!  From his drink selections to the menu recommendations, this place is a winner!

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States

TkE4TQj5TbfC2trXDL6lOw.text: It was great lunch with nice server Chris P. We were not that much hungry so we shared the hell's kitchen burger and truffle fries. It was perfect portion for us.

0WUHrxDaCa7SSsWPtLq04Q.text: I have been here twice and and was not disappointed one bit. From their great staff service to their DELICIOUS food, I definitely recommend stopping by for a meal.

FA5fIcFeejnGWddR2S4ktg.text: We ate here because it was convenient and we were starving on a late Sunday afternoon after checking in to our room at the Caesars.  We had the following:  Wings:  a lil' greasy, but good Sliders:  good Truffle fries:  good  The hostess and our waitress were both very pleasant.  And the food came out quickly.  I wouldn't hesitate to go back for a quick meal and/or drinks.

op4J_QfQ9wyM6s3AWI23GA.text: We came here on a Friday night with a reservation and were seated within minutes. I was lucky enough that beef Wellington was a special for the night and it lived up to the reputation!! My husband got the wings and loved them too. Service was so friendly and professional. But... oh my god!!!! The toffee pudding was absolutely amazing!! Like heaven on a plate!

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States

BxdbiVFM_Qsi1FLqvElo0A.text: This place is awesome. Got to meet Chef Christina, Chef Ramsay's prodigy. She signed a board for me and gave me their specialized silverware to go with it. Generous and awesome. I'm a huge fan of Chef Christina. The food? No question, the best burger I ever had.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chef Christina Wilson came down signed the board for me and threw in the silverware for free. She is awesome.

j2yzy4C1kzZGoIrGpkUCvw.text: Set menu as part of a large group but nothing was well executed. Caesar salad was very  bland, curry and rice wasn't seasoned and creamer brulee (vanilla tart) was over cooked. Pretty crap for any restaurant but an embarrassment for Ramsay who usually enforces better standards. Go to his fish and chip shop instead, which was awesome...

i1nVbrdt3uIoE93wbQyRng.text: I had the fish and chips here. It was pretty good however the mushy peas were an odd pairing. Overall, not a fan for the price.

DVzL1A7JuIlyNRXk_LzB1Q.text: Finally made it to Gordon Ramsay's third Vegas restaurant- it seems to be the least favorite based on the ratings but I still had a solid experience with Bethany E. Server uniforms are fun, as are the little decorative touches like the custom cutlery. Dining room is much larger than it appears from the outside.  KETTLE CHIP NACHOS: huge portion of house-made kettle chips topped with corned beef, short rib, and English cheddar cheese. Definitely a shareable portion, in terms of size of the dish and how well the flavors worked together. MAINE LOBSTER & SHRIMP ROLL MINIS: Two cute little rolls packed with shrimp and lobster salad. This version is way better than those served at the Phillips Seafood nearby. Generous amount of lobster and perfectly toasted, buttered rolls. GRILLED LAMB BURGER: Yes, it's as good as other reviews say. Lamb was cooked perfectly medium, topped with curry onions (flavor was subtle) and a thick layer of goat cheese and feta spread. The burger itself was so good, we barely touched the side of fries- even though they come with a delicious garlic aioli that I couldn't get enough of.    Heads up, the menu seems to change pretty frequently and many of the dishes mentioned and shown in previous reviews are no longer available so don't get your heart set on any one thing. Service checked in on us frequently but didn't go over any specials and didn't seem up the same standards as at the other restaurants. Would come back to try the fish and chips or one of the pies.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lamb burger
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Maine lobster and shrimp roll minis
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Kettle chip nachos with short rib

LXhA1u2beWBVgmY5Yej0pg.text: Very British menu so might not be the best for a mixed group. We enjoyed most of the items we ordered. The braised short rib and the steak and ale pot pieces our fav... oh and the nachos... well not really nachos but great!!

Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States

PU5RXTIsVH6IE1N7IJd5Ig.text: Located across from Caesars Colosseum, it's the perfect place to grab a bite before seeing a show.  A friend and I were planning on seeing a show there Saturday evening.  We both thought it would be a good idea for an early dinner.  I wasn't sure what the crowd was like so I made reservations just in case.   We were greeted and seated immediately.   As the hostess was walking us to our table, that was the point I noticed how large the place really was.  There is an abundance of seating throughout.  Scott was our waiter for the evening.  He was attentive and friendly.    With Yelp friends like Stefany, we can order and split items.  We decided on the Grilled Lamb Burger with fries, Lobster and shrimp rolls and Kettle Chip Nachos.  All delicious and tasty!  Here's the low down:  The kettle chip nachos had a decent amount of tender short ribs scatter about topped with an English cheddar cheese.  The house made kettle chip was delightfully crunchy and sturdy to hold the nacho toppings.    The lobster & shrimp rolls were also a hit.  They had a light lemon zest already blended in the lobster & shrimp mix.  This little brioche sandwich is delectable.    The Grilled Lamb Burger was probably the highlight for me.  Grilled perfectly, this burger was juicy and full of flavor.  The goat & feta cheese spread really clinched the blue ribbon.  BUT WAIT! The accompanying french fries are served with a garlic aioli that is to die for! Phenomenal.  I wanted to take a to go bowl of that home but I think that was frowned upon.    G.R. has once again impressed me with his menus and food.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Kettle Chip Nachos
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Maine Lobster &amp; Shrimp Roll Minis

nVfP1v6SewYszpH1tHzRHg.text: The food was perfect and tasted as described on the menu. Service and ambiance was good. Overall had a great experience!

XzTQtf72rzcDx1FnsX4Mhw.text: Rodney was amazing! Had great recommendations and celebrated service! I got the Mac and cheese and it was very good, along with the lemonade which was awesome! Had great experiences here and at Hell's Kitchen on this trip! Definitely would recommend!

B40KJk6aWO_1nZhRmSsW1g.text: Staying at Caesar's and wanted to try this place. Located across from the Forum it is very convenient to get to. Place was busy so glad we made reservations. Started with the lobster/shrimp roll...very nice on a buttery roll...sorry no picture. I ordered the braised shortribs and my sister ordered the steak and ale pie. Both were very tasty and presented nicely. The carrots were a bit on the hard  side.  Pie dough not as flaky as we hoped, but tasty. Food came out a little slowly. This is a noisy place (which is ok if you expect it) with TV screens showing the current football game and everyone seated fairly close to one another but not too close that you can over hear each other. I used my free sticky toffee pudding dessert from Yelp..thanks Yelp and my sister got the apple tart.  The pudding was definitely sweet but a nice light cake that comes with ice cream and a side of caramel. My sister's tart came with a scoop of salted caramel ice cream which was very good. The tart itself was ok. Again the pastry was a bit on the tough side. If staying at the hotel again will definitely be back...next time I'll try the fish n chips, they looked amazing. Service was very nice as well.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Apple Tart with Caramel Ice Cream
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sticky Toffee Pudding
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Steak and Ale Pie

RkuEnjzweNv_cJf59_aTCA.text: I stopped in and had the most amazing Irish Coffee created by bartender Matt.  First off he treated the drink as if it were an art form. He made the whipped cream right there at the bar. I told the people there to be prepared as I was going to advertise this Irish Coffee. Stop in and let me know what you think yum!  Everyone was super nice.  It was a random guess my logic was that a UK themed pub would most likely have a good Irish coffee.  Plus it gave me a much needed boost of energy.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States

14ggJbN7nBMI4C5Ck32BRQ.text: Over-priced pub food with a celebrity name. Fun theme, varied menu, and great service but only so-so food.   We love all things Gordan Ramsey, just not sure if this is an accurate highlight of his talents.   The butter chicken curry is supposedly one of the star dishes which takes four days to prepare. While the chicken was tender and the curry was decent, the basmati rice was actually one of my favorite parts of the dish. The naan was a pretty charred (which the boyfriend actually loved... Me, not so much) and the yogurt tasted like it was just plain yogurt with a bit of citrus.  I'd take lower-quality Indian buffet food over this for a fraction of the price.   The charcuterie board came with slightly more than a single serving of each item and the cheeses of the night were a Cabot cheddar (wait, can't I get a while block of this at the store?) and what I think was a drunken goat cheese... Something that sounded oddly close to a featured cheese they had at Trader Joe's the other day...   Over all not impressed. Kind of a let down for such a big name. What a gimmick.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The recommended chicken curry. Tender but it really didn&#39;t meet my celebrity chef expectations...
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. A big eh for a lot of $.
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Menu. Nice ambiance.

m4rc0hLc_OWZUqKCf7qt2g.text: Excellent food combined in a relaxing atmosphere!! As much as we love going to all Gordon Ramsay restaurants, we especially enjoyed our experience at his Pub & Grill. It has all the high standards we have grown to expect at his restaurants, but a welcoming, relaxed atmosphere.  Our meals were superb!  Best fish & Chips ever!! Same with the curry chicken & yellow rice.

Szw1mDYVHdG6l1uIv6g2ww.text: I was actually surprised.... And pleasantly so! Taking in a show at Caesar's, we decided to hit Ramsey's place. Great pub feel and they were introducing many new items on the menu. We tried the fish and chips..... Best we've ever had. Light/fluffy and very tasty. We also had the pork chops that had good flavor and cooked perfect.   The service was good. Different than what I expected.....but in a good way. Friendly and engaged..... Even saw the manager having fun with the guests.  Yes its Vegas expensive, but overall, a great stop'

El8YW2l1fI-5-H3Hao4t3A.text: Chef Ramsay needs to be scolded as what he does on the TV show... Worst food to eat...Good to Take a picture but definitely not to eat... Yelp didn't allow me to choose 0 star..else I might have opted it..

m3BQyicEuV03Xtugdp9OQA.text: Went there for the first time on my birthday and was not at all impressed. Gordon Ramsay needs to come back and monitor the quality at his restaurants. I had fish and chips for $30 and the mushy peas were so full of mint I gagged, the fries were tasteless and the fish was just okay. The only saving grace was the Sticky Toffee Pudding, that was good.

i88SjbKlb_DOk70ATMwXrA.text: I have eaten at this restaurant before and everything was spot on, not so much on this trip.  We ordered several appetizers, deviled eggs, pork rinds and "crispy" brussel sprouts to start.  All were delicious, the brussel sprouts flavors were good but they were in no way crispy!   We were not half way through our apps when the entrees came out.  We commented to the expeditor that we were still working on our appetizers, he shrugged and said sorry...and walked away.  The Lamb Burger ordered was very good, no complaints but the Fish and Chips, the chips were just barely warm and soggy but the fish was hot, fresh and delicious.  We did notice that other tables that had apps also had their meals come out before they were half finished with their first course.  I am not sure if management was trying to turn tables quickly but the entree coming out before it should is one of my pet peeves!  We finished with the Chocolate Triffle, it was delicious.  Please, please don't rush the meal and check with Chef Ramsey on how to make a proper chip!

YHr1sKrssBTV9-HWjdfoLw.text: --3.5 stars-- My first time at a Gordon Ramsey establishment. In all fairness, I was overly excited for this opportunity owing to the fact that I have been watching Ramsey on a number of TV programs for some time, and he is hands down my favorite celebrity chef. That being said, I was a bit disappointed that after an hour long wait for a table, it took another ten minutes after being seated to even be approached by a waitress, upon which we finally received water and a drink menu. I had the scotch egg appetizer and the mussels and clams, both of which I thought were delicious. I was surprised by the heftiness of the mussel plate...I'm guessing there was at least 2 lbs. of shellfish on there. Overall, good pub food, but service needs a bit of work.

9wEvALhsjq04Ng2dwLTVtw.text: Loved this spot.  Grabbed some dinner and ordered  A LOT of food (we had a tough time deciding).  Beautiful and funky decor with an energetic atmosphere.  We would even go back for the great cocktails and an app/dessert.  Our server was great as well.  All in all it did not disappoint!

Zj7ByTfkSPysWITU2g2Nlw.text: I recently visited Gordon Ramsay Pub in Caesars Palace after having a positive experience two years ago.  As a Celiac I am always in search of SAFE dining experiences.  Boy was I ever HORRIBLY DISAPPOINTED with both the service and the menu.  I was told by the hostess that they did indeed have a gluten free menu, however when I asked for the GF menu at the table I was told the gluten free menu was "not up to date" -- which in short meant "non-existent".  Food that should be "clean and free of gluten" had added gluten (the shrimp for shrimp cocktails is poached in beer).  The waiter pointed out in a snarky manner that I could eat "most" of the beef (steak) selections and salad; his attitude was visible wth slumped shoulders and short, snippy sentences.  Not one single chicken item was a safe choice.  I finally just stood up and said I could eat Salad ANYWHERE.  I left and I will not be back although I stay at Caesars 4-5 times per year. The waiter finally realized when I stood up that I was angry and I did make my comments heard by the surrounding tables.  I don't think Gordon Ramsay realizes that Celiacs AND THEIR FAMILIES will not dine where it is not safe for the entire family to eat.  We went directly to Mesa Grill where I was treated with respect and offered many appealing GF food items.  The chef and manager assured me in person that they knew what they were doing.  And the food was scrumptious.    Bad, bad, bad experience--Celiacs and gluten sensitive folks beware of Gordon Ramsay establishments.

xgp4twmxwCRRqKE_Ok8IAw.text: Epic! I've been here twice and it's one of my absolute favorite places to eat. I ADORE the corned beef brisket sandwich, the pretzels with home made mustard, the lobster rolls, and the steak and ale pie. The pub crawl cocktails is spectacular. Both times I've been here the service has been above and beyond what one could possibly expect, with Scott being an exceptionally cool server who was honest (no to the lobster mac n cheese and steering us to the shepherds pie) . I'm afraid to over-hype this place, but I really can't say anything really bad about it. It's not cheap, but they use real ingredients and you're not going to leave hungry. Sometimes quality food costs more, and let's be real here, Gordon Ramsay is a name brand so there has to be a mark up. I definitely recommend eating your heart out here!

aPxuzw2WOmRYDzlGHS1HlA.text: Great food, but it was a little pricey. The goat cheese burger I had was phenomenal and the only reason I wasn't upset with the price was because I was up at the tables. Their fries are also great, I love shoe string style. Another part of their menu that was unique was their cocktails. I had a cucumber gin drink that was tasty, yet strong. Granted, it was about 8$, but for Vegas prices that's about as good as it gets.   Note: I was staying at Caesar's so this place was also uber convenient for me.

6oqxKrxSMbIlYEiSYSAOgA.text: The food was very disappointing.....i had the chicken sandwich with pesto and it was so so sweet and no other taste, couldn't feel the pesto, i was not salted or peppered either. The chips that came with were so hard i almost broke my teeth eating them. My boyfriend had the lamb burger, he said it was good but not the best he had....we shared some brussels sprouts which had a tone of oil on them....very greasy.  And i ordered a  club soda and they changed me 5$....really....in most places they give it to you for free or charge you 1,2$.  I wish I could do a big scene like Ramsey does on TV and spit the chicken all over the table and say" whats this shit!!!!!". I hope you read this!!!!!

gBwSrz2cswNimJEXtRRfCA.text: I used to watch Gordon Ramsay's show, so I expected better food with better seats! Food was not good in a way that two people in our party got sick! The seats are so uncomfortable that your back will hurt even the next day! So disappointed! I don't even want to talk about the price! I wish I could give this no star.

QmqIlM2P-ifqIa1TMmxc0g.text: I was disappointed in this restaurant. I realize that it's pub food, but still. I think that, like everyone has said, Gordon Ramsay needs to come back and whip the ex Hell's Kitchen winner back into shape.   We made a reservation for 1 pm and we wound up missing one of our people. We told our waiter that we were just going to order/eat without him, and it took so long for him to take our orders.   My fiance liked the bangers and mash, the fish and chips were a little sour tasting (weird). If you go, you should order the duck poutine, that was the best thing!

87FEGRBuPRSpaMCE6wzE2g.text: By the yelp rating I really didn't know what to expect but I love Gordon Ramsay and often watch his shows (Hells kitchen and Master chef) and I can not imagine him allowing his name on a terrible restaurant so I decided to give it a try. This place did not disappoint! I had the best time and have NO complaints because the FOOD and the SERVICE was absolutely great.  If I lived in Las Vegas I would definitely be eating here at least once a week. For sure next time I'm in town I will be stopping by.

69JzKglFfdjUqPkSgoQhlQ.text: Food was not very good. Ordered the wings and the sauce was pretty bad, not good wings overall. Truffle fries were 2 out of 10, mini pub burger tasted like old dirty oily bread, and the nachos are really thick homemade potato chips that tasted like oil. Hostess made us wait 30 minutes to be seated even though there was over 20 tables available in sight. Cups and utensils were very dirty, the second set they brought was even dirtier. After waiting at the table for over 15 minutes to get service, I had to twirl my napkin over my head like a lasso to get noticed. Also, the napkin was very weird and looked like it was made from a dirty old hotel curtain.

7HoRlnDTyRX63_nRv2Ls_w.text: Stopped in Vegas for lunch on the way home from a trip and tried this place. I love Gordon so I wanted to give this a shot. We shared the deviled eggs, duck poutine and heirloom tomato sandwich. The food was fine across the board. Just fine. We each made comments sharing what we'd do differently, which made me pretty sad.   The main distraction was the terrible uniforms the staff is made to wear. Totally uggers and unnecessary, but I guess when in Vegas-style Rome...

ccW-XKvVqzug1SkoVTZ28g.text: My boss took me here for a really belated birthday lunch. I wasn't really sure if I wanted to eat here due to being overpriced and mediocre reviews, but I figured we should at least give it a chance.  For appetizer we got deviled eggs which were really good.  I got the Shepard's Pie. It was so bland. I was rather disappointed with that.  My boss got a sandwich that was essentially two giant pieces of bruschetta. She didn't enjoy that.  My coworkers got fish and chips and the beef burger. You would think the burger would be just as good as the burgers at Burgr, but it wasn't.   The service was ridiculously bad. We asked for ketchup and salt, waited forever, finally was able to flag down the waiter again and he said yeah, I'm working on it. Who says that and why would it take so long to get ketchup and salt?? Everyone was trying to eat slow, waiting for the condiments...  The desert was amazing though. I got the Potted Triple Chocolate Trifle. If I were to go back here, I would just order that desert. And maybe the deviled eggs.

wJ0xDcpscFAcwolAcH0KZQ.text: Eating here was a bit of a let-down for me, as I am used to the most delicious food and superb service in Vegas. I've been to my share of the "pubs" in town, most notably the pubs by Todd English and Michael Mina, and was expecting a similar experience.   The drinks were delicious, most notably the Pub's version of a Moscow Mule, but my food was mediocre at best. Perhaps I ordered something really random in the Pub's version of Butter Chicken with basmati rice, but the sauce was bland and way too peppery at the same time. The rice was tender and well-cooked, but so drenched in butter that it appeared yellow. Other friends ordered fish and chips, the pea soup, the sliders, and fries. The fries were soggy and limp, which was a huge letdown. Everything was else was fine, just nothing to write home about.  The atmosphere is fun, but that was probably the best part.

RQX6qiURO-sLSnvs3EMCCg.text: Very good food, and a great beer selection (though strip prices: $11 for a True size pint).  Loved the lamb burger.  One star off for overly fussy closing hours:  pints ordered and delivered at last call but then "Here are your to-go cups, get out of here: no you can't have five minutes more".  Not clear what the rush was:  spent 10 minutes finishing the drinks standing by the entrance with the to-go cups with no sign of clearing our table or any rush to really close the place.  Ah well, we were out of there, which I guess is what they wanted.  Definitely left a sour impression at a place I went to every night of my stay.  Still recommended, but not as enthusiastically as I had hoped.

ui_hkVeDlGu1tHAIKZpSJg.text: 1. They sat me right away. 2. Service was excellent.  3. Waiters made drinks on point. 4. Food came out on time. 5. Food was acctually hot. burned tounge on fries. 6. My drink never was empty. they refilled it consistantly. 7. price was decent. 8. energetic staff. 9. desert was awesome 10. lastly, fish n chip ladies and gentlemen. Fish n Chips

vloWEoW9_bdptFt5_GEsxw.text: Amazing! If you only order one thing here make it the sticky toffee pudding! Most delicious desert of all time. However, my lamb burger and truffle fries were pretty damn good as well. Delicious cocktails, and my husband said his bangers and mash were excellent.  I loved the ambiance of this pub, and our waitress was outstanding. You can't go wrong at a Gordon Ramsay restaurant.

6z-2unMsOEEAhOknlZipKA.text: My boyfriend and I decided to try something new while in Vegas and we were not disappointed. The kettle chip nachos were fantastic, left me not as hungry for dinner, but definitely worth it. My boyfriend had the burger which he said was very good, i had one of the pies which was also good (a little strong on the ale taste but still enjoyable). I ordered the brussel sprouts for a side, I'm a big brussel sprout fan, these were pretty good, I wish they were a bit more crunchy. Good flavor all around!

YGpXA7ktD2nps0vznrdH6w.text: A strong 5 stars. The food was absolutely amazing. Also, very personalized service from our waiter, Rodney. We highly recommend and cannot  wait to come back. Pricing is very reasonable for the quality. The manager, Randall, was very attentive.  You can't go wrong!!

EvaJgAoDGxxP9swcjWwS3Q.text: Another bar eat for me. Small snacks with good beer what more can you ask for! First tried the English ole onion and it was fantastic. One of my favorite soups of all time, it was prepared almost to perfection with temperature being a slight low. Cheese melted perfect and a perfect portion for a starter dish which is important. The pickle vegetables was the second starter I went with and it really hit the spot. If you are in the mood for a change but still need to watch the caloric intake this is an amazing choice

jTijPBNngoqkg0JSQDveww.text: This is an awesome spot. Second visit today in a three day stay. Ronnie at the bar is professional and personable. Great poutine and truffle fries. Also excellent drinks!!

Eyjzye9G3dZOCAyJS-ZT2w.text: The less than stellar reviews on Yelp made us very wary and lowered our expectations sufficiently much before visiting the restaurant.   We ordered the corn soup and crab salad which were both very very tasty. The fish and chips was perfectly cooked, with fries done the proper English way (not the American Mcdonalds way). It was a little weird to find green peas on the plate of fish and chips, but whatever, it worked.  Also, we told our waiter that we were sharing all 3 dishes, and he took the initiative to split all our orders. Awesome or what?  I'd say that this is authentic English pub food but at Gordon Ramsay prices.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. fish and chips
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. crab salad
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. corn soup

wOGgsma3getfvzfYv6AJ9A.text: We are locals to Las Vegas and this restaurant was a hard reminder on why we don't go to strip restaurants. Service was non existent. Server came to our table, took our order and we never saw him again until he dropped the check. No menu explaining, no restaurant story, no nothing. Your typical union environment that you can tell no one working wanted to be there.   Food was all extremely bland. I can't say it was bad but it had absolutely no "pop" in flavor whatsoever. I would expect more but given the location it's your typical get them in and get them out tourist trap mentality.   If you are a tourist reading this please try some of Las Vegas's better restaurants. Like the goodwich, Carson Kitchen, Other Mama or Glutton.

oCkS0DbBKpJj03vQMHXahQ.text: As a fan of Gordon Ramsey and a Food Network addict, I was super excited to go to Vegas and try this restaurant.  There was a long wait for our party of 9 but they put us on their wait list and texted us when our 1.5 hour wait was up.  As for the food, I thought it was good bu nothing special.  I had the Hells Burger and it was just ok.  The onion rings weren't anything special as I'd rather have a stack from Red Robbin!  Kind of disappointed given the high standards I expected from Gordon.  I won't be back.

gH5WWraClc7o5r8f5oBOAQ.text: This is unlike any Pub, it is Pub in name only but actually a Michelin Star quality high end casual dinning inside Caesar's  Palace Las Vegas. This is a massive restaurant, great environment, great service friendly staff and food well goes without saying a Gordon Ramsey standard. My wife had The Butter Chicken and I had the fish and chips. We had Scotch egg for starters and sticky Toffee pudding to end the night. It was great and we will be returning soon. I highly recommend this restaurant.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sticky Toffee pudding with Ice Cream.
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fish &amp; Chips with Mushy Peas and home made tarter sauce.
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Indian Butter Chicken, Saffron Rice, Naan Bread and Yogurt.

cSxaDcQzySL7k-z8h973Cg.text: Around 30 or so craft beers on tap, fun bartenders, terrific looking place, and some ok fish & chips. Still, Jones Wood Foundry on the UES New York does them better! Sorry Gordon.  Was here last week for a bite to eat and to catch the college hoops championship game. The bar area itself is huge with many stools to take a seat and watch the game on one of the large flatscreens hanging above. As you can imagine this place is loud and hopping being right off the main casino floor across the sportsbook area. Cool trendy design with beer kegs decorating the walls. Plenty of tables in a very open air kind of setting.   Personally, I had no problem with the service here as it was just right. I just wanted to hang at the bar with a drink and watch the game anyway. The beer selection is terrific and having Innis & Gunn on tap is a winner. Bartenders were attentive and fast with slinging the drinks. Had to try the fish & chips here, as it's one of my favs. It was just ok but I have had better. I felt the batter was just not crispy enough and lacked overall flavor that I expected. Not a bad meal, but with all the choices in town I was a bit dissatisfied.   Still, one gets the feeling that this is just another Vegas corporate chain type trendy restaurant. Not bad overall, and would come back again for a cold brew next time in Ceasars.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Eh, just ok fish &amp; chips.
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Innis &amp; Gunn on tap!

_MYe2aI9N5SYupYr5HtNvA.text: Passed by and saw Gordon's name.  I was looking forward to a nice dinner.  Everything tastes great. But they don't seem to be able to bring the food hot.   In fact , Barely warm. Sent it back so they can hear it up for me. Came back the same temperature.   how could the chicken wings not even warm? I don't get it.

BqOXnxslietnTpN6NQmd5w.text: Fantastic and very friendly service at the bar.  Lobster/crab rolls delicious ! Steak was tender , flavorful, and perfectly cooked. We will definitely return while we are here.

xySoWW1rrYB0-QYPm76oBQ.text: Awful.  I give one star because the server tried to be accommodating.  I have seen the Chef toss people out of the kitchen for putting out the awful food we were served tonight. He should yell at himself and toss himself out now.   The Fish and Chips were essentially frozen fish sticks that were saturated in oil. The same with the chicken sandwich.  My chicken Caesar was pitiful.  My daughter had a Guiness.. 3 glasses..3 flies. Disgusting.  Never again.

Z1Yb093tuFR5ZbVXtOR6jg.text: I'm very sad! Not really for me, I've already had bad experience at restaurants, but for my son. He really wanted to eat in a restaurant of his Idol Chef Gordon Ramsey so I brought him here. The restaurant was not crowded. My son ordered a Ribeye, should be an easy choice, a simple steak medium cooked. We waited almost one hour to have served a piece of hard semi carbonized meat. Nobody apologized for the long delay, no one from restaurant notice the bed quality of the Ribeye, we paid 40$ for it. After paying I had to go to another fast food to feed my son. Bad experience!

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ribeye

hSr4TfCIPInk8EGAYs7sqw.text: Hmm, I have to say that this was disappointing. Yes, I know it's pub food, but I've had much better pub food. Calamari? 2 stars. Fish n Chips? 2 stars. Kettle chip nachos? 2 stars. Everyone in my party all said, "it was "OK" pub food".  So there is your verdict: it's "OK" pub food... nothing more.

pQbhL9vly4-8g-WTvQzjfg.text: I travel to Vegas a lot for work and always stop by this restaurant.  I've always gotten in quickly - might be a different experience if you've got more than a party of one.  Highly recommend the Drunken Grasshopper, which is both delicious and heavy on the alcohol.  The shepherd's pie is another favorite.  Nice ambiance and a good amount of food.

RwyNbXJCbijubixgOX-6kg.text: I love this restaurant. The service was on point. They kept filling up my water without me having to ask. The food was delicious! The ambiance was perfect! I highly recommend this place.

oUIzHDCJkouBH5t45c-3Aw.text: Goodbye Blue Sky- Delish!  Time for some Truffle chips and Lamb burger. Don't forget the toffee pudding!

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States

sUQDBzkBIbNX6h28NXZ1Ww.text: Food is very expensive for the quality had the peppercorn rib eye steak($45)and the hells kitchen burger($21)  honestly below avg taste Carl's Jr jalapeno burger is about the exact same taste just without avocado and the rib eye steak was far exceeded by palace station cafe midnight NY steak  Service is great food isn't

0FYIwxji6rG4yYENZqYp3A.text: Haters gonna hate. Does not deserve the low reviews. Let me tell you why.   People are complaining about service and steep price point. They do know they are in Vegas right? Also, the word PUB is in the name, that literally means that it's a casual ambiance so chill the hell down.   Food was remarkable. Sister had the deviled eggs, I had the lamb burger, wife had the ale onion soup. All of which were perfect.   I love lamb. You can say you love it more but I will disagree. I don't like the actual animal, I like the meat it gives. It's juicy. It has that remarkable taste. Leaves a taste that lingers in your mind.  This lamb was cooked perfectly. Great burger. Great price. You're in Vegas. It's in the middle of the dessert. Food isn't cheap.   The ale onion soup lived up to its name and tasted like ale reduction. A fun take on the French onion soup.   Service was FANTASTIC. I wish I could remember our waitress name but she was amazing.  Side note: if you're the manager reading this, she had blonde hair and was stationed by the kitchen entrance that served the booth with 2 love seats, on 8/08 , around 4pm. Give her a high five.   - not five stars because the food won't blow you away but it will get the job done right -

PICZCrs8vr30oJvyotr7dw.text: From an outward appearance, the restaurant seemed to be a bit on the upper scale... and of course it was, if we base everything solely on price. We were greeted by 4 hostesses and one manager upon which we were seated immediately. The crowd was a mixture of people, families, business men from a local convention, vacationers. Being that this is a Ramsay restaurant we expected so much more seeing how he calls people out for the smallest things on television, but alas the food was very average. We started with calamari.. it arrived less then a minute after we ordered it? How is that even possible? The breading was just okay. The squid itself, soft as butter~ Delicious.   After finishing nearly the entire plate (more then enough for 2 people) we ordered our burgers (what we came for in the first place) one lamb burger, the taste was good but nothing spectacular and a Hell burger... to which my wife commented "Meh. I like yours better." 70 dollars later we were full, of food but nothing else too memorable. The waitstaff was pleasant and ridiculously fast. We spent a total of maybe 30 minutes in there at 6pm on a Tuesday... We didn't order drinks and the fries were some glorified version of a MacDonald's recipe. The sauce they came with was delicious though... Nothing to write home about.

Ku4RRH0d12PDxHZMWfekdA.text: What a wonderful place to eat! I was here with some colleagues for a work event and ended up eating here twice: once for lunch and once for dinner.   The ambiance is very modern pub with lots of colors and fun decor. They have lots of beer options, great Bloody Mary's and a decent wine offering.   The staff is fun and polite. Well versed in the menu options and smartly dressed in their British fare. We especially enjoyed our server, John, this evening. He was engaging, polite, and happy that we were there. We felt welcomed and appreciated.   The menus are slightly different - lunch from dinner, but all the food is good. It is well seasoned and wholly satisfying. I had the Reuben for lunch. It was huge! Very traditional, but definitely one of the best sandwiches I've ever had with buttered toasted bread and generous portions of sauerkraut and meat.  One of my colleagues had the mussels (an appetizer) for her meal. They were in a large pot and again the portion was more than generous.  The sauce was a buttery white wine sauce, very tasty.   Another colleague had the curry chicken with yellow rice. I'm not a huge curry fan, but my friend raved over the dish.  On our dinner trip, we had the Jumbo Shrimp Cocktail.  It came with 5 extremely large prawns, but even with their size they were perfectly prepared so that they weren't tough. The cocktail sauce was well balanced and had a nice horseradish flavor without being too spicy.  Then we shared the fish and chips. It is an enormous portion and the fish was well breaded with a very nice piece of fish. It was a great option.  With both meals the table shared a Sticky Toffee Pudding. It is a wonderful sweet to end the meal without being too heavy or overly sugary.   This was a great experience both in food and service. And the prices weren't too bad, for Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Curry Chicken
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fish &amp; Chips
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Reuben

FdLZUqm27PzCYutil9ewYg.text: My daughter and I enjoyed dinner tonight at the Pub & Grill. I had the Wagyu filet and Creamed Spinach, and my daughter had the Tasting Menu which is Gordon's signature dishes from Hell's Kitchen. Scallops, Beef Wellington and Sticky Toffee Cake. The food was pure heaven. I will remember this meal for a very long time. Our server, Rodney, made our culinary experience even more elevated. Rodney is the best server bar none.  He is very friendly, warm and welcoming. His knowledge of the menu and all things Ramsay was delightful. You will not be disappointed if you go here for dinner, and if you do ask to be seated in Rodney's section.

fROd4cM6PgxUaGlxtzas3g.text: I was going to watch a concert this night with a co-worker & we decided on dinner as small plates with drinks.  I'm a big fan of Gordon Ramsay and chose to come here.  The hostess we met was friendly and seated us immediately- I was worried because the place looked busy.   Our waiter Scott was smiley & friendly and took our drink order - good thing is we have our normal usual suspects for drinks.  The place setting was unique- a small wooden chopping board with leather edges where the knife and fork stayed.  After our drinks were ordered, we placed our food order.  I've been to the UK and suggested what to eat as shared small plates.  Corned beef poutine fries, shrimp plate, ale & meat pie was our choice.  The poutine fries was topped with cheese curds & strands of corned beet over fries.  So good, but it was a bit salty because of the corned beef. The serving size is just right if you're sharing this dish.  My favorite was the beef & ale meat pie. Though is was more like a meat pot pie - versus a full pie encased in puffed pastry It still took me back to England when I tried it for the first time.  Shrimp were huge and succulent & there was pretzel bread that was chewy and soft.  The whole experience from start to finish was amazing.  Scott & the rest of the waitstaff were friendly and made us feel at home.  If you're looking for pub fare with some good drinks- stop by here and enjoy a quick bite & leave with a smile.  :)

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mariah Carey 3
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Woofie
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Zapponians

YtoHgbHg4sf-fhQ0Wgap3g.text: What a pleasant unexpected trip. We really wanted to go to Gordon Ramsay fish and chips but the line was out the door. We decided to the pub and grill because they had fish and chips too.   Service was good. A little awkward. The waiter was making small talk with us before we ordered and we were so hungry we just wanted to order THEN talk. He was polite, speedy and always topped our drinks off.   Fish and chips were as tasty as ever. A bit bigger and paired with the smash peas. Not our thing as we though they tasted horrid, however that's the thing to eat in Britain.   Next the lobster Mac n cheese. Wow! Talk about cheesy and large pieces of fish. My daughters couldn't finish it all so we took it to go.   The Sheppard's pie was my favorite. The presentation was fantastic and eye appealing. The small pretzel was a nice touch, including the pots. Fresh veggies were nice and different. They didn't get eaten as my dad only eats fries. The mash potatoes on top were very creamy and flavorful. It was meaty underneath and crispy from baking.   My Ruben was delicious! The sauerkraut was perfect ratio to meat and the sauce on it was the kicker. I had promised babe half and I wished I wouldn't have. My chips I didn't like and so I ate babes French fries.   My only complaint was that I wish there was a kids menu. I like kid friendly places on the strip. Families want to have fun and eat great food too.

Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sheppard&#39;s pie, pretzel and fresh veggies.

ZEEy1OYvoeaNDG_5PgObyw.text: The food here was really good! The chopped salad was beyond my expectations! The dressing used on the salad along with the combinations of shrimp, salami, and chicken were all so delicious. The Sticky Toffee Pudding... AMAZING! It just melts in your mouth. It's so hard to describe how good it was!  My server, Rodney was EXCELLENT! He made my experience even more enjoyable! He was very attentive and super friendly!   I'd highly recommend anyone to stop by Gordon Ramsey's Pub & Grill for lunch or dinner. You'll definitely be glad that you did!!

pHLf4cj7sYpKzVgbvksWFg.text: It's Labor Day weekend, super packed so we sat at the bar. All I can say is Amazing! Was helped out by Ronnie the bartender. He kept great conversation and had advice about all the food; which we finished in all of 5 minutes. We felt very welcomed.  The food was absolutely phenomenal. Had the Pork Belly and my boyfriend had the wings. They also gave us complementary dessert ... just cause. Couldn't have been  better. Thank you soo much to Ronnie and all the staff hear. Great food and great environment! Can't wait to come.

FIJ99xL8lO1uMvPmPM3d9Q.text: The server was super friendly and sweet. She gave really great service. Helped celebrate my husband's birthday with some sticky toffee pudding which was delicious and on the house.  The Sheppard's pie was awesome one of the best I have had. Great lamb flavors. The vegetables on the side were just strange. The presentation was strange and they were bland.   The restaurant could be so much more in terms of theming. I have been to Gordon Ramsey Burger and you almost forget you are in a hotel/casino. At this restaurant, you don't really forget that, and I think it takes away from the experience.   All in all, a great choice if you want above average food on the strip.

CyXVbg3YXE_BK2QUuuS5Aw.text: Wow! Good job. What an amazing experience. If you have watched top chef then you have an idea about what I got to eat. The service was also top notch.   Ok so the food! I got the short rib kettle chips nachos. Simply put they were outstanding, the paring with the pickled peppers was shocking. The fish and chips were perfectly made. Perfect execution on the fry, and the fish was fresh.The paring with the green pees was fantastic. The bar tender paired our meal with a Scottish ale that was delicious. And to top off the end we got the sticky toffee pudding that was so tasty. I loved every minute of my visit. Bravo!!!!

oWhzgKFXQ884hQNwysKpQA.text: Loved it. Had the Gordon Ramsey feel, like u knew it would be great. The tasting menu with scallops, Wellington and sticky toffee pudding was to die for.
