btc4tiv0Rp3nUD9ounpyWA.text: Came here with a party of 10 and we were seating in about 25 minutes.   I've tried Gordon Ramsay's burger restaurant and liked it so I was hoping this restaurant would be good.  The ribeye was cooked perfectly medium but  it was a little too salty for me. It comes with a side of mashed potatoes and one carrot, asparagus, and onion. I liked that they offer 3 diff types of sauces for the steak: peppercorn, bearnaise, or house sauce which is basically their version of A1.  The burger was good, we liked the garlic aioli it comes with. The fries were kind of bland, I didn't even finish them and I usually love fries... sadly, here it was just too plain.   My friend ordered a Shepard's pie and thought it was ok, the cute little baguette it came with was really hard. Lol she even hit the table with it and it definitely sounded hard.   Would I be back... probably not. None of the food stood out to me but the service we had was excellent! Shout out to Michelle! She made us feel welcomed and always had a smile on her face.   Tip:  check in to get the free sticky toffee bread pudding. It's big and comes a la mode. It's good!

VMGxE5aLokMgss31k2Zn7w.text: Welp. It lives up to the hype.   Let's start off with the appetizer. Kettle cooked chips nachos with slow cooked ribs. God everything on this plate was delicious. I loved that the chips were from real potatoes. And the meat was seasoned so well.   Beef Wellington was amazing as well, I just wished there was more of the red wine Demi glace and more of the Wellington. The sides were a big let down though. The potatoes and veggies were nothing to brag about.   The dessert was freaking amazing. His sticky toffee pudding. My god. I thought I was so full but somehow I still found room for it cuz it was freaking heavenly. There are no words to describe this invoice.   The decor was not great though. I hated the "napkins". It literally looked like the outside of a sack of potatoes. I get it was part of the theme, but I'd appreciate proper napkins. Also, the price for the quantity? Just meh. I appreciated the experience, but idk if the quality and quantity justify the price.

cSWGu1FLEFq_TjbAoiqj2w.text: I find it overrated. Nothing special about the food. You can find better tasting food at a much cheaper price around Vegas. We don't mind paying a lot for a tiny portion if you could savor what you're paying for, but like I said, meh... Service was so slow. It wasn't that busy on a Wednesday night mid-August. After we gave our orders, it took 40minutes for our food to be brought out eventhough the place wasn't crowded. Even other tables looked bored waiting for their food. Constantly refilling our waters, I'll give them that (but only because we're thirsty waiting and waiting). I'll skip this one whenever we're in Vegas.

m2xWMZNcRynKXL2LMB20Jw.text: I love eating at Mr. Ramsay's restaurants. I just returned from Vegas and totally enjoyed stuffing myself with excellent food here at the Pub. My question to Gordon Ramsay is will you please open a restaurant in the Bay Area.  Please

Ce_j6Lp275UEML3qy1_rGg.text: First time here and we loved everything :) Great service and great food!   For our lunch we ordered the Maine lobster & shrimp roll, crispy pork belly and Hellfire chicken wings. All came out to our liking. Juicy and yummy!  Sticky toffee pudding was our dessert. It's so good, we devoured it just as fast as it came out.  Our server Rodney was very attentive and very polite. He came around just enough to check for drinks and how our food was.  Will definitely come back again and will recommend to any friends and family that will visit Caesar's Palace.

sJ0XAxTMRLv11qA9ht3P8g.text: I eat here all the time!  Best scotch egg I have ever had I usually request the same server Rodney, he is always so funny and makes every guest feel welcome and special. He introduced me to a new cocktail today, the Avon came upon Sin. Sooo good.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States

NNoq6BtgW6wEMjp7I74zoQ.text: This was my first time eating at Gordon Ramsay's Pub & Grill and I did look forward to this. We went there for late lunch so it wasn't packed. I was so excited to try one of their most popular dishes which is the Beef Wellington and they have it in all Gordon Ramsay Restaurants so I expected a glorious meal of course. My husband and I started with a tomato soup and that was good. We finished it in two minutes after having to wait for 20mins for it and it wasn't even HOT. I was gonna ask our server to at least have them reheat it but no one even checked back on us after we got it. So I just ate it because we were both starving. After another 40minutes, our entrees arrived which are the scallops and the beef Wellington. And both of them were just a disappointment. Both dishes were very dry and the Wellington tasted like blood and it arrived cold, just like the scallops. The scallops we're pretty burnt and dry, and again, we never had anybody checking on us after we got our meal. So we just didn't eat it! This was our first meal of the day given that we had such a long night, because of course it was weekend in Vegas and we were so hungry.   I tried saving my mood with a dessert and it didn't do anything as it was so mushy and just tasted weird.   So yeah. Nothing special. You can definitely get better food and better service elsewhere. There plating is good but taste is more important because you're not there to stare at your food anyway.

cPnyJj5UORKCibNx8AvPDg.text: Oh My Goodness!!! Best birthday dinner ever!!!! Absolutely NO COMPLAINTS!!!! Everything was AMAZING!!!!! My husband and I had the greatest experience that I have ever had in Las Vegas!!! The food was amazing!!! The service was amazing!!!! We had the pleasure of having Greg as our waiter and Jason as his right hand man! They were great!!! Very informative and attentive!!! We had the salmon, lamb chops, and the famous sticky toffee pudding!!!! Omg!!!! That's enough to fly to Vegas for the day!!!! I'll definitely be back!!! If they ever need a spokesperson for a commercial for this restaurant, sign me up!!!!!

x4981bweA7TIdUUFnlZlnA.text: To start things off - I'm a Brit and a huge fan of Gordon's.  I've been watching his shows for over ten years, and was excited about trying out his more casual restaurant at Caesar's.   The good:  Service was very sweet - everyone was so courteous and lovely.  A+ for hospitality.  Our bartender was the best, and took care of our food issues without so much as a blink.  The bad:  I have to say, I'm really disappointed that Gordon takes his brand so lightly.  He's a chef, and the food I ordered was sloppily presented, and criminally under-seasoned.    I got the Steak Tartare, which is probably my favourite dish in the entire world.  I get it anywhere I see it on the menu.  The tartare was served in a round on the plate - a very measly serving for $25, but worse, it was unevenly spread, making it look more like a shmear on the plate than a real dish.    The worst of it, however, was the fact that it had practically no flavour whatsoever.  That's really bad.  You don't even have to cook tartare - seasoning is literally the entire dish.  So under-seasoned tartare is just raw beef, poorly plated.   Like I said above, the staff were very sweet, and our drinks were served quickly and professionally.   But jeez... how can you be a chef's name-branded restaurant and not know how to season food?   I'm embarrassed for you.    Going to Hell's Kitchen Monday night for a work dinner.  Hopefully it's a different experience there.

PqQ1HyqZMlrtmDoLg-jpyg.text: I'm so grateful this place is open late. My colleagues and I were working an event at Caesars Palace and luckily found seats. It was a full house! Lots of people were at the bar, and everyone else was sitting at tables wrapped around it.   Everyone was eating by the time I got there, so it took some time to flag down our waiter. He was awesome, though. Always made good suggestions about beer and wine. I didn't need help with food. Once I saw the flat iron steak, it was an easy decision.  The flat iron took forever to cook, as expected, but it was worth the wait. My other colleagues stuck around to enjoy a few drinks anyways. I love that once our waiter found out one of my colleagues is really into wine, he brought out his favorite bottle and got her going.  For a Gordon Ramsey restaurant, I love the energetic yet laidback vibe. People were here either watching sports or simply hanging out. Like every other packed place in Vegas, it was quite loud, and at times I felt like I had to shout. Happy to cross off another GR spot off my bucket list. Let the culinary exploration continue!

q3JHtgPGebgbDSxisjfnXA.text: On the latest episode of Gordon Ramsay Kitchen Nightmares  Gordon visits his very on pub and grill!  The land of hour and a half wait times for food, while watching people arrive 10-20 minutes after your group get served their food.  Where mini burgers arrive immensely undercooked but deemed " it looks safe enough to eat" by management.  Calamari comes out as soggy bread.  And who knew it was possible to ruin chicken wings?  At Gordon's Pub and grill anything is possible so come on down!   Unbelievable our meal wasn't comped.  Servers and hosts were all very friendly however this review is just of the food.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. It was all terrible

Tx8TYWD_mj2HYqthmVNvgw.text: Friday 2/16 had dinner here.   Since my last review we've eaten here two more times. Each time the service has been very slow. That's unfortunate.  This time our server was Taylor. He was very personable/ accommodating yet again- service was sluggish.  We started with the wings. A little disappointed in them. We noticed they weren't as saucy?! Some of the wings (flat/ wingettes) were broken. The drumettes weren't as meaty and smaller than our prior experiences. Also, noticed one wing that was just a tip mixed into our appetizer.  Pork Belly was average. I would have preferred it to be more on the crispy side.  The Lamb Burger is outstanding. Such a simple yet amazing delight. The BEST thing on the menu in my opinion! Accompany that with the Truffle Fries which add an extra special touch to this burger meal.  Yelpers if you check in here to dine: you may get offered the Sticky Toffee Pudding. It is so moist. Perfect amount of sweet. Put the warm toffee sauce on top for the finishing touch. Delicious!

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. This was probably the best burger ever put in my mouth! Lamb burger &amp; fries!! Out friggin standing!!
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ribeye steak with Grilled Asparagus and a side salad. Pricey but good..
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beef Short Ribs &amp; Cheddar Mashed Potatoes with roasted carrots- delish!!

dAe9DGFn9lrGM2HEyNzDVQ.text: Ate here on St. Patrick's Day with my co-workers. We were able to make a reservation for a large group (10+) on Open Table and were seated quickly at a large high top. Service was ok. They were slammed (no doubt), but it took forever to get everyone's drinks to the table. They were running a special; for $20 you got a Guiness and a shot of Jameson. It was awesome and hey, Vegas price, but fun none the less.  We ordered Buffalo Wings to start and they were perfect. Not too crunchy, and a nice sauce Next were the amazing entrees. I had the Corned Beef and Cabbage special (because St. Patrick's Day!) and it was amazing. So flavorful and a healthy sizes portion. I wish I could eat that every day. Just tender and juicy...ah, so good. And with a Guiness, it was a perfect pairing. I had a bite of a lobster roll slider my co worker had, and as a native New Englander, I have zero complaints. It was lite and full of lobster the way it should be.  Service needs improvement, but the food is outstanding!

Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Corned Beef and Cabbage for St. Patrick&#39;s Day

I knocked off a star for the "warm and salty pretzel". It was luke warm and hardly salty. The mustard was good but cheese sauce was meh. Happy hour prices were fair for a casino.

vHl5M92KwFiwiwDVwMTjRA.text: If you're looking for the famous food but don't need the gimmicks of Hell's Kitchen, definitely come here! The 3 oz. Beef Wellington is offered for lunch as a combo with the sticky toffee pudding. The dinner combo comes with scallops and a 6 oz. cut instead. The service is top notch. The food is so, so good. Save room for the sticky toffee pudding!

PTdAtSwoy2-hwepXapmH9Q.text: Soooooo... truth be told, we really wanted to go to Bobby Flay's Mesa grill, (oops)! They closed from 3-5; so we stumbled upon this establishment. Considering it was a fish n' chips typa place, that's exactly what we ordered.   My fish was pretty cold though :(... it came out with a ton of fries, and some sort of pea mash. In order to enjoy the pea mash, one must fancy fennel! The taste of fennel was very overpowering. Probably wouldn't yearn to go back here on future trips, but still gave 3 stars bc the flavor was good despite the temp of the food.

cxeK5lJqrpVrnQTGAKx-Sg.text: Again as in the ramsay burger a lot of waiting time for my food, but great wagyu and mc and cheese, the fish and chips is not what I expected, and the steak and ale pie is of a regular flavour.

bCsQj9iNPvh6Cc38sv_HRQ.text: We stopped through here as part of our Gordon Ramsay owns every restaurant within two blocks tour. This place looks great as you are walking through Caesar's Palace with a classic pub look including kegs upon kegs all over the place.   We just had some drinks but the bartender Keith was outstandingly helpful with explaining the brews and mixed drinks. He seemed to have a deep brewers knowledge about how things were made and the notes to be expected in a drink. As part of the Yelp check-in here we got a free Sticky Toffee Pudding which was very different then most desserts I've had and delicious to boot. I would recommend a stop by here for atleast a drink or 2 to check out the cool atmosphere. I'm sure the food has some good notes as well.

FS55aQdsj52i2mBRPDMQGA.text: It was our first time eating at a Gordon Ramsey's restaurants. We were very excited and the place totally lived up to the expectation. We had the famous Beef Wellington and the Salmon. Both were great especially the beef was very soft and well seasoned. Adam, our server, took great care of us too. Would def come back to try other stuff on the menu!

jl4fM0mOUGjok-h8VvXpDA.text: We came here before a show...and I have to say it was one of the best dining experiences we have ever had.  Before i rave about the good stuff, the only downside is it's loud. However the meal and service made us not mind at all.    The food was exceptional. Between the 4 of us, we had soup,  mac and cheese, lobster, prime rib and bone in rib eye. All of it was served hot, well cooked with a nice presentation. For dessert, the mint chocolate cake and sticky toffee pudding were the perfect end.  The service was superior. Of special note, when packing up leftovers,  one of the meals was accidentally thrown away. They ended up making our friend a whole new meal. Thank you Joe, the general manager, for stopping by to chat and for a great experience!!

4-bO9KM39u55zYeLEQ9tWw.text: As my first time in Vegas, eating at as many Gordon Ramsay restaurants was a must and this one was a great choice. Between the Belgian Margherita, the macaroni and cheese, and the Shepherd's Pie I honestly could not pick a favorite part of my meal.  Complemented by the service, this will be a long time memory that remains close to heart and stomach.   All I can say is bring your appetite, because you will be getting plenty to eat.

wTuOzE2qiQ7fGGz4bvc2vA.text: Dry and I mean dry no flavor cheeseburger  A total fail  I was looking forward to try this place when I find out is one of Gordon Ramsey's place but I think Gordon needs to go back and remake this item I hope he can read this comment and do something about he's cheeseburger with abocado  The service at this place sucks and for the price not worth It if you want to have a great burger go to guy fieri's restaurant at the linq The best burger ever Sorry Gordon but you have some work to do at this place  Also try the spicy wings not so good you can find better at winstop any day  For 2burgers and the most flavorless fries $80 not

9fmQT4onbvArV4G1eQtHXw.text: Great pub food with a touristy marketing target Americanized, expensive, portioned, formula based idiot proof and accessible.     Great fun   Greatness on a compromised plate  Worth a visit  No doubt... bottingtons  guinness

nK44nI8iWIvzwWa_naQ5SA.text: Soooooo good, the servers were very attentive, food was delicious. Don't forget to order the sticky toffee cake! Would be a waste if you don't try order it. Can't really find it anywhere.

4PK3rSTEae4vHuoN8UGgJA.text: For a restaurant based on a television personality, this place is amazing. The atmosphere is just prefect, and while it sits right outside the slot machines at Caesar's, once you are inside you feel like you are in a pub, hanging out with friends.  We started with the chicken wings on the recommendation of our waiter, and they were divine, along with the Mac and cheese (which was good but not earth-shattering), and them the Short-Rib, paired with a delicious cherry beer that he also recommended.    You guys. The short rib. It was one of the best pieces of meat I've ever had in my life. It fell apart in our mouths, and paired with the gravy and the mashed potatoes, it was heaven. We both moaned our way through it.  So...highly recommended: Short Rib with a side of the chicken wings.  We finished it all off with the Sticky Toffee Pudding, and that ALSO made us make unholy noises as we were eating it.  It was a great meal, and not too expensive, seeing how it is Vegas.  The vibe was relaxed, but the food was divine.

KTmoTrPC1O56oBL8CWCtyw.text: 5 stars! We were able to sit in the bar with no wait on a Saturday. The bartender, Keith was so welcoming and attentive. He also provided great  recommendations for the food and drinks. Cocktails were on point, delicious and strong. I ordered the Beef Wellington, one of Ramsay's signature dishes and it was beyond amazing. Perfectly seasoned and melts like butter. Everything on the plate was perfect. Also, got to use a Yelp coupon for a free sticky pudding. Soooooo yummy! Definitely recommend, even though its pricey, it's worth it.

If you manage to save room for dessert, I recommend the sticky toffee pudding, I cannot even find the words to tell you just how delicious it is. We'll definitely be back the next time we're in Vegas.

xjfodGHP3OwD_W-63m6fAQ.text: This is my favorite place in Vegas to come eat.  I have to come here regardless of time, or other places around.  We have eaten the shepherd's pie, short Ribs, the kettle chips, and the ribeye.  Not a single complaint.  I absolutely adore the shepherd's pie.  It is my must have.  Everything is just so yummy.  I wish I could eat 2 servings when I come here lol.  The service is always wonderful and quick, friendly and kind.  My servers Sarah and Scott were amazing!  They were on top of keeping drinks refilled, checking in and offering suggestions.  They were a great representation of the restaurant along with friendly and fun.  I have nothing negative to say about this restaurant.  Make this a stop when you are in the area.  You won't regret it.  You'll come back over and over. QQ9f7F0M1HHPKfr1xe6Zzg.text: I have come to expect great things from Gordon Ramsay restaurants. While the food was still the star of the evening the service left a lot to be desired. I made a reservation for Friday night Nov. 2 at 10:15 pm after the Celine Dion show, but was moved to a second line after checking in with the hostess. It was busy however there were plenty of empty tables available. So after waiting in our second line we were seated in the back corner of the restaurant where we found ourselves ignored by our waiter. The nice lady serving our water was diligent but that seemed to be the only one on her game. Once we ordered (the braised short rib for me and fish and chips for my wife) the food arrived quickly. It was amazing and consistent. It appeared the table next to us was having the same experience we were do the apologies from there waiter. As we waited, and waited and waited after finishing our plates we decided to skip desert to avoid and additional long wait for the sticky toffee pudding that our neighbors just had. Then to top it all off my waiter gave me someone else's check, I'm glad I was paying attention! I'm not sure if a big crowd caught them off guard or if they were just understaffed for that day but I expect only amazing things from any restaurant that bares the name Gordon Ramsay. I hope that they can fix these issues and return to greatnesses.

hWx_pY32CTaEhtACbyad1A.text: Excellent food. Loved the nachos. Nong was super helpful and suggested the best food. The steak tartare was so good so was the lobster Mac and cheese. Definitely check it out.

sWAKpRs65GgdoMppwZozEQ.text: Oh lord, where should I begin? It was my first try in a Gordon Ramsay restaurant, and I was thrilled to share my 26th birthday with the high quality of food provided. It got pretty busy at any casino, especially the one in Caesars Palace. However, when you stepped into Pub and Grill, it seemed like you were in a different world. It is spacious, fun, English driven dining area. It gives you enough privacy to establish a conversation among your group without feeling the rush in Vegas. I am still extremely happy with the food, dining place, and service overall at the place. And I cannot wait to return to Pub and Grill as well as trying other Ramsay restaurants in Vegas!

xNztw12U1OepZt6Mf0ngag.text: Came here to celebrate a coworker birthday while we were in Vegas for a conference. The ambiance and design of the restaurant is cool and open. Our service was amazing. Daisy took care of our table and provided excellent service despite our large party and special requests. I ordered the bacon cheeseburger, with truffle fries. There is an additional cost- but totally worth it. My coworker ordered the beef rib plate and other people at the table ordered the fish and chips. Everyone reported that the food was delicious. My boss even claimed that the burger was the best burger he's ever had. I have to agree. The brioche bun was light and toasted. The beef patty was thick and delicious, and cooked to order. I added the truffle fries, and enjoyed every delicious savory bite. The presentation of the plates and meals was great and all the food was flavorful. Our server provided great service and the whole dining experience was awesome.

B9kIogM1ljSAq0k9tR-1hw.text: Gordon Ramsay your pub sucks. Customer service is shit. You should not be on television for a while criticizing other people's restaurant until you fix your shit first. I like your shows but you need to get this place together. I am a huge fan of your other restaurants but this one is not cool. I got puked on by some drunk jackass

hKL9GbhgTz4wyD5xSX2RfA.text: We were staying at Caesars and decided to grab a quick early dinner with our family who were going to rush off to the airport after dinner.   We ordered the pub bites including the mac and cheese, the cheesy bread (cheese sauce with tomatoes and rye bread?), and the salmon toast.  The salmon toast was pretty good with a crispy toast paired with salmon.  The cheesy bread was horrible.  The bread was cold and too thick and it just didn't go well together with the lukewarm cheesy sauce and a tomato slice.  The mac and cheese was fair.  I like mac and cheese but it wasn't exceptional.    For the main course, we ordered the bangers and mash, along with the shepherds pie.  The shepherds pie description was lamb stew with root vegetables.  In my mind, I thought I thought I was going to get chunks of lamb like in a stew, but when it came, it was just ground lamb, like meat in a regular shepherds pie except it was lamb.  It had a good strong lamb taste so I was fine with it.  But I expected more because it was Gordon Ramsey's shepherd pie.  The bangers and mash was cold and we didn't appreciate it.  We just thought Gordon Ramsey would be yelling if he was there trying his food.    We checked in with Yelp, so we got a free toffee pudding.  The descriptions said it came with almond brittle but it didn't.  When it arrived the waiter poured the butterscotch sauce on top.  It was good, but started getting sweet because it was too much sauce for us.  Would have appreciated it if he didn't pour the sauce or if he poured less.  But it was free so we still appreciated it.    My husband said we should have tried Hell's Kitchen instead, but we thought since we were eating an early dinner and we weren't that hungry yet, so that's why we decided on the pub.

GnTBIf2SfN90y1Y1bGIWuA.text: Wonderful place! Up to Gordon Ramsay exacting standard for sure! Food is great and service is awesome! Ask for Rodney, he is a high quality server!

1omWJyOh7o7HdvfskhOw1g.text: The food was good, the service was great, but nothing was exceptional.   The menu is very limited so consider checking it out before you head in. Maybe the name "Gordon Ramsay" attached to the restaurant title raised my expectations a little, but overall I wasn't that impressed. I ordered a cheeseburger that came with fries and it was definitely good and satisfying but this isn't a place I would choose to come back to.  The only way to get in to this restaurant is to be a cardholder for Caesar's Entertainment. Otherwise, the wait is always very long. H5zthfTeqxuXQLTx4VdEkw.text: Excellent service and food. Everything sounded good so my friend and I ordered several appetizers to share. I loved the Scotch Egg but my friend and I agreed the mini Lobster Rolls were outstanding! Our sever didn't mind at all. I did order a drink recommended by our server that I was told would be sweet but it was more bitter. The sever saw I wasn't happy with it and offered a different drink instead. EbM-aOsYmsHtfJ2yDmO_FA.text: Absolutely loved the food. We ordered bone marrow, truffle fries, nachos with meat on the side, onion rings, Mini corn dogs and the lobster and shrimp rolls.   The service was amazing as our waiter was very attentive.   Reasons for the 3 stars; I was extremely annoyed at the white, heavy set host at the front. Mainly because he sat the white people who arrived AFTER my party and had the nerve to tell me "someone will get to you"   Point is, we arrived first so we should have been seated first, despite the volume of people or the foot traffic. And the fact of the rude response I received is what really turned me off and almost made us turn away. The other hostess however was a sweet heart.   The waiter did change my mind, but that does not defeat the fact that we rudely were passed up.   How do you tend to someone who had just walked up even though I was there before their party?   They're really lucky I didn't get ratchet up in there, because I'm not afraid to let shit be known when shit is being done wrong.   Overall, food was good and my wait service was great but I definitely do not want to walk into an establishment, wait patiently for my turn to be seated and then be passed up by a group of white men and it just so happened that the host who sat them also a white man.   Step ya game up honey, that shit is not cute and you know dam well I was pissed.

UnA2K7t3ap0hEoTdGnRYcA.text: A complete waste of money! That's my take away from this establishment. Now whether Ramsey's sticks his name on this restaurant or he actually owns and runs it, there comes a time when the hype needs to live up to the fact and this restaurant clearly missed the mark. We ordered the fish and chips. What I got was two pieces of dry over cooked inedible clumps of white fish, accompanied by the 'hand cut' chips that were just too prefect in size and shape to be hand cut. The mushy peas were seasoned too heavily with mint so that all I was tasting was 'mushy mint'. When I asked my server about it I was told in a very derogative way that, 'this is how we do it here'. Well if thats the case, you are doing it wrong. And I know it's Vegas, but where do you get off by charging $11 for a Coors Light, and the glass was not even full! In the end I paid $30 per plate for bland tasteless food, lackluster service and an experience I will not forgot because of how bad it was.

1M-Aaa10COzZV9PvKBg8mQ.text: Gordan Ramsay should consider featuring this restaurant on his show Kitchen Nightmares. At some moments, I thought there must be secret cameras filming my exasperating experience for the sake of entertainment and reality TV. But alas, it was just an unintentionally underwhelming dining experience.  I ordered the beef burger, and it was delicious. Juicy, huge, well seasoned and cooked as I requested, medium. Served with ketchup and garlic aioli on a soft bun, it was decadent, rich and meaty, everything one would need after a night out in Vegas. However delicious, I found it to be extremely plain. No options for toppings or anything could have offered some freshness. Just a meat patty, bun and bacon. I can't say it was worth the over $20 price tag for a burger alone. The accompanying fries were nothing special. The fish and chips were good, but extremely oily. I loved that they were huge, thick chunks of fish, and the batter was crispy and flavorful. But just a little too greasy for my taste.  Service is undeniably what put a damper on our experience. Our food took an eternity to come out. The two tables next to us were seated, ate their meals, and even paid their bill all in the time it took for our party of six to receive our food. When we asked for the check, it took an eternity for our credit cards to be processed. Most of our meal was spent anxiously waiting, either for the food, drink refills, and finally, the bill. There was no sense of urgency, and the restaurant was less than half full.  For a restaurant of Gordon Ramsay repute, the service was baffling. I wish he were there to scream at the chef and waitstaff to hurry the f**k up.  Located in Cesar's Palace, this restaurant doesn't seem to get too crowded so it's a good choice for a decent meal if you want to eat somewhere other than the food court or the lines for more popular establishments are too long.

We arrived 30minutes late from our reservation since it took us a awhile to find this place inside caesar's palace.. the lady was so nice and instead of us waiting another hour, she was able to get us a table (bonus 1million points or is it the bday sash?).. for a party of 5, the bill was just right. We ordered different entree 1) grilled beef burger - (medium)was so good, the fries we know are just regular but it taste differently better than average.. 2) shepherd's pie - not a fan,.. maybe coz the lamb is not my thing.. 3) Fish & Chips was a good one too! The wedge fries that comes with it taste extra special 4) oh my goodness, i forgot what my other friends ordered!!! Lol but over-all, worth the money,! I would dine here again,, our server looks stressed but trying his best since it was sooo busy! I love it! Thank you for my birthday pudding!!!!

aJ_7OBoT0RvkPYQ6zMmw8A.text: I'm a big Gordon Ramsay fan but I think this is the first of his restaurants I've been to. I have to say I left a little disappointed. Perhaps its because its Vegas and I have high expectations from every meal, especially considering the premium prices, but coupled with the fact its managed by one of the world's best chef's, I would expect more.  I went with a "classic Ramsay" dish; Bangers and Mash. It was pretty small, the sausages tasted a little manufactured and the mash and gravy was just...A-OK. My colleagues had the rueben sandwich, beet salad and Ramsay burger respectively. Again, no one was that impressed by the food and we all left underwhelmed.  In general, Caesar's needs to up their game as they are falling too far behind others such as the Aria, both in terms of hotel/casino standards and the restaurants they have to offer.

XWO7bJQH_B9QEOIyukyQLA.text: My wife and I visited for our second time, on March 25th 2017. Our server, Rodney, was extremely friendly, informative and accommodating. We ordered the Scotch Egg, which we had tried at Gordon Ramsay Steak, but it's only available with the tasting menu. It was delicious! It was a bit larger at the pub than the steak house, and I really liked the sauces they serve it with better here. Then we ordered two Ramsay Tonics. Also delicious! We ended up ordering two more each by the end of the visit. We then finished with the sticky toffee pudding, topped with brown butter ice cream. This was one of the best desserts I've had in my life! I highly recommend this place, and will definitely return on my next Vegas vacation.

uMrUDAA8p3adytvnfg9w2A.text: This review is for their Las Vegas Restaurant Week 2015 menu.   The male servers still don what I'll always refer to as "Hipster Lederhosen." Some things don't change, but second impressions can certainly make up for a bitter first. Round 2: the food, service, the entire experience surpassed my expectations.  Appetizer - Calamari (not on the Restaurant Week menu): Perfectly breaded and fried, but chewy,  First Course - Appetizer - Chopped Salad: Lightly dressed, this had strips of salami, slices of chicken, shrimp, apples, tomatoes, and cheddar cheese -- held off on the chickpeas. Not a bad way to begin a three-course meal.  Second Course - Entree - Pan Seared Scottish Salmon: A solid piece of fish that was light and flaky. The caramelized cauliflower and herbed salad were delicious. I was concerned that the lemon fennel puree was going to have a strong fennel flavor, but fortunately it didn't.  Third Course - Dessert  - Sticky Toffee Pudding: This was my first time trying sticky toffee pudding, so I can't make any comparisons. All I can say is that it was an incredibly sweet dessert when the ice cream, moist cake, and caramel sauce are combined.   Service - Terrific.   Overall - I'm still on the fence about this place, considering how my last visit was horrendous and this one was great. If it wasn't for their Restaurant Week menu, I probably wouldn't have given Pub & Grill a second shot.

Instead of delivering regular olives for the martini, Alex stuffed olives table-side with blue cheese! His personality and service was THE BEST!!! Everyone needs to ask for Alex on their next trip here.

SzGawCunXDakGqgz1x-UTw.text: This is the second Gordon Ramsey restaurant and I have dined at and have come to the conclusion that he is a better entertainer than a chef. Had the shrimp and lobster rolls for an appetizer. The bun was legit but it was obvious the main ingredient was the (cheaper) shrimp and not the lobster. I then had the $13 onion soup which was subpar. The cheese was cheap and flavorless, the bread was sparse, and broth lacked depth. Don't go for the hype, you will be dissapointed.

ucU3uwlK6firSOpyT1ihGw.text: I am always so happy when I come here. The bar staff are incredible and make my favourite drink that is no longer on the menu. We visit the pub daily! The food is also very good!

0JLfBDcQWJD0QQV5iUH9wA.text: Outstanding experience! Heather (Connor/Tanner) was amazing. Seriously the best service we've had in a long time.  Bangers and mash, chicken curry, and corn beef brisket plus the drinks were So Delicious.

iFIB1aDzabEenlLu6bfY8w.text: My 4 star review has a lot to do with a review I first posted. I rated it lower then. However , after a prompt reply from someone who actually read my post and addressed each one of my gripes with sincerity. I have to give them  credit for constantly trying to improve and not just live off the "hype".  The food was very good. It was very expensive (2 burgers, 1 fries, special fries dip , 1 desert and 2 soft drinks $75 after tip. But hey, we're in Vegas, everything is jacked up sky high.   The burgers were a little small and I could have easily had 2 of them. But the price pulled that off the table.  I think it's more of a bucket list thing. We always loved his shows and wanted to say we are there.   The presentation and decor was beautiful.   Would we do it again ? probably not. Are we glad we did it this time? Definitely yes. We may not have another chance. As fans of Gordon Ramsey, it was worth the time and money spent.

c7cFDUETmX5BzaThyFziBA.text: Great atmosphere, food and drink. Enjoyed hanging out at the bar. Ramon provides excellent service and the Sticky Toffee Pudding is fantastic. Will be back!

fK3F59tae1brc_CM3uVGhQ.text: The staff was super friendly and we were able to get seated super quick even during CES.  I ordered the steak and ale pie and truffle fries. Would recommend. The sticky toffee was delicious and worth the work out after.

cbEhKhg5JH8PMj0CUasxYw.text: Great atmosphere!  Happy hour drink specials are awesome!  Our server Rodney was super personable and attentive!

gtsbAGHtQ5G2bePzH0BKIA.text: The food here was absolutely spot on. I met up with my sister and her friend for our last lunch in Vegas and it was the best meal I had during the trip.   I started with the Maine Lobster Rolls Minis which had a generous portion of lobster and a light seasoning of lemon. I loved that the brioche they were served on also had a faint lemon taste.   For my lunch I selected to the Pub Chopped Salad which I loved. Everything in the salad was finely diced so I did not need to use my knife, and the dressing was light and evenly distributed.   The only downside to the pub was the seating. I was on a low chair by a large coffee table and it was incredibly uncomfortable to eat from that angle (and thank goodness I wasn't wearing a skirt!)

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Salad
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mini lobster rolls - absolutely delicious

syI93sNU2-7Fuag7L4Mr3Q.text: Being a Gordon Ramsay restaurant I had nothing but high hopes...  Last night my family and I (party of 10) went in for dinner, no reservations however we were seated under a 10-15 minute wait so that's no a problem.  Once we were seated our server greeted us and continued to inform us about all the special/ best sellers and her personal favorite dishes/drinks.  We ordered the chip nachos appetizer and those were delicious, even tho there were burnt pieces (and I mean BURNT pieces of chips.. they were black..)   Here's where thinks went downhill.  4 of us ordered the famous fish n chips. As I started eating, I noticed the puddle of oil under the chips that were coming from the fish.  Half if not all my chips were soaked in oil and were therefore soggy.. fish was okay.. honestly I wasn't blown away. My boyfriend ordered the Hell's Kitchen burger and he LOVES GORDON RAMSAY. As he ate the burger he said the burger was pretty much a Chili's or TGIF burger.. and expressed how disappointing it was.  Although the restaurant is pricey, the price wouldn't matter if the food lived up to the standard that Gordon holds. 2 thumbs down.

HjOvw1qa-wbeIvYmKv3Fdg.text: Surprised to come upon the Gordon Ramsey Pub in the casino and was excited to sit down and experience an excellent meal.  Was not terribly hungry and took the servers recommendation of the Lobster Roll.  When it came it looked inviting but sadly it was served on stale bread lightly toasted with a meager amount of lobster.  Took several bites, waiting for the magical bite.... it wasn't there.  Sent it back and settled for Hummus.  Clearly this restaurant does NOT uphold the standard you expect from the name on the sign.

7DLhyYATr14zgEywClsTsg.text: Ronny served us at the bar. He was phenomenal. Every suggestion he made was spot on. He was very personable and attentive.  He and his crew took great care of us. Even shared recommendations and attractions to visit in Las Vegas.

XE56NMWOGz-2pZtYpZfy9g.text: Great bar service and food. Went with bar tender's rec for short ribs and enjoyed very much!

6RIaqx3yEP2IhCOBX707jw.text: I expect to pay a lot for basics in Vegas... I paid $48 after tip for a fairly good piece of fish along with a small handful of raw cauliflower. (This was supposed to be "caramelized")   I am not upset at the portion size, yes it's small, but if it had been fantastic I would have been happy.  I can't imagine what Gordon Ramsay would have said if he saw this.

1vTKnmwNmLMzgc5Wbeldlw.text: The calamari is salty and we've been ignored for a while. We have waited for our food for at least 30 minutes and no service so we left.

TfkP_I1zEgiHcbBy4K6mow.text: Loved the food, fast service! Great atmosphere. Highly recommend checking out this location (:

OdY6CeQinK7TVLhbeLypiw.text: Great place to watch a soccer game during World Cup  and eat yummy comfort food! Especially with kiddos.  Heater our waitress was very patient and accommodating. Love this place.

owqwh9sWgmGeHPveMHxQAw.text: Bucket List Disappointment  Less than thrilled about the dinner but the service was very good. Eating at one of Gordon Ramsey's restaurants was a bucket list item so on my recent vacation to Las Vegas we went to Gordon Ramsey's Pub and Grill.  I was so disappointed.  I ordered what was named a Classic Ramsey Beer Braised Short Ribs, 1st the order came out in less than 5 minutes... before our drinks and everything was ice cold; the rib, potato puree and vegetables.  Our waiter caught on very quickly that the food came out very fast and asked if it was ok.  I told him it was ice cold and he returned it right away.  The re-fire order came with minimal sauce on the short rib, the puree had small lumps and the vegetables tasted under cooked but like they were cooked in oil that was not hot enough because they were greasy.  I have been a fan of Gordon Ramsey through his recipes and TV shows.  Quality seems to be #1 for his brand, however Gordon Ramsey's Pub and Grill did not have quality control in the kitchen as a priority.  Since I did not eat much for dinner and we had traveled so far to get to Vegas we ordered dessert.  Our waiter recommended the Sticky Toffee Pudding.  The waiter was wonderful, because I have a nut allergy he had them make the dessert with the brittle on the side.  I have to admit that I am not a dessert person but that had to be the best tasting dessert I ever had.  Keep in mind it is very sweet.  I shared the dessert with my mother and we were only able to eat half, but it is worth tasting at least once in life.  Because I went for dinner and not dessert I would not return. Another item crossed off my bucket list but I am so disappointed.

0JTSmMRjP1wUkt2gOHRr_Q.text: Had a wonderful lunch at this restaurant. Ordered burgers that were grilled to perfection and mac and cheese that was just fabulous. So full of flavor, could easily eat another serving.  After being a bit disappointed from Gordon's burger restaurant on the strip I didn't really know what to expect, but the burgers exceeded my expectations and were delicious. I will for sure recommend my friends to visit here.

The lobster Mac and cheese which was excellent! The waitresses was very sweet and had a bubbly sense of humor. She's so cute I will definitely come back and definitely refer friends here. Beyond amazing!

a6rJ1HPJ6EPN_1ScSIFOGA.text: Food was great!!! Lobster shrimp and lobster roll was awesome!! Toffee pudding out of the world!!! Great atmosphere!!! Worth the price!!!

_BWPdEN99PiOxpSysEcYUg.text: I just had the Scottish Egg accompanied by  the refreshing cucumber and St. Germain liquor, Ramsay Tonic - delicious!   The egg was soft boiled and wrapped in thinly sliced beef and dipped in a flour batter and baked...it was served with balsamic caramelize onions and some micro greens...all I can say is that the photo I included, does not do it justice, as it was layered with different textures and flavors, and I loved the kick and zing of the tasty mustard sauce.  Adam, the server, was terrific, and knew all of  the ingredients of the Ramsay tonic and the Scotch Egg, and enthusiastically explained how they were made. He was also personable a friendly, and I appreciated his interest in what I thought of each dish.  The Shepherd's pie was good after adding a bit of salt and pepper. Made of ground lamb, carrots and peas in a mild sauce, it came piped on top with creamy mashed potatoes. As a basic meat and potatoes type of dish, it was filling, however, I do not think I will order it again, as, to me, there just was not a lot of flavour going on in the dish. I think next time I will try the Ramsay signature fish and chips.  I decided to order the sticky toffee for dessert, as I had heard so much about it.., and Wow! Was it ever good! It was so creamy and delicious with a moist date cake base, topped with a sweet cream ice cream and Florentine cookie, that I almost wanted to order another.  Adam came table side, and slowly drizzled the luscious warm toffee syrup over the top. This dessert together with rich hot coffee, was such a perfect ending to a tasty adventure in Gordon Ramsay's Grill and Pub!

55ByU8-wttRTpw-3nIGTYA.text: My boyfriend and I come here every year for our anniversary. This is our 3rd time to this restaurant and it has continues to exceed expectations. Their food is always perfect and the desert (sticky toffee pudding) is the highlight of my trip.   This time we had Daisy as our server and she was fantastic. She was very attentive to our needs and made excellent recommendations to us. We had a small mishap with our food, but the manager Randy took it with grace and made us feel much better.   We will continue to come back here trip after trip and it will always be the best part of Vegas!   Thank you so much to the staff here year after year to make us feel welcome and continue to give us amazing service!

TgEzzwlfmMwT0HGdkidXEA.text: Was staying in Caesar's for the week, so our group decided to try out one of Gordon Ramsay's restaurants. Overall, had a good experience here.   Really enjoyed the ambiance of the restaurant. Just dimly light enough so that it was intimate, and the servers were very nice and helpful. Our waiter was top-notch - and he even offered to connect us with a promoter for night clubs. The 3 stars is for the food, though. I sampled the pesto chicken sandwich and lamb shepherd's pie. Both were good, but nothing really wowed me. Some other friends tried the maple sage fried chicken sandwich, which they said was delicious (it looked delicious too).   To summarize, I was slightly disappointed dining at my second Gordon Ramsay restaurant. However, the food is decent according to Vegas standards, as you'll end up paying around ~$30 after tax and tip.

vIM6ViMIlrHpX9cMCYr5UQ.text: Went here when in Vegas in vacation with a group of 6. We did make a reservation because we were going at prime time, right before a show at Ceasers palace. I would recommend a reservation, the restaurant seemed to be consistently busy and on a wait.   The beer and drink menu was large, and they had 12oz or 35 oz portions beer or ciders. lZtx-uzkfI64nsRh9csxug.text: My 2nd time here and still did not disappoint!! The food was AMAZING!!! The 12oz ribeye is such great quality that it is full of flavor and perfectly seasoned. Our server Rodney was also very helpful, fast and knowledgeable about the menu. I highly recommend giving this place a try.

GUpA9o9L1HDv_UMxb--X_g.text: I was so excited to come here! Gordon Ramsay is my idol! That's why I am so heartbroken to give this place 2 stars. My star rating metric is at the bottom of this review.  Ambiance: This place looks amazing! It's got a very modern and sleek design and I loved it!  The Price: Get your wallets ready because there's a big price attached to this place. I was prepared for it and I didn't flinch because it's a Ramsay restaurant. I'm paying premium prices for high quality food. Entrees ran around $27-$30, sandwiches around $20-25, starters anywhere from $8-$20, and sides around $12. Unfortunately, the value was extremely lacking. The portions were fine, but the quality was terrible.  The Food: This was the biggest disappointment I've had in a very long time.   My fiance ordered the Bangers and Mash. It's Ramsay and it's a British pub so I'm thinking you can't possibly screw this up.... wrong! I was actually INSULTED at what we received for the $30. They served dehydrated potatoes. Guys... even chilis bar and grill serves me real potatoes when they serve mash! When I'm served dehydrated potatoes at $30 a meal that is Unacceptable. Period. There's an expectation of value and quality that comes with that name and that price.  He sent it back for Fish and Chips. This meal was acceptable... not excellent, delicious, amazing, or worth the cost of the $30. It means he ate it without issues. That's not good enough for a Ramsay place. Do better!  I ordered the Chicken Tikki. I was assured that they used Ramsay's recipe for this dish, which may be why I was satisfied. My dish was good. The chicken was well proportioned and well seasoned. I had just enough naan for all my chicken and just enough yogurt to blend well with the tikki sauce. The down side of my dish was the rice. It was boxed rice with very little seasoning and it was not cooked properly.. While I can say that this dish was good and recommend it (aside from the rice), I can't say that it was head and shoulders above anywhere else. My local place is almost as good as this. Ramsay's tikki should be incomparable.   I wanted to try the Mac and cheese because I know it's one of Ramsay's signatures but I'm allergic to lobster. Luckily, there was a starter option called Little Mac. There are a few flavor options and I went for the Jalapeno Bacon option. The predominant flavor of the dish was jalapeno, not cheese. The cheese was such a subtle flavor that it felt more like texture than a main component. I did not taste cheese. The noodles were cooked better than the rice but overall I'd say this dish was just okay.  The Speed: There are a couple speed components here - kitchen and service. I'll address Kitchen first and talk about service as my final piece. Too fast! I know Ramsay is all about speed and this is great! You don't want to wait forever for your food! However.... you DO want fresh food made to order at a place with Gordon Ramsay in the name of the restaurant. My Mac and cheese came out maybe 5 minutes after I ordered. Sure, ok... it's a starter so I'll be lenient. The noodles were likely precooked to al dente to speed the process. However, our meals came out within seconds of my starter being presented to me. WAY too fast!! No way do fresh bangers AND tikki chicken come out that quickly if they were made to order. Simply not possible. This made me feel extremely rushed... I picked the starter with the intention of having time to enjoy it before my meal came out because the flavors don't mix without time to cleanse your palate. On top of that, it made me feel as if all our food had been pre-made in morning prep then stuck in microwaves when it was ordered. This is what I'd expect of a chain restaurant... NOT what I'd expect of a $30 entree attached to the name Gordon Ramsay. How disappointing.   The Service: Our server was Michael. He was the one redeeming factor of our visit. I work in the restaurant industry, and over the past 10 years have been both a cook and a server, and his service truly blew me away. It's so rare these days to find a server like him. He struck the perfect balance of being approachable without hovering, made menu recommendations with ease, and never let our glasses empty before refilling. He handled the sent back dish smoothly and without making us feel awkward about it. If only the back of house was as phenomenal as the service!!  Overall this place has received 2/5 stars, with the ambiance and service keeping it from a 1 star review.  1 - Hated. Avoid!! 2 - Meh. Bored by it. Nothing special. 3 - Enjoyed while there but won't leave lasting impression. 4 - Really loved this place. Recommend it! 5 - Law of diminishing returns does not apply!

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mini Mac - jalapeño bacon

4S9N_NP5kO9IpADNDsJZ6g.text: Ok. Specifically this review is about Mike the bartender. Four of us wandered in because of the Bloody Mary's we saw floating around the casino. He's a genius and I've never run up a bar tab like that or been happier for it. We had a great time and it's a highlight for our trip.

OVRJi6sRQoLkjlHflSLGiQ.text: The gem is located prominently in Caesar's palace. It felt like I was going into a pub. With the Union Jack flag plastered everywhere, it definitely felt like I was teleported over to the UK.  First came the lamb burger cooked medium rare. When it came out the patty was beautiful when sliced in half and plenty pink in the middle. It was one good burger. I believe we had the Bearnaise sauce. It came with a side of fries.  We also had the butter chicken curry, which came with Saffron Basmati rice, yogurt & naan bread. The aromas and flavors created from the spices were excellent. The spices were bold and its taste really stood out in the curry. The curry chicken was great with the naan bread and yogurt dip.  With a yelp check-in, my date and I scored an excellent dessert to end our meal.

vO8PB_RJjYjYF81bfcKDWA.text: Another great meal at Pub & Grill.  Me and my friends had plans for a big dinner later in the day and didn't want to over stuff ourselves so decided to split two appetizers and one main between the three of us. The items chosen were the crispy calamari, crispy pork belly and the Steak & Ale pie.  The calamari was crispy and is given a sweet & sour flavor when combining with the pickled peppers. The pork belly was juicy, fatty and had a crispy outer layer of skin that gives a loud crunch when biting very similar to the skin on thick cuts of deep fried chicharron. However the meat was a lot softer and more flavorful.  The highlight of the three was the Steak & Ale pie. The steak chunks, the puree, the mushrooms, and the crust...simply delicious. As good as the other two plates were, we should have just ordered two pies due to how fast we ate it. One of my friends is a very very picky eater and he ate the bulk of it.   A Yelp check-in gets you a complimentary order of sticky toffee pudding. It comes pipping hot so careful when digging in. A tasty hot sponge cake and melted ice cream combo.  Third time visiting and enjoyed it as equally as past visits. Keep the good food coming!  Lunch 1/27/2018

rZM843iJyCAPpxZ7zIzI9w.text: Good atmosphere, great service, beautiful food. Lisa was and is wonderful server very accommodating. Lisa took time to check on us.

nerDUwPt1kaES3KbbpA00g.text: Wow for the prices that this place charges the quality and flavor is just completely unacceptable.   We ordered the beef hash poutine to start and the gravy was way overly salty. Fries tasted like they were previously frozen and didn't taste fresh.   We also got the short rib dish and the chicken curry. The short to rib was decent but too much fat was left on the rib which the texture took away from the enjoyment of eating the dish. Also again it was too salty. Then the chicken curry was supposed to be like an Indian dish and the chicken was dry and stringy as well as the rice was under cooked and dry. The naan definitely wasn't real naan.   Overall a complete disappointment. Would not visit again.

arSmmIrT07KyjJsfsn-jTw.text: My girl and I came here on Thursday August 22nd after making some bets at the Sports Book in Caesars.  It was busy but we were seated extremely fast.  Our waiter was nice and helpful but after taking our drink/appetizer order and then main course order, we didn't see him again.  I literally had to get up and track him down to get our check, which is the only reason I couldn't give more than 3 stars. I kind of got the feeling that he wasn't going to waste too much of his time on a couple only getting some burgers for lunch.  The food though was phenomenal! We started with the short rib kettle chip nachos and they were delicious. Then we split the lobster and shrimp rolls and the corned beef poutine.  Both were great, not a detail ignored in the food at all.  I always like to try a place twice, so second time around I am hoping for better service.  Overall, just know when you go, the food will be excellent.

B0_F2a9GLlC2fleqnSaMDw.text: Food was good, crowded and service a little slow. Prime rib ok, I've had better, onion soup great. Thank you.......

LInT_d_xzeyK-Dy-08_44g.text: Wow! First time eating here! Sat at the bar was served by Ronnie... made some great recommendations for us. Turned out great! Had a steak, Mac and cheese, spinach... insanely good.  Trying the desert right now. Coming back soon and will recommend this to all of my clan.  Thanks !

MSfpz1zH3vaVobjF1-UHkg.text: Amazing meal! I had the braised short rib and sticky toffee pudding (check in on yelp and sticky toffee pudding is free!). Braised short rib was buttery and perfectly cooked. Highly recommend.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Braised short rib! Yummy!!

kPXbcmV0Z0pv9jfWlEeVEw.text: Amazing food and service. The best Beef Wellington I have ever had! For desert suggestions we let server Scotty lead the way...the Sticky toffee pudding was awesome!

eIUhXf90Q4APEPfOlg0new.text: We weren't able to make it to any of the Gordon Ramsay's restaurants because we didn't have reservations, but we were able to make reservations for the pub and grill. The service here was really great. Our waitress was really friendly and split our check and everything. Our water glasses were also constantly being filled which was really nice because I was feeling kind of dehydrated. I was pleasantly surprised at how good the food was here! I had the butter chicken and it was really flavorful and the naan was so soft and yummy! I tried a bit of the short rib and it was also very tender and tasty as well! I would definitely recommend coming here!  Make sure to check in!! The sticky toffee pudding is so sooooo amazing!

wS5VaWOGLXnaMmHqIov62w.text: Excellent service , foods are amazing so good . Nice place .. service was just in perfect timing .. not really rush you out that fast ! Will def go back again ! Thank you ! And I ate the whole thing ! The next day went to hell kitchen restaurant ... check both restaurant out !!!!

Gp1A9kxFk3LoRwgkUGIpbg.text: My girlfriend and I mixed up the Pub & Grill with his Burger restaurant in Planet Hollywood, but by the time we realized it, we already placed our orders.  We started off lunch with the pork belly appetizer. The pork itself was prepared well, the meat was still fatty and juicy and the skin had a nice crisp to it. I personally thought it fell short when it came down to flavor though. My girlfriend enjoyed it, however.  We also ordered the brisket sandwich and braised short rib.  The sandwich was actually really good considering the fact that I'm not really a sandwich type guy. The sourdough was hearty, soft, with a nice crust, and flavorful. The brisket wasn't too salty and the sauerkraut and sauce worked well with every bite.  The short rib was probably my favorite though. The rib was incredibly tender and the meat would fall off with just a push with the fork.  Even though the meal started off on the wrong direction with the appetizer, the main entrees helped redeem our meal and we left pretty satisfied... except for the soda water. Sparkling water is $5 just as a heads up.

eUxH5H-Qq0pziTG2I_8xpQ.text: Pretty cool little setup, my only regret was not ordering more food. We went light on this one with the shrimp cocktail appetizer and an order of calamari and a few specialty cocktails.   Success is built upon knowledge which I'm sure is a big driver for this establishment. Our server was very knowledgeable and was able to walk us through the menu; offer suggestions, and answer our questions.   The decor in this place was very cool, it offered somewhat of a medieval feel. The place settings, utensils, and everything about this place showed a wonderful essence of class, I'd really like to go back.   Pro tip: the old fashioned is delicious!

x-pyeLkZsuKB9wcMOJRxwg.text: I've been to all the Gordon Ramsay spots in LV.  This is my third favorite behind Steak in Paris and Hell's Kitchen at Caesar's Palace.  Great touristy British Pub theme - a little pricey.  I've had the deviled eggs and mini lobster rolls before and tell were excellent.  This trip I did steak tartare and was pleasantly surprised.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States

1KS5LSvRHEamgOIbOv9W2A.text: Love this place!! Best drinks food and service!!! Love love love the lobster roll and fish n chips!!! Ronnie and Big Dave are not only hospitable but are so nice and friendly making your dining experience at Ramsey Pub a Amazing!!! Always come to visit here when in town!!!

KufgdW7QKj6k0M0oNLsClw.text: The scallops were over salted but everything else was superb!   Enjoyed the sucatash very much and the bf really enjoyed his prime rib dinner.   He gave it an 8 out of 10.  I got a FREE dessert thanks to Yelp.  Thanks a bunch ya'll, it was yummy!

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster mac n cheese was YUMMY!

wg54044hlezj71WLnatw1Q.text: I will give this place 4 stars solely because of the service and special treatment we got. The food was not all the hype it gets, the mac and cheese was so bland and missing flavor and salt . The burger and fries were good but again not something out of this world either. Good was a-ok but the staff and management were so friendly and generous and attentive to us it made the experience worth it. With a yelp check in you get a free toffee pudding which is apparently Gordons signature dessert. We showed our waiter 2 yelp check in but he actually ended up bringing out a dessert for each one of us , and we were 7 total! I will tell you not one dessert was left untouched, this was definitely the best thing on the menu

FwVwGGy8axsQk4zux4SuKQ.text: Great place for lunch! We had a little bit of trouble finding it, but that's no fault of their own, Caesars Palace is huge. All of the staff is so friendly, and the food is top notch! We tried a variety of foods and everything was delicious! I definitely recommend the short rib kettle chip nachos. To die for! Ask for a spot in Scott's area, best waiter we've had all weekend!

Zxz8BJrdBvLASdFx05JTwQ.text: A total disappointment across the board. Service was terrible for a Monday night. The calamari was decent but our entree was cold and the lettuce in our salads not fresh. Maybe just a bad night but bad enough that we won't be back.

mfxiIwCcTHWbrsGAhqJODw.text: We ordered the fish and chips w/ mushy peas & fries. Amazing food & service! Really wanted to try the sticky toffee pudding...maybe next time!

aXrFc5ZVi_h7l3HOBhyV5g.text: First off, I understand that most, if not, all restaurants are overpriced on the strip. This place has by far been the biggest rip-off in my opinion. First off, we started with and appetizer order of pretzels.  When they came out, they were luke warm at best. Immediately, after the pretzels came out, our main course came out. So much for having an appetizer before dinner. Anyways, I ordered the Bangers and Mash and my wife got a basic cheeseburger. I wonder how the food came out so quickly. Could the food have been pre-cooked? My Bangers and Mash was ok....the potatoes were good, the sausage was ok. The burger my wife got was terrible. Zero flavor, dry and downright boring....for the cost I would expect much better. I feel like we could have had a better burger at Smashburger. I am disappointed in this restaurant and the value for the food. I wouldn't recommend anyone to eat here....i have eaten at other GR restaurants in Vegas and this by far was the worst. I hope GR takes a serious look at this place. It might be time to sent the kitchen staff upstairs, Hell's Kitchen style.

FFnoHLs6AMH6XchWtZNJKw.text: I had the bangers & mash. I thought  it was delicious. It was... well a stereotypical man's dish. Meat and potatoes. Very simple, very good. The sausage was perfectly cooked and the sauce/gravy went well with the mashed potatoes that also tasted really good.  However....... was it worth 20 bucks? Probably not.   The rest of our party had a bunch of various dishes. I remember the pub beef burger being a popular one among our group. No one really seemed blown away by it. Again 20 bucks.   I got the notion that a burger at Smashburger might be around the same caliber as the ones my friends were eating judging by their reactions when eating.  The duck confit poutine was OK. It was interesting, but there was definitely a lot more fries and cheese than any duck. I wish there was more duck since it actually tasted decent.  The bottom line here: the food is 'good', but not really worth it. The ambiance is nice, but the service is also hit or miss. Pretend you're that guy at a busy bar trying to order a drink for you and your friends. It's hard to get the bartender's attention right? That's probably what you're going to feel like when you try and get your waiter/waitress' attention.  I think knocking 50% off the menu prices would be appropriate for the food that you'll be eating. Gordon Ramsay is a baller chef, but since he's not actually cooking the food, I have no problem dissing the restaurant and saying it's not worth the price.

9Ob5qe1TMBg2UTq4kqkqQQ.text: We had a fabulous time at Gordon Ramsay's!! Went for lunch before we left Vegas. There was 6 of us and my 2 year old son and they were super accommodating! They gave us a great table and their service was fabulous! We all had burgers! I had the lamb burger and it was one of the best burgers I've ever had! We ordered the pretzel stick appetizer for my son and he totally loved it. I was so relieved that they were accommodating consider we had a toddler with us. I'm a huge Gordon fan and having a great experience at one of his restaurants made me love him even more!

0Qr4dPHuGmmkWv2UHdoF7Q.text: I decided to surprise my wife for her birthday with dinner and a show! The decor and atmosphere is a nice mix of classic pub and modern bar. The place settings and seating had a classic feel. Everyone at our table was very pleased with their food and the service was excellent. They even gave my wife a dessert for her birthday which was awesome.
