i4zYNggA6wEAMhYwQJ7jTw.text: Really? This restaurant bears the name of Gordon Ramsey? Actually, more closely resembles Amy's Baking Kitchen. How can he have any credibility judging and criticizing the food of others when his establishment serves such horrible food?  Now I wanna say that the service was excellent and the staff very warm. Drinks were large as they should be for the price. Apps were okay. Onion soup was awesome and vegetable salad solid. But the entrees were absolutely horrible. I had the pork belly and could only get through a  bite. It was too fatty and oily, without flavor!   I'm shocked that for the money and considering all the great good alternatives, how can this place stay in business? Should have just gone to Nobu and spent $50 more!

vpaRHnZh_FAi3FRcXKWYPA.text: Overhyped, overpriced and awful. Service was awful, waiter never checked on meals or offered to refill any waters, iced tea or ask if I wanted another beer. $120 for three meals, two iced teas and a beer.... don't waste your time at this tourist trap. My lobster mac and cheese had more salt than the Dead Sea. Save your money, your odds are better in the slot machines.

dXGQ3K2LKHiVK-y0PCqV_A.text: Had blackberry vodka cocktail that was good! Ordered the Fish & Chips and found it to be sub-par. The batter didn't stick to the fish and was still 'wet' batter inside. The chips seemed like standard wedges you'd get anywhere (the pea-mint mash was interesting). Wife ordered short ribs which she found just average. We were looking for something spectacular food-wise from a Gordon Ramsay restaurant however the most spectacular thing here was the pricing  ($30 for bland fish & chips of a quality that I can get equal or better at 30 other places in LV). Service was good, ambiance pleasant, just underwhelmed by the food...pubs aren't scarce in LV and have had much better pub food at several different LV establishments. If at Caesars, I'd take Mesa hands down (from the more casual celebrity chef restaurants).

LcYqOU7QfalcymaJ4v6XqQ.text: Amazing food service nice waiter accommodate my vegan request nice place gordon is amazing !!!

Z9QscYU4YcN-mAn-bSDwgQ.text: Quality food, mediocre menu. Wasn't at all impressed with the selection of "pub" food. Burgers, fish and chips... That's pretty much all they had that fit the bill. My chicken pesto Sammy was less than impressive. The overall constancy of the sandwich was soggy by the time it got to the table.

5H7A__Y3i07e8jOjzXuyqQ.text: The food was amazing but not so much for the service. The server didn't know anything about the wine on the menu. She also forgot to bring the oysters before the entrees. When she brought them after we finished our meals, she brought 1/2 dozen instead of a dozen (which was the actual order)... However, she didn't ruin our evening since the food (we had a rack of lamb, trio of meats) was heavenly!

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Rack of lamb
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Dx0zpXx-pDJiQOn93AOngg.text: Wow. I hope whoever wins Hell's Kitchen hasn't taken over as executive chef of this place yet because that would mean that Ramsay made a bad choice. If what we experienced happened during dinner service on that show, someone would have been kicked out of the kitchen.   My boyfriend tried to order a beer, but we were told they were out of it and the server couldn't really recommend a comparable choice. So he gave us what felt like 15 minutes to choose another beer and then came back for our order.   I ordered the chopped salad, Leo got the Shepard's pie and we share the pub chips. Everything was just OK. The chopped salad mentioned wood-grilled chicken, but what I got resembled shredded rotisserie chicken - pretty bland. And then midway through our meal, we got bread service - which made absolutely no sense.   Leo ordered another beer and after our meal, we asked for the dessert menu. And watched our server schmooze with a larger party for 10 minutes before we could flag him down and ask again. Once we got the menu and picked out a dessert (Sticky Toffee Pudding, which was actually very good), we had to wait until another server tapped ours on the back to let him know we were waiting.   By the time we finished everything, nearly two hours had passed and the place was pretty much dead. It may have just been because we had a poor server that night, but we would never go back to this place.

QCyzJsPO82N77PCQQWjV7Q.text: UGH this place is sooo good. The hostess, not so much, but our server and every other staff member we encountered were 100% on it. We came for dinner and YOU MUST TRY the beer flights. The cocktails were good too, but.... the beer flight....just do it. The food was excellent, we decided we would order a few different options and share them around the table. We had the Lobster & Shrimp Rolls (one HUNDRED stars), the Mini Pub Burgers (you'd think once you've had a few sliders you've had 'em all, but you thought wrong; these were da bomb), the Deviled Eggs, the Fish and Chips, and the Hellfire Wings (the only thing we ordered that were average, but I mean, I still ate them all, so...), and you already know we sprung the calorie bank for dessert. Worth. It. We came back the next day for lunch and saw a different hostess, same bad attitude, but we this time we sat at the bar. The food was again awesome and the bartender, for an afternoon bartender, was hilarious. 5 stars!!! I don't love going to Vegas but I sure love going here!

fv8fg1wVCv8y0sMGH8f9JA.text: Best meal we had in Vegas (and way better than Chef Ramsay's steak, for about 20% the price). The service was excellent, and although I didn't particularly enjoy the ambiance of sitting at the edge of the casino, I'm sure you could sit more 'in' the restaurant to enjoy it more.   That being said, the scallop dish with potato and bacon moat under it was heavenly. Each bite on its own was wonderful, but combined wax a little symphony in your mouth with each bite. The shepherds pie is good (if you like lamb), but the Caesar salad was just average.   This is a great option to try some of Chef Ramsay's food influence and ideas without using hearing protection & dropping a mortgage payment over at Steak.

RoGoQuP1DTUstVfDLPkx1A.text: Food is tasty, but very small portion for the price. Entrees are appetizer sized. My husband and I each ordered a chicken, kale and bacon pot pie, but there was no kale or bacon in either pot pie. Our server was very rude, as well. He was rude when I had a question about the menu and actually mocked me when I asked for a spoon. If entrees were bigger and servers were more friendly, this place would have been given 4 stars.

D37oS_muWzIWN5zw9F38yw.text: My husband and I went to dinner here the other night. Fantastic. We made reservations because we had read about long waits. We arrived and we're seated in minutes. I read some reviews that said that they staggered seating. I didn't see this happen. The tables that were empty for a bit seemed to be for larger parties with reservations. We also didn't have a long wait for our food. Waiting time, all around, was average.   My husband had the lamb shank and I had the lamb rack. Both were delicious. The lamb rack comes with a couscous that is to die for. The sides not listed with your dinner come at extra cost. We ordered the mac and cheese, which was the best mac and cheese I've ever eaten. To be fair, the sides probably come at an extra cost because you don't need rhem. We both would have been full and satisfied with just our meals. Our helpings were pretty large. We struggled to finish the extra side.   As a side note, I ordered my lamb rack medium and it came almost well done. This didn't bother me at all, since the only reason I didn't order it well is that we'll usually translates to burnt at most places. So I was perfectly satisfied with what I was served.   There is a photographer that will ask if you want your picture taken at dinner. She comes around about 20 minutes later to show you the picture. You get three and a frame for like $18. She also stated that she worked for ceasears and does this at all of the restaurants and attractions within the hotel. So, no matter where you go in ceasears it seems this will happen. You can always say no and she will leave. She in no way pressured us into getting or buying our pictures.   We also ended with dessert, because we were waiting for our pictured. We ate the pear cobbler, which was warm and gooey. It came with a sweat cream which evened out the dish very well.   The only complaint I have about the night was that the chairs (not the stools) are pretty low compared to the tablw. I felt like a toddler trying to reach everything, no matter how close I got to the table.   Other than that, great and interesting place! Would definitely eat here again if I was given the choice!

Qrkx6WPYoEDRLWOL4LcAFQ.text: We went to GR's P&G this afternoon for lunch and, I won't ask forgiveness for being blunt, this place was absolutely terrible and the only black mark on an otherwise perfect tour of Vegas' fantastic dining experiences.   I must also say that we have very forgiving natures when it comes to restaurants, and that neither of us are food snobs; we simply like good food, whether it's from a proper gastro-pub or from a fine restaurant. This of course was neither.   I ordered the little sliders (I forget already what they called them, having all day tried to repress the memories). I don't mind paying good money for good food or for good quantities. These sliders fit none of those descriptions. Each was as small as a silver dollar, greasier than anything from a proper pub, and to be quite honest flavourless save for the strong garlic butter the came with. A "plate" of three of them cost 14 dollars. The "chips" were greasier than a fast food place, were not crisp, and flavourless to match the sliders. These little greese-bars were nine dollars alone.   My charming companion tried the shepherd's pie. Being the verbally generous thing she is, she could only say that the dish wasn't terrible. A 22 dollar bowl of tripe is not what you'd expect from a fancy chef's establishment. Having tasted the pie myself, I could not be so forgiving in my description as her, nor could I really come up with something intelligent and so instead made, I think, an awkward face upon tasting it.   The one thing I will say was pleasant was the service. The hostess was very friendly, and the server was rather attentive and pleasant. This, combined with the fact we were terribly hungry when we arrived, was the only thing stopping us from walking out.   Again, I must point out that I am not snobbish when it comes to food. This place was terrible for cheap food, let alone for something this expensive. In our time at Vegas, I have eaten fantastic burgers at "I Heart Burger", "The Grand Lux Cafe", and KGB (Kerry's Gourmet Burgers" . . . Each of these phenomenal burgers were cheaper than my tiny little sliders and had flavors I cannot even describe. If you feel the need for a good burger, I would recommend any of those.   I feel I must end this review on a positive remark . . . their little symbol of the Union Flag within an English Bulldog was cute.

2ooRpUxqJY_pVmEw71W1TA.text: NOT WHAT I EXPECTED!! I don't even think there was a manager working because they were no where to be seen. So after making it a point to try pub and grill before we left town my wife and I were very underwhelmed. The service from our waiter was slow and lackluster the one thing he did do was he was nice enough to get some egg for my daughter who has a soy and lactose allergy. The food was just ok I had the bacon burger and was very disappointed. The cook was a medium rare when I ordered it medium I am very particular about the cook of my meat especially when it is undercooked. I was so disappointed I didn't finish it. My wife had the lobster and shrimp rolls and deviled eggs. The tools were AMAZING the eggs on the other hand were very mediocre at most.

fbCCQwJEAN6rRh-tYlHwgw.text: Another great experience today the pub! Today we came here to watch football and they had tons of TVs with different games on.  I had the Dublin sandwich  and my friend had the lamb burger and we really enjoyed them. Service was great we asked the server to turn the TV for us for another game. Great place to come watch NFL ! Can't wait to come back for great food and service!

kKUqY9s5qXsqQBEcg-dn5Q.text: Lunch visit for our management team: Two tables of 8. One group was seated in the front by the entrance, the other group was seated in the back left corner behind the bar.  It was the best of times, it was the worst of times.....literally a tale of two lunch sittings..lol  GR Pub & Grill Ambiance and Service:  English Pub & grill decor throughout the restaurant is well designed from the murals to the details in the uniform and even place settings.  The whole resto is as big as a small warehouse so there's plenty of seating in tables and booths.   We booked 2 reservations online and the hostess desk was great with getting both parties once we checked in.  Our server was on point, tried his best but the floor wasn't staffed correctly for a busy Friday lunch rush.  It looked like him and another server was covering about 50 covers/customers in our table section.  The kitchen took about 30 minutes to get our appetizers, 30 Minutes for the entrees and 20 minutes for the desserts.  This was a 2 hour lunch.  Our other party seated at the front were already ordering dessert while we had not received our main entrees yet.  GR Pub & Grill cuisine:  The deviled eggs were yum and made for another great appetizer.  The tomato soup was tasty and definitely something I'd order again.  The beef wellington comes out one way, medium rare and flavorful.  It was a small serving but packed lots of flavor.  The pigs in the blanket came with full sized sausages which was a win.  The sticky toffee pudding was definitely the star of the meal, absolutely delicious and not too sweet in flavor.  All the dishes I sampled were savory and everyone was happy with their dishes  I don't know why one group received fast efficient service while the other group/my group had time issues.  Overall the food was good but service is very inconsistent and you expect more for a $$$ restaurant  Hopefully they're better on my next visit.  Enjoy!

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States

A6zBOS2ZiiBsPPihMSFUkQ.text: First things first, the atmosphere is really good. I love the barrel wall and the table set ups. We originally made reservations at first because it was my birthday weekend and we didn't want to wait for to long. Good thing we did because there was quite a wait even with our reservations. After waiting for maybe 5-10 minutes we were seated promptly.   I feel like our server's name was Chris.. Either way he was awesome and very attentive. We started off with the Hellfire wings. Now, I usually don't order wings because the amount of meat I waste on them is atrocious. I usually take one-two bites as I don't like to chomp on the bone. However, these wings are my absolute favorite thing of my birthday weekend in Vegas. The sauce was delicious, I wish I ordered the full size. Even the blue cheese was incredibly creamy and yummy.. And I usually hate blue cheese dressing! Even half way through the wings you knew it would be a good dinner.  The mains didn't disappoint either. My husband ordered the fish and chips and I went with the tenderloin with a side of Asparagus. My husband thoroughly enjoyed the fish and chips and found it incredibly filling. My steak was like butter! It melted in my mouth and it didn't even need the sauce It came with (I went with peppercorn) However, the sauce did add a different depth of taste. The asparagus were pretty big and they were seasoned nicely. Who knew Asparagus could be so good, even with the drizzle of the Bearnaise sauce. All together the dishes were amazing! I legit still think about the wings to this day and would love the recipe to the sauce, been trying to Google it.  Now the sever was amazing, he overheard it was my birthday and instead of us having to order the sticky toffee pudding, we received a free one. The cute part? It was topped with a birthday candle. The dessert was amazing. However, we were unable to finish it simply because we were just to full.   This place is a definite must visit when in Vegas and you want some good food!

Riaz0OaTFTJJQoMeO1DuQA.text: First and foremost, shout out to the staff. Our hostess was very nice and shared a short convo set the mood to a good vibe as we sat down. Next we met our server Joe... personal shout out to Joe. He nailed it. Amazingly friendly and never did I have to worry about my drink. Always beat me to s refill. Love the environment.    I love calamari the most as an appetizer. Personally nothing beats it. So naturally we had to try his out. In doing so, this calamari has to be one of the best I have tried to date. This calamari from the pub is huge!!! The rings are fairly sized and in the Centre is all the tentacles as a whole, fried!! All of it had great taste but the rings are really the. Eat grabs I will have to say. The tentacles might be a little much for some people but it's just a different mix of the same tastes.   Ordered the burger myself and got it done medium for a big switch up from the usual  way from a restaurant being a well done burger. As far as size goes the burger is massive. A good amount of bacon on top of the juiciest burger I have ever seen on top of vegetables. What a sight. Again the bun does the same thing as it does at his burger joint. It so soft it literally almost melts in front of your eyes.    Took the first bite and instantly regretted not getting it medium at his burger restaurant. The volume of juices that contain mad amounts of flavors from the patty is huge. Mix in the crunch from the bacon and it's taste and holy god damn. The bacon helps to absorb some of the overflow of juices along with the bun!!      Can't make this up. A perfect bite burger. Each bite as tasty or slight variations in taste from the next or previous bite that result in my new favorite pick for a burger to date.     The fries on side surprised me just as much. Very loud on the taste and the garlic aioli on the side makes for flavors that punch nicely.     For the medicated or just burger fans. This a must have. Little of a walk (but what isn't) will allow one to walk off how full they will be

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States

AIwynd1ZDBnHefDuestbjw.text: Gordon, you must try your own butter chicken plate.  Chicken was dry and lacked butter curry sauce and was a bit flavorless.  The nann bread is no where near authentic and bland.  The rice was average.  I also tried the macaroni and was far from impressed.  The spinach cheese side was pretty good though.  I guess i went in with really high expectations because i know you are very critical when it come to quality.  I was shocked with the quality and at a premium price.  Please check your kitchen as something is not happening in there.  Hope this feedback helps

jbWnQIsWYic7Cxc23l8kPQ.text: I've always wanted to try one of Gordon Ramsay's restaurants here in Vegas and I'm glad I did. Nice ambiance and staff were great! I would definitely recommend their Beef Wellington, that beef just melts in your mouth. Yum!

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sticky Toffee Pusding
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beef Wellington

jukzUA8R7vyfbts8aAp5Ew.text: Disclaimer: this review is only for the bar! Unfortunately I can't speak on the food other than the sticky toffee pudding dessert because that was the main attraction for me during my visit to Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill. My friend and I came here around 3pm on a Saturday and was told it would be about a 15 minute wait to be seated so we grabbed a seat at the bar instead. We ordered a couple of mocktails between the two of us and shared a sticky toffee pudding dessert. I know what you're thinking - "you sat at the bar to drink a non-alcoholic drink and eat dessert?" I sho did. The bartender was super personable and we got really great service.   The sticky toffee pudding was nothing short of amazing! Albeit a little sweeter than I'm used to but hey, that's toffee. They wait until they bring it to you to actually drizzle on the sauce. It came out fresh and warm with a scoop of vanilla ice cream on top. The cake was moist and the sauce just added the rich sugary sweetness to it. You definitely want a little bit of that ice cream with each bite to balance out the toffee pudding. All the elements put together make one decadent dessert. Don't let it sit for too long because it tastes best warm...but honestly I can't imagine why you wouldn't devour it within minutes anyways. If I had one complaint it would be the scoop of ice cream was too small.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Toffee pudding cake

_RsVn1z-mB5DukC1buV_ug.text: After walking all day up and down the strip, my friend and I found ourselves inside Caesars Palace looking for a place where we can rest our painful feet and have a drink or two. What do you know? Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill happens to be right in front of us, so we decided to come in.  The bar was pretty full from end to end. But we were lucky enough to find two open seats almost all the way to the left end so we sat there. After perusing the menu, we asked for something familiar: 35 oz Blue Moon. My friend wanted something to munch so he ordered some hummus with naan bread.  - Beer: 35 oz of ice cold Blue Moon poured just right? Can't go wrong with that. - Hummus:  nothing special. Tasted just like regular bar hummus to me despite the Gordon Ramsay name. The hummus I've had at my local (HTX) Persian restaurants are all way better. - Bartender: Compared to all the other bartenders that we saw working other areas of the bar, our bartender just seemed so uptight. No smile, no small talks, no attempts to connect. He gave us the menu, took our orders, and left. He did occasionally come back to check on us, but again, he did so with a blank stare on his face sans smile. Meh.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hummus
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 35 oz of blue Moon. Oh Yeah!

Jyi0YG7V_rf9WpxFIOaa_g.text: Came here because we had some comp credits so we decided to give the pub a try!  First off it was super busy so just be aware and it is loud so you won't get a super quiet atmosphere but the place was super nice.  Food we got an assortment of food I decided to go with the sampler or whatever it is called got the scallops which were amazing!!! Beef Wellington good and the dessert was sticky toffee pudding oh goodness so good! (Got another one for free by checking in on yelp!!)  We also got pork belly, lobster Mac and cheese, steak and ale pie, pub burgers!  All the food was soo good and all the meat was tender!!!  The steak and ale pie was an amazing pot pie! Mac and cheese was super creamy and flavorful!  Over all everything was delicious and definitely worth coming! We were there for almost 3 hours though with service and waiting on checks.   It was not cheap either I think the total bill was well over 300 just a heads up but worth the experience!

6V-VjiWvRuhNAFUnfPLPlg.text: What an amazing restaurant!  Came in late without a reservation and was still welcomed and sat down immediately. The service was fast considering they had a lot of customers and several large parties. The food was amazing! Tried a little bit of everything because it was a rare experience. Everything was exquisite! Top quality and amazing taste!

hltnqH-jIIgjV5G8usAzuw.text: I was excited about trying a Gordon Ramsay burger. We tried to get in his Burger restaurant but the line was very long so I was happy to find the place on Opentable with no wait.   I was tempted to try the Beef Wellington but didn't want to spend that kind of money on something I wasn't sure about. Too bad they don't have samples. I decided to go with the Cheeseburger and fries. I loved the burger.  It was as good as I hoped it would be and the fries were great.  Maybe I'll splurge on our next Vegas trip and try the $57 Beef Wellington.   This restaurant is inside Caesars Palace in the casino so it is more casual than his other restaurants. It's a great place to hang out and enjoy great food and drinks. The service was good and the staff was friendly.

i5wGEznP6fFO3TDzxAUCVQ.text: We stayed at Caesar's so we ate here as we checked out and were on our way to the parking lot. There was no wait unlike the 2 hr line for the buffet.  Overpriced mediocre food, like the majority of places in Vegas.  The presentation of the food was good as well as the service!  It's a great place to go to if you're in a rush or don't want to wait in long lines.

-v2GNol3F7BaWHeNd-SJpQ.text: We absolutely loved this restaurant! I got the asparagus, side salad and hummus appetizer and my husband tried their burger with fries. Everything was seasoned perfectly. As a middle eastern, I am very critical of hummus but thought it was perfect. My husband said it was the best burger he ever had! The ambiance is very cute and eclectic.

dY8Y9z-mz9L9xGn8ynN6QA.text: Ramsey is our favorite celebrity chef.  Love his shows, love is online cooking videos, and appreciate his no nonsense attitude that demands excellence.   So we had high standards coming into this experience.    We give it a 3 relative to the 2 other celebrity dinner experiences that had while visiting.  Mesa grill was better and the other unnamed was much worse.    Beautiful ambiance, well done on decorating and bringing a fun Vegas style English pub experience to Vegas   We walked 30 minutes to get there... Vegas baby...  it took 15 minutes to get water on our table after sitting.  It was warm, no ice, and the worst tasting of our trip. We splurged on a $10 bottle of chilled water since getting ice was an elusive task.  The Caesar salad was a real disappointment...  no cracked peppercorn, and even though it was coated with dressing it lacked any real flavor.  It's only savior was  the fresh parmigiana shavings.   The braised pork rib was fantastic and we enjoyed every bite of it... but the cheddar mashed potato had no cheddar and no temperature.   The beef Wellington was good but not great.  The smear of sauce that accompanied it was gone in 2 bites (the best 2 bites of the meal). After waiting for more sauce the beef was as cold as the potatoes that it arrived with.    Dessert was amazing...  we had the sticky toffee pudding it it was a delight.  Great to end on such a strong note.    If Gordon has come disguised to this restaurant as he has to so many others. He might not have been as nice in his comments as we have. We enjoyed the experience but left wanting a better experience from our favorite chef.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States

ORmaxqigai27dekugRQy-g.text: Ramsay has a good reputation. Place is inside Caesar's Palace. The fish and chips were delicious. Perfectly battered; crispy without being greasy. The braised short rib was perfectly cooked and a nice size.

7HQ25zc6TGkyv9R_Jsw-mA.text: Diver Scallops and wedge salad were amazing.  The beef Wellington was so incredibly tender and tasty...  we had an amazing experience, our waiter Chris was so informative and made great suggestions.  He even entertained our annoying fan questions about Mr. Ramsay.  The ambiance and food were to die for.  Coming back tomorrow for the lobster Mac and cheese.  This is a got to try place.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Wedge salad and diver scallops

d0KUcIj9dsP4gxOG2SoYbg.text: First of all Check in for a free dessert!  I had Gordon Ramsay's signature menu tasting. Amazing from first course to dessert.  Pan seared scallops cooked to perfection. Beef Wellington cooked medium rare didn't need a steak knife to cut it. The beef was well seasoned, tender and was a hearty portion. Served with seasonal vegetables and creamy Yukon gold potatoes.  The sticky pudding was topped with vanilla ice cream and drizzled with caramel. Overall, the food was outstanding and the prices were reasonable. The roasted Scottish Salmon was flavorful and cooked perfectly and moist throughout. Quick and attentive service. No complaints at all.

K9AdqqBAFeBBH6v4AzEY5Q.text: Great place to get a great meal  I highly suggest you eating here ! Everything was so delicious  mmmmm! woT4ZNjBe18YEi-aHYOERA.text: Let me start with, I love Gordon Ramsay.  He's the man.  I love Burgr and Steak, but my food experience here at the pub was just lacking.  The ambiance was kind of cool, hip and trendy--one wall made completely of stack beer kegs--but at times the decor kind of felt a little forced.  I had the fish and chips---classic right?  Unfortunately I felt the fish missed the mark in flavor.  No doubt it was light and crisp, but just lacked character to it---as Gordon would say--bland.  I might try it out again for another menu option at some point, but it's not high on my list.

ak-nveHeDi1-puEegK3s7w.text: If you're looking for a restaurant that honestly has amazing food - this place is it! We had everything on their menu - making it just in time for their happy hour specials so why not?!  Their menu has options for everyone, even the pickiest of eaters. kVMaUvk341qKnRBrcTcjHg.text: We were pleasantly surprised by this restaurant...it far exceeded our expectations of just being an overrated celebrity restaurant.    We ordered the tomato soup to start and the chicken as our main and both were to die for!    They also brought out sticky toffee pudding for my birthday and it was also amazing!! Will definitely be returning!

R_OX38svYQA-KpTifpT_4w.text: After walking around the strip for a few hours, my friend and I decided we were both hungry and wanted to try something new for a change. I've always wanted to try one of Chef Ramsay's restaurants so I figured lets try the Pub and Grill. I must say I had very high expectations for this place because I always watch Chef Ramsay on TV, but I  was not too impressed with the food.   I ordered the lamb burger as suggested by the waiter, and I could not get myself to think that it was better than any other lamb burgers I have had. It had all the good elements of a burger, but it was very similar to the burgers I've had in the past. The best part was that it had a nice balanced flavor and was well complimented with the sauce. Nothing special though.  I also had some of the pan roasted airline chicken. My qualms with this dish is that the serving of chicken was really small. Also, the bed of white beans was all that was on the dish besides the chicken. The presentation was very bleh and the beans were flavorless. It became difficult to eat after awhile as it was very redundant especially because the chicken was quite flavorless as well. For the price, i thought it was the least appealing.  For the side, I decided to go with the mushrooms and poached egg. This was probably the best thing I had. It was the best poached egg I've ever tasted. Also, the mushrooms had a nice texture.   I really think that this place is pretty good depending on what you get. My experience with some of the dishes were not altogether "wow"ing but maybe it was because I hyped myself up because it was a restaurant owned by a world class chef. So, If you do go here, I recommend asking for the popular items, that way you can sort of filter out what is sought after, rather than waste your money on something you can go somewhere else for for cheaper;

XYZsAK-PJ2iUPQxp8rKtTQ.text: 10/26/2016-Wednesday dinner. We decided to eat here because it's Gordon Ramsey and we liked the idea of an English Pub atmosphere.  I enjoyed the ambiance of the pub and it was fun.  The food was just OK and the beer selection was limited.  We ordered Deviled Egg, Shepherd's Pie (lamb) and Fish and Chips.  The Shepherd's Pie was tasty and moist.  The Fish and Chips had crispy batter.  I poured that malt vinegar all over my fish and chips though.  I had the Pub Crawl cocktail which was good, but my husband complained about the limited draft beer selection considering it was supposed to be a pub.   I would dine here for the experience.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Front of restaurant. Fun place

Me-OQBb3WoGYy-SJGo_RWQ.text: We loved it! Thank you to our awesome waiter Rodney! Kids had the burgers, hubby had the flat iron steak, I had the short rib. Every thing was very tasty!!

I8UWNwSZQ4fDeG8ENT29Hw.text: Awful. Some of the worst food possible.  This place is busy and they have obviously tried to get that authentic 'English pub' feel to the interior. This, sadly, includes a horrible smell at the bar that is reminiscent of pubs that need a good clean.  The service was great. The staff at the door & the bar were friendly, helpful and highly recommended. The drinks menu is good too and the Bar Crawl cocktail was delicious. We sat at the bar as there was a 30 minute wait for a table at 19:15 on a Saturday evening (to be expected). This was fine and made for a great experience as we got to chat to the bar staff and watch some sports on tv.  We ordered the lamb burger, cheese burger, cauliflower cheese and sprouts. It was all cold and my cheese burger was really dry and inedible. I sent it back as I just couldn't eat it. It was so poor we didn't want to risk ordering dessert. I think GR would go mad if he came here on Kitchen Nightmares and tried the food! He needs to sort it out or take his name off it. Do not come here. It's really poor.

_JLALFn2na2iwh-DHZ123w.text: Wonderful, amazing service. Food was prompt and hot. Steak & ale pie for my girlfriend, and shepherds pie for me. Both were out of this world. Kudos to chef Ramsey.

OoYQ3q4OUZw25VW9B-YCpQ.text: Surprisingly good food for a place that calls itself a pub.  The scotch eggs were done with a touch of flair, the shrimp cocktail was better than expected and the organic chicken was great.    I'm used to having bangers and mash for breakfast but what the heck I ordered it for dinner and it was good enough to be an entree.

7n012F7dddYWjSYQSCR7CQ.text: Bad food, just not good. I ordered fresh hot pretzels and mini corn dogs. The pretzels were steal and the corn dogs were room temperature. I was not interested in re-ordering, I just got a full refund. This place has a big name but not quality control.

X0ISHBxaaNeiJ-F7h16Ddg.text: Came here for lunch and had Rodney as our server. He was GREAT gave the best recommendations (get the Bloody Mary you won't regret it!) had the lamb burger, crab sandwich, fish and chips and the bacon burger. Started with lobster Mac n cheese and it was incredible!

LihOk429f6gilp3VqqP-Fg.text: SHUT IT DOWN!  I was incredibly disappointed when we went to grab dinner here last night. Chef Ramsey would have been so upset at the lack of customer respect. It was like they really didn't care. And I found this unacceptable.   The hostess took us to our table which was a very cool table but it was not very comfortable for our group to have dinner at. It was so low, that there was no way we could even eat or cut our meat. If we were just drinking then we would have hung out here all night. I asked the hostess for a booth, which was right next to the original table.   She told me that the 4 empty booths were reserved and we couldn't sit there. I asked the hostess how embarrassed would she be if we sat at the uncomfortable table and no one showed up for those 4 booths in the next hour.  She ignored me and didn't respond.   She then told me that this was the only table we could have. The sad part is that 60% of the tables were empty and she refused to seat us anywhere else.  I told her I wanted to speak to the manager. She went back to the hostesses station told the other girl and the second hostess rolled her eyes. Honestly I'm the customer.  I don't need to see that. The hostess made a phone call to the manager, who never picked up his phone.  She then went in the back and when she came back she gave us one of the booths we had requested. Wow! What changed?  First, why did it take me 10 minutes to get a booth in a restaurant that was only 40% full. Secondly, I asked to speak to the manager and the manager never came out. Why? Completely unacceptable and disrespectful. Really where is the manager and why didn't he come over to talk to us.   On a side note: At 10:22pm, we were seated and at 12:19am the booths were still empty.  In fact, nobody ever sat in any of those booths for almost 2 hours. It became apparent that the hostess completely lied to us by telling us they were reserved. Who is training the staff to act like this?  Plus we sat at our table with no service for about 10 minutes. I believe the hostesses probably thought it was funny to send no one over.  We all discussed leaving but decided to stay.   At 11:52pm all of the lights went full blast, during our meal. It was so bright it hurt our eyes. I spoke to the guy cleaning the tables and he went to speak to the manager and the lights went back down after 5 minutes.  We were just trying to finish our dinner. He came back and said, "the manager had no idea who turned all the lights on!" I think the manager might need a visit from GR and he may have his lights turned on. The waitress told us the lights go full blast every night at that time. I think it must be on a timer, like last call for alcohol. But it should not blast all the lights in the dinning areas. It was not a fun feeling as we ate our dinners.   My first drink didn't look like the picture in the iPad menu. And I was told by the waitress that the drinks never look like the photos in the iPad. Then why do we have photos of the drinks in the iPad? Again this is wrong and not right. GR would be screaming at someone.   I went to order another drink at 12:00am but was informed that the bar was closed. I said really and why didn't someone tell us it was last call. There was no response. I told the waitress that I was just having a wheat beer and it shouldn't be a problem to pour a pint. All the bartenders were still there. She went to ask and came back with my pint but I noticed that the Orange slice was missing and about an inch of beer was also missing.  I asked where was the orange slice (this beer is suppose to come with it) and I was told that it was wrapped in Saran Wrap and put away. I asked her to grab me a slice and she said that it wouldn't be possible. Why is this dinner so painful?  I'm so mad that I haven't even got to reviewing the food yet.  The best thing we had here was the fingerling potatoes. It was a side dish but it was the star of the show. My buddy was not happy with his lamb. It was covered in a cheese and he felt it was over powering. I liked my PEI mussels and clams but didn't love them. They came with chorizo, carmelized fennel and lemon zest. I've had better mussel dishes elsewhere. I will say that the shellfish was fresh and only two clams had some sand in them.   Would I come back here again? Probably never! So you're saying there's a chance? I would only probably ever eat here if Chef Ramsey was actually here running it. This place needs to be on one of those Restaurant Rescue Food shows and its only been open 4 months. I was also informed by the staff that GR had only been there 5 times in the last 4 months, since this location opened. If that is True then, he really needs to spend some time here fixing the many issues. I think the loser of Hell's Kitchen might be running this place?  I let my love of GR influence my choice to stay! Next time I will follow my brain and not my heart. We should have all walked.

ui9tEQaKOwv7y2VrQW8Rvw.text: Great beer and great burgers. My friend had the lamb burger and I had the Signature burger with ghost pepper cheese and jalapenos. A little too spicy for my liking but scrape off the jalapenos and it was quite alright. Friendly server. Will be back. YumYum.

9liDKd-zr2-czs86MX_18w.text: I think i naturally set the bar to high because chef Ramsay's  name is behind it. Ok the waiter I had was really cool, loved the decor nice atmosphere and good service go a long way. The hell kitchen wings were delicious we also had the lobster and shrimp roll on toasted brioche which was bite size and only comes with 2 for $18.00 I know this is vegas but my experience here is basically summed up as overpriced pub food and nothing related to the food warrants the price.

AHuXONJm8bSckmJ-dafGcw.text: I stopped here a few times during my stay. I had the fish and chips and then the beef Wellington. Both very good. I wish they had some local beer selections.

qRSnS8vL7LomrdvE_uiyqQ.text: Stopped in for dinner last night.  Bottom line: the food is good, but the service is poor.  I tried the onion ale soup - B+. I also had the bacon cheeseburger - B. The burger would've been an A, but I ordered it medium and it was delivered nearly well done. The truffle fries were just ok. My wife ordered the steak and ale pie - A.  The service - F. Our waitress was inattentive and rude. She rarely checked on us, and when we tried to get our bill to leave, she was MIA. When we finally flagged her down and asked for the bill, she took 15 minutes to have another server bring it to us.  Probably won't return unless the service is addressed, or if we do, will just sit at the bar.

T6EZWdziUN4WdoNZVVe60A.text: Horrible- lets start with the front hostess, we had reservation for 5 @7:00 with confirmation numbers.  Of course it's not on there system, so we put our name down and it's an hour wait.  I talk to another girl with my confirmation number and she seems like she's the head hostess and tells me she will get us in earlier and take "some" off the bill for our inconvenience.  We get a seat 40 min later, screws up on our order, we send part of it back to the kitchen and they don't even take a dime off the bill for all our troubles.  Ironic seeing that it Ramsey's name and reputation and being such a big fan, it's a HUGE disappointment.  Can get better treatment and regular pub food in a whole in the wall anywhere else for 1/4 of the price

dIffciPWFjjttKT7HDTgWQ.text: I'm sooooooo sorry to say but this place was a BIG disappointment. My family and I were so excited to eat here but it was all a big hype. The food was cold, service was terrible and the prices were high for the type and quality and food. Will never eat here agin.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States

XBMqALkW85btdpYCZhlTpg.text: 1. Make a reservation and sit in the low chairs 2. Ask for Rodney S as your server.  3. Order the Nachos as a starter; excellent topped with short rib meat.  4. Highly recommend the fish and chips. Wifey got the Butter Chicken Curry which was awesome as well  Most importantly, finish the meal with the Sticky Pudding. It's amazing. Even if you're full, order it, I bet you'll finish it.   We will be back for the excellent food and first class service.

WF2eSXiRwB8eLKG2-2nFcQ.text: The service was excellent. The staff was very attentive and able to answer our questions. The waitress mentioned that it was restaurant week and there was a special which included a salad, entree and a dessert. I had a Caesar salad, shepherd's pie with another side salad, a caramel cake dessert and to drink a pint of Guinness. My wife also had a Caesar salad, the chicken curry with rice and naan, for dessert creme brulee and to drink a fruity cocktail. We were both satisfied with the salad but had problems with our entrees. My shepherd's pie was way too salty and my wife's meal, the chicken curry with rice, which was also salty, had rice that tasted stale and had an unpleasant smell.  My wife enjoy the creme brulee. I had the caramel cake dessert. I was dissatisfied with the taste of the cake. It was very bland and the caramel sauce and ice cream just masked the distastefulness of the cake. I ended up throwing it away.  This was the first time I've eaten at Gordon Ramsay's restaurant and I was expecting something more than what I got. If I'm to return, it'll only be for the Guinness.

mybYARikTihyMCoRlhq90g.text: The staff was very nice.  Asked for sweet tea and offered to make it for us.  Had the calamari  app and fish and chips. Both were good.   Decent portions of fish and seafood.  They came out timely and hot  asked for some extras and came out without a fuss. good side sauces.

UDz6UBGzKGeR1qwk1ueiJQ.text: My husband was severely ill after our visit to Gordon Ramsay Pub. Unfortunately he began feeling it at the Cirque Du Soleil show that evening following our meal and our entire arranged night was a write off. We returned the following afternoon to report our concern about the food and the manager was not attentive, and tried very hard to not be available. Nothing was done and we were made to feel that it wasn't possible that the food would be a source of his very violent illness. Really unfortunate, unappealing experience lacking standards.

KJyVNLeRRj5lv2jjWoC5jw.text: My husband and I just decided to walk in  just because it was there.. Well 1st our waiter was Scott!  An amazing person and absolutely took care of us. We had the hellfire wings 1st-  wow they were the best winds I have ever had.  Then we both had the burger-  WOW-  the best tasting burger I have ever had!  I would tell anyone to stop in and try -  if you are the all American- the ketchup is different but oh so good!   Thank you for an amazing experience!

Y_zaOBRgcgRLqPrlZCjECA.text: Gordon might've put a bullet in his brain if he'd had the dining experience to which I'd been treated. The good:nut appetizer and deviled eggs. The mediocre: overdone salmon (c'mon, there's never an excuse for this and worse, no offer of a condition), steak that while cooked to the right temperature, was a little tough and overly doused in some kind of unknown sauce.  Wine glasses far too small for swirling and a server that didn't seem to know pouring etiquette.

WnVscFerOM2pnINJfQ7u3A.text: Probably one of the worst dining experiences EVER!!! We went with high hopes and expected to be blown away.  The service was the worst service I've had in years, The waiter was a pompous jerk. The food runner was even a jerk. I took us 30 minutes to get our dessert. It was just bad.  I figured he had such high standards according to what he shouts about on his shows.  He really needs to get in there and whip them into shape. I would never go back. I'd rather eat at McDonald's

-7qXBA_NKBn1Xy6KmXSu5g.text: We ended up at this place because it had the shortest wait among other places in the vicinity and when everyone was going crazy for the buffet!!  We visited on Christmas day so naturally they were short-staffed. But the waiter was really nice and friendly and tried to make our experience a good one.  I ordered the scallops, it was good but it wasn't to die for. There were too many shallots in the dish and the sauce.   The atmosphere is very nice and chic, and I really liked the furniture and the decor.

fKjthDde1_1krfkYr4qeCQ.text: I normally don't write reviews about restaurants on Yelp, but I visited this location on 5/2/15 for dinner and I must say that the food in this place was very good.  The service was second to none and the vibe was very fun and energetic.  From the appetizers to the main course, I must say the food was incredible.  I will be back to this location the next time I am in Vegas.

oJ8kVlNj0NB2-9XZSMM11A.text: One of my nights in Vegas, my wife and i ate at the Pub and Grill. I have to say I was disappointed. The staff was outstanding, super attentive and friendly. The food was just ok. I ordered the Shepard's pie and it was very good, but my wife's short rib and cheek sandwich was very dry and looked like it had been slapped together like a fast food burger. I've eaten at Ramsey Steak and BurGR and I have to say Pub and Grill needs to step it up to match the quality of the other two.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beef short rib and cheek sandwich was very dry and lacked much flavor. Disappointed!
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shepard&#39;s Pie was very good!

pk6zSyMpA1SgAqFxeNqCJg.text: I'm going to take a shot at gordon. You always yell at your chefs for seasoning, but your pea soup had zero salt in it! Your bangers and mash, amazing, best dish I had there. Loved loved the onion gravy. Great beer selection too! Just add salt gordon, please! (Imagine me yelling this like he does)

K-acw-vjdKD9siXQMSV8Vg.text: Amazing food. My wife and I stuck to drinks and appetizers but it was all exceptional. The Executive Chef's English ale onion soup was essentially an immaculate play on the French onion soup. We ordered desert first and the salted caramel cheesecake was a decadent start. The seared diver scallops and chicken pot pie were exceptional as well. The service was attentive. So much so that our waitress replaced the mocha martini that was cleared early by a busser. No charge for it on the final bill. Love this place!

Xc56Lj_b47V7TAbFBejyEw.text: I Love this bar i make an annual trip to Vegas and This is always one place i make sure to go to. Bartenders are phenomenal and the drinks are just as good.  For a great bar/pub experience you cant beat Gordon Ramsey's!!!!

mNNzGQx8lhcCBGoOZpBbvQ.text: Ray Ray is incredible. Food is awesome and the service is even better.  Amazing number of beers on tap and always a good time. Recommend the warm salty pretzels, nachos, bacon burgers and tomato soup.  Always make a point to stop by here at least once per trip but usually go at least twice.  Thank you!!

700_iV_DaWSkjW4RVihd0Q.text: Must visit if youre in vegas. Ask for the brisket corn beef "ray ray style".  Best service, thanks again Ray Ray.

osnUuF9ovU-3JLpfpA2GVQ.text: My boyfriend and I visited on a Saturday night. Even though the place looked packed, we were seated within 5 minutes of walking in without a reservation. We didn't want to spend too much money since we had mistakenly come to Caesar's looking for Ramsey's BURGR and decided to eat here since we were starving.  We were seated behind the wall of beer kegs which was awkward since the table was raised and we were technically sharing the table with another group on the other side. The table was also weirdly wide and the place was noisy so we couldn't have much conversation. My boyfriend had the fish and chips and I had the lobster mac n' cheese, which is a side dish. The fish and chips was surprisingly big. The fish was well seasoned and still moist. With the tartar sauce they tasted really good. The fries were also nice and crisp and well seasoned. The house made ketchup was really good. The lobster Mac n' cheese was a bit underwhelming. The noodles were a nice al dente and the bechamel sauce was rich and creamy but I was expecting more lobster for the price (ridiculously $21). And it was still side dish size. I had maybe 1 small piece of  lobster for every 7 bites which is too small a ratio to call it lobster Mac n' cheese if you ask me! Also could have used more cheese, but I guess that's personal preference.   For the pub atmosphere and the pub quality grub, Ramsey should definitely consider lowering the prices.

e8LBynnKktmxw68qzcjcrA.text: Great foot, drinks and service by Christopher for lunch today.  We stopped in for a lunch bite and casino people watching and were not disappointed in the least.  I had the trio min-pie sampler and can't decide which is my favorite as all were yummy.  My husband had the fish and chips very well seasoned, nicely fried, not greasy and very flavorable.  The best part was our side, english peas with bacon and onions that melted in your mouth...well done and we will be back the next time we come to Vegas!

MVf_a-fGUCvlq4aE9-kuog.text: Food was fantastic! Make a reservation just in case though. Service wise, our waiter failed on many aspects. He barely  paid attention  to our table and was a little  condescending towards us.

uToiAEZzCyBA4gjIbVfOpw.text: I have eaten at his steak house and it got great marks. His burger place is good. the pub sounds like a grand concept but it does not measure up. food is average at best and that is stretching it. The prices are over the top. 4 beers and appetizers at lunch and a bill of 140 at lunch for 2 people.... I seldom comment on price-- more than willing to pay for good food but this was not good while being over priced. Vegas has many better choices.

Rh3iuTK1AvSK99xcd7V0sQ.text: For Gordon Ramsey this place is a disappointment.  The warm pretzels were not so warm or soft.  The deviled eggs were tasteless.  I was really disappointed in these.  For the price this place is charging it's a pure embarrassment.  This is nothing than a tourist rip off.  I would have rather paid for McDonalds.

NvTkoZ6V37STVgz4RWr5rw.text: I'm not sure I went to the same place as others. Either that or some people get some kind of weird thrill out of nitpicking celeb restaurants rather than reviewing honestly) We ended up here Christmas Eve after deciding that the 4 hour wait for Bacchanal wasn't putting us in the holiday mood. We asked for specific seating (not  wanting to sit at the pub tables) and received it with a smile.  We started with the pork and duck rillettes, which were delicious and well prepared. Our table of 3 had the hangar steak, the scallops and the pork belly with the baby carrots and potato puree to share. Steak was flavorful and tender (the server did suggest my Mom order it no more done than medium which was a good call), the scallops were very well done and the pork belly was yummy. Desserts were beyond good. We had the triple chocolate trifle, the pear crumble and the spotted dog. Total for our table with 3 entrees, 2 sides, 1 app, 3 desserts, 2 glasses of wine and bottled water was $240. Service was impeccable and friendly. This is pub food at its best. English pubs, by the way, are not known for huge menus, so to expect a Cheesecake Factory type menu here is ridiculous. It is actually a fairly extensive menu for a pub. Prices were in line with other casino restaurants of the same pedigree.

yXrdIAyeFC229fASCj5hVw.text: Loved the decor. Heavy good bar furniture , great silverware, good happy hour prices.  Really really wished the service was faster, food and drinks took some time. The appetizers were very very good though. If they had better wait staff, would have been 5 stars.

UTFNuXSIFWIp0w6_4m22hg.text: I love this place. Everything I've ever tried here is delicious. I always make sure we stop off at Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill for our fix. Love the bartenders they're the best. They're all so friendly & they can make delicious drinks. Ask for Airrion or Mike...aka Magic Mike... they'll hook you up with some amazing drinks.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sticky Toffee Pudding... to die for
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States

k7_LXG-0U92ALVRDfqpaVQ.text: Christian and bong were terrific bartenders service was great!  The food was amazing would definitely come back again!

JWchaOy8M_aZel4SfbyJvg.text: Great restaurant. Menu was really good. Staff at the bar where friendly, welcoming, and social. Food is next level. Will definitely come back on future visits.

Tg2JzkFbFyQZknAjWyXr2g.text: Had the chance to try the beef wellington sooo good and I dont really eat beef anymore(had to), shrimp crab rolls so yummy and refreshing, creme brulee tasty but over cooked

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Had the special beef Wellington , rolls refreshing, creme tasty but overcooked

KygpoTvPFXVQhVBn951iNg.text: Enjoyed Hell's kitchen so much we went to the Pub and grill. Same great service and nice food selection. I enjoyed being catered to and this pub did just that. The wedge salad is large so if your a light eater share   The steak was cooked to perfection.

ytDrXOd0kxpoH8toQ0jLLw.text: Do not waste your money on Chef Ramseys place, great marketing, high dollar for mediocre food.  On his TV shows he scold's his Chefs to be cooking their best, that is not the case as we have experienced it. What a donkey!

q9nZ0EFlHaJ7tobCNChjEQ.text: Service was mind numbing... they were not busy at the time, yet it took forever to get our drinks... we ordered ice tea not overly labor intensive.  The hummus was good, was going to order more but didn't want to invest another couple of hours.

5kfzz-A4-oDcezzOxhNJZQ.text: Food was good.  Sat next to high roller and server paid more attention to that table.

nE5zmiClz5yE9t14WBY12w.text: GR has three restaurants in Vegas, and I've been to 2/3 of them -- BurGr (that's another review). Anyways I had high hopes for this place since Gordon Ramsay is known as that judge that insults people for messing dishes up. He needs to come to this location and train these cooks... better yet insult them. KIDDING. When I took a bite out of my Butter Chicken Curry, it was very bland, along with the saffron rice. Curry and saffron rice are supposed to be flavorful, which they both lacked.. I guess I shouldn't have expected a strong flavor of curry since this is a pub & grill... BUT its GORDON RAMSAY! Why put it on the menu if its not a dish you specialize in. Note: the menu is pretty limited with signature dishes.  My bf got the fish and chips with peas, and that was just okay as well... IDK if it was an off day or what, but everything felt under-salted. The experience there was also meh, service was just OK,  the waiter asked us how our mixed greens salad was, and never checked up on us when we got our entree's.   Fortunately, there was a good ending to our meal, which was the sticky toffee pudding -- it comes with caramel sauce and vanilla ice-cream (ice cream was the best part) and that kind of made up for the lack of flavor from our dishes, it's really sweet, but the vanilla ice cream gave it a nice balance.  Would I come back?  Only if GR himself were there.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Butter chicken curry. Meh
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fish &amp; chips with mushy peas
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sticky toffee pudding. The ice cream makes this dish! Very sweet if you&#39;ve got a sweet tooth

mPU22zdSYQpDPPRDAmWhpg.text: Review is strictly for drinks at the bar-- too full to eat!   Our bartender Ronnie was awesome! Very personable and gave great food recommendations for a future visit. He also made a mean Ramsay Tonic-- the combination of gin, St. Germain, cucumber, tonic, and grapefruit juice was refreshing. Also a very nice serving size for the price. I left the bar feeling pretty good to do some damage at the Forum Shops. Thanks, Ronnie!

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ramsay Tonic
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Boddingtons

palnMr0lh3b6kVB8KKsuAQ.text: Very disappointed! The food looked more like dog food! The butter Curry Chicken was suggested by the waiter, it was so spicy (waiter failed to mention) I had to eat it with the burnt Naan that was served with it . Sheppard's Pie Looked worse than dog food and on the opposite side, had no flavor!  Rice was very dry and minty?  Waiter never came around, pretty much paid and left.... and that was pushing it! GO elswewhere!  I really had high hopes as I watched Gordon Ramsey poor his heart into his food or so I thought!!!     *Update: while this review is based off of the food my husband and I ordered, I updated this review as the management staff was very attentive and professional in dealing with this matter. Thank you!

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States

q0SyPKY9d0J1uM3erTo_bw.text: Heather was awesome, great service. Very attentive, service was unusually fast for a vegas restaurant. Beef Wellington was amazing but so was everything else our party ordered.

dXpc1jLG5dPbbGToQYdjfw.text: 3.75 stars rounded up   My party of three ended up here after learning the wait for Bacchanal was a hangry-making three hours long, forcing us to breakaway from our usual & try someplace new.   Buffalo wings were some of the best I've had; meaty & not overly acidic (HH pricing was a plus.) Two out of three cheeses on charcuterie platter were of the blue variety, which two out of the three of us didn't appreciate!   Steak & Ale Pie was blanketed in a buttery, golden crust & had a generous amount of fork-tender beef, mushrooms, & root veggies in a salty gravy. His ribeye looked slightly overcooked, he called it "buffet quality" (I get it, we're at a pub not a steakhouse, but a $45 steak shouldn't disappoint.) She had bangers & mash & liked the variety of sausages except for the chicken, which had little flavor.   Dessert was a heavenly, decadent Sticky Toffee Pudding and a lighter Eaton Mess with berries. Delicious!

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Steak &amp; ale pie

KZSCgvGeXnNgcqx-usUf9Q.text: We've been to Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill twice in the last year and each time is even better than the last! I am NEVER disappointed when I eat at a Gordon Ramsay restaurant! The food is always amazing and the staff are so nice and fun to be around! The drinks were even delicious! I will definitely be back again! Very soon'

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States

wJ-4VslgEYSDJjNGriocGg.text: Having watched some television shows with Chef Ramsay, you know he is very demanding with high standard and so I expected nothing but perfection out of an establishment bearing his name. I had dinner here. The service was just average: in no way bad, but not exceptional or memorable. I had a chicken wing dish to start. It was pretty good, but no better than what you might get a Buffalo Wild Wings. I followed this with a Shepherd's Pie, which was really good. I would definitely come back to Gordon Ramsay Pub for food if in Las Vegas again.

VTL2BPKbhlDoCpgLd1CtUQ.text: Average pub with rather pricey food - I suppose you pay for the brand. We ordered fried calamari as a starter and they were pretty good. As main we ordered steak for $43/ each and the chef cooked it to the point as requested. However,  the quality of the meat was average and rather tasteless. Also the peppersauce was missing the special kick and the broussel sprouts were swimming in oil. On the bright side, the service was excellent at all times. Finally, I still wouldn't recommend it because there are plenty of better places for dining around offering better quality food to a better price.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Steak with pub sauce
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Brussel sprouts
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beef fillet with pepper sauce

sud2zQkNr1VjbBE_sdvL_Q.text: Went to Vegas for a nice weekend of fun with several work friends.  With so many different choices its hard to determine the best options for dinner. Hell's Kitchen was booked so we continued our walk to Gordon's Pub & Grill. We arrived on time for our reservation and we were seated immediately. The restaurant was almost to capacity and had a very loud vibe to it as it is open to the casino floor inside Caesar's Palace.  Almost 10 minutes passed before our waitress checked in and once she made it to the table she walked us thru a few different drink options.  We ordered 2 drinks from the bar and proceeded to wait another several minutes. The menu was awesome. There were so many great choices it was difficult to decide on a starter and even what to have for dinner.  Many of us all ordered the Beef Wellington and it truly did not disappoint. It was cooked to perfection and we well seasoned. Our waitress did a nice job checking in to make sure we all had everything we needed.  Overall it was a good experience. My only critical feeling about the entire place was feeling like I was sitting in the middle of the casino floor having dinner. Otherwise I recommend the restaurant and will return in April with another group.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beef Wellington

TkwGmlor5uxJsInt2QcrHg.text: We had a variety of appetizers,none very good. Ordered beef Wellington,fish and chips,cheeseburger,and truffle fries. There was not one decent dish in the bunch. So disappointed,as that was one of the reasons we went to this namesake of one of the best chefs. We expected top notch food. So sad to see that it's obvious that Mr. Ramsay's doesn't oversee the restaurants that bear his name.

p8iPdMSIrP-XlQxWs5Ba9g.text: Just terrible. An incredibly pedestrian cheeseburger  for $21 and an over dressed chopped salad  with $13 beers on top of that!! Over $70 for a mediocre burger, salad and 2 beers? no thank you. We were in a hurry so only thing good about this visit was the fact that our waiter was attentive and got our food order in and to us quickly. But the speed was not worth the outcome of just pour quality food. I would stay away

8WZ66HVkOhXpsTpLk2J_dw.text: Was in town for the weekend and was joined by my daughter and son in law who were visiting from New York. I had visited this restaurant once prior during the CES Show and thought it was ok. On Saturday evening at about 9PM no wait to speak of so we thought we'd give this a try. I shared the Fish & Chips with my daughter and her hubby had a wedge salad. For the table we decided to try the Lobster Mac & Cheese which from the description sounded great. Once delivered we could clearly see that we had built this up in our minds to something it failed short to deliver on. Once we started to dig into it we were reminded of Kraft Mac & Cheese with a few bits of lobster. The cheese was runny and very Kraft like so there was no hot bubbly and crusty goodness to this dish...not even, "please be careful not to touch the dish it's really hot" coming from the server....Anyway, we ate it and commented amongst ourselves about how this dish falls short and is not worthy of Gordon Ramsey's name. I even commented that, "If he was here I'd ask him to try it and would rail him if he thinks this is acceptable of his name and the $26.00 price tag attached to it. I decided to let the server know that it fell short of expectations even though we consumed it entirely. She was very gracious and even sent the manager our way. I repeated the way it fell short of expectations based on the word smithing in the menu...to which he apologized profusely and offered to take it off the bill...I rebuked his offer bu he insisted and won out. The fish and chips were ok as was the salad. I'll give it another try for sure but do not expect miracles. I don't envy Gordon Ramsay putting his name on lots of different venues and trusting that they all would meet his expectations when they can't meet even mine.

_6fiTkZAgEXc-eqGTQ0JuA.text: It would be 0 stars if possible. I've never been to a Gordon Ramsay restaurant before, but for our last night in Vegas (all other meals were great!) my girlfriend and I decided to check out his Pub and Grill in Caesar's. Hands down worst meal of the strip. Service was friendly but every course was wayyyyy over cooked. Buyer beware, if you want medium order extra rare! Smallest wings of my life and as dry as the nearby desert, medium rare prime rib more like well done, over salted everything, and medium strip steak was well done and charred (sorry for repeating myself but overcooked is the theme of this review). The manager offered to "take care of us on our next meal here," but there is no way I'll ever be back, or any Ramsay joint for that matter. Sorry Gordon, you lost me at hello.

LUsXH-JgSAW90_EA7E8QXg.text: Second visit and still Ray Ray taking care of us at the bar. I ordered the fish and chips and wife had the butternut squash soup. I grew up in the U.K on fish and chips so I've had a few in my lifetime. The beer battered cod was everything you'd expect. I'm taking off a 1/2 point as you never get shoestring chips in England. The fries were a bit of a disappointment. I'm adding a half point on how well they did the peas. First you have to like peas and then again you need to like mint as it's seems to me a combo dish. Personally loved it. Wife had the butternut squash soup and practically licked the bowl. Bartender service outstanding. Will be back next visit.

kRscfJKjl3J_ywGEUuAmWg.text: A lot of folks appear to have had a negative experience. We did not.  Food was very good.  Yes it was expensive..... this is Vegas.  Everything costs more here especially on the strip.  Add to that the fact it's a Gordon Ramsey establishment and the cost ticks up.  But what did you expect?  Vegas, The Strip, Gordon Ramsey, and a $6 burger? Everyone is entitled to his or her opinion based on their experience.  We had a great time and everything we ate was excellent.  Could there be a little Ramsey bashing going on?  Why, you ask, if it was so good did I only give it 4 stars?  Well our server was excellent but that was the last staff member that was.  The hostesses are in need of training.  We were promptly seated only to be told several minutes later that there was no server on duty of that table (despite tables all around us being handled).  So we were moved and damn if it didn't happen again!  The third seating was a charm, however.  Unfortunately, it wasn't handled well.  Their staffing issues should not be experienced by the customer especially when they had what appeared to be plenty of staff on hand.  And yes, for the amount of money we spent you expect better service.  However, the problem wasn't the food!  I've lived in Vegas for many years and watch restaurants come and go.  All experience some growing pains.  I sincerely hope that this one grows out of theirs.  We'll go back expecting the same great food, higher than average prices, but much better service.

fEE6n4AFxiZWPsK0OMAkWg.text: They take boring pub food and make it taste good.   The pork chop was the best.  Great service from all.  Had the chicken come out cold.  They took care of it right away and com the one meal.  Things go wrong how you How you it makes the difference   Very good

tPDRKLupMdUsTNdARksDCg.text: The food and service are worth 4 stars but the 3 stars are for the price. If you call yourself a pub I don't think you should serve a $20 burger or a $10 dessert. Just seems kinda anti pub to me. However my lamb burger was delicious! The sticky toffee pudding was equally delicious. I'm usually not a bread pudding dessert fan but it was one of the best things I've ever had. I've had the push pop version at burgr that is equally delicious. If it weren't for the price, I'd give this place 4 stars!

5CAml0Iy4j4_M-fsBWHbTg.text: Incredible! The food was amazing. Our waiter, Joshua, was fabulous. The atmosphere was great. We have now visited two of Gordon Ramsay's restaurants and know that whenever one of his restaurants is an option, that will definitely be where we go. So happy with our experience here!

r9b4DfT30yl719i0SIFK_Q.text: This was an average meal. We went on a Saturday without reservations and had an hour or so wait. They did have a nice bar to wait and a good selection of beers. I had the scallops. The dish lacked taste and creativity. One of my friends had  over cooked lamb and the other the sliders. I have to say the sliders were the best thing we ordered on the table. I would go back for an appy and a beer but would steer clear of the main dishes.

9d8MYMRiyLglRRtBHx-8WA.text: Had to walk out.  Sat waiting for drinks (even water).  The table we were sitting at wasn't big enough for kids, much less adults.  GR should be embarrassed.

Q4wVKlMIclQuOKQ2qklKsw.text: I am a Gordon Ramsay fan so I wanted to try this restaurant solely due to that fact. The place was decorated nicely resembling a modern british pub even mismatched chairs and dark woods. Every waiter however wears the same weird outfit, which in my opinion should be rethought, but I don't like men in skinny jeans. Being seated took some time because the place was busy but I could see many unoccupied tables. Not enough help? Once seated the waitress was friendly and answered any questions we had. My husband ordered fish and chips. He wasn't impressed. He said the batter was bland. I had the sliders and although greasy they were very tasty. The absolute highlight of the meal was the truffle mac and cheese served family style! That was amazing! I would go back just to eat that! I would eat here again.

cvW2ypbZkljul4Om-2Z4mw.text: The food was good but the service was slow and the bill for four came to $225. Yikes.  We had two appetizers, fish & chips, a chicken pot pie, a pot pie sampler, a Caesar salad, one alcohol drink, three sodas and two desserts. Does that sound like a $225 meal to you?  $29 for two pieces of fish and shoe string fries? Really?  There was a side order of Yukon Gold mashed potatoes listed on the menu for $12 or $13. Those potatoes would have to perform a dance or stand up routine to be worth that kind of money. This is pub food not fine dining.  The only reason we went was we had $125 worth of gift certificates we had to burn and this place had space available on a Saturday evening. We never expected to have to add $100 to cover the bill.

VxfKZcf6MAXAKUFgOgrWFQ.text: This was my first ever restaurant week place and I was pleasantly surprised despite the not so stellar reviews.  Boyfriend loved the pork belly, my salmon was soft, slightly raw but still tasty.  The onion soup was a tad salty.  The sticky toffee pudding is a must - that's to die for!

rEGhMKRQzkZpBXEFS3egWg.text: Service is very good, but they really try too hard to have you order a beverage or dessert.  I would recommend you make reservations 2 days ahead of time.  It seems to be very popular especially starting Thur-Sat, when the crowds pour into LV for the weekend or when a big headliner is in town (Elton John was performing when we were there).  We tried: 1. Baby beet salad, $16, very good 2. Ale onion soup, $12.  OK, wouldn't order again. 3. London Calling (cocktail), $15, very good 4. Cornish Chicken, $26.  Hubby liked this dish, I didn't try it. 5 Fish & Chips  - large pieces of fishy-tasting cod, fried the way I remembered it in London. Tastes better if you pour malt vinegar on it, but the bottle had one of those spouts that will pour large amts if you're not careful.  The fries were wedge-type, meh. $26. I really wanted to try the sticky toffee, but we were too full.  If you want dessert, would recommend you skip any appetizer, salad or soup. The portions are very large in LV.

PCpoUpo0m85CumKmDYpdUw.text: When you think of Gordon Ramsay's reputation, you think of culinary excellence. This place delivered anything but. The food is horrifically bad. Of the 4 dishes, the food was bland, dried, cold (when it should have been hot) and beyond disappointing. The wait staff must have been trained by the Renaissance Festival circa 1980. Since when does a person go out to spend $30 a plate and be treated like they're wasting a servers time and beneath them? Here's a bit of advice, you can talk to me like Gordon Ramsay when you're writing my paycheck. But if I'm the one potentially giving you yours, don't give me any lip and don't act like an ass. To Gordon's Ramsay Pub and Grill staff: Piss off all of you!

RHizEvXwo_b8uXcuyGAmLA.text: I so wanted to give this place 5 stars for the Dublin Corned Beef Brisket Sandwich alone. First time we came in Wednesday with a party of 8. Phenomenal food and great service...everyone was happy. Came back today with just myself, my Husband and Son. We sat at a high top in the bar area. Worst service ever. One girl came and asked if we wanted anything other than water. I said as soon as my husband gets here yes, he was parking the car. She never came back. Husband came, we waited. And waited. Finally a guy came and asked if he could take out food order. We ordered. And waited. And waited. Husbands salad came out and it was supposed to be blue cheese. We said so and got a blank stare with a "well this is balsamic vinaigrette." Uh, we'd like what we ordered please." And got attitude. Food came out two minutes later. Then the salad five after that. Still good food but by this time no one came to get our drink order or bring water. Ever again. We tried several times to get ANYONES attention and were ignored. My son jumped in front of the guy who took our order to get the check. I get that it was busy but I couldn't even tell you if we had a server let alone which one it was. First time I have ever not left a tip. Please get it together because we really like the food.

Gpd0lXka_ax9wlGIiTK6dQ.text: I stopped by GR Pub for a quick drink with clients before they had to catch a flight home from doing a site inspection in Las Vegas.  Our experience with RayRay ("he's so big he needs 2 names" - his quote), was amazing!  I passed my credit card as we only had 45 min and knew we'd need to drink, eat and run...RayRay passed the card back but not before he slyly recognized my company name listed below mine.  He called me by name but also just before we left, had his manager come over and introduce himself.  They both said "Thank you for the business, not only today, but for all the business we bring to Las Vegas!" It took me a minute to realize that he had coyly notice I work for the Las Vegas Convention Authority.  This experience with that kind of attention to detail and personal service, is what makes every visitor return home with a great story and attributes to making Las Vegas the number one tourist destination that it is!  Thank you RayRay and team for making me and our city look fantastic.    P.S. The customer brought a 20,000 person convention to town one month later. They told me they brought 6 groups of people to Gordon Ramsey Pub because of this interaction with RayRay!  Great job sir!

JVrn48SKuDXPZHLaai7p_Q.text: Took the weekend and traveled to Las Vegas Thursday night stopped in for a few drinks and dinners. Wow Carri was our waitress, amazing service not to mention food!! To top it off we also met 2 over the top people, Randy G.  Bar manager, what a class act.
