He made sure our experience was unforgettable and took a genuine interest in us, he went as far as introducing us to season 10 winning chef ... She was very welcoming and even though she was extremely busy, she took the time to get to know us and let us know how thankful she was that we choose Chef Ramsey's pub and grill to dine  She even took pictures with us.... This restaurant is the Bomb, great food, atmosphere and fun people, who's service levels were over the top. We returned Sunday and the experience was consistent. We were waited on by Scott who was entertaining, service driven and truly interested in creating another unforgettable experience. RANDY was working the evening shift and when he seen us, he immediately came to welcome us and to insure our dining experience was top notch. Even though we just met these fine people, they made us feel like family and they there actions reflected a perception of passion for the service industry and that they loved what they do. I would highly recommend you make Chef Ramsey pub and grill inside of Ceases Palace a must experience, when in Vegas this restaurant was Amazing!! Thank you Randy, Carri, Scott and the season 10 winning chef for making my Birthday and visit to Vegas an experience I my wife and friends will not forget.

ZFA1JKPZ7WHKc5t9BBHAxA.text: Well like many of the other reviews our expectations were based on our belief that Mr. Ramsay's consistent push for excellence would be reflected in his own establishment. Our party of seven had reservations for over two moths prior to arrival, unfortunately we still waited twenty five minutes to be seated. Our server who was friendly and enthusiastic was also inattentive and unprofessional. We waited for over 15 min. every time we ordered drinks, and even though our entrees took 67 mins from the moment we sat down, he only served one serving of bread sticks (5). We are frequent travelers to Las Vegas and clearly understand that everything is over priced, However we were extremely disappointed in the service and the quality of the food.

L0BYivsgcb_sCdXUSims5g.text: Tried it out this past weekend with a few friends. The feel is sorta between a bar and a restaurant(duh hence the name), little dark, open air. Located inside Caesars Palace where Bradley Ogden used to be. As expected for such a spot, prices are a bit on the higher side, and like all other Caesar properties, slightly discounted(read as $1-2) prices for their Total Rewards cardholders. Had the shepherds pie. Very good. Our server seemed a bit slow. Took him awhile to greet us, refill waters etc. He brought out the complementary bread when we were in the middle of the meal. He did apologize about that. I heard good things about their desserts but didn't try any this visit, maybe next time. Woulda gave it 4 stars but the service wasn't grade A. If the prices don't give you sticker shock and youre in Caesars Palace, it wouldnt be a bad place to try.

ESw8IKzKv1OR9HzLVGkv5A.text: Had the fish & chips. Yes. A winner !  Hard to find places that don't over cook them... Also had the muscles and clams. Also, good. The bread with the sauce to soak up, yumm.  All the hype and pom poms aside. This is a great place. I would go back for the overpriced fish and chips. I poured on the malt vinegar. mmmm so good. Will go back for the dessert next time.   Ignore the negative nellys, the palce is fun & festive ...

XCJA_hPeF2H_borKekFm7A.text: Atmosphere was great, our server was fantastic, and the food was spot on! We went to celebrate my fathers birthday. Had the scotch egg for an appetizer that came with pickled Brussels sprouts and cauliflower which was amazing! I normally hate Brussel sprouts but I loved the ones they served. For my main course, I had the bangers and mash which was to die for! I definitely left full and happy! My father had the fish and chips and had me try some which was amazing as well. The fish was perfectly cooked and very moist and flaky. I would definitely recommend this place to anyone! It's a bit pricy but definitely worth it! ^_^

IxojtaV7KvX1A_jIofIojQ.text: 4 stars just because the service was very very slow !!!  Other than that the food was amazing !!! Got the lobster rolls and Mac and cheese for starters, GAHHHHHHHHH!!!! Amazing   Entree wise I got the chicken pot pie, amazing as well and the chicken beef sausage which OMG let me tell you!!!! That was amazing as well!!!   Seriously worth every penny !

WbG0PB1RDZW4HW3l5ZrIJA.text: Had a dinner date here & it was one of the highlights of our trip to Vegas last week--it helps that we already love both pub food and British fare in general.  Briefly: The shepherd's pie was excellent, and my wife devoured her lamb burger with much love. We think the real highlights were the starters and desserts, though; the "Pub Spots" (sliders) were phenomenal, and we think well worth the price. We ordered 3 desserts to share (though it turned out to be too much by that point in the meal, and we left a little at the table) and while all were bliss-worthy treats, the sticky toffee pudding was the standout favorite (and the only one entirely finished).  A bit pricey, but more affordable for us than, say, Gordon Ramsay Steak and (we think) worth it. The service we received (it was relatively early; we arrived around 5:30PM for dinner) was excellent, and we never felt we were waiting long for anything--and there was always someone to hand to take a plate or refill a drink or whatever was needed.   After watching Ramsay on TV for a few years, it was nice to be able to see that he really does run (or at least put his name on) well-run restaurants with great food and service. We probably won't return, but it'll be because we've saved up for Steak, next time we want to do Ramsay in Vegas!

6BEkwmldrlt99FDSXOMMdw.text: Let me first say, I love Gordon Ramsay. I think he is a fantastic chef and watch him all the time. So when I was planning my anniversary trip it was a must that we eat in at least one of Gordon's restaurants. So we decided on the Pub & Grill because my girlfriend really wanted the fish and chips after seeing him make his recipe on one of his shows. I ordered the Shepard's Pie with cheddar mashed potatoes. Then we ended the meal with the lemon raspberry tart.   The negatives: we made a reservation weeks in advance and were placed directly next to kitchen. There was also a store room where chairs were paraded in and out throughout our hour there. I don't know if they get a lot of walk ins or if they are primarily reservations, but making a reservation should ensure you don't get placed in the worst seat in the house. Maybe that's an unspoken rule that this restaurant doesn't acknowledge. The fish and chips were ridiculously greasy. I understand fried food is greasy but I pinched off a small bit and had grease running down my arm. Parts of the batter were raw which is never pleasant to bite into. The Lemon Raspberry tart did not arrive per the menu description and the staff did not mention any changes to the menu. I get that ingredients sometimes run out but there wasn't even any raspberry on the tart. It was supposed to have a jam and compote, but instead it  came with some fresh strawberry and blueberries with a dollop of whip. Not bad just not as expected.  On the plus side: The wait staff was amazing. The food came out hot and delicious in a matter of minutes. The shepard's pie was perfect in every delightful morsel of a way. The atmosphere at the restaurant was great and cool for a pub. The cod was cooked perfectly  and the fries were great. I had never had smashed peas and they are a new fav.

U_IPHmgzX1YC-QIgYJ3OBA.text: I'm going to recommend this place to everyone I know. This place is amazing! I had the bangers and mash. It was delicious. Everything that my group had was amazing.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States

wJmOLiLoppy-dcTlznIJqw.text: This is a 3 star place. Decor and bar very nice and service was pretty good  We had: Scottish Eggs , good but not hot Wings- pretty good  Steak and ale pie- Like a a pot pie.  Small portion and average   Lamb Burger- My son liked it very much  Toffee Cake desert- very good

i49mpQ0iwRkwnQy4RIDbxw.text: Atmosphere: very loud and crowded. Funky chairs and lots of tvs. Very fun and casual.  Food: Huge beer selection including beer samplers. Fun cocktails as well. I got some sort of blue lemonade cocktail and it was delicious. We also ordered truffle fries. They are a little but thicker than shoe string fries but very good. We also got toads in the hole, which is what they call pigs in a blanket. They were good but I was not a fan of the meat to pastry ratio. I would have preferred more pastry or less meat.   Service: service was pretty average. We were waited on but it was a little slow (even though they were not that crowded). Also very hard to hear so we had to repeat ourselves.   Of course everything is pretty expensive. We might be back but there are so many other things to try it may be a while.

m-4qg3-GUQUgFDzuodTU_A.text: Let me start by saying the food was great! Small portioned but great! However the prices and the lack of service really drove down my rating for two stars. We had to flag down the waiter to get water/tea refills. The prices are typical vegas but I mean come on for the small portioned and no presentation I am not sold. I was half tempted to get a dessert however when I saw the portions I did not want to spend the extra dollars. My advice would be to go somewhere else where you can leave and be full. Still hungry and spend way too much for the little you get.

A3ti1XfsdMjyww31YCpQOA.text: The food ain't even out yet but Imma do this review anyways. Our waitress seems to be lost most of the time. I asked for some lime/lemon for the water and she never brought it. We have a table for six and it has been 40 mins since we ordered and still nothing on the table yet. Our water needs refilling at this point in time but she just looks at us and keeps moving. I'm so thirsty right now i feel like im about to go drink from the water fountain at the bellagio The chair is unusually high with no backrest in this joint. Better be carefully or u Crack your head when u slip.   I'll edit this review once the food comes out...   The food is OK. Not great, not good, but ok. I expected more from a Gordon ramsay restaurant seeing how they put him on TV and shit. Now i know why he's pissed all the time, it's all shitty. How do you not provide spoons when customers order soup? The rice was stale. The steak was very bitter. The clam chowder is good, but i think i like progresso better. I'll stick with yelps reviews next time.   Btw, did I mentioned that their chairs are super uncomfortable??

QsDJwED82nqYfW6ADErTnw.text: Let's start off that in Caesar's Palace, there is no shortage of food options. Fine dining is as commonplace as a tourist with a spiked neon slushie in a foot-long container. That said... When we chose to eat at Gordon Ramsay's Pub and Grill, it was calculated. We were all enthusiastic to eat at this scary, yet reputable chef's restaurant.  But all went awry when 45 minutes after placing our order, our party was awaiting the APPETIZER.  And the most puzzling part was that the restaurant was damn near EMPTY at the time we ate. Where the dag nabbit was Ramsay with his inappropriate and oft mal-placed British curses and wrinkled forehead to scare the bejesus out of these chefs for a hustle on our order? 45 minutes on a meal in Vegas? You know what I missed? I missed the taxi cab that was going to take me to MGM to see Calvin Harris. Or... I might have missed the end results of the poker tournament at Rio. Or... At least 2 drinks with my cousins from out of  town.  In other words, time is money and in Vegas, time and money is currency.   Ramsay, you have a 3-star pub and grill. And your name brought us despite the mediocre reviews. I still have a homoerotic man-crush on you, but the service  needs a firm kick in the pants.

l-veZtPI-KV98OvIwI-UQA.text: Wow! I'm so glad I came here, everything I tried was wonderful. The filet mignon was melt in your mouth heaven, my ceasar salad was dressed perfectly and was more on the vinegary side which I liked. The sticky toffee pudding and apple crumble aren't to be missed no matter how full you are.  Gordon Ramsay is pretty amazing!

6qdkc5niVa0YRjKoHp7eqA.text: Have been there a number of times and the food is super. The service and atmosphere are added bonuses.   The steak and ale pie, sticky toffee pudding, and lobster rolls are and have been totally tasty and delicious. The selection of comfort food is well rounded and slightly different than the average pub/ sports bar.

DITzmXDV7iyBo1eJ-_QpNg.text: Eh, I would expect more from GR's restaurant considering how much he rants and raves about quality on his shows. We had the Bangers n Mash and Fish n Chips. Both were medium quality to be equated to any "English Pub" that reuses their oil for frying.  After dinner we ordered coffee (to which no menu was offered) and dessert. The coffee came out 7min before the dessert and was luke warm at best. We had to cancel the dessert due to the bitter taste the coffee left on our pallets.  Again, I expected much more from GR's establishment.

-KXgBo9FNLBxixCGCKPlgA.text: Ugh. This place is a hit or miss. Service is okay and food is overpriced. We paid over $40 a person and no alcohol was ordered and only one appetizer to share with our meals! The wings and fish and chips were decent but the burgers and salads were not very good. Plus one server was very rude to one of our guests who wasn't feeling well at our table. Here's a hint you jerk, don't patronize people and make rude comments. Not coming back anytime soon.

sdX40b4Oz4h2R_xra6tngQ.text: This restauraunt completely affirmed the stereotype about bland British food. The $40 ribeye was beyond disappointing. It was ordered medium-rare and came out well the first time, rare the second. The "seasonal" vegetables (vegetableS plural) that came with it were 4 fat, unseasoned sticks of asparagus. Pitiful.  Also, the busser dumped a drink all over us right as we were getting ready to leave.   Giving 2 stars because our server was solid and the craft cocktails were pretty good. However, I cannot recommend this restauraunt to anyone.

8cMa-koNFkAYgRoKRXhFkA.text: Gordon Ramsey's in London was one of the most exquisite dining experiences in my life. The "Pub & Grill" was not. It is competent food, served efficiently, in a fun atmosphere. It is a step (or two) up in the quality and inventiveness of the food of Chili's or BJ's, with a more "sophisticated" beer and wine list. They handled our group of 14 even better than expected. It was impressive; Ramsey really does know how to run a restaurant. They messed up some items on our order, and more than made up for it by comping those items and apologizing. Our total bill was around $860, including tip. (~$61/each). If you expect haute cuisine, try one of Ramsey's other places. For well-prepared pub food, the Pub & Grill is a good, but pricy spot.

MLbHYJmFwAOqmKMcXOGAtA.text: If I could give this place a 0 I would. I have never had such terrible service in my life. While we were on the waiting list we went and got a beverage from the bar across the way we got called to our table the host rudely told us it was not okay and to finish our FULL drinks which was totally reasonable. Not even 3 minutes later she came up to us and asked if we were finished (which we were clearly not) so we politely said yes and threw away all of them. Secondly, we let the server know it was our friends birthday which he could care less. It was awful service with subpar food. My girlfriends and I will never be coming back or giving a good recommendation. I don't think I saw a smile from anyone working or a costumer.

9eysfYE_wSrjiwPPT2iBpQ.text: Ordered the filet for dinner and got the weirdest thing I've ever seen that I should have taken a photo of :-( I ordered it medium rare...it came not only medium but the "filet" was cut in half and cooked on both sides before.  I complained and the waiter said that really was a filet (eh?  weirdest one I've seen and I don't think it's good practice to cut it in half before cooking it). The one they replaced it with was indeed a filet and cooked properly.  The sides were terrible.  I don't know why Gordon Ramsey put his name on this...if this were on any of his shows, he'd ream out everyone in the kitchen and the wait staff for what happened :-P

NoIgD-DpzFQp7MfZznfdgg.text: The staff is extremely attentive, the food of the highest quality, and the price quite affordable for what else we found on the Strip. For this place to sit at a 3 star rating is criminal. From the fulfilling entrees to the delicious desserts, it is one of my best wins in Vegas, and wish it could be a home town favorite.   Recommendations include the Steak and Ale Pie, Lamb Burger, and Sticky Toffee Pudding.

LuKOr9MrGfFe1RmwA0ZrSg.text: Being a longtime fan of Gordon Ramsey, I must admit that my expectations for this Pub were pretty high.  Our server was very friendly and pretty good. We started off with the Pretzel Appetizer - not any better than any other pretzel appetizer you could get at any sit-down restaurant. We then ordered the scallops, mashed potatoes and lobster mac & cheese.  Scallops - they were cooked decently, but surprised by how tasteless and bland they were Mashed Potatoes - Very tasty and very lumpy, but in a charming way Lobster Mac & Cheese - Not as tasty as I was hoping. Was even more disappointed when I CHOKED ON PIECES OF LOBSTER SHELL in my food.  I did notify the server about the shells who then spoke with one of her bosses not more than 5 feet from me who said they didn't shuck the lobster from the shell, but that it comes pre-done. Now there are 2 things that really bother me about this situation: 1) I paid $27 for Lobster Mac & Cheese and it appears that quality is not a priority for this restaurant. 2) The manager didn't even take the time to come and apologize to me. I wasn't expecting this to be comp'd, but an apology for serving me lobster shells in a dish that is supposed to be void of it I think merits at least an apology.

q0QzSWx4CE6VW0BSPW7BCg.text: Awesome,  Try the Lamb! Great atmosphere, food and service! Ask for Mike the waiter. Personal service, great guy, on his game! Will sit and talk with you but never miss a beat.  Do it! And ask for Mike!  2 Thumbs up!

uYVk5U7zhr-VJlqpMgmDbA.text: Having been a patron to Gordon Ramsay's Burgr, I figured his pub and grille could be a good choice since I absolutely loved my food at Burgr.   I was so wrong.   I wasn't terribly hungry so hubby and I decided to do appetizers only. We were staying at the hotel so we reviewed the menu in the room (note: the listing says casual dining but the prices are equivalent to or more than the upscale restaurants) and headed down.   The hostess told us it was a 15 minute wait so we added our name and stood around. After half an hour, I realized the hostess forgot us as she kept seating other 2 top parties right away. I told her the dilemma and she insisted she didn't forget us and that we were next. Sooo we finally got seated after 30 minutes of wasted time. Not too good of a start for dinner.   Our waitress took our drink order of a soda each ($5 sodas. Yeah. That's not casual dining prices) and didn't return with our drinks for 20+minutes. So here we are thinking we were forgotten by the hostess and now by our server.   We ordered the lobster mini rolls (it comes with only 2.....not really an appetizer and more of a small bite) and the jumbo shrimp cocktail (7 shrimp if even...with large croutons stuffed between them.)  The food was actually delicious but was overshadowed by the ridiculous expense of it all. We spent equivalent to a full fledged meal for two on two drinks and two appetizers. The service was abhorrent and absolutely TERRIBLE for a high end establishment.   Save yourself the time and money by not eating here. This restaurant is a flop.

nw6Jhk7g8yCZTF-TZNNDDw.text: Went to Gordon Ramsay Pub for lunch on a Saturday when I had a bunch of buddies in town.  Service was fantastic.  To start, we had the deviled eggs and sliders.  I had both dishes before, and they didn't disappoint.  One guy proclaimed the sliders the best burger he had eaten.  They are perfect in composition and execution, you get every ingredient in every bite.  They are consistent as well.  Our table ordered a second helping....  To eat, I had fish and chips and part of the short rib/beef cheek sandwich.  The sandwich was legit, had a little spice to it, and the meats were very tender.  Likewise, the fish and chips were fantastic, although the fries are a little thick for my taste.  I realize this is classic for this dish, I just prefer skinnier fries.  The fish and chips may seem expensive at around $26, but you get a LOT of food.  Very large pieces of fish, and the breading can stand up to vinegar or the homemade tartar sauce.  Both entrees are definite repeats.  For dessert, I recommended the sticky toffee pudding.  This is the 2nd time I've had it (we ordered 2 servings, like with the sliders), and I still say it may be the best dessert I've eaten.  We had people eating the caramel sauce out of the small pitcher it comes in.  This dessert is moist, yet a little crunchy.  The ice cream and sauce complement it very well.  A must order.  Good beer selection, and knowledgeable servers.  This is an excellent place to get a casual bite while at Caesars.

fRPDZr-4yCGycpFzXNvL9g.text: In a nutshell, disappointed. I really hate to say it, but I am. I'll never come back, and here's why:  $30 for fish & chips!!!!  (Was it you or Caesers that set the prices?)  Best I've had in Vegas, definitely outside of England, but are you freaking kidding me??  $30!! For a spoonful of mushy peas, a few steak cut fries, and (2) 2x2 inch fish fillets??  Yard House fish & chips are almost half the price, same portion size & just as good.   Lightly battered. Crunchy on both sides. Fish flakey & cooked through. Fries were great. Mushy peas...I prefer them without the mint. Fantastic!!  Definitely not worth $30!!  Lobster mac? Just good. Cheesy. Not great. Not fab. Not worth $25, even if you split it with a friend.  It's a side item, not an entree. No chunks of lobster in this, but its there. Just not easily noticeable.   $5 for ice tea. And we had to beg for a refill.   As for our server: don't know her name. My receipt says Lisa W. Wanted to take our drink order before the hostess walked away from seating us. She was nice when she was at our table. Lots of attention prior to ordering, none after. She was kinda a know it all about English food, trying to one-up us when we asked a question about the food in comparison to what we've eaten in England.  Refilled our tea WITHOUT ice. So much for ice tea.   Our bill was $90 for 2 people: 2 ice teas, mac & cheese, fish & chips, & some corned beef sandwich. We left with NO desire to come back. NO longing to come back to try something else. Chef, your prices suck!!  Your own burger here is TWICE that of what you serve at BurGR and truffle chips are better & $3 less at BurGR too! And you get more!!  I expect to pay these prices at an upscale restaurant, like Steak, but NOT a pub. Not even in the UK!!  Come during happy hour. Sadly I will never be able to. I work full-time!!  This place DEFINITELY caters to tourists & not the locals.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Not for locals ...
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 5.24.15 Fish &amp; chips

7AUexF0bhZFBjLeaucxXLg.text: Had the nachos which were yummy and indulgent. Not what I would expect from a Gordon Ramsey restaurant but tasty. The 2 cocktails I had were fabulous. The bartender did an amazing job. I had the goodbye blue Sky and the Pub Crawl. Two totally different drinks but very delicious!  Nice stop for a drink and a bite!

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Nachos.
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Goodbye blue Sky

BLLKJpoobs7wXOHHE6rM9g.text: Tried the Shepard's pie. The rib eye.  The fish and chips. The lobster rolls. And the calamari. From the service to the food everything was fantastic.

Onwux2MxNr7rlXh3mkfOOQ.text: We wanted to try one of Gordon Ramsey's restaurants while in Vegas and decided on the Pub & Grill for supper after checking out Caesar's Palace. We were seated right away we and ordered a happy hour half price drink just in time. My husband had a Newcastle Brown Ale and I had an Angry Orchard Cider. We shared the 'Pigs in a Blanket' for an appetizer, served with HP sauce and spicy mustard, very tasty. For our mains my husband had the 'Beef Wellington' which he thoroughly enjoyed, cooked perfectly. I had the 'Fish & Chips'. I personally prefer a firmer fish like haddock or halibut, but the cod was good. The batter was light and not greasy. I enjoyed the steak cut chips and the mint mushy peas were nice; served with ketchup, tartar sauce, lemon slice and malt vinegar. We were stuffed but shared the free 'Sticky Toffee Pudding' for dessert, it was delicious! Our server was Chris and he was attentive and helpful. We enjoyed the food and atmosphere and would go back again.

DR7BqvDhP2yc-fBdkI5qRg.text: Was really looking forward to trying this place esp as I've been a fan of Hell's Kitchen for years. Wait was about 30 minutes on a Saturday which I suppose isn't too bad for a group. I had the steak pot pie and it was average at best. Brussels sprouts were good - had a nice tangy vinegar flavor. Service was attentive and friendly. So I also learned that Scott - the winner of Hell's Kitchen worked there for about a year but eventually left as he was burned out and overwhelmed - doing two jobs plus taking fan photos. Overall, it felt average but I'll give it 4 stars because it was a pleasant experience

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Steak pie - average

hdTSKHinrpSR5s5b75FkNA.text: The Scottish egg and Salmon in the classic Ramsay section was really good! Our server Adam was awesome and helped us with a lot of useful recommendations. Will definitely visit again

_YwnoNdo2zpbUsGrPwDDVQ.text: I had the pleasure of eating here during a conference.  I had the fish and chips and wow was it amazing.  Super flaky fish with the perfect crispy batter.  Potatoes were perfect fried.  At $30, it was well worth it, I would definitely order it again.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fish and chips, super flaky and perfectly battered with excellent potatoes

wWHTbyGW0Xv16aDopuGeXQ.text: Whenever were in town Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill  is a must stop for us and we always bring friends to try the amazing food. I'm a huge fan of Gordon and I've followed his passion before he was famous in the states. So the chance of anyone in my circle stating something negative about him is not going to happen! So with that said, it brings me great disappointment to write this review. Brought friends to the Pub & Grill Saturday, and it was the worst experience with the exception of our waiter. Our starters: crispy pork belly with a mustard cream sauce. This was simply delicious. Perfect layers of crisp, juiciness and tender melt in your mouth belly paired with the full flavored course mustard. Second starter was Maine Lobster and Shrimp roll. This was ok not what I would've expected from Ramsay at all, (the Lobster Truck in town is a better choice) My main dish was an English cheddar burger with fries. My dish was plated wrong they gave me a salad forgot the fries. Our waiter was getting frustrated because the chef/s couldn't get his orders right and he was trying to rectify their mistakes. I took one bite of my burger and it was full of salt. The burger was so salty it had a crispy layer of salt around the patty that felt like it burnt my taste buds. This completely ruined my entire meal. Our waiter noticed that something was wrong and came to my rescue trying to help by offering something new on the menu. I kindly refused and he said the manager would be right over to talk to us. Well you know what they say in "Business" your staff is only as good as the manager!!! It took a very long time to get water, to get serviced, to get refills on water, to get our food and shocking the manager never came to our table!!! It must be difficult to be a waiter with a restaurant full of staff and managers!!!but your really on your own trying to keep up the good name of Gordon Ramsay !!! he apologized once again for everything and one last try to make things right,  he was told my favorite dessert is cream Brule and insisted that I try it! it was delicious and his eagerness to make sure we were happy and left full was very much appreciated.  However, I can't say that we'll be referring friends here anymore. Extremely saddened and disappointed that Gordon Ramsay's  name is on this Pub!

C_qLzcY6GwA6pLW9h9waOw.text: Visited the establishment during a business trip - on the company dime, so why not try it out?  I was not let down, the food, service, and atmosphere was all top-notch!  First - our server Rodney made it a great experience and the reason for the 5 star review!  He was good sport when I misheard his name, fixed our table when it wobbled, and provided personal recommendations.  He also shared some fun stories with us and talked about his background a bit.  What a great experience, he's definitely among the top servers I've experienced around the world!  Second - the food was tasty and well portioned.  We really enjoyed the side order of fingerling potatoes, VERY well seasoned and pancetta, yum!  My chopped salad was good and my colleague's fish & chips was described as "very good!"  Overall - highly recommend, was fun to people watch in Caesar's Palace and the staff was all very friendly.  Thanks for making it a great experience!

vleIVwXQSzXrv3qcmYOo9Q.text: No wait and many options so decided to stop in. Front desk ladies were rude and acted bothered by any questions you may have. Waitress was helpful and nice. I got the salmon and was wildly disappointed, especially with the chef name attached to it ( a guy who yells at people about their cooking). It wasn't anything special,  could have got the same fish and taste at a cheaper restaurant and it would have been the same.   Definitely wouldn't recommend it as the person I was with didn't enjoy her food either.

fSbOZeW_ObskHgzKTFO9xA.text: This was the perfect place to stop for some appetizers and drinks. The waiter was fantastic and the food hit the spot. No complaints here! My husband isn't much of a truffle oil fan but the fries were perfect.

3rkX6nfAaCpZqaoKhLXA2w.text: I have been a huge fan of Gordon's for years and watched almost all of his shows. Hells Kitchen, Kitchen Nightmares, and the like but by far my favorite has always been 'the F word'. Now maybe it's because he has all those shows and how critical he is that we are eager to experience a GR restaurant! And of course he did not make my meal today and anytime you build large restaurants (franchises) then there will always be some loss of fidelity. Having said that - I was excited to try the pub here. First of all if you're gonna name it a Pub your prices shouldn't reflect that of 5 star steak house. That aside (it's Vegas - inside Caesars after all). I ordered a beer and an app at the bar oh and a water. The calamari I ordered was dreadful - it tasted more like deep fried salt pellets, which is to say that someone dumped so much salt on this dish that I'll not be tasting anything for the next 3 days. The only saving grace was the awesome water that came in a clean as opposed to my $11 pint of peroni which didn't. See picture of water below.   Dare I say that Gordon or his staff failed in the hiring of the staff for this place - and perhaps has gotten a little smitten with himself and lost touch a little because the decor and staff uniforms are just pretentious wank! Maybe he should put this place on restaurant nightmares or get kitchen crashed or something. Sorry but being spread as thin as he is is no excuse it still falls on his rep - this place....FAIL! I would give a half more star if I could for the staff courtesy in dealing with my shocking food and delivering great H2o.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States

O5aodg8MUZaeLQD6PEz-Rg.text: We stopped in here just before leaving Vegas to come back home b/c going to a G. Ramsay establishment was on our to do list.   We ordered buffalo chicken wings which tasted great, the sauce they used offered just the right amount of heat w/o taking away from the taste of the chicken.  I ordered the fish and chips as my meal and my gf ordered the lamb burger.  Overall I'd say the entrees were pretty good.  I ordered a beer called Innis & Gunn Original to compliment my meal, I can't say enough about the beer, it was full of flavor.  I ordered sticky toffee pudding for dessert.  This hands down has to me one of the best sweets I've ever eaten.  I don't have much of  a sweet tooth but this dessert was delicious.    The meal itself was a little on the pricy side for being lunch but it's Vegas, so it comes with the territory.  The waitress was both so nice, knowledgable, and made great recommendations.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Wings &amp; Beer
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lamb Burger
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sticky Toffee Pudding

OafhBxg9FMJPYfw9HrXj-g.text: I was real excited to try Gordon Ramsey's Pub & Grill. Service was slow at first but I think that was because the dinner menu was just starting.  When we ordered our food the Brussels sprouts were great. I ordered a half lobster and when I turned it over there was no meat in the shell!  We let our waitress know but the cook didn't believe it was served that way. This made my dining experience very poor thinking I had someone else's leftovers. They thought I ate the lobster meat and was trying to get more.  I did get another half lobster with meat after my family finished their food.  There was no compensation for the situation. We left feeling we just spent a large amount of money on a poor dining experience and were rushed to get out for the next set of people.  I will definitely not go back and my view of Gordon Ramsey restaurants is definitely a one. The experience made me feel like they just wanted my money. I would be embarrassed if I were Gordon Ramsey and saw what happened.

zKhqLEacL9M6HEN6LLobkw.text: A two star steak with a 4 star waiter.  Particularly disgusting were the mashed potatoes rated 0 stars for their instant mashed potato flavor.  They may have been recalled from the dumpster as they had a distinctly dry crust from being exposed to the air too long.  Vegetables were equally disgusting.    Did not know that asparagus could be grown with only stalks.  That could be why they were tough.  Cooked, yet tough asparagus requires a master chef.  I had never experienced that before.  Beer was good.

c7Od1-XtFBcy-nTIDfk9HA.text: Good food but not outstanding.  Overpriced.  Service was good.  Wife had fish and chips that were very good but not outstanding.  The chips (fries) were warm at best and got soggy and cold very quickly.  The fish was light and a very nice batter but Chilis, or any good local brew pub's were just as good and 1/3 to 1/2 the price.   I had Cesar salad with chicken.  I get it that this is not a signature dish, but it was really uninspired.  The chicken was a rather dry breast that was just dropped on the side of the salad.  Not cut into bite size pieces. Again any local microbrewery or local would have been just as good for 1/2 the price.

QwqE-jW76VgbrfXJgCV6LA.text: This place was delicious. I had the BLT which was loaded with bacon and the tomatoes were marinated and very delicious. My husband had the Hells Kitchen Burger with Truffle fries and he said both were delicious! Only thing I would say is a con, are the drink prices and a few menu items were pretty pricey. You pay $15 for a small 8oz glass of their house drinks, when in other places you would get 12oz or bigger. To top off our experience, our server Christopher Lee was fabulous!!! Would DEFINITELY recommend this place to everyone and ask for Chris!

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Us and our waiter Christopher Lee!
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Birthday Cake Surprise Shake!

jOKuVj-3xIOwYy3DQsi9Vg.text: Gordon Ramsay is a name that has branded itself as funky, unique and a good quality dining experience, and that is exactly what you will get at the Pub & Grill! Located conveniently at Caesars Palace, it opened about three years ago with now head chef Scott Commings from Hell's Kitchen!  When I first walked in, I was greeted by a friendly hostess and noticed the unique uniform that the staff wears. I love how they dress the part and really makes the dining experience even more unique. I came here on a Saturday for lunch where there was futbol (soccer) game showing so the restaurant was live and packed! The ambiance felt so warm and welcoming and the decor inside the restaurant was modern and very classy. Of course, I didn't except anything less for a Gordon Ramsay restaurant inside Caesars Palace!  I ate here for lunch and picking my meal was hard when I wanted to try everything! Carrie and Sara were our waitress and they were so friendly and accommodating to me and my friend. They told us about the restaurant, a little bit of the background and many things about the menu. Just talking to them for the first few minutes, I knew they were knowledgeable and trustworthy of their suggestions.  First, the drinks! They have an array of beers, wines, and cocktails! They have a full bar and use fresh ingredients to make your drinks. I tried the very popular cocktail suggested by Carrie called "Goodbye Blue Sky" and I must say... best drink ever! It is so refreshing for a hot summer day. I believe it is a blueberry vodka drink with muddled fresh berries and a splash of sparkling wine! For an appetizer, I tried the calamari with bacon bits. Wow! It is out of the ordinary. The calamari was crunchy and packed with flavor, especially with the bacon added to it and they make their own tartar sauce! For my main course, I tried the chicken pesto sandwich with fries. The portions are huge! My sandwich came with a very thick and toasted sandwich packed with chicken and mouth-watering pesto! The fries were crunchy and simple to compliment all the flavors inside the sandwich! Lunch was delicious and I wish I had enough room for dessert. I have been hearing from word of mouth, yelp and the staff that the sticky toffee pudding is a must-try! I will definitely try it next time I dine!  Overall, the experience was amazing. Everything from food to service was impeccable. Carrie and Sara were amazing! I had mentioned that my friend and I were fans of Hell's Kitchen so Chef Scott came out and introduced himself! It was a very friendly and unexpected gesture that made my dining experience even better! I will definitely be back again!

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. chicken pesto sandwich
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. calamari w/ bacon bits!
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. goodbye blue sky! sooooo good!

oCMWsAis-FV26yrV9CTsfw.text: We stopped in for a happy hour early dinner. I really was perplexed about what to order.  We ended up ordering the pretzels for an appetizer. I was thinking oh these will be regular bar pretzels. Oh Gordon Ramsey, the things you do! First, it comes with three different pretzels. The bacon pretzel is by far my favorite! The two sauces were also quite amazing! The mustard gave it a kick while the cheese was a nice finishing touch.   For our main meal, I ordered the Pub BLT (blt is my favorite meal at home) and my partner ordered the bangers and mash. After eating the Pub BLT, my homemade BLT will never be the same! The cheese bread was so light. The flavors and fillings of he sandwich were so perfect. I ate slow to savor every bite. The perfectly crisp chips that came with BLT were an amazing compliment for my dinner.  The bangers and mash was also amazing. It comes with three different sausages and the most amazing mash.   The only down side to our visit was our server, Scott. He seemed very disinterested in assisting us at all. Thankfully there was another server who came by a few times to make sure we were ok.

raPJfGOODVcD5t5cXYGxZA.text: If anyone knows me, I'm a huge GR fanatic, mostly because of the GR brand and a little fan of GR himself. I come here a few times throughout the year, but this time one of my favorite bussers was not there. He was I believe Korean from our previous conversations. Besides that, the service was great especially from the server who I believe his name was Chris. I look forward to coming back yet again, highly recommend.

JpAuyalpugyHzhmQ3WPUYQ.text: FIRST TIMER AT A GORDON RAMSAY EATERY  I never have been to a Gordon Ramsay eating establishment before. I watched him on TV however I didn't know what my expectations were. After eating here, this eatery met my expectations. Since this is an English pub it made sense to order the Shepherd's Pie. I'm not a big fan of meat pies as they tend to be heavy. This meat pie was hearty. I love the mashed potato covering on the pie as it had that outer crust. In addition the mashed potato was creamy and not heavy. Regarding the meat there is a contrasting texture with the minced beef and lamb that makes the dish very appetizing. Everyone mentions about the Sticky Toffee Dessert but for dessert I ordered the Spotted "Dic". I liked how the warm bread pudding meshed with the cold ice cream. I would have given a higher rating had it not been for the Truffle Chips. I expected the chips to be a thick cut chip. Instead the chips were the typical skinny cut. Overall I had a good dinner Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shepherd&#39;s Pie

H0IyZr9YbimdR80qVreYCA.text: I got pretty lucky when I came her being a diamond card holder for Caesars entertainment group, I missed the 45 minute wait and got seated immediately    The thing I enjoyed here was the service. Not sure if it was preferential because of my status or if it's a standard offering. Waiter was personable and had nice, short conversations with us. Order the clam appetizer and it was ok. Not much to brag about, tasty but I've had better.   Wife ordered the chicken plate and she couldn't stop raving about it. Paired nicely with some pesto and gnocchi (I totally stole her gnocchi) and that was pretty good. Pesto was super rich and creamy, loved the flavor and the smoothness of it.   I order the chop salad but those are boring to review. Kinda disappointed with the flavor. Felt pretty bland to me but again, who the hell cares about a review of a salad. Don't make the same mistake as me  I recommend checking it out but don't go out of your way to eat at this place. Vegas offers a lot of great restaurants, happy eating.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The clam appetizer

EcmTHhSUVWMqJLXdJLrTXw.text: We loved Gordon Ramsay Pub!  From the minute we walked up, we were greeted by the nice hostess.  I let her know we had a reservation and we were immediately seated, table waiting and ready for us.  This was absolutely amazing, especially when everything in Vegas is usually a wait for a table.  Definitely worth booking a reservation ahead of time.  After being seated, we were waited on by Tayler, who was absolutely the best server we had this entire trip.  His attention to detail was much appreciated.  His recommendations were on point.  I went for a filet steak, but once I saw the prime rib special, I was sold.  The prime rib was cooked to perfection at a medium rare temp.  It was delicious.  The MacNCheese trio on the starter menu is a must have.  The Pesto MacNCheese is so tasty and well worth it!  We researched the menu before we arrived in Vegas so we were prepared on the price range for dinner, it was right on point, we budgeted just enough for this amazing dinner.  Big Thanks to Tayler for making this dinner a great one!

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Amazing Prime Rib Special

dHFW8Nb0TOyn6gnZmzWYQw.text: Do not use high tables, the stools are much lower than high tables. Not easy to eat while you are sitting, only fine for standing around the table.  Asked server to change the seat and they never followed up they had plenty space open. Ketchup that came with burger was a sampler. As a server when you bring fries and burger better to know how much ketchup to serve with the food.  I wouldn't try this place again.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States

zod4snjr2ymUGiAEW890sw.text: Our server Kerry was so friendly and helpful and the food was amazing.  This place truly has innovative tastes and large portions to fill you up. I read some of the negative reviews that complain of the price.... get real people.  You are eating at a chef quality restaurant not Panda Express. Quality food and service costs and is worth it.  My party of three ate an appetizer, 3 entrees, 3 beverages and dessert for 120 bucks.  Great deal. Thanks again.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Corned beef brisket sandwich with English Fish and Chips in the background.  Yum

PvygvmiyoisCrHmh7EHfDw.text: Underwhelmed.   We were so excited to eat at a Gordon Ramsey restaurant while on Vegas. Started with the pretzels... Dry and cold. Not a good start. My husband ordered a burger and I ordered the pesto chicken. Both were fine but fine is not how we expected to think about our meal. It took 40 minutes to sit, get a drink, eat an appetizer, order dinner and eat dinner. But it took 30 minutes from the time we finished to have our plates cleared and bill delivered. Would not recommend for anyone who is looking to have a Gordon Ramsey quality meal. Would not go back.

CS9gnKkNuMxYj9dBVKza3g.text: Eating at a Gordon Ramsey restaurant was on my bucket list... my overall impression was only meh!  Don't get me wrong... The food, service,  and decor were all excellent.  But... considering this particular restaurant was just standard pub fare it just wasn't worth the prices. If you're going to pay this much for the Gordon Ramsey experience you're better off going to one of his nicer steak houses.  That being said..  The food was really good!  We got the deviled eggs and the warm pretzel snacks. Then the mini pie starter. I had the fish and chips. And our table shared the sticky toffee pudding for dessert.  Everything we tried was delicious just expensive.  For a table of 3... With 3 beers, 2 snacks,  1 appetizer,  3 entrees and one dessert. .. total bill was $178. Could have been worse I guess

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sticky toffee pudding... doesn&#39;t look pretty because our ice cream fell off the top and we had to re - place it for the photo
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mini pie sampler... All were good but my fav was the sheppards pie
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fish and chips! Big pieces of really good quality fish. Yummy!

2FD05MHjRO1HzT0ILKizYw.text: This deserves more credit than currently given on yelp. They have very comfortable seating polite and attentive wait staff and the food was properly cooked. I had the salmon and it was perfectly done and well seasoned. Yes, maybe I should expect more from a Ramsay restaraunt but that's why I could not give it five stars. It's a solid four star.

D0a2ub23nio5MiabhcVudA.text: Worst service in Vegas in my entire life! And, I am a veteran Vegas connoisseur of restaurants so I know what I am taking about  To begin with the hostess forgot about us and we had to wait longer than usual as she took other parties ahead of us as she lost our name and reservation  Food was fantastic but the waiter was terrible. He (Travis) had a attitude and totally ignored is from the moment we sat down till we paid the bill.  Travis didn't ask us if we wanted drinks, I had to order a drink for my gf from the bar. After our food arrived we were not asked if everything was ok. The guests next to us were asked if they're food was ok immediately a after their food arrived. We needed salt and pepper as well as more catchup. We were asked about our food when we were practically done with our entries, too late.  Not a pleasant experience. Travis treated us like crap as he hovered over s group of girls dining next to us.  I loved the food, bad service though.

dMmyInhVJ6sHhKM-1OrViA.text: Service great! Food very good! Mini burger  lobster Mac' and cheese great!! Waiting for the free pudding after my check in on yelp! Hehe

JRmCXXKrUhMJTc4Px8brsg.text: Ordered appetizer and main course.  Appetizer came with main course.  When asked why it didn't come first, response was "must be how it was entered into the system".  Granted the appetizer was good, but they never offered to comp it for the mistake.  This very unacceptable to the Ramsay standards.  Also, for main, ordered the lamb burger which was supposed to be the signature burger but it was too dry and bland.  Certainly disappointed for this level of restaurant.  Hopefully they can get their act together otherwise those doors will be closing in the near future.

9eVAPaw3T-PriQBoWiTb3Q.text: WOW! I was truly impressed. Far exceeded my expectations. Derek, one of the managers greeted me and made some suggestions of what to eat and great beers that paired with it. I was not expecting to order 'nachos' but I did and I am TOTALLY glad that I did. The nachos were absolutely the best that I have ever had. The happy hour menu has items almost half off. The kettle chips, the meat and the sharpness of the cheese was perfect. I also had the pastrami sandwich. The bread on the sandwich was sort sort of zucchini that takes a whole day to make and to me tasted like pumpernickel, which was the PERFECT combo, and it was worth the wait. Derek had me try three beers and they were all different than I am used to and tasty. I can't wait to go back and try some desserts.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Get the nachos!

oG9-fl3OYXhwjkpt_Filpw.text: Went there twice. First time is 4-star. Second time is disappointing. Ordered beef burger, lamb burger, fish and chips and scallops. Expensive. Burgers are average. Fish and chips are very bad, over fried, little portion. Ordered dogfish head IPA and it is not cold enough. Overall, food quality is not comparable to the price paid. great location.

CXVV9zR8TzSzdpPb1qv63Q.text: After watching Mr Ramsey on tv for many years I was excited to eat at one of his establishments for the first time. I had the fish and chips which I thought would be a signature pub type meal and assumed they'd knock it out the park. I was extremely underwhelmed by the food and my experience and I will not be returning to dine here again.

Dr8RmoiAf11mFLz9046E6A.text: Highlights: comfortable booths, timely food prep, nice ambiance  Lowlights: service not good, expensive and poorly prepared food, recommended dishes were only the most expensive on the menu  Had the short rib, was cooked until tender but still dry, would typically ask for something else if I received the dish at any other restaurant. When we sat at booth we waited for 25 minutes for a server to assist us - the restaurant was 40% full. Gordon Ramsay is clearly 'over his skis - this restaurant is broken in nearly every capacity.

VNMwyADf8VXxfnRKcIppWQ.text: I have to say I was reluctant to eat here since I've spent a lot of time in London and the food never won me over.  I can't say the food here is stellar, especially since I don't eat fish.  What we had wasn't too bad, the pretzels were the best, and my kids loved the mini burgers.  It would be nice for them to have more items that are kid friendly, maybe some chicken fingers..    Scott was our server and he was very, very knowledgeable about the menu as well as his customer service was top notch.  I'm pretty sure he was on point with ordering our meal, but I guess there was a bit of a disconnect with the computer and the kitchen.  I've worked in the service industry and I can say that Scott was a great waiter.  I forgot to post about Scott's excellent service, I had to find the receipt so I could post his name and make sure everyone knew it wasn't his error on the food but the kitchens...  What really won me over was the manager Michelle.  She was awesome!  My meal came out all wrong, twice, and she went above and beyond to make things right.  One of the things that I thought was awesome was that she never threw anyone under the bus.  She just made it right, and even got some cherries from the bar for my daughter to make sure she was smiling.  I'm huge on customer service and she made our experience well worth it.  I'm not sure if I'll be back for the food, but Michelle is for sure a keeper in the restaurant management game...

m9ygkedREIlS5cefWh25mA.text: One of the better meals I've ever had in my life.  Came here as a large group for a fun dinner out. Server was awesome. He was outgoing and fun. Food was amazing. Everyone shared and we had a great time!!! Ordered the beer braised short rib and it did not disappoint. My friends were all jealous. Compliments to the chef who came out to check on us. He talked with us and asked how we liked the good. Props man!! We were greeted by the manager as well half way thru. All around a top notch establishment.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beer Braised Short Rib

kR9Nbpl9JC3HIsbpfO0qtQ.text: Shout out to Christopher L. He killed it. Super polite. Had great recommendations. Super helpful! 10/10 service

sM_znoZCRlfZdQ4ZHHdugg.text: Once again this place never disappoints, stopped in for an early dinner last week and had the amazing short rib for entree with calamari app and onion ale soup! Food was amazing! Service was just okay, the food runners and bussers were much friendlier than our actual server but she seemed overwhelmed and since the food is amazing we barely noticed her aloofness. We've been there many times I would recommend  the fish n chips and also steak and ale pie was really delicious! There's not one thing on the menu we haven't ordered! Can't wait to go back!

tyARgajCf9fu4nUUXM0dIQ.text: Gordon Ramsay should fix his own places before setting out on TV to fix others.  We have had horrible food and horrible service at his pub and grill.  Ordered a steak medium rare and it came out well done.  At $48, that's pretty bad.  Had to get up to ask the server to bring another beer as she was terribly busy talking with the other servers. Sticky toffee pudding was mostly cold and largely without toffee.  Not going back.

iylY7k8xds6O3zKgZywFoQ.text: With a limited menu the flavors should have been amazing. I guess our expectations were too high as we were expecting the same Gordon Ramsay expects of his chefs. And why the fish and chips are twice the price of the rest of the menu but absolutely nothing special about them. The Dublin sourkrout sandwich was good. The lamb burgers unfortunately we're lacking and palet did not sit well. Without the name I'm sure as a pub it's nice however we are still disappointed and won't be coming back. Left feeling a little queezy. 2 stars for our nice waitress who kept our glasses full.

L5kuoOQEtISiks5nyn_bmw.text: A friend and I came here just to try one of Gordon's restaurants. I ordered the salmon and she ordered a burger off the menu. Nothing special about the food but it wasn't mediocre either. Would I come back to this specific location? No, but we are definitely going to try one of his other locations :) I want to find his famous risotto!

l7fyN0SsRQWwn-7jy1lQbw.text: The service was great & my husband definitely enjoyed the hostess cute outfits. I loved the cool atmosphere & the comfortable seats. I had a beer that cost $9.00 which was a bit much, but the food prices are what you should expect from a Gordon Ramsey restaurant.  Tip: make sure to make reservations & if you have a rewards card you can get a discount.  Menu tip: they have a bar menu & a dinner menu. So make sure to ask for both. If you sit at the bar you can only order from the bar menu.  Food recommendation: I highly recommend the Mac & cheese. It's like no other you have ever had. It is topped with truffles. It is a good portion so you can share with another person or take the other half home.  If your not a fan of steak fries then I don't recommend the pub chips since they are twice the thickness of steak fries, my husband is very picky and did not like them, but I thought they were yummy.

zbotuXNln-jc4vS7n0P5JQ.text: We were a party of 9. Our large group was easily accommodated - we didn't have reservations. Our waitress was very good. We had the burgers (lamb & beef), blt, wedge salad and pretzel sticks. Everything was delicious! Prices were what you should expect for an upscale pub! I recommend it!

6P_ixEFch-wqlb_ONzDzcg.text: Great food, decor and overall experience. Service wasn't amazing but not bad either. We had a table of 5 and everyone seemed happy and satisfied. I got the wings and thought the flavor had just enough spice to it. The only things I wasn't a fan of were the fries. The other people I was with had a lamb burger, steak with a side of mushrooms and a regular burger. We left full as can be and happy. Would deff. recommend. We also made a reservation the day of and got right on in at the scheduled time but it prob. wasn't necessary.

QO_Cm-lFNA2Jg_QUo9R-kw.text: gordon ramsey would throw a plate across this place. TERRIBLE service, manager didn't even care that food was cold (and small portions and nothing special), waiter never brought extra plate for split meal, and another server turned around and walked away while being spoken to. would never EVER go back! Ri Ra in Mandalay is twenty times better.

8kBvwUuy0Hnk4YlZFPyWNw.text: Had the fish and chips, awesome. I lived in England for 4 years while in the military and these fish and chips are authentic. The wait staff are professional and beyond reproach.  Great place when in Ceasars Palace definitely stop in.

FYjunwez8RO1Y_Z4657Law.text: If you like your steak medium rare, order it medium. All of our steaks were rarer than expected.

JqNgy7e-DihxgabCoL2O2A.text: So lastnight my beautiful wife and I go to eat dinner ,expecting a non forgettable dining experience. After all that passion Mr.Ramesy demonstrates on TV about food with flavor, temperature, and presentation I guess my hopes were pretty high. But come on really, $100 for basically two hamburger combos,McDonald's like frozen fries! They need a Whataburger in this town to show them how a Texas burger outshines their crappy gourmet burger anyday! And the waiter,  not very engaged with the work and customer service aspect at all! I will never go back,and my curiosity for fine dining is ruined for good! Thanks alot Gordon!

CG7HYV_X9iC1geHqiBuDjw.text: Got a horrible table here on Memorial Day weekend (with a reservation) on a busy racetrack area near the kitchen, where waiters were whizzing by all night, creating distractions and lots of shouting over the meal - never a good start.  Our waiter also was interrupted three times while trying to go over our questions on the menu by other patrons as if we weren't even there, which is also another star off.  I could go down to two stars, but it wasn't awful food, but it wasn't spectacular either.   It's a high priced Pub, and with a star chef's name attached, I expected better.  I have been to Ramsay's Burgr place and that's a four star burger, but this was just meh.  Soups and salads all serviceable.  If you are in an English Pub, have to try one of the mainstays, so I went with the Fish and Chips.  You get two very large pieces of fish and plenty of chips, but a tiny little tin of tartar sauce (had to ask for more and that seemed to be a chore for the waiter).  Decor is fun and a lot to look at, but highly bothered by the service and location we got.  Not likely going back to this place.

HcshvTaF71jTFFbuOT2OxA.text: My family went here after a show at the colleseum . The indian fare we ordered was horrendous. The pub grub was ok .

xvdY_LGoU3TjOcIVyKM4WQ.text: We were lucky yo find seats at the bar...since the wait was about an hour. We ordered the Flank Steak with Mashed Potatoes and Brussel Sprouts. OMG!!! The steak was so tender and juicy. The potatoes were scrumptious. The brussel sprouts were awesome..   Everything was soooooo good!  I'd go back for sure! Love Gordon Ramsay!

EcD4dAgsKRNTnH7TSEXHYg.text: We came to this restaurant hoping to try a celebrity chef's wonderful dishes. Instead, we were very disappointed.  Let me start with the steak and pork chop. They were very dry and salty. The fish and chips were just as bad, three thick strips of fried fish with not much taste to it.  The waiter asked how'd we like our food and we told him the condition. He offered to give us another order of steak and pork chop but we turned it down. Who has room for another piece of bad steak?  The manager came to apologize. I thought that gesture was very nice. In conclusion, we came for the big name and realized the food was just mediocre.

RhKwxzcpqLRnGdZpW-8LSw.text: None of us enjoyed our meals.  I got a BLT.  I didn't think it was possible to ruin a BLT. It was not edible.  I'm pretty sure if someone served that to Gordon he would spit it out.  The service was almost as bad.

AYPBjk_pyHXGMJErL6SUMg.text: My wife and I stopped into the bar for a minute to have a quick drink while I tended to some business.  It was a Thursday afternoon and the place was pretty empty.  We had the friendliest and most personable bar tender that I remember ever serving us.  He was certainly well suited to a career in the hospitality industry.  Our one quick drink turned into several drinks and lunch because of the friendly service.  Well done!

CPkhM4Tqny0otV9Oa1LeyA.text: My wife had a pesto chicken sandwich with the "Danny Boy" to drink. I had the fish and chips and an "Innis & Gunn" beer (they recommended I pair with the f&c). We both really enjoyed our meal and the drinks. Everything tasted so fresh. The cod was thick with a nice batter and it came with An excellent pea mash which totally took us by surprise how good it was. My wife's sandwich was really good and had tons of flavor.

Qnd2QxewXnXdVP96eFUhaw.text: I ate here for lunch and overall good experience. Both of us had the burger and for med well, they cooked it awesome. Temperature was correct yet it was still juicy and had great flavor. The fries are good too. I will say the menu is limited so I would suggest looking before you go, for me there was not much more than the burger I would eat. I gave 4 stars because the service was slow. Very friendly but slow.

VBJFEWhg589whk1QPqvrYg.text: Food and beer is amazing as expected.    I got the fish and chips, which was good  but the quantity was a little less than desired for $30.    Would have been more expected at $15, but whatever.   The Ruben my friend got was massive and probably a better choice.

4_TJA5ZhzxVGdfqNtWjlWw.text: Food was ok, came here after a show and stopped by to get a bite of something. We had the fish and chips and the steak potpie. Small serving for the price.

kZKJ8lv2r-nbkPHqJy6lJg.text: Worst garbage food ever ! I brought my wife there after Joel robuchon thinking we were going for a great time and it was the most embarrassing moment of my life. I was a nightmare !!! Literally the worst burger I ever had ! What a shame to trick people like this. Stay away !!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The burger what a joke

-HnBt42ZaCDQ5hVQ9_Li1w.text: Not great, not horrible. Happy Hour wasn't very happy as the drinks were only a dollar or 2 cheaper when advertised at $5 when they are like $13. Service is good tho.

cFOVUcsKwFZe4jw2T9jq9w.text: My wife and I recently visited Las Vegas for our anniversary. As HUGE Gordon Ramsay fans we had the goal of visiting all 4 of the Gordon Ramsay Vegas restaurants (Steak, Pub, Burgr, and Fish and Chips). Friday afternoon we chose to start our GR Tour of Vegas at the Pub and Grill. Upon arrival we were immediately greeted and seated. Within a few min we were introduced to our server Joe. For anyone reading this, please ask to sit in Joe's section. His friendliness, and knowledge of the menu was refreshing. He was able to make some suggestions that sounded amazing, however after seeing the nachos Gordon Ramsay posted on his Instagram we couldn't help but give them a try, and boy are we glad we did! They are out of this world! In addition to the nachos we enjoyed a chicken pesto sandwich. While the flavor was amazing I almost cracked a tooth about half way through on a chicken bone. I discreetly brought this to Joe's attention so he could give the chef a heads up for future sandwiches. What was impressive, is where most servers acknowledge and nothing ever comes of it, he immediately spoke to his manager Derek who came over to apologize and even went as far as offering us a dessert. To think I almost left needing dental work, but still feel compelled to give a 5 star rating should tell you how great Joe and Derek were! They both truly understand the meaning of customer service and I hope someone at the Gordon Ramsay Group reads this to provide them with the recognition they deserve!   PS - The sticky toffee is to die for and personally I think it has Steak beat!

uQt0AozvLPxbyxaQlbhATQ.text: Service was great at lunch. Had the lamb burger with fries. They give you a ton of fries couldn't eat them all. Food came out quick. The lamb burger was delicious. The place is like being in an English pub without the plane ride. Did have a few items of note featuring scotch eggs, bangers and mash, and a few types of meat pies i.e. Shepherds etc. The prices are quite high, but less than Gordon Ramsey steak. If you are a fan of Gordon's and are by Cesar's Palace I would definitely recommend it.

BGkLvNcRM_fQ1OjmacK8fQ.text: After an amazing night at Gordon Ramsay's Steak, we had to try the Pub & Grill (sadly, Janel of Hell's Kitchen fame has already left the crew).   The staff was friendly and attentive. The waiter we had was so polite and so nice. I adored him!!!   For my meal, I got the fish and chips. It was alright. I'm also not a huge fan of the fries (they were soaked in the oil from the fried fish). The fish kept coming out of the fried bater.   My parents each had a beef burger and lamb burger. They were really good.   My date had the vegetable salad, which was refreshing, amazing, and light. I would so go back just for that! The vinaigrette on it was so delectable.   He had the scallops for his entree, which was covered in the best white sauce. It was so good that I kept dipping my fish in it or my fries. Definitely the best out of the ones we ordered.   As a side, we all had the lobster mac and cheese to share for the table. Um ... yes. This was actually better than the mac & cheese at GR's Steak. There were HUGE chunks of lobster in it.   By the end, I was licking the bowl - we sadly have photographic proof of this that I must now go destroy.   Also, GR's Pub & Grill have two of the dishes that are exclusives to his Hell's Kitchen menu at Steak: Scottish Egg and the toffee dessert!!!!  Check it out if you're a fan!

ggpPACTzlYANvuv81fXVtw.text: Dark and comfy English pub-feel with cushy booths. The big chairs were beckoning my name. I sunk into them and drank my glass of wine wishing there was a nearby fireplace.  It wasn't upscale, it was an English pub just like ones in London except without the history.   The menu did a great job at reflecting British fare. Shepard's pie, steak and chips, fish and chips, and mashed peas were all present.  What we ordered: Crispy white bait a traditional pub dish. Fried light and crispy with a creamy aioli.  Duo rillette of pork and duck with brown mustard and pickled radishes and grilled thick toast. Lamb shank with chickpea stew. Lamb had a tender "fall off the bone" meatiness and a hint of that masala in a tomato stew.  Steak and fries were standard, True to form pub style. All washed down with a bottle of Beaujolais.   Solid and hearty food; more like 3.5 stars. We ordered way more than needed. Didn't get a chance to try the sticky toffee, but there is always next time.

fORuaS-wOsJWAtvWjyTI7Q.text: My wife and I both had the bacon cheeseburgers.  They are as good as it gets!  Fresh delicious ingredients, and cooked to perfection.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fantastic bacon cheeseburger

aO5FP1mcWKnK3ltGFXurmA.text: This was our first Gordon Ramsay restaurant experience. I would classify this as upscale casual. The ambiance was very nice. The food did not disappoint. Very flavourful...good comfort food.   Towards the end of our meal we were asked to move to accommodate a large reservation. This was not a big deal to us and we were happy to accommodate. Our server (Daisy) and the manager (Randy) were very apologetic for the inconvenience and made us feel like the most important people in the restaurant. In fact, all of the staff that we interacted with were all professional and courteous. Great dining experience from top to bottom.   We have no issue recommending this restaurant. First class. Well done!

lV_VBl5JnY2TfXf-r2LxvQ.text: Delicious. Truffle fries were good. Mashed potatoes were good. Ribeye delicious. Scallops needed 30 more seconds.   Toffee pudding the best thing ive ever tasted in my life. The dinner was delicious. I guess I wanted just a bit more "something" being that its Gordon Ramsey. I expected fireworks in my mouth. Would go back again.

uokZ-ufQaNyVpXD2Mw64JA.text: This was an amazing experience. Just in line with the expectation set in my mind by the "king of the kitchen."  Ghost Pepper Cheese? Yum! Great experience and great vibe. A must visit.

sftfc226ls3WMqwFkxEtNA.text: Went here with my family and we were all so disappointed! I gave it two stars because we were seated quickly for a party of ten and a walk in. Also the ambiance was great! They had good over all service. Only two stars because the food wasn't up to part. I'm of fan of Gordon Ramsay and for having his name on this restaurant set my standards high. I ordered the fish and chips. A lot of my fries were too over done. I barely ate the batter on the fish, if you saw my plate after, it just had a bunch of fish batter because I ate around it because it was too greasy and not good. My cousin also ordered the fish and chips and hers was covered in too much oil. My dad had the braised beef which was good but that one good didn't make up for all the other bad dishes. My drink and my Aunts drink were too sour and full of sugar. Our apps were just average. We had the nachos and calamari. Overall the food was not great and super over priced. We will not be coming back to this establishment.

AhVyIrLGXUtSXmGX-4s0sQ.text: This place is amazing !!!  The bartenders are so friendly and customer service is impeccable !!!!!  Gene and Keith could not have made us feel more welcome and took just great care of us.  Everyone should try Gene's Moscow mule !!!!! Yummmmm

kCyMFD_9TaC_r6Z33gOdWQ.text: Gordon Ramsay has a great stop in the Caesar's Palace for those seeking upscale bites and a few brews while watching the game. I love the ambiance of the place and the menu. There aren't five pages of options, which helps narrow the choices down. I highly suggest ordering appetizers to share. Not only will it cost the same amount as 3 regular entrees, but you get more variety and more food for your buck!

VMO7Af8jnbeDDXD0RW3SLw.text: This was the most disappointing meal of our vacation. I have long been a fan of Gordon Ramsay not just through his American shows which are fairly insufferable, but his British ones in which you see that he is a person who practices what he preaches. Sadly, this Pub & Grill is the embodiment of the American cartoon version of Ramsay that so many people have embraced. The pretentious decor is overly busy and fatiguing from the design of the fake wall outside made from kegs to the ridiculous studded belts and Hot Topic shorts the waitstaff wear. Even if one were to enjoy the aesthetic, there are still several details that I doubt GR would approve of if he were actually on site. These include things like water being served from swing top bottles that still have sticker residue on them and wall paper that was peeling in the bathrooms.   All of this would be forgivable if the food was stellar, but sadly it doesn't live up to he name here either. My steak and ale pie was served piping hot while my wife's bangers and mash were lukewarm. Additionally, while the sauce and crust of the pie were delicious, most of the steak was very tough and chewy. While there were two or three pieces of melt-in-your-mouth steak in there, they just made me more angry that they were the exception to the rule.   So after $60 for two tiny entrees and water that were worse than the offerings from my local Irish pub, I couldn't help but wonder who this restaurant was for. It's too spendy for the regular pub crowd, but the food doesn't live up to the GR name. That leaves only diehard Hell's Kitchen fans who want to say they have visited a famous chef's restaurant.   Vegas is a foodie Mecca. Skip this one.  P.S. Several pictures show bread being served with the meal but we were never offered any. I also didn't see it on the menu. That looks pretty great, would have been nice to try.

P2MtTIC2UMWUHfS2hcsyaw.text: Upscale British pub food! Great drinks! Bartenders are always fun!

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States

NeZ9pK3pMXnL4RRK1Od_Eg.text: I have been wanting to eat at a Gordon Ramsey restaurant ever since I saw Hell's Kitchen the first time. I was not disappointed. I started with the onion soup and it was the best I ever tasted. I had the bangers and mash as my entree it was superb. The whole table raved about their food and desserts. I was reading some of the poor reviews and all were price related hello people this is a Michelin star chefs restaurant and you are going to pay for the experience. The food and service were awesome and I believe it was well worth the money. I am just a normal working guy so not made of money but when I get food and service like I had tonight why not. So if you want a great meal and great service I highly recommend this restaurant.

_QCLjls0NUPTT9yiYBsuDQ.text: Since when did British Beef Sausage become a Hotdog , ? Very Disappointed

aN0Atc-6O78s6pFbXCc7bQ.text: All stuff were very friendly and great job!! Casual and confutable seat and big restaurant. I wish they have more choice of salad menu!

TC5Q2s7-ljMd7uOQqraJHg.text: Nachos and cheese and pratel for happy hour from 2 /5 on Monday afternoon service good food good love is restaurant I try the friend and mins corn dogs next

hGFhvLkH9FfHqiKP5LKZAw.text: A nice place to eat in Caesars Palace. Everything we ordered came out promptly and tasted great. The burgers were juicy and the wing sauce was excellent. Juice and Ronni behind the bar were awesome.

OWY70wct5Q9fA5D3RSXqOQ.text: Ronnie and Juice made us have a great time. A Greta experience for a first Vegas meal!

nVIudFaGL7pvpwM_0UWqHw.text: Terrible food and service!!  Waited over 1 1/2hours for terrible food!  Don't mind prices of food is good.  Will never go back.

yRNay0Z-lcd6PuVGJgBZ0g.text: I am absolutely amazed at how delicious the slow braised short rib is! We came here because hell's kitchen was super crowded and we had a great experience by sitting at the bar with no wait. Ronnie helped us and was really nice! He recommended the shirt rib and we will come back just for that. This place has a great atmosphere and the prices are reasonable.

kdQthGmVt3IfgxCV_B7XWw.text: Awesome food and service! Michelle was so personable and sweet and we absolutely loved her.

BANoG0mKX2b5KSOmjKk-Rg.text: What a pity and what a disappointment.  This place prides itself as " the most authentic English pub experience in Las Vegas, as only a native UK chef can provide", however I found the quality very poor. Had the cooks been on Masterchef they wouln'd have made it past a challenge.
