Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Nothing special: greasy buns, not worth the price

_kmQ0vUniBgzqJXgk0rd8g.text: Amazing food and amazing service. My husband and I are celebrating our 10th wedding anniversary and wanted to try Gordan Ramsey restaurant. We both had the pigs (English bangers) in a blanket and we both ordered the fish and chips. Huge portions. We love English pub food so this was the place to go! Heather was an awesome waitress. Very pleasant and attentive. Thank you so much for making our anniversary special, Heather. Ask for her when you come.

Js3bVPnOwsDzyaQXTTs3CA.text: Awesome experience at this pub and grill! Excellent Ribeye steak and Calamari starter! The friendly staff knew just what to recommend with there large selection of beer. The atmosphere was the perfect start for a great night out on the strip. No long wait for our food and I really enjoyed the sticky toffee pudding!!! Can't wait to do it again!

1S9btaE1uKQ-gb3RC0mRzQ.text: There are so many mixed reviews on yelp that made me hesitant of trying out Ramsay's restaurant. But I am glad I did.   As much as I love to read other people's reviews, I have to say, not one experience is the same as another. Nor does everyone have the same tastes buds.  The appetizers alone, can be your main dish for the night due to the large proportions. I had ordered the shrimp cocktail and the size of the shrimps were huge ! The appetizer by itself had filled me up !  My boyfriend had ordered the grilled lamb burger, my mother-in-law ordered the mac and cheese, my father-in-law ordered the New York strip, and my bother-in-law ordered the lobster mini rolls.  All the dishes were fantastic, especially the mac and cheese and the lamb burger ! However, service was extremely slow.

HubIN_Z1XRE2xduVofY-VA.text: Best service in the city. Great place to watch the games. If your luck Lisa will be your server!

cjtJpY8ZvOARBSV2i4ZMtQ.text: Came here during my birthday weekend for a quick bite before seeing Jlo Live and I had a great experience here. We ordered the mac and cheese, the fish & chips and mash potatoes and split it between three people. I enjoyed everything but we only got 2 fishes and thought they were slacking on the count of fish since it is expensive, we thought we would get more. They ended up giving and extra one for free which was very nice of them. Service was great! It was super busy but still ended up getting a table within 15 min. The mashed mint puree was perfection..very refreshing with the fish and chips! I didn't drink but it looked like they had a huge beer selection on tap. Might have to come back here to try the beers. Good job Gordon Ramsay!!

-7WYPS1x0H3UhzT51PfIcA.text: Not quite sure how I feel about this place. I think I was expecting a little more for the price, only considering it has Gordon Ramsay's name on it. I ordered the ceasar salad and was a little disappointed that it was small and didn't have too much to it except lettuce and sauce. Although, others in my group ordered the lobster mac and cheese and the corn beef sandwich which were both pretty tasty! The beer menu is also pretty great. Overall good experience, maybe just don't order a salad.

ihLZVXOiys577AYHmKm9eQ.text: Hostess - Mely Ann directed 5 of us to sit at the bar so David and Shawn could take care of us.   (One of our group has never been to Vegas).   Such a delightful experience.   Conversation, beverages and delicious food.   I'll add - we were hungry and the food came out fast, hot and yummy! We will be back!!!

D9SYRPzO_xeIUXqldj5zuQ.text: We enjoyed the food and most of all the service. Our server Rodney was nice, friendly and professional. Our truffle fries came a little cold first.  After we told him, he apologized and replaced it with no questions asked.  We checked in Yelp and got free sticky pudding. It was the most delicious dessert I ever had. We will be back.

Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States

6N5RRQ2lWlG_PZou2PQmZA.text: Stopped in for a bite to eat whilst making bets at the sports book area. Found a seat at the bar and was quickly greeted with a menu.  The bartender behind the bar was an extremely friendly gentleman who, as I would learn, checked in frequently with all of the patrons and myself. He did a great job during the lunch hour under much duress.   I was much in the mood for a burger and fries despite the fact that the two gentleman on either side of me ordered the fish and chips, which looked very appealing.   This British-themed bar had Champions League soccer on the tele, and you could tell the bartender knew his soccer.  The burger I ordered was very good, and it came with standard fries. I noticed that the fish and chips came with steak fries. Kind of wished my order came with those instead of the shoe-string style.  I ordered a couple of German ales, and the beer was perfectly chilled.  Good visit! A little bit more expensive and the lunch-time clientele was dressed up a little more, but well worth the visit. When on vacation, there is no harm in splurging a little more, particularly when you double or triple your money at the sport book. Ha :-)

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Burger and fries

XQVmNWQ5b8WbFBExGY2iWg.text: Came here while I was visiting my sister who works in Vegas. Our waiter ended up being a friend of hers and he was amazing. The food and service were top notch. I am a huge fan of Gordon Ramsay and was afraid the restaurant wouldn't meet the hype but I am so glad it did. We got a couple appetizers including the scotch egg, mini lobster rolls, and mac and cheese. So flavorful and so good. I have to say the highlight was the fish and chips. I've never had fried fish that was so crispy and moist. Our server friend told us stories about how when Gordon stops by he casually talks to customers, and how the fish is not allowed to be cut until it's ordered. Whatever they are doing is working. The signature burger we got was amazing as well. And I got to enjoy my favorite beer, Innis & Gunn, which I found out from the menu is Gordon's favorite as well!

FSnci8fW_hrlgEcJFQWSWA.text: So we were very pleasantly surprised on the flavors and quality of the food served. The food was very tasty and packed with flavor. We were quickly seated and the environment was that of a stylish English pub. I loved the setting as I was starving and there was amazing food along with a live collage football game.   The appetizers we had were the Maine lobster and shrimp rolls. This has to be one of the best appetizers have had. The roll was crispy yet soft and buttery. The lobster and shrimp spread was to die for and I wanted to keep ordering more and more of it. I had the famous fish and chips with a large glass of beer. Best food to watch a game with. The fresh cod was perfectly cooked and battered.  The cod was tasty and moist. The fries were soo good and the bowl of mashed peas was something I will always remember. My wife had the Salmon with fennel. She said it was really tasty and she licked the plate clean. She normally does not like her salmon oven roasted but when Gordon Ramsey create a dish, somehow he has you living things you don't normally like eating.  We will definitely come here again. The only reason I did not give this place 5 stars was because the service could improve. The waitress we had seemed overwhelmed and I had to ask twice for ketchup before I finally got it. She also would not look towards our table a couple of times when I needed her. But overall the service was good but could improve.    We paid 131.62 for the appetizer, two dishes, large beer and a non alcoholic beverage.  Well worth the visit.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yum
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Maine lobster and shrimp roll minis.
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Salmon with fennel

PZY8zVCjmkrG1WjGFImeFw.text: The third time is the charm for three stars! (Or now my average rating of this place!) The first time was fabulous, the second time it was awful and the third time (you ask, why we even gave it another chance? We had friends who really wanted to try it) was A-OK.   We made reservations for a late dinner for four people and we were shown to our table promptly when we arrived. I will say, we were seated at a 4 (low) top in the center of the restaurant and the chairs were 'sunken'/ worn (?) which doesn't really work well for a 5'2" lady in a dress and heels trying to eat a meal. I felt I needed a booster seat and a bib.   Our server was pleasant and attentive and the food was good. We all were happy and tasted the meals amongst ourselves. What really made my day? Our guests enjoyed the event when I was worried about it.   Why only 3 stars you ask? This place is super inconsistent with it's food and service (plus the whole chair thing).

-R4P93LdrjIbI_6ySAUiXg.text: So glad we made it to this place. Nachos are amazing and their Salads are great  are Server John is the best

iJLuVUHJKsPwQ-zLPtOy5w.text: Chicken wings were great.  The Bleu cheese is freshly made. The burger was superb.  Perfect spot for girls night out!

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Ss9z__39-2BIthRzyqXIQA.text: Mr. Ramsay!!! It's been a pleasure!   I've watched Hell's Kitchen, but only religiously during season 1 and 2. I highly enjoy the world of cooking and creating a meal that's enjoyable on all levels. I've wanted to eat at a Ramsay restaurant for some time now, and I finally got that chance!   Now, let's talk about the atmosphere. The decorations, the barrels (or maybe kegs?) on the walls, the lighting, the choice of color, the "British Art Decor" on the wall; all of it was highly appealing and fit for a "British Pub and Dinner Grill environment". It actually encouraged to eat. Even the dang menu was fancy and red and nice, and it was pushing me to try this stuff. I loved it.   Now let's get to the food. I ate 'Bangers and Mash' a traditional British meal consisting of sausages and potatoes, and this had been spruced up a bit for Ramsay's Establishment. It was a small portion (I can consume so much, so to my standards it was small), but the presentation was superb. The taste was amazing too, the potatoes were great and they deliciously went well with the three sausages I had! And those three babies had been cooked just right too, it was ridiculous.   I also tried a bit of the "Rueben sand which", a corned beef, rye breaded and Swiss cheesed (mind the grammar) American made meal. The Rueben was great; it fell apart nicely with one bite. Not too tough to overcome at all. The bread was soft and tasty and the meat tasted great as well.   Finally, I had some a delicious spot of some cake. Not too sure what it was but at first, it didn't look too appealing. And then man. Bit into that buggar and my mouth was having a holiday. Again, the quality was great and it came apart quite nice in my mouth, and the taste just overtook my tongue. It was not too sweet at all, it was probably one of the best desserts I've had for some time.   Now, price wise? Quite the tab, but quality definitely ran rampant in the meal I devoured. You definitely get some high quality chow that doesn't disappoint. I'm really starting to appreciate this sort of eating.   I also highly appreciated being able to eat some actual European themed food. It's not too often that you come upon a British or German restaurant. Heck, it's hard enough to find something Norwegian or Scottish. Most European themed places are Irish pubs for the most part. It was great to actually be cultured with some English recipes.   Would o return? Definitely would. My only disappointment was not being able to see Gordon Ramsay yell at some. But we can't all get everything we want.

C6b5I315Ziv29jcTDFu6Lg.text: Wow, came here for happy hour and what we got was even better than expected. It was delicious. We had the pretzels, deviled eggs, nachos, and toad in a hole. Pretzels were good, everything else was amazing. The nachos, what can I say. I will be dreaming of you. I loved you ever since the waiter placed you in front of me. No seriously, it was amazing. Deviled eggs... Those eggs should have been between two slices of bread... It was so damn delicious. Not sure if it's on the menu, but if it is, I'm all over it. The toad in a hole were too damn small. That's my only complaint!  They were so good... Check out the pics and my bill. Sorry, I totally forgot to snap a pic of the deviled eggs before devouring it. Hush, you guys are lucky I was able to hold back the gf to snap a pic before we dug in. I nearly lost a hand...  No joke.

7nDR965tpfBEmKF5X8T0BQ.text: It's a solid 3. Great spot for a bite and much better than the Caesar's overpriced food court. I had the cheeseburger. The don't do tomatoes etc so you may have to ask. Food was delicious & service was really good! I'd eat here again for sure!

P0ZQz2z9v39rCGn1BaEgig.text: Arrived with mid-level expectations -- celebrity restaurant in a LV casino. We were very disappointed. Hostesses were blase at best. Server was friendly but seemed stressed/overworked. It felt as if they had to accommodate some huge party unexpectedly. Drinks took 15 mins.   My $40 tenderloin was overcooked but I dare not complain given the spotty service.  That aside, all food was very tasty. Fries I would guess are NOT house made - a slight disappointment.  You set high expectations but clearly you overextended. Shame on you, Ramsey!!! Service atrocious.  Some woman (not our server) delivered our truffle fry starter without even looking at our table -- almost dropped the plate. Thus was pretty aggregious.   Overall, food 4 stars, service (better yet, restaurant management, 1 star). I leave sad.

HOxJDtDUpb9F_axBiVTZHQ.text: This is review is just for the cocktails and they were really good. All the 5 people who I was with here really enjoyed their cocktails. For me personally, the mocha martini hit the spot and I ended up having two. Located right next to the casino, if you are with people who are gambling, its easy for everyone to come and go between games. Definitely a place to try while in Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mocha martni

_fXgRalEOn8C3Dc74PFAVQ.text: We came back at this restaurant because we had awesome burgers that we ordered a few months back. We ordered Bacon Burger and Grilled Beef burgers again both cooked medium this past weekend and it was terrible.  The patties were dried and no flavor!!!!  Do not order burgers here!!!!!

QwyAF1379PUtystz9YH9UQ.text: I've had a lot of burgers, and I mean a lot of burgers. But this by far provided the best burger i have ever had. The price is competitive with all of the main stay burger and pub places on the strip. If there is a mistake made, they promptly correct it with out asking

VEGYCiKYPmiaBatPwo8RxQ.text: Our server recommend the fish and chips, the chicken curry or the Bangers and mash. I really want the shepherds pie but that is only dinner. They have limited selection for lunch. So I try the corn beef sandwich. The meat is really good n not salty like all other corn beef I have eaten. But the sandwich was little dry and serve with potatoes chips(not great). But the chicken curry was really good. That itself made our meal better.

IqxlCFlLS-pb5rn7QXpaLQ.text: Expensive but good. We had four people with 2 appetizers,  4 alcoholic drinks, and 4 entrees and our final bill was $200 not including tip.

sMJr54Mco2OCBmiLWnQ4QQ.text: Drinks great.   Food great.   Service , well theBest ever. We really enjoyed the great service of  David Su. He was very knowledgeable of drinks , food, even when we asked him why there was a big red dot painted on our table. He was there when we needed him   He could even get our jokes. I think I  surprised him by calling the manager on the phone to say how much we really thought he did a great job to take care of all 6 of us.  David Su if you read this I pray only greatness and success in your life. You are a great employee.  GREAT!!! We will be back

cRSGFIekRiiXMlBlZ2cQcA.text: The lobster bisque was amazing although the server didn't say it was in addition to the entree (still totally worth it).  The salmon with green stuff was really good.  I'd explain it but all I got from server was "amazing what can be done with butter and salt"   Service was average to poor.  I tip high so 25% is low for me.    The scotch eggs were decadent and tasty but did set off my stomach issues.  I was fine till those so... could have been the butter or ... but I left feeling totally nauseous which is too bad after what was mostly an incredible meal

tVGupN-uDZT0R5jY_t2pQQ.text: Best service ever. David was our waiter and he was so attentive and had a great personality. He is what made the restaurant experience 5 stars.  And the food wasn't bad either :)

XODCFUtLvkU6ULkXNQK3cw.text: I really Was surprised first with the food and Second the Service. The Food was the Minimum level,you know when  you go to Try a big name like that and Specially a Big Chef like Ramsay you will be waiting for something very Special from the taste of the Food and different choise of food on the Menu but the  food with this Place it was Really Really okay.... The Service wassssss the Bigest Problem,i'm gonna Keep it like that. I can just tell you about the Service that i Refused to leave tip for the Waiter....

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States

c570UbYVUrn4LjEwaK9wZw.text: I'd be lying if I said the sole reason I came here on my trip to Vegas wasn't because I am a HUGE Ramsay fan. I had very high expectations, though maybe I shouldn't have. My family was seated in the center with couches and a coffee table...that may have been fine for drinks only but definitely not ideal for a family of 6 eating together for dinner. We ordered drinks first, I got the blue skies drink....easily the star of the whole meal. When the waiter came around we asked for suggestions, I was already leaning towards the lamb burger when he mentioned it was his favorite on the menu so I ordered. When our food came I can say we all ate in relative silence, not because it was so good or we were starving, but because we we're so "meh" about the whole experience. My lamb burger was okay, the flavors weren't amazing and it was a little dry. Everyone else seemed to feel the same about their various meals. I think you're paying for the name on the building and menu as opposed to quality of food, which is disappointing. I would not come back here again, except maybe for round 2 of that drink.

8bCETdT0tVHdmUg8zXDuRQ.text: Ordered lolly pop wings, was served plain dings, no wings: had sherpered pie: it was bland: i was very disappointed ? Very very disappointed.  Does Gordon eat here?

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States

wO_ZwNtMhuGz9ReHZl5gMg.text: Given the restaurant was Gordon Ramsey's, our party was extremely disappointed and shocked at the terrible service. The waiter must have been scared to do his job because he kept glancing at our table and not stopping by. I watched him pass about 4 times before asking if we wanted water (uhm yes, it's Vegas and we need to stay hydrated), another 4 times before asking if we wanted drinks, and another 6 times before finally bringing them. He literally forgot to bring the beer and then quickly left again when we were clearly ready to order. It wasn't a busy night, so his flightiness was unexplainable.   This continued throughout the night. We needed salt/pepper, and the waiter continued to walk by hesitantly and not stop by asking how we are doing and if we needed anything. This might not seem like a huge deal, but no paying customer wants to feel avoided or neglected.   Also, he'll need to brush up on his adjectives and food reviews. When we asked about how their pea soup tasted, his only response was "it has texture." WOW you sold us on that one.   For Gordon Ramsay's name.. The staff needs better game. Very surprising..  The steak was pretty fatty. I was starving at that point (since the waiter took a lifetime to commit to his job) and would've ate anything.

0FcYNjib23PUSckjwkTW5Q.text: If our server treated us better I would have give it a 3 stars. But, the only thing he had done is greeting, taking order that's about it.and the only time he show up is when the food is here. Sure, that sounded fair. But, we are running low on water and condiment and would love to ask for the check and he is no where to be find.  My husband still left him with decent amount of tips because it is Christmas eve( maybe that's the whole reason for inattentive  service?!)  Food is ok.  I ordered the steak medium rare which comes out surprising rare and dry?! My husband ordered the chicken Breast thankfully it is nice and tender.  The dessert straight forward dead sweet. And it takes about a good 20 mins wait ,but it felt like an hour to me.

lR4UpwHQ6mrRa2rmmI5Efw.text: Always a great time , drinks and food!  Everytime we go , it never disappoints ! Service is great especially at the bar .. Our last visit this weekend was great and "G" took great care of us ! Had us go back for one last drink and bite before we left town! Lamb Burger and Wings are AMAZING .. Along with the sliders , fish and chips , pretzel and French onion soup .. AND THE DRINKS! Made with great enthusiasm and deliciousness ... Everytime ! Can't wait to go back!

lI1YQajjDlfHT6jE2IbTEg.text: I went to the self named pub of Gordon Ramsay to see if it truly lived up tie the greatness of the man who it was named after. And I must say, it certainly did.  At first glance you can see by the decor the theme they were going after; a charming casual place that served bold flavors. The menu was appropriately priced for Vegas and the food was modeled after a traditional English pub with keeping its American guests in mind. The beer list had a nice blend of English ales and some good American craft beers among the standard miller lite.   As for the food, I had the corned beef sandwich as a few bites of the lamb burger. Both were outstanding in flavor and well portioned. Having them accompanied by a 90 minute IPA, my lunch was set.   I give my recommendation and hope you have a chance to try it.

nCY_2UjM8UzyjneXuMcskQ.text: Pros: Shepard's Pie is out of this world! (would you expect any less here though?) -my burger was delicious -mushrooms were out of this world -decor was cool -waitress was friendly and knowledgeable  Cons: -Expensive...duh (not as bad as I was expecting though) -the bar stools were a little too squishy (really not that big of a deal..) -the cocktails we had actually weren't very good...especially for $14 or whatever they were  All in all, we were impressed!

XRCANCPXax1Etpiladv4IQ.text: Don't eat here! Gordon Ramsey clearly doesn't have anything to do with this restaurant. Poor quality, cheap airport like food, slow service with no drink refills, and prices too high for the quality.  Easy foods like fish n chips and burgers should be a no brainer but were near inedible. Stay away!

EDGbblp_H4d2NAS6pk7yBw.text: This tells me everything I need to know about this restaurant.  I asked the waitress for a recommendation, and she said:  "Oh I don't eat here!  I can't afford it!"  The staff at the restaurant doesn't even get to sample the food so they know what to recommend to the customers?  I've heard TV Gordon fly off the handle about much less.  At the very least they could give a reasonable staff discount so that customers looking for an opinion about the specialty of the house could get one from the "presumed" expert who is standing at their table.  My burger was fine.  Everything with Gordon is a "stunning" hamburger.  Mine was good....  Not great....  I wasn't stunned.  Fries were good.  Ketchup was probably the best part of the meal.... honestly.  In fairness it was pretty special ketchup though.  For the price and the ego, I was hoping for stunning.  I got mediocre.

gcZ4KAa0MMAjQ6gqbGf69A.text: Meh, not impressed. They where having a corporate event so I had to sit at the bar. No biggie. I ordered a Boddington's and the Shepard's pie. Pie was too salty you could hardly taste the meat. The beer tastes a bit off too. Not how I remember it. The staff are. Decked out in this late 70's punkish type garb. Kinda weird but what ever floats Gordon's boat I guess.   Bottom line with what 3 Michelin stars after his name I would have expected more.  I also expected a little larger English beer selection. But oh well.   I won't go out of my way to come back but if I am at Caesar's again. I'll give it another go.

8d0OW6n--hFko8eg0baB2Q.text: Nice place. Good atmosphere with excellent food.very tasty . Best fish and chips I ever had. Woa a British guy who knows how to cook.

GkFlLUb_mbfSspbytY_0Zg.text: Hate to do this.... I love Gordon Ramsay! - but..... The food here is mediocre. I have been on three occasions now with people visiting me from out of town. I kept giving it a chance, but was let down each time.  Tried something different each time and just not up to the standard of his other 2 places here in Vegas.  The Sheppard's Pie was even mediocre :(  I would go there for a beer and chat with a bartender, but if I am looking to get a quick eat than I would rather go to Burgr.  Sorry Gordon......

DEeHG5b9CFQSQOkRtPMPHA.text: Ate lunch. Didn't have to wait long for a table. Had the kettle chips with cheese and short ribs for the table to share, then had the wings and sticky toffee pudding for desert. The chips were absolutely fabulous, the wings were ok, desert was awesome. My son had the fish and chips, which were bland at best.  Mom had the cheddar burger appetizer which she said were good. The service was excellent. It is really overpriced for "pub" food, but worth a try.

i-rClU079cfdbXdax3iL7Q.text: Cool restaurant! Definitely makes me miss being in London. The food is really good and the cocktails are awesome. I love the decor so much too! Definitely a cool place to hang out for a bite and a drink.

FPgRv_LMVZYMCgrDNmmSoA.text: Got right in with no wait.  Great waiter with good sense of humor.   I hade the short ribs which were fork tender.  My husband had a cornbeef sandwich that I sampled and was very good.  I loved it and was a little disappointed to hear I missed Gordon by about 2 hours.  That would have made my night.  Eat here if you get a chance.

ZwJfZ91R38QmQuCEi6S_OQ.text: Disappointing! My wife and I are big Ramsey fans and we religiously watch Kitchen Nightmares. We've both been to London and love Pub food, so we were very excited to go to the new Ramsey Pub.    First, the hostesses quoted an hour and a half wait even though it was off peak Sunday after 8, there were six to eight open tables and what appeared to be very few people waiting. They took my contact info and less than 30 minutes later the text came through that our table was ready. The early table was a pleasant surprise but it was obvious they weren't really keen at estimating accurate wait times.  Our server was friendly but not attentive. There were a number of times we had to wait a while before he returned to our table.  The Shepard's pie was bland and not very tasty at all.  The portion was very small, which wouldn't be a big deal if they weren't charging nearly $30. It was an entree price with a tapas/small plate portion size. Everything was way overpriced, the side of mushy peas was $11. $11 for a few ounces of mashed peas? And they weren't very good either.   Overall it wasn't a very positive experience and with Ramsey's name on it you certainly expect more.

7j8GF3UfDcyLdqyf_fXDUg.text: Let me start by saying I am a huge Gordon Ramsay fan.  I have watched all his shows from BBC to Fox.  I have also dined at the London NYC and it was one of the best meals of my life.  Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill?  Not so much.  We waited at the bar for the text that our table was ready and the wait was the highlight of our experience.  Great drinks and friendly bar tender.  He made great recommendations of what to eat and seemed to know the menu well.  We were seated just after finishing our first drink which was perfect.  After that it was all downhill.  The table we sat at was directly behind the hostess both so it was a high traffic area but it was so close you could reach out and touch them.  Not only was it awkward placement but the table was far to short, both in height and depth, for the 2 chairs and booth that were pushed up to it.  Strange and uncomfortable, but I could get past it for great food and service.  Unfortunately we got very little of either.  The waiter was friendly enough and for some reason felt the need to share that he was a competitive eater (even called another staff member over to prove it).  Again, awkward, but whatever.  For an appetizer we ordered the Scottish Egg, as recommended by the bar tender, and it was good.  Not great, but good.  There were 3 of us, we had the Prime Rib, Diver Scallops, and Fish and Chips.  The scallops were cooked perfectly and were very good (best entree ordered), the batter on the Fish and Chips was flavorful but slid right off the fish, which was tasteless, and the french fries didn't have any salt at all.  The Prime Rib was extremely bland but the mash potatoes were pretty decent.  For desert we had the Sticky Toffee Pudding and it was definitely the star of our dining experience.  I have watched Gordon make it on TV for years and was very happy that I wasn't disappointed.    For what I have reviewed so far I would have given 3 stars but the service is where it really fell flat.  Every single dish we used from our drinks, to the apps, to dinner, to desert were all still on the table when we left the restaurant.  We were out of drinks, even water, 45 min before we got our check, which I had to wave our waiter down to request and then it still took another 20 minutes before we got it.  Outside of taking our order and delivering food he only stopped at our table to check on us once the whole hour and 45 minutes that we were seated.  I saw the manager at the hostess both several times and tried to get his attention to inform him of our experience but he never would make eye contact.  Normally I would have got up and went to him but at this point I was annoyed and just wanted to leave.  Needless to say for a meal that cost over $170 (not including the $60 we spent at the bar) I was EXTREMELY disappointed.  This is a restaurant worthy of Gordon's show Kitchen Nightmares!  What a shame.  I hope, Scott Commings (Hell's Kitchen season 12 winner) will turn things around when he takes the head Chef position and hopefully that is soon!

9luVakrUTwrBA9GZfj9PGg.text: I never ate at a Gordan Ramsey restaurant So I was excited to be wowed. I  was going to have dinner there but after my lunch experience I decided to go to Hugo's cellar on Freemont st (highly recommend) All I was looking for was something light to hold me over for awhile so my brother and I ordered just some soup I had the chicken leek with broad noodles and truffle fries off the happy hour menu. my nephew had a bacon burger and Fries my brother had a bowl of split pea. my soup was bland and flavorless more like grease and water only two curl noodle not broad. the fries were like Mcdonalds with some and a small some of truffle spray my nephew only ate half of his burger so my bro and I took a few bites and to say the least not impressed again very little flavor the bacon was a little under cooked. All they sell there is the name. You better off at the lobby bar and grill in the hotel. I mean if they can't do soup and burgers for lunch than dinner is out of the question. Its was Hells kitchen alright.. Bloody Hell Gordan.

HNocHtXj0i1fcPciPTOo5A.text: DON'T waste your money and time. After having a great experience at Gordon Ramsey's BurGR, we had hoped an English pub by an EmUK chef would be amazing. Sorely disappointed. Hubby had fish and chips. The fish was not seasoned at all. The batter was crunchy but amateur chefs can get crunchy. Here is a tip: try salt. I had the lobster macn cheese. Solely based on this I'd have given it 3 stars. Better than fish n chips. Lots of lobster but mac n cheese was blander than it could have been. I had much better lobster mac at House of Blues. The staff seemed to be working hard but we had to wait forever for drinks and for the server in general. The bus boy was awesome though. Kept our waters filled and table taken care of. Fish n chips: 2 Mac n cheese: 3 Service: 2.5  Hugely disappointed that a restaurant with GR's name would be so lacking!

sRk1Tbn7ES2aqM2Nt-Owjg.text: I think Gordon needs to work on Hell's Front End. . .  First, I had to wait in line to put my name on the list (no problem, I expected that), so we went to the bar and had a great time.  Then they texted me, "Your table is ready."  I walk up to the Hostess and she said, "get in line."  I told her I already waited in line and my table is ready.  Apparently, "Your table is ready" doesn't really mean that at all.  I had to wait in the same line I first had to wait in to put my name in for a reservation!!  So after pulling me from the bar (drinks are not cheap either!), I had to wait another 15 minutes in line to get to my table!  I should have left then, but I really wanted to try Gordon Ramsay's food.  I first let the waiter know the issue they have at the front, and his response was, "You got to expect that."  WHAT?!  Serious?  No I do not.  We stayed, but the food wasn't worth the wait either.  I hope this helps your decision making whether to eat here.  I would never go back.

R_3hIw4EIgejZMc26PL3jA.text: Nice atmosphere. Service was spot on. The server had good knowledge of the menu.  The food was delicious as is expected in a Gordon Ramsay restaurant. Location was easy to find in Caesars palace.   Would eat there again.

UQI2GBbkVkn7vGMM7plXlQ.text: Had an amazing meal. Adam Rogers was our server and he made the night memorable for my family.  Superior service, delicious food and met executive chef Scott!  an expensive restaurant, but woth every penny.    Absolute must haves are the fillet and the sticky toffee!

gwRxnfnofJO_KUAw0RkjDw.text: Egads this place is a hot mess. The service was atrocious. We waited an hour for the spouse's food and when we asked what the problem was the waiter said he had no clue and the kitchen must have screwed up the order but he'll put it in again as a "rush". No offer to comp the delayed food or even spring for a beer. We cancelled his food asked for the bill and then the douche had the nerve to charge us for the food that never arrived. Oops he said - my bad.  Very disappointed because I love Gordon Ramsay and wanted to love his restaurant.

l5a_R6NYPEJCJM6IczBIbA.text: Visited a few months ago while on vacation.  I was really impressed with the beer selection, and the food was fine, nothing too exciting.  We were there for happy hour and had nachos (meh), truffle fries (meh), deviled eggs (everyone else loved them, I don't like deviled eggs), toad in a hole (meh), and the chicken wings (not good).  Service was also not good.

9J9cIKaML5VdblxVIByVnQ.text: Well... where to start?  The evening before we enjoyed a FANTASTIC dinner at Joe's Seafood, Prime Steak and Stone Crab (It's in Caesars...run...don't walk to this place if you want a wonderful dining experience)   So... we figured we would give this place a try, the menu price wise is about the same as Joe's, we expected something close to the level of service Joe's offers.... BOY we we wrong!    The waitress sat us and the bench seat I was in sank down like an old worn out sofa... it was awkward to dine in.   She brought us an Ipad for the drink menu and didn't really go over the ordering process... we figured it out and pressed on.   I ordered the mixed grill which comes with a couple of shrimp, pork belly, and a fillet.  When the food arrived the side dish we ordered did not show up. No apology, the guy just said he would go back and the dish would be out in 5 min. My wife ordered the Scallops with polenta...  Her scallops were not bad but the polenta was nonexistent ... her bowl looked empty LOL a few scallops and faint smear of polenta.  My meal... the steak was over cooked, it had a good flavor but wasn't nearly as good as the fillet I had at Joe's the night before. The pork-belly was the best thing in the dish and the shrimp were very plain... lacked any seasoning.   About half way through the meal we stopped eating... called over the waitress who hadn't followed up about the missing side dish.  She went back... said it would be out in 5 min.  Again... no apology... nada.  Then she went on drifting around the place not doing much of anything.  We waited a little longer... said screw it and finished our meals.  Not once during the meal did the waitress check on us... offer to get us additional drinks... nada.    As soon as we finished the meal... the guy shows up with the side.  I politely let him know we didn't want it... we had finished our meals. About 10 min later the waitress drops off the check... minus the side and says have a good night.  Again... never admitting there was an issue... just treated us like the millionth pain in the ass tourist she has served.   For a $150 + meal... you would expect better food and better service.    This place was a huge letdown.  I only wish I would have read the Yelp reviews prior to wasting our time and money at this 2 star establishment.  I've had better meals and service and chain restaurants.   Again... if you want a great meal... with great service... I highly recommend you walk on down to Joe's on the 1st level of Caesar's Palace. You will not be disappointed.   (PS...   Frank

q8T4BgHw99nMv9LgJRKTiA.text: I ate here with my girlfriend and her mother in January of 2019.  The food was awful and I was going to let it slide, until I ran into the service at Gordon Ramsay's burger place today and lost it. This review is for the Pub & Grill though, located in Caesar's Palace on the Vegas strip.    We came for dinner and had high expectations, as you would imagine considering the brand name. Each of us ordered $70 steaks and they were almost inedible.  There was obviously no preparation of the steaks since they were rubbery, had no flavor, and the cuts were worse than the clearance aisle at your local grocery store. I was starving so I woefully scarfed down my ribeye a la propane.  Seriously, all I could taste was chemicals in my steak. Mr. Ramsay needs to visit his own places and do a tough introspection.  Or maybe TV just pays better.

H6oJ1pIbH_K3LE5Ye61xBQ.text: I had the burger which was really good and the Mac and cheese was delicious!! One of the tastiest I've ever had in a restaurant. And what an unexpected surprise to see Mr Ramsay himself, and even got a photo with him. Too bad he blinked in the photo, but oh well...

Qebp9pM3P4jwVGw-a5Gmow.text: This place was just spectacular! This was my first stop after I landed in Vegas. I had wanted to try a Gordon Ramsay restaurant. This place seemed causal with no reservations required, but it had one of the food items on my food bucket list. And that item would the famous Beef Wellington! I ordered that and I asked my waiter if their Bloody Marys are any good. He said they're the best. When he brought it to me, my first words were wow! It tasted delicious and came with various pickled items like asparagus, tomatoes, and an actual pickle. It also had pieces of salami so it all balanced out with the drink. Now when the Beef Wellington came out, that was awesome! The meat will literally melt in your mouth. Everything in that plate was delicious. It was worth every penny, and I now have one less item in my food bucket list. My waiter was also great. Super nice and just the right amount of attentiveness.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States

q7EeKCoUTxfe_qkcAtu34g.text: Not our favorite ordered the sliders and the mussels. The sliders were very under cooked and frys were cold and soggy. The mussels had no flavor had to add a lot if hot sauce.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mussels and sliders

uZMcilLkAU1ujuYkBqhuLQ.text: Overall disappointing!  The lobster roll - bun was over toasted bordering on burnt.  The pork belly was over cooked and the jalapeno Mac and cheese had no heat.   I really wanted to love this place but just couldn't.

98UtlayNm8mVslI8s41W8g.text: Not bad food but the bitchiest bartender in Las Vegas . No manors and even Gordon Ramsay would not put up her shit in her shot in his restaurant! He is the owner! Lol

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States

PfVRjG1D6mUP41c68b6xyg.text: Great food! Exceptional service! Nom (Juice) and Keith are great!  Perfect recommendations; most especially the kettle chip short rib nachos. OMG. Out of this world!!  The sticky toffee pudding is also a delight. Wonderful ending to a great experience.   Super spot for a casual and not ridiculously expensive bite in Vegas. Enjoy!

bFS2dQ14YhlEbklqV31HLg.text: There were 4 of us for my birthday weekend.  The food here is mostly traditional English fare.  I actually had the chopped salad which I enjoyed.  I don't eat beef and I didn't want to spend $$ on Scallops.  The salad had chicken, shrimp and salami( I told them to keep that).   The salad was a good size for an entree.  My wife had some nachos made with potato chips.  She said the chips were crisp and not greasy.  My friends had short ribs( shared) and poutine and a wedge salad.  They enjoyed everything.  They had a 100.00 dining credit for being Total rewards Diamond members so they were able to use that for the meal.    Overall, it was an OK meal, however I do feel a lot of the dishes are very overpriced.

VOpNaq8VB3cQBUpD730Y_Q.text: Amazing everything. HIGHLY RECOMMEND. Out of all the meal I had in Vegas, by far the best. Free Sticky Toffee Pudding Cake too. Was just perfect.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Scottish egg
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Old fashion
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bone marrow and oxtail jam

4_fpTIMy-A80fWrzUcDo0Q.text: Had an awesome meal here tonight!  Always consistent, top quality, just amazing!  Ramon and Tom my waiters were especially knowledgeable and very helpful in recommending some great dishes off the menu, I chose the Shepard's Pie, it was was brilliant!  I highly recommend this restaurant, and do seek out Nong or Ramon they were great!

tfOhSYh4MRJ7UXrAopdD_A.text: Great quality food and really good happy hour. Make sure to get the truffle fries. They are amazing! I also liked the pub burger and wings. Check the Caesars website for the current happy hour menu.   Review was edited. I had issue where there happy hour menu had incorrect information online and the server would not honor it. Manager reached out to me and made up for it and also made sure the website was corrected. Thank you.

6X0Yr5fR1K4diHVaZqXAlw.text: One of the best meals I've had in Vegas. I had the ribeye with the mashed potatoes with olive oil infused with chives. My wife had the braised beef with mashed potatoes and steamed vegetables and I couldn't pick between the which one was the better dinner but they were both out of this world.  Worth every penny.

oVsK83MCKsIjB7IF-egH3w.text: Michelin Star Chef Gordon Ramsay has many restaurants in Vegas this one is at Caesars Palace. Beautiful decor, Comfortable seating and Authentic british fare.  We went for lunch and were promptly seated ~ Guinness $16 ~ Mocha martini $15 ~ Truffle fries with truffle aioli $12 ~ Salmon toast $9 ~ Butter chicken curry served with rice, naan and yogurt $28 ~ Sticky toffee pudding served with icecream.  Drinks were nice martini had chocolate, baileys and kahlua. Nailed the butter chicken just the right amount of spice. Truffle fries on point, salmon was fresh and light. Service is Excellent and Food is Delicious.  Don't miss out on the Sticky toffee pudding. Gotta Love Ramsay's food and definitely check out one of his restaurants.  Cheers!

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sticky toffee pudding
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Butter chicken curry $28
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Guinness $16

SfjrflFl27gW6qdjpZlcjQ.text: Very good food and very versatile as you would expect a from Ramsey. It was so good we ate there twice during our stay at Nobu in Las Vegas. The drinks were also very well made especially  their own. I absolutely recommend this place! The appetizers were amazing!!

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States

mK6UrDHD2TXpo9ec-BB2rg.text: Food was delicious and our server Elyse was amazing. The lobster rolls are perfect and our entrees were perfect the Wellington, chicken and short rib were so good even full you have to have every bite it's that good! The sticky cake was amazing I wish I would've ordered 2!

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 1 of the lobster rolls delicious!!

XCOMe6rb4e9RvijHj2SS3w.text: Pros:   - Calamari (OMG freaking delicious)  - Lobster roll (SO GOOoooD) - Butter chicken curry (Good variety of dishes here) - Free sticky toffee pudding with ice cream with a yelp check-in!   Cons:   - None

_iAOx4EVgWuH_XTG_VHBXg.text: Pub and grill is awesome! Great atmosphere and food. One of our favorite restaurants on the strip...

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States

uRo1o_xu5qH75ANc2hoiKg.text: This place was beyond amazing. We ordered the truffle fries and enjoyed every flavor. We all could not decide on an entree since the options all sounded amazing. The atmosphere was elegant and service was professional on the busy night. We had reservations and were seated promptly. I would recommend the Mac and cheese. Though the steak was on point the Mac and cheese was not like any other I've had. We loved the special attention to detail with the placements to the utensils

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States

CwT59Ilv4OqVNtm1BcXuzw.text: I had aspirations to go to all of his restaurants while in Vegas but only got to this one the first night we landed. It's in Caesars Palace and a very happening scene. You were able to get seats at the bar without a wait. Our bartender who looked like a lumberjack was super cool and helpful with a lot of Vegas tips. I ordered the beef pot pie which was absolutely perfect. My husband ordered a burger and fries which was good. I stole some of his fries and dipped them in the mayo which was home made and a little garlicky.   I thought the houndstooth shirts worn by the waiters were ugly compared to how they dress the hostesses and waitresses were much better kind of like the spy who shagged me. It's a little pricey I think our bill was over $60 with 3 beers but I did not expect it to be cheap. The bartender said Gordon Ramsay visits all his restaurants every other month or so

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Gordon&#39;s fave beer

ZlbLfjaD5P_ZNIyLMgtKiQ.text: The burger was burn and dry. Other than that. Everything was great. We talked to the manager and he took care of us. I will be back because the sever did a great job and other food were great.

2X--lH6dKmF4oiLDTVUEzg.text: Been a fan of Gordon R. for years and was excited to finally taste his food.  But it was meh at best.  The fish and chips was basically Fillet O Fish from McDonalds and the Shepard's pie tasted like Shepard's foot.  Besides that, the food was outrageously over priced.  I'm still a fan of his but he should really really be ashamed; price gouging people for meh to bad food is so disappointing.  Cross the street, eat at Inn and Out,  and use the 100 plus bucks in savings on the slots.  You'll thank yourself.

sHMBWNHX10_srAfSAE0Wcg.text: My husband and I had a reservation for 7:30 through Open Table on a Friday night and were seated immediately. We both had a drink at $11 a piece for an Angry Orchard and some other craft beer. Ordered the Kettle Chip Nachos as an App and they were alright with cheese, shredded beef, sour cream, and some pickled sweet peppers on top. The chips were hot as if they came freshly fried and was pleasantly surprised.   My dinner on the other hand was kind of a let down at $39.00. I ordered the Beer Braised Short Rib meal that came with mashed potatoes, grilled carrots, and a brown sauce. The beef was the same meat that came on the nachos and was completely tasteless and bland. It tasted like bland pot roast out of a crock pot. I couldn't pick up any beer accents and it definitely needed salt and some seasoning.   My husband loved his meal as he got the special that night of Gordon's famous Beef Wellington for $55. He was extremely impressed and very satisfied with his dinner. My dinner made me sort of depressed instead.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beer Braised Short Rib was very bland but looked pretty.

pfqRTA58FnYpdfckvBXsjQ.text: I must admit, I stayed away due to the lukewarm reviews, so I wasn't expecting much. We exclusively stay at Caesar's when we're in town, but we didn't want to brave the heat outside to get lunch. From the team to the drinks to the food, I was pleasantly surprised by all of it. I'm not a Gordon Ramsay fan, so none of that hoopla did anything for me. Instead, I am a huge fan of English fare like Pimms cups and mushy peas that I can't find decent versions anywhere in CA. The Pimms cup was spot on, and even though the mushy peas weren't traditional, I liked the spin the Pub put on them. I would most definitely dine here again.

3_f5fn2Ckzfq3AOOPpiziA.text: I ate the braised short ribs and it was quite salty. Eaten it before I felt like the quantity went down. We also had a waiter named Scott. As an Asian American we felt like he ignore us. When we needed something (napkins for example) we tried to catch his attention, he'll look at us but then go someplace else. We felt unwelcome in a way. But when all else fails, the sticky toffee will make it better.

_RTSmmSgrL549dvIowsz1A.text: First off, our server Rodney was exquisite. Best server I've ever had, bar none.   I had the main lobster and shrimp sandwich appetizer; the bread was buttery and crisp. The chicken, kale and bacon pot pie was the best pot pie I've ever eaten.

0R0GJqK9UrFYxgRk4q-3CA.text: We were visiting Vegas with some friends and are fans of Gordon Ramsey's Master Chef, so decided to try his pub. While some of the dishes we ordered were great: beef short rib, lobster roll, and shepherd's pie others were subpar: fish and chips, lobster mac and cheese, and calamari. Point is that if you don't do it well, don't put it on your menu. The atmosphere at this location is very noisy and cramped. It seems that Ramsey isn't holding the same standard at this restaurant as his others.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beef short rib: cooked perfectly

CYtLMwV7J0EdRWT9bFrSAg.text: Was amazing!  Yes this is a pub atmosphere from England.  Pot pies, bankers and mash, Indian cuisine, fish and chips....  That being said, the food was phenomenal.  Had the Chicken and kale pot pie.  Tried the truffle fries. Both were tremendous.  Would suggest staying away from Lobster Mac and cheese.  Was like runny Kraft boxed mac and cheese.

ekpQkpq9mRvf9C8LfOsW2Q.text: Server was very knowledgable about the menu and drinks. He recommended a beer to my sister and quickly gave her a sample (she ordered a full one after).   We went with 5 people. My sister got the lamb burger and I got the fish and chips. The other 3 got the burger. We also go pretzels to munch on while we were waiting. It came with 2 sauces - course mustard and cheese. They looked hard but were very soft.   Food took a while but it was very great. When I got my fish and chips, i said I could eat more than it but in fact, I couldn't even finish! The waiter said that their fish is never frozen and I believe it. It was firm, yet flaky. The batter was perfection. The only thing was the "chips" were more like roasted potatoes (not crispy) but were still good in their own right. Mushy peas were fresh with a hint of mint. The TARTAR SAUCE (!!) was very creamy and clearly homemade. It was worth the cost ($29).  I tried my sister's lamb burger and the spices were not appealing for me, but she loved it.  Lastly, we tried the toffee pudding ($10) after the rave reviews! It did not disappoint! It was more like cake consistency than pudding and came with sweet cream ice cream. The server pours the toffee sauce on top. So so good!

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Front of restaurant
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Toffee pudding
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dessert menu

ridq81bTksaIX9Z9FpVEDQ.text: We ordered the Shepard's pie, burger, shrimp cocktail and the lobster/shrimp rolls. Everything tasted awesome and our server Taylor was more than great! I highly recommend this restaurant. Get the Shepard's pie! Ambiance was great! And seriously everyone was sooo nice!!!

w8WZCoBu3_pXg-T_DS3lXw.text: Being originally from Slough in England I thought this place looked the business and I might get a decent taste of home...... wrong! The service was absolutely horrible and it didn't get any better. My scotch egg looked like a shrivelled up bollock and had less meat on it than an Ethiopian chicken! Sides were cold and the steaks came well over cooked. The food took ages and the server was a right tosser. Come on Gordon, get your bloody act together and sort this place out. They need to hear a few " for f*cks sakes" around there for sure! Sack the Manager, he was a real wanker!

KxuOeGyvKzjkClIPWxpyQQ.text: The service is awesome. Special thanks to our server, Rodney, who was so helpful and friendly. The red sangria was especially delicious as well as the food. I

VU9Xx0TDh0uIo_bZ_FaoEg.text: Really noisy! Seating sucks unless you have one of the 3 booths  Food was ok had a hell burger not the best I've had but not the worst either. The truffle fries were awesome! You pay for the name Gordon Ramsay! Boy Vegas has gotten expensive!!!

z4BmJHdRxNdDpG5Ej980xg.text: What a great evening sitting at the bar, enjoying Juice's company and eating delish food.

IubMAjEKA_eztaRpIceVmg.text: This has to be my go to place whenever I'm in Vegas. Personally, I really enjoy the Pub environment. The decor in this place is awesome! You have so many elements just giving it a overall astetic pub masterpiece.   As far as food goes, I would try the butter chicken curry. My favorite is the Lamb burger, the coleslaw gives a good crunchy texture when you bite into it. The feta sauce goes well with the lamb. A lamb burger must, it also pairs perfectly with their Dog fish 60 minute. You can really get a hightened taste of the lamb with every sip.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States

7gUYmmxE_gfd1BAoVJVLJw.text: Can see why the star rating is not as high as I expected.  I'm currently in the restaurant now. Don't feel British / English at all. They play American pop here...  Customer service & food:   The lady approached us pouring water with no greeting. We asked about the Happy Hour info, she kept flipping the menu we were reading then disappeared and came back with the page opened.  Our waiter came with no intro, instead just asked us if we had any questions or not. Then we ordered the Shepherds Pie, the Steak & Ale Pie and happy hour Truffle Chips.   Food came within 5 minutes. That's impressively fast for starving people. Food tasted very good!  We 2 persons did the Yelp check-in with a free sticky toffee pudding. The waiter brought in 1 portion only. After he checked with his colleague. He came back and said they offered 1 per table. That's ok, but hope they indicate this restriction on the redeem page.  Never knew his name until persons seated next to us. As he did a full introduction to them with recommendations. We found funny that a waiter mentioned to the customers that certain dishes he did not suggest as they weren't his favourite. Lol...  I definitely won't return to this restaurant especially after the dining experiences in Gordon Ramsay Steak and the Fish & Chips one.  Btw I'm a huge fan of Gordon Ramsay's!!!

TLrtXAQ1FMhOGJw7Re4ipw.text: I have been waiting to try a Gordon Ramsay restaurant and finally had the opportunity to try one at Caesar's Palace in Las Vegas.  Food was top notch and prepared with skill,  passion, and love.   The signature dish here was the shepherds pie and it was awesome.  Perfectly seasoned and prepared perfectly.  I had the first one out of the oven as it is ususally only served after 4PM.  We ate at 3PM but the chef prepared one special for me and I sampled the first one out of the oven; nice.  Thank you Mr. Ramsay.  I very much enjoyed your restuarnt .

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shepherd&#39;s Pie
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States

V4SrT5bRnTZ0e6duHpxsyw.text: We were desperate to find a restaurant that was open passed 10 p.m. in the Caesars hotel and ended up here. We've been to other Gordon Ramsay restaurants and this one is definitely not up to par. We should have trusted the Yelp reviews but we were too hungry and limited on options.   Service was slow even with barely any customers around. Nobody really care for their food so doubt we would ever come back again when visiting Vegas.

JZmhylNBG5CZ7Dlvhv0g_A.text: Overall, a good experience here.  We came in on a week night, a bit early, and were seated quickly.  Drink orders we taken and filled in a timely manner. My wife had the French onion soup for an app and it had a nice ale note to it.  Meals took a bit longer to come out, but we weren't in a hurry.  The food was good overall. Prices were a bit high; but that's expected when you're on the strip.   The one detractor for us was the "restaurant photographer" who came around and took our pic...then wanted to sell us the pic.  I was a bit surprised that a restaurant of this caliber would have someone doing this.  It seemed a bit gimmicky.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Place settings

6Akk5eBjiiF-RL3LrEDBKA.text: Fantastic ambiance, phenomenal food and my waiter at lunch today, Adam, was perfect!!!

Cy4sEVg_F6j6smi8lx3ONg.text: What a disappointment! Tried 2 of the hyped place-Yardbird and this. Yardbird was the one of the best experience in Vegas, whereas this was one of the worst. The food-bland, more of the canned food! Did he really trained his cook? Felt like yelling at him, the way he yells at the people. Enough said! Go waste your $$ at the casino, you might as well win than this crap!

BGrliCw71L-aU9iWZj5rDg.text: We came here on our trip to Vegas and it was the best experience we had so far! Our waitress Elise provided stellar service! I ordered the cheeseburger which blew my mind - it was cooked medium rare, just how I like it. I never eat burgers from upper scale restaurants, so I was pleasantly surprised. My boyfriend ordered the steak, he likes them VERY well done, but they brought it back still red inside. Elise was very accommodating and brought it back to cook a bit longer. Unfortunately it was still red inside when he got it back. Third times the charm and finally it was perfect!  Everything was delicious and the sauces were super tasty. The manager (didn't get his name) came out to chat with us and was really kind.  We finally tried the sticky toffee pudding which was the best part of the meal! SO moist, I almost died. I would eat this every day if I could. Definitely a must try if you're at Caesars!!

Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Steak
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cheeseburger

4g2qkdK8Uq1PVnpg-MwSiQ.text: Amazing place and the food is delicious! Our server was super kind and attentive. She told us about the Yelp check in for the sticky pudding. Thank you!

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Roasted Scottish Salmon, awesome

S7FWmM0fBXi1Pk9V1ME6SQ.text: Just visited this restaurant in Caesars Palace.  It gets a one star for the worst Chicken Caesar Salad I have ever had . $24 for probably 2 ounces of pulled rotisserie chicken that was old and hard.   This place is expensive for sure and I am not right with money but I do expect value for money which this place is not. The wait staff were absolutely fine and very courteous.

VTXC39IkL1rbg8hk5uQIcA.text: Everyone's a critic, I know. Especially Gordon Ramsay. We were coming here after a late showing of Celine Dion at the Caesar's Palace and were excited to give it a try. Despite the number of people coming out of the concert and going towards the restaurants for food, we were seated quite quickly (within 5 minutes or so?).  This particular restaurant of his specializes in English pub food. So you get your steaks, fries, shepherd's pie, many others. All very enticing as you look over the menu. I appreciated the quick service with the attentive staff to my water and other amenities! Anyways, sat down ordered a prime rib and a shepherd's pie with the intention to share with a plate of poutine to start! The poutine came out quickly. Hot and dripping the way we like it. The cheese curds and fries were awesome along the strips of beef. The gravy unfortunately was overly salted making this the first time I didn't want to finish my poutine =(.  Unfortunately by that time of night they were out of prime rib. No worries. I switched over to butter chicken which is an English take on an Indian curry. Quite nice actually but the shepherd's pie was quite the disappointment. The mince meat was a little on the runny side and needed some umphf to the seasoning. The mashed potatoes on top needed some season as well. If only the poutine and shepherd's pie mingled a bit.  It's too bad that the food here weren't just a little better as I would have loved to try the dessert. At that point in the dinner other than the butter chicken, I was disappointed. Service and ambience were great but food was a little flat to "meh." Plenty of other restaurants to check out around here that open late so I might given them a gander before you settle on this place!

LV8lMPT51voXJAYgFyJQcA.text: I was very excited to try this place, especially the well known dish like Beef Wellington and scallops. it took about 45mins-50mins for our entrees to arrive and when the food got to us the food was cold, we were very hungry already and they offered to change it but we didn't want to waste time and wait for another 45-50min wait. Im 100% sure Gordon Ramsay would have not served these items to us cold, and tasted dry. Super unhappy with the food and maybe just completely let down because I had high expectations since its Gordon Ramsays name. 2 best dishes the server said we ordered and was unsatisfied with service and the food. Do not come here for main courses guys prob just for beer and snacks.

18tWeTHkqW-oEhj4iZHqCg.text: It earned all three stars because of the food. We all got big burgers and they were amazing. The garlic aioli for the fries and smothered on the burger was probably my favorite part.   The lobster Mac and cheese was another awesome starter. We were all full and satisfied by the end. Ready to take on the night in Vegas. However, as a group of 6 22-25 year old girls we were given bad service. Maybe because we decided not to buy $16 drinks, but we got slow service with a waiter who maybe visited our table twice. Once to take our order and to give us our check. So that was a bummer, but the food was definitely amazing. M

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Entrance
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster Mac and Cheese
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bacon Cheese Burger

1p3aEfNr7pvCpyiDnvKZMw.text: UPDATE: since my original review, management has reached out to me and I appreciate their doing so. Turned a tough experience into a good one and I'm more than satisfied with the outcome. Looking forward to a visit on my next trip to Vegas.   ---  It'd be far too easy to throw out a classic Ramsay one-liner about what was wrong about this. But suffice to say that he should be livid about what is being done under his name. We came here for lunch with a small group in between meetings we had.   We had 75 mins to eat but it's lunch and no one was ordering appetizers. Should be easy, right? Well this place figured out a way to mess that up.   Drinks came out well after ordering.   Food came out over 45 minutes after ordering. Half of the dishes were lukewarm at best. The fries were limpy. And the waitress would disappear for long stretches. Water glasses not filled.   And then my Caesar salad? It was about as good as the to-go salad I got at the airport. Which was a rip-off at $9 then. But this one was $23! The chicken was cold and probably sitting in a fridge overnight. Missed anchovies. When the Anchovies arrived, they were virtually flavorless! Were they canned in water? The croutons were... oh you get the idea.   By far the most disappointing place we've eaten at in Vegas. For these prices, just go to the food court next door. You'll get better food and cheaper and won't miss your session when the meal takes 90 minutes.   As the. Chef has said"Hey panini head, are you listening to me?"

i5Seop4hxEAGcW6h1DrNaQ.text: My daughter loves Gordon Ramsay and chooses to spend her birthdays at his restaurants. The food is delicious and the staff is very friendly and attentive. We ordered the corned beef poutine and the shrimp and lobster rolls for an appetizer. Super good! For her meal she got the steak and ale pie... She said is was savory and supportive yummy.  The braised short rib was delicious. We will be returning for another visit.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Birthday lunch for my daughter!

AAuDb4bZH4EQCwOr2z6-Sw.text: Ate here for the first time: HEADLINES: service on point, fish and chips were best ever, mac and cheese very good, EXPENSIVE.  We were seated immediately and served cold water which was in bottles on ice out front...noticed when they bought more from the back they were pre-chilled...(nice attention to detail).  Server was attentive and timely. We both ordered fish and chips, and a side of Mac and cheese. All were served promptly. The fish was probably the best I have ever had, flaky hot and fresh! Portion was average at 2 medium sized pieces. Served with very good fries, very small tartar sauce and a side of pureed green peas(?) which I passed on. The Mac and cheese tasted very good but was lukewarm. I sent it back, which was done gracefully and quickly, but the exchanged dish was not much warmer.  The bill including tip was $92. We just had water to drink. The fish and chips were $30 each, which seemed quite high, but we were hungry and were short on time. I am going to try one of his fast food outlets at the Linq and other places to see if the fish is the same but at a lower price.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fish and chips... sorry... dove in too quick!
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mac and cheese

gmNxwAdTnRErVklvF9QsvA.text: Gets 4 stars because the food was good. Service gets one star. They delivered the poutine appetizer 10 minutes before the beverages were delivered. Server took his time picking up the check (10+ minutes) and most of our dining party ended up leaving.   The fish and chips were delicious. The fish was not over battered or greasy which are my general complaints about this fish, but these pieces of cod were lightly battered and crunchy. The cod was flaky and fresh.   Bottom line: good place to grab lunch but don't come if you're in a hurry.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States

PB8zePr5t0jf9_yn5TgoBw.text: Great service and food. Antonio rules!  Had Yukon Mash potatoes and Mac and Cheese side dishes to go along with our drinks; they were delicious

demJN6FotEVw4WL0LpgJ6g.text: 4.5/5 stars  Our first server was just okay, but not the friendliest. We asked to move sections because the party next to us was quite loud. Our new server was wonderful, however.  Food was great, we had a burger + fish and chips. Hands down the best fish and chips I've ever had. Perfectly battered; crispy without being greasy. However, the chips weren't quite as good as I had hoped. They weren't quite as crispy as I had hoped for.  The -.5 star is because of the lackluster chips and inconsistent service. However, I'm rounding up to 5 because it's basically a 5. I would definitely recommend this place.

iIaGMpXnS-vcu1OR-TZmnA.text: Hold on to your bollocks... Not my first time here. Place is inside Caesar's Palace. It's a big place, not a crowded feeling. Wait staff very friendly and helpful, seem to know their stuff. Had the Corn Beef Poutine (corned beef over fried, with cheese and gravy)... I really liked it. Beef Wellington was also good, meat was tender and had good flavor. The Salmon was also perfectly cooked and tasty. The Steak and Ale pie was also good and flavorful. g1ELP2955Ka1V3gUtH-Z6A.text: Came here because let's be honest, Ramsay has a good reputation. We had already gone to his Burger location in Planet Hollywood, so we knew his burgers were amazing. But not at this place, this is the only reason why I'm giving it a 4 instead of a 5. The burger was basic, nothing special. I mean, it wasn't bad, we just expected something similar to his other location. A dish that was 5/5 was the short rib, every bite made our mouths water. So much flavor! The pork belly was good, the sauce made it better. Overall a little on the pricey side, but this is Vegas and how often do you go to a Ramsay restaurant? Definitely recommend, just stay away from the burger. If you want a good burger experience go to the Gordon Ramsay Burger restaurant.  Service was 5/5 Atmosphere 5/5

h6nYzdSeyChe0M2iWQo2Ig.text: I will never not be bitter about the $19 Caesar salad.   This salad is the embodiment of Gordo's "Kitchen Nightmares" career before the great restaurant and menu makeover.  For $19, you will experience: about 1/4 head of lettuce, 3 croutons and some bland dressing that is indistinguishable from literally any supermarket dressing. That was it. That was the full salad.   My dudes. Less than $3 can recreate this at Wal-Mart.   Look, the beef wellington is good. Great, even. For more than $50 for a tiny portion (in what I remind you claims to be a "pub and grill"), it had damn well better be.   Everything else about this place is a damn rip-off, and not one that you can even convince yourself is "worth it because it's Vegas." A single Scotch egg (which is apparently UK-speak for "flavorless dry meat surrounding an egg") will run at least $11. Your draft beer will also run at least $11.   Ambiance? Meh. It would be the same fine, generic decor of your local TGIFridays if not for the fact that the design plus the music sucks up sound, so you will find yourself literally shouting at the person across the table from you to be heard.   Props to the waitstaff, though, who were friendly, enthusiastic and trying to make the best of a bad situation.

Bx-YH_KMhJRNqhh57JZgNA.text: First, let's talk design. As an Anglophile I of course love the decor- the bar has the London red iconic phone booths theme, and photos of British bulldogs abound- even on some chairs. My favorite touch, however, is the wall of kegs. This is definitely a pub atmosphere, so do not arrive expecting an upscale ambience.  Next, the service is impeccable. Greeted and sat immediately by a beautiful and friendly hostess, then greeted by a server/assistant who gave us a choice of still or sparkling water, and then our very professional and knowledgeable waiter arrived, with food and drink suggestions. Our choices arrived quickly, our water refreshed consistently, and our waiter had the right balance of attentiveness/respect for privacy. Very impressed. Finally, the food. We started with Corned Beef Poutine and I am not exaggerating to say I could eat this every day- absolutely delicious. I chose the Lobster Mac n-Cheese appetizer as an entree, it was certainly large enough for a full meal and it was equally delicious. I also enjoyed a Belgian Margarita, but warning, it is a bit tart. My husband raves about the Shepherds Pie.  The prices are high enough to save this place for special occasions, but it is one of the more affordable options in Caesars Palace. They did offer a 3-course menu at a special price, if one is looking for a deal. But truly, the food is fantastic and worth the expense.

u2rH7SxdxYLCGIRG5kFsIw.text: Ok, so my final Gordon Ramsay fan-girl experience review is GR Pub & Grill. Honestly, it's a 4.5 and my least favorite of my GR restaurant visits, but obviously still pretty excellent!  I came for my first taste of that flaky, tender Beef Wellington, that the hubs and I always see on television and I got just that. Next time, I'll probably just go to Hell's Kitchen for it, (no issue, just a vibe preference when spending big bucks) but I digress. It was divine. The meat was tender and juicy, while the outer pastry was perfectly flaky. How do they do that?  We ordered the Prix Fixe Christmas Day menu and LOVED IT! Scallops, Beef Wellington, and rum bread pudding.  We also ordered the lobster mac and cheese, just to give it a whirl-- because Gordon Ramsay!  The lobster cooked to perfection, and perfectly plated (loved the full claw), but the mac and cheese itself wasn't my favorite -- hence the -.5.  I used my check in offer on Yelp (thanks guys) to give the free toffee pudding a try, and absolutely loved it. Also, the ice cream atop was EVERYTHING! (Sidebar: Who the heck is making GR's ice cream-- I need to know!)  Our server (with the the mole on her brow) was an angel and worked the room like a certified champ.   All in all, the "public house" vibe is alive and well here, the decor is spot on, and the details are killer (check out my photo of the cutlery--yaasss!) and consistent with the expectation.   Another win for this GR fangirl!

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Setting!

gscJ6hK4Y906zwiLbX2mfA.text: $23 burger? Check. $12 Lagunitas? Check. Great burger, fries and services? Check!  WHEN YOU GO- Definitely one of the better celeb chef eateries in Vegas. While I expect celeb chef prices at these joints in Vegas, I've often been disappointed. Never the case at a GR restaurant (see my GR Steak review).  While someone in your party is required by GR law to have the pub burger (with bacon, or course), don't skip the soft shelled crab sandwich, scotch eggs and pork belly- all winners. I've had GR's Wellington and scallops at other locations and haven't gotten to them here yet. I did have the fish and chips here and found it less flavorful and crispy as it was at GR steak. It was still pretty damn good! The spot is right in the middle of the casino and does get busy during lunch and dinner hours so make reservations!

sPHjZy_7S6O9iefdgTpLQQ.text: It's not bad... but for you are paying for the celebrity label situated within the iconic Caesar's. It's going to run you $50-100 per person for pub food.   I had the special, Beef Wellington. It was good, well executed even. But no better than a cruise ship and at $57, I probably wouldn't order It again. Companion had a riff on pt pie of sorts for $25 - much better value and just as interesting. Another companion had the $24 hamburger - well it was a hamburger. The poutine riff was actually pretty good and worth a shot.

2CuWNIctF6256BOW8XWtsw.text: Rodney was excellent and efficient. Great quick meal. Would definitely recommend! Cheers!

r7d4mowrP8DAK8lJ19C1FQ.text: I've made this place my main go-to destination for lunch for each of my semi-annual trips to Vegas. Just made my 18th visit to the Pub and each time I go, I sit at the bar. Every time!  Such friendly service and I always get great advice from whoever waits in me. Extensive menu and I haven't been disappointed yet. Shepard's Pie is a highlight and the Caesar Salads are above average. Looking forward to my next trip in October.

c13NeJnCe6QCE_Of78S4PQ.text: 10/10 for Mac and cheese, bacon burger, and and truffle fries! Our server Scott was super cool as well! Last but not least, the toffee dessert is basically food porn...absolutely worth every penny!
