36LyAvYXZ-hqNb28rLPQdg.text: Had a fantastic experience dining here yesterday, 08/09/2018. The food was great, as is expected at a Gordon Ramsay restaurant, but more importantly, the service was top notch. As a solo diner, a lot of my enjoyment of a restaurant comes from the quality of service and interaction between me & the staff. My server was Rodney & he was very attentive, efficient & a pleasure to talk to! He also helped me narrow down my menu choice and made sure I was enjoying my meal. The rest of the staff was awesome as well, all very friendly & focused on making sure the customers were happy. I look forward to returning on my next trip!  One quick tip; do yourself a favor and save room for the Sticky Toffee Pudding. No words to describe how good it is!!

I5sG4Q4kMzTtyVcwIqbX4g.text: The Steak and Ale pie was amazing!!! Had a fluffy crust and the beef melted in my mouth. Loved it!

oGMELbAAYeqExBVd-neLLg.text: There is no shortage of celebrity food spots in Las Vegas.  A coworker really wanted to try Hell's Kitchen but we found out it doesn't open until winter 2018.  The steak place was way too expensive so we opted for Gordon Ramsay Pub and Grill.  I was able to make a reservation on Open Table and that was so easy to do.  Since walking in Las Vegas takes 3 times as long due to the various pedestrian bridges and the miles of loops you have to do to walk the casino floor, the Open Table was perfect as I had to push it back 15 minutes when we realized we were still not there!  We had a tiny wait when we got there but were seated relatively quickly.  There were 3 of us and we asked upfront to split the bill.  We each decided on a cocktail and two apps instead of an entree but then we wanted the lobster mac and cheese and right away our server Elise asked us if we wanted to split that amount in 3 on our checks.  She was so perceptive about our dilemma it was much appreciated.  I had their popular cocktail Goodbye Blue Sky and it was delicious.  I also had the calamari and wings.  I had a bite of my tablemate's samplings which also included nachos and pork belly.  Everything was good, about to be expected from a hyped up restaurant trying to serve the masses.  I couldn't finish and didn't want to waste so I took the leftovers back for a midnight snack.  Yummy and fun.

qZgrg6STyl2kOqUHeUFhBw.text: Another home run!  Every time we get to Las Vegas this is a must stop for us.  The food has not ever disappointed any of us that visit. The happy hour is not the best but okay. At least the cocktails are full pours and worth the money.    We visited twice this time and were completely satisfied.   MANGA!

l2yw-ZCfv3T8lOBzw2I4fw.text: Chris B is awesome! He's very knowledgeable about the menu and did a great job at explaining.   Really enjoyed the food!   What I ordered:  Lamb burger  Braised short ribs  Fish and chips  Wings  Pork belly

He covered my food and drink when I went to the washroom.  Nice guy, great service. Oh and I'm obsessed with the menu, in particular the shepherds pie!

0hHZXNy2Br0BON0c6qXPRQ.text: We thought the staff was fantastic but the food wasn't that great. We expected a lot more from prices. It is overpriced for the taste. The calamari was very salty and didn't have a great dipping sauce to go with. My husband and kids got the $21 cheeseburger that they were disappointed with, being over cooked (the buns were soft and good though). They all ended up with stomach aches for the remainder of the night. Mine was fine, but I had the lobster and shrimp roll... which was just okay.

Jsj4Dw_wmCTMxl1T71JoSg.text: So nice we visited twice.   Finding this place was the happiest of total accidents. My group and I were just wandering around and happened to be hungry just before walking past this fun little Pub & Grill. Thankfully it was still pretty early in the evening so we were seated right away and camped out to watch the Astros beat the Yankees in game 1 of the ALCS. I'm not saying that solidified this place in the history of my life as a winner, but I'm also not not saying that. We helped ourselves to the Happy Hour menu and watched the restaurant fill up as we enjoyed pretzels with some amazing beer cheese dip, truffle fries with the perfect amount of truffle and a side of some kind of delicious truffle aioli, sliders and more. The name of my drink escapes me currently, but it's Gordon Ramsay's take on a Gin & Tonic (except I got mine with vodka instead because Gin is ew). So refreshing and slightly cheaper before dinner starts.  Everything in this place looks awesome, including the staff. The silverware is also pretty rad - makes you feel like you're at a medieval times feast.  Our second visit was equally as interesting with a lot of the same food and my husband ordering the birthday cake milkshake. It's basically a meal in a shake, complete with a cupcake on top. It also came with candles, which our server was happy to light for us.   Perhaps my only complaint is that Gordon himself didn't emerge from the kitchen to insult my entire life's existence. Next time, I hope.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Birthday surprise milkshake. Sorry, it&#39;s no longer a surprise.

EuyG-7b3eEs-OBu_UaI6lA.text: Okay... I am going to make it short... my fun in Vegas is just trying the restaurant cuz I don't gamble and I don't drink. My husband and I love to go to different restaurants and we really enjoy it. This place was really good! It was super busy and I really suggest to reserve a table online to save time. I got "chicken, kale and bacon pie" and he got the short ribs. Both was just excellent! We also got chicken wings for appetizer and it was good.the service was really good and our server "Jon" was so nice and caring. Also, Sticky toffee pudding is a must as a desert. This place is highly recommended!

wAa2ZUMGQ1TFJRf2GUVAGw.text: @gordongram is the man! Love his PUB @caesarspalace  This place is a top flight restaurant without being too expensive. The #chickenwings are some of the best ever. Subtle heat, not too acidic and not too salty. Crispy yet tender and moist. Saucy yet not too messy. Such a well rounded flavor profile. Not the lazy typical vinegar bomb #Hotsauce Perfect sides of celery, carrots and blue cheese dressing. With extra blue crumble on the side. This place rocks. Service, comfort, decor, food, drink, value, all come in with honors. Plus a nice #HappyHour I'll be back for more. #foodsnob

T3-x79NmSC2vdxIM0iaraA.text: Great food. Tried the signature Ramsay Beef Wellington and brisket for my friend on the recommendation of our fantastic waiter Rodney. Very personable and kept our water glass full. Overall wonderful experience, definitely a Ramsay standard.

qDC0DfYpBsac9Uojqwu1XA.text: I was very dissapointed with my visit to Gordon Ramsay's Pub and Grill. The food was just not that great and very over priced. We shared the fish and chips - which was $30... and got three small/thin pieces of fish and just a few chips. Nothing special about these at all. Especially for $30. We also tried to order the pub pretzels and told we couldn't order them until 12:30 (place opened at 11/this was about 11:45) because they make them fresh every day. ?!?! So they don't make food to serve when the place opens? Then.. not ten minutes later (not noon yet)saw an order arrive at another table. We did get the "deviled eggs" which were pretty good and had a drink, which was good as well. Overall, not what I expected. Won't return.

eAcoZkKxK6gHt2JAPuX8aQ.text: we went to Las Vegas for Thanksgiving. It is the True Mecca for foodies. Having been a fan of his many cooking reality shows we decided to eat at the grill at Cesars Palace.Things quickly went down hill after being seated in a tiny table stuck next to a row of 4 cramped tables with barely breathing room. Our waiter was the worst I have ever encountered after eating out for 30 years at some of the better to best restaurants in the US and Europe. He repeatedly ignored us and after sitting for 30 minutes without a drink I complained to the management who got us started with our cocktails. This caused our waiter to futher act out in a blatant passive aggressive way. He did not smile, gave us no eye contact but plenty of attitude as he sarcastically announced with each entree "is this good enough for you". I literally wanted to put the food up his U KNOW WHAT but we were hungry and would have been late for our show so we had to put up wth this clown. While ordering, they had 'RUN OUT " of 3 of the 4 items????. Sounded odd. Anyway the shepards pie was ok, the lobster mac and cheese very salty and my memory is a wash with the rest of the meal. Thus I conclude that it must not have been memorable. I was so irritated with this snarky, pompous jack ass of a waiter it was all I could do to contain myself. The one plus was dessert some kind of bread pudding that was super sweet but definitely the best among the items ordered . Just when I thought things were bad enough I went into the rest room. Had I done that first thing, I would NEVER have eaten at this establishment. It was FILTHY. Yes! you may find it hard to believe, I DID but the smell and look of the toilet was as if they had not cleaned it. Rather disgusting what was on the toilet seat thus I will NOT describe it in case you are as visual as I am. I still can't get the imagery out of my mind a month later. When it came to soap supplies, they had 1 little bottle of soap for 4 sinks and plenty of patrons waiting like kindergardeners to get a squirt of the stuff. A 50 plus year old to my left erupted and questioned the staff and was seen on my way out complaining to upper management. Tell you what, for such a fussy chef with his noteriety of perfectionistic standards, he should visit the place he sold his name to on the sly and see for himself. A real let down and all around dive with absolutely lazy staff that needs a major attitude over haul. I would never recommend this place.

WzjzpkULcfF2xSJs9avirA.text: We recently visited Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill in Caesar's Palace, Las Vegas for the first time. We had been to his restaurant in the Paris Hotel the year before and absolutely loved it.   The was good, however there were some issues with the service which is why my rating is low. We were sitting towards more towards the outside of the restaurant, closest to the interior of the casino. During our dinner, a holiday giveaway was going on inside of the Casino and crowds started to appear right by the restaurant. At one point, people's behinds were practically in our faces! Also, people were coming into the restaurant and started crowding us as well. I could barely enjoy my food as this was annoying and none of the staff said anything or did anything about it. I heard another woman behind us complain but apparently nothing was done about it.  As stated, the food was good, but the entire experience was ruined as a result of this "crowding." Hopefully, in the future, the staff will address this type of situation so as not to ruin the dining experience.

Qkeyx7FyTdO6mX01NSJDyQ.text: Came here a year ago and was not impressed at all. My wife and I felt let down as we had expected it to be much better. Anyways I wasn't going to write a review until my wife went there with some friends that were in town yesterday. Just like most people that try the place, we all expect it to be great since the guys name on the sign is such a jerk if the food isn't perfect on his tv show. When a restaurant can't even cook a hamburger correctly, there's got to be much bigger issues. My wife's raw hamburger seems like every episode of that tv show that I have ever seen. The cooks can't even cook a hamburger? Service has been subpar there and the price is not worth the food quality. I was hoping our first experience was just an off night but a year later it proved to be another let down. Oh and while my wife and her friends were waiting for a table they sat down in the bar area to have a drink and not a single server/employee helped them. So another loss of revenue for this place, but I am sure the guys name on the sign will get his royalty check or else someone will be in trouble!

zlltQcXSlUU8rA0IvZhe0A.text: We were at Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill on opening night. Nice atmosphere. Food was great. We saw a few celebrity chefs. I forgot to submit my original review after returning home and we have eaten at his restaurant again since. My original review was 5 star amazing but I have to say that our visit a few months later was not as great. Just 3 star ok. We were a little disappointed with the food. My husband and I both ordered the same items Fish and Chips and the Cauliflower soup both times and I felt the quality and attention to detail was not as good compared to or original visit. Probably because the chef himself was not there the second time... who knows... That being said, I would probably eat her again for a late night meal but not when looking for a nice dinner date night.

Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fish and chips

SGRFFmnFtK7DxZWkDk9Wzw.text: So underwhelming. Completely mediocre. Service was good but it seems that Gordon needs to get some Hell's Kitchen action going to deliver a better tasting and more interesting menu. We had calamari starter, a lamb burger and a rueben sandwich. I can't recommend anyone go here.

TFJweikO25nUVOfLNQ68BA.text: This was our first time at a Gordon Ramsey restaurant and we were excited to try it.  For appetizers, we ordered Pork & Duck Rilletes which was very tasty.  (We had never had Rilletes before so we don't have anything to compare).  They also give you  a small bread course for free.  My main course was the Mixed Grill.  It contained steak, pork belly and shrimp.  I loved it.  It was the best steak I had ever had, so tender!  The shrimp are large and juicy.  My husband ordered the flat iron steak.  He said the flavor was great, but when he received it, it was barely lukewarm so it was cold before he could finish it.  The sides are separate but we both ordered smashed fingerling potatoes.  Black truffle makes this dish absolutely delicious.  For dessert, we had the Sticky Toffee Pudding.  This literally made my eyes roll back in to my head!  It was so heavenly.  My husband also tried a few of their tap beers.  The service was excellent!  They constantly checked up on us and were very attentive.  As packed as the place was, I was amazed by that.  Expect to drop some cash (almost $200 for both of us) but it was worth it in our eyes.   There were only two negatives...  his steak being barely lukewarm and the music was SO loud that we had a hard time talking.  They play music by British artists. . However, they get props from me for playing Depeche Mode.  :) We will DEFINATELY be back!

LoeC5lPcxsw_UvyD70Ea0g.text: Seated immediately for lunch. Service is good. Fish & Chips had three great pieces of fish $25. Chips average.

TsYHT_y3pr1sIzv-7u_vNg.text: Wow. I'm a big fan of Chef Ramsey and the food here was a complete letdown. I know he isn't in the back cooking, but the food and service were well below par. My ribeye was medium rare and was somehow still chewy, thin, and lacked any flavor. We repeatedly had to ask for items our server failed to bring. Sodas were flat. Some items like the Shepards pie were so small, they shouldn't have been on the dinner menu and rather, belonged on the appetizers menu.

BkOUlKtJztnMcA8Je5ZoVg.text: We stop by last Sunday for lunch (10/23/2016). Before stopping by Gordon Ramsey I did what people usually do first which is to check the yelp reviews. After reading the reviews I was having a second thought wether I want to stop by for lunch. But thank god I did! Our server Sarah was amazing! She helped us order and everything was awesome! She's very funny and knowledgeable of the menu. For the appetizer she recommended the lobster roll that my boyfriend and I shared. Noted that my boyfriend doesn't like lobster but after trying the lobster roll he really enjoyed it! And for the main course Sarah recommended fish and chips and med rare lamb burger! And I have to say that it was one of the best burger that I have ever tried! After the main course we ordered sticky toffee pudding to share and it didn't disappointment us and it was delicious! Beside having the best food! The service was amazing! Our server made sure that we were having the best time and she gave 110% customer service! No complain we will definitely come back! Great food! Wonderful experience!

zS2EVvZfXMvpbkDXnFkXDQ.text: My absolute favorite pub at this point.  It did take a long time for the food to come out.  They did however notice and get me a free drink and I didn't even say anything.  +1 point for being aware and preemptive.  They do give some bread service with assorted pretzels and butter and horseradish cheese that rivals the Culinary Dropouts pretzel appetizers.  And it's just the bread!  The food was worth the wait.  The potato puree was so rich and delicious.  The chicken was perfect.  The drink menu is on an iPad and the four that I tried were all spot on.  Enjoy!

L6vUpSOQ2c2MiR5_FyMwzA.text: Great food, great atmosphere all around 5 stars. The short rib and beef cheek sandwich was out of this world. Definitely leave room for the sticky bun desert.

1epUyKBTe8q1iyBZdv0C2g.text: Terrible, terrible service.  And the waitress' uniforms made me uncomfortable, their dress is fine but the lock on their choker necklace, very tacky. And did I mention about their service? Horrible! We waited an hour and a half, and still didn't get our food. Maybe cause  it's the way we were dressed, but I had better service at Lawry's wearing sweatpants and a t-shirt. We walked out, thanks for the free bread and butter though.

RxFaywM0NzpK1NxBpbSZ6A.text: Way overpriced. Fish & chips were VERY salty. Very disappointing. Would NOT recommend. If you eat here you are just paying for the name.

fbYadmMTHmvByk2FqlIBNg.text: I've never written a review, but I felt very compelled to do so for this restaurant. Our bill for two was $127 including two glass of wine and no appetizers.  For this price we were expecting the food to be exceptional...and it definitely was not!  We left disappointed and unsatisfied. The food was mediocre and lacked flavor...it was very bland.  Service was also very slow and our pub table was very tall making it difficult to eat comfortably. We love Gordon Ramsey's tv show and were hoping for excellence. For a man who reprimands people for lack of taste, flavor, and service, we were expecting more. We will not be back to eat at this restaurant.

7u_zsK_mRiHqEOFETcY6Qg.text: Excellent service, quality, and style go into this place. Really enjoyed my experience.

6NvReb4gEa06lvntUFMYeA.text: On May 1, 2015, my wife and I had dinner at Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill. We had had dinner there previously and truly enjoyed the food and service. However, on this occasion, the dinner started out on a bad foot. We ordered wine, which the servicer promptly delivered to us. My wife's glass wasn't clean. So, we told the servicer, who quietly took the glass away and bought my wife another glass. Again, the glass had a sticky film inside. So, we told the servicer and that's when the attitude started. He took the glass without any apology and disappeared for well over 10 minutes. So, we started to leave, when the host called the manager, Randell Goldich, who saved our evening by one apologizing, and two, by providing a server (Stacy B.), who gave us exceptional service thorough the dinner service. The food was excellent. I'll will definitely return to one of my favorite TV celebrity's (Gordon Ramsay) restaurant. This is a clear case of not allowing one bad apple to spoil the bunch.

MvBeoHFSy8aI9EHJsI39Kg.text: My boyfriend and I came to Las Vegas to try different restaurants since we are extreme food lovers and fans of great customer service. After the experience at this highly recommended restaurant we will NEVER go to another one of Gordon Ramsey's restaurants again. First off the hostess said it was a 30-40 min wait time so I gladly gave her my number and went to have a drink next door while we waited for her text message, after 1 hr I walked by to go use the restroom which was close by the restaurant I noticed there was not many people waiting in line so I went back to my boyfriend and finally after waiting 1hr and 30 mins I went up to the hostess and asked what was going on it had been 1hr+ she stayed  oh I don't know  "sorry thought it sent" I told her that was ridiculous and she went ahead and sat us only because we were clearly irritated with her non professional response after sitting we waited 20 mins for our server I then had to flag someone down to attend to us finally our "waiter" came took our appetizers and drinks down and never returned. Other servers were coming by to ask if we needed anything! We were extremely disappointed with this place in fact we gave our " waiter a $6 tip" and we gave another waiter who was actually doing a great job a great tip! To top it off the food was not great it was ok but not great like I have heard! perhaps they were referring to the other restaurants because this one definitely did not do anything but makes us never want to return!

b0kdls7wCfUJEeTIztqy2A.text: Such an expensive disappointment! Calamari appetizer was very good. Had the waiter recommended short rib entree. No amount of salt and pepper could help. Would not go back!

hvMfw58lN4sUuqcsk80NfA.text: Stopped by as I was walking through Caesar's for a quick snack, and sat at the bar. The server recommended the Scotch Egg and pub chips (fries). She was friendly and efficient, and correct on the recommendation. Both items, while simple, were done to perfection. The chips were about a third of a potato or more each, and you got eight, so quite a bit of potato. They were crispy on the outside and just right on the inside. The house made ketchup was good enough to eat without putting it on the chips. It was my first scotch egg, so I don't have much to compare, but I enjoyed the contrast of the spicy sausage, egg, and slightly molten yoke. yum!

kkuxmih4arf2aHIWw7wi_g.text: Our group of 4 went for happy hour. The food and drinks were amazing!!! My husband and I shared pretzels, wings, and fries. We also had drinks, which were delicious. Our friends got sliders, fries, etc. We all said this was the best place we ate at, during our vacation. Would definately go back again.

kji8WYO0HyDwGlgK9BPnsw.text: Sat at the bar. Ronnie, our bartender, was spectacular. Very down to earth and made my wife's cocktail exactly as she wanted it. Had some great beer recommendations too.  First time eating here and we loved it. Only had appetizers including the Scotch Egg, Pork Belly, and Lobster & Shrimp Rolls. All excellent, but the Scotch Egg is the superstar. I would definitely come back next time we're in Vegas.

2YZjbdWImyP_T5sdnuBcmA.text: Rodney our server was EXCELLENT! Friendly and attentive!  Food was good. Not great. We ordered the nachos and they were good but a little soggy.  Got the free dessert via yelp and it was good too. The ice cream was too frozen so hard to eat but understandable because you don't want it to melt on the warm dessert. We will go back!

Y1m_HS-0LIpirGPo77FtKA.text: Very fast service helpful staff will be coming again soon! Thank you team Gordon Ramsey!

YvpuirJO1TrSfbWIlRckxg.text: I would recommend this restaurant if you're a Gordon Ramsey fan as we are & you're staying on the strip but, be prepared for a larger bill as it's to be expected because of location & it is owned by a famous chef.   No complaints on service.   There were 3 of us. Our bill came to approximately $120 after taxes. We ordered a beer $11, 6 wings $13 and for entree's we ordered the burger $21, steak pie $25 and fish and chips $30. While we all enjoyed our dishes it was more of a novelty and probably won't be back.   If you have a good appetite the steak pie wasn't very filling as it was small in portion and no sides to accommodate the dish.     Overall, good food and a good experience!

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States

qkN_W_MC5JgzmudwQadGPg.text: We've been here 4 times now and the other three times were excellent...but not this time. It was just ok. The service was exceptionally slow and the waiter never checked on us. We waited about 20 minutes after our meal before he came by and asked if we wanted dessert. By then we just wanted to leave.  The food was ok. I had the fish and chips. The fish was excellent but the chips were soggy (McDonalds fries are actually better). My friend ordered the bone marrow and it was not good. We did tell the waiter it wasn't good but he didn't do anything (of course that was later so we didn't want to push it). All in all this was the worse of the 4 trips here.

Kj-z9d5-Cz0rnaXCA6xPhg.text: Rodney was an amazing server.  Food was fantastic and had a great happy hour. Get the wings, the short rib nachos, and 17 beers. People watching is great too.

d0RZ_8y2OJCgS2fmxRZZFA.text: It was a bit underwhelming for the expectation I had. We went for the toffee dessert and we also had some appetizers. They came out cold. The toffee cake is very rich. It was okay.

MkEJW3ZUa6x5fNMbWuPtRQ.text: Update: shortly after writing my initial 2 star review, I received a direct message from the manager who was very apologetic and encouraged me to come back for a full refund. I thought this was A+ customer service and really appreciated the extra effort taken to make me feel better about the situation. Thank you for going above and beyond!

WF_1N-C19xxayhC67tlD8w.text: Loved everything about this Resturant! Chef Ramsay is  a True perfectionist.  Alex says this is the best Prime Rib he ever had. I say, the onion solo is the best I ever had.  Service and ambiance  are excellent

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States

FsCFZCJNWwY3v71RxdKnCg.text: I excepted so much more considering this is Gordan Ramsey's restaurant, but I truly hope he reads my review and pays a nice visit to the chef here..... literally all of our food came out warm/cold.... the manager was more than accommodating and refunded one of the things we complained about.... the server was nice also...but the fact the food was cold, eh expected more for the price...my advice don't waste your time.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. It was COLDDDD
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Well done so it came out hot
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cold

Mt1sylvuDJsCNhNMNeCSXQ.text: Truly and honestly, this is the BEST restaurant experience my husband and I have ever had. Rodney was our server and he was amazing! We felt beyond welcome, he kept conversation with us and never failed to keep my drink full! If I could give more stars I would! Reality was better than our expectation! Try the lobster Mac and cheese, I would describe it as "sex on a plate". Thank you Gordon, Rodney and everyone at Gordon Ramsey Pub & Grill!

zfxD0R6C4qT-L-FBfNXi1g.text: I was very disappointed . The calamari were burnt and rubbery . The burger was well done and dry when we ordered medium .  I hate writing this review because I'm a big fan but I feel that Gordon needs to know .

4pFhdNn5PD59gdDjkQJTxQ.text: Can't beat the burger. Great full meals. Large portions and great staff. Wings are great but the burger was the stand out. The toffee dessert was amazing.

SfIT5oqgy6uqS7eWEJpdJg.text: You really need to try the Scotch Egg here: outstanding. And pair it with the Ramsey Tonic -- made by the gloriously sassy barkeep Cristina -- so smooth and fresh. Then order the Crispy Calamari...you won't regret it. Then make your way to the Celine Dion concert. A mind blowing evening.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Scotch Eggs
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States

gavKiEs-mS0j_qGNYF4UIw.text: Spot on! Reservations came in handy! Great table and our waiter Sladjan was great. Started with wine, beer and mini white cheddar Mac. Then I ordered the steak n ale pie,hubby had fish n chips. My dinner was phenomenal and just the right size. Hubby said fish was a bit above average. We finished with sticky pudding. So good!

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States

cHQeFNshM-h-b1oVCxktRA.text: So the reviews were not all great but we thought we'd give it a try. I'm happy to say we found the freshest of salads in the middle of the desert!  Though I was not a fan of Gordon Ramsey the chef before, I certainly am now! You can tell some thought went into creating a wonderful dish out of a salad. I had the wedge, and I believe my friend had the Cobb, and both were wonderful! Someone in our group had the lamb burger and thought it was great! The calamari was excellent and not everyone does it right. Light, crispy, yum!

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States

li_KJEcR5zTncDvL6me-Jg.text: Very disappointed. The service was good but the food was TERRIBLE. The bun on the burger was dry and the burger itself tasted like it had been sitting in the kitchen a while before they served it. The cheese on it was hard. The fries also did not taste fresh.  We also ordered the chicken wings. I tried to eat them because I'm not used to sending food back but just couldn't. They're were hard n dry, felt like we were eating jerky.  Im a fan of Chef Ramsey from watching all this TV shows but he really should give this particular spot more attention or sell it. Don't put your name on it Gordon!   His fish n chips little shop by the Vegas Roller is 100X tastier. You know why? Cuz their food is made fresh and served right away. It is temperature hot. A minimum expectation.   Thumbs down. Wish we didn't waste our hunger there.

7j5iU5cxvrRr_lj_r-kWKg.text: Huge disappointment. We had the side of Mac and cheese, the Wellignton and the butter chicken. All entrees came in warm , not hot! The Wellington tenderloin was almost cold, and it was a HUGE disappointment... i will never recommend anyone ordering it. The butter chicken curry tasted good, but it was just like curry you would have at any Indian restaurant. The food was not impressive at all... I'm only giving 3 starts because the sticky toffee pudding cake was amazingly good!

7d7PGpYIkvAh2TFjIjG4mQ.text: Thank you Christopher. Food was great, your singing was better. The short rib was delicious

yxUPp2MiAPXUwBlibdNa4Q.text: My sister and I had dinner here and I was so excited to experience Chef Ramsay menu. The pretzels were great but that is all I can say about the food. We ordered the beef check and I had a steak. The beef check was so salty and the veggies (2 slivers of potatoes & carrots). My steak had no flavor and was tough. The service was amazing and the manager did apologize for the quality of food.  I would have expected much more

ReVl6Eq8xR8oCyOq_jHMIw.text: You must try the peanut butter & jelly crumble!

zT1nVO6kjzdcq5Oh7XGZLw.text: Wow do I have to give it a 1? That seems high.  Daisy was our waitress who we did not see all night after she introduced herself.  I had the 2 lamb chops which were fatty and small ($38).  The glass of Pino was fine ($13)  but served in a tiny glass probably purchased at wal-mart.  The special fries were almost raw.  The lady at the table next to us had spoiled sea food and I think they were going to charge her for it.

isB6eN9ZE2e6dRw0T93AnQ.text: I was so looking forward to coming here. It was the one place I told my friends that I really wanted to go. I don't think I have ever felt so uncomfortable in a restaurant in my entire life. We went at a non-peak time, restaurant half empty, just to grab a couple of drinks. We told the hostesses and waiters we were just getting drinks. Took nearly 30 minutes to get first drink order. Then our waiter complained about us to hostess since we were not ordering food. He grabbed everything off our table and was super short with us. Hostess then came over and apologized and said we weren't being rushed out, but could move to another table. Since we were done with our drinks, we just opted to leave. I would have loved to come back, but there is no point. I am not a fussy diner, I don't send food back and never write negative reviews but, this really ruined an experience for me that I was actually really looking forward to.

EpFuPG0wtBwqahkb8A5bBg.text: As a Brit I was embarrassed to eat here.. It was terrible. Overpriced ($10 for a side of chips/ potatoes) food not freshly prepared dry and not very warm snapper, mussels and clams old and cold. Very disappointing everything Gordon Ramsey tells establishments not to do. a wine lst that belongs in a 5 star  restaurant not a bar.  And I wish he would stop using the British flag he is not representing the average Brit.

SoGyYsryTFVanMYoHTD1aw.text: It is a shame how truly disappointing this restaurant was. We purposely made a 5 p.m. reservation because we had our baby with us and were celebrating Father's Day. On two separate occasions I called the restaurant to confirm that we could bring the baby. Upon our arrival at 4:50 p.m., the hostess snarkily told us to come back at 5 p.m., the time of the reservation, and we would be seated. Ouch! Mind you, there were tables everywhere but we did as we were told. Once seated, our baby was sleeping and would have remained asleep had our waiter not taken it upon himself to move her stroller from where the hostess told us we could park it. From the get go, our server was visibly irritated that we would have the audacity to bring a baby to this restaurant. From there it went from bad to worse. Here are some highlights... the food (corn soup, English peas) was not even warm; anytime we asked for anything (a straw, a glass of cranberry juice, an oyster fork) we never got it; HORRIBLE service combined with lackluster food does not justify a $256 price tag. When the manager asked how our experience was we were honest and told him and he responded by offering free dessert which we took to go. The one menu item I'd recommend is the sticky toffee pudding.

AxlUFtdaGWWOpWSY6LEyuQ.text: This was my first experience at a Gordon Ramsay establishment.  I have heard around LV that he is a very nice guy and since this particular eatery opened I had heard excellent reviews.  I was very disappointed when I went to this pub because I was looking forward to it.  My server was very nice and attentive enough during the visit, although she could not recommend any of the bottled beers to my friends because the establishment will not let their staff try any of the bottled beverages.  That is odd to me that the establishment will not take the time or money to train their staff on bottled beers they carry no matter if they carry 2 or eighty.  Regardless, the next thing that was weird to me is that there are no substitutions for fries even if you offer to pay more.  I went with it thinking no matter because I was certain my burger would be out of this world but nope, it was just a regular burger and not even that flavorful or good.  All the food ordered by my friend was also very average.  My friends shepherd's pie had literally two peas in it exactly, and my friends fries were just regular McDonald's looking fries.  The dessert was also very average for a mousse trifle.  I could make the same thing with different flavor pudding mixes and whipped topping.  I'm so surprised because I truly thought this would be a great place to eat and try.  I felt like an idiot because I am the one who chose the place to eat.  My friends were also disappointed.  Looking at the yelp reviews I can't believe so many people gave so many stars!?  How did that happen???

-dQ1ON8YLdC-Q6qQNbDXXw.text: I sat at the bar. The menus are confusing because there are two, a pub and grill menu.  I heard from a friend that I should try the Pork Belly.  I reviewed the pub menu but I had my mind set on the pork belly.  So I asked about it, and the bartender had to gave me the grill menu,  Two menus didn't make sense.  I probably should have been given a choice or at least told there are two menus.  I will often eat "dinner" at a bar not just bar food.  So I ordered the Pork Belly.  Unbelievabe.  It was unique, extremely flavorful but surprisingly light.   That coupled with the bar tenders attentive service and the great selection of beers it was a good night out.   In the future please consolidate the menu into grill and pub so I don't miss out on any great food offerings.

giiUb0k6fEdnrX5A1CGaLA.text: I don't usually dole out 1 star reviews but this place was really awful.  The signature scallop dish recommended by our server was small and below Red Lobster quality (think Shoney's or something along those lines), the chicken pot pie tasted like a frozen meat pie.  No joke, it was really lousy and the loud mouth celebrity chef should be ashamed to have his name attached to it.  It's a restaurant worthy of a reality show and perhaps that's the point because I can't think of a better reason to open a new restaurant in the middle of a busy casino that is so awful and completely overpriced for the poor quality food served up.  Service was equally uninspired, the girl that brought our dishes to us was flat out frightening and surly, our main server seemed completely out of it as well.  Overall we felt completely unsatisfied with our meals and ripped off even by Vegas pricing standards.  Yuck! Totally disappointing considering we'd had a great meal at Ramsay's BurGR two days earlier.  I understand that The Pub was supposed to be Gordon's outlet for serving up his own favourites so I can only assume he's acquired a taste for the fare he samples when he arrives on set at Kitchen Nightmares. It's that bad.  The decor was cool but.. that's the only thing thing this place has going for it... period.

f7hCty80VKhhttnUsiMFMA.text: the food is below average and bland ! from watching is shows i expected something spectacular, i was wrong, for a guy who likes to tell people on his show that they are terrible cooks he may want to pay closer attention to his own restaurant, i know its not "fine dining" but the prices sure are ! i miss the old vegas when food was great and cheap and they made money off of gambling, now corporations own it and they do the bare minimum, i liked it better when mobster ran it !

fYPdKsP5Ie8-2wAnzoPqew.text: We were all looking forward to our reservation at the pub.  Cocktail menu is very limited.  I asked about some of the drinks I saw on their website.  The waiter said he didn't know anything about them, but they change their I pad list often."  Not impressed.  We ordered a bottle of wine.  Not once did the waiter come over to refill our glasses.  We had to ask him every time, as he did not leave it at, or near the table for us.  My hubby was looking forward to a nice burger...There is not a burger on the menu.  He goes to London twice a year, and said, there is no pub in London that doesn't have a burger on its menu.  When our meals arrived, we were very very surprised with the small portions.  The shephards pie portion looked like a small appetizer.  The guy that had it, said he had never been to a place where he had to fill up on bread.  The food was tasty, but very over priced for what you get.  The desserts were delicious.  About the only positive thing, all 4 of us had to say about the pub, was the dessert was good.  Service was very poor, and our waiter pretty much ignored us.  The next day, all 4 of us said, we would never go back again.  Very over rated.   I should also mention, we have been to Ramsays burger place in Planet Hollywood, and loved it.  Also to his fine dining steak house in the Paris, and loved it.  But never again to the pub

3jZLXvauaVec5dHskz16nw.text: Please save yourselves! I so wanted to like this restaurant. We were there for dinner on a Monday night. Arriving at about 9:15, we only had a 20 minute wait. The decor was really neat, from the lighting to the eating utensils. Even the servers and hostesses uniforms were nicely done. We should've known after waiting 15 minutes before anyone greeted our table that our night was doomed. Of course we were getting anxious and ready to leave but we wanted to try this restaurant so badly and we didn't want to look around for another restaurant and have to possibly wait again. So finally our server arrived. I had seen this server the whole time taking care of the table next to us, so clearly he had seen us as well as another one of his tables that was seated one minute after us. Unfortunately we were not given drink menus when we were seated. The server had it with him on an ipad when he greeted us. This could've taken another five minutes to put our drink order in because he tried to leave it with us and walk away. Fortunately my husband and I immediately spotted a couple of beers on the first paged and ordered before he walked away. When our server returned with our beers five minutes later, he dropped them off and said he'd be right back after he dropped off a menu at another table. Another few minutes later he dropped off some bread and again said he'd be right back to take our order after he dropped off another table's bill. Either this guy had far too many tables to wait on or he was the world's biggest idiot. He was very nice, and tried very hard to crack jokes and make us forget about the past 25 minutes of horrible service. I actually felt really bad for the guy. My husband ordered the lamb burger which was only available on the bar menu but our server made it sound as if he would do us the huge favor and get it for him anyway. Turns out we saw lot's of burgers being delivered to tables. So I wonder why they don't just put the $20 burger on the full dining menu. Anyway, my husband didn't care much for the burger but we both agreed that the fries were outstanding. I ordered the chopped chicken salad and honest to God have never had a worse salad. I think there must have been some sort of mix up or error in the kitchen with my salad because it was so bad. The dressing must've been mayonnaise or something worse. My biggest regret is that I didn't say anything about it to the server. Normally I have no problem with speaking up about bad food but I was mentally exhausted and so completely over this dinner that it was too much effort to say anything. My next regret is that I actually ate it. What is my problem? I ate this disgusting salad and what does that say about me? Gross! I guess I was hungry. Our server obviously felt bad about the service because after we finished eating, he dropped off our check and told us he was deducting $10 from it. We smiled and thanked him. Nope, no deduction, just our full price bill. Again, too irritated and over the whole experience that we just paid and left. On a more positive note, they had a great selection of beer. Overpriced of course, but so is everything in Vegas so we can't fault them for that.

SvOtxRBehz1ZoWC4RPvv0w.text: I have never been more disappointed in my LIFE!!! my first experience was so amazing I am now this thinking I imagined the the whole thing.  We were a party of 7 with reservations and we were completely forgotten about..... yes forgotten.... I guess other dinners were more deserving of our food. After 2 hours of being nice and waiting we all snapped and were ready to go. Our imcompentent waiter seemed surprised when we said we were tired of waiting of....REALLY???!!!!! if he had done his job we would have spent a fortune on alcohol while waiting but he didn't do that right either.  The only good thing he did was tell the manager we were leaving who had enough common sense to stop by and did comp what we did get while waiting.  We left and the tip is we should have gone somewhere else. The hubby wanted to stop later in the week for a drink I said NEVER AGAIN for any reason. I would not Wang 7 people to walk out and also being platinum and diamond total reward members.....I have been telling everyone and writing lots about my trip isn't there a saying about telling two people who tell two people and so on.......all I can say is don't waste your time or money.

j5ueCCEdYcuyNzWWH6Oh-A.text: Don't waste your time or your money.....worst dining experience in Las Vegas! We arrived early evening to a fairly empty restaurant, yet the hostess and four waitresses hanging around the front desk were so engrossed in their conversation that we were a bother to them, imagine that!  We should have walked away then! Well, we were seated when one of them decided to do the right thing. We found the decor unimpressive, kind of old style, dark decor....didn't really appreciate it. The waiter came over and recommended a drink which we took his suggestion on. Might have been ok if they had put some alcohol in it, extremely weak, at $15.00 a pop. We each had a plate of 3 tiny sliders, fairly ok. Had to wait 20 minutes for a second drink, what were we thinking?! Bill came to $93.00+ tip. Unimpressive Gordon Ramsay, I think you need to start practicing what you preach, starting in this restaurant.

Xum_aiHB0dCjm_JD6xZEhQ.text: So sad.  After enjoying meals at Gordon Ramsay's steakhouse in Paris Las Vegas I had high hopes for this restaurant.  Because of the bad reviews my boyfriend said no, but I insisted.  The quality of the food is not up to par, but the prices were high.  We sent 2 out of the 5 things back and were still charged for the drink that we did not drink and sent back because it tasted bad.  The Mac and cheese was undercooked and also sent back.  After some argument about whether or not it was undercooked or just "al dente" with the waitstaff we felt so awful we wanted to just get out of there.  I know the difference between the two and felt insulted that they argued with me. We left and looked at the bill on our way out-- Unfortunately we were overcharged on our meal as well and had to go back for a $3 refund which was super emabarrasing and I wish we had just left with our dignity at a $3 loss instead.  The manager never came out to apologize for us having such a bad meal or being overcharged.  Even at low end restaurants they would do that.  Very disappointing.  We won't return.

9I-0eAzrAkOOa1vw6thh6Q.text: Terrible service, over priced average food. We decided to try the pub and went for lunch. The pub was a little more than half full and we waited 15 minutes for the server to come over and ask us if we'd like a drink. Another 15 minutes passed and we got our drinks and placed our order. We waited an additional 45 minutes for our food! We watched people come sit down, order, eat and leave while we were still waiting. I asked to speak with the restaurant manager and when I told her we were there an hour and 40 minutes and still waiting for the check she asked if we ordered something that would take a long time?! We ordered a burger medium well and fish and chips! The manager said because I ordered medium well it takes a lot longer, she did not apologize and went to get our check. She brought the check to the table, said sorry guys, turned and walked away! This was the worst service we have ever received. The manager made an excuse for poor service, blamed us for ordering  a medium well burger and did not care to even try and make the situation right. I will never return to any Gordon Ramsey Restaurant or recommend one. This was an extremely disappointing experience.  The food was average at best and over priced. Being in Las Vegas you have many restaurant choices, do yourself a favor and stay away from this one!

NKaA1mSFRzqymkSvMh6pTQ.text: seeing that this place gets 3 stars it's just about right...hopefully the new winner of hells kitchen rights the ship..first the sliders are amazing, everything else we tried was not gordon Ramsey quality...also the waiters need some more training. the real problem is zeus the manager. my waiter honestly made a mistake which happens i understand but it took over an hour to get my lamb chops and when i got them they were over cooked and the plating was awful. when i asked for the manager, this guy zeus comes. i explain to him what has happened, since for a hour no one came to my table, he just took my plate and came back with the bill and DID NOT apologize or anything. the reason this place gets 2 stars is because the sliders were awesome. hospitality management really needs to be replaced. i  expect the same service and food on a Monday that i would get on a Thursday. i watch all his shows and i know for damn sure he would not allow this. Gordon i Hope you read.this review and get rid of zeus. After waiting over a hour for my main course and not getting the right meal all i need is a simple apology which i didn't get. i got treated like my money was worthless here. this was also the 2nd time i went here since the first night on our trip we had a great time. i look forward to hearing back from you guys

lOezPDs8KtoqqoLt0MTLow.text: We were so eager to try Gordon Ramsay Pub and Grill only to be disappointed by a hostess with no training on how to treat guest. She asked us for our last name and told us to told us to wait 10 minutes. We stood right in front of her face and she never called our name. When we questioned her she told us she is too busy too look for us and we're suppose to check with her. After I calmed my husband down we ordered our food and to our dismay my simple order of chopped chicken salad dressing on the side was made incorrectly. My husbands Fish and Chips was delicious and I did not get my food until he was done with his. Our waitress never checked back with us in fact she never new that I had to send my salad back. We were very upset and asked for the check. And after waiting 20 minutes I asked to speak to the manager who had me wait another 10 minutes. She apologized and admitted they were not busy for us to have to go through this terrible experience. She offered us a dessert, which I declined. I come from the restaurant world and I never complain about service because I understand that shit happens. But this was the worst service I have ever received and I will tell everyone I know to never go to this restaurant

NLdwV4poLZhVZhPL6abjBg.text: I was so excited to have a reservation to eat at this establishment, as I have watched Gordon Ramsey turn around the worst of the worst restaurants on TV.  Unfortunately our experience was not at all as expected.  It began with a rude waiter.  We were provided with a dinner menu, however we could see clearly others receiving hamburgers, etc.  When I inquired he rudely responded, "What is the point of your question."  It took more than 15 minutes to get our drinks, at which time I had to grab another waitress and ask her to get them.  We did not see our waiter again so we grabbed the same waitress to request an appetizer.  We waited 45 minutes for our food.  The waiter came over one time to assure everything was okay, and then we never saw him again.  We requested that our party have separate tabs and the waiter brought us one check as his gratuity was larger if he combined the bills.  We spoke to the Manager who asked him to do as we asked and he never came back with the separate bills, so we finally paid the one provided as we had to get to a show.  There were 9 of us and none of us will ever return to a Gordon Ramsey restaurant.

jlUqvN6jJfjxK3YpkW94qQ.text: Let me just start off by saying that I have been to this restaurant quite a few times since it has opened, and never had a bad meal....until now. I was here for my birthday dinner, and was very excited to spend my birthday eating here. The evening got off to a very slow start by the poor service we received from the waiter. It took us about 15-20 minutes to even get the waiter over to the table to get our drink order (which was only an iced tea and a Diet Pepsi).   Once we placed that order, and our food order at the same time, the waiting began. The food actually came out rather quickly...we decided on the fish and chips. Unfortunately, when we received the food, the french fries were damp and soggy, not sure if it was moisture from the fish or what, but we sent the food back because who wants to eat damp, wet french fries? By this point, we still didn't even have our drinks yet.  Finally the second batch of food came out, and although there was less moisture on the fries, they were still damp and not very good. We finally received our drinks, from this point on, we never saw our waiter again. Never came back to check on us, never offered refills, and therefore, we never offered a tip.  I understand that sometimes things happen, like a new cook who can't quite get the food right, being too busy, etc. However, the bad food, coupled with a waiter who didn't seem to care, have left a bad taste in our mouth and we won't be back to this pub. We will just go to Gordon Ramsay Burgr.....hopefully they still know how to make decent burgers and fries there!

aH7q3QoLZZhwr0z03L3L1w.text: The items are so expensive here, I expected a huge portion. I mean, my Shepard's pie was like 25 bucks, and it was not large at all. Filling, but for that price you expect to have some leftover to nosh in your room later. Nope. SP is very basic, and nothing special. I ended up wishing I had gotten fish and chips.  We also got an order of warm pretzels for 7 bucks (a happy hour price). Three smallish warmed pretzel sticks with a dip. Should not have cost 3 bucks much less 7 (normally they are higher). Lame.  As we were hydrating after casino cocktail time, we asked for regular water (free). They come pour it for you out of chilled beakers. I was sucking it down, but our waitress was ignoring us (it was not busy at all) and I had to ask busboys for a refill. Twice. At normal cheap diners they ask if you need a refill all the time. Here where you are spending 30-40 bucks on maybe 15 dollars worth of food no hospitality. Lame.  We went at a quiet time, but it was sort of a let down. I don't expect Gordo to come out and ask how the pie is, but I just wish it had been a bit more special.

4xh1ttZGZy3v2gYe_7kEqQ.text: Well, let me start that I really was looking forward to go the this place, i have always admire Gordon Ramsay as a chef, very serious chef about all that he does in the kitchen and take care of how to prepare food. First: Irish Pub? their choice of beer there really sucks! I asked about IPA beers and the had only 3! what ALL LAS VEGAS HAS.. Sculpin, Dog Fish and Laguintas. really? thats all? Irish pub? Brown Ales only 2, red ales NONE... the place its decorated with all this beer barrels all around the restaurant.. its just marketing, I can get better beer in a safeway in Fresno CA or at a shitty bar in Oregon..... its a shame that he puts his name but he has gone comercial all the way, money matters, thats it.... The food was "OK" I oredered the ribeye and my co-league the NY strip.. I ordered medium and he ordered medium rare... the sent us the food the other way around, mine raw and hes almost all cooked, KUDOS for the service and the waiter on our table, very very polite and wanted to change us the food, we decided not to change it, we were hungry... my ribeye was bland, flat, and no flavor..... the mac and cheese with lobster nothing to talk about, just mac and cheese..... GR you are a star now... making lots of money and I congratulate you for that, thats whats all about, but I feel you sold your self to big corporations.... sad.

uzTzTi7VExYmmnpKOLPH7w.text: Great service and generous food portions. Nachos were delicious. Our server Rodney was exceptional.  I recommend a visit.

u0zyKCLF7NFtmGkhCg1SZw.text: Yikes. .. was I disappointed or what. this place was so expensive and so under par that I am amazed it came from the same team that brought me Gordon Ramsey Steak - and "holier-than-thou-TV Chef-erie". Common Gordon - whip these underling's butts into shape - please.  We started with the lobster-rolls for 21 bucks - for 2 small ones. And when I say SMALL --- they were essential common dinner rolls with a tablespoon of so-so lobster salad (or should I lobstery say celery salad) on top (not even in it). This would have been one of my grunge snacks in college when I was going to school in Boston, using left-overs from my dad's dinner visit the night before, and some hamburger bun from the pantry. Gordon! GORDON!  The best dish I had was the pea soup with creme fresh - a little watery but tasty. At least tasty in light of things.  My companion and I had hoped that things would go up from here - however - the truffle fries were oily, mushy and Luke warm (obviously left under a heat lamp for too long) ... the fish was over cooked and the breading fell off too easily (obviously under the same heat lamp no doubt). ... and the minted mashed peas were cold (I was really looking forward to these too).  Total bill for all this (a couple of appetizers and one main course to split) was around a hundred bucks.  SAD  Luckily I Bitched loudly - and the very nice manager gave me a discount on the bill, and a free dessert (a really tasty sticky toffee pudding - the best thing that we had here). So come here for dessert and get the pudding: it is served at room temperature and comes out of a big common pan - so no immediate cook-prep required. The theory - like in the army - keep things simple.  When I went to the bathroom (not because of the food) I noticed that there are hundreds of seats here - many of them full - and the food rushes out quickly to them all - so obviously the kitchen prepares their dishes more like TGI Friday's rather than Gordon Ramsay Steak: fast and finished quickly. But at TGI Friday' you get what you pay for.... and at Gordon Ramsay's Pub & Grill: YOU DON'T.

fCa4XjE58FZNR9KutiHOmQ.text: My husband and I were in there last night celebrating our birthdays and honeymoon and it was perfect! Randy (the assistant general manager) was wonderful! He gave us lots of great suggestions and made sure we felt special! The Ribeye and short ribs were delicious!! Travis our server was on top of everything and super friendly! SxDu5rJiG36SFgDXfwHWLA.text: This was my first time at one of Gordon Ramsey's 3 restaurants and it was a pleasant surprise.  Randy was very hospitable and seated us quickly.  We started with nachos which were amazing!!  Never was a huge fan of corn beef until now.  For my main course I ordered bangers and mash which was delicious.  The sausages were tasty and the mashed potatoes were perfect!  My lady ordered the steak ale pie which I almost ended up eating all of it jk.  It was fantastic the meat was so tender you gotta try it.  We were full but had to try a dessert so we ordered chocolate truffle.  It came in a little container and was the perfect size after such a hearty meal.  All in all it was a great experience and I look forward to coming back again and again!!

OwTJjyqyMUgBsEMa_T1KKw.text: Been here a couple times.. They are losing their touch a bit... The fish and chips and the Scottish egg this time weren't as good as the last time. Gordon wouldn't be satisfied with the service I received either. Nice theme in the restaurant and I know working in a themed environment could probably get old at times but the entire staff just seemed uninterested in their work. I don't think it was an isolated incident either because last time the food was great but the service was bad  this time food and service were just alright.  Its the little things... especially in Vegas where we are spending a lot of money.

UAsjRrodh2UrqynNXKS2WA.text: Came in just for a drink but ended up trying their lobster and shrimp rolls. So glad we did! They were delicious! Lots of lobster and shrimp with a great sauce that kept it moist and added to the taste.

iewOaHgr-HZ84ViVZwjUXw.text: My husband and I are huge fans of Gordon Ramsay. HUGE fans. We are locals and had a night away from the kids. We decided to indulge ourselves by eating at the Pub & Grill.  We ordered the fish and chips and Brussel sprouts. Food was amazing! Came out fast and it was delicious! Best fish and chips in town.  BUT the highlight was our server, Christopher. He tended to everything... anything we needed. Made us laugh until it hurt and gave us a VIP experience. Any friends and family that come into town will be sent to this place. The manager was amazing and made sure we felt at home. He pulled up a chair and we all shared our children's pictures and laughed about being parents... felt right at home! The manager even gave us his card and urged us to send him an email if we sent anyone to the restaurant so he could welcome them with open arms. Wow! Amazing. This doesn't happen often in Vegas.   Vegas is a busy city. Hospitality is usually very good but sometimes feels fake or forced. But Gordon has really made sure his staff is genuine and they truly go above and beyond to make the experience wonderful.   Solid 5 stars, and if you are visiting Vegas please have a meal here, you won't regret it!   Thank you, Gordon. We had such a wonderful time and we will be back!

Y6kCAoKFUlJUJs4CcWBh4A.text: Mehh, I've definitely experienced better.  This place was a disappointment. However, my friends disagree.  I ordered Beer-Braised Short Rib $38 this lacks flavor. I mean, they added vegetables to add flavor to the short rib but the vegetables didn't have any flavors either. It was missing basic ingredients, like salt and or pepper. Such a disappointment. I expected it to be better. My friends ordered steak, well done. They loved it but then again, they don't dine as much as I do so when I tried their steak... my god, it was not good. When they said well done, it was literally well done that it was tough, dry, and flavorless. I don't understand why they said it was good when it was literally hard to chew. That steak was a fail.  2 good thing about my experience: The skinny fries and the dessert which I forgot the name of it.   Service was mehhh also. We ordered for drinks and it took a while for it to come to our table. Our server was so occupied with the table next to us because maybe they had more demands and there were at least 5 people in their table while there was only 3 of us...   This place was such a disappointment that I will never come again. I love Gordon Ramsay so I will check out other places or restaurants that he owns.

xATIV18eZzakjawhGSMn-w.text: If you're a well known chef, why would you ever put your name on a less than average place? I would have to say that Gordon Ramsay is hyped up way too much. From the outside it looks like a hip restaurant. I would describe it as an upscale pub.  ===Service===  The service here was extremely slow. Our waiter took at least 10 minutes just to come and take our order. It took an additional 35 minutes just to get our food. I understand the place is pretty busy, but they should already know the place will be packed on a Saturday night and have the correct amount of staff on hand.   ===Food===  Complimentary bread and pretzels: The pretzels were in the shape of a breadstick, but they were perfectly chewy and soft. They serve the pretzel with a mustard cheese sauce and regular butter. I'd recommend going with the cheese sauce. The other bread that they served seemed to be some type of wheat bread with toasted seeds on top. Definitely not as good as the pretzels.  Braised beef cheek: Served with mashed potatoes and broccoli rabe. This dish was very disappointing. The beef cheek itself didn't taste fresh. Think of when a fatty beef dish gets cold. You get that layer of oily white fat. It tasted and felt like that in my mouth which is not appetizing at all. Also the gravy was pretty bland. Not worth the $28. 2/5  Pan seared diver scallops: Braised artichokes, baby carrots, pearl onions in a white wine garlic broth. They give 4 scallops in this dish. It's not very filling at all since they don't give any type of carb with this dish. It could definitely use some risotto, mashed potatoes, pasta or anything that's a carb! $32. 2.5 stars  Overall, I was sadly disappointed with this Gordon Ramsay location. The service was poor and the food was boring. I personally wouldn't recommend this restaurant to anyone that I know.

jlEcUWNOZGHwuaR3_fDWPg.text: Great Service Mr.Ramsey should actually try eating his own food( or for that matter appear once or twice a year [staff]) $46 for a rib eye steak sooo skinny it's what I buy at the grocery store  in Chicago to  feed  to my  3 dogs... 25$ for lobster Mac & cheese without any discernable lobster... at all  Beyond poor...a COMPLETE RIPOFF

mSlEshFYs_qiRIhbr8_epw.text: I requested an intimate table for two months in advance and we were seated at a four top near the casino floor despite there being far nicer tables open.  As we were so close to the casino floor we were bombarded by not only the sights and sounds of the casino, but the cigarette smoke as well. Then, one of the servers spilled water all over our table and never bothered to wipe it up, leaving our placemats and flatware in a puddle.  And they served our entrees less than 5 minutes after they served our appetizers which was not only unprofessional, but just downright rude.  My Husband's Toad in Hole was tasty, and they cooked his steak rare, just like he requested, but the British Ale and Onion Soup was just so-so, and my Shepherd's Pie lacked seasoning.  Seriously, just a bit of salt and pepper would have been nice.  You'd think lack of seasoning would not be an issue at a Gordon Ramsey Restaurant! The only saving grave was the delicious cocktails and the Sticky Toffee Pudding.  I'd say go for drinks and dessert, skip the dinner, especially for the price!    I've now been to all 3 of Ramsay's Vegas establishments and would recommend Steak and Burgr hands down above this one.  I'm surprised they hail it as Gordon's hang out when he's in Vegas, because we found it.. well.. disappointing.

tAGQB1BbwPlYAVdD4qB__Q.text: March 12, 2016 Dear Mr. Gordon  I live here in Las Vegas and I had friends come in to town from Corpus Christi, Texas we had gone to Ceasars to eat the buffet but found ourselves having to wait for 2 hrs in a half just to get in so instead my husband was looking through the Internet and found that you had a restaurant there at Ceasars so he knows I watch you all the time on T.V. and came up with the idea to let's try it so we did as we were greeted with a well manner manager I told him I see you all the time on T.V. and he told me I had just miss you that you had been there the day before so I was sad but I just wanted to tell you that we all really enjoyed everything we ordered my husband ordered a burger with bacon and of course I had the rib eye steak and a salad everyone was very nice and in great spirits I just wanted to say it was the best food I have had in a long time that I can't even remember when I had a great time and eating great food I will definitely go again and try something else next time I mean no words can't describe how great your food really taste like until they have had it I was also so amazed when I took a bite off my husband's burger it didn't smell like a burger it smelled and taste as you were eating a great piece of steak it was awesome I will give you 5 stars and  A plus plus plus plus plus plus that's how good it was thank you so much for bring great food to vegas I think others need to learn from your restaurant so we can have better food here in las vegas home of the world!!!!  Always Sandra Cano P.S. and trust me I will tell you the truth and not be shy to say what needs to be said like i have with other restaurants.

V14g88JD0udYwPKWqtXpZg.text: My husband and I stumbled upon this place and had to try it.  We were definitely NOT disappointed....it's amazing.  We started with the kettle chips nachos and that was a meal in itself!!!!!  As my entree, I had the lobster roll and very pleased with the buttery bread!  Yum!  My husband chose the bacon burger and loved it.  We would recommend it if you are in the area.  Great restaurant.

yAYLccSa-xRNNHOUHavJnQ.text: How dare you have the attatude you do on your show and have your name on such a poorly run restaurant!!!  Even the bathrooms were worse than a gas stations ...  Service was slow. Drinks mondain. Food pedestrian.  Close this place before more like me lose all respect for your talents!

vp_3z2930A5wxFGNCPfEgg.text: Mr Ramsay got greedy here... this is supposed to be an in-between for his 3 restaurants in Vegas but it's overpriced and unimpressive. I love BurGR and GR Steak but this place missed the mark for me and I can't say I was surprised based on the reviews. We had a friend that wanted to go though so we gave it a try.   Roast beef sandwich - "would you like a sandwich with those fries?" This is what they should ask when you order. The fries were impressive in both portion and taste and totally overshadowed the much less impressive roast beef sandwich. The caramelized onion au jus was awesome but they barely gave me enough for half of my already small sandwich. I ordered mine without the horseradish aioli as I'm not a fan of horseradish and honestly a good roast beef sandwich shouldn't need much else other than the au jus. The meat was good, not great and it was pretty much just lacking all around. At $18 I was quite disappointed. But again... fries... awesome. Had to ask for additional ketchup though as they brought out the smallest little half shot glass of ketchup lol  Warm salty pretzels - 3 pretzel bread sticks for $8... umm... how about some free bread on the table? Isn't this pretty standard when you are paying for a nice meal?  PEI Mussels & Clams - not my choice to order but I'm a fan of clams so I picked at it... and when I say picked at it.. I mean i had to literally pick at the plate to find the tiny bits of clam that had fallen out of all the shells. The chorizo was the best part of this dish and there was about 4 little slices of it.  Chicken Pot Pie - KC ordered this and enjoyed it but it was awfully small for $23. I took a bite and it had good flavor but the one she makes is better.  Our friends ordered steak and caesar salad and seemed to enjoy it but felt like it was overpriced for the place.  Service was so-so... waitress was very friendly but made a few mistakes and forgot some things. She made up for it by comping the pretzels and I don't get too upset with mistakes as long as you are friendly and make an attempt to make up for it.   No ciroc at the bar?! Seriously... I just don't understand that. The place was packed though on a Friday night and I'm sure it will keep doing well with a great location inside Caesars Palace. Crazy tourists....

Wd3cEjpNhWIwnW96vbK6aA.text: Extremely disappointed. Nice atmosphere, however the bangers and mash was average at best.  The meat and cheese plate to was just enough for one person let alone a table for two. Not the best place on the Strip for sure!

frhtNqwAQPO0UnCrFJZPKg.text: Great place to have dinner and drinks great atmosphere food is definitely awesome and u get ur monies worth

Q84WReOl1kfIFLb2G6oCTQ.text: This place was great! We ordered the burger sliders and the pie sampler. If I go back I'll be getting the Sheppards pie... Out of the three samplers that one was everyone's favorite and it was soooooo good! The burgers were good and cooked perfectly.   The mojitos were very refreshing too!

1YUCpoMGR4kKQ32xkeF3mQ.text: Overpriced for quality of food, even for Vegas standards. Service was mixed but not bad. Redeeming qualities- good beer selection and desserts.

lwcAYhVigmMp-mPq4JspXw.text: As a fan of Gordon's I was excited to have lunch here. I ordered the Salty Pretzel to start and a bacon cheese burger.  The salty pretzel turned out to be three pretzel sticks, clearly pre-made, and not a single piece of salt to be found. The cheese deep looked like it just came out of the microwave and the mustard from the bottle. Not a very good start. The burger did not impress either. The meat, while very juicy, had no flavor, and I mean NONE. The fries are run of the mill.  I have had much, much better food at a local Red Robin, and it didn't cost me $36!!!!!!  If your looking for bland, pre-made and tasteless food and want to blow a ton of cash - then this your place. Otherwise, there are much better options.

uwt1YhqbI8REN37eO2UxPQ.text: Still sitting here waiting for our waiter like we have been all afternoon. He's a ghost.  The food was nothing special. You are paying for the name. My sandwich didn't say anything about having mayo on it on the menu but when I received it, it had mayo. We waited forever for everything. FJAUIYVdTK20ZPBAh_mI_A.text: After a big meal the night before, I needed something lighter for lunch, so I got the Pub Chopped Salad here. Holy cow this was good. Nice large salad with lots of meats and other fixins. The "Apple Cider Vinaigrette" complemented it perfectly, without being too sweet or too vinegary. It was expensive for a salad, but it's one of the best I've had.

QJbBux8yu5ZM_6svy5aMKw.text: FANTASTIC!!!! I FOUND MY NEW SPOT IN VEGAS!! I'll start with  my server  MJ. This guy was awesome.. I'm a big fan of Gordon Ramsey ,so obviously I wanted to try the Shepards Pie. It was lunch time and not on the menu but MJ made it happen.. it was absolutely  amazing!! The manager Michelle came to our  table and greeted us and also gave us some must haves on the menu. Needless to say we took her advise and it was fantastic. Calamari, pretzel bread, and the sticky toffee pudding.. it was unbelievable!!  Michelle  and MJ definitely  left a good impression. I will make it a point to come back to the pub and grill. Best service by a manager and server I have ever had in vegas.  I'm in vegas at least  6 times a year, so I'll be back very soon. Thank you Michelle  and MJ, you both were amazing!!

a5AHkuaxpENTvqIkB954lw.text: A long wait. Service walk by ignoring us. We were right in the middle of the bar area and it was not busy, so I really don't understand how that happened. Got a manager and he just smiled and gave me some insincere stock answer but the service didn't improve. Beer and food finally came. It was okay. Ultimately I had to hunt down the server so that I could pay the check and leave. If I own the place I would be looking to improve this place

saWB1Bbe5XPLOS3W6otSyg.text: My expectations were a bit higher than the quality of food that i had. Quick recap:  Bacon Wrapped Date (2/5) - Two big let downs here. First of all the size and portions were super small. 4 super small pieces for an order that cost $9.  Second disappointment was in terms of flavor, it didn't wow me at all.  At other places I've gone this dish has been a hit and I think the missing ingredient is Goat Cheese.  It's not in it over here.  Hot lollipop wings (3/5 rating) - Northing extraordinary at all.  Just average. Lollipop wings so smaller in size as i expected.  Mini Lobster roll (4/5 rating) - This was my favorite part of my meal and I really enjoyed it. Plenty of Lobster and the quality of the roll was perfect.

DJfglN-hdL_uII4NEMKPzQ.text: We stopped in to get some snacks.  Ordered the deviled eggs and wow so good.  The Bloody Mary was amazing!  Service was good and atmosphere was fun!

VbegakQ9wPNRuL_AqULo0g.text: I won't complain about the food,, it was delicious. The service on the other hand was HORRIBLE!  Alexander K. Was our waiter and he was just plain old rude. He checked on us MAYBE twice during our meal. He seemed like he didn't even want to be there.  When we asked him a question,  he sighed and gave us a 2 worded answer, then simply walked away. I won't be recommending this place going forward. It's amazing how one person can ruin everything.
