photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bangers &amp;a Mash

5hjwgOr6SZBNWR7waPY42Q.text: I wanted to BE Gordon Ramsey....  The meal we experienced would have invoked rage in the man himself had he been served such mediocre food.   Starting with a Scotch Eggs ($9) - Eggs are plural, meaning more than one. We were served a sole lonely egg - just one. Appearance was nice, but there were more pickled vegetables than Scotch Egg. The egg itself, which is supposed to be soft boiled, was right on the edge of hard boiled. Sausage was bland and crumbly. The hit of the dish was the mustard, yes, the mustard.   Main course: Mini Pie Sampling of All Three Pies ($21) -  The menu was accurate with this description - they are definitely MINI. These "pies" are more like pie sliders. Barely a taste of each for what was supposed to be my main meal. The meats and vegetables inside were perfectly cubed, which made it look like those old Swanson turkey pot pies - taste was about the same.  I could not discern a noticeable taste difference between the three, so I can't label a favorite - all were below average.  The pies come complete with a puzzle for your dining entertainment / frustration. Take note of the long wooden basket with the thick wooden dowel running the length over the pies. Trying to eat with a dowel running interference is brilliant if the point is to slow you down. Practical no, frustrating - yes.  Why didn't I simply remove the pies do you ask? The server will warn you that the ramekins are blisteringly hot...  Yorkshire Ale Batter Fish & Chips ($28) -  My petite wife scored with the largest serving size of the day! There were several nice pieces of fish, which were flaky and cooked perfectly. However, having seen Ramsey's perfect fish & chips on TV, these would also have not made the pass. The batter was not crisp - soft and pliable would be a better description.  The chips - try to find them in the photo... still looking? There are a smidgen tucked under the fish - under the fish, where they can steam and lose ALL crispiness. No crunch in the bunch. As Gordon would say, "Damn..." Ah-ha, there was malt vinegar in a little pour bottle on the table, love malt vinegar on fish & chips! Tipped the bottle and a tsunami of vinegar filled the basket, spilled over the edge and all over the table, stopping short of becoming sour perfume all over my wife lest it not for quick reflexes snapping the bottle back to attention.   Desert....not a chance.  Server...very animated and could tell loved his job, but once the food came, was absent until the check appeared. It seems like he was trying to cover one to many tables and a table of two obviously wasn't going to make him as much as the other larger tables that received lots of attention. If he had made the rounds during our meal, we certainly would have made our feelings regarding the food known.  Highlights: Yes, there was one - I had a pint of the Innis & Gunn ($11) - quite pricey, but not available anywhere else in Vegas that I know of, so it was enjoyable.  Overall, to sum up the meal and experience at Gordon Ramsey's Pub & Grill Las Vegas, no arm flailing or curse words although it may have made me feel better. I am simply at a loss...  I think Gordon himself would sum it up all to well...  "What a shame"

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fish &amp; Chips - Looks great, but soft, pliable, with a smidgen of soggy chips hiding somewhere under the fish...
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. MINI Pie Sampler - not exactly a main course... pie sliders anyone? Served complete with a large wooden dowel to impede the feed
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Scotch Eggs - That should read &#34;Scotch EGG&#34; on the menu, only one small sad overcooked egg.

We had burgers and chicken and it was very delicious! The waitress was very nice was very friendly and even brought my birthday cake to the table! The atmosphere was casual and nice. HHp9lbPl2XyQA3wbtMno3A.text: Seeing other reviews, maybe I got lucky? Our experience here was AWESOME! We came here for dinner on our first night at Caesars. We got sat immediately and customer service was excellent.  The restaurant is unique with very interesting decor. From the table settings to the ambience, I can see chef Ramsay written all over it. We had their lobster rolls for the appetizers and ordered the chicken pot pie and the corned beef and brisket sandwich to share for our entrees. The sandwich was VERY good and flavorful. It is one of those messy eating sandwiches, but totally worth it to try. The chicken pot pie was really good as well, filled with chicken, kale, and other vegetables. the dough was nice and crisp, yet moist on the inside. The lobster roll had a lot of flavor in it as well with good chunks of lobster, but you can't taste the oceany lobster flavor as much because of other flavors. It was still a good try for our appetizers.  Our server checked up on us constantly, and was very friendly yet professional. Overall, our experience was good. If we come back to Caesars again, I would definitely come back to the pub to try more of their other menu items.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken pot pie with kale and other vegetables
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster rolls

AUC3F_t7xe2zzmwE5rJFuQ.text: Being a Vegas local who is English, I am very sceptical about the Irish and British pubs around town. Many rave that they have the best fish and chips in town or the best curry on their menu and all of them fail miserably at delivering to the high standards they hype the restaurants up to by serving frozen chips. That is, all of them but Gordon Ramsay's Pub.   We started off our late lunch with the Lobster and Shrimp Rolls. Holy cow! These were the dog's bollocks! (For you Americans, that means they were BOMB!) Light and refreshing Maine lobster and shrimp served on a toasted roll. My friend and I both agreed we would be happy with just that every time we came. Then came the Sliders which were perfectly cooked and a decent size.   Here's where we got a little greedy... Well, I got a little greedy. Back home I would always opt for either the fish and chips or the chicken curry and chips. Today, I opted for both... And shared reluctantly with my friend. Bloody hell, GR Pub know how to portion your food to feed you for a week. Let's start with the curry... The Butter Chicken Curry was served with basmati rice and a naan bread. The chicken was so tender it fell apart and melted in your mouth. Chef Otto Spohn came out to check on us and was saying they marinate the breast for a day in the curry base. This set the curry apart from other attempts to serve Indian in a pub in Las Vegas by miles. Normally I would do half and half (chips and rice) with my curry in England so I was looking forward to soaking my chips in the curry sauce.   Now onto the fish and chips. This is where I am most critical. There's nothing like proper fish and chips from the chip shop or pub back home. I never order them in America because I'm always disappointed. Freshly cooked, they came out steaming hot with tartare sauce and mushy peas (a British staple side for fish and chips). The chips were not cut like a typical chip shop chip. They were miles better than the frozen chips or French fries every other venue serves up in America, but they just weren't what I was hoping for. They were bloody good, mind. Just not what I expected from a British guy's pub. The fish on the other hand was PERFECTION! Light, crispy, and huge pieces. I ended up with enough for lunch the next day as well. LOVED the recipe.   We were celebrating my birthday and we were sent out two of the four desserts. The chocolate trifle which I had forgotten how much I loved back home. It was refreshing and delicious. The masterpiece however, was the good old fashioned Sticky Toffee Pudding. Oh. My. God. I was in heaven!!!! This was THE best sticky toffee pudding I've ever had... Trust me, I've had a lot of them.   The whole experience from start to end was bloody marvellous. Our waitress, Yanesy was bubbly, funny, and very attentive. I will be requesting her every time I'm back. The decor has a very posh British flair with fancy upholstery and excellent uses of the Union Jack, British landmarks, and of course the signature newspaper print typically associated with fish and chips. I can't wait to go back.

Wing itself wasn't too spicy or too sweet. Very mild yet good kick of spicyness follows.  Again, for wings and burger, it is expensive, but it's the price tag for the experience. The flat iron steak was tender and the drinks did not disappoint. We sat at the bar both visits and were extremely pleased with the bar staff. Friendly, attentive and gave great recommendations! This will defiantly be a must visit for us every time we visit Vegas!

aooYHT63yM6b2FlvdwMROQ.text: I have a major complaint with this restaurant. My wife cannot drink alcohol for health reasons. The menu has a great choice of non-alcoholic drinks. My wife selected the 'Goodbye Blue Sky' drink from the non-alcoholic menu to split with our 5 yr old daughter. My wife happened to smell the alcohol right before trying it. Turns out it is the only drink on the menu to appear in both the non-alcohol and alcohol list, same exact name.  How would my wife know that since she was not looking at the alcohol drink menu? It could have made her very sick. My daughter could have sipped it. There is absolutely no reason for this drink to appear with the exact same name on each list. I do not blame the server but think this is very irresponsible of the restuarant.

x3eZ8i_FqKuzehzpy0wdsA.text: My husband and I love coming here for our last lunch/meal before we depart to the airport to go home. Waitstaff has always been great. I love the decor. Food has always been yummy and the peas are just so good. The chef makes them to my liking and I don't eat peas anywhere else. The menu is full of pub food that is well worth the money.  Can't wait to come back and eat again.

35LcvgfCqaSDhAdtYrJo3A.text: We stopped by for a late afternoon lunch not knowing what to expect.  We were welcomed and quickly seated at a pub table.    Our server Nicole showed us the menu and made drink recommendations as well as food recommendations.  She then quickly brought us our drinks and took our order.  We went with one of her food recommendations which was the lobster mac.  We also ordered a bacon cheddar burger.  Our food quickly came to our table.  All the while Nicole made sure our drinks were full.  When we finished eating, Nicole casually recommended a delicious toffee bread pudding.  Since we were so happy with her other recommendation we ordered it even though we were stuffed! The dessert was AMAZING!  Actually all the food we ordered was beyond exceptional!!!   I would also like to point out that our server Nicole was wonderful.  We are owners of two tourist based companies in Big Bear Lake, and Nicole is exactly the type of employee we would love to have if we could afford someone like her.  Her take charge attitude and her pleasant demeanor is exactly what most employers dream of!    Great food and Great service!

byNB62-bUfMIpzvZO-8caw.text: Second time visiting the Pub-first time a couple years ago was meh (tried the burger) this time was really good!  We had the fish and chips. The fist was the best fried cod I have ever had with a wonderful batter and tangy dill tarter sauce. We (of course) ended the meal with sticky toffee pudding - don't skip that if you go - it is exactly the same as the one served in GR Steak with a slight variance in presentation.  They are a bit skimpy on the ice cream though-but I'll live

I had the tomato soup, which was so salty I couldn't eat half of it, but the 3 guys said their burgers were good once they scraped off the gross sauce. It wouldn't have been the same experience without him and he was as funny as he was nice.  We had the restaurant week salad, chicken pesto sandwich, and sticky toffee pudding and a dogfish head IPA.  Everything was good, but the sticky toffee pudding was insanely amazing.  If you have one thing here, make sure its the sticky toffee pudding. Byhts0HaltlZaexv0bOBtg.text: Awful! My fiance and I watch Gordon Ramsey on TV all the time we loved him. So we were extremely excited to try his place out! The high prices didn't bother us and the food choices were different. I had the lobster mac-n-cheese and my fiance had the shepherd's pie.. well my mac-n-cheese was very mediocre it was a bland gritty cheese sauce (I can make a better sauce at home) and the few pieces of lobster sitting on top tasted like they have been sitting in an ice tub in the fridge. Come on Gordon I know you can do better. Infuse the cheese sauce with lobster or something.. $24 for a cup of cafeteria mac-n-cheese with some defrosted lobster bits on top.. Now for the shepherd's pie. My fiance got violently ill the next day! FOOD POISONING! Never in all the years that we have vacationed anywhere (several times in vegas) has anything like this happened. The day we were suppose to leave to go home and he can't stop.... we'll you know no need to be graphic. He was so bad that we had to stay an extra night in vegas cause he couldn't be in a moving car. An extra night in vegas is not great when you are taking care of a very ill person. Needless to say we will never ever come back to this location and probably never go to another Gordon Ramsey restaurant. Next time we are sticking to Craftsteak (Tom Colicchio's place) now they know how to cook lobster.

I had the fish and chips which were so good - the batter was light and crispy and so yummy. My husband had the shepherds pie and said it was just like it is supposed to be. We will definitely be returning to this one!!!

oCqFkJwhUbmNFRwD3S0uXw.text: At first I was surprised there was no line, then quickly realized why.  We were  greeted warmly and with a smile; then this young lady asked us to follow her to a table, as we were following her, "OOPS there is no table available at this section", anyway we came back to the front, she went to find a table and came back to guide us to the table.  A few minutes after we seated, our server came to our table to take the orders, due to my eating style I asked for a dish from sandwich section with no dairy on it. After 20 min the server came back and apologized that they can't make it without dairy; I quickly changed my order to medium cooked grilled lamb burger with lettuce wrap.   As I was chewing slowly, I tried to recall what I had at GR in PH. This burger tasted great and delicious; however lack of amazingness made it less pleasant compared to PH location. I was stuffed but semi-satisfied from the food, service and the dining experience.  Because of more variety and higher prices I was expecting more compared to the other location but it seems more variety makes it less compelling.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lamb burger

v3yI6cFwVEYvAtIjQIut8g.text: Great staff and awesome eats! Staff was awesome and food was great. I had the beef wellington and it was very tasty.

mLPJvEH80EVrHLFYqTLutA.text: Came here before seeing the Reba show.  I ordered fish and chips.  The batter didn't stick to the fish but the fish tasted good.  The chips we're nothing special.  Wife ordered the French onion soup which was pretty good and the truffle fries were decent.  They were a little soggy.  My peas and mint weren't all that but I've never had them and they just weren't my thing.  The calamari was oily and the batter was falling off also.  All in all, we probably wouldn't recommend to a friend for the money it cost.  The staff was friendly and service was good.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fish n Chips with mushy peas
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Enterance

ezpcpOBQdR5O14nw4W2nIg.text: Went in with high expectations, left highly disappointed.  Biggest disappointment was the service by Scott, we were ignored as we tried to call him over, he never came to refill empty beverage glasses or checked to see how we were doing. Food was ok but nothing to brag about....I'm hoping it was an off day for them because I love Gordon Ramsay.

9QZNuhHNUc8ickUlAl343g.text: We have lost count on what number visit this is to the Pub and Grill, but it was as wonderful as ever! This time we tried the happy hour, and it is a great deal with the same tasty food! Rodney was a treat and was the Sticky Toffee Pudding that completed our meal. Can't wait to come back!

5CJJberoPRjT-05WlO3sqg.text: I'd like to up my stars for the pure attention the manager gave to our experience. He attentively reached out to me and did everything he could to make it right. Thank you, Joseph!

JXOtdoV-2Zczkjyuyf_dGg.text: Such a great restaurant, beef Wellington and lobster mac and cheese are the best I've ever had. Lisa was our waitress and she was amazing always checking in with us and having conversations, it was overall a great time because of the food and Lisa.

q38fLGqUP6IbK5rL7yb2Vw.text: My wife and I were actually planning on going to Hell's Kitchen for our date day, but was told by a Caesar's employee that it's hard to get in without reservations and suggested the Pub & Grill instead.   We were seated right away and was greeted by our friendly server (I forgot his name, but he was excellent!) with water. After that we order drinks, I got the smoke and mirrors which was delicious! My wife got a berry vodka drink which she said was amazing. For our meals I ordered the Beer Braised Short Rib while my wife opted for a BLT with truffle chips upgrade. We also shared a lobster mac'n'cheese!   The food that came out and looked amazing! My short rib was in a delicious sauce served with root veggies and mashed potatoes. My wife said her BLT was very good. The truffle fries were amazingly delicious! The lobster mac'n'cheese was very good, with a HUGE portion which we ended up taking home.   The restaurant is a bit pricey, but worth it if you're okay with the cost. We will definitely be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States

R623mSmoGRytfw72ivfIhA.text: The food was amazing, best burger I've had in a while my girlfriend had the braised short rib and it was absolutely amazing. Great service too. My waiter Taylor is legitimately the best waiter I have ever had. Super friendly, checked up on us and made conversation about the food, super welcoming and very appreciative of the tip I left. I have had waiters who act snarky and entitled to the tip but not Taylor, I gave him as much as I possibly could because he was so awesome and really deserved every dollar I gave him. Definitely request him as a waiter he will make your experience that much better and yes I said experience because eating here is truly an experience like no other. Also I should add. The desserts here are absolutely fucking incredible

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States

yFhj9amSw8JXr8wIRAT3ng.text: Our experience here was mostly a disappointment, made all the sadder because the primary reason my daughter wanted to go to Vegas was to be able to eat at a Gordon Ramsay restaurant. Our waitress was polite, but constantly bugging us to order. She kept telling us we didn't have to rush, but then she would come back 20 seconds later asking if we were ready yet. I was really annoyed, but it also seemed like the woman was just so high energy that she couldn't stop herself.    We got the nachos as an appetizer, and they were excellent. My daughter ordered a medium-rare burger, and that shit was FUCKING RAW. It was seared on the outside and not cooked at all on the inside. I know a medium-rare burger should be pink, but this was completely raw - like the kind of raw that gets you into a news story about e coli. Why can't this guy teach people to not serve things that are raw?? We did get that item taken off the ticket. I got a reuben, and it was fine, but no better than the ones I get from my local dive bar back home. It was a bit bland, and just way too big. I swear the stack of meat was like five inches high. I took off most of the meat and still could barely finish half of it.   We got the sticky toffee pudding for dessert, and that was amazing.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Prettiest nachos ever.

qliNmZ4hjmhbZXGgd0vwSw.text: Waiting for my meal wanted prime rib Med rare but was told nope the cook cooked it to well done. Wtf who does that . Well got a 14 oz rib eye over cooked tough meat one pc of asparagus one carrot one cocktail onion small dab of mashed potatoes that was flavorless . Meal was $45 for that lousy pc of meat. I sure don't recommend this place . However my son said his burger was great but that cost $22 for a burger and fries . I think Gordon would not be happy if he knew his food was crappy !! I do not recommend this place

egB-4r8sG7twmV2vktzGcg.text: The atmosphere was 5 stars, the beef Wellington was Devine, the toffee pudding (not something I ever thought I'd like) 100% delectable.  Fish and chips which is the one thing I was REALLY looking forward too... extremely salty .

Bxhn5D8VrQ7zxxbKsquvtw.text: Let's face it. You're going to play a premium to eat here. That's just how it is in any restaurant in a casino on The Strip. Was my meal for two really worth the $100 it cost? Absolutely not. The portion sizes were paltry for what we paid. The fish and chips aren't very crispy (and you only get 2 small pieces of fish), but the Steak and Ale pie was good, albeit small. The Sticky Toffee pudding for dessert was very good. Probably the best thing we got, but not really worth the $12 we paid.

PAv2Zx2R0eIZN2ZNGYTYBg.text: We eat here every time we're in town. The food and service are excellent! The atmosphere is very relaxed as opposed  to some of the more "upscale" restaurants on the strip. You can get anything from  Wagyu filet, a few seafood options to butter chicken which is phenomenal! I also recommend the hellfire wings for an appetizer, so good!

8EreWOnyvRX7Xli6FKL9Tg.text: Love this place! I do not give out many 5 stars..but Gordon Ramsay deserves this one. The food, decor, and service is top notch and inventive.   Set in Caesars Palace, it's a bit of a walk to get here. I recommend you make reservations if you come during a busy time, especially on a weekend. I made a reservation and we were seated immediately. The decor is upscale and has a beautiful bar as well.  I've been here a couple times and have been pleased each time. This last time we started with the kettle chip nachos!! Omg!! They are the best. They make their own chips and it's topped with pieces of juicy tender beef short rib and drizzled with white English cheddar cheese sauce. I could eat a bowl of that alone  We asked our waiter to bring more sauce and she happily brought us more! I then had their signature dish, the Shepherds pie! It's made with lamb and fresh veggies and topped with mashed potatoes. It was so delicious and seasoned perfectly! It is a large portion and very filling. It's the perfect comfort food. One person in our group had the lamb burger. It was juicy and cooked to his liking and  he ate every bite. We all tried the sticky pudding cake for dessert. (One is offered free on Yelp check-in). Winner winner... so good and huge enough to share. I loved everything we tried. Our waitress was amazing and super cheerful as well and made us feel very welcomed.   Some reviews ding this place due to the price. I agree the prices are high..but you expect to pay more when you dine on the Strip and at a top notch casino like Caesars Palace. The food is prepared with skill and passion and worth it. Take the time and check it out. I will be back!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sticky toffee pudding
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lamb burger

sPKiz6mqdyZn_lO9lnONdw.text: We enjoyed the short rib nachos, kale salad with shrimp, and the strawberry trifle. The dessert was nice and light and not overwhelming sweet. The shrimp were large and plump, however I wish they were served warm/grilled instead of cold.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States

cAP7t0b2aP1iRMYYzmfrXw.text: Nong best service in town, will be coming back next time I'm in town. Belgian margarita was the best

MWJjOQuA6QKXFEzPhn2pnQ.text: Exceptional Customer Service! Came back a 2nd time and was pleasantly surprised this time!  As always the staff was very friendly and we really enjoyed our waitress. She was engaged and made great drink recommendations .Ordered the Beef Wellington. It was OUTSTANDING ! Definitely a better option than the burgers. Steak Ale Pie was also spectacular ! OHHH MY that was delicious! Very happy we came back and WE WILL BE BACK AGAIN!!!!

78N9rmBRKlCe3BS3NQx-nw.text: So disappointed - was looking forward to delicious dinner - did not have the whiskey selection on menu, rib eye was a very poor cut and over cooked - mashed potatoes good as was the salmon.

StUQymyaLmEx-ybgdxBzQw.text: The food was delicious and the service was impeccable. Gordon is so judgmental on all of his shows, which is why I wanted to go and see for myself if he backs up what he preaches. He absolutely does. The decor was great, the staff was very friendly, the cocktail was amazing, and the food was cooked to perfection.

jAiLdhcIPqoH5iafDPkVkQ.text: It was not as good as I had hoped. The fish and chips were very good with 2 large pieces of cod with a thin crispy batter.  They could have used a touch more salt, but that is my taste.   The split pea soup was nice and creamy.  The disappointment was the Shepard pie.  The potato top was good with a crispy top but the amount of peas and root vegetables was small.  The major fault was that the lamb had been seasoned with spices that hid the lamb flavor. I thought it had an Indian spice overtone which was uncharacteristic to someone who was born in England.  I enjoyed the Innis and Gun ale.  Not too bitter. We skipped dessert as we had already tried the Sticky Toffee at the Steakhouse which was very good there.

tp3IycSBfqMsum_Ek7m6LQ.text: The best restaurant period! I loved everything. The pretzel bread. The Sheppards pie. The chicken, the streak and fries. The mac and cheese. The best dessert I have ever had (I can't remeber the name). The waiters where super nice. The seating was amazing. The menu was short and sweet. Every detail of the place was presented well. From the menu that was on a clip boared to the  place mats that were made of wood. I will come back and bring my mom :)

44TafIDIz3z29Xicmn2YlA.text: Fish & chips was so delicious!!! It was my birthday, and the waiter brought me a complimentary dessert. It was the toffee & date cake, & it was the most delicious dessert I have ever had. Service was exceptional & I will definitely be back!!'

WjWdULiJa_q_tgdzo14KDg.text: Awesome beer selection.  We were there watching some March Madness games, so we primarily went there to drink and to have some appetizers.  Food was pretty good - the wings were amazing!  Service was solid.

jIjRwfoPEZMQEHiG6eQkow.text: I was very disappointed by this place. If you watch any of Gordon Ramsey's shows he always talks about quality. This was very poor quality food. Frozen fries, weird watery meat in Shepard Pie, and a rather bland in eventful burger. It is also expensive.   Just blahhhh.  The whole Gordon Ramsey thing is just an act to sell overpriced food.   The winner of his Chef show that was supposed to be the Chef of the restaurant failed her drug test so she is not there either. So they are just a ship at sea with no sail.   I have spent time in England and this is very much on par with British food. It is pretty bad.

3Lv6oH02nRTZG4iAbu-zBg.text: Ate there last night.  We just had Fried Calamari and burgers.  Calamari is crispy and tender and not overly breaded.  Burgers were delicious-- cooked perfectly with great toppings-- caramelized onions, crispy bacon, cheese sauce. The best was our lovely waitress Kim. If I ever went back I'd ask for her. Very personable, friendly, funny and attentive.

DFsScGWkNrdzee-8OBF-pA.text: The food was excellent, but I honestly expected Amazing and did not get it. We love Ramsay so we wanted to try this place since we were here...the appetizers were very good. calamari was excellent. The drinks were okay, nothing great. The mini Shepard  sampler was really good, but super tiny. The french onion soup was okay.   The service wasnt very good. I had to raise my hand three times to wave someone down for more water. I really didnt like the couch/coffee table set up because I had to lean over to eat. Then, interestingly, I give the waiter a $50 bill when I hand him the black folder (that contains my credit card ) with the check and he takes the cash and puts it in his pocket, and brings me the the bill with the full amount on the card. I reminded him I gave him a fifty with the bill (to apply cash first, rest on the card), he thought that was his tip? He did go back and fix it.

Zat6qud1JRRhpFuQq36WLg.text: 1.5hr wait for entree's... and even then, they were small portions and the burger was overcooked (well done, when medium was requested). The shepherd's pie was good but a small bowl and still left us hungry.

BzbbNYb-hc-4xLK8L0MLIg.text: Had poutine, fries, and a couple burgers. The burgers were wayyyy too heavy. Buns were soaked with butter and grease from the patty. More fattiness coming from avocadoes and mayo dressing with nothing in the burger to cut through the fattiness. There simply wasn't a balance of flavors. When you are charging 20 bucks for a burger at least serve it with a house salad with some vinigratte. I couldn't finish the burger because it was simply too heavy when the portion was kind of small to begin with. The poutine was good. But the server didn't get our order right and forgot my friend's order which cost another 30 minutes of waiting time. And we were seated at the entrance besides the revolving door where ambience was non existant. It's difficult to understand the purpose of placing a table that is practiacally outside of the restaurant. When asked for a re-arragement, the only option was to wait for another 30 minutes because better seats were offered to those who were behind the line wearing dresses... All in all, this was not a dining experience that one expects at a Gorden Ramsay franchise.

ycJtehWVHdPG1_lHz0SUQA.text: Very disappointing! Went with the fam for dinner. We ordered the crispy calamari and chicken wing pops for starters. The calamari was far from crispy but rather soggy the batter didn't even stick it mushed up. The chicken wings were bland and cold, i had one that was undercooked. For main course we tried the shepherds pie, sliders and fish and chips. It didn't get better, the pie was drenched in oil and the sliders were dry. Fish and chips were good great fries. The services wasn't the best either, took our server 15 mins to take our order and we had to hunt her down for 20 mins to get our bill..  Expected way better from a chef like Ramsey.

Lw2Btt1MIIP7KlO1cbjc2Q.text: I don't get the negative reviews at all. The service was great, my cocktail was amazing, and the food was delicious. Had the pork belly and it was spot on. Had to also get the English chips, seriously no complaints. We had a great experience.

WKfcQ10B-rjx6qWYVorXnQ.text: Went here with my husband because Mesa Grill had a 3 hour waiting time if you don't have reservations on a Saturday night. Me and my husband are not fans of pubs but we were pleasantly surprised. We got seated without waiting.  The chairs were comfortable.    The food was really good! The cheese plate was unforgettable. But they don't give you enough bread. We had to order extra bread. The fish and chips were good too! The batter was very crisp and the fish was still moist. My husband had the lamb chops and he liked it a lot!   Service was good. And met the manager, Randy, and he was very friendly!   Music was too loud, but, it's a pub...  Will definitely come back.

sEcHhkjsCJTq0bdYx08TEw.text: Service is awful. Food is so so. We waited 30 minutes for the food to arrive only after our server pointed out to us that we were at Gordon Ramsey spot and not Applebees or Denny's. Uh no shit! Meanwhile folks that sat down after us got their food before ours ever came to our table. We did not order anything complicated that it took 30 minutes to get to our table. The communication was poor from the server to us.

4df78j1MWwQd2IEGiGnI3g.text: A good place for English food. We had lunch there. Quality food and great wait staff.

I19ve_Ybua1RwHJt8Q6o9w.text: Tonight we had one of the best servers we've ever encountered. For you foodies out there, Julio knows how to pair food/beverages. A must for a great experience in LV.

6dqbGY5kv4jXueU1iZeprg.text: Service was great. The food was good as well. Had the burger, wife had the pesto chicken sandwich. Pub atmosphere reasonably priced for vegas.

7mWV1nCy7-adc3piasrNnA.text: We were seated right away.  The hostess was friendly and our server was very attentive.  The decor was cool.  The kids and I liked the dog photos on the back of some of the chairs.  It reminded us of our own dog and we were missing her.  The food was good, but I wasn't anything to rave about.  The variety of food, to me, was like what you can order at BJ's Brewery.  Same type of food, but more expensive.  I don't think we would return to this restaurant if we were in this hotel.  There was a quick food court right next door that had a variety of good looking food and less expensive.

OLPXFuD_GaJRC0xlhL_G3Q.text: The food was great, the service was awesome. Definitely a place to come and eat and have a couple of drinks to start the day

BAxCy5ikHQqIWTMH5GiM-Q.text: Well I gave this restaurant three chances. It's very over-priced, food was mediocre but the service was the worst. My husband and I went there last week and the waiter was so obnoxious right from the beginning that we got up and left without ordering. I will never go back and Gordon deserves to have his ass kicked for allowing his restaurant to be run this way. Can you even imagine how he would crucify a restaurant owner on one of his shows for such appalling restaurant management. The only thing that might save him is that his restaurant is right across from the theater so it will get unsuspecting guests either coming from or going to a show. Don't bother!

TwbcoRuzDspvHFV7yWrEWg.text: Stopped in after refusing to wait for Caesar's buffet. We were able to get seated immediately since there were plenty of open tables. I asked our server for some suggestions for dinner. She suggested Fish & Chips as well as Short Ribs. Each dinner was over $ 30 which I don't mind as long as the quality, taste & portion match the price. After waiting an unusually long time for our dinner, we received small portions of fish & short ribs. The majority of my tasteless short ribs was a huge helping of barley, also tasteless. The fish was prepared well & tasted good, however, the portion did not reflect the price. The chips were unremarkable French fries. Drinks are overpriced also since they are served in small glasses. Worst part was the service. No excuse for the lack of attention since there were many open tables, we did notice the staff enjoyed congregating & enjoying one another's company much to the customers detriment. I will not be returning.

0u5AUOCGBczqtW4pZXhHLw.text: great cocktails and bartenders, we sat at the bar and had the pork rillete!! amazing-ness!!!

NQIXxtgMizajaEc0cpwSfA.text: Really bad for a pub and grill...Gordon should be careful of where his name goes... he needs to visit this place and kick someones rear.....appetizers were good (salmon and scotch egg) . The main course was well...the Christmas holiday prime rib meal....only prime was cost for a bad cut of meat (fatty and bad) the Yorkshire pudding tasted like...well nothing, just like dough...the only good thing was the cold beer....wish I would have spent my $100.00 elsewhere on a good meal... just have an appetizer and a beer.....

e6K8TxVYmcpoq6iHK4I9aQ.text: As a pretty big Gordon Ramsey fan, my husband and I could not wait to go to his pub and grill, especially since he is in the process of hiring a head chef on Hell's Kitchen. It's located in the perfect spot inside caesers palace, the walls were made of empty beer keg's which was pretty awesome. My husband was a little let down at the fact that there were no hot wings on the menu, so he decided to get a burger, while I got the calliflower soup, lunch menu. The food was so good. While I loved my soup I wish I would have gotten the burger, it was amazing. Our waiter was also pretty cool, we were his only table at the time,  so he took the time to chat with us and made our lunch even more enjoyable. All in all I would 100% recommend anyone to this restaurant, and I myself cannot wait to return.

67rnGoy1AWUSrYxJnarqXw.text: Truly disappointed!!! Got the Scotch Egg. Very plain. Ale Onion Soup, plain. We waited with each item coming out. Over an hour after we sat we finally got our meal. I got the lamb rack -asked for medium, came out rare - no seasons. I had to add salt and pepper. The baby carrots were good and seasoned well and the mac'n cheese was good.. I told them 3 times it was my husbands birthday. The waiter came over after we ate and delivery of the check with all kinds of small talk....I plan to never eat here again...

n8hktboi9yTvzH26JUN2Ug.text: Had the Dish and chips...flavorful...but not hot...sort of tasted like it had been in the window for too long before serving. Sweet pea salad was good.

SBOk4uZB2T6nkleHExtdaw.text: I'm in Las Vegas every few months for business, and this is the third or fourth time I've come to the pub-and honestly, the food keeps getting better and better every visit! I am looking forward to coming in next and seeing what they have!   I ventured away from sandwiches this time around and tried something new-the pork belly. I've never seen such a unique and beautiful preparation! I couldn't believe how light it was, I didn't find it fatty at all. I would recommend this dish to EVERYONE! I may be back just for this...

ygkBvgCdX330j59muM3AoQ.text: Worst Dining Experience in a Very Long Time!!  We have eaten at Gordon Ramsay's Pub on previous occasions and while not outstanding, we have never had the abysmal service that we experienced on Thursday 3/26. I booked a month in advance for a party of 6, expecting a dining table or booth. Instead we were shown to a high top bar table with stools in a crowded, extremely (shouting to each other to talk) bar. Nothing else available we were told. Server took ten minutes to acknowledge us. Drinks were offered. Another ten minutes passed before we were able to order. While the appetizer of mildly hot and sweet wings was good, the rest of the meal went downhill. Two diners ordered Shepard's Pie, mediocre reviews. Lobster Mac & Cheese first course was over price at approx $22 ($24?) dollars and missing lobster. Two diners ordered the organic chicken dish. When dinner was served, after an almost 40 minute wait, the Organic chicken turned out to be Bangers and Mash. When this was called to our servers attention, he said (and I quote), "Oh, the button for the Organic Chicken is beside the Bangers and Mash, I must have pushed the wrong button." When we advised just to take the plates and we didn't want to wait another 40 minutes for our entree he offered to bring us a Shepards Pie (which they must have made ahead and keep ready under warmers?) Since neither of us eat red meat this was not an option. Our table asked for salt and pepper four times before it was brought, after dinner was essentially over. Our consolation for no dinner? Our server grudgingly offered dessert "on him". Incidentally, while no one could remember to bring condiments, they did manage to return to the table four times to refill drink orders from the bar, thus goosing up the check to the best of their ability. Terrible, terrible service and Chef should be appalled. No manager approached or offered apologies. I left a 10% tip, my husband, who is usually overgenerous with tips, wanted to leave nothing. We will not return to Gordon Ramsay' Pub.

0gtBGat-h21YVAGA6Uxd6g.text: I went there for lunch and it was horrible. Overpriced, mediocre food and servers in the goofiest uniforms I have seen in some time. Save your money and aggravation.

G0pnc3DSVNUceHne9c37Zg.text: I went with my family when we stayed at Caesar's and it was the worst meal of the trip. The service was sub-par, but the food was worse. I wish he had stuck to True pub food because he missed the mark on being something more. When you order pub fries, you expect fries. Instead we got potato blocks. The steak was just ok and that should be fairly easy to get right.  It's ironic that he has a tv show about bad restaurants, because his is not what I would call good. Even if the meal hadn't cost $500, it still wouldn't have been good.   Don't waste your time, your money, or your calories.

PCAiJDRHuePofpIU7hk8mw.text: Having stayed at The London in NYC and dined both at Gordon Ramsay--which was excellent and at Maize--which was also very good, I was very disappointed with the Gordon Ramsay Pub and Grill. From the start, the girl acting as Maitre D could not find the reservation that I had made with her personally the day before. There were a group of female employees--hostesses--I think who spent more time chatting g with each other than assisting guests. Very tasteless.    The food was mediocre at best. The Caesar salad was atrocious. My colleague had the flat iron steak which was tough, fatty and "the worst steak he's ever had". I had the shepards pie, which Mr Ramsay has featured on many a special. It was good, but the presentation was mediocre...a crock of Shepard's pie that looks like someone took a crap in a bowel and served it. I had a side salad of weeds, with a tasteless vinaigrette and a few slices of apple. Hardly appealing. I would rate this dining experience 1.5 out of 5 at best. Chef, I am truly disappointed. Perhaps your Hell's Kitchen winner will liven up a rather lousy dining experience.

4YN-HuxktRB3KraAUnp_yg.text: I happened to walk by and see they had my favorite beer on tap (Innis and Gunn), so I sat down for a late lunch. I wasn't expecting much, as previous reviews have been mixed, but the Scotch Egg was phenomenal! It was so good that I stopped back in that night to have another pint of Innis and a scotch egg before my red eye flight out. Service was great, sliders were great, beer list is great. A great casual restaurant, through and through.

Ee9AVMW2UKtznWcXUTdTpw.text: On vacation from Canada and family brought me to the Gordon Ramsay Pub. Well I am glad they did! I am a big Gordon Fan and wasn't sure what to expect. The four of us got there and we started with some nice drafts, they got a big selection like 24 I think the server said. The server forgot his name was friendly and knew his stuff recommended a calamari, different from what I am used to but this was good. For entree I had a fish n chips one of the best that I ever had, my wife had the lamb burger and she thought it was good. Our friends had a filet and salmon, John though his filet was a little under cooked but ate it all. For desserts we had this sticky toffee pudding all I can say it was the best thing of the night. You have to try this dessert if you go here.

ZpXu7nv-XtN67hOhfvLrOQ.text: Visited on February 23 and had a blast!  The wait staff Elise and Sam were very accommodating and answered a lot of our questions.  The food was delicious, of course it was a little more expensive than we are used to but we're in Vegas on the strip at a Gordon Ramsay eatery!  Hats off to the employees great job at making us feel at home!

LQVgPLlFqxX4FKSPZEdK4A.text: This place is lively and full of energy. Service was good. They always checked up on you. The mini pub burgers were awesome according to my son. The roasted tomato soup was good according to my daughter. My wife loved the fish and chips. The lobster mac n cheese was disappointing. It was dry and was not worth $25 for a side. The red wine short ribs were also disappointing. It did not have much flavor (kind of bland) Overall, my family loved it, but i did not.

C2ulC5B_DEUM6cY3Lk-MQg.text: Happy Hour.  The Deviled eggs consisted of rubbery hard boiled egg whites served with a blank blob of yolk filling and another blob of tasteless crab.  Disappointing.  Beer was fine.  Service ok.

-lwlhH6ylbd-CngkmBV7LQ.text: Very Disappointing.  We are locals and spent $126 on bland tasteless food.  Don't order the short rib, the calamari or the Caesar salad.  Don't understand how a celebrity chef could dupe so many people.  Sadder because I was such a fan of his show.

7LPlXzq74x-gOrC_shqfOw.text: **Have a Spiced Cider cocktail and ask for Joshua!**  I had the most enjoyable dining experience at GR's Pub & Grill. Being warmly greeted and seated quickly established my positive impression and the staff maintained the momentum. Our server, Joshua, arrived promptly and took exceptional care of us.   We started off with Spiced Cider and Sloe Bramble cocktails. The sweet cinnamon flavor of the cider hit the spot. I cannot recommend it enough! The Sloe Bramble was "berry" nice but lacking in the wow factor. I enjoyed rifling through the online bar menu on Joshua's tablet.   The Rib & Cheek Sandwich is beyond tender. It was flavorful and rich. The potatoes were huge and nicely seasoned on the outside with Parmesan cheese.   The Mac N Cheese is divine. I adore the truffle and tiny duck fat crouton topping. Just a luscious dish.   For dessert a must is the Sticky Toffee Pudding! Forgo the Chocolate Trifle and order two of the puddings! Don't worry about the servings being too big. They are just right.   Thank you Joshua for being so knowledgeable, quick to gauge customer tastes and just charming in general. The staff was sweet and pleasant all around. I am happy to endorse this establishment and will certainly stop by again.

3wgoW9V_enbx6s2bmfAaCA.text: Gordon Ramsey, you need to rescue your own restaurant!  I love to watch your TV shows so had high expectations. So disappointed!!!!!  We made reservations for 7:30pm, arrived 20 minutes early so were shown to the bar. After waiting until 8:00 pm, and having to check with the hostess, we were finally seated at an empty table that we noticed was empty the whole time we were standing bar dodging the waiters/waitresses coming through with trays of drinks.   As soon as we sat down, a waiter tried to deliver a yummy looking dessert, but we hadn't even ordered yet!  Three of us ordered the fish and chips and the other ordered mixed grill. After about 45 minutes, two fish and chips and the mixed grill were served. We all sat there for another 15 minutes for the last poor guy to be served.  By the time all the food was served, everything was barely warm. The fish was only so-so, "the chips" (big fat fries) were very good, but not chips! The peas were good. On the mixed grill, the shrimp was tough, and the pork belly was fried so long it was hard.  I think this restaurant is overpriced, but great service and great food are worth it. Unfortunately, Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill had neither.

CCe4dugXMG0hlk0gKNQ8Hw.text: Easily the best meal of our recent Vegas trip- and we dined at several other places that were much more expensive.   Stumbled on Gordon Ramsays location here at Cesears one hungry afternoon. Seated right away and ordered two beers. Drinks served promptly by our server who was very professional the entire way through our meal.   We shared the sliders, mac and cheese and mixed veges (brussel sprouts and carrots). Sliders were great- cooked medium with cheese and bacon. Very tasty. Mac and cheese was excellent with several cheeses and duck fat croutons. The veges, believe it or not were outstanding. Mini brussels and carrots sauteed and seasoned perfectly.   Service was quick and professional. Prices were high but on par with what you got and Vegas in general. No complaints here! Will definitely return.

D3YmW5qkwDwkpYFCMf8ZzQ.text: My fiance had dinner here on our latest trip to Vegas. We love Gordon Ramsey and we're looking forward to eating at one of his restaurants. And we were not disappointed! We had a great dinner, and great service our waiter was very attentive, we even had an opportunity to meet the GM Louie, the hospitality was top notch. Would definitely recommend for your next trip to Vegas!

wzb1T2vyTG-BLsBQo67vGA.text: I enjoy watching Hell's Kitchen so I have to make sure that I try all his 3 restaurants in Vegas. As you walk in to this restaurant you will fell like you are in one of London's pub. The British telephone booth is perfect for selfie and the big posted of the one and only Gordon Ramsey is a nice bonus. Must try: Yorkshire ale batter fish and chips, traditional shepherd's pie is delicious and end it with the stick toffee pudding. Burgers are average but I'm not a big burger person, beer Braised short ribs is good.

4VkOJUZ1Y9_VjLxrt4Af2w.text: The service was horrible! The last time we spoke to our server was when he took our orders. He never came back to check up on us. And he wasn't busy at all running orders and checking on his tables because the times I did see him on the floor was when he'd bring the bill to his tables and serve them water. We were able to catch another waitress that was serving the table next to us to grab us more water and steak sauce, and she wasn't very pleasant. Our bill came out to $225. No gratuity. Sorry, not sorry.  The food was OK. I ordered the prime rib. It could've used more seasoning. The restaurant was laid back. This was definitely not a place for kids.

KlucwDe4D5DwVTLX0FV2Mw.text: I wish we would have gotten to try it! No service was given for a good 20 minutes...and then the server helped the table next to us that was seated after us! We had to cut our losses and check out Mesa Grill across the casino floor! I'll never understand why these restaurants have 4 hostesses at the hostess stand and people aren't getting service!!!  The menu wasn't that tempting anyways and the items that I looked up online and on yelp that I was looking forward to weren't even on the menu ;(   Maybe next time Gordon... I really want to try Gordon Ramsay Steak though!

fDfYJwZDMzyLPbH8DCB1bw.text: If you are a vegetarian don't ever plan this restaurant.. I didn't know that Gordan Ramsay never planned to cook for vegetarian. Above that had the worst service of my life. I think Gordon Ramsay should play hells kitchen with his own restaurants. One good thing about the food n restaurant for which I gave one star is the desserts.

7wKmdyASCLpjw5roBFE-Iw.text: I had lunch here with my wife and mother in-law this week (donated to local Las Vegas casinos this week :-/  The service from " Sara" (Filipina server) was awesome..  She was very attentive and personable..  Had the Pastrami/Reuben sandwich that was HUGE and juicy.. My wife had the calamari.. My mother in law picked off both our meals..;-) Awesome on both items!   It ain't cheap but a good lunch.. Thumbs up!  Will ck out the other Gordon restaurants next time I'm there on an expense account.. Ha!

80gOrPjwLqioGecWiFOxJA.text: Very un-impressive meal. The look and feel inside the restaurant is nice but the quality of the food is low. We ordered soup as an appetizer which was good but our main meals were subpar. My wife ordered the salmon which looked good on the plate but was less than flavorful AND cold - not heated properly. I had the bangers and mash...the bangers were less tasty than the sausages you can buy at Costco and grill yourself. My iced tea was also $5! Sure, this is Las Vegas, but that's the most expensive iced tea I've had in my life. $120 later we felt ripped off.

Ont6fkBdYaH9XHizKGpikQ.text: One word - DELICIOUS. Hundreds of choices but Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill caught my eye while exploring Caesar's Palace. I knew I had to try it out. The server recommended butter chicken and I decided to go with it; hands down, it was the best butter chicken I've ever had. The ambience at the restaurant was great, service delightful, and I found out that a week ago Ramsay was standing at the same spot at the bar where I was sitting :)

jlyrszCHy7gNg0cRSAw8pw.text: This was our first gordon ramsay restaurant experience. The decor is nice and creative..especially the keg wall. Our waitress was nice and helpful which made the 5 hr with traffic bareble. We ordered fish and chips and sliders with two cocktails. The fish and chips were great! However the mushy peas were not so great... it just doesn't work with the meal.it must be a British thing hahaha. The sliders only came with two..wish it came with four haah but it was good. Pricey for bar food..but good food in general. Would def. Go back!

APCnLGjlb-brqO88WhsHoA.text: Since there are no half ratings, I went with a 3 because a 4 seems like a stretch for here. Nice stop for a decent meal if you're walking the Forum Shops or need a break from gambling. If you get a table near the casino floor it's also fun for people watching.  My wife and I both enjoyed our meal. I had the corned beef sandwich and my wife ordered the fish and chips. Nice drink selection. The service was solid as well.   Pretty soon Gordon Ramsey will have a restaurant in every hotel, but we're fans so we were happy to give him a few bucks.

aln__qrGJV-Gz5xomBzzzg.text: Always have fun here - 2nd time here in 1 weekend. Came here a few years ago and is a good staple visit. Usually sit at the bar, great draft beer selection,

nbE8hKWxAlehoCZwW91Dbg.text: My wife and I went here on 8/11/2016 for appetizers, and we're very disappointed. We checked in with the hostess, and were told it would be a fifteen minute wait. After several other patrons without reservations were seated, we asked on the our status, and they forgot about us. After being seated our service was slow, and I found the menu to be overpriced. We each ordered a Sierra Mist that were $5 each, and our two appetizers were $18 each with small portions. Service was slow, and our server was slower. The food was good, but you can get much more for your money at other places. Do yourself a favor and go to BurGR. That was light years ahead of this place.

6VHJperC2ebPE5epRfZiJw.text: Gordon Ramsay restaurants consistently deliver more hits than misses and should be recognized bc the hits are way above most other restaurants bests.  That said, this visit I sat at the bar and enjoyed Ray Ray the bartender's regular, but not obtrusive check ins. He personally checked the kitchen when the man's burger next to me was delayed. And by delayed, I mean free extra wine bc it was a long time and the kitchen refused to serve less than well-executed food.  I again, ordered the fish and chips. It's a pub and I wanted pub food. The fish was tasty, crunchy, slightly salty (in a good way), hot, flaky, moist, and HUGE. Plus, it was light and not greasy, beckoning additional bite after bite. and when my paced slowed, a little tangy, salty, texture-pleasing tartar sauce propelled me to finish every last bite.  So what no bread service at lunch. Not a deal breaker here and Ray did ask if we wanted dinner menus.  The chips were thicker, square fries, with crispy edges and hot, soft potato inside. The Parmesan and seasoning blend were delights and almost rendered the ketchup unnecessary. My husband finished his and started helping me on my portion.  My last time here I wondered why oh why, mushy peas? Now, these peas still retain enough texture to have some bite. They taste fresh. The savory, almost umami-like taste kept me going back bite after bite.  His pork belly sandwich delighted the palate with a nice blend of bitter, soft, crunchy, wet, sweet, and heat. He did request extra horseradish sauce but only offered me a single bite bc it was that good. He says he would order it again, and add a crispy or cheesy element. Still a hit in our books!  Best part, Ray-Ray excellences advised in a more-British tasting beer, and delivered my husband a Guinness and Dunn from Scotland. It perfectly complemented his sandwich.  We will return! Till then Yelpers, try to read a few of the 500+ reviews to order wisely and granted, the service sometimes ha hang ups but I'm always, always a pleased customer!

VGgVVFr4oFMaYZ7MSOc01A.text: We just arrived home from a weekend in Las Vegas. Tried this restaurant on our first night for happy hour.  Our waitress Carriey was excellent she was very good in recommending food and made our visit fun. We also met the bar manager Randy what a great gentleman he not only is from our home town but went out of his way to make sure we were taken care of. The food was excellent.   Since we had such a great time there we decided to visit on our last night.  Our waiter Scott was again very personal and a lot of fun. Great recommendations on food. We had lamb burger, beef burger, wedge salad and lobster roll. Food is spectacular. The serves at this restaurant is superb. It's always great to go to a restaurant with pleasant waitresses. In the midst of talking to Randy he introduced us to season 10 winner of Hell's Kitchen. Very nice to have met and talked to her. Our experience here was the best definitely will be returning. Thank you for a wonderful visit!

Uok4DB6dlUV026BR-2Qkdg.text: Impeccable service at the bar. Recommendations were thoughtfully considered based on our preferences, and the meal preparation was without flaw. Thoroughly enjoyed our visit.

FFq_uEpa-GRSz89ot3JpTA.text: Omg! By far the best fish n chips ever!!! Shrimp and crab rolls appetizers were sooooo good!!! They just melt in your mouth! The nachos and hot wings were awesome!!!! We had the best service ever from Travis he made sure we had everything we needed and kept checking up on us and suggested we have the toffee bread pudding desert which just melted in your mouth with warm caramel drizzle on top of vanilla ice cream!! We left so stuffed but well worth it and we will return and recommend to everyone I know.

FvYt-qPieMKlGfSVvit5Ww.text: Came here late on a Tuesday for some steak. It's very expensive: $60ish for an 8oz steak and three asparagus spears. Their cocktails are $15 each as well. This is a situation where these restaurants can get away with charging whatever they want for normal-quality food just because the people who eat there are splurging in Vegas. The staff here isn't great either and the front of the restaurant is open to the casino floor so you get to watch people playing slots while you eat. $100 should buy a little more ambiance than that.

16-KQQXxbybqtwHGi-czxw.text: Enjoyed my two lunch visits to the pub.  Rather surprised by some of the low ratings.  The Sheppard pie was quite good, but my two favorites were the steak pie and the goat burger.  Both were excellent.    The service was fair one visit and very good on the 2nd.   I would definitely return.

YDqvxiAVphjvuCL89I9ZUw.text: Was an amazing experience..The server and hostess was very friendly...The food was simply wonderful..Highly recommended

FKhaGq_PEUYqqEG6rmYgCQ.text: Omg so I was so excited to eat here  but it turned out to be HELL. We were sat down within 20 minutes and that was great it was very good timing. But when we ordered we placed orders for the hangar steak. The manager comes within 30 minutes to tell us that they ran out of hangar steak so if we wanted to go with something else. We chose the rib eye. It's been nearly another 30 minutes and still nothing. People around us already ate and left yet we are still here. So disappointed. Very poor service for such a great name. First and last time for me.

NsHTLSkUlVtuRMQWjtMs1Q.text: The ambience was eh, the food was surprisingly nothing to write home about. One waiter was sticking his fingers in the water bottles they were using to pour our beverages. Not what I expected but willing to try another GR restaurant in hopes of experiencing the greatness one anticipates when dining in a restaurant associated with the name.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Small but filling Lobster Rolls.
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Would have loved to have had the Wellington.

HS3lzn_vBr1aXnS_Eh1vNQ.text: Enjoyed this restaurant. Lisa was my waitress and made my experience really great...especially as I was dining alone.  The fish and chips were very good, just right. Batter light, not greasy...fish fresh.  I also ordered the Brussel sprouts. While the taste was excellent...they were just warm. Coffee and sticky toffee pudding were very good. I definitely recommend this restaurant.

SIonl8twQNgbPJHXr60KVg.text: We've been here many times. Food is always over-the-top excellent. Steak was superb and perfectly seasoned. Kettle chip nachos were so tasty-- a surprise with short rib and red and green peppers but all the right combination. Onion soup was flavorful in every way. Tonight, our waiter, Carlos was kind, attentive, and all-around top notch. A+++

Yo8h2eWvcSWePVouvI0oGA.text: I thought this place would be top of the line.  Wrong!  I liked the crab I had, onion soup was lacking for the price I paid and the fries were hard and lukewarm.  We had a man waiter in the bar area and he was very good.  Noticed everyone else was standing around doing nothing, but talking.  One blond lady waitress in the bar whose dress was so tight was just standing around talking and watching everyone to see if they were looking at her. This went on for the whole time we were eating.   She would bend over the men's tables and noticed if there were ladies at her tables, never saw her go back often.   I would not go back for every reason above.

OLc9zBikhY3oG_c5nGWO_Q.text: I am a Las Vegas "local" - I'm constantly in the area due to family business, but I rarely have time to visit the strip. This was my first time in a Ramsay restaurant and I was absolutely blown away. The decor is amazing, and the service and food is even better.   I ordered a goodbye blue sky cocktail, which was delicious. My friend and I also ordered flat iron steaks ($39) and a side of truffle chips (i don't recall price). I've had my fair share of steaks, but this was absolutely amazing. So flavorful and the pub steak sauce made it even better.  Truffle fries were delicious as well!  I would like to give a special shoutout to our server that night, Sladjan. I noticed that a number of customers were really giving him a hard time. My friend used to be a server and even said some patrons were a bit much. Because of how busy he was, we got our drinks a bit later. However, sladjan was very professional and apologized to us promptly once he realized this. He came back to our table numerous times to make sure we were happy and doing well, and even shared some stories and jokes with us. I've never had such a pleasant experience with a server before. I'm sure he was very tired, but he never let that show. He was always smiling and very professional. When i return i will be sure to ask for him if he's working. His service was impeccable and because of him, my experience was even better than what it was before. He even took our picture with the ramsay picture, then joined us for one picture afterwards!  I'll definitely be back - great food, better service - if you haven't been here before, you should check it out. It is one of the more affordable ramsay options, but that doesn't mean it isn't as amazing as his other restaurants on the strip.

vCuUOaqEoySbmqJWeq6Hvg.text: My wife and i stopped in for appetizers and desert. Sat at the bar so we could watch football. We had the tomato soup and mac and cheese. Food was very good and service was excellent. We tried the sticky toffee pudding. It was very good.

z-bV53mHA9FC4OW8ZgyFwA.text: Was super excited to try some food here.  Came to the casino just to try the food here at this Resteraunt and horrible customer service.  I ordered pub items and the menu clearly states 3 for $19. Pub items.  Bartender argued that is what only for mini macs and offer was not valid for the rest of the pub items. Co workers had to come in and verify it was for any 3 pub items.  Bartender then gets an attitude and says "well now we got to go tell the kitchen to cancel the extra mini Mac orders" very rudely and then left me hanging almost 20 minuets before taking care of my order and having the manager come out to fix the transaction. He never even apologized. Please learn your menu items and how to bill costumers correctly and offer more professional customer service! Terrible experience.  To top that off we stood on the other end of the bar and couldn't get any type of help all bartenders were free and ignored we were there trying to order. I had to approach them asking them to help me! Wow...

muUG3K4l95xRpA-z2m6Uww.text: We planned a trip to Las Vegas because my kids are HUGE Gordon Ramsay fans (esp love Hells Kitchen and MasterChef Junior). We went to Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill and Hells Kitchen. Food came out cold at both places. Not enjoyable at all eating cold food. Wouldn't Gordon Ramsay through cold food in the chef's face on the Hell's Kitchen show? Why is this acceptable at his restaurants? The food is not cheap, $59 for the beef wellington. I feel cheated and like a fool, and have lost respect for Ramsay. He owes my kids an apology.

0QtoX-oskSnPApRPutK8jQ.text: Perhaps unsurprisingly for a Gordon Ramsey branded restaurant, the food here is pretty great though the service is lacking. The beer menu is excellent with a ton of craft and small breweries available. The decor is a bit odd with a hit you over the head amount of British decor and kegs everywhere. Yes, we get it, it's a British pub. The food is excellent though, particularly the burgers. The Hell's Kitchen burger is fiery hot with some ghost pepper but not so much that it overwhelms the palate. The meat is well cooked and seasoned too and didn't get lost in the heat. Service was mostly non-existent and only showed up for orders and the bill.

2F8NvWBevAQakRatbE6_zA.text: Went with teenage son to enjoy happy hour food and atmosphere. Place was fairly empty. Food was great!! (Best Nachos ever!).  Service, not so much. On advice of server, tried a pear cider. Didn't care for it and didn't touch it after the first sip. 99 min later, still sitting there full and no comment from server. For 9 bucks (happy hour) you would think a place like this would offer another beverage.  To expensive place even at happy hour to not have GREAT service.  Lots of other options.   Update-- Received a form message added to my review from GRP saying they would reach out regarding my less than stellar review of the service received. After 3 weeks, no such message ever came.   Gotta believe they posted to my review so others would see it and believe they actually follow up.

F5QcqfDu0EqYgVMcOTM5fw.text: Just had lunch - great food and excellent service.  Heather was the best- great recommendations on food items and very personable.  Would come back

LueJqDqVCR4-i0Fp6lonRQ.text: This is one of our favorite must haves while in Vegas.  The food is amazing and service is always spectacular.  Heather was our server last time and she is the best!!!  I recommend the fish and chips and you cant go wrong with the sticky toffee pudding.

FMQ07OrywnjdjtfRU69XUg.text: 3 stars. I think my expectations were too high, sadly I was let down. The service was great. Our server even came to our rescue when he noticed our table was a bit wobbly (not a big deal but with the stemware they give you, it's easy to see why this could potentially be a disaster).  Okay the table is fixed and our orders are in. It didn't take long at all for our meals to arrive. I got the pub burger, my friend ordered the pork belly. They were just okay. Nothing to write home about. Forgettable. I think I'll try Gordon Ramsay BurGR next time instead.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pub Beef Burger

GYdfz9Z02aUIpIaV-esnoQ.text: I'm not giving them 5 stars because it's a Gordon Ramsey restaurant. They earned those stars with excellent service, our server was very knowledgeable made some very good suggestions for food and drinks, the atmosphere is comfortable enough to eat there in jeans, a tee shirt and sneakers but also classy enough to where you want to dress up for a night out. And let's not forget about the food, we both had a burger and they were cooked exactly how we ordered them and I wasn't looking for anything else on the burger. It was an excellent experience especially if you're a foodie.  One negative though, there was a slight odor from the English food and cigarette smoke from the casino mixing together.

-guoM8xo3xAOIzKj5YA4_w.text: Dining here felt like we were on an episode of Hell's Kitchen! Both blue and red teams have failed miserably! I was waiting to hear yelling and screaming from Chef Ramsay from the kitchen.  My cousin wanted to dine here before we proceeded with his bachelor party evening. We didn't make reservations here, so we ended up with a wait of forty five minute to an hour. When the estimated seating time came, we were seated promptly. While browsing our menus, our drink orders were taken and water glasses filled. I was very anxious and excited to try Chef Ramsay's favorite dish, beef wellington. Apparently, it wasn't on the menu. So, I ended up getting the roast prime rib entree, medium rare.  After twenty minutes had passed, we were told our entrees would be out in five minutes. Then ten, fifteen, and thirty came and went. Still, no signs of our entrees. Yet, other customers who were seated after us had their entrees served. We were all ready to get up and leave and dine else where. But, we all just decided to stick it through. Once our entrees were being served, they were served in waves. I was the last one in our party of seven to receive my entree.  For a $40 entree, I'll admit the entree looked hearty. The prime rib was cooked to a medium rare and accompanied with some glazed baby carrots, brussel sprouts, and mashed potatoes, and Yorkshire pudding. I had a side of creamy horseradish sauce, but no au jus for dipping. I would say that the prime rib was comparable to other dining establishments in Vegas. I would've been better off with the $10 prime rib dinners and paid way less than $40. But, I guess it was for the name and experience, right?  At the conclusion of our meal, my cousin went to place a complaint regarding our dinner service. The server and hostess were great, but not sure what was going on in the kitchen. I really wanted to like this place, but I wasn't impressed at all.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Medium rare prime rib with mashed potatoes,  glazed baby carrots,  brussel sprouts,  and Yorkshire pudding.

vuHW-laWcY4CJikVDmMjMA.text: This is not the first time we dining at Gordon Ramsay restaurants, maybe he got us to expect not more but excellent, but I'm sorry to say this time it wasn't the case. I asked for the vegetarian pie, it was promising, i got it warm only, asked if it cooked fresh, they said they make it here but warm it in special oven, it sure taste like it. Have to say they offer to replace it but I had to try, they serve it with very nice but very not fresh pretzel, I stopped eating. They say they will tell the manager, I guess it wasn't important enough or he was busy because we just got the bill with no charge of the pie. Again, maybe I expect too much, but for the price and what Gordon got us used to it's no less then big disappointment.

BzuiaXAXfB0a29kIRyBxCw.text: I had the salmon and creamed spinach...Possibly the best creamed spinach ever. The salmon was crispy on the outside and juicy inside, and nice and hot. We also had the flat iron steak. Good with a small serving of delicious mashed potatoes. Super neat ambiance. Great drinks. A tequila soda will cost $13 with house tequila which is Patron Silver.  Food came out fast and hot. I'd recommend eating here.

jbavZjH71ouK8eDP31iBlA.text: OK well I'm a big GR fan. I had high expectations. Had the famous fish and chips. Fish was good Chips cold and soggy,  pea mint just bland. Gordon would have sent it back. As Vegas restaurants go its pretty much the same as any. Phonie stuff on the strip.

zl707qJNwW0B2T-88-7Q8g.text: I was so disappointed in this restaurant. I love Gordon Ramsey and had really high hopes for this place. I ordered the fish and chips, the waiter said it was the most popular item on the menu. But it was very hard to eat, it fell apart and was greasy. Also the tartar sauce that it came with was bland. I was just expecting better.

OmOhVXZrGZiPF4Ku8dPyUQ.text: My boyfriend and I are absolutely in love with the Ramsay restaurants but, over the course of this last trip Pub has taken the cake.   First off, the five star rating should mainly just go to our bartender, Ray Ray. He's the type of guy you should blindly trust when it comes to your beverage and is an amazing person to get to know.   The food is just what you'd expect out of a Ramsay kitchen. We've tried things we liked and things we didn't think we'd like and ended up falling in love with.   My recommendations: Warm Salty Pretzels.  If you love mustard, the English Granary Mustard tops it.  Herb Caesar.  8oz Beef Tenderloin.  Yorkshire Ale Batter Fish & Chips.  Pistachio Pesto Chicken Sandwich (I have a sick obsession with pesto and this makes the top of the list). STICKY TOFFEE PUDDING.   Cocktails: Salted Caramel Apple.   Beer: Innis & Gunn.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States

vWyiUrPzzoCIhxPW7wjLQw.text: Amazing drinks and the bartender is down to earth and friendly. We had such a great time surrounded by a laid back atmosphere.  The menu looked amazing, but we had just come from lunch at Gordon's burger restaurant so we stuck to drinks. We topped off the experience by meeting chef Scott!  He was so nice and talked about show and took photos with us. For a Hells Kitchen fan this was an amazing birthday gift.   Thanks to the amazing staff for making us feel so special!

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Meeting Chef Scott

F-6tqP5kUqj_2haryrCjsg.text: Excellent fish & chips. Great selection of British style beers.

hjoYv7YBXBNqQTc-07AVVg.text: Stopped by for dinner. Love the decor and style - all the furniture, utensils, menus, place settings - everything says "English pub", a pleasure to look at and to hold. Definitely great ambiance.  We started with an appetizer of Calamari, and the dish was executed perfectly - great flavor, crispy but light calamari, elegant presentation.  For the entree, I was between Bangers and Mash and Beef Short Rib, and unfortunately, listened to our waitress' advice to take the short rib. The rib was cooked well enough, but had no flavor and lots of fat. Short rib is one of my favorite dishes, and I had much better versions at other places on multiple occasions. It was also served with some bland Barley Risotto which additionally dulled down the dish which was not great to begin with. We got Sticky Toffee Pudding for the dessert, and it was one of the highlights of the meal.  Service was friendly and attentive.   Recommended, but mostly for the ambiance.

e0hrR1ZLwM0x_9xQe92MsA.text: Poor wait staff. No chicken in chopped salad. Salt shaker did not work. Asked.  No bacon on burger , guess what we got.  Complained but were ignored.

DKtNPh3s9pGo5urkm_D1Rg.text: I was looking for a place to eat on my own and came across this place. Seems like there is a Gordon Ramsay restaurant on every corner in Las Vegas.  I took a seat at the bar and was quickly served by one of the bartenders. The menu contains a lot of classic British pub dishes, so I decided to go with the Fish and Chips. I'm typically not a fan of mushy peas as you usually get so much in the UK, but the bartender assured me they would be on the side.  The food came rather quickly and was an average portion size - 2 pieces of fish and some fresh cut potato wedges as fries. Mushy peas were like a condiment- the same serving size as the tartar sauce and ketchup.  The fish was good - crispy batter and tender fish, but nothing more special than a good corner fish and chip shop could do at a much lower price.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fish and Chips

2e545-DeeGNGg-meNV9OhQ.text: establishment is great, and quite large. We were immediately greeted and seated. Our waiter was very friendly and made us feel comfortable I ordered the 12oz NY strip steak MEDIUM RARE. It took about 30-45minutes and I was quite disappointed. My steak was overcooked, nowhere near medium rare, I could of made a scene and complained but my body was in much need of protein so I ate it and told our waiter to notify the chef about the overcooked steak. They apologized and offered me a new steak but I was in a rush and hungry so I was letting it slide.  Giving it another chance next time I come back to Vegas  Establishment 4/5 Waiter/Staff 4/5 Food 3/5 Price 2/5 (lower score the pricer it is) Cleanlines 4/5  Overall 3/5

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States

r1mjv76O8ZNU-IBbraMCNQ.text: Went in for lunch on out way out of Vegas. Our server was slammed but still did a great job of being attentive and making sure that we were okay. We ordered from the prix fixe menu which included Roasted Tomato Soup, Shepherds Pie and Sticky Toffee Pudding for dessert. Everything was SO GOOD! The Roasted Tomato Soup was what every tomato soup should taste like, creamy, tangy, warm, delicious. The shepherds pie was everything you want (especially if you are slightly hungover, which I was) creamy cheddar potatoes with a slightly crispy crust and a rich lamb stew, lamb was especially tender. Even better than all of that was the Sticky Toffee Pudding! I had a sliver of it at Gordon Ramsay Steak at the Paris (literally all you get is a sliver of the same deliciousness). I expected just a sliver here but was delightfully surprised to get a huge serving, I thought I was full but sinfully ate the entire thing! The ice cream and some of the pudding is a perfect bite every time!

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. STICKY TOFFEE PUDDING
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Roasted Tomato Soup
