That hellkitchen burger was phenomenal and way better then any burger joint out here in LA,  they also have some very delicious sauces that compliments the burgers.  I definitely suggest if you are staying in Vegas to try this place out, you won't regret it!

EXECMtJqyKJ4tYCGKB2kuQ.text: Omg!! Food was DELICIOUS!! And mind you we had Burgers ... they were the BEST.  Of course I had the Hell's Kitchen Burger and it was awesome, I normally don't like sliced jalapenos but I ate them in the burger and they were great!! The Ghost Pepper Jack Cheese was good!  The burger had a good balance of Heat!  Also, tried my husband's Wedge Salad and it was amazing!! Tasted the Bacon Burger the Bacon was delicious!!

aWvt_XajKhYWB9AkkTeq6Q.text: Nothing here disappointed. Not one thing.   The service was truly the best we've ever had and would be back just for that. Our server Adam was funny, engaging, knowledgeable, and readily available.   The food was very good and I honestly felt that while the prices tended to be on the higher side, it wasn't outrageous. My wife and I left feeling like the quality of the food we received accurately reflected the cost of each item. Simply put, it was worth it.   We started with the nachos which were incredible along with the lobster rolls. Now, we're from north of Boston and have a pretty high standard for a lobster roll. I can say that while this wasn't the best roll we've ever had, it was pretty fantastic for being in Vegas. Best one that I've had outside of New England for sure.   Our mains were the fish and chips and the curry chicken. Both excellent. Both larger portions than we could finish. We did our best to save room for dessert so we could have the toffee pudding. Again, excellent.  We loved out experience from start to finish. The food was as good (maybe better) than what we had at Gordon Ramsay Steak the following night and for much less.  Can't wait to go back.

dTTT_-aS_Dmvn0jwWwJkyA.text: Shrimp cocktail is the shit!! So damn good! Beef Welly was cooked to perfection! Drinks are well crafted.

-L1raWHQz5GEUQxaPNKdHw.text: Food was absolutely amazing. I had the salmon, my brother the 10oz steak. Taste was perfect! On top Heather gave us the truffle cake dessert for free, which was amazing.  Try the Cold Breeze drink!   Thanks for having us!! 5*

hjSELaVp7uYJlXw3gz16Mg.text: This review is only for the Sticky Toffee Pudding.   Come here for the Sticky Toffee Pudding!  What is Sticky Toffee Pudding?  It is Sticky, Toffee and Pudding...   Ok, really, it is a mini baked Date cake, drizzled in warm toffee/caramel sauce and served with vanilla ice cream.   If you like the warm chocolate cakes out there, you would enjoy this too.   If you are not having dinner, and you just want dessert, they can serve you at the bar. Bartenders are nice, and sometimes you hear interesting conversations from the people at the bar.

The meat had no flavor, although it was cooked perfect (pink in the middle). I had two Stellas and two sliders with fries for $45. Ouch! I expected much better.

a0F2ooDD4jXAcL22vRgY9w.text: You're getting the Vegas prices ($23 for a burger, almost $30 for fish and chips), but you're getting some damn good food for that price. The Pub also has a free sticky toffee pudding for checking in on Yelp, and it's no cheapie. It's decadently sweet and luxurious. I would recommend you start with pigs in a blanket. Cliche, you say? Not when the puff pastry is perfectly baked and just the right amount of flaky and buttery. I went with a medium rare burger after that (with bacon for another $2), and it made the world right again. Perfect sear on a medium rare 8oz patty in between two toasted brioche buns. Bring me back.

PeF32z8Az5AdIk-h2BeFjA.text: This was our 1st stop when we rolled into town! We were 3 hungry gals so we ordered a bunch of stuff to share:   Short rib kettle chip nachos: they didn't look like much plated but they were soo good! The waiter suggested short ribs so this was our compromise and it did not disappoint! Homemade chips with queso and short ribs cooked to perfection! Just the right amount of peppers to make the whole dish really flavorful.  Creamed spinach: really good! Eat this first before it gets cold!  Lobster Rolls: I didn't try these but my friends enjoyed them!  Chopped Salad: really good, light, healthy...a great compliment to the entrees we chose!  English Cheddar Beef Burger + bacon: BEST DAMN BUGER I'VE EVER HAD IN MY LIFE! Wow! Dreaming about this burger! You see Gordon bust out an amazing burger on TV but this is ridiculous! The truffle fries with garlic aioli were to die for as well!   Great drink menu that offers a great wine list, variety of beer and some mocktails so there is something for everyone here!   To top it off our waiter Julio made our experience amazing!  He was super helpful suggesting menu items, checked on us frequently, and was very personable. He brought us a warm sticky toffee dessert for my birthday with a scoop of vanilla bean ice cream...we didn't leave any behind! We literally canceled our dinner plans at another restaurant because we were soo full!  I would fly into Vegas just for this burger if I could! This will definitely be my 1st stop on my next trip!  Cheers to Julio! Ask for his section if you visit!! Gordon...this guy should be training servers! He's awesome!

0AMXqFuMTfwwkww1j-YMBw.text: I love deviled eggs.  They are one of my favorite things to eat, so I came out of my way to specifically go here, and unfortunately I was underwhelmed.  I was choosing between this and Bacchanal.  I wish that I'd have tried Bacchanal instead.  However, I also wanted to get some drinks and other things at a few other places, so I thought I'd be too full if I ate the buffet.  Anyway, I came here.  The layout of Caesar's is kind of strange, and the signs weren't helpful, so I walked for a long time, and just kind of ran into it.  If you're staying here, it would probably be easier for you.  I went at lunch, and it was not busy, and I decided to sit at the bar.  The bartenders were very nice, and one of them asked to help me right away.  They got me a menu and water.  I ordered the deviled eggs and a Goodbye Blue Sky drink.  The menu said the eggs have crab, so I ordered them without crab (I'm vegetarian).  The bartender then told me that they have crab mixed in them, so you can't get it without it.  I was really disappointed since I came here specifically for them.  However, then a waiter came by and he heard us, and said the deviled eggs don't have crab on them now.  He knew the menu still said it, but they don't actually serve them with it anymore.  I really don't watch any of the reality shows with him, but wouldn't Gordon Ramsey flip out if a restaurant's menu was wrong!?!  In any case, it worked out for me because I got my deviled eggs.  They were ready really fast, which was nice.  They weren't anything special though.  They were kinda pretty, but nothing too fancy.  I was really disappointed that I came out of my way for them.  They were fine, but I've had better ones at restaurants at home.  The drink was also just ok.  People seem to love it in the reviews, but it pretty much tasted like juice to me, and it was expensive.  Overall, I really wish I had gone to Bacchanal instead.  Or, I wish I'd gone back to Yardbird at the Venetian again.  Their deviled eggs are awesome!!  This place was nothing special.  I'd skip it.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Deviled eggs and Goodbye Blue Sky
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Deviled eggs
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bar

RHwFxB6UsSPSy-K2bG_hGA.text: So, being a big fan of Gordon Ramsay and his plethora of shows, You Tube channels and various cookbooks, my wife and I decided we needed to try his restaurants with each visit to Vegas. This most recent trip, we decided to try his Pub and Grill at Caesar's. What can I say? The man knows how to give you the dining experience you expect and more.   Atmosphere:  We reserved a spot on their website and arrived at the restaurant. It was a Thursday evening and the place was moderately busy. We waited about 5 minutes and then were seated promptly. Walking through the restaurant, you really felt like you were in a traditional English pub,but with a modern twist. There were barrels on the walls, cool looking mini chandelier lights hanging from the ceiling, flat screen TV's and tables with the half- rising comfortable booths.   Food:  The menu featured many traditional pub foods, which all sounded delicious. I had the scotch egg starter. Prior to this I hadn't ever tried it, but it was amazing! The inside egg was cooked nicely and just slightly runny, the crust on the outside was very crispy and the sauce complimented it perfectly; I could have eaten a small cup of it all by itself!   We ordered our main courses: I had the steak and ale pie and my wife had the shepherds pie. Both were traditional pub dishes and both were amazing. The steak pie had beef and veggies, both of which were very tender and delicious, surrounded by a crust that was extremely light, flakey and delicious. The shepherds pie was also very delicious. The lamb was very tender, the potatoes on top were so creamy, yet not very heavy tasting like you get with most mashed potatoes. Overall, great dishes!   I tried the sticky toffy pudding after hearing so many great things about it. It was a party in my mouth! So many delicious flavors between the ice cream, toffy and caramel. It was truly one of the best desserts I have eaten.   Service: Our server was amazing! From the time we sat down to the time we left, she was extremely laid back, friendly and very attentive to any needs we had. She gave us plenty of time to review the menu, order and brought out our food quickly. She was always on top of refills for water or other drinks we had. It was a very comfortable service experience.  Overall:  We were thoroughly impressed by the atmosphere, service and food of Gordon Ramsay Pub and Grill and I am not just saying this because I am a fan of GR. We went in putting our fan bias to the side wanting to truly experience all this restaurant had to offer. It definitely did not disappoint. If you are looking for a very authentic English  pub experience with a modern twist this is the place to go to in Las Vegas. For a lunch or dinner out or just for some beers and appetizers, this place has you covered. We'll definitely be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Scotch Egg- Delicious!
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Steak and Ale pie- Great dish!

u_3qSnhp8eRxLubzVaVeIQ.text: Dined here on September 9, 2019 for lunch and it was fantastic!  Jenny was my server and she was the absolute best - friendly, attentive - a great asset to the restaurant.  For my meal I had the signature Beef Wellington (although I've dined at other Gordon Ramsay restaurants I had yet to try it) and it did not disappoint.  It was tender, flavorful and cooked to perfection in a buttery flaky crust.     Wow!  Will definitely get it again.  I had a Caesars Diamond Celebration Dinner $100 certificate to use (and it had to be used all in one shot or you lose what you don't use) so I got the BLT and Caesar Salad with chicken to go.  They were both outstanding when I ate them later on (I purposely got things I knew would be good cold).    For checking in on Yelp I got a free Sticky Toffee Pudding (Ramsay's signature dessert) and lets just say it is a decadent slice of heaven on a plate.  I've had it before, so I knew what to expect.  It's worth coming here just for that!   I had a great experience and highly recommend Gordon Ramsay Pub at Caesars Las Vegas.

Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Close up of Wellington
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beef Wellington (amazing)!

0XDPMY_WFPEwed6Ru02nwg.text: HIGHLY RECOMMENDED!!!!  My experience here was so positive I came back to eat again the next night. I knew the food would be delicious again and the service was great. The first night I had the tenderloin and the apple tart. I also used the check-in offer for their signature dessert.    The tenderloin was honestly one of the best I've ever had! The temperature (medium for me) was perfect but the smoky oak flavor and slightly crispy crust put it over the edge for me. Absolutely delicious and perfect!  The Apple Tart was amazing and the salted caramel ice cream balanced the flavors wonderfully.   Service from Ronni and Nong was TOP NOTCH!    I returned the next evening with my wife and they made it special once again!  This time my wife had the tenderloin (she described it as the best she's ever had) and we had the wings as well and they were absolutely DELICIOUS!  The balance of savory and sweet with a slight bit of heat. The meat of the wings was mostly tender but slightly crispy, too - great balance once again.   Our whole experience was excellent and we can 100% recommend it. We will return soon for sure  Update:   We just went there again!    I took buddies there & they said it was the best (Prime Rib & Beef Wellington)  they'd ever had. We had appetizers, drinks & dinner and all left glowing.   I went again with my wife 2 nights later & sat at the bar. Nong and Johnathan treated us like VIP guests again and made sure everything was special.  We had drinks, dinner and dessert - savoring every bit of it.   We won't forget going here and will return every time we're able.   Well done, Gordon Ramsay's Pub & Grill!  Every time we go you consistently impress us!

FLMtDvfAmn0emqVsrUOo_g.text: I tried the Roasted Beef Wellington and it was delicious! The meat was tender and cooked perfectly. The sauce was smoky and the vegetables were a nice complement to the beef. Chris P. Gave us a nice service too. Everyone was really nice actually.

This being my first experience, I'll vouch for the lamb burger that was cooked and seasoned perfectly! The truffle fries were amazing all by themselves.   Needless to say, the level of service at any restaurant, in and by itself are the game changers for me...and our hostess (Heather) was hands down an A+++. She was attentive, friendly and should be an example for all other hostesses to emulate.   Definitely worthy of a return visit!

HOwNNjNivVXt-A9rLSM6Xw.text: I was "braised" to learn to love and appreciate food .. Surely, Gordon Ramsay was one of my inspirations!  Food: (first) Braised Short Ribs, (second) Fish and Chips, (third) Pigs in a Blanket, (fourth) Sticky Toffee Pudding  Price: $39, $30, $14, $12  Ratings:  I loved the tenderness of the braised beef. Super tender and not that salty. My mom ordered their Certified Black Angus Tenderloin (8 ounce-$43). It was a perfectly cooked medium steak! Super juicy and very tender.  I also enjoyed the pigs in a blanket, which had three mini hot dogs. We ordered this for our appetizers, which was really good to share amongst 2-3 people. The sausage was very crisp on the outside and warm and tender on the inside.   I also tried their fish and chips! It wasn't too bad, but for the price, I did wish that they gave more of the fish in relations to the ratio of the French Fries.   I definitely recommend trying their sticky toffee pudding! However, be warned! It is a little sweet as the server pours it for you to create that sticky toffee pudding. Nonetheless, it was still very creamy and yummy.   Service was pretty good. You can make reservations! We walked from Palazzo to Caesars Palace (~10 mins!)

hC_-NXBamM8ou5xq7hSFjA.text: *Check In for Free sticky toffee pudding!  We finally tried the pub but dined about 8:45pm so we were there more for a snack. Ordered: . Steak Tartare app - have had better and this should've been chopped finer . Pork Belly app - very tasty with super crunchy skin; scarce sauce was delicious  .  Butter Chicken curry - probably not as popular as other items but we wanted something light. It's tasty if you're not feeling something heavy.   Service was very attentive.

b2U10xfjg-cKXTqH0KifTQ.text: We recently took a long vacation with good friends and their two teenage sons. At the end of our trip, we ended up in Vegas and went to Gordon Ramsay Pub and Grill at Caesars.  Ryan, age 13 is a real fan of GR so he was very excited and had high expectations.  We were served by Lisa and Alex. They were both attentive, professional, pleasant, and added positively to the whole experience.  We started with the nachos and lobster mac. Gobbled both up and licked the plates!  We each ordered an entree: Wings, Pesto Chicken, Reuben, Fish &Chips, Bacon Burger and Lobster Roll. WOW! All delicious! Then we met the manager, Derek. Class act, all the way. He brought Ryan some GR swag which was totally unexpected. While we were waiting for the bill, Lisa and Alex appeared with two Sticky Toffee Pudding deserts for Ry and told us they were from Gordon. We were floored!  Desert was over the top good and we were left with full bellies and great memories.  This was my wife's and my 4th time here. Each has been great but this one topped them all!  Thank you so much to Lisa, Alex and Derek!

1rgj8coXc7Gd88xClA9l4A.text: I had the chance to visit this location in May while on a business trip. Rodney was amazing! Had the poutine out so quick. He had such great recommendations too. We enjoyed the poutine and the sliders so much. I will for sure be back next time I am in town, would love to bring my husband next time.   We also got the free dessert check in offer, and OMG that this was to die for!

YFSfND9MKKpM-U1I5ADIWg.text: So I feel like maybe I'm being a little too critical with my 4 Star rating, but I have pretty high standards for any Ramsay establishment.   Food and drinks were all good, some were great. Service was attentive but not necessarily personable or warm. Accommodations were comfortable and unique, like an upscale sports lounge.   I can't remember the exact name of my cocktail, but it was the one with "blue" in the name; it was incredible. However, my boyfriend ordered a Moscow mule and it was oddly not served in the traditional copper cup, but a highball glass instead and I think it affected the drink.   We had the poutine starter and the flavors were great! Fries cooked to perfection, appropriate amount of gravy, and flavorful corned beef for a Ramsay twist. However, I felt the cheese curd component was a little skimpy on the portion as they were only on the top and had been put under a salamander/broiler style equipment, so they were slightly tough, chewy and did not unify the dish like gooey and melted cheese  in traditional poutine.  I had the side order of lobster macaroni and cheese for my entree and still had leftovers, it's huge. And amazing. Tons of lobster chunks and a flavorful cheese sauce. Taylor had a bacon cheese burger, also huge. And more perfect fries. But he couldn't stop raving about the aioli it came with and dipped his fries in it all night, which is a big deal because he doesn't think he likes "mayonnaise".   Our service experience was not lacking, but it also wasn't memorable or anything beyond what you would expect from a full service restaurant.   The restaurant sits next to the casino floor but the main dining room feels separate enough and the smoke is not intrusive. Entering Caesars on the south side bridge (connecting from Bellagio) you would cross the casino floor, towards Apian Way- a marble row of shops. Go straight across the walkway and it will pop out on another area of the casino floor; the restaurant is to the left on the left. You will notice a bunch of beer kegs and masculine colors- that's it!

He knows what it takes to make a successful menu that caters to Alllll, and how to stay relevant at all his different restaurants. We enjoy dining at all his restaurants and blessed enough to have tried them All.

i24ARcTUyWBjoOVmXAYq8A.text: I am a HUGE Gordon Ramsay fan, but I have to honestly say I was expecting a little bit more from this restaurant. The portions are big, so you can share with people. However, the food quality was just average; considering Gordon Ramsay put his name on this restaurant.  It's a little bit more pricier than your average pub, but the quality of food is SLIGHTLY better. Maybe I am just being critical since it's Ramsay's restaurant, but trust me, I wanted to give it a better rating if I could.   The group decided to share some wings and nachos with each other, and those were pretty good. I did not like my selection of veggie pie.. tasted a little bland.  Cocktails were served quickly, and the service was nice!

BdUi1Wg0YJs_IPYQX0eTpA.text: Great food, great ambiance, great beer! Highly recommend! Ordered the scotch eggs and the fish and chips along with a beer at the bar! One of my go to places when I visit for work.

z2xGcLn5jvsXyM1lZBiU_Q.text: Rssevation at 545. Seated at 610. Tried to get a drink at the bar while waiting took 15 minutes.  Seated and no sign of a waiter for 10 minutes. The service sucks. So the overpriced food better be good.  That will be the only way this is a 1 star.   Well....medium well burger was medium rare. Fish. One filet was overcooked and one was mushy.  So food was a 1 Star also.

h-s3-C3iBw76_aNOEK8wWg.text: Happy Hour: Monday - Friday 2pm to 5pm HH Specials: Draft Beers Starting at $9 pint, Wines Starting at $9, Specialty Cocktails $12, $5-7 apps  Nestled inside Caesar Palace, Gordon Ramsay's Pub & Grill is teleports you from Vegas into a British pub. We sat at the bar and admired the wall made of barrels that were part of the decor. Matt, our bartender, was an awesome guy who mastered the art of balancing several patrons. We never felt ignored or smothered. I got the smoke and mirrors, which I really like because it was the perfect combination of sweet and strong liquor. I also got the goodbye blue sky and it tastes exactly like the purple skittle. It was good but too sweet for me.   If you check in, you also get a free sticky toffee pudding! So we got that and an order of the truffle fries. Matt aptly named them "death by truffle" because there's truffle oil as well as bits on the top of the fries. They were deliciously crispy which I loved. One of our nearby patrons got the nachos and said those were worth it too!   All in all, if you want a place to duck away from the fast pace of the Strip but not leave the Strip, I'd recommend this place.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Goodbye Blue Sky
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Smoke and Mirrors

GtuedXse2GOHa8UW_8_AEA.text: This is my first time here and, I had an amazing experience. Of course, my great experience is due to the amazing FOOD but also because of the waiter, Rodney's, amazing service! He is so friendly, attentive, and interpersonal! Rodney was like an old friend treating me to his restaurant. He kept checking on me and suggesting if I needed anything to make my experience here better! Gordon Ramsay, please give Rodney the best recognition for extending and expanding the wonderful experience of your Pub and Grill! Additionally, I would like to provide my experience of the food. We did the 3 course meal of the diver scallops, beef Wellington, and the sticky toffee! The scallops were by far my favorite-- absolutely delicate and delectable! I'm not one for medium rare meat but after the Wellington, I'm a huge fan! The Sticky Toffee was absolutely delicious, flavor town indeed! Perfect experience! Thank you to the food and thank you to Rodney!

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. From left to right: Waiter Rodney, my mother, my stepdad, and me!

lLjYB110N2S1siBq3-nZ4Q.text: Honestly surprised at how bad this food was! The bad flavor and bad service was not a great representation of Chef Gordon...with the amount of reviews this place has you would think it should have more then three and a half stars. If I was Gordon Ramsey I would take this place out of the equation because it's embarrassing. Either that or fire the chef and staff and start over!

odNhMsKcYkyVzxyoTyS9_w.text: What an amazing experience. Rodney was on point with the recommendations and knew the beer and food menu very well! My husband told him the type of beer he liked and Rodney matched it perfectly with his recommendation. I ordered the union jack IPA and it was good. We started off with the white cheddar and garlic mini mac. The portions are good size and the flavor was an explosion in my mouth. Garlic is my new go to to add in mac! We split the beef Wellington, a must if you eat at one of his restaurants that offer it. Splitting it was a good choice and it was very filling. The mashed potatoes it came with was perfection. The asparagus, I could eat a whole plate of it alone. The beef Wellington was cooked to a MR and it was absolutely delightful! We ended with the sticky toffee pudding (made with sweet dates) and it was the perfect sweet ending to a delicious filling meal!

Iy2E5pwW8YStSarM4Uxxpw.text: Our waiter was absolutely awesome, great experience! Lobster and shrimp rolls were so yummy, perfect lunch meal!

Qs1bSJgUufDEW-zHa42UNw.text: All the food tasted fantastic. I had the wings and shepherds pie while my girlfriend had the chopped salad and sliders and we both enjoyed our meal immensely. I'm only taking a star off Bc the service was a little slow, our appetizers took a long time to come out, and the vegetables to accompany the wings and shepherds pie were pretty sad/old

Bqiy9uvwhrnDqqsn8t8hlw.text: Gin and Juice are the best bartenders in town! Also the sticky toffee pudding is to die for

jl783xxmdCvcyhb258BFyg.text: We had the braised beef nachos as an appetizer and they were amazing. The beef Wellington and Shepherds pie were also delicious. Overall, great food and amazing staff- especially Andre!!!!!!!!! Thanks for a great night.

P_ypyKjovnSfwYuRcdLv2g.text: Such a bummer. We were very excited to eat some steaks and sides here. I ordered a ribeye medium rare with creamed spinach. The ribeye was the worst cut of meat I've ever had and it had zero flavor/seasoning. The creamed spinach had an inch-thick layer of loose panko crumbs on top that I had to scrape off in order for it to be edible. I mentioned to the waiter that my steak tasted "like nothing" and he offered to swap out my ribeye for an alternate protein. I was given the prime rib, after a 20 minute wait, which was also flavorless. When the bill arrived, they charged me for the prime rib which was more expensive. My husband ordered a NY strip steak which wasn't half bad. Overall, we spent $200 and I ate maybe 5 bites of my meal.

tXYUhJ20_GybEmKTgaLTUA.text: When in Vegas you definitely need to make your rounds of restaurants with famous-chefs-names in them. This was an exceptional restaurant with pretty tasty food in a convenient location inside of Caesars palace. Nice beer selection and tasty food.

KjnJeXYQIjt5FGXOgBB7YQ.text: Sadly wasn't too impressed.  I think Gordon needs to pop in and try his own dishes.    The chicken I had had no taste and the burger my girlfriend had was dry.     Fries were just luke warm.   Expensive restaurant for mediocre food.   We were a party of 6 hoping for a better experience

sGMnS7RfuHXzaUR7BcsKBg.text: I'll admit I'm a die hard Ramsay fan, have been for years. So when I visit Vegas, I always eat at one of his restaurants.  For the price point, the pub and grill is worth a try.   We stopped by for happy hour and started with the servers nacho recommendation.  Think midrange pub nachos with kettle chips, but kick it up a notch. The chips were flawless, cheese of good quality, meat not overcooked, and less greasy than expected.   For drink, I tried the Moscow mule. It tasted great, but I really wanted it to come in a copper mug instead of glass.   For main course, I tried the fish n chips. It came with two pieces of fish, wedge cut fries, and some mushy peas. For the price, I was hoping for a three piece, but the fish was well seasoned, tender, and flakey. Definitely some of the best fish n chips I've had.   The fries were a big let down. I prefer mine crispy, while these were more on the soggy side. The mushy peas were made well, but weren't appealing to my palette.   My partner ordered the maple fried chicken sandwich. It was huge, tasty, a slight bit dry, but did not disappoint.   We wanted dessert, but were stuffed and already in a serious food coma.   Despite mediocre fries, I still think this restaurant is worth a 5 star rating when compared to other restaurants in its category.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fish n Chips

vdNog9LakizrhIkxteWxhg.text: This is the second time I've had the pleasure of eating here, and a pleasure it is! The big Bloody Mary is a meal in itself, and very tasty! The first time I was here I had the Bangers and Mash, and my tummy was in heaven! Great texture and flavor in the sausage, yum. On this most recent trip, I had the mini cheeseburger appetizer as I wasn't super hungry, and it was perfect. So often, sliders are dry and puckish, but these were incredible! Perfectly grilled to a nice juicy medium, the generously sized  and delicious patty filled the tender brioche bun and was smothered in cheese and a crisscross of bacon! Yum! They also do a great job with their cocktails. My friend is picky about her greyhound, she likes just a splash of grapefruit juice, and the bar got it right every time. Our server, Afro, was beyond excellent! He made good suggestions, knowing we weren't starving, and was a delight. I would request his table again for sure! Love Gordon Ramsay and love the Pub & Grill!

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bangers and Mash!

LTdO5FiGfLBB9Q5BzAikdg.text: Fantastic food. We have always been a fan of Gordon Ramsay so this was one of our Vegas Bucket List items. Does NOT disappoint! Perfect spot for lunch.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Our waiter Scott (daytime) was awesome! Delicious food!

oXFzABs9Wuh2Kw14LvGbkg.text: I downloaded the yelp mobile app just so I could write a review. Horrible food. Butter chicken is not butter chicken. It is shredded chicken with an unappetizing sauce.  It reminded me of an americanized mexican shredded beef dish served in a cheap restaurant known for something like their " $2 dollar margaritas". The basmati rice was an embarrassment. I also tried the truffle fries. The oil is past due and the fries taste like it. This entire dish should apologize to all of India for masquerading as butter chicken.  I wrote this and then saw the guy below me. He is spot on. This butter chicken is horrible.

lGV9iPwhHE4tHr6BHrq-dw.text: Delicious food, had prime rib and wife had beef Wellington. Great service from Rodney, all staff friendly. Would recommend.

CVvvYEID7qb9lAYJpgjBCA.text: Absolutely amazing food. We were so hungry we got the Hellfire Wings, Burger Slider, Truffle Fries, and Butter Chicken Curry. Wrapped up with the Sticky Toffee Pudding and the Potted Chocolate Trifle. Not one dish was a let down. Every one of these dishes is a Five Star to me.  Plus, it doesn't hurt having one of the best service experiences we have had eating at various restaurants. Rodney is absolutely amazing and next time we visit, we hope we get him as our server!

GwzlKqkEcClBz5yec5GthA.text: I'm yelling this out: You've got to be kidding me! You yell at people all day and this is what your restaurant serves?! Adjfirnfjeifks!!!  The wings were way too sweet. Fried chicken sandwich was really just too soggy. What's the point of frying a chicken if you're going to serve it cold and wet? The answer: to get bad reviews.

M4X4cfIBQy21NgDgLNWpkQ.text: This was a great Gordon Ramsey compromise if you don't want to pay an arm and a leg but still want to eat Gordon's classics. I went thinking I'd get the fish and chips but we decided to split a Beef Wellington. It had always been my dream to try it since I've watched every season of MasterChef. The server Rodney suggested we share an appetizer and then the Wellington and that was the perfect amount of food. We had the braised beef kettle chip nachos and they were good. They were definitely the fanciest nachos I've ever had. Then came the Wellington. Oh goodness it was a EVERYTHING! I have never had beef that cut like butter. The potatoes were potatoes, velvety smooth but could have used a smidge more butter but that could just be me since I live buttery potatoes. It was such a rich flavorful pricey plate, but it was worth the splurge. The awesome thing was that they offered a free sticky toffee pudding if you checked in on yelp and it was AMAZING! The combination of caramel and ice cream and cake was so perfect. It's one of my favorite desserts now. It could have been really sweet given its components but it was so wonderfully balanced. I'm sure we'll be going back whenever we're in Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sticky Toffee Pudding of my DREAMS
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Braised beef kettle chip nachos and a Stella
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fantastic beef Wellington

HZdN6mCIBlUvI0Yvz564dA.text: Came here for after dinner drinks and wasn't disappointed. Great service and a great pour.

-mEGIDBmJW_z3BHIrf5meA.text: The Pub is next to the casino and has an open bar area, but there is also a dining room that is protected from the hoi polloi (and the smoke) and makes you feel like you are in a pub in England (except for the waiters lederhosen and newsprint uniforms - there are no uniforms at English pubs).    We were seated immediately, but there was a slow start to our service which was always rather harried and not particularly friendly.  We started with the warm pretzels ($8) with a white cheddar sauce and seedy English mustard.  The cup with three pretzel sticks were perfect - a nice crispy skin and tender interior.  The creamy and slightly sharp cheese sauce and the gourmet mustard were plentiful and great for dipping (separately and together).  This was a great prelude.  For our entrees, we split the wedge salad and the mixed vegetable salad ($15 and $16 each).  The wedge salad was quite good - baby iceberg was sweet and crisp and topped with grated hardboiled egg, bits of blue cheese and bacon and crispy onions and sat in a bed of creamy blue cheese dressing with a drizzle of sherry vinaigrette on the top.  It was a hearty salad that was at once rich, sweet, salty and tangy.  I would definitely get this again.  The mixed vegetable salad was a melange of spring greens with shaved fennel, carrots and radishes and bits of cucumber and halved cherry tomatoes that were overdressed with a white balsamic vinaigrette and finished with some crunchy caramelized cashews.  Other than the excess dressing, this was a very good salad.    Overall, it was a 3.5 star experience.  I know from experience that the potted chocolate trifle is worth the trip, and the wedge was great as well as the pretzels.  The other salad and the service were not as wonderful, but such is the Vegas food scene.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Wedge Salad

bfBvZBJPiz_fNwPA6z3laQ.text: I just had what could be the worst meal ever. Overpriced, (yeah I know I'm in Vegas) but all the more reason that my overpriced meal should look good and taste as good as it looks, even from the menu description.  Chef Ramsey should do an Undercover Boss epipsode just to see what is going on. The spouse and I had a series of small plates since we had just landed and checked into Caesars Palace and did not want to go on a hunt for some snacks.  I ordered the British Cheese Bread just to get a glimpse of what is going on cuisine-wise in the British Isles. Terrible. "Rye" bread smothered in some kind of cheddar cheese wiz kinda sauce with a tomato slice buried in there somewhere!  The Smoked Salmon on Toast with truffle cream cheese was a hit but too little smoked salmon swimming in a puddle of cream cheese.  The kettle chips nachos were piled high with some kind of mild red chilies and very little short ribs. They are Gordon's own secret nachos recipe, maybe he forgot to tell the kitchen how to make them.  The small burgers (two to a plate) were quite good as were the wings, but those items two alone would not make me want to walk the gauntlet to get to this place, and we were staying at the resort.

VBbfBBr5C8YFYx3hFdxZVQ.text: I came here with 4 friends. First time visiting a Vegas and a Gordon Ramsey restaurant, and thanks to Heather our server it won't be the last. What a great staff and delicious pigs in a blanket for happy hour!

1PMi1QHxajZh7V-_0plzRQ.text: Great steak and some of the best brussel sprouts I've ever had. I wish we had more time to grab another meal, but definitely plan on going back!

mDYHgyfFrTqtDj-39Xpc-g.text: Love this restaurant.  Great experience, delicious food, Caesar salad, Sheppard's pie & lamb shank with sticky toffee pudding paired with a bottle of Orin Swift Abstract,  soils all the way around   Chris P. Our waiter was an added bonus to the evening  great service, attentive to every detail.  Definitely going to be a go to spot.

jPbAlFBPzL5wAG4h4YYjOQ.text: Nong has the best service in town! Great atmosphere, great food, good beer choices. Had a pleasant and kitchen service was fast.

rgoqByhJ-p-dQCI6EQzAig.text: We enjoyed our visit to the Pub and Grill. The Corn Beef Poutine was outstanding. I would go there again to just get that appetizer. The Shepards pie was very good except (excellent presentation) for me it was too salty. I liked the bread that came with it. Very good! I must confess that I eat a very low salt diet and my food would not be on par with Ramsey's version of a well-salted meal but I have been traveling all week eating out and no other place I ate was I so overwhelmed with too much salt as I was with the Shepards pie. My daughters steak was excellent.  The wait staff was excellent. He sure knows how to pick a good team.  Something I must mention is the place was loud for me (Ya I am older) but it seemed the cats meow for the younger crowd. Something I picked up while watching his shows was they he believes restaurants should be lively (loud).

Fnk1ng5O35cqvMbiqjMM6g.text: Continuing our Ramsay themed Vegas vacation, we had an awesome lunch at his pub! We had the wings, pigs in a blanket and chicken curry, all with incredible service from Adam.

sTSUxP_C6YhT_Nxd9b861w.text: Adam was a great server. Very attentive and friendly!! The sticky toffee dessert needs to go back to original though. Bring on the vanilla ice cream on top and drizzle the caramel sauce. Please!!

RFKCfJGyWf3BJ31_JH_aig.text: It was pretty good, but I was expecting better. The steaks were okay at best no wow. The truffle fries were amazing though.

Y5b9ZnsN4hLOdTmhBoA_1Q.text: I came here mainly for his much touted Fish and Chips.  $30 for two small pieces of fish with an ample but limp amount of chips.  I will admit the fish was good but $30 price tag is ridiculous.  On his most recent TV episode, it was a team challenge featuring the Fish and Chips and a sandwich.  The going price on that episode was $10 for the Fish and Chips  I will admit, the fish tasted good, the service was adequate but the prices were ridiculous.  I later found out his other restaurant at the Linq offers the Fish and Chips for $10.99

y4LHpJaFB6QU3IBHMCEwIA.text: We did not plan on coming here to eat and  just so happen we were starving when we did. I ordered the lamb and my man ordered the ribeye steak, oh my gosh!!! The best lamb and the best ribeye that has ever entered my belly. I highly recommend everyone come here!  I dream of eating here again.

LTXo5VmpmdECkaOuNYlPyA.text: conveniently right on casino floor and ronni the bartender is super helpful and awesome !!

LoOKw7VYBMpLRjbqYja_Sg.text: David is great! Friendly and quick service, and personable. Ambiance was great. We got seated right away and food was prompt. There's a lot of tough competition in Vegas, and this place is at the top of the list. Will be back!

-vRbQ9B-odUwkd_viv8UlA.text: My favorite place in Vegas.  Steak, ribs or with salad wedge was the bomb!!! Must have desert.  Pudding is amazing balls.

3jLGPRHR_8eHMP7ILTyxkw.text: I have never had a chicken pie as delicious as the one I had here. The natcho's with beef were amazing. The atmosphere is very British with fabulous distressed tables and chairs. Staff were funny and gracious making the whole meal one to remember. It isn't cheap, but, the portions are huge. I would share a starter if you really want to enjoy your meal. This place is one of my favourites and I will visit again. One tip is to ask for a table near the back of the restaurant as the noise from the slots could be a bit distracting. I loved it though as I like to people watch.  Thanks for a fabulous meal!

mUXIBXlBGOGT9B9HoDcvvw.text: Holy Crow!!!!   Just had dinner here tonight, and it was a completely awesome experience - I hardly know where to start!  THE DECOR/AMBIANCE. Loved, loved, loved the decor, different sections/seating areas and especially loved the bold,  colored stripes down the middle of the whole restaurant.  I'm a geek for great graphic design and this place kicked some major ass in that regard.  MENU. Not huge (2 large pages), which was totally fine by me because it tells me they are sticking with what they do best. Only 2 vegetarian options for my friend, but a few sides were vegetarian-friendly... just not called out on the menu as such.  As a carnivore, I had more than my share of choices.   SERVICE. Everyone I spoke with (phone-for reservation) and met were very friendly and helpful. Adam Z. was our server, and he was awesome.  Adam was fun, engaging, had the menu details nailed (which greatly helped my friend pick her entree), and a real sweetheart of a guy who made our experience truly memorable.  When you go (when...  NOT if), be sure to ask for Adam Z!  Lastly, THE FOOD.  Ah the food.  Veggie Dish of the Day:  delish.  Bacon Cheeseburger:  excellent. Truffle Fries:  fantastic. (Didn't have the Fish and Chips, but the guy next to me did and they looked heavenly.)  STCKY TOFFEE PUDDING:  THE BEST FOOD (not just limited to desert) IVE EVER EATEN...  EVER!!!   No exaggeration, the sticky toffee pudding is hands down the best thing I've ever had - it's an absolute MUST-HAVE when you go.  I just finished eating and I'm stuffed, but I'm seriously already planning to go back tomorrow just for the Sticky Toffee Pudding, and the next night...  Such a cool place with fantastic food. p.s. Consider yourself extra lucky if you get one of the dog chairs like I did. #Bramble

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The best thing you&#39;ll ever eat.  Ever. Sticky Toffee Pudding.

2SmKwA0Rvr7Kc4kxiZYSXw.text: Food: 3/5 stars I think I set my expectations too high, and I got disappointed. I got a sandwich and it was very ordinary, taste-wise and presentation-wise. It came with chips on the side which weren't fresh, and they were a tad too thick for me.   Drinks: 5/5 stars 5 stars for Goodbye Blue Sky! If I remember correctly, it is their best-seller. It has the perfect blend of alcohol and fruity flavor. Definitely a must-try!  Service: 5/5 stars The staff are real friendly! They also gave my aunt newly cooked burgers after she initially complained about the patties being a bit raw.   If you're in Vegas and you want to dine in a celebrity chef's restaurant, I strongly suggest you go to GIADA instead at the 2nd level of The Cromwell. You'll get more value for your money there. It's fancier and it also has a spectacular view!

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Wasn&#39;t impressed with the plating, but I really loved the Goodbye Blue Sky cocktail!

2VTLwMlEp2eNvmN3uBQXNg.text: This was probably one of my favorite dining experiences. It wasn't anything too crazy but the food was so on point! I ordered a burger and decided that however it came was how I was going to try it. My husband ordered shepherds pie I believe. My burger was so damn good. They served it with this mayo that's made in house and it's got a hint of garlic or something, it was seriously so good. That's all I put on my burger and it was perfect. Cooked perfectly how I ordered it. The atmosphere was great! Our server was super friendly and very helpful in helping us decide. Our dessert was out of this world good! Definitely will go again!

wzEIO3q74TlfvYQhnG7xeQ.text: WOW! Service and food was impeccable!!! Randy made our night stand out from any other place we visited during our stay in Vegas. AWESOME. The Sticky Toffee Pudding was perhaps THE BEST dessert I've ever had. Thank you Randy for recommending it!

Ecy5OiMnCKmYMpqRvFoX2A.text: Always fun to hit up one of Gordon Ramsay's restaurants. Needed a quick dinner before hitting the tables, so we ended up at ceaser's palace and found this place.  Was torn between the fried chicken sandwich or the Hell's Kitchen burger, and went for the chicken.  Pretty good, but it was super heavy! The fried were delicious too...all in all, will be back, but this time to try the burger.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fried chicken sandwich

YYs80FR-SvtHSazOxXYM1g.text: I've been here several times and will definitely be back for more. Sometimes the table service can be a little slow, so if you're in a hurry (catching lunch at a conference) stick to the bar. But no matter where you sit, the food never disappoints. The bangers and mash are my second favorite in town (Nine Fine Irishman still hold first place), the burgers are great, sides are phenomenal and this version of sticky toffee pudding is my favorite of the three Vegas Gordon Ramsey restaurants. Beer and liquor selection is outstanding and they have the best happy hour menu in the whole place (Caesar's).

IC7wS8WUsy6k9l9y18cY_g.text: Some of the best fish and chips that I have ever had and it comes with mushy peas. The staff was outstanding and the beer and wine options are plentiful.

QHxB5WoRdADXpcEtH5do2w.text: I seriously love this restaurant, every year when I come to Vegas I come here for the nachos! By far the best in the world!

vvNb-PDaADSbAO_RzzUDqQ.text: Terrible representation of my chef hero, Gordon Ramsay. I was extremely looking forward to trying my first Ramsay restaurant and left disappointed. I've watched every season of MasterChef/MasterChef Junior and Hell's Kitchen, so I feel like Gordon has subconsciously trained me to know how a decent meal is cooked. Unfortunately, my 1st negative YELP review goes to the fish n chips entree. I remember him on a MasterChef season yelling at a contestant for putting steamy, hot food over fries. Why? Because it makes a soggy mess on the bottom of the fish batter and soggy fries on top. Also, the batter was way too heavy that I scooped out the cod which ended up to be terribly seasoned and bland. Our waiter says that this entree is the most requested..really?! I know he just opened up a fish n chips restaurant, and I hope it's a lot better than what I ordered.   However, my mother ordered the Shepard's Pie which she thoroughly enjoyed. I did appreciate the kind hosts in the front and our waiter who was very friendly and engaging.   Please make sure that soggy fish and chips doesn't get through the pass..you might disappoint more Ramsay fans other than me. Chef Kristin from Hell's Kitchen was my all time FAV, so it might have been just an off day. I'm just pretty bummed that I'm heading back to LA not raving about this place to my friends.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. :(((
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Calamari was really good!

QI_iKe8najYsVW0RJY8yJA.text: Food itself is pretty on point. I had a perfectly cooked steak and nice sliders here. BurGR gets all the attention and unfortunately i can't compare between the two but dinner was good. The truffle fries were delicious! Service was a little lacking. The table next to us was seated after us but given their order much faster. We mentioned this to our waiter who was friendly, apologized and promised he would check up on our order... then disappeared again. It was hard to find him at any given moment. Thought the restaurant was rather small. Didn't realize how large it was until after our meal. We were sat by the bar and the bar stools were pretty uncomfortable. I'm not the tallest person and felt like a little kid eating on the high tabletops haha!

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Steak ribeye with bernaise
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sliders and fries

3IdjE6s6JDxC5A6NZBGx8Q.text: So far not too impressed, I would expect one hell of a lot more from a Gordon Ramsay establishment.  The service was less than stellar.  We waited 15 min before anyone even came over to take our drink orders. We ordered and haven't seen any one for 30 min since we ordered.  I hope the hell the food is good or this review will go down.  I ordered the braised ribs and my wife did the steak pie.  Well let's see what happens.  well, the food was great.  the braised ribs melted in your mouth and the beef pie was a bomb of flavor.  But the service was horrible, our server Richard was slow, he couldn't remember the desert order.  he almost made us late for our show.  Gordon, you need to look into this.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The short rib melts in your mouth
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Steak pie great flavor

_yKHyyh2ISJ_-g3o4kTKsg.text: Great food and beer! We got a free dessert with first check in. Gordon Ramsey signature dessert!

WuT0pivYWwTSIXx9bA7gYw.text: I've been to this restaurant a few times now and never have had a bad meal. It's set in the heart of Caesar's Palace Casino. They have a good selection of beers and drinks. This time I had the chicken wings which are crispy and super flavorful. The bleu cheese that comes with is about the best I've ever had. We had the hummus and olive appetizer. Again, the hummus is the best I've ever had. Lots of flavor going on here. The Mac and cheese comes in a smaller portion but is good.    On prior visits I've had the steak which is a great choice and worth the money. The hamburgers are smoked and quite enjoyable.   This place can fill up so maybe try coming on off hours. The one complaint I have about Gordon Ramsey's pub is that the service can be slow. I've noticed this with all the times I've been here. The staff is friendly, but you may not see them for a bit between courses. If you're not pressed for time and just want to relax and enjoy your meal, the slow service may not bother you.  Overall, superb food and drink. Not a bad thing on the menu. The level of flavors in every dish are incredible.

sQ4ShF-N3sc9hNzsTSiZZA.text: Scheduled a business lunch here and was able to get their back room (seats 8).  I mentioned beforehand that we'd be meeting while eating and the staff was very gracious in coming in, doing what needed to be done and then leaving us to talk.  Admittedly this wasn't a busy time but they never made us feel rushed or that we were a bother.  Had the pot pie and it was amazing!  Complex flavors and perfectly tender meat - getting hungry just thinking about it!

Vca_ouaurTYwAAenRxGMyA.text: The service was not good and the food was even worst will not be going there anymore and nobody should go there.. too expensive!!!

_FZtAfxBX3Sq5WCztYnIBw.text: First off, not cheap. Ramsay places will set you back, and that should be a given. But if you have Total Rewards, you get a discount and you can pay with points.   Next, go on open table and make a reservation. It just makes things easier.   We started off with the sea salt malt vinegar crisps. It's just potato chips with aioli and vinegar to dip, but a tasty simple starter.  The fish and chips were $26, even with the Total Rewards discount. It's 2 hunks of fish in a light batter, over skinny fries. No peas anymore. My soda was $4, which my server didn't refill until prompted.   Stephen had the pie sampler which he liked. It didn't look that filling for $18, but he seemed to find it adequate.   Our lunch would've set us back $57 but since I gamble a lot, I used my points and got it complimentary. Score!

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Use your Total Rewards card for discount and your points for a COMPd meal
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mini pot pie samplers: chicken, steak n ale, shepherds
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yorkshire fish n chips

JsSLqXuXI7PGodc4Fi5WGw.text: This place is very nicely decorated inside. Food is very good and flavorful. The only reason I'm giving them a 2 star is because the food takes a really long time. If you request sauce on the side or any substitutions they don't do it. All they say is I'm sorry. I didn't send it back because I didn't want to wait the same time. Server never followed up with us for more drinks. Which is was disappointing. With all the competition around I would come here again. Lacks service. The only happy guy around was the hostess and Busser.

lfByLmdfUSyarsKcdbTsuw.text: Steak and Ale Pie - The rich slow roasted deliciousness that you would expect from traditional British comfort food did not disappoint.  The steak in the pie melted in your mouth which was a nice contrast to the tender veggies and the rich deeply flavored gravy.  The top crust however was lack luster at best.  In my head I could hear Gordon Ramsay berating his expediter for putting up a dish that was undercooked. The crust left a gritty texture in your mouth that detracted from the overall yumminess of the filling.  I was sad.   The Sticky toffee putting quickly put an end to my sadness.  It was everything and beyond.  The sweet cream ice cream was to die for.  The pudding itself, I had to admit was better than mine.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sticky Toffee Pudfing
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hells Kitchen Burger
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Steak &amp; Ale Pie

jUmXoF0D3pvM8n_NqE-Ciw.text: The overall rating is due to service rather then the food. Although our waiter forgot to put in our wine order and we sat and waited for a while he made it up with charm and laughter. We had the lobster roll appetizers and they were great, for dinner we all had burgers. Beef and lamb burgers with fries. They were moderate. Just not exciting, I would have opted for In-N-Out.

SQzthlzRI41n2dzAcCMNSA.text: I've never seen this guy's show, but I've heard plenty! So, walking by it at Caesars, we had to go in! First of all, the hostesses were obnoxious and seemed to have an attitude when we asked for a regular table, when we were offered a bar-styled table. We had been walking almost all day and needed to sit with our feet firmly planted on the ground - not dangling!!! The servers on the other hand were phenomenal and made the experience of coming here more positive.  Food! Ah! I am a SoCal gal who just happens to be familiar with British pub food and I must say, the food lived up to the expected standards of British blandness! My chicken/seafood salad was excellent, hence the 4 stars, and the Hell Fire wings were pretty good, but definitely did not stand up to the name. My poor husband on the other hand, who ordered fish/mashed potatoes/vegetables was unhappy to say the least! I tasted his food and only the vegetables came out winning.  Gordon Ramsey: you need to understand that Americans like their potatoes mashed NOT liquefied! lol! Anyways, we had fun at this place. Their decor here at this location was very close to the actual old-school British pub atmosphere, minus the mural. Tableware was very interesting to look at!  I would say, anyone passing by a Gordon Ramsey must try it for the sake of trying it!

GS4qP92Ewgsdqcpo7rlnJA.text: Where to begin.  Service is top notch.  Sat at the bar.  Friendly service from the bartender who recommended a hefenweizen beer I've never had.  That was smooth.  I opted for dessert only here as I had eaten lunch down the street already. I heard things about the sticky toffee pudding.  By far one of the finest desserts I've ever had.  I had the chance to speak to the GM and told him how good it was.  He told the chef of my kudos.  The place lives up to the Gordon Ramsay name.  Next trip I am trying the actual meals here.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. This is their signature dessert,  the sticky toffee pudding.   Get it.  Worth the $11.

_6Efjg71az4WGvM9IySMgA.text: This review is only base on the service at the bar.  Since we didn't have any reservation, we just walked in and found two available seating at the bar; we were immediately greeted by the bar tenders and they were all very friendly and cool.  We had two glass of beers and an appetizer (we already had lunch before we came here); since I was already full so the husband finished the Deviled Eggs by himself, he said it was quite interesting, in a good way.   I also enjoyed their decorations, Ramsay's photos were everywhere and my husband took a photo next to the big one outside their kitchen; the next time we come though, we'll need try more of their food.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States

n4uGBCdmm3useoVDllkAZg.text: The onion soup is excellent.  Would recommend it.  A little mix up on the order but worth the wait for the lobster rolls.   Give them a try.   The service was exceptional.  Attention from several folks not just my main waiter.   Come on in and give it a try.

62zJS4edQ58gcL2hzqzy8g.text: The wait was long but the food was excellent and service was perfect.  The braised short ribs were outstanding and the toffee pudding for dessert was absolutely insane.

E6FwELZfERBwEgCrVN9RVw.text: Fun spot to grab a bite at the bar.   The crab deviled eggs were pretty good but not excellent. My dirty martini was not that great but my mom enjoyed her lemon drop!   Located across from the colosseum so be sure to check the show schedule before heading this way. The hallways become crammed and this spot is overfilled before and after their concerts let out.

XIOk3p5vQSl0qsZJqF8qTg.text: This place is just a place to go to say you've been here. You pay for the experience. I didn't feel like the food was worth it, and I'm not talking about the portion but the flavor was not as great as I had expected. I ordered the pot pie, it was good but nothing special. Marie Calendar could compete with  this pot pie.

1dKamBE1WFGLXz8tyTUfPg.text: My husband and I had lunch on a Friday while in Vegas for a long weekend. We split a couple sandwiches (corned beef and the Pub BLT - each $18 on the menu). I happened to notice from the menu that the burgers came with fries, the sandwiches chips, so when the waitress asked if would we like chips or fries, it was a nice surprise.  We said "one of each then, great, thank you!"  End of story. The food was OK. Both sandwiches came on thick toast and quite frankly, started to irritate my mouth. But no biggie. Our waitress then full on disappeared -- never to be seen again. But the bill finally came once we flagged someone else down and both sandwiches rang up at $19.00, and it listed "truffle fries" for an extra $3.00. Are you kidding me?  No one ever said anything about an extra charge for fries, nor anything about "truffle"!  And after re-checking the menu, it shows "truffle chips" something or other as an appetizer. That's the only mention of "truffle" anywhere!  Then the manager wanted to say the $19 instead of $18 charge for the sandwiches was the waitress' mistake regarding a "dinner portion something or other".   Ohhhh Bull s....    Yea, yea, $5 ...no big deal. I'm sorry....them trying to get us for $5 is a BIG DEAL!    Pretty disappointed Gordon!!!!!!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States

KvrtbB-P_Gi1ZN_mlHVJJg.text: First Gordon Ramsay restaurant stop while in Las Vegas. It was OK. Calamari as an appetizer was good. Wedge Salad, Fish & Chips, and Grilled Burger were all good. The Lamb Burger wasn't all that good. Perhaps the goat cheese was it's undoing.  Overall, it was not as good as I expected. We'll try another one of Ramsay's restaurants before we decide to give up on the hype.

4kjtetkIUrDo4b1tKMw-yg.text: This place was just okay. The fish and chips were bland. You will be paying for name of the restaurant not for the QUALTIY of food. The mash potatoes were pretty good.

9oij5BzGd8nvUHxMj9OH2Q.text: Just had an awesome meal at Gordon's Pub. Come say hey to Keith and the Juice Man at the bar. They'll take great care of you like they did with us! CHEERS!!!!

2eWQkmnbKRS-31FYKbBt_w.text: Ok, so I decided to give GR Pub another chance... Because I really wanted a burger.  So, I had lunch here on 9.4.18.  I ordered the cheese burger and fries.  It was very tasty, cooked properly and presented well.  The fries are the real winner to this meal.  Although everything was great this time around, to me, the fries were the best.  Service was spot on-although not busy, she was great.  I'm glad I gave this place another try... will keep it on my list and if I have an experience like I did previously, I will speak up and send it all back.

5UDVrM-t7csV4CFliKYepg.text: Fancy atmosphere with reasonable prices! The staff is very friendly and we loved the food! The lobster Mac and cheese and salmon toast was great. The service was very quick and attentive. We loved being able to enjoy a nice meal in Vegas, while in a restaurant where we could still hear each other talk. And the deserts are AMAZING.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States

xyaLXOAMmpyqK6ZSSHXX8Q.text: Our server was AMAZING. She was friendly and attentive. Ok, now for the food, I had the wedge salad (get it chopped, you'll never eat it any other way) and shared  a tomato soup to start. Both were delicious and generous portions. We had the Short Rib and the Diver Scallops. I wasn't crazy about the lentils served with the scallops, but they were fresh, tasty and had a wonderful citrus sauce. With my Yelp Check-In, we got the Sticky Toffee Pudding. OMG, it was not what we expected. It looks heavy and dense. Not st all - It was warm, fluffy and delicious. We will def visit again next time we're here in Vegas!

J_U0nj_JQVgqdOtA2CbeGA.text: This place had wonderful service.  We ate Happy Hour and tried all the items on the happy hour!  We even shared the famous Toffee pudding! Delicious

Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Happy hour menu

aMmHzSKoesxRqkOmvUbj7w.text: First time at a Ramsay restaurant and I was very pleased. Has the fish & chips and they were moist and a great fish to batter ratio! Cooked excellent. Fries....just meh. Smashed peas, not my thing, tried them, didn't go back for more. Had the sticky toffee pudding for dessert and it was amazing, moist, perfect! Sat at the bar chatted with great staff, great people! Highly recommend!

zSmMu2sXlAc1WgALaRwWCA.text: I went for a quiet dinner and had the Caesar salad and French onion soup. Both were very bland. Service was good though.

LZYEsamE7akDKiu8A04Zgg.text: Worst customer service ever! Place is OVERRATED..My husband and I went there and it took forever to get our appetizers then dinner was even longer..Waiter was more concerned with groups that look like they would tip big..He lost out on a $80 tip that we ended up giving to Homestead Steakhouse also in Caesars, cost was almost the same but Homestead was top notch! Not like this place, horrible..

Ks2970mv4RBFj_MgpX1_tQ.text: This is an awesome spot to stop and eat!! My 13 year old loves Gordon Ramsey, so we had to stop by. The pub menu is amazing! We paid more for a crappy Mcdonalds lunch than we did for a delicious meal off the pub menu that made us feel special and a bit pampered! Staff is terrific, out server Rodney was such an upbeat and friendly guy!! Couldn't say enough about the food, gave us perfect recommendations and couldn't be more supportive of G.R. himself. We will be stopping here on all our future visits. Kid friendly, date friendly, fun, relaxed but authentic and unique.  5 plus stars!!

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yummy!!!
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States

e1PO0KucyF5YW-KBFhYKuQ.text: Made a reservation and got seated immediately when we arrived 10 min late. The food was amazing but the server rolled his eyes at us when taking our order. The food we ordered made up the stars here. I had the fish and chips and the fried dough was perfectly crunchy on top of the perfectly cooked fish. I also sampled the chick curry and shepherds pie. All were amazing! Got the free toffee sticky cake from the yelp check in promo. It wasn't too sweet and has a nice soft texture.

Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bacon burger
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fish n chips

VPIGu_e70u1Udf7u-8qpfg.text: I am a local in Las Vegas , my daughter and I were here for lunch a couple of months ago and we had superb service the food exquisite , been a fan of Gordon Ramsey since the Fword, watch all of his shows , bragged about our experience of our lunch, well yesterday was my Birthday my husband surprised  and we went to Dinner at the Pub I was very disappointed on the service we received , I ordered a Caesar Salad and husband Shrimp cocktail  after 10 minutes of waiting for black pepper for my salad and horseradish for shrimp cocktail that is when our waiter came to table to ask if all was ok , that when I asked for pepper and horseradish , I was eating my salad and waitress came with our entree I had beef Wellington and Husband Prime Rib she asked us if we wanted to keep it warm, we said no , the food was delicious, but service we were very disappointed .....I have to add to my review the prompt response of Joe Richardson and his impeccable service is greatly appreciated. Thank you Joe

RmriiiyN4I38HImlPd5aAw.text: We stopped by here just to grab a drink and keep the party going on day. Just ordered a few beers, but then noticed with Yelp! you got a free Toffee Pudding! It was unbelievable. Super sweet, but so tasty. Other than that there was nothing special about the experience. We probably would not eat here with all the other places to venture. In fact as I write this, I remember there are at least 4 other if not more Gordon Ramsay spots to choose from just on the strip. So, make a pick and get the Toffee Pudding ;)
