zwH5SW8JRg0M-a7OyUqYVw.text: 4.5 stars for the food.  Got the braised short rib.  The meat was very tender and soft but a bit under seasoned.  Or just a bit more of the sauce would solve it  4 for the service.  I understand they are busy. But my food took more than 30mins to arrive is a bit too long.    Price is ok for Vegas standards  Free pudding for checking in at Yelp!  Update, the manager responded and apologized for the delay in getting food out.  So 5 star for service!

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States

0KsbsBCgmqx6sR2NzptWuw.text: Make a reservation. Super loud, super busy but well worth it. Female wait staff adorned in newspaper print dresses let's you know you're about to step into a fun place. Inside walls are lined with metal beer casks and various UK knick knacks. Ordered Fish and Chips. Super crisp batter, white fluffy fish, and huge pieces too. Minty mushy peas were fresh and complements the dish perfectly. Chips beyond this planet. Not greasy and great season flavors. Everything was seasoned perfectly, no salt, pepper, or tartar sauce needed. It was simply that good. Chips were soo good. I am reminded by eating here as to how important seasoning is. In fact if you look for salt and pepper on the table you're out of luck. There is none. It's loud and busy but FUN! Don't miss this gem inside of Ceasars.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mushy peas a minty surprise

pERRGuAARBfFM_uIzSBTfQ.text: This place will never disappoint! And our sever Rodney was amazing! He was attentive and made great recommendations....the deviled eggs! Oh so good! My favorite here are the wings, extra crispy! And if you can get them during PUB Hour, daily 2-5; $1 wings, 1/2 priced drafts, sliders and truffle fries that's an added bonus!

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Goodbye Blue Sky....it&#39;s raining anyway....yummy

kEPzJy7oowSAdjC2Q7jdVg.text: I live in Las Vegas and dine out almost every night as I don't cook. Two if my three favorite restaurants are Hells Kitchen (see my review) and Gordon Ramsay's Pub in Caesars   The prime rib special is out of this world. The serving size is huge and well seasoned. It comes with a popover, mashed potatoes and vegetables.   The staff is friendly and caring. Kudos to Gordon for instilling a philosophy that combines great service and top notch food!!  Best  Margo Lundahl

mbZv1Os7e9YNCbLB1gWDzw.text: The food is great. You just have to be careful which server you want because some are so disrespectful that is ruined dinner. But 5 stars for good food

na-EDNRQx10EF9CXEQrhhA.text: Excellent food. Sat at the bar and had Ronnie the bartender. Excellent service and great recommendations. Had the chicken wings appetizer , scallops, and free sticky toffee pudding with yelp check in. Would definitely come back. Felt at home.

fvbqNcQbHudCoFqQ3kp2cw.text: Hour and a half to wait for food, soggy calamari, can't follow simple directions on what not to place with my meal. Also cannot even cook a basic burger. Delivered food raw, going to be sick from this burger. Took a picture of this disgusting raw burger. The manager just responded saying "it doesn't look like you'd get sick eating it" ridiculous management service. And wouldn't comp my meal.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States

D93_sQPBf9TGI7NF0A9TmA.text: The food here is amazing!! Our table got the steak and ale pie, lobster Mac and cheese, and the fish and chips. The only complaint I have is the price we paid for fish and chips for only two pieces. It was so good though, I would go back again and pay at least for the steak and ale pie.

LNyk_gfdoMm5iJSBhzn8-Q.text: SERVICE is terrible. I don't know how my food tasted because it couldn't ever get to me. I was staying at Caesar's and wanted to get something downstairs by myself so I sat at the bar. I wanted to order a bud light for something light with my heavy burger I ordered, but the place didn't carry AB products. The couple next to me was really hungry too, so I told one of them can have my burger when it finally gets out so they don't have to wait as long as I did. If you are going to pay $21 for burger, it should be assumed the price reflects stellar service. I did tell the bartender I shouldn't have to wait over a half hour at the bar when the place is half empty for a burger and he was kind of a jag. No apology, just something about it was the first burger order of the day and then told the couple next to me that "of coarse he's the first to order a burger and they are checking on it." I didn't know how to interpret this, but he said it in a fashion that I was too impatient. I will say that the design of this place is pretty cool. I just don't like this place because it wasted my precious Vegas time!

gjJzSTFDPuvTmOSbBLelVA.text: Went to GR Pub & Grill 1/12/13. Ordered a $16 appetizer of "crispy fried oysters". Brought out three little oyster shells about the size of a quarter on top of bed of salt, with a little piece of oyster in each of them.Could barely find the oysters!! Looked like one oyster had been divided into thirds. Ordered fish and chips. I have had better fish at Long John Silver's. Potatoes were like frozen steak fries from Walmart. Took a knife to cut them.  We sat at the bar and the bartender was super nice. Will never go back there again.

cfuKBOQBkDP0Tau7afbDzQ.text: Worst restaurant experience in my week in Vegas!  I recently visited Gordon Ramsay's Pub & Grill and was very excited to try it.  Our visit started out very well.  Our server was extremely professional and friendly.  It ended there, however.  I was with a party of four and we all ordered.  I ordered the lamb burger and couldn't wait to taste it, which I never did do.  I specifically asked if the burger had lettuce on it and was told no.  It had some on it when it came and the server stated that it wasn't supposed to be like that so he took it back.  This would have been fine, however, somehow my meal got "lost" due to our server needing to wait on a table that had a language barrier.  So I sat while my whole table ate and finished with still no food. When I flagged down our "new" server, he seemed not to know what was going on.  I asked for the manager, who was also not aware of the issue.  When I told her, she did offer to get me a meal, but by then it was too late.  I was not about to eat while everyone else waited for me.  She did comp our drinks, but I would have rather had my burger and enjoyed my meal.    I was so disappointed because I am a big fan of Gordon Ramsay, and if he puts his name on a restaurant, I expect it to be great.  The others in my party did enjoy their meals.  So, ultimately, I left hungry and annoyed!

aoLgxGQkYB3Mo_BNzGVR4g.text: Very good. The waiter was very helpful and friendly, and the food was great. Our table had the fish and chips, shepherds pie, shrimp salad and their equivalent of french onion soup. Everyone tried everything and everyone was very pleased. Good drink selection. Would recommend coming here.

-cMuvr8Tqz2fYYJ3euKYWw.text: Ate here on the 19th and it was the best meal we got in Vegas..the pretzels were delish and the Yorkshire fish and chips were the best I have ever had so moist and to thick and the chips were so different and good~~also go the Shepherds Pie and it was savory and so tasty~~but dessert takes the cake a triple choc triffle and a peanut butter and jelly cobbler were the total stars of the night~~will definitely eat here the first night every time we come to Vegas

QreShZBKBth6MG2GitrQcQ.text: I went to Gordon Ramsay's Pub and Grill and had the worst experience. We were in Las Vegas for my sisters bachelorette party for the weekend, we went there for our last meal together. We had reservations for 9:15 and showed up at 9:10 and got seated immediately. Richard E was our server. He was fast about getting our drinks and complimentary bread and appetizers, but after that he rarely came to check our table. We waited well over an hour before our entrees came out. I confronted a bus boy about how long our food (because our waiter Richard E was nowhere to be found) was taking because we noticed a table of 4 that got seated at least 15-20 mins after us got served before us. He went in the back to check and came back telling me that the reason they got served first was because they have a smaller party and it takes longer for the kitchen to prepare all our meals to come out together....Once the food came out it was okay but definitely not worth the wait and rudeness we experienced. Richard brought one check over without asking us if we were all paying together at the end. We were a party of 8 so we asked if he could split the check for us and he made a huge deal about how long and difficult it would be for him to do it but he guessed he could. It took him 20 mins to do so..which we saw he had finished earlier and was waiting to bring us the split checks...Overall very disappointing for what we thought would be an amazing experience.

6RH5j_hBk1lcq1bf6AVwJA.text: Worst service I have ever received in a restaurant!! If I were Gordon Ramsay I would be embarrassed to put my name on it. I was there on New Year's Eve and the restaurant was empty. Their dinner special was 100.00 per person. We asked if they had another option and were given their ala cart menu. My friend and I both ordered the sliders and a pear ale. We waited for a long time for our food to arrive. When it did I was shocked at how small portion was. The sliders were about the size of a half dollar coin and were nothing but bread and dried out burger. I only ate one because I was having a hard time swallowing the dried out mess. After receiving our food our waitress didn't come back. I then asked a busser for a to go box ( I would have just left the food but for those prices I was taking it with me), he didn't return. When we saw him again my friend reminded him I was waiting for a box. He apologized and brought me one. My friend held up her credit card for at least 30 minutes trying to get our waitress to bring our check. Finally when the busser brought my to go box we asked him to get our waitress to bring our check. We noticed that a couple who were seated about the time we got our food had still not had anyone approach their table and take their order by the time we finally got our check. When we received our check we found they had already tacked on a 20 percent gratuity. I guess they do that because they would never receive a tip otherwise. My recommendation.... Don't Go There!!!

7sn2cGfzvoXhEfQkdGyLVw.text: Is there a zero star option? Because, that is my rating.  Extremely disappointed and offended. When I arrived at the Pub and Grill, I noticed that the establishment was extremely empty. I thought this was odd since it was New Years Eve and the strip was packed. the hostesses did offer an ala carte menu, as I was not interested in their main menu for the evening. The bar was open seating, so I decided to eat there since other establishments looked really busy.  My friend and I were hungry since we hadn't eaten in a while. At first the waitress seemed very friendly, and she offered us drinks. We ordered a pear ale, and it was very tasty. We didn't see the waitress for quite some time to order our meal. When she arrived, I ordered the sliders. When they arrived I was extremely disappointed. First of all, it took it seemed forever for the food to arrive. Secondly, the burgers were just buns and a burger no toppings. The buggers were the size of a quarter, they were extremely dry, and lacked taste. After visiting Gordon Ramsay's burgers we had very high expectations.  That establishment was phenomenal. Gordon Ramsay's burgers had a very friendly and helpful staff, and excellent, I repeat, excellent tasting food! The sliders that I received from the pub and grill were sub par. After I was finished with the disgusting sliders, I didn't see our waitress to receive our bill for more than 45 minutes. I even held my card up for at least a half an hour with no response. I would have spoken to the restaurant manager, however we were pressed for time for the firework show. I did write a note on the credit card receipt about how it did not compare to Gordon Ramsay burger, and that I was disappointed. To top it off, 20 percent gratuity was automatically charged to the bill. I did not feel that the waitress who neglected us deserved to receive 20 percent. I will not go back to this restaurant, and I will not recommend it to anyone I know. However, I highly recommend going to Gordon Ramsay's burgers!!!

Q6rZojPAVuZ-AORUgqgVQw.text: What a disappointment! The food was awful! Shepard's Pie had zero seasoning.  I ordered the Scottish salmon and it was raw, sent it back and the second serving was burnt. I will never go back....EVER!

hWMuil8MYdDYvJIV3Y3b7A.text: I'm not typically an overeater. I rarely finish my plate. But I ate to the point of discomfort at this place. The Pub "Spots" are friggin DELICIOUS. I don't know if it's the rosemary bun or garlic aioli or what but I could't stop eating. And the fries were awesome - also not my usual go-to. I actually went here twice during my visit. Once with my husband (who actually only described the regular burger as "alright" which seems weird) and once with girlfriends. I talked up the "Spots" so all the girls had them except one who ordered the Diver Scallops. I actually traded her a handful of fries for half a scallop and I think I got the better end of the deal. The hostesses are very whatever, but the bartenders are a good time and our waiter was awesome. Even the food runner had a good time with us. I also like the decor with the kegs working as a divider. I ate at the bar and at a table and liked both options. They also had a good beer menu. I really liked this place. Definitely worth trying out.

ovjUZ_5PtB-Rbk2lu-L8ig.text: Very good fish n chips. Server was pretty nice. She joked around about Janel getting busted. But I was very turned off by the attaire that the staff was in. Girls were in a short skirt boobs basically hanging out. I understand its a pub n all but coming from Ramsay I expected a little more

GQvjtpdcWI5SIkWRjSNoRA.text: This new restaurant is great.  The food here is definitly not something you find anywhere else in Las Vegas.  I particularly enjoyed the poutine and the fish and chips.  The selection of beers on hand is a nice variety for those who like to stray from the usual options.  My friend and I sat close to the front which I actually enjoyed because it wasn't as loud as it is in the center of the restaurant.  Service was pretty attentive eventhough the restaurant seemed fairly busy.  I will definitly be visiting this place again!

88bZAeFP75FQe3RIme-Ldw.text: I was excited to eat here , until I ate here. After a 45 min. wait, We finally were served. My wife's Scotch eggs were dry, over cooked and served cold as well as her lobster mac'n'cheese. My steak was served cold with the wrong potatoes and raw asparagus and a sauce that was dried and stained the plate without movement even when forced by my finger. The worst part was the bartenders laughing about it in front of us. I will never eat at a Gordon Ramsey Restaurant ever again. The worst $100 I ever spent in my life...Even Gordon Ramsey wouldn't eat here...Extremely Disappointed...If I knew how to give no stars I would...

_UrRPAyuaaxcOsHsEkKR7g.text: I downloaded the Yelp app just to write this review. Normally I am very easy going and am not motivated to give a place a bad review (this is my first ever in fact), but in this case I feel like Mr. Ramsay has traded on his name as a stickler for quality and there was little to be found here. We've dined at Gordon Ramsay Steak and it was very good so this came as an unwelcome surprise. The staff were generally nice, though they started to flounder when things went south. We ordered a Caesar to start and I must say that was good. However, for our lunch entrees we ordered the Shepherd's Pie and the baked Mac n' Cheese and were very disappointed with both. The shepherd's pie was average at best but barely had any vegetables in it; the Mac n' Cheese was just terrible: bland and undercooked. When my girlfriend said something about it the genius waiter went right into the classic al dente argument - nice. He offered to have it cooked more - baked more? We sent back the Mac and even with that off the bill it came to $50: one Caesar salad to share, an iced tea, a lemonade, and a small, underwhelming shepherd's pie. If that suits you then look no further!

7LYOS8dNm8novjphxiXfuA.text: Wow I had one terrible dining experience a year ago on a visit, but returned last month for a conference and wow what a great change. New managers, new menu, customer interaction was great with the servers. Totally impressed wit hth food quality and service. This place really made a great positive change and I will return, nice improvment....tenderloin and salmon are excellent BTW... nice place to dine for lite fare, pub food or a good well prepared meal. Servers, we found were great, ours was Daisy and she was terrific. Enjoy :-)

pZ4tJuyCTzgizzUBqeEUqg.text: I agree with the other reviews about the staff and what they are wearing. They look very uncomfortable walking around in their outfits.  The staff seated us write away and we got a nice little area in the back so we can watch the crowd.  The waiter made some recommendations for beers and he was right on.  We ordered just a small quick lunch and I had the mussels and clams and the wife had the salad.  They were both outstanding.  Then the staff came by and asked we wanted dessert and made yet another recommendation and this time was even better than the beer.  The dessert was a toffee cake and it was splendid and I will eat it every time I am in Las Vegas.  I hope they do not change anything about this place, well maybe the girls outfits.

5CNnRlHNwiTF4husGbzQOA.text: Embarrassing.  On Juy 16 2013 we've got a drink server and a bread server, but the main waiter Scott was barely showing up. We've waited forever for our food and had to ask another waiter for status. He then found out that our food was accidentally taken by someone else, or whatever else happened.  We then got out filet steak which was just mediocre for a $45 steak. I visited over 100 restaurants in this city and this one was one of my worst experiences.

ZUydWoqyjTPdjpNBfnbznw.text: I doubt Ramsay has much to do with this place, other than collecting a check to use his name.  I had cauliflower soup for an app, it was excellent. My wife had sliders and they were nothing special, but not bad.  The shepherds pie my wife had for a main course was fantastic. I had fish and chips for my main. The fish was cooked well, but was a little bland. The chips were awful undercooked oversized potato wedges. They didn't even taste fried, I think they were baked, and the center was still crunchy. They screwed up the second half of this classic pub dish, that's not acceptable.  My real problem was the service. We sat for around twenty minutes with dirty plates on the table before anyone came by. Our waitress was M.I.A. and the rest of the wait staff was too busy standing around chit chatting to clean off the table, refill our drinks, see if we wanted anything, etc.  The iPad with the drink list was also a little ridiculous. Stop with the stupid trendy crap, this is supposed to be a pub.

5t3wvZJTLKIo3Nc-NrU0Vw.text: The very first impression I made of this place was the barmaid seemed annoyed with me because I ordered a Miller Lite instead of a micro brew, craft beer, or a foreign beer. What she didn't realize was I had already been drinking those types of beers for many hours that day, but it was late and I was winding down with a Miller Lite. I ordered the Shepard's Pie and Mac & Cheese. Both were delicious. No doubt the best Shepard's Pie and Mac & Cheese I've ever had.  A few days later a I took a couple friends back, and we sat in the dining room. The place wasn't that crowded, but the whole night our waitress kept disappearing, and leaving us hanging. She even apologized on one occasion for being gone for so long. It was actually kind of weird. One of the people I was with asked her what she recommended to eat, and she said everybody loves the fish & chips. When she walked away I told both of my friends how good the shepard's pie and mac & cheese were. My one buddy and myself ordered the fish & chips, and my buddy's wife ordered the shepard's pie. My buddy's wife loved the shepard's pie, but $28.00 for the fish & chips my buddy and myself weren't impressed. When you cut into a piece of fish you expect to see nice flaky fish. This fish wasn't flaky, and it was too greasy. My buddy also ordered the Butternut Squash Soup which he said was delicious.

FkPjrDgn_Rpw4ZYuY1W9EQ.text: I expected to love this place. We loved  Burger across the street and Steak at Paris, Very disappointing had lunch with my husband at the bar. New waiter on his first day probably would have been better on his own. The guy training him was offensive.  When I said I did not like their take on the corned beef sandwich in a bowl he said I shouldn't worry about looking pretty while I eat it just dig in there.  high priced as it is and after presenting our Harrahs card still did not get the $4 off a $20 so called corned beef sandwich. Why bother putting the two prices on the menu if they don't understand what it means.  Will not be going back.

-4kEeVZO3QcjhJdYJZSPQQ.text: This meal was pretty darn good, however, yes the burgers were small. I do not need a big burger though! So it is likely more size appropriate than other places! The restaurant was nice, atmosphere was nice, presentation was nice. It was fun as a group and I may go there again if the opportunity arises.  It is very upbeat which is wonderful as well!

21zYP58Cn_K7CK3CvOPm5Q.text: Great food and great beer selection.  Our server Chris was the best.Get the nachos- yum! Atmosphere is fun and the location is by Caesar's Sportsbook. Can't beat it.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Great food! Our server Chris was the best.Get the nachos- yum! Atmosphere is fun.

kXOb3qhiBTEUEp6ECk3CjA.text: The food was amazing! My friends and I made a reservation day of for this place. If you are running late, you have 15 minutes from your reservation time.

las75uHOAMsWxZMi_mLUZg.text: We stopped here for a late lunch and it was one of the best meals on our entire vacation. The lamb burger is out of this world. So well flavored, juicy and high quality. Ask for the truffle aioli to put on it and add a slice of cheddar to make it the best burger ever. Days later our mouths were still watering over it! Wings were pretty good too. Really nice, fun atmosphere and good service. We already can't wait to go back!

9dqapzyx9ka3OL6l_lwTRw.text: The food was absolutely amazing!!!! Had the braised short ribs that fell apart and melted in your mouth. The flavor was rich and delicious.  My friend had the beef Wellington and the addition of the mushrooms between the puff pastry and filet gave amazing flavor.  Rodney was super attentive, personable, and on top of refilling drinks without asking.  Would highly recommend this restaurant.

hMgEPwkUpV-LWLlhkQ5rug.text: Rodney was awesome!! He recommended great food and paid excellent attention to our table.

wEOm8EbS4b-gmQpB7RcPCw.text: Like nachos? Then order the Kettle Chip Nachos and thank me later. I'm a big eater, and whoa! This is a mound of perfectly fried kettle chips lathered in cheese sauce and sour cream, with what had to be a pound of succulent short rib. Garnished with some inspiring and tangy peppers (ask for more). We had some pear ciders to drink which were awesome. And to seal the deal, I used the Yelp Check-In for a FREE(!!) Sticky Toffee Pudding- possible the world's best dessert? Our service was excellent. Walked away totally fully and satisfied. Thanks Gordon!

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Kettle Chip Nachos 1/2 eaten- loads of short rib!! Pear cider is a nice sidekick
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Kettle Chip Nachos- masive!
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sticky Toffee Pudding with extra ice cream.

URi240jCMuusIU-qaXPVhw.text: Great until they messed up our order. I ate the food anyway and it was still good, just not exactly what I wanted.

jk6i7mkocY62ySOWIc5aMg.text: I may be bias as I am slightly in love with Gordon but this experience was amazing.  I had the fish and chips how could you not right?! Al had the lamb burger and they were both so flavoursome and decent portions which I wasn't expecting. We did not have a long wait for a table either which was an added delight.  The decor was really cool like an English pub and the menu had something for everyone but not to big either. The service was exceptional we actually had a uk waiter who we had a great chat with. The meal was presented well and cooked to perfection. I look forward to our next Vegas trip and will definitely hit this restaurant up again.  The only let down to this meal was that Gordon did not make an appearance while we were there, however look at the picture I post with this I got the next best thing lol!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Since the man himself was not here I got as close as I could to him!!!

lk44S5-f01P7-nFo5056Ig.text: Awesome pub Food. Tried the lobster mac and cheese, wedge salad, fish and chips, sticky toffee pudding. Everything was delicious no complaints. service was mostly great, the hostess were little grouchy but other than that the atmosphere was good and table was clean. Awesome beer choices as well.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. YUM!

ff4wjBuDzjsPtx-iQfF5KQ.text: Gordon Ramsay would be embarrassed of this own restaurant. By name, it's Gordon Ramsay. By food, it's slightly better McDonald's. Service was almost non-existent. I get that we are young and filthy rich enough to continuously order glasses of wine, but we deserve to be treated well.  Good was absolutely mediocre. I ordered the two mini burger side and fries (I have small portion size) and my boyfriend ordered chicken sandwich with kettle chips. My mini bacon cheeseburgers were a joke. The picture will show their ridiculous use of ingredients. I paid extra for that bacon. I get that it's a mini cheeseburger, but I think it deserved more cheese and bacon than that. The fries were soggy and not great at all. I had to dunk them in aioli to get decent flavor. My boyfriend's sandwich was eh (according to him) and his kettle chips were stale.  I won't be back. Sorry Gordon.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. A joke right?
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States

XZMSdvccEXqNRrzDlCY-ow.text: Donkeys all around, I think.  Had the fish and chips, and continued to have the same fish and chips all night and well into the morning.  You know that feeling when you eat something and it just keeps coming back like a psychotic ex-girlfriend?  It was like that.   In the elevator, overhearing a couple talking about their experience...exactly the same as mine.    Pals from my conference also tried it out, and were also way less than impressed.    I guess our expectations may have been high.  Like a lot of people, I really wanted to see just how good a Ramsay experience could be.  I've lost a lot of respect for the guy.  Granted, this is just his pub, but you would think that good pub food would be easy.    Gordon really should drop by this place for some quality control.  I can't believe that he'd approve of his name on the door when the food is blah at best.  Oh well, it was pretty expensive for fish and chips, but at least I got my money's worth.  First time I've ever had a 24 hour Fish and Chip.

PUwsGOuiRTN_igR_JLKXKQ.text: **Review update** Benjamin, the manager, went out of his way to resolve things for us. Very unexpected and very nice!  Because of this, we will be going back when we return to Vegas in November!   The service was great. Very friendly and welcoming. The lobster rolls were amazing!  However our entrees were really disappointing. My husband had the salmon (bland) and I had the short rib (tough and over cooked). Normally I don't make too big of a deal, but if I'm paying almost $40 per entree - I would like to be somewhat satisfied. Anyway, the decor is cute (Gordon's bulldog - love) and again, the staff was great. Just wish we had a better experience with our meal, especially since my husband is a huge Gordon Ramsay fan!

Zv54YtsJHeEgKLxNIYzZ_Q.text: The server was very energetic and recommending basically everything in the menu lol overall the food was good as expected.

Ewum50Qt9OjDcOZR8K6tkw.text: The short rib nachos was off the hook delicious! Homemade chips with tasty cheese and tender short rib meat, yummy! Scott the waiter suggested the pesto Mac n cheese and he was right in! I had the Moscow mule drink which had absinthe....it works!

uKHyHBkVnpUVhkWgn7mO3w.text: The restaurant got one star because the waiter was excellent.  I have watched El Gordo on tv when he rants and raves and that is exactly what I wanted to do when I tasted my soft crab at his restaurant.  Relatives came into town and took us there as a special treat many months ago and I just didn't write a timely review. Hah!!!  I  ordered one of my favorite things and was unpleasantly surprised at the lack of taste and the consistency.  I couldn't even see the soft crab because the pastry around it was so thick and so tasteless.  Maybe the head chef should be given a lesson in how to prepare this usually wonderful dish.  And now when El Gordo does his schtick on tv I just have to laugh because I'm not certain he knows how to cook!!! And I don't live in CA but in Henderson, NV.

alOggdp_m4CEaoRxmj__Sw.text: Best onion soup of my life. The truffle fries were just okay to me. The burger were great , service was great. Will go again

TudkcxTVDgwaICh3sxWrFA.text: Server was super helpful and offered suggestions. Lamb stew was amazing! As well as my husbands burger.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bar area

rAU1acSpXvmWdMhNcIAcZg.text: Ronnie and Charlie behind the bar are the best! Great food great service great atmosphere! Never a bad meal at this spot. Highly recommend.

PqxY2HKzf_XB0upDOsHQ2g.text: Gordon Ramsay's restaurant delivers the goods. I will be back for sure.   - I had a party of 10 and had reservations. As we waited, I noticed that this spot had a great flow of energy and gave off a good vibe. Had a "bar/pub" feel to it. Ambiance, music, and energy was great. I'd have to say the stuff was completely on point and went above and beyond in service.   - When the hostess led us to our table, I could smell the delicious aroma of steak. We were guided into the private dining area, which is a private room with TVs, independent light controls, and a single table perfect for 10 people. The room was great. It was well managed and kept clean. I own a cleaning company so I pay attention to details very closely and I was pleased with the cleanliness.  - As for the food, I would have to say it was delicious. I had the ribeye steak with asparagus. Very tender and superb steak. I was pleased that it was not mainly a fatty piece, since ribeyes tend to be on the fattier side. Not this steak though. It was very meaty, juicy, and tender. Best of all, it was cooked exactly how I asked; Medium Rare.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States

qx23mqiXwz6CtCmtA1FzsA.text: Not a bad restaurant, but not the greatest. My boyfriend and I really love Gordon Ramsay, and we have now tried all of his restaurants in Las Vegas, but this was our least favorite.  We made reservations via Yelp, but we were running late because of Las Vegas so I called the restaurant and they were able to hold our table. That was really accommodating, but I just wished our server was as accommodating. Unfortunately he was really slow and standoff-ish. The table next to us I believe won a VIP dinner for Gordon Ramsay Pub and Grill, so he was focusing his attention on them. The water wasn't refilled until we asked and this poor busboy came running to give us water. Food came out in good timing though.  The food was good, but for the price I paid I expected more. We got the Bangers and Mash as well as Steak and Ale Pie. We also got the sauteed mushrooms and wings. The wings were great, but pricey. The portions were smaller than I expected, but I was full since it was full of mashed potatoes and bread. It was delicious, but it's the type of food that's not too hard to make so we weren't too impressed.  The location is great as it is near the parking structure so you don't have to walk too far. The restaurant itself is pretty comfy, not romantic, so it's best for a group of friends or coworkers. Lots of TVs so it is also great to watch a game.  A plus was that we got to see the Hell's Kitchen winner so that was pretty cool. Overall, it was A-ok.

wmSSmFSHlQmSwAoQ5iBoTA.text: I'll say upfront that I'm a huge Gordon Ramsey fan and that we only ate there at happy hour.  Our server Nicole was fantastic, so I cannot agree with the other reviews that talk about marginal service. The happy hour menu and prices were reasonable. We had the nachos, wings, toad in the hole and pub spot, all 4 items tasted great. Very flavorful, though the portion sizes were on the small side.  Overall very happy with our visit, we would go back again.

dqNVcCQZD5AZ1z3nZ5VpUg.text: i'm a HUGE fan of GR's since day 1 of 'hell's kitchen', i enjoy his US and UK shows, so of course when i went to vegas 4/28-5/3, i HAD to go to at least 1 of his vegas restaurants.. my husband and i ended up choosing the pub and grill at caesar's palace for it's casual attire and atmosphere, in fact, it was planned to be our 1st official activity in vegas, i just couldn't wait to go to his place! when we arrived hungry, i didn't even mind the 1 hr wait (we didn't do reservations cuz we were unsure of how long it would take to get to the restaurant), and i thought it was cool they text u when ur table is ready (never experienced that b4 w/ a restaurant lol).. and to be in his restaurant was AMAZINGLY wonderful and exciting for me, being such a fan! but quite honestly, u'd never know that this was his restaurant, his face isn't everywhere. there's no GR merchandise section that i saw. his name is in the restaurant name and his pic in the menu, but otherwise, it's like any other place to eat/drink! personally, i was hoping there would be a merchandise section cuz i'd love to have a shirt or souvenir of his :) anyway, i initially savored every minute the sec we walked into the restaurant! however, the server sucked tho. my husband failed a few times trying to get her attn (doing the standard method, but exaggerated so u'd think she would've noticed!), she was so busy and scattered, she never paid us any attn, not even the minimum cuz our water/my sprite was never checked on. i had to ask the guy who brought my food to ask her to get me a sprite refill lol.. that was pathetic..   w/ my food, i was kinda disappointed too :/// i got the ny steak w/ fingerling potatoes and replaced the asparagus (ewwww) w/ carrots. considering how expensive it was, u'd expect absolute perfection on a plate! well, a few carrots were too raw/hard to even put my fork into, and the potatoes were only a handful amount so the side dishes were really a let down ://// BUT the steak was delish! :)))) the plating for the steak sucked too tho! GR is all about presentation & plating so i think he may be disappointed to find out my dish came out very messy (or idk, maybe that's how the dish is supposed to be plated??)... see, the carrots and potatoes were randomly scattered on the plate *carelessly* imo, and the steak had a potato and carrot underneath it, like the steak was just plopped on top of the potatoes and carrots :/// i just tweeted pics of the dish from b4 and after i ate it to show the plating, and the raw carrots and fatty steak part i left behind.. dunno if he'll respond at all, but i thought i'd at least notify him of how things were done.. i also got the potted triple chocolate trifle which i LOVED. it was various layers/textures of dark, milk, and white chocolate :)) w/ a couple small cookies on the side.   so i had very mixed feelings about my 1st and likely only experience at a GR restaurant as i doubt i'll have the chance to go back to vegas again (or any other location where his restaurants are). i really did have high expectations w/ his location b/c it's GR! he's all about perfection w/ taste and plating, and of course, he's anti-raw foods lol.. and then there's the horrible server i mentioned b4 who really was frustrating, if i wasn't in such a great mood about the 1st nite in vegas, i would've complained more outwardly at the time, right now, i'm wishing i had... will try to post pics of everything.

Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. these are 2 of the carrots that wound up being raw, i couldn&#39;t get my fork into em.. and the fatty part of the steak..
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. the &#39;side dishes&#39; were severely lacking, and IMO, this is very poor plating/appearance.. BUT the steak itself was delish!

CeMWqsBCc1ekfjQwIP6Pgg.text: Not bad but mediocre. Meat served in my burger was tasty but lukewarm and stuck to the bun. Chips (potatoes) were good and I liked the ketchup but this place didn't live up to all the hype. I appreciated my place setting and napkin more than I did my meal. Gordon Ramsey should spend more time working on his own menu instead of making an ass of himself on T.V. degrading other people.

MK5btmW2HW0UDiZwF9ZUuw.text: Ran in for a quick lunch at the bar while waiting for Absinthe tickets.  The bartender wasn't much of a talker, but service was good.  I just got the burger, which came with fries.  Cooked well but could have better seasoned.  Fries were tasty.

V5khE5gJEjmNjiqxU8jiKQ.text: Bad food, horrible service, long wait times, & not worth the price.  We waited an hour to get a table.  I ordered the corn soup.  After waiting 25 minutes, it came out lukewarm.  The flavor combination was odd, and the temperature didn't help.  I sent it back.  My wife ordered the three blend sliders (pub spots) and I ordered the Jidori chicken breast.  Our waitress didn't know what kind of meat was in the sliders.  They were bland and so was the chicken breast...no seasoning at all.  We could only eat half of our meals because of the bland taste.  The only good part of this meal was the sticky toffee pudding.  $82 later, we walked out very disappointed.  We won't be going back.

17ODEcqLH2pvbS9hMoMlnQ.text: Not too many selections on the menu. Expected the food to be a lot better. I had the beef burger and all it came with was a patty on a bun with cheese. Not much to it. Food was okay but the service was horrible. Took 30 minutes for my food to come out and a while for our check. Totally not worth it

0uAq8TPt2QTSB5iUNzgnlQ.text: I went to Vegas for my birthday last week and it was a great experience. My party of 3 had really great service and the food was fantastic. From the wonderful white wine that the waiter suggested to the warm bread sticks with cheese sauce to the braised beef cheek. The atmosphere was wonderful and comfortable. And the price was reasonable. When I go back to Vegas again I will be dining there for sure.

LLsJh5tuWI3bY0oewyGOrA.text: Food is good. It is kinda expensive. Service was great! Did not like the French onion soup.. It was very sweet! Overall enjoyed it. :)

Zw3WO1YFXDe5lAUYOjdcgQ.text: Strip casino dining in its purest, most naked state of corporate cynicism. Enormous space packed with unsuspecting diners, a cautiously daring menu, an army of impersonal wait staff buzzing to and fro, European sports on surrounding flat screens--everything about this place feels like it was washed through a series of trend spotting gastro-bots. But at least you get to wait way too long for your food, and as a special feature it's all ridiculously over priced. A pint of bass will run you ten dollars. Ten. Dollars. For a pint. Of Bass. Let that sink in. Two of us ordered fish and chips and one went with hangar steak, all served with French fries. Thirty minutes later plates arrived with luke warm, flaccid fries and serviceable proteins. The fish is substantial yet flaky and comes with a tarragon tartar which is a nice touch, but the whole thing lacks any kind of contrast in flavor or texture. Hangar steak was cooked properly, end of story. Hardly deserving its thirty dollar price tag. The table shared a sticky toffee pudding for dessert, which I have read much about. Moist cake, small scoop of generic vanilla ice cream, and standard warm toffee--enjoyable, but unexceptional. Overall, the "pub" fails miserably for how much it promises yet doesn't even attempt to deliver. More proof of the inherent evils of scaling ever upward. Everything about this place, the size, the insane prices, the vague service, the thoughtless dishes, exists merely to support its own fat, bloated fanny.

AW_H48A6rJ0FAgD-zQMT7w.text: We went to Gordon Ramsay's Steakhouse on a previos trip to Vegas and loved it so we had to try this place.  Place was very busy even for lunch on a Friday so I recommend using the OpenTable resevation on this place even if it is only an hour ahead of arrival.  Everyone else had to wait at least 30 mins, but we were seated immedately.  I had the Short Rib and Cheek Sandwich which was good but seemed like it needed a little something extra so I added the mustard.  The mustard is very good but be careful the stuff is SPICY.  My wife really liked the Fish and Chips and we loved the Sticky Toffee Pudding.

jh5_pojWkLk6UHIsob4Fag.text: Me and wife went to Vegas on our honeymoon. After finding Gordon Ramsay's last year and liking the food we decided to make this our first stop for happy hour on the day we got there. We decided to sit in the bar area and were immediately greeted by our bartender Ray Ray. Ray Ray asked us if we were right or left handed as to make it easier to pick up our drinks. After talking to Ray Ray he congratulated us on our wedding. We went back two days later on a Friday and Ray Ray was once again behind the bar and not only remembered us but also remembered we were newlyweds which I found amazing as Gordon Ramsay's is right on the gaming floor in the middle of Cesar's Palace. Ray Ray was once again very hospitable and even gave us a free Sticky Toffee Pudding which was amazing as were the pretzels, deviled eggs, and sliders we ordered. If you are ever in Vegas and want to go to a celebrity chefs restautant make sure to check out Gordon Ramsay's Pub & Grill.

pLnB-BglN_bphYUL2kvAgw.text: I have been a bit obsessed with Gordon Ramsey since I fIrst saw him on t.v. With this being said, I was so excited and jumped at the first chance I got to eat at one of his restaurants! I must say I was very disappointed. The food and drinks were a bit pricey for what they were and our service was horrible. I think the expectations of it being a Gordon Ramsey restaurant may have been too high. We had the Fish and Chips and it was very greasy, the flat iron steak had great flavor but for $32, we expected there to be a side item but instead it was served with a small piece of onion. Long story short, after $150.00 we left upset with the service, still a bit hungry, and extremely disappointed.

5UmkNLti0hufpitjwqei5w.text: We were seated right away and then asked to move to a different table because the seats were to low and my wife is short, no problem! We had walked from our hotel in the busy downtown foot traffic, in the heat so my wife was a little abrupt and in a bad mood. It was like water on a duck and just rolled off, no problem. The service was amazing as was the food. We are definitely going back the next time we are in Vegas.

CXLuga9giwHnwq4x6umcPw.text: Very disappointed. Sand in the scallops. Fish and chips - fish over-cooked. When told waiter, he said he would let know chef know. Came back and said no one else complained. I asked if he thought I was lying. Said no, but no one did anything. Not what I expected from a Gordon Ramsey restaurant. My family is English and I have had MUCH better fish and chips from our local take out in San Diego and a LOT cheaper!

5v_pQH0uCKrtL51Mata_zA.text: Fan of Gordon's other establishments so tried the Pub and Grill. Expectations not as high as this is pub food. I'd really give it 3.5 Stars if I could.   The service needs a lot of work as it is dreadfully slow. The time it took just to take our order, receive our drinks and get our bread was pushing 35+ minutes - underscored by the fact that the Pub was at about 70% capacity.   The food was very good. My app and entree was very good as were my buddies'.    I read some comments on here, which are really short sighted. Of course it is expensive - you are in Vegas and at Caesers Palace. I paid $5.90 for a large coffee at the damn food court nearby. Everything is over priced there. Room service for 2 burgers at Caesars was about $75 so compared to room service this is a bargain.  The staff seemed disoriented and somewhat aloof. Not sure what the culture is there, but it is different from the other GR places I've been.  Anyway the place is pretty cool and tv's are everywhere.   It isn't worth making an extra effort to go if you are staying far away but if you are staying at an adjacent property it is worth going to.

n_ljv9h1Ds1_TGBU-VhLTQ.text: Not very impressive overall.   I'm a local and had high expectations for dinner. Made a 5:15 reservation to give me ample time to make a 7:30 Jerry Seinfeld show.   Was promptly seated and had our drunk order taken, but we didn't see the waiter for 15 or so minutes.   We each ordered salad and an entree. It's a good thing I enjoy taking with my girlfriend, because by the time the salad came, I had completely forgotten we ordered them.   Dinner came about 6:30 and was ok. We both ordered the same thing, a small fillet, piece of pork belly, and a couple shrimp. The fillet was cooked perfectly, but the other two items were over cooked at dry.   The manager came over to offer a free dessert for the long wait, which was appreciated. The bill came and the $11 charge was there. The show read starting and I didn't push the issue.  I can go to Flemings, spend 2/3rds the money, and get a perfectly cooked meal. I realize we're paying for his name, but I don't think our meals would have make it out of the kitchen on Hell's Kitchen....  They're plenty busy with the constant traffic in the hotel, but.....

WdmeOy972C2wKM1TcnEdNw.text: Expected so much more from this place. The food was good, but at these prices it should have been great. The ambiance is fun and the wait staff was great. The bartenders are the highlight and probably the most down to earth people in Vegas.

ytGR-e74gB8xtX7HCl3sZw.text: Waited 30 min to get a table which I didn't mind. Ordered the fish and chips and expected them to be great but the chips fell short.  The fish was perfect but the chips were soggy.  I sent the chips back only to get the same back. What a disappointment! Expected more from Gordon Ramsey!

wf2aJ0z9RK4NOFaVW6RvtA.text: I value restaurants on three criteria: food, service, and ambiance. Unfortunately, the food is only adequate, the ambiance is maybe a hair above average, but our service was terrible! With so many excellent choices on the strip (or even in Caesars), I can't imagine this restaurant lasting very long.

6QrWQuWe65Y8ATekZdAxBw.text: Menu selection wasnt much to choose from, prices were a bit steep for the food portion that was served, i was still hungry after i left even after and appetizer and entree.... the atmosphere was ok, we were sat near by where everyone was walking by in the casino by the railing, felt everyone watched me eat or see what i was eating on my plate. The waiter staff was ok didnt help much in the menu selection ending up playing it safe and got the fish and chips, that was really good, soft and flavorful just small portion , to me his Burger restaurant in the planet Hollywood was way better, just my opinion... the rating would be higher if the portion was more and more of a selection...

ratILWpljqfVnY29nvmkIQ.text: Good portions & attentive staff. I don't follow his show so I'm not familiar with his particular cuisine but the menu is a little more than the usual you'd find in big fancy restaurants.

Z23bLNj7ObjlzLG6wK9GvA.text: The deviled eggs were amazing and the fish and chips are a must. But then service is even better thanks to Heather!

Ir8hAIVM_wK1lXi1WVRY6g.text: We went restaurant hopping in the Caesars Palace and decided to sit in the bar and try a few items. The lobster roll was good and tasted fresh with the lemon mayo. The kettle chip nachos with short rib and corned beef was just okay. It was a good portion, but the flavors just didn't mesh well together. We didn't eat most of it. The truffle fries also tasted like regular fries; the truffle was very faint. We decided to try the sticky toffee pudding and that was delicious. So rich and sweet and also very filling. The bartenders were very prompt and friendly. Overall, good ambience, good service, okay food.

The Mac and cheese was runny and tastes like it was out of a box. The Hellfire wings were medium heat and came out barley warm. The Siders were Ho Hum they need a sauce to give them some zing. The Deviled eggs were good along with the Potato chip nachos but they were not enough to drag this review up!  Sorry I would not recommend a stop, I now know why the place has a three star rating.

JC21P3AXTu3N6klh2mr5Nw.text: The food here was great! Our server, Sara, was amazing and very personable. My husband ordered the pesto chicken sandwich, which he said "was the best sandwich [he] has ever had in his life"!. I had the beer braised short rib. It's was good but not the best that I've had. Overall, the food and drinks were good. It was a great experience but one visit was good for me.

NACu--1RaM9XiXwEddsVQQ.text: Service is awesome. We were served by yaneisy, she has a great smile and is very sweet.  The food and drink are super yummy. We ordered the sliders, which were juicy, the lobster Mac and cheese and the steak and ale pie. You should definitely come and try. It is worth every penny.

yFSkA9wrZ2TAz3rnDvNZsw.text: Went in today to have a couple of drinks. The atmosphere was great!!!  We sat at the bar and I highly recommend the drink called " the Pub Crawl". It was nice and fresh. My wife enjoyed the Innes & Gunn on tap. The guys at the bar we're super friendly and welcoming. I would always recommend this place for drinks or for a meal.

DcX51uXwqLR2JYFU7Ys1pQ.text: The food was absolutely amazing. The price definitely reflects the quality of the ingredients of the food. Highly recommended it!

A1IRxHJzc_Y-1IZqClEcHg.text: Decent food, great location. The food here is awesome. The salmon is cripy and tender. The drinks are awesome as well.  Stick pubbing is a must have if you like having a desert.  Overall, it was an excellent dining experience.

8OtFgnqUr6lbZ1sXpA8B3Q.text: Lukewarm, that was our meal experience. The waiter was professional and attentative, the only pro.  The cons, all of the "hot" food was served lukewarm.  And the food itself was nothing special.  We ordered french onion (though it went under a different name), the tomato soup, the burger sliders with bacon, fries, and brussel sprouts.  The tomato soup was served warm, not hot, and the local Safeway does better with its Signature soup line.  The onion soup had a great broth, and the cheese was freshly melted and hot. There were plenty of onions. Unfortunately the broth wasn't hot.  The sliders, bun was toasted, yet cold on the bottom. The meat cooked nicely, but warm at best.  The fries, not hot.  And the candied brussel sprouts? Not hot except right in the center, and the candy, appeared to be maple syrup in the bottom of the dish.  The food came out quickly, so my assumption is it is prepared ahead of time and then assembled when ordered. Perhaps they forgot to turn ob the warming tray.

d93COXmMGQE_XIHeBxUZaA.text: We found ourselves here for dinner since one of my companions was too tired to leave Caesar's Palace for dinner. We made reservations and went up to our rooms to rest prior to eating.  We were seated quickly and were entertained with World Cup Soccer on the TVs around us. We had very attentive waitstaff. There was a nice selection of beer on tap, which made my dining companions happy. We started with the fried calamari, which was yummy. I appreciated that they included the tentacle pieces since those are my favorite. What was pretty gross was the pond of grease that was at the bottom of the paper when we finished our meal. The kitchen needs to be a better job of draining the grease before serving.  I had the BLT Duo. I wish I knew it was served cold ahead of time. Cold pork just isn't my thing. The pulled pork was more of a pulled pork salad since it was mixed with a light creamy dressing. A thick cold piece of bacon on top was less than appetizing. Minus a star right there. Again, I wish I knew ahead of time that it was served cold. I would definitely not order this again.  One companion ordered the NY Strip. His comment was that it was much better than the NY steak at the Old Homestead Steakhouse. It came with a tiny portion of fingerling potatoes and asparagus. He asked the server for a piece of bread since the meal was pretty rich. The server said no. He indicated he would need to order the appetizer pretzel bread. This seemed unreasonable as we saw other dishes that had bread. This 80+ year old man wanted a small piece of bread with his steak. Seriously, the waiter should have brought him a piece of bread on the house. It's not like we didn't each order a full meal, plus appetizer and drinks from the bar. They lost 2 stars and a percentage of their tip right there.   The other companion ordered the curry chicken. It's an Indian curry served with a side of chutney. I thought it was just ok, but my companion really liked it. By the end of the meal he was sweating from the spices.  One last point: The seating is meant to be like a pub. Each table had different style of chairs and tables. Some were regular restaurant table and chairs, there was also traditional bar seating and other tables that were homey with high backed sitting room style chairs. We were seated on a raised table with high bar stool seats. It wasn't my preference to eat dinner on stools without back support. I wish the hostess checked in with us about this prior to seating, especially considering we had a senior citizen in our party. Minus one star for lack of consideration for any special needs of our party.

Z29utGMtKpzHsSE81jE_Pg.text: A-okay nothing special. The entree I ordered was delicious, however, quite pricey. I ordered a BLT and it was over $20.  The BLT was really good and had a unique twist to it. It had basil in it which was a good surprise. The only thing I found odd was that the bacon was crushed or chopped instead of strips of bacon so the bacon kept falling out when I was trying to eat it.  Everyone else in my group said their food was good. No complaints. Service was pretty good. They were pretty attentive.

wFARf4Op-t3ZMJWJIZmEWw.text: Great service from Chris P, great recommendation with the lamb shank & pale ale! cheers mate

NSFCHEKBmDyIx107NxEKBQ.text: We ate here yesterday on our last day while staying at Caesars Palace.  Nicely decorated restaurant.  Wait staff and bartender on duty was very friendly and attentive.  Drinks were strong and flavorful.  Burgers cooked to perfection with a great brioche bun.  The fries were nothing special though.  You'd think that a quasi English pub would serve thick "chips" not these thin fries.  Not an original presentation of fries either.  Hell, even Chili's is putting fries in metal baskets now. Dinner for 3 was $125 for 3 burgers, appetizer and 3 cocktails minus tip.

Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States

PesJhmcUh3cK78fcVlz95Q.text: I want to give 4.5 but alas I cannot. So, here it goes, the Ramsay Pub and Grill review. :) knowing we were going to Vegas, we knew we wanted to try one of Ramsay's places.  We love his shows and wanted to try his food.  We decided on the Pub and Grill. We made reservations via Open Table. About a week before, we got a message on our home answering machine from the restaurant. We were being bumped, a VIP came in and bought out the restaurant for the night we were going to be there. They were very accommodating and worked to get us in while we were there. The evening finally arrived. We got there a little early and were seated immediately. This is where they lose the half star. I sat in a chair and felt like I was on the floor. My chin, literally scrapping the table?! What is up with the chairs? Our waitress and another staff were very helpful though to get us "big people" chairs. I quite literally needed a booster to reach the table appropriately. But the dinner got better. We started with drinks. I chose the blue sky, sweet and yummy! I am a sucker for a sweeter mixed drink. The hubby chose a beer on tap, all I know though is that it was a heffeweizen. It was delightful though. We picked apps. The beer nuts which come with a variety: sweet, salty, and spicy. I didn't try the spicy but the hubby liked them a lot. I tried the sweet and the salty. They were delicious. We also got the lobster roll app. Two small rolls filled with an awesomely good lobster roll filling. For our main dishes...the hubby got the fish and chips which comes with  mushy peas. I have never heard of mushy peas but wow...how interesting who would have thought that peas and mint would taste so good together. Wow! What flavors! I chose the Scottish salmon and this came with cauliflower. Wow! Best salmon ever! The skin tasted so good! And the fish cooked perfectly, flaking off, so fresh. Cauliflower was delightful too. Just a really good dinner. The food was just really quite good. I would visit again!

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mine: the Scottish salmon - a perfectly cooked and fresh piece of fish and some really yummy cauliflower
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The hubby&#39;s: fish and chips and smashed peas, those smashed peas, wow (different but so good!)
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Apps: lobster rolls and beer nuts - both excellent

-eXXYp99wKZpJlajfFbFEg.text: It was awful trying to find a decent lunch spot for the July 4th weekend at Caesar's. Bacchanal had a nearly 90 minute wait for a $53 brunch and we were denied at Mesa Grill because they had a dress code for lunch (screw you Flay). Our fallback was the more casual Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill.  Anything with Ramsay's namesake should scream quality and consistency, but most of the plates fell short of expectations. We started off with the little piggy deviled eggs, which were presented with the yolk separated for self-serving. From there, I went with the shepherd's pie, which came lukewarm. The mashed potatoes had an unpleasant texture and I didn't get much of the cheddar cheese. The ground lamb and peas had no distinguishing flavor. The steak & ale pot pie came off as salty, but at least I enjoyed the crust.   The sides we tried included the truffle fries and the lobster mac & cheese. The fries were far too similar to the regular fries and didn't have enough truffle oil. The lobster mac & cheese was worse than the Kraft blue box. While there was a generous helping of lobster meat, the mac & cheese itself was very watery and no crispy crust. We declined the popular sticky toffee pudding for next time.  Our waitress was great and sold us on their imported beer menu. Her entertaining small talk was probably the highlight of our meal.
