aoLZKyJGaUQk_j0pEq9Oxg.text: The food here is extremely underwhelming. The server was rude and not friendly at all. Don't eat here! There are many other restaurants in close proximity.

Qz3WeK5SE7UXv2p3BvuuJQ.text: We have been to this restaurant 5-6 times. It is always good but not extraordinary. The best things we have found on the menu are the soft pretzels and the sticky toffee. Not going to change your life but is great for late night.

T2kVasb3udUL3lU6JkWptw.text: I visited this place during the Mayweather vs. Pacquiao fight.  It was super duper busy but despite that the servers did a great job handling business.  Whenever I wanted another cocktail they were right there for me.   The food was awesome especially the FISH AND CHIPS.  If you are ever in town and you like fish and chips I would highly recommend this place.  I normally would not go to a place like this but thought I would give it a chance.   You never know till you try!!!  Good job guys.  I will be back again this month.

-93sPERCHywn4kOKd_YEIg.text: Excellent service and food up to the mark as you would have expected in Ramsay's. Had heard a lot about it and made it a point to have food here on this Vegas trip. Adam was our host, excellent service and a very funny guy. Great experience over all.

Yj6fyODC4EZ8W3ZHeOFt0w.text: Great food! Loved saffron rice with caramelized onions and other veggies! Our server Adam was awesome! Just ask for Adam!

UdF_JEDVhP2ibP7f8QpaNg.text: Vegas trip with my wife and friends and we decided to eat here cause of the long wait at the buffet. I believe the servers name was Alan, he was an amazing server, answered questions well, friendly and polite. Only reason why its a three star was because the food was ehh.. If youre craving greasy buttery salty food this is the place to go, if youre not, ehh not the best place. We ordered the two famous Burgers, they were okay but other than that we tried the fish and chips and salad, an 4 people ordered and left more than 50 percent of the food. Server got it those extra stars! But who knows, maybe we just all have different tastes.

tPz8DGfTQUXKQ-o6xiIg5A.text: This place is absolutely amazing!!! The staff is on point, and very knowledgeable and attentive to guests needs and wants. I am a local and very rarely visit the strip, but we scored tickets to Mariah. We knew the pub would be busy based on location, and it was. We opted for the bar, due  to time restrictions. Evan was our bartender he steered us the right way with both food and beverage, and we were out on time. We also were visited by both the GM Louie, and manager Manny!!! If I were you, I would visit whenever in the area. This place was a huge hit!!!

yUHhq3QiymRwe8f3qzMJ8A.text: Food is ok. Service is lacking. Up to you if you go, but far better places to go for a far better meal for equal or more inexpensive prices.

ZXztPgKmVhmkQBne7arMtw.text: Not a lot i could eat so i just had some drinks. They were good. I have a gluten allergy so makes it hard to eat at a pub. Its a fun place. Were were at a Corp meeting. A lot of us walked in and had fun while there. Full service bar.

XZvT3txul4ag0e4pv6R23A.text: Hungry, hot, overworked (came to Vegas for a business trip, sadly not fun) my coworkers and I decided to try this place since it was close by and seemed to have lots of items that would be filling.  Pros first! - Their burgers were AMAZING. The meat is cooked perfectly and portions were just right.  - The fish and chips were great and portions were HUGE. I could only finish half of it.  - Our server was really nice and gave us free pens at the end of our meal (sucker for free stuff..)  Cons... one kinda big con actually.... - When we arrived we had no reservations, BUT we saw the entire front section was open with about 15 tables or so. However, when we asked for a table, they told us there was a 30 minute wait...but their were tons of available tables... none the less we were all hot and tired and decided to just wait it out and ended up only waiting 15 minutes, but still...you would think with all those available tables they could give our small group of 4 one table. Guess they were ALL reserved since on our way out the tables were still empty.

qw84DDOjn5Ftf99UBlw9Uw.text: Stopped in for dinner after seeing a show, and had the best beer-battered fish & chips I ever ate.  The only reason for not giving a 5-star review is the price was a bit too high for a fish & chips dinner, regardless how awesome they were.  (And, I was a little disappointed that they were out of Stone IPA.)

vBL3il5AlTNMiGdPjiu5vg.text: Gordan Ramsay Steak was so good we decided to eat here the next day for lunch.   Service here was excellent. Drinks were excellent. I really liked the fish and chips but my fiance found it a bit too salty.  I ordered the toffee pudding, again. AMAZING!

ix7Fq3oYxmiiKokrD1vHEw.text: Taylor is a  sweetheart. Professional, cute and charming. Just giving the right girl some love.

X9Rlh7UNmuUJMCbE9XPF6Q.text: Only because zero stars was not an option.... 15 minutes for WATER! We waited 30 minutes for cocktails and the food was okay at best. If Gordon Ramsey was there he would "shut it down"!!

D4ZsT3pYt26mTTbi-laJ6Q.text: Gordon Ramsay's pub at Caesar's Palace is okay. We had tickets to see Jerry Seinfeld on a Saturday so we decided to eat here beforehand. My husband and I share the fried calamari appetizer, which was nice when you got a bite of calamari with the sliced chili, but was way too salty on its own. My husband enjoyed his lamb burger but thought there was way too much feta spread on it. I had the sliders, which were a bit dry, and chips with truffle aioli, which were excellent: crispy, lightly salted, and the mayo wasn't overpowering. Dessert was the best part. His famous sticky toffee pudding definitely lives up to the hype.

2GhYc7l2mdOd667WjwY04w.text: I actually wanted to give this place 4.5 stars but unfortunately yelp doesn't allow that :(  A date took me here for dinner two nights ago. I loved how decor was bright and colorful when we walked in. The server was extremely attentive and knowledgeable about the menu which was great since I couldn't decide what to get. We both loved the extensive amount of beers on tap!  We were served complimentary pretzel bread with a sharp cheddar cheese spread that I could have just eaten as my meal - Delish! Since it's pretty cold here right now I started with the english ale onion soup which was an even better version than french onion soup. It was rich and very filling.   My date had the pub beef burger with ginormous fries..I totally wanted what he had. Sadly, he demolished the whole plate so I didn't even get a taste but that's what I'm getting next time.   The server really sold us on the sticky toffee pudding with sweet cream ice cream. I was in heaven..  I took away half a star only because they have huge flat screen tv's at each table and my date was glued to it since the game was on. I think it took away from the experience a little bit but I was definitely pleased with the service and food.

TO_J8HdRsxSyhtNgcUZWXw.text: We came here after the wait at Mesa Grill was going to be 3 hours- it was close and only a 15 min. wait.  This was my least favorite place we ate in Vegas.  We shared 3 apps: shrimp cocktail, sliders, and lobster rolls.  I guess the best way to say it is I don't really remember any of them.  The lobster rolls were more veggie than lobster and the burgers were totally lacking in flavor.  Our server (who had to wear such a terrible outfit- felt so sorry for her) was nice, but service was really slow.  We did order the sticky pudding and I have to say THAT was delicious, the redeeming part of the meal, but didn't make up for the rest of the meal enough that I would go back.

_5vvi9Z7e8GWpSegwB6hJA.text: After a disappointing foray into Wolfgang Puck's Bar and Grill at the MGM, I didn't hold out much hope for the whole celebrity chef restaurant thing.  I'm glad to have been proven wrong at Gordon Ramsay's Pub and Grill in Caesar's Palace.  My friend and I were in there at around 2:00 on a Sunday.  The place was hoppin', but we found a couple of seats at the bar and were promptly greeted by a really friendly bartender.  I asked him a few questions about the beer selection, describing the flavor profiles that I like.  He brought me several samples and was able to speak knowledgeably about the vast array of beers on offer.  I know it's kind of lame, but in the end I decided to stick with Peroni.  Hey, it was 109 degrees out, I had just walked all over creation, and I wanted something on the lighter but flavorful side.    My friend had a couple of mojitos, prepared by the same bartender.  She said they were amazing.  We both ordered the burger.  My friend ordered hers medium and I ordered mine medium well.  Both were cooked to perfection.  We both opted for the cheese and bacon toppings (because you just kind of have to, right?).  We both had gruyere.  It was melted, nutty, aromatic, and delicious.  The bacon, while thick, was still very crispy, and richly maple flavored.  It was a delicious meal with layer upon layer of fantastic flavors.    My friend ordered dessert (some rhubarb tart) and she said it was delicious.    My meal (burger, fries, two imperial pints) put me back $40.  Not bad at all.  I highly recommend this place.  Give Wolfgang a miss and come straight to Gordon!!

VdKRpeDQO3vjX-lHtkFZjw.text: The service was amazing here. Very attentive. If you like mixed drink the " goodbye blue sky" was really good. I got the lamb burger and it was cooked perfectly and tasted great. Would eat here again.

JTa25G860RMMuzaQxfC9Gw.text: The food is the star.  Everything we ate was wonderful, but pricey.  The fact that it is pricey is OK because it was on par with the rest of the restaurants on the strip.  The only complaint was that our drinks came after the appetizer and half way through the main course.  The drinks would very good when they did arrive.  Highly recommend the Lobster Mac & Cheese.  We will be back.

EmQ9VHh4fkAQV7jkKAa51w.text: Disappointing. The fact that it's a Gordon Ramsey restaurant got us excited and eager put our names on the hour long wait list. Ordered the Lobster Brioche and was VERY letdown. What I thought would be fresh, seasoned lobster over amazing fresh bread ended up being a mediocre cole slaw concoction  over a cold lemon poppyseed bread. Could have been great but tasted old and like it came off of an assembly line. Nothing special about it and felt like no passion or time went into it. Maybe the other dishes are better, but after the disappointing first dish we closed our check. Sadly won't be returning. Decent beer selection though.

cgaQ92WgER_RH8RdDof-Og.text: We had dinner here.  While we mostly liked the food my salad was not great.  The dressing had so much lemon it over powered everything and literally made me pucker.  Also, it said shaved vegetables which really was just a few slices of carrots/radishes.  Not what I was expecting.  The tomato soup and the pork chop was delicious.    Service/experience was okay.  I don't think it was worth the price.

XUFYSvZUlfBuRyaU-19B1Q.text: This was completely unexpected in its greatness.  We had planned an expensive dinner at Gordon Ramsay's Steak to celebrate our anniversary.  We were staying at Caesar's Palace, and were looking for someplace to eat lunch.  We decided to stop in, with the plan to get a drink and an overpriced lunch.  We were fortunate that the restaurant week menu was still active, with a $30 three course price fixe menu.  It was a great deal.  We both had the chopped salad, which was a step above most.  Crisp, fresh items, tossed with a tasty dressing.  Generous portion as well.  The salmon entree was amazing.  Perfectly prepared, with amazing sides.  Then there is the sticky toffee pudding.  Served warm with home made ice cream and with hot caramel poured over it table side.  Arguably the best dessert I have ever eaten.  Nice selection of beers and wines.  Worth it if you can get the price fixe menu.

8JyyGw_lVZAGFX13mtsvNw.text: This is a great place for friends and family! I wish I could afford to come here more often! Great stuff and food! If you're there, pay attention, Gordon might be in the room and you might miss him!

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spotted Dog
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sautéed Summer Mushrooms with poached farm egg! To die for!
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Caesars salad! One of the best in town! Ok, the best Caesars Salad in own :)

c_LeNipXuQwgTkYqIIQI-w.text: A group of friends and I were here on 7/28 and we were all disappointed with our experience. Service was on point but the majority of us thought the food was a joke.  Lobster rolls looked extremely appetizing.. but had little to no flavor. Wings.. you can tell that these wings were definitely fried for way too long and have been sitting for a bit. Flavor? Waaaay overly salty. Everyone that ordered wings didn't end up finishing them. Sliders.. I've had better from Dennys unfortunately.  This was a first at a Gordon Ramsay restauraunt and may honestly be a last.

1Q1mohATjLbbIiy_mSlFow.text: We arrived and had a small wait (20-25 minutes) before we were seated. It was a nice atmosphere with TVs on showing local sports. We were seated at a table with bench seating on one side and a chair on the other. The bench was stiff and the chair sank in but both were tolerable. The bacon cheeseburger was really tasty and the fries were fresh. The shrimp on brioche appetizer was also good. Our waitress was very knowledgeable and informative when it came to the items on the menu. Everything you come to expect from a Gordon Ramsey establishment.

sTovEVEZ-IYIDx-TvpSDMA.text: With all of the restaurants on the strip it was unbelievably hard to choose one so we found a local and asked for their opinion. This restaurant was their number one pick and boy were they right. We had an incredible experience and the food was amazing! Can't wait to have the nachos again!!

z8UlXz4-ETbr_c19a7g5FQ.text: We went here around 2pm and ordered a few appetizers. The French fries were old and Luke warm and the sliders were absolutely drilled. The soup came with one sad little slice of bread and all for $75. To make it worse they drained a gift card taking more than what was agreed. By the time we realized we were miles away. Poor food at extortionate prices.

2d0RT3RG5hqfls-J7knAjA.text: I wanted to come here because I am a fan of Hell's Kitchen. This is the place where the current season winner will be cooking. Of course we don't know the winner yet. I tried to ask the bartenders and they don't know either.   Came here on a Friday night. It seemed pretty busy. Not a huge wait though. We walked up to the bar and got a seat. I preferred the bar because there were TVs and I like to socialize with the bartenders. However these bartenders were not very friendly. They seemed cold and was all business. We asked to change a channel on a TV to watch one of the March Madness games since there were at least 2 other TVs that were showing the same game. Not sure if they heard us or not, but no response. Finally after asking several times, one of the bartenders said that they had to ask the manager if they can change the channel. However, no urgency to go ask the manager. He just stood there doing something with the register. O-Kay...   As the night progressed, the bartenders got a little bit more socialable. They recommended the poutine with duck. It was A-Mazing! We had few Magic Hat beers which was a perfect match the to poutine.   Overall, the service needs a bit more help. The restaurant is great for any sports enthusiast. Lots of TV and some tables had their own TVs! I only had the duck poutine but was ridiculous good!

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Duck Poutine. Really good!

SWXkQQz3GnMN3V3_qQrfmw.text: The food was awesome..one of the best burgers I have ever had..I gave the restaurant 3 stars because the service sucked...our waiter never once checked yup make sure our food was right or if everything was ok..There was another gentleman who did bring us our food and made sure everything was ok...but our waiter totally sucked..I will not say any names but we sat in the second seat behind the hostesses stand...I hope we get better service at Gorden Ramseys steak tomorrow night.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Tvh6MfnAXBHmZY0VwzOt9A.text: My partner and I went to Gordon Ramsey' Pub on Valentine's Day. The atmosphere was very nice, and furnishings very comfortable.   We were a bit surprised at the actual food unfortunately. My partner ordered the shepherds pie, and it was very salty. I ordered the fish and chips, and it came out on a plate with a sheet of newspaper between the food and the plate. When the newspaper started getting wet, any attempts at cutting the fish resulted in shredded newspaper. I ended up eating two or three news articles along with my meal. I understand the desire for the British chip shop "authenticity", however, if they had just put the food on the plate, I would have been able to finish my meal.

TZdmfLEtNmfXD_qY9zLGvQ.text: We needed to find a place to eat on Tuesday night and decided to stop by here.   Wait was short. About 5 minutes.   Our waitress wasn't that friendly or attentive. We got seated at the bar table and once a table opened up, we asked to switch (this was before we even ordered). Waitress said she needs to check with the front and took over 5 minutes. She comes back and starts moving our menu and silverware over without telling us we're moving.   We ordered: Lamb Shepard's pie Fish and chips Beer Cider  Food took a while to come out. Waitress didn't give fiance a spoon for Shepard's pie (or offer to). I had I ask for salt and pepper, which took a long time for her to return with it.   I think if we are paying $25+ per dish, the wait staff needs to be more attentive. She was not only slow, but she never checked on us. Food was ok... I wouldn't pay $30 for fish and chips..... Sorry but, you've disappointed me and I will tell my friends.

PIx82Ob7rM2r6Dl3kWR9PQ.text: Staying at the Caesar's for the week and went to have a quick bite at Gordon Ramsay Pub and Grill. We sat at the lounge part of the restaurant. Was attended by Julio! what an amazing and hilarious guy! Very few servers like him! He was polite and very helpful! He suggested the fried chicken sandwich for me and since my girlfriend likes meat! She has the corn beef sandwich which was delicious! He took his time to conversate and have a good time! He didn't rush us or was money hungry! We will be coming back very soon!

MLGyMgyI5oDa-D2QHOFV_Q.text: One of the best meals I ate in Vegas. Those deviled eggs were divinely sent. And the Brussel sprouts were the Bomb.com. My waitress recommended the Dublin and it was quite tasty. Healthy portions and worth every penny.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dublin and side said

lImTTidKrYSUMoE7no_pBw.text: I came here with friends a while back.  I really loved it here.   I'm mildly obsessed with Gordon.  I watch everything of his that I'm able to, having access to only what's on Netflix and Hulu, so when I saw that he opened a pub here, I jumped at the chance to go...especially since its a lot more affordable than the steak house. (still dying to try that one.)  For starters, we had the Warm Salty Pretzels, with the beer cheddar and mustard spreads.  These were absolutely delicious.  Good thing we split them between four people, because I could have filled up on those alone.    We each got a sandwich/burger each: Welsh Rarebit Ham Sandwich:  I hate ham.  I really do.  But I wanted to try a bite of this sandwich so that I could say that I was brave and ate ham JUST because it was at a GR restaurant.  It was reallly good.  Open faced sandwich with lots of flavor.  My only complaint is that my first bite fell into my beer. :(  that was totally my fault though. lol  Pub Lamb Burger:  The menu gives you the option of feta or goats cheese.  My friend opted for the goats cheese, and I think this is the perfect decision.  The lamb burger was just a touch on the dry side, so the feta might have taken away from the taste of the burger.  With the goats cheese, it was flavorful and pretty good.  I'd order it, but like it a little less well done.    Pub Beef Burger:  This is the one I got.  Of course, I added the applewood smoked bacon. (duh.)  I loved it.  I thought it was the best tasting meal of the group.  Not only that, but the beer that I chose (Lucky Buddha) went with the burger perfectly.  It was a good size, very juicy, and perfectly cooked.    I'm kind of ashamed to say right now that I might have gone too long in writing this review to remember the fourth sandwich.  I could have SWORN that my friend had a corned beef sandwich, but I'm not seeing it anywhere on the menu.  So it might have been the beef cheek one, but I'm not going to review because I don't recall.  Whatever it was, it was really flavorful. :D  I loved how the sandwiches were all served with REAL chips...they were perfect as well.  Not a single one was over cooked, and they were't super greasy either.  I will definitely be going back, and hope to save room to try the sticky toffee pudding next time.    The staff was awesome, and I love the decor.  We were seated at a "coffee table" type setting with two love seats.  It was right in the middle of the restaurant, where I could watch the football matches in the other room (real football, not American.) :D    I felt that the price was good for the quality of the food.  4 of us ate AND drank for about $100.  Not too shabby.    Hm.  Maybe I'll go back this weekend... ;)  Now that I'm thinking about it, I'm getting hungry again. :D

pueb35ce-lwyvcYgU_U8uw.text: What isn't to love about a restaurant where the beer and wine menu is twice as long as the food menu?  My aunt decided to visit me in sin city this past weekend and this was the first restaurant on her list that she wanted to try.  We arrived at about 3 on a Saturday afternoon and there was only about a 10 minutes wait.  We were seated by the very sweet host.   We were seated on the side near the walkway  Truffle Chips - They are huge!!  They are about 1in x 1in x 3in.  I heard they are boiled, baked, and deep fried to give it that wonderful consistency.  The Truffle Chips are special because they drizzle it with wonderful scrumptious truffle oil and top it off with truffle shavings.  There are also two dipping sauces one tomato based and the other has a creamier consistency  Pub Lamb Burger - This burger comes with a good sized lamb patty that is cooked to order.  Topped with goat cheese and sun dried tomatoes.  It was wonderful!  You also get a side of their giant chips.  If you are a beer drinker I recommend pairing it with a bottle of Delirium :)  I took off one star because of the tight seating situation.  My aunt and I were seated near the edge of the restaurant and we could barely get in and out of seats.  I'm not sure if all parts of the restaurant are like this, but it was pretty uncomfortable.  I really enjoyed my experience (minus the seating issue).  I can see myself coming back in the future if I have more visitors, but I will be sure to try and sit in a different section.   TIP:  I recommend parking at the self parking near the Forum.  Once you come off the elevators turn right and you will run right into the Pub & Grill  Bust out your Total Rewards Card (the players club card for the Harrah's Casinos) and save a buck or two on every item.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pub Lamb Burger
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Truffle Chips

SMXV8Kx4bg-cp5kaQqCN9A.text: Thought this was a fun place to eat. This was the first time I was able to have bangers and mash, and it left me wanting more. Also I am a fan of Fullers beer. I had to ask but they did have ESB on draft. I must say it has never tasted so good. If I am ever in Las Vegas again I will definitely be going back!  Service was good too.

yzgvgiMFl9CyAFid9sFy5Q.text: We had the best food and service here tonight.  Rodney was awesome, his service guarantees we'll be back.  Do yourself a favor and stop by and ask for Rodney!

EQ0YPcmpxr7S1OaekUL4WQ.text: The fried maple chicken sandwich was amazing! Our waiter, Rodney, was very friendly and attentive! Good food, nice atmosphere. Don't leave here without having the sticky toffee dessert!

DTAZkFN9mA0nXnSooUKYNw.text: This is my second time here and I will be back every time I'm in town from LA. Scott was extremely helpful and accommodating when we wanted to add on to our reservation. He made suggestions when we had questions and was available any time we needed him. My sister ordered the beef Wellington and said the meat was melt in your mouth. I absolutely love the pub feel here and plan on bringing my friends here whenever we want a beer and some amazing pub food!

r3-AsgatEU6oLF3RAfuxpQ.text: I normally write separate reviews for each visit but these visits are only days apart.   VISIT #1 I came with some Yelperazzis for a snack before a Yelp event ( yes, we ate before a food sampling event and we went to eat after that too). We just decided to share some bits at the recommendation of David who has tried a extensive bit of the menu.   The short rib and beef cheek sandwich was the star for me. It was beautifully braised and tender and I love their housemade stone ground mustard with a horseradish kick.   I hate when a place can make a Shepherds pie that puts mine to shame (and I know mine is fucking delicious) but this did me in. I like that its a combo of lamb and beef and the gravy of it was savory and worth sopping up if there's some left after devouring (save a piece of bread or ask for some!).   The deviled eggs were good in that the bacon does add a kick to it, but to me a deviled egg is just alright.   Pei mussels and clams were perfectly cooked and the broth with it was solid and had a nice saffron flavor.  I got the Magic Hat #9 to drink which was nice and freshly apricot to cut the richness of the food.   Service was on point. Lovely, funny, enthusiastic Elise took such great care of us, filled our drinks, checked in on us, gave great recommendations and got us checked out in a flash.    VISIT #2  A few days later I return for my BFs friends birthday with a large party of 10 people. It was much busier on a Saturday night than the weekday we came.   The BF and I got the duck confit poutine to start as I really wanted it when I came last but they were out. I say it's rather good and comforting, lots of shredded confit to go around for each bite of fries. I don't know if I would call it poutine as I normally have a much thicker gravy, but this au jus gravy situation was densely rich. We tried bites of our friends scotch egg which was a great version of a dish I am a big fan of. One friend got some pub spot sliders which was okay but a bit too well done for my taste.   The BF got fish and chips which I thought was a solidly done one. I definitely am a fan of their tartar sauce! They don't give you malt vinegar automatically but ask if you want it. They have this garlic aioli that came with someones order but I asked for more to dip the steak fries in. If you love aioli on potatoes like I do, it'll elevate your fries.   I got the Irish beef cheek stew and fuck me sideways it was so tender and perfect. I did need some more potato but people kept throwing me their log fries so I mashed that into the jus and aaahhh, noms. Clean plate of course. Between this, the short rib and cheek sandwich this place knows how to braise meat to meltingly tender.   I had to get some sticky toffee pudding and it was delicious. It's one of my all time favorite comforts and theirs was definitely everything this is supposed to be. People wanted to taste and inside in my head was screaming "no, no, no" while I shared nicely like my mommy taught me.   Everyone was happy with their food. One of our friends orders wasn't put in... It worked out since there was no way another friend could finish their sandwich so they shared and they expedited a duck confit poutine for him.   Service was decent enough from our server and another server helping our table with water a few times. The person who white knighted the service though was our busser David that helped get all our random sauces and got to some ignored sodas and waters a few times.   The thing that really blew chunks was we were held hostage for the bill. People shoulda spoke up to maybe split before things were even ordered so that part was our fault, but the way it was split was so inefficient. Went to one person and asked what they ordered and then disappeared and going one by one and coming back to recheck and check again and again which is which. He came to ask us what we had twice after the first time.   Split checks during my first visit was painless. She tabbed which person is whose on one big check then came with one check back that split it into seat #1, #2, #3, etc. to make sure it was right then paired the card/cash to the seat and came back with our individual receipts - done. This took forever this time when I really think it shouldn't have been that hard to get items to the right person. A little wait was expected, but we waited almost as long for checks than our entire meal duration. One friend was salty they got attitude from the server about the bill? I did not witness or asked for a elaboration. Apparently this place also runs with having a cashier settle bills for the servers and they only have one? This place is packed so I think they may need another if a lot of people are waiting.   Pleased with the food and my first visit but coming with a smaller party at non peak hours to sit in Elises section! I'll average it to a 4stars as "I'm a fan", but warn big parties to handle splitting yourself and don't come when busy!  (Yelp 100 Challenge 13/100)

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Little Piggy Deviled Eggs
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. PEI clams and mussels
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shepherds Pie

5fX2dAq-4yMxpiHK4MhzCw.text: This place was just "okay" nothing I tried wowed me. We ordered the fried calamari and chicken wings for appetizers. Both good, but not worth going back for. For my entree I got the fish and chips; fish was good, but chips were weird and dry.  I wish I ordered something that wasn't fried haha. At the time it seemed like a good idea to eat some crispy/greasy goodness with my black and blues.   Three Stars because everything about it was basic.

YHaxuQUMzZq-aGVD14GmwQ.text: My friend and I came here on a Saturday night after we saw a sign saying that Hell's Kitchen was closed for a private event. We were told it was a 25 minute wait but luckily we were seated in less than 10 minutes. They don't have pagers, so there were just a bunch of people standing immediately in front of the restaurant waiting. There are penny slots very close by if you want to gamble while you wait but I'd recommend staying close by and not going by the quoted time.  We split the poutine, chicken wings, and kale salad. Everything was adequate, not especially good or bad. The poutine was annoying to eat because the cheese was melted in a single mound on top instead of dispersed throughout. The chicken wings had a lot of skin/fat on the ends and could have been trimmed more. The kale salad was my favorite and I liked that there was a lot of vinegar in the honey mustard dressing, the bite of the vinegar was very refreshing against the heaviness/fattiness of the other dishes we ordered.  Our server was fine and accommodating and got us in and out of there without rushing us. Overall fine if you're staying or seeing a show closeby, but not somewhere I'd go out of my way for.

cjQws6FFBtEcKO-Fx0_J1w.text: I have been a huge fan of Gordon Ramsay and have watched every reality show he has produced in the U. S. so when we were planning our recent trip to Vegas, all I could hear in my head is Gordon yelling at me, "You better eat at one of my restaurants, you f***ing donkey!" With those inspiring words resonating in my head, I booked our first dinner at Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill ( yelp.com/biz_photos/gord... ) for Thanksgiving dinner. This also continued a recent tradition I like to call the "Untraditional Thanksgiving." It started a few years ago with a trip to Big Bear for a Chinese Thanksgiving and since then we have done Hawaiian and now British cuisine. One of the things I like right away was the vibe of the place ... I really felt comfortable and at home. The attention to detail was extensive including a wall mural ( yelp.com/biz_photos/gord... ) , the table settings ( yelp.com/biz_photos/gord... ) and menus. Even the mix matched furniture just felt right in this restaurant. And if the staff needs a reminder of who they work for ( yelp.com/biz_photos/gord... ), you have Chef Ramsay staring at you every time you leave or enter the kitchen! Once we were seated at a half booth table, our server came over, took our drink order and introduced us to the menu. The menu consists of Table Starters, Soups & Salads, Sandwiches & Burgers, Seasonal Choices, Pies, Oak-Fired Grill Entrees, Classic Entrees, Sides and Desserts. For my wife, her entree was preordained weeks before the reservation and she chose the Classic Yorkshire Ale Batter Fish & Chips ( yelp.com/biz_photos/gord... ) Substituting Mashed Potatoes with Chive Oil for the Chips, I decided to go with the Steak & Ale Pie ( yelp.com/biz_photos/gord... ) and we split the Kettle Chip Nachos ( yelp.com/biz_photos/gord... ) Starter item. The Kettle Chip Nachos came to the table surprising hot and I think these were the first homemade chips that really impressed Laina. Usually we would have some major complaints about the lack of short rib (very little) and corned beef (even less ... think nada), but the HP sauce (Tamarind based sauce with tomatoes, molasses and malt vinegar) really elevated the chips and there was a good amount of the other items. Needless to say and to paraphrase Dr. Suess: the one speck of food that we left on the plate was a crumb too small for a mouse to have ate! Our entrees came out shortly after we had wolfed down the nachos. Laina liked the fish and said she could taste the ale in the batter, but was more impressed with the dill tarter sauce and sides. Opting out of the chips for mashed potatoes was an excellent choice as the potatoes were perfectly whipped and the chive oil was a great compliment. Usually Laina will ask for extra butter with her mashed potatoes, but no butter was requested on this occasion. Her only regret was there could have been more chive oil with the potatoes. She was also a fan of the mushy peas and thought the vest of lemon was a great addition without being too acidic. My steak and ale pie was a well balanced dish, just a bit on the small side. The pastry was a perfect golden brown and flaky. This is a very hearty entree and there was a good amount of tender steak, 'shrooms and root veggies. I am just not sure the quality makes up for the lack of quantity when you consider the price tag ($24.00). For dessert, we selected the Potted Chocolate Triffle ( yelp.com/biz_photos/gord... ) which came with two mini chocolate chocolate chip cookies. Rohlinism: It isn't Thanksgiving dinner without a fattening dessert! Laina was basically full, but always manages to find extra room for chocolaty delicious desserts. The triffle was topped with white chocolate shavings and round dark chocolate crisps. The mixture of dark and milk chocolate was fantastic and the Chantilly cream put this dessert on another level! Fantastic way to end the meal! Service was really good for the most part. We arrived a few minutes before our reservation and were sat promptly at 7:00 pm (love that British punctuality). Our server was efficient and answered all our questions (or asked someone who knew), but he could have benefited from a personality transplant. It is a bit on the expensive side, but that is to be expected and you can get $1.00 off most items by joining Total Rewards. Overall, I was impressed enough with the food to return in the future.

4J6BACLzuKlEnrgWw8f4cg.text: They offered us $150 voucher when we checked in at the hotel to try this place out. I have to say the service was horrible and the food was not that great at all. My expectations maybe were just so much more being a Gordon Ramsay having grill. It's more like a sit down and on the go type food. And I have a great food experience LOL. I will try somewhere else

g1RMX7sp1vNpKi37ULaE7g.text: Well the wedge salad was pretty impressive. I don't normally like wedge salads but this one was very special. Lots of different flavors going on, and very complex. We shared a pastrami sandwich which was absolutely amazing probably the second best one I've ever had. The lobster mac & cheese was also very good, just what you expect from Gordon. But the brussels sprouts were the real star of the show. Absolutely unbelievably amazing!! I could eat them all day!! Our neighbors had the steak and it smelled amazing and was cooked perfectly to his liking. Go, get whatever you want, but make sure you order the brussels sprouts too. You will thank me.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Nice The Wedge Salad

eC2RskKD4ZpXmz7uUljFfA.text: Due to circumstances beyond our control, we missed our OpenTable reservation but we proceeded to the restaurant and there were tables available and the amazing staff accommodated us. We wanted to try everything on the menu but due to our horrible day, we were exhausted and just hungry. Our server was amazing, the atmosphere had a lot of fun energy, and the food was incredibly satisfying. Highly recommend the Scotch Egg. Very pricey, but I would definitely return if I am in Vegas again!

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. BUTTER CHICKEN CURRY Saffron Basmati, Yogurt &amp; Naan Bread $28.00

vD8JU97dzi7hV53FV-RpgQ.text: Enjoyed the hub's birthday dinner here last year and it was wonderful. We were sat on the fake patio area and it was a bit loud so that's the 4 stars. The nachos didn't last two seconds on our table! Our service was nice and because he ordered a large beer the price of the mug was less. Of course topped it all off with sticky toffee pudding!

Hgn6C2oefpS5dNvlqe5fjw.text: Had the corned beef brisket which was tasty.  No complaints, pretty good for pub food, but super expensive for pub food.  I ate at the bar and the service was great.  Super friendly bartender

-gOHXLabEM9bdB7j3Lf4iA.text: My husband and I were really looking forward to trying a Gordon Ramsey restaurant. We were not disappointed! The wings are a must! The sauce is spicy, sweet, and salty. It's so well balanced that we requested some on the side to dip our fries in. The truffle fries are delicious and flavorful. Of course you can't beat a free sticky toffee pudding! We spent 5 days in Vegas and ate here for happy hour twice during our stay. Shoutout to Rodney for fantastic service! He answered our questions and provided timely and professional yet personable service. Next time we're in Vegas, we'll be back!

Var0L73T0qe0_rRO6DWE9A.text: Braised short rib was AMAZING. Juice behind the bar took great care of me - will definitely be back!

kHepm6SadJvzsMnI-IQaEQ.text: Had a great expectation when we walked into Ramsay's pub, it turned out to be a big disappointment. Bad food and service. Lobster Mac cheese had 2 tiny lobster pieces the size of small thumbs, fish and chips were bland, the chips were luke warm, Sheppard's pie was bland served with pretzel roll that was cold and hard.  Our server didn't ask us on how the food was. When we said we didn't like the food, she hurried up to pick up the Mac and cheese and removed it from the bill. Manager didn't even come to see us.. I've dined in many good & high end places, a manager always came to our table if there was something wrong with food/service. I wonder if Ramsay knew how the staff run his restaurants. For a chef that barked and screamed to his staff over bad service and food he really should come to this location. So far it was the worse $100+ dinner I've ever experienced.  If I could dispute this charge with my credit card company, I really would!

HdCZvP6VrrouHZQxSUgh_Q.text: Our server Christopher from that show Shameless  was the best! He made our visit here. The food was also amazing. Great way to end a Vegas trip.

JLdULpJMcqj_MO17mlxAVQ.text: Lobster Mac and chee on point  also fries (not chips) very good...  service was great server was very nice.

6wr9q-7lOy80qbUmLLPjkQ.text: This. Place. Is. Awesome.  Ordered the NY strip with some creamed spinach. The strip came with a housemade steak sauce. It was divine. This was the most succulent creamed spinach I've ever had.  As if I needed it to get better, the sticky toffee dessert was foodgasm.  I'm definitely coming back!

Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States

kO1pr9o9geVc7xFLih_DAw.text: Happy hour is worth the stop.  Monday-Friday 2-5pm the food deals were reasonable.   I got the warm pretzels - they were just ok and the beer cheese was pretty bland.  Also ordered the nachos and they were great.  Kettle chips with onions and peppers, short ribs and a cheese sauce over them.. yes please!  My group ordered wings and gave them a positive review as well.   Menu prices are steep otherwise.  $30 for fish and chips  There is a Gordon Ramsey fish and chips place on the Linq promenade that serves the exact same fish so if that's what your after, it's a much more affordable and fun option.

pA0842gZDj_Z71IdpRV-2A.text: So I was hyped for this. Spent hundreds of hours watching Gordon bite off the heads off of incompetent managers like Ozzy Osbourne, I was ready to get some real food.  So my girl and I stroll in at about 7pm, I order a gigantic 32oz Guinness because I'm a whore and I wanted to see what wierd stuff I can throw my money at.  Beef Wellington wasn't on this menu and I just didn't feel as depressed as should have to order fish and chips for $29. I went with the Chicken Curry.  It was still under Gordon's signature stuff so I was expecting something distinct or different, but It was pretty standard curry.  Good rice, good meat, nothing to write home about.  I've had better curries at small Indian joints when I lived in the East Bay.  My girlfriend got the Hells kitchen burger and ate it like a lion devouring a gazelle. I can't look at her the same way anymore.  We decided to try out the toffee pudding at the suggestion by our waitress and my God was that a good decision. However one caveat, when she delivered it she grabbed the giant cup of caramel and just poured it immediately.  I wanted to pour the caramel. Like my hopes and dreams the opportunity to pour the caramel has been taken from me.  The whole dessert was unbelievable though. I'm going to be scouring the internet to find a recipe that will allow me to recreate it at home.  All in all, it was good, little overpriced, nothing Earth shattering, but it's still an interesting place to eat if you're a fan. I would not recommend this place for tinder dates. Unless you know they're paying.

ukttnq07RVXeUX7X2oypjQ.text: There is only one thing you want here. Okay, there is only two things you want in here. Skip the food menu.  Come in for dessert (doesn't matter if it's before your meal, after your meal, or in-between your meal) and a drink.   The only two things you want when you come here are the Sticky Toffee Pudding and the Innis and Gunn beer that pairs perfectly with it.  Imagine the sweet, liquefied caramel just running itself down the sides of a crispy toffee mounted inside ice cream, layered on top of one of the softest bread puddings you'll find. Every spoonful of this dessert is a touch of heaven's bliss.  1. Take a spoonful of that sticky toffee pudding 2. Then a good sip of the Innis and Gunn 3. Proceed to smile as your mouth spins in orgasms 4. Return to step 1 and repeat all steps again, until there is nothing left.   Heavenly, truly.  -- Side note, I've had the food here and to be honest the stuff is good (as expected of Gordon and Ramsay), but all incredibly overpriced. I mean, $30 for regular fish & chips -- really, Gordon? Anyway. The sticky toffee pudding and Innis and Gunn..that is all you need here. Grab your meal elsewhere. :)

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sliders. They&#39;re tasty if you&#39;re craving some meat, but they&#39;re not &#34;wow&#34;. Do yourself a favor - get the sticky toffee pudding!
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The sticky toffee pudding and an Innis and Gunn beer!

K2X2s2b96f5ViBGC4kHE_Q.text: The Gordon Ramsey pub was  very clean and the service was extremely friendly. Our waitress/hostess  Stacy  was a pleasure and very helpful. We experienced exceptional service and would go back to this restaurant and pub again.   Thanks so much

Q721wrpqtKVrK038lIiCkQ.text: A little disappointed at this pub! Ate at a few other Ramsay restaurants and they were excellent. Was looking forward to this one as well but it fell way short. Three of us went for dinner here on Friday evening. For appetizers, we had the wings (which were excellent) and shrimp cocktail (nothing special). Then ordered the main courses of butter chicken (good, but cold) fish and chips (2 pieces of fish, not that big) which was average in flavor, and the short ribs, which had no seasoning what so ever on them.  Service was good. All the staff were very friendly. However, we were kind of disappointed with the whole experience based on the food and knowledge of Ramsay reputation. Hopefully the chefs just had an off day this time around and will be more attentive if we decide ever to go back to this place again.

_9F6mZlUbAvX7xI7wB2ROw.text: Went here on girls weekend and we wanted to try a few celebrity chef restaurants. This one was a favorite. Amazing service...thanks Mike! We got the kettle chip nachos for an app and they were delicious! Fish and chips were also really good. Recommend the wedge salad (big enough for two) and onion soup. Toffee pudding is a must! Next time we will try more of the entrees. The steak the guy next to us had looked amazing!

1ucHEipKW2fwzOAoqiyfkg.text: My family and I dined here last week, and it was a GREAT experience, top to bottom!  We arrived for our reservation, and were seated promptly.  We were hopeful this was a good indication of the service to come, and we were right.  Our waitress was attentive and friendly and really added to our overall dining experience.  (I'm just sorry that no one in our group remembers her name - oops!)  We were a party of four, and here is what we ordered: Starters: crispy calamari and kettle chip nachos Entrees: grilled lamb burgers x2, 8oz. beef tenderloin and beer braised short ribs Sides: grilled asparagus Desserts: potted chocolate trifle and mum's apple tart  We learned from our friendly server that Darin and Randy were our chefs for the evening.  They came out and greeted us, and we were able to compliment them on this delicious meal.  The calamari wasn't greasy or overly fried, it was perfectly light and flavorful.  The kettle chip nachos were one of the highlights of the night; the chips were crunchy and solidly held the shot ribs and cheese.  Our party devoured these!!  Lamb burgers were juicy and a nice change of pace for a burger.  The tenderloin was the perfect size for me, so tender and such a great fit with the potatoes.  I originally got the brandy sauce, but it was too sweet, which I told our waitress when she asked.  She kindly and quickly brought me an alternative, a white sauce (don't remember the name!) that was much better.  My husband felt the beer braised short ribs were one of the best entrees he's ever had - a THICK piece of meat that just melted when his fork touched it.  Carrots are one of my favorite things, and the caramelized ones that were served with the short ribs were the exact right amount of sweetness.  And then there was the dessert: both excellent, again - our table inhaled every bite!  The chocolate dessert was VERY rich and chocolatey, so you definitely have to be a hardcore chocolate-lover to enjoy this one.  The apple tart was light and fluffy and the ice cream tasted fresh and not overly sweet.  We left full and happy.  This was a dining experience that FAR exceeded all of our expectations.  We were fully wowed by Gordon Ramsey's Pub & Grill, as well as Darin and Randy and all of their wonderful staff.

yJPkN83R_u7lwofajKPT5Q.text: Scallops were amazing!!  Thank you for the free desert for my two sons for their birthdays, which was this past Sunday.  Evey was awesome!!

5kZQ5A9ZojjTbDTWKlA-7w.text: There burgers are to die for! The cheese is cooked and melted perfectly, the meat is so juicy it makes the burger spot on!! The staff are very friendly, great atmosphere, very clean!!

t1Ee7peJv80cqBgbBi3GEQ.text: Stopped in while visiting Caesars Palace with some friends. Ended up make a reservation online while shopping and walking around. The food and service were superb just like you would expect. Prices were surprisingly affordable even with a celebrity chef name attached. Would definitely be a go to spot when in Vegas if I don't care to get too adventurous.

yupWFLRfnMQykE-bWfq4kA.text: It was a busy weekend. However our server didn't seem to have an overwhelming section, yet the service was slow. Our drinks, while delicious were overpriced and under liquored. Not that I need to get boozy, for $15, I just expect more.   We started with the calamari. There were bacon pieces in...of course it made it over the top delicious. Delightfully fried and light on the oil and perfect crunch. Maybe the oil was just changed or maybe it's always good.  I had the lamb burger. I ordered it medium temp. which I realize now was my mistake. Medium rare is the way to go as that is how I had it last time. This time there were parts of the burger that were charred to a crispy blackness which were unappetizing. Come on...that's amateur. However the truffle fries saved me. Their always delectable and never in need of dipping sauce. The black truffle was plentiful; my favorite!  Always a fun place to meet good friends.

W93IcqCkph-G1YhDHKK_xg.text: It was good, really it was.    I had the lamb burger which really was good.  The beers we're good, super overpriced, but good enough.  I think I was expecting a bigger selection....if it hit 15 draught selections I would be surprised.   I was expecting a lot more especially with all of the kegs being used for decor.  Nothing particularly earth shattering, again five uk beers would be pushing it here.  Other people had the fish and chips, sheapards pie etc.  everyone thought it was good.  But for these prices you would expect exceptional.  It's Caesars....otherwise no one would even consider this place.  Be prepared and accepting of that and you'll be alright.    Outside of the strip it wouldn't get a second look, here it's pretty legit....weird huh?

N5mv3XuLEg80fu1EBdL-JQ.text: The mixed drinks are amazing! I highly recommend "goodbye blue sky" it was heavenly. I've tried a few food items here, my favorite was the mac and cheese- so creamy and decadent. They have a great variety of beers on tap including some English brews. The decor is very cool with the wall of kegs down to the uniforms the staff wears. It is a bit pricey here, but definitely worth a try!

-aeEJoiNzVOfkxOdWLPHPA.text: Tasted good for just arriving, but was shadowed by Strip House and Bouchon for high end food on this trip.  It was very tasty, but not exactly cheap.  Was it something amazing and give me a new respect for Gordon?  Not really.  Was it a good restaurant with tasty food?  Absolutely.  Was it worth the price?  Nearly... not entirely, but pretty close.  All said, it was a really good meal, but just wasn't a mind blowing experience.

OcRv0sEyQZTLbWOVHeFfww.text: As fans of Master Chef, we had to check out at least one of Gordon Ramsay's restaurants : ).  The ambiance was rustic and we enjoyed the style/presentation of the food.  We tried the calamari, truffle fries, and the shrimp cocktail for appetizers - though all were okay, nothing was anything special.  For a main meal, we shared a chicken basmati rice dish (I think it was seasonal) - that was also okay.  The best item we had was probably the dessert - we liked the sticky toffee pudding : ).  All in all - everything was fun to try!

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken with basmati rice (I don&#39;t recall the exact title, it was a seasonal dish)
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Truffle fries!
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sticky toffee pudding!  It was neither toffee, nor pudding, but it was sticky :D!

nKHFx3LAHSWehYcIQFp7TA.text: Unimpressed for a  Gordon Ramsay restaurant! Of all his restaurants that I've been to (a lot) this was by far my least favorite. The scotch egg was good, so was the truffle fries. The pub burgers were good. The curry rice was just ok, and the rice they served me was old and crunchy. The bread for the curry had burnt marks that made me feel like I was eating charcoal. The salmon which was suppose to be their special dish was very dry. We also got the Brussels sprouts which had a good flavor but were way too hard to eat. Such a bummer, our last day in Vegas and we were looking forward to a good meal! The night before we are at BLT and it was very good! Not visiting this place again, there was nothing special.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Too hard to bite.
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Too burnt

Ul9GDEGGAqutX_Wsl7Fe6A.text: I thought I'd check out GR so I came for happy hour, since I'm not a meat eater. Truffle chips with garlic aioli were very good but the fries were tiny.  I'd rather have full size fries and less of them than teenie tiny pieces. . The atmosphere is friendly. I like it!

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Happiest  Hour Baby!  Truffle Chips and chardonnay!   Garlic aioli all over my lips.  Way not?

9-ROrP5-u9cSajTFknvM2Q.text: The food was delicious, drinks were awesome and our server AFRO was perfection. Very knowledgeable, funny, great attitude and his service was superb.. He definitely gets five stars from us..

pjsvkNKCS9NqjCxzVZzYuw.text: Innis & Dunn.  Fish & chips Cleanliness issues. Table reeked of mildue tabled wiped and napkin put down in dirty table then into my water glass then she tried to dry table with napkin from next table. Thoroughly disgusting. Smell on my hands  they moved me to the dining room.  Fake news paper disintegrated from the grease and vinegar on plate.  Disgusting.  Staffing issues Nice cutlery bad napkins Watery Ono flavor malt vinegar Watered beer Tartar not refrigerated  Good added lays up Minted peas good and not overly salted Batter had a huge salt lick on one side. Unfortunately my last two bites Chips soggy tasted like Denny s or made the day or two before Waiter offered fries. Whoa. Terrible soggy. Strange for sure. Waiter was very helpful offered to help. $30! Way outta line for what should be a perfect lunch experience.

Ucxx7XcydqCQv16ACPBEYA.text: Oh Sir Ramsay! (Has he been knighted yet? Can I nominate him, if not?)  You are the man! How can you not be? After the years of Kitchen Nightmares and traveling the back woods of America  to "fix" the restaurants and attempt to "educate" the restaurateurs...you learned some nifty little tricks. The aesthetics are sublime. The uniforms are admirable. The food is edible. The bartenders are knowledgeable. The beer selection is commendable.   My palate said this...The corn soup was too sweet. But the "fish and chips" were perfection.   So Mr. Ramsay I do have to say, sir, your television travels have paid off. After all, it is Las Vegas. If you build it, they will pay...$60 Fish & Chips, bowl of soup, cocktail and a beer.  (It's three stars in reality, but I love Gordon Ramsay, so one star just for him)

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Corn soup
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. @GordonRamsey you&#39;re the man! Love the space. Cute uniforms. Yummy comfort food.

lK60xoOmcOMtNGGNZJXiww.text: Food 4 out of 5 stars Atmosphere 3.5 stars Service 3 stars  Huge Ramsey shows fan. Was really excited to try one of his restaurants. I was rather disappointed. Food was only Ok. I was expecting my socks to be knocked off. I had the beef burger with bacon and the wife had the lamb burger. Both were decent but that's it. A decent burger isn't worth $20. Menu is super small, which is okay in one sense. Do fewer things but do them better. But these really aren't "better". I'd say a five-guys burger is better than this, and at only a quarter the price.   Pretzel appetizer was pretty good but a little lean. I'll have to try Burgr next time I fly into Vegas. Hopefully with better results.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Here&#39;s the photo

OaZjjzgCh_XoqFu2jM4Iuw.text: So, i read the reviews before going to Gordon Ramseys to get some fish and chips....like everything else thats reviewed, you have to choose who to believe My wife is from england so her opinion on fish and chips really means something I think "delicious" was the only word she said until her plate was clean  Anyone who said that the service was bad, obviously did not have Afro as a waiter....he was funny, personable and just a pleasure to be around. Nice guy. Ask for Afro and enjoy

5QHqcHPJNC9JFqkbsSTlLg.text: The atmosphere of this restaurant is fantastic. While the prices are quite high at about $17 per person, the meals are all great. Each entree tastes like the real deal and has an alcoholic pair that is recommended. I highly recommend this place and the pesto chicken sandwich in particular.

OjE_XRPcTiicitgmYFmU1w.text: Let's have a discussion about the term "over-extending."  Or if that proves to be a non-starter, how about "Celebrity Chef."  Was in Vegas on a recent guys weekend, and had set up a few reservations a month or so in advance.  This happened to be one of those "filler" nights where I tagged along with what was fast and easy before a show.  I should have known better.  Listen, it would be far more difficult to skewer a place, if its owner and Executive Chef weren't on TV every other night berating contestants over one flaw or another while simultaneously puffing his chest and pimping his brand.    Either Gordon Ramsey has never eaten at Gordon Ramsey Pub & Grill, or he's full of shit.  For starters, the place is so fully "in the casino" you can't really differentiate between the scent of the beer steamed clams, and the cigarette smoke wafting around you as you attempt to chew.  Ordered the "Calimari and Bacon Crackle" for an app.  I'm not sure what exactly makes it part bacon, but I actually counted the pieces of finger-nail sized bacon in my cone of calamari and there were 4.  Besides marketing to a ravenous for all things pig consumer base, I can think of no worldly reason for the word "Bacon" to be in this dish.  The calamari were cooked well with utilitarian dipping sauces.  Sprang for the Herb Caesar Salad w/ Chicken for an entree in a feeble attempt to incorporate a vegetable into a meal during the stay.  I am not kidding when I say that Applebees serves a better chicken Caesar salad.  This salad is 23 dollars.  Twenty three dollars. The chicken breast (and I use that term loosely) that came on top had the texture somewhere between a tire and a silicone breast implant.  If it was not cooked via microwave I will literally give Gordon Ramsey the entirety of my craps earnings. This salad was atrocious.  Minimally dressed and lacking in every viable flavor that usually makes its way into a Caesar.  Service started out decently, but then we turned into an afterthought.  Cocktails were surprisingly good.  This takes me back to my opening sentence.  This experience has soiled me on the name Gordon Ramsey.  I have zero desire to ever set foot in another one of his establishments.  For every contestant on another one of his shows, please point to this restaurant when you get scolded on the inadequate ratio of crust to filling in your apple pie.  That is all.

abHV8MO5z1LATQyN7Q40tg.text: Happy hour was fantastic, all the apps were amazing, tried several signature cocktails and all were excellent. Thanks Rodney for the great service.

lkzSy3QHy0ureNlr4rfqzg.text: Had an absolutely wonderful experience here. From the host to the server to the food - it was all great! Would highly recommend this place.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Delicious desserts!

e7Cwxbwmar2mzB00ZgitHQ.text: So here we go -  #1 - The Service and Hostess greeting were very, very good. Really the ONLY reason I am giving it 3 Stars. #2 - If The Hell's Kitchen Chef was in this house last night, he would have lost his S#&T over the Food Quality and presentation. #3 - Appetizer! i ordered the Chef's Concept of PIG'S in a Blanket. This was the best of the food items I ordered. The Mustard and HR Sauce to Dip was very good. #4 - I thought I would try his take on fish and chips! OMG this was a greasy, semi warm plate of YUCK. The fish fillets were stacked on top of one another and it turn them into a gloppie ( is that a word ) soggy mess. The Chips were just awful!!! Under cooked greasy and I just watched a show earlier in the month Master Chef where they tried to replicate Perfect French Fries / . The Chef wouldn't have served this to his dog!!. Really Fish & Chips at a premiere english pub, owned by the man and it just sucked!! #5 - At least the Ice Tea wasn't F#&Ked up LOL!! $62 with 20 % gratuity added in total, because like I said at least the service was great.  I live in the Las Vegas Marketplace in Henderson, The other Ramsay Group restaurant s I have visited have been exceptional _ Burgr/ Steakhouse / so this was a total downer.  Never again at the PUB!!

K2hh3-zfcuGDXP4SwYl3nA.text: Service was terrible.  We had a party of 7 on Saturday night.  They had a prime rib special   It was around 10:30 pm so we checked to make sure they still had prime rib before ordering.  We even joked with the server about who would get the last piece if they ran out.  3 of us ordered it.  We also ordered an appetizer.  About 30 minutes later she comes back and tells us they are out of prime rib. No kidding. Somehow it took 30 minutes to let us know they were out.  I ordered the ribeye instead. I then realized we hadn't even gotten our appetizer. I asked her to include an extra app of wings since now everyone was starving.    Much like our experience earlier that day at the Cafe Americano, our server then stopped coming back to our table. Food runners brought everything out.  My steak was pretty good. Another person in our party never got part of his order and had to cancel it.    We asked her to split up the check and she brought out one bill with each party separated.  Of course a 20% was automatically added.  So I guess I now see why she had no interest in coming back to the table.  I know this is common but this is the result.  I will not return to this place.

Lik6ixFRbqx-IGMxOcnwJw.text: Going to a Gordon Ramsay Restaurant we were expecting the best. Especially when Gordon Ramsay is on his restaurant show telling other people that their food is shit. Well, this shit wasn't far from it!  We came in for happy hour and it was less than impressed. Service was slow, yet they were not even close to being busy. Our sever took at least 10 minutes before she greeted us. We did notice she enjoyed visiting the staff more than serving guests.  When she did come to see us we ordered asap since we did not know when she was going to come back. We each ordered the the $5 pulled pork sandwich. It was tiny for $5 and the flavor was not there. We also ordered onion rings and those were served with some kind of port demi sauce.  What the heck was that?  It said on the menu and aioli.  We asked the sever if the demi sauce was right and she said no. So she replaced it later when we only had two onions rings left.  Oh goodie.  We also ordered the wedge salad which is $16.  Now, when you order a wedge salad, it comes with a blue cheese dressing. Why in the world would it come out soaked in a vinaigrette on top of blue cheese dressing?  Is that a British thing?  The combination of the two was not good.  I can't say we plan on returning due to poor service and so-so food.  We were both really surprised that the food and service wasn't up to par since Gordon Ramsay was at Caesar's Palace the following day for the 50th anniversary of the casino.

Ift4INgJmq4r-boQfjG1gg.text: Was looking for a different spot to try out in Caesars before heading out for a show, and stumbled upon the pub.  Despite being 50% empty at 5PM, we ended up being told we couldn't be seated until 8:45PM. Still, 2 minutes later via use of the opentable app, I had a reservation in hand for 6PM and killed an hour at the tables prior to getting seated in a half-empty house.  Figuring we were at a british pub, I did the fish and chips w. mushy peas, and skipped a starter as we had an awesome lunch earlier and weren't super hungry.  Despite the pleasant service from the Gary Busey lookalike waiter, the food arrived scalding hot, as we downed our first pints.   The chips were undercooked and scaling hot (as my buddy got a side of chips that were a bit crisper with his dish).  The fish was super-oily, and despite the newspaper themed dresses worn by the hostesses, it wasn't served over any sort of newspaper/newspaper style wax paper.  The mushy peas were pretty good.  As we were leaving after finishing dinner, the restaurant was still 1/3 empty.   No idea what was up with their reservation system, as we were told we'd need to wait 3.5 hours for a table at 5PM, got a table via opentable at 6PM and were seated in a half-empty house, and when leaving at 6:45PM, left a restaurant that was 1/3 empty.  Also, given the pricing (significantly higher than Aria's Todd English P.U.B.), and non-quality of the food, I'm not looking to return on my next venture to Vegas.

U5dV37IloV2HtFUktsGKuw.text: First, the positives: I had Shepherd's Pie. It was perfect. The meat is "melt in your mouth" good. Also, we got an order of English Chips to share. They were amazing. Very good. The negatives, however: Extremely small portions. When my Shepherd's Pie arrived, I thought it was a kids meal. Tiny. Very tiny. And don't expect a visit here to be easy on the wallet. Very expensive. Especially for the size of the meals.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. In Caesar&#39;s Palace.

aKxjs3b66zyFUxPLFDfOeA.text: Very disappointed - hot food should be served hot!  We decided to give Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill a try after we attended the Elton John concert on New Year's Eve.  The wait for a table was fairly short and we asked the server to make sure our onion soup was very hot.  When the soup arrived - it was luke warm at best.   The server said, "I told them to make sure it's hot" and then the manager returned the soup to the kitchen.  The steaks were pretty good, but then we ordered cappuccino with our chocolate desert.   Desert arrived and the server said our cappuccinos were on the way.  We finished desert and then the cappuccinos arrived - mine was room temperature - not one sip - not even the cup was warm!!!  My husbands was warm to the touch but not much more.  The server deducted them from our bill, but what a huge disappointment when they fail at the basics.

qpApkFRvgIfHgWqP4vmO3Q.text: Fantastic service and food recommendations from Brianna.  Just finished another week of projects in Vegas and wanted to find a good spot for lunch this past Thursday. Was central strip and thought I would see what was in Caesars Palace. Went to Gordon Ramsay's Pub and After being seated asked my server Brianna what I should try. She suggested the nachos to start and they were great. Great crunch from fresh made chips that stayed crunchy. I liked the combination of flavors and how well the dish was made. Brianna suggested the curry dish for my main and I enjoyed greatly and finished lunch with the cheesecake she suggested. Great service and nice having someone who knew the menu and could help me with selections.  Looking forward to my next trip and lunch again at Ramsay's   Here for CES and looking forward to returning.

aysjfIv-cuoTQ6U08ZjKIw.text: Wow!!! Lobster roll, calamari, chicken Loli pops, truffle fries. Need I say more? Great atmosphere. Awesome drinks. Superb service. Love this place. A must in Vegas!

_qXt015_askuAO_rKE4S4w.text: Our server, Adam Rogers, was amazing!  His level of service was second to none, and the food was fantastic to boot!  I highly recommend the nachos!

ufd9YTR1u9hd8BQunBL_JA.text: Talk about phoning it in... This is the perfect next episode of Kitchen Nightmares! Staff was fine to good... food was way below what I would have expected. It is a pub so I figured how could I go wrong ordering the bangers and mash...What a mistake! First off it should have been called the sausage variety platter in mush! 3 different variety of sausage, one of which was a banger and it tasted fine. For a reason that escapes me they dumped steamed spinach over the mashed potatoes making them a soupy mess. Onion gravy was the only reason this is getting 2 stars instead of 1. 1 of the sausages was some sort of smoked thing that tasted some where between a nathan hot dog and a sausage you would get at a texas bbq, weird...  I knew this was not going to be fine dinning by any stretch. It's a pub, but this simple dish should have been sooo much better.

0UXVNS6nzsP-9ayHrPgyvA.text: Just went here over the weekends and we had great service from a bartender named David! He was super friendly and he gave my friends and I amazing service which made the experience at the restaurant great even and fun experience!! Thanks your amazing service David!!

MAF1p4snMRJrPJyJMJLhmQ.text: Stop and stare was amazing for a laid-back afternoon with family and friends. Great food and the service was fast and friendly. I would say that Heather is one of the most friendly and menu knowledgeable servers I've had in awhile. I have worked in the industry my entire life and for me to leave a hundred and 110% happy does not happen very often. So thank you again for the delicious very much enjoyable service.

BK5htVL5D2dAOfm9p0mr8A.text: oh, my goodness...Love yelp!! I read the reviews before going to this restaurant, and I am so glad I was prepared because everyone was right on.  Let me start by saying that the quality of the food was very good, and truly that should be the important part right? The service however...ugh. Husband and I came in Xmas Eve, dressed to the nines as we were going to a show that night...the hostess put us on a tiny crappy table stuck by a beverage cart and then she walked away without asking if it was ok...I don't like to make waves on a busy service night, so I didn't complain, but we had a reservation made over 10 days previous and it would have been nice to have a decent table when we were obviously dressed for a nice dinner.  Our server was then clueless to anything.  He was slow, did not have a good knowledge of the menu, and was not genuine in his approach to our questions.  When he asked us for our drink order  we were very specific in what we wanted.  I specifically asked him if he had a particular liquor,& I overhead him ask his co-worker about it,  and we could tell they had no idea. He then placed the order..?  Out of concern I then walked the 10 paces to the bar and found out myself that indeed they did NOT have what I wanted.  Low and behold, my drink arrives. The server tried to pawn off a drink as the one that I wanted....Furious. If someone is going to take initiative and ask me to try a drink in place of one that I want, I'm ok with that....However, to pretend to give me what I want, and pretend knowing otherwise angers me. These drinks are $20 bucks a piece, so I am pissed at this point and so is my husband. Bartender to the rescue...I walk up there a second time and he looks sheepish. He knows already that the drink he made came to me after knowing full well that I did not want what was obviously given to me. He offered to look in the backroom for a replacement and ended up getting me exactly what I wanted from somewhere else.  Food: we had the mini trio of pot pies for appetizer, delicious, came out quick, but a little pricey for what you get. Prime rib entree also very good, nice cut, well cooked. Caesar salad, simply delicious, homemade dressing with anchovies, yum! Grilled lamb burger on the brioche bun, soooo good, I loved it!   Its so sad that an experience like we had could overshadow really good food. The food is served well, its creative, eye appealing and tastes great. The service is poor, the hostess stand awful,  stacked with 2-3 girls who don't use any common sense,  and are phony to greet but yet don't even notice as you leave after spending $250.  It all left a bad taste in our mouths.  This is vegas, and there are so many restaurants to choose from...We will not be back.  Well, maybe we will sit at the bar :)

PfxonAQWsvJdOqWBlO4Xcw.text: My wife and I came in for a lunch. Wanted to experience the place.  The location is great.  You can sit in the back if you want to escape the casino, or sit by the Bar in a high top if you want to still be a part of the casino.  I'm 6-3 so we opted for a high top.  Service was excellent- very attentive.  We had the Hellfire wings and split a burger.  Wings were very good- loved the sauce.  The burger was good as well.  Temp was wrong so they corrected and comp'd a dessert- sticky toffee, which the wife loved.  3 beers a Moscow mule, wings and a burger -$96.  Do I like the place, yes.  Do I feel it's overpriced- yes.   Yes I know your paying for the location and name.  Still felt like the bill should have been $60-70.  Pice dropped it from 4 stars to 3.   When we come back it'll just be for a beer and wings..

RHD3hqVURzeCw4pXrChvjg.text: Just stopped in for a few appetizers before going to see Elton John with the girlfriend. Our server Lisa was friendly professional and fast. She recommended the sliders with apple wood bacon and the calamari and they were both excellent!  We got table touches from table touches from two managers Louie and Randy who both seemed to be very much on top things in the dining room. Will be coming back for a full meal soon for sure!

rO5zIRIbrT1QI6_gas3JfA.text: My husband and I came to Las Vegas on our honeymoon. Being from Sonoma County, we are surrounded by delicious food. My husband and I both love watching all of Gordon Ramsay's shows so when we stumbled across his Pub and Grill at Caesar's Palace, we knew we had to give it a try. The hostess sat us in a lovely cozy booth and the ambiance was on point. Our server was David S. Gordon Ramsay is very lucky to have such an amazing and talented server such as David, working for him. My husband and I come from the restaurant industry and so we know the importance of good service and David is what all servers should strive to be. He was welcoming and professional and extremely knowledgeable. He showed us his picture of him with Gordon because my husband and I were very curious about the "real" Ramsay compared to what you see on television on HK. David had nothing but raving reviews about Gordon. Next we looked over the menu and couldn't decide what to order since it all looked so good. We decided to try the happy hour menu so that we could taste multiple items. Excellent prices as well! We ordered the kettle chip nachos, wings, truffle fries, and burger.  Everything we ordered was exactly what you'd expect to get from Gordon Ramsay. The nachos were to die for. Kettle chips and tender meats with the most velvety cheese sauce was like an explosion of flavors and textures in your mouth. The truffle fries come with the most addicting dipping sauce. Garlic fries don't stand a chance to these fries! My husband loves wings but I do not, that was until I tried these. WOW!!!! Just goes to prove that quality of food is truly key to successful dishes. We wanted happy hour cocktails but didn't know what to order so David recommend the Goodbye Blue Sky and The Pub Crawl. Perfectly pairs with our dishes. To make this experience even more fabulous and memorable, David presented us with it only one, but two, amazing desserts to help us celebrate our honeymoon. This was the first and only time during our stay in Vegas that we truly felt special regarding our honeymoon! We asked David about other spectacular activities to do while in Vegas and he had many suggestions. Everything we asked him about the food we ate and the restaurant, David had a very insightful response/answer. Mr. Ramsay, your server David is a delight and treasure to your restaurant. We will be back yearly and although David may not still be there, we will eat there every time! Thank you!

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States

O3U97Sqnkeve-5BsnFxrCA.text: I have had the good fortune of dining here multiple times. It's great being a local! This experience was with my husband on a date night. What a wonderful meal and I love the decor. The staff was attentive and our waitress was on top of things. It was crowded but we were never made to feel rushed. We asked our waitress what her favorite side was and she suggested the Brussels sprouts... I know?!?!? They were amazing! The hubby and I didn't want to share. I would definitely recommend reservations because you don't have to wait in line for a table. It's a must for a celebrity food fan!

0n8hXgDg4IOwPu7nlFs8xw.text: one of the worst experiences i have had. after we were seated (party of 4), it took over 20 minutes for someone to take our order and bring us water. after that, we did not get our food for another 40 minutes! there were tables around us getting served and people that came in after us were getting served. fine, so after we get our food, it was mediocre over priced pub food.   no apology from the waitress. in fact, she came by and said we looked bored. really? could it be because we have been waiting a crazy amount of time that we were falling asleep?  don't waste your time or money. keep walking and go to panda express for better food and service.
