YHg8YarzzdxOkTuLVOtsng.text: Definitely get the truffle fries. Or crisps, I think they're called... They are really good and you're given a large helping of truffles! Yum! I was really surprised when they came to our table because it looks like 6 large, fatty fries stacked on top of each other. When I picked up the first one I was so surprised by its weight that I almost dropped it... Apparently the fries are boiled, baked, then fried to give it a great consistency!  They're still working on smoothing out the service and everything since they just opened not too long ago. We were initially seated at a table with basically no lighting. Other than that, I had a great experience with the boyfriend.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sliders and truffle fries

BjmZm_iHdbjES4mnBtvPvg.text: I really wanted to eat anywhere but here as I am not a fan of Mr. Ramsay's tv show, but I have to say, I would eat here again.  The food was fabulous and cooked to perfection.

BYCNYjLAa7lDIW_OA0L-FQ.text: Amazing ! First class food and treatment. Calamari, lobster rolls and pastrami sandwich ... Sooooo good. Thank you Randy for making my birthday extra special ! Can't wait to come back.

lPjYJ1wDbCrTm-7Hfva_hw.text: Okay, so I think the beer selection is weak for it to be a vegas restaurant. The food we ordered was delicious! we had the sliders and yukon gold potatoes with chive oil. Those potatoes were phenomenal! Great service but over all I think it is a bit overpriced because it is the same type of food you can find a wolfgang pucks but it is more expensive and you get less of it.

LCMs6c5IP_qet-TyaFvnsw.text: Okay if you were to ask my husband you'd probably get a rave review. I got banggers and mash which came with various flavors of banggers and I didn't care for that one of them was pretty gross, my daughter wouldn't even eat it and she's not picky at all when it comes to that type of food normally. My potatoes were good so I ate those, I also had some little sausage appetizer that wasn't great either. My husband liked his lobster roll and I'll admit his steak was much better then my food. We did get the Sticky Toffee Pudding which was really good. So Id' get that again. Over all I was disappointed and would skip this place to try other foods Vegas has to offer. It was also pretty loud and we had so many people bringing food or drinks I'm not even sure who our server was. It was kind of late and we were too hungry to wait for Creaser's buffet. I'd wait next time.

5tUa47FwCtmFt58gDX6zbA.text: Almost everything at this restraint was perfect.  First the ambiance was casual and unique.  The food was cooked to perfection. I had the short rib cheese steak, this is the first time I had short ribs prepared like a cheese steak.  It was original and delicious.  The short rib was perfectly seasoned and had a horseradish sauce while delicious, it made the sandwich a little spicy.  The caramelized onions and red peppers complemented the dish.  The fries were prepared as small wedges and baked, topped with parmesan cheese, this was such a simple but delicious concept!  Be warned before you eat here you are going to pay. While the prices are high the food quality is defiantly worth it.  If you stay away from alcohol your average price per person will run between $15-30 for lunch.  The only thing stopping me from a 5 star rating was the stow service.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Short Rib Steak &amp; Cheese Sandwich
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lamb Burger

VPboTqqpAgbnPZtB_aSPoA.text: The only this is 2 star and not 1 star is because of the service, the food was really bad, lobster roll, the brooch was could and dry and the filling he no seasoning,y wife's steak was served iced cold!!!!! Love Gordon but this was not up to his standard,

9h8EbCBkJcGtFHOCybTGFQ.text: Extremely disappointing. I have wanted to go to this restaurant for 3 years. After finally being able to visit this establishment, I have never been so disappointed. The waiter was very disinterested. We had burgers, mine was lamb. The burger was way under cooked and the buns so small for the size of the burger it just fell apart. Impossible to eat. The fries were not fresh, and barely warm. We each had one drink and a burger and the bill was over $100. Totally outrageous. Never again.... Total waste of money!

BNq54WJrI-XO9oWMV24NTg.text: My husband and I go to Vegas all the time and have eaten here several times before. We were excited to go back but this time was such a disappointment. The fish and chips used to be awesome. Not anymore. Instead of large pieces of tender fish in a delicious batter, now you get a skinny flavorless greasy piece of fish. My expensive braised short rib tasted like bland pot-roast and there is no salt and pepper readily available. Our server was just okay and we like to tip well for good service. Not this time. And we wanted the manager to know we were disappointed and he didn't really seem to care. Getting offered a free dessert is not the solution (and we didn't take the offer). We said the solution is to let Gordon Ramsey know. Mr. Ramsey, you may not be aware that your menu has changed. but you should because there  are too many other options for dining in Las Vegas.

EsPpQzwJrCh0nIzrQlU3gQ.text: The server got my friends order wrong. Another friends burger he asked for medium rare came out mushy, raw, and cold to the touch on the inside. Prices were ridiculous for the quality of the food. Don't go.

N3lrLOIm0xzqOPZOWrLhug.text: Lunchtime food was good but had a difficult time getting waitstaff's attention.  Too many customers; not enough staff.

yz3niHa6DhY0CHdX2Zl3Jw.text: Unbelievable experience, all around... From the food, to the excellent service and the special attention from the management staff.  Best food experience  in  Vegas so far.

ndjdafCQH2FYc45WpUcrTA.text: Ok it's been a while since I actually stepped foot in this joint but I'd just like to share our experience from the one time I tried to eat here.  My girl and I are at Caesars looking for a bite and I decided on Ramsey's pub n grill so we stood at the hostess desk for a good fee minutes before we were even spoken to by one of the 3 girls in miniskirts that were talking to eachother. Then we are taken to a seat in the bar area next to all the kegs that were used as the divider for the bar area and the seating area. We were not asked if we wanted to sit at the bar, my girl always will prefer a booth but we were not given that option.  We were seated and left alone for about 5min before I had to flag down a busser to ask for a menu. Looking at the menu for about 5-10 more minutes we were never approached by another employee at all. We were not offered water or drinks or asked if we were ready to order. Now considering the fact that by the time we each have a meal and a drink we were looking to spend close to $100 for burgers we elected to just get up and walk out. As far as the food goes I have actually eaten wings and a burger from here while playing poker in Caesars poker room and it is pretty good food from what I have seen. Having said that I cannot say the same for their service in my particular case. I'm sorry with me you only get one shot at my business I really see no reason to go back after my initial experience. I would rather go to Bachi Burger by my house and only spend $40-$50 for an even better quality meal that you will get here.   Sorry Gordon I just call them the way I see them , from watching all your shows I was honestly shocked by the service we encountered. End Rant!!

WpXcvRg0yAE9C5tFm33gBQ.text: A big fat "meh". Do not get the fish and chips for thirty dollars. I asked the Bartender why it was the highest priced item on the menu and he said because of Vegas prices.

Ts1fsta_bo_XHwULEIrnYw.text: For drinks and snacks while watching a game ok. For a real meal, find any of the 1000 other places on the strip to try.   Service was slow and lackluster. Knowledge of the menu was way below par for a restaurant with this claimed pedigree.  Bottom line, trying to do upscale British food is a lose, lose.  Shepard's Pie was bland and about half way though butcher paper was found nestled in  with the plain mash potatoes which topped this wreck.    Stick to beer and fish sticks. You would be better off with that.   They really don't do much well for the price.

0ZuFkT0G36rFnMA_x_q1hg.text: So while in Vegas Girlfriend & I wanted to try one of Gordon's restaurants. At the time we were in Planet Hollywood so decided to go to BURGR but the line was (--------------------- *now maximize by x100) that long, so I made a reservation for Gordon Ramsey Pub & Grill instead. We got there probably 5 mins late due to not being all to cross the street in Vegas (damn escalators everywhere.) When we walked up to the hostess she asked for reservation and said that everything was fine/table was still available. Sat down, greeted by a very nice waiter, made small talk, oversell good enough guy! As an appetizer we shared an order of truffle fries and the were excellent, seasoned very well/ not over powered by the truffle oil like most places do. On to the entrees: GF- Lobster/shrimp roll - she loved it, roll was nice, not soggy at all, Lobster was perfect. Mine- pulled pork sandwich - the bread was VERY greasy which I wasn't expecting, the pork was slightly dry, apple slaw was nice.  Overall , I believe 3 stars is fair. I would still like to try BrGR and Gordon Ramsey Steak! Black jacket? Wonder if Chef Scott was running the pass or Latasha(oh)

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Truffle fries
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pulled pork sandwich x Lobster roll

xEbbckZsZXMiTuMUFMI8CA.text: This was probably our overall favorite restaurant on our trip because we both had a good experience. I got to go off menu when I requested a vegetarian dish. They waitress offered me the risotto, but then she came back and said the chef wanted to something different and fun. I ended up with a delicious pasta with veggies that had a sour flavor, but was really good. The artichokes and olives complimented the flavor well, and it only ended up being $14! My girlfriend got the shepherd's pie, which she really enjoyed. For dessert, we went with the famous toffee pudding, which did not disappoint. This place didn't blow our minds, but it was definitely the most solid restaurant we ate at on our trip.

Szb7GYXiEUPrFP8C1KDTUQ.text: 4.5 stars  Oh man this food was awesome. Just got the shepherds pie, but oh my. Literally the best mashed potatoes of my life. I just wanted to keep eating and eating. They had a slight glaze on them as creme brulee looks. So, so good.   The service could have been a tad better (specifically the hostesses). There were like 3 of them and seemed as if it all their first day on the job.   It was a tad pricey, but for vegas it actually wasn't too bad. Especially at a famous chefs restaurant, I'm going to call it a bargain.

n2ZOHEQcrtAiExjA1nXMHA.text: We had a wonderful dining experience at Gordon Ramsay Pub and Grill at Caesars Palace 2/25 and 2/27/15. We had the lamb burger and the fish and chips. Both were well prepared and of fresh ingredients. The service was attentive but not overwhelming. We will certainly return next time we are in Las Vegas!

ATusUK2h4g4CzYHXoqRvzQ.text: Very good food and we had a great waiter as well. However, it is a little overpriced in my opinion. My husband and I went for lunch and our bill was $100. We got a burger, sandwich, a large beer and a mixed drink.

20Pfas2ohR5oZYuqxv-Gvg.text: The sticky toffee pudding was AMAZING! I went with my family during our vacation in Vegas and we all enjoyed our meals. It's a cool atmosphere and the service was good. Maybe a tad overpriced but to be expected for Vegas. The drinks here are pretty good too...we got the mocha martini, two Belgian margaritas and a wheat beer. All of us were happy with the drinks. Though we all agreed the dessert was our favorite thing :)

gHhBtwIigUnk7-X1Cg8ZFQ.text: When something has Gordon Ramsey's name on it you expect a well run restaurant, top notch service and excellent food. Unfortunately our entire group left disappointed on all 3 points. Here is where they failed.... - seated late for our reservation (large group of 16) - staff could have been friendlier  - The washrooms were gross (a reflection on what the kitchen looks like?) - the food was mediocre, disappointed and expected better! - one burger order came out raw - the waiter got the order wrong then tried to place blame on the 2 people which ordered - they had to wait 25 mins for the right order while the rest of us ate our food. The food came once everyone else was done eating.(was told it would be 7 mins) - was told bills could not be separated...they had to do a minimum of 4 cheques- despite our telling 3 servers how to separate the 4 bills at the start of our meal it didn't happen. We had to wait for an additional 30 mins for the bill to be separated...we also had to calculate taxes and gratuity ourselves.  - the entire experience was a 3 hour ordeal which is much too long when u want to get out and experience Vegas!!   The good points... - sticky toffee pudding!!  - truffle fries

jx6QsqhXOhuYJ54vFA8JjQ.text: $33 salmon over cooked!  Popsicle chicken wasn't Popsicle, it was regular wings they just brought and didn't tell us...manager came over and comped bday girls wings but seriously Gorden wouldn't stand for this shit!

wdaWBCEhK71QU5TruCeMxQ.text: Bear with me.... This story has a point.  I travel A LOT for work.  Like....five days a week. More often than not, I end up eating alone at the bar to try to find some measure of friendly conversation.   Now, good drinks and food are just the minimum. I expect that.  But I really want the bartender to act like I am his long lost best friend.  Enter Ray Ray, the afternoon bartender at Gordon Ramsay Pub and Grill.  I was not only happy to be there, I hated to leave.  Ray Ray introduced me to new beers, and was not short of fun conversation.  Not to be outdone by Ray Ray, the bar manager Randy came by to personally make sure I was happy.  And he also spent time getting to know me.  The drinks ( I had the 'God Save the Queen') and food (Fish and Chips) were outstanding.  If you plan to attend, it is indeed pub food.  They have a couple high end dishes. But this is the place you can come if you don't feel like changing out of your jeans or shorts.    There is no shortage of unique eateries in Vegas.  Heck, there are a dozen under one roof.  But if you want someone who REALLY cares about you having a good time, head to Gordon's Pub and Grill at Caesars.

VmDdNyHOndO1EMwledZe0A.text: I did not know what to expect coming here... but I was definitely satisfied with what I had. More than satisfied!  I wanted to try the poutine... but they were out :( Me sad.  I ordered the fish and chips as an entree, and the table ordered the pretzels with cheese dip, deviled eggs, and sliders to share. I got to try every appetizer, and they were all delicious. Except the cheese was a little gritty. I like my cheese sauce smoother... but the flavor was pretty good.  My fish and chips were so good! Well, mostly the fish because the chips were big, fat potato pieces that are fried... pan fried? Haha I'm not a big fan of thick fries, I like them a little thinner and crispier. But the fish was flaky, crispy, moist, and fresh af. MMMMmmm and my bf ordered the pork belly.... omg............. It was SOO delicious. It's very rich, fatty, melty in your mouthy, and maybe a little too salty but overall it was really bomb. I don't think I could finish one by myself, so I'm glad I got to try his :)  DESSERT: Sticky toffee pudding - ORDER IT! It's soooo decadent, warm, caramel-y, gooey, and sticky, and topped with ice cream = heaven.

cuGX9A-wqXZDkedUKkoxbg.text: What a perfect spot to sit comfotably, eat amazing nachos, and talk with our wonderful waiter Rodney. Im hoping that was his name, he was very good to us. It was our first visit to the palace..first time to the pub. Thanks for the memories.

m_S3Z-vV-A9059JcrrIF5w.text: Came here to eat dinner but got no service for almost 20 minutes. There were two servers that kept walking by, but they did not even bother to give us water. Such a shame.   We walked out and went to cheesecake factory instead....  So disappointed...

-ney4qzutlllSKLr4WIdwA.text: This review is on one and the last time we will ever dine here. We where sat down by a friendly host and when we sat down, the waiter just started to pour water and said nothing. We said thank you and he just looked at us. It was the most awkward thing we had ever witnessed! I have never experienced such rudeness in all my dining experiences. We decided to just leave and told the his about our waiter and we left. This should be much better for the prices and being a Gordon Ramsay restaurant. Huge fail!

9jh7Z66-J1gzOds8u9NYag.text: This place has the best fish and chips I've ever had. A bit pricey, but definitely worth the money. The atmosphere is pretty cool and the signature drinks are very tasty. If you really like fish and chips, you gotta go here. Plus it's in Ceasars Palace which is fun to walk around in.

vIdSbEGYyspXCh4v7bz0gQ.text: So my boyfriend and I are foodies, and we came to Las Vegas for the shows, and the food.  We had a list of "chef signature" places we wanted to visit.  Gordon Ramsay's Pub & Grill was actually an accident because one of our other places was a bust.  The Experience: We came around 2pm for a late lunch and were seated right away.  The experience here started off a bit rocky since our waitress never came, but once we asked the manager what was going on, we were seated at a different table with a very friendly waitress (her name was Bridgette I believe).  The manager (his name was Derek) was extremely apologetic and checked on us often through the duration of our meal.  He even offered to comp our appetizer, which was a really nice touch, and alleviated any possible hostility that we might have had.  Derek was probably the highlight of our experience since he was so accommodating and warm.  He truly went above and beyond for us.  Thank you Derek!  The Food: Both my boyfriend and I had the lobster rolls, shared a chicken caesar salad, and lastly the toffee pudding.  Lobster rolls:  Great portions, but lacked a little flavor.  I expected a bit more or maybe something different, but still delicious.  Chicken Cesar: Comes on large leaves of lettuce, but generous portions of chicken, and the dressing was phenom.  Very delicious.  Toffee Pudding: We bought it per recommendation from Derek...it was incredibly delicious.  Im not a super fan of caramel, and even I demolished this thing.  It was perfection.  The caramel is served warm and you pour it on top....YUM!!  All in all...wonderful..and we will be back! :)  Thank you Bridgette and Derek!

Rn3UMZUPbNrPAWujAVtkXg.text: I have watched chef Ramsey quite a bit, and have gotten the impression that all his red-faced histrionics are just his way of "taking the piss" as a brit might say. Certainly he has become quite the star by informing chefs and restauranteurs in no uncertain terms why their food or dining establishment falls short of his professed high standards. So naturally on a recent visit to caesers I felt drawn to his namesake pub, to see how it was living up to those standards.  I must sadly report that it fell way short. We were there for a happy hour so got to sample a variety of items, and not one of them was in any way noteworthy. I recall a dry as bones slider, a pastry wrapped "toad in the hole" sausage that can be best described as insipid, some very ordinary "chips," or fries as we deem them west of the pond, and a few items than even now, just a few days later, have already faded from my gastro memory.  Perhaps an earlier yelper was correct in stating that Ramsay himself should get in here and start yelling at people, but until he does I suggest you limit your patronage here to a couple of pints.

Bfy6qxD8P-aARALWaBjz4w.text: First time here. The food was amazing, especially the Lobster Mac&Cheese. Our server named Rodney was excellent. He was very friendly and helpful. 5 star service at its best. We'll definitely be back!

wTUs9BauKOj8X8B9gwMJSA.text: Junk. Plain and simple!  Obviously Gordon Ramsey just sold his name. Chopped salad was basically a head of lettuce with a few chunks of meat (see picture).   The food isn't worth the stop. I could have gotten better at the food court.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States

J-hKAsCP2D3gBsm-BjjuHg.text: First time I have had "Innis and Gunn" ever and hopefully not the last.  Went strictly with the yelp recommendation and had the Fish n Chips.  One of the best Fish n Chips I've ever had.  Not greasy at all.  Crispy exterior, tender on the inside and excellent flavor.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fish n Chips

k8RBFeCP6QKgz0aYC3_99w.text: Went in hoping to have lunch with my idol the Chef himself but he wasn't in but was lucky to have Rodney as our server.  He went above in making sure our lunch was enjoyable and he is a class act.  The food wasn't too shabby either :)

53MY5AgmDe0lHiaMs2seBA.text: One of my favorite restaurants.  I love the fish and chips and the chicken wings.  Service was also spectacular.

FphrDmQVt4rIH6SsWDHNSA.text: This visit was not as good as the last. Beware if you have a large group. They sat us in a low table with deep couches. It was difficult for our older tablemates to sit there. If you have a back issue it could be a problem. The service was mediocre. The food was very good however.

hcaw1WGq9xubNm82_rNgvg.text: Best meal we had in our few days in Vegas.  We had the most amazing waiter, Adam!!   I'm a self taught Private Chef and have followed Gordon Ramsay on tv for years.  I've auditioned and made it to producer interviews for Master Chef but sadly that's as far as I got.  However I was thrilled to be introduced to Hells Kitchen runner up season 15 Kristin!!   Everyone thinks Ramsay is an A$$$ because of his language and boisterous behavior.  He demands perfection and sometimes the only way to get the best out of people is doing just what he does.  He's an inspiration to,all who want to be the best and the staff at this restaurant are living examples of excellence. Well done Chef Ramsay, you have a winner here in Vegas!!!

9xaViJWVQdaDB9qpLg0R-g.text: Went in for fish and chips that Gordon Ramsey all talks about on his shows. The only thing the fish had going for them is the crunch. They were completely tasteless the fries were totally limp with no color.  The service was not friendly. $30 for 2 pieces of fish and soggy fries. Extremely disappointed

hrNPM-0O_i8JFgHtMP3BQQ.text: I am a fan of Gordon Ramsay! I love his shows and I love his other restaurant, Gordon BurGR, but I was not too impressed with this place. We got there pretty late so there was no wait. The waitress led us to a table that was ridiculously too small and you had to sit on stools, so there was no place to put your jacket or purse. I immediately asked her if we could be seated at a bigger table but she said that they had a limited waitstaff because they were closing in 45 minutes. OK, fine, I figured I could make it work. But no, the table was just way too small. I wish I had taken a picture of it because it was half the size of the other tables around us.  Our waiter, Chris, came by and introduced himself to us. I asked him right away if there's anything he could do about our table situation. He said he would have to ask the hostess. He came back right away and said we could move to a bigger table. THANK YOU, CHRIS!!!  BTW, the area where we were seated was kinda dark but I was happy for a bigger table.  My boyfriend and I both ordered the Shepard's Pie. He really enjoyed his but I thought it was kinda bland. It did not have much taste to it at all. I've only had Shepard's Pie once before years ago and I remembered it being flavorful. Usually we don't order the same things but for some reason on this night we did. I should have ordered the fish and chips.

e946HMfD1DlQ7H_nIu4T4A.text: This is the worst place I have ever eaten in Vegas. The fish and chips are mediocre and the pulled pork sandwich was disgusting. I even got food poisoning from here. You may not believe me but that day I only ate there and at night Gordon Ramsey Steak. This was the only food I had my boyfriend didn't try and he didn't get sick. I love all the other gordan ramsey restaurants so go to one of those and avoid this one.

FMgefK8zH6O7dLJhUh0xSQ.text: Came here on Friday night...we had a reservation for 6 but we kept calling to put the time back (6 girls getting rdy is no joke!). The server was really accommodating to us.  -- AMBIANCE -- Really cute decorations..you can see Gordon's face on a lot of walls. Also Britain flags, very cute. Waiters and waitress dressed in black and white. The skirts were cute.  -- FOOD -- We had the corn soup first. It was pretty good (3.5/5) We all order the BEEF CHEEKS with MASHED POTATOES...it was very delicious (4.5/5). My beef cheek didn't even need a knife. It was very tender. However, one of the beef cheek my friend had was a little hard. Maybe they need to work on the consistency of the entrees. But I was very happy with my plate. We also had an extra order of ASPARAGUS (5/5)...its sooooo good!! You must try it! YUMMM  -- PRICING -- Its a little pricey....but what do you expect? Its vegas + Gordan's name is on it. Some things are definitely worth the price.  -- SERVICE -- Our waitress was very friendly. She had a lot of conversations with us. She came and checked in on us on a regular. Oh and did I mention she is also very cute. They only thing I think they can improve on is getting water to the customers ASAP. We waited about 10 minutes or so before we got menus and water.   -- OVERALL -- Definitely still a fan of Gordan's!! Will definitely come back =)

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beef cheeks with mashed potatoes !! Soooo delicious!
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sooo good!! Asparagus! Must get!
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Corn soup yumm

MqXUh8rw3bSg1jAl8DfwBw.text: What's the only thing I like more than Gordon Ramsay? Gordon Ramsay AND Fish & Chips!  This was disappointing. I'm a fan of some of his other restaurants and a huge fan of his shows. I have had waaaaay better fish & chips anywhere (and almost everywhere else). The fried calamari appetizer was okay - a little fishy smelling and the breading was falling off the calamari. The fish and chips were VERY overcooked and tough... they didn't taste that good either. I had to smother everything I ordered in the tartar sauce and malt vinegar. Even the fries were overcooked and tough.  Server was nice but inattentive. Won't be back and I wouldn't recommend you try this.

jCbtqZyI-mBUSzZ_Awyx6g.text: We shared chopped salad and a corned beef sandwich with fries.   The chopped salad was good but nothing special.   The corned beef sandwich was delicious.  My husband ordered Ramsay tonic for cocktail.  He did not think it was worth $15.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Corned beef sandwich

EA7xjmJwD5RxQWOsKJJxdQ.text: Our waitress (Daisy) was phenomenal! She was no doubt, the best part of the meal. She was friendly, sweet, and adorable! I really honestly cannot rave enough about her. We even searched out the manager just to let him know how incredibly amazing this girl is. I hope you get appreciated there Daisy!  Now, the food... delicious! I ordered the Dublin sandwich with no sauerkraut. Daisy suggested I leave it on, said to trust her. So glad I did. The sandwich was amazing! The fries were just plain and basic, nothing exciting there.  I will definitely be back, and hope to have Daisy again!

lyJfCGoOLAT0C1KcPCK6iQ.text: Well the food was great I had a burger with truffle gets OMG amazing . The service was superb the waiter was so nice gave us all the specials looking forward to coming here again !!!

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Looking forward to this drink !!!!

8hLF8lkDdZXSocJmoK-I4g.text: Had a great time in this beautiful pub. Try the steak and ale pie. Deep, savory flavor.

zx7f5l4NAdg3Ovk8PrijAw.text: Great rest for our after concert nights!!! The staff was busy with the concert rush and Manny greeted us right away found us a great table to enjoy our food and recommended a delicious cocktail to try which I did ! Our server was bridgette she offered more great suggestions! We tried the steak and ale pies the pigs in blanket and nachos ! The short rib on the nachos was so delicious that next visit I'm going to get the short rib as my entree!! Manny and  Randy checked on us throughout our meal and you must have the sticky toffee desert!!! Great ending to our night!!

L9sqt6X5tM-JyVMRinGcag.text: We waited for 5 minutes for a booth, pretty great start. Then we ordered, food didn't take long at all to arrive, and when it did, the food was superb. We had the chicken wing appetizer, a cheeseburger, and a corned beef sandwich. YUM! Only flaw I would say is the waiter. Noticed him giving more attention to other tables and then would take forever to come back to us. Didn't quite appreciate that. Also, this restaurant did not have ranch or BBQ sauce. Otherwise, the food was amazing. I plan to return in the future.

H1aPB_iolePB76Hgm9R_Kw.text: Overall: One would think, the food would be good backed by a celebrity chef whk charges arm and a leg. For heaven's sake, I've watched the man yell at people for making bad food. He should really yell at himself.   Seervice: Staff were friendly but not stellar. They were more focused on trying to push more items to sell. We had five in our party and took over an hour to get our food. Granted, it was 8pm on Saturday night, food came really slow.  Food: We orderes fish & chips, corned beef brisket sandwich, burger, scotch eggs, salted pretzels and beer. Servings were huge but everything tasted mediocre at best. We left most of our dishes untouched more than half and didn't bother to take the rest home.   Price: $260 for the five of us and 4 beers.

kCXN6LEkJzN1tCVYqZPf4A.text: Ordered Scottish egg, deviled eggs, Shepard's pie, and a sticky toffee desert. It was just nearing the end of happy hour for the apps 4-5pm when I arrived. The three stars is for the service. The service was nice. However, the food was disappointing. Maybe if I had not experienced Gordon Ramsey's Steak before this establishment, the rating would be better. If you are searching for the Gordon Ramsey VIP experience (awesome service, food, and memories to boot) go to Gordon Ramsey's Steak, instead. The difference is like night and day.   Food here at the Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill  is average at best and not worth the price tag.

p3x9F1ruN-X_1SUUXyqiug.text: I came here with friends on St. Paddy's day. We all happened to be a little hung over from the night before...and weren't in the mood to do a lot of walking looking for something to eat. I'm glad we ate here...because I have never experienced a Gordon Ramsey restaurant and I wanted to get an idea.  The pro's? The food was AMAZING! Everything we ordered was fantastic. My friend and I had the Fish & Chips, which was really good. I went to College in London for four years, and never had Fish & Chips as awesome as this! My other friends had a pasta dish and a flat iron steak which they also repeatedly commented on how good their meal was.   The Con's? The service was SLOW! We actually got to that point where we asked the server what was taking so long? The only other complain? The price was high...as to be expected I guess...but I've never been one of those guys that thinks a Flat Iron Steak should cost 30 bucks! Especially when it's literally just the steak...no other side.   It was a nice time...but I don't think I would go back unless I really wanted to...which I don't as of now.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Caesers! We look sooooo hungover!

AT3XCOuCcoHABZ86XrH0fw.text: In True Las Vegas fashion, my family did Christmas on the Strip starting with dinner at one of the most recent additions to Ramsay's restaurant empire. The good impressions started even before we entered the place. In the first moments of walking up to the restaurant, I fell in love with their uniforms! The hostess' are outfitted in the most adorably sexy newspaper dress accessorized with fingerless leather gloves and matching booties. Someone remind me to ask our loving David S. to steal one for me ;) The uniforms only got better as the rest of the FOH people were dressed in this awesome British punk street wear. Designer Allison Leach of Mad Men and Glee did one heck of a job of creating that awesome first impression.   Our server was a little too high energy for me. You know when you have that fake salesperson vibe when they're trying to sell you something? Yeah, it was a little much. But other then that our server and serving assistants were working like a well-oiled machine. My mother is a lightweight and needed a girly beer. Our server smartly suggested the strawberry Fruli... It is now her favorite beer ever. And bread service was amazing. It shows up warm and delicious with a cheddar cheese spread and whipped butter cream. Andthey don't have a problem with serving you seconds. Hands down the best bread basket in town.    The food. Oh man, the food is British pub action on point. I was itching to try some Sheperd's Pie. And although it is one of the cheapest entree items it was one of the most delicious non-Asian foods I've eaten in forever. Tender chunks of lamb, beef, and vegetables blanketed in mouth-watering mashed potatoes. *heaven* In the fish & chips, they used cod which was a little heavier on the breading but fried to perfection. And the chips (fries) were thick blocks of fried potato served piping hot. Instead of a salad, we ordered a side of Brussels sprouts sauteed with bacon and apples. The slices of apple were real treats! They absorbed all the delicious flavors from the seasoning  and the sugar cooked off in the little bit of bacon fat. Amazing! I wish there were more than just 2!   The only downside to our meal was the lamb riblettes appetizer. Tiny bits of lamb were served with a creamy cumin-based yogurt sauce. It was tasty but for the price, portion size was absolutely abysmal. GR insider David S. says the lamb entree is the way to go and 1000x better.   I'm loving GR's new diggs. It's cool but still upscale with the food & service to match. I shall return.   Cheers!

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sheperd&#39;s Pie, Fish &amp; Chips, Bread Service, Brussel Sprouts, Lamb Riblettes, &amp; Gordon Ramsay&#39;s handsome face. ;)

O_MnIsuLpLksJrPOvGxa6Q.text: Decent place and good service.  Had the lamb shanks. Very tasty.   Also had pigs in the blanket. You get 3 but decent sized.   Overall: pretty good.

SOu6v5HNJ1NQlmFb79wv-Q.text: AWESOME food! We had a burger,it was big and very delicious! I was lucky enough to meet the winner of Hell's Kitchen and take a picture! Will definitely return! The drinks were pricey,but what do u expect,but they tasted great! Highly recommend when in town! You won't de hungry when you leave!

ZdEN1x7drFYrpOGkwcixIA.text: We celebrated our 25th wedding anniversary today !!!!! Our wonderful server Scott H was very pleasant and knowledgeable about the food. The best meal yet!!!!!  Great experience. Can't wait to go back.

1EKKEUbnErVRkxx7a0CP9g.text: Absolutely loved this place. I had the special for the day which was the beef Wellington. It was amazing 60$ meal so well worth it. Absolutely breathtaking melt in your mouth dish. Had the sticky toffee and it was very delicious. Service was fantastic.

fUP3_H0NzkFId6_9J1PV-Q.text: Our first stop when we got to Vegas. We got a few drinks and order the truffle fries. Good drinks, food, and great service! I'm a fan

Rq68_kR6AhzSAXjpaiKYcQ.text: Food was absolutely fantastic. I got the rib eye and it was cooked to perfection and so flavorful.  My husband ordered the burger which was delicious and they make their own ketchup.  Sooo tasty.  Our server, Sara, was the greatest. She never let my glass empty and she made great suggestions like the side of ever so creamy mash potatoes and the out of this world toffee pudding. Plus I just love the atmosphere and vibe of the place. Definitely coming back.  Sorry I don't have any pictures to go along with my review. We just ate everything too fast!

pxZYb46zGLt-qdAKVo7N-w.text: Great casual dining but amazing quality food, definitely recommend the steaks, burgers, truffle fries, and also Calamari is amazing.

YVkMjkEfQhouISzEezjc5A.text: By far, the most pathetic interpretation of. British pub I have ever encountered. I cannot believe a British person prostituted their name on this place.   The food embodies the caricature  ofBritish food being bland and tasteless, their steak an ale pie would make McDonalds seem tasty by comparison   A wall of beer kegs greets you as you approach, but the actual selection is a couple of session beers you can get in many other places, zero real ales,  they have old speckled hen in cans if you are desperate for flavor.

3Pp7_yYOZdRP50r9ZHi7Pg.text: We gave it another chance after a disappointing first experience and we were disappointed again... We sat at the bar the bartender barely paid attention. The food arrived while we were just starting our appetizers... so now we are at the bar with an 3/4 full plate of nachos, two burgers and 2 beers. The bartender did not do anything about it to help us out, we had to send the nachos back... the food was not bad but not good either, especially for the price. The entire experience was just a disappointment unfortunately, no major problems like last time, but this time was probably the last time we tried.

xmyjZJZSa4CJ6XeD6uvqbQ.text: Fish and chips were amazing. Service was really top notch. Tried his Mum's apple tart for dessert. And it was so good. First time here in Vegas at this pub and grill and I hope to eat here again in the near future. Also the kettle chip nacho's were to die for. Really  good food.

dymocNvKMS6WSgaUOngDow.text: Everything was great! Great service and good atmosphere. I would come back here in a heart beat.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States

hHZ2FWYPywt84jlmD9BFZQ.text: Wow, wow wow! Gordon Ramsay has a new fan in me! My food was absolutely delicious! I tried the calamari, the mini burgers and the short ribs. I recommend them all! Our waitress was extremely helpful and recommended everything I ate! Service was good and we made a reservation and were able to get immediately seated. Unfortunately, they were out of sticky toffee pudding so we weren't able to try that.

Wgg2NK3kxW3KY5DCqpMyXg.text: Came here with a reservation on a Sunday night and we were seated right away. The place was not crowded. The table was extremely small for my liking and it was right next to the crowd walking inside the casino.    I ordered the "Good Bye Blue Sky" cocktail - sounds refreshing, but it was too sour so I poured water in it. Made it enjoyable. My friend ordered the pork belly appetizer which was not as good as I expected. I ordered the Lobster Mac N Cheese (a "side" dish for $25) and I really enjoyed it. There was lobster in every bite. 2 appetizers, the Mac N Cheese, and 2 cocktails I WAS STUFFED.  Overall it was an ok experience. Not worth the money they charge for food.

mXyclj_YI8iggrBi51y0kg.text: Such a great experience!! Our first time in and Alexander was our server. We came in a little late so I felt bad when they closed and we were still finishing but he didn't rush us at all. Made us feel very comfortable. Burgers are great and the beef Wellington is incredible! My boyfriend and I were celebrating our birthdays and he took care of us with a sticky toffee pudding which was fantastic. Can't wait to come back when we're back in Vegas.

zjSZbwhNLUzWn29w-vM12A.text: As an Englishman I tend to avoid British food so I came here reluctantly. Initially my low expectations were realised. Uncomfortable recliners that are too low for the table and Pepsi rather than Coke. At least the service was good  The food however was excellent. We had the beef and ale and the chicken and bacon pies. Both were by far the best pies we have ever had, gourmet meals in fact, and that includes plenty of America  restaurants! All ingredients were fresh and high quality.  We are every scrap. Generally the Strip restaurants ate overpriced but this was fair value. Would definitely return. It's not True British food. British food has never been this good.

eLWcZj_88SV_DZRRw0QPug.text: We came to Vegas for my wifes birthday. She tried to get reservations for Gordon Ramseys Hells Kitchen but it was booked.  We went to Gordons Ramseys Pub and Grill in Caesars.  It was the best service and food that we had our entire time in Vegas.  Our waitress was Jenny and the manager was Derrick. They were both absolutely awesome. I can say that Gordon Ramsey has to have best hiring process. I expected a very high standard from Gordon and I was not disappointed.  I saw other customers food come out and this is the first place I have ever been that the food looked better than pictures. I would recommend that if you visit Vegas and dont go here to eat it us your loss. The food is fantastic and extremely reasonable.  We will be back.

faHuXFefQaOtXBvmX8Aalg.text: Definitely a let down considering this is one of Gordon Ramsay's restaurants. Service is okay. My server seemed to be nice but a bit fake and pushy. I hated the fact that when our dessert came out and was put on our plate. He took the sauce and wanted to pour it on my dessert. I politely said no thank you. I also noticed he lifted someone else's sauce at the table next to us. It's just a bit weird.  I ordered the mini burger and it was good but nothing special. I saw a lot of people ordering the pretzels so we got those too. They look amazing but they taste like a few days old. Not hot. Not fresh. The cheese sauce also looked like something that had been sitting for days. I mean... who could ruin a pretzel? It's just dough.   Wish I could say my experience was better but I would never go here again and I wouldn't recommend it to anyone. There are so many better places in Vegas.  I'd really like Gordon Ramsay him self to come in and have a meal. I'm sure he wouldn't be pleased.   And here's my review since my waiter said about 3 times that I should write one.

BsklaiJo3V_skgBsR63LyA.text: I had no clue what to expect since my friends and I were wandering around and stumbled upon a place with such cool decor. Coincidentally, it was happy hour! And we were immediately seated as it was the middle of the week.  I believe the cocktails were $12. The truffle fries were fantastic too! If anyone asks you to share, it would do you great service to firmly say "no" because you'll regret not getting your own during happy hour. Great place to grab a quick bite, start up a buzz, and find yourself in the presence of great restaurant staff. Definitely a must try!

bcyqnrmL9CZhFIXJsJpjlg.text: My boyfriend had the most amazing Beef Wellington and I was lucky enough to get a bite because it was to die for! I had the Salmon with the basil dill creme fresh sauce that just made the dish! Service was on point. I had a goodbye blue sky from the bar that was the cherry on top! Management was active on the floor and that's always nice to see!

g3c3QNoaIfYkqbOhbT-caA.text: Great food and awesome service at this location!  I tried the Shepherds Pie, and loved it with the lamb.  Great beer selection, and the most perfect Moscow mule I have ever tasted!  (I went back to the bar while at Caesar's just to get another!). I recommend this stop if you're on the strip and looking for some good food!

3yKPhfv0cHFAY6jv2fY2iA.text: Best fish and chips I've ever had in my life. Rodney was an AWESOME server and deserves to be second in command to Gordon Ramsay himself. Seriously...promote Rodney.

WMt975wrGBfXD8v8ciM_UA.text: Meh.... there are high expectations for GR.  Food 1st day here w time change, wanted the Beef Wellington , but too large a portion for "10pm". Had the shepherds pie and it was nothing to write home about, nothing special at all - plus there was 3-4 in of potatoes on top of filling. Would never order again Service Ate at bar, bartender had a bit of tude when it came to recommendations etc, like he did not want to answer questions  Based on food & tude, would not recommend or likely return

L8X2hcDqsvvFI6DWJ2M77A.text: Love this place--the food, the atmosphere, and the waitstaff.   The sticky toffee pudding is a must here but the other desserts are good as well.   Only two complaints... miss the lamb chops. That dish was incredible. Should find a way to put it back on the menu.  Also, at the time of this review, it was hard to find a table that didn't wobble... extremely irritating having the table shifting while cutting your food.

9JPeLI1ClXBshO_JOy-vcw.text: Restaurant itself is perfect! Tastefully done. The food was amazing! Best calamari I've had . Also my drink, Cucumber cooler. So refreshing ! Not too sweet and so amazing! The only reason I would mark it down a start would be our rude waiter. Other than that AMAZING! I love Gordon Ramsay!

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pigs in a blanket
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fried calamari

qljJVizIq3sFzQtce5PKqQ.text: Steak and ale pie, sticky toffee pudding. Simply perfect. Not the cheapest place to eat, but it's in a top notch casino. Worth every penny.

9Jjx2MNriPU6Lw5FohBJ5Q.text: I think I would have enjoyed this better if my expectations hadn't been so high. I mean, it wasn't bad, but nothing special. I think they invested more in presentation and less in flavor.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States

-3191POIwJK3QrMCEdM_QA.text: Awesome experience and Juice the bartender was super friendly & informative! We came in 10 minutes before the kitchen closed and they were so cool about it!

fmjgv2pD00oCRP5s1xqIZA.text: Shepherds pie is amazing. As is the Pub Crawl cocktail. Christian is a great bartender, sit at the bar and find him.

OYZKapQWvDih8fVCn1FllQ.text: My husband and I drove from Northern California  Gordon Ramsey Pub and Grill. Very worth my time and belly. Travis our persistent waiter listened attentively to my two sisters, mom, husband and I's order.  We ordered the 3 grilled bacon burger, main lobster and shrimp roll minis, and Pub Chop Salad.  As the runner dropped off our food in an incorrect order, Travis walked behind her and placed the food in correct order.  The water boy persistently to poured our empty water cup. Great job Gordon Ramsey in ensuring great customer service by your hostess to your runners and waiter! I'll definitely will be back! Love your show too!

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Delicious bacon burger with a side of Maine Lobster &amp; Shrimp Roll Minis!

oRvnlXRg4Cq5nigqL_EEog.text: Had a great meal here, the fish & chips and steak & ale pie were as good as from England! Our server Rodney was very helpful in making menu recommendations :)

BfgaQUQLOlPUFNaCFS340g.text: It's right in the middle of Cesars and someone help you if you get seated right at the railing, it's like you are an animal on display and all the people waling by stare at you while eating.  The atmosphere is pretty chill for a trendy pub.  It was pretty noisy while we were there but the service was great and the sliders were outstanding, best sliders I have had to date.  They have a great beer selection, including some of Ramsay's claimed favorites.  I tried them all a couple times, it was good.  Overall its worth a trip, but you better get reservations in advance or you will be waiting a half hour or more.  Reserve online and you get right in.  Like I said, the service was awesome!

tHtJE-TEb3d1LJdu0ehygw.text: We stopped by here last weekend around 4pm for Lunch to a medium sized crowd dining while watching football.  We didn't have reservations although they take them and were sat in 10 minutes.  We had the luxury of being seated at a low standing coffee table w/ two king chairs on one side and a huge sofa on the other.  Since our party consisted of me, my wife, my 6 month old and our 3 year old, the seating was perfect.  Our waitress came by within 2 minutes of us being sat to take our drink order.  For a gastropub, the "hard stuff" concoctions were a little limited (about 10 to choose from - zero tequila based beverages) as the majority of their libations are Beers.  Not a bad thing for a gastropub, but I like having variety open.  We ordered a very tasty Bourbon drink that immediately put a smile on my wife's face and I ordered a Rum concoction that tasted like a Watermelon Cooler.  To start we ordered the "Chilled Shrimp Salad" - poached in lemon-beer shandy, light ginger-mayo, w/ red cocktail sauce.  It came out in about 8 minutes and my 3 year old couldn't stop eating "his shrimpys".   Very good dish. For our entrees, I ordered the Traditional Shepherd's Pie and the Beef Short-Rib & Cheek sandwhich - on hearth baked sourdough, horseradish mayo, roasted red pepper jam, red onion marmalade.  The Beef Short Rib was one of the best sandwich's i've had.  Dipping it into the horeseradish infused ketchup made all the difference too.  Couldn't get enough of this flavor bomb.  The Shepherd's Pie was also very good, but too traditional.  I would have preferred more gravy and less potatoes.  It was VERY traditional.  Not a bad thing, just hoped he would have kicked it up a notch.  Overall, the meal came out to $100 w/ the two drinks ($30) so overall, medium priced for a Casino meal and would go back.

fOqA1MpgOSzeEisyiMl59Q.text: Probably the biggest disappointment I have had in Vegas. I have been to other restaurants from Gordon Ramsey and have enjoyed them. This one was a fail on most levels.  I found the food to be pretty crappy. Not good flavor profiles at all. All my food was even bland at times. I tried nearly everything that our table of 6 got. Nothing really wowed me.  The service was slow. Not very attentive.  There were 2 positive notes. The sticky toffee pudding (which is one of my favs) was really excellent. I would go back only for desert just for that. I also like the sound track of British music playing.  Aside from that, I think Mr. Ramsey should take a page from some of his own TV shows and go in there and cuss people out for failing to run a good restaurant.  Whoever is in charge there needs a good yelling at.

v9EUFUbVj5kP_3VMWqiBUw.text: I have to say to leave a respected restaurant a one star review feels wrong. With that being said the service was awful, the food was late (an hour late), food was subpar, and absolutely everything was overpriced. Our waiter was standoffish and seemed annoyed the entire duration of our dinner. Overall just a bad experience which is ironic considering the restaurants owner. Move along if you're thinking about stopping in, your money is better spent elsewhere.

NlWZjvR7D61VH5xCzVynGQ.text: I am here at the restaurant and wanted to share me experience. We ordered the Mule and it was good.  We also ordered the Lamb Burger "Med Well" and pigs in a blanket. The Lamb was over cooked. It took the server more than 10 minutes after we got our food to ask how the food was.  I told him that I asked for the burger to be med well and it was more than well done.  He said well med well is some pink and it barely past that stage. I said there should be pink for med well and red for med. He offered to get me a new one but we had plans to be somewhere with friends.  The manager or supervisor past is more than 8 times and never acknowledged us and never said hi. He would spend more time with the girls that worked there talking and laughing by the table then supervising. We got our total bill and he never apologized when giving us the bill or fortune our payment. We still tipped him 15%  for someone who has worked in hotels and has managed a restaurant I know i can be critical but bad service is something I don't deal well with.  I watch Gordon Ramsey show all the time and I admire what he does but I don't think he would be very happy with the strive provided here. The lamb was over cooked and had no flavor.  Well. It actually tasted very lamby if that's a work. Lol.  I expected so much more from this restaurant.  We were going to order dessert and shots of tequila but after my experience I did not want to give this restaurant more business.

WgpUM-n5PjyLGOqYQCLKlQ.text: This is really the worst pub I have ever eaten at!  We should have left after looking at the menu, but I figured it really could not be that bad.  WOW was I wrong.  Fish & Chips; thick soggy batter with white mush inside for fish and Zero flavor.  The chips big huge block like sticks of greasy mush potato.  Brook Trout; a slab of fish with no flavor and root vegetables that tasted just like dirt.  So ok maybe the chef had a bad night, like he forgot his seasoning apron.  I could see a off night, but I can't  see horrible service.  Not in Vegas where ever casino has at least three great restaurant and five or so ok ones.  Our waitress or lack of one was awful she literally was never there.  I had to grab someone walking by every time we needed any thing drinks, bread, our order, and check.  Ok all that and a bus boy that spilled twice all over the table.  First time pouring water, he just kept pouring even after he had left the glass.  Second time picking up our plates, spilling what ever buttery watery juice came with the trout all over the table and my iPhone.  Each time he did this he never apologized or said a word.   Guess I can say, just don't go.  Go anywhere else, there are so many options

_DeAed9GRP3k8-dcCdJ4sw.text: Where to start?..... My hubby and I stumbled into the pub and walked in without know that it was Gordon Ramsay's pub. After we walked in and saw the mural on the back wall we only expected greatness as I am a fan.    The waiter greeted us with most friendlyness it almost seemed like we had met before and were long time friends.  He proceeded to explain the menu and make recommendations.  We took his advise on a couple of dishes and boy, oh boy..... We are hooked!   Everything we had was delicious.   The portions are small so no sharing is advised. Another word of advise for the restaurant manager and the lady patrons that walk in with heels.... Hold on to a rail for dear life.  I almost fell three times on my way to our table.  At first I thought it was my shoes but after witnessing 2 lady guest fall in front of my table at different times while we had dinner, there was no doubt in my mind.... The floors are slippery and very dangerous specially after a couple of fancy cocktails. You have been advised!!! :)

ii_6CWfxVx5SWuSgEaV1Bw.text: The bartender Ray Ray is amazing and knows how to build a drink!! His personality and drink knowledge is outstanding! Great job Ray Ray!! Thanks!

oQuXCMCTeV-YM2xF6poHsg.text: Second Gordon restaurant in few months. Please know: huge fan of the show, etc.   Second restaurant, second disappointment. Food was good but: - portions are tiny - ridicoulously overpriced - terrible service at many levels: 10 minutes wait for the warer order, 15 More to order drinks and 20 to order food; no napkins; 5 waitresses at front door doing nothing and a bunch pf customers trying to catch their attention; horrible outfits, especially woman (btw not a good idea to have the Sun's headline celebrating the folkland's win on a dress...) - the fountain drinks suck. Coke was watery and with a very weird backtaste; asked for an outlet to plug my phone and the waitress would not even know what to do.  - did i say overpriced?!? 17 bucks for 3 miniscule sliders with no side.   Bottom line: Gordon you're full of s***, you talk about consistency but that's what this is: inconsistent and not worth the money.

2BpjfTjCTHJlCgUrhZkfwg.text: The wings were good. Scott was great. Beer was even better. I will be back again to drink even more beer and I want to do it here. I haven't even left and I can't wait to be back again--highly recommend any of the appetizers

9Mn1FVH22akRBpVFBj6Ssw.text: Dear Gordon,  This was my first trip to this 'restaurant' of yours. May I say if I wanted to feel like I wanted to be in one of your 'Kitchen Nightmare' shows this was it - at your very own restaurant. !! I am very disappointed Gordon.   Arriving Thursday evening, four front of house lady restaurant hosts in their tight fitting 'London' dresses (just to remind you you were entering the land of british cuisine) sparring over seating arrangements on their seating/reservation computer made for great amusement as the restaurant waiting line grew.   Eventually getting to the front we asked whether we wanted to sit on the low tables or higher tables - we indicated lower. A few minutes later one of the other hosts took us to our higher table - we told her of what we had asked for - she seemed confused - however we told her we'd stay at the table she'd taken us to - communication a problem here ?    After five to ten minutes waiting our waiter Ali D came along. A young chap who told me he had been educated at a college in Birmingham, UK and had attended business school but had come back to the States to waiter because the money was better 'waitering'. Taking my order of Shepard's Pie and a pint of Fullers he promply disappeared. Twenty five minutes passed and then the Shepard's Pie turned up.  Ali still no where in sight with the beer. The bowls for the Shepard's Pie are circa 7" are smaller than what you think, however quality over quantity here as you are paying $23 for a tasting experience Ramsay style.  Asking this waiter about my drink - he promptly left and ten minutes later Ali turned up with the drink ! yeah ! - only 40 minutes to get a drink. !!   Quality of the Shepard's Pie - packed with lamb and vegetables , it was not extraordinary in anyway , however what let it down considerably was the mash potato topping which was watery, singing to the fact this thing had just been microwaved - either that, or Gordon's mum had trained Gordon to make mashed potatoes this way - I think not.     After finishing this and waiting another ten minutes for Ali to come back, I decided to be brave and order the Sticky Toffee pudding. At this point , I had a further surprise - a bread basket appeared !! another first for me - isn't this suppose to appear at the start of the meal ?   Five minutes, ten minutes, fifteen minutes , boy how long does it take to make this dessert ? Ali passed  us a number of times and no comment from him. Eventually I flagged down another waiter and told him I was 'pissed' and wanted to see my waiter. A few minutes later Ali turned up, telling him promply to cancel the dessert offering and get me the bill. No apologies or anything, he left the table. Bringing us the bill for, you've got it, for $122.00 !!! - instead of $32 - way to go Ali !! .    At this juncture, I think one of the other waiters must have summoned the attention of the evening manager Brian Ward. Brian was exemplary in apologizing for the level of service I had received and invited me back to experience the restaurant one more time as I had a couple more days in town. He gave me his card and I thanked him for coming over to make amends.    Unfortunately Gordon, there are many other places in Vegas to eat and this is one restaurant of yours I shall not be returning to. This place is a disaster and I'd strongly urge you Gordon to get on the next flight here to shake things up as this restaurant could be on the road to no where sooner than what you think. Sorry to give you this news, but as a fellow Brit - I have to be honest.  If you want me to show your Chef there how to make Shepard's Pie - I'll gladly take the F Word challenge against him/her and see who wins.

ALC1ljIuughx_ueyEEHaWA.text: Do not eat here. This place is super overrated. Maybe Gordon Ramsey himself is overrated. Two people in our party ordered lamb burgers. My friend ordered his medium, no tomatoes. He received a very well-done burger w/tomatoes. I ordered a med/ rare burger, I received a very well-done burger. We told the waiter about it right away. He asked if he should take it back to the kitchen and we said no, because it was 5pm, our first meal of the day, and we were starving. We just wanted to point it out to him.   You get 4 big steak fries with your burger. One of mine was half uncooked and the other was cold. We told the waiter again and he scoffed at us like we were complaining to get a free meal. He basically made it seem that if the meal was that terrible we shouldn't have ate most of our meals. Come on, we are staying at the Caesar's Palace and ordering $15 dollar cocktails with lunch, you jerk, we are not that cheap.   He did end up taking a $9 dollar appetizer off the meal but was clearly annoyed about it. He even made a big scene about the frozen fry by stabbing my steak knife into the frozen fry and carrying it across the restaurant that way, to the manager, to explain what happened. We tipped him well for taking the app off the meal but we all made it a point to discourage everyone we knew from eating at this place.

B8INViabDwTX9anLjZjzrA.text: Not sure what the gripping is about. We went there on a recent trip to Vegas and LOVED IT! We started with the pretzels and cheese and they were really good! I ordered the Chicken Pot pie and OH MY GOODNESS! Flakey and not overcooked. The gravy was perfect. The veggies and chicken were moist and perfectly made. The wine selection offered was perfect.  My hubby had the burger and really enjoyed it with homemade chips. I would go back in a minute!  Did not disappoint.

S8tKf_HBVrRvEwe4tMRNzA.text: Very disappointed for a Gordan Ramsay restaurant. Worst service I've encountered in a long time and I could have ate better food at a bar. First off there was 5 of us and the hostess said 30 minutes. 15 minutes later I went up and told her it will only be 4 people now so she said ok it will be 20 minutes more. My other friend came up to her at the 20 minute mark and said are we next it's 4 people and she said oh it's only 4 people okay give us 10 minutes. Finally, we got sat to a 7 top table and we said there's only 4 of us and she said oh opps sorry and we asked for a smaller table so we could actually communicate instead of yelling across from each other at the table. We ordered are appetizers and we got everything but our pretzels. It took 20 minutes for them to send out the pretzels. We ordered alcohol and one of the beers was not what we ordered and we wanted chilled glasses. It took another 20 minutes to get it and glasses weren't chilled. 45 minutes later we get our entrees and their luke warm not hot. I've never had such bad service of such plain jane food. Our server seemed lost but he was nice and actually admitted that he didn't provide great service but I give him credit for being honest. The only positive is the manager comped our meal and that was very kind of her. Hopefully they will work out the tweaks and maybe I will return since I do enjoy Gordan Ramsay steak at Paris.  PROS: Price, service, unorganized, food, communication CONS: Ambiance, decor, cocktails

Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sliders

TaVkEOiNuC1iG84azwebVA.text: I visit this restaurant every time I'm in Vegas. Since it's in Cesar's Palace, we can always drop in and expect good service and good food. I'm now forever in love with scotch eggs and toffee pudding. Lol Check it out if you're in town and looking for a central spot on the strip with reasonable prices (for Vegas).

wcRvdLJhB6nJGk8HErxrMw.text: Disappointed! The food was average at best and maybe my expectations were just too high. Ordered a burger, medium to medium well, that was seriously close to rare. Ok, the made me a new burger but that's not the point. I just expected more. The menu was limited. I supposed to be an English style pub and the much of the food is British (and I'm not a huge fan of English food) but there just weren't many appealing options (at least on the happy hour menu). Would pass on this place next time.

L8sG9tN2IYdr99lzhdaNMA.text: We were in Vegas to celebrate my wife Norma's Bday along with Sherry, a friend of 40 years, who is a Caesar's Diamond member.   The service and hospitality was impeccable, which certainly added to the quality of the food and drink experience. Our servers, Adam (on 3/7) and Sara (on 3/11), were terrific. On our first visit the bar manager, Randy, also came over and introduced himself. He was very personable and we shared some laughs as Norma and Sherry related how they had met Gordon Ramsay a couple of years ago.  The calamari with bacon crackle was simply one of the best we have ever had. My wife fell in love with the fish & chips (great batter!) and my NY strip steak was exactly medium rare. Every dish was one of the best we have ever had. But the kudos do not end there -  Sherry's Cosmopolitan and Norma's blueberry & blackberry concoction were delicious and my bourbon cocktail was literally PERFECT and the best outside of my own! It was wonderful to not have to explain how to mix a Perfect Manhattan. As Randy explained, all the bartenders have won contests. Well...it showed. Randy also steered us to two wonderful desserts, sticky toffee pudding and snickerdoodle madeleine.   We also got to meet Scott Cummings, the winner of Season 12 Hell's Kitchen. We were happy to have the opportunity to tell him how much we loved all the food!  Needless to say, we loved it so much the first time that's why we came back for a second visit in the same week!! We will be sure to try Gordon Ramsay's other places as his brand is as good as his name!

IAbWJo_Ydw3KbZXHsdAbRg.text: we were staying at Caesars Palace and wanted to try a Gordon Ramsey restaurant, so naturally we came here for dinner. The atmosphere is lovely. our server was wonderful, but the best part was when the manager, Randy, came and talked to us for about 15 minutes and told us fun Gordon Ramsey tidbits (my husband is a superfan) thanks for making it such a great expierence! of course the food was awesome as well!

u0tE0Lc2DcWkCxT7et89Cg.text: We ordered five entrees, all were delicious. We shared each other's at the table and argued over which one was the best, delicious!We recommend the corn beef sandwich it was! We would also recommend the lamb burger it was delicious

wHbnxDVRutZ5U-HvHyBU9w.text: I was here on 1/30/13. The wait time is about 45mins and we were seated once we returned on time. Our server is fantastic, very nice, recommended sliders, pork belly, and steak, so we go ahead ordered those. Now I clocked the time, we waited 30mins for food to come out, very slow. Our server keep checking on us and reassured us about our food which is very nice of her.   When our food is served, nothing is really good. Sliders were dry, pork belly was decent but not great. Now the steak, that was way over cooked, seasoning is way too salty, to a point you can't even taste anything but saltiness. We ask our server to come take a look, she instantly apologize and told us she will speak to her boss to see if it can be take off the bill. and it was taken off the bill, which is about $40. We didn't ordered any replacement course cos we scare to wait another 30mins...   At the end the whole dinning experience is a disappointment, that fact that food came out of Ramsay's kitchen is so sub par, here I will use his fav phase Dreadful!!! If wasn't for Ramsay's name..it will be a 1 star review, seriously!!

CmXsrxfgiMuLi8sVK97njw.text: I expected it to be pricey , but you don't get your money's worth at all! The fish and chips were "recommended" by the waitress and it was decent enough , but for $30 the 2 pieces of fish and few  Fries were  a disappointment , I don't expect a Tom of food but it was a very small amt for the $$.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. $30 fish and chips at Ramsey&#39;s pub

VzFNIt56NHMpanKeIp2N6Q.text: Drinks are expensive, cocktails are on the sweet side.......bartender keep on rushing customer to pay first. After paid will ask would you like to open a new tab? Why? Ask open a new tab........why don't you just tell the customers pay as you order.....he (Charlie) keep on telling customers there are so many people just walk off after they finished their drinks. Then try to come up with a better solutions without telling everyone of your customers. I'm sitting here for an hour and half I've been hear him keep on repeat and repeating the same sentence..........to every customer. I'm telling you customers won't come back to you. This is so annoying!!!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States

GQGL1AGELmSe-eoechuwDw.text: OUTSTANDING!  Weeks after our visit and I still dreaming out the Sticky Toffee Pudding.  The calamari starter we ordered was delicious and full of flavor.  Call me weird but I had my heart set on a burger.  I heard they were the best in Vegas and if Chef Ramsay's name is on it... I just have to believe it's True.  Guess what kids?  It was the best damn burger I've ever tasted.  Cooked perfectly, seasoned perfectly and on a fresh homemade bun.  I added the truffle fries and I was in Heaven.   One thing that really impressed us was the guys walking around refilling your water.  It was like an art how they twirled the water into the glass not missing a drop.  I loved this place and I loved the atmosphere.  My one and only complaint was the price on the beers.  $11 for a 20oz beer including Miller Light?  Yowza... Someone is banking on those kegs.  I get it.  Ramsay's name is on the place, the service is killer amazing and the food is out of this world amazing.  They can charge whatever they want for cheap beer.  Listen folks, if you are in Vegas, GO HERE.  You will not be disappointed and you will dream for months about sticky toffee pudding.

-6tp1KVVnxPSXN4AK-L3CQ.text: We loved the restaurant, great food, tasty and large starters size (nachos). Nice atmosphere and great service from Chris P. , very helpful and friendly!

0mIk7ZgPaF8dm_MX1fCspg.text: The food and service are delicious and wonderful!  I ate here 2 years ago and have looked forward to eating here again on my trip today!  The food and service did not fail my expectations!  Our server Heather was delightful, helpful and fun  and made our experience so comfortable'. Our bus person, Medhi, was charming and fun!  Heather and Medhi added to an already wonderful dining experience!  A must do while in Vegas at Caesar's!

d_KoXz3hu87EZ_uHsIq5tw.text: The fish and chips were awesome. Heather was great. Will be returning later in the week to try something else from this restaurant!

PlRHP5LJhBSmgXhXjeM18g.text: Our server Rod was amazing! I ordered the BLT which was phenomenal. The bread was soft, and it was loaded with bacon and an amazing garlic mayo.  Drinks are somewhat pricy but it's to be expected at a resultant like this. Will be a for sure go to for our next trip to Vegas.

tVNqrfDFVLiNhLXcd9tOnw.text: We are enthusiastic Ramsay fans and finally got a chance to try the Pub & Grill. The first thing that struck me was how comically low the chairs are compared to the tables. My husband is 6-feet tall, and the table top lined up with his chest. I'm 5'1" so you can imagine that I simply had to slide the food in a straight line directly from the plate to my mouth.   We started with the Ramsay Tonic & a Moscow Mule. Both were just okay. My Moscow Mule tasted mostly of lime, and my husband didn't even finish his drink. The calamari was also just okay. It wasn't crispy, almost chewy, although it was seasoned well. And they served it with tartar sauce and ketchup. Ketchup...?   Husband ordered the Fish & Chips, and I got the Braised Short Rib. The chips (or wedge fries) that came with his were seriously under-seasoned and slightly under-cooked. My Short Rib was the highlight--it nearly melted apart before my fork even touched it. The potato puree was tasty & smooth. Small sad face: the three carrots were still raw. Then came the Sticky Toffee Pudding. We've been obsessed with it ever since our first visit to Gordon Ramsay Steak. This one tasted great, but it didn't have the same sticky consistency I love about the one you can get at Steak. This was more like a cake.  The least desirable part of the whole experience was the service. The hostess was cold and didn't even look at me. However, the hostess assistant that sat us was friendly and engaging. Our server was fine but insincere. When he came to take our entree order, he just approached the table and stood there looking at us expectantly. I had to say, "I think we're ready to order," just to break the awkward silence. Again, he was fine; I wouldn't classify it as rude. Just not attentive or warm.  Overall, we had a decent experience. Looking back, I would rather have spent our 7-year anniversary and hard earned money at Steak again because the pricing is nearly the same, and the experience at Steak is significantly better.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Braised Short Rib. Delish!

gLBMTAHoQHkxhn_wUcOelw.text: I tried the Burger & Fries and it was very tasty. Full of flavor and cooked just right. Lisa was our server and I couldn't have asked for a better server. Full of energy, great with advice and just a burst of joy.

oBzNpzCGuLC6y_rDUlcgFQ.text: This place has amazing food and Heather is Wonderful and helpful I would come back anytime

cB1PY_rnXuzOFFJE5lYZcA.text: We stumbled in upon this place after some hardcore shopping in Caeser's forum shops. Very cool decor - British grunge punk mixed with contemporary decor. Cool mix of tables and sofas and loveseats. HUGE bar. We chose to sit at the bar (being the alcoholics we are) and the happy hour was kick ass. Probably 20 different beers and ciders. Prices on beers and appetizers were so affordable. The nachos here - oh my word - just try them. My boyfriend got them while I attempted a healthier option. Pretty sure I scarfed all his nachos when he got up to use the restroom. Talk about order regret.  The best part of our visit here was the bartender Ray Ray.  He's off on weekends, but if you are nearby during a weekday, look for a big friendly bartender named Ray. He anticipated our needs ahead of time, was personable and professional, and has years and years of experience in the service industry in Vegas. Would have loved to kick it at the bar with him all day.  He was equally as friendly and helpful with the other patrons at the bar as well.
