Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The nachos. Just. Order. Them.

-PyyFnZiYejOMTVHFuHhnQ.text: Great food and service. We could see how the staff lives up to Ramsay's attention to detail. The staff was very attentive and checked on us every couple of minutes.

tA7QfDQqeeuGgOWVf9YFaw.text: The food was delicious but a little overpriced. The service was great and the location is convenient.  The highlight of the meal was the dessert. It's a must have. Make sure you order the Sticky Toffee Pudding.

Ep4CC8SST4lFzjXeSLJulA.text: We were here today for happy hour, honestly very disappointing.  Ordered nachos, wings and slides from the happy hour menu, food quality like in TGIF Friday's. I would honestly say that Friday's is better. Service was pretty bad too, we waited close to 20 min for him to even look down our way, and at the end I just grabbed random worker and asked him to get us a check.  They r getting 2 stars because the wings were A "ok".

VLzfEI4NV97TCmd4krrGfw.text: Great British Fare! A bit pricey for pub food, but its probably on par with all the other restaurants in the strip.  The pretzel appetizer was pretty good but for 7$ it would be nice to get more than 3.  The english cheddar sauce that is served with the pretzels is amazing though.    The Beer Braised Short Rib entree is fantastic however a little steep at almost 40$.  The portion size was generous.  The Sticky Toffee Pudding is a must have.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beer Braised Shirt Rib entree

hnzd5GJZ-ccB9NH3RGkhuA.text: I am a huge Gorden Ramsy fan but this was very disappointing.   Got the burger and truffle fries. It was just ok nothing special by any means. A bit above a red robin burger. I ate half and wanted to take the rest to go. While pouring my fries into my to go container a half an inch of oil came out and ruined what was left of my burger and the fries were so saturated with oil it was inedible.   I tell mgt and they agreed to reduce my bill from 30 to 26. As I didn't get to eat most of my meal I thought it was a bit cheap and dismissive. For that price for a burger it should blow my mind.  Help staff was great though.   For the price I would pass if I were you.

CFtkP2OLuL5kUj_hspL73Q.text: *UPDATE  Gordon Ramsay opened a Fish and Chips fast food joint at the Linq and they serve the exact same fish and chips as the pub except it's literally half price! 14.99 vs 29.99.     Still a 3 star restaurant but the only reason for me to go back is gone now...  On the whole, this place is about 3 stars... the fish and chips however are 5 stars!     I got the fish and chips which were AMAZING.  The batter was perfect and the fish was fried perfectly.   The fries were medium sized and also delicious.  We also got the scotch egg, bangers and mash, and sheperds pie at our table.  All of which were average (3 stars).  Their beer selection is actually pretty weak although they did have Innis and Gunn on tap which is an amazing beer.   This being Vegas,  there are much cheaper places to drink so I would suggest just getting the 1 beer to go with your meal.     Prices were 9-13 dollars for largely mainstream and uninteresting beers.

kRjB9PbBcWltUe0vt6qXXg.text: Delicious food & great ambiance. I had the Beef Wellington- which was the best Beef Wellington I ever had.  And amazing service at the bar from Keith & Juice

mtAI9mybQTEtzeiIcMwTvA.text: Had high hopes for this place as I am a Gordon Ramsey fan however very disappointed with the quality of food here, my wife had the salmon was only able to eat a few bites I also tried it and it was without a doubt the most bland salmon I have ever tasted, with a $40 price tag you would expect much better quality. I had the bacon cheddar burger which was $25 and was very average at best. I think Gordon needs to take some of his own advice and re-evaluate his menu at this place because it in not very impressive to say the least.

Pn2z5Z7agG2xl0h2nReudg.text: Chose to try this restaurant after having dinner the night before at his Steakhouse. Another amazing dinner. I had the BLT and as it was a great BLT, it was not only the food, but the great customer service that made the meal. Gordon himself should be proud of the staff he has working in his restaurants as both were fabulous. WTG ! Thanks for making my trip to Vegas even more memorable. To the bar mgr, thanks for introducing me to a Moscow mule !! Love them.

rjlNsk6jR_hykqPAR-ZMOg.text: If I could give this no stars I would. Horrible meal. Maybe our expectations were too high given the name behind the restaurant but we were so disappointed. All four of us sent back barely eaten meals. Dont be fooled by the name. There are plenty of better options.

wXC2nqrhwyD655C2eaPKfA.text: Rodney was awesome. I'm originally from Maryland so I'm very picky when it comes to any type of seafood. The soft crab was excellent. Very lightly battered and HUGE. I wish I could give the service and the food 10 stars. Rodney is so personable. All servers should be like him.

PBQ9v0GPs4fey6cmbCJEGQ.text: Well this place was one I had NEVER been to and I figured, if we are going to "do Vegas" lest do it all the way. I ordered the Shepard pie and her, the beef tenderloin. Entering the Restraunt, I thought that it was kind of cliche but nice. The place was a bit empty on a weekend but the food was cooked to perfection. One thing I was a tad miffed about was the lack of opulence. I am not sure what I expected but what I got was a very casual dining experience. Thanks to my lady, I had a great time and really enjoyed the rest of the experience there.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Kegs are used as a room divider. Pretty neat...

mEI5HWaXfCqEjZT-bVqQrA.text: Nong great service thank you! Great recommendations, best scotch egg I've ever had! Finally a great place with a great bass.

x6PmpBEi5Z7UrHPtLXAkuA.text: I'm literally here now as I type this. My server is Roger. The food is great. Really good. But each night our servers have been a bit short, uninterested. Roger being the worst. It wasn't until 10 minutes into the service that we knew his name and I had to ask for it. Also he rushed us through ordering, very rude.  Gordon Ramsey your restraint is awesome, staff, not so much.  Something to improve for sure

zF-CyMeoxWTXTGe2MTpuFg.text: So I never really liked Gordon Ramsay's show, Hells kitchen. But his restaurant here at the Caesar's Palace, has great ambience plenty of TVs to watch any sports games you want, the waiters very friendly and very knowledgeable, which is always a plus, and the food is very good.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. BLT with cheese
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Butter chicken curry
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster roll

ftjtxnsXzyUWeWolwzJhsw.text: Simply way too much money for very little.  I know it's Vegas but,  this was a little bit crazy.  Don't get me wrong, the food was very good.  But not for what they are asking for it.  I got the seared scallops which were ok but it was literally two scallops.  I got the Wellington which was really good!  I tried others short ribs which were good but nothing special.  The sticky toffee pudding was good but didn't blow me away.  I've had better while in the uk for way way less money.   The food is good but for the price just good doesn't cut it for me.   If I'm gonna pay the crazy Vegas prices I want something special.

Ocx8QzHlnVFcNPJovHgmWA.text: The food was great!  Lobster Mac and cheese and the wings! Atmosphere is nice and relaxing but still classy.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States

K9aNR1mvBtXWUqfTX36O6Q.text: "What are you?!" "An idiot sandwich"  ...not if you eat here, you're not.  I first had the opportunity to eat at a Chef Ramsay restaurant when I went to Plane Food in Heathrow.  I'm glad to see what regardless of where in the world it is, his restaurants live up to certain quality standards.   We dropped in without a reservation while wandering through Caesar's.  I had the Mule's Hind Leg cocktail and it was pretty good, though just par for the course for a Vegas cocktail.  But the food really shined, especially for the price (relative to Vegas anyway).  I had the fish and chips and while the chips were nothing to write home about the fish was maybe the best fish and chips I've had anywhere in the U.S.  It was lightly breaded with nice chunks of white fish.  My friend had the steak and ale pie and really enjoyed it.  Through Yelp we got the sticky toffee pudding and it was a nice way to end the meal.    I think if you're looking for an unpretentious not-over-the-top Vegas restaurant that beats the food court, you can't go wrong with GR's pub & grill.

ExPgyyvHSytzISmpt3ornQ.text: The food and service was phenomenal! Loberster roll, scallops, fries, crispy calamari and lobster mac and cheese definitely hit the spot!

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster Mac &amp; Cheese is absolutely phenomenal!

hAJuIqup_pIaQfBhIvMFeA.text: Omg this place is amazing.  The beers were great.  Margaritas were even better.  I'm picky on my scallops and this place had perfect scallops. Seared perfectly. The employees help each other and I love that. It was busy considering it was a Monday evening, but then again we are in Las Vegas. I will definitely come back and try other items on the menu.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States

iVgFxnS-ItmuC4gegBZ01g.text: Despite the name, the setting is very laid back and comfortable. The dishes are elevated comfort foods and that is not a knock. The beer list is extensive and the quantities incredible (35 oz beer that kept me sipping all night).  The staff is attentive, fast, and courteous. I would definitely come back here, especially for the juicy lamb burger.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States

EIUS88U7keyGAHSXjIj-HQ.text: This is my favorite restaurant at Ceasers Palace. Great food,great atmosphere & great staff. Our Bartender Ronnie was amazing. Very talkative and knowledgeable about his drinks. I highly recommend this to everyone!!?

WdqVGyCJlhauNKvlh2H-4g.text: Chris P. was our server. He did a fantastic job!  Very attentive and polite which made the experience even better.    The food and drinks were spot on -  tasty and large portions.  Atmosphere is lively with music and laughter all around, yet still reserved enough for intimate conversation.   Definitely recommend this place for delicious food and great service :)

lUW6vsvxvh_vTlwaig2KXg.text: Loud. Uncomfortable. Overpriced. My 13 year-old was craving a Caesar salad. For $17 dollars (no protein added on), what arrived was barely bigger than a bread plate. We also ordered deviled eggs (mine are much better), the Scotch egg (decent), Shepherd's pie (tasty if you like lamb), the steak pie, creamed spinach (more like a dip). The redeeming dish was the pig's in a blanket, which were very good. In a town with so many good restaurants, give this one a miss.

8DUJbKIB55BcZfA1r1OqEg.text: One of my favorite spots in Las Vegas to grab a bite to eat.  Just like all of Gordon's other places to eat you just can't go wrong.  The duck fries were delicious and we ordered the steamed mussels for appetizers.  The sticky toffee cake with butter ice cream is just on another level of pastry.  Please check it out

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bar is great and just in time to watch the game!

_x1GG0ZK6iB8MiAYjbrAYw.text: Always delicious! Had the fish and chips. Excellent! Highly recomm thanks for the great time!

Ay9e_qjajex8mJGv7NejKA.text: We were curious to try out Gordon Ramsay's grill. I had planned to just get their fish & chips since I assumed that would be pretty good. When they mentioned that Beef Wellington was their special and that they only serve it about 10 times a year, I decided to order it knowing it's one of Gordon Ramsay's signature dishes.  Time passed. More time passed. After 1 hour, 20 mins we asked where our food was. The server finally went to see and they came out with our food a while later. Come to find out later, they lost the ticket for our table and had to rush an order. Beef wellington typically takes 30-60 mins to make. The right thing for them to do would have been to come out and tell us what happened and ask if we wanted to wait for another hour for them to make it properly or give us the option of ordering something else. Did they do that? No. Instead, they rushed the order and overcooked the Beef Wellington. If I wasn't so hungry I wouldn't have eaten it. It didn't have much flavor and it was really disappointing. Even the mashed potatoes was luke warm.  They ended up giving us 20% off and the manager came out and apologized. It wasn't enough to make up for it though.  I'd like to think if Gordon Ramsay himself had been in the kitchen and see the mess, he would have screamed "SHUT IT DOWN!".

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Over cooked beef Wellington. Gordon Ramsey&#39;s signature dish but apparently the chef at this location isn&#39;t quite up to snuff to make it.

V4tUNqqmsluFt5zap5Q41A.text: Overpriced, bland food.  Onion soup was tasteless and lukewarm, fish and chips were greasy and fish was like leather.  First time I've ever eaten at a GR restaurant, and it will be the last.  There were seven of us in our group and everyone had a crappy meal.  Don't waste your time or money.  For a guy who yells at everybody on TV, someone needs to do the same at him for such a worthless effort.  Service was terrible as well.

iS5Db4eJC0kQ7kVXN10zJg.text: First time coming. Short ribs - very tender, mashed potatoes were perfect. Fish and chips - tender and flaky and perfectly crispy.  Burger - juicy, garlic aioli perfect. Macaroni and cheese was spot on. Butter chicken - naan was good. Goodbye Blue Sky cocktail was delicious! Service - Chris P.was friendly and attentive! Sticky toffee cake dessert absolutely fabulous. Overall would come back again.

PJUvXYe_Ny0tqOqCfyRJyg.text: i'm not really a fan of visiting 'reality' TV show chef's restaurants, but a friend of mine told me i needed to visit this place while i was visiting vegas... let me tell you, this place exceeded my expectations! the food was marvelous!!! the beer steamed clams melted in my mouth. it was actually the first time i had ever tried clams and this place made me fall in love with them!! the sauce they were cooked in was so beyond delicious. my boyfriend ordered me some calamari (my favorite appetizer) and it came with a fresh dill tar tar sauce...MMMM... my mouth is just watering thinking of it right now. might be some of the best calamari i've ever had. we then shared the fish and chips plate since we heard these are the best fish and chips around. people weren't lying. these WERE the best fish and chips i've ever had, and i've had a lot of them... they're better than places i've been right by the ocean. they weren't greasy, it came with the dill tar tar again, and they were cooked just perfect. the food wasn't just perfect but the service was just as great! our water glasses were never empty and they were extremely friendly. i felt really good vibes being at this restaurant. i would give them more than 5 stars if i could. i recommended all my friends to this place and would recommend everyone to try it!

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. English Beer Steamed Clams, so delish!!!

h5saQnLw412AowHpKS73yQ.text: Just went here for lunch.  overall probably should get 3 stars, but the drinks and sticky toffee pudding helped it get over the hump.  Main entree was just ok, or C- for the price...  Would i go back?  If I'm ever at Caesar's around lunch again, ill stop in and try something different.

zLzo9YqiEYRZ9wU8FQIdbg.text: I had a filet, and it was perfect.  We returned another time, and I tried the Fish & Chips - and it was the whitest, fluffiest fish with the crunchiest batter I've ever had.  I think the tartar sauce is made on premises, and it was excellent as well.  Both times we had the famous Sticky Toffee Pudding - so wonderful!  And excellent choice for a delicious meal.  A nice selection of creative cocktails as well.  Highly recommended!

PMTujb_P01jd2SHDUOGcFw.text: $55 without tip for a side of truffle fries, a side of Brussels sprouts, and two 4oz screwdrivers... We don't mind paying for good appetizers but of all the delicious ways to cook Brussels sprouts and pork belly, this restaurant chose a method that makes them taste like canned frozen goo-sprouts. Overpriced, unoriginal, disappointing... We walked 100 feet away after to smash burger and got double the amount of fries ( Rosemary Garlic) for $3.50... Stay away unless you want to waste money.

SOwTSM9nfoz-eeAq8FMX_w.text: I wasn't really expecting much given the previous reviews but feel compelled to add my 2 cents - the wine was pretty decent (malbec), but the food, not so much. had a veggie burger that was super gooey - not sure what it was, maybe too much rice in it? they upcharged $3 for truffle fries - the fries i got were stone cold and barely tasted of truffles at all. turns out it's not even truffle oil, it's truffle salt....$3 upcharge for a tiny salt shake? no thanks.  waitress was nice, though.

fgRC4T4qchdulBgq5xguFw.text: The service was great our waitress was so helpful funny and nice anything you can ask for in a waitress. BUT the food was less than mediocre, to be honest I would have been better satisfied at McDonald's. I came to eat poutine (which they discontinued) so I just got regular fries. They came with garlic mayo and ketchup the fries were over cooked and bit crunchy :( my dates food was also over cooked. Over all huge FAIL!

6cx-M4QfF8q7-Du1CqWYDQ.text: I don't write too many reviews but figured I should take the time for this one. Burgers were ordered medium and medium rare and both burgers came out very well done. One of the 4 fries that came with it was frozen in the middle. We told the server about the burgers and fries and said he would take the burgers back but by this time we were so hungry we just ate them. After having to ask if something could be done because of the poor food preparation we received $10 off the bill. Save you money and skip this place if you're in Vegas and looking for a good meal.

eqC3XM3L_fI3oiFvWgUsEw.text: Server had the personality of a door nail, rushed us to make an order, described nothing about the drink menu or dessert menu  Portions are very small  Drinks were slow to arrive, we finished our meal and our round of drinks arrived in team for us to leave  Go to BURGR instead, cheaper and much better environment all around

0A9yilqhS89sDcjUSdnuTg.text: Sitting for half an hour and still no food. While the workers in the back are screaming and joking around half the restaurant is sending its food back. Finally got burgers that were average at best. Definitely not worth $20 a burger. Staff is rude and service is nonexistent. Don't waste your time or money here. Feel sick already.

kUPsVXHnMd_UgDdHLzw02A.text: We went here on Thursday the service was excellent! The fish and chips were the bomb!  And the good bye blue sky best drink ever... The busier Arron really made the visit at Gordon Ramsay's amazing!!!

DhDFC05tLPkyig0YV0bYMg.text: My husband and I went there for our first year anniversary. Too many negatives and no positives. When you bother the hostess by being there, leave. The place had about two other tables, our table had a bench seat. I sat on the bench, my chin hit the table, the hostess said oh that seat has a whole. She offered a chair off to the side but wouldn't be close to the table. Should have left, my husband changed seats. One time I was taller than my husband at the table. We ordered fried oysters, crunchy yes like pretzels, not good. Fish and chips were horrible. No flavor, greasy, and not crispy. Just pathetic. Went and had a slice of pizza at secret pizza shop, it put our dinner to shame.

XXJcVeenGv_f4RJkiwpV1A.text: A family wedding brought us to Vegas. We follow Gordon Ramsay and wanted to try his casual dining atmosphere.  The hostess sat us promptly and our beverage order was taken. Afro was our server and he made the experience a terrific one. We had various questions about the beverages, menu items, and even Gordon himself.  The grandkids had fun interacting with Afro as well.  The pesto chicken sandwich was moist and tasty.  Wings, sliders, and lobster roll were top notch as well. Scott the winning chef was in the kitchen that day and he was gracious with photos.  We tried various alcoholic and non-alcoholic beverages suggested by Afro and were not disappointed.  Overall one of the best memories we take home from Vegas.

_1MTUKgB7C0yC5zBBzy5qw.text: Awesome!  Some friends and I had been wanting to go for awhile, finally went last night.  Sat at the bar and had 3 or 4 appetizers and some cocktails.  Staff was awesome, and our bartender, RayRay, explained everything to us about the menu and drinks (who knew there was such a thing as keg wine?)  Great experience, we will be back!

RRJcItLnlsOqull3IRyOSQ.text: Really good food.  Great service from the waiter, Scott.  Knowledgable, helpful, real.  We went twice during our trip this week, once with my wife, once more with all the kids.  Learned a lot from Scott about Beer, and thoroughly enjoyed both visits.  One sour note- the female greeters are unattractive, dressed in ridiculous outfits, all seem to have a really bad attitude and are uniformly unhelpful on both visits.  Don't let them scare you away- it's great once you work your way past them.

ROBevLv7T61v5urPcdFSsA.text: Smaller menu but still vey good. Fish and chips very good. Corned beef sandwich...not NY deli style but still very very good. All in all excellent meal

OqciQnbsZ_hv88ELXhlTWA.text: I wouldn't have even given this place 1 star but I had to choose something. The burgers in our party had none of the toppings stated on the menu and were flavorless, my sliders were sent back twice and came back both times raw. There was a beer spilt on someone in our party and a new one wasn't even brought to the table. The manager was nice and chalked it up to a "new menu rollout" and in the end we were given a discount but won't be back. Too many great choices in vegas that have good food and great service.

6dcWzrH1LP7R3NjwOSWhXA.text: This place has cool decor but as with all of Vegas, the waitresses are dressed very tacky. The food is mediocre at best and extremely overpriced.  Go here to say you did and pretend things are great.

DEZXd4FBvgBKC_hxiu_dkg.text: We decided to try this place for lunch on a Saturday while we were in town for the weekend since we ate at BurgR last visit and really liked the food. Surprisingly, at 1:30 PM on a Saturday, we were seated right away without a wait. The prices for lunch were a little startling - $27 for Fish and Chips! It didn't take too long for our lunch to leave a bad taste in our mouth due to the horrible service we received. We were a party of 5: Two ordered the Fish & Chips, 1 ordered a Caesar Salad, 1 ordered the sliders and 1 ordered a burger.   1 order of Fish & Chips arrived within a normal waiting time. Then we waited, and waited for the rest of our party to receive our lunch orders. We insisted to our friend that he shouldn't wait for our food so his was not cold, so he ate. We waited. 40 minutes AFTER his order arrived, we received our lunch! Our server did come by twice to let us know "she was sorry about that" but that the kitchen cooked his first (because it's really fast), but that didn't really explain why only 1 order of Fish & Chips came out first and why it took an additional 40 minutes for the rest of the food.  By the time the rest of us ate our very mediocre, over-priced food, we were pretty much done with the place. We had to ask for our bill twice, and when we received our check, we noticed that we did not receive the "Total Rewards" card discount printed on the menu for all of our food items as there was only a $1 reduction in price of bill.  Upon asking our server about the discrepancy, she stated that she had "nothing to do with it" and the cashier swipes the card and all eligible discounts are applied. "So, the prices printed on the menu are False?" I told her that every single item we ordered had two prices; a "regular price" and a "Total Rewards" price. She shrugged her shoulders and said, "well, I don't know."  So I asked her for a menu so I could compare what the difference was. She never brought me a menu and instead, avoided any contact with our table (she clearly had dismissed us). So I found a menu by myself and upon review, we could clearly see that we were overcharged $12.00.  I went up to the bar and asked for a manager to come to our table. The manager came by after about 10 minutes and was a dick about the whole thing. Sorry about your lunch coming late . . . blah, blah, blah, I don't really give a crap, blah, blah, blah, I'll "do you a favor" and adjust your bill, "blah, blah, blah." The reality is that he had them remove an $8.00 item (deviled eggs), which still wasn't reflective of what we should be discounted, so frankly, we just paid our bill and left.  This was probably one of the worst restaurant experiences I have ever had.

6-1Ak_s4TTSLTKS6TCLGIA.text: After a miserable experience at Maze in NYC, I decided to give Gordon's restaurants another shot because I am actually a fan of his. Unfortunately, this experience wasn't any better. When the waiter took our drink order, I asked for the Strongbow cider on draft. They were out...on a Tuesday afternoon. Gordon Ramsay's pub was out of English cider! Ok, so I asked for the pear cider...nope. They were out of that too. My lunch was pretty bad. I ordered the lamb burger, and when it came out, the bottom bun was already bloody and soggy...inedible. Yuck! I was actually surprised they had the nerve to bring it out to me. I tried to eat the rest of the burger and the meat was almost too gamey to eat. I know some lamb meat has that flavor characteristic, but this was bad. I've had a good lamb burger before and I can assure you this isn't it. All negatives put aside, my wife ordered the "spotted dic" desert and that was about the best desert either of us have ever tasted before. I recommend this place for that and maybe some cider if they aren't out. Stay away from the lamb burger, though. Ughh...

deHSc9qMEgWMGtrn0s4vtw.text: Service is 1 star worthy because at least the assistant/runner tried to take care of my request. If I could tip him directly I would. Fries cold, burger rare (after specifically asking for well done) so I had to send back food. Server never checked on me or acknowledged the issues. But he fussed over the couple at the next table and poured her wine for her repeatedly, made conversation etc.

4w5a5JP9yI8FF2-XqVphYA.text: overall great place to eat. We came here on a Saturday afternoon. After we tried to walk-in their new hell kitchen restaurant without reservation and failed, we decided to go to this one, it was about 3 pm and no wait time, which is really convenient. We tried their New York strip, I really like this one. I also tried fish and chip, this is just fine, I will not recommend this. And their bugger is very delicious and worth to try!

Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. New York strip
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fish chip

PRsP3vgwDcDRFTwsRArB9Q.text: Excellent, had a great meal. Never been disappointed with Gordon's Restaurants. Love the Pub atmosphere and the menu is True Pub style. Wonderful comfortable interior.

gVDxcjCYJFlu7HskGLgffA.text: The food was great. The service was even better! Rodney was our server....loved him. Funny and very knowledgeable. I've been to a couple other " famous Chef" spots on the strip and was very disappointed..... Not at the pub though. We will absolutely  return for another great meal. Oh , by the way the Shepard's pie.... delicious and very filling.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shepherds pie!

_Gkt8Ytj_GwgAlEr8q3eTQ.text: The food here is pretty good but the prices take this restaurant into tourist trap territory. 11 bucks for a Bass?

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sliders from the pub bites section of menu

Fj7qTRv75UpG4mU25B24sw.text: The lunch service here was fast and friendly! I tried the chopped salad at my friend's recommendation, and it was delicious! One of my dining companions ordered the fish and chips, and she seemed to enjoy it. Overall, great place for lunch and I'll be back again.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chopped salad -delicious!

HGSQBnCfyCaSnFzM0XOLEw.text: Ramon was the bomb He was helpful And nice  Appreciate the service Thank you  for everything

rp-5Bkh9kKPpOyVa1RM6qQ.text: Visited this location because we wanted the Gordon Ramsay Experience and couldn't get into Hell's Kitchen (and didn't want to pay an arm and a leg for the steakhouse). Everything was fine, it just wasn't what it was cracked up to be. Our server was funny for the most part, but questionable at times too.  I got the NY strip and it came out cooked to my liking. The truffle chips (aka fries) were the real mvps here, but it didn't seem like they were cooked in house or anything. The creamed spinach was excellent, we liked the breadcrumbs on top. We also got the mushrooms without the egg, but they were nothing special.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States

8Rj5qX-CxXPODqNZus5VoQ.text: We like to stop in here whenever we come to Vegas because the fish and chips are on point!!  Sitting at the bar is always nice because there's rarely a wait and the bartenders are friendly and like to chat when they have time.  This time around we also ordered the lobster mac & cheese. It's $14 more than a regular Mac & cheese, but only had two little pieces of lobster inside. It was a bit disappointing and not worth the price.  However, they were nice enough to bring us out another order when we said something...  and it was loaded! Overall, we've always had a pleasant experience here. Check it out!  Oh, and get a Guinness too!

-1g_mbKXMBHyL1jiOz617g.text: Went here for a meal while visiting Las Vegas. Located in Caesars Palace.  We had chicken curry and shepherds pie. Both were very good.  Service was good. The noise level took from our comfort. TV's blaring with Sunday night football. Rock music blaring for the not so NFL inclined. Both competing with each other, no one winning. Everyone shouting to heard.  Price was a bit high, but isn't everything in Las Vegas these days.

5FsSMHcfIZbN4N7wakrXLQ.text: I love GR and all of his restaurants. The food here was good and service was personable. Tried lobster mac and cheese - yummy, fish and chips - tasted so good and scotch eggs - mmmm yess!!! The cocktails were also good! This is not fine dining and decent $$ for vegas :) They do have some famous GR dishes like wellington, scallops and sticky  pudding

JdNdVdqnoSDl1yXjtRDwwA.text: Kinda greasy but the service is spot on as are the beers on tap. It's busy but not crowded so a good spot in an area that has many spots overflowing with customers.  The chips are brilliant! (sorry, my sad attempt at sounding British)

HLcKfsDeADSmwe8PKO2A2g.text: Everything was just as good as I was expecting!! We did the tasting menu so we had Gordon's 3 most popular dishes. Everything was superb and the beef wellington was as good as it gets.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. appetizer scallops with creamed corn sauce.
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. beef wellington.
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. sticky toffee pudding.

yPtuwsIkyDDaBu_H5OB2RQ.text: First time at Gordon Ramsay Pub and Grill. I had the fish and chips and my husband had the beef wellington. The food was great and our server, Rodney, was very quick and attentive.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beef Wellington

VHm6wd2Ye6kl5F7Z77mJ4Q.text: Food was good. Not the best and not what you'd expect from a Gordon Ramsay restaurant. It was worth the experience, but there's better food at lower price points in Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Are dinner really good
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States

ygLPIs6MBKiM5b7eT2_DQA.text: (This review is solely based on their HH as I've yet to eat a proper meal here)  Hot damn this is one of the better HH deals you'll find on the strip and throw in the fact it's at Ceasar's makes it that much better. The slots may be tight but you'll feel like a King walking away without burning a hole in your wallet.  Their HH is valid between Monday-Friday and the range of hours is pretty decent honestly. I can't recall the exact hours because I was drinking but I know we had more than enough time to enjoy it properly.  Some of the bar food items you could enjoy were their signature wings, mini corn dogs, pretzel sticks, truffle fries, mini sliders, and about 2 other food items. As for the drinks you could choose from a few beers/wines/cocktails.  My family was all over the wings, mini corn dogs and fries. For my personal taste the truffle fries were stronger on the truffle fries but damn they were delicious. I'm certain my Mom was obsessed with them everytime we had to take a new order for the table. What's great about the HH menu is the food items range from $5-$7 a pop. (Crazy I know). The pretzel sticks weren't the freshest but s*&$ for that price you really don't have room to complain and that beer cheese and mustard dip (it has a kick, you've been warned) is to die for. The wings were the True hit of the night and we ordered a few of them.  The staff was super friendly and very accommodating for a party of five.  I really digged the decor of this restaurant and the kegerator wall with real kegs was definitely unique and fun. The party was wearing shorts and casual wear and didn't feel uncomfortable whatsoever.  We didn't have a reservation and were able to grab a table very quickly.  Can't wait to have a proper meal here the next time I'm in town.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Really loved the kegerator wall
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Interior

YICaCbsMBSkCQmwrq7UOCw.text: Bridget was our server tonight, she was on top of things and made sure we always had our water filled, any utensil we needed was readily available, and checked on us regularly even though she was quite busy being that game 3 of Dodgers vs Astros in the World Series was on.  Great job, keep it up!  I ordered a classic Caesar and it was really good!  The anchovies were awesome!  Also ordered a Steak and Ale, which looked like a pot pie and pretty much is, but it had some delicious slow-roasted pot-roast type beef in it stewed with some veggies.  Yum!  Would definitely recommend this place to others to try, however, I have to state a note.  Note:  if ordering a steak, 3 of our 4 from our group of 7 was not cooked to correct temperature.   Order your meat more rare, 3 of the 4 were overdone.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Classic Caesar
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Steak and Ale as it comes

Xu5omRee8QKaMgZ6XpIP0w.text: The bar area is nice and location is great if you're going to a concert at the Coliseum. Pork Belly Nachos are great to share. Lobster mac and cheese is amazing! Big pieces of fresh lobster and not too much cheese. Great food!

mTPr_pquFH8UnuvoPXAtGw.text: Three words: sticky toffee pudding  Now my husband won't stop harassing me to have it again!

_Q2tUhpWzM_0Bbgg8GhBvQ.text: Came in and was able to get seated right away but was seated in the back in some very awkward chairs. They sunk right down to the floor. Then we moved, took a look at the menu and found that it didn't have a very large selection but what was there didn't fit our tastes at all. Didn't stay to find out more.

cg2KafwH9rcqHJ2GhFDL_w.text: Our experience was over the top. It started when we walked in the door and everyone was smiling and happy. It continued with the awesome food and excellent options on the menu. Then there was our server. Wow, he just made this the best dining experience ever. Our server Sladjan by far was the best we have ever had. If your in Vegas we highly recommend you visit Gordon Ramsey's pub and grill and ask for Sladjan to take care of you.

ZRIH6QuLdKSkacVnlPBfHg.text: Went here for my birthday and it was one of the best tasting meals I have ever had. Fish and chips were amazing and so was the stick pudding. The staff was also extremely impressive. Definitely recommend to anyone.

Uu5nw9XdoTImJfw0B7d3KA.text: I read all the reviews before I went - they all seemed mixed so I suggest you try it for yourself. I had the Goodbye Blue Sky cocktail and it was DELISH!  Fresh raspberries, blueberry vodka - crazy combo of stuff - to die for!  And they aren't stingy on the booze.  They started us off with pretzel bread sticks and an awesome mustard dip.  I'd buy these by the dozens to have them always.  GREAT bread for the table.  The service was fantastic.  Super friendly host, super friendly waitress - all the staff seemed happy and attentive.  People on Yelp commented on the uniforms - they are awesome, please - it's a pub, young, hip, England punk - totally cool, get over it.  I had the fish and chips and it was delish.  Awesome tartar sauce..can't say a bad thing.  A friend had the steak, side of mashed potatoes..again delish.  Mashed potatoes were really awesome.  Husband had the scallops - again delish.  Pricey, yes, but c'mon, you are on the strip in Vegas - if you want cheap, get off the strip.  It's for a night to splurge!

sLujQ5JLAk9SB6bpyPtY8w.text: Family going to dinner? Don't got here unless everyone is over 21 and look like they are big drinkers. As other reviewers noted, there is discrepancy in service.  We waited so long for drinks - one cocktail, soda and water - that we were putting our coats on when they arrived. The waiter said, "don't blame me I only put the order in." Really? Food was so so. Scratch that. The dressing for my salad was gross because it was so vinegary. And we waited forever for it. We were starving and I asked the waiter if he could bring something out quick. Quick turned out forever of an appetizer. Our water glasses were filled once by a hostess. Our waiter was too busy fawning over a six top of drinkers. Thank God we had a $100.00 voucher. Had I paid for that service I would have been really angry. Ironically we chose the restaurant because my son is such a fan of Gordon's show. P

AG7powQ7DxanJBUiqiEPzA.text: I had pretty high expectations for my dinner, because my friend who took me just raved about.  Like many other yelpers I read on here, we had to remind the hostess several times we were still waiting for our table even though we had a reservation.  As for the service, our server was a doll, really I liked the guy and he had a great knowledge of the menu, but the restaurant moved at a glacial pace.  For one it took a long time for them to just take our orders.  As an appetizer I got the shrimp salad, which was very good and came pretty fast.  For dinner I got the Sheppard's Pie, and our entrees took a long long time to arrive, I didn't time it, but it was very obvious.  My pie, was ok, very salty, nothing I would really say wowed me (or was worth the hefty $23 price).  Dessert we had Sticky Toffee pudding, a personal favorite of mine and it was the best part of the meal.  It was very delicious.    My husband had the fish and chips, which he liked, but thought was overpriced ($30).  He also had the corn soup, which was very good he said.    Overall, I would say go, but expect to be at dinner 2 plus hours, so if you have show tickets or somewhere to be, make an early reservation, because this place is slow.  I also think the prices are a bit hefty for pub grub.  If I went again I would just get an appetizer and dessert, because I found the main dishes disappointing and expensive.

pvLT0ZpKEBPtv3aAGXf9Mw.text: Just like an amazing guy you met the night before, Gordon Ramsay's meal was on my mind the next morning...and I'm wondering how did I get so lucky??!  I started out night keeping my expectations low, I hate being disappointed. I started with a cocktail, the "Goodbye Blue Sky". It was a delicious concoction of blueberry vodka, sparkling wine, & chambord. For my main, I had the NY Strip w the butter bernnaise sauce. Even though it was a bit overdone (my fault for asking medium-well instead of medium), it was tender, flavorful, and absolutely THE BEST steak I've had. The accompanying grilled asparagus was cooked perfectly too.  My friend had the lamb, and at a bit too rare for me, it was damn tasty also.  We shared a side of lobster mac' n cheese. All I can say about this dish is OMFG!! With the first bite my eyes were rolling to the back of my head....the cheeses, the perfect macaroni, and the lobster....the LOBSTER! There were whole claws of meat....it was perfection!  We shared the spotted doc for dessert.  The bread pudding was just right, and the sauce not too sweet.  Yes, I'll be thinking of this meal for a while with much fondness and awe.....and know that since I have proof with the pics I took that yes, it really did happen. :)

hw86BT_OU_5nhxemtFIJrw.text: I just threw up the morning after we ate at Gordon Ramsey pub and grill I ordered the salmon which was the worst thing I have ever eaten in my life. The waiter never asked us how our food was and there is no condiments on the table not even salt honestly I want to puke right now thinking about it for someone who critiques food for a living critique your own food

ZQdCKdNvJ3P_NdxBfLeP7A.text: Had the truffle French fries & some drinks at bar. Very friendly bartenders

fDtk5NN9MKLNptCabZao2A.text: I love Gordon Ramsay, so I couldn't wait to try his place at Ceasars Palace! Nice decor, great outfits on the wait staff (kind of like 90's punk), and rather friendly. I liked that they incorporated tablets/iPads into their drink and dessert menu, very modern. The food selections were your usual pub fare (fries, burgers, etc.) with some nicer exceptions (scallops, fresh fish, etc.). We tried the sliders (called something else) and the scallops, very fresh and tasty. The only small nit-picky complaint was that the entrees were not very hot when they arrived, but still were wonderfully prepared. The pretzel and cheese free bread appetizer was so yummy, I'd go back just for that! Overall, a good experience, but be prepared to pay for it! With no drinks (sodas or alcohol) the total was $100 bill for four items. Hint: Make a reservation! We walked right in with a reservation but others were waiting for over an hour on a Saturday night.

wCuWDvCyp-cf0qsmrA-iEA.text: Not worth the time. We went on a Friday night and were thoroughly underwhelmed. Took 20 minutes to get drinks. The appetizers actually came before our drinks did I have never seen that before. The onion soup was pretty good every one else's appetizers were roughly OK not bad but not exactly up to the expected quality that the name attached to the restaurant would suggest. Main courses were nothing special the flat iron steak was disappointing basically a fancy way of saying fried -undercooked on the inside burnt black on the outside I'd say that was quite an accomplishment if it wasn't my food. Wife had the fingerling potatoes that the waiter suggested we're the best potatoes he's ever had. My guess is that he hasn't had many potatoes then. They were very bland. One of our number had the fish and chips and seemed moderately happy with it though so perhaps only 5/6 people leave disappointed. Mr Ramsey should be embarrassed to have his name attached to this place. We Will never return here.

6HW4a63fYBAslY_pM3yIgg.text: Wow!!  This place has gone down hill!  The pretzels and cheese that used to be free are now $10 for three pretzel sticks. When we asked the server, Tayler, why they are now charging for bread he said " we are trying to run a business and people would come in, eat the free bread sticks and then leave".  I stated maybe they should give the bread after the order is put in. He stated "you know our rent is $250,000 per month".  My thought, you can't argue with stupid. They also removed the truffled fingerling potatoes, that was my favorite, from the menu. We ordered fish and chips and sliders. The fish and Chips were $30 and are only average. When some of us were done with our subpar meal the bus boy began removing plates and reaching right over my plate as I was still attempting to eat. I suggested to him that maybe he should wait until we are all done.   Tayler, in all his brilliance, decided to come over and tell us that the bus boy was the best they had, blah,blah, blah. In a nutshell Gordon Ramsay needs to bring kitchen nightmares in to his own place and Tayler, you need to learn that the customer is always right and to shut your stupid mouth.  Skip this place Vegas is full of top notch restaurants fantastic food and stellar service.

XH3ENSZ7fcoW-WB8OzTvhA.text: Came for dinner opening week.  No reservation, pretty easy to get a table.  This is an attractive restaurant, I really enjoyed the decor and uniforms.  Service was also pretty good aside from the one major issue of the night, menus (minus 1 star).  There were 4 people in our party and we had three menus showing one price and one menu that was about $10 higher per entree.  It is a big difference if the Shepard's pie is $25 or $16.  We asked about the price difference and the server immediately took away the expensive menu, but it makes me wonder...  The food was all great.  Portion sizes were average for the Shepard's pie, large for the pork chop, and VERY tiny for the lamb riblettes appetizer.   Beer selection was great including a dry English cider.  Sticky toffee pudding was very good served in a traditional fashion with plenty of sauce.   Value was reasonable for Vegas standards using the prices on the cheaper menu.  I will happily return as long as the expensive menu prices don't take effect.

a1ZvDTAJwbuIGB87SDZ_Xg.text: Neat atmosphere, think they are still working out some of the new restaurant kinks. Service was not so great but she had a great attitude. Seemed like she was a little overwhelmed. I requested a birthday desert to be brought without having to ask...said to just add to the bill. The server said "So, we are celebrating a birthday?" Then never brought desert! Ugh! She had to circle back again and again to double and triple check what was ordered. We had to chase our drinks! Never brought one beer then she brought it and another server brought one (not as sweet as it sounds...all got added to the bill LOL!) But she did smile the whole time. Frustrating but still fun. Believe it or not, we would go back! Burger was da bomb! The fries were totally unique..."I only had 4 fries" but they were 4 fries on steroids...more than enough! LOL Perfect light crisp outside and soft hot potato inside, served with seemed like a ketchup / horse radish side...WHY is there NO menu anywhere online? Oh we started with the pretzels breadsticks with a ground mustard sauce and a cheese sauce...yuh to the um!

0BTAKhrNQ5TCjWFNgh8sXg.text: My wife and I dined with some friends who came in from out of town. They wanted to go to GR Pub and Grill. Having dined at some of GR's other restaurants here in the states and abroad, I looked forward to going to try a different experience. I am sad to say that I was a bit disappointed. The service was ok and the food was mediocre at best. The food was served cool to lukewarm at best, and it seemed as if it (the food) was sitting at the pass for longer than it should have. I know that having dined at some of his other establishments, the food was always exceptional. I will continue to go to the other restaurants but I will not return to the Pub and Grill.

HQQgOKZnVO6VlByvug216g.text: Was just in Vegas to celebrate mine and my husband's birthday--both share October birthday month.  Anyway, we had wanted to try a Gordon Ramsay restaurant, so my aunt, cousin and her fiancee took us here for dinner.    Husband had the Shepherd's Pie and thought it was terrible.  It looked more like an appetizer than a meal.  He said it was bland and nothing to write home about.  He had some of the "chips" from my Fish and Chips. He was left dissatisfied and disappointed after he finished his "meal".  Both myself and my aunt ordered the fish and chips entree as we thought it would be out of this world since we were in the restaurant of this renowned chef and both love fish and chips.  The fish, while cooked perfectly and WAS a large portion, was totally tasteless.  No seasoning was used whatsoever.  We both kept reaching for the vinegar to help liven it up some.  The french fries (chips) were very good, seasoned perfectly.  There were peas on the plate--not my favorite--but I tasted them and found them to be awful, too.  We did have an appetizer--the deviled eggs--and while they were okay in taste, the eggs were WAY overcooked.    The service--or shall I say lack thereof?  The service was THE WORST I've experienced in recent memory.  The server treated us like we were putting him out for asking for things that should have already been delivered in the first place.  I felt so bad for my family who took us there for our birthdays, only to have such a rotten experience.  The only thing I felt was worthwhile at that restaurant, was the sticky toffee pudding we tasted for dessert.  That was really good. Also, if I could pick out anything else that would be considered noteworthy from that restaurant...the utensils were pretty cool in their design.  I will never go back there again.  For what it costs to eat there, they ought to be turning it up a notch and then treating the patrons MUCH better than they do.

m9qzKE1pWpDTdhBI336rMg.text: Didn't eat here, but had some drinks. Impressive mixology. I recommend "The Pub Crawl", made with black tea syrup and Knob Creek Whiskey.

KJkbaH_hcU0LfOzXI_QANg.text: Brianna saved your reputation.   Not only is she a phenomenal server, knowledgeable about beers, cocktails, food, she accepted some feedback on the short rib/cheek sandwich (first half tough and included gristle).   I didn't know how the sandwich was supposed to taste until the second half.   Then it was awesome.   She took the feedback graciously and took care of it.   Another great GR restaurant!

WWiqLNaetr98PAKUgokpnw.text: Service was terrible, server William was arrogant and rude. Steak was overcooked, server didn't seem to care. Rest of the food was pretty good. Not what I had expected.

HqVDAyat_12gjEwTL5zyJQ.text: Terrible service.  Ignored for 20 minutes.  Spoke to 3 servers who ignored us.  Expected a lot more from the GR brand.  How disappointing.

4SDpDufPxdWl8997kPD1MA.text: Some buddies and I were wondering were to eat on our first night of debauchery in Vegas. Being a longtime Ramsay fan, I suggested GR Pub and Grill. Luckily, we had made reservations, so the seating wasn't a hassle. The decor is that of an upscale pub. It was warm and inviting, but still felt too modern to have that "Old English" feel. Either way, it was nice to be there. As we were sat by a smoking hot hostess, we were immediately delivered water and bread. The bread basket was out of this world! Especially the pretzel bread. I ordered the pork bellies and fingerling potatoes. Rarely do I say this, but the side dish was WAY better than the main course. Don't get me wrong the pork bellies were crackling good and tender, but something about those potatoes that drove me insane! Overall, a fantastic experience with a cool way to order your drinks- thanks to the sophisticated computer tablets on the table. But like I said, a good time was had by all and the food was delicious. I recommend.

VaFHep0Fs8P93yESaoE7cw.text: went here late on a friday night. we were immediately seated and the staff was very kind and attentive. the decor is very eclectic, hip environment, and great people watching. we ordered caeser salad and fried oysters for appetizers, different beers off their very cool ipad drink list with pictures of each drink, and ate hands down the best shephard's pie I have ever tasted. the beef stew is delicious and there were soft mashed potatoes layered over the stew. great place for a date, for friends, everyone!

0WDqHp4_rQClfn55UJedkw.text: I tried to email Gordon Ramsay with a review of our dinner and I got a reply that says they get too many emails and couldn't answer. Are that many people complaining??????  So here is my email.  Dear Mr. Ramsay,  I hope this email finds its way to you. I thought I would give it a try.   My husband and I were in Las Vegas this past weekend celebrating our 24th anniversary (it's actually on Oct 16th) We had tickets to see Celine Dion at Caesar's palace. Apparently Celine didn't know our anniversary was the 16th or I am sure she would have performed that evening. (Doubt it) We decided to try your pub at Caesar's since it was right there.  First off, my husband is a big fan of your show. He watches several cooking shows and yours is right up there on top. So we wanted to eat somewhere special. Personally it doesn't matter to me because I don't like to cook and have been blessed with a husband who really enjoys it. (Thank goodness!)  We showed up for our reservation and were seated right away.  Our waitress and all the wait staff was more than pleasant.  Things went downhill fast from there........... We ordered a cocktail, Gin & tonic for my husband and a Vodka martini (up) for me. My husband's drink was wonderful and mine was as warm as tapwater. No problem,  I thought it could happen. Not going to complain over such a minor issue.  For dinner, my husband ordered the Burger with truffle fries.  So let's start with his meal....... The fries that were brought out were  plain fries. I hate to think what you would have done to one of your chef's if they served plain instead of truffle fries. Again, no problem we simply asked our server and she took care of it right away. I had the flat iron steak and it was just ok. It was Ok if I was at Chili's or Outback (not that they serve a bad meal) but not Gordon Ramsay good. I was however, looking for some kind of bread or dinner roll.  The waitress told me that I would have to order a side of bread and pay.......again, no problem, I wanted a piece of damn bread with my steak. So what came out towards the end of my meal was undercooked pita bread and butter. Yikes, I couldn't keep quiet any longer and had to tell her that it was awful pita bread when she asked how everything was. I didn't and wouldn't have asked her to remove the cost from our meal but she was very sweet and offered.  So my point in all of this is...... the meal was just average except for the price ($150) and we were expecting a "Hell's Kitchen" quality meal.  I thought you might like to know how the restaurants that are promoting your name are actually cooking your meals below what we you're your standard is.   Disappointedly Yours,

Zu1z7I0daGB6VegW7mx3Tg.text: Great food.   A bit slow for us because we don't sit around drinking .... salmon was amazing, shepherds pie was a treat of course and the spare ribs mmmh. The chopped salad had tiny diced bits of Apple awesome great. Just like my own home salad.  Define comfort food=Pub&gGrill  I had to send my scotch egg back.     I've sent two things back at two of four restaurants by chef Ramsay.  And this night there were four dropped bottles or glasses which is a clear sign there's too much bar time while waiting for the table.   Good times!!!!!  Still great though.  The deserts were exactly as described.    Love love the pieces of meringue in the strawberries.  Yes.    Give it a bookmark and make it a choice!

iKvVJm58l4h27N8tchcxjg.text: Stopped in while we were in Vegas.  Had the deviled eggs, pub wings, bacon-cheddar burger, lobster mac-n-cheese and Brussels sprouts plus a few beverages. Everything was delicious and the service was top notch! Everything you'd expect from a Ramsay owned establishment.

Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States

a1EvBsZS-53KO2vR99hFFA.text: Let me start by saying we love Gordon Ramsay and have eaten at many of his restaurants. We were super excited to try the pub. What a huge letdown. I only give two stars because of the ribeye. We ordered the jalapeno mac, scotch egg, Shepards pie, fish and chips and ribeye. We also ordered an Angry Orchard beer, but that never came. The ribeye was perfectly cooked and delicious. Nothing else lived up to our expectations and was mediocre. The mac n cheese was dry and gritty, the Shepard pie was strange and the potatoes on top tasted instant and not toasted. The scotch egg came out cold. The fish and chips were two tiny pieces of fish for $30 and were completely bland. So sad because I wanted to love it.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cold scotch egg with strange garnish and BBQ sauce.
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Small portion, a teaspoon of tartar sauce and no seasoning for $30 Yorkshire Ale Batter Fish &amp; Chips
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The only redeeming item we ordered

fBy6tSFvVTOW--hnIINnyg.text: Food is excellent. Salmon was moist and delicious. Service was great as well. Thx Chris P.

t9vXZeSjI14pv4NhSMo7hA.text: Anytime we come to Vegas from Austin, Texas, we love to come to The Gordon Ramsey pub specifically for the "Lamb" burger and were disappointed when we were told it was no longer on menu.  Rodney our waiter was very sympathetic, hopefully we will enjoy other items on the menus.

bbZnDl0nxUbbhgjNaxc8TQ.text: We checked reviews and were kind of hesitant to come here after all the negative reviews. But that was not our experience at all! The food was great, service was amazing and the environment is fun. Definitely go with the special. Wine was a little overpriced.

4UfEnqwhnSTMbwazYVivXA.text: *  Welcome Experience -  Ordinary  Nothing to note here.    *  Establishment -  Outstanding  Incredible!  It's Vegas!  BIG and LOUD like it should be!  Casino dining!  *  Service -  Discouraging  The people were friendly enough but you had to flag one of them down to get anything done.  Busy?  Yes but is that any reason not to provide reasonable service?  No.  *  Food Quantity / Quality / Presentation -  Encouraging  The food here was INTERESTING and executed fairly well but was definitely not as good as I expected.  $28 for fish and chips?  That should be done VERY WELL not JUST OK.     *  What I'll remember  -  The unique decor and ambiance is very cool.    *  What I can't wait to forget  -  The intermittent service issues - AND the menu has DUAL pricing, less for those who have a total rewards card.  We gave the total rewards card with the payment.  They never applied it for the reduced rate.  We had to ask for them to give us the reduced pricing.  It took forever and was SHADY...  They should have just APPLIED it without me having to call them on it.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States

-Uol9azNNptaHDABl7hoXw.text: The truffle fries were soaked and cool, did not finish eating. Burger was dry and plain... No lettuce or tomato or ketchup offered.

E7eEi37nQbshCJ1Ywow2CQ.text: This was my go to restaurant most evenings in Vegas.  I tried quite a few things on the menu.  The hellfire wings and the short rib kettle chip nachos were delicious, the Sticky toffee pudding was outstanding.  I also tried a burger which was also very good.  I was disappointed with the Shepard's Pie though, it lacked seasoning and flavor.  Daisy my server was excellent and went over the menu with me and pointed out the highlights.  Gordon Ramsey really is worth every penny he charges, one of the best celebrity chefs in Vegas.  Bonus if you check in on Yelp you get a free sticky toffee pudding

DQ-lxtRtVhf4Ftq39JqQtw.text: Slow service and not friendly, waited forever for drinks and food. Food was just ok.

FzPDDN2DUVtNZYzfxAw0gA.text: The service was 5/5 and the food was amazing! I usually dont eat fish in a restaurant but decided to try the salmon. I'm glad I tried it, it was very tasty. For dessert we had the sticky toffee pudding and it was mind blowing! Worth every penny.

h6L6UoQPP27qa_yqQ6OkLQ.text: The pastrami sandwich on rye is huge and one of the best tasting sandwiches I've had in a loooooooooong time... maybe ever. My guy enjoyed his chicken sandwich, but I couldn't break from mine to try his.  I couldn't even finish it!  Meant to take the other half out to give to someone outside  (let's be real,  there are plenty of hungry mouths out there) but I was in too much of a stupor... I'd go back just for that.  Thick, crunchy,  chewy rye... mmmm...

Xag4qGCLddV9NCpq7gfOEw.text: Our waiters Big David and Nong are the best and lots of fun. We have been here 3 times in 2 days! Best food ever... try the nachos, sticky toffee dessert w the Scottish Ale "Innocent Gunn" beer!! Yummm!! Have fun!!

lWe9KGwVN3leFZ74W-QG2Q.text: As many others have reported, we had to wait a while before we saw our server. Since there was no sign of anyone after several minutes, I told the hostess that we needed to catch a plane (which wasn't a total lie) and we saw our server a few minutes later. From that point onward, the service was excellent.  I got the English beer sampler, four 4-ounce mini "pints" of beer, while my wife got a glass of house chardonnay. We were happy with both choices.  I started with the lobster rolls and my wife got the Caesar salad. The lobster rolls were subtly dressed and tasty, but two rolls the size of my fist for $18 seemed overpriced. The salad, on the other hand, was generously portioned; I wish the dressing had a more pronounced anchovy flavor, but it was very good (comparable to Macaroni Grill's dressing).  The main course blew us away. I got the The Dublin Corned Beef Brisket Sandwich, which looks like a standard fair reuben, but is better in every way from what you'd normally expect, from the bread to the quality of the meat to the phenomenal cucumber aioli. My wife got the Scottish Salmon, and I asked her why she was eating it so slowly. She told me that it was so delicious that she wanted to savor every bite.  The only misstep was the Sticky Toffee Pudding, which we got because we kept hearing how great it was. I really wish the server hadn't poured the insanely sweet toffee syrup over the top of it as part of the presentation. The tiny parts of the bread pudding that weren't soaked in the syrup were sweet and nicely balanced. Unfortunately, the sweetness of the syrup was so bad we couldn't eat more than a small nibble before having to take several gulps of coffee just to wash it down. We gave up after only a few small bites. If anyone from the restaurant reads this PLEASE consider keeping the syrup in the mini pitcher that you bring it out with, so the diner has an option to add it themselves.

NArIouXgkZv1JXw2X9IZgA.text: The food here is 5 star, easily. The service, on the other hand, was terrible.   We're staying in Nobu and wanted lunch after getting into Vegas; this place is super conveniently located, and you can walk straight out and gamble.   We got here at around 2:30pm and were seated immediately. It took our waiter, Michael, about 10 minutes to come introduce himself, and while the restaurant was busy, it was far from packed. We wanted to do a preemptive strike against the long night ahead, and ordered waters, which was when our waiter seemed to "size" us up. We're a mid-twenties couple, which in LA doesn't really have any bearing on the service we receive, but Michael definitely treated us differently from the older patrons around us.   We decided to start with some of the happy hour appetizers, and went with the pub nachos and hellfire wings. Both were AMAZING, and I would gladly come back for them. The pub nachos were a surprisingly large portion, and everything was fresh and cheesy and flavorful, without being greasy or too heavy, a surprising feat for kettle potato chips, pub cheese, and a ton of brisket. The wings were some of the best I've ever had; I'm not a huge fan of blue cheese, but the blue cheese sauce served with them was divine and the sauce they were tossed in was wonderful. Easily 5/5 on both of those. When we ordered these, though, our waiter took our menus and almost sprinted away, never asking if we were going to order more or not.   Our waiter didn't drop our appetizers himself, and he didn't come to check on us a single time while we were eating. We were planning to order more food, and my husband had to flag him down after about 20 minutes of him walking by us constantly, standing at the bar, and talking to other patrons. It was so blatant it was almost comical, except for the fact that we were paying customers.   When we finally got his attention, we ordered the steak and ale pie to split. It came out piping hot (literally), and was delicious. The ale came through in the savory broth, which was loaded with steak and fresh mushrooms, and the crust was crispy, soft heaven.   Again, our waiter never came to check on us while we were eating and didn't drop the food himself. After about 20 more minutes he brought us dessert menus, since we apparently now seemed like people who came to a restaurant to order food, but I was so annoyed at this point I was ready to leave.   This waiter was not in the weeds, the restaurant didn't have a wait, and I watched him provide basic service to other tables. I don't know if it's our age or what, but being ignored isn't something I typically pay for. I tipped him 15%, very low for us, and I maintain I would've been better taking that money to the roulette table. The food will bring us back, but we'll likely get it to-go.

YpXPEgIGJQ9qaJVYr4wmeg.text: I did a take out of the ever famous sticky toffee pudding- waiting for the dessert was fun as the bartenders were amazing company! We came close to the end of the day, but still they were forthcoming! The pudding - OMG! FANTASTIC!!! The ice cream with it was too good. Will be returning, this time for the fish n chips also :)

4dIYcQGcS5V0IEG5GkYPFQ.text: Best meal in Vegas so far.  The waiter was outstanding.  They were packed but you can tell these guys were well trained because they don't get stressed.  The braised short rib was so good every bite was accounted for between me and my husband.  No matter how full you are make room for the sticky toffee pudding it was one of the best desserts I have ever had in a restaurant.

UPzytRWBjnSeSfsxiBF2Zg.text: Very excited to finally have a Gordon Ramsay experience,  we stopped in on a recent Monday evening.  We were told it was going to be a 15 minute wait, but were seated within 5.  Things were looking up.      We should have checked the menu before going in though, because we really wanted to try a burger, but there was none on the menu.  Fortunately, our server told us he could get us one from the bar area, so that made us very happy! (we probably should have just gone to the bar, but we didn't know there were two different menus).     Having come from Happy Hour elsewhere not long before, we both just hydrated with iced tea, which was okay tea.  And since we weren't starving, we opted to share three things:  The onion soup, the burger and the infamous sticky toffee pudding.    The soup was possibly the best onion soup I've ever had...the broth was rich and delicious.  Not sure about anything that tasted like welsh cheddar rarebit though?       Big plus on the burger, they were kind enough to split it for us, so they brought us each a plate with fries.  The burger was very tasty, had a bit of a smokey flavor.  Good, but not the best we've ever had.  Husband kept saying he thought there was another meat in it besides beef...I don't know about that, I think he was tasting bacon.  The fries were okay, but unevenly cooked.  Some were mushy, some crisp and some in between.      The highlight was definitely the sticky toffee pudding.  Yep, it ranks right up there in sweet heaven like everyone says.    Service was also like most everyone has said.  SLOW SLOW SLOW.  We were in there for what felt like forever.  We even got to know our two-top neighbors from Canada, who seemed to enjoy the beet salad they shared and their scallop entrees.    All-in-all,  with all the choices in Vegas, I just don't know that there's enough of a draw to go back.

2xLXb4FQVFniS_XdbMsj0Q.text: I'll rate this Pub & Grill based strictly on the food, and not on the astronomical prices.   The shrimp cocktail was excellent.  Rarely can I say a shrimp cocktail has so much attention to detail paid to it.    The fish and chips were very very good.  High quality fish, and a very decent portion.    Not rating the price, but if you don't want to pay $53 total for an order of fish and chips, a shrimp cocktail and a soda, you may want to look elsewhere.  I paid for my meal with my casino points.

06SFWw37aVhhm4JgyRRntg.text: This place was fantastic.   During my trip, I visited different buffets and restaurants throughout the strip.  In my wanderings,  I happened upon Ramsey's pub and grill.  We were seated immediately, no wait time.  Our waitress was an energetic lovely Filipina gal that was extremely good with service.  She made sure we were checked on regularly for top offs on the drinks, questions for the menus, and making sure our experience was nothing but stellar.    The food was great!  I had the lamb burger, extremely well priced.  The waitress suggested medium rare, and it couldn't have been done better.  Food was out in 10 or under,  and we have absolutely no comlaints.  The bill was extremely well priced in comparison to the prices of the surrounding areas.  And the location was perfect since my hunger appeared just as I was passing through the casino.  I'd definitely return during my next dalliance in Sin City.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lamb Burger.  NOM.  Perfection is medium rare.

gqpT5ROs0aXlGkBBQxRoWw.text: This establishment has great customer service. Our waiter, Afro, was nothing but helpful and patient with our table there. We ordered the Butter chicken curry and Beef and Ale Pie which were nothing short of excellent.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States

MrW6GsisSFB-7TOZ9HX-ng.text: Absolutely one of the best places I have ate in Las Vegas ever!! The food was delicious and amazing the waiter were very polite and very easy to talk to I will be coming here again next time I visited Las Vegas.

SRt_SnmqtPFOgV6Fv28khg.text: Service - great. Convenience to Colosseum - awesome. Food - mediocre at best. Chopped salad could've been from any deli, pigs in a blanket appetizer was underwhelming, coleslaw was dry. Brussel sprouts were good, but if that's the only reason to come, then it's not worth it. Maybe if you're going for a beef dish, it might be worth it but I cannot attest to that and won't be risking it with another visit.

IH6QcKIZrAuT7KqlVZpBBg.text: So far Gordon has NOT let us down & this place is another one for the books! We had the Steak & Ale Pie and the NY Strip, Lobster Mac and the nachos to start. Nachos were so good! Kettle chips piled high, topped with a blend of yummy gooey cheese sauce, sweet chili pepper relish stuff & braised short rib meat... it ended too soon. The steak was cooked perfectly and the Steak & Ale Pie was incredible. The only thing we didn't wipe the plate clean was the lobster mac n cheese... there was a slight gritty-ness to the cheese sauce like something was overcooked, but I'm still giving this place 5 stars because it was a great dinner - we were greeted pleasantly & seated right away. The server was slow but apologetic; overall a good experience.

Q6_yu9SPOk6Xb1UncHQDiQ.text: Came here for the first time after seeing Ramsay post it on Twitter!  To start the place was so cute and had a cool English vibe. I ordered the fish and chips and they had many sauces to pick from along with it. The fries were authentic English cut/style and the fish seemed like it was fresh. Over all I thought it was good but it  tasted like any ordinary box of fish and chips. Loved the food and the place but I was expecting a little more from Gordon Ramsay.

wHpt2Um58Jfkx8v3_CTYHw.text: The food is amazing. Before everything else, the food is SO. GOOD!   Our server was nice, he helped recommend drinks and service was surprisingly quick for how busy it was.   Appetizers were tasty, pigs in a blanket and deviled eggs. Great quality... but the entrees!   Short ribs and steak were phenomenal. French onion and tomato soup were very good. Friend who had Shepard's pie was the best she's ever had. AAA+ food. Pricey but god DAMN

cLUZrFfHqJAJMW8fH7mYkg.text: Came here for lunch with my siblings! Awesome food, great Server RODNEY WAS AMAZING!!

rtVia-VGg7OD18H4rkersg.text: I had the beef burger and it was delish. But at $18 (TR) it's pretty steep.  I asked for med rare but it was more medium. At medium it tasted pretty good. My burger didnt have a bottom bun! It was made with 2 top buns!! Yesss!! Everyone likes the top bun better. :) Fries were horrible.  We were going to order the fish and chips but we saw the next table have it and it was pretty dinky for $30. So we order a couple of app dishes instead since the only other seafood dish was Salmon. We ordered the Calamari and the Clams. The calamari which was delish!! It was topped with some thinly sliced peppers that tasted pickled. Pretty good!!  The clams were decent but be warned there are sausages in the dish!! For those who cant have meat.  I had a pint of sam adams which put me down $10.  It was either that or a $4 coke...ugh haha  Also our server tried to pull a fast one and didnt give us the TR discount...I had a feeling he wasnt going to...so I told him to recheck it and he did and "fixed it". Tsk tsk..I'm no stupid.
