7cfP-9TDnJAqjKrQJU1IoQ.text: Love this place!  I am from Denver and are at the bar. Ning "Juice" was great!!!!  Highly recommend!

4MGbRfdHKqyWh4nF_eMTeg.text: Service left a lot to be desired.   If we could have gotten a smile or a little bit of interaction this would be a five star for sure.   Food was amazing!!!   Went with a group and ending up sharing lots of the items.   Burgers were perfect, pigs in the Blanket were amazing, MAC and cheese was top shelf!     I walked away feeling that I get treat better at Taco Bell!!!   Not just by the waiter, but it was truly everyone that came to the table for one reason or another, with the exception of one guy who brought us our Kettle Chip Nachos (which I will go back and get again!!), he interacted and was nice.

rSBWVf9ntEOovNPOJ9wS7A.text: Disappointed!!!  Located inside Caesar's Palace in Las Vegas, Ramsay's 'authentic english pub' sells overpriced, under-portioned food.  Seriously, $30 for fish and chips??  Same for bangers and mash??  Now, I realize that the overhead here must be tremendous but this food is overpriced and there isn't enough of it.  We ordered 1 bottled beer each (Heineken) and the fish and chips and banger and mash.  Our bill, with tip, came to just over $100!!  Crazy.  The mashed potatoes were not fresh, the bangers tasted like hot dogs.  The french fries were soggy and the battered fish looked like it had been frozen.  Such a disappointment. I'm certain that Gordon NEVER sets food inside this restaurant which is exploiting his name.  In fact, I'm not sure who's exploiting who here.  We had plans for a 'Gordon Ramsay Food Tour' but, based on this experience at The Pub, we cancelled our plans. I figured we would get stuck with a much, much higher food tab at the Steak House in the Paris hotel so ..... nah, not so much.  This is a TOURIST TRAP.  Consider yourself warned regarding the pricey menu items.  PS. I lived in England for 20 years and this place is ANYTHING BUT an english pub.  Please.

dSQBkV6VdRXKYsSK4h7jdw.text: Christopher Lee is amazing! best server ever! 5 stars for his service food was good also

oohRQPzxLtr5ZKZ_EMuWBg.text: Short wait time, great service food came out extremely quick. Food was just "okay", the lobster Mac n cheese had very little lobster, burgers were extremely under cooked, and fish and chips were very oily. Too expensive for the quality of food.

rB5TQoharGpoNc9NMdQ2JQ.text: Best service! Everyone was so nice and helpful! Ramon BEST Bartender ever!!! Made the cutest girly drinks for us! Outfits on point

27DPl8ie_fXRNohkkxK_AA.text: Delicious food. Ronnie was super helpful and provided excellent suggestions. We loved our meal. Thanks for the recommendations!

7Yb_-J7qYeNGSjd48YxwyA.text: Greasy fish and underdone greasy fries.  When I do fish and chips they should be crisp.  The mushy peas were good  Little late on this update: Mgr contacted me the next day.  A refund has be sent to me.

1EwQzhFsHX1C4-Zxs4PwVQ.text: So my husband and I came here because we are big Gordon Ramsey fans absolutely love the guy! We had the deviled eggs as our appetizer, I had the fish and chips which was so tender it was falling out the batter and my honey had the lamb burger bomb.com. Our waitress Yaneisy was amazing and the food came out in a reasonable amount of time. Overall good experience looking forward to trying others!

utoYGmPQyTI3IbHgO2AoFQ.text: My husband and I were looking forward to dining at another Gordon Ramsay restaurant because we had such a great experience at his restaurant, Bread Street in Singapore (I highly recommend that restaurant!)  However, the Pub & Grill is grossly overpriced for the quality of food you get. I'm not a trained chef but I know what great food tastes like. The scallops were as Gordon would say, Rubber! The salmon was definitely over cooked. The Wellington tasted like metal. Yes, metal. We specifically said to the waitress that my husband was allergic to nuts. My husband's dessert was replaced with a creme brulee with an almond cookie. Really?!? Also, I thought Gordon Ramsay's motto was attention to detail. Our table was wobbling the whole time we were trying to eat our dinner. The service was okay, the environment was a bit chaotic.  I'm sorry but I was quite disappointed to think that Gordon Ramsay would put his name into this place.

kj5kZZPOCTNo0H2ls82IPw.text: Excellent appetizers! Great bartenders! Desserts amazing!! Fun, casual atmosphere.. well worth your time! Enjoy!!

PqwHLcZrqpmo-DUWfbNNHA.text: This place does not only get a 5 star rating from me because it's Gordon's  place,but because the food and service are also amazing ! My friend and I went during memorial day weekend and expected the pub to be very busy but it wasn't bad at all. There was no wait and we were seated in English style chairs (very adorable) However the seats  were a bit uncomfortable since we had on dresses lol. So our awesome waitress ,Sara, kindly moved us to the booth were she claims she first met and served GR. Sara made the experience very personable by addressing my friend and I by our names throughout the whole service and making recommendations from beverages down to dessert.  We started with the Fish and Chips that came with an VERY AMAZING garlic aioli  and of course classic tartar sauce. The Cod was fresh and had a nice buttery texture- not too greasy . After ,we had the appetizer, Lobster and shrimp rolls. Of course, the shrimp and lobster blended in the in house sauce was delightful but the BEST part was the freshly baked bread !This may seem greedy but we also tried the shepherd's pie because it's a pub classic !The shepherd's pie was great for my first time having ground lamb topped with creamy cheddar mashed potatoes which was also a first for me ! LASTLY, my friend and I had dessert  and  we decided on the classic sticky toffee pudding and  the toffee cheesecake. I don't want to seem dramatic so ill just say it was an amazing way to end our meal.   I almost forgot! The manager Derek did come out to greet my friend and I to  ensure that we were having a pleasant experience and only had good things to say about his staff. ENJOY the photos and next time you're in Vegas  please go and experience GR's  Pub and Grill.

Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Toffee Cheesecake
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Emoji  is definitely accurate

UIf4_WJyaf0vJzLMuRlPGw.text: We ordered a cheddar bacon burger and a lamb stew pie. Both dishes are pretty good and personally I prefer the lamb stew pie better. The burger is good but it just a burger and couldn't go any further. So try something new and special. By the way, Chris Peter serves us and he is absolutely great on his job.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States

zUZlfr-lVSyUJ0LnqMsa8A.text: Loud pub atmosphere as expected. Dark restaurant. Convenient location if you're attending a show at the Coliseum. We were seated at our reservation time. We received our drinks quickly. They are not serving their beer flights due to "problems with the glass ware" according to our server. Food came VERY quickly. They are really trying to turn tables and the meal felt rushed. My dining companion enjoyed his shepherds pie and lobster mac and cheese. My salmon was good but all the sides on the plate tasted like they'd been sprayed with lemon Pledge. Lemon mashed potatoes?  Disgusting. Chemical aftertaste. Server checked in once but I was only one bite into the meal.  $150 including drinks and tip seems steep for what we got, especially given the inedible sides on one entree. Other Ramsay restaurants in the area are far superior. Try Hell's Kitchen or Steak instead.

MkAvhyB8hA5dv1a7k1t02A.text: Everything about this place was excellent! Imma huge Gordon Ramsay fan so my expectations were high and they did not disappoint. Would've been 5 starts but they were out of sticky toffee pudding!!! How can a Gordon Ramsay restaurant run out of sticky toffee pudding, wasn't even close to closing time!

ksFJw-rsYhXRaT5QVTUJDA.text: Had to eat here because my daughter loves Gordon and his shows.    I had the pastrami sandwich and the wife and daughter had burgers.    My wife's burger was WAY under cooked and then when they recoiled it they left of toppings like bacon   Not to mention the price you pay to eat here it was quite equal.    Not a bad place but not a great place.  Add the cost in and it's pretty much just ehhhh ok  5 people burgers/sandwiches and a couple of beers over 100.00.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States

5san92SxQ8FODga4QdkTUg.text: I updated my review to three stars because the GM reached out to me apologizing for the confusion with the electronic visa gift card, and invited us back for a meal on the house.  I think that level of customer service is commendable, and most likely our second visit will be an all around better experience with both food and service, than our first.  After our next meal I will update the review again with thoughts on the food and service, stay tuned!

JSBXp9-7qfWc7RhFMfziKg.text: The food was good.  Not the best but it was a nice lunch.  That sticky tofffee pudding is amazing.  The Hell's Kitchen Burger was spicy and delicious Butter chicken was whatever Scotch egg is a must try Sausage rolls are just ok

gVsjQZC_F9mZEGXIwg9bpQ.text: The Good: The ambiance is very pub-ish.  The staff was friendly.  The fish (cod) & chips was a good way to go.  Big pieces of fish with tangy sauce.  The beer selection was solid.  The steaks were cooked perfectly - 2 were ordered, both medium.    Just OK: I had the chop salad.  The vinaigrette dressing was good and the protein (salami, grilled chicken, and chickpeas) was a nice variety.  Someone had the filet and it was par for the course.    The Bad: My beer was poured into a glass table side for me and had a 50% foam head that billowed out of the glass onto the placemat.  Never got asked if I wanted another beer.  The flat iron steak had an funky bacon flavor to it.  I think it was cooked in rendered bacon fat.  I had a bite and it was off-putting to have a steak texture with a bacon flavor like that.    You pay for "Gordon" on the strip inside Caesar's, but the price point doesn't match the experience.

BkwVJDzkJm7VWki0z9ApGQ.text: Good.  Stopped by for an unplanned meal.  There wasn't a wait so we decided to check it out.  The ambiance and decor are very unique - it's a neat place to go for drinks and food.    Our main goal was to try the sticky toffee pudding, but needed a little something else first.  Wife and I split and burger.  On the positive, the burger came out cut in half with two plates making it easy and a nice presentation for splitting a meal.  The downside was that the burger was a bit overcooked.  The medium we ordered was definitely towards the well done side.  Not a big deal for me, but wife wasn't digging it.  It did taste good though - it wasn't a bad burger, except for the over charred parts.  And the fries were good.  Finally got to the sticky toffee pudding and it was pretty darn good.  My friend called it life changing... I wouldn't go that far, but it was tasty.  I wouldn't turn my back on it.  The employees seemed friendly and our server definitely was.  She was really nice and attentive.  Bonus points for how many beers I saw her carrying out on one tray.  I'm interested enough to come back.  It wasn' the best dining experience in Vegas, but I had a nice time and would try something else if I wound up here again.

E3axvEO6s7ft_eCZo3DYxg.text: Ate here with my colleagues on a work trip. Everything was superb, I had the fish and chips and I have to say they were probably the best I've had anywhere.  Cooked just right - crispy on the outside and light and flakey on the inside.  Fantastic drinks and dessert too.

gWcArDIPMU4sJH5hEXrtcg.text: Here is the restaurant of a man who critiques restaurant staff for a living so needless to say I had pretty high standards for Gordon Ramsay's joint :)  I ordered the lobster roll and the hot wings. The lobster roll came first. It was good. The roll was a little too buttery and the dandelion type greens on top was a little disconnected from the flavor of the lobster but it was tasty.   Next the STAR of the show...those hot wings. Boy oh boy were they delicious! The flavor was so unique and had so much depth. By far the yummiest, most unique tasting wings I've ever had! The blue cheese /ranch dip on the side was so good I was licking it off of my fingers.   The cocktails were made very well. My only critique would be the lackluster waitress we had but overall my tastebuds gave this 5 stars! Highly recommend.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Oan4B74YzwUJDHUW4JYQ2w.text: Excellent food and fantastic service by "day" Scott. You definitely want him as your server.  Came to Cesar's for their buffet and was disappointed when my wife who wasn't going to eat was not able to even order a drink so we left before going in. We walked around and decided to try this place and we are EXTREMELY happy that we did... we will definitely be back!!!!

6SYa2sxYxJpROH23LzmbTw.text: total experience was good(: atmosphere, service, food all good and not too pricey for how much you get. I got the mussels and fries, and we checked in for the free date cake with ice cream. I usually only like chocolate cake ..but that date cake was so good!

gx5LBzWck5cxwCWYWZ9DUw.text: I really enjoyed it! Dark pub scene, cool vibe, great great English pub style food. I had the Sheppards Pie and Sticky Toffee Pudding. The only reason for 4 instead of 5 stars, the hostess stand and service was a little snooty/uppity. Be humble, help your customers and you will earn a 5 next time.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sticky toffee pudding -- aaaamazing!!!

d8zimYN3rI3hUld2wMZ0vw.text: This was suppose to be a good experience...I was so disappointed...lousy servicer Scott, lousy food... chicken was so dry ...thought it was gonna be everything great for my friends birthday...it was NOT...do no go!

gZmZa17NMEijbszGQjEbUg.text: We had a great lunch here. The food was great! Everything was so good that we couldn't help passing everything around and sharing it. My fiance really loved the soft shell crab sandwich which was a recommendation of our server, Adam.   Special shout out to Adam who was very attentive and spot on with recommendations. There was never a moment where we were short on drinks or water in our glasses and he was very personable.   Special bonus - Gordan Ramsey himself was in the restaurant!

RUQUxd2Rv7uNah1pmkvj_g.text: What a disappointment. We figured Gordon Ramsey at Caesar's, two world class names would have to be amazing. Expected for the price that it would deliver on the food and service. It did not. With all the options available and a only few days to make choices, we blew it with this choice.

NsnTBpZsyM8EqGLVi6Sr6Q.text: We had lunch here and I must say we thought it was pretty bloody good. Not knock your socks off, but good. Love the vibe and decor, exspecily the wall covered with beer kegs. Surprising at lunch time the wait wasn't bad for a table.the service was very good. The lunch menu is large with plenty to choose from. We always like to try new places but I would definitely go back to this place again, there are things on the menu I would like to try. Anywhere in Vegas is good for people watching, this is by the Caesars Palace sport book so plenty of passers by.

6WW2-5qKL4s0V07cS0RVAQ.text: Fantastic food, great bartenders good beer selection. Ronnie was awesome for all our needs! Highly recommend

xTldOkDUvtiRx_B7lLfQpg.text: Head a great time here for a drink and a quick snack. Our bartender name Juice is awesome!!

fjVLgpu75Ib22ovJ8qXWTg.text: Had a great lunch here with friends.  One had the Shepard's pie, big hit.  One had the Ruben, also a hit.  I had the braised beef, it was maybe the best feed i have had.  Very well done.  Last friend tried the curry and was not so impressed, not bad, just not memorable.

A1OsmE0-deM8prqAAcfwCA.text: Too many things to rave about!  -Scott, our server was world class, took great care of us. -They were very patient with our 15 month old son, made us feel completely welcome. -The food was made perfectly, crispy where it counted, soft and flaky where expected.  Will definitely be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Amazingly cooked salmon!

8OgfXShb9jrw8mNJNIiQ-Q.text: Great spot to stop for a snack and a drink. Bartenders were super friendly and the cocktails were delicious.  Poutine was top notch Calamari was well fried but not rubbery Mini burgers were a great snack, good hearty bite

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States

LDe2nDy4Lvq9yH_lzmKSIQ.text: Arrived here close to 10pm on a Saturday night and was seated immediately. It was crowded, but it's a pretty big restaurant so there's plenty of seating. My husband and I shared the following: 1) Shepard's pie: we really enjoyed this. The flavors were well balanced. It was ground lamb (the way it should be). Gravy, lamb, root veggies, mashed potatoes. Also came with a side spring mixed salad for some freshness. Total comfort food. One negative was the mini pretzel bread that accompanied the dish was super hard and almost stale. 2) sauteed forest mushrooms with a poached egg: this is what I wanted. Simple sauteed mushrooms but cooked right. Then you have a poached egg on top. Bomb! 3) beef poutine: I did not try this because I was full but my husband said it was a tad salty. Half was left uneaten. 4) toffee bread pudding (free when you check in on Yelp): bomb.dot.com it was delicious! The bread was warm, moist and so soft. The vanilla ice cream that came with it was a perfect compliment. We both loved this. Not to mention...it was free 99! Service was super quick, efficient and courteous. We had a pretty good late night dining experience here.

LFsgU2u0AdKcRTgx0mqg_w.text: Definitely get the sticky bread pudding!! It is so sweet and yummy!!   Went for happy hour and got the nachos which is bomb (kettle chips and pulled pork among other things). I love the melted cheese they use. Big portion great for sharing!

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States

NKMIiSiTZITwj3D5K0rFUg.text: Wow. Impressive!  Service was Awesome! Christopher was our server and he did a fantastic job. Very friendly and attentive to our needs.  We ordered the burger and the fish and chips.  It didn't take too long to get our food.  We split the two meals so we each could try bith and Christopher had requested the kitchen cut the burger in half since we were sharing.  The fish was perfectly battered and fried. It was not greasy. The fries were more like flat steak fries. I would have liked them crisper and not flimsy but they were good non the less.  Next - the burger. We added bacon which was a nice touch. Asked for medium and it definitely was. It was flavorful, juicy, overall a really good burger.  We finished it off with sticky pudding. Which is not pudding at all. It was a moist cake, vanilla ice cream on top and a nice carmel type of sauce. Light, perfect amount of sweetness. A really nice finish to a great meal.  It is however on the pricey side. But worth it.

U0gCYjkufxMFQzKD3uWGTw.text: The was best food I have ever tasted in my life. I eat a lot of food so let me tell you. The Beef Wellington was cooked to perfection. The Mac and Cheese was delicious, the perfect consistency. Everything was perfect.

_C6xXB97DlkX4KjeZDvRhg.text: Came here because a friend recommended it, and I've wanted to hit a Gordon Ramsey restaurant for some time.   Summary: if London themed fare is what you're after, this is the spot. It's one of my personal favorites in Las Vegas.  Brussel sprouts - it says roasted, but it's more a glazed sweet/savory thing where the sprouts aren't necessarily crispy. They tasted fine - just a little different than I expected from the description.   My buddy got the fish and chips, and they reportedly tasted very good.   I got the curry chicken with rice and naan.  Curry: better than most Indian places I've tried. Savory with the right amount of spice (might be a little spicy for those of you that don't normally eat it). Well colored, the chicken was tender, and it was gone soon.   Naan was fine - it was more pita bread than authentic Indian naan. The rice was a nice twist, strong herbal aftertaste and yellowed.   Server was the bartender Kevin, and he was legit. His family has a background in chemistry (mixology anyone?), majored in hospitality, and loves Vegas. He makes his own mead (fermented honey), along with beer and other spirits. He was friendly, helpful, good at what he does, and up for fun conversation.   And he had the kitchen whip up something I requested: an extra thick Bailey's vanilla shake. I have pictures, but I can't explain how perfectly it was mixed. It's not on the menu, but it should be. Thick vanilla ice cream with a touch of milk and just enough Baileys to notice.   A lot of Vegas restaurants are over-hyped when it comes to food. This one delivers on all fronts. It would be one of my regulars at Vegas. Go!

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Baileys shake - perfection that&#39;s not on the menu
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fish and chips
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Brussel sprouts

Rb8M_iDOebYkvgx5JXxFOA.text: We dropped in for lunch, without a reservation, and were seated immediately.  I ordered the corned beef brisket reuben and my wife ordered the wedge salad. The sandwich was terrific, with a bit of spice to the dressing, wonderful bread nicely toasted, and fantastic beef. I also happened to eat every single potato chip. My wife said that the wedge salad was "the best salad I've ever eaten." I snuck a bite (or two) and agree that it was very, very good. All ingredients were clearly fresh, the amount of bleu cheese was indulgent, and the vinaigrette was perfectly balanced. The only "grr" was the service, and we were seated right next to the waiter's station. It took quite a long time to get started, but once started, it was fine.  We are now thinking we should work our way through all of his restaurants in Vegas.

M3SG7vVioo7bIZoY-9Z8NA.text: The food was great,. The staff was excellent and I will be back for sure.  The Corned beef Poutine is absolutely delicious.  Recommend it for sure!!

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States

qNahAu63E1VACd_BX3xmEA.text: The experience was awesome for my son who's a huge Gordon Ramsey fan, but we both agreed with the price and for the Gordon Ramsey name, we were expecting much better food. It was an ok steak. But maybe they could use a visit from Gordon on 24 hours to hell and back.

pvyNiVEvS4EEe13IhPPafQ.text: The Hellfire Wings and the Sticky Toffee Pudding were two of the best things I ever put in my mouth. I will have dreams about that pudding. I almost wish I hadn't tried it because I live in Louisiana so I won't have access to it other than in my dreams. I ordered the BBQ oysters for $10 and it was only two small oysters. The truffle fries were really good as well.

XjlVIp3-no0eVYxt0WWcSA.text: Warner and Nomg are the best bartenders! Margarita on point  A must visit, Lobster  Mac & Cheese

2vaktZqgH_IdthJ9T1h1EQ.text: The food was actually really good.  We ordered a burger, fish and chips, and the sheppards pie.  We also got the sticky toffee pudding for desert which was amazing.  The shappards pie was the best of the entrees.  The restaraunt also has a lot of cool decor.  I feel like this is a great spot to have a beer and pair with food.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States

XLY3JT7r_XwBhTWjT3dgWA.text: We dropped in here before a show to grab a quick bite. The service was excellent with the staff more than accommodating our needs. A big shout out to Joe, who sat us quickly near a screen so we could watch our nuggets game beforehand. Why the 3 stars? The food. The poutine was very good but the calamari was dry, no flavor and very uninspired. I've never understood why in this country everyone feels the need to crumb, batter and fry the bejeezus out of such a delicate food. All it needs is a flash fry without any coating with flavors such as garlic, chilli and pepper.  Otherwise, the pub was good, busy and an excellent choice of beers.

R_f0lZddMmLnJm9ZowdrXw.text: yummy lunch  RODNEY is the best in the west!! Thank you for the wonderful service Rodney

yJojx7CfQJPFHWlfNqADiA.text: Went here for my birthday dinner and it was awesome! Scott was our server and took care of us. He had a great personality and told us about the check in option for the free dessert. Most servers don't mention it. Food was amazing and service was quick. I love this place and will come back soon for a great meal!

CWTlChywuWgK6oAk7M7fRw.text: Their happy hour is Monday through Friday from 2pm-5pm which is when we came. We sat at the bar where our bartender Matt was perfect amounts engaging and conversational while also non-intrusive after we got our food and drinks. Make sure you check in to get the free sticky toffee pudding! I actually really liked it! Free dessert, how could I not?  We ordered the truffle chips ($5) which were damn addicting and delicious probably because they are cooked in truffle oil and topped with truffle as well! Our bartender mentioned it was "death by truffle" and honestly there's no better way to die.   I ordered the pub crawl and Danny boy, both $12. They were both very good; I preferred the Danny boy as it tasted like an old fashioned but they were both very refreshing.  Overall, I really liked this place. The Gordon Ramsay-related restaurants I've been to in Vegas so far have not disappointed.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Check in to get a free sticky toffee pudding!
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Danny boy ($12 during happy hour)

sRTW6SB_8HsbCjZGYC68-Q.text: I am on a mission to try all of the Gordon Ramsey restaurants, and this is one of my favorites in Las Vegas!   I love the ambience- it's perfect. The wait staff are very attentive. And, you really can't beat the British theme.   I love their Scotch Egg, and their Bangers and Mash. It's True British comfort food with a nod to American comfort food. Make sure you try the Sticky Toffee pudding for dessert. It's worth the calories.

Mv1X8BMQWaEpETD-465gLw.text: Rodney is awesome! Excellent service, incredibly personable, made us feel very welcomed. Mr. Ramsey should give him a handshake for a job well done.  Food-wise the beef wellington, diver's scallops, and lobster mac and cheese were amazing.

P1CC6rM5jqmOtQpZkuA-rw.text: Our first disappointing Gordon Ramsay experience, but I guess I should expect it to be downhill after the Savoy!  We like GR because the food is simple, basic competent and delivered at a high standard. It was the basics that we're missing: fries that were oily and soft, oddly chewy instead of crispy. The pie samplers were OK, but nothing special and maybe a little runny inside. I've had better in good London pubs. The waiter agreed that when they are made in small ramekins, they don't cook quite the same. I have an idea: THEN DON'T FREAKING OFFER THEM!  I will say the lamb burger was absolutely awesome! If the chips had been right, I would've added a star.

NknnxKe4KTSwklJ8c0HNIw.text: On a recent trip to Las Vegas we stopped at Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill in Ceasars Palace to meet up with friends.  We arrive around 4:00pm, during their happy hour.  The hostess was in a conversation with some coworkers and never acknowledged us.  We waited a minute or two and then proceeded to the table where our friends were.  They were the only occupied table in the restaurant.  There were a few guests at the bar.  Our friends  had put in an order for some appetizers and drinks for themselves before we arrived.  A server brought water to our table but said he could not take our order as he was not our waiter.  Eventually a waiter came and took our drink order and to make a long story short, that was the last time we saw him at our table.  We waited 15 minutes for someone to come with anything but it did not happen. To pass the uncomfortable time, my husband and I walked to the poker room thinking that when we got back our order would be on the table.  It wasn't.  My husband went up to the bar to place the order with the bartender instead.  BIG mistake.  The bartender rolled his eyes and made it clear that this was an imposition.  We ended up canceling our order and asked to speak to the manager.  He was less interested and as rude as the bartender.  Gordon Ramsay has a reputation for perfection.  Clearly this establishment would not meet his expectations!  There are hundreds of amazing restaurants in Las Vegas! Don't wast your time here, go directly to The Palm Restaurant or Olives in Bellagio! You will be glad you did!

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The front entrance
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The front entrance

czsnnbSKbe2NxQf30HdkPg.text: The food was fine. Aka good enough pub food.  The service was terrible.  We were a large group so the staff seemed to think the tip was already added so why bother.  Yes everything in Vegas is pricey but 11 bucks for a pint of Miller Light was a bit steep even for the name and location.   The atmosphere is nice though.

1aOqCSp6Yj6aPTSBQHyoUQ.text: simple lunch like corned beef or pastrami Sammy and some beers. service at bar just excellent. Sammy solid with a good spread with some on side. overall very friendly staff and it's vegas baby they know how to keep the beers flowing lol. a lil expensive but again its vegas babyyyyyyy.

J_BkP7HrnLi9g_UpS0-qxw.text: Had a fantastic lunch on a Friday afternoon. A bit expensive for lunch but it's Vegas.  Sevice - Excellent  Drinks - large selection of beers  Appetizers - The lobster roll was fantastic!  Entree- Highly recommend the Fish & Chips  $$$ - $175 for lunch for 4

_jPSo46LO-dRT0TMckbHyw.text: Would have given them a 5 star.  The only thing I didn't like was the curry Marsala was supposed to be served with a naan bread, except they served it instead with a Costco variety pita bread!  I will have naan of that coming from a Gordon Ramsay establishment.

cCkK9JuDNT1ELG2RwTbWGA.text: Had a wonderful lunch experience! The food was quality and the service was great! We loved our server Nini! She was fantastic! And we later found out that she was covering two shifts as another server had to leave early! We would have never known! She was warm, attentive, and efficient. We would definitely come back to eat here again, try different items off the menu, but hopefully have Nini again as our server.

8YslInrn2uH-PdlGxDRYcA.text: Over priced Poor service Mediocre food 15-20 minutes for first round of drinks $30 fish and chips  Thin filet over salted and over battered  Chips tasted as if they were frozen  Peas over seasoned with mint A lot better choices Gordon Ramsay would be screaming his head off

nkeSY3sD18nO2vDw6tCmYg.text: They don't have ranch dressing and you better bloody well not ask for it!   I guess this is the restaurant people go to when the line for the buffet is too long.   It is over priced. ($9.00 for 7 green olives!) Kinda pretentious and mean.   Thet mac and cheese wasn't bad.

MOjWGeMtqUDHFknzdT7dqA.text: Stopped in after several friends recommended it.  It was ok. The Caesar salad was run of the mill average.  Did not come with lemon.  The rack of lamb was good.  Tender. The sauce green bean mix that was the bed was soggy tho. The cherry custard was nice.  Hint of cinnamon was a nice surprise.   On the negative side,  the water was warm.  I requested lemon and it didn't show up until half way through my meal.  The main course was brought out before I had hardly touched my salad.  They took it back.  Which is probably why things were soggy. It took over 15 minutes for the dessert to show up.  I enquired about an herbal tea. They didn't have any,  so I declined.  Then someone shows up with a green tea., which I sent away.  The kicker was the waiters comment when he brought my check.  He said I had eaten more than anyone he had seen that day and had taken my time.  How rude!  I didn't finish my salad or my dessert.  Not sure how 3 courses is excessive.  Rude!

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Keg walls

EkaTvqHUzz85XOOAVphN0Q.text: Pros: 1. Ice cold Newcastle at the bar 2. Scotch Egg was very tasty 3. Fries were super salty and hot 4. Friendly bartender with a heavy hand on the alcohol :) 5. Meat pie sampler was top notch per my gal  Cons: 1. Dusty front of the restaurant (the black steel window frames) right next to diners eating at the "patio" 2. Had a rare burger but the meat had zero seasoning and the bun was meh...wilted lettuce leaf, bland experience 3. Prices were through the roof (we spent the same for lunch here as we did for  dinner at Gordon Ramsay's Paris restaurant) 4. Seating was designed with high back chairs that were way too low for the table - felt like we were eating at the kid's table 5. Manager type guys in suits that looked like they were in the Mafia - never smiled or spoke to the diners.

N1mAMtHOQFcMOwcv4rNEAQ.text: Amazing food and great service! They made a tiny mistake by bringing our friends soup (entree) out as an appetizer. We didn't mind but they insisted on giving us a complimentary dessert. Had smiles the whole time. Amazing atmosphere. Best service I've had in Vegas.

i6p5inV6V3Bj9H6TuLvUnw.text: Surprised at the generally average reviews of this place.  Our group thought the food was fantastic, the atmosphere was solid and the place was clean.  Service was friendly and a bit slow (they also forgot part of our order), but that was a small hiccup for an overall very good experience.  The best shepherd's pie I've had outside of England and the drinks were decently strong.  Portions were sizeable.  This is a solid, upscale pub.

8HrByA-vRmW-viQUf5g1EQ.text: With so many great eateries on Vegas Strip, this place just taint Gordon Ramsey's name.  A hip pub joint that serves food which my mom can make better at home.  We were seated around 1PM on a Friday, and our server did not come over until 20 minutes or so after.  Then after he took our order, he came back and "confirm" our order.  Basically, he forgot our second entree order.  Anyhow, after waiting close to half an hour, I was about to blow a gasket.  I asked the waiter to check on our food, he said it is coming.  He served our entrees first before our mussels and clams appetizer.  The mussels tasted like mud, not fresh and tender.  It was just very musky.  The bacon burger was just ok, nothing real special about it.  It was under favored.  For $19, I expected a bit more.  Then the Steak and ale pie also lacked in favor.  Marie callendar's chicken pot pie tasted better than this.  I still can't believe I tipped the server.  The restaurant decor was nice, but the food and service really stinks.

IIGM6cCRdxuDjg7boSz4oA.text: I was so excited to try a celebrity restaurant. This was probably not the best choice.  It was good, but it wasn't the great I was expecting. I am the biggest Gordon Ramsay fan do that was a bummer. I got the Mac n cheese with duck fat croutons and the sliders. For the price,  I wouldn't go bad.  Again, bummer!

Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States

uMc5sfTsyBZWf9AQJ0k4iA.text: The service was lackluster at best. I heard the hostess complaining to one of the servers about her shift, loudly. Our server never ONCE checked on us after he brought the food. It also took a very long time (over 30 minutes) to get the food. That seems like a long time to wait for lunch. I would expect 15 to 20 minutes, especially since it wasn't that busy. Also, while the food was tasty, it cost us 82 dollars after tip for: One can of beer, two beef hamburgers, and one BLT.   I know Vegas is expensive but the meal wasn't worth more than thirty five or forty bucks, tops - even in Vegas.  My advice:  find somewhere less expensive with better service. You'll be happier.

zpTz721SLFwWqDl6zbckgw.text: Were I writing this solely based on the food, I would go 4 stars, but the service and high cost to food ratio knock it down to 3.   We were seated right away, but in requesting that we did not get one of the "high" bar style tables we saw at the entrance, were shown instead to an oversize "booth" consisting of a table and two large but lightweight movable couches. This proved to be somewhat uncomfortable, I felt like I was hunching over my food the entire meal as the table was too low for the level of the couches and the couches better suited for lounging than eating. All I could think was, if I wanted to eat dinner at my couch in front of my TV, I would do so. Might be fun with a larger group but it was not very intimate for 2.   So lets get to the food, we had the calamari appetizer which was light, perfectly fried and tasty, and also a decent size portion as well. The accompanying sauces were the standard cocktail and aioli, uninventive but appreciated. We both decided on the lamb burger, which was enormous. If anything the meat to bun ratio here is unbalanced, the patty could be downsized a little bit or bun upsized without losing anything, the meat overwhelmed the remaining ingredients on the burger to the point you felt like you were eating just a big pile of patty. It was a very good lamb burger nonetheless.  Meanwhile, the accompanying fries were nothing to write home about, and like the fried squid, they also came in a suitably large portion.   The service was surprisingly poor, my iced tea glass remained empty at one point for more than 10 minutes during our meal, and we were not attended to promptly when sitting down. I suppose by American standards the service was "normal" and Europeans would find it too fast a pace.   Lastly, the place was quite expensive, you do indeed pay for the name in addition to the food. Two burgers, an appetizer and two sodas cost us $85 with tip. I was expecting this, but its worth noting nonetheless.

Lc0-C-xFyQmeQODIK6Qa8A.text: The food was alright. I got the pesto chicken and it was nothing  amazing. Probably wouldn't come again which is a shame

F1U-n_wws22n97VPYdLkzA.text: Awesome.  Would love to give this place a five, but I can't. And here's why.  The location is right on the casino floor and for me, this is not a good thing. The service was also pretty slow and more importantly, the portions were not mindblowing; especially compared to similar restaurants nearby.  The menu was compelling, and the cocktails were outstanding. A really enjoyable meal.

VmSqUK_VbEyEd0FaB0w2tQ.text: I would say the pub is a cool little spot to eat price are ok. The waiters are good and friendly. The fish and chips are really good

Alac7IFblOZaexMU-Cd_5A.text: As far as the food goes, well that's a given...aside from the tasty dishes they have a great beer selection and down to earth service to top it off. Christian and Cisco were very attentive and genuinely cared about my experience here at Gordon's Pub. Best part about this place are the prices. For Las Vegas, this is reasonably priced and a must for the experience.

Kmh9YSfPaWK2HUyhLHMLcw.text: Exactly what you expect from one of his restaurants. I had the steak and ale pie. This was something new for me, have to tell you I am love. The combination of everything from seasoning, the diced vegetables, the brisket meat that melted in your mouth was out of this world. I recommend to try something new at his restaurants.

22Bdn7jUBoB9im23o8vPhA.text: This place sucks! The food is horrible and the prices are ridiculous! Tourist trap! This place has a central spot in the casino and if you see it pass it up to play some slots!  Slow service and crappy food for high prices. So not worth it!

Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States

dzGCIPZlgXKe0ktyY2GCBw.text: My boyfriend and I were super excited to come check out one of Ramsay's restaurants and the Pub & Grill did not disappoint! We've binged watched Kitchen nightmares and hotel hell on more than one occasion so we were definitely looking forward with starting our Vegas trip here.  We came in for happy hour on a Thursday and loved it. Our server Rodney was super personable and the service was definitely on par with the high expectations. If you have the chance, try the Pub Sliders! Definitely a good place to meet up, drink, and eat to sort out your Vegas plans on the strip.

2VXzTFtdze7UTeI8XImCzw.text: Yummy British pub fare. Cute place and bigger than I expected. Had seats on casino floor but we sat in the back area which was nice. Normal overly high vegas prices. Food and service were great, but in a half empty restaurant they sat us right next to the kitchen door. Only good thing was I saw every amazing dish come out of the kitchen. Wish I could have ordered every one.

Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bacon burger

v-ch-Fl7hhQmtoRrDUqXAg.text: Another of our Gordon Ramsay visits on a recent trip to Vegas.  I had the Maple Sage chicken sandwich.  So delicious.....the decor can be a little much with all of those kegs on the wall and the tables a little close but hey, on this visit we came across another couple from Colorado with whom we were able to share a couple rounds of shots.  Such a fun pub experience!  The wait staff was quick with the beverages and she was able to recommend some good choices.  My girl had a pastrami on rye and absolutely loved it as well.  With reservations in hand we were sat quickly and seamlessly.  So whenever you visit.....do yourself a favor and make a reservation!  Will we be back?.....Definitely! :-)

WKLFsSZ6OQlQQCAJf-Pq_g.text: The service here is amazing! We were a table of 6 ladies in Vegas celebrating a friends marriage and we were treated wonderfully. From the waitress, servers, and manager who personally came over to talk to us and make sure everything was okay. The food was good. The nachos, although an appetizer, was very filling and enough food for two of us to be satisfied. We will definitely be back for more.

lKKz46Qa5bVjVuULufG66g.text: Delicious. Meticulous. Perfection. From the cider I was poured to the jumbo shrimp cocktail app I was served, the food/beverage was phenomenal. You will not go wrong with the fish and chips! The bartender could have smiled at least a little, but it is a British Style Pub, so I get it. A must visit when in Vegas!

BbOYXuvZy0HmlBe8ESGcXg.text: It's a-ok. We made a reservation and were seated promptly. Our server was friendly. The food was tasty enough, but not crave-worthy or exceptional.  The ambiance is upscale pub. Overall, it's got a nice vibe.  The beer list didn't do much for me as there wasn't anything particularly notable. But all the standard ones you'd expect at a pub are there.  We ordered the calamari, fish and chips, English ale onion soup, and lobster mac 'n' cheese. Our server somehow forgot the lobster mac 'n' cheese and brought us fries instead. She promptly fixed the error, leaving the fries and putting in an order for the lobster mac 'n' cheese. But then she added the fries to our bill! Seriously.   The calamari was alright. Good enough to eat when you're hungry. Not good enough to ever order again. The fish and chips were good. They're fish and chips - nothing particularly notable, but the fish was battered and fried well. The English ale soup was quite tasty and the best thing of the night. The fries were alright. Would never actually order them. The lobster mac 'n' cheese was tasty. But I've had far better elsewhere and probably wouldn't order it again here given the price for the small portion.  Aside from the order mix-up, we had a pleasant evening here. It's a perfectly fine place. Good enough food, but not the wow food that one often comes to expect of Vegas dining.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States

YQEY1AI0kMH49TEb30monQ.text: We came here for happy hour (Mon - Friday, 2 - 5). We tried most of the bar bites and were quite happy with them. Our server Rodney told us that if we were still hungry to try the nachos. We decided to give them a try and they were amazing! Best nachos that I've ever had! The flavor combinations worked so well together.   Give this place a try and if you do, say hi to Rodney. He'll give you attentive service and great recommendations.

rjII-MbfZJzsBsBSxFTKRQ.text: Best damn salmon I've ever had. I think back to it even though it's been one year. My husband loved the shepherd's pie we also had the beer cheese as an appetizer and a dessert. The price was only 100$. For a 3 course meal and great food, it was amazingly priced well...especially for vegas. I love it so much and it's like steppin into London. Everyone is so friendly and amazing.

C7XFmcOpJA1j2OXhPXofOw.text: Ask to sit in Adam's section! Super nice and will gove you great recommendations.  We had the nachos ($7) and deviled eggs (5). I had a glass of cab ($7) and hubby had a stella ($9).   It was so awesome! Great food and experience at Caesar's Palace. Stop by for happy hour!

ohmIXVJyZ3OqT_Y2AegV0g.text: Bar was good. Boodingtons on tap. Had the shepherds pie. It was good but a little greasy. It was standard food nothing the blew my socks off. The prices were high. However I left full and satisfied.

W-Ucf9NtVWHH6-YaEmOklQ.text: I think I have just found my favorite beer (Innis & Gunn) and even better I think I've found my most very favorite waitress EVER!!!!(Lisa). This is always a great place and happy hour makes it even better, but wait. What could be better than that, Lisa as your server, that's what. She's phenomenal!!!!!

oPH-gy_G60pqvTpBdt24oA.text: This place is a bit of a shit show. Way too packed and understaffed. The prices are outrageous for pub food. The server is fly by night in that they are literally rushing away from you before you finish your sentence. The fish and chips were so awful. Fries soggy and fried fish batter was totally starchy and mushy. Epic fail. Only reason I finished my meal was because I was hungry and had a conference schedule to attend to. I

Y9aIu1cS4UbL-hM6bFJelw.text: /TL;DR  Having seen Gordon Ramsay's shows, I expected to see a reflection of his indications for a good restaurant displayed here. Wrong. Obscene menu with a large array of choices.  /ATMOSPHERE  Large, open space with unusual dining tables and chairs. It's basically like eating while you're sitting in your favorite recliner. I liked it.  /FOOD  I went with the lamb burger. It was hella good. However, I went splits with another mate at the table who went with the fish and chips. Not so good. I was disappointed that I gave up half of my lamb burger. Chips are mediocre. That is sacrilege.  /SERVICE  Very good and accommodating. Had no qualms splitting our check one thousand ways. However, they never indicated tip was included. It did show up on the main bill though, so I caught it before we also started writing them in as it does not show up on the split bills.  HOW TO READ MY REVIEWS: 1 Star - Does not approach edible. Enter at your own risk. 2 Stars - If I'm in the area, I'd pick something else. 3 Stars - I would stop by if I happen to be in the area. 4 Stars - I would pick this place out of other places nearby. 5 Stars - I would go out of my way to dine here.

O5M7hlWGIyma0e7D0qvywQ.text: This place has the best, and I mean the BEST mini burger appetizers I have ever had in my entire life!!! We ended up ordering at least 2 more orders. They were simple with just cheese, lettuce, and ketchup but obviously the beef came from a magical cow because we couldn't get enough. Huge beer, wine, and mixed drinks options available as well. We will be back!

iN8dlS0c7DZJcJoIqYf0EA.text: Nong "juice" Keith, and Christian were amazing!!! Gordon's pub and grill is a show stopper. Great service and even better food. A slice of London in Las Vegas.

gbDOBptOyp-rxMaS1fLl1A.text: Best part of the meal was the bartender RayRay. He made the meal sooo much more enjoyable. He really knew the beers and could size me up, just by looking at me, what I was going to like. And he was spot on. So RayRay was the best part of the meal.   But a close second was the lamb burger. One of the best things I've ever eaten. Highly recommended.   We also had the butter curry which was very good. And the chopped salad which was ok. But overall an outstanding experience.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Great bartender RayRay with the beer taps

op7YUGGTRVoqm9Ri5bmTpA.text: I thought for sure that the Gordon Ramsay brand would ensure a great meal. I thought wrong. Clearly our server would much rather be somewhere else than at work on a Tuesday night. His couldn't be bothered attitude set the tone for the meal.   I am a brussel sprout fan and was excited to give these maple bacon style a try.  Pretty sure they were at the bottom of the pan as they were too sweet and over sauced to be palatable.  They don't offer salt on the table assuming because the chefs are experts at seasoning everything to perfection. We asked for salt and never received it....     The chop salad was fine, but the fish and chips were underwhelming. All for a price tag of over $100.  So many great food options in Vegas - super bummed to have wasted a meal and my dollars here.  Oh and skip the fancy house favorite cocktails - and go with a basic drink.

l4bfltq4KCVXdViWxLDA3w.text: So this is our third time eating here for lunch and we asked to be seated in Scotts section again.  Even though its been over a month he remembered us and even what we ordered.  When we came in August it was for my hubbys birthday and this time it was Scotts Happy Birthday.  Just wanted to say thank you for your consistent behavior and uplifting spirt.  For all the new items we tried he was helpful in explaining and even insightful on our dining experience.  We of course will be returning around Halloween.

Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States

b2z7Kgd6UoZ9ZnYor9qktw.text: This restaurant is AMAZING from the food to the service everything is top notch! There was only a short wait on the weekend.   Our waitress was really great, she asked for our names and talked to us by our names the entire time. Now where do you ever see that? She gave a very welcoming and friendly vibe. Service was fantastic the whole time.   The food was...incredible. I was blown away with all of the flavors and how delicious everything was. The soft shell crab sandwich was the best that I've had, the crab was cooked perfectly. The Mac and cheese had so much flavor. I usually like very cheesy Mac and cheese, this one wasn't too cheesy but the flavor definitely made up for it. I can proudly say it was some of the best Mac and cheese I've had.   Check in for a free desert! That toffee cake was out of this world good. So soft and delicious. There is a few of Gordon Ramsey's restaurants in Vegas. This one was a bit more casual, but the food and service without a doubt was 5 stars. Highly recommend.

FSeHFu1Lvu3A4YNN8lHKdQ.text: I have to say the service was great but the food was lacking, especially the Lobster mac n cheese. Especially for the $25 price tag. It came to the table luke-warm, the noodles were a little undercooked and it pretty much tasted like Kraft Mac and cheese with a few pieces of lobster meat thrown in. I had a side order of the Yukon mashed potatoes which are normally the best I've ever eaten but not this time. I've eaten here before but this time was a total disappointment.

qi3IVYvSHYHqW9MeoHWpxQ.text: Hi last night (c9:30pm 09/15/19) my mother and I dined with you having just arrived in Las Vegas for my mother's birthday and we were both absolutely appalled and disappointed with the quality of the service, the food and the environment!  Firstly the air conditioning was on so high I needed two napkins to keep warmer! There was no way I could order hot food as it would have been chilled by time I ate it the atmosphere was freezing with a big draught coming from the back of where we were initially seated. I asked to move to be told there were only 'high tables' available so I said we'd leave as my mother is 63 years old. All of a sudden a few tables became free so we were moved there.  The food was shocking, I even feel like sending Gordon a message (my partner is his bodyguard) to feedback our visit with you. We have visited Atlantic city branch and were amazed by the quality of food but here was possibly the worst meal I have ever experienced - no joke.   The mushy peas ordered with my mum's fish and chips were cold, so we asked for them to be heated up and they returned once she had finished her meal. My kale and chicken salad had no butternut squash and the chicken was chewy and grisly. I asked for the squash to be added and when it returned to me the waiter explained it was at the bottom of the salad (I can assure you it was not!). The staff were very rude.  The staff knew their service and quality of food was not up to any fit standard although they did not say anything but offered us a free sticky toffee pudding of which we refused because we wanted to leave immediately and forget the experience.   Had it not been for my mother's birthday I would not have paid for one food item but as it was our first night I didn't want to cause a fuss.  PL

0FY64loob5n2Nx5xRJKNyA.text: I wish I could give more stars. Service is excellent. Gluten free options are excellent (see pic). Decor is excellent. Everything was just freakin' excellent. Read on for details.  For some reason, finding gluten free options on the strip is really difficult. You'd think with the overwhelming options around here that every restaurant would be competing for everyone's patronage. Whether that means catering to vegans, those with allergies or whatever medical restrictions, you'd think they'd try. But that doesn't seem to be the case.  Living in LA, we come to Vegas often as a quick escape. And when we do, it is for 2 main reasons.... To sleep and to eat. We wander the strip aimlessly shopping and sightseeing in-between meals and naps. That's our thing. So food ends up being mighty important.   Tonight we were doing our usual wandering after a glorious mid-day nap and we were in the mood for some Mexican. Our plan was to hit up a fave place in the Miracle Mile but as we passed by Hell's Kitchen we suddenly had a craving for some good ol' Gordon Ramsey quality food. But we didn't know Hell's Kitchen needed a reservation weeks in advance. So we wandered into Caesar's to find Ramsey's pub that we had walked past earlier in the day. Soooooo glad we came here.  Gordon Ramsey's Pub & Grill is our new favorite casual restaurant on the strip.  We were seated quickly even though the place was busy. The decor is the perfect mix of vintage British meets modern hipster. Even the wooden placemats make for a unique experience. And it is relatively inexpensive considering it's location. Win!  Our server, Sladjan, was phenomenal. He greeted us right away and acted as if we were his only table even though he had several other tables already seated and had others sitting down right after us.  We ordered drinks and as he checked our IDs he noticed my boyfriend's name. So the two of them bonded over their similar upbringings (Bulgarian and Serbian). And then after ordering drinks our server did something so unexpected. You ready?   He asked if we had any allergies and when we both said that I am gluten free he asked what kind of gluten free "preference, intolerance or Celiac" whhhhaaaatttt? Even high-end fancy places usually don't bother to differentiate between the types of gluten free peeps. I can count on one hand how many fancy strip restaurants I've been to that seem to have any knowledge of Celiac as a disease rather than just gluten free as a "lack of ingredients". Needless to say, I was super impressed.  I did have to ask for the gluten free menu but that's no biggie... because they actually have one! And not only do they have a gluten free menu but it has a secret option. You can get a burger with a gluten free bun! And the bun doesn't cost extra! Nowhere on the regular people menu is this mentioned so this was a welcome surprise and without hesitation I ordered the burger.  The burger arrived with a side salad. Sladjan apologized for the side salad as a replacement for the fries but explained that since I was Celiac and not just gluten free that they wouldn't be safe for me. I had already assumed this but it was nice of him to explain why I didn't get fries.   We finished our meals, I finished my two delicious cocktails and I pulled up my Yelp app to show our server that we had the free toffee pudding offer for checking in. I told him that I knew I couldn't eat it but I wanted my bf to enjoy it. And then, without skipping a beat he says, "No, there is a gluten free strawberry parfait. I'll get you that instead so you can eat too". We thanked him and eagerly awaited our parfait. Before it was delivered he came to the table to assure me that everything was gluten free in the parfait including "... the little cookie things on top. All gluten free. You're good."   Ummmm, so not only does this restaurant HAVE gluten free options and a gluten free menu but our server is super knowledgeable and goes out of his way to make sure everything is safe for me and that we are happy as can be. If that's not an experience deserving of more than 5 stars, I don't know what is.  BTW... The boyfriend got the Caesar salad with chicken and anchovies and he loved it. Even the croutons were really good. "Like homemade".   We downed our scrumptious not-too-sweet parfait, paid the bill, left a great tip and went back to our room to pass out again. A great final night in Vegas all thanks to Sladjan and our new favorite restaurant.

CnUww8Ct6My_EKtcT6IZLQ.text: Hungry after a day at the pool we picked Gordon Ramsay for some food!  Restaurant has a relax atmosphere with various British dish and more available. I went for the lobster roll and shared the nachos. The Portion were generous and the food was fragrant and tasty! A little overpriced for some dishes especially after living in England for 10 years where most of this menu items are sold for a bargain.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States

ztvIBneq7Pc4-dHnzo6sZw.text: I've never tried the food here but I every time I come to Vegas I make sure to stop by at Gordon Ramsay's Pub because they have the best Sticky Toffee Pudding ever!!  If you haven't tried it I've gotten all of my friends hooked on this delicious sweet savory dessert. It is a masterpiece. Pudding is actually cake in British English. It tastes like a caramel chocolate cake but it's actually made from Dates. There's no way I can do justice to this but really I am NOT a dessert person but Sticky Toffee Pudding is an exception.   The best part is that if you check in on Yelp, you'll get one for FREE. I typically order 2 puddings plus I get a free one for checking in. Make sure to go to the bar to make your orders and it'll come out within 10 min.

dXw3o9-9p0Ns7urrvxQ_Iw.text: I can't imagine why this place has a 3.5 rating.  I have been here probably 5 times and everything I get or try from my friends playes is 5 star all the way.     My meal last night was the Chicken Curry.   Not spicy, but a little kick.  The basmati rice was perfect as well.  My mother got the Rib Eye.  It was cooked perfectly and had a great salt and pepper flavor.  I would recommend it 100%.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States

NJZjS41mDrUMhsjmGKETQQ.text: **********UPDATE ON REVIEW****** We were back in May 2019. How much do we enjoy this place?! Twice in 3 days! Always terrific!*****  Arrived in Vegas a bit tired~3 States in 3 days. All the Vegas Bling Bling gets your heart pumped up though! After a 48 minute hard fought battle with "the spouse" - back and forth on where to go for dinner, I Lost. And boy am I glad!  Dear Chef Gordon Ramsay,  You made me cry twice today. Came to your Pub...where were you? Looked everywhere, asked everyone but to no avail. 1st tear.  Luckily the staff in charge is completely amazing, delightful, and well trained. Had reservations but arrived early. The place was bouncing with people, full, to the "fish and chip gills" but the Hostess' words of "No problem" was like a sonnet to my ears! (did I mentioned I was tired?)  Our evening server and now friend Miss Evie took such great care of our roost; she was such a pleasure. Her genteel manner and service was remarkable.  On to the 2nd tear Chef Ramsey- Our order consisted of:  *Appetizers- Crispy Calamari and Lobster Rolls. These dishes need no work, please leave them as they are;stunningly delicious! *Ordered 2 Stella Draft beers, a 35oz for the loser of the earlier battle and a 20oz for the Lady whom did not even break a sweat in that exchange.  *Main Course- Prime Rib (medium rare) and order of Fish and Chips. The Prime Rib was done to perfection with Mash Potatoes following suit. Again amazing!  Now for the 2nd tear- The Fish and Chips were SENSATIONAL! A total Knock-Out! The tear came out because it brought back memories of a stint at English Public school, how this meal was authentic, and very indicative of how it tastes in England. Bravo!  Bravo! Thank you Chef. As if that wasn't enough, you graciously sent out a free Sticky Toffee Pudding. I knew right then, you were at the Pub watching me eat with full delight and splendor. The heavenly dessert was consumed VICIOUSLY!...as it should be.  I close now giving you many thanks and warmest regards, Ever Faithfully yours, Jon H.  PS...my battle contender "the Spouse" said I wouldnot finish the 35oz Stella. So after dissipating the "35" with full vigor, I had to win that quarrel (at least) by ordering an extra 20oz for me, consuming it with a grin, slowly, like a World Class Champ or Chimp :/

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Wifey with Chef GR
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bar area with vino
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sticky Toffee Pudding! Yelp Dessert!!!! Free Thanks Chef Ramsey.

l3EpFXX0R7QitmRyKLRk8w.text: We were in Caesars Palace and we were hungry. Not sure what to eat we passed by Gordon's Pub, stopped to look at the menu, saw that it was happy hour and decided to try it because I love Gordon's Fish & Chips so I thought,  why not. The atmosphere was cool. Beer kegs as decor, cool silverware and place mats, interesting burlap type  napkins and funky leather looking staff uniforms.    I was eating with my friend who is a Chef. We ordered every food item on the happy hour menu, 2 beers and bone marrow and asparagus which were not on the happy hour menu.   Service was eh. My friend was annoyed because our waitress came by only once to ask us how we were. My friend wanted to order another beer. We had to wait awhile. The water guy came by more than our waitress. He was great.  Food was eh.... pretzels came out cold, the menu said they were supposed to be hot. Truffle fries were ok but there was too much truffle so it over powered the fries. Chicken wings were dry. The one pig in a blanket was ok, nothing remarkable. The one slider was ok but the bread fell apart. Not sure why. The bone marrow was good but for the price the portion was small. The toast that was served with the marrow was burnt. My friend literally had a conniption. "Look at this, it's burnt. I would never send something like this out."   Overall it was disappointing. I expected more.  Would I go there again? No

yQgF7uAkJr94fZS7n4wqhQ.text: If you're use to good pub food then don't go to this embarrassment of an establihment unless your just a starving tourist like I was.  I'm assuming Mr Ramsey gives two fucks what his name goes on cause honestly, that's nothing but a lot of money that a cook watching YouTube will screw up.  Sucks cause I figured a guy that hates screw ups would of not blown such an easy gig. He did.

bVv_NpeEDDt-Nvr-AIonKA.text: This place is soooooooooooo over rated.  $68 for a burger with fries and two glasses of Merlot.  Come on man!  + tip $81+.    The burger was ok definitely not worth $23.  A glass of wine $17!   Gordon Ramsey needs to recognize this is a pub not a white linen 4 star restaurant.  The burger was dry and the bun was either burnt or stale, the best part of the meal were the fries.  Excellent fries! Maybe worth $5.  The rest was a complete waste of money given the great restaurant selections on the strip.    If I wasn't interested in watching NFL on their 42" tv I would have gone to in & out burger for a better meal and much less money.    Not for me.....

El5yNAISdr2eSAP9JOsRHQ.text: Awesome food and service! The whole experience was amazing, from the friendly and accommodating staff to every delicious bite of food. I started with the Pork Bellies, then tried the Pigs in a Blanket, for the main dish I had the "fall apart" Short Ribs, and ended with the scrumptious Sticky Toffee Pudding. I was happy with everything and have no complaints. Yaneisy was on her game and provided a perfect mixture of fun, energetic, friendly and passionate service. We didn't have to wait for anything and she did a great job of anticipating or needs without having to interrupt our conversation. I will be back.

Em0BGOlNygzl0MAwmAKb9A.text: I'm surprised that Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill, which is located in the Caesar's Palace Hotel - only has a 3.5 rating! I really enjoyed my first visit, where we received great customer service from our server, Josnin and the food was delicious!   My cousins and I (a party of 5) shared a ton of appetizers and they had decent sized portions where we were soooooo full after, it was hard to walk lol.   Here's what we ordered:   1. Bone Marrow w/ Oxtail jam - although it was a flavorful bone marrow, the amount of meat on the bone was small so maybe got one or two scoops of bone marrow and that was it. The depth of the bone marrow was slightly deceiving and there wasn't that much meat. The small amount of Oxtail sprinkled atop was tasty. This dish comes with slices of bread.   2. Steak Tartare - yum! Now this was good! The added capers really bring out a delicious flavor! I would order this again and again! The meat is fresh which you can tell by the color. The portion was decent - you can buy two to share between 5 people.   3. Pork Belly - mhmmm, this was good too! I really appreciated the crunch from the skin and the juiciness that dripped down. Try this!   4. Lobster Mac n' Cheese - 5 stars alllllll the way up for this dish! The noodles were cooked perfectly; there was just the right amount cheese and the best part...a ton of lobster sitting right on the dish! Wow - this Mac is delicious! I was 2nds, 3rds... you get the picture!   There were a few other things that we ordered but I didn't get the chance to try: the scallops and Shepard's pie. From the presentation and from what my cousins say: "Oh my goodness."

Lastly we had the sticky taffy cake which was so phenomenal!! I definitely will be coming back in the future!
