qo8rLFkMIYPpQq8t7_0BqQ.text: Unfortunately, I have to give fewer stars this time. It wasn't incredibly busy and there were ample empty tables, yet we were placed at a table that we shared with the water servers. It felt a little awkward and we kept feeling them bump it. Plus, I just kind of wondered why we were chosen to sit there. Kind of an ambiance-destroyer.  The food... was alright. It wasn't the best burger I've ever had in my life (like last time) and was really rare around the outside. I'm not even sure how that's possible, but I had to pick it off my medium-well burger. The fries weren't crisp, although they seemed fresh. It just wasn't special. I recall last time I wanted us to try and finish everything on our plates because it was so good.   My hubby had a steak and asparagus. He enjoyed it well enough, but we both think we'd rather go to a real steak house instead.   It's difficult not to expect something exceptional when you come to a celebrity chef restaurant.

xxNMGesPCIHiWNVJCCOVng.text: Beef welllington. Scallops. All good. This place has the same stuff mostly all Ramsay restaurants have, except maybe a little better on the budget.

Hc1798WC7lgQzsBIOhyRoA.text: Gordon Ramsey should be ashamed of himself putting his name on this restaurant...  I ordered the Fish and Chips, and guess what, they were cooked from FROZEN. At this price point and with Gordon Ramsey's name on it (which is ironic, seeing as how much of a stickler Ramsey is concerning restaurant's serving frozen food), I would have expected at least hand-cut chips and fresh fish.   My meal was not bad, but was the equivalent quality of a TGIFriday's. Please save your money and go elsewhere if you want a quality meal for the price point.  I'm giving two stars because of the waitstaff; we had an excellent waiter who perhaps should be working at another restaurant that serves fresh, high-quality food.

x_RmtZbwEpHcUPOj1SnVxQ.text: For my best friend's birthday, we reserved a table for 10 people, and we ended up with a "private" room away from the rest of the restaurant goers.  I love Gordon Ramsay and the food did not disappoint! I ordered the cheddar beef burger (with bacon) and it was very filling--I was an extreme fan of the garlic aioli that came with the fries! The braised short rib was also very flavorful and melts in your mouth. The deviled eggs were also delicious.   The dish that was the most lackluster was the lobster mac & cheese. It tasted like kraft mac & cheese and there was barely any lobster, and was not quite worth its $25. The group pretty much enjoyed their meal. The food also didn't take too long to come out.   Forgive me, for I forgot our waiters name, but he was very lively, attentive and entertaining to talk to! He made our dinner that much more enjoyable.   This is a great spot for dinner with a pretty diverse menu and does not make too much of a dent in your wallet when it comes to Vegas and a Gordon Ramsay restaurant. I would suggest making a reservation!

BIGixXJE_DdSJogXUF9ngg.text: Love, love, loved it. The food, the hostess, the friendly atmosphere. We ate all of the delicious dishes made on TV and loved every one of them. Thank you for the experience.

Flf7mOeFvulSixjT6vNmxA.text: With Chef Gordon Ramsay's name attached, you can expect to spend more for the same type of food as you would get anywhere else.  I'll start by saying that I KNOW I'm not the target audience.  I'm a vegetarian (a real vegetarian - no meat of any kind) but my husband isn't.  For this reason, when we go to Vegas, I've taken him to Ramsay's Burger place, Pub, and Steak house.  I'm sure we'll visit the Fish and Chips place sooner than later.  This is my second time visiting the Pub & Grill.  We first went a few years ago, right after "Scott" won Hell's Kitchen.  I got the lobster mac & cheese without lobster and my husband got the Fish and Chips.  Shortly after, my husband got pretty sick but there wasn't a way to pinpoint if it was food-related or a delayed hangover, which we know he gets.    We went for round two this trip.  We started with a flight of UK beers and a pint each of Innis and Gunn.  For those beer-fans out there, that was Bass, Boddingtons, I&G and New Castle.  The I&G is the "original" one and although the rum-cask is better, it's still delicious.  Then we went to order our food.  The prices have nearly doubled since it opened!  I bought my husband the exact same meal last time and now it's $30!  For Fish and Chips!  I got the beet salad for a whopping $18.  For beets, lettuce, and goat cheese.  I felt like it should have sat on a bet of poker chips.  I liked my salad and my husband loved his Fish and Chips.  We didn't over drink the night before and were totally healthy after our meal.  Because I've had it before and because it's amazing, we got the Sticky Toffee Pudding.  It's served with ice cream on top and not the ice cream butter stick you'll see at Gordon Ramsay Steak but lord is it delicious.  If the prices weren't so high, this would become a staple lunch place during our routine Vegas trip but I nearly dropped $100 on this meal and I literally had a salad and some beer.  I'm usually the cheap date since I don't eat meat but again... $18 for the salad.    I'm sure Chef Ramsay is not hurting monetarily so it would be nice if the prices were only slightly ridiculous.  Then again... it's Vegas.  Note: The service was awesome.  Our waiter was great. I wish the music was a little better.  It sounded a little clubby which didn't match and ambiance.

z7mrGR2csOhIlTFOxfmZHA.text: Ordered Gordon's Fish and Chips and it is the best Fish and Chips I have ever tried! Light and Crispy crust with a silky and flaky fish! Just superb!! The chips were crunchy and the mashed peas were delightful! Our waiter Chris Lee was outstanding! Attentive and happy, I'm definitely making a trip back to Vegas to visit the Pub and hopefully see Chris again!! Memorable experience!!

QBN7ktod2tqO6CjJs1jaEg.text: Had the worst time ever! Thanks to the crappy service/ crappy waiter! Wow! Much kudos to you sir! Please rethink your staff @GordonRamsay or whoever's in charge of the staff! We waited an hour for our food and the waiter didn't even seem apologetic. He told us since we ordered an appetizer another wait for our main course food was expected and not something to complain about. HE DIDN'T EVEN APOLOGIZE MIND YOU. Then the manager came out and he was nice and very apologetic. OPPOSITE OF OUR WAITER. Probably my worst experience regarding service in a restaurant.

MNc3l5Ne-qRJnYaAUP63cA.text: Came here after Celine!!!! Lobster Roll is life, curry chicken is amazing. Bartenders Nong and Keith are awesome! Vegas baby!

IvxXtthq5tArE7PuWuthKA.text: This place was like no other on the strip! Not only was it one of the only Gordon Ramsay places we could actually get a reservation for 7 at, but it also had amazing food. I personally had te prime rib, which was the most expensive thing on the menu, but also I received the largest and most delicious piece of meat I have ever laid eyes on. Additionally, other people in our party got the lamb, fish and chips, and the salmon and all of them were fantastic. Price-wise, with all of our food, drinks, and desserts it got up there but nothing crazy compared to other restaurants on the strip. It's also a great place to watch sports if that's of any importance!

PqG4O_w8D4jmyjaZWyT8ZQ.text: I wanted to taste a $23 burger; very disappointed.  I ordered the bacon burger, no cheese, med well.  Came out a little more pink than I wanted but it was from a Gordon restaurant.  It was juicy but tasteless, no salt/pepper or any flavor at all. My fries were excellent.  Blah tea, no offer of any sweetener either- a texan's got have sweet tea.

KlUDtyX3ChTxt-CQdJ5p4A.text: Cheers to that manager that spotted us, on deck, waiting to grab a seat while the patrons ahead of us hassled and argued with the front hostess about every little thing -  Trying to score that free meal, treated like kings & queens.. c'mon, I'm hungry and willing to pay for food, the hell you doing here?    Two thumbs down to our server whom, at times, made us feel like we weren't even there. He was so inattentive and disregarding - I'd like to say I forgot his name, but the dude didn't even introduce himself. He seemed focused on other people, giving the feeling of someone looking through you as if you ceased to exist.   A mixed thumb up for their Beer Braised Short Ribs. Unreasonably priced and it wasn't as tender as one would expect - The flavor screamed & howled, 'Puuub'.. And rightfully so, 'cause we were in one. Nothing exciting here, it seemed to lack flavor all together. A tad chewy and bland would describe this dish best. What WAS good was the potato puree. It lasted all of 1 minute as did the vegetables which were just okay.    Two thumbs down for the Crispy Calamari. It was more soggy and flimsy than crispy, which is disappointing when you want that snap and crunch. The fresh dill tartar sauce was actually tasty, just wish we had something other than the calamari to dip in it!   Shared a wedge salad that was straightforward. They didn't overdose the thing with blue cheese nor vinaigrette and were rather generous w/ the bacon. Fresh bites of this wedge salad overpowered the emotional depressant disguised as the Beer Braised Short Ribs. Sad, a salad won us over and it wasn't all that!  Toss our table next to the outer railing, where drunks, kids and families stroll by and stare at you and your food.. we've now created an all around unpleasant experience.   At least I went to a Gordon Ramsey eatery, though, we were highly disappointed.

YF5oQoG-LtEGbOduciGtIQ.text: Awsome place great food and fun employees great time Banger and mash is to die for.thank you guys for a great time

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States

El3boe5uxFzyYK5xukn4SA.text: Atrocious!!!!! The server was fine and very attentive when we came in. After ordering the food, it took forever to get it. On his recommendation I ordered the corned beef sandwich with extra crispy fries and asked for an upgrade to truffle fries-$3 extra. Best thing in the sandwich was the bread and it was soggy . The fries were limp and I had to ask if they upgraded to the truffle fries-which he said they did. NOT!!!! My husband had their signature fish and chips and it was tasteless. So the over-all meal was a fail. Gordon Ramsey is hard in the Hell's Kitchen crew-he needs to be hard in his crew.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Truffle Fries-you can tell they are truffle from the green flakes he said. Yuck!
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Corned Beef sandwich with truffle fries

_QVmx045mt2tqnm1ao-WiQ.text: Had a pot pie and sticky toffee pudding. Great conversation at the bar. Food was absolutely amazing! Definitely Ramsay all the way!

4RgOVRc7rb2biJ7dO-pufA.text: Excellent restaurant! The staff is awesome and makes you feel really welcomed. The happy hour apps are great. I recommend the nachos and corn dogs. I enjoyed my experience and the food was delish!

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States

kvF3-JXzfNAC8Y0-vg9MBw.text: Man oh man, love this f**** guy and his f**** food! Inside Caesars, one of the most fun places, not as fancy as STEAK at Paris or as casual as his Fish And Chips at the Linq promenade, but definitely more fun than both! Good for anything from a drink alone till your friends come down from their rooms to a few drinks and some good food with your friends, (the ones who came down from their rooms, the other ones you'll probably see tomorrow!). Try the Bloody Mary, it comes with slices of salami and olives, it's a meal in itself! Or just go for a Moscow mule or a beer, you can't go wrong with either! Had the Bangers and Mash, 3 different small sausages on mashed potatoes and a nice sauce with crispy fried onions. Also got the Pickle garden, probably the best pickles I've ever had (and I had a few in my life!). The bar staff is so nice and funny, we talked about our plans for the rest of the evening and I had to promise I got back to confirm that we were still OK! (kidding but that's how friendly we got there!) If you don't get to this point it means you didn't drink enough, so start working on that!

ov8j4sbEZeCB8TcggkTq7g.text: Great pub and grill! Great feel to it. My husband and I went last night for dinner. We are big fans of Gordon Ramsay's shows, but were hesitant to try one of his restaurants due to the price point. After some winnings, we opted to try it last night. It was delicious!   I had the fish and chips, which was quite substantial. I didn't even finish it. I was leery of the "mushy peas" it came with but they were quite good! The crispy fish portions were huge! At $30, it was very tasty but a tad overpriced.   Husband ordered the chicken curry ($27) and he was scraping his plate at the end of the meal.  Service was excellent!   A solid 4 stars - it's just a bit pricy for "pub and grill" fare.

eaW_uOJMUtBO5TX02OezvA.text: My family had an overall great time coming here for lunch one weekend. It was pretty busy, so service was slow at times. But it wasn't too bad considering the amount of people that were there to eat. I had the fish and chips, and they were great! It was more food than I could eat in one sitting. The decor in the restaurant was lovely. Set the atmosphere just right.

5aaPw10Oh58-4GbfrvL2Tg.text: Great lunch of fish and chips! Our server Cristopher Lee was awesome and helpful about the area and our dessert choices.  Sticky Toffee was awesome!

iimC02ehebigxK30EQKyvQ.text: Food was amazing.   We had the pigs in a blanket with hp sauce, Mac and cheese with bacon and jalapeno, chicken curry with saffron rice, sliders and beef pie.  Cocktails were delicious.  Service unfortunately was not good.  We sat at bar, 3 bartenders and all of them ignored us.  I eventually got their attention and they all thought the other was looking after us.  One guy took our order and made our first round of cocktails but then had to work the other side of bar.   I can't remember his name but he was great.  Anyway I love Gordon Ramsey's restaurants and his food is worth it.  Pricey but who cares when you're on vacation!

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States

h6Z_QGqt8qwdJF1R6BYnRQ.text: We stumbled across this place while gambling at Caesars Palace. Even though the place was busy and we did not have a reservation, we were seated fairly quickly. Being situated in Caesars Palace, you've got great people watching. The restaurant and bar are beautiful with good Energy. Service was exceptional. Both our meals and drinks were great. I feel for the prices in Las Vegas, this restaurant was very reasonably priced. Would not hesitate recommending to all!

h-cmeRH5Un6s8P87yjuQYQ.text: So many other choices in Vegas, even in Caesar's. I'd recommend something else. I've watched all the Hell's Kitchens and stuff. Ramsay would have lambasted anyone who presented food like this, with a terrible staff. Maybe it was just a bad night, but it was our night. Won't be back to any Ramsay establishment. It was way too much like a bad episode of Hell's Kitchen, with a FAT bill at the end.   We actually went out later and had a great late dinner.   Very disappointed.

mZ5K5Ho3ZfoeAVneVYs0EQ.text: Best girls night amazing dinner Rod Schaffer took the best care of us. Ask for Rod when you make your reservation that way you are guaranteed great food and Amazing dining experience!! Thanks Rod for making Nancy's Bday and Tari's engagement night best time!!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States

tM8gxPSbbFa1dJishTgFhg.text: The food here is amazing! Full of flavor. You must try the nachos!!!!! AMAZING!!!! Great ambiance, staff are nice, out waiter was Incredible and very helpful.. thank you!

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pie!! Delicious
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Best nachos EVER!!!!!

l6RjYBkjMGR6R8M2HkyWWg.text: Was looking forward to dinner as I have never been to a Gordon Ramsay restaurant.  Made a reservation and was seated promptly.  Sat there for 30 minutes and did not even have a server come over to greet us or at least say "I will be with you shortly".  Completely ignored.  Apparently, this is not uncommon at this restaurant as the people sitting next to us said that is how it was for them too.  I could tell that the table next to them were annoyed as well and had been waiting a long time to be greeted.  After 30 minutes we got up and left and went to Spago for a great meal.  I expect more from a Gordon Ramsay restaurant as this is something I would expect from any restaurant.

wDjrKiMvi84IV1O0jdbtwg.text: We should have got the shepard's pie, I think it would have been much better than the basic burger we split.  There was a legit gray hair in my ketchup too, so not cool!  I may have asked for a replacement, but as usual, my fiance grabbed the hair out of my dip and threw it on the ground, then deemed the ketchup good to go (he did this once before when I found a huge black fly on my pizza).  The service was good and the burger was not bad, but it was nothing special!!  Next time, we will go straight to Burgr and skip this place entirely.

qzs-hlGSIdXL-0bWl2S54A.text: My wife and I are big Gordon Ramsay fans, but this place was a giant disappointment. The food and service were both average at best.   - I ordered a pint of Boddington's (draught) which should have been $8. When the bill came it was $11. I asked the server why it was $11 and he said because it was a 20 oz. I am still trying to figure out how they squeezed 20 oz's of Boddington's into a pint glass. Hmmm....  - My wife ordered a diet Pepsi and it was $4. Wow!   - I ordered the Chicken Curry. It took about 25 minutes to come out and when it arrived the portion wasn't the biggest, the sauce was good, the rice was fine, but the chicken was undercooked (pink). Definitely not worth the $24 price tag.  Would I go back? No.

yjVx3YzV-6ShjGBQBWuD8Q.text: WOW What a big mistake... Had the fried Cali almost ok and Pig rapped devil eggs nasty. Bacon was cold and under cooked. Yoke tasted like vinegar.  The drinks are fine. Service was strange.. The bartender took my place setting and beer before I was finished... Must be a Ray Ray thing I guess that's his nickname... Strange uniforms.... We will not be back. To many super KOOL place other than GR Pub & Grill...

E2ZmDODUOjxhv7kqEJF_gQ.text: This place exceeded every expectation I ever imagined.  The Scottish egg appetizer was perfectly prepared with a runny yolk.The pub lamb burger was heavenly. The beef cheek sandwich was really well cooked with a nice horseradish sauce. The Bass on draft was smooth.   Coming back for dessert for tomorrow night.

1kHMifWjdafU4Xh-vL7xlA.text: Meeeh .... Went there last night for dinner, the hostess seemed uninterested. When we finally got sat, even though there were plenty of seats, it took the waitress at least 5-8minutes to acknowledge us. We ordered calamari which was great! We also got a rack of lamb, first it was over cooked so we sent it back - then it was basically raw. We ate a few bites and paid the bill. very disappointing from such a well known place.

MKfSH2agryn9K5VN5r45Yw.text: Bartenders Ray Ray & Matt were fabulous!! Great ambiance & food. Look forward to trying out dinner menu. As usual GR exceeds expectations.

RktwgL5JIrMQdINZQyUkew.text: Piercingly loud! Smokey. $128.00 fish n chips x 2 n two beers! We took server away from his post watching gamblers. Next night Voodoos! 180 degrees!

TUwAPTFylXbNbKBLb6MYAA.text: Just have to say happy hour is he best time to go! The apps are amazing and the service was outstanding! We had a very attentive server followed by a manager that came around after the food was delivered assuring us to find him personally if we had any concerns. First time in Vegas and will not be my last, look forward to eating there again and receiving the same great service.

OET7Urm703tOoBM3Un1Rtg.text: I love this place and love Gordon (please hire me):))) just kidding ok. The food we ordered was amazing. I ordered a lot of items just because I wanted to taste as much Gordon's food as possible. All I can say he didn't disappoint me at all. The food and service were great!!! Thank you for the beautiful dinner!!!!

UOnxTqP02cA8-KG1Qm8VjA.text: I'm flabbergasted. I love Gordon Ramsey on TV. He comes across as having such high standards for taste, presentation and quality on his show. But all I saw was over priced, over hyped, bland food. My friend had the shepards pie and she didn't finish it because it was too gamey- and she loves lamb. I had the duck poutine and the fries were like McDonalds fries, the duck was almost imperceptible, the curds were barely existent, and the gravy was on the side and totally watery. It was a total disappointment. Fortunately the chocolate mousse dessert was good, but it couldn't make up for an incredibly disappointing meal.

Q_MowYLZZuQEEi74amZ4_Q.text: This local had the WORST EXPERIENCE DINING EVER here on Saturday night.  Mr. Ramsay, you need to spend some time at this place; it has your name on it and if your shows are real then you would be ashamed of this place.  My wife and I had a reservation at 8:30.  We showed up at 8:25 and were seated immediately.  By 8:35 we had ordered and had our beers were on the way.  Her onion soup and my tomato salad show up at about 8:40, along with the complimentary bread.  The soup and salad were outstanding.  We drink our beers, and talk, and wait, and wait, and wait and wait.  The waiter came by at 9:20, the only time he came by, to offer his apologize saying the kitchen was backed up due to large groups and our food was up next.  (My problem why?)  That was interesting considering the side of the restaurant we were on was half empty.  He did not offer to refill our nearly empty beers or water too.  At 9:45, I was ready to leave, but low and behold, our waiter reappears with our food.  My wife and I both ordered the Mix Fillet, with Yukon gold potatoes and sauteed mushrooms as the sides.  Well, the steak was lukewarm, the pork was room temperature, and the mushrooms were room temperature and the egg on top was not fully cooked.  But the potatoes were good and so were the two shrimp that come with the mixed fillet.  My wife and I were both ticked, asked a bus boy and another waitress to see the manger, who shows up 10 minutes later.  Mark the manager offers us a free desert, which we decline and I ask for the bill, letting him know this was the worst dining experience we have had in Las Vegas and will be telling all of our guest, friends, family, and coworkers about it.  He offers to comp us a dinner and asks if we want to make that reservation now.  We flatly say no; I don't want to waste another attempt at a meal at this place given all the great places to eat in Las Vegas.  We finally left at 10:00 and when we rolled into the hotel we had some fruit and ice cream which were more satisfying.

8Fha0sFhQPoVAhs9ibECSA.text: I really liked this place! I came because my husband had come with a friend during Nascar Weekend and raved about the lamb burger. The lamb burger I had was amazing! I also hadn't eaten any real food for about two days (We were there for a convention) so I got the carrots and brussel sprouts for a side and they were perfect and al dente and very flavorful! I can't wait to go again!

Zh-oY7L5i4GKggt1fmJNZg.text: Great food - miserable service.  The food is outstanding and reasonably priced for a brand name chef restaurant on The Strip.  The service was slow and inattentive.  Not a positive experience even wit wonderful dishes.

wgpLpwQrnCjSz_PB9YhLdQ.text: Sadly, no local beers, but the bartenders are local and they rock:  personable, attentive and engaging.  What also rocks here is the music selection: Smiths, REM, Ramones. I sat at the bar and had the chicken breast. It was simple, tasty, and exactly what I was looking for: something that emphasized the protein over superflurous carbs. I'll be back.

Sn9vifoVtuAuDGemFlJbBw.text: Atmosphere and service good.  Food average to below average.  Price for 1 calamari appetizer, 2 burgers w/fries, chips w/fries, 4 drinks, and 1 beer came to $118 before tip.   I'm hardly an expert but these basic entrees had little flavor.  Mr. Ramsay, this restaurant needs help!

ih2PkUHlfJsdivi4ktt0Pw.text: Been here a couple times now and love it!  Server Sara was awesome! Order the pesto chicken sandwich each time and it is amazing!!! Great food, service and atmosphere!!!!!!!!

b2fmw5f9bMGBtu6RxFdQkg.text: I've been here a while ago. Lovely decor and interesting cocktails. I had some seared scallops, oysters, and truffle fries etc. Delicious but not very memorable and a tad pricy for me. It's a pub so it was very loud. Suitable for casual dinner with friends and families though.

ZxvohOPq5Y_PVjPw6kJkXQ.text: Worst service ever. I eat out a lot and have not seen something like this before. Came around lunchtime, didn't have breakfast, so I asked our waiter Adam if they have mimosas. He said yes and then went to ask how much they were since he didn't know when I asked. That's fine. Unfortunately it took him about 15 minutes to come back with the info. It was $10, so I rather ordered a glass of sparkling. Then we ordered our food. Deviled eggs as appetizer, tomato sandwich and shepherd's pie as entrees. The time we ordered our food was the last time we saw our waiter (until he brought the bill). The entrees came about 20 min later - but no appetizer. Our waiter walked by a few tables from us about five times - but looking in the other direction the whole time. He never came by to see if we were okay. It really seemed like he could not care less. The place was not busy at all - everywhere were waiters and hostesses standing around. I got up to go to the bar and ask for salt and pepper. Then finished the meal. The food was basic and okay. The service was just awful.  So when he brought the bill, I finally got a chance to tell our waiter that we never got the appetizer. All he said was that we weren't charged for it and pointed to the bill. Ridiculous. Don't go there. They don't treat you like they want your business - at all.

Z8qcl38HguuAXRs34K1kSg.text: My wife and I decided to try out the Gordon Ramsay Pub and Grill since we are local fans of his.  We were very pleased with Burgr at the Planet Hollywood and figured we would be equally pleased here.  Overall we really wanted to like the place but were disappointed and will not return, especially after the surreal experience towards the end of our stay.  We didn't have to wait to long to get in (30 minutes and my wife won some decent coin on the slots beforehand).  Our server was not very knowledgeable about the beer selection or other items on the menu (as we were about to find out).  My wife wanted to get a beer comparable to Stella Artois (something we could justify spending $10 on) but the server could not help us identify a similar beer since we were unfamiliar with some of the brands and figured he was.  We ended up ordering sodas and water instead.  Probably a wise choice considering the cost.  I ordered the bangers and mash and my wife ordered the onion soup and the mac and cheese.  I enjoyed the sausage links (made in-house) but felt the potatoes were a bit overdone with cream and butter.  My wife liked the onion soup but felt that there was only one tiny slice of french bread on the top and not the normal amount of bread usually served with this soup.  The taste of the mac and cheese was pretty good yet the noodles were very underdone.  They were about 3-4 minutes away from being al dente.  When my wife brought this up to our server (she has professional kitchen and culinary training), he said "yes, the noodles are supposed to be al dente", and that was it.  It was a weird exchange.  It was too bad the noodles were too gummy because the rest of it was pretty tasty.  I had never had rhubarb before, so my wife ordered the rhubarb cobbler from the menu.  After about 15 minutes, our server came to us and said the item had been 86'd from the menu but they were making some more "downstairs".  My wife (a former employee of Caesars/Harrahs) asked about the other desserts and found that they come from the downstairs bakery that provides pastries for other eateries in the casino.  We were very disappointed with this news.  The desserts might be Ramsay's recipes or they might not be (it wasn't clear to us), but the fact that they were being mass-produced in the downstairs bakery rather than in-house upset us a little.  Nothing against the people who work in the bakery at Caesar's (they make some delicious pastry), but for a fine dining experience you would expect to get your dessert made in house at the prices being charged.  After 15 more minutes they delivered the cobbler, yet the cobbler they delivered was a peach cobbler.  She again notified our server, and this is where it got bizarre.  He argued that it was indeed rhubarb (a different kind of rhubarb at that) mixed with other fruits.  My wife was flabbergasted, as was I.  She knows the difference between a rhubarb and a peach and was offended that our server tried to convince us otherwise.  I have no experience with rhubarb myself, yet I know it is reddish-purple because I see it at the store.  I also know what a peach looks like, and it looked and tasted exactly like the fruit that was in the cobbler.  There wasn't a shred of red or purple anywhere in that cobbler, just straight up yellow.  After we left, I looked up a picture of rhubarb cobbler and it was bright red and purple.  We sent the cobbler back and they did not charge us for it.  Afterwards the manager came to us and apologized for the mix-up, yet still carried the viewpoint that it was a different kind of rhubarb.  I mean, enough already.  It was peach.  End of story.    Long story short we wanted to like the place, but were disappointed and slightly offended that they kind of thought we were dum-dums in the great rhubarb/peach debate.  Good thing Gordon Ramsay has a good burger place in town to fall back on.

kc27ew7qRAIXOdUO4xQaBw.text: Good food. Not so great cook (all but one of our 6 burgers were the wrong temp). Horrible service (waitress yelled at us for no reason).

OLnoa-QjmpHAOQCK118Saw.text: Ambience was trendy, Food was good, overpriced, but the service was AWFUL.  (Dear Bryan, we didn't stiff you.  10% was overtipping for the attitude that you brought.)  From the second we sat down till the moment we had to ask for our check, we were a bother. There were FIVE long legged girls working the hostess counter but only saw THREE waiters in the entire restaurant.  And it wasn't lack of experience.  He brought the Gordon Ramsay "you're an idiot" attitude to all of his tables.  So if you want to be treated like a moron for asking if the toffee pudding is good and being told that it's like "EVERY OTHER toffee pudding in normal restaurants, "scoff" then go somewhere else.  After 5 years of waiting tables, I don't complain.  This experience was the exception.

7TFmwXmhHy1ooAyESDqU4Q.text: As a Las Vegas local I usually don't go on the strip to eat unless there is a special occasion, but we had a room on the strip and did our research as far as price goes, we were not trying to spend a huge amount of money.  We decided on Gordon Ramsay's Pub and Grill. The atmosphere was great but the food was not great at all.  Over priced Fish & Chips and very small portions for the price.  When we got back to our hotel I became ill and was sick for the rest of the night.  My Significant Other did not get sick till the next morning.  We do not recommend this place.

ZYt9T8PlBU0On5vpyldt9w.text: Shepherds pie was good,as was the mushy peas,  fish and chips was so so, fish was good but the big block/logs chips were not. We didn't get our drink order till half way through our dinner. Thankfully the waiter did comp our drinks for the poor service. So that made up for it.

Vs9ewYix6FzAqL2HrIgG4g.text: Should have checked yelp before going! Horrible service. We waited a good 20 minutes before anyone came to greed us. 30 more seconds and I was ready to walk out - wish I kinda wish I had. Again took the server forever to bring our drinks. Didn't even bring the basket of bread until AFTER our main entree already came (although the bread tasted good, unfortunately it was too late for it). I had a salad which was ok. My fiance had the burger which he said "sucked". His entree plate had a little container that was supposed to have ketchup in it but it was empty. Took them another 5 mins to bring that out... Just not what you are looking for sitting at a restaurant. You want to relax and have a good time. Not spend the entire night waiting on your service. I could tell the people sitting at table next to us were having the same issues - their eyes were wondering around looking for the waiters. When the check came, we didn't bother paying by card, just left some cash and got out! Disappointed.

gUhY7s99VLoL08OcrJ7GSA.text: Gordon Cmon mate.  You have a show to tell people how to run a restaurant and this place is a joke.  While food was decent, service speed was horrible.  You should be ashamed to have your name on this place.  The place was 30% occupied at 830 on Monday night and it took 25 min to get our drinks.  Took equally long to get second round which showed up when dinner was finished.  Our bill could have been twice as large and we had a party of 8.  Get off of your high horse and run your business!!

IhjmCpE2bme9rSEbLUhD6Q.text: Awesome awesome awesome food! I had the fish and chips and my wife had the ny strip and it was amazing! Chef Scott is super friendly and down to earth. Just an awesome chef and very deserving winner of Hell's Kitchen. The whole experience was amazing and we will be coming back many many times!

PGsyloD5Yk2WvFgZOOofbg.text: Went here because I love Gordon Ramsey.  Ordered the shrimp cocktail which was amazing and the best thing we had to eat there.  I also had the bacon burger...no toppings so don't expect any LTP or O because they don't have them.  We also had the 12oz ribeye with peppercorn sauce...let me just say it was pretty horrible.  Cooked right, but the flavor just wasn't there.  Our waitress was amazing and the drinks she recommended to us were perfect.  The atmosphere was my favorite, unfortunately I won't be going back for meals anytime soon.

zUooTPaQbKMWimerQbLSvg.text: I had the beef burger which had an odd flavor.  My son had the Shepard's Pie which was cold under the potatoes and again with a strange flavor.  I'm not sure if there is a herb that they use in the meat but it's very off putting.   The servings are small and the small plate is more like a bite.  Service was good but it's to expensive for what you get.  I would probably go again for a beer at the bar since there is an amazing selection of beers and the pretzels are delicious!

NAA2iIZv7_--dAm9GGNIIw.text: My girlfriend and I just finished our meal here (as in haven't even received the check yet). Absolutely incredible food. I had the Scottish Salmon with a potato puree side and she the Lamb Shank. Both were phenomenal; even my beer burps afterwards are delicious. Service was quick and pleasant. I will recommend this place to anyone, and we can't wait to visit again.

Mb5nEq0FzwvDMpEVf-H1cA.text: Way over priced for the amount of food served. Our bill was double that of a great restaurant and food wasn't that good. Service was horrible I sat waiting for tarter sauce and I had ate all my fries during that time. Also NO SALT OR PEPPER ON ANY TABLE. I would suggest the Yard House right by the high roller much better food and reasonable.

aDhWJj1NmnIg8qPfcuoA8w.text: My husband and I are big Ramsay fans and while visiting Vegas decided to eat at all 3 of his restaurants. This one was our favorite by far.  The service was phenomenal and the food was great too! Our waiter and who ever the other server was were outstanding.  They took time to talk and joke with us.   Definitely a place we will come back too! Bottom line: great food and great customer service.

4jzQq3PwDidjYdlT77hemQ.text: We stopped here after seeing Jerry Seinfeld and as we expected there was a wait, and it would be an hour. We returned about 40 minutes later and the friendly hostess remembered us and had our table ready.  The dining room was very dark. I had asked our waitress what kind of beers were available and she put an iPad at the table to scroll through and walked away.  It was a bit awkward since she didn't tell me if I was to follow the directions and select my choice, or if she was to do that.  She was a bit slow to return, but was very knowledgable of the menu and our drinks arrived quickly.  I ordered the Yorkshire Fish and Chips and my son had the Bacon Wrapped Shrimp.  We were then served warm soft pretzels with a cheese spread and a mini loaf of bread with whipped butter. Honestly, I could have just had the pretzels and been perfectly happy.  Our meal arrived and my son's shrimp were huge. Usually I'm worried they won't be flavorful when they are so jumbo, but these were great. Cooked just right, and I didn't try the sauce they were in, but he loved it all.  The fish and chips were very good. Nothing extraordinary, but I did notice they were less oily than most. The tartar sauce was the best I've had, and I don't usually care for tartar sauce. I eagerly tried what I thought was cocktail sauce in the other ramekin and was disappointed that it was just ketchup.  I really wished there was malt vinegar offered for my fries, but by the time anyone was available for me to ask, I was already too full to be able to eat them, so I didn't bother.  Even though our sever was slow, she was very friendly and I assume that the disorganized atmosphere was due to it just being open a few days.  The prices were in line with most Vegas casino dining. We would eat there again.

R1p2lXRPQavILrsQGhAiFA.text: We've eaten here twice so far (both times selecting from the grill menu) and each experience has been different. Speaking to others that have dined here, it seems that your experience depends a lot on the server that you get. Both times the food was outstanding, but our first visit was somewhat dulled by the lackluster performance of our server.  Our first visit was a weekday afternoon. We arrived just before 5:00 and it wasn't that busy--plenty of empty seats. We were told it would be about 15 minutes--strange since there were plenty of tables available. The hostesses are dressed in some sort of strange/tacky newsprint style dress that really isn't flattering. It seemed like everyone except the hostesses were busy--they were mostly standing around at the front kiosk chatting with each other.  It only took about 5 minutes to find us a table. The waiter stopped by after a few minutes, dropped off an iPad, and told us to order our drinks through it. No problem, except that it's for alcoholic drinks only and Brenda wanted an iced tea. BTW, you don't order off the iPad, you just browse--what a waste of a perfectly good paperweight. Brenda ordered the Braised Pork Belly with Sauteed Asparagus and I had the Filet Mixed Grill with sides of Creamed Spinach and Smashed Fingerling Potatoes. No starters, but we did snack on the delicious pretzel bread with butter and a cheese sauce. The cheese sauce was nothing spectacular, but the bread was warm and soft and went great with the English butter they brought out.   From the time we placed our order until the food arrived was about 20 minutes.  Brenda's iced tea finally arrived after the meal was served. The pork belly was delicious--just the right amount of crispiness without being overdone. The asparagus was done to perfection as well. The lemon zest and thyme went perfectly with the sweetness of the asparagus. I had pork belly with my meal, but it just wasn't the same as Brenda's. It was a smaller piece and it seemed it was cooked just a bit too long. Still had the good flavor, but it was just a bit dry. The filet was OK, nothing to rave about, but at least when I ordered it mid-rare, it came that way. The shrimp weren't bad, but I just don't think you can get really fresh, good shrimp in Las Vegas. For me, the stars of the meal were the two sides. The creamed spinach with stilton cheese was perfectly seasoned and really complimented the flavor of the pork belly. The fingerling potatoes had black truffle with small chunks of British double cream. I could have eaten two servings of these.   We finally got to see our waiter again when he brought us the check. He didn't ask if we wanted dessert or an after dinner drink. Small tip for this bozo.  All in all, it wasn't a bad experience. The food was as good as we expected, but the front of house staff turned what should have been an enjoyable dining experience into a mediocre one.  Our second visit was much better than the first. We made reservations for 6:30 on a Friday evening to take our friends out for dinner. We were greeted warmly and waited less than a minute for the next available hostess to take us to our table.. It was a nice table away from the bustle of the casino with deep, comfortable chairs. Our waiter was there almost immediately and we were given the menus along with the useless iPad.  We placed our drink orders and before they were there our waiter was ready to take our order.  This visit we had two orders of the Braised Beef Cheek, one Fish and Chips, and I ordered the Grilled Rack of Lamb, replacing the olive oil crushed potatoes the great fingerling potatoes I had last time. Since we passed on starters, we continued snacking on the bread while we waited for the food to arrive. Very busy this night, but the staff didn't seem to be as disorganized as during our first visit.  Like the last trip, the food was amazing and as before, Brenda picked the better meal. The beef cheeks simple melted in your mouth and the sauce was so rich and tasty, I wanted to dip some of my lamb rack into it. The plate of fish and chips was huge. The batter was crispy without overcooking the fish and the tarragon tartar sauce complimented it well. My lamb rack was cooked perfectly to a medium rare with a nice sear on the outside. The rosemary lamb sauce was tasty without having that overpowering rosemary flavor or odor. All during the dinner, the staff was attentive, refilling our drinks and water glasses. We definitely didn't suffer through the poor service we had the last time around.  This trip we all had dessert and each picked something different to try. Steph had the Potted Triple Chocolate Trifle which she enjoyed, but couldn't finish because of her large portion of fish and chips. Joe had the Spotted Dog (a bread pudding) which was tasty and quickly devoured. Brenda, who loves rhubarb, had the Rhubarb Cobbler. I had the Sticky Toffee Pudding, which I first had at GR Steak, and it was just as good and a few bucks cheaper.

X40Fp21l1j8fvhyVsW73Jg.text: My wife and I decided to go on a little stay-cation for our anniversary, as we live in Las Vegas! Obsessed with Gordon Ramsay's Hell's Kitchen, we wanted to dine in one of his restaurants for the special occasion and the Pub & Grill did not disappoint. We were greeted with a smile and seated promptly. The manager came over to say hello and the waiter was to us in a timely manner. John, our server was quick and never left the plates on the tables or drinks needing to be filled. We were torn as to what to select as the menu was amazing. John helped with some suggestions. We started with the calamari, which was tender and had great flavor. I had the Ribeye and it was cooked to perfection. My wife's entree of the double lamb chops had her cleaning off the bone! We shared with our entree what will be the item that makes us crave to return, the Lobster Mac and Cheese! Spectacular with its large chunks of lobster! We ended the night not being to tell John no to some toffee sticky pudding and we will not regret it! Worth every last bite. I would suggest anyone in the Las Vegas area check out Ramsay's Pub in Caesars.

jNoqXPL5tGEfvpHhz8fwCg.text: Went here for dinner during a friend's Bachelorette Party. The staff were amazing. We had made a reservation and were extremely late because we got lost several times. When we arrived, the place was packed and there was probably a 45min wait, which we had no time for since we had plans to attend a show after. The host took us right away after realizing we had a bride to be in the midst and did so with the biggest smile on her face! The restaurant had great energy, good decor and a was a fun place to hang out with my girls. I ordered the Goodbye Blue Sky drink to start, which was ever so yummy! For dinner I had the braised short ribs. They were extremely tender and the side of truffle fries were to die for. Last but not least, I couldn't leave without trying the Sticky Toffee Pudding, which I first saw Chef Ramsey make on Masterchef and I must say, it was one of the best desserts I've ever had. We got it to go and I ate it on the way to the car. My feet were hurting like no other, but once I took a bite of that pudding, all of my worries just floated away and I was on cloud 9. I will definitely be returning next time I'm in Vegas for this dessert. My meal was roughly $80, which is pretty steep, but it was well worth it!

QgBIX5XukOIqCdLydJfxfg.text: I was expecting a night of great food and fun. We had recently eaten at Chef Ramsey in Hollywood and it was the best food I had ever experienced. The Pub and Grill was overly crowded and the wait staff was over worked. The scallops were bland and the risotto was crunchy. An extremely disappointing meal. Try a chain restaurant and save yourself a hundred dollars.

gJtkyalSvYiaABB4pf7WGg.text: Disappointing experience, I didn't like the food or the service there. Despite the fact that it is over priced for pub food, I was expecting something different, something tasty, unfortunately it wasn't good

Wd985pQ1GRyK06F7pkcLSw.text: We dined here this past Saturday. Our server was Taylor, who was great. We were unsure of what to eat and he took time to recommend what he thought was excellent choices for us. He was very attentive. Great service makes a meal for me. The food was excellent too. I will be back for sure. Highly recommended. Good drink selections too.

sH5is-oL4Zt5yXemc_l5oQ.text: The food was delicious!  The mac and cheese was my favorite.  However, we were at our table for almost 15 minutes before anyone acknowledged us. The server that ended up getting our order and drinks wasn't even our server - our server wandered up about 10 minutes later and made a comment about how the helpful server wasn't suppose to be with our table. I did enjoy the # of TVs around - I was able to catch up on multiple games during the meal.

fiS5Ql64aHkuAk8RDB_AiA.text: Way over priced but attentive service. Inventive menu items, but not so spectacular that it would justify the price point. I mean $11 for a pint of Miller lite is crazy even for the casinos. That said it is worth checking out. They have interesting and varied seating arrangements. We sat on a couch and had dinner. That was great! The steaks are too big at around 14 ounces, but it is high quality cuts of meat. That said, they dropped from 4 to 3 stars because my wife's burger came with a slice of tomorrow that had a stem on it. Gordon would have lost it for that alone I think.

l2Tsdf2dJh_y_O3RKy-kfA.text: Good stuff!. We came here Friday night during my sister's bachelorette weekend.  Our server was extremely fun and attentive and we were able to get in and out fairly quickly to get to a show. We all ordered the steak and fries and enjoyed it. The drinks were expensive though, we each got one and decided to wait until after dinner to get more drinks elsewhere. Inside was buzzing with big groups, so looks like a good spot to bring a big party. It was loud and had good energy. Overall would recommend, make reservations, it was busy.

RfC4dmnEGdkc8VyYicTYpA.text: We grabbed a last minute reservation at the Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill.  There weren't many places available on short notice, so this seemed like a good option.  I had pan seared salmon which had a nice sear and good flavor.  It wasn't bad, but nothing I would rush back for.  My three dining companions all ordered the beer braised short ribs.  Their feedback ranged from mediocre to 'awful'.  The risotto was consistently undercooked and the meet was quite fatty (even by short rib standards).    Overall this restaurant might work in a pinch, but for the price (entrees ran around $30), there are numerous better options on the strip.

Au7MG4QlAxqq9meyKSQmaw.text: So my boyfriend and I came here for my birthday ; I have been wanted to try this place since it has opened big fan of Gordon watch him in Hell's Kitchen so I couldn't imagine so where better to celebrate my birthday. Daisy was my server she is so sweet knows the menu very well and suggested great items I didn't even really have to look at the menu I had some fruity cocktail it was very refreshing and her server asst. helped by cleaning items off table and refilling our waters. I got the ribeye medium it was so good ! I ate all it's served with potatoes and my boyfriend had the chicken pot pie chicken was very juicy and gravy was top notch! She suggested the sticky toffee to top it all off it's the best dessert I have ever had I still dream about it served with a vanilla ice cream. I will be back !!!! Thank you daisy for making my birthday special

C6sgitEn8KSLswUuiTaGzQ.text: Absolutely an amazing place to eat. The average price per person (without bar drinks) is about $30-40. If you eat here, know that some of the best food on the menu is some of the more humble options, like the sandwiches, etc. I would prefer the blt to the steak. Also, GET DESSERT! It is so good. Especially the trifle.

mwvqsRAVEHQgvyOxPDEgrw.text: My boyfriend and I love this place! We LOVED the  Randy!!! He was so personable and accomodating. The place was packed but Randy spent time with each table, he made sure we were satisfied and came by more than once. It's always nice when someone besides the waiter cares. We will definitely be back to see him and have dinner! Thanks Randy for such an enjoyable night!

XWbOW7WxQxSyzX6I5fbEGg.text: Did not reach my expection. Since this is a grill own by Gordon Ramsay.Kidna Disappionted.Especially the scotch egg, curry chicken.They are really.just o-Kay...Probaby won't go there anymore.

d7WqC7YcIJiBo7mycO0bmQ.text: Adam in the bar is AMAZING!! You have to go sit with him and get their version of a mint julep OR a Ramsay tonic!!! So so good! And their deviled eggs appetizer! OMG must go.

uvwCOYM1uTm1tTJtQc-9kw.text: was looking forward to eating at a Gordan Ramsay restaurant. it was mediocre IMO. the staff was mostly awesome, they were very attentive and came by frequently to fill water and take drink orders. but actually getting food was really slow. it took about 1 hour for them to take orders and another hour to get the food.  IMO, the food was, ehhh. IMO I was a bit disappointed. we had a B-day girl in our party and the staff just dropped off the desert and left. no showman ship at all. The desert was really delicious. I hate to say it, the $20+ burger i got was ehh. nothing to rave about. i would not recommend this restaurant considering the price vs taste.

EoH8yyK_XzRmkRuMaDUWJg.text: Having been to Vegas many times for business and pleasure, I have had my share of good and bad eats. Reading the reviews - the Fish and Chips are "AMAZING," I am not sure where these people have had fish and chips before, or maybe the Chef forgot to drain the grease from the fish before plating - in any case - not impressed. Two of the Three Filets were a bit overcooked, and the Third Fillet was dripping with grease, which left a pool into my Mushy Peas.  Service - meh. Typical Vegas, seat you when available, give you a beverage menu, return 10 mins later, take the beverage order, and if you are not ready to order your grub, then be ready to wait at least another 10-20 minutes to order when your beverages arrive. At one point I am pretty sure our Server was too concerned with her co-workers conversations instead of our table with empty glasses and dirty plates.  Reccomendations if feeling the need to experience - the soft warm pretzel appetizer (best spicy mustard!), and the Pear Cider was a winner too!  Our Bill for a party of Two (we shared) - Pretzel App, Fish and Chips, and 1 Pear Cider = $52.00 Not worth it.

8B2ieCB2Ocl9cpGV06iSVw.text: Went with the expected, fish and chips.  Fish was great, not greasy, cooked perfectly. Light crispy outside flaky inside. Fries were very tasty. Will definitely come back, wish I had ordered the bread pudding....next time. Was Crowded, noisy,fun atmosphere. Service was quick. Food hot. We did not have reservations.

8nu6irhkxEvGkNhDUo9DqA.text: Food was good but portions were small and expensive for what you got. $22 for a pot pie.  Thought it would be larger but about the same size as a frozen Swansons. Got five medium scallops and 3 out of the 5 clams had no clams in it. I know vegas is expensive but this was too much.

nvJ0EoV4bScsEtszaww-GA.text: I will be straight forward with this review. Being that it was our wedding anniversary, my wife and i decided to try out the Pub and Grill. It was not up to par from what I expected it to be. I will start off with the server. First of all, he was not very friendly and I felt the attention was not there. Took 15 minutes to come back and ask us what we would like to order after he brought our drinks, considering there were only 2 other customers he was tending to. Once we received our meal I asked for a second beer, he replied he would get that for me..10 minutes later, I reminded him about my beer, his answer "yes I know, I need to go get it" Really? I am dropping at least $100 for our meal and you answer me like that? The burger was good but not excellent for being a Gordon Ramsay restaurant. I was expecting a big juicy burger, but it was compared to maybe a Red Robin burger, and I am being generous. I will not come back here again only because the service was so bad.

7YrW_MTwK1HQ347pMwqTQQ.text: Stopped there about a month ago as we toured Caesar's.  My wife ordered the fish and chips.  This was perhaps the worst food I have seen in a restaurant.  Nothing is worse than fish where the breading is thicker than the fish.  Biting through 1/4" of soggy breading to get to 1/8" of fish is disgusting.  I would not feed this to the people in Guantanamo Bay...this would be torture!!!!  On top of that I had to pay $30.00 for this!  Perhaps someone should yell at Gordon Ramsey and call his food s**t like he does on television.  Stay away from this place.

LVCO7HqeOERGA-LZHZsqnw.text: This place is disappointing. They needed up our order three times and was not willing to substitute items in our entree when they clearly told is they ran out of. For example we had a burger and it was supposed to come with a dill pickle and pepperchini garnish. All they said was they ran out and that's it. I thought most restaurants would substitute something for that. It's a $20 burger that's worth $9 after this experience. Also the wait took an hour wait. Will not come back. Gordon better come back and fix this.

ots-fhjymi60cyhbtXOUtg.text: I had dinner here Friday night, we had Calamari, Hells Kitchen Burger was the bomb , and sticky toffee pudding was delicious !The Good Bye Blue Sky blew my mind! What a good drink! We met Louie and Randy the managers and they were very cordial. We will be back!!!

iTxM8XtA5IWvG8SZHVcsLA.text: We came here for their Super Bowl party.  Such a good time!  The food was tasty, service friendly and the beer kept on flowing!  Ask for RayRay at the bar, he will take great care of you!

8kEZ3gm3jZ38VpGT0sCo5g.text: 'If you don't spot by this place the next time you're in Vegas... consider yourself a f*ckin donkey'. Service was okay but the food was great (a little bit on the heavy side). This place is better then Ramsey's spot in The London Hotel in LA

WJhkSG6fSMb3aZj7fv7ySg.text: We came in for happy hour for a snack. We ordered all but one of their appetizers. The nachos were my husband's favorite and the pretzels were mine. Even though each app was only $5 each, 1 1/2 deviled eggs & 1 pig in a blanket felt way overpriced. And they were discounted for happy hour so they were less expensive than usual. The accompanying sauces were good. Wouldn't go back though unless Gordon Ramsey sent me a personal invitation. Service was nothing special.

p3Y27B3zx7VvjGrYZjqDDg.text: We did family style and ordered the chicken, fish and chips, mac n cheese, and lamb burger.  For me, I would just go back for the fish and chips. Everything else was just mediocre. However, for lunch it was quite expensive. The waiter was nice. Not sure if I would come back.

dHdtStGlAPglVyBF66KJ2g.text: Gordon Ramsay pub and grill is a really great restaurant with a fair price too( spent $60 with tip 2meals and drink). First thing that came in my mind is it being expensive because of the name of course but no and they have different types of food and so many options to choose from but I bet that whatever you choose it's the best thing. The waiter help me decide what to get which was the kettle nachos and those were the best nachos I've ever had and it's coming from a person who doesn't like nachos at all. The cheese is different and all the stuff it has combined so perfectly from the bell peppers to the meat. One of the best drinks I had in Vegas is their bye blue sky.

0f1pzzqD1ivGsJOwrDucGw.text: Really like this place, sat at the bar by myself, got the shrimp & lobster roll and the Caesar salad. The bartender was super friendly and when I lamented that I should have brought my laptop to work, he let me go upstairs to grab it to do some work while I was eating. He also recommended that I check in to get the sticky toffee pudding.  I'd recommend all the food I got, it was really delicious. The Caesar salad was perfect with white anchovies, fresh shaved parmasean, creamy dressing, crispy housemade croutons & fresh romaine lettuce. The shrimp & lobster roll was a little on the small side, but was an appetizer after all, but all in all very good, fresh chunks of lobster & shrimp with some celery and mayo on a buttery roll with a few micro greens on the top. The sticky toffee pudding really topped off my meal, really meant for at least 2 people, but really decadent and caramelly.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Delicious Sticky toffee pudding!!!

pA05OS_zSYT_Lj76tXEdtw.text: Nong was awesome and very attentive at the bar. The appetizers were amazing! Great job :)

7UBgvsro_4PPtmoR847h3Q.text: Great food, great service, our server Scott was awesome.  Definitely be eating here again

koY4jISxGJQAiDHArgbY6A.text: Service was outstanding! Our server's name was Sara. She was so sweet and helpful. We got a bunch of small bites to share. The nachos, lobster Mac and cheese, lobster rolls, calamari and a Bloody Mary. Everything was yummy!

hJ0o2SLQXoO25N8o9SKoxg.text: Trendy place, of course you will get a great service ! I know this is a restaurant from a well recognized chef , but I have been to several places from Gordon Ramsey and this is by far my favorite one . From the beginning the greet you and you feel welcome ! I believe our Sever name was Lisa. I mean she was perfect ! She asked us about any allergies , if we have been to the place before , as we didn't she asked us how we were enjoying Vegas then she started with the drinks and our food . I had the burger and my wife had the tomato soup and fish and chips ! Just as expected , tender fish, fresh fresh fries and of course the burger was on point. You can tell they pay attention to detail . The decoration is amazing from the silver ware to the beer barrels and the restrooms . Try the fish and chips and ask for Lisa!!!! You won't regret it .. it's pricey but worth it.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States

1DkhZgwWiVypn0Im4abhhg.text: It's funny, if Gordon Ramsey goes around and critics other restaurants, perhaps he needs to spend little time at this place, and QC the food quality.  I ordered a chicken and shrimp salad, and the quality and ingredients were low quality and cheap, I could find 2 slices of tiny chicken and shrimp on my salad. There are much better options in Vegas than this place.

Jxkf8uKy-dkthegbIctQ3A.text: My fiance and I came here for lunch a few days after we got married in Vegas, it was so good and our server Rodney was amazing! He recommended drinks, food, we had sliders which were delicious and I don't eat bacon but I ate every bite. He even gave us a free sticky toffee pudding at the end of our meal which was the best dessert I have ever had. Definitely come here and see him!

KOy0HlwMRs9T1ywf1o19ow.text: All I can say is BOMB! Went here for a family dinner and was not disappointed. Server and staff were super nice. My sister didn't like her drink selection and they had no problem taking care of that for us at no extra charge. 3 guests of our party did one of the pri fixe menus and they loved every single bite. The beef Wellington was spot on and no one had had anything like it before. I personally had the prime rib and OMG! My mouth was in heaven. The only reason I'm giving a 4 star review and not a five is the portion size of the sides, they were a tad smaller than I had expected. But.. don't let stop you from trying this Gordon Ramsay restaurant.

Ou2DX-5vmVsXAc8sT9g1Xg.text: OMG ... I just had to send back a Gordon Ramsey dish (Roasted Scottish Salmon) for being under cooked!!! Round TWO was spot on. And a shout out to our server (Taylor) he was AMAZING!!! Oh, and definitely recommend the Jumbo Shrimp appetizer. My husband wanted something on the lighter side after the James Taylor concert (two thumbs up). He wanted the Roasted Tomato Soup with a grilled cheese. Our server, Taylor (he rocks twice), pointed out that the toasted cheese and basil bread was their take on a grilled cheese. LOVED IT!!!

xLAGk0bDPkiCBSSxtd7lmg.text: The Beef Wellington, Shepard's pie, and short ribs were amazing. The potatoes were incredibly bland and needed salt desperately- not salt on table to help. It tasted like they just cooked a potato and spooned it into the plate with nothing added.   The waiter was ok. He hovered and rushed us even though the restaurant was pretty empty.

dztXF1s5R_XInMx-rNKtpg.text: Came in on a recommendation for fish and chips. I didn't look at the menu being it was suggested to go for the fish and chips. So the three us ordered them. Two pieces of lightly battered fish. Cooked just right and very good. The not so good, chips (steak fries) not hot and soggy. Also came with some peas. Two of the three of us received soupy peas with a minty flavor. My other friend received peas that were the consistency of mud. Then we got the bill. $30 each for two pieces of batter fried cod, some soggy steak fries and some inconsistent minty flavored peas. It was a long hot day and the three of just had water. The bill for the three of us? $125 with the tip. Like I said the fish was very good but the sides? Not what I'd expect at Gordon Ramsay.

7UX2phzBSh9Leaqara5txg.text: Well, I was ready for anything but wanted to see for myself whether the famed Gordon Ramsay could produce Fish & Chips that would justify a high price for them.  I received that and more!  "Pricey" is an appropriate term here.  After three appetizers, an order of Onion Soup, and two orders of Fish & Chips, an Iced Tea, tax, and tip, I walked out with my wallet $165 lighter.  But it was $165 well spent.  I rate restaurants mainly on food taste and according to their type--not on how costly they might be.  And for a pub & grill, Gordon Ramsey delivered great quality and taste on everything I sampled.  Plus, the atmosphere was pub-like and comfortable sitting in a sunken booth with regal sword-like silverware in a well-decorated dining room.  Service, too, was good and very accommodating of special requests for a very busy restaurant.  We began with a truly Jumbo Shrimp Cocktail with a Citrus Crunch, Horseradish, and tantalizing reddish Cocktail sauce.  The shrimp was meaty, perfectly cooked, and delicious.  Deviled Eggs served with bits of chives, tomato, bacon, and tiny Red Onion and White Onion squares contained beautifully whipped up yolks,  The individual egg halves taken as a whole yielded a pleasant crunchy flavor that offered a fine prelude to what was to come.  And Lobster Mac 'N' Cheese, with Gruyere, English Cheddar, and Parmesan, at $25 a pop delivered a fine shareable and soothing side for me and Diane even though the dish was presented as an appetizer.  The three conjoined cheeses melted harmoniously over the cooked macaroni, and flowed over good-sized chunks of tasty lobster meat.  Since it was on the menu I had to also try the Sweet English Ale Onion Soup, which was quite cheesy, mellow, and without any noticeable hint of alcohol.  It will join my list of memorable French Onion Soups even though it was technically British rather than French.     My two long lengths of blonde battered cod with Mushy Peas, lemon juice, malt vinegar, and a superior homemade Tartar Sauce were served hot and were simply excellent, cooked just right with steaming and flaky flesh inside the lightly golden batter.  And the thick log-like "chips" were quite tasty as well.  Although I didn't try it, a friend dining with us pronounced the golden-crusted Chicken, Kale & Bacon Pot Pie with Marjoram & Creme Fraiche, & Vegetables the best pot pie she had ever tasted.  That is now on my "to try" list!  So a return visit will definitely be made once my wallet has been replenished.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fish &amp; Chips
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sweet English Ale Onion Soup
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Close Up of a Deviled Egg

16J97HmZQ5Juei54-Tf4xg.text: Goodbye Blue Sky $15: This was a good refreshing cocktail. It says their best seller on the menu and I could see why.   Tomato soup $13: This was good, but not $13 good. I was just in a very soup-y mood.   Pesto parmesan mini mac $8: This was pretty bland.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tomato soup $13 and pesto parmesan mini mac $8
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Goodbye Blue Sky $15

ZdTVR5wChDCRHGsakXsjnA.text: I have to give this a 5 Star... Not because it's Gordon Ramsay by name but because this is our 4th time here and it never disappoints. Our waiter was very charismatic and took great care of us. He even hooked us up with ordering Scottish eggs that were not on the menu. The steak was cooked to perfection. The Shepherd Pie delicious. The pork belly was a delicate sweet pork with a tasty acidic mustard sauce that my daughter loved! The price is what you would expect for the quality of it and well... it is Gordon Ramsay in Vegas! I recommend coming early to avoid huge wait times. Definitely highly recommended... We will be back many more times in the future!

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States

hhYVbIs2xQz8qLBaP6TYGQ.text: Nong and Derek did a great job at the bar. Great fish and chips. Great dessert selection, too.

jP8I7e1gF7Obm_RPyqE-aw.text: The Maple Sage Fried Chicken Sandwich at Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill is one of the greatest sandwiches I have ever eaten. I ordered this sandwich expecting it to be good, and it exceeded my expectations to the max. The flavors of the breading on the chicken will throw your taste buds for a loop... you'll love every bite of it. In addition to the chicken itself, the bacon aioli and shallot marmalade accompanied the meat ever so perfect. Seriously guys, this chicken sandwich is the real deal.  It also comes with a side of pub chips that add a great crunch to the dish.   To top off the meal, I ordered the Sticky Toffee Pudding for dessert and that too was absolutely delicious. You also get it served to you in True Vegas fashion ;) (see video)    The atmosphere here is fun and lively, especially because it's located in the middle of the casino. The prices are pretty standard for Vegas but you can definitely count on getting your moneys worth. Do yourself a favor and head over to Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill for a great time and an even better chicken sandwich! Trust me, you'll love it!!

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Maple Sage Fried Chicken Sandwich... so good! (It looked a lot more presentable before I cut it! :P )
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The front entrance

S7tlcKx4QF1G6_xF0JIOTQ.text: The short ribs are delicious, the meat just falls of like butter. The service is great and the specialty drinks are tasty.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States

3HpyEfRq603NMaHlrB5HhQ.text: Here's the thing... we eat really lovely food, so admittedly, our expectations were quite high for "Gordon Ramsey!"    Beer menu is good. If not, overpriced - even for Las Vegas Boulevard.   Food is honestly average - at wayyyyy above average price.  Again, understanding this is LV Boulevard - $26 for a steak and ale pie is egregious.    Additionally, my kale salad was lacking a ton of ingredients and flavor.   Was hoping for more flavor and intention - that's all.

9LbrGbK5NFEEMCAkb2QOcg.text: Steak & Ale pie - SO good - braised beef with root vegetables and mushrooms.  They didn't skimp at all with the beef and mushrooms.  The beef chunks were huge and there was a good amount of it in the pie.  The pastry on top was also delicious.  It also came out SUPER fast (maybe 10 minutes after ordering?).  Atmosphere here is really cool - like a hearty, English pub.  -1 star: I think $25 is expensive for essentially a pot pie....

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Steak &amp; Ale Pie - huge chunks of beef!

-cmbcdnZ7S3AmPKOwMq0mw.text: Came here to watch the end of an NBA game because there are plenty of TVs and ordered the chicken wing lollipops. The wings were poorly done. They were dry, the breading was thick, and there was barely any sauce coating the wings. I will not be back to try other items on the menu.

qZr1XtoKu0n9YifzJMWKzQ.text: this review is really 3-4ish stars. solid food for lunch.   fish and chips: generous portion of 2 thick and tender (not overly salty) cod filets. ask for the fries to be extra crispy.  lobster mac n cheese side dish had nice parmesan flavor along with plenty of lobster chunks.   bangers and mash comes with 3 plump sausages of different meats: chicken, pork and beef.   sticky toffee pudding was a winner!!

XOf8Clah0WF6Ov4tiWQb6Q.text: well taking the rents out to dinner however there was a few things that went wrong.   The beet salad -- I ended up biting down on something hard that almost chipped my tooth see picture -- it was either a hard pine nut or something however not roasted nor edible I thought I was eating something other then a salad. Also the ridicule salad part ( mix with arugula ) was very sandy or harder then normal. However the beet part and the goat cheese part along with the dressing was nice.   The order was beer battered fish -- cough 29.00$ I shure Gordon you don't offer that price in your England restaurants. was good   My dad got a medium temp burger that was done on the rarer side - witch put him off . however ingredients mixed nicely.   Mine well -- ( ale pie ) the filling was amazing however I was thinking it would be more like the shepherds pie with piped mashed potatoes like Gordon Ramsey always to have tips on his other then his hair lol. But the filling aspect was great however the mashed made it feel more like a meat chicken pot pie taste .. ( dont get me wrong it was good I am not shure the topping is wright. )   Spotted dc ( yes I abbreviated it ) lol . was great -- I know they stress on that.   Overall 3 meals a little confusion with seating etc. -- Also we where set back in the part with tvs for the game -- Witch was blaring -- I am 30 not old - couldn't even hear our server   I would be willing to give it another review at a latter date - due to fact I love hells kitchen. but will be back since I am a local know well obiv with over 80 something reviews in las vegas.
