rs-dCLoeyYxAEfvUq-T6jw.text: First the good. The Waiters were attentive, friendly. My salad was good. Now the bad. Steak was so-so but not for the price they charge. My husband said he's gotten better ribeyes at Texas Roadhouse. The menus were sticky, dirty and curling. My chair seat was so badly torn Gordon Ramsey would have had a fit. I've seen him complain about better chairs and menus. We all commented Gordon must not have visited this place in a long time. Won't be back. Food just so-so. Very overpriced for what you get.

8HykDVzNMU5XHqTr2Ea-iA.text: Best fish n chips I've ever had, and the lobster mac n cheese had huge lobster pieces in every bite!  And Chef Scott came to say hello. Service was awesome for our high maintenance table of 10.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chef Scott and friends.

OXsfVTAXWxaIxIybJNwqBg.text: Man, very few places I would say is at this quality. Everything I tried was amazing but the real stars are the desserts. I tried a bite of everything on the dessert menu and I have to say everything was amazing. You can't go wrong

x9MfDcA8fcPdyaL4p_tQJw.text: I lived in England for 4 years and my husband is English. Despite this we've never made it to a Gordon Ramsey restaurant and after this probably won't ever again. The fish and chips was tasteless soggy batter yet dry in the center. The calamari was bland. The bartender was incredibly rude to my friend. The waitress didn't understand boundaries - she just kept interrupting. The only redeeming thing was the fact the fact that they serve strawberry beer. It was overpriced entirely. I don't understand how someone so opinionated about others have such a crappy restaurant. It's really a joke.

XU9NUmszZNRelAf-iQvgGA.text: So my husband and I were on a date here the night before he deployed to Afghanistan. We were really excited as we've been fans of Gordon Ramsey for quite some time. There was a 30 minute wait (no problem) and actually built the anticipation. Somewhere with this kind of wait MUST be awesome. We were texted when our seat was available. The decor was nice and the uniforms were fun.   We ordered the Roasted Tomato soup and Truffle fries. The Tomato Soup was great, not quite as good as we just had in London, but thats okay. Truffle fries were great. We also ordered a mixed beverage with Bourbon and a glass of wine. Mixed drink was really tasty.   Because the appetizers were so good, we were even more excited for our entrees. We ordered The NY Strip and the Scottish Salmon. What a disappointment. The NY Strip was medium-medium well when we ordered medium rare. It was INCREDIBLY chewy. We've had better steaks at chain steakhouses (no exaggeration). And the sides: the asparagus was so overcooked it was actually mushy and there were just a few tiny potatoes. The salmon came with lentils and was SO SO SO bland. Like SO bland. Our water was never refilled and when my husband got his steak, the did not bring a steak knife and had to get up himself to go find one after waiting quite a while for someone to bring one.   Overall, I was so disappointed and feel like I wasted my last night with my husband at a subpar establishment. We would have gotten better food from a Macaroni Grill.   With a name like Gordon Ramsay plastered on the front of the menu, you expect to leave with a smile on your face.  OH! And we were sitting in front of a tv that was playing a show where surgery was taking place. Nothing better than chewing on bland salmon and looking at a human organ in a plastic bag on a 60 inch tv. Excellent.

EJN8hM6KS-SaT4FQtlf2-g.text: Wife had the kettle chip nachos, WOW.  I had the braised beef short rib.  Both were very good.  Seating was quick, food was quick, service was very good.  Lots of other things I wish I had time to try on the menu.

K-o0RVOZaluCzIRPDlDUdw.text: Great food, great drinks but poor service.  This was my second visit to this place because I was wowed by everything during my first visit. The food, drinks, ambience and service was absolutely perfect the first time round. Head chef and Hell's Kitchen winner Scott even came out and chatted and took a picture with us.  This visit however, was a disaster in terms of service. Our server didn't greet us, placed our cutlery on our table in a rather rough manner and even tried to cheat us by adding additional items on our bill. When questioned, he just said, 'Oh I'm so sorry, let me get that rectified.' He did not seem surprised or shocked but instead, expected it. Doesn't this mean that it was deliberate all this while and that he tried to get away with it? The second time he presented the bill to us, there were still discrepancies on it and again, he has the same reaction like it was done on purpose.  It's a shame that this place has hired servers like this. My first experience was so perfect that I would have recommended it to anyone. Unfortunately, it has been tarnished by this bad episode. Such a shame.

f5Ahrv9TDZ6lkoKcPCvwsA.text: My wife and I came here to treat our uncle to dinner because he was visiting. We had the following:  Appetizers: 1/2 dozen Lolli-pop chicken wings $12 Scotch Egg $11  Entrees: Chopped salad $16 12 oz Grilled Ribeye $39 12 oz grilled NY Strip $37  Sides: Forest Mushrooms $11 Sauteed Brussel Sprouts $11  Dessert: Sticky Toffee Pudding $11  Drink Innis & Gunn $8  This meal was probably one of the best meals I've had in vegas. The scotch egg appetizer was pretty good with a nice bbq sauce and it came with marinated vegas. The chicken wings were not actually wings but drumettes. The sauce was AMAZING! It tasted like a honey, bbq, sweet chili, and hot sauce all in one. This is probably the appetizer I've in vegas. I would have to put this in my top appetizer list with Carson Kitchen's Bacon Jam.   Now to the entrees. My wife said her salad was good with a lot of texture going on with the chicken, chickpeas, avocados, shrimp, etc. My ribeye was perfectly seasoned and cooked to medium. I liked how there were 3 sauces you could choose from (i forgot the names) but the one I got tasted like an au jus. My uncle said his strip was great and he got a gravy looking sauce. The sides were great too. The pork belly that was sauteed with the brussel sprouts were melt in you mouth...so bad yet so good.  The sticky toffee pudding is Gordon Ramsay's signature dessert. That too was WINNAHS! (excuse my Hawaiian accent). It came with a toffee sauce and vanilla ice cream. It didn't taste as sweet as I thought it would be. I was so curious to know why that i actually researched it afterwards and found out that this dessert is made with dates and brown sugar.   My uncle and I also tried the Innis $ Gunn beer. Our waiter, John, said its Gordon Ramsay's favorite beer. We both thought it was very smooth with a nice foam on top. It paired well with our meal.  Overal, I would definitely come back again. The ambience was great and we were lucky enough to sit next to the tvs. Kudos to our waiter John for the great service.  The chicken appetizer and the sticky toffee pudding were definitely the stand outs. I've  been to his Burger resto in planet hollywood and now this one. Two down, one more GR resto to go!

rdTkED4iQCOTvf1EtVAzfg.text: In short, i got my meal for free.  Ordered the beef burger with bacon. The waitress even repeated it before leaving the table. The guy serves it and mumbles what could have been either "hamburger" or "lamburger". I look and no bacon and some white creamy sauce instead of bacon with chopped lettuce and cheddar. So i call her over and ask if it's really the beef burger with bacon. She says it looks like it but they forgot the bacon. (Put them side by side and you can easily tell by the topping that it's not).  3-4 minutes later i get a new burger with proper topping and bacon. Cut it in half and notice it's quite pink but i did order medium instead of medium well as i figured the meat at a Gordon Ramsay should be top quality.  After a couple of bites, someone else comes to deliver my burger...yes, they sent two out !  So i eat half and only a couple of bites on the outside are good, the rest was too raw for me. When i look into the second half of the burger you can clearly see it's very raw.  Show the waitress and she says she will talk to the manager. A couple of minutes later i see him coming towards me but he walks by. A minute or two later he comes over and says he went to the wrong table and started saying sorry to them about the burger, they said it was great why are you sorry ?  So he starts his i'm sorry speech and says it's on him. And asks that i try them again the next time i'm in town...right, with all the restaurants in a one mile radius, why would i bother taking the long trek into the abyss of Cesar's Palace for that ?  What a complete useless bunch ! I left a tip for the waitress, but now regret doing so, she doesn't know the difference in looks between the two meat burgers they serve ?!?  Gordon would have been livid if he actually worked there and not just sell his name. Shame, i rather like Gordon and his devotion to food.  Now lets hope i won't get sick from the raw meat.  Save yourself the trouble and eat elsewhere.

_dF8EQLtR13G5wxvyrzUFQ.text: Had high expectations for this place because it has Gordon Ramsey's name.  The food overall was good but not great.  Salmon had good flavor but was a little overcooked, the butter chicken was pretty good and the pesto chicken sandwiches were very good.  The service was fair.  It took about 45 minutes to get our food & our waitress didn't come refill our drinks & kept avoiding us after she dropped off our appetizers.  Would have given it 4 stars if service had been better.

4DLFDdNDbNEK2lCi5njOEg.text: This was a good experience.  This restaurant was somewhat empty at 8pm on a holiday weekend night, even though the restaurant was hosting an international rugby team and a chance to speak with them.  I ordered the fish & chips, one of the starred items that was noted as a favorite.  It was very good but not excellent - I like the fish n chips by Elephant & Castle better.  The fish was small, the menu ala carte.  Lemon and malt vinegar had to be requested after the food was delivered.  Meh.  The service rode the line of slow-attentive.  Our food took 45 minutes to arrive and we were left for long periods unattended.   I was sad that no pub burger was in sight on the menu.  We were not offered bread while we waited.

NEKecg1HcjZUMUvUa5Nlmg.text: Everything we ordered was amazing...bangers and bash, onion soup, pretzel appetizer, the beef pot pie (forgot the name ) and the bartender was so friendly and let us sample everything

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bangers and bash

-AJAEqAdaCqtDdV1A5qZKw.text: My wife and I very much enjoy British Pubs,  and are fortunate enough to have one just a few blocks from our home. Given our affinity for them,  and the Gordon Ramsay name, we wanted to try this one.   The atmosphere is decidedly non-traditional for a British Pub,  with the majority of it open to the casino floor. If that's a deal breaker for you,  be warned.  In my view,  it's Vegas and we didn't come to look, we came to eat and drink. It didn't disappoint on that front.   We shared a starter of Toads in the Hall, which was delicious. The drink selection was extensive. While we're not usually beer people, our waiter recommended a brown ale called Innis and Gunn that was fantastic.   We both had fish and chips for our entrees and it was some of the best British style fish and chips I've had in the states. I highly recommend it.   It is pricey, but it's on the strip in Vegas, that's the norm. Even if you're not a player,  sign up for the Total Rewards player's card,  as you do get a menu discount.

PdAX-7i0WdxrdUerTA1FeA.text: I had the onion soup & the lobster mac & cheese and they were both delish. The blueberry cocktail I ordered was also tasty! Service was fast and efficient, I like that they open until late on weekends. Overall a good & convenient place to eat in the strip!

n4ynkSO9k0vi1fyRIN-XKg.text: There was a 20 min wait since we are visiting during the holidays, but the food was great and the service was good. The ambiance is cool too and not too dark and closed off like some other eateries. I got lamb burger with goat cheese and it was delicious. Be warned that it is 9 oz and veryyy heavy!!!! We also got the chopped salad which was a little bland but w a touch of balsamic it was good to go!

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lamb burger!

2Q7fS4PVuEEaA8IEqwfzWA.text: One star for Richard E. yet the food is good.   I have been here a few times and normally the service is as good as the food, however this time the service was horrible. We were rushed to order our main dish and asked repeatedly in a span of 3 minutes to order dessert. No the place was not packed at all.    Note this was for game 7 of the 2014 World Series, so I could assume the staff just wanted to watch rather than have to serve that night.  If your place has pub in its name and numerous televisions you should expect people may get the idea they can enjoy a game there.    I thought it may have been because we asked to switch tables (something I don't do normally) in order to see the game, but the table next to us has the same problem with the server.

NtvaSXS-n901bK51pSq2lQ.text: Came here with high hopes of a great meal with great servive I got neither The hostess was to interested in her friend to notice us.  When her friend mentioned that she had customers she just dismissed us Not happy about this at all When we got seated by a different hostess we were given the lunch menu.  Alot of lovely food to choose from I went for the chicken and pesto sandwich with fries.  The chicken was dark and white meat.  I had a few chewy bits which is a turn off for me I only ate 1 side of the sandwich The only time we seen the waiter was when he took our order and again with the bill.  My water was never refilled or the offer for it to be filled.  I have to say i found better service at McDonalds later that evening where i had to go because i was hungry.  Gordon you need to step in

Uwwtvx44PnWmg5366h0wOQ.text: Everything was awesome !!!! Adam was the nicest server I've ever had. It was our first time here and he took the time to go over menu with us. We took his suggestions and EVERYTHING was delicous.  Thank you for going above and beyond !

ZwWPOV5ixDSOCs50xJR5qQ.text: "As filming [Kitchen Nightmares] comes to a close on the latest series of Kitchen Nightmares I've decided to stop making the show," Ramsay wrote on his website. "I've had a phenomenal 10 years making 123 episodes, 12 seasons, shot across 2 continents, watched by tens of millions of people and sold to over 150 countries. It's been a blast but it's time to call it a day."  DON'T STOP TOO SOON... you have one more restaurant to fix up... this one!  Worst Gordon Ramsay experience we've ever had (and the first bad experience so maybe that's why I'm taking it so hard).  1.  Our experience started as the hostess walked us through a reasonably open restaurant: past the "patio", past the bar, past the really nice booths, and all the way to the very back of the "family room"... where one might imagine the staff eats.  What's up with that; do we not fit your preferred demographic or is there some other reason why you did this to my family?  I'm curious; really.  2.  Waitress seems to have trained at the local Denny's.  If you were here, Chef Ramsay you'd tell that 'fat cow" to EffOff.  Ordered drinks and food.  Food got delivered (shockingly fast), then the drinks.  Not relaxing at all.  3.  Fish and chips... let's talk about this please.  I'm in no way qualified to tell you how to cook, but these fish and chips were fish and fries.  I've had plenty of fish and chips in the UK, both in pubs and from small shops... and once from a place so small they didn't even have electric refrigeration.  Really... fries pretending to be chips on a plate of fish and chips???  I've seen you rip people new a-holes for misrepresenting food like this.  Oh... and we never tasted the mushy peas.  The expeditor forgot them, the runner didn't notice that the expeditor forgot them, and the waitress... well she was out to pasture and didn't notice much of anything.  4.  Shepard's Pie... let's chat some more.  Served "bare naked" it was a disappointing sight from the moment it landed on the table.  Mash was barely browned and no garnish at all.  No visual appeal and no olfactory appeal either.  As I ate all I could hear was you saying "season, season, season" as you prepare to send a MasterChef contestant home for serving bland food.  Whoever the donkey is that cooked my pie... please ask him to return the apron and leave.  Please.  And those straight-sided dishes sure did make eating the mince and veg a frustrating experience.  5.  Manager was finally summoned.  I was unhappy.  He was polite and kind but had an "excuse" for almost everything.  Fries rather than chips: "you can order real chips on the appetizer menu" and when asked again "well, this is a Ramsay-twist; Las Vegas twist on a pub."  WTF does that mean... that you can call chips fries because we're not in the UK?  I think not.  He did the best he could to make things right and comp'd a couple of desserts to make up for the missing mushy peas.  But days later all I can remember is that we didn't have the kind of experience we should have had.  6.  Oh, and let me not forget to mention... the table next to us was set for guests, but there were chips -- errr... fries, I mean -- on the floor, presumably from the last diner.  EVERYONE walked past them, over them, and past them again.  I had the pleasure of looking at squished fries on the floor as I ate my meal.  I know, I know it is my own fault: I looked (and looked again).  Manager verified that they were fries and not chips... then took 15 minutes to get them cleaned up.  But cleaned up they were... eventually.  7.  Now that I've vented my spleen let me compliment a few things:  salmon was very good.  The fish on the fish-and-fries was good too.  Desserts were excellent.  Please forgive me, Chef, for having such an attitude but it is you who inspire me and you who keeps bleating "standards"... and I totally agree.  Standards are everything and should be maintained at all times.  I only wish they were maintained for me during our visit to your PUB.

QzhOmqPyB0Fk-s99fqFPxw.text: 2015 YELP 100 CHALLENGE - 073/100  We were starving after the Mariah Carey show, and this was right across from the theater, I'm so glad we stopped by because there was no wait, and the food was incredible. I suppose I wasn't expecting much because it was about 11:00p and they were packed, but it was a really good experience. Firstly, I really love the way the restaurant is set up. So awesome to see different style tables and chairs. Everything from high tops, to couches, to stools and love seats around tables, very charming. Unfortunately we were seated at a high top table lol but that's ok because the atmosphere was great, lots of people at the bar, lots of good looking waitresses and bartenders, and our waitress was very sweet. I ordered the fish and chips, and my friend ordered the salmon and both were incredible. My fish was crispy and so tender on the inside, the plate came with seasoned potato wedges and mashed peas. The peas were very different, interesting taste but I liked them. My friend's salmon was thick and it melted in your mouth. They didn't have an extensive wine list but we made it work. Salmon plate was 36.00 and fish and chips was 30, add the wine and we spent over 100.00! But the portions were large and the food was great. I'd recommend this place!

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Salmon
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fish and chips

6YIMP-WVktVHkO63p2KJSQ.text: Stopped in for an impromptu dinner after a great show at Caesar's last night. I will not make the mistake of dining under the Gordon Ramsay banner again. What a colossal rip.  The four of us were sat on these couches that looked cool but were ultimately impractical and grew highly uncomfortable over the evening.   The service was spotty at best with much of the menu unavailable, some of which we didn't discover until after the order was put in. There were also no towels in the men's bathroom over the course of the meal which was especially disconcerting since the menu is mostly comprised of finger foods.   I was foolhardy enough to order the $30 fish and chips which paled against the dive-iest pub food in London or the US. No seasoning on the fish, chips undercooked to the point of hardness, and a price point that made each bite taste of regret and the feeling of being taken advantage of.   The night ended with one of our party needing to make a hasty exit due to some digestional challenges that my wife and I now share.   Save yourselves, friends.

4Xq94agT5oDPvco7DGVyLw.text: Stopped for happy hour.  Nice beer selection. Sat at the bar and bartender was attentive.  After beers had a Belgian margarita. Awesome. Had their nachos and was different. Short ribs, scallions white cheddar, peppers.  Kettle chips.  Get this when there.  Will visit again.

87J_Nq8U0i-wLMZmq4b-7A.text: I really enjoyed the food.  I ordered the lamb burger, medium rare.  It comes with goat cheese, grilled onions, and lettuce on it, and fries with garlic butter and ketchup on the side. The goat cheese perfectly complimented the lamb. The fries and garlic butter were great too. My meal was absolutely delicious but it was really rich.  In the end, the portion size was too much for me and it felt like a waste. I could have probably split it with another person. Service was fine. We came in a party of three and were seated right away at arund 9:30 on a Saturday night.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lamb burger with fries.

qSTmTCx4lrbvzbP6MnYKaA.text: Absolutely love this place. We eat here every time we're in Vegas. The ambiance is great, and the food couldn't be better. I absolutely love the Scotch Egg.  Everything I've had on the menu is great, especially the English Ale soup, which was recommended by the best bartender ever, Ray Ray.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. English Ale Onion Soup
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Scotch Egg

FfGo6lBPKWcTzDIqIUwN0Q.text: We came here on a whim, because this is the point where we were so tired from walking and stopped and decided that this would do. Our waiter was busy but nice enough to check in on us and make sure we got what we needed. We were impressed by the quickness in which our food got out. We had just ordered the wings and nachos which had a different take on flavors. It was good, but nothing that was very impressive. The prices were just too exorbitant I don't think we've ever paid $22 for a dozen wings. The nachos were like $15 or $16 and that seemed too high as well. I understand that this was on top of kettle chips and it was short ribs, but that was a bit crazy. I can appreciate the creativity but it comes with a cost. This also seems to be a popular spot for birthday celebrations and there were 2 right next to us, and we were here at like 9:45pm.

LKiLQpWMFr7lPuRErzaRzw.text: I've been looking forward to eating here for literally months. I browsed the menu online and arrived expecting to be quite happy. Unfortunately, the best I can report is that I left full.   Our flight was delayed, causing my spouse and I to be about 30 minutes late for our reservation. Not a problem- they were able to seat us after a 10 minute wait. Unfortunately, after that we kept waiting. It took another 15 minutes to get water. 10 more minutes after that before our waitress arrived to take drink orders. We ended up placing our meal order at the same time, just to cut down on the delays.  As a starter, my son and I shared an order of the Warm Pretzels....which arrived stale and significantly less than warm. The accompanying cheese sauce was glorified velveeta. My entree, the Steak & Ale Pie was okay. The description said the pie contained "root vegetables" so I'd been eagerly anticipating a pie rich with steak, potatoes, parsnips, turnips...all those lovely British veg. But no...I got a basic stewed beef with a couple of sad little carrot bits, topped by a crust that left my mouth coated in lard/shortening film.   My spouse and son both ordered burgers and raved about them...but they both agreed that the fries reminded them of Burger King. Not what an English pub should aspire to emulate.  Overall? Horribly overpriced (we paid over $100 for 3 entrees, 2 apps and 3 sodas) mediocre food. Cannot recommend.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Steak &amp; Ale Pie
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Grilled Burger
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States

S4k8d69h87ctAoDUcr2Mmg.text: Not impressed.   I've always heard so much about Chef Ramsey and his food but boy, was I disappointed this time around. I had the NY Steak with a side of the Yukon Gold Mashed Potatoes. My steak was chewy, hard to cut, and burnt on the outside. However, the inside was fine. Maybe if I had cut off the exterior entirely then I would've enjoyed it better. The mashed potatoes were bland. I guess that's good if you're sharing at a table of people with different taste buds - it gives you the choice to season it more on your own.   The service is mediocre. Although we liked the girl who was serving us (she was friendly and helpful), she didn't come by too often and the times that she did, we didn't have food on the table yet.   Overall, it was a whatever experience for me.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. NY Steak, medium rare (butter on top - forgot what it was called) with Gold Yukon Potatoes and Ma Bec wine
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ramsey Tonic (Green), Goodbye Blue Sky (Red), Ma Bec (Wine), Blue Moon (Beer)

7RVGovdJS6fZRnnZMLJZkA.text: Landed at GR Pub & Grill on monday night...was looking for a place to watch MNF with better food than just the standard sports bar fare. The service was excellent and there were TVs everywhere. Our group started off with the calamari...excellently fried...crispy on the outside, not overcooked and chewy on the inside. Our entrees entailed 1. chicken, kale, and bacon pot pie, 2. butter chicken curry, 3. shepherd's pie, and 4. fish and chips. All of the food was excellent! My buddy was extremely surprised and pleased at how good the butter chicken curry (think indian curry) was good at an English pub. The rest of the table was pleased with their meal as well. The only downside is it is a Gordon Ramsay restaurant in Vegas so the prices are higher...example: $30 fish and chips. But work will end up paying for our meal so I'm glad we got to experience it. Would definitely stop in again!

8Zugw9HbcD4SqfcGbag6aw.text: Rodney and Tesla were excellent hosts.  We average eating here 2-3 times during our yearly stay in Vegas.  Shepard Pie, kettle nachos, steak, bangers and mash, lobster roll, we have have just about eaten everything on the menu.  And for dessert the sticky toffee pudding is a must! Friendly staff, great food!

CfLwcR4Y7-mNL8zEhloY8w.text: Took a very long time for our server to take our order, but when she did come to serve us, she was very apologetic and tossed in an additional appetizer for the inconvenience. We had the hellfire wings, mini pub burgers, mini maine lobster rolls, and the mini jalapeno bacon mac. In my opinion, the mac and the wings were the best items. All in all, as a huge Ramsay fan, I was unimpressed. BurgR was SO much better.

pNDM9M-7cOnCJMvZTQdLaQ.text: Our servers name was Rodger. I got the braised short rib and it reinvented happiness. It pulled me out of my chronic depression. Rodger gave me a free signature ramsey cake since I came here for my birthday. Literally the best birthday or anything experience I ever had. A must visit if you ever come to visit Las Vegas.

KH5G0Oo0EuPs1N9BU_XpZg.text: One of our favorite places to eat when at Ceasars. The steak and ale pie is my favorite- so delicious and flavorful! We've been here for several Cinemacon events and as guests- and service and food has been consistently great for both.  The sticky toffee is awesome!

mcTEdjyq-ELOVyT1Z7hVhQ.text: I'm a fan of Gordon's shows, but not this Resturant.  Took 7 minutes once we were seated for someone came by to take our drink order. Decided to order our food at the same time as it looked like they were overwhelmed.  Well my surprise when the bangers & mash and scotch eggs showed up in 5 minutes, before our drinks arrived!  We guessed it was all precooked which was supported by the attached picture off the partially cooked yokes on the scotch eggs.  Also, I've never had sauerkraut in the mash of bangers and mash...but I did here.  The experience was more what I expect Gordon to critique rather than put his name on.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Undercooked scotch egg

u1NoLc7fNF0QkSnGTCGEng.text: Nice place. Energy was ok. A little  bland in my opinion.  Food was ok. Had the wings and airline chicken.  Needed a little more seasoning for my taste.  Food was fresh though.  Waiter was very kool and knowledgeable.  Very casual for sure.

AR25e-gzO-yySADQ_ifZsg.text: This place is exceptional. Our server Ali was freaking awesome. Super attentive, made sure we had everything before we needed it and had amazing menu recommendations. On top of that, Ali explained the special for the evening (beef wellington) and then proceeded to whip out his phone and show us a picture of the special to sell us on it even more! The guy is a flat out pro, and the restaurant experience was excellent. The food was great and the service was excellent. I even went to the managers and told them how awesome our server was. All around, our party of four loved the restaurant and loved our meals from stay to finish. Will be back for sure.

tXQb0zLUCLGog7-el66SrQ.text: I am not sure why anyone gave this place a low rating. It was 4 of us. Place was packed and we were hungry. They initially told us long wait time but when we explained we had a conference we needed to get to they made it happen! Good was really good! I had the Butter Squash Soup which I was soooo good! And I also had a taste of one of my counterparts dish which was the pesto chicken sandwich. It was simply scrumptious!!! This is a celebrity owned restaurant and in my opinion lives up to the expectations!

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States

SKX4YHV0qYiEZVS-jcDUXQ.text: Daisy our waitress was awesome and gave us the best customer service, she made us feel as a VIP customer. I met Kristin from Hell's Kitchen Season 15 that made my birthday vacation top notch and the icing on the cake. Kristin was great to take the time from the kitchen to say hello and take a picture with me.  I had the Steak and Ale Pie, it was so tasty. If I was not out in public I would lick the bowl. I also had a Big Dog Lager that went great with my dinner. My mom had the Chopped salad that she enjoyed so much. For desert I and my mom shared the maple cheesecake, it was out of the ball park. Everything was so scrumptious. I will be back as my five year old loves Hell's Kitchen and all the Gordon Ramsay's shows too and she said she want to come with me next time to Las Vegas. :) Cheers from Napa Valley CA...

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Kristin Hell&#39;s Kitchen Season 15!

Mij0t8DHXyGeG-9KtWMomg.text: The food that we ordered was absolutely exquisite and wonderful. Definitely order the scallops, steak ale pie as well as the curry chicken. I'm sure our orders were not the only menu items to die for. Service was great by Chris P. and the sticky toffee pudding was bomb

usAcpjrK_kgJB3wulvGZ6Q.text: I've heard so many good things about Gordon Ramsay restaurants but wow was I disappointed!  There's some factors that are out of the staffs control like; it was Friday at 6pm'ish and busy & it looked like there was a couple large groups they were dealing with.  But The whole atmosphere made me uncomfortable and anxious.  We were seated in a very awkward table in the doorway that left very little room for the waitstaff to move around and get to their computer and flatware.  My chair was bumped several times and I tried my best to scoot in.  The chairs were strange like they were bottomed out and really low where our knees are sticking up and the table is too high.  The staff was rearranging the floor plan or something...I've never seen so many empty chairs being slid back and forth around the restaurant- it was crazy - the staff pushing chairs all over and yanking on this room divider wall that was stuck in the tracks and screeching along inch by inch.  One of the waiters kept trying to take our plates every two minutes which made me feel nervous.  All I ate was the pork belly appetizer but I really didn't like it.  Maybe that's how it's supposed to be but it was really fatty and just not to my taste.  I can't blame them for that.  But as far as comfort and atmosphere goes, it was not good.  Too much commotion and bunched up tables to be able to relax.  I'm a local and was only there to get dinner before a show inside Caesar's- I wouldn't make a special trip for this place!

6wN2duLyu6g43DGZ-AF1KA.text: I was at their venue last night but just didn't have a chance to write out a review.  So, I'll just cut to the chase. I intend to rate it 4.5 stars, but kind of hard to swallow the .5, so, I'll leave it at 4 stars, due to couple reasons.  If I'm bringing a group of six adults for dinner after the CES convention week, I just assumed this will be a great place to experience the actual GR food. No to mention, two of my guests are GR fans, so, why not give it a try, right?  The overall food experience was good, I wish I could've said great! I first ordered the calamari as to share the appetizer, and the truffle fries, which I thought is a great way to start a meal. Especially if GR had been showing how crispy he likes to make them calamari. Well...I didn't expect it to have seen the calamari to have so many tendons, AND not being somewhat crispy as I'd had hoped for. A few of us tried it, it really turned out to be a bit soft and chewy. So, we had to send it back and ordered something else instead.  Anyways, aside to the bad calamari, the food we ordered were delicious, we had the burgers, and few of the folks ordered the steak. It was a lot of food, but we managed to finish.  Our server was friendly and super courteous, but perhaps they need to pay more attention to the cleanliness of their sections! Not a Ramsay standard, I'd say! ;) The booth we got sat in, the seats weren't wiped clean, the floors were dirty and not swept properly. I understand the concept is to be a pub and setting is to be as if we are to eat at a London pub...But, if we're to spend $45 on a Ribeyes, I'd consider that being a steakhouse, right?  So, aside to the chewy calamari and cleanliness, I do enjoy the rest of the food served after, as well the rest of the folks in my table.  #foodporn #cleanmuch #GordonRamsay #Standard #VegasRestaurant

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The calamari that got sent back, after 1 bite. Lol
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. This is the bacon burger. It was really good and juicy, as I had wanted!
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Delicious truffle fries to share. #delicious #loveit

sFtNEK6YsVwx8olcfiXZPA.text: My boyfriend and I stopped here for a quick late lunch. He had the bacon cheeseburger with house sauce. It was really good a flavorful. I had the Mac and cheese and lobster and shrimp rolls. I'd skip and max and cheese as is wasn't mind blowing or anything. The rolls were small but very fresh tasting. Our server was Adam aka Afro! He was really nice and personable and made us laugh! The sticky toffee pudding is AMAZING!!!

5TYyO2IIvr-zDSQ9E5rF1w.text: We came here on our first night in Las Vegas and the food and the service were not great.  We talked to the manager who apologized to us, as the night was much busier than they had expected.  He invited us over for a second night which was a completely different experience.  We had the best meal we've had in a long time.  The hamburger was awesome and the black angus tenderloin was to die for.  They definitely redeemed themselves !

8xrHYD0VLFMXDGVzoibK-g.text: This place was amazing. The decor was a little different but the food was amazing. And I rarely ever say this about a location.  We ordered the Devil Eggs which had bacon. And the lobster/shrimp mini rolls. Those were finished without any issues because they were delicious.   I ordered the Short Ribs. The portion of that short rib was beyond what I could imagine. I had no idea it was going to be a huge portion. It was lacking a little salt and was a little drier than i preferred but it was still delicious. It came with some cheddar mashed potatoes which I enjoyed. Probably one of the best mashed potatoes I have ever tried.   My girlfriend ordered the Scallops and she got 5 portions of Scallops with a succotash puree. She seemed to enjoy it.  Overall, I am glad I stopped at this location while casino-hopping. The food was amazing, the portion was good sized. The bill kinda sucked between 3 people but it was vegas and we did splurge a little lol.

ygfImDg5vYKPKIUmELvFEA.text: We decided to do a Gordon Ramsay food tour in Vegas. This was our second stop. It's a little pricey, but the atmosphere and food more than justify the cost.  First, it's much more relaxed than the steakhouse. They seem to recommend business casual but I saw plenty of people in jeans there. They have TVs pretty much everywhere and the tables are nice and spaced out. I had a pot pie and my husband got the bangers and mash--both were delicious. The pub nachos were very rich and flavorful. Also: sticky toffee pudding!! Enough said about that.  The only reason I didn't give five stars is that while the food and atmosphere were good, none of it was AMAZING. Granted, the price point here is not on the same level as the steakhouse, but if I'm dropping $100 I would like the experience to at least be memorable. This was a good experience, but nothing I would crave or even need to experience again.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Steak and ale pot pie
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bangers and mash
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sticky toffee pudding is the best thing ever.

JCItLo09EHMmQ0eARCAchQ.text: I celebrated my 21st birthday here and the food and drinks were AMAZING. definitely made it the best birthday I've ever had!! our server Rodney was so great and made sure everything came out quick and was delicious! if I'm ever in Vegas again I will be sure to visit this place, no doubts about it!

cJ1Anf2K9pShIYJ34yRjqw.text: I'm not sure why this has only 3.5 stars... I loooved my burger and my dad loved his steak. I don't normally order burgers at restaurants but I was happy I did, it was so juicy and buttery (the bun) and I enjoyed every bite. I also loved the big cushiony chairs!

4sD3YuOyZdGvnTqGfiyvhQ.text: Omg..... My first time in vegas..... English single mum living in Colorado. Work hard n play hard..... Out here for fun but my friends were hesitant. I talked them into eating here as I know it is going to be fantastic. Mr Ramsey is successful for a reason. These girls needed to taste this. Absolutely Fan-bloody-tastic as I knew it would be. So so pleased my best friends got to experience. The staff were wicked too. Thankyou Rodney for your excellent service and Mr Ramsey for your truly exquisite experience.  Sincerely Sara.... One very happy Yorkshire girl.

M5aHotI3tyNvM9bVYEp3_w.text: I'll probably check back in the next time I'm around (:  Pros: It's Gordon Ramsay lol. The food is realllly goooooooood. Ordered the grilled lamb burger and my SO ordered something else.. forgot what it was, but it was pretty darn good too. Quality if top notch and service is friendly, quick and attentive. Serving sizes weren't bad, the decor is nice, and the way the food is set up is near perfect.  Cons: Price obviously lol. $30 for fish and chips and over $20 or something for the burger. You have to pay to play at restaurants like this in Vegas lol. If this were just some random joint then the prices of the food would have more of an impact on my rating.  Bottom line: Surprised this place has a low 3 stars on Yelp!. Oh well lol. I'll most likely be back, but give this place a try if you're around.

UbGKE_6cp2WAjzpIEQYUmQ.text: We wandered in for the happy hour specials and stayed for a late lunch/early dinner. A big part of that decision was based on the excellent service we received from RODNEY. He was warm and personable, and gave us valuable information about the restaurant and menu. He checked on us regularly and laughed and joked with us. This is what service should be and what I would expect from a GR restaurant. Kudos to Rodney for a fun experience.

7GBVws5HQGZnIDPYd0z-ZQ.text: Bloody hell, that's all I can say. If I wanted to spend $4000 on food I would just buy the entire Cracker Barrel menu. I mean cmon. You call this food, I call it manure. Scratch that last comment, I wouldn't even put that garbage in my garden.

CVCgfqFicbBtTF8Vi5CTCA.text: The service was excellent, but the food quality should have been better for the price. We ordered the shepherd's pie, butter chicken curry, and steak & ale pie.

ZrvmHYHdxyewt5ng4HECYw.text: Fish and Chips were amazing! Rodney our server/bartender was great!! Highly recommend!

OayJempeneqUIzTC7Mkpng.text: This is a great place to go and eat in Las Vegas. Menus ranging in prices for people in a budget to people who like high luxury prices, this place has everything to offer. Great customer service and the wait period is not that long. Michael was a great waiter and helped all of us through the night. He was funny and made our night.

rdF4QXBcf4KzJqG9-lr9mg.text: Sausage and Mashed potatoes (9/10) Living up to his name, this restaurant was superb. The mashed potatoes were perfectly mushy, combined with the saltiness from the sauce and the sausages made a wonderful burst of flavors. The sausages themselves were very unique in taste. Each had a particular crunch and chewiness which was very enjoyable. The service was spectacular. Their drinks were tipsy. The waiter, whose name i do not remember, recommend me a drink to which I was very satisfied with and had to control myself from finishing it before the food even came.   Definitely would recommend coming here to grab some delicious dinner.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sausage and mashed potatoes (9/10)

OgrazmC7uIR7cXdOSsk9_Q.text: Had a great time! Apparently Hell's Kitchen needs a 3 week reservation so we went with Ramsey's Pub and Grill. (Big fans of Ramsey) We saddled up to the bar and a bartender, who goes by "Juice," gave us exceptional service and great knowledge of food and beer.  Come visit him at Ceasar's Palace! You won't be disappointed.

b2Zh7iEpjqxRg9CHxwX4EQ.text: Of the 3 Gordon Ramsy establishments we tried, this one fell below expectations.  As a Yelp foodie first and foremost is taste, and that was definitely lacking for me.  Food: I got the Aline Chicken dish, the description sounded super flavourful but the dish fell flat.  Presentation was nice, when it came I was excited to try it, the chicken leg looked crispy, but it truly had no taste.  I've cooked tastier chicken myself.  The beans with parsnip as well lacked taste, so it was dry tasteless chicken on a lot of tastless beans with some chopped veggies for $29.  Not good value either.  My husband had the Sheppard's Pie, which he says was better than my dish but not amazing, $24.  Service: lacking in a sense, server did not recommend any "most popular" dishes, and maybe this is where the problem started because I may have ordered a so so dish to start.  What was annoying was we asked to split the bill, he forgot to, left, then started serving other ppl/stuff and forgot about our bill, then finally came back and stood there while we were paying.   This is annoying as I would think most restaurants train their staff to not stare while you pay.  It seems like this restaurant tries to do too much with the menue, ranging from steak to burgers to sandwhiches to pub food (pies, etc.), fish n chips, etc.  Suggest they scale down the menue and focus on making what is on a condensed menue super tasty to live up to the Gordon Ramsy name.  Overall, will not come back on my next travel and would not recommend.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States

NBtgZZm7FXFULfV5GOZs9Q.text: We tried the lamb burger, ceasar salad, pub ale onion soup and the hell fire wings. Our favorite item was definitely the lamb burger. The wing sauce was too tomatoey for us and didn't have the heat we were expecting. The salad and soup were alright but nothing amazing.   Overall the food was good as was the service and the overall decor but it seemed overpriced for what it was. I would recommend going to Gordon Ramsey's Burgr place across the street at Planet Hollywood I think it is way better than the Pub and Grill.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lamb burger with fries
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ceasar salad
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pub ale onion soup

p96vJ7KIrm1OEEykrojlsA.text: We keep coming back here when we're in town. The Bangers and Mash are great, the drinks are devine. We received our food and drinks super fast. Our waitress, Stacy, was amazing. She was really friendly, intelligent, and although she was really busy and obviously working hard, she didn't let it show. She was calm and not stressed at all. Better than most wait staff I've experienced (give her a raise, Gordon).

x5iGAQ79bUlaMURA7D7N1Q.text: Not sure why this place gets bad reviews.  I've been here several times and the service and food are top quality.  The happy hour is great with great Irish nachos and the beer selection is pretty impressive too.  My favorite dish is the Curry Chicken and it goes great with an Innis and Gunn.  Will definitely come back when people come to town.

YM4yYG4-4Hl9K5yfUa7IiQ.text: Came with a large group since we were staying in the hotel. For an appetizer we ordered a lobster roll that was well seasoned but very small. Their signature salad was not seasoned well and the ingredients didn't compliment each other. I had the beef tenderloin that was not seasoned at all and I was very disappointed. My cousin had the ribeye and it was more seasoned and had a better flavor. The service was slow and it took us 2 hours from the time we sat down until they brought us our checks Also we had a specialty cake and we were charged $3 per slice but they didn't cut or help serve the cake, for them to hold the cake which was a bit ridiculous since we spend over $60 per person here and we had 15 people I our party. If you have a choice for the price I would say skip the restaurant unless you really want a $15 burger. But hey it's Vegas!

G7dWMpSepZahhrUwOaOO0A.text: The average 3 star rating is pretty accurate, although I give it 2.5. After my fiasco years ago at his restaurant in LA, I decided to give another one of his places a try. Well, that will probably be the last time I ever eat at one of his restaurants again. One would expect, of all people, for his restaurant to have really good fish and chips. Nope, they were kinda dry and just mediocre. Actually, all of his dishes were just okay. If you removed the name and decor, it's about a $10 meal. Instead, it was approximately $50/person but we did each have a beer.

ULQitxOJd_zVmbVqEqV7eA.text: I can't believe this place has Gordon Ramsay's name on it - the perfectionist who gives his staff hell if the littlest thing is off??  The menu is very meh, but maybe that's british fare for you. There weren't as many of pub food choices that were sharable than I would have liked, and cheaper and smaller glasses of wine would have been appreciated. The quality of the "bait" was very poor.  Just overall a huge disappointment.

TYnYMVhmxb84uGev3nx2yg.text: Awesome food. Great service! Don't have any complaints. This was my first time here and I loved it!

mVg6AxSKJJzG_Uj_eCK0fQ.text: Tayler, this was an amazing visit. I told you I would post a good review.   First, I think the only unsettling part about this visit was the hostess stand. These girls think they're better than everyone.  That being said, the food was outstanding. The service itself from tayler was outstanding. Very personable person and really entertaining and sweet.   I was sad to hear I couldn't meat Ja'nel because she wasn't going to start until Wednesday...which is yesterday, but 3 days after I was there.   Great job Gordon, I was highly impressed.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States

O4st5mQRtlctIZDXYU3niQ.text: Despite the play on the menu, offering very 'traditional' Whetherspoon pub-grub from yesteryear, the food was lacklustre and for all I know it was defrosted ready-meals from a mid-range supermarket. Nice beer selection though.

p7XdZMOL1b8m0jbcVEOGfA.text: Prior to flying to the US, I'd promised myself that I would try Gordon Ramsay's Burger joint and this one as well. I did the Ramsay burger on the 3rd day and loved it so the Pub & Grill was the one remaining.  We went for dinner there on the last night of our 4 nights in Vegas and I have to say, in all honesty, that I had a great experience. Alright alright, I am a fan of Chef Ramsay but you have to give credit to where credit's due. He knows how to structure his restaurants - the layout, decor, the way that everything is setup; it works!   Ramsay Pub & Grill has a bit of a retro/funky feel. It's not too formal but then again, it's not too casual either. Whether you're hanging out w/ friends over dinner or you're out on a date, it'll suit the occasion.   I really like the photo of Gordon and his bulldog Rumpole on the menu - pretty funny!  I had the Shepherd's Pie and it was really good. The bread and cheesy dipping appertizers were very nice and I also had a cocktail - not bad. I really wanted dessert however I was too full - that'll be for next time!  The waitress who looked after us was very nice.   You'll find Ramsay Pub & Grill at the entrance to the Palace Casino inside Caesars.. Check it out...

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Shepherd&#39;s pie..
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Logo of Rumpole the bulldog..

wGDFfDXC3Ceebv-8cITvIA.text: In a nutshell: over-priced and awful service. A month ago, I came here with 3 girlfriends. I had decent expectations. While waiting at the bar for a table, 3 drinks got returned from the dining area to our bartender (who seemed new). The the servers were bluntly rude to the bartender about the drinks right in front of us. It was uncomfortable and customers shouldn't be around when an employee is getting scolded. There was also a woman tending (who appeared to be training the bartender). She was snappy to him in front of us about checking our IDs after we had already been served (we are all nearing our 30's and he had indeed already checked all of our birthdays). She never smiled or acknowledged us. Again, it made us uncomfortable.  This woman took our tabs (as opposed to our bartender who had served us, laughed with us, been friendly, taken pictures, etc.) when it was time to sit at our table even though she had 0 communication with our party. She then shorted me money. It was a very small amount, but I was immediately irate because it had been an odd amount due to tax (I believe my total had been 5.36, I paid with $10) and I only got $4.50 in change back. I would understand if it was an odd amount, but I received 2 basic quarters. Nothing else. No odd pennies or nickels, just 2 quarters. It was CLEARLY wrong without even thinking about the math. It was pure laziness. She never even looked at us, just took our money and left.  I did not want to leave a tip for risk this woman would steal it (after she'd already taken $.14 of my own) and I couldn't find our bartender to tip him directly. I boldly circled my "change due" section on my receipt since after we paid the woman never returned to our side of the bar and my party was already at a table. If our nice bartender ever reads this, I'm sorry I didn't tip you. Once seated, it was very hot in our dining area. We were all sweating. Had the food made up for this, we could have looked past it.  I ordered french onion soup and it had (what I hope was) a chunk of rock solid bone in it. We couldn't identify it. Why would there be anything hard in french onion soup? It was super disappointing because the soup was great until then. My friend ordered sliders that were ok, slightly dry but ok. The other 2 ordered the same thing: the burger. One rare, the other medium. When they were delivered at the same time looking identical, one girl clarified with the food runner that they had each gotten the correct burgers to the correct person: she guaranteed they had. They were wrong. One bite in and each girl could tell they had the wrong one. They swapped, we were all friends, no big deal. Up until this point our dining service had been fast, attentive, and great. My water glass never stayed empty.  When our server came around to ask how our food was, the 2 ladies told him about the burger swap. They wanted our server to know of the mistake so that it didn't happen to any other diners and risk the restaurant having to re-cook or clear a check for someone later on. They were professional and kind about it, and didn't expect anything besides acknowledgement that there had been a mistake.  After bringing this to their attention, none stopped at our table again.  We had to stop a random busboy and tell him to get our checks after we'd been sitting, finished eating, for quite some time even though we were in the center of the dining room. The check came out as 1 whole (not sure who they thought intended to pick up our entire $70 bill...maybe they should have given it to the bartender who shorted me) so we then had to wait for it to be separated.   It took longer to pay and leave than it did to order and eat. Overall it was our worst dining experience the whole time we were in LV.

jMP42qoQSoJv0PzmqaHC_g.text: I stayed in Caesar's Palace in January 2015 and knew we had to give this place a whirl. We stopped by for a late lunch, and right from the start I knew the food was going to be delicious. Our waitress knew everything you could possibly know about the dishes offered there. The atmosphere was nice, but nothing fancy -- space was limited since it's inside Caesar's Palace, and the entry to the restaurant is open and wide, so you can do all the people-watching you want as tourists and gamblers trot by. It was quiet when we ate there, with a couple of other people scattered here and there. I enjoyed the *#@& out of my chicken pesto sandwich on mint bread. I would definitely go back to this restaurant to try something else if I could, because there were lots of interestingly-titled dishes screaming at me on the menu. Yay for Gordon Ramsay.

FPUjLsWr7vpzYvBhtyasPQ.text: Wedge Salad was a bit large.  I know, shouldn't complain.  Bangers and mash was good, real good.  One tasted like Oscar Meyer....the other two were delightful.   I would eat here again.  Had a couple of Mojitos from a Cuban bartender and the caramel desert.  No Head Chef at either Ramsey place I ate at this week.  Just can't keep them I guess.  They must be F'n wimps or wankers.  How could you not like working for Gordon!

FyzkpM5ey7mHGKsPNvvocg.text: Great meal and great service!  My family wanted to eat at one or Gordon's restaurants.  We decided on this one.  The food was phenomenal! We had the nachos to start which have kettle chip and short ribs meat.  Delicious.  I had the Chicken and Kale Pot Pie, my wife had the Fish and Chips and my kids had the short ribs and a burger.  The short ribs were some of the best we've had.  Finished it off with the Sticky Pudding.   All of these dishes were great.  You won't be disappointed.

3etEau5yRFulS61iamVhIw.text: i've always wanted to try one of the many gordon ramsay restaurants - finally got the chance!  i'd say the food is very average - got the pub burger and the beef patty was way too dry, fries were at a room temperature - perhaps it's been sitting there for some times? took a bite of my friend's fish and chips though - it is really good.  cocktail is something i'd come back for in the future - salted caramel apple martini - blew my mind! i had to get two at just lunch hour....   would try his other restaurants still next time!

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States

mTt6QvKDva_GWDujqt9IBA.text: We had just gotten to Vegas and decided to try this place out for a quick dinner before heading back to our hotel. Little did we know this meal would take almost 2 hours due to painfully slow service.  Our waitress informed us that they were out of fish & chips...this is supposed to be an "English" pub and you're out of fish & chips...ok.   I had the Caesar salad for an appetizer which was drenched in dressing. For my meal, I had the pork belly roll. I had high hopes since I love pork belly, but this had more fat than actual pork. It was also so salty that I could feel my fingers swelling as I ate it. Others ordered the scallops which were terrible, as well as the shepards pie, which was dry and had no vegetables in it.   The best part of the meal was the sticky toffee pudding.   Overall, this place sucked. I am appalled that Gordon Ramsey yells at and denigrates people on television for their cooking skills while his own restaurant is sub-par with terrible service. I am not a fan of Gordon Ramsey. Perhaps he should take a break from acting holier than thou on TV and pay attention to his shitty restaurant.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Terrible and salty

V45OVBs2zW_IkYFOyVFaCA.text: The lamb burger is delicious and the fries were amazing. Really expensive for what you get but all celebrity restaurants seem to be that way. Great service and yummy food! Only thing that would've made it better was if Gordon was there himself

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lamb burger with no onions. Delicious!

STyrcTGzfoJmbQmGSribHw.text: We've been here twice in 24 hours now. The salads were very tasty and the pasta was absolutely delicious. You can't go wrong with this place it seems. Definitely recommend this place.

bRbVhKYI5OmMg-g6j9RE8w.text: This place is delicious. My better half and I were walking around at the Caesars Palace and as soon as we both saw the restaurant, we just had to try it! We both love Gordon Ramsay and his crazy bad temper, so why not try his restaurant?  We had the Devil eggs and they were out of this world!!! So tasty!! Very interesting way to serve them too. Serve the yolk as a spread rather than already inside of the hard boiled egg white is pretty brilliant.  I tried the lamb burger and it was really good. I asked for some mustard for the burger and the fries and I almost died. It is so spicy!!! Delicious!!  My bf had the fish and chips and the fish was cooked perfectly. Really flaky but crunchy on the outside. Exactly what I expected out of fish and chips.  The only bone I have to pick with this restaurant is the uniforms.....what on earth were those girls wearing?? There was some waitress well in her late 30s, early 40s wearing the trashiest little number ever! And trust me, it was definitely not age appropriate. I would change their uniforms to something a little more modest. Even hooters girls look more modest and out together.   Hopefully we will be back, soon

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fish and chips
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lamb burger with feta cheese. Very yummy

Zrhzji1HXdAmTLOGAFIJ1A.text: Highly disappointed. Prime Rib was chewy. Lobster was iced cold and was sent back for replacement by a chewy shriveled one. For the price, it was not worth it. Go next door to Mesa. Was there last night and the food was at a much higher level for the same price I paid at  Gordon's.

DsECsR0ATlSbXKfepn_ICg.text: The name/image of "Gordon Ramsey" is super hot right now, so of course there was an allure to try out this new restaurant.  It's located in Caesar's Palace, near the Forum shops entrance.  This is the location where the winner of the current Hell's Kitchen will be awarded the Executive Chef position.  Making reservations didn't seem necessary as the restaurant wasn't very full.  In fact, I was a little disappointed in our table selection considering we took the extra time to make reservations and plan weeks in advance of our LV trip (we were put in a middle isle table away from the outside view or more intimate, private booth areas).  The atmosphere of the restaurant was incredible.  The theme of an English Pub was evident in every detail, including the staffs' attire.  The color coordinated Doc Martens were awesome!  We absolutely LOVED the music (throw back memories of high school), which included The Smiths, The Cure, and other great Brit hits.  The menu offered standard English pub food.  The drink menu wasn't very expansive.  We opted to start out with the fried oysters as an appetizer with the Mothers Ruin and Ramsey's Tonic for drinks.  The appetizer was executed and delivered perfectly.  The drinks were ok, nothing spectacular compared to other places on the Strip.  One of my fav parts of our dining experience was the bread plate they bring to your table.  It was phenomenal and I wanted like 5 more!  It includes 3 different flavored pretzel sticks and nut loaf.  My fav was the herb pretzel!  It had 2 dipping options: butter and a cheddar/horseradish (which had just the right amount of "kick").  For our main course we got the Shepard's Pie and the Fish 'n Chips.  I really don't care for lamb and its flavor seemed to take over the whole dish.  The Fish 'n Chips were superb.  All the food was piping hot and seasoned perfectly.    We ended the meal with the Sticky Toffee Pudding.  Honestly, we were so full that we left half the dessert, which was a shame considering it was so good!  The caramelized top was the best part!  It wasn't too sweet and had a nice balance with the sweet cream ice cream. Definitely worth a try!  The only reason I didn't give my experience 5 stars is because of the service.  I was disappointed that for the cost of the meal and quite honestly because it is attached to Chef Ramsey's name, the service wasn't more professional.  I took offense to the young hostess calling me "sweetie".  Her interactions came off as condescending and indifferent... she never greeted us until a manager came up.  And considering I am at least 2 decades older than her, it was rude.  Our waiter wasn't attentive, in fact he refilled our water AFTER we asked for the check.  We also had to ask for appetizer plates and utensils/napkins twice, while the appetizer grew cold.  While fine dining is meant to be savored and time is not of the essence...the 20 minutes it took to just get our check and pay wasn't necessary and was wasted moments of my life.     If only Chef Ramsey had been around....our dining excursion would have been heavenly.....  I mean who doesn't like Hell's Kitchen?!?  :)

Md7DAYMvV0PexJ3I_mPi0w.text: We've been here twice and have been satisfied with the service and food both times. This time around we had the fish and chips and a side of Brussel sprouts. Both were very good and the food came out so quick! Considering it was New Years Eve, we were especially impressed with the service because this place was packed! Look forward to the next visit. I'd like to try a burger and dessert next time!

Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States

55oUWkVCQrQGCxCR9pDF5Q.text: Great pub with wonderful food. Our server, Heather was amazing helping us to decide what to eat and providing excellent friendly service.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Jd_lMxso6ESIkSu1vgV_PA.text: My favorite stop on any trip to Vegas! The New York strip steak is my go-to and I had a hankering for it from the moment our tickets were booked this last time around. Fabulously seasoned, a hearty cut, and cooked to perfection, i'm craving another just thinking about it. If you're visiting on the weekend try to book a table online to avoid any wait but being there in the middle of the week, we got lucky I guess and were seating immediately.   Leading up to the meal I gave the garlic/parm macaroni a go and it was so tasty but mannn, pack a mint, tons of garlic gave it a real KICK.   Despite how stuffed I was on steak and mac, gluttony won out (per the whole 'Sin City' deal) and I split the Sticky Toffee Pudding with my travel homie. A warm treat topped with ice cream and a chunk of toffee brittle, super decadent but a must try.   Decor is comfy, flat screens with all times of sports airing, and a friendly wait staff. If you're going to try any of the Ramsay restaurants in Vegas, I'd recommend his Pub and Grill to anybody.

CGlHx7Ok-NbjN7-vkiz19g.text: Christian and Nong at the bar were fabulous with wine selections! The menu was great-best part hands down was the chocolate trifle!!!!!

2zTZbbnqzupaS9CFdMn1BA.text: I had the fish and chips. The fish was bland, the tartare sauce had a skin on it (oxidized), and he chips were just steak fries, not even remotely proper Brit chips.  Service was good and the decor is atrocious. Why did I go here???

ImtSndKQ_9YehoaYYY7vEA.text: Quick dinner while in Caesars Palace. We visited on a Saturday evening and for a party of 5 we were seated pretty quickly. Our group ordered fish N chips, lobster and shrimp roll, Shepard's pie, deviled eggs, Mac N cheese and beef sliders. I enjoyed the last three items I listed and will start with my favorite which was the Mac N cheese. I had the selection with bacon and jalapeno. It had a lite bite of spice with a sharp cheese taste. It came out piping hot which I loved. The sliders were good with bacon, some type of sauce and arugula. Now the deviled eggs were pretty bland. I could really only taste the bacon and the egg mixture needed some more seasoning. I could have made them better at home.  The decor of the restaurant made you feel like you traveled to London. Or it could have been the Queen's Elixir Martini (nice and strong made with gin) but either way great atmosphere and good food.
