Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sliders
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Deviled eggs... Sort of bland

5jmKrZmqBjJCILq3DeX-Bg.text: Third time here never disappoint, their wings, fish and chips, nachos, chicken pot pie and the amazing beef Wellington, wow!

bvWzj18qAh_gKaw_ke8E6w.text: This place was ex.cellmb m  ent. But of course what makes a great restaurant is it's persml. m Mm uonnel. Heather, our waitress, was excellent. Great p. ersonality. Very professional. You can tell she  MLBloves her work. Gre at j ob! .m

9KcHV4rWcClVLdr_l9ilYw.text: The food here was very tasty. I really enjoyed the butter chicken curry and the lobster Mac and cheese was a hit as well.  Nice vibe in this place and a free dessert with a yelp check in!

QhWMR6tLqen7FNy2RlDlgw.text: Classic Gordon Ramsay fare coupled with great service and a cool setting.  Our waiter Sladjan is the best we have found in Vegas, always working hard and extremely attentive.  Randy, the AGM is excellent as well.  He is always working the floor with his team.  Loved the Beef Wellington and Shepherd's pie.  We keep coming back!  Such a great place.

xKD5qMz1E9Kf7hU3qS2Eiw.text: We dined here before seeing legend Elton John and how British it really was!! Considering we were seeing Elton John, it really completed a British evening. We made reservations on Open Table and like any place on the Strip on a Sat night, reservations are key. I overheard the wait was 30 minutes but we were seated straight away, due to pre-planning.  We started off with the calamari which was fresh, crisp and had a hint of heat due to the peppers. They were served with two types of sauces, a tartar and cocktail. The serving was a good size as it allowed enough room for the main courses.  I ordered the typical WWII patriotic English dish of Fish and chips. It was not served in newspaper, sorry folks. I was pleased to see the fish as one long piece which is typical in England. I've visited the UK about four times and when I order fish and chips it's always as long as my forearm. The fish at Gordon Ramsey was no exception. The chips were actually potato wedges and not your typical chips. I ate a few only because I don't eat a lot of potatoes, it's a personal thing :). It also came with a side of yummy mushy peas, another typical British accompaniment with fish and Chips.   I highly recommend their sticky toffee pudding. For us Yanks, our pudding is different so don't expect the stuff you buy in cups and lick the lid. It's more of a sticky cake and served with a side of warm caramel and vanilla ice cream. It was sooooooooooooooo gooooooooood!!! Omg. It was moist, sweet, sticky and when you add caramel it takes it to a whole new dimension.   So to round it up, experiment and go with the British dishes. I mean you are in a British pub/ restaurant!

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. A definate must! Sticky toffee pudding! Hellya!
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fish and chips
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Calamri

-iPmk-YDTA3aCaOne2ZKTA.text: Our first day in Vegas (3rd time here) and we were so excited to get some lunch at the new Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill. Cool decor and weird waiter outfits. The reason I'm only giving this place to Stars it's because the prices are ridiculously inflated! $34 for a burger is absolutely atrocious! It's like they're taking advantage of the Taurus. Gouging you any chance they get. We quickly learned to go off of the strip to eat and have fun. We will probably not stay on the Strip again either. It's just not worth it. The Burger was amazing but it wasn't $34 amazing. It was worth about $17, maybe $20.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Calamari. Pretty good.

cd8tzgvlIU_Q6_qgK31yuw.text: Visited this pub on the first day of my trip. I ordered the nachos, they were hand cut chips, cheese sauce, short rib, peppers and some other goodness on a plate. I was expecting the traditional nachos,but this by far exceeded my expectations. Great part about it was the process, 7 bucks for cheesy goodness! Heck yeah I'll take it. Now this was during happy house, but I think the original price is about $16. If I get a chance I'd go back to try something else because the menu sounded delicious no matter what you picked.

N46NbQFY94xJEygC3QIa3A.text: Agree w/ the ratings. Had high hopes. Food was OK. Unremarkable. Servers looked like displaced craps table dealers. Didn't seem to be trained in waitressing. Table was a little dirty, which always get me. Ordered a variety of food, but nothing stood out. Servings seemed pretty small, in fact. Signature burger was ok. Unremarkable. Fries were good!   But, wait for it... The dessert! Sticky toffee pudding. Sweet, sticky, yummy, boozy. So worth it! 5 stars. Forget dinner and just come for dessert.   Casual atmosphere (bar-ish), w/ high tables/stools. Adjacent to the casino, so casual. Wouldn't recommend for any romance of sorts. But the sticky toffee pudding..... ah......

ZsnugTZOOJWkr0I_xltdHA.text: I love Gordon's Burgers, so while staying in Caesar's, I decided to head downstairs and try out his pub and grill.  Service was great, the hostess stand was a little slow, but overall not terrible.  I was seated and my server was very attentive and knowledgeable about the menu.  I have to say, from reading the other reviews I was a little hesitant to eat here, but really it was a nice place.  I had the fish and chips, which was a perfect amount of food, though I wish it had come with one more fish.  It comes with 2 pieces of fish and about 15 or so fries.  I was advised the fish and chips were better then the Shepherd's Pie by the server, so that's what I went with.  Overall, I'd come back here for sure.

Pt_mTaxScMoIimil3gshTw.text: Alex was a phenomenal waiter. From menu suggestions to the extra reading glasses , he was spot on!!!  Great time. Great dinner.

wuBBSVmzd7zSDsFGVSQBEA.text: My husband and I were so happy to have the chance to dine here. The food and drinks were perfect.  We both ordered the special and tried all of Gordon's signature dishes. Everything was seasoned and cooked to perfection. The service was outstanding. We will definitely be back.

mfYUFC9gFFBg6-vGuDro1g.text: The best burger I had in years (beside the one I fire at my backyard ) Michelle was amazing and went the extra mile to serve us Thank you Gordon ( if you're reading this!)

Oghwjjl0krJfaAQFnCZI3Q.text: Love this place! Great food, great workers. Ronnie behind the bar is awesome, he had excellent recommendations and made you feel at home!

xkzLYzddVrIu4GwEM5omHQ.text: So yummy and a great place  with the family.  Scott H was our waiter and he is phenomenal! If you come request him as your server!! You will be happy you did.  The restaurant is great and paired with Scott equals a superb dining experience!

HACK1Ul8WB7qYtm57BdbAg.text: Service: 1/5 soooooooo slow. The servers were so slow but they were so painfully inattentive and SLOW SLOW SLOW! We asked for ketchup and extra tartar sauce like 4 times and never got it... we'd finished our fries by then so just gave up. Check and payment took about 15 minutes. I'm usually really understanding about lacking service but...it was not busy at all.  Food: 3/5 the chopped salad is basically a replica of the one at Ramsey's Burger. I suppose it's my fault for wanting to be a little healthy, but the salami strips were awkwardly long. It was an ok salad, nothing to brag about. The fish and chips were alright, but it's so confusing because his fish and chips place near the LINQ is so much better. Confusing how his restaurants don't serve the same quality fish and chips.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States

iA1W1e_Be9sClOd39Y6rvA.text: I came here on a Sunday evening after walking by this place all weekend during our stay at Caesar's Palace. I wanted to treat my friends at Hell's Kitchen, but all of the reservations there were booked so we came here hoping it wasn't the same ordeal and fortunately we were able to be seated on upon arrival.  We were first seated on the high top tables and asked to be seated in the booth which they moved us with no problem. The waiter was very friendly and was able to take care of my friends with various food allergies from lactose to peanut allergies (such a struggle).  I ordered the 8oz Beef Tenderloin medium rare while my friends got Oven-Roasted Scottish Salmon, 12oz NY Strip, and Beer-Braised Short Rib. We sampled each other's meal and they were all delicious. It is what you would expect from a well known chef and more.  For dessert, I got the Sticky Toffee Pudding which you can get for free when you check into the restaurant. Mum's Apple Tart was also ordered. I was surprised how good the Sticky Toffee Pudding tasted as it looked like any ordinary dessert from face value. Desserts definitely blew my expectations away on how good it was without being too sweet.  Overall, one of the best dining experience I've had in my life. This is probably the best in Las Vegas I got, which the food service was what made the entire experience really worth it and food being secondary. Highly recommend if you win big or you're looking for a great dining experience.

UmMf9QlmzpqFt9h17L7eXg.text: Pretty chill night for a dinner on Thursday.  Mike was our server and was awesome!  Our table enjoyed bone-in ribeye, tasting menus, mac n cheese, and truffle fries.  The scallops were divine!  Drinks and dessert was great.  Definitely a must for a Caesars visit.  Thanks Mike!

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pub and Grill!

bE_3s74dpE3bGrkhJCBYpg.text: Service was great. Table of 4 and sadly the $17 caesar salad was flavorless and tiny. Glad I also got the sliders which were delicious but the salad was week. Crazy cause I think I could make a better salad. Was really looking forward to this meal but it felt short. The wings my buddy got were just ok. We were shocked cause it's a Gordon Ramsey restaurant and based on his shows I don't think he'd serve the salad and wings we got. The butter toffee cake was delicious. Ya know going to this was really looking for an outstanding meal but again  fell short.

YVSM-TQ1Ensl_ergQH-JTA.text: Unbelievable food,l and excellent service. We both ordered the omakase and it was out of this world. We will definitely be back to Zuma.

BMlDynYbl3bZsjYHs7D2Fw.text: The food here is excellent. Located inside Caesars Palace with lots of seats but also very busy during dinner so reservations are recommended. The toffee cake dessert is my favorite in all the strip.

CTrlpWrn3CeWroTgkP_TZw.text: This experience was everything my guest and I wanted it to be! We were hoping to maybe catch a glimpse of the winner from this season of Hell's Kitchen that owns this restaurant but did not. Maybe next time!  There are a large amount of beers and handcrafted cocktails at the bar and tables. Since it was a pub, they were expected. However, the incredibly friendly and hilarious bar tender was unexpected and a pleasure to chat with. We were so involved with him that we almost missed our reservation.  Dinner was spectacular. We started with french onion soup and tomato basil soup. Both were incredible. Then came fish and chips and a filet mignon. Both were incredible. The rice pudding we had for desert was different and interesting but still great! It's pretty pricey, because you're in Ceasar's Palace let alone it's Gordon Ramsay's restaurant, but it's worth it!

Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Rice pudding with caramel sauce
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fish &amp; Chips with mushy peas

u6VITtOgzdugVj2Nglxabw.text: Hearing how picky Gordon Ramsay is about food I went to this place with high expectations. The wait time was about 10 min to get in , so not that bad for Saturday evening right after the Celine Dion show across the hallway .   Service was attentive but didn't give us any suggestions. I ordered steak and mushrooms pie . Food came hot but it was lacking spices.  There was 4 small pieces total of steak and the rest was a gravy with vegetables. I   actually had to hunt for the meat . Vegetables were overcooked so you had no idea what actually you eating.Bread was hard to chew or break apart. I only give 2 stars  because I was expecting to be blown away and I was not that impressed at all. I would not reccomend this place for the price they charge.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States

HKlroILksnwnN1yHFLt2yQ.text: So I'll be fair and start with positives. We had a reservation and were seated 15 min early. The Poutine fries/corned beef were pretty good. The Shepard's pie was fantastic, very hot so allow to cool A bit but it was amazing   The bad. The service was not very good. It took my wife 20 minutes to get her Diet Coke. I ordered a 35oz Guinness which wasn't bad, but clearly was not poured properly( Guinness is very specific). My wife had the rotisserie chicken. Dry, zero flavor.   For the price you pay, go somewhere else

dkiQA3nQA5h54yjBhds-MQ.text: This place was awesome! Beef Wellington is cooked perfectly and the salmon was exceptional. I can't say anything negative about this place. Service was A++ food was A++ and drinks were delicious. I'd come back repeatedly to this place. One of the best in Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Perfect
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Salmon was to die for.
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States

dfa8CC6zAYAsfQD3yxfPXw.text: Deviled eggs were amazing. Service was amazing. Make sure to make reservations (although some days you might not really need them) it's better to get seated right away than wait 30+ min! I got the Cesar salad which was good but I'm not a big fan of anchovies & they put those bad boys right on top. Which when i took them off left my salad a little fishy tasting. Also got the tomato soup & my god that was AMAZINF!!! i love Gordon Ramsay so much & i was extremely excited t be able to sit down at one of his restaurants.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Caesar Salad
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tomato basil soup

X0oLjq55ckqWMt25Ew0T_w.text: Concept...excellent. Wellington. Meh. The biggest issue was the temperature of the food. The Mac and cheese and the Wellington were barely warm. My husband had a burger and said it was amazing. The prime rib was good as well. My friend and I had the Wellington. The seasoning of prosciutto and mushroom made for a soggy , oddly flavored Wellington.  The Mac and cheese was good, just like warm. I'm not sure Ramsey would approve.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Wellington with Mac and cheese

VTDGmNnvijJkdG5T3Xbwkw.text: So good bit the food is a bit heavy. Very kind staff. If you are looking for comfort food, it is the place to go.

kpLtfHgCNQ1CUG7c4vZcNw.text: So many classics English dishes on the menu. Loved it!  Had the fish n chips with traditional English mushy peas.  I know doesn't sound great but very yummy! Big beer steins and great relaxed atmosphere.  If you can save room for the English sticky toffee pudding.  A lip smacking good treat!

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States

n6JEHIzsrK5seey-72O0jQ.text: Fantastic food!  Great place! Everything tasted better than it looked!

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sticky Toffee Pudding
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beef Wellington
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. English Ale &amp; Onion Soup/Seared Scallops

P4R-LE0hPHn1WCoKeo-axg.text: The fish and chips were delicious, great place to stop for lunch at Caesars and our server Christopher was awesome!

wEyfienoQc8Me23XAArVAw.text: A more casual experience to the Ramsay restaurant business.  We got a quick seat and were served fast.  The joint has TVs all around and just has the sports bar vibe down.  I had the UK Flight and my wife got the IBU Flight.  Both were excellent and delicious.  It was just cool to have a seat and take a breather and drink beers at Ramsay's.  It was a 15 bucks for a flight I guess that's rather nominal for Vegas.  We got the truffle fries for snack and they were a little bottom of the barrel for us but they do have actual grated truffles which is nice.  Overall it's for the fans and if you also like beer you can't miss.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Getting angle correct
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lovely setup

JV4vNpIqMeu2sWWFD2srzw.text: This was our 2nd time here, and really I came for the sticky toffee pudding. But we were already here, so why not have dinner?!   For a Friday night, there was only a 15 min wait via Open Door reservations. The hosts were friendly, and the service was fantastic...5 Stars!  Our total bill was about $120...the tasting menu was $80 itself but we split it among 2 people.  We started with the wedge salad with blue cheese crumbles, bacon, tomatoes, crispy onions, red onions, hard boiled egg, and a sherry dressing...it was very fresh tasting with lots of flavor.  They had a sample tasting menu consisting of seared scallops with a vegetable medley...delicious! Maybe the scallops were a tad overdone, but the sear was nice and buttery/crusty! Next course was the beef Wellington...Gordon's is one of our favorites, but compared to the entree at "Steak" at Paris, this one did not seemed to be cooked as well, even the pastry crust fell apart while we were cutting it up, but maybe that was the knife's fault?! It was still very tasty in the red wine glaze! And then there was a cheddar potato puree with 2 carrots & 1 asparagus stalk...all were delicious. And finally, the dessert...it has become one of my favorites, and I hate when I have to pass it up!  We shared the course among 2 people, and it was plenty of food!

NjCQ1uNjxMQS-4LuiLuPwA.text: This was my supposed cheddar burger with Swiss cheese. After trying to wave our waitress down, my husband being the gentlemen that he is gave me the burger he got which had the cheddar because we both ordered the same exact thing except I didn't get truffle fries.   All our waitress worried about was that she put in-the order correctly. Tacky and no Gordon Ramsey's standards of customer service! Disappointed as I am a huge Gordon Ramsey fan! But the service in his restaurant lacks his finesse. Other people can't keep up the standards that made you famous. Sad  Merry Christmas thank you for the wrong order and not even a free dessert for messing up the 80 dollar burger experience! Blah

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. This was my supposed cheddar burger with Swiss cheese. Wrong ordwr

TF7dDx1S6x0rl2VCEA0r4Q.text: Able to get a last minute reservation for this location for a group of 7.  We were seated within 5 minutes of arriving.  There is a wide variety of items on the menu to choose from so it was easy for the group.  The beer menu has a fairly large selection, but I opted to go with the Black and Tan.    We did not opt for appetizers for the table since some of the group was using that as their meal (the wings were plentiful enough to be able to use as a meal).  I opted for a twist on the traditional pot pie - chicken, bacon, kale pot pie.  It was delicious and full of flavor. I loved that it came with a small pretzel roll to dip in the sauce as well as a small side salad (with some awesome dressing on the side).  I don't know the type of dressing since the roll and small salad were not listed as coming with the meal, but I was pleasantly surprised by it.    It seems like a casual fun place to have dinner and hang out for some drinks so would stop in again if in town!

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken, bacon, kale pie

R9Xsrr5Eii-8uymkZvjzLg.text: Ordered the Lamb burger, cooked perfectly. full and flavorful taste. Ordered a side salad with my meal, bill was 3 dollars more than the waitress quoted for said salad.

IhTqOAZ6zEkCslKL3xrt1Q.text: Over priced marginal food. Fish (2 small pieces) and chips for about $30. Fries were warm. It was more like hell's dining than Hell's Kitchen.

bKx_rpG9v_yddjRNnhMN2g.text: Overall, the food here is GREAT. My only complaint is the same as many before me.  LUNCH -  It took so long to get our food during lunch. It was about 2pm and we all ordered salads and soups, only to have to wait about an hour to eat a morsel of food. The drink I ordered, The Pub Crawl, which was delicious, took at least 30 minutes to get. The server said that was normal cause it had 7 steps to making it. UMN, no its not normal. I think he had too many tables and not enough help - he was running around the whole time.   DINNER - Loved the food so much we came back a couple days later for dinner. This time my drink, same one as before, took less than 10 minutes to get. We had great service, and were taken care of. The opening bread pretzel sticks with dips are a highlight of the meal, just don't eat too many cause they are filling! My shepards pie was the bomb.  I would get that again next time and highly recommend it.   *If you get a beer and don't finish it you get a cute plastic Pub cup to go. Great little trip memento to bring home.

OptefYkfQFzmdGlRBsiCXA.text: Huge fan of Gordon Ramsay, Plus staying at the Nobu hotel I wanted to eat here. To my dismay the service at this location was a joke. My husband and I went to eat last night (a Wednesday night) and literally waited nearly 15 minutes for one of the two waitresses mindlessly walking by us to either acknowledge us or even say hello. Nothing! Shame on you for the piss poor service at this location with Gordon Ramsay's name on it. I would hate to see the service on a weekend when it actually is busy. Needless to say we left and had an amazing meal at Mesa Grill and dropped $300 for dinner. Totally worth it, so the silver lining was discovering a much better dining option at Caesar's!

54t4IrhSbbl0taYtNUQD8g.text: I have been there twice so far this year and each time it was great!  I was alone so I sat at the bar.  The bartenders were very attentive even though they were swamped with a full restaurant and people waiting in line to get in.    I had the beef cheek sandwich with their home made chips on my first visit.  It was a great sandwich but I had never tasted beef cheek and did not really like the flavor but still finished it.  Their home made chips and onion dip were great.  My next visit I had the fish and chips.  Plenty of fish, very light and flaky well seasoned but not too much.  I recommend both dishes.  There are plenty of places to eat in Vegas as we all know, I recommend at least one visit here.  I'm sure I will go back again as a favorite.  I like the fact that if you are a Harrah's Rewards member you get a couple bucks off on the price and it's listed clearly in the menu.  Great job Chef Ramsey !!

Ztoi8WzZ9OgW-HGxEJOjPQ.text: First the Hostess are not very kind and are really rude. It was 10:15pm the hostess said it was last call in 15 minutes. Hmm ok. We still were seated in the Restaurant. However they were still serving for another hour. Get your facts together.....   I believe our Server was Elise. She was amazing.   We saw they had mac and cheese on the menu up front however it was not on the menu we were given. So we asked and were brought the pub menu as well. We both ordered beers they were great.  We then ordered out Mac and Cheese and were going to share the truffle chips (fries). Our Mac and Cheese came out before our appetizer.  We asked about it and then just told them never mind. The Mac and Cheese was Damn  good.  They ended up bringing the truffle fries. They were very good, however the dipping sauces were not very good.   Back to the Service. OMG Elise she was great. She was joking with us and made our dinner out a wonderful experience. She made a real connection with us. Would recommend her to anyone...  However the main menu was a little over priced from what i saw the portions to be.  Take a look at what you are serving and make some adjustments.   Will go back again....

NBTYOD0mT4No9pqciYByYQ.text: Visiting Vegas for my 25th birthday. Came here for dinner and Caesar and cleopatra visited me and wished me a happy birthday. The food was delicious. Definitely recommend stopping here if you're in Vegas!

_MaLaK-V2Py6RDzABVUDGg.text: We had a late dinner here on our first night in Vegas - around 9:30 or so. No tables and the hostess said they basically wouldn't have any tables available for the rest of the night - so luckily we found two spots at the bar. We shared the Scotch Eggs, Lobster Rolls and Fish and Chips. Everything was just OK - I was expecting more from Gordon Ramsay!!! The Scotch Egg was basically just one egg, cut in two. At most pubs, when you order Scotch eggs, you usually get at least two eggs - for half the price of what we paid for this one. As far as taste, it was just OK - they put some kind of sauce on it that was almost a little too much. The lobster rolls were pretty flavorless, in hindsight I'm not even sure why we ordered them. I guess it sounded good at the time. The fish and chips was the best thing we ordered - and also the most expensive fish and chips I've ever had. The fish was actually the best thing - the chips were just mediocre. The fish was really good though - and the tartar sauce was tasty. Also, they close at 11:00, which was weird to me for a pub in Vegas. I definitely won't be back and wouldn't recommend it to others. So many better places to eat in Vegas!!

sHWV7F3zaapGI_Dc730rXA.text: Sorry Gordon but English pub food is for wankers. You don't serve Breakfast and the music is too loud for a Sunday at noon. Get rid of those high top tables also in front or tell your hostess not to seat people there that early in the day.  The lamb burger is a big gooey mess with that goat cheese. Your fries could be a little more crispy too .

RJvgFAmYgwnBlToJ5lTwUA.text: Definitely not worth a detour.  What bothered us is the extreme noise level (loud rock music), the slow service, the prices are high because of the name on the door. It is also adjacent to the casino and therefore a lot of smoke comes into the place.  The food was tasty but not a great deal. Will not come back.

vrGDL7piA5uvd1_fSSun5Q.text: Wow! Don't give many 5 stars, but couldn't find anything wrong with this place. My brother and I were walking by on a Saturday night @ 8pm and grabbed a table for two in the dining room. Our server presented the ipad with their brew selection. When he returned we ordered our food and asked him to pick the best beers for our entrees. He hit it perfectly. I had the fish and chips with the same beer that is used for the batter, my bro had beef cheeks with some other beer. We had the poutine for an app. Amazeballs!!   Great service! Great food! Don't know how authentic of an english pub it is, but I don't care. I'll be back.

X0mlW67CMEdeT2SEPIwMBQ.text: The food was amazing but nothing in comparison to the great service.  If there were 6 stars as a rating this would be my first 6 star review. The place was packed but the server and the manager made us feel like VIP'S with a personal level of service that was unbelievable.

DVJFIi9hx4vrglB7jJOC5g.text: Wow, this definately did not live up to the hype. The Leek and Chicken Soup was under seasoned. The hostess was rude. The fish and chips were just average, the calamari was bland and the peppers in it were flavorless. I tried just about everything and can tell you there is nothing special here except the price. Could have gone to Morton's for dinner instead of here for lunch. Too many good restaurants in Vegas to go to this one.

yr_KO8tFbVsgRvSzopdTqg.text: The worst experience we have had.  Very disappointing in Gordon Ramsey staff.  Service was horrible and rude, we ordered Salmon, ate the outer layer inside was raw and gooey.  DO NOT EAT THERE!  Worst experience! We had to ask for the manager 3 times before he came out.  If Gordon was there he would throw the plate across the room with disgust!  I reiterate,  don't  waste your time nor your money,  go to other restaurants that will treat you like you deserve to be treated!

Q1mQuwR74rU2gf3XUVn8Jg.text: I came here for an early dinner so around 4:30 p.m. and I sat at the first bar and even though there were about 4 people behind the bar, not one person even greeted me for about 15 minutes.  They weren't even helping any of the other customers.  I finally just got up and went to the second bar and thankfully the guy behind the bar there was attentive.  I ordered the lamb burger with creamy goat cheese and it was delicious.  I also tried one of their specialty cocktails which involved Guinness and I think Kahlua and it was interesting.  The food was good but the service could really use some help.

jNFR5EyOHc58k5ZDO24UZg.text: I tried the restaurant twice on my resent visit. The first time for lunch. as I approached the podium 4 women were talking and it took about 5 seconds for one of them who all had seen me approach them to ask can I help you.  Well yes you can I am hear for lunch okay lets seat him at table #, no put him at table are you kidding I was the only one in the restaurant at 11:45 others were eating in the bar. I order the corned beef sandwich and the waiter Scott informed me that he would have to check to see if the bread is available. Scott returned and said you are in luck the bread is available, "why should I be in luck for an item listed on the menu". I wish the bread was not available and that I could have chosen something else, the bread was so soggy from being placed on the flat top to toast the bread that the sandwich fell apart.  I had to eat the sandwich with a fork.  Also the ends of the bread were so hard it was not a pleasant experience.  I returned to the restaurant again to give it a second chance. Normally I would not return but since it was located in the hotel I was staying at I decided to return.  It was dinner time and again I was disappointed. I sat at the bar this time to make the hostess job easy for them again 4 women standing at the podium. I witnessed the following from the bartender and others. The bartender after politely taking my order returned to the kitchen and returned with a cup of water melon as he ate it he did not was his hands that he used to stick it in his mouth. He also drank water from a huge water bottle at the bar. If that was not enough he continually checked his phone. As I waited for my food another employee stopped at the bar and informed the servers that the glass washer was not working. Some how he turned the conversation into I did not break the washer I washer I break hearts. Well this went on for a while and something I did not want to hear about after a long day sitting in a seminar.  Well not the food came and again it was very greasy, I order a burger and should be juicy but not to the point that the bun fell apart. I do not mind spending my hard earned money but $37 with a tip for a glass of Stella that was not cold and cheeseburger with fries is crazy. I also paid $35 for lunch which was below my expectations for the Great Gordon establishment.    There might be a reason why the restaurant was not busy both times I visited and hotel was sold out per the front desk.

xqIrYnM-_aFQ2lq-ZsebgQ.text: The hostess dresses were the best part of the experience. Under staffed and cheap un comfortable stools in the bar. $17 dollar drink was less than expectable. The portions seem to be around 600 calories and cost on avg. $25. The menu clipboard is lacking in a variety of options. My opinion it's a place to be seen, not to enjoy good food and spirits.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States

zOfA3yKwP7t54-VPp0tNPQ.text: Came here last night with some friends. Took us an HOUR to get our food. We kept asking when our food was coming and the server kept saying "it's on it's way" (it wasn't). It wasn't even busy and the server kept attending to the other tables ignored us for a very long time. Our server gave us some pretzels to hold us over, but we were still hungry. After our meal was finished, we felt still bothered by the fact our waiter was incredibly discourteous to us, so we asked to speak to a manager. The manager kept saying "oh if you told me earlier, I might have been about to do something" to which we replied "we kept asking where our food was." The manager comped 2 drinks for our friends, but this entire place is a poor excuse for an incredible name like Gordon Ramsey.

sWgZ8Ts-_EpRXiyZuQvV0A.text: I'm a huge fan of Gordon Ramsay Steakhouse (GRS).  I assumed this restaurant would bring a similar experience for this more casual fare establishment (relative to the steakhouse).  I was mistaken.  It took nearly as long in terms of service as GRS even though the dining room was no where near capacity.  The burger that I ordered was not only overcooked, but it took nearly 40 minutes to get to my table after I ordered it.  The lag between appetizers and the lunch entree was not what I would have expected - grant it the time was filled with good company.

eEgUdFKVNLqTw_cvSwC7xg.text: Had the pleasure of enjoying happy hour with the best bartender known to man big Ray Ray. He chose the best beers for my friend and I, I was especially excited when he found a beer that I was able to drink to accommodate my gluten intolerance! The truffle fries are a must and the herb ceasar was perfect! Ray Ray is our new BFF!

42x-M-Iq7c_vTWpDGniT-A.text: This was my alternative option after the Caesars buffet was a bust. Long lines to pay and long lines to be seated.  Looked up what other options and found Gordon's spot. No wait and came during happy hour so we sat at the bar. Great friendly service! We ate the mini sliders (2 come in the order), wings (4 half orders total 24 wings) and a side of Mac-n-cheese. All of it was delicious and presentation on point.   Be cause I checked in on Yelp we got to try the Sticky Toffee Pudding. OMG! Sooooo glad it was a freebie because now I'm in love with this dessert and are looking forward to going back! Highly recommend this restaurant!  Total bill was $60 for two people, which was less than what I was gunna pay at the buffet.

MX5DD7xPaBozJmfH4e0fYA.text: This restaurant is so overrated  It's not good quality food  Over priced Poor service  Don't even waste your time

WYMHKqG3_rYYDq0E_24Z2w.text: Ugly dishes Beef was too salty Wagyu beef was disappointing, the dish could not bring the impact. Honestly I couldnt tell wagyu from just normal 24Oz. Beef wellington was just average. Sauce was too salty and simple. Last but not least, service was below average. Waiter was inattentive. Sticky toffee was overly sweet. Put back some sugar on the sauce plz.

2uN7RRZ_Lhykm1jiitufng.text: Husband and I were excited to try this place since we love watching Gordon on Hell's Kitchen. We paid about $150 for 2 entrees and one beer. The Caesar salad with pulled chicken was so disappointing. The chicken was served cold and didn't mesh with the overall dish. The dressing was good. My husband liked his dish (some type of beef) but said it was not worth the cost of the dish. Hopefully can try Hell's Kitchen instead next time we are in town.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States

tDX8N46upPnxSUb0fz2BxA.text: This place was good but not great. We had a lot of ups and downs for our reservation of 12. We were seated in a private room for dinner as we came to celebrate 2 birthdays in our party.   The service was good. They were very accommodating to collect all of our glasses to put ice in them for each of us. Our alcoholic drinks were good, however the sodas we ordered were all flat and they couldn't do anything about it so we sent them back. The members of my party appreciate good carbonated soda. It took quite some time to receive water refills. Our food came out in a timely manner.   The beef Wellington (one of the best pieces of meat my boyfriend has ever had) it melted in his mouth and worth every penny.   The truffle fries were basic but good.   The hellfire wings were very tasty. That sauce is a perfect amount of spice and flavor.   The braised short rib with mash potatoes was tender but the flavor was just okay.   The salmon didn't have much flavor.   I think this place was a good experience but we're probably one and done considering the pricing is pretty extensive.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beef Wellington
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Truffle fries
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hellfire wings

AzAYHrRiLMV0zbhCr0NpXg.text: 3.5 stars. Now normally I avoid places like this because they are usually overpriced for a mediocre quality of food. But we had $100 to spend on dinner and Hell's Kitchen was not on our possible options, so we went to the next best GR restaurant in Vegas. Located inside Caesar's Palace, it is next to the food court and the Caesar's rewards. The decor and architecture is quite chic pub like. They have multicolored barrels creating a partition which is a cool idea. In the back is an Eng village pub feel with wallpapered wall and a fireplace with a mantelpiece.  We didn't have to reservations but got seated immediately. Looking over the menu, I do have to say, there aren't a lot of options for vegetarians and chicken lovers. We wanted to stick to the GR signatures (cz we are only doing this once!). And those signatures included 4 red meat options, a salmon and a scallop option.  So since chicken was out, I decided to go with the Scottish salmon and my boyfriend decided on the braised short rib. We got the calamari for an appetizer.  The calamari was good! Crispy, tasty, albeit a little salty and decently sized. The addition of peppers on it was a good touch.  I was a little underwhelmed by the salmon. Broke off beautifully and was obviously well-cooked. But I love my flavours and it was quite bland. The veggies in the cream sauce around was a decent touch. But, maybe add some pepper?  The short rib, again, broke off beautifully. In fact, my boyfriend did not need to use a knife! But he wasn't seeing stars with it. At times, it had a slight burnt taste. The veggies and mashed potatoes on the side were decent.  Because of our yelp check-in, we got a free sticky toffee pudding - a desert lover's (not me) delight! It's a hefty sized thing, so easily something to be shared by 3-4 people. It was good, but got quite heavily sweet towards the end. All in all, pricing of the food matches the restaurant name but I cannot give the food more than 3-3.5 stars. Guess I was looking for more spices from the GR recipes!

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Scottish salmon
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sticky toffee pudding
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crispy calamari

RYCbRNOrvC6WNbByLZsU5w.text: Make sure you check in for a free Sticky Toffee Pudding! Max two free desserts per table. We were trying to go to Hell's Kitchen, but it was fully booked for next two weeks. Fortunately, Gordon Ramsay Pub and Grill had plenty of open seating!   I tried the Beef Wellington on this visit, and it was awesome! I've been wanting to try it every since I started watching Hell's Kitchen on Fox. The flaky crust complimented the steak perfectly. Even the side of potatoes were so soft and flavorful. The Sticky Toffee Pudding was definitely a highlight of the meal. The cold ice cream was the perfect addition to the warm pudding.   Overall, my visit here was outstanding! The service was great, and the food was awesome. I can't wait to try Gordon's other restaurants on the strip!

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States

O03WTsSH3ocBhY31V1X0_Q.text: "Chefs are nutters. They're all self-obsessed, delicate, dainty, insecure little souls and absolute psychopaths. Every last one of them."  Gordon Ramsay  But boy do we love you, Chef Ramsay!  We got the Washington Steamed Mussels with thick cut fries fries and the Maine Lobster & Shrimp Rolls with a side of brussel sprouts. Everything was insanely good! I couldn't believe how much mussels you get for $14. They were steamed in a mild hefeweizen with some Sriracha. Rodney told us to dip the perfect crispy-on-the-outside-and-creamy-on-the-inside fries in the beer and it was great. The Maine Lobster & Shrimp Rolls were also amazing. Served on a toasted and buttered roll, you get huge chunks of lobster and shrimp. It was creamy, had bright citrus flavor, sweet from the natural flavors of the seafood, with the slight bitterness of the daikon sprouts to help cut through the fat and acidity. It was a great balance of flavors. As for the brussel sprouts, you could probably safely pass on these but hey, we needed some vegetables that weren't deep-fried, okay?  With the Yelp check-in offer, you get a free Sticky Toffee Pudding! Rodney put us to the test to guess the cake. *whispers* It's a date cake! They put caramel and vanilla bean ice cream on top and wow! What a great dessert! It'll make you want to stomp your foot like a horse that just learned math!  So come to GR Pub & Grill! You can get a taste of a British pub while being dazzled by the flashiness of Las Vegas! 5-stars because while the food is amazing, Rodney really made our evening!

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sticky Toffee Pudding! Free with Yelp check-in!
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Maine Lobster &amp; Shrimp Rolls.
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The spread.

VomJQ4NUtlGWO8z4wLz_Ww.text: "Look, Joyce! It's the man of your dream's place!"  I pointed out, me flipping Mesa Grill the bird, as we stroll on by.  Yaaas! We're going to MY man-crush's place, GR Pub & Grill! Ever since I stopped by GR Burger, I have decided I need to try his other places.   GR Pub & Grill did not disappoint. We came here for dinner on a Monday night and were seated at a high top with ease. Our waiter was Rodney and he was a cool guy. Since the wife and I had a pretty delicious lunch, we decided to just order a couple of things to share. Joyce got the Steamed Washington Mussels and I got the Maine Lobster & Shrimp Rolls. We also used our Yelp check-in offer to get a free Sticky Toffee Pudding.   Everything tasted as good as Ramsay looks. The mussels were cooked in a delicious hefeweizen with some Sriracha, some thick cut fries served on the side, and the Maine Lobster & Shrimp Rolls were tasty. And the dessert, don't get me started! We were asked to guess what flavor the cake was by Rodney. I guessed raisin and Joyce guessed fig. The answer? It was date! We were pretty close so we felt good.  All in all, GR Pub & Grill was great! Get your British pub food faire here in Las Vegas. And if you have Rodney as your server, you're in for exceptional service. Now go and give my man-crush your patronage and money!

Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Another shot of inside decor

Wl9Wlenrvd1xZL5ozhG5yg.text: Thanks to our server, Julio, for making this a fun lunch!   We made our reservations on OpenTable for a late lunch, but were pleased to discover that it wasn't packed. The atmosphere was "upscale pub" and the food followed theme. We opted for the calamari appetizer to share, which was a delicious crispy treat (though just a tad on the greasier side?) with yummy cocktail and tarter sauces for dipping. We also split the mini burgers, which came as a duo. And then we were treated to a Yelp deal of a free sticky toffee pudding. And O.M.G. if you haven't tried this dessert yet, please do so as soon as you can! It's light and not too sweet and melt in your mouth all kinds of yum.

R_0Egg7e0gWNyjM_Nx8T0Q.text: I only came to get Wellington Steak to go.l since I was intrigued by the reviews and photos. I ordered from the bartender and waited while getting an opportunity to witness the intense work that a Las Vegas bartender goes through.   The Wellington Steak eventually arrived and I took it to share with my hubby and two kids as an afternoon snack.  My daughter, who is usually picky with her food, really liked it.  The meat was very tender and juicy. The steak seasoning was light and  went very well with the flaky crust that wrapped the steak.  It was a pretty expensive (overpriced) dish. But I guess that's the premium you pay for being at Ceasar's Palace and experiencing a Gordon Ramsay dish.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Wellington Beef

z51yQdKp6I5sIdckbY1qfg.text: Stopped in to eat at the bar since I'd never been to one of his restaurants before! I ordered a wagyu filet, asparagus, and sticky toffee pudding. Everything was WONDERFUL and I truly enjoyed it. My steak was deliciously perfect!  I will definitely be coming back here when I'm in Vegas again to try more things on the menu.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sticky toffee pudding
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Wagyu filet &amp; asparagus

WBljchhkz7loUj5QeVPOFw.text: I really wanted to love this place. I'm a huge fan of Gordon Ramsay.  We ordered the Nachos, Crispy Pork Belly, Truffle Fries & the Duck Poutine. The fries & nachos not surprisingly were both good. The duck was horrible & cold. I could not eat it. The crispy pork belly was another starter I couldn't swallow.  I got there on a Tuesday @ 11am, as soon as they opened. There were flies all over. Not fruit flies, bigger. We kept swatting them off our food & I actually swatted one away from my husband's tee shirt. - This was annoying. On the plus side, I checked in using Yelp & was instantly given a coupon for a free Sticky Toffee Cake. It was AMAZING! The best dessert I've had in a long time. It came hot with ice cream. I would definitely come back solely for this dessert. Gave this place 3 starts for the dessert alone.   Another negative was that the bathroom stall offered no privacy. I wasn't comfortable with the gaps around the door of the stall. I rushed to get out of there.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sticky Toffee
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Dv4bMSYUIEA9c5kfTg7u0A.text: This was the only Gordon Ramsay restaurant we hadn't dined at in Vegas so it was time to check it out. It's located inside Caesar's and not challenging at all to find. We had a reservation for just after they opened at lunch on a Saturday. We clearly didn't need one as there was no one there at that time. I know it's weird but I keep remembering that the waiters were wearing studded suspenders, I guess it stood out cuz it was the second time in one day that I saw waiters in suspenders. Must be the new thing, not that it even matters!  First off, there is no kids menu...apparently those are for chain restaurants according to them. Ok then! So my daughter ended up ordering the Mac and cheese side which was big enough for 3 people to eat. The other options for kids are sliders.   All together we ordered the soft shell crab sandwich, the ginormous BLT, the pesto chicken sandwich and salmon salad. The sandwiches all came with homemade kettle chips. They were so good drizzled with vinegar and salt. Everything was so good but the chips definitely needed that extra salt.   For dessert I checked in on yelp and received a free sticky toffee pudding. I would have ordered whether it was free or not! Every restaurant has had consistently delicious sticky toffee pudding. Don't ever skip it!

Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Salmon
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Blt with kettle chips

VrvVlFetq63NBXwetAAjRg.text: I stopped here a couple nights ago and ordered a burger. Simple fare that was done up a notch and was wonderful. Cooked perfect. Great presentation and a decent price given its Caesars Palace.   Stopped tonight and ordered the salmon. Beautifully presented. I prefer my salmon a bit more cooked so I'd recommend medium well instead of medium. Still delicious. Bartender offered to recook but I had enough to satisfy me. Very pleased both times.   Both nights a very friendly and gracious staff.  Third time here. Fish and chips. I thought the smashed peas sounded weird but let me tell you what...they are so good. With just a touch of lemon. The fish was perfect. The tarter sauce was by far the best I've ever tried. So three times and all of it good...they get a 5 star which everyone knows I rarely give out.  Sorry. If I could give them an extra star I would. The sticky toffee pudding is probably one of THE best restaurant desserts I have EVER had.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sticky toffee pudding. AAAAAMMMMAAAAZING!!
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fish and chips. Best tartar sauce EVER.
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Salmon

xA8oFj5eE1BaoVS1T_FnCQ.text: Obsessed with everything Gordon Ramsay.   We have not had something from Gordon Ramsay's restaurants that we've not liked.  I'm never going to be able to eat anywhere again because nothing is going to live up to Gordon's food. Sigh.  ;)  For appetizers we got the Ale & Onion soup, pure magic. The flavor was INCREDIBLE! By far the best onion soup I've ever had.  Then we got the Corned Beef Poutine, I mean, I think you can guess where I'm going with that...it was delicious!! The gravy was decadent, the cheese was super yummy and the fries were just the best! Last app we ordered was the deviled eggs, I'm not a huge fan of ordering deviled eggs at a restaurant. However, my dad loves to and obviously I had to try them! They were very tasty, just enough tang and heat to make you want more!!  My husband ordered the Beef Wellington, which he loved. I had a bite of it, it was definitely delicious! Neither one of us have ever had Beef Wellington before. Naturally we had to try it at Gordon's restaurant. :P  My husband loveeesss old fashions! So he ordered one our server recommended which was a smoked old fashion. They literally smoke it right in front you, so freaking cool!!  My mom got the pork chop, literally melt in your mouth. We ate so much we were about to BURST! She also got one of the signature margaritas, so tasty!!  Needless to say, it was a great experience and our server MJ was very attentive as well as the supporting staff. I highly recommend trying everything you can! :D

xMuUWdFiKyiSx79FFe-fcg.text: Super rare beef Wellington. Gordon ramsey would be ashamed at the perfectly raw center.   It wasn't tantalizing, it was returned.   Although I have to admit the one my wife got looked cooked to perfection.

OYp9_c9SUVW2p7z8I1FBCw.text: Came in because my Mother is a HUGE Gordon Ramsay fan and we just happened to be in Caesars Palace.  We weren't particularly hungry but we wanted to grab a drink and order from the Happy Hour Menu.   We sat in the bar and I expressed to the Bartender how big a fan my Mother is of Mr. Ramsay and he plied us with Gordon goodies like postcards, pens and stickers (So nice!!!).   From the menu we ordered mini burgers to share, I had the cocktail of the day (something delicious and fruity) and a draft beer. The cocktail and beer were good but the pub burgers were just "ok".   Slightly disappointed that they didn't taste better considering this is Ramsay's place but maybe I woulda had better luck if I had ordered a full meal. Overall customer service was excellent and the restaurant itself was very nicely decorated and really fit the pub theme.

8I3mfCG4SnVpsZex-66irA.text: This was my second time eating at the pub and I tried the fish and chips. The cod I could tell was EXTREMELY fresh and I know that because you could see the iridescence when you moved it in the light.  Only complaint is that the batter was VERY salty and I love salt but, it was a bit too much. The chips were perfectly cooked with the lovely herbs in top. Was not a fan of the mint peas that came with it but that's just me. I love mint and peas just not together.  Also ordered the pigs in a blanket and I could tell that were high quality sausages due to their taste and texture. Been a long time since I had a good sausage roll. The house made BBQ sauce was delicious. Both sweet and tangy. Great balance.  I wish there weren't TV screens all over but I get it. Its Vegas and tourists in particular are all about betting especially since its NFL season.  All in all it was as I remembered and enjoyed my experience.   -Las Vegas Local

WZMPzQi1peqVVPu5ahL1gA.text: Well it looks nice, but the service was very slow, took over 25 minutes  to get food from time of order. Fish and Chips is $30 but I guess that is Casino pricing. The staff didn't smile much either. The food was mediocre too.. The batter on the fish disintegrated the moment the knife hit it and the fish was flaky but tasteless..you tell how you feel about a meal when you get the bill, hence the 2 stars...

iSblCfJujJHGctSpdmlu7A.text: Finally tried a Gordon Ramsey restaurant and it was AMAZING!! Great service and a big thank you to our waiter Chris P.

1BoK31GJqq0CCtah8m5vAQ.text: We wanted somewhere casual to watch the hockey playoff and have some great food and was glad we stopped in.  I really enjoyed this cozy restaurant. We were seated right away, in front of a TV--as requested. A few years ago, I tried Gordon Ramsay Steak in Paris and was not impressed, even though I had the chance to meet the contestant winner, Christina. The pub, on the other hand, is all about the food--no hype. Everything was delicious and fairly priced. We even checked in and got a free dessert. Highly recommend!

cJovDElgT1-9ucRjhAiK5w.text: Our first night in Vegas and we decided to eat here. The hostess and waitress were nice. The atmosphere was great but the food was nothing special. We had several beers and wine.....Really can't go wrong there. We also ordered the fish and chips, wings and salmon. The salmon was delicious and the wings were okay. The fish and chips were average.  Probably will not recommend.

tgy8zQzamRW-KfLqkBHdwA.text: The food was phenomenal! I ordered the braised short rib & didn't even have to use a knife!  the service was amazing because of our waiter Day Scott, the next time my family & I come here we will definitely ask for him again! Awesome place!

ItiZLkjBgwv7JHOud5M1WA.text: One would think that a GR pub would have high quality to go with the high price. Fish & chips, what should be the best thing on the menu by a British owned business, were dull and bland. They cost double what other places charged.  My favourite beer (Fuller's ESB) is on tap, which attracted me in the first place. They were out. I can get over that, but throughout the week I was in Vegas, they never did have it available (I called) The extra star is only because the bartender was good. Shame that this carries the name of a chef that is supposed to be talented. Is it he or his chefs that lack the talent?

D7g3bbaXRZWGcetwQneE0g.text: Awesome service followed by great food. My cousin and I eagerly made our way to this location after coming from Rehab at the Hard Rock Cafe and we were not the least disappointed. Our bellies and thirst were quenched.   I ordered one of the popular burgers, which was the Euro Burger which was very good with sweet potato fries and the combination was definitely a winner: sweet on top of sweet. Would highly recommend this place!
