A0BV5rnl2LvVwPLFuq0Jhg.text: This place was excellent. Our server was amazing. He was so pleasant and had great recommendations. We had nachos and they were so far the best food we have had in Vegas so far- we were not expecting it to be nachos of all things.

mzMERoXOxGfYpkUeAh7c3g.text: Shaun was an amazing bartender and made me a margarita just how I liked. It. I told him 1/2 rim salt and not too sweet. I didn't have to repeat when  ordered a second. Super professional yet wonderfully personably with myself and others around me today !!!  Made this a wonderful experience Shaun thanks so much!!

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The food is fabulous. Almost GONE lolol

xUyBDik7XqXTSbLCe4a_Yw.text: We had an early dinner, something small so we ordered the Lobster and Shrimp roll, it was so tasty and good we had two orders. Wine was excellent, don't mind paying for what we got. Service was excellent, atmosphere was fun, reminded me of Gordon! Good job, keep up the good work!

_mbMcg0rXc0yTiZ_frrLDg.text: Dinner with friends.  This place is amazing.  Get the nachos for an app and the short rib is excellent as well.  Sit in Nicole's section if you can.  Great server with solid recommendations!

mNZnBNV52rhT7H6uWWSQ7Q.text: Came here honestly with no expectations. Ended up here because all the restaurants around had a long line. I ordered a french onion soup and butter chicken. The soup was great, I can't complain about it. On the other hand the butter chicken was completely tasteless. Seriously, getting a butter chicken at India Jones (the LA food truck) is waaaaay better than this. When I told the waitress about how bad the food was, she called the manager. The manager came to the table and offered 50% off of the dish that I didn't eat. When I told him that you come here trusting the "name", you expect something a bit better than this. He told me that I have to understand that chef Ramsey is not in the kitchen cooking or yelling at people. What a lot of crap.  Save yourself time and money and avoid this place even is there is no other place to eat.

mdUCIg7CABvEZtx10yRktA.text: Expect to pay top dollar don't whine about paying over the top prices in Gordon Ramsay's restaurant inside Caesar's Palace.  Ok on to the review. The service we received was fun and what I would hope for from any restaurant in Vegas. The food game out quickly and correct. The ambiance is nice. People watching from the railing tables was amazing.  Food: I ordered the bangers and mash and it was wonderful. I see a lot of complaints about the portion but it was a nice size. No need for you to have a feeding trough amount of food. The mash was full of flavor and was perfect texture. I ordered the sticky toffee pudding for dessert and it was out of this world!  My husband ordered the 14 oz ribeye and it was cooked to perfection and needed none of the sauce choices. He ordered his sauce on the side and never needed to touch it since the steak stood perfect alone.   So yes it's expensive but don't go to any restaurant on the strip and expect McDonald's prices for a buffet amount of food.... I highly recommend the pub if you want a awesome meal.

G5ZH7iXRxOifLBxN7ZpvpA.text: My husband and I came here to celebrate our anniversary and loved it! We were at Caesars Palace for a show and appreciated the prompt service. The food was fantastic and our sever Rod provided excellent customer service! We had the braised short ribs, bangers and mash, and sticky toffee pudding (best dessert ever!).  As Las Vegas locals we will definitely return for date night.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Delish!

ZfiwqapNCKHllky1dfVeSA.text: Had a great night!  Took my daughter out for a daddy daughter date and had a great time!  Shepherds pie and fish and chip.  Thank you Travis for fantastic service!

mMKWghgiROZSJ2sWphHutg.text: Came into the restaurant  at happy hour and the staff was friendly and attentive. Most outstanding customer service we received was from Antwon, one of the bartenders. He was funny, attentive, and helped predict our needs. His drink making skills were great as he promised. My friend ordered the Goodbye Blue Sky drink and it was awesome. I ordered the smoke and mirrors drink and it came in second in taste and quality to my friends drink. The sliders were savory and tasty. The wings were pretty good. Definitely recommend getting a drink with Antwon anytime you stop by. He was even kind enough to get me a warm towel when he overheard me saying that I wanted to go wash my hands because they felt sticky after the wings.

NyyC4-n7uFT5g3Zqe1IQBg.text: Solid pub fare. The beer braised short rib was good. Wife had the fish and chips. Fish was great. Fries were typical American fare.

zA-nRvOPnsZMXKz7OamCbw.text: Great service! Food was yummy! Joe (from New York) was our server. He was fantastic. I split a meal.  We shared the shrimp cocktail which was clean and very flavorful. The shrimp were huge. We ordered the Hell's Kitchen burger. OMG! Yum! We also got the Brussel sprouts as a side.  Great place to have lunch if you are staying at Caesars or close by.

5DtdVLgMmiUUR108bSiErw.text: Wow.   My friends and I had dinner at Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill inside Caesars Palace and it was incredibly disappointing. Our waitress forgot our drink orders, so she came back to ask us what they were 15 minutes after she promised to get us some glasses. We decided to cancel our drink orders right then and there, because hey, why spend $11 on a beer when you can get drinks for free while gambling? She then brought out our canceled drinks 5 minutes later, reminding us that she had in fact remembered to enter in our drink orders. Uh, what the !@#$? We asked that she take them back.  Other than the strange drink order situation, the food was nothing more than mediocre. But ridiculously expensive. My stupid salad was $17. The scotch egg appetizer was $11. For one egg. I know prices are high in Vegas, but for the spotty service and so-so food, this is a big no-no.  I still can't believe this place exists. Shame on you, Gordon Ramsay.

S0dhE8xEabEqNcDvMKBiFQ.text: My sister and I came here for dinner this evening and were very impressed! We made a reservation for 6:30 and were seated immediately upon arrival. Our server was great - friendly and efficient. The food was served incredibly quickly - we were shocked by how fast it arrived! I had the beef tenderloin and lobster mac and cheese; my sister had the shepherd's pie. All our dishes were delicious! My steak was cooked perfectly and was melt in your mouth tender. It came with 4 stalks of asparagus, which were also cooked well.  The lobster mac and cheese, however, was the high point - eating it was a spiritual experience! My sister raved about her dish as well. For dessert, we shared the potted chocolate trifle - it was a perfect end to a great meal. Was the meal expensive? Sure, but it was delicious and filling. We'd definitely come back again!

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Potted chocolate trifle
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Potted chocolate trifle
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beef tenderloin and lobster mac and cheese

HCwbA-1q-Uy6kh7T0TdtYw.text: I have enjoy all the rest of Ramsey restaurants here in Vegas with the exception of this one. I spent over $100 for two and ended very disappointed with the food that was presented to us. Fish and chips tasteless, Rack of lamb salty! The only thing that was good was the Draft and local beer that we ordered. Overall visit was disappointing and the evening was ruined. Good luck to all those who may attend here!

wGXoICde5kDH36Bm01SFaw.text: Always been a fan of Gordon Ramsey so was excited to visit his place at Caesar's.   Saturday night around 8 the wait was only 30 minutes but we ate at the bar which was perfect.  I'm not a Deviled Eggs type of person but my sister ordered those as an appetizer and I had one and couldn't believe how good they were.   They didn't taste like the kind you get at a picnic.   Very excellent.    Also the Salt and Pepper Calamari was really good.  I ordered the PEI Mussels & Clams with Chirozo and it was amazing.  The mussels & clams and chirozo tasted just like anywhere else but the broth it was in was delicious.  Sopping that up with the bread took the meal over the top.  Enjoyed the restaurant,  good, friendly service,  good food,  not a long wait for orders to arrive.   The food definitely tasted a step up from the average restaurant.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mussels &amp; Clams
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Deviled Eggs

ZNQ-n-mmIodaMSQ8yC8sWw.text: I got food poisoning from the mini pub burgers. Not sure what's going on here. I tried to order a side of fries but the waitress recommended getting a full size burger with fries because it's be the same price and better meat... Also overheard the next table complain that their steak was undercooked.

vsUEiGsDRhM0rxuibcaS3Q.text: Thankfully I do not have to be able to hear to write a review because this place is LOUD! So loud in fact that sitting at a table I had to literally yell for people at the same table to hear me. The fact this place sits in a casino makes it bad, but then if you add the tv's playing sports at maximum volume it makes it even worse.   The food is just okay. I have been to other Ramsay restaurants and they were by far better than this. Although it is not horrible it should be noted. I would suggest that anyone that comes here to eat some of the more British style food like shepherds pie or fish and chips. After all it is a British chefs menu and would you go to a Mexican restaurant and have spaghetti?

lqbvuF7VOM299qzaQk8CnQ.text: Food was very good - scotch eggs, pretzels, tomato soup, sliders...we loved it all.  Took a while to get, but it was worth the wait. We had an awesome server, Jamie - she was super attentive and made it a fun experience for us... make sure you ask for her!

yYEXleqc2csyz5naRU_kow.text: Four of us shared Braised Lamb Shank, our favorite, Braised Pork Belly, was fatty, Roasted Jidori Chicken, dry so dry, and Fish and Chips, same as most places, mushy peas were a hit.  We asked our waiter what he recomended and he just said it's all good.  When asked specifics, he said the same thing.  He either hates the food or he hasn't tasted anything.

L1C7kscLQ2T8KLvoBkd6cw.text: Horrible fish and chips.   Expect the over priced being vegas but quality was poor.  Small heavily battered fish with uneven/different sized chips so they fried differently and were poorly seasoned and soggy.

DfojyGvA5anyhjYzSlk_-w.text: Simply amazing. The fish and chips were the best I've had outside Whitby  the staff is inhumanly friendly, In a good way though! They remember you by name and make you feel like you're being waited on hand and foot. I dropped my fork during my meal, and not 0.2 seconds later was someone handing me a fresh one! I've never experienced service like this and probably never will!

zpjkcDqju8Sins8vJyw0zw.text: The name alone is worth checking this place out because if any of you have seen any of his shows he strives to be the best and well this place is almost just that. I can honestly say I have never had such amazing service in my life. Not only do they refill your drinks the second they are low but they also know what you want before you even ask its pretty awesome. But besides the great service the food is also really great. I had there lamb burger which was recommended by the staff. I was here for lunch so its unfortunate i wasn't able to try there dinner menu. There prices are sort of high but then again it is Vegas so that is kind of expected. Overall its a great place and well worth checking out.

o7Ok7qVeI4EGHOeEmkBVGg.text: Just finished lunch here.  Ate in restaurant side with tables.  Great service by Joe and outstanding fish and chips with the best mushy peas I have ever had.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States

D4n_sdWBY6kXamrlcHsIhA.text: I had a great dinner at Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill at Caesars Palace.  My server Nicole was fabulous. She recommended the Lamb Burger (one of their best burgers) and an Anchor Steam Beer.  It was a great combination,  The burger got to my table in less than 15 minutes after ordering and it was hot and juicy.  This was the best burger I've ever had. The service was unbelievable, with Nicole checking on how I liked the burger and beer.  During the meal the person who delivered my meal suggested the bread pudding for dessert. OMG the bread pudding was soo good and I don't usually have dessert after a meal.  Overall, my experience at Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill was one of the best meals I've had in many years.

5-m92k8VPUtkANXS-5_9xA.text: Fantastic service! Nicole is an amazing server. Why? Attentive, offered a genuine compliment, totally above and beyond anywhere I've been. Second, the kitchen staff: perfectly prepared lamb burger. Fantastic presentation! Also, Keith is a highly skilled bartender. My drinks were top notch. And the manager (Manny) was also very friendly. This is how customer service and dining should be :)

6NM73o2zAlyUuDeM0iTWJA.text: My magical evening at Gordon Ramsay Pub and Grill began two years ago. I had saved over a year for my 40th birthday celebration, prepared to make this an experience of a lifetime, until all the friends I invited bailed leaving me spending my 40th in Vegas with my ex-boyfriend/best friend. We decided to make it a lavish affair, buying backstage passes to "O" and booking reservations at Gordon Ramsay Steak, fulfilling dreams I thought beyond my reach.  July 27th , 2013 - Dinner at Gordon Ramsay Steak  I have watched every episode of Hell's Kitchen so we decide to splurge and order the Hell's Kitchen Limited Edition Tasting Menu with Wine Pairings, fulfilling both my foodie and photographic dreams to eat, and capture food perfection. Our waiter William, and sommelier Thomas were fantastic and might even remember me as the girl in the pink tutu and rainbow furries. Every moment was savoured and devoured, as an evening of good food should be.  Christina Wilson was the chef that day, and I remember happily paying our $600 bill upon receiving my sealed, numbered, souvenir menus to take home.  What we didn't know as we dressed to see "O" the next day is that those menus were already gone, it was not until I looked through the pictures while on the plane and confirmed with my friend when I returned to Canada that we realized neither of us had packed them...because the maid had thrown them out.  I contacted the hotel to search for them, not realizing at first that they were not even in our room on the last day. After a lengthy investigation (6 months), I was informed Planet Hollywood was not accepting responsibility for my menus, and therefore consider the matter closed. I was heartbroken. I attempted to reach out to Gordon Ramsay Steak, it was certainly not the restaurants' fault, but I thought I'd tell them my story in case they could reprint my menus or something. I called the restaurant on multiple occasions, being put on hold and transferred over and over again to the hotel. I never did manage to talk to anyone at the restaurant, until a recent visit to Vegas (April 2015) with my 13 year old daughter.  I wanted to show her where I had discovered my food love, and took a chance on approaching the hostess, I don't think I got one sentence out before I realized she wasn't even listening and then dismissed me saying sorry there is nothing we can do.  Deflated once more, I gave up on having any chance of fixing this situation and thought I had moved on, until tonight.  June 19th, 2015 - Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill  We meet our lovely and kind waitress Elyse, while grabbing a late dinner before our first night @EDC.  Throughout the course of our delicious meal I share the story of my 40th birthday, the amazing food and sad ending, tears begin to fall.  Elyse decides to make this dinner extra special, and brings me a piece of fabulous sticky toffee pudding closely followed by Scott Cummings carrying an autographed menu, I was over the moon.  While being regaled with Gordon Ramsay stories, Randall (the Bar Manager) brings me a couple of lovely mementos and asked to share my story on Yelp.  I want to send a huge heartfelt thank you to all of the wonderful staff I have been so fortunate to meet at Gordon Ramsay's Restaurants; it's more than orgasmic food!

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Magical Night - Thanks Elyse &amp; Scott (June 19, 2015)
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My Delicious Burger - June 19, 2015

amk9edmTqUDnlkhToc2L9w.text: Ya no, not impressed....  I was seriously expecting better... The deviled eggs and lamb burger sounded so amazing on paper but was really just a disappointment on arrival. The deviled eggs were too vinegar filled and tasted like they had been sitting in the fridge for some time. I was expecting an extra kick of flavor from the burger but nope, just tasted like lambs and nothing more... I have neutral thoughts about the fries.  Not saying this is a terrible restaurant but this is not on my "to return" list.

spDAgbQJo_sX10nTUEmL7A.text: Was expecting really good food and service, but all I got was your typical bar food.  We were a group of 4 and I tried everyone's food and can't say I was impressed with any of it.  The service was so so, had to keep reminding the waiter for stuff.  Overpriced for the quality.

y6NYQDd2FyLPOwzqT8aStQ.text: A testament to my Yelp loyalty. I should have read some reviews.   Our server was extremely knowledgeable, friendly, and helpful. The unfortunate news is that this review solely reflects the food.   The scotch eggs were a good starter (I love HP sauce), and it all went downhill from there. We also ordered the pretzel starter, and there was no warning on how hot the mustard was! I love heat in a dish, but there should have been some warning. I dunked that sucker all the way in not realizing that it would take my breath away. It came with 3 under seasoned pretzel sticks, and the cheese sauce was nearly tasteless.   My pulled chicken sandwich came out soggy from the kitchen. The over application of cheese and sauce created a gooey sandwich I was not expecting; The ciabatta bread did not hold up. If they had grilled it on a panini press, it would have been a different story!  I had a few bites of my boyfriend's fish and chips. It was better than my sandwich, but there was no seasoning. To their credit, the fish was fresh and flaky, but there was no flavor to it at all without the tartar sauce.  The meal was a surprising disappointment.

CpCyhACKkbjzEOFPaFLYTA.text: Really enjoyed our meals here the service was excellent . Our server even wrote down the names of the beer flight we were sampling so we could remember what we enjoyed would come back for sure.

ztdayK20MdFnIIiBty2b5A.text: Best restaurant I have ever been to in Las Vegas!  The food was divine!  Lobster Mac and cheese highly recommend. Buffalo wings out of this world. Best service! Best decor! Will be back.

Bbcc5Xx0De_-_5GMAS6ILQ.text: My girlfriend and I went to Chef Ramsey's Pub last week. I have great respect for this man and his accomplishments. His food was excellent. My problem was with the service. The place was only half full and we were seated immediately. We had to wait too long for our order to be taken. Then when the meal was over, we waited at least 15 minutes to get the check after asking for it. Then the pen she left did not work. I waited another 15 minutes and still no waitress so I raised my hand with the dead pen in hand before the manager came over and gave me a working pen. Sadly when we speak of this experience in the future, it will be the poor service we remember and not the great meal...

rz8z2u0CyFw7tncw7eL8UA.text: Came in for lunch between classes at Caesar's. My server, Rodney recommended the fish and chips with a Scottish Lager. It paired well. The beer was cold, the fish was fresh and delicious and service was excellent. Highly Recommend!

Q8NtbbXjne3NEQP-laQGig.text: I was really disappointed in my experience at Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill.   Firstly, the service was terrible. It seemed like you had to ask for every little thing (refills etc). Mostly importantly, we ordered 1 salad and 2 entrees. Over an hour later we finally get the salad and about 5-10 mins later we get the entrees. We noticed it was taking a long time and inquired but just got a passive "it should be coming out real soon!". We noticed from afar the manager (which we found out later) was peeking at us to see if we got our salad etc. It wasn't until I went to the hostess and asked the manager to come over that he finally did. He didn't introduce himself as the manager, just came over and said, sorry the salad took so long. He didn't even initially address why it was taking so long for the entrees. Also, we noticed tables around us getting their entrees way before us. Rather than trying to defuse the situation, the manager seemed to try to defend the poor service. "I don't know what the people around you ordered". "Your entry is late because your salad was late and that caused your entree to be late". He left the table and said he would subtract the salad. Finally, the entrees came and they were mediocre at best. The chicken pot pie was mostly gravy and hardly had any chicken in it. It also was rather smallish for the price (I'm not a huge eater either). The steak seemed like a poor quality cut and was overcooked and not tender at all. After everything was in the ditch, there was no follow-up. The management doesn't seem to understand "writing the best last chapter". Things WILL go wrong in the service industry, but it's how you handle it and how you send the customer away.  Gordon Ramsey needs to have more quality control. He needs to pay this place a visit and throw the book (soup?) at them.   So my biggest gripe was the service followed by less than mediocre food. I might as well just went to the quick food place next door (Cypress?). They are located across from the Colosseum. I would never chance going to that restaurant before a show.  There are some awesome places to eat in Caesar's Palace but I would definitely skip this one.

-9-ikZcGm6Ktfcjd7kAMoQ.text: This restaurant is a solid four. Let's start with its a beautiful place to have a meal.  The decor is fantastic.  the placesettings, the plates everything is really top notch. I do have to say that the service was a little slow. We got there at 5:30 on a Friday so was still early but obviously busy. But it took us over two hours to eat our meal and a lot of that time was waiting because the service was just slow. The way Gordon Ramsay behaves on TV I don't think he would've been happy with the service. However the menu is really solid. It seems they have a lot of British classics as well as some very nice upscale dishes. Here's what the table had we had the pretzel breadstick snack which was delicious it came with grainy mustard and cheese. A friend ordered the scotch egg. I can't say that I am a huge fan of the concept but it was well executed. For entrees we had the scallops the short ribs and the tomato soup. None of these disappointed. For dessert we had the bread pudding and the sticky toffee pudding. Really do yourself a favor order the sticky toffee pudding no matter how full you are and even if you don't like dessert. It is moist, crunchy, and the sauce is soooo ridiculous!!!!

LWuiaVATmlifRZIg_hFjAw.text: I would not come back.  The prices were high for bar food and there were several misprints on the menu.  I expected more from Gordon Ramsey.  Food was average.  The one good thing was the devil eggs... If you find yourself there, get them!

GAkqN4nLEyclOllPalEQ4A.text: Me and wife order steak. Med well. My was cook fine. Hers was cooked well done!! Took over 45 min for her to get another steak. Obvious I was done with my meal. Calamari was OK. Suppose to have bacon on the dish. I seen maybe at best three crumbs. This pub does not live up  to Gordon Ramsey quality or name. Service was ok. Wound not recommend or return.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ordered med well got well done.

DnkaAP3KHurYtxVBMQafvw.text: Much better  than burgr in my opinion. The shepherds pie was pretty good- lots of meat and the mashed potato topping was yummy. The pretzels, which used to be free, go perfect with the beers. And the cheese sauce was delicious. The sticky toffee pudding was super good! Seriously. Delicious.

tLrS9IV2DnxKYVta9jg09A.text: Fish and chips were marginally better than long john silver for 10 times the price. Party of 20 and they would not split up the bill...guess they haven't  bridged that technology gap. ..that's not even tough for Dennys!  So so experience.

mw_zvF3opwQkZOOXvki2lA.text: Craptastic service at the bar- But two stars for having Meantime Porter on Draft and tasty deviled eggs. Couldant endure the bar staff any longer so we bailed on this joint after finishing our beers..

SPxQgYGb2aImoKA_q3AifA.text: Having grown up in a former British colony there are two things I crave ...fish and chips and shepherds pie and Gordon Ramsey's didn't disappoint!  The shepherds pie which I haven't been able to enjoy in a few years was a bit different from what I remember from my you th but the flavors of my childhood certainly came through and the portion size was just right.  The fish was perfectly cooked ...I like a bit of seasoning in my batter but the fish was perfectly executed and I enjoyed the tartar sauce that was served with it but again needed just a bit more seasoning.  We tried so many things on the menu from the delicious truffle fries to the lobster and shrimp rolls and the expertly crafted drinks.  The service was great - our server attentive, knowledgeable but the table set up was a bit odd.  I don't like feeling like I'm sitting in a walkway and our table was directly towards the back of the host stand and we saw everyone that walked by, also we had some fun benches where people patiently waiting got to stare at us eat so that would be my one and only criticism of how the restaurant is laid out.  Mr.Ramsey and his reputation are definitely elevated by this particular location.

5nm9F1f00olia25H0Y0M5w.text: LIFE CHANGING!  No joke, everything we had here was amazing and the people that ate on both sides of our table couldn't stop talking about how great their food was.  Our appetizer was the pretzels (so soft and you have to get it off the Pub Menu) with the housemade mustard and cheddar ale dip.  Then we got the bangers & mash (amazing), truffle mac & cheese (so good) and the sliders (on the Appetizer section of the Lunch Menu) which were so good because they were charbroiled.  The desserts we got were the pear cobbler and sweet cream (whipped cream) which were really good but the best part of the entire meal was the sticky toffee pudding.  When I said life changing I mean LIFE CHANGING!  I've never had anything like it and I'm pissed that I probably never will again!  We put in our reservations through Open Table and I'm glad that we did because there was a 30 minute wait.  At the moment we couldn't find the restaurant on Caesar's map layout online but it's right outside the entrance to the Forum Shops.

1vVmf3IW7QVsJr4sM1Dl_w.text: Vegas weekend! !! Had to come here being a fan of Ramsay...  I have to say drink choices are incredible... food even better took a little time to get here but soo worth it.... portions are small but delish ...  will be coming back

MFbhVPtxxMMij2sPoaSXrQ.text: Lovey food here and not as busy as Gordon Ramsay's burger joint. The fish and chips are fantastic and I highly recommend them. The steak ale mini pie was better then the larger version. Salmon was good, but not my favorite.

TLoGjrr1yUBQVhbmsT4yOg.text: I've been a fan of Ramsay's UK restaurants for years, but many of his other ventures appear to be in name only. His BRGR at Planet Hollywood is overpriced burgers. This "authentic pub" (hardly) had good food, but not great, and certainly without the flair and twist of Mr. Ramsay's usual cuisine. The charcuterie was good and the burgers tasty, but nothing special. If you're going to eat here, try the scallops. That dish was truly sublime. Atmosphere-wise, the place is open to the highly trafficked casino near the entrance to the Forum Shops, so there's no feeling of being anywhere special either. Service was unattentive and spotty.

CO5p0sNVi0UFEluhKl3nxw.text: I just down loaded the Yelp app and searched my favorite restaurant in the Vegas area.  I am shocked by the amount of negative critiques!  I've been to GRPG several times.  ...to grab a quick bite before Elton John, a luncheon with the girls, drinks at the bar after a night out.  I've been there with a party of eight for dinner and once just for dessert etc,etc.  I have never experienced anything but great service and great food!!!    Partial to seafood, I have tried almost every such thing on the menu!  The Calamari, Steamed clams, Prince Edward Island muscles and clams, lobster roll, ...all fantastic!  The lobster Mac and cheese was absolutely the best I've ever had.  The Yorkshire fish and chips were light and flaky deliciousness!  My absolute favorite was the Scottish salmon, served crispy skin-side up on a puree of fennel with caramelized cauliflower.  (Oh, and I did have an amazing salmon sandwich there as well once!)  I rarely order desserts, but the sticky toffee pudding was melt in your mouth happiness!       My opinion is that you shouldn't believe everything you read on this app!  These are some harsh critiques!!  Go try it for yourself!  Until I get to London, I will continue coming to Vegas' Pub & Grill!

EotQvtW2_kkzjKrJrGEh4w.text: This place was awesome. We met Chef Allen and he was phenomenol, make sure Allen is your chef and you won't be disappointed

KS_3VBKE88djHwPs4IP30w.text: Kitchen Nightmare I took a few days off last week to celebrate yet another year getting away from me. My wife and I went to Vegas, not for the gambling but for the entertainment and food. We stayed at Caesars Palace and one evening we thought we'd try the "Gastro Pub" experience offered by none other than Brit Bad Boy, Gordon Ramsay. Truth be told, although I love to cook, I'm not a huge fan of cooking shows, and shows where Mr. Ramsay makes a buck by humiliating what are often hardworking (albeit out of their depth) restaurateurs I find less than edifying. As a fellow reasonably foul-mouthed Brit bad boy who has been known to yell on occasion, maybe I just find it too close for comfort.  In any event, I love good Pub Grub so we gave it a shot. In their defense, the beer menu was excellent and the chips (French Fries for our US cousins) were authentically soggy and British... but beyond that, the food was just horrible... by far the worst we had all week. What was especially galling was the pretense that this was in some way Great British cuisine. Let's all agree on something... much (if not most) British food is horrible... really horrible. It's food made by poor people from less than great ingredients, typically over cooked under spiced and dull. It may have won us the British Empire... but it would get one star on Yelp on a good day. It is possible to do British staple dishes really well, with great ingredients and proper care Bangers and Mash or Fish and Chips can be killer... that's what's behind the current craze of "Gastro Pubs." Unfortunately, done poorly Brit Grub just sucks... as did the Fare at Mr. Ramsay's Caesars Palace joint.  To start with the bread was stale. I had the fish and chips with mushy peas; my darling wife had the "mixed grill". The fish bore absolutely no resemblance to real Fish and Chips, and the mushy peas were simply green peas which had been pulsed in a blender for a couple of seconds... not remotely authentic. The mixed grill (to phrase it how Gordon himself might) was "F*@king atrocious". The steak was perhaps passable (though over-cooked and served cold), the weird pork belly thing was a revolting gelatinous mess, and the lame lone shrimp was either horribly spiced or perhaps spoiled. The waitperson did her best, and when I pointed out the shortcoming she apologized but made no effort to resolve.  Mr. Ramsay, if you are going to use your brand and our heritage to foist over priced high concept but poorly executed crap to an unsuspecting world, would you at least take the "British" part out of your promotion to save us the national embarrassment.  There are a thousand chip shops or hole-in-the-wall cafes up and down our damp nation which wouldn't dream of serving up the swill you deal out in Vegas. It is (by the way) entirely possible to do that kind of fare well in a Vegas context, Todd English proves that to be True every day of the week. If the menu at Caesars was ever decent, it is being betrayed by your team there... sort it out!  If this makes it to your hallowed halls, we ate on September 10th and our check number was 1884527.

ImNJ41ckxSQvwe8mj8pXdA.text: Great place. Best English pub in Las Vegas. Best Scotch egg this side of the pond. Our server Rodney was the best. 5 stars plus.

GWx_0J-R3FqG7AJ4Iki4rA.text: Came here with my entire family for my 50th. Rodney served us and I'm telling ya, what an amazing experience.  Food was insane and the nachos...  OMG.  Thanks Rodney.

L_yv78PTRIdiujtvLAtRVw.text: Make a Reservation first!! we had a 45mins. wait to get in G.R.Pub &Grill which is inside Caesars Palace, it seats about 300 people to me it is authentic and sorta of dark inside,there are all type of tables here tall,short,large round ones as well as small round ones,I saw about four flat screen TV on with no sound,all of the hostess had on dresses that look like newpaper printing from London on it,the server inside were all dress difference too dark pants,dark long sleeve shirt with a vest on that has zippers and chairs that was cool.We ordered fish &chips,english chips,rhubarb cobbler with two scoops of Ice cream,the food was OK nothing really that special,the server also bring a I-pad to your table for you to order wine and dessert on, Our experience here was not as good as expected slow yet friendly but improved as the meal progressed,the server was not that attentive to our needs.We are not in a hurry to get back here.

ukWWRmoaEZ8U4Q-Mv6EVTg.text: Sat at the bar for a quick meal. Chicken pesto sandwich was very good and served quickly. Great atmosphere and quick service. A little pricey though but it is Cesar's Palace. Expected.

oNUrBaxi9Qkz5zFhKgzXog.text: Fish and chips were pretty boring, nothing seasoned or flavorful. Huge portions, but it just lacked flavor. Disappointing.

raWj5LZtb1c39ZnHIlQA6g.text: Gordon Ramsey Grill and Pub is ordinary. They have pub style items at an astronomically higher price. We ordered Pub "spots" as an appetizers which is basically 3 two bite burgers. They were $18. They did not have much variety. You either had to have fish, pork, or chicken. It was very ordinary. Service was decent for a place like this. The only real redeeming quality was that the drinks were good!

V2jO_8Qi8z1_SpnnrZtxJg.text: I ordered BLT Duo was really disappointed.  The burger was cold. Does it suppose that way? i couldn't find any special taste in it! and yeah the fries was cold.  I would say the fries at mcdonald way better.  So why we have to go there to pay for the name?  for sure I wont come back.  I wish the YardHouse open more locations inside casinos.

Et5eAOzXjNCCS3ZB41VZAQ.text: Great food and great staff! We sat at the bar and the bartenders were awesome. My boyfriend ordered his usual beer and the bartender gave him a sample of the house recommendation beer: Innus and Gunn. He loved it and switched beers. We live in NYC and we are now on a search for that beer. I got one of speciality cocktails; I forgot the name of it. It had pureed blueberries in it. It was so light and refreshing!  For food, we had the prime rib and the pie sampler. They were delicious!  Definitely coming back here next time in Vegas!

UyvRlEvpvUax0k_IdfQ8Ig.text: Loved it! Friendly staff! Good food especially the pretzel breads. Too bad they were out of the shepherds pie :/  but I would definitely come back here for more fish and chips!

I2un3ZJKhCZKjQ937YfWPg.text: Made reservations for which we were glad. Good was pretty good but waiter never asked if we wanted more drinks, brought salad right after appetizer and then dessert took forever. It came with walnuts and I have an allergy so I asked him to check to see what nuts they are. He made a production when he came back with one without nuts of any kind,  when that wasn't what I asked. We expected more.

552ET9bzBCJ549QAXBnQUQ.text: This place was amazing. I had Bangers &  mash. DH had steak pie.  Service was great. Absolutely want to return.

rT7UCtDqdeLqBXuUu7w9oA.text: Watching this seasons Hell's Kitchen and realizing that Ramsey made a mistake on the head chef who ever it is. The place is pricy and the food is not good at all. I have been to quite a few pubs and this does not serve real pub food. The only reason it gets 2 stars instead of one is the beer was good but still pricy even at Vegas prices.

JS8hQXy5mGamdGohyfczzA.text: If you want real bad experience even after overwhelmingly spending, this is the place. My expectations out of a world famous chef's restaurant has crashed down to nothing after this experience.  When you pay 25$ an entree and 15$ an appetizer, you definitely expect something nice out of it. The portion is so small that no one is satisfied after the meal. Even the taste is so average. After spending and expecting so much from a world famous chef's restaurant, if the food is bad, the feeling is anger and dissatisfaction.

OdQLc14EM9-EvTrlOpibdw.text: The restaurant is in Caesars palace and is a combination pub, higher end restaurant.  The food was great; ambience was excellent.  the beer choice was great. I loved that they used an ipad per table to allow you to investigate the beers.

Io9GK29466fi_nFBA2dg6Q.text: Very disappointed...calamari was salty & Cesar salad had a bottle dressing not good. Overall food was average not worth the premium price!!!

R4PA8OWLGXuQD44TwAX6Dw.text: Well, I have a candidate for Kitchen Nightmares next show. Here. Yes, here.  Went for Sunday dinner on Fathers Day.  We were seated right away.  However, that is where it all went wrong. Waiting over an hour for salads is unacceptable. Getting bloody chicken wings a half hour after the salads is not cool.  Waiting another 45 minutes for the main courses is not ideal either. So, after a 3 hour meal that was horrendously expensive for pub food, we thankfully got out of there. Servers were either rude or unavailable, which is understandable as they probably were embarrassed by the food times.  Too many other places to go in Vegas to give this another try.

okL3v7jeHRk7DzKMD6Ksvw.text: What a disaster. We came with a large party. They knew we were coming. 2.5 hours later and we just got the salad. We were here for 4 hours before dinner was complete. Manager is clueless. They scheduled 2 servers for a party of 40.

cGDlEhu7xPOWkj9Q1ru6Cg.text: Service was excellent. We were seated right away.   I had the shepherds pie which was excellent. Someone else had the braised ribs. The meat was falling off the bone didn't need a knife. Good atmosphere. Fun. Good selection of beer. Head chef was going around the restaurant checking on everyone. She stopped by our table several times and was very friendly.

DPIbVhDFl7lGUB0UU8gpQQ.text: All I know is that the Fish & Chips mostly the Fish was the best we have ever had hands down. I eat fish & chips all the time and never has it been that good. I'm not gonna lie this place is not cheap but worth every penny. Our family tried 3 different dishes. My son had the Salmon which he loved and myself and my other son had the steak and chips. All were delicious but the fish was amazing. The service was great and they were playing all 80's which my wife loves. Oh Oh I can't forget the sticky pudding, I'm drooling just thinking about it. My only complaint was the limited menu and the prices but I expect nothing less then paying for good food and good it was.

5tkQjpxFZIcp3_RKBj9JCA.text: My wife and I two Vegas locals who are Ramsey fans went out late on a Saturday night.  They were somewhat busy but not slammed for a Saturday night.  We only saw our server twice all night.  The manager brought us free drinks which I had the goodbye blue sky which was pretty good.  Wife had mocha martini which wasn't very good each for 15 bucks glad we didn't pay for those.  We both had pies I had the Shepherds which was decent but needed more vegetables she had the steak and ale pie which was pretty good but once again short on vegetables.  Then we ordered dessert which was awesome except we got up to use the restroom.  We flagged down our waiter telling him we would be right back and when we did everything was gone.  Water and all the table was bussed and once again no waiter to be found.  Overall I was pretty bummed out over the experience.

0-zfrnXFkuiMD64BYAbn4A.text: The service, food, and atmosphere was outstanding. I made a reservation the day before. We were seated promptly upon check in. I will definitely be back.

A6g4oFuICsFdwWgIiQsHEA.text: I have been there two times. First time I had the Sheppard's Pie, not a big fan. Taste was just a bit off for me, but the sliders were great. Second time I had the Salmon, cooked as expected, crispy skin , tender and flavorful. The sides was very nice with a puree and veggies. My guest had the chicken also very good and tasty, but the hamburger was just Ok. Quality of the food is good and fallows Ramsay standards, but a bit pricy for the quantity. I feel the sides were not enough and the portion on the small side.  Staff was very nice but the place is a bit noisy.

dALZQpMn1vdP7qfKDCS1ng.text: The Pub Lamb Burger at Gordon Ramsay's Pub & Grill is one of the best burgers I've ever had.   It comes with feta or goat cheese (I had the goat...  goat w/ lamb) and it was really simple and very good.  The lamb wasn't overly seasoned, which resulted in a straight-forward, fresh tasting burger.   I substituted a green salad for the fries, which was great, but another guy at the table had the fries and raved about them.  Great, friendly service and a nice atmosphere - noisy but you'd expect that being in a casino.

ApbQP8n6oyeROWHxGUnTZQ.text: Service was wonderful ! We ordered beef cheeks stew which literally melts in your mouth and my husband has fish n chips flaky crispy batter with the delicious peas. We really enjoy the beet selection of my favorite beers was the Fullers ESB it's English and went perfectly with my meal. We were one very happy couple and will be returning soon .

YgMWep_n-LrOs9OX5qTaiQ.text: Lets be honest I hold Gordon Ramsay up to a higher standard than your average run of the mill restaurant. For the prices charged here I just don't think this one made the mark. For lunch I ordered the Burger. The burger here is massive and you better be hungry if you expect to eat it all. The burger was also quite good. If I was doing this review solely on the burger would be 4 stars. However my Husband ordered the Calamari and it was awful. For $18 it should be fresh and this was anything but. It was chewy and loaded with salt. If this dish was on hells kitchen Gordon would thrown it right in the garbage. The pretzels were also just ok nothing special. If you go here stick to the burger but if you are going for a burger you are also much better off at Gordon Ramsay's other restaurant Ramsay Burger at Planet Hollywood. Gordon needs to make a surprise visit here because I have a feeling he would rip his name right off the sign if he tried the food being served here.

BoEXHT2-PrBe99Gc_w_6ag.text: The most important part of this review is at the end: the ice cream that came with the sticky toffee pudding! Be sure to read that part! So about this restaurant. I liked it, but not as much as Gordon Ramsey Steak in the Paris Hotel.  If I could give it a 3 1/2 I would. The service was efficient and friendly, and they have a decent craft cocktail menu, which I always enjoy.  I ordered some kind of blueberry cocktail and it was tasty. My Scottish salmon dinner was really flavorful and the salmon was perfectly cooked, but my husband said his steak needed salt and the potatoes were dry.  I tried my daughter's steak and ale pie.  Yum! I thought it was really excellent. I'd order that if I go again. The menu has good variety, lots of items for different moods. Like almost everything in Vegas, it's expensive. I didn't find it to be that much cheaper than Steak, and because it has "Pub" in the name, it makes you think it'd be less. Although since it's in Caesars Palace and it's a chef Ramsey restaurant, it's not surprising. Now let's talk about the sticky toffee pudding. Like other reviewers, I love this dessert and it was my fourth time ordering it at different Chef Ramsey restaurants. The best by far though was at Steak. What's different? The ice cream. The first time we had the sticky toffee pudding at Steak, it was divine! It came with brown butter ice cream in the shape of a stick of butter. Out of the other times when it came with vanilla--believe me, nothing has ever compared to that first time. The brown butter ice cream. I have no idea why they don't offer it all the time at every location, because it is so much better with this dessert.

7CoShaVH5oSNfs6I7F0_yw.text: I kind of feel let down by the hype that was created around Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill. And it's mostly disappointment emerging from the food menu, which pretty much doesn't have very many vegetarian options. You really have to be a hardcore meat eater to enjoy items listed on the menu. Sure, they will modify whatever they can to make it vegetarian friendly, but the best option you really have is well, the beer. We walked in for lunch and the seating hostess seated us at the farthest table possible, which was closest to the kitchen. That just seemed very odd when there was a plethora of empty pub tables and tables with comfy chairs on the walk over. I asked that we be seated elsewhere because I did not want to smell of food. She made a face, but f*ck that. When I fork money on the food at a restaurant (and I am not cheap by any means), I expect to be seated where I deem I would be most comfortable. Once we were seated and handed our menus, the server came by almost instantly. He made recommendations on beers, but given that most beers lately are on the hoppiest side with the IPAs and such, barring your quintessential Coors, Stella, my only option was Boddingtons. Which wasn't bad (more like an amber ale), but come on, I can buy these at the store. My husband opted for a combination of Guiness and Stella, which he rather liked. We also ended up ordering an order of the Warm Salty pretzels and the mini pub sliders (minus the bacon). Here is where food math fails me - there's 2 of us, but there are 3 pretzel sticks in the order. Am I supposed to break one in half to share it 50-50 with my husband!? That said, they were soft and the mustard that came with was great! We requested that the meat be well done on our burgers, but they were medium at best. Flavorful, nonetheless. The order was fulfilling. But nothing spectacular. Our server was great. But this will probably be the only time I visit here.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Boddingtons and the Guiness &amp; Stella blend.  And a woman&#39;s second best friend.

LISDRrmXjpJGUDGIlfQPHg.text: EXCELLENT service and food!  Our server was fabulous!  Food was hot and fantastic quality.

EJh4PTy1mxlbC9JWsEwWGQ.text: Meh. GORDON RAMSEY'S PUB AND GRILL at Caesar's wasn't terrible - but it didn't live up to the expectations I had for it. Especially after I loved "BurGR" so much.  We shared some Spicy Bacon Deviled Eggs and those were solid. I ordered the Shepherd's Pie and thought it was pretty good too. Other items ordered at our table were a mixed bag. I did enjoy that they had Dogfish 90 and Lagunitas on tap.  We had a super sweet server, and everything was pretty good. But it wasn't mind blowing enough for me to return to with so many choices in Vegas.  3.5 stars. Solid, but overpriced and not spectacular.

wWvzMNBIo8dE4QcNSj0fvQ.text: Service is great. The place looks amazing and like you could party there all night long but you're not allowed to! Haha!  The food is delicious, but not compared to BurGR or Gordon Ramsay Steak.  We also met Scott Commings, winner of Hell's Kitchen 12 which was pretty damn awesome!   A must go if you haven't. You won't be disappointed.

fTa_EiIre2lt4i0l-zZDfg.text: Had a great time here for my 2nd Birthday Dinner.   I ordered the Deviled Eggs and the Bacon Cheeseburger. I also tried the spicy Chicken Wings and The French Onion Soup.   The food was tasty, and I didn't really have any complaints.   Nice environment for large groups, plenty of options that will please everyone's food tastes.   They gave me a free bread pudding at the end, OMG it was to die for. LOVED IT.   I would definitely come back.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. THE TABLE

BPM5OH9wIVoywQsf2YXUHQ.text: Good flavored pub food. Not healthy!   Great hangover food.  I had the fish and chips.  Very authentic English chips.  Thick and hearty.    My husband enjoyed a refreshing salad and salmon. It was fantastic.    Gordon has flavor down

3QhrUzeI_f3x3wightTJVQ.text: Excellent food and service! I recommend mixing up the bites and creating your personalized meal! Reasonable prices and super tasty food! You must try it out!

BNPfBcXmUPxDwgOrK06YrA.text: We came down to Las Vegas to see family and we all had been wanting to go here for a while now having been to Burger.  From start to finish we had excellent service "let's get that right," the staff are warm and welcoming and accurate.  We enjoyed some wonderful beer while we waiting for our food.  I ordered the Lamb Burger, which was cooked to perfection, juicy, succulent, along with an order of the delicious truffle fries with the heavenly sauce on the side.  This was the best burger that I have ever had and even though others in my family ordered different things and loved them, I would come back just for the Lamb Burger alone.  I should note that my 3 year old ordered the tomato soup and now compares that soup to others that we have tried to have her taste (little Ramsay fan already).  I have been to the Burger restaurant in Planet Hollywood as well, which had the same level of service and excellent quality of food.  I loved the fact that the environment here was comfortable and not pretentious or over-the-top, it is warm and inviting and my family will definitely be coming back.

fEjsaWeZ4vMT7mwX0c6H1Q.text: We had an amazing time here last night. We ordered the fish n chips, and it was incredible. I live by the ocean and can appreciate a fresh fish. Even the tartar sauce tasted ridiculously good, I learned they make just about everything there fresh.   The service was incredible. A manager came to our table and really made us feel welcome. We had the toffee pudding and it was the best dessert I've tasted in my life.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Toffee pudding was the best.

wENMGPfQSBd5WemvZA99Rw.text: The bf and I are avid Gordon Ramsay show watchers. We came on our first night in Vegas because we couldn't decide where to eat and this sounded as good as anything.   We were totally stoked on the complimentary pub cheese & pretzel sticks, which were filling and delish.   I ordered the shepherds pie which was tasty and very hearty. He ordered the fish and chips which he seemed at least satisfied by.   I think I really wanted to try the sticky toffee pudding but I was so full by the end of the shepherds pie that it was just not gonna happen.   I don't necessarily know that I'd go back on my next trip to LV, but I wouldn't be opposed to it either.

GZOlA2riXmTEOe9N7oaVXg.text: If I could eat here every day, I would. I don't care that it's expensive. Everything was delicious. The food came out in record time, and I nearly stuffed myself as the waiter talked me OUT of dessert (he told me, "you really don't HAVE to." But, no, I do...)  The deviled eggs appetizer was one of the best things I've eaten. Like, ever. The Ramsay Tonic was yummy and refreshing. I ordered the Fish and Chips because I felt like I just *had* to, and they didn't disappoint. Everything was delicious. I loved the ambiance, the over-sized chairs and high tables, and pretty much everything about this place. Just go.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Menu cover

Xw7AyC8dQg-OB8gh7_N3mw.text: Excellent!! Food was amazing and the sticky pudding was out of this world! And our waiter, Day Scott was the best!! Polite, efficient, went way beyond for us.  Helped us get a free dessert thru Yelp.

3shyonom7jT7FHxt0K1B5g.text: I'm beginning to get the feeling that every celebrity chef restaurant in town is merely a siphon for tourist cash and nothing more. The quality of food rarely ever meets the expectation that comes with the famous talking head promoting it. Gordon Ramsay demands quality on screens worldwide, but when it comes to his restaurants you get what you pay for. High quality does necessarily not trickle down from the mega-bucks eateries these celebrity chefs own.    After a decent wait - because these hot spots are always packed - my gf & I took a seat in the back. We were here at an odd hour late in the day, so we decided to just get a couple drinks and split some appetizers. That "couple of drinks" became one when we checked the menu and noticed each signature cocktail was $15 a pop. Now, yes, I know I could've just had something else but where's the fun in that? Still, there's no way in hell I'm going to try getting drunk on $15 drinks. I ordered a Pub Crawl, which was bourbon whiskey with ginger liqueur, lemon, and mint & black tea syrup. Tasted great, would've loved a few more... but not at that price.   For the apps, we decided on a Scotch egg and the pot pie sampler, which included mini versions of their steak, chicken, and shepherd's pie.   The Scotch egg was killer. I've had this exactly twice before in my life - the first time was very good, the second time it was two burnt lumps of sausage surrounding a medium-boiled egg. This blew both of those away. I would assume if they can make a Scotch egg great anywhere, it's going to be here.   Now, the pot pie sampler shows up and it's tiny. Really tiny. Tyrion Lannister's little mitts would make these pies look small, and in my hands they looked like silver dollars. At $24 (which is $8/each), you'd think the serving size would be double. Too bad, because the steak pie was delicious. Chicken pot pie is chicken pot pie, and this tasted like any other chicken pot pie. But the shepherd's pie was kinda rank. It smelled like dirty gym socks and didn't taste much better. WTF? I've had great shepherd's pie before and this was not even close. Lame.   We grabbed the bill at this point and - HOLY SHIT - $72 and I'm not even full or drunk?!? I don't even have a mild buzz, and I'm already asking my gf where to eat next. If you feel like blowing twice that, go for dinner. Me, I'd rather fill up somewhere else just as good; a place that won't charge me for a fancy name.

s7zsX4O5l8_g3pt235QgKw.text: A yummy dining experience, thanks Gordon! Hubby and I are not big turkey fans, so in recent years, we have taken to searching out non-traditional Thanksgiving locales. Being a fan of Gordon Ramsay (a bit of a crush?!), his shows on t.v. and last visit loving Gordon Ramsay Burgr, hubby made dinner reservations with Open Table and we showed up at the appointed time. Our half booth/chair table was ready and we were sat almost immediately. The decor and general vibe is a bit loud, a bit fun, large open area looking out into casino, with a mix of slightly different appointed areas of lighting, seating and various artwork. The table settings were unique, including the flatware. Service was efficient and friendly and our waiter would come back with answers to our questions without being prompted to. Appetizer: 4 stars for English style Nachos, delicious hot freshly cooked kettle chips with a terrific sharp English cheddar, a delicious English TP sauce and corned beef bits and tender short rib. This could have been a 5 star contender but the chef was stingy on the meats. Main Courses: 4 stars for Fish & Chips and 4 stars for Steak & Ale Pie. High end ingredients in both, tasty, tasty tasty. I opted out on the chips for chive truffle oil mashed potatoes and that was delicious. The reason the 2 main courses didnt receive 5 stars are due to the fish batter could have been crispier and the steak & ale pie was a tad on the small size for a main course. Did you save up room in your tummy? I hope so because below was the only True worthy five stars! Dessert: 5 stars for Potted Chocolate Trifle, perfection and a must for chocoholics! Stealing hubbys pic: yelp.com/biz_photos/gord... I highly recommend Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill and even if you just want to chill, have a beer and watch some sports, this is a solid spot.

IKEhmQ41m1Nupoz1BjHi1A.text: Great steakhouse in the middle of Caesar's Palace. Food cooked to perfection. Service is excellent. Rodney was a True champ guiding us through the meal. Would definitely come back!

M0BeDbFH5o03sO9V5nAzPw.text: This was the worst foodie experience I have ever had in Vegas. There is amazing food everywhere you turn in Vegas, except here.   First of all, the food is so bad. I can't believe Ramsay would even want his name associated with this restaurant. We tried multiple dishes on the menu including the caesar salad, beef pie, scallops, and lamb. The caesar salad had overly fishy, bad tasting anchovies which you could barely taste under the dressing the salad was drenched in. The beef pie was not only much too salty, but too peppery as well. The scallops must not have been cleaned because eating them was like eating a handful of sand on the beach. They were also in a chowder type broth that was mostly potatoes with no flavor. The lamb was nothing special and irony tasting. We enjoyed nothing except our cocktails, which by the way were excellent. Guess this is the place to only grab a drink. I would expect food like this at Denny's, but not at an extremely high priced restaurant with Ramsay's name attached to it.   The best part if the story is that this awful foodie experience took place on a night that Ramsay was actually visiting the restaurant, but he clearly wasn't watching what was going on in the kitchen and was preoccupied by fans. If we couldn't have a somewhat decent meal with him there I would sure be afraid to try this place when he isnt there.   This really should be his next stop on Kitchen Nightmares.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Overcooked clams and gritty scallops...
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beef pie - really salty :(
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Too much dressing

Ngh4KuPy00vnCI0lDn3-mw.text: I was quite disappointed. We paid $120 for two drinks, fish and chips (nothing special whatsoever) and a very small subpar bowl of Onion Soup. In addition, we were seated at a table for an almost 2-hour dinner on bar stools - no back. The amount we paid should have at minimum gotten us a chair! The wait staff was tolerable. My water stayed full. Another person at our table ordered calamari - it was carried around for nearly 10 mins. before the waitress figured out where it was going. At that point it was cold and being fried - not good. When we let our waitress know she did nothing - not even as much as an apology. Our bill was wrong at the end and needed to be sent back for correction. During the two hours there we were seated near a wait staff staging area - 4 dishes were broken just while we were there. This was definitely not the quality of an establishment I would associate with Gordon Ramsey's name.

0L04raTMKGdCiGLq5NuYYw.text: I love Gordon Ramsay and had the opportunity to eat at one of his restaurants. Good food, good service, friendly staff, nice atmosphere. Everything was delicious and I look forward to trying another one of his restaurants.

7I9RALdi6qBIfc5P1x_Eww.text: The service here was splendid, the server was a little older and loves to explain us the menu. I really thought the fish batter and chips were okay... The buffalo wings though were exceptional. but what made me fall in love with this place was was the dessert. I don't even remember the exact name of the dessert, all I know was that it was a triple chocolate dessert like crepe brulee in a glass cup. It came with these mini chocolate chip cookies I couldn't get enough of. Like I really loved it!!

Ht8zZUn_L1AzuRCUy2WRoQ.text: If you are a big fan of paying $43 for a $10 steak then boy is this the place for you. Less flavor than your local Outback Steakhouse. Other dishes at the table were ok but everything is overpriced.

NGWOYGTxLV1tnACwzBgrHA.text: I was a little skeptical because sometimes 'star' restaurants are all hype, but my experience here was excellent.  Bar staff was helpful and friendly.  I was in town for work solo and they made me feel welcome and not awkward being solo in Vegas.  Salmon was some of the best I've had, but wish there was more to it.  There were maybe 3 pieces of cauliflower on my plate, a smear of sauce and the salmon.  Had the salmon not been stellar I would have been disappointed.  Was still hungry after, but otherwise everything there was great.

2GEr0hgpNngd4zikwZ_quQ.text: The interior deco was a tribute to the motherland, England. Made to look like an English pub. You won't believe how casual and laid back this place is, in comparison to its neighbors at Caesar's Place. Peter was our host and he reminded us of Mario Lopez!   I really like the pork rillettes (despite mistaking it for fish initially). It had none of the porky taste and looked as white as fish meat. Topped with strings of sweet caramelized onions. It was the perfect finger food to wash down with a pint of beer. We had a good pint! I can't recall its name but if a non-beer fan can love it, I am sure most people will too! It had a dark oaky color, wasn't very strong but had slightly bitter aftertaste.   The Deviled egg was a miss for me though my friend seemed to liked it. To each his own.   It's definitely one of Ramsay's biggest restaurant in Vegas and Hell Kitchen was shot there too. Interest ambiance but nothing beats the real deal English pub for sure!

oyR-bpNLeg4trnG6iUFxxQ.text: This pub is Awesome!!! Had the salmon for lunch and it literally melted in my mouth!!! Sooo deelish and healthy for pub food! Oh and don't forget to try the Mini Lobster roll (ate it the day before lol) it made me feel like I was on the East coast! ;) amazing cocktails and awesome food!! SIT at the BAR with the #1 Bartenders at Caesars!! They'll definitely make you a cocktail you will NEVER forget!!! CHEERS!!!!!!

RNhB9kOFcH74SRP_dncaLg.text: Went for lunch... I've had better.  With 300+ seats and 3+ turns per meal, it's a factory.

nlUDTG6u0NnH0OkZunFZlg.text: Gordon, I had high expectations. Took a bit for the bartenders to realize I was new and have not been helped. Once noticed I ordered a bloody marry and that was fantastic. I then ordered a 1/2dz wings and a medium burger with fries. I was expecting u wings to come first since they were an app but when they came the burger was served at the same time...  I started with the wings. The second one I bit into was raw. yuck! What a turn offfffff. They got sent back and they brought me new ones but after biting into raw chicken in the first set I couldn't think about eating them the second time around. Didn't even really want to eat my burger after that. My burger was suppose to medium but it came out medium rare and the bun was soggy but at this point I just sucked it up and just ate it. I had to ask for ketchup. When it was brought to me I thought it was cocktail sauce but was informed by the bartender that was how they made their ketchup.  Over all I give you two stars for the fact that your bloody Mary's are the bomb and I appreciated the managers checking in on me. Not charging me for the wings and hooking me up with a second drink. I've been in the restaurant business for 16yrs and I know shit happens, but when both items I order come out under cooked and the guy next to me is complaining about his scallops being under cooked as well You need to step it up in your kitchen and hold up to your name.   Forgot to mention the menu is over priced. Your paying to be sitting in Gordon Ramsey's restaurant in Caesars palace more then the quality of food and service. $35 for a burger and bloody marry. Plus tip.

oM6U5e3lkvfKvwLSd4e1zA.text: Our first time here and that was some delicious food and amazing service! Definitely coming back again! Michelle, Joe, and the rest of the staff were all so very helpful, which made our experience here even more enjoyable! Not to mention it's Memorial Day weekend, so it's busy. Loved it all! ((:
