IkEj2KCwx4DiVGf2kOsorA.text: Came here to enjoy lunch on our first day in Vegas. We ordered the Cheese & Charcuterie Board, the Fish and Chips, and the Sticky Toffee Pudding. Absolutely loved the fish and chips - served as it should be - just like back home in the UK. The waiter was incredibly informative, offered up nuances and backstories to the items we had ordered. The real highlight though, was the Sticky Toffee Pudding! Beyond gorgeous! I will be looking for Ramsey's recipe in order to make it at home! Check this place out for sure!

n_9D8xQYHHCjOKGHfpqNIQ.text: Slow. Had to ask and wait 30 mins for the check. Food was not even ok. Worst service ever.

h354TyaWY5XuWr2qLBzAjg.text: Came here because Mesa Grill didn't have availability and we love BurGR. They only had room for us at the cocktail tables, and the stools were very squishy and sinking down, but had hard edges, so my legs kept falling asleep.   Our server was very friendly, but our food was somewhat slow to come out. With the location right on the casino floor, there was a man smoking a large cigar in line to get a rewards card, and the smoke cloud was almost intolerable, of course our food finally came out while the smoke cloud was hanging over us.  The food was very good. We ordered a NY strip that was surprisingly tender for a NY and cooked perfectly, but had a chunk of gristle. It was very good value compared to Mesa Grill, maybe not quite as good, but also much cheaper. Asparagus cooked well. Peppercorn sauce had an overwhelming rosemary flavor, but was good.  The pub chopped salad was also good. I think for a similar price, Cheesecake Factory has a better salad, and their portions are three times as big. The menu indicated the salad had apples, which I do not remember on the salad. The ham was more like strips of salami perhaps? It was very good, though.  The mashed potatoes were good, but the STAR of the show was the mushroom side with poached egg. This is brilliant! The egg, and I think chanterelle mushrooms, had similar texture and it was a wonderful and unexpected combination. Loved that.  The server wasn't able to adequately describe the toffee pudding. She described it as a cake. Maybe it was; her description was vague enough that I didn't want to try it.  If I were to return, I'd make sure I had a reservation and ask to be seated farther into the restaurant. I think I'd try the fish and chips next time. They looked fantastic.

o5BZ12aiJK_Bv7AL1GONrw.text: Big fan of Gordon Ramsey's Bugr and Steak and decided to stop by here for lunch. What a mistake. We sat at the bar and ordered drinks and their burger from the bartender. After a few minutes the bartender just started wiping glasses. We were pretty irritated and got up, the bartender noticed and said he forgot and apologized. He put in the order and brought our drinks. We waited for about 20 minutes and our bartender disappeared. I needed a refill on my beer but we couldn't get anyone's attention even though we were sitting front and center in the bar area.   There was one bartender who was glued to the television watching the soccer game. We were finally fed up once and for all. I reminded the bartender that he wasn't sitting in his apartment watching TV and to bring my bill (for 1 beer). Also canceled the burger. What's even sadder is that the bar seating around us was empty and a complete mess. On a better note the pizza in the food court next door was quick and delicious. Overall, Ramsey shouldn't act like he has such high standards and rip apart restaurants on Kitchen Nightmares then have his name on a place like this. Too much expansion to create restaurants for contestants to work at from Hells Kitchen without proper training.

OG6wRLsdDTJIMWr2JA0GyQ.text: I have to say I am a big Ramsay fan and so far the couple of Ramsay restaurants I have dined at have not let me down; and I am a fault-finding customer. With that being said, I am so surprise to see so many two and three star reviews here. Nevertheless I had to give it a go and form my own opinion.   From the minute you walk in the door you can see that the decorator went above and beyond to provide the guest a "pub" experience.  Now it may not fit an authentic English Pub, but you're not in London, you're in Las Vegas and I found the setting to be perfectly fitting.  We sat in the dining room and found the wait staff was personable, attentive and quick with the drink. I will say that the menu held more than your traditional pub fare, but still offered classics like Bangers & Mash or Fish & Chips.   For the table we started with Hellfire Lollipop Wings, English Beer Steamed Clams and Maine Lobster Roll Minis.  As I sit here and write this review I still cannot think of one thing I would change about the starters. The wings were unique, they were crispy, sweet, spicy and savory all at the same time, I still regret not asking what chili pepper they used in the sauce - I would say these are in the Top Three best wings I have had.  The clams were exactly what I expected, perfectly cooked clams in a tasty broth with little pieces of chorizo and the lobster rolls were spot on, as if we had been sitting in a restaurant in downtown Bangor.   For main courses, two of us got the Yorkshire Ale Batter Fish& Chips and the odd man out went with a Grilled Lamb Burger. Now I can speak to the burger but from what I could see and what I was told, it was juicy, flavorful and very filling. I almost wished I had ordered it.  The fish and chips were really good. The batter was light and crisp, the cod was perfectly prepared and flaky, it was simplicity at its best. I also enjoyed the different take on chips, as they were fried potato wedges and held up well against the malt vinegar without getting soggy. The one thing that brought it all together was the little ramekin of Minted Mushy Peas.... Delicious.   As I left Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill I remember rubbing my stomach and telling my friends what a good meal that was. I really enjoyed it.  Typically I would give the restaurant 5-Stars at this point, but because of the other lesser reviews I am wondering if there are some issues with consistency and therefore until I visit again I can only give them 4-Stars.

qvlKrsPv-FdAsnfssbUDEw.text: 11am lunch.   Caveat:  I've heard what a jerk this guy is supposed to be, and I really wanted to be able to call him out on this meal.  We'd previously tried Gordon Ramsay BurGR at Planet Hollywood, and it was very good.  So this visit was our shot to see what the big deal is.    We actually sat at the bar before it opened.  We were sitting right there, watching, and the bartender did not use the ingredients listed in the menu.  Now, this was a recon visit, so we didn't say anything--I just took notes for this review.  Our other drink was as stated in the menu.  Okay.  Both drinks were very tasty, even very good.  (We're into mixology, so take that for what it is--the drinks were good.)  We had fish and chips and the beef burger.  We both thought the food was excellent.  Damn it to hell, I cannot trash him on this meal.  I would have liked more peas with the fish, but no ding for that.   Incidentally, I don't think it's widely known that many of these big shots' restaurants are actually joint ventures with the hotels.  Very likely there is some lack of control and issues with quality control in such arrangements.  Nevertheless, if a guy who expects 110% out of everyone in his sphere of greatness puts his name on something, he gets held to that same standard.   So, 4 out of 5 stars.  It was very good, but not 110%.  Next Vegas visit is GR Steak.  Stay tuned.  I'll be taking notes.

Fm7DTgguvRH8-IEEKdteeg.text: Do NOT come here in a large group. The service is bad, comparing to other places in Vegas, and food is JUST ok. We came here on a Wednesday night with a group of 7 people. Gordon Ramsay plus some beer sounds pretty awesome after a long day of work, so we still decided to give it a try despite the not so good review on yelp.   The wait wasn't too bad, we got seated in about 45 minutes or so. They do have a good variety of beer selection and other alcoholic beverages. I wasn't too disappointed at the drinks but was definitely disappointed at the food.   30 minutes after the waiter took our order, we asked about our food because the table next to us with party of 2, who got in about same time as us, already finished their food and left. He told us that our food is next on kitchen list (not exactly sure what this means). Then he came back again, he told one of my friend to choose something else from the menu because they ran out the dish he ordered.   Finally when the food came, the order got a little messed up and the food only tasted ok. The fries had different consistency where some are too crunchy and some are not crunchy enough. When we get the bill, the 18% gratuity is already included. Not a good overall experience and it was too expensive for what you get.

fYlakHijg19fhJ4b1tDUZQ.text: This restaurant was my third stop on my Gordon Ramsay tour (Steak, Burgr, Pub).  Kind of a disappointment. The beer, wine, and overall drink selection was nothing special. Average, at best. The food was just OK and definitely not worth the price.  Service was just okay. The staff was friendly, but slow and hard to flag down. We constantly felt like we were waiting. Waiting for drink orders, waiting for drinks, waiting for food orders, waiting for other drink orders, waiting for drinks we ordered that never showed up, and waiting for dessert. It was ridiculous.  I had a shot at a few beers, scallops, short rib, scotch egg, steak, and of course the sticky toffee.  The scallops were abysmal. I've paid half the cost and received twice as many, better prepared. Two people ordered scallops at our table and both orders were bad. They were so sandy that it felt like I threw a handful of sand in my mouth and started chewing. One order seemed overcooked. Would not have this again at this restaurant.  The short rib, while tender, seemed lackluster in flavor. As with the scallops, I have had much more flavorful short rib for a fraction of the price elsewhere. I would not order this again at this restaurant.  The steak was nothing special, honestly, and I felt was about twice as costly as necessary for what it was.  The scotch egg was actually very good. Probably one of the better/best scotch eggs I've had. I would order this again.  The sticky toffee was great, and I would order it again. One of the best desserts I have ever had.  All in all, I would not recommend this place. You can get similar or better food at a plethora of other restaurants, for a fraction of the price. If I were Gordon Ramsay I would be appalled at how this restaurant is executing.

txRxLs4vHQ9YcPFc2l1d7Q.text: My brother and I really wanted to eat here because we used to watch a lot of Gordon Ramsay food shows. We had high expectations for this restaurant and we were definitely not disappointed. The food was amazing and the service was also really good!   I ordered the lobster Mac and cheese, which was really delicious! There was a lot of lobster inside the Mac and cheese, which made the price worth it. For dessert, I ordered the sticky toffee pudding, which was also really yummy!

Sxy-Waj8-gPJaRmhAaaD0A.text: I just don't see the big deal. Maybe because it's in a fancy resort, and has the Gordon Ramsay name, but I just don't find it that great.  Prices are super expensive for what you are getting, which is basically a nice craft burger and craft beer.  I got the fish and chips, and while they were good, they were definitely not the "best" fish and chips I had ever gotten.  Bottom line, the food is average. You are not going to be blown away by the food. You will be blown away by the price though. 4 of us spent $100+ after food and drink. Then again, it is Vegas, so I guess it should be expected.

gXugidpcpc1ft54oFeYUcw.text: I have lived in Las Vegas for 13 years. Over the years when friends come into town for birthdays or business, I've been to many of these celebrity chef restaurants. Some live up to the hype. This one does not.  The Service: Our waiter had no personality. He delivered his opening spiel with all the charm of a robot. He performed his duties adequately but definitely did not go above or beyond. We ordered two desserts to split between the four of us. When they arrived we asked the server for two more plates but we never got them.  None of the employees seemed like they wanted to be there.  The Food: Enjoy the pictures of the bread? That's all you're going to get. They no longer serve it. I had the Shepard's pie which I thought was a little bland. Unfortunately there is no salt or pepper on the table. So I couldn't season it. My friends had the Fish & Chips. They remarked that it looked smaller than it used to be but was still good. Lobster Mac & Cheese is creamy and delicious. Sticky Toffee Pudding is indeed very good.  Overall, I was disappointed and it's way overpriced even for Strip food.

PLYAI7hIZZSruAw7GSGD_w.text: Loved it at first glance. First time coming in with high expectations. Not disappointed. Had a nice beer (Innis &Gunn Scottish ale) which I don't normally have but it's a pub right. Ordered the bangers and mash and my wife had the fish and chips. Both were awesome. Glad we decided to come. We will come back and probably bring the kids.

34bFyZ9BAzkSvtBRMveBmA.text: Went there on a Saturday night and was able to find seating at the bar for a few drinks before dinner with relative ease.  Had dinner there after a long day of gambling and split a bunch of plates with friends.  Everything was great and I wish I would have went back again for a more focused experience.    Definitely way better than Bobby Flay's place in CP.

cRCC37gAoWv6M98Dv5a5lg.text: Yes it is not very clean as some people say in their reviews but I had the mini lobster rolls and they were excellent!

OklWISh6EOzWQmyrveusOA.text: Stopped in this past Saturday for a family dinner while in Vegas. I was skeptical after reading some bad reviews and I should have followed their advice. Overall, there are many better choices in Vegas to dine at and would not even give it a second chance.  Reservation/Atmosphere - We had a reservation but were seated at a bad location and bad table. They put to tables in a walk way area and then put short chairs around it. They were mix & matching the dining tables and chairs to squeeze in more people. The low bar chairs made us feel like we were at the kids table during Thanksgiving. Before we started I asked to be re-seated but they came up with excuses (30 minutes and no guarantee) and a little attitude. The waitress acknowledged the table/seats wasn't good but not much they would due. Given the time and not delaying the dinner we took it, but it was annoying and uncomfortable.   The music was way too loud when we arrived and after about 30 minutes it was turned down, probably someone complained. Hard to believe that management couldn't tell that it was too loud even for Vegas.  Service - Pretty good, attentive enough given that they were busy.  Food - Here is the second reason I wouldn't go back. The food we had was average, and I expected a lot more. Bangers & Mash was only ok. Fish & Chips were also only ok, same you can get at any sports bar. The Braised Short Ribs was a huge disappointment, the meat had a lack of any flavor, the sauce was boring and the risotto was flavorless & held too long. I really expected the quality to be better on this dish. The highlight of the night was the Chicken Pot Pie, it had a flakey crust and some great flavor for the filing, good chucks of chicken and veggies. Deserts were ok, the Sticky Toffee Pudding was the highlight.  They were very busy as expected on a Saturday night, but it showed in their arrogance over the table & waits. They we stay busy with first time diners but don't believe they will get many as repeat. They are pricey, which I am ok with, but they need to deliver on the food and they failed there.

ZfKvlmQdc3iRYF6RQHhfXQ.text: I've eaten here a total of three times with some varying degrees of deliciousness, but I have to say that the most recent visit was the best.  I've never had a problems with service, although for my first visit, I was seated at the bar.  It's not easy to get great service at a bar... Anyways, this last visit was by far the best.  I had the pretzels with the home made dijon, a bowl of the corn chowder with a basil creme fresh, and the heirloom tomato sandwich.  Let's break these bad boys down:  1) The pretzels weren't anything ridiculously amazing, but the dijon mustard is the star.  You can tell it's fresh.  It's a coarse-ground mustard that has plenty of heat.  If you put too much, it will clear out your sinuses, but wasn't retardedly/annoyingly hot.    2) I'd have to say that the corn chowder wasn't my favorite, but it had some good flavor combinations.  The chowder was sweet and had some crab meat placed in, which made it much more sweet that I usually go for.  I'd kind of like something sour (citrus/lime juice possibly) to cut the sweetness.  But the creme fresh paired well to smooth the flavors out.  It cut into the sweetness a bit.  There was a bit of julienned basil to also help cut the sweetness.  Overall, pretty good.  3) The heirloom tomato sandwich is EXCELLENT.  Crispy bread with a citrusy aoli.  Perfectly rip tomatoes with thinly shaved parmessian on top.  Awesome.  I want another one for dinner.  Sh*t, I'd eat one for breakfast.  The freshness of the tomatoes work perfectly for a hot day.  And it was light enough not to weigh me doswn, unlike a shepherd's pie or a flat iron steak+fixin's.  No post-lunch naps required...  All in all, good execution and a great place to take someone to, since you'll be able to have good conversation about the decor, ipad drink menu, and presentation.

ss7bl9Gr6Gjur7Q_pmuomQ.text: Stopped in for a couple drinks and bar snacks before seeing Absinthe. Drinks and snacks were good and they have a pretty decent variety of beers, but they definitely have the Vegas and Gordon Ramsay price tag. Cool spot though and good people watching if you're sitting in the area open to the casino. I had the sliders and a my husband had the kettle chip nachos - sliders were good but the nachos won. Worth I stop if you're looking for a quick bite in Caesar's, but not a place I would make a special trip to visit.

ndGRriZvBE7Kr9hBdVMGEw.text: Not impressed at all with the burger and fries ordered from here.  Had dinner with four friends all of us had burgers one had a lamb burger. The fries were just warm. Save your money and eat somewhere else .. Especially if your paying $21 for a burger.

TvKhxW0McUSdpZ7sElNnuw.text: How do I describe my experience here? Horrible and pathetic. If my name were on the place, I'd verify the quality. First, took and hour to get appetizers. Second, two hours for good with a "medium" requested burger clearly "rare."  I would not only not recommend this place, I would persuade people against it. Horrible worst burger I've ever had.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Medium? Are you sure? Really? Looks not like medium. Very overrated. Would never recommend.
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Two hours later finally have food... Taste like a $8 burger #overrated

y8ezkQdndv2owyMvCsMEmQ.text: Had Dinner there on Wednesday night this week and really enjoyed it. The truffle fries and aioli were my favorite and the beef tenderloin was cooked perfectly! Goodnight Blue Sky was a very refreshing, and tasty drink after walking the strip the whole afternoon. Would absolutely dine here again!

PNpTnB34gSB0wLR-yveNrg.text: Ok food. Nothing special, very bland. Got lamb burger and the lamb Shepard pie. Good service, but disappointed in the food. Drinks expensive!!!!

_sC5elP493j1zs09r8UIfA.text: I was looking forward to trying this restaurant.  I have never been to England,  but if they serve fish and chips like they do at this restaurant,  I can't imagine why anyone would talk about them. It was really mediocre.  The crust was greasy and didn't hold up. The fries were soggy.  What a shame.

rMau7YijIj7JgcY0nDsCoQ.text: Attempted a second visit January 14, 2017. The hostess took our name and number saying there would be a 15 minute wait. 45 minutes later we were still waiting. We asked the hostess if she had forgotten us and she assured us it would not be much longer for us to be seated. After an hour and 15 minutes later  we still were waiting. Went to another restaurant. Three hours later and still we had no text.  VERY  disappointed.

L-g6Dzg7xmlrfYDky7rdTw.text: Five stars for the food and beer selection here.  I like food, I like beer. Give me really good food with a really good beer spin that around with some really helpful service, and we are talking.  The secret to getting the best experience here is asking your server what are the specials and recommendations.  On multiple occasions, the server led me onto a tasty new adventure.  One of their highly recommended beers is the Scottish Innis and Gunn.  The server recommended this very crisp and refreshing ale to me.  It has become the centerpiece of what I am basing my dinner on.  Do not be afraid to ask them what they would pair your food with.  My servers on the occasions I have gone here, really sold the food choices by their descriptions. One evening, I tried the Shepard's Pie.  Very flavorful, very moist.  It is lamb based, rather than ground beef.  The potatoes on top were just so soft and melted in my mouth. Another one to try is the bacon cheeseburger.  Sounds simple enough, but that bacon is maple bacon...  The server told me that the bacon starts the day before.  It is cut up then soaked overnight in pure maple syrup.  It is then cooked with more syrup. I am telling you this right now, IT IS GOOD.  It is gooder than good. The chef that afternoon even came out to check on some tables.  I told him right there, "Best thing I ever put in my mouth." Service was top notch.  Friendly, knowledgable servers that know the menu and the beers available. Do not be afraid to use them to help you decide on your meal.  They know their stuff.

CsxdCEKh1ZyK_jdJ0NA7Ag.text: We had reservations here last night and this was a special treat for us since it was our anniversary dinner and we really wanted to do something special.    The hostesses were extremely nice and congratulated us on our anniversary, (thank you!!!!!!!!) our waiter (Ali) was awesome, extremely helpful, knowledgeable and very patient.  He was there all the time asking us if there was anything we needed.  Our food was delicious, I ordered the corn soup and the Iron Steak.  My husband ordered the summer salad and the Cheek steak,  everything was great, the food the service, the atmosphere!    We will def come back again!

rFUiZPo75jQhodsDYAX9MQ.text: May have to be my go to lunch spot if all else fails.  Pub & Grill is a good alternative if you don't want to wait in the dreaded buffet line. They really got the ambiance right for an English Pub and Grill, and they make it fun and lively.  Good: Decor/environment, staff, beers on draft (carlsberg,innus and gun), fries  OK: Food (Burger needs more flavor, Fish needs more flavor the texture was good)

vyhHThktUV8TA4VihAqL1A.text: Today I came into Ramsay's expecting great food and great service like I had in BURGR. I was sadly disappointed. The server Scott Hines, barely came around to our table, we had waited extremely long for our food, and when we were finally done he took over 30 minutes to take the last plate (mine) and bring the bill (which took him about 10 minutes to pick up our cards). The place was not busy in the slightest, so there and was really no excuse.  As for the food. The second star goes to the good salad dressing and herbs on the "herb Caesar salad with chicken" and my friends who got a good lamb burger and chicken sandwich. The chicken in my salad however was extremely dry and lacking of flavor, moisture, or anything good in chicken. I recommend going to BURGR, or the steak place in the Paris Hotel if you are looking for good food or service. And I also recommend sending Steve on one of Ramsay's TV shows so he can learn how to serve properly especially under the name of Ramsay.

aU8z5H3wP3phU7BBxoEhbA.text: The toffee pudding was excellent dessert!! You should try! The braised beef ribs was really nice too. We had the scotch egg but the egg yolk was not runny.. overall a good dining experience!

D-0LndYABrw2LcLfT0M5TQ.text: Ramsay does it again.  Walking into this restaurant in Caesar's, I was definitely impressed.  The decor was a hip modern twist on a traditional British pub.  The lighting was a little bit darker than I would've like but it definitely added to the ambiance.  The keg wall was probably one of the coolest parts.  Though a little loud, the charm of the restaurant was definitely appealing.  We made a reservation on-line but we were a little irritated that we couldn't call to get ahold of anyone if we needed to make changes to the reservation.  It just kept gong through and automated recording.  Also, when we approached the hostess, she actually didn't seem very enthusiastic towards us nor any other guests who approached.  It was a minor wait before we were seated.  The table was cool and I really like the chairs.  It seemed to take awhile before our server even came to greet us let alone give us water. I guess it was busy.  Once the waiter greeted us he was really nice.  Great smile and willing to answer any questions we had.  He also offered suggestions for items on the menu.  We did order some cocktails from the bar which got to us in a timely fashion and we also got a platter of bread and butter courtesy of Gordon...thanks!  The pretzel sticks were amazing.  I lathered them in butter and gobbled them up!  The drinks were good and strong yet pricey but what do you expect for Vegas.    Most of the entrees were pricey as well.  I ordered the lamb shanks and was definitely pleased.  They were tender and well seasoned.  Absolutely yummy!  My boyfriend ordered the Shepard's pie.  The mashed potatoes were to die for.    Overall, my experience was great.  Ramsay definitely does know his way around a restaurant.  Then only qualm I had was with the hostess'.  If they were a little more charismatic and interested in the customers they were about to seat, I think I would've rated it a 5/5 instead of a 4/5.  Still great though. :-)  Will definitely go again!

viS1eDl8u1RNgn4mcAJt2A.text: Surprisingly mediocre. We met a bunch of friends at the restaurant for lunch the day Bon Appetit's Uncork'd festival was going on at the hotel. The restaurant wasn't too busy and we got in with no wait.   Service was really slow. Appetizers came out reasonably quick but entrees took forever.  Tried the pub pretzels which were quite good. They're served with a cheddar sauce and mustard. Fair warning: the mustard is quite hot, like Chinese mustard hot. Good but if you're not expecting it you'll be surprised.  I started with the English ale and onion soup. Very good.  A friend and I split the lamb burger with feta cheese. The burger was quite bland. Really could have used salt and even the feta was on the bland side. On the plus side it was cooked perfectly.  We really expected a bit more, especially since Chef Ramsey was in town for the event that evening. We much prefer Public House or Todd English's P.U.B.

LRWlyDOODYafcHoFh6n3Nw.text: I had the recommended fish and chips, it was great. Peter and Heather had steaks but the sides came up short on portions - needed more grilled veggies.  Peter really enjoyed his steak and dessert of Sticky Toffee.  Although a little pricey for my taste, I expected it, being Ceasar's Palace, and not a buffet.  The atmosphere is unusual; but the offset was really good service.

7Hk1xwRBuY6RR2FIIJ9YAQ.text: Sounds like my experience wasn't too far from other people's 2 and 3 star reviews. Had a lamb burger, ice tea, and split a dessert for $30 each. Pricey but typical for Vegas I guess.   I was seated against the wall in a ridiculously low cushioned bench seat. I'm 6'3" and I can't imagine how awkward it must be for others to have to eat like that. The server was really low on energy, no smiles, just smirks even at my low brow attempts to lighten the mood. She really never did perk up much, I had to continually ask for more ice tea.   The lamb burger was just ok. Not much, if any, seasoning. The 4 sticks of french fry potato slices were also cute but not very tasty. Dessert was fine, the toffee pudding thing seemed like a safe bet.   Overall, I don't recommend it and I wouldn't return. We had a much more entertaining dining experience at Grand Lux Cafe at The Venetian/Palazzo for half the cost. And that waiter smiled all the time as she kept my iced tea filled to the brim!

P4ltdnPQO_7WNHcwx0r8Mg.text: The food was good, but the drinks sucked. (I just turned 21, all I think about are the drinks) The decor was fun and interesting but the overall atmosphere was really loud being right next to the casino. I think they were going for a roudy-pub atmosphere, but it was more forced than anything else.   I really wanted to like this place because Gordon Ramsay is awesome, but I just...didn't.  Weird note: The outfits for the waiters and waitresses were interesting, however they only worked if the waiter was in shape. The outfits for the men who were overweight was really unflattering.

w6Y90dna8iDlMsAtXd_2FQ.text: Mini lobster rolls, rib eye, short ribs, shepard pie, coktails, all prepared under Gordon standards. Friendly service and a lively atmosphere. All good in Hells Kitchen at the pub n grill ;)

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Casual dining with high end delights

wxwlZkXN4odolJxGgquLjA.text: Best way to try this place is to take advantage of Happy Hour. We weren't wowed with the food at all with the exception of the onion rings and dessert The staff was Awesome from the greeting till the end. Much nicer than the Atlantic City location and bigger too. The staff and atmosphere will bring us back for another try, but perhaps will do another GR next time

2tCBZTWMHn0NxKV797U_AQ.text: Good pub food. Enjoyed the Shephard's Pie. The restaurant is quite informal and the food is the same. Also too noisy for a nice dinner.

ppY3_Nlm9s3FzhF99d0jBQ.text: TL;DR: it was good but not $30 for a burger, fries and caesar salad good.  i ordered medium-rare and bf ordered medium, they switched our orders and i ended up with the medium burger wondering why such an expensive burger couldn't be cooked the way i wanted it. upon inspection we realized that our burgers had been switched (which is strange because the waiter made a big deal of putting a flag on one of the burgers to remember which is which, lol) and so we traded burgers. the medium-rare was downright cold, which isn't how a proper burger patty should be.  the salad was really much too mild in flavor because the dressing didn't have enough kick. there were anchovies in the salad but they weren't salty, just oily and bland. overall the salad lacked salt and since there was no salt or pepper on the table i couldn't adjust the taste for myself.  the fries were really good though. crispy and garlicky, my favorite kind of fries :)

iAvTa8kV6_9R0OgDGnKWVQ.text: Great place for lunch on a busy day.  Quick, efficient service in a nice space.  The salads, especially the chopped salad, and the burgers are all flavorful.  The prices are high for what you get, but not exorbitant.

cFYzhByxZ-wGUoYwfXFgpA.text: My wife and I are big fans of Gordon Ramsay, so when we go to Las Vegas we try to eat at the pub at least once. My wife was lucky enough to eat here twice last week and had a great experience both times. She had server Carrie both times and she  was awesome enough to remember her and introduced her to chef Kristen. We watch Hells kitchen so that was very cool.The food is great, along with the staff and decor. We will eat here again!!

EMMsLCalwo8PC28vjAjZwA.text: Butter Chicken and the Vegetable Pie were really below par. Sticky Toffee Pudding, however, was great.

8E8tj8m-I3FY5m2CdHw_kw.text: Well, in direct comparison to the Wolfgang  Puck Bar and Grill, Gordon Ramsay's joint suffers a bit. We came in late one evening, and the place was absolutely packed. Now, I understand the place is not geared for kids, there was no kids menu available. But I really appreciated their accommodating our little party. The manager made a special point greeting our little munchkin, and made her day by giving her a Gordon Ramsay pen...it instantly became her favorite art instrument of choice.  The deviled eggs were expensive, at over $3 per bite, but really surprisingly bland. Fish and chips consisted of two huge fillets of crispy but bland fried cod, a nice version of mushy peas, and large serving of steak fries that were just meh. The $45 ribeye was a perfect medium rare, but was marred by being excessively gristly and fatty without being particularly marbled. The accompanying bear aide sauce was a cold, congealed mess. Come on Gordon, at these prices you can afford to serve better quality than this!   Speaking of prices, single bottles of hard cider were $11...a "special" was a bucket of five beers for the low, discounted price of...$40!  Whoa!

4qrQxVV-kFyyIQ5np2UEBw.text: We stopped in for a beer and were welcomed by the bartender. Lots of beer on tap, good variety, something for everyone. I am not even a beer expert but I found a beer I liked.    We tried the calamari and it was very fresh and came with tartar and cocktail sauce.   Service was attentive and the couple next to us wanted a sit down dinner. The bartender walked all the way to the front and got the hostess, walked back with her and introduced them to the hostess. Can't get better than that kind of service!

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beers on tap
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Calamari

0oZdGfQVqDhTRgTuL1IsMg.text: From the moment we walked in for lunch, a couple of weary Las Vegas noobs, we felt welcomed and valued as customers. Huge fans of the Ramsay franchise, this was a bucket list visit for sure.   The atmosphere was warm, inviting and a nice break from the overwhelming glitz of Vegas. We were shown to a comfortable booth and quickly introduced to our waiter Julio and placed a drink order, eager to try some of the authentic beer offerings. The menu's food offerings were all tempting and while waiting for our beers, we debated which we wanted to try.   Julio returned with some bad news; neither of the beers we chose were immediately available, which made us turn back to the menu and we went for Gordon's favorite, Innis and Gunn.   Shortly, we were introduced to Randy Goldich, the bar manager, who apologized for the unavailability of our original choices. We appreciated his candor and spent several minutes chatting before he left us to enjoy our drinks.   Our waiter Julio and his partner David were quite attentive and soon we had our meal selections; I had the grilled lamb burger and my wife had the Pub Chopped Salad. We also had the sticky toffee pudding as well and what can I say, the food quality was Ramsay level, just as we expected.   Despite it being early afternoon, we were treated to a visit as well from Hells Kitchen season 12 winner Scott Cummings who was friendly and engaging. Come to think of it, everyone we met there went out of their way to make us feel welcome and special.   Our Vegas trip was a first and the standards set by our visit to Ramsay's Pub and Grill are sure to make us come back again.   Thanks to Randy, Julio, David, Scott and everyone else for giving us such a wonderful visit to remember.   Tim and Debbi Crawford (we'll be back!)

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Careful, Gordon&#39;s watching!

CnWBH1xAVxlOJ_D6ToBEbQ.text: I went here last night for dinner. It was mediocre from start to finish. We were seated at a high top table and the stools were comfortable but had no back support, so you want to eat and not linger.   Their wine selection is abysmal and the server was so excited "about our many beers". Really? Maybe because I'm from Michigan and we have usually have at least 10-20 craft beers on tap. The beer selection was rather boring at the Pub and Grill and topped out at maybe 12 beers.   I got the Braised Short Rib and while it was fall off the bone tender, there was nothing spectacular about it. It was simply atop some plain old mashed potatoes with a few undercooked carrots and parnsips on the periphery. Certainly not worth near the $40. I don't think I would ever eat here again. Not that it was a horrible experience but because there was nothing special about anything.

zLO-VOaeo18-gEPxHwh7Vg.text: Lot's to say about this place...  First, the decor with all the kegs would lead you to believe that this place is a good place for beer. It is not. There's a fairly limited selection, and they are not exactly impressive beers to choose from.  We were seated at a table that I'm not sure was originally intended for dining. It was low to the ground with sofas on either side. It was incredibly uncomfortable to sit at and I had to adjust numerous times so that my legs would wake back up.  My burger wasn't bad, but had too much of a taste to it that I can't place. Maybe garlic? It kind of ruined it for me. I wished later I would have tried something else. The fries weren't exactly the greatest, either.  I'd give the restaurant three stars, but two things picked it back up for me.  First, the sticky toffee pudding was very good. I had not had it before, so I can't really give a comparison to any other sticky toffee puddings, but it was so good I was sad when it was gone.  Second, the service was very good. We didn't even know our dinner was delayed, and we got apologies from the waitress, the manager, and the person who brought out our food. Seems that there was an issue with getting it out from a ticket being closed when it shouldn't have, so they redid the entire meal. Our dessert was free as well, which was a nice touch. It was nice to see that the customer service that Gordon is always preaching on Kitchen Nightmares held True for his restaurant.

uTvO5KXAjyq-4vB1KZdyQg.text: Such a delicious place to eat if you are in Vegas and craving a delicious burger. I never order burgers at restaurants but this was definitely the place I wanted to eat one. I got a medium well burger and the taste was amazing! It had a warm pink center that melted and got tastier and tastier with every bite. The garlic aioli truffle fries were to die for! Mannn writing this review makes me want to have this meal all over again right now! The service was on point. Very quick and very fresh! Definitely recommend :)

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Amazing!! Absolutely delicious! Medium well melts in your mouth with every bite, aioli garlic truffle fries on point
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Deviled eggs
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Menu, cute little English bull dog

f-SJdcAnBOuNTkMfRNA6Fw.text: I came here for a late lunch during the week and it was delicious! I got the beef rib and cheek sandwich with a side of fries. The bartender recommended the Scottish beer to go with the sandwich called Innis & Gunn which I really enjoyed. The meat in the sandwich was super tender and they gave it a nice breaded crust so it was a good surprise when you bite into the sandwich. The bread was perfect! All in all, tasty sandwich with an equally good beer.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States

E2phxZNLtZ1o1kyKs_f_-Q.text: Great food!  Great atmoshphere!   Rodney our waiter was excellent and very attentive to our needs.

35EZBAjRd2ln7VS7RCg6UA.text: I wouldn't eat here again, we got into Caesar's Palace around seven or 8 o'clock and we were starving just want to good burger and fries. I had high expectations for Gordon Ramsay's place. It looked very nice open concept great decor. However, it is completely open to the casino so it is incredibly loud, we were screaming at each other just to carry on a conversation. We had to wait quite a while for the waitress to come  over. I don't think she spent five minutes on us the whole evening. We each had the bacon burger and fries and a martini. It was no different they you get anywhere else and it cost $41+tip. Save your money you could get this burger anywhere.

tjjiHCapg5wH5gxh5ADhSQ.text: Kitchen Nightmares is one of our favorite shows, so we've been wanting to try all 4 of Gordon Ramsey's restaurants in Vegas. This was our first.  Located near the Forum Shoppes in Caesar's Palace, we had no trouble finding this restaurant in the huge casino. We arrived without reservations and ended up waiting about 30 minutes for a table. The 2 of us were seated near the back of the restaurant. The ambiance/vibes are definitely watered down back there. Our seats were super uncomfortable armchairs where I almost sank completely in and could barely reach the table.   We ordered the Shepherd's Pie and the Butter Chicken Curry. I tried a few bites of my bf's Shepherd's Pie, and it was good, but not exceptional (pies are not really my thing). My Butter Chicken Curry was also the same. Was not expecting it to taste like chili instead of curry. If you do end up ordering the curry, I recommend NOT mixing the curry sauce with all the yogurt/rice/chicken. I did that, and it ruined the whole dish.   Wish we saved room for the Sticky Toffee Pudding. Don't know when I'll be dining here again to try it.

_LtsBCTjm_IibuWkVsj_kw.text: Back again after my wonderful first experience and craving for the best salmon I've ever had. This time around, we got seated right after walking up to the hostess without a reservation. It was around 6pm on a Wed night. Very different experience compared to the first time.   Things have changed a bit since the first time I was there. First, the yummy complimentary bread is now $8. Second, the bar menu with the sliders is not available anymore. Third, my salmon is now prepared differently.  However, it was still perfectly seasoned, and skin, perfectly crispy. Unfortunately, my fish was still raw inside. Upon showing this to my waiter, he took it back to refire me a new one. I watched my family eat their yummy dinner as I waited for mine. Time seemed to have passed very slowly as I waited. When my refired salmon finally came out, it was as tasty as I could ask for.  To my surprise, my salmon was taken off the bill, and we were also offered a dessert of choice. This kind of service has ensured my return.   While this place is pricey, the quality of the food and service matches it.  I just hope that changes in the future are more positive than negative.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sticky toffee pudding - warm, spiced, and yummy
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Scottish Salmon - $30 - crispy skin, cooked perfectly.
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Jdori roasted chicken. Yummy with crispy skin.

FGhH1ggYuVu_kJADjKiPoQ.text: Stopped in for a quick bite to eat & a few beers during happy hour.  My husband & I wanted to share a meal, & our server Rodney recommended the nachos! They were amazing! The nachos come on potato chips instead of tortilla chips which is unique and tasty! We will be back!

R-FLc3Ib4CG_s15aI6RlCQ.text: Went for a date night with my girlfriend, we had an amazing time! Food is awesome, drinks are great and most important the staff is super friendly. Nicole was our server and next time we go back we will ask for her! Great place!!  Btw the sticky toffee was omfg yummy

yVr_fn2g941ha2OoCWekCQ.text: On our trip to vegas we booked reservations here before flying out. Make sure you get reservations because there was a long line on the weekend.  The nachos are awesome.  The Shepard's pie was very good as was the bangers and mashed.  To finish we had the sticky toffee pudding per other reviews on here. We were not disappointed. Our waiter was very nice and attentive without being annoying.   For the bad..  I realize this is a pub theme but with a bill for 2 @100+ the tvs everywhere make it much less special. Especially  on the dinning room side. March madness bs didn't help either. We had a female server come to our table on 2 occations with dishes that were not ours and she seemed completely lost. We also over heard two waiters standing directly behind me talking about rude customers. They very well might be rude but talk in the back.   Overall we might go again but then again for the price it makes it hard to be a favorite.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States

D5av14ILiHNWNxhBOEfT-g.text: My husband and I were there in Saturday for lunch. This place had a great atmosphere and loved the decor with all the kegs.  Our server Brianna was awesome. She made great recommendations on both food and beer. She recommended the Inns & Gunn I believe that's what it was called as Gordon Ramsey's favorite beer .. and always made sure we had beers. She was extremely busy but still very attentive. Going to a new place you never know what to get so we followed her recommendation on that too, so we got the fish & chips and the Dublin sandwich. .. they were both great.    Next time we are in town we will definitely be going back and hopefully getting Brianna again. It's hard to get great service these days so thank you so much! !!

1FQ2egmoxamM-dqkMi1c2A.text: Opening night!!  BTW, the previous reviewer only posted to be #1 on yelp for this restaurant, lame. A+ ambiance, good food. I had the fish and chips and the fish was delicious and with a really neat presentation. A touch on the salty side... keeping it in mind that it's opening night. Nice selection of draft beers and really friendly waiters and waitresses.  My neighbor had the duck poutine and that looked AMAZING. He also had the deviled eggs and said that was the best he had that night.  Will definitely be going back when they work out the kinks.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Gordon Ramsay&#39;s take on fish and chips

6Ecs4qWw1iHXbXnGjGNwEA.text: They took the split pea soup off the menu...my friend was so bummed..  The tomato wasn't that great,  but the Butternut squash soup was wonderful.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. They took the  Split Pea soup off the menu,  my friend was so bummed as it was her favorite.

oNhw_lVYGwZudUQkP_WhBw.text: The nachos are AMAZING... had to go back a second day to have them again.  Made with kettle chips!  Top notch servers.  Ask for Rodney!

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The nachos are AMAZING...had to come back a second time.  Made with kettle chips instead of tortilla.  Ask for Rodney.

qsB2ljCGKWg7UC3jTvK8Rg.text: This place totally sucks - I went there with a crew of colleagues and it took 20-25 minutes to get a drink ordering at the bar - The register was messed up and charging Folks the wrong prices on their tabs - it wasn't even that crowded - never go here

u7Dsl-Y8I3DyrUBlHs4LKw.text: After a long car ride my bf and I came here for a late night bite to eat. I am a huge fan of Gorden Ramsey food shows and I was excited to try his restaurant. So I came here with high expectations. The environment is great and I loved the feel of this place. The hostesses and waiters were all dressed in new paper costumes.   Food  First thing that came out was the hand made soft pretzel. The presentation was great  and it was good. I am not a big fan of pretzels but it was quite good. It came with a tray of spicy horse radish melted cheese and pub mustard or was it some sort of butter.   Pork Belly:  This was surprisingly pretty good. The flavor was delicious it had a fatty, crispy, and just enough salty flavor. I recommend this dish for those who are not afraid of a fatty dish.   I ordered the Beef Cheek Stew. The meat was very tender and it melted nicely as it was in my salivating mouth. It was a bit on the salty side and it came with only four pieces of potato fries. I wish there was a little more starch in here to help balance the saltness.   Sticky Toffee Pudding: I read yelp reviews about this dessert and I am so glad that I ordered it because it was food orgasm in my mouth. It was a warm ooey gooeyyy toffee pudding with a scoop of vanilla ice cream YUMMAY. Highly recommend this. I would just come here just to eat this dessert again.   Our server seemed to be tired or ready to clock out. He was not very attentive and did not really describe how to use the ipad to order drinks. Lucky, being computer  savvy we were able to figure it out. I also ordered their whiskey sour. It was eh okay.  Overall, the experience was nice but I guess I expected more because it was THE Gorden Ramsey. At least the place is clean, food was not over or under cooked, and the environment was great.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bread pudding with toffee. Heck yeaaa so good
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pretzel bread to start off the meal
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beef stew

WlPBeJ9_gAp9ZP3Q7LPmuw.text: Loved the look and feel of this place, from the racks and stacks of beer kegs to the waitresses wearing what looked like newspaper dresses.   The food here was really excellent. I got the burger, which was a thick piece of meat and it was cooked well done just the way I like it. Service here was one of the better ones I've had on the Strip.   I know some people are weirded out by the fries, but I loved them. They're cut and shaped like large potato wedges. There were 4 to the plate and it honestly looked like a potato quartered and cooked. Yum!  I'd come back here in a heartbeat.

ay4mng8dQgAFdX4V74vBaw.text: We had dinner here on 10/08/16 prior to seeing a show. Service from Scott was very good.  However, the meal rates only two stars.  We first ordered the crispy Calamari. It was quickly served but was greasy.  See posted photos. Edible?  Sure.  Best we've had?  No way. Cost: $18.  Next we ordered something different in theme with and saluting British food.  Bangers and Mash.  This meal consists of three different sausages plated within a double scoop of mashed potatoes. The potatoes were good. The sausages were essentially flavorless and they were a bit undercooked and tough.  We both agreed we would not order this again.  Cost: $25.  We could prepare the same meal at home for $4, and it would be a lot better.  My wife is a 5 star chef, so we routinely taste and rate meals which can be a challenge to prepare correctly. Yes, this is Vegas, but we are expecting superior quality food and great flavors, which are prepared correctly.  Here we didn't get it.
