Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. You can see the grease

91MdJbMQXFiPYqmuQVD2KA.text: Awesome waiter delicious food and great atmosphere! Straight to the point no novel needed

el-U2JQBG09ohV4DxQCY6Q.text: We were here for a work outing, and five of us needed to jump in for dinner before seeing a show. "Randy" -- the bar manager -- took care of us and was so completely awesome. His beer recommendations were absolutely on point and he was a totally awesome, nice guy. Our experience was absolutely perfect, and the food was equal. I had the ribeye (amazing) but the real special bite was the lobster mac & cheese ... wow, so good.  Love this place and totally recommend it. Great, lively vibe too but not loud or anything.

_LSQVeXEVz2LgVdvCAVviw.text: My birthday was coming up and I happened to hear about the opening of this restaurant. I have been to Gordon Ramsay Steak and it is amazing, so I knew right away where I wanted to go. I brought along 11 of my friends to share the experience.  The service is pretty fantastic. They all learn your name and take the time to chat, they even put on fake British accents when they heard us doing it. My water glass was never empty and they even had the entire restaurant sing happy birthday to me. There are two menus, the grill menu which is a bit pricier and the pub menu which has yummy pub food. We ordered off of the pub menu. Since we were such a large party, we tried a lot of food!  Fish and Chips - The fish is so buttery and melt in your mouth delicious! OMG! I didn't care so much for the garlic on the chips. I love garlic, but they tasted like they had been rubbed with raw garlic, not my favorite.   Shepherd's Pie - The mashed potatoes were so buttery delicious. Everything really worked well together, it was easy to see why this is a signature dish.   Duck Poutine - The fries and the duck gravy were phenomenal. There were bits of duck that were a little overdone so didn't add much to the dish, maybe if they were cooked a little less it would have worked a little better.  Trio of Pretzels with cheese and mustard - Two of us ordered this appetizer and the bacon cheese pretzel was fantastic! The mustard was a bit too spicy for my liking and the cheese spread it a little weird, but not too bad. This dish is not worth ordering because they bring the exact same thing to the table for free, except the free one has a small loaf of pumpernickel bread and butter instead of mustard. I can't believe they charge for this and then bring almost the exact same thing to the table for free.   Mac and Cheese - Almost everyone at the table ordered this and the response was 50/50. I was expecting a warm and rich mac and cheese, unfortunately, there was a really sharp cheese flavor which turned me off.   Short rib and Cheek sandwich - My friend ordered this and passed it around the table. The meat was tender and delicious and there was a horseradish sauce that really added a kick.  Sticky Toffee Pudding - You really must try this! It is absolutely delicious! Everyone at the table stole a bite and enjoyed it.  Overall, there were a lot of hits and some misses. We did have one big thing that turned me off a little. My sister in law ordered a burger, they forgot the bacon and then the burger was almost raw. She sent it back and by the time they brought the new one everyone was finished eating. She asked them to just box it up since we were finished. I would have liked to see that taken off the check since she didn't even get to eat with everyone, unfortunately this didn't happen and I was not comfortable asking.   There are some great dishes on the menu, the restaurant has a really cool vibe, and the service was pretty good. This is definitely a cool hangout for some yummy upscale pub food, but Gordon Ramsay Steak is where it's really at!

O0cITGG7dIpKVcZewEBIRQ.text: What a huge disappointment.  If you want a good Ramsay experience try one of his other places because this probably won't be it.  The Truffle Chips were really pretty good but when it came to Fish & Chips, that's another story.  The fish was a pretty thick piece with a very light batter that made it seem out of proportion and not cooked properly.  The taste was okay, but when you pay these prices at a Gordon Ramsay restaurant you expect a lot more than okay.  We had two waiters that took turns waiting on us so you would expect good service but again, it was okay at best.    Wow, what a bummer.

rPrxNiZzNQ7Duh5nEZDrAg.text: Beer was excellent, our server was phenomenal. The only reason I feel I had to give it 3 stars was my first impression. The hostess just stared at me when I walked up. It was only a little after 1pm on a Saturday and they were busy but not to the point of having a waiting list. I just expected more after visiting Burgr in the Bellagio. I expected the hostess to speak. Say "hello" or in some way welcome us. Disappointed in the hostess but not the overall experience.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Awesome chair at Gordon Ramsay&#39;s Pub inside Caesars Palace Casino.

cc2ZIc7y0V0iiaK56Bo-Tg.text: Dinner was amazing. We were a large party of 9 which included 5 kids. We had 2 waiters who were super attentive. They went out of their way to make sure the kids ate first and that they had everything they needed. The food was awesome. From the appetizers to dinner ( chicken pot pie) to dessert...everything was delusions. I would absolutely come back to this restaurant.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sticky toffee pudding- so good

cmG0Rz_JFvQwm7ygrCnBhA.text: I was so looking forward to this after being a total Gordan Ramsey fan. It took 20min to be seated (with a reservation). 45 min before we finally got sorted and had drinks. They ran out of prosecco, they ran out of the beef Wellington special. The steak came out like it had been microwaved from the night before, we sent it back.  Service was slow, the manager had to come over and readjust the bill and apologise for our experience. Appreciated the discount and free dessert to rectify but  so disappointing seeing how high Gordan Ramsey's standards are on his show, compared to our experience. It felt like he needed to do a kitchen nightmare on his own resturant tonight.

Jye2EaTA7AN4r4HOO8nAFQ.text: LAS VEGAS, NV: This restaurant is significantly underrated at 3 stars.  Haters gonna hate.  The food was excellent.  Service needed work, otherwise I would give 5 stars.  Eat here.  Tried a bunch of awesome menu items:  Fish n Chips (4.5 stars): Delicious English fish n chips, soft, tender fish with a flavorful crisp exterior.    Steak Tenderloin (5 stars): Tender, delicious, perfectly cooked.  It was a wonderful dish!  Lobster Roll (4 stars): Delicious, flavorful, pretty good size for a starter.

wAtWElGbHPcFQKmViNETag.text: What can I say?  Just fantastic! This was our second time there this year. Food was excellent. Service was great. Ambience is cool. I would highly recommend this restaurant if your in Las Vegas.

MaKOKzqX089Xu-D0FMfDLw.text: With my specific food allergy, I spoke with a friendly manager about the options I have there. He was so gracious that he took me to speak directly with the chef and I was able to get the perfect meal. They accommodated the 10 of us and the waiter and secondary were also great. I have a hard time finding places I can eat and usually it becomes a drag but they made it seamless. I would give more stars if I could. Kudos to the staff and manager that Saturday night.

VvSMTr3GLvHqyZfISW1weg.text: Incredible food, with even better staff. Our waiter, Roger was genuinely a delight to talk to. All of the staff went above and beyond for us to enjoy our experience.

JPnbncbaKRMKdawyHc0oGQ.text: Gordon Ramsey is blowing up Las Vegas with his steakhouse in Paris, his Pub in Caesars and then his Burgr joint in PH...someone forgot to spell check that sh*t!   Anyhoo, back to pub-tastic...we attended the preview dining and we were very pleased. All the servers were very attentive and pleasant & they have the cutest outfits!  The food was good, a very nice mix of European/English flair, although not a lot of selections for Vegetarians. They have a nice ambiance for a Pub and I would suggest it for sure, it's a mix between a restaurant, bar & lounge - you can choose to sit in any.... EXCEPT.....it's VERY pricey.  Our meal, two people, was $125 :/ Eesh!  My husband had the Scottish beer and he loved it!  "The pub includes 36 beers served on tap plus 24 bottled beers. With an eye towards dishes that pair well with beer the pub menu includes English ale onion soup, shepherd's pie, and a selection of sausages, fried egg sandwiches and the classic pub fish and chips."  Save up your money before you go & Enjoy!!

Qqo2hpXvPlk9gQMo8SReDA.text: DISAPPOINTMENT!  The cheeseburger was dry and tasteless. It came with nothing; no lettuce or tomato. I had the choice of putting ketchup or garlic aioli on it but nothing else.  The fries were OK but nothing special. I was lucky enough to have the one server behind the bar who really took care of his customers but the rest of the Hipsters working behind the bar, they were more interested in talking to and impressing eachother than taking care of the customers. There was a definate lack of Management on my visit.   A pint of draft IPA $13, I could buy a 6-pack of this beer for $10. Cheeseburger and fries $19. I would rather have a 5-Guys burger with it's better tasting meat and many toppings and bigger, better tasting fries all for half of the price. I just can't believe that Chef Ramsay has tasted and approved of this food. But after eating at his namesake Gordon Ramsay Restaurant at the London Hotel in Hollywood (Restaurant has closed) maybe he has found a way to make money on hipe alone.  So everyone, don't waste your money here. I guarantee you that if you order the cheeseburger at the hotel coffee shop you will be eating better than at GR Pub and Grill. Someone conduct this burger challenge and post your results on Yelp. I would like to know how it goes.

TPZOuwjYgy7YYzajvyEOqw.text: Let me start by saying I read the reviews PRIOR go going here.  Overprice - ehh, it's Vegas, and it's Gordon Ramsay, so what.   What was constant in other reviews was the service.  I thought, you know, worth a try, could be start up pains.  Well, WOW.  Very disappointed with the front of the house.  We had reservations, showed up early, and they were clearly confused looking up reservation on the computer and an iPad, so stand to the side.  A manager type (noted as a manager by not wearing the newsprint jumper mini dress all other hostess were wearing) asks "may I help you".  Tell her we were told to wait, she asks for name again, and then with an attitude, tells us, "for 7:45"  (it was 8:25 and we had an 8:30).  I reply 8:30, she walks away without saying a word.   Eventually we're seated, smack in the middle of the dining room that is visible from the casino, good table, near a POS/waiter station.   18 minutes later - yes, eighteen, the waiter comes by, politely greets us, asks about drinks, but we didn't have a drink menu.  He was trying his best, but good service is not solely the poor waiter's responsibility.      When we placed our drink order, we placed our entire order (app, 2 entrees).   Bread plates were provided, then breads were brought.  Breads were finished, so empty crock, tray and 2 small bowls for sauces remained on the table.  (did I mention the waiter station/lsland 6 feet from us).  Our appetizer came, long plate, used our bread plates for serving plates.  Finished, and now all those plates were still at the table.  Our entrees came, after having been walked around to the dining room with the beer barrels (cause I saw the food go by me first, then come back).   Plates were set, we moved our bread plates to the side on top of the appetizer long tray - and there they remained.  The only redemption was the food was good.  My husband ordered Shepard's Pie, which I wish I would have ordered as it was very good.  I had fish and chips, which, one of my fish got soggy at the bottom, but another was crispy.  I read critiques that the chips weren't authentic - I liked them.  My guess if I had to replicate at home, is that you take 1 potato, make it a thick steak fry - so 1 potato = 1 fry; and they probably use the rest of the sides for the mash, but I liked them.  There was another manager type, male this time, (manager noted by his not wearing the punk suspender type clothes waiters were wearing) and this guy looked so sleazy .  Sweaty - seriously, like the kind Gordon rips to shred on Kitchen Nightmares.   I actually told my husband it looked like the KN in NY where this godfather type guy wore the trench coat and glasses and they owned a lobster house, and argued with Chef about "maine lobsters".  This guy seriously went to the table behind me, about 12 times.  And please, I'm not knocking appearance, I'm not a barbie type person, but I do expect people regardless of age or size, to look presentable, meaning, clothes fit properly, clothes are clean & neat.   Not sure what the couple did or who they were to warrant attention every 7 minutes, but obviously this clueless manager couldn't turn his back and see a stack of empty plates at our table while we were trying to finish our entrees!  Almost thru our meal, the waiter came buy, said could I take those plates, since you've been staring at them your entire meal.   Again, he was waiting every table in that dining room, and he was hustling, but no support!  At one point when we finished our meal, he ask someone when he saw us finish, to please bus our table - and he did, about 10 minutes later.  Never did I think a pub meal would take 2+ hours.  Again, it's Vegas, so yes, it's over priced, but shamefully not worth it.  I won't be back.  The poor front of house isn't a testament to starting pains, it's poor execution and leadership.  I'll keep watching the damn shows though!

U9Bn_NX6LVgwIYmU7ZMSjw.text: We haven't been to a Gordon Ramsay restaurant before but we were expecting a good experience. Boy were we wrong. Some of the food were pretty good, I'd give that 3 stars, our server was awesome - I give her 5 stars, everybody and everything  else 0 stars...   First of all, we went at 5:45 to get a table for 3 - with lots of empty tables in the restaurant they tell us, they can't accommodate us until 9:45 that night. We weren't that hungry so we decided to take the 9:45 reservation. When we got there again, we had to wait to be seated because it seemed like they didn't even know which tables were available.   We finally got seated at approximately 10:15 and the hostess gave us ONE menu for a party of three. Okay, you might be busy and ran out of menus for the moment, but you should give us two additional menus ASAP. She never came back, and every other party around us had a menu for per person in their party. My friend saw a hostess with extra menus in her hands so she flagged her down to give us the menus. She had the nerve to say, "I'm sorry, we usually only give ONE MENU PER TABLE." - really?! That's a ridiculous excuse...if you can't think of something better, just say sorry and hide behind the counter or something. Oh yeah they ran out of water as they were filling our glasses so one of them was half full and they never came back to give us more...  We finally placed our order probably at 10:30. We ordered pub crisps (pretty good, might be a little too oily), mini sliders (I tried one that was overcooked, the meat was so dry), duck confit poutine (best dish of the night), a burger, and fish and chips (if I had read the review that all fish dishes were crap, I wouldn't have ordered this) and two drinks. During the 1+ hour that we were waiting for our food, we decided to order desserts ahead of time because we were afraid that would take another hour. We ordered the sticky toffee pudding and triple chocolate trifle - both were very good. We also got the peanut butter and jelly but that was too sweet for our taste buds.   We ordered at the same time as this table of two girls that the bald manager guy snuck in after we were seated. But their food and drinks came way earlier than ours.   We finally got our drinks at 10:45 and we didn't get any of our food until 11:44. That's over an hour after we placed our order, and people who were seated after us got their food, one table even paid and left already. Our food didn't even come in the order that the food should arrive, we got appetizers and entrees at the same time. At least they didn't bring us the dessert too.   A different manager came with the people serving our food. My friend just started to complain about the poor service that we had all night. (Aside from our server - we didn't quite catch her name but she acknowledged us, she keeps coming back to tell us she had already asked the kitchen to hurry up and get us our food; she was very attentive and nice to us while we were waiting.) So the manager was apologizing, saying sorry that we had such a bad experience, yada yada ya. And they ended up giving us a free meal.   If we had to pay, I would say the food is slightly overpriced. Portions are small but depending on what you order, the food was pretty good. (DON'T ORDER FISH!!) Unless they fix how they run the restaurant (kitchen and everybody else minus that one server), I wouldn't come back...even if I loved the duck confit poutine, sticky toffee pudding and the potted triple chocolate trifle -_- But they just opened recently, so I might give it one more try (after careful screening of fellow yelp reviewers comments) in the future or if it is still around...  They have pretty judgmental people working there, if you want better, quicker service, then dress up. There was this other table near us, they received the same kind of crap service when it came to food, drinks, and all. They had to wait just as long as we did, if not longer. And they messed up their order on food too.

LkqXYmCYsf4r9qHBxPxP4Q.text: Was super excited to try this place because I am a fan, but ended up being severely disappointed. Walked up to the nearly deserted restaurant and was told it was an hour and a half wait. The 3 of us found seating at the bar and quickly pored over the menu. In the end we only ordered 3 things: bacon cheeseburger, chips, and a Caesar salad. When the order was put in our server, Ramon, talked to us a bit explaining about how unique the uniforms are. Then he completely ignored us, along with the rest of the staff because they were either talking about their workout routines, diet, or flirting with the waitress with the new boobs. Time passed without so much as a refill. 30 minutes later Ramon said, "your foods not here yet?" Clearly the empty placemat was a clue. Another 15 minutes passed and he woke up out if his stupor to again say, "wow, your food still isn't out?!" 2 minutes later it finally arrived. The salad was more a bowl of dressing with a few lettuce leaves. The burger and chips were extremely bland. It took another 10 minutes to flag down Ramon for the check. When it arrived we paid with 2 cards and cash. I wrote the payments down and even explained it. Well, Ramon pocketed the cash and charged my card double. I flagged him down again and pointed out his mistake. He said he must not have heard me and fixed it. All in all it was a shit experience. I would expect more from a restaurant owned my someone who has shows where he gets people and their restaurants in line. Bottom line: You're better off at a buffet.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Copies of the many receipts.

xTtbLWsd9DvULKvzjPIbqw.text: I actually thought this place was pretty good. The whole restaurant remodel went over very successfully and it now boosts a large open floor plan.  True to form, all the staff still wear crazy outfits that just look silly on some.    We got the Shepard's pie and the mac-n-cheese and shared these two items for lunch.   The Shepard's pie was AMAZING def get this.  The mac-n-cheese was just OK for me.    Service was great and availability to make a reservation online on opentable is always a plus.

7TnbFLeUKMm-mbg_EGh-dA.text: Top notch, great staff and amazing food.   Fish and chips ( Thumbs up) Mac (Thumbs up) Corn chowder (Thumbs up) Sticky toffee pudding (Thumbs up) In other words holy hell this place is awesome,if u are in Vegas it's a must try.

HoXvJz62tA00nhLLPooYrg.text: This place offers good English pub comforts (bangers and mash, Shepard pie, etc) but the real draw here is the casual atmosphere, good beer and fun waiters. Our waiter (my brother from another mother, Christopher) was awesome and took very good care of us.   Sadly, they no longer offer complimentary bread anymore.   IMHO, it's good food but a little pricey. But then again, you're on the strip and inside ceasars so I guess it's to be expected.

mdLMHqO3-D4mf2LTybRUPQ.text: Ordered beef cheek and pork belly. Amazing! Beef cheek was super tender you don't even need a knife. The mashed potato was a tasty side to the meat. Pork belly was well cooked, crispy on the outside, tender inside. Sat at the bar, Keith was fun to converse with. So much fun eating there. Would definitely go back. They need to work on their 'text message' system though, not organized or efficient at all.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beer for girls who don&#39;t like regular beer lol. Beef cheek and toffee pudding. Tasty!!!!!!!!

5bV8l0wry7E6t0tb8xSamQ.text: Came on Tuesday night specifically for The Scuffle!!!! I had been craving it for so long, its one of my favorite drinks! But of course, they were out of the Guinness cream which completes the drink! That was a huuuuge bummer.... One server said he doesn't think they'll get the Guinness cream like AT ALL anymore which saddened me even more =[  We enjoyed the sticky toffee pudding! And Antwon was a pleasure. Every time I go there, he's at the same corner of the bar polishing glasses-- he is such a great character, he needs to actually tend bar, make the good $$$, and do what he does best.... INTERACT WITH GUESTS!! I came in New Years Eve, nearly 10 months ago, sat at the bar visited our friend who was the General Manager at the time, and Antwon was doing the same thing then-- COME ON, time for a promotion?!! Team Antwon!

eLyp0JaR__N5uPGGSOEBMQ.text: This was a fabulous dining experience for everyone in our party of 8 (ages 4 to 51.)  We were greeted by a very friendly young hostess who immediately sat us at our table.  A nice young man immediately arrived and filled our water glasses.  Our waiter, Christopher, was very friendly and professional.  My 4-year-old grand-daughter was sleepy and in a bad mood, but Christopher's interaction with her really cheered her up and made our entire dining experience so much more enjoyable.  The food was great!  We ordered the fish and chips, lamb burgers, hamburger, salmon, curry, and appetizers, as well as desserts.  Every item was excellent!  The soft pretzel and wing appetizers were good, all of our entrees were outstanding, and all of the desserts were perfect.  I do recommend that you dine here at off-peak times for best service because this casino complex is always packed with visitors.  This is one of the best pub-style food places in Las Vegas.  No disappointments.

J4sT1h1LkpF8gn1llCyYvg.text: Just had the NY Strip. Previously had the Lamb. My wife had the Short Rip. All cuts where cooked to perfection and juicy as can be. Our waiter was awesome. I would highly recommend this place. It's pricey, but knowing you are paying for the brand, you are not caught off.

P3V08-ow5CtP_bsiSZ4zMQ.text: Hey Hey Hey Heyyyy! For starters ... YOU PAY FOR THE NAMEEEEEE!!!!! It took forever for our food to come out, and the waiter was way too bouchie for me. But... I ordered a $28 glass of wine and a Gnat was in it. Then when I got the bill the waiter didn't even remove it from the bill!!!! Ugh! I ordered a burger (well done) with the special sauce on the side. By the time I got the burger it came out sloppy, with the sauce on the burger. But it was well done and Pretty thick! My man ordered the Rib Eye Steak and the MAJORITY of it was FAT. I know its a fatty steak anyway, but it was almost like they but a slab of fat on the grill with seasoning and brought it out to him.  I had high expectations for this place and was not impressed AT ALL! :-(

e1UXlmnD9OE7lrGbZXedpQ.text: I had high expectations for this place. This was suppose to be my one big nice dinner in Vegas. I expected perfection due to the stigma attached with Gordan Ramsey himself. To my disappointment we sat down and immediately had poor service.   It took 10 minutes to be properly greeted. When we were greeted it was quick short and in a rush and not personable. Another 10 minutes to receive water and my iced tea took even longer.   We ordered an appetizer which took atleast 30 minutes. I would guess our order was not even put in because our server ran by our table to tell us our dinner was on the way and we were already at 40 minutes from out initial order.   I spoke with the manager and the only thing he was able to do was provide us with a free B-day dessert which we would have not ordered in the first place, and decided to take off my iced tea from the bill. All together our food took about 1 1/2 hours to receive, and the overall time took 2+ hours.   I felt the management did not care about our experience, and no one admitted to any wrong doing with our ticket times. I paid the bill and left no tip.  After all the issues we had the food did not make up for it alone.

8tYBBRq1jET3OH6ORMRN4Q.text: I got the Caesar salad and hubby got the fish and chips.   The salad had a little too much dressing and the chicken was dry but all in all it was good.  Hubby liked the fish and chips but said that the Nine Fine Irlishmen in New York, New York was better.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken Caesar salad

n_mSFlGZRgsnkXjryC-nhg.text: Slow is key word! Not a little bit Terribly slow! 30-45 min for appetizers and the same for the entree! Fish was fishy and small in portion! Appetizer little burger bites were good. Others in my party were not impressed.   Service people are very nice and personable but the kitchen is a disaster and killer!! For $50 a head plus tip I won't go again! Server was embarrassed by the kitchen. The beer is good and the server was knowledgeable. Even on reflection weeks later - No stars for kitchen -wait time and food (fish) poor! Server 4.0. Overall 1 stars. December 26. Unfortunately the service cannot overcome the food since that's why I came.  I would caution accepting high reviews on face value. Appears they must have had a stellar opening and served drinks because the good reviews rarely focused on the Dinner food but liked the bar. Guess it depends on if you are there to eat or drink!  Overall, I left my short trip to Vegas feeling I had wasted one good meal opportunity given the price there are just too many other outstanding choices to waste a dollar or precious time here! Appears Mr. Ramsey is better that hyping his restaurant and TV shows than producing it in his restaurant. Save your time and money.

2yfmVVz3-YyfUtpNT74LJA.text: This was one of the worst restaurants ever. The food was great and juicy but the portions of the food was bad. We ordered the lamb ribs and they only gave us 2 tiny ribs the size of our pinky. Then we ordered this other dish that had steak, shrimp and ribs for $44.00 but they only gave us 1 shrimp, 1 riblet the size of my little pinky, and a tiny piece of steak. What a rip off if you guys haven't eat here yet don't they charge you a lot of money for just little portions of food.

4-f9cu0FASJxtw5-giiI0g.text: Too expensive, bad service and did not like their menu! But the food is delicious but never again!

EDIBSTBJce7HWB97-woPwg.text: Only 3 letters are needed to describe my 1st Timer experience here...WOW!!!! I've heard the rave and hype of Gordon Ramsay's creations, but not only was the food Amazing, the staff/service was just the same. Both Michelle and Joe provided superb service, not missing a beat and making sure we had everything we needed. Definitely will be back for seconds, and if you haven't been, this is not one to miss! =)

0Y2LfO_ZDPwTUifTDkdoDQ.text: I have had two dreams involving Gordon Ramsay's pork belly, and that was just in the last week since I have eaten here.  We went to the pub last week for a nice, relaxing dinner. The restaurant was packed for a good reason, so we weren't able to get a reservation until 10:30PM. The reason why I was willing to wait was because when I went to the hostess stand and asked if they had a gluten free menu, the hostess pulled it out and it was full of GF happines. A pub with a gluten free menu? I never thought this was possible! Oh, but it was, and oh was it amazing.  We ordered their house chardonnay in a carafe. Very reasonably priced and went perfectly with all three of our dishes. It was a strong chardonnay, and I didn't want to stop drinking it.  We started off with the cauliflower soup with curry oil. I am very sensitive about curry. Curry is powerful and if used incorrectly, it can devastate or illuminate a dish. Since we shared the soup they split it into two bowls, no extra fee. The first sip? MIND BLOWING. The soup wasn't soup; it was so light and airy that it was actually like a foam. The curry brought a subtle smokiness to the dish and with the little saltiness from the bacon and sweetness of the caramelized onion, this became one of our top 3 soups. EVER.  Then we ordered their salmon and pork belly as entrees, both which are naturally gluten free. The salmon skin was like a potato chip and the salmon was cooked to perfection. Not too raw in the center and perfectly soft and flaky all throughout. The cream sauce was subtle, not heavy and not overwhelming so that salmon was still the star of the dish. It went beautifully with the mushrooms and other garnishing vegetables.   My husband got the pork belly, the star of the night. Neither of us have ever had pork belly before, and I am now spoiled on pork belly and have very little hope that any restaurant will beat Ramsay's because this pork belly, even with all the fat, melted in my mouth and did not make me ill with greasiness. It was pork butter, and I could have eaten the entire dish had my husband not devour it before me. This pork belly was perfectly cooked and the sauce underneath was not rich was I LOVED because there is only so much my palette I can take before going into to overload. There is too much for me to say about this pork belly, so to avoid the novel, just eat it. You cannot go wrong. Also, grab a side of chips with fried truffle. Best chips my husband has had in the U.S.  Service was phenomenal, manager stopped by to see how we liked dinner, the environment and rhythm of the restaurant was smooth, sexy and upbeat and there is truly nothing I did not like about our experience here. We will absolutely go back VERY, very soon.  Mmmm,...pork butter...  P.S. Throw down your Total Rewards card and save a few dollars!

B3u79H_TGmKkG5G1Q-KF5Q.text: Absolutely excellent burgers.  I went here alone and was able to get a seat at the bar.  Tried the next nigh with a small group and was going to be a 45 minute wait.  If you've got the time, worth the wait.  Fairly small selection of beers is probably the worst thing about this great hamburger place

SoY7O8PvsSjkVbSla4FcvA.text: Overall this place was ok. Nothing special. Ordered a $22 beef burger with bacon that was ok tasting unfortunately the bottom of my bun was burnt. My girlfriend got a cesars salad, she said it was good. Overall this was not the best burger I've eaten especially paying $22 for a burger with bacon. Would have expected way better food especially since is has chef's Ramsey's name on it.

g8j_0TRVcT1f4ZzQ8uV8hg.text: I love this place and cone back every visit. I crave their deviled eggs but they changed them up. Good but not amazing like they use to be. d4gxskr-vLYQhVlkO6AJIQ.text: I never went to a Pub and neither did my parents or my brother, so this was a first.   The place is quite dim, but adds to the atmosphere. The seating is quite unconventional in my opinion. There are the couches or benches that have tables that seem quite low. A taller table would be very beneficial.   When I went there, the service was great and spot on.   The Food: The lamb burger is delicious! Order that sucker as medium rare and you'll have no regrets. I was pleased on how much french fried it came with. Personally I think its around $2-5 over priced, but hey its a dish from an A list chef.  The steak with potatoes and asparagus was very tasty and quite large, and I think it was worth the money. The chicken sandwich is quite gigantic and wast good, not as good as the burger or steak in my opinion.  Only go, If you've been planning on eating at a Ramsay establishment for a while and have the money.   Would I recommend it? Definitely, especially if they wanted to have an experience at a Pub.   I'd give it around a 4.2/5

oQeEJkhjyURseah8W3481Q.text: I recently visited Gordon Ramsay's Pub on a business trip a few weeks back. Upon arrival I was introduced to Randy the ASM, whom I was told could help find the right channel for the game I was seeking. After speaking to Randy for several minutes he was able to locate my game, and boy was I happy. Not only was Randy exceptional, his Bar tenders were equally as accommodating. They where very knowledgeable about their beers and were able to help find a new beer that was different from what I usually drink. Overall experience was so warm and inviting that I decided to go back the next night for dinner again. I would highly recommend this place next time your in Vegas.

3mcKd3tl-MCBkf6BH9TJjA.text: The food was unreal. But better than the food was the service of waiter Rodney. He was super friendly informative and cared about us the entire time there. The crispy pork belly is very good, and the Hell's Kitchen burger has just the right amount of spice. My wife said the salmon was the best she ever had. Great job. Good work Rodney, would definitely come back and try to get served by him again.

Bbuadpn2tjmVPnHVTH4sMw.text: Let me tell you that the Lamb burger is as good as you day dreamed it! I had a small issue and my waiter, Roger was very attentive and helped me resolve my issue. The food service is fast and professional. I cannot wait to try another burger here tomorrow.

HyAzmnTnXd9ROHFBR9igog.text: Ok I must say my burger was omg D Lish!!! The beer was good, they had a nice variety. We were both happy with our meals here. But overall it was ridiculous the prices they charge here for a burger & a beer. Wow, I could have sushi for a little more.. lol

sQ8qAPWlebdMQC-tqVsdmg.text: We had calamari for 18$. Pub burger for 13$ and hells kitchen buger for 23$ . It is pricey for what you eat and i think is because of franchise brand. The burger was too spicy, so order it if you like hot burger. Calamary was yummy and it was a decent big portion.  I expected more tasty and fansy food from Ramsey's kitchen ( because of his shows and the way he critices chefs) but anyway it was on good level. I change my review to 4 since the customer service and care is excellent and this is what makes me feel respected.

4_QJ1h_TkoluHP7oEaNmgg.text: First time for me to visit this place. I had Good foods and kind customer service here. Great place to stop by at Vegas! Thank you.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States

39Guxl2CdpGHxRpsORO_2w.text: What a great dinning experience at a restaurant by the famous Gordon Ramsay. I came here with fellow elite Melissa Y. because she had invited me for lunch. I could not resist skipping out on a celebrity chef meal right? I actually came here 2 years ago for a Yelp event and they have certainly made changes for the better.   Before we ordered our waitress Carrie gave us a little run down on the background of the resto in addition to some of her recommendations from appetizers to entrees. I thought that was very nice of her to do that considering some people are clueless as to what they want to order. We started our meal with calamari which was suggested to us by Carrie. It came out pretty fast and I did enjoy it because the breading was quit different than what I'm used to. Typically calamari is more of a flour based breading and I could tell they used bread crumbs possibly? I liked it because it added a bit more texture to it and to add to that the squid was not rubbery which I have experienced at other places. The tartar sauce was had a home made touch to it, it was probably house made? For the entree, I had the pub salad. The protein in the salad was chicken, ham and shrimp. It may sound overwhelming, but it actually wasn't. The amount they put of each was just right, which made the salad still a light option. There was also little bits of apples, chickpeas, and cherry tomatoes which added to the freshness to the dish as a whole. Finally the red wine vinaigrette brought everything together and they did so by putting the perfect amount for the salad. I was definitely pleased because I did not want anything heavy because I knew I was going to have a heavy dinner. As we were eating we saw that a man in a suit walking around the resto asking customers how their food was, I overheard him say his name was Derrick. I assume he was the manager and it just goes to show how much they care about pleasing their dinners. While eating we needed re-fills on our drinks and caught the attention of a server by the name of Sara. Normally I don't like asking other servers for anything because they are assigned a certain area of tables. However, Sara  did so willingly and was very nice about it. She even said if there was anything else we needed to let her know. To top off our meal Chef Scott from Hell's Kitchen came our and introduced himself to Melissa Y. and I, totally unexpected. We were kind of star-struck too at the same time! Lol.. Anyway, this place has definitely improved this time around and I can't wait to be back.

gqVHGd_lMy7cV4xqjyttCQ.text: We enjoyed the best burger ever. While we expected a "tourist trap", what we got was simply very good food, along with great service from Heather. Happy to have made this stop, even though I suspect that Caesar hasn't tried this burger...yet!

jwvL5J49ta6Fs2oJwY4iSA.text: We made reservations at 7:30 pm and sat us down at our reservation time. The staff and server is very polite.  The menu is very English pub food- great selection of appetizers and entrees. Next time I'll have to try an appetizer.   I ended up ordering Ruben sandwich with rye bread and it had sauerkraut gruyere cheese, with truffle fries on the side. My mom had the fish and chips which was pretty pricy for fish and chips $30, yet the fish was flaky and not as greasy.   The server kindly asked if we were a total rewards member (casino rewards card) cause they have special pricing which you can save $1 on each entree you order. I will be definitely be coming back!

s9yPBK_KCAH3du1qmrwbjg.text: Out in Vegas for a conference and staying at Caesars - and didn't want to go too far for dinner. Saw Gordon Ramsey's pubs and thought I'd try it.   Ordered the bacon burger medium and it came out medium well. It was also dry and tasteless - certainly not worth the $23 price. Beer selection was good and service OK - though when asked how my food was - I told them not so great - and the bartender shrugged and walked away.   The guy next to me had the fish and chips and it looked delicious, so if I go back - that's what I'd order.

8ynPcy22ZLRaya6qM1IvsA.text: Only because I think it's over priced for portion size and ambiance, but taste great. The butter chicken curry had great flavor, and the fish and chips is void of greasy flavor. The food came out so fast, I didn't believe it was our order. Even with the price I'd come back again. The Mule's Hind Leg is the BEST version of a Moscow Mule that I've had. The fresh ginger takes the drink over the top.

imSsppVlPqQ7ZVHfkDyUqA.text: The food doesn't disappoint.  The truffle fries are excellent along with the sliders are flavorful.  Rodney, our server couldn't do enough for us and so helpful and friendly.

R-o1eVvmPkrIHuWVVy_pig.text: I only stopped in quickly for a bite before dinner. The beer was good and service was good. The two appetizers I had were pretty bad. I about choked on the sliders because they were so dry. It's probably fine if your in a hurry, but I wouldn't wait in a line.

1ujGEGsFmlx51YsX5ocKQA.text: Food was delicious.  Highly recommend the lamb burger.  We got the mixed greens salad and lamb burger and it was big enough to split between fiance and me.

hXkX4lHBIZxrwoQXNvVskA.text: To preface, I will say that my review of the Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill is based strictly on their happy hour.  The happy hour runs daily from 2-5 PM, nice because it is on the earlier side of some of the other happy hours in Vegas, allowing for optimal bar crawling if that is your preference.  In my case, I happened to stop in on my last day in town before getting on the road back to Los Angeles.  The bartenders were great, extremely friendly and very prompt when service was needed.  For food we ordered the Truffle Fries ($5) and Nachos ($7).  On the fence about the wings, we were proposed to give the wings a shot and if we didn't like them, we would not be charged for them.  Swayed, we gave them a shot.  Despite the name, they were not breathtakingly spicy.  They did have a tinge of Asian-style sweetness, but all-in-all were pretty good.  The nachos came with a good chunk of meet on top of potato chips.  A little different, more British style, but all around pretty good.  The truffle fries I was quite excited for given that I saw pictures of thick planks of fries on Yelp.  Unfortunately, they were the thin variation, not much different from fries you could get anywhere.  The aioli was good, but I was unimpressed by the fries, especially for $5.  However, my girlfriend enjoyed them.  Drinks were also on special, including champagne, to my girlfriend's pleasure.

VeIkqAclBZgNSK-ZxD72-g.text: This restaurant is located in cesars right next to Mariah and Celine. It's actually a great place for large groups to come because they can accommodate big parties. Also good for people who like the drink beer ( even though it's pricey). They take reservations and make sure you do so you don't have to wait. The waiters and servers are really nice. Our survey Rodney was great!  He was friendly and waived or cake cutting fee!  Because if him I added an extra star.   So why only three stars?  For the food and the price. Looking at the menu its traditional pub food. We ordered steak and ale pie, shepards pie, burgers, fish and chips, bangers and mash and short ribs... Basically almost everything on the menu.  Sounds really good. I never really crave this kind of food but I  thought it was great change. After ordering we were all really excited but the food took forever to come!!  I swear it was 45 mins. Granted we did have a bigger group of 8 but I thought it was still too long. I ordered the lamb burger upon recommendation. For 25 bucks a burger... I expected more. I tried Gordon ramsays burger place in planet hollywood and I thought that was way better. The meat was juicier and was less dry. The fish and chips were good and so was the steak and ale pie. When I say good it's not amazing or a must try. It's decent.  But it wasn't worth 30 dollars a dish. I think they charge for the atmosphere which is great but the food was sub par.    This is a good option if you like pub food and enjoy the atmosphere more than quality of food. We had a great time with great company but I don't think I'll pick to eat at this place again. :)

cN7hso6GZQOILcockNgcZw.text: Unbelievably high prices!  Obviously, when Caesar's Palace went in with Ramsey on his Hell's Kitchen joint venture, they took the normal prices of food and doubled it so he could get his 50% cut. I paid $30 for fish and chips (2 pieces of fish with french fries) $40 for salmon and potatoes. Not to mention the $11 beers.  Not going back.

ldL29WeEqcpKCDyR6eWCWA.text: Meh.. it was ok...  nothing to rave about at home.  The name really got us at the door and Im pretty sure for most people.  We were hungry did a lot of shopping wanted a quick drinks and food.    And we were in the area.  It was busy waited 10 minutes for a table.  The restaurant itself was cool, the decor was "ragged British" leather, dark colours, and metal.  The menu wasn't to big but had options.  I went it a caesar salad and onion soup.  Friends had drinks.  Coming to Vegas its all about eating for me, service was ok we wanted to order more drinks but it was hard to get our servers attention, we ended up rushing out.  Food, I had pretty much appys it was ok, I cant say for other menu items because I didn't try it.  Overall it was ok.

5YjFKNEav1Gu7-jUfvzvBw.text: I had a late lunch today at Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill today.  Gord and I are fans of Hell's Kitchen and MasterChef so I thought I'd check it out.  It was fairly packed so I sat at the bar rather than wait for a table (a 15+ minute wait).  It's in Caesar's Palace so it's not cheap.  I ordered a burger and fries (without lettuce, onion and cheddar and added bacon).  It took about a half hour ... Charlie, the bartender, said the kitchen was backed up.  It was good but could have been hotter (I guess it was sitting around for a while).  It was rarer than I like it but tender and juicy.  The experience was okay, not outstanding.

Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States

3STlDfUnbpTpSvB2d3QD6Q.text: One of our plates came out cold. Brought a new plate out and the meat had no salt on it and it was smaller than the previous piece of meat.  Food was decent but not worth the price tag.  Won't be coming back. Too much good food in Vegas to waste time here! Gordan you have disappointed me :(

qDSOg4J-d3mg0IpoKhokvA.text: Only ok.  Crowded.  Food would not be up to Gordon Ramsey's standards.  Server was very good.  Reception was terrible, 2 girls with 0 personality doing (from what I could see) a lousy job.  Management responds to customer feedback, and I think is honestly trying to give everyone a good customer experience, I will try this restaurant again in the future.

6qNxwMqBoi3IYi5mz1Dvuw.text: I've been getting spoiled rotten with delicious food in Vegas on our current trip and sadly I must say my lunch at Gordon Ramsay's pub was my least favorite meal.   The chopped salad was off.. there was a ton of shrimp, chicken, ham, and other ingredients in there but it just wasn't good...  :(  The pistachio pesto chicken sandwich was... blah. Bread was hard... too hard on the outside and soaked in olive oil on the inside... I mean I don't know maybe it's supposed to be like that.. and if other people like it that's fine but my husband and I didn't enjoy it. There wasn't much flavor in general in the chicken, provolone, and roasted tomatoes. The tomatoes had the most flavor but not enough of it in the sandwich.   The appetizers however, saved the day. We ordered the truffle fries and the mini lobster rolls. The truffle fries were delicious... and the lobster rolls were good. Not the best but definitely good!   We were very impressed with Gordon Ramsay's steakhouse so I had high hopes for this one but it just wasn't as good as I hoped it would be. Maybe we'll give it another try next time if we have a chance.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mini lobster rolls
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Truffle fries
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pistachio pesto chicken sandwich

OiAonqWG1yOYfuBFaLxVEQ.text: We ate there October 28, 2017. The plus side was location, as we were going to Elton John which is directly across from the restaurant. We had a wonderful server, and they were able to accommodate us to help us get to the show on time.    Food was the down side. 2 of us had "side" salads. Very expensive and was served in a tiny bowl.  You could eat the salad with 2 forkfuls, no exaggeration and was WAY overpriced, even for Vegas.  2 of us had the short ribs.  It was very tough, had to chew for a very long time.  Short ribs are supposed to be very tender, and I have had them at many restaurants, these were a big disappointment.   I wouldn't recommend this restaurant unless they change the quality of the food.

_bgn79gG702sBy3M53Rxsw.text: The food here is great! Heather the waitress was fantastic! We had sliders, fish and chips, ribs and Brussel sprouts. Drinks were great.. service was great and overall atmosphere was fantastic. Happy customers!!

Up7HoUqeLvHc43Hl6Bkcmw.text: I got surprised with lunch from my boo at Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill when I was just here for my birthday.  The service was phenomenal.  We ate at the bar and had such a lovely time chatting with the bartender.  She was great with my man's allergy concerns and was very honest about helping us pick the best things to eat.  I had the lobster mac n cheese and split pea soup.  SOOOOO Good.  We got surprised with the spotted dick --insert juvenile joke here-- for dessert.  The warm bread pudding with ice cream was to die for.  Honestly, who needed lunch food.  Just get this!    It is pricey.  But honestly, EVERYTHING nice in Vegas is pricey now.  Not to mention, food like this is starting to look cheap in comparison to the price of 2 drinks at a club.  $40-$60 for 2 drinks?! Seriously people!?!?! WTF!  --endrantonsoaringvegasdrinkprices--

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Birthday spotted dick. Thank you Christina!!!
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster mac

j6WJGdybqdM8vmrEr95mRw.text: My husband had The fish and chips and I had the short ribs. Perfection!  Our server Rodney made the experience that much better.  Truly lived up to the Ramsey name.  Highly recommended!

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States

cCT1JTViZ0VJpf33zEEL0Q.text: Came here because we're huge Gordon Ramsey fans! This place did not disappoint. Truffle chips were off the charts! Would recommend this place to friends who are into great food. Christopher was the best and his beer recommendations were spot on!
