Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States

t-sD-sxxUME48a32aUitCg.text: Started with a potato chip natchos. Overal novel..but the beef brisket was supper fatty. And super greezy.  I had the steak pie and it was both salty and chewy. Thanks to a really great server he rushed out a chicken pot pie to substitute out. This was Bland, tasted like a marie calandar microwave special.  My good friend who dinned with me had a simple burger. Looked good but he tells me it was just plain. And generally disapointing.  For a Gordon Ramses restaurant i have to say. It was really a poor place to eat. I think Mr. Ramses needs to rethink his menu...  Overall service 5 of 5 stars.. For food... Its a big zero.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Steak pie. Cheap tasting salty meat bellow them potatos
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The truffle fries here had no truffle oil.. Looks nice but wendys makes a burger that looks like this also.
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Nice looking pot pie.. Not so tasty

0tfwixpo3JdbMb7PdDN61g.text: The food was poor. The curry was bland. The calamari was super salty. The service was slow and they didn't refill water. I won't come back here

Yn-oMznMvZbXBSpt-GVpoA.text: Great pub food and atmosphere- we went to watch the game(s) and had a really good lunch - shared some British traditional dishes.  Server Heather was awesome and so was the Sticky Toffee pudding!

_DcyAhzfsV1n_XlVCOxU2w.text: The nachos are the BEST nachos I have ever had. Fell in love with the meat,  secret cheese sauce & homemade kettle fries. Service was great- loved the uniforms that the staff wears by the way- very steam punk.   Secretly, I am happy that there is not a restaurant near me or I would have to have those nachos once a week!!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The best nachos!!!!

Cs1UO5UcJWieuOav8p0xUA.text: They have a wonderful deal on the menu where you can choose three items for $15 it is known as the "Pub Bites".  I went with that option and loved the choices that I got. It is an even mixture of pub and grill food which is fantastic. and especially in the items where you can get three items for the certain amount- the same goes.  I had a delicious "White Cheddar Garlic Mac and Cheese (Mini Mac)" and for people who don't like garlic I wouldn't recommend this but I love Mac and Cheese and garlic so this was great for me because the taste of garlic is definitely noticeable in this dish. This was more of a pub type item with a hint of grill with the added grace ad class of white cheddar and garlic. If it would have only been Mac and cheese this would have been a complete pub food item.  One of the other items I had was "Smoked Salmon Toast" which was my favourite of the tree items. However, I like toast to be medium toasty not completely toasty so this was extremely crunchy and even hurt the roof of my mouth a touch but was my favourite. However, this is a typical dish so it is hard to go wrong with.  I also had the "White Bean Hummus"which I wanted because the other options such as beer nuts or house marinated olives did not sound appetizing to me. You may not think that white bean hummus would taste different than a regular hummus made from chickpeas... but it does and its great.  Out of the three items I would want the Smoked Salmon again with the toast less toasty :)

OpIACWPSD1uG8RuxfiVeng.text: Okay Ramsay!  Now this is how you restaurant in vegas.  First, our server Stacey was no short of amazing. Juggling multiple tables and worries and still didn't rush or forget us. Now the drinks? Whoa!! Had the cocktail with the blueberries and I got drunk off of just one. Whoever made the drinks has a strong pouring arm and I'm not mad at it. The food? Everything came out very quickly. The wings were great, an the lobster roll was delicious  with buttery, grilled brioche bun. The macaroni and cheese was the only thing that was just so-so. And it was still pretty good. I was expected it to be baked but it was noodles just tossed in cheese sauce. All that aside, I will gladly come back. Maybe even later tonight

aWG1KGr49wNr5lKSRMU8ww.text: The food was flavorful.  We had the nachos, the fish and chips, the shepherd's pie, a salad, and the butter chicken.  Also the sticky toffee pudding was good.  I've been to every pub style restaurant in Las Vegas, and this was at least as good if not better than all of them.  I love British food, having lived in England for some years, and was looking forward to having a British experience.  My husband has lived in Canada and was looking forward to authentic fish and chips.  The wait staff were efficient.  They did their jobs well, and the service was prompt.    We had looked up the menu online before arriving, but when we arrived, the menu seemed to be pared down from what we were expecting.  That was a slight disappointment.  Even though the quality was good, it wasn't on par with the cost of the meal.  We had heard this so we were expecting it, and we thought it might be worth it if it truly reminds us of London.  While I'm not sorry that we went, we won't be back.  I don't think it's the type of place that relies on repeat business.  One more comment about the wait staff:  My husband and I always tip 20%.  We feel that if you can't afford to tip, don't eat out.  If something is wrong, a comment to the manager or on Yelp is far more effective than stiffing a wait person.  Our waiter made a comment about money.  It was a deliberate reminder to tip, and it was crass.  I'm sorry if the waiter gets stiffed sometimes and feels it necessary to drop hints about tipping, but it's not my problem.  This is a common practice on the strip, and it's one of the reasons I rarely like to go there.

LhYd80vvtPHmiu0KaNECFQ.text: Short rib and chedder mashed potatoes dish hit the spot! Great service -shoutout to Rodney.

-diPoNFjys81EiLCfSlGBg.text: Eaten at a lot of Vegas places, including Ramsay's burger joint, a bunch of wolfgang pucks and batali/bastianich places.  This is another overpriced celebrity chef restaurant that hasn't received enough love and attention from it's celebrity chef.  The decor tries to be an english pub, but ends up with a lot of low arm chairs that make eating uncomfortable.  Really it's an American interpretation of a UK pub and is hardly authentic despite the authentic name.  The food was boring and underwhelming, certainly not inedible but disappointing for the price, and doubly disappointing given the name.  I've had plenty of better meals in real English pubs for far less.  Of course it beats the batali/bastianich joints, but that's not saying much.

XpAh13uuxJk11xgI7df6UQ.text: Food was outstanding! Service was great! The atmosphere is fun and inviting.  Food is a bit pricey but worth the price.  I was surprised about the 3 stars. My girlfriends and I ordered the NY strip steak and beef tenderloin (definitely worth the splurge) with sides of mashed potatoes (they were ok) and lobster Mac and cheese(super yummy).  The hostess came around to see how everything was.  The waiter was attentive and the manager Randall came around to introduce himself and to make us feel welcomed.  When he found out it was my birthday he offered dessert on the house. Definitely coming back when we are in Vegas again.

vqBtMPDdRqnqR8UtCxtpsQ.text: Amazing food, service, quality and ambiance.  Lamb burger outrageously good. If you visit Vegas you have to try Gordon Ramsey Pub and Grille at Ceasars Palace, you won't be disappointed!

wn6YjnSQ6KhrW2igM3rHEQ.text: Went in around 4PM on a Thurs. Had a limited menu to pick from since dinner menu starts @5. Staff seemed very friendly. Then I realized my beer was not what I ordered. Next some appetizers did not arrive. Waiter seemed to disappear.  After several apologies, we get our food 45 minutes after sitting down. The food was good, but definitely not great. Also, though I usually prefer smaller portions, these portions we really small. Not good value.  Do yourself a favor and go to Mesa Grill instead.

4q3CkflAOleh5cYZPQd6RQ.text: If you're looking for horrible, you can find it here. I suspect that chef Ramsay sold the rights to his name. The food was hideous, the fries were reheated and probably came in large plastic bags from an industrial operation. The chopped salad was wilted and contained bits of disgusting salami and something that was supposed to be shrimp (???). Everything was greasy. On top of it, the high price didn't match the service or the quality. The waiter spilled a drink over an iPhone. Just a horrible experience overall.

x0Mc4LWu1Jj0negndpfRhg.text: I have no idea how this place is only rated 3 out of 5 stars.  This place is amazing!!!  Although it was a while back when I went (Summer 2013), it was the best food I ever had in my life.  The braised beef or whatever I had was AMAZING.  I don't know if it was because of here, but I was on the toilet for the next 24 hours, but it was all worth it.  No joke it was amazing.  My friends salad may not have been the greatest, but the 3 course meal that I got was absolutely perfect.  Not to mention the waiter we had was a really nice guy.  He heard me and my friend were from Hawaii and how big of a fan I was of Gordan Ramsey, he hooked us up with a couple of cups, matches, and I even took the napkins cuz it was all Gordan Ramsey labeled.  This place was by far the greatest restaurant I've been too and I can't understand how it's not rated anything less than a perfect 5.  From the appetizer, meal, and desert...  It was to die for.  I can't wait to go back to Vegas and eat here again.  Better yet, open up in Hawaii please!!!

NQyrjuieyKJ6E3kHarFFEg.text: I am a huge fan of Gordon Ramsey. I have to say this was a very disappointing experience. Food was mediocre. Service was not great.  Not at all what I would expect from Gordon. One word to sum it up would be OVERRATED!!!

vfcymF_7PeaPGoybFAjcaw.text: As a huge fan of Hell's Kitchen and Master Chef, I was very excited to be able to eat at Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill at Caesar's Palace in Las Vegas. Unfortunately, it was one of the worst restaurant meals we have ever eaten. I'm sure that Chef Ramsay would have asked the chef "what the hell is this s**t" and then told him/her to "f**k off". Soup looked and tasted like dish water...signature fish and chips was obviously frozen with a strange texture and both the fish and chips too greasy to eat with grease puddled in the bottom...had a better wedge salad at chain restaurants. We almost left before being waited on because we waited 15 minutes before anyone came to our table.  I wish we had left.  Choosing this restaurant was a very expensive mistake.

sbknXzBN2wAfWtkEP1VswQ.text: Sticky toffee pudding is a must have...i had brisket sandwich with fries...perfectly executed...husband said the fish and chips were awesome...definitely worth every penny :)

G1TVYJpLvn2Uo9sebBZIEg.text: Nice,  food was good but not amazing.  Atmosphere was great and service was average.  Yelp map was wrong on location.

8TQnYzuBjwZ9ejUwR_-SJQ.text: After a series of meals designed to appeal to the lowest common denominator palette, I was glad to have some flavor-packed comfort food.  At the Pub, we were greeted with warm, soft pretzels acompanied by whipped butter and cheddar spreads. Beef cheeks were tender and tasty. I normally dislike cooked carrots, but these were prepared well and maintained their snappiness. Shepherd's pie was the standout with shredded, braised lamb rather than the usual ground preparation.   After watching Gordon's "Nightmare" shows, it was good to hear he practices what he preaches - each staff member has tasted the dishes they serve, and could describe them well. Our server was also knowledgeable about the Belgian and UK beers.   I was even glad to hear disagreement on favorites - it was good confirmation they were sharing their opinion rather than promoting a certain "chef signature item." To this end, we decided to complete our meal with a blueberry cobbler topped with peanut butter crumble and peanut butter creme fraiche instead of the more traditional sticky toffee pudding.  We'll be back.

LBZDUSOig7VQV4mv3RFF-Q.text: Disappointing considering this guy yells at people for sub par food!  We honestly just stopped for drinks and figured this was a safe bet-place looked cool and there were empty spots in front, perfect for people watching.  I ordered a grey hound and my friend ordered a mojito.  While waiting we realized we could have taken advantage of the happy hour menu which was never mentioned by our server.  (Would have been nice to know.)  After waiting much too long our drinks arrived but we were certain the mojito was wrong-it was in a clear glass, no fresh mint to speak of.  My friend had a sip and she said it tasted like the pre-mixed drinks you can buy in the grocery store in a can.  That is where I suspected my greyhound came from as well judging by the taste-it was horrible.  But if you are going to charge $14 (?) for a mojito at least fake it by throwing in a spring of fresh mint...but mAybe that was too much work.  So, we ordered from the happy hour menu next thinking this was clearly not a mixed drink place-we should have paid attention to the keg-decor and impressive beer offering.  I happen to love IPAs and was excited to see Dog Fish Head on tap...but no...it was out.  It was only 4:00 or so!!  Okay, so I ordered  Stone IPA, also. Rey nice.  Strike two... "Sorry-we are also out of that."  So the only other IPA was Lagunitas which I like.  At $5 (happy hour) it was a deal including the $5 nachos-over the top fattening but good.  I can't believe a restaurant of this caliber had the audacity to serve those so called cocktails we started with-they should be ashamed of themselves!

XJG6UOGCN2v3MCYfwcHFGQ.text: My husband and I were in Las Vegas for a work-cation in the beginning of June. and we went to all three Ramsay's restaurants.  I'd say we are both "amateur" foodies, but we will go out of our way for good food, never fast food.    The food was great, and a vey ample selection of beer, wine and drinks to choose from- that thankfully they condensed by using an iPad- making it much easier to navigate than a bulky menu.  We shared the duck confit, my husband ordered the beef short rib and cheek sandwich, and I had the fish and chips.  The duck was so tender and sweet, no gamey after taste at all.  My husbands sandwich looked beautiful and the small piece he shared with me tasted wonderful, my fish was amazing.  It was so light and wasn't greasy.  (A silly side note... the ketchup is AMAZING- and I normally hate ketchup)  I've seen other reviews saying it's expensive or that they had long wait times or that portion sizes aren't huge....  my husband is a decent sized guy, 6'5" and a good 250 lbs and his meal was enough to satisfy.  I am much smaller and almost never can finish my plate, but I could finished this one and we both had room for the BEST dessert ever.... the Sticky Toffee Pudding is definitely a recommendation.    I, personally, appreciated that it wasn't an over sized portion.  Mainly because I hate not finishing my plate and not having any place to store leftovers (our room didn't have a fridge).    The price was on par with all things Vegas in my opinion (at least on the strip).  For the food, the experience and the atmosphere are worth it.

dZm1vmR8r4k-53vlusnpnA.text: We had a reservation for 7:30 but when we arrived a half hour early, we were seated promptly. The service was very good, and the atmosphere was lively. The seating was also really comfortable, which seemed like a bit of a commodity on the Strip. We shared the truffle chips as a starter. It was a smaller portion than what you get at BurGR, but they were just as good. I had the beer-braised short rib served over risotto ($38) and it was amazing. It was very tender and the risotto was cooked perfectly. I was disappointed that I couldn't finish the whole thing. The meal was a little expensive, but basically everything in this area is marked up a bit, especially places with a celebrity chef name.

SfAC2PJbep9ZLQO9XTGn5g.text: Hostess didnt take our name just said come back in 45min because we didn't bring our phone. Came back she forgot said it would be 25 min and we said it was her that didnt take our name and funny enough we got a table immediately. ..Server was rude..got our onion soup before drinks..Soup was lacking any real flavour. Ordered the chicken breast with peas and onions and salami or duck? Something was substituted as we asked about what appeared to be bacon. .Flat iron steak had little flavour the side mustard was good and breadsticks good. Sticky toffee well I've had a lot better for way cheaper.. oh ya .funny enough my food was served on cold plates..practice what you preach.

i6NdnElWH-S6IpZ-_62Uww.text: A group of friends and I went out to eat here because it was right in our hotel. There was no wait and our waitress was nice and attentive. For a starter we split a bottle of wine and the meat and cheese plate. The various cheeses and meats were fresh. I ordered the beer braised short ribs, which was served over creamy barley risotto surrounded with pearl onions and root vegetables. The short ribs were cooked to perfection and was nicely complimented with the other parts of the dish. I tried one of the diver scallops off of my friends plate and it was also cooked to perfection. I also got to try a piece of lamb from the shepherd's pie and it was delicious.     My only complaint of this restaurant is that I left hungry. Normally, I take food home because I cannot eat all of it or I eat just enough to be almost full, however, not the case here as after eating at Gordon Ramsay's the group headed out to Serendipity 3 for ice cream as we still had plenty of room in our bellies.

iLqq2rAJPabnmwh-llVeng.text: I was just there the other night at let me tell you I had the best time! The service was outstanding, the food incredible, and the atmosphere was great. The Manager even came to our table to chat with us, his Name was Louie. What a great guy, really made the night!

tf-wUTCwt3MVGr-nukOGZg.text: The experience in this place was excellent .. Service was on point but food was beyond !! We order the calamari and appetizers  pretzels they were yummy , also we order lamb burger one of the best a ever had , and fish and chips were delicious

SwxAoUjevBJkO0Hj6w__-g.text: Food is good but not great for the price. Excellent ambience and service.  the fish and chips were overpriced and tasted only so-so.  waitress said they were top seller and I guess it because people think it would be like eating in England, but not even close to the real thing!

khkm7ow_SMyPt8Pt_H4d4A.text: Great experience! We had the filet mignon, wine and the sticky toffee pudding! Loved our waitress Lisa from North Dakota! She was so good that she made the entire evening a super enjoyable experience! The wine was great and was a great price point. I would eat there again in a heartbeat.

gZJLdaTp3NijsY1Zp0rt8Q.text: Sat at the bar (you can skip the line if there are seats at the bar) and was served by Ronnie and Warner. Great guys. Amazing food.

C_m1tHRvHqOU-k1kTjDIuQ.text: Nong and Christian at the bar Rock!! Sticky toffee pudding is to die for!! Dinner options are great as well

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States

netZCLd1wYzLZI5fxzH7OQ.text: The food was incredibly good and the service incredibly bad. Part of the problem might have been our table placement which was at the back near the kitchen doors. Our waitress served tables around us but also a private room near us. We were able to order a drink, our appetizers and main course. Then after ordering the private room filled up and our waitress became a ghost. We finished the first drink after the appetizer and were never able to order another drink. About 40 minutes after finishing the main course, the waitress walked by dropped the desert menus down and kept walking. After waiting another 30 to 45 minutes (she never came back) I asked someone else if they could get our bill. For 3 people it was over $300, for one drink, no deserts and it took 2 and half hours. This was the worst service I have ever received.

bDB-5bpP5kZyKSTWK35mVg.text: My mom and I were on a girl's getaway and came to eat here for our last meal before heading to the airport.   The food was just what we needed! We got the Crispy Pork Belly app, English Ale and Onion soup, Fish and Chips and topped it off with the (free if you check-in) Sticky Toffee Pudding. Kudos to the chefs!  But really what made our meal was the service, starting with our hostess who seated us, all the servers who brought our food to us, and Rodney, our main server. Everyone was attentive, gave great recommendations, offered a brief description of what we were about to eat, and were personable and kind.   If you're looking for a casual spot with some tasty food and exceptional service-try out this spot when you're in town!

mleaANK1KkhfcFlQdhbpCg.text: Review for the bar only.   Came here to have a couple of bloody Mary's at the bar before stuffing our faces at the Bechanal buffet. The bloody Mary's are made with belvedere and they're pretty big.   $15 a piece, and very appealing. Comes with celery, a dill pickle sphere, olives, peppers, and salame all in a hurricane glass. I ordered mine spicy and boy was it spicy. So go mild even if you like chile. I didn't like that the consistency of it was very thick. They need to go heavier on the lime juice and vodka and easier on the tomato juice.   All in all the ambiance was very chill, bartenders were friendly, drinks were okay.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fun unique interior
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Close up
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Funky bloody Mary&#39;s $15

SC7c4CtYevhd_i_ov3xLiA.text: Really loved this place! The quality of their meat is top notch! I would highly recommend the braised short rib

k2yKEUmaXJYIiNOi6pfaKw.text: #FirstTime here! Short rib was so tender I didn't even have to use a knife. Got the sticky toffee for dessert and it made my night. Kieth and Nong really took care of me at the bar. Couldn't have asked for better service.  The atmosphere felt like home. Everyone was genuine and was really friendly. Drinking, eating and talking rugby with Kieth got my trip started off PROPer! #Rugby #RugbyBrotherhood #InstantBond #RugbyLyfe

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Short rib on point!

kUI3jFvxrDTEuv6X2cuD_w.text: So we were at Cesar's for a business conference and my wife decided we'd try this spot for some dinner. The wait was roughly 30 Minutes, not too bad late in Vegas). We both started with Their version of French onion soup, we were starving and it was a good start. I had the braised short rib, very tender and decent, I did have to add a little more seasoning as I'm assuming salt is a lost commodity in Vegas, joking, but a little salt and pepper made it pop. The portion was the perfect amount. The server was great and attentive. The food came out quickly, a little costly but it's expected for a decent restaurant in an expensive quality Hotel.

MBWSoSzXT3CoGPlXZFezxA.text: We stopped by one night after work and were surprised how busy the restaurant was on a weeknight. I would definitely recommend a reservation. The restaurant is definitely one of the more fun ones I've been too. Its designed to look like an eclectic British bar and yet it is somehow still very upscale. It's a bit on the noisy side, but that just adds to the fun atmosphere. Our server was extremely friendly, as was the manager who was circulating to various tables and chatting with guests. My boyfriend and I split the nachos and then I had an onion soup and he had the prime rib. The food was not as great as I would expect from Gordon Ramsey himself but as with most things in Vegas, the expectation and the reality don't always line up. Overall, the food was still an 8/10. The restaurant pretty pricey by normal standards, but by Strip standards, it isn't bad. While we won't be dining here regularly, we definitely wouldn't be opposed to coming back here if we were in the neighborhood, so to speak.

q5Dj9sC8NaTAZY2MxnP-_g.text: The kettle chip nachos are worth the hype. The shredded beef and the sweet peppers on top are divine.  I will say I ordered the $15 "most ordered drink on the menu" & it fell flat. It was OK, but I spit out the sad, quick thawed blackberry that was sadly skewered on a stick as a garnish.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Kettle chip nachos. There&#39;s beef under there...

UpF91M-Amfea8jpHoXWH4Q.text: Went to check it out because Burger is one of our favorite places to go in Vegas. Not impressed at all by the Hanger Steak. First of all I requested medium well, and to me and the waitress it was medium.  Sent it back, and the ends were more cooked, but it was still medium, to me. The sides were good, but not fabulous. We did order dessert and really enjoyed it. For me, not worth the price sadly.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spotted Dick
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States

RBkI7uIX67RZ8cdE1_r4IA.text: When my husband & I approached the hostess podium to be seated, the 2 hostesses didn't even greet us & looked at us like we were trash. We had to ask to be seated. Our waitress was very friendly & offered very good service. The food is expensive but average tasting you are afterall just paying for the name because we all know Ramsey isnt in the back cooking it. I would go back if the hostesses hadn't been so nasty & snooty.

Bf3am6Y4UlkoS_e5mlyT5g.text: I have three words for you: sticky. toffee. pudding.  Each of Gordon Ramsay's Las Vegas restaurants has a different take on this classic English dessert, but Pub & Grill has the BEST take on it.  Each sticky toffee pudding here comes out perfectly warm with a scoop of vanilla ice cream and sticky toffee syrup on the side. Drizzle the syrup over the pudding to let it soak in. Take a spoonful of pudding and ice cream. Admire its glory. Devour. Repeat. Cry when there's no more.  I seriously dream about this stuff. It's that good. If you're into beer, pair this dessert with an Innis & Gunn (also Gordon's favorite!) and you'll be set for the night.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sticky toffee pudding with an Innis and Gunn

WjbD0B-NXDe5abP1rngOgg.text: It is loud. There is funky green peas on or with basically everything on the menu. Personally, not a fan of the whole vibe and didn't think the food was very creative. Just basic overpriced burgers. I had this shepherds pie thing which was just a pie with lentils inside. It was super dry. The salad was a small kale salad with a few shreds of carrots on top. Beer options for a "pub" were minimal. It is a shame, considering I am a GR fan and I love the Caesars property.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States

hT76D000iO7e1o89mY5mfQ.text: If you pass this place up your missing a great meal! I eat here every time I'm in Las Vegas. Hell's Kitchen burger is great  My boy is 12 he loves the sticky toffee pudding and will not share lol So I get my own ! YUM

rcam2GY64u-X_wJIgNWOOw.text: Went again last night.  Was unable to get prime rib at 12pm.  Ordered fish and chips which were cold. Fish was ok but a little greasy. Mini Mac appetizer was good and so was dessert. But overall after spending $150 for two people I left disappointed.

Mio57du0iNPTI0IE4YyWDQ.text: Made a reservation arrived early and they got us seated promptly. Our waitress, Stacy, was very friendly and went above and beyond to get my husband a BLT sandwich which is not on the menu but is one of GR specialties ! We ordered lobster rolls for appetizer the roll was soft and the lobster cold, they were  really good. For our entree, there were three of us, we had, Cobb salad which looked ok, I had steak and ale pot pie yummy!! And my hubby had the BLT!! If you check in with yelp you get rewarded with a toffee sticky pudding which is like a cake that melts in your mouth!!! They do have a Happy Hour at Vegas prices, lol! Food, Service, and atmosphere very good!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States

3_hormPuS2iefCFKgh3F0Q.text: We had a great meal here the other night. We opted for the casual route and sat in the bar area. Excellent wait staff and excellent customer service. My wife and I shared the hamburger, which was very good. For three dollars extra we upgraded to the truffle fries. I was surprised that they actually used real truffle on top. My only disappointment was heavy grease at the bottom of the fry holder, the oils below had a funky burnt taste. I don't eat a lot of truffles however, so maybe this is normal? For a Vegas restaurant in a major hotel, we found the prices to be very reasonable. The onion and ale soup was also fantastic! We ate around 6:30 PM and got in with no trouble (on a Sunday night).  Mariah Carey was also performing that evening, so we were surprised to get in that easy as this restaurant is directly across from the theater.

TyzQ8ellC6aMCbJzPbdx-g.text: Bring Back the Bangers and Mash.  Love going here when I visit Vegas.  I have always loved their bangers and mash and can't believe it's been removed from the menu.   I'm not the only one, I overheard the person next to me asking the waiter "where's the bangers and mash."    Great restaurant.... excellent service.  Innis and Gunn on tap.... Gordon Ramsay's favorite beer I understand.   Too it all off with Sticky Pudding.

xsoAUHMq9kx5airMWUZYjw.text: The service was great; first ordered the lobster Mac n cheese n it tasted like from a box from the Mac to the cheese; ended up sending it back which I never do ; replaces it with lobster brioche which was good but the size of half ur  hand each; prices r a bit higher than regular; then ordered the prime rib which was tough in the center and I didn't finish it but it was a big portion; slaw n cream spinach was excellent but won't be going back sorry

x9LqLYl2eUkytCWaLCfM5Q.text: I would have to agree that the best word to describe our experience was "underwhelmed".  Absolutely love the decor, ambiance, staff uniforms, flatware, dishware, etc.  Aesthetically it delivered, especially if you're looking for that "adult theme park" feel from Vegas.  Our server Scott was very knowledgeable and professional.  He did point out some menu errors prior to us ordering.  He did a great job considering that his section was full and he was managing relocating a large party due to a leak in the ceiling (it was raining and we know from first hand experience that these things happen...absolutely no big deal at all$ and he was so pro in managing his guests.  Kudos to Scott and staff.  Drinks were good and timely but our food took a loooooong time....especially for lunch.  A party of seven with two rounds of drinks, soup for two as a first course and salad and sandwiches for entrees took over two hours before we left. The menu selections really were well written and tempting but the actual food just lacked magic, flair and spark.  I will say that if I was able to eat red meat I would have sprung for the burger as those bad boys certainly looked good.  I ordered the chopped salad without salami.  It comes with pretzel croutons and they were not what I expected--stale, small and flavorless.  Dressing was good and the dish was well balanced, but just fell a little short compared the environs of the restaurant.  I'm not going to let this impact my opinion and image of Chef Ramsay as I know this is a watered down corporate version of his award winning creations.  No Michelin star here.  Just some Vegas grub.  Bon ape tit.

4RMcoHeLJPdUyjWWQl4rcQ.text: I love British food and have been looking forward to eating here for some time. We arrived at 4pm on a Saturday. The place is about a third full. Sat at a table in the bar for 10 minutes with the wait staff ignoring us. Finally flagged someone down to be told I can't sit there because it's not part of the bar. The bar starts 3 feet from the table. Went to the front to be told I would  have to wait 10 minutes for that table because its not wiped down. Finally took a table in the dining room only to wait another 5 minutes for the iPad so we can order drinks. The service is so poor, I don't really care how good the food is. I'm only staying because my wife wants to try it. I won't be back.

pLcbbuRlSNlKpgnzeoUEAg.text: We went there expecting alot more then we received with regards to the food and service. The waiter and other staff were not very friendly almost as if it was a choir to be there..Seemed it took a long tie for the food to come out. The appetizer was very good we had the sliders but the entire for a lack of better words sucked.  we had the Fish and chips after taken a few bites it was clear the fish had not been cooked completely (translucent) so we had to send it back and wait another 10 minutes. The manager came over and bought a round of drinks for us while we waited for the second delivery. Although it was cooked correctly the taste was bland and uneventful.  bottom line i wouldn't waste your money . Go to the burgr place its 10 times better food and staff. To be brutally honest for a few more dollars the steak place is fantastic.

qOPQP0IvUU4OSFw0rD2Mgg.text: We waited a bit for our table, but we showed up 12 strong with only an hours notice,  and they threw six apps at us to make up for the wait.  Bangers and mash turned out great and nobody walked away hungry.  Great bourbons (nothing really rare, just a a bunch of good ones) and good craft/import beer selection.

hVysz1vuPGKQH92BAKHR6g.text: This has to be the biggest culinary disappointment I have yet to experience.   For drinks, we ordered the Mothers Ruin and the Ramsay tonic.  Both were unpalatable and likely among the worst cocktails I have experienced.  Price: $15 for each drink.  Our waiter seemed like he didn't want to be there and we were ignored pretty much most of the time.  Although he did sport a well groomed goatee, he seemed a bit unkempt.  In our group, we ordered the Summer vegetable salad, Shepherds pie, Pub Burger, and  Short-rib & cheek sandwich.  All of the food lacked taste and no one in our group liked anything.  The only flavor came from the Horseradish in the Ketchup, but we had to apply them to soggy, mushy  fries.  For a restaurant whose namesake is a person that judges the quality of other peoples food, I expected so much better.  Looking back, I regret that I spent some of my vacation time and money at the Gordon Ramsey Pub and Grill when I could have spent the same amount on Helicopter rides.  My advice, plenty of good restaurants in Vegas. Your money can be better spent elsewhere.

GYjx_otX1LzS_uyisq7ynQ.text: Our first meal on our last trip to Vegas.  It is exactly what Ramsey wanted - pub food taken to the next level.  Great staff and good atmosphere but it does lose a point for being a bit pricy.  Over $50 per person including a drink each is a bit expensive for what it is.  I'm giving it 4 stars but I can see how people gave it a 3 star rating.  Let's call it 3.5 stars.

hQHXprZWDhYL3KX4ZUT8Rw.text: Fun, fun, fun place.  Love the vibe, the decor, hip-Brit fashions of the staff, and the modern pub food.  We enjoyed the Deviled Eggs and Gordon's secret nachos with kettle chips, corned beef and English cheddar.  Paired with a Boddingtons and I was happy happy happy.

DcvMZYd3E5r_eveV5rwl5Q.text: We made a last minute reservation and we are so glad we did. The food was amazing. Best Rack of Lamb and Prime Rib. Truffle fries were delicious and the Sticky Toffee Pudding is to die for.  Good atmosphere and Tayler F took wonderful care of us. He even talked chef Scott into visiting our table. Best meal and experience we've had in Vegas. This should be on every 'not to be missed ' restaurant in Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States

vDeMPfLYHDSHY-qes-7XvA.text: We had excellent bangers&mash! Surely we'll come back!

JGkXFixkQPYYMnastsf1ZA.text: We tried all of Gordon Ramsay's restaurants on our recent trip to Vegas.  The pub & grill comes in second.  The food was good, I had the Fish & Chips and my travel companion had the burger.  She enjoyed the burger here, at the pub & grill more than she did at Burgr.  I mentioned that it was my daughter's birthday when I made my reservation and hoped to get a fairly decent table, but we were put in a little awkward table when there were clearly other tables available.  Highly recommend the sticky toffee pudding.

dGqldECdAYWkDkvnNYUUAQ.text: One of my favorite places in vegas to eat. We have been here twice for lunch. First time was Christmas 2012. For appetizer we had the fantastic Duck Confit Poutine. it was so good all the way to bottom where there is more confit.. My daughter had the mac and cheese and son in law the fish and chips which the catsup was awesome homemade. I had the irish beef cheek stew which  I could eat 5 times a week and still crave it. it is so wonderful.  Service is good

K-whYOQQYjADdvJgakODjg.text: Food was 4 stars, service a paltry 1 star. I ate lightly, just a bowl of English Onion soup which was fantastic and a side of the mac & cheese which was above average, but not the best I've ever had. Main problem was the service. Even though we had 3 different servers waiting on us, they were all incompetent. Splitting a bill 3 ways shouldn't take 30 minutes which it took for them because they kept screwing it up. Improve the service and you might be looking at a 4 star restaurant.

g6ZqsZ-_JqG-NUxos8ZSTQ.text: Gordon Ramsay Pub and Grill was so great! We were greeted with great big smiles from the hostesses in the front, we had great service from the waiters. We came on Friday night and the place was booming and our food came out very quickly. We were so surprised we didn't have to wait. As a huge fan of master chef and kitchen nightmares and all of Gordon's shows I had to go to a Gordon Ramsay resturaunt to celebrate my 30th Birthday. I was not at all disappointed with anything, everything was perfect!!!

WYRdmhmKgtxsAuowdr5pxA.text: I had the pesto chicken sandwich and it was absolutely amazed by. The chicken was so tender and moist, sorry I know a lot of people don't like that word but it really fit this situation. The atmosphere was really fun with games to play while you wait. Would totally go back if given the chance, and the price was really not bad considering Vegas.

YgOSFfd_evUIrD5JF-5bvw.text: The pub is a fun, relaxed environment.  Our waitress gave great service.  The lollipop chicken wings are so good.  Also tried the mussels and fish and chips, which are great too.

5bKi97vJO4FaH5-RPm43VQ.text: We are big Gordon Ramsay fans, so I expected great things.  Unfortunately, we were disappointed.   The decor was nice, but the food was cold, uninspired, and bland.   But it did have the advantage of being overpriced (sarcasm here).   Don't waste your time or money.

xhd8EZIh6zJXFDaoyVNGsA.text: Spotted dog hands down an amazing dessert. It's organismic good. Entree of choice is shepard's pie, totally delicious!

rz7Zd11nRwtCeUtRVlIUnw.text: The burger I had at the food court the day earlier tasted better and a third of the price. Way overpriced. They charged $5 for a soda.

YtUbTHLamG5GwH77OY8ZCA.text: Get the lamb burger!  It's so juicy and flavorful and yummmm.  I wish every burger place in the world has something like it.  The fries were decent and the gourmet ketchup served along with it was pretty tasty.  They also had $1 mimosa refills when I came here.  Great service.  I would definitely come again.

IZngExQkqQXTzya0p2ZwLA.text: Service was incredibly slow. All 4 people at the table complained their food was bland,tasteless,overpriced and just"meh." The pretzels were decent. I'll give him that. For someone that prides himself on helping others to cook and be the best. Maybe it's time he make a visit to his own restaurant.

ZxEvVRbOltIF0fua5SQssg.text: I love his show so I was very excited to try his restaurant. What a huge let down. The service was horrid, the music so loud it was hard to carry on a conversation and the food bland at best. If you are looking for boring and flavorless food that the English are known for this is the place for you.

VtP5LdLbDOt7hPa-nstkzg.text: The food was great.  I had the mushroom w/ egg over top and loved it - AMAZING!  The only issue was that my credit card was run 7 times when I went to pay.  First, they credited the meal back to me, then they charged me $36.81 for the meal (which was the correct amount), then they continued to charge me - $190.85, then $92.42 four separate times.  So I walked away from dinner with $560.53 extra charges on my credit card and they said they can't account for them.  Called them "ghost charges".  So now I'm left to deal with it with my credit card company.  Awesome!

P5S7UzG40p7rvbQiPCtweQ.text: I have been here twice now! Once at lunch with my husband and kids and another time for dinner for my husband's birthday with our friends! They were very accommodating and were able to seat all 9 of us together. Our reservations kept changing because we were coming from a tournament, but the staff was very understanding and helpful! The food was so good and you really can't go wrong! The drink menu had a lot of variety. I'm usually a beer drinker, but I wanted to try something different this time. The Salted Caramel Apple Martini was my favorite!

90L1w7tyyi4wrZVHHmzAGA.text: We opted to go here for a family birthday dinner. The service was extraordinary -- from the time we made the reservations with the hotel concierge. Kimberly and Lisa Marie took great care of us and accommodated all of our special requests. We loved our meal. Burgers were fabulous-- very special ketchup. And my salad with chicken was awesome. Great beer list, too! We love Innis & Gunn. From jaynefurman.com "It was beyond sensational." The drink menu is extensive and they bring it to you on an ipad. Three kinds of pretzel rolls accompanied by an amazing flavored butter and an extraordinary cheese sauce. The burger was flavorful and cooked as ordered, which is phenomenal for any restaurant. Our group is finicky, so kudos to our superb server, Kimberly, who must have a photographic memory. The server/runner Lisa Marie was incredibly helpful and sweet. When we left, we felt we had two new friends! Gordon Ramsay's homemade ketchup (and we're not even ketchup fans) is not to be missed. Michael loves the sticky toffee pudding here. The mac and cheese was over the top fabulous -- duck fat croutons, truffles and three cheeses. Burger with applewood smoked bacon and cheese was awesome. Photos to follow soon

H6D-r9IJIEA76Fm7Xg9Mmw.text: After visiting this weekend the wife and I decided to check it out. Based on all the hype from hells kitchen we had expectations that this was a quality place. It was a disapointment Was not to the standards that Gordan Ramsey would have.  Service: Horrible, after being seated it took long time before our drink orders were taken. Ordering water was a choir and we didnt even get it the way we asked which was how the waiter offered it. The bus or water people had this pissed off look like they did not want to be there. I ordered a bottle beer and it took half an hour before i got it Mind you it was not that busy It looked disorganized and it seemed like the staff really didnt care about any of the customers Even the manager seemed like he avoided everyone. There are 2 menus pub and grill, the server didnt bother explain it I only asked becuase I saw someone else with it. After ordering food that took an hour and they seemed to confuse which tables. No apologies about the delays. We werent asked for desert, refills or if we wanted more from the menu. terrrible service. While we were there, we saw at least 3 customers complaining to manager about the service. At one point a customer got pissed and walked out. You almost want to warn people not to waste there time there.  Food:  the food was average we had devilish eggs and the pretzels which was good. We ordered the Salmon from the grill menu and the Rib and cheek sandwhich The sandwich was good but nothing wow. The salmon was dry,cold and bland. We ended up sending it back. Of course no apolgies for thr food quality. Not up to par for chef ramsey also for what it was, it was overpriced.   Overall, I wouldnt return unless the overhal the entire place.Too bad becuase it seems like it has potential Maybe chef ramsey should come down and film an episode of Kitchen nightmares to fix it. I would recomend going to other resturants at Ceasers.

gmV6nMdYdLR0IflpF-Xtag.text: OK.  Entree came out before the appetizer.  Not sure if I misread the menu but...but I was very disappointed with the BLT.  The pork belly was good but no bacon?  Really want a BLT that has crispy bacon.  Wouldn't eat here again.  Service...so so compared to what you see on TV.  Disappointing.  Not at all what I expected from Gordon Ramsey.  Live and learn.

Py80BaOKFKAl5Rko7oYg_g.text: So firstly we were excited to go here, but from start to finish this place has problems. We were seated and our first server came, took our drink orders and left. My wife opened her menu to find it torn and dirty. Our second server came and so did our drinks, my Guinness had the biggest head ever, I asked it to be topped off server 2 rolled his eyes but did it. My friend had ordered a glass of sparkling wine, but the one on the menu wasn't right, I mean come on update your menu. As to the menu it's not detailed enough 3 of us ordered "toad in the hole" but although the server questioned the order he didn't explain how much food it was, plus they were supposed to come with HP Sauce but didn't, when we asked for some they said they didn't have any (order hadn't come in). The food is ok, but the service is just so, so. One staff member was standing near us drinking Starbucks (bet Mr Ramsey would have something say about that on his TV Show if it was somebody else's restaurant). In the ladies toilets one was damaged and not in use, in both mens and ladies toilets they had huge wicker baskets to put your paper towels in, they looked stupid and tacky. All in all a bad experience.

q8sB79NxgtrRPxv1EeWNbQ.text: Love this place. The food is delicious, drinks are amazing, and dessert did not disappoint. Ask to sit in Scott's section. He has been my waiter every time I have gone and I have nothing but praise for his wonderful and friendly service.

hzTeNMX5KRYlAaeE4B4WzQ.text: My daughter and I went for dinner 5pm on 5-26-13 memorial weekend. Made reservations. Had a small wait. Think they forgot about us sitting at the bar but after that it was smooth sailing. Our waiter was great. Very attentive and made recommendations. We had corn soup and veggie salad to start and got very full from just that. The salmon was to die for. My daughter loved the fish and chips. Highly recommend the puree potatoes. So good and flavorful! Eventhough we were stuffed we split the signature dessert and very happy we did. All that for about $150. Our food was fantastic as well as our service.  I will come back next time I am in Vegas!

jGR65emerlfBeXujNlg_PA.text: Poor service, bad menu, and worse food. It's no wonder the UK is not known for their food. A disappointing dinner experience. Never again!

mnQ2X9Ivb9EvFO8XCBoI6A.text: First of all, my expectations were obviously way too high.  I was fully expecting to be greeted as a bloody wanker by Gordon or at least an audio recording of him. Anyways, we were promptly seated, thank fucking god, I was starving. We ordered cold beers, and oddly enough we weren't made fun of for not ordering them warm. Whatever. Beer is beer, I don't need to elaborate here, I hope. Apps were good, pretzels with beer cheese, scotch eggs, and lobster rolls. I knew the lobster rolls were fresh because some dumb ass left shell pieces on it, pick that shit out and it's delicious. Moving right along, for entrees, we got the bangers and mash. The bangers were about the size of an average man's penis. While the ladies are laughing and the guys are thinking "wow those must be huge," I'm going to be busy describing the taste. The bangers tasted fucking awesome, unlike the average man's penis (or so I'm told.)  The mash...well it's mashed potatoes. If I have to describe mashed potatoes to you, then you're obviously looking for the wrong restaurant. There's a white castle within walking distance, you neanderthal. Anyways, overall the meal was pretty fucking delicious, price was worth it, too. Basically, just fucking go here, you bloody wanker.

nxiYLb1Lmav0YyMBAddJMw.text: Service was awful, the waiter ignored us most of the time and then gave us the wrong check; which by the way was triple ours.  My scallops were the wors I've ever had, loaded with sand.  Couldn't eat a single one.  The waiter was so nasty that I was afraid to send them back - he was definitely the type that would have spit in my food.  Don't bother with this place.

ByUkvVMHt_B9cgKGpENYdg.text: Was a very disappointing dinner! First of all our server wasn't that great but what  made it a less than average dinner was the New York strip while it was cooked correctly it was way under seasoned and the potatoes where way overcooked. For those kind of prices and knowing that it is Gordon Ramsay I expect a lot more!

RlxEKzPjqLbrcpUvdmKTQQ.text: We almost didn't go here because the reviews said it was hit or miss. My husband and I decided to try it for happy hour. At first, when it took 15 min to get a draft beer and a soft drink, we could understand the reviews. We ordered deviled eggs and devils on horseback. The deviled eggs came out. They were great. Then the manager came out and said they had burned the bacon on the 2nd appetizer. He apologized and gave us 2 little dishes of chicken pot pie. And the devils on horseback came out within 2-3 min later.  Just that little thing with the manager made all the difference. It made us feel better and not just part of the huge vegas crowd.  We definitely will go back for a meal next time we are in vegas !

2_G5Zfc2Sck6Yj6Iq6D22A.text: I wish I could give a more detailed review concerning the food but we couldn't even get pass the bad hostess in the front to get into the place...I'm a local vegas "foodie" and decided to try this place on a Monday night around 630pm figuring it shouldn't be too busy and when my gf and I looked around the restaurant was half empty including the tables in front by the bar...as soon as I asked the hostess if we could sit she said it would be a 45 min wait so when I asked if we could sit at the bar and wait she said that area was reserved also...so I stayed polite and gave her my name and number and sat in front by the slots and watched as she let others in...after twenty minutes of watching this we felt insulted and left the casino and ate at a local Thai place with way better service...and not surprisingly the hostess at Gordon who I gave my number to never called me the whole night...so I'm going to make it a point to not recommend this place to all my local foodie friends and make sure none of Gordon's restaurants get a penny from me ever..thanks Gordon Ramsey for the worst front service I've ever experienced here in vegas!

Zy6gA4m1AE8rCBt712JAig.text: I had high hopes of going here for appetizers and drinks before dinner and was very disappointed.  My brother and I were hungry and decided to give this place a try.  The menu was very limited when it came to vegetarian options for me, but I decided to order the soft pretzels.  My brother asked if the mini burgers or truffle fries were better since he was not very hungry; the server suggested he get both and would not comment further.  I asked what wines they served by the glass and when he mentioned there was a Malbec, I inquired what the price was.  The server quoted $9-11.  I said ok.  Our food arrived and the pretzels were a variety including plain, herbed and bacon/cheddar.  I told the server I was a vegetarian and he looked shocked.  He did replace it with another plain one, but the pretzels were rock hard and I could barely bite into them.  My brother enjoyed his mini pub burgers, but there were items on the burger not listed on the menu.  We were mostly ignored after we made it clear we were only there for appetizers.  We were sitting at a highboy table, with uncomfortable chairs.  I received the bill and was charged $13.50 for my glass of wine.  I didn't even bother to bring it up because I just wanted to get out of there.  I would not go back or recommend it to anyone.

BtJYsXRtaDuiURYdc_I12A.text: This place was a terrible disappointment. My girlfriend and I stopped by on Friday night on our way back to our room for some drinks. We went into a nearly empty bar and sat at a table for two only to be chased away by a waiter who said tables weren't open seating. We should have left right there. Instead, we went and sat at the bar. I ordered a Goodbye Blue Sky and she ordered a Margarita. My drink was bitter and lacking in any other flavor. Hers was served in a small glass that was half filled with ice. There seemed to be very little alcohol in either. For this, we were charged $15 for each glass (one bad drink and one tiny one). I've paid more other places, but gotten more and better and I came away happy. The next night, we stopped by Numb instead. We had drinks that were better tasting, and stronger for less money. Don't go to Gordon Ramsay's!

0xfP7zSAixFdoUdzlaH26w.text: The shepherd pie with potatoes was incredible. The sticky pudding and ice cream heavenly. The chicken pot pie had no flavor essentially but the pastry crust good. It is expensive but in line with Vegas prices.

8JLUx5BTmZePgWb9ypULQA.text: I'm a huge fan of Gordon Ramsay, but his newest head chef (Hell's Kitchen Winner - Ja'Nel Witt) has her work cut out for her. Three of us went during a NOT busy lunch. The service was friendly, but nothing special. The braised cheek sandwich was phenomenal and the clear winner at the table. The fish & chips were tasty, but the mushy peas were under seasoned. The bangers & mash were disappointing b/c the bangers lacked flavor and the mash were under seasoned. However, the biggest disappointment was that after ordering the appetizer (burger sliders w/ an unpopular spread) w/ the mains... THE APPETIZER CAME OUT AFTER THE ENTREES!!! Since we ordered everything at the same time, I can only assume the fault lies in the kitchen and not w/ the server. Even more disappointing is that they CHARGED US for the late appetizer! The server apologized for the inconvenience, but are you kidding me?! Chef Ramsay has higher standards than that. Best of luck & congratulations Ja'Nel!

NYvG86dxvY_2LxipLSpjBg.text: I attempted to go here twice for dinner but both times was turned down from my friends opinions of it already. I guess they had a couple bad experiences there before but I really wanted to go because I was wanting a good beer n some simple unpretentious food.  I'm glad I went. I thoroughly enjoyed my meal. I started with the mushroom salad on a bed of frisee. I really love mushrooms, so when I say four or five different kinds, I gasped, and dived in. I didn't come up for air until It was finished. Oh what fun that was. And the pretzels were a nice touch, I liked the mustard far better than the cheese, surprisingly. I ordered the chorizo mussels for dinner because I'm a big mussel fan and the waiter recommended it.  Very good even tho I hardly ate the chorizo bc that was the only part I wasn't interested in somehow. The broth was salty but savory and it was gigantic.  My friend got the pork belly which had wonderful flavor and the fat was super crispy, I liked it more than him I think. The other guest ordered the shepards pie and said it was great.
