wzibQ3Y6-tHe98TJ1XnkJg.text: Wow.  Great food.....been to Hell's kitchen and this is just as good!    Will definitely be back this trip and others!!!!         Every thing exceeded expectations!

D6bpEqtwvYGULy5ot6zcRA.text: Folks, this is one we NEVER miss when we go to Vegas - even if we don't stay at Caesar's Palace. The service is always great, and the food is just incredible. We always try something different - Yesterday was wings (ordered extra crispy, came out perfect) with a perfect spicy sauce. Another ordered scotch eggs which were a bit odd to me but everyone else loved them and it was a perfect mix of crunchy and savory. Special orders are no problem - one of our party wanted a blue cheese martini and the olives came out just crammed with bluey cheesy goodness.   Folks the price is right, the location is great, the food is wonderful, and this is a great Gordon Ramsey option.

RQjczqFdxMM2gzl5UA2HSQ.text: The food here was really great. The waiter was especially nice and looked very professional. I had the English cheddar burger and the Blue Sky cocktail. Both were delicious. The atmosphere was pleasant with plenty of tv's to watch the game on, but it wasn't o early loud.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spotted Dick
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. English Cheddar Burger
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Blue sky

lvve9sw37TCeYRdhaKvqRQ.text: Terrible .. Gordon Ramsey my ass ...too over priced for a third grade junk food, it will close down soon. I'm 100% assured. One fish and chips. A salad with chicken , that are cut in cubes and not filling at all . Two cokes and a calamari as starter which is drained in brown oil . $98.00 . Go figure

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States

awVxPvJfShxqCOHHbcbqlA.text: It's just okay.  First meal in Vegas after checking into Caesars.  Love the location, and the service was excellent.  The food was just okay though, and FYI, I think the menu online is outdated.  I got the Hell Burger, which was a spicy beef burger with jalapenos and habanero.  It had a delicious smokey flavor, a nice bit of heat to it, and it was juicy.  The patty was perfectly round though, so it makes me wonder if they were using prepackaged food or not.  Nothing on the menu said fresh, hand-made patties though, so can't blame them if they aren't.  Gordon Ramsay wouldn't expect any less though.  The fries were really good though.  My gf got the classic fish and chips.  We both agreed that the fish was perfectly breaded as it was light and crispy, but the fish itself was plain.  You really had to dip it in the sauces to give it any flavor.  Not sure if this how it's supposed to be or not.  They also give you wedge fries, which weren't as good as the shoe string fries I got with the burger.  The best thing we got was the lobster roll starter.  I love the buttery, toasted bread that it comes on, and the lobster is the cold style type.  It was very refreshing, and was topped generously with lobster, so you got a lot of flavor in every bite.  I'd probably try the other places in the area before coming back here, but that doesn't mean this was a bad spot.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. lobsta roll
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. hell burger
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. fish n chips

GYku7GwuWy3titqHgpqfYw.text: We walked in today for fast dinner before Celine dion concert at 6:40 asked waiter if we need to be at the concert exact at 7:30 she said "noooo Celine will not be at the stage on time" We ordered 2 burgers to make it fast. service was slowly, burgers were dry( So finally we got the check at 7:40!!! and what we saw when we entered to the concert that Celine already finished with 2!!! Songs!!! GORDON, u owned us 2 song of Celine! I'm from Russia and I dreamed to see her whole my life! If I would know that she starts at 7:30 I would be right at the doors but just because waiter was so sure about the inf she gave, I missed my chance to enjoy 2 songs((  Update: manager offered us comp drinks after review. Thank you.

Imac6FobE-2UQ-hUu7CX_A.text: We are here just before a Hall and Oates Concert-who knew they were still playing. This is a riff on a British pub. We started with the shrimp and lobster rolls which are fantastic! Stuffed full of meat and the bread is perfectly toasted-these rival those you'd find in Maine. The kale salad is also really good-the dressing makes it. The fish and chips are also a solid choice. The fish was crispy and cooked to perfection and surprisingly the mushy peas are quite tasty. The fries, however, were a bit limp-perhaps this is how the Brits like them. A bit loud-lots is TVs give it a sports bar vibe and we were here during March Madness so what do you expect....still I'd come back, the nachos looked fantastic-still regretting I did not try them! We ended with the sticky toffee pudding....wow! All I can say is that I will be dreaming of that for a very long time time-so delicious-the ice cream melts into the tender date cake and the caramel sauce (generous portion) is soooo good!!!

wl1Nl_eD3SIQBIhNdIqMzg.text: Great service and scrumptious food! Got the lobster roll and my mom got the mini burgers. My only complaint is there was a little too much grease on my roll. Will return!

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States

UvrBXmlI5bP2jgLMhhsvJg.text: Really great food and service!! We started with the shrimp cocktail and it was to die for! I ordered the scallops and my husband ordered the burger and truffle fries!! Amazing! The flavors are perfect! Would def come back!

52tAjJoP-y2CJ5J6h_2UTg.text: The food was excellent and quick. Drinks were great. The place was a little loud but it's a pub in the center of a casino!  I had fish and chips and it was amazing. Partner got the scallops and they were the best either of us ever had.

jBSaNq5vWctWu4sun8SSEw.text: My husband and I were starving from all the gambling and lucky for us this GR restaurant was nearby. I love Gordon so I knew I wouldn't be disappointed!  We ate their Korean-styled poutine and it was delicious. If you're planning to eat this, ask to have the fries in a separate plate unless you like them to get soggy. The ribeye was cooked beautifully and tasted great.   The star of the show: the sticky toffee pudding. That is a definite must have. Its sticky. Its toffee. Its amazing!

07rjpl-500_-UFLbcIxgZg.text: Amazing! The nachos were to die for and the burgers were incredible too. Rodney was our server and he was fantastic - from the service, to the food recommendations, and the ambiance, everything was great and we can't wait to be back!

6Wnc_7UpGbi1LMLyPA2lcA.text: Went here based on glowing reviews from friends and was not disappointed.  Everything was excellent- the burger, the steak, the pot pie!  The signature dessert (sticky toffee pudding, or something like that) was fabulous!  Don't miss it.  It's really cake and ice cream with delicious toffee topping, by the way, not pudding at all!  My only complaint was the price.  A bit much for pub food in a loud environment.  But, I suppose you pay a bit more for the location and name brand!  (And high quality)

Y1VXZ7cacItjBARXBU9dzw.text: Ambiance was nice, waiters were very kind, overall good experience. We ordered the lobster rolls to start, I got the steak pot pie dish, and we finished it off with the sticky bread pudding. The lobster roll was delicious - the bread was buttery and the lobster was tender. The steak dish was a little salty for my taste with too much sauce overall, but the flaky crust helped balance it out a bit (too much sauce for the amount of crust, though). The bread pudding was great - I wish there had been more ice cream with it, though. But overall great food, would come here again.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States

ZbNu_N0LHRk1kjj6GS0NCA.text: Food was delicious and staff was incredible! Came with a party of 10 and would hands down come again. Don't forget to Make a reservation! Casual dining, come as you are.  Mac and cheese was to die for. Deviled eggs and beef poutine were also amazing. The table also had the braised short rib, shepherds pie, English cheddar burger, roast chicken, fish and chips. Everything was delicious!

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States

EnN35fYw9Zsra0UeJyL8Lg.text: My husband and I were so excited to try this famed restaurant so we booked two months in advance. We promptly arrived for our reservation and waited 10min for our table.  Once sat, My husband ordered a dirty vodka martini which arrives room temperature 15 minutes later.  It took an hour for our first appetizer to arrive. At this point it is 90 minutes after our reservation time and we still haven't gotten our main course.  While the food is outstanding, the service is not so I won't be coming back.   On a positive note, our server was apologetic and offered free wine while we waited.

BGLA3O8DzOqoRpAe13Wytw.text: Wow I give this place a perfect 10/10! Everyone must try the lobster rolls and steak! Everything was perfect and well worth the price!  Iv been to Gordon Ramsey burger, and Hell's Kitchen but this one takes the top! We had Jon as a waiter and he was nice and knew everything on the menu. Thanks Jon and Gordon Ramsey for a great dinner!

G5Xl3DaE2UG-Sx4cBqHMBg.text: I came here every night while I was at Caesars. I sat at the bar and had such a great time, Keith, the bartender, was entertaining, funny and genuine. I love a good Hefeweizen and they have it on draft. The Shrimp Cocktail is so delicious and the Wedge Salad is wonderful as well. I also had the Bacon Burger which was awesome, but the best part was the Sticky Toffee Pudding which was free after checking in with Yelp! You won't be disappointed!

Dzyt-KWzyGx95Q9QP2dA1Q.text: I really enjoyed my meal here.  The restaurant is located in the casino area with somewhat open seating where you can watch the action or there are some tables and booths that are a little more private though close together.  I ordered the shepherds pie and it was really delicious.  It came with a small salad and a pretzel roll.  It was more than I could finish but enjoyed every bite.  I saved some room to try the sticky toffee pudding (free with yelp check-in) which was amazing.  I couldn't eat all of that either but did enjoy it.  Service was excellent throughout my meal.  Granted the restaurant was not very crowded at the time I had dinner but it was a good experience for me and really loved what I had.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. sticky toffee pudding
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shepherd&#39;s pie entree
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. interior facing the bar.

RCieGbvK6elJ1x63g1As8A.text: Gordon Ramsey should be ashamed that his name is associated with this restaurant.  As an English person who now lives in America, I take any opportunity to eat proper English food.  This was not that. Had the steak pie, it was okay-ish, honestly the one you take home from waitrose is better. It weirdly  came with a side of raw, random vegetables (seriously who eats raw courgette?) and also weirdly a pretzel... pie should always come with chips or some type of potato...if I wanted potato it would have been another $11... bloody cheek!   My friend had the fish and chips. The chips were good, the fish was not. It was American style and not proper English. Think if you're going to have the cheek to charge $30 for fish and chips, they better be awesome.    The bar staff were okay to us but really really rude to this other poor couple who asked for a drink - they had a table in the bar area and had waited for about 10 mins with no service.  The man came up and tried to order a couple of beers and was told that he needed to go back to his table and wait for his server and have some patience! Poor bloke sat there for another 15 mins before he got a drink.    Glad I went to Burger before I went to Pub because I dont think I'll be heading to any Gorden Ramsey resturants again

5bMr_xZA0yBfCRzBAnr-DA.text: Great pub and grill. I would highly recommend getting the cheese board along with the rack of lamb. The cheese board has a great raisin slaw that adds a hint of sweetness to the cheese. The Lamb was cooked to perfection along with the spinach and mushroom sides. If you want that pub feel and taste I would recommend it over any other restaurant.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Perfect cheese board!

1G7Cd_KggverqBHl8Jzsrg.text: I expected over priced and fancy. To my surprise, it was casual. Prices were reasonable too. The food was in general good. It's good bar grub. There are plenty of beer options too.

uisKaqLCk1kqHXMJ55irfA.text: Hamburgers in the $20s but tasted ordinary. Fries were hard as if they were left under the heat lamp for sometime. Much better eat at In-N-Out. Service was excellent.

nOlVO_tHKZ_vgZxbS_bsUA.text: The food was delicious, we sat at the bar and ate because there was a 1.5 hour wait. The bartender Shaun was less than desirable. He was not very friendly and he played on his cellphone. The funny thing was that Gordon Ramsey was in Caesars doing an appearance, would have thought employees would be on their toes    Back again (4/5/18)  Great bar service very friendly...enjoyed happy hour specials...  thanks for a great experience

2V3Rt0e7hBTmA9ADDCB6NQ.text: Came here to have a late dinner with a girlfriend.   We got some pretzel sticks, an IPA, the french onion soup and the main reason why she brought me here was to try their sticky toffee pudding. That dessert was really good!! I never ever order desserts-I don't care for sweets that much but she said it was a must try. The dessert didn't disappoint-You get a chocolate cake with ice cream and toffee slightly drizzled on top. Really yummy!!!   This restaurant is right in the casino right by Omnia. The service was incredibly slow!!! But the dessert made up for it.  I will definitely be back to eat that sticky toffee pudding again :)  Would I recommend this? Yes, must try that dessert!!!

bsLwScuP7T5CtPGIyBm0lg.text: Horribly loud, open to casino so smoking wafts in, burning my eyes.  The food was good, but the atmosphere made it not so good.  The tomato soup was very creamy.  I did get a really bad stomach ache in the middle of the night, but I don't know if it was the restaurant.  The sticky toffee pudding was really good.  I wouldn't go back though due to the loud noise.

rOEekl0T-Yaf07vvNhPu6g.text: My husband and I are here on August 9th 2016 for lunch. I was actually hoping the food would be horrid because well, I really just wanted to provide some criticism to the Ramsey. However the service and food was incredible.    We were seated quickly into a booth, the place has a good vibe and decor was on point. We had the best "water" boy, seriously I kept him coming to the table as Vegas is HOT.     I ordered a BLT and my husband ordered the fish and chips. The BLT was easily had the best the flavor, probably the best BLT I've ever had. My husband fish pieces were huge and perfectly cooked and it came with a side dish of these amazing peas, I believe to be a dill and basil blend they were so good.   From the staff, food, beverages and decor this place is everything you would expect from the Ramsey! Well done.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States

NkTnNinpuEUC1JrL1790oQ.text: This restaurant disappoints and a lot of ways and it exceeds in a lot of ways. I think I'll start with my disappointments, so we can end this on a positive note. The initial waiter we had was rude. When he came over to take what I thought to be our drink order. I asked him two questions. First, is the tea just typical tea or is it specialty flavors? I also asked if the onion soup was a dinner portion or did they have a half order to order at the start of the meal. He said to me I don't know what you mean by specialty tea, the tea here is just tea. He then said the menu only has one size a soup and so "we only serve one sizes soup". When I responded back I was borderline snapping back. So, we place the drink order and we order two soups as a starter. Well, he just continues to stand there. He's blurts out what do you want for dinner? I said "oh you're taking our dinner order now" and he said "of course". He was very rude. Well, I think he realized he wasn't going to get a great tip from us and he passed our table over to another waitress. Which she was very pleasant, however you could have been a rock and been more pleasant then this man. Finally, we were seated next to the server workstation it was in the middle of the room it was not blocked off it was just a basic banquet type stand and they were sorting silverware and waiters and waitresses were coming up and chit-chatting and customers were walking up and asking for things. This service station should be away from customers views. Especially, with the prices and this place. The steak I ordered was $48 it came with a small very small order a mashed potatoes that was under the steak and you could not even see it whenever the steak was placed in front of me. My fiance ordered the Hell's Kitchen Burger which again was very expensive for a burger over $25 is a lot and it came with nothing but the burger so he had to order fries which was an additional $12. Here is the good the restaurant is extremely beautiful and they have beautiful chairs that are very comfortable. The Ambiance is amazing aside from the waitress station being in the middle of diners. The soup was very good and was jam packed with flavor. The steak was cooked perfectly to a temperature of medium rare the flavor was excellent. Once, my fiance's Burger was remade and put on a proper Bond he really enjoyed his Burger and being that we have eaten at several Gordon Ramsay restaurants the Truffle fries was delicious like always. We finished with the promotion offered by the restaurant for checking in via Yelp the sticky butter cake and it was delicious. It actually is my favorite sticky butter cake I've ever had. So, here's a recap the wait staff needs to work on their manners and realize that this is a service industry and the restaurant itself needs to move the waitress station out of the middle of the dining room. The kitchen needs to make sure that all orders go out perfectly the first time and keep up the good work as far as they're cooking. We would definitely go back, however it wouldn't be something we would go to often it's just far too expensive for pub food. I would definitely give it a shot if you're looking for a great dinner in Las Vegas

b74vUNNSLGesmwNqlLkVdQ.text: Great service with Heather today at lunch time!! The food was hot and delicious!! Would definitely recommend!!

6Ez3EHp-BHKPq-ZE_8PIug.text: This place was AWFUL! I'm literally sitting here right now writing this review. I have plenty of time to do so because I haven't seen my waiter in 45 minutes! The fries were awful but no substitute was offered, I would give the lobster/shrimp roll 5 stars though!! Thanks for ruining my birthday dinner!

EX2t2hwie8Mg1kernWWhpA.text: Server Rodney was excellent.  Made great suggestions and had extensive knowledge of menu.  Had the Steak and Ale Pie ($24) tender sirloin with rich gravy and carrots onions celery.  Friend had Short Rib ($39)  tender and delicious with creamy mashed potatoes and carrots with pearl onions prepared perfectly, large portion of meat and potatoes.  Manager touched table and was profesional and attentive.  Ended meal with Toffee Pudding which was moist and sweet with great carmel sauce and ice cream.  Beers were $11 per pint.  Goid place to treat yourself.  Will be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Short Rib with Creamy Potatoes.

caqOq83U5huo74QXnmPDPw.text: Myself, my husband, and our 3 year old went in for lunch sometime around May. First the service was extremely slow, it took almost 10 minutes to have our waiter take our drink order, which by that time we were also ready to order our food (there were maybe only 6 or 7 other tables). When we ordered our drinks we asked for a chocolate milk for our daughter, which they said they had. It was made extremely clear that this was for our 3 year old. A little bit of time after that we received our drinks, and everything seemed fine. But my daughter took a sip of hers, and said it tasted funny. I took a sip and was absolutely shocked that it had alcohol in it! We brought this to the attention of one of the staff who was quick to grab our server. He apologized, and brought over the manager. He said that for some reason the bartender thought we wanted an alcoholic beverage, and used the chocolate milk mix from one of their alcoholic shakes. First of all, it was explicitly clear this was for our 3 year old, second we ordered a chocolate milk, there was absolutely no mention of alcohol in that order. The manager apologized again and brought over another chocolate milk (non alcoholic). My husband and I were in such disbelief over the situation we didn't even know what to do. We received our food, which took quite a long time, and it wasn't as delicious as I had hoped it would be, but I can forgive that. What I can't is the fact that my daughter was served alcohol, and then we weren't even offered anything by the manager, we even had to pay for the chocolate milk!!! I expect much better service from a place with the Gordon Ramsay name. Needless to say, we will never go back!

mkTlSFBmFNz_-Lwr0_sYOQ.text: We are here to see if the restaurant lived up to the hype for a celebrity chef restaurant and it did!  The server was attentive and helped us navigate the menu.  Everybody in our group was impressed with the abundance of flavors from our dishes.  I had the Hells Kitchen Burger and would prefer this burger to any $30 steak in most restaurants.   Definitely worth checking out in Las Vegas if you're on an expense account or winning big.

FZeYcOe1ZXTKdkek2twLDw.text: Average experience overall. Service was typical Strip - they don't look you in the eye or make a connection of any kind unless you yell at them. Food was good but you expect more. Left with the conclusion that this just a big brand on the Strip place. Nothing to talk about...average at best.

rpDzNxdB7-Orvk_zB_qatQ.text: stopped by for some pre-dinner drinks on the way to MESA since they are kinda just right next to each other lol  we didn't order any food so i will not comment on their food items  there were lot of groups waiting to be seated, since we only wanted to grab a drink, we just quickly checked with the reception lady and went in for bar seats   we tried the "ramsay tonic" and the "goodbye blue sky"   the ramsay tonic is very refreshing and not too sweet and the goodbye blue sky is a very very tasty ladies drink (lol)   they do have decent beer selection, however, i didn't get to try this time :)   not sure if it's really worth the wait for the food tho...  i do recommend to stop by the bar and grab a quick drink (it's vegas, #youfuckingdonkey lol)

Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. #youfuckingdonkey lol

VWInB7qqgVJ4jJnbC4zOVA.text: Food (scallops, burger, and truffle fries) is good. Truffle fries smelled delicious. service is great. Always refilled our waters. Thanks, Chris p!

q9q7aBBXShfN-B6WjSU6IA.text: Went here for dinner with my husband ad the line for Gordan Ramsey burger was too long. He ordered the fish and chips and I ordered the meat and ale pie. We had a salad for appetizer. Food was mediocre and the beer my husband ordered had so much head on it. Service was lack lustre. Basically wanted us in and out. We paid our bill and gave a normal 20% tip and didn't even get a thank you or a you are welcome as we thanked him. Not worth it. I rather of spent my money elsewhere. Should of had the fish and chips at the Gordan Ramsey fish and chips place near the strip for half the price.

XEt6SYDRwmAouXLE5asv_w.text: Loud, crowded & full of energy- not unlike Chef Ramsay!  My visit was at the bar to check out the drink menu for a future visit here. Lots of specialty cocktails & I'm impressed that one, Ramsay Tonic, is gin based.  Bartenders were easy going & happy to answer questions.  Forsake the touristy vibe here & would be a great hangout pre whatever show or event you're heading to.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Good selection at the Pub!

pMjdxfCsa_Fe65htLwfiew.text: Loved my steak! Grilled perfectly as I ordered. Can't go wrong with this place. Second time here and will keep coming everytime I'm in Vegas! Ask for Rodney he's the best treated us very well:)

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States

4AiV1l92xKAb6y8OKMcYcA.text: Great food. Great price. The lobster Mac n cheese had a big piece of claw meat in it. Not disappointed at all.

0IkW9s_YCIPANM6coay0NA.text: Dined here for lunch on 06/04/14.  Ordered: Mini Pub Burgers - (2) sliders with great taste and nice grilled buns   Loli-Pop Chicken Wings - I should have been suspect of Loli-Pop in the title. Only ordered 6. Teeny-Tiny Things. Stilton Cheese Dip they came with was incredible!  Toad In The Hole - Pastry wrapped sausage with a wild and crazy mustard dipping sauce. The dipping sauce was the star of this dish.  Lackluster waiter.  Husband ordered a beer. Total bill was $50.00.  Not bad. Not over the top wonderful.  I think my husband's thoughts of my becoming a food snob may be coming to fruition...

l6O56tPU9BjcQum2-wrwWA.text: Not sure how to take this place. I was in the mood for steak and since I already tried Mesa Grill in Caesar's, I figured I'd give this place a shot. I can't say I was thoroughly impressed, nor was I dissapointed by any means. I had the 14 oz Ribeye w/a side of mashed potatoes. The potatoes were excellent but the quality of the ribeye was satisfactory. Although I'll admit, the three sauces that come w/the steak were great, along w/the asparagus. I also tried the kettle chip nachos and they were good...just wish there were more meat on it than what was given. To me, price was slightly high for what you get. Overall, it was an average quality place for both food and service. I wouldn't turn this place down if given the opportunity...but then again, I wouldn't volunteer this place either given the choice.

NUj8OLpfhxlQJ9-sVp7VvQ.text: The atmosphere was nice. We went for happy hour and had the much talked about truffle fries. These were very good!

XcYitdA2oAfXbXXpeBd5-A.text: Absolutely love coming here when I am in Vegas, Gene is the bomb behind the bar. Must have the lobster mac 'n cheese!!

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States

nLOux5-KV8HDwZoJYu3W7Q.text: My sisters and I came here for Super Bowl Sunday.  It was $100.00 per person to get in, unlimited food and drinks.  The food was delicious.  I didn't drink but my sister's did and said the drinks were good.  The decor is nice, the workers uniforms are ridiculous, lol, I felt bad for them, but it is a very English look.    The big bonus to this was though that on occasion Gordon Ramsey himself comes in to check on things, and at the time we were there so was he.  My sister is a big foodie and we were stoked that she got to get a picture with him.  He is very nice and personable in person although I didn't get too close because I couldn't get past my terror and PTSD of watching him scream at people on TV.  lol.  Overall it is a great place.  I'd definitely go back both for the Super Bowl, or just for dinner or lunch.

jDAjSlr9ihzQKeieXGbqjA.text: Great food. Good service. Not as clean as I expected. Atmosphere was great.  My wife and I both loved the traditional pub favorites on the menu mixed with some creative offerings. We chose the more creative offerings and lived everything. Can't wait to go back.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States

kzGIj3cKgOdJYi_D6w8EXQ.text: My boyfriend and I dined here on December 27, lowering our expectations after reading some of the recent reviews. We were pleased with our overall experience. We arrived around 7pm, were seated immediately without reservations, and were well-monitored by relatively friendly staff. We both got the fish and chips with some drinks. There were four huge fillets of fish and plenty of chips (fries), and everything tasted great. No disappointments! We should have split the dish (and I wish our server had warned us of the portions but it was our responsibility to ask). The beer and my cocktail were good (I got the mocha martini) but both arrived at the end of the meal, which was annoying . However, our server apologized for the wait, explaining that the bar was backed up. I liked the decor of the place, the servers' and host/hostess's uniforms were really cool classic British punk themed.  My only significant complaint is regarding the few tables behind the host/hostess counter. The table was very high compared to the low-resting chairs and made for an uncomfortable dining position. The table was also a bit wide and it was difficult to have a more intimate evening when we were seated so far apart and had to have a shouting match over the casino music.  We may be back again but I want to check out Ramsay's other establishments.

dQeGdbgaiqPkh0ra_QliWw.text: Had a great time dining  at the bar before the concert. The bartender was super friendly and didn't push us out as we ate & drank at our leisure. Mini pub burgers. Truffle chips. Devil eggs and scotch egg were yummy. Fast service! We will Def be back.

6-Q-scR-ISpVuPQq4q7CsA.text: Good was great quality meat and John our waiter made everthing even better. He was friendly made recommendations on food its great.. if you con you should try the nochos they are made with kettle chips..good call from our waiter John.. will go back and ask gor John and try what he recommends...thank you good food good service

ZzO3D4Jcc82qWjD-Pn2vMA.text: Good place to watch the game. My second time here.  Thus time around my service is much better. And I actually enjoyed the food Spend about an hour and a half. Watched works cup game here. The waiter was very nice.  Good thing is they have lots of TVS  I ate the lamb burger. Very tasteful and juicy.  Little bit pricy for the burger but might be because of price of lamb.

imFrIsiiWOcgfR1SShsGJw.text: Everything was perfect!  I got the salmon, which I adored.  Our server was amazing and the appetizer of three pies was perfect!    All of our desserts were yummy as well.  Definitely want to return!

zhuCFSltux9ZYT3esGPUCg.text: Gordon Ramsay you bloody ass; you're an Englishman representing the culinary arts to satisfy the most demanding palettes...and yet you somehow failed!!!  For a bloke (dude) that talks as much rubbish (shit) as you do on other people's cooking, you can't even make the damned FISH & CHIPS RIGHT!!   The chips (fries) tasted like the chef you hired cooked it on some hot bonnet (hood) and then carelessly threw it on the plate...because it was super soggy and overly salted!  The style and decor is amazing. If this place were to be solely judged on decor and service, this place would get a 5. But instead, the food was blah.   My mate (friend) ordered the pork belly. Quite dry.   Geez I can't wait for the next season of Top Gear.

ZiKKwdhEGPxIgOpumyrnwA.text: We had to visit at least one of GR's restaurants in Vegas so we chose this one.  5 of the 6 of us had the prime rib, the 6th (damn combo-breaker), had something else which I don't remember.  In any case, the meal was excellent. The prime rib was perfectly marbled, had the right amount of seasoning and tasted exactly how it should. I will say, generally speaking, either restaurants don't know what the hell "medium rare" means or they're afraid of getting sued if someone eats meat too underdone and gets sick. Medium-rare seems to be always served as Medium.  The Yorkshire pudding that came with it was also excellent. Fluffy and flavourful. I don't see this served with prime rib in other restaurants as much as I'd like to.  The service was adequate but not spectacular by any stretch. Drinks came in a reasonable amount of time, as with the food. Refills were a touch slow.  The price was a little bit steep but not in outer space by any means. Enjoying the food makes it easy to forget how much it cost.  I'd say that you should check this place out on the strength of their prime rib alone.

IXl7bC1AMQ3P4glEjjL5oA.text: Contrary to most of the reviews for this place, I found GRPG to be a refreshing change of pace to the stuffiness (or severe lack thereof) of most Strip restaurants.  What I found most impressive was that they cater to everyone. If you're looking for a fine dining experience, get a bottle of meritage and the veal chop. If you want a beer and some fish and chips, they can do that too.  Speaking of fish and chips, they were phenomenal. Fat pieces of cod, seasoned perfectly, coated in boddingtons beer batter and fried to a perfect crispness. The homemade chips are tossed in herbs and Parmesan. Ask for a side of garlic aioli to dip them in. It's a revelation. But honestly, the best thing on that plate were the bright green and buttery mushy peas. They had such a beautiful freshness to them and really tasted like...well...peas! But the best peas you've ever had.  We also had the shepherds pie. Down home goodness with a British flair. The use of lamb along with beef adds such a depth of flavor. Also, instead of using ground meat, the chefs braise it, so you get a nice stew like texture and flavor galore. The potatoes were creamy and rich and the vegetables inside were a perfect al dente.  We finished this feast with the sticky toffee pudding. Just get it. You are missing something divine if you don't.  Our server, Elyse, was kind, quick witted and on top of it. She anticipated our every whim. And a huge shout out to Raul and the amazing bar staff for such genius cocktails. These guys know what they're doing.  All in all, this place rocked it.

Kk6G4GsjRF3PIhfhT4ujJA.text: So this is my fourth time visiting this restaurant and finally decided I had to write a review. Firstly the food and service has always been great with the exception of the Fish and Chips. If there is one thing a English Pub should get right it should be the fish and chips. First time I ordered them I was presented with frozen McDonalds type fries and I was horrified, actually pissed off that I had been served those type of fries instead of chips. Next time I ordered I was told they had gone back to chips however it may not last because customers were complaining perhaps due to the American palet. I was thrilled they now had chips so Gave it another try. I must say here that the fish was honestly incredible and authentic but the "chips" while being wedges or chips of potatoes they were not hot and were heavy and wet without flavor. I grew up in England and if anyone has eaten at an English pub or "chipper" you know you cannot stop eating the huge portion of chips, they are like candy.  Today I ordered Bangers and Mash which has always been one of my childhood favorites. My first bite I was expecting the deliciousness of the English Banger but instead tasted Polish Sausage. WHAT? Gordon come on really? There were however bangers there also thank goodness however my opinion the onion gravy was thick and congealed not thin and smooth like it should be and while the sauerkraut was an interesting touch I still don't understand why stray from one one the most authentic English dishes. It has been perfect for centuries why add Polish sausage? All the other appetizers I've had here are awesome and the burger is simply amazing, however I will go to Todd English Pub at Aria to have the most authentic fish and chips and bangers and mash this side of the Atlantic.

OjOVeCKRLlYt65M43M-u1g.text: Great food! We ordered the shepherd's pie, some cherry dessert, lobster roll.

3uaE8P-N9T7ejhgbtwX-eA.text: Best place. Friendliest people I have met this trip. LOVED IT. Go see Ray Ray. A mixologist that can put many to shame.

afR-Sntu8Or_qkyKyWNsPQ.text: I gave Gordon Ramsey another chance and you failed again. Please do not ask for a well done burger because you will not get what you ask for, I say this as a 2nd visit at a Ramsey restaurant.  The service was BLAH nothing comforting about the service. It took a long time to get a greeting. The drinks were good. Atmosphere was nice, good for large groups. The second star is for Randy for really picking up the broken pieces from the team we encountered during our visit.  Overall my birthday dinner was distasteful and unpleasant from the service of the waiter to the improper food request from the kitchen.

1_NOG3hKPknTe20kTU8X-A.text: The best ever!  Excellent service, great atmosphere and I love Caeser's Palace.  Food had a lot of flavor and salty (I like salt).  Gordon Ramsey came out and said hello.  He was nice to us (unlike how he is to his chefs on tv).  Got a beer and Bloody Mary.  Deviled eggs were quite "devilish"

OjdE1JRyK5d5ZDgkuO4TYA.text: I really thought I would be impressed with this place but overall it wasn't very good service and steak even though ordered mine medium but was chard too much and tasted a bit burned and crispy. Our waiter was good just no salt and pepper no A1 sauce on top of it made it an OK experience.

PoyufaFjMjOyyjRpugYIOQ.text: Nice spot to eat and people watch. The staff is friendly and attentive. Food was good. Maple sage fried chicken sandwich was tasty. Chips were ok. Calamari was tender but could have used some salt or seasoning.

3BfzHVioXa9u7ogdwh-tPg.text: First time here we got the brine chicken,the scottish salmon and the fish and chip. The fish and chips and the chicken was a good portion the salmon could have used a side. As for taste the fish and chips and the chicken we're good. The chicken taste was unique and good the fish was very good, the fish meat was good. The peas with the fish was a little wierd. Salmon was good, just not enough on it's own for me.

B4VmX3Lz-4psKeyMKn6HKA.text: What a great dinner?!?!?  The Butter Chicken Curry was AWESOME!  Can't wait for my wife, Chef Colleen Curley to be in Hell's Kitchen wig Chef Ramsay!

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chef Kristin, Runner-Up Season 15 of Hell&#39;s Kitchen. Could Chef Colleen be the next winner?

LmykO9gE3Mkwmqi4IQxyLg.text: Happy Hour allowed us to try a few different items without having to shell too much money out of our already emptying pockets (the flashing lights of Vegas really get ya). All the food on the happy hour menu is from $5 - $7, which is pretty decently priced for the richness of the selection. You do have to sit at the bar, which was super crowded on this cold November Tuesday, but if you can manage to find a spot it'll be worth your while.   Each dish was delicious! We were blown away. They were all classic happy hour appetizer type foods (nachos, wings, etc) but made with better quality and a slight twist of the fancy. The type of food you can eat until you're full and not feel like you're going to pass out after, you just feel good.   Here's the dishes:  Truffle Chips: Basically, fries with truffle aioli. The fries are super good, those thick but not too thick ones that are just crispy enough. The truffle, and the other dipping sauce, was flavorful too.   Toad-in-the-Hole: A sausage wrapped in a pastry with dipping sauce in swirls around the plate. Fluffy, pastry with perfect balance of sausage. This dish only comes with one tiny sausage for a $5 price tag, so just be warned if you're sharing you'd need to order a few more if you want your own.   Crab Deviled Egg (w/ cucumber, tomato, relish): This was good, the flavors were balanced. I'm a hug fan of regular deviled eggs, so the twist was definitely interesting. Not my favorite, but good and definitely worth the try! (They come with three egg halves).   Kettle Chip Nachos (w/ corned short ribs & cheddar sauce): SO GOOD, probably my favorite dish. It's everything good about nachos but with better made parts. The chips by themselves are the real potato kind, the meat is flavorful enough to eat on it's own, and the cheddar sauce is rich. It all balances super well, especially with the sweet baked peppers on the top (I think that's what they are). It was so good we were literally scrapping every last tiny bite off the plate even though it was our last dish of the meal.   Lollipop Wings (w/ Blue Cheese Dip): SO MUCH YES. Comes with 6 wings.

YJWPKvhhU5aU0U287wZk5A.text: Gordon Ramsay has quite a few restaurants in Las Vegas. The Pub and Grill was the one we selected for dinner before a show on Saturday night. We made reservations and were seated right away when we got there. This spot looked just like an old pub, classy but still pretty casual.  The waitress offered us some specials and helped us decide on our dishes. She told us that when Gordon Ramsay is there he always gets the Bangers and Mash. I decided on the pistachio pesto chicken sandwich that came with fries. It was delicious! So tasty and the bread was a zucchini cheese bread - yum! The fries were tasty and the ketchup was even better! I don't know what was in it, but it had some type of kick to it. The braised short ribs were also amazing and the risotto with that was so delicious!  There is also a Steak and a Burger spot from Gordon - I will have to try one of those the next trip!

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pistachio pesto chicken sandwich

B2m4an5IVp-JL7qzwqSEng.text: Amazing. The service is incredible, without being obnoxious. This place is very, very expensive, but honestly the best British Pub food we have ever had! My Mom is English and lives in London, so we have eaten many pub meals, but this is by far the best! My daughter ordered the Bangers and Mash: substituting French fries for the mashed potatoes and all pork Bangers instead chicken, beef and pork. They were tender and amazing. My husband had a corned beef sandwich with homemade potato chips and it was THE best sandwich he has ever eaten. I had the fish and chips. There are no words! It was unreal. I do not exaggerate. The fish was tender and flaky and the batter was incredible. My daughter who has never tried fish and chips before wants it next time. This is a must in Vegas!

2j5rc3PhdHivLH2s676L2Q.text: I'm surprised this restaurant doesn't have more stars. The ambiance of the restaurant is great--ranges from comfy sofas/couches to booths and fancier tables. Dim lighting and cozy wooden kinda feel...with sports games to watch. Our waitress, Daisy, is absolutely amazing and I think our experience would not have been as awesome if not for her. She had a great sense of humor, top notch service, and was completely professional yet personal at the same time.   We ordered:  Lamb shank: This actually brought my friend back to the days when his mother was still around and cooked him this as a young boy. The meat literally fell off the bone, and no knife was needed. An amazing dish, especially one that could trigger such nostalgic memories.  Fish and chips: I loved their thick steak fries--well seasoned and pairs GREAT with their house-made ketchup--trust me, this ain't no Heinz. The ketchup is AWESOME. Apparently they make all of their sauces and you really can taste the difference--the tartar sauce for the fish and chips was also very well done. The fish itself was tasty and yummy, though not our favorite (which is actually a gluten free dish located in Florida), but it still was a winning dish in our tummies.  Baby carrot side: This came with brussel sprouts and bacon lardon--I swear, bacon makes EVERYTHING taste good. This dish was simple and nice as far as veggies go, though I would have liked it cooked a minute or two more to get an even softer bite for the carrots. Still, not a bad side...though I might opt to try another side next time.  Forest mushroom with frisee: It's literally shrooms and frisee. Granted, the frisee is very lightly dressed--just the way I like it and very fresh. The shrooms are delicious and well cooked...but that's really all you should expect. Nothing else fancy thrown in there.  Overall, I really want to come back, say hi to our wonderful waitress, and to try their other goodies. Everything looks amazing...I've been to all of Gordon Ramsay's restaurants in Vegas, and  none of them have let me down yet!

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster Mac n cheese
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Forest shroom side
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sliced veggie salad or something like that

CwJ7rFr_106x2WXDhQlpiA.text: I doubt Ramsay has ever step foot in this dump.  9/9 people in our party were overly underwhelmed by the food.  The entrees ordered at our table were the short ribs, salmon, vegetarian, and fish & chips.  I personally had the vegetarian dish, which was a laughable, tasteless, heap of mix n' match veggies and rice.   No creativity or thought went into that $30 plate of mediocrity.  The other entrees were described as sub-par, and nothing memorable.   I would be mortified if my face was plastered on every cab in Vegas drawing people into a pathetic, Vegas style Applebee's.  However, Gordon has no shame.    On a positive note, the service was fine.

PDytPZs6qPo2GkrEVBK7-Q.text: Wouldn't really recommend. Ordered the NY filet mignon with half a lobster and bearnaise sauce.  The sauce tasted like it came straight out of a jar and not very fresh. Lobster was overdone and was feeling more like chewing on rubber. The steak was ok but not worth 43 usd. Was also a bit overdone for medium rare. I've visited many steakhouses in LV and you can get a lot better for less money.   Kinda dissapointed. Will not be back again. Service of the waiters was good.

8W6whlJGsFvrQAbkig0-nQ.text: Best happy hour I've ever been to in my life. We ordered the nachos, truffle fries, and onion rings. The free toffee pudding for dessert was phenomenal and we had to get seconds. Our waiter's name was Afro. He was very kinda and helpful! I would definitely be coming back!

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States

iQMCYkfPK5z30jkzPve_Ag.text: This is my third time coming here for their happy hour whenever I come to Vegas. It's so worth it! The food is amazing, especially their Kettle chip nachos. Our server Afro is so friendly and upbeat he made the experience so much better. Yelp has an offer where if you check in you'll get a free Toffee Pudding dessert and I highly recommend you get it. My friends and I were pretty full so we were going to just share one and be on our way. However after one bite we couldn't stop eating and had to get another one. It was that good! Definitely coming back again the next time I go to Vegas. Thank you so much Afro for the wonderful service!

jxEc-bpXwpBIIcLgeukvTQ.text: Just had my wife's birthday dinner here and it was everyone's first time. The service was great. The food was delicious. And our server was awesome. Granted every request I had to make our celebration fantastic. I wish I got his name. I ordered the fish and chips, and I was a bit disappointed. The fish was a bit bland. But my wife ordered the steak and I was amazing. My friends ordered the bangers mash and it was delicious. If I ever go to the strip again I would definitely eat here a second time.   Thanks guys for making tonight great!

gJlta0QnUFHLAnDTp_DTGg.text: We are local and have been coming here for years. Unfortunately tonight was the last time. Prices are the same but the quality and quantity has gone down hill. Lobster rolls went from three to two and the filling was no where near what it used to be. The ration is way off. The side lobster Mac n cheese was gross...almost like it was sitting out too long and was discolored. The Shepard's Pie had a dozen peas and carrots at most....which is ridiculous. The supposed fresh peas and carrots are what makes the Shepard's Pie. It was over cooked and the pretzel that came with it was hard. Having the pretzel appetizer before it's night and day. Then for the fish and chips....the fish batter was so salty it was almost sent back. Ended up just taking the fish out of the batter and eating it. This is extremely sad as this was one of my favorite places, but it seems that the expectations and standards of this amazing restaurant has gone way down hill.

Xqx1c2cRF9KMACopg-o7WA.text: Tonight my family and I decided to have dinner at Caesar Palace before our Elton John Show. Gordon Ramsey Pub & Grill was the first place we saw so we decided to try it out. We were told that this restaurant has wonderful food and to make sure and try it out if we get the chance.  Since we are on vacation from Hawaii and don't have this restaurant back home.   We went to get a table for five, the hostess was very sweet and asked us to wait about 2 minutes while they set the table for us. We were seated at a super cute table. We all started looking over the menu.   During this time no one came to greet us or offer us water.  We were sat at the table at about 4:37 pm. at about 4:57 pm still no one had come to greet us or offer any beverages.   At about 4:59 pm another table was sat right next to us. This table was greeted offered water within a minute of being seated.   At this time we decided to leave the restaurant because it appeared no one wanted to serve us. As we were making our way out of the restaurant my mom informed the manager of the poor service we had encountered. The manager stood there and looked confused they got out his table map to check who was suppose to serve us. After that he offered us another table but we would have to wait a minute.  By now we were fed up, hungry and not feeling welcome at all. So we left. Thanks for ruining what could have been a wonderful experience.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States

5A2rQmTpvhgEBS4IJEf44A.text: If your looking for a delicious Lamb burger this is the place. We also had sticky toffee pudding and it was amazing. No need to go to London. Keith at the bar is the best. He knows his beers. Trust him.

uQ8fYzZevHgb-ujbC4HUIQ.text: I love Gordon Ramsey so naturally I had to try this place out.  Pub and Grill is located right in Caesar Palace near the coliseum.  We came on Friday around 5:00 pm.  The wait was minimal and we were quickly seated.  I have to say I'm not really a pub and fish and chips kind of girl so I was happy to see a diverse menu. We ordered the potato chips nachos (very good) to share and for my entree I ordered the Butter chicken curry with basmati rice and naan.  My entree was phenomenal and the portion was big.  My daughter and sister ordered the burger and that looked delicious.  We all agreed this was a good solid meal.  Drinks were also well crafted and executed.  For four people, an appetizer, salad, 4 entrees and 2 drinks the total was around $200.  Not bad considering this is Vegas.

Q0eAfPllN8EsaS9mesX5Pg.text: The food is pretty average but the prices are insane. $30 for fish and chips? I guess they are tourist prices but for those prices there is better food in Vegas.   Ordered the calamari to start. It's pretty generic and come w tartar sauce and some homemade version of ketchup. Unfortunately they don't have regular ketchup for fries. They just have their version which has horseradish in it. Not a fan. Lobster roll was fine. Nothing special. Pastrami sandwich was also fine. All in all, everything was just ok.

mnyBaRT-wyW4o02VegDvXQ.text: My husband was craving a Scottish draft beer here so I had 2 Hendrick's gin and tonics. We shared a bar bite serving  of  hummus and pita bread. Everything was really good and the service was excellent. Next time we'll have a meal.

Dw06lFYfEowHrdO0pFOOPA.text: Both of these stars go to the Sticky Toffee Pudding. That was AH-MAZING. Delicious, and enough for two people (or more, depending on how much you want to eat) to share.   Other that the Sticky Toffee Pudding, the restaurant is disappointing. We had a party of about 10, and a few of us were running late (Ceasar's is huge!). They would not seat the party until everyone is there. Who does that?! Then, once we ordered, it took them over an HOUR to bring out our food. I got the fish and chips, and it was mediocre. Nothing special, and definitely not special enough for the high price tag and the extra long wait. Save your time, go elsewhere.

WL-uLCyYyWnh5qdDulC5uQ.text: Let's get one thing clear: I'm not giving this restaurant a one star review for the food.  All four of us really enjoyed our dishes and I do highly recommend the steak and ale pie (which is what I ordered).  Now that that's out of the way, here's the main reason for my one star review:  THEY MADE MY WIFE CRY.  Why?  Because they served her an alcoholic drink when she ordered a virgin one.  While this doesn't sound like a big deal, it is.  She's pregnant.  She was crying, my in-laws (who didn't yet know and had to find out his way) were confused, and I was not happy.  The issue lies in that there is a drink on the non-alcoholic menu that has the same name as one on the alcoholic menu.  The confusion was almost guaranteed.  While we couldn't really taste the booze (it was a pretty weak fru-fru drink), we noticed on the bill.  This mistake was the feather on the cap because even getting into the restaurant was a pain.  We had 6pm reservations, but didn't get seated until almost 6:30.  That, too, was an issue because we had show tickets for 7:30pm.  To top it off, the incompetent hostess initially gave us a table for two when there was four people in our party.  Despite how good the food was, we'll never be back and probably won't patronize any of Ramsay's other establishments based upon the mistakes that were made at the Pub & Grill.

E4lmpUX2C6WwVuiDplGf0g.text: I consider myself being a patient person but when it's a disrespect, then hell no. I simply asked the hostess how long the wait was for a party of two, she writes my name down on a post-it and tells me to wait a second then disappears. I thought she was finding us a table and it felt like we were next to be seated but after seeing parties of 5, 3, 4 & 2 walk by us and seated instead, I simply asked her again what the wait time was and she forgot my name and lost the post-it. Never got a straight answer and could've easily waited there until they closed before getting noticed. I felt like we were being ignored and probably were. The place wasn't too busy and they were all walk-ins that came after us. I don't think they needed my business and I went elsewhere but I felt that issue alone was worth documenting. The food reviews are awful too...glad I didn't spend any money there.

jomUIdztVNfwmE2VKtx31g.text: Always a fun place to visit. They showed a championship fight during last visit, which was an unexpected bonus.  Most bartenders are very responsive and friendly.  Pigs in blanket a great appetizer, fish and chips top notch. Ketchup must be made in house. Really good. Lobster mac n cheese not so good. Not the decadent cheesiness I was longing for.

th9xnMqKAwsiLa45at7g_Q.text: A-OK, just like the rating is meant for.  Nothing special for what you're about to pay here.  It's not bad food either but it's just A-OK

pAUxz62Vy1VWZ6CHcvCpyA.text: Went in for drinks. My drink was wrong and severed without a smile and got doubled billed. Talked with manager he said well we are training it happens.

aEW62gFvcpkj2LN_OWvaUQ.text: Everything was PERFECT and DELICIOUS. Our server, Daisy, was great too. We all agreed there wasn't a single bad thing we could say about our experience. We had Lobster Rolls, ribeye steak, potatoes, and a steak and ale pot pie. Perfection at every turn.

Kds8WPxjbRR9MPVdVnxhUg.text: We had a very poor experience. Gordon needs to pay his own restaurant a visit. This was a kitchen nightmare!! They served is cold nachos, undercooked and cold sliders and then one burger had a hair in it. The atmosphere was fun and our server was good, but not great. The other items were okay but not worth the $20 per appetizer that we paid. Don't go. Go somewhere else. There are just too many places in Vegas you can spend your money! Like Bobby's burger palace near cvs and Monte Carlo. Much better and only about $10 for a burger!

tRnFJcKI5zoSJD0O8UN3rQ.text: My expectations for this place were fairly high, so I think I was a bit underwhelmed.  I came to Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill twice during my recent travels - once just for drinks and snacks and once for dinner.  With that, I think this is a great pub and a great place to have a drink.  For dinner... I would suggest spending your money somewhere else.  I loved the atmosphere and the bartenders all had sexy Irish accents, so that was a nice touch.  The drink selection is great as well.  The whole restaurant has a very rustic and homey feel to it.  The one time we came here for dinner I was underwhelmed by the food.  Mainly, because one person in our party ordered the mussels and at least half a dozen hadn't opened.  Anyone who knows anything about seafood should know that un-opened mussels usually means they're no good and a good chef should never let those out of the kitchen.  When we pointed that out to the server, we just got a shrug of the shoulders. Umm... ok?!  Honestly, I can't even remember what I ordered, so it wasn't that memorable.  My husband had the Shepherd's Pie and thought it was good.  With all the fantastic food choices in Vegas, I wouldn't waste my time here for dinner.  Just for drinks!

EEglX4zuJP4Vd-QhXjVTzw.text: Only 4 stars because it took forever to get our food. Just like in Hell's Kitchen! Oh, and you don't get any dinner rolls or bread while you wait for your food. So don't come here if your starving. You'll be waiting forever!!! But the food is good.
