zPBelJcUgdGZRU2rHbjUVw.text: Stopped there on a whim, my girlfriend ordered the hells kitchen burger which was excellent.  I had the shepards pie which was very good.  The service was excellent,but they did not have a birthday desert for my girlfriend.  We would come back here again when in Vegas.

6FhpnfsLBRRBgTQ6KomW6g.text: Must try the truffle fries and lamb burger ! Very delicious. Tried also the steak ale pie which was also good but will place the lamb burger and truffle fries above all. Best fries I've had

rK0cjSoSuAAOus2hyK_87w.text: This is the place! My husband and I stumbled upon this restaurant while walking around Caesars hotel. It was a Wednesday around 4pm and we were starving! We decided to go to Gordon's this was the best decision of our trip! It was happy hour ( runs from 2-6pm and includes half off of certain drinks and appetizers.) OMG I could not get passed the appetizer menu as it all sounded good. Good is an understatement I decided on the hellfire wings (spicy but delicious) and could not get enough of the sauce ! Then I had kettle chips which were topped with cheese , pulled pork and more, yummmm ! My husband got a burger which he claimed the best burger he has ever had!! Gordon he is hard to please but you did it!! After tasting everything, enjoying the atmosphere, the friendly wait staff and the signature cocktail obviously we went back another night for more!!! Gordon has multiple locations in Vegas that specialize in different dishes and it's easy to see why!!!

4NsLAAyn04CEuQanpjeeZw.text: The food and the service was amazing. I witnessed a waitress with a full plate of dirty dishes, drop some silverware- The fork prongs were facing up. She gently flipped it over with her foot and moved it to the side so no one would trip. THEN, one of the Bus Boys witnessed and ran over and took care of it. So Classy!!  I was super impressed!!

3Waewv5EBH_QFAWKVOU3zA.text: The food was good, but it was outrageously expensive.  We ordered fish and chips (excellent), a hamburger (ordered medium, which was practically raw), soft pretzels (quite nice!) and bacon wrapped dates.  The food was good, but not really much better than what you would find at any brewpub across the country.  Certainly not worth what we paid, however, that could be a Vegas thing and not a Gordon Ramsay thing.

s1MWwkBW5XlwKsKZHzqvZA.text: I am a big fan of Gordon Ramsey!  Definitely wanted to dine at one of his restaurants in Vegas this past weekend while celebrating our son's 21st birthday. We were very excited after viewing the menu prior.  Made reservations prior and loved the decor.  Once we were seated, the sorrow began... Our waiter was horrible.  my husband and son ordered a

wsbUjo9peT6GdLg-mb9Y2w.text: I had already eaten at Gordon Ramsay's Burgr the day before, so when I ran into this place going through Caesar's Palace, I decided to try it. I had the Kettle Chip Nachos for an appetizer. I was surprised how large it was (his apps in Burgr were really small). I couldn't finish it, but it was amazing. For my entree, I ordered my favorite UK dish: Shepherd's Pie. It was served in a round bowl, which I felt looked a little small compared to other's I had ordered in other places, But it was a deeper bowl too. It was really alot. I did finish that because it was too damn good, but I did stuff myself. Funny, I was sitting next to a large group of Caesar's workers dressed as various Romans along with other impersonators such as Dean Martin, Elvis and Sammy Davis, all having drinks.  Weird but cool.

D-4y0iyYAk7A0ga-wO2BzA.text: As huge Chef Ramsay fans, my family and I had to stop here for lunch during our trip Vegas! I had the Fish & Chips while my family had the rack of lamb, scallops, and we shared a side of basmati rice. Everything, as expected, was AMAZING. The Gordon Ramsay name obviously comes with a price tag, but the food completely lived up to the hype and was well worth the money!  Great environment (def captures the English Pub vibe, but with a modern twist), VERY friendly and helpful staff, and to top off the experience, Chef Ramsay ended up following me on Twitter. (Humble Brag -- Sorry, not sorry.)

IWEHPcqkQFr4fN5b-_ebuQ.text: Just had my annual lamb burger and, as usual, it was cooked perfectly and delicious.  The service was quick and friendly and the truffle chips were good but not quite hot enough when served.  This is my 5th or 6th time here and it's pretty consistent.  I've had their sliders and corned beef sandwich as well and all were good.  Of course it's a little $$, but it's in Vegas so you expect to pay $21 for a burger.

bYQTBGeX8nvmJ_qwgKPHyQ.text: The food was amazing, the service was extraordinary! Kerry, our server was fantastic. She was extremely helpful not only with the food but also the tourist attractions to visit in Las Vegas. The  sticky toffee pudding dessert is a must have! The BEST dessert I have ever tried. Extremely satisfied with my experience :).

mJ-cqL6ZcaKCX359QVrCLQ.text: OMG!!  I couldn't wait to write my review for this place. For one I love Gordon Ramsay and this is the first time I've been to any of his restaurants!    My awesome friend and I came here after shopping and the service was great.  Our servers name was Mike and he was really tentative and provided great input for the drinks and food on the menu.    Based on his recommendation I ordered the Pub Crawl... I was in the mood for something where I could taste the alcohol.  I never had bourbon and I wanted to try something new... Definitely a great recommendation Mike, both my friend and I really enjoyed it.  My friend had a beer, I have no idea what it's called, just came in a cool gray bottle (I don't drink beer, but it's there fav one so I'm glad they had it there)  So the food.. Uhh so good. For the Starters or App we had the Pork and Duck Rillettes.  That was delicious.  I will say it was interesting as well b/c I've never had anything like it.  For the real deal we had the Fish and Chips and the Grilled Lamb Burger... OMG the burger was the kind that melts in your mouth... We took Mike's recommendation on ordering it medium... Yeah that was good.  I was a little nervous ordering fish and chips b/c I didn't think they could be any different, but once again Mike was right and the fish was amazing.  The breading melts in your mouth and doesn't fall off the fish.. Tartar sauce was good with it, and the peas were more for decoration for me, but they were actually seasoned well too.  I know Ramsay and he would have expected nothing less than perfection at one of his restaurants.  I can't wait to go back on my next visit!!  We were definitely in food heaven going here!!  I will save a little room for dessert on round 2 and I will try some of Ramsay's other places on the next visit.

wa3vsUMyM-wFN7Lrvjtu4Q.text: I ate four times at at Ramsey pub and grill at caesars palace during my stay. Great beer selection. The bangers and mashed is excellent. The blt was just ok. The pulled pork tastes just like tuna. The barkeeps were friendly knowledgeable and fun. The prices were were reasonable for the strip. Cheers.

d_t_lJitDFgoN4UrHfW3Vw.text: Just a quick bite to eat early in the evening but enjoyed the bar and appetizers we had.  Drinks were good and the atmosphere was perfect for pre-gaming.  Hard to give more than four stars simply because we weren't there long enough but there's no reason I wouldn't go back.

Q4T9nQBnMUXisD6U0C6Lbw.text: When it comes to British-themed gastropubs in the US, this is as good as it gets. Of course, it doesn't come anywhere close to Ramsey's original gastropubs, the Devonshire in Chiswick and the Narrow in Limehouse, London but that's not unexpected.  The menu is a delightful mix of classic British pub favorites and simple seasonal dishes seasoned with a sense of humor; so, if you expect to find fine or upscale dining, you'll likely be disappointed. While the service is an odd mix of attitude, amateurishness, and friendliness, we did enjoy the large selection on tap and some very decent food. I found it silly that they won't let you sub a side dish on a $60 prix-fix that features ordinary dishes from the regular menu but life's too short to worry about that. Also, I'm not a fan of casual restaurants where there's no salt and pepper on the table - even though I'm very unlikely to actually salt my food, I'd like to have the option should I ever wish to do so. This practice has nothing to do with the food or the guests, it's all about the chef's ego. On the bright side, I found it very comforting to have European soccer on and enjoyed some kick-ass music playing.   All in all, be open minded, come to Ramsay's Pub & Grill, don't expect a fine dining experience but rather enjoy a decent casual dinner, have a pint and have a laugh. Also, give yourself a break and stop imagining what GR would or wouldn't do if he were there for you might find you actually enjoy the experience for what it is. (And stop looking for the salt shaker already.)

IwEm__8iBe1TAE59eKq0ZQ.text: Disappointing at best. Food cold. I sent mine back and they microwaved it I think. Unremarkable in every way except the overpricing. Boo.

yxeTGNVfulHzQLuY2p-zdQ.text: Our group of 6 wanted to try this place for the first time so tonight we went for dinner. Most of us were ordering a burger when were told that they did not have any, but the server did offer us lamb burger as a substitute...How can a restaurant such as this one not have any burgers left on Labor Day weekend?! We left the restaurant and will not be coming back!

xgUz0Ck4_ciNaeIk-H8GBQ.text: I loved this place. Easily the most hipsters per square inch of any place in Vegas.  I sat at the bar and watched the NBA playoffs and ordered some brews and a burger. The staff was attentive and engaging but not in a cheesy way. The atmosphere was cordial and inviting with some good talent in the hostess and waitress department. The burger was so outstanding I came back two and a half hours later drunk and ordered the Shepard's pie, which was a life changing experience. If you're in Vegas and want a affordable great meal you should definitely hit this place up.

idDn5DBSCDhBnxbffjFDsw.text: Well it was my husbands birthday and to treat him to a nice dinner we decided on the newly opened Gordon Ramsay's Pub and Grill.  I had made reservations for 8pm, but we arrived around 7:30pm. There was a bit of a back up at the hostess booth. They were having trouble deciding who to seat first and there wasn't really in order to it. A little bit chaotic if you ask me, especially for a Gordon Ramsay restaurant. The restaurant is definitely British themed, no doubt about that. There were a few TV's playing the various games, but other than the medium size bar and the wall of empty kegs, nothing screamed pub. Once we were seated, they gave us the Ipad which had the drinks menu on it. I was fine with water, but my husband ordered a 20 oz Innis and Gunn. His drink was brought over fairly quickly and we decided to order the appetizer, while we decided on our main course. We ordered the pork belly entree to share as a starter. After deciding what we wanted to eat, we placed our menu's down on the table. Our server  came by and took them away without asking or getting our order! I had to flag her down to ask her to bring them back so we could order our food. A few moments after we ordered our entrees, our pork belly arrived. I had noticed that every other table around us had received bread, so I asked if we could get some bread. She said she had put out order for the bread in. We were almost finished with the pork belly roll, with pea puree which was very tasty, when our bread arrived. Around this time the server came over to refill our water glasses, she touched the spout of the water pitcher (which looks like a clear wine bottle) to the rim of my cup. Lucky, she had not refilled my husbands water, so I switched and drank out of his. When she came over to refill 'his' glass, she again touched the rim. I was able to waive down a bus boy and get a straw. Our dinner arrived and I decided to focus on that. I had ordered the lamb, while my husband had ordered the mixed grill, which included, filet, pork belly and shrimp. I had ordered my lamb medium and I felt and that it was on the well side, and I also thought that it tasted burnt. It was charred after all, but my husband tasted it and said it tasted fine. My taste buds are extremely sensitiveness at the moment, so I decided to let it go. My husband was happy with his dish, but the side dishes that we ordered to share got mixed reviews. We ordered the carrots, two ways (roasted and pureed) and the mashed potatoes. Neither side dish was served with a spoon. Keep in mind these are family style dished. Luckily, we didn't mind sharing. So we had to use our forks to get the carrot puree and the mashed potatoes out of the dishes. I was by no means happy about this and than the server came over to refill my water for the third time she not only touched the rims of the glasses but also the straws. In addition every time the server came over to our table she bent down so her face was at my level. I did not like this, especially when she was at the table next to us. When she bent over to them, her butt was in our faces. Not very lady like and not very professional at all. I was pretty much fed up with her service at this point. I walked to the front and asked to speak with the manager. I ended up waiting at the front for at least 5 minutes while being repeatedly told that the manager was on her way. When she finally arrived, I informed her what was going on in regards to our water glasses, and said I didn't appreciate that at all. I also questioned the method of serving side dished without spoons and she said that side dishes were not served with spoons. She said that she would follow me back to the table and observe. I thought the least she would do is have someone bring us new water glasses.  After a few minutes of waiting and never receiving new glasses, the server came over to ask what we wanted for dessert. We turned down dessert and asked for the check. The check in case you were wondering was not discounted in any way and was close to $200. I have now been to "Steak" four time, and always rave about it to my friends. Everyone was waiting for my review on the Pub and Grill and I will not be raving about this to anyone. I was so disappointed. Yes, I understand it is a Pub and Grill, it is not Steak, but I think that a little professional can go a long way- especially considering the prices at just a 'pub!' Little things like touching my water glass and then the glasses next tables and back again, doesn't make me very happy. Also serving side dishes that need spoons, without spoons??? This restaurant has a long way to go.  Not Impressed

N9zko73jDpNzwb7LIP6Twg.text: The food is always great! As a local the possibilities are endless but i always seem to choose Gordon Ramsey for pub food! Service is always great and atmosphere takes it over the top! Keep up the good work!

f4mHxK7LNbPWIqi4-cjeJA.text: Really underwhelming. My husband's pot pie was a disappointment. My onion soup was marginal. We are unlikey to try it again.

_3P2gFhn950VK3GoJ8jp2w.text: I have visited Chef Ramsay's other restaurant in town Gordon Ramsay Steak several times so I had high expectations.  We got in without a reservation which was great. Service was just ok.  We are locals and the waiter honestly seemed more interested in finding out our opinion about the city such as houses and where to live as he was new in town.  He was friendly, however he didn't do very much as a server. Once we got our food he was pretty much gone.  The food was honestly a disappointment.  I ordered the Shepard's pie.  Gordon Ramsay is always talking about his Shepard's pie so I wanted something great.  What I got was eh...ok.  It really was just pot roast with severely undercooked crunchy semi-raw veggies topped with un seasoned mash potatoes.  Good idea but severely poorly executed.  The pot roast was super watery making the dish a big mushy mess.  Having ordered sticky toffee pudding from Gordon Ramsay Steak and absolutely loving it, I thought I would order it here and maybe find a possibly cheaper fix to my craving.  I was disappointed.  Sadly the pudding was overcooked and hard chewy on the outside and dry inside.  The place has a good concept, but the wait staff is lacking and the kitchen staff is lacking execution. Next time I want to an English Pub in Vegas, I'll head over to the Crown and Anchor on Tropicana.  A quarter of the price, and taste better.

3yTXCA7lWrZ79xlMSusThQ.text: On Sunday September 15th I entered into the bar area at Ramsey's and asked the Bartender if they can change the station to a specific game I was interested in. The bartender refused to change the station because he was a chargers fan. He was wearing a chargers leather helmet at the time. When we asked to speak to a manager it took over 20 min for Casey who was the manager to arrive and she argued with us about changing the station instead of complying with our customer request. In addition when I asked the hostess in front for a manager she said there were a lot of managers on duty and one of the managers is Brandy. When I asked Casey about this she claimed there was no manager there named Casey. We ended up leaving the bar very upset at the level of unprofessionalism displayed at this establishment by the staff and management. I suggest that Corporate management start sponsoring customer service training for all staff members at this establishment.

65pnDdFqmWghA2bMCvxrIQ.text: I had an excellent experience at this pub. The decor, service and food were all great. I particularly enjoyed the fish & chips!

oBGQQNBP5PsD7VDgnQmsTA.text: Overpriced mediocre food. I really didn't enjoy the food and no matter what do no order the beet salad! By far the worst one I've had! So disappointed.....

zqLUgmJPuaE9ll9AsVAlsw.text: Last minute choice!!! Tired after 20 hours of travel - we were looking to eat and get up to room! Every where else wanted us to have a long dining experience! This seemed perfect- great hostess - but the fun began with Rodney! He cheered us up In a flash - so nice, kind and efficient!!! And then the food arrived - the butternut squash soup was fabulous!!! And the short ribs were just as yummy!! A light shared meal which was at we wanted! But Rodney made our night! He was beyond kind and energy to boot! Truly lightened our night!  Found the manager and told him and he was just as nice!  The food-  the staff - wish we had another night to have gone back!  We even loved the silverware!   Gordon knocked this place our of the park if you just want great food - great staff and to enjoy your dining partner in an atmosphere that lets you see the traffic of people but is not overwhelming!!! Thanks RODNEY!! We are coming back to you next trip!!!

84wv3Ft4hrslSrgS74gXMw.text: My wife and I watching every season of Hell's Kitchen religiously since the very first season.  So when we were in Vegas we had to come visit this restaurant since it is where the winner Jeanelle (sp?) will be working starting August 14th I believe.  We were quite excited to come here with our friends and my two children.  We had reservations and when we got there we noticed all of the tables that seat more than 2 people use only high backless stools for chairs.  My youngest is 4 years old and while she could sit up there fine it was not something I really wanted to chance.  There were two cocktail type tables in the middle of the restaurant that were open but they said at first that we cannot sit there because there is no server for those tables.  Really on a friday night you dont have servers for all your tables?  Seemed a bit fishy to me but in the end we were able to sit there although after waiting 15 minutes we had to go back to the hostesses and say the waiter they said would help us still has not shown up.  Once he did show up our waiter was good but not anything special in the least.  The drinks were ok, one of us had a blueberry smash and I had a grapefruit drink from the cocktail menu.  Both again were good but at $15 I thought were a bit overpriced.  I will only speak for my own meal and I got the flat iron steak which was $30+.  When I received it, it looked liked 5 sliced small pieces of steak.  I couldnt believe that for that price the portion was so small.  All in all I think we were all let down by this restaurant mostly for its lack of value, slow and not that friendly service and seating arrangements.

H6r5WnnOVBV2djESFhUm9Q.text: First - the food is exceptional. The problem is with the front-of-house and overall presentation. Arrived 6pm and the place was 75% empty. Seating only by reservation! We had to cool our heels 15 minutes because they do not accept walk up business! I suppose this keeps out the riff-raff but it also keeps out customers. The bimbo squad that act as greeters/seaters are just that - bimbos. Fairly attractive and none too smart or just not well trained. Or both. The drink menu is presented to you on an iPad but the size of drink involved and the pricing does not match what they offer you! Attempted an $8.75 25oz. Newcastle draft off the iPad but could only order a pint at $7.75! Pints were not even on the iPad menu! They mention that this is a 'craft' beer place but it must be relegated to the bottled section as the draft selection is pretty pedestrian. Did I mention the food is outstanding? No doubt, this is what kept this at a 4-star rating. But they serve the entrees in a plate that is almost like a bowl. This makes cutting meat a bit of a challenge. The 2-seat tables are pretty small with little room to manage all the glasses, bread plates, raised wooded placemats, etc AND the freaking iPad. Service was decent by the wait staff. The decor does not match the hype. It is pretty boring and almost ugly unless half-kegs of beer as wall art is your thing. From place settings to 'reservation only' seating this is as far from a friendly, down-to-earth pub as one can imagine. I suspect Gordon Ramsay was involved in the menu and the overall licensing of his name/image and that is about it as part of his overall Harrah's deal. This location in Caesar's was Bradley Ogden's which was an overall brilliant restaurant across the board. Too bad it was replaced with this - which boasts as friendly and inviting but really isn't. But this is all about the food and the food is OUTSTANDING. Just don't expect a Michelin experience.

65Lv5AYQiprLeWrqjG6Cqw.text: My wife originally wanted to go to the steak house at the Paris but once we realized it was going to be About $400 for lunch we opted for the Pub. First impressions nice atmosphere clean bright vibrant. We sat down with our daughter and waited about 20 minutes for a server to come. I was hungry and went straight away for the toad in the hole and the diver scallops I told the waiter I had not had toad in the hole in over 20 yrs. he explained it was not traditional at which I realized it was basically a pig in a blanket. I changed my order to scotch egg and chicken curry my wife had fish and chips. When the waiter eventually came with the food all at the same time I think a quail egg was used for the scotch egg I got scallops instead of the curry. My wife's food was okay at best for $16 F&E but they cost $30. Scallops overlooked. $180 for two and a half peeps with two drinks each. A lot of dosh for bad nosh, Done!!!!!!!

O38AMLvDVGCxoxQtELDAgA.text: Gordon Ramsay needs to take his name off this mess. The beer selection is great. The service was decent. The portions were small... small portions at a pub? The food was nothing special. 4 non spectacular dinners and two small beers $140. Dollar for dollar the worst disappointment of the trip. We ate foot long hot dogs within two hours in the forum shops. Next time I will spend a little more money and eat somewhere nice or spend a little less and eat at a real pub.

DF3zuNfQo-sd7EN8172u7w.text: I popped in here one week-night, when there were no vendor-sponsored blow-outs lined up for the conference I was attending. The place was crazy busy, and the two hostess babes on duty looked me up and down, and basically said 'no way!' I walked on back to the bar, and eventually wrangled a barstool. I eventually managed to  order what sounded like an intriguing cask-aged 'London Style' Porter from the over-whelmed, inattentive barmen-- which at $13 a pint, was sort of like a watery stout, not any Porter I have previously encountered.  I next decided to double-down and ordered the Pub Pretzels, Pub Burger, and chips.  The Pretzels were pretty good.  The burger was a huge, decently cooked patty, while the 'chips' were mildly soggy steak fries.  So, basically $40+ for a burger and a beer left me feeling liked I had been conned -- even by Las Vegas standards!  If you want pub food, go see The Man -- Hubert Keller's Burger Bar (or even Fleur) further down The Strip will treat you right, and send you on your way happy!

s5StnPmU9vmPQcCVnZ914g.text: Another Gordon Ramsay experience.. I have to admit I liked the food here better Gordon Ramsay Steak.  Had the short ribs.. a sucker for them anytime they are on the menu.. and my husband and daughter had the fish and chips.  I will take the short ribs here over the steakhouse anytime! The fish and chips.. I expected more from the "chips" seemed like frozen french fries to me!  But alas.. the toffee pudding makes everything better.  Two down one to go.. Burgr see you next time I'm in Vegas!

Dn2bvnMh9rlNE9m1KNaO9Q.text: Overpriced.  I only went here because someone else was paying.  Average quality food for a ridiculously high price.  But to be honest, even if Ramsay himself cooked me a dish I doubt I'd be terribly wowed.  He's more of a TV geek with an overly fake bad attitude than he is a chef.  If he spoke to me the way he speaks to some of the people on the show I'd straight up knock him out.  What a waste of time.  I ended up eating a few bites and giving the rest to my brother.  Had a couple McDonald's double cheeseburgers right after we left.

Z346f09A-9ga9VTEfnSQcw.text: Our Bartender Ronny was amazing, the food was outstanding, what a nice place to stop in and enjoy fine dinning

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Truffle Fries

7BXh67QVFJwuyEsRBPyt_A.text: For me, every time I'm visiting Vegas is a tradition to come to the Pub & Grill. Can't beat the sticky toffee pudding. The food is awesome too! Highly recommended! Make sure Nong is your server, he's awesome!

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States

fp1T12QzZjMJqgZHQYqUZQ.text: We were visiting my daughter in Las Vegas and wanted to enjoy dinner together.  We picked Gordon Ramsey's Bar and Grill since we wanted to try his famous beef wellington he fusses about on TV.  The place is extremely noisy, had a hard time visiting and catching up.  aBeer and wine were just okay while waiting for the food.  Finally our beef wellington arrived and to our shock it was overdone.  We ordered one rare and the other medium rare.  They both came out at best medium well.  Showed the server and she told us that the chef had told her that it could not be cooked rare or medium rare otherwise the pastry would burn.  HUH.  My daughter is a pastry chef in LV and was so mad with statement from the chef, the pastry was Burnt.  I think he knew it was bad but told server that to make an excuse for the Horrible beef wellington.  I had to send mine back, my daughter was too hungry to wait that long again.  When the new one came out it was decent, not rare but possibly medium rare with the pastry looking good and NOT burnt like the first one and was not hard and burnt like the first one.  That chef should be fired by Ramsey like on TV, he had no idea how to cook a dish that Ramsey always fusses about and if known for.  Only good thing was the truffle fries.  When we got the bill, they did not even comp one of the horrible beef wellingtons let alone maybe our drinks.  For the price a little PR should have been given.  This place is one of the worse places in LV to eat at.

WT_wLW7xORToeMhHARsMiA.text: The food is amazing here. Ask for server Sara. She is enthusiastic and very friendly. She along with the food made the experience perfect. Highly recommend the shepherd's pie. Also the mac and cheese is creamy and perfect.

KzJ4j_7_Tf4KB7PAzMZDdA.text: Due to a snafu with another restaurant we ended up at Gordon Ramsay's Pub for brunch. I think it was a happy accident because I loved all the food. We had pigs in a blanket (sausage rolls) and deviled eggs for apps. The sausages were fat and juicy and delicious with the spicy mustard and HP sauce. I ordered a Goodbye Blue Sky cocktail, it was fabulous but probably more suited to someone who likes their drinks tart versus super sweet.  For entrees we had, Braised Short Rib with cheddar mash, Fish and Chips, and Steak and Ale pie. Let me tell you, i t was probably one of the best short ribs I've ever had. It just fell apart and perfectly meaty and savory. I was trying to sop up every bit of gravy on the plate. The fish was perfectly light and flaky, chips appropriately fried potato-y, and the mushy peas as expected. My mum hates them, I think they are great. My DH enjoyed his pie, the crust was nice and buttery. At this point I moved on to one of their cocktails they were offering as a special. When my mum went to order a margarita the server recommended the Napa Valley. I tasted it and in turn wanted one too. It was sweet and I very easily polished it off.  Moving on to dessert we ordered the sticky toffee pudding and a Mocha Martini. Pudding aficionados of the world, look no further. This is the one. Dark brown butter overtones, rich caramel flavour, and yet still light and spongy, this is a dessert lovers dream come True. I devoured it like I hadn't eaten in days.  The service was interesting. The server only delivered our bar orders, the rest was brought by food runners. The restaurant seemed a little short staffed but they managed to still be very attentive. I never got to have my martini, but the server apologised profusely (was not a problem) and she took it off the bill. I will definitely come here again and take advantage of the happy hour prices!

Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fish and Chips with mushy peas

KdXJWghM4fcsEa1F1c7r5g.text: So good! Lots of options in Vegas but don't pass this one up. Fun atmosphere and great food. I had the fish and chips. The fish was cooked to perfection and so soft in contrast to the fried outside. Fries were on point' I'll be back for sure!

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States

YOAA4Lg9cTVaGpg5i9uk9g.text: The waiter was very slow. I had to ask twice for my drink and the second time he was weird about me asking. There was a woman walking around and filling waters and clearing plates and she was very friendly. The food was disappointing. I feel bad rating poorly but I think Gordon would want honest reviews. The chicken was dry and had little flavor. Portions are pretty small and that can be typically of a higher priced restaurant so I wasn't annoyed by that..except the food wasn't high quality. I honestly feel like I could have better at a chain restaurant then here. Gordon, pop into this place unexpectedly. Maybe have someone else do it so they don't recognize you and try harder on your meal.

K0QfoVcC-0Pd53aHufEeWQ.text: Ramon, Keith and "juice" had great customer service. I had the 24oz ribeye and it was fantastic!

3IPq9TG576YZBNKf53WPVw.text: Sadly I basically live in Vegas due to work but this place makes the best Moscow mule in town!   Charlie, Keith and Nong are amazing! They basically know me by first name since I come here so often, I only come once a month but I make it a point to come here every trip. They make the best drinks and great to chat with when sitting at the bar!  Items to get, Moscow mule, kettle nachos, salmon toast, and can't forget goodbye blue sky! If you have room the bread pudding! But if you love Moscow mules come here!

v3zRWRBuIhgjpHu9MnsSIQ.text: Whenever my brother is in town we always eat here. We have eaten here at least 6 times now. Everything I've had had been excellent. I've had the Ribeye, wagyu, butter chicken, pork chop, beef pot pie, and finally the hellfire wings. The hellfire wings are some of the best wings I've ever had. They are the perfect balance of heat and flavor. The toffee dessert is awesome also. When we eat there I bring my two daughters, 4 years old and 8 months, the servers go out of their way to make my daughter chocolate milk by "borrowing" from the bar. GREAT service every time. I will always recommend this restaurant to friends and family. As most people that live in Vegas I don't frequent the "strip" but I make an exception for this great restaurant! One last thing save room for the sticky toffee pudding. It's mine and my daughters favorite dessert!

A7wHvIVagmSDsLW8yx4vkg.text: Derek, the manager, allowed us to order pretzels even when it was off the dinner menu which was very kind. Our server, Noug was very attentive and answered all of our questions. Would definitely come back!

hAHgLlVWAKagpkYIusLMSA.text: The  mustard is everything.  Great beer selection, however, it  was way over priced even for Vegas. Pretzels and strawberry dessert were awful. When the staff member took my quarter eaten strawberry dessert I told him how awful it was and he told me I should have gotten the toffee one instead of offering to replace it.  Very disappointed.

YGuOBXfcN2jWc76Pqolcag.text: Came here for a taste of the UK which we had just visited. Fish and chips for me which was quite good. Fish had a good batter and wasn't oily. Waiter said they had changed their process recently. The mashed peas were some of the best I've had. Chips (fries) were pretty good and a good size portion. My wife had the Steak Ale pie and she loved it. I tasted it and thought it was very good as well. My one complaint is value. Pretty pricey place, but not too out of the norm for Vegas. My wife and one beer for $12. Two lunches, plus the beer came to $85 with tip. Same lunch anywhere but Vegas or NYC would probably be $50 tops.

5f91DrujeFOzVovjWp-XJw.text: I went it for a quick bite, which that quick bite lasted well over an hour. How in the world can one sit at the bar and have so many things go wrong: forgot to put in order, forgot I wanted a beer, forgot to even check on me or my food for over 20 minutes. I was way too happy to be in Vegas to raise a stink, but man this place needs work!

xwNXoCvGzCbP8x3QKg3MnA.text: ITS FUCKING RAW. (Jk)  Huge fan of the guy, but thought the Gordon Ramsey restaurant hype was bullshit. I was very wrong haha.  Amazing food and next level quality of service.  They remade a macaroni dish which I didn't know (because I was buzzed and not reading) it had lobster upon ordering (which my friend was allergic to) and it came out not too long after the request.  My server asked me if I wanted a seat with a softer cushion, what kinda nice chik-fil-A shit is that?

2YamXrLDzpcIqaOra1fKXw.text: Happy Hour starts early in Vegas.  The lobster and shrimp rolls were awesome but not as awesome as truffle frites.   Get the 35oz beer great value.   Good service   Great food!!!!

ER69AUNNnYVSApjRald5rA.text: Christopher Lee is great!!!!  The staff are very friendly and the quality of the food is amazing. I'll definitely be back again.

xyp9lJbiqZ1nAx7Sbosh2A.text: I usually do takeout from this place. Best item: Chicken pesto sandwich with fries instead of potato chips. The lobster roll and brussel sprouts are good too. Staff at the bar is amazing!

tFXASi86-lAe2QeTyLJhqw.text: Eh- wouldn't come here again or recommend to any friends.  My friends and I ordered the ribeye, the calamari, brussel sprouts, and shepherds pie. First off, they had gotten our order wrong and had not offered to fix it. We had ordered the bone-in ribeye, which was the special they had, and the server had not heard that we said "bone-in" and served us the regular ribeye. When we were first brought out our food, we informed them of this, but rather than fixing their mistake, they brought out the same steak and insisted that this is what we ordered....  Ribeye: fine, cooked perfectly to medium rare Calamari: soggy and way too salty Brussel sprouts: over cooked and soggy Shepherds pie: good  Overall, the service was OK and the food was average and way overpriced. Not worth coming to.

Nwc431xHRg7-flbqjrvDKA.text: I came here with a group of work friends due to a conference that we were attending. The service was quick and friendly. The menu had all of the standard English pub style entrees, plus some more bar food type options for finicky friends.   The lobster mac and cheese is super cheesy. They will even dust it with fresh parmesan for you. The pot pies are freshly baked and served bubbling.Flavors were spot on.  Helpings are HUGE!

smGfEngiO74Plk84VYXAbQ.text: I watch Gordon's Kitchen Nightmares show on BBC and was really interested in checking out one of his establishments to see if his product lives up to his name. I remember a show where he stated if you can't make good fish and chips at an english pub your in trouble, so that's what I had to have. Spot on great! The dill tarter sauce was so good I had to ask for more. The Cod was batter fried to perfection. The deserts were incredible.  I live in Texas and can't wait to get back to Vegas to have another go at some of the other items on the menu. Wow, What a treat!

4spDZXOhpyGKlKQ7v-uPUg.text: The four of us thoroughly enjoyed our experience here. While I did not like the decor much, the service was excellent, no problems whatsoever.  The pretzels with the dipping sauce were very tasty, and difficult to stay away from.  Our party ordered the Scottish salmon, two orders of Fish and Chips, and the rack of lamb.  All entrees were praised, although the Fish and chips were a bit too salty for one of us. The rack of lamb was the best I have ever tasted. I also really loved the Ramsay tonic cocktail, and am still searching the internet for a recipe for it.  The cocktail was exactly what I expected from Gordon - imaginative, a bit innovative, and delicious.  We all the had the sticky toffee pudding and it did not disappoint.  it was not a cheap meal, but worth it.

JN8J2wNRZLDu0r2cgro7nA.text: My first time eating here and it was amazing!!!! I ordered the Dublin corned beef sandwich and I was AMAZING!!!  Definitely a must when inside Caesars Palace. .

vMcxZhJnwL9oMvOXrhkv3g.text: First of all Gordon, please give Scott (our waiter) a raise!!! What a great experience we had at your restaurant.  We loved every part of it.  Ordered the fish and chips and everything was perfect.  Cooked just right.   We would come here again next time in Vegas!!

ZYq3rpWxHzKOnqV5Q1xt_A.text: Not a lot of hesitation in wanting to try some of Chef Ramsay's tasty treats; however, after bellying up to the bar for a couple drinks and a bite, I can say that I was more than pleasantly surprised by the drink & pub menu!   Our drinks were fantastic! I had the Ramsay Tonic & my date had the Innis & Gunn draft. We ordered up the Truffle Chips & Deviled Eggs much to our delight, as everything was better than anticipated. So much so, that we downed our appetizers & declared a round trip after seeing Elton John perform.   Upon our return for additional drinks, we had the opportunity to meet & thank Chef Ramsay for a great experience.   Saving the best for last... I will say that our bartender, Brandon, was beyond friendly, insightful, attentive, and gracious. He truly made time to make us feel welcome despite how busy he was. He provided drink and food suggestions, & also pointed us in the right direction for a fun filled night of gambling.    I'd give five stars; however, given our limited time to dine, I'll leave that for our next visit where we try more of the menu!!

A4caA7jTJvn8MFs2GvXbJw.text: Very unimpressive. Dinner time and not overly busy. Seated promptly. Waiter 1 arrived with menus. We were in the bar and a guy was eating a burger. We read menu.... pork, veal, lamb, pork, pork ... duck. No burger. Waiter 2 comes by and we ask about burger and part of lunch menu. We can order but will take 30 minutes or more to get them since prep staff not present. 2 of 4 of us order burgers, 1 gets hanger steak and 1 gets fish and chips. We have empty drinks and not asked about refills. Ordered drinks with waiter 1 and drinks no show. Order drinks with waiter 2 and get 10 minutes later. When waiter 2 returns with the burgers but no hanger steak or fish and chips. Then drinks arrive from waiter 2, as we watched our drinks from waiter 1 sit on the bar for 30 minutes. Waiter 1 starts to deliver our drinks 5 minutes later and does an about face before arriving at our table when he sees the drinks on the table. But no one asks the other guys in our party if they want refills. I started this review on my Smart Phone which I had for a week and wasn't used to typing on it and now I am finishing it up a month and half later. But the upshot was it was one of the most unusual and memorable (not in a good way) dining experiences I ever had. I thought of filling out a card for management as I left, but I couldn't find one. I asked the hostess and she looked at me like I had 3 heads and a tail.

eGJlqG9jihxcWjY_v0iDGg.text: Amazing! We stopped in for some food and drinks while visiting Vegas on 9/5/14. Our server was very accommodating and suggested a cucumber wine spritzer that was out of this world. The lobster roll, sliders and clams were all delicious! The manager stopped to check on our table, we were so impressed with our service we told him he needs to get our server a raise. Awesome atmosphere, will be back for sure

mAPvOdySSnoUj_Xdxc3Kag.text: Nope.  Sat at bar and watched each order get screwed up mine included.  Steak was tough and salty , veg over cooked. Fries wilted.  Honestly, I have been to Ramsay at Clairidges and doubt he has ever set foot in here recently.  Oh yes very expensive. Las Vegas always falls down on food.

g0zdiSOMf5vtD4BdUGUkyg.text: My boyfriend and I went to Las Vegas together for the first time, this was also our first vacation together and we have been together going on 10 years. The one and only place I really wanted to go to was Gordon's Pub and Grill. We drove straight through the night from the Seattle area to be able to get there with enough time to enjoy all of the sights. Let me tell you that this was by far the biggest disappointment. I have watched EVERY show this man has EVER done and I am the biggest fan, all I wanted to do was taste his food. I ordered an 8oz steak medium rare and it was supposed to come with potatoes and seasonal vegetables. Well I got my steak and vegetables(no potatoes) my steak was rare and cold so I had to hunt down our waiter to put it back on the grill for a bit longer. He was very rude and said that I should have ordered it medium...uh no you should have just cooked it medium rare like I asked and delivered it warm not cold. When I did get it back I still had no potatoes but the steak was perfect. My waiter never did return, instead a runner named Chris brought my food out and was very nice. He even checked back with me to make sure it was good. Throughout the meal we had obviously drank all of our drinks but still no waiter. We ended up calling the manager over and he was gracious enough to comp my boyfriends meal. This only happened because he had only eaten a few bites because his burger was also under done but he didn't want to create even more of a scene than I had. All in all I would say that I wouldn't eat at this pub again do to the rudest service I had ever experienced(keep in mind that I eat in Seattle usually so I am used to larger cities and the fact that they get busy) At the end of our meal I finally found our waiter at a table filled with all women, I guess flirting was more of a priority.  I wish I had a better experience this will most likely be the last vacation I get in a long time.

TTeJc7iuEgzrBPJqvt8m6A.text: Mixed review for me.  The service was great, from the manager Zeus and waiter, Ali to the bartenders.  However the food was nothing exceptional.  Had pub shots (mini hamburgers) for appetizer, grilled asparagus for side dish (grilled well) and filet mixed grill.  The mixed grill wasn't worth the price.  Needed a touch of salt, but for the prices charged, shouldn't need anything.  Though I'll admit the sauces were good.    Love the pub crawl.  Not much of a bourbon fan, but the pub crawl could change that.  Excellent drinks.  Overall a disappointment.  Over priced food, but drinks and service exceptional.  Not a total loss, but definitely room for improvement.  Just need to tweek seasoning.

crtmf_gK68nnUoYDLmdCsA.text: The food and service were a-mazing. Well done Chef, well done! Had the sticky toffee pudding. Was the best thing with sauce to die for.

RGuuKDooK5_M1LkYwHfSHg.text: Had dinner with my wife last evening. Tenderloin steak was way under seasoned. asparagus was not even cooked. mashed potatoes were cold upon arrival. Short ribs were fatty and under seasoned.  And the audacity to not have salt and pepper on the table while serving such bland fare is ridiculous. this is not a 5 star place. Service was perfunctory at best. Busboy cleared plates by piling them up in front of us!!  Really. We will not be back. Oh and the bill for 2 of us with no alcohol was $94.00. Yikes.

4vA-ejoSbQF4vumhPSDGRA.text: Gordon needs to come down and re train his staff, when asked, the waitress told me marjoram was a mushroom (it is a spice). The pie came stogey and dry as hell, I didn't mind the small portion if it was going to be tasty. Then we were handed someone else's bill at the end to pay - what a waste of a meal that could gave been had elsewhere!

erpkwbIOLDmUZ_cs2DMlZw.text: Service was excellent! I ordered the duck confit as an app.  Received about 1 tablespoon of duck and a bucket of fries.  VERY disappointing for the price.   I ordered the  shepherd's pie.  Flavorful, but so dry.  It needed some kind of sauce. My wife ordered the lamb burger.  It was so dry, she dipped it in her ketsup. Side of fries were so hard, had to use knife to cut them. We made this a destination restaurant, and it was bitterly disappointing. Will not try again. Gordon you're building an empire, but it's all in about the quality, and our recent experience at your Pub questions how much you are involved.

kK7Etqau3Zgxc6Bpi3XZaw.text: I had been looking forward to eating here for a while so the first chance I got while visiting up in Vegas I took it.  Overall I felt this place was okay. I would have rated it a 3.5 star but that is not an option. Its a very nice restaurant and my waiter was pretty good. I had the chicken wings which were nothing special in the end but you can only do so much with a chicken wing. For my entree I had the fish n chips. This comes with two pieces of well battered Cod and steak cut fries. The fish was very good and met my expectations. The fries overall were just fries. They did have a unique horse radish ketchup which was pretty good. I would return for the fish but not much else. I felt there was something missing but overall it is a little pricey but worth a go.

tqITsXJEw0UWkjC8biC9-Q.text: Meh...is right. I had scallops...the bread tasted better. The food...salad,entree,had no taste. Thought the server (who seemed overwhelmed,and not very attentive.. would have a fit when my dining partner asked for salt.) Service needs some service. The food tasted like nothing. No flavor...The place has great atmosphere,and that's about it. I don't know why Gordon Ramsay is so bitchy on the TV show about flavor and texture of food...he needs to pay attention to his own cooking....never should have wasted 175.00 on dinner for two here. Should have gone to Trevi .

_IaSmEfUeqfzEKSn-41Jkg.text: Would have given it 5 stars but the service was not great.  We sat for 20 minutes before someone came over to us.  Multiple waiters passed us and could see we were just sitting there with no food or drink...like they were saying to themselves "That's not my table."  Other than that, once we got a waiter, he was pretty good, and the food was great.  Try the shrimp salad...very fresh!  I would go back only if I walked by and it was't crowded.  FYI - this is the 4th Gordon Ramsay restaurant I've been (all 3 in Vegas and 1 in NY).  The food has always been great...anyone saying otherwise probably has no taste!

y59wzXHxirdeOkDBN0gQiw.text: Walked in and thought it was bloody boujie.    But boy was I wrong. They sat us in right away and I didnt even have to slip them a 20 to be first in line. There service was impeccable. We changed tables as many times as the color wheel from twister. The waitress gave us her recommendations and the lamb burger was to die for. The first bite I took was filled with creamy savory feta and carmalized onions that just make u think of being on vacation and remembering the first step u took out of the plane watching the sun set in the horizon. Yes it was like an oasis in my mouth accompanied by a savory but lean and juicy lamb patty that was perfectly spiced. The lamb was so delicious I had to buy the chef a shot of patron. Kudos chef ramsey. I was so stuffed that I couldn't make room for dessert. So I excused myself from the table and threw up in the restroom so i could have some of their world famous bread pudding.  I cant even begin to describe the bread pudding. Its consistency was more like a cake that crumbled as it touch my lips. The ice cream was light and whipped with crunchy peanut brittle that made me pause from reading shades of gray. Yes it was that good.  Chef ramsey left my loins on fire. Kudos!!!!

WGS0lM5dvT9gfyaPU15MCw.text: Can't really talk about much but the poor service. We walked out after 25 minutes without any. We even told the hostess we were headed to the showroom. She said she would tell our server. We never saw a server. Too bad, the menu looked interesting.

CZYCsTEAVOFgF1kSC_GleQ.text: Amazing!  The pork belly was heaven!  Service was great. A definite "must eat" in Vegas!!!

mwchGtI7-ZPJrfSsT_Lc8A.text: It's just amazing !!!! Such a nice experience - the environment , interior design - very very british . You feel like you're in GB , and not in states . The service is great - they are very fast, pay attention on every single detail on the table , waitresses just are always around your table , but it's nothing compared to how delicious the food is . I can't even describe - it's tender , full of taste, rich and beautiful ! Def will be back next time I visit Vegas .

qamCqrB1RwFaW42sIZUcbA.text: Great food and service! Best service we have had in Las Vegas. Violetta is a fantastic server!!

23bzfQ0C0a7DbkD70A2lKQ.text: Ronnie, my bartender/server, acted like we were in Des Moines Iowa or something! Nothing like a Vegas server. He was awesome! Attentive, offered suggestions, held my spot at the bar while I did middle aged man stuff :) Anyway, being my mum's from Wolverhampton in England, and I've had my fair share of meat pies - yep, delicious! Plenty of brews on tap...my favorite go to in Caesars.

R0Y9hHwA6hrDAhnkcSo6ng.text: Rodney was awesome Poutine was delicious  Butter chicken curry was devine  Beef Wellington was everything and more  Wait was very minimal. Staff amazing. Food Devine. Definitely a must.

bFV0gPmSN4hZLkwZ1WNQIw.text: This is a disappointment. I have always been a lover of all things GR and have made an effort to frequent all his best establishments.   Came here to just get a quick bite between other meals. Upon showing up, plenty of empty seats available but the Hostess just pointed us to the bar. No worries, I didn't really need a table but at least being led in would have been nice. Went into the "bar area" that I was pointed to and sat down at table there. Had several servers walk by with no acknowledgement. eventually, as I was about to get actually pissed off, a server came by and told me the table was "reserved" and we would have to sit at the bar. Again, no effort to actually assist or direct or give any sort of service, just really poor form.   By the way, while I was sitting at the "reserved" table waiting for service, I had a chance to notice how poorly kept things were. There were dirty tables everywhere. It just seemed as there was a lot of staff walking around and no one actually caring for things. With the amount of staff they had here this place should have been spotless. So not only was the service completely lacking but it was a mess to look at.  We moved ourselves over to the actual bar and were greeted by a friendly enough bartender, (he is one of two things keeping this rating from being a 1). He took our order and poured up some drinks. The weird thing is that I had a Stella Artois, and it had absolutely no head at all, I assume that either the line was dirty or there was some film in the glass that prevented a head. They rinse their glasses so it almost has to be a dirty line.  We only ordered a couple of items, Scotch egg and deviled eggs. Both were really good for sure, (there is the other thing that kept this a 2 star instead of 1).   The other thing about this place - it just looks confused as hell. If I were to go all Asian on you I would say there is absolutely no Feng Shui. It just seems like there was an argument between the chef, the hotel, the backers, and the bank and they ALL got their way. It just does not flow and for shits sake GET RID OF ALL THE RIDICULOUS KEGS ON THE WALL!! They are not trendy, it is not visually pleasing. It is just super heavy and distracting.   Anyway.....To Gordon, or the GM - PLEASE get on your front of house and have them learn a bit about service and upkeep for this place. There is just no way that it should have been this rough when it was not even remotely busy.

wzl3NEwe8F9qJofU2RrROw.text: Located in Caesar's Palace across from where Celine Dion plays is Pub and Grill. Like everything in Vegas things are expensive for example the bacon burger is about $23. A good tasty burger but $23 is a little extreme. The table setting is very elegant and the decor of the restaurant is very nice and you can definitely tell they would have good beer. Service is on point and efficient.

_S3qAIFuNBwyVuMmhzFQsw.text: Absolutely delicious!!!  I am one of those girls that loves a good hamburger and fries...Top notch!!!  The atmosphere was friendly and wait staff charming!  I enjoyed this adventure very much and scratched one off the bucket list!

TRQTM3oAgaySIRPZWQGAJQ.text: Nong, juice and Ramon are the best!!  We sat got drinks right away, ordered food and it was all awesome and friendly service and can't  go wrong here!

n_ZlAC5rtGAapaS9S_Dj5g.text: I've been here twice and the service was on point. The first time was the best as the waitress made us feel like royalty, calling me "m'lady" and my husband by name preceded by "Sir." I put her in the books as one of the best waitresses of all times.   This last time, we didn't get the royal treatment so much, but he was on it and our food seemed to be up to Gordon Ramsey's standard. I wish more restaurants were run by Ramsey to keep the service stellar.   The sticky bread pudding was amazing, by the way. I had no idea an English food could taste so good. I was impressed.

hPJeAmXaPqrG8a5W0-47jA.text: Well, I went to Las Vegas for my 50th birthday. I am a super fan of Gordon Ramsey so I wanted to visit a couple of his restaurants. I made reservations for Hell's Kitchen and the food was top notch. We had the best customer service and the food was amazing . I would highly recommend Hell's Kitchen. The next day myself and 12 of my family members made reservations at the Gordon Ramsey Pub in Cesar's Palace. I ordered the fish and chips along with a side of the Lobster Mac and cheese. Well I will tell you if Gordon Ramsey took a taste of this lobster Mac and cheese he would have fired the chef on the spot. This was the most dry no flavor Mac and cheese I've ever eaten in my life. It was like someone used a box of Kraft Mac and cheese from a super market.  I received only a tiny piece of lobster in the entire dish. We had the Lobster Mac and cheese at Hell's Kitchen and it was amazing. I personally feel that Gordon Ramsey should pay a visit to the Pub and it's chefs.   Thank you Mario

mcxVi82Xv02jbvwRFpin2A.text: Wonderful dining experience that encapsulated what one would expect of a Gordon Ramsay restaurant.  The roasted tomato soup is a perfect choice for a light lunch on a hot Las Vegas day.   Service was excellent and Rodney, who was very friendly and attentive, went above and beyond what I usually expect of wait staff.   I would love to rate this establishment five stars, however the pricing is, in some cases, a touch on the steep side given what is on offer.  Service:  5/5 Food:      5/5 Price:      3/5

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Roasted tomato soup.  Creamy and rich.  Absolutely delicious.

1sHZ3F-CY2tmSZJANGtQpA.text: Great lunch. Delicious pork belly! Highly recommend.   Great homemade chips and soft shell crab sandwich.   The London breeze mocktail is amazing!

EkuSwMfuWZcQlLWkrJXZMA.text: Nong is the man. Best service in town!!!! Drinks were delicious, and the sticky toffee pudding was the best I've ever had - no joke.

f8_wcqOJha3ut8kFpOUmaw.text: I rarely do reviews but I was compelled to do so for Ramsay's Pub and Grill. Let me start my review by telling you that I am a HUGE Gordon Ramsay fanboy. He's a legend in my eyes and I couldn't wait to try this place (We did not get tables at Hell's Kitchen or the Burger place unfortunately). I do realize this is a pub and grill and not a fine dining restaurant but its still Gordon Ramsay dishes and his recipes.  Appetizers - We got the truffle fries, deviled eggs, pigs in a blanket and the poutine. Truffle fries were great, no complaints there. They literally gave us 4 pieces of deviled eggs though. We were a party of 4, so that was 1 tiny piece for each of us. They did taste good though. Pigs in a blanket - We got 3 pieces, literally 3 small pigs wrapped in pastry puffs for 4 of us. Alright, I can get with the portions but they were just about meh-okay. Hardly any flavor to them. The poutine - I was SO excited to try the poutine here. There were literally 3 small tiny puddles of cheese curds for the entire dish. The beef was good but the gravy was SALTY, VERY salty. Almost overpowered the whole thing.   Entrees - We got the beef wellington, butter chicken curry, fish and chips and a burger. Of all the entree's, the beef wellington was OK. I mean its almost 60$ for an order, the meat was cooked well but was not seasoned at all, very bland. The fish and chips were actually really good, no complaints there. the burger was again, under-seasoned, whatever little taste we got was from the sauces and cheese. And now the butter chicken curry - oh bloody hell (circa 2017, Gordon Ramsay).   The butter chicken deserves an entire paragraph. Firstly, its not butter chicken at all. Its pieces of chicken in some sort of curry sauce with honestly tasted store bought. I am not accusing anyone of anything here but I have Indian roots, I know what butter chicken should taste like, this isn't it. Not even close. The curry was salty with the slightest hint of spice but that's about all one can taste in it. It was really bad. The rice that comes with it - oh bloody hell - it was literally just cooked in saffron spice, nothing else. It had no salt, no other spices, just the flavor of saffron. If you know saffron, you should know that its a very expensive spice and it's supposed to be used in minimal quantities and enhance the flavor of your dish, its not supposed to the only flavor coming through. The rice was overpowered with saffron and that's the ONLY thing I could taste, incredibly disappointing. The naan (bread) was actually really good, soft and warm and the way it was supposed to be.   Drinks - We got some beers, wine and a mule. The moscow mule was served in a tall glass rather than the traditional copper mug but the drink itself was nothing to write home about. Just a mediocre moscow mule.  We ended up paying around 350$ for the whole meal. While we all knew coming in that it was going to be expensive, we expected WAAY more from the food and we felt cheated walking out.   :'(

b_iJ4BkXO9oUzwJ62gSaLQ.text: Loved the toffee pudding and lamb shank! The place was just really loud as it's very open and near the casino.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Toffee pudding
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Nachos
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States

gIM1mbl3dHymElaT9PxFtg.text: My first night in town I was looking for a delicious meal in a fun relaxing environment.  I found it here with the bar staff, Juice,  Cristina and Christian.  The starter,  a Scotch Egg and an Old Fashioned,  plus good conversation was great. The main meal was Beef Wellington and it was tender and delicious! All in all, a wonderful meal and night.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. An Old Fashioned &amp; Scotch Egg started the evening &amp; I progressed to the Beef Wellington with root vegetables, was so tender and flavorful.

Di1QV4DcDDNwMw4REcEPnA.text: Went here for lunch with my brother since we wanted to try a new place and figured we might as well go to another Gordon Ramsay establishment (we went to the fish and chips place the day before lol).   We ordered the steak and mushroom pie, lobster rolls, pesto and garlic Mac and cheese, and the salmon bruschetta. I was expecting the portions to be on the smaller side and boy did they look small lol. It was a good thing I ordered a bunch of food, but surprisingly we both got full from our meal and even had some left over! The pie reminded me of a pot roast with big chunks of steak and mushroom. My favorite component was the crust on top and I wish they gave me more of it! The lobster rolls were also good and it was really fresh. The pesto Mac was my favorite since I love pesto while my brother (and the waitress) preferred the garlic Mac. The salmon bruschetta reminded me of the bologna lunchables for some reason haha. It wasn't bad, but not something I would order again.  I will definitely be coming back to this place to try out some of their other items. As expected the place is a bit pricey, but you're paying for the name and atmosphere lol. Our lunch was about $70. Would recommend this place if you haven't been here yet!

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Steak and mushroom pie! Really good but way smaller than I expected xD
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pesto Mac on the left and garlic Mac on the right! Both are pretty good
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Salmon bruschetta! Reminds me of lunchables in terms of the flavor lol

Pyqud2UytVoVwON-WcEEbA.text: 30 minutes since order and not even scotch egg. Just informed our meal AND appetizer will be brought out at same time!WTF?  Gordon Ramsay should be careful who he sells his name to.

0P0wQn2AIz_SLt11yWhP0w.text: Ronny was a great bartender and hooked us up! Even though we only ordered desserts,  he made sure we were happy and having a good time! The sticky toffee pudding was amazing! For the signature chocolate wellington, I was expecting to have a creamy center, but turned out to be more like a chocolate cake, still very good though! Go check them out!! :-)

P1jbDfYQfKXER4OoirHYrg.text: Pro Tip: Don't forget to check in on Yelp at this place for your free Sticky Toffee Pudding!   Staying in Vegas, it is necessary to try a famous chef's restaurant and this was the perfect Vegas meal. We were staying at Caesars and were not wanting to travel far and this was perfect for our casual attire. We were in comfortable booth that was great for lounging and drinking.  The little details from the union jack logo, wooden menu, keg wall, and many other things really made this place great.  Starting Vegas off with a Boddington Pub Ale that Ramsay has on tap. This is one of the smoothest beers I've had in a can and having it on tap was delicious!  We started by ordering the scotch eggs and soft pretzel sticks(may be under a different name) that were inhaled so fast I was unable to get a picture. The scotch eggs are breaded soft boiled eggs with sausage with a mustard cream sauce. These were perfect for the table.  The pretzel rods come with a spicy mustard and a cheese sauce that you will want to lick clean.  I ordered the Sheperd's Pie which is one of my all time favorite dishes. The beef in this dish seemed to be inconsistently seasoned but the areas that were tasted amazing. It also comes with a small kale salad and pretzel rod.  My boyfriend ordered the Dublin Corned Beef Brisket Sandwich that comes with homemade chips. I am not a fan of corned beef but this tasted good to me. Its not a traditional Texas brisket like what were used to back home which caused some confusion but it was devoured.  My cousin ordered the fish and chips and I have to say this was the best item of the table. The fish was light and with the malt vinegar it was incredible. The "chips"/fries that came with it were slowly being stolen from him plate as these tasted incredible also. The only thing that was odd was the peas that were served had mint in them which may be an authentic British thing but was not my favorite.  Now the best part was as being a part of the Yelp family, when you check into this restaurant, you get a coupon for a free Sticky Toffee Pudding. It is served with a cookie butter ice cream. This is RICH but I think one of the top sticky toffee puddings I have had. This was split between 5 at the table and everyone had a hefty portion. This is the perfect place to grab a beer, great food, and sticky toffee pudding! Highly Recommend.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sticky Toffee Pudding-free with Yelp check in
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yorkshire Ale Batter Fish &amp; Chips-winner
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Dublin Corned Beef Brisket Sandwich

Vn2CPwqatnQlg22aS5nvDw.text: Sooo, I was pretty excited about this place and total fail!!!  I paid 30 bucks for fish and chips that were very bland and not even worth 10 bucks.  I substituted the chips for a side salad and the salad was just dry lettuce with some carrots and snap peas. Not good, don't waste your money at the Pub.

YXcQKK4DGZYJeIImsQraPw.text: I had the calamari for the appetizer it was very well designed with two dipping sauces. I had the fish and chips for my entree and it was very crispy and very moist in the inside. Then I have the sticky toffee pudding with ice cream and caramel sauce and it was also moist and very good
