Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States

2C--Zc3Pj8p72vQ9I--wtg.text: I'm happy to give GRPG a solid four stars. Our meals were piping hot, and the portions were quite large. Also, beer lovers will find their line up of beers to be quite good. I went for something a bit different, and got myself a pint of pear cider. It went very well with their braised pork which I think was cooked to perfection.

tydh22MacZfXTip_4v9L5w.text: We've eaten at Gordon Ramsay's Pub Grill several times, and tonight wasn't any different!  A regular stop for us when we're in Vegas! Besides the wonderful food (try the hanger steak!), the service is top notch! Even though it's in the middle of a casino and can get crowded, the staff is what one would expect when eating at such a famous chef's restaurant. The waitress knew the menu, made wonderful recommendations, and catered to our every need. We started off with the Butternut Squash soup with herb butter (rich!), after I ordered the Traditional Shepard's Pie, made with beef and lamb. It's wonderful topping of whipped mashed potatoes browned to perfection is to die for! My husband ordered the hanger steak, and he offered me a few bites. So tender! Finally, we devoured the sticky, toffee pudding! I can't say enough about our waitress, or the table attendant. So friendly and always asking if we needed anything, and when dinner was served, she came straight by to make sure we were happy!  Awesome job!!  I nearly nicked Ramsay a star for a lady walking around taking souvenir pictures. She had a rattling loud gab fest at the table next to us in a restaurant that has to modify noise levels anyways. She stayed too long chatting it up at this table.  I don't think we need souvenir photographers in a world with Iphones. There was also a very large pool of water in the hallway in the kitchen area that I could see from the restrooms, and it was alarming they'd allow that to be tracked around. My paper menu was soiled as well.  Other than that, we'll be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lovely place for fun &amp; food 5+

6LWuGswyiTjgWwGEb9UQoQ.text: Stopped by here on our latest trip to Vegas. We were pleasantly surprised by the service even though it was very busy. The food was good, we had a burger and Fish and Chips. The GM even came over to ur table to check in on our experience. Front of the house and the Pub is great!

iW_KuL_lGJ2w1Na0NPkSIg.text: Raul was our bartender and server! Loved my drink - it was the Ramsay Tonic. Fresh, lovely and perfectly mixed. My husband had a beer and Carmel Salted Apple and he thought they were great! Louie the manager stopped by to check on us. So nice! I had the sliders were super delish and the hubs had short ribs and the bowl was licked clean. :-) I also enjoyed the Santa Barbara Chard exactly what it should be. The energy in the room was fun and happy. We'll be back!

45BcVIufzVeZXapHiamaMQ.text: Waited over 30 minutes for our food... Fish and chips, lamb chops and lamb shank were ok. Scallops had no particular flavor. They were just salty. Accompaniments were less than desirable. Waiter was busy flirting with two ladies sitting at the next table. He stopped by once to check on us when we were nearly done eating. Don't come here if you want service. Trying to get someone to take our credit card so that we can pay and get out of here...

11_-aBbzMzjrcel0zVa3ew.text: We were in Las Vegas April 4-8 to attend the Celine Dion concert celebrating my daughter's 30th birthday. We had eaten at Gordon Ramsay Steak earlier in the week, and decided to give the Pub and Grill a try. We are so glad we did. I have recently moved back to the US from several years in the UK. I was homesick for great fish and chips. I ended up being swayed by the promise of fresh Scottish Salmon and OMG was it amazing! I nearly wept. I have missed great salmon. Scott H. our waiter was absolute perfection. He described each dish, and seemed to intuitively know which dishes we would each like. He was spot on.My daughter had the fish and chips  -perfect flaky white fish in light batter with homemade tarter sauce and my sister had the steak pie with a rich gravy and flaky light crust.  He took pictures of our group, he approached Chef Christina from Hell's Kitchen for us to ask permission for a picture (which we got and it was DAY MADE lol),  recommended delicious cocktails, and in general made our experience as close to perfect as possible.  We have been Ramsay fans for years. After dining in three other Ramsay restaurants in England,  I honestly thought the Vegas restaurants would be a let down with disappointing food. I was wrong.The food was worth every penny, although I thought the prices extremely reasonable especially in light on the high quality.  Ramsay deserves many kudos for the great staff he employs. These are people who obviously love their jobs and are masters at them. It was a terrific experience and one we will not soon forget!

BwWlEHQJnfKNVdL6MIuT4w.text: This is pretty good, I got the fish and chips and they were just as I expected, which is weird because I was hoping they would be better than I expected, so I guess I actually expected better fish and chips? Yeah I did. The Server was awesome, bald white guy , wish I could remember his name. There is also a huge bar tender that works there, he's really cool. I like the "text me when my table is ready" thing they have there, it's smart. Beers are good, the price is high for the quality but the location is convenient...right in the middle of Caesars. I would go again maybe for lunch, not dinner, idk, I wish it was cheaper so I could try more of the menu. But yeah, if you're hungry and in Caesars go for it, but I wouldn't say you should go out of your way to try eat here. Done.

lPDhtmVc97EZsKiRqBU8EA.text: Walked in with trepidation given the other reviews, but...  - Impressive beer on tap list but crappy wine list - solid and unpretentious food including tasty fish and chips (thought the fish portion was small), yummy pork belly, and perfect Caesar's salad - perfect pub waiter who recommended a dish which we ordered, didn't like, and the waiter immediately removed from the table and the bill  Well done, good place for comfort, pub food.

0dbu9yPfvMQwzUxuhFJDSg.text: I had high expectations for this place.  Maybe after having dinner at the London restaurant in West Hollywood, I expected more from a Gordon Ramsay restaurant.  We arrived a bit early to our reservation and the hostess treated us as if we had just slapped her mother.  When I sheepishly asked if we could get a drink at the bar while we waited, she flippantly said we could but that she wouldn't be assisting us with a table until our reservation time.    So we got a drink.  2 Vodka Red Bulls, 1 Black & Tan, 1 Heineken and 1 Iced Tea...for $60?!?  Regardless, I realized we were going to a well named chef's restaurant and I tend to be prepared for inflation...but that was a rough way to start out.  Once it was time for our reservation, I went back to the hostess booth and was pleasantly surprised to find someone new.  Fortunately for us, this new girl didn't hate life in the same way and was kind enough to sit our group.  3 of our group ordered the Fish & Chips.  1 ordered the scallops and I, in an attempt to try as much as I could, ordered the Filet mixed grill.  As a starter, I ordered the corn soup and my wife the heirloom tomato salad.  The Starters...incredible.  My soup was fantastic and the tomato salad even better.  We loved the pretzel bread the brought out and all were very excited for our main courses.  Main courses...mine sucked...well I should say...the fish & chips DIDN'T suck.  My friend's scallops were good, but they were sitting in a bowl of broth.  There really wasn't much to the dish....except a $32 price tag.  Then came my mixed grill.  The shrimp were WAY over cooked.  Rubber Shrimp.  The Steak was cooked nicely and the Pork Belly had great flavor, but under all 3 items was a sauce...all of which were horrible.  The shrimp had a white puree that was completely pointless.  Under the pork belly was a horrible pea green baby food that didn't taste like much but made the food unappetizing.  Lastly under the filet was a poor rendition of a tomato based barbecue type sauce.  On top of it all, when I ordered my meal the server asked "Ok and what side would you like"  which I assumed meant that I was supposed to choose.  I asked him his recommendation and ordered the asparagus.  Not only were they completely boiled and tasteless...they were only there to add $10 (Yes TEN DOLLARS for boiled asparagus.) Brutal.  All in all, I struggle to not give it 1 star, but the fish & chips were good and the appetizers were nice...so I'll give it 2.  Regardless of how many stars, we will not return to this restaurant.

mpvDwzlwGFjrIJJVjNrCEg.text: My husband and I ate at Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill for lunch on 2/16/13. It was by far my LEAST favorite meal we had in Vegas.  We had the deviled eggs to start with. They were just ok, way over priced. I would have thought for somewhere around $12.00 we would have gotten more than two boiled eggs ( 4 halves) the taste wasn't anything special.  My husband had the fish and chips, he liked the fish fairly well but some of the chips/fries were way under cooked. He couldn't even eat all of them due to the fact that the potato was hard in the middle.  I had the chicken chopped salad. The dressing was flavorless, the flavors all blended together, (what little flavor there was) I wasn't even certain that there was chicken in the salad until I was able to finally spot  it, once I tasted it, I realized that it wasn't worth looking for. There were large chunks of hard lettuce mixed into the salad that was fairly bitter.  All in all, I'm glad I went so I can say that I went to one of Gordon Ramsay's restaurants, but I do not plan on making a return trip, to this location or any other of his brands. Very disappointing.

eKKdaFQi05d080CVOAn4gA.text: My husband and I decided to go here for our anniversary dinner and were not disappointed. We ordered the fish 'n chips and shepherds pie. The fish was like butter and delicious but the shepherds pie was DIVINE. We also had two cocktails that were so tasty they didn't last long. The staff extremely helpful. Would highly recommend this to anyone who is keen to try some famous Ramsey food. The bill didn't break the bank either.

UVTM2tfJCwAjFwb7I_I-1g.text: I had a really nice dinner here.  Everything was pretty good.  Not great, but just good..  I had the pretzel appetizer, followed by the pork belly entree and the spotted dog dessert.  I did expect a lot more from a celebrity chef's pub and expected to pay more because of it, but I felt the reputation outweighed the food.

j0iDJZITWd-Eo2D-WMgHjw.text: Wow, right off the bat, great looking bar. Waited for the cool sofa tables. Got great service, lets just leave it at that! Way to go, we'll be back when we're not so stuffed! Btw, great pub bloody mary!

0ApJ-VjURKwJ3Gji9MiAaw.text: Last week me and my wife had dinner.  Sat for 10 minutes to get a server.  We ordered the filet each, mashed potato, asparagus and salad to share.  The filet was terrible, poor grade, at the price should cut with a butter knife.  Asparagus was woody, mashed was good as well as the salad.  No rolls, they serve no rolls.  The toffee dessert was excellent, should have just had that.  Mostly upset with the filet, fine quality you should be able to cut with a butter knife and not chewy.  Wonder if the steakhouse has the same quality.

cUf68pDwkbWZhTGiSpz1Uw.text: Ok, allow me to begin by saying that the food here is quite satisfying. Our server was willing to accommodate any special request and did so, with a smile. Our party enjoyed our time and our food. Upon leaving I realized that I could not find my sunglasses. I immediately called and let the restaurant know. Unfortunately the 3 females located at the host stand were not very helpful. I believe the exact words were "no one has turned anything in, you can check with security later. That's where we will turn everything in" um... Ok? I literally JUST left ... One of those girls can't walk 10steps and take a quick look around the table and possibly the women's restroom??? You have to be kidding me. I understand that the conversation of what they did their past weekend is fascinating but, you just had a guest call about a missing item. This missing item can be easily tracked since I left less than 15 minutes ago. Nonetheless, it seemed hopeless so I turned around and headed back to the restaurant. A very kind gentleman in a suit (probably the manager) offered to assist. He walked to the back of the room and came back in less than sixty seconds with my sunglasses in hand! Thank you kind sir for being the hero. I know hostesses usually don't have the best reputation... But these three had the opportunity to change that tonight. Sorry ladies... Epic fail. Thank goodness there was someone else willing to step in. It may not be important to you, but if it's important to your guest... It should be important to you. This place would have received 5 stars otherwise.

WQn7PSwjGFXHk8ArChV5Yw.text: The service was excellent as was the food.  The atmosphere was great as well. I would definitely recommend this place for friends or a couple. My friend and I were on a short timeline and they made sure we got out in time to see our show that we had booked. We definitely appreciated that.

5xSi9F6-x7QfIeEmvTPBPg.text: Went their had a great time food was great bartenders where nice . Just don't sit by the taps kept getting sprayed by the glass rinser kind of a bummer

JtsQbBEafAyBZuVNZmjr7A.text: Was there on Super Bowl 2015 weekend and decided to try out the restaurant with 3 friends. Ordered draught beer that was luke warm, Cesear Salad and New York Strip steak medium done. The steak came out as if it had been sitting and wasn't hot off the grill or even close.  Prices are high for a pub and grill and definitely would have thought the quality of food would have been much much better. Disappointed!!!!

BqfSXFqoZxcNEJDXSyq8jA.text: I can see hot and cold reviews here- but we had a great time here. First of all- the service in the restaurant was excellent. We interacted with several wait staff and they were all great. We had a party of 4 and we all enjoyed our different dishes - but the bartender was a star Friday night. Those were some of the best cocktails I've had all week! The nachos were super yummy, the Mac and cheese was on point and so were the sandwiches we got. The atmosphere of the restaurant is fun, and because this is GR's pub I expected pub food- not Michelin stars, and I was delighted to have a delicious version of just that.

db0J5n7_GW7jsbFQ9iVNQw.text: I don't know why the reviews seem so crappy. I had great customer service and excellent food served to me at a timely manner. The only thing that was weird was the pineapple juice. In the week I stayed I made it here a total of like 3 times! I couldn't resist! But that goat cheese burger was effing nasty way too over powering I recommend HELLS KITCHEN, the egg appetizer and the sticky pudding cake(:!!

Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hell&#39;s Kitchen!

6d_L0AkM-LNcHdXf4aT7Hg.text: We ate here Dec.2nd my son-in-law's hero is Gordon Ramsay and we were in Vegas to celebrate his birthday. The service was excellent and we were seated right away since we had reservations. My husband ordered the prime rib which was adequate in fact everyone's food was good. Not exceptional given the hype of this restaurant but good. Mine however was aweful and inedible. I ordered the half lobster which was so overcooked it was RUBBER! To consume I had to tear off with my hands and swallow  ( I didn't want to let my son-in-law know) Please eat somewhere else. There are better restaurants in Vegas

UGnMjNtJ7hYtMhBR3-zXdw.text: With great expectation, I visited Gordon Ramsey's Pub & Grill at Caesars Palace. I ordered the braised lamb shank which I make at home. Done correctly, it will fall off the bone. Not so at the Pub. I could have used a steak knife. It did not appear to be very fresh. Rather dried out. If you watch Gordon Ramsay's Hells kitchen on TV, you know he insists upon properly seasoned food. With today's lamb shank, I had to ask for salt as it definitely lacked  seasoning.  On the positive side, after the manager asked me how I liked the lamb, he was gracious enough to cut my bill in half.   I am not giving up on Gordon Ramsay. Tomorrow evening I am going to try his steakhouse at Paris hotel in Las Vegas.

O6KnMwLcGczTbLP7nEi6Yw.text: Had lunch here because we wanted to try Gordon's food and the Pub and Grill was very convenient. Glad we did since the fish and chips was as good or better than London. As good as the food was, the service was even better. Out server, Rodney, was terrific. He's friendly, helpful, just delightful to talk to. If you are lucky enough to have him you will have the best dining experience you can have in Las Vegas. Also, if you like sticky toffee pudding, this is the best.

TG97WNi_pBzR__UyUq4Otg.text: I had the fish and chips. Amazing and flaky. Atmosphere was great and had a great waiter named Rodney. He was extremely a tentative and friendly. We will eat here again to try the other food on the menu that sounds good. would recommend to anyone at the Ceasars palace.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States

KQnaCOkEX4pMGX-kjDtCjg.text: Fist of all the decor in this place is pretty awesome, makes you wanna order a beer. Barrels hanging everywhere high tables. It is just pretty cool.   As for the food, my hubby and I had a few things there. As we weren't that hungry we only had a salad (forgot which one) the 3 pies combo and a spotted dick. We were sharing everything.   The salad was just a big waste of time, had some good elements but not worth the money or the time to chew it .   As for the pies, now that's where the magic is. the combo is 3 pies, chicken lamb and the famous shepherd pie. Each one was absolutely great but the Shepherd pie definitely blew the others out of the way. So flaky, and warm, it was just perfect. So if you do try the place just trust me and order the Shepherd pie and you'll be like a happy little kid.   As for the spotted dick, AKA bread pudding, it's absolutely and utterly amazing. Perfection on a plate. Don't you dare leaving the pub without trying it. It is just great!

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cool wall design

P5f66V1Z71ZE0p6N-sRNjA.text: Excellent place for a casual lunch during our trip to Sin City!    We ate at the bar and Ray Ray was fabulous!  Fun, helpful, and attentive.  He helped us find some local faire to enjoy during our week.  Visit him and chat him up!  For lunch I had the Lamb Burger which was excellent, just slightly over dressed with the feta topping and it had cabbage in it, which I don't love.  Still melt in your mouth delicious!  As always, Drew picked better and had the bangers and mash.  Three different sausages made of different meats with one of the best gravies I've ever had!    Beer selection was great, including Boddingtons on nitro!  The beer gods smiled upon us that day.  The place is spendy so cheapskates don't even bother!  Worth every penny in my opinion, wish we would have eaten here a second time.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Delicious lamb burger.
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bangers and mash, an absolute must have!
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Boddingtons on nitro!!!

0NXECDhBhKK0GcL41NGggw.text: Omg the entire meal was amazing, but thanks to our amazing waiter, Scott H, i think I had the best dessert of my life. Make sure to have the sticky toffee date cake thing (can't remember the name)...but it'll blow your mind!

nEvBcNAELF27z1dSV4f0KA.text: Gordon Ramseys chain of restaurants is growing but the quality is slipping. Had the Sheppard's Pie and it was tasteless. Too much potato and not enough vegetables or meat. Used lots of salt and pepper to give it taste.   Tasted my friends shorts ribs and Risotto which was undercooked. This is something Ramsey rails against yet his restaurant violated it.   The atmosphere was good with an airy feeling and the service was average. For the price in Vegas on the strip it is a good deal.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. French onion soup
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bar area

nD7MeIgZayzbVO6vdvRtSQ.text: Eight of came from different states to meet up for the Def Leppard / Poison / Tesla Concert.  In doing so we thought it would be great to meet up for dinner outside the concert, so we all agreed to meet up at Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill.  It was an EXCELLENT choice.  The food was fantastic (I had the Rib Eye Steak... OMG!)  and the service was spectacular.  Alexander was are server and we had so much fun with him that we had to "COMPLAIN" to Mr. Management Manny!  He didn't fall for it though, I guess the smiles on our face gave it away.  Alexander refused to take our group photo because little did we know till after the fact, he photo bombed us.  IT WAS AWESOME!  He made our evening that much more special.  But really, the Fish & Chips, cant go wrong.  The Nacho's were really good.  AND, in case you missed it... the RIB EYE STEAK for you steak lovers was heaven for us food snobs.

x6yKiaHdu2fiuaTCN0DxMQ.text: My family and I went for their Happy Hour. We had Pork Sliders, Nachos, Wings and Fries. The waiter recommended a really good beer (which I should've written down), but he was good at helping me make a selection based on what I like (He asked me if I like dark beer and whisky, and i said "yes"). We also had the Sticky Toffee Pudding Cake for Desert. I liked the Nachos, as it was different where the chips were like kettle chips, and the toppings with the meat was tasty. The Wings had a nice kick to it, and the Sliders had good flavor as well. All-in-All we were happy to stop in for their happy hour and have a light/late lunch before a heavy dinner.

9TwtV1eOXUosaQN_0RBpeg.text: This was one of my favorite spots we hit in Caesars on our last trip. It is situated in the Forum Casino right next to Caesar's food court, so it is on the way to the Forum Shops.   The look and feel of the place is a hip, upscale pub.  There is a a big bar, tons of tables and then some booths too.  It is a really big space and it is lined with lots of big TVs if you want to watch a game (they had soccer on while we were there).  All the waitresses are in newsprint and safety pin dresses and the waiters are in skinny black jeans and spiked suspenders.  It is modern hip punk....whatever!  I liked it all, it worked.    We basically ordered burgers and beer.  Their drinks menu is on an ipad that they bring over and let you flip through so you can see pretty pictures of whatever you want to order.  Drinks are Vegas prices (so high).  Our Sam Adams was like $9.  The burgers came out and they were thick and well cooked.  The fries that come with it, as many have commented, are different.  They are a very, very think cut steak fry.  It is almost like they quarter a potato and deep fry it (to give you a visual on how thick they were).  I loved both my burger and my fries.  The burger had great flavor & it was juicy. The fries were fully cooked and had a bit of crust, but were a little more mushy in the middle.  They had a great flavor though and I loved the different take on a classic.    Our server was terrific and he let us linger.  It was a good experience.  It was Vegas pricey, but we were in the resort so you just kind of expect that!

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Seating area

6Z9bfpScGORzbH2uDYaPfQ.text: Hosted a small reception in the bar/lounge area. The space was not as private as one would hope, and not having seen the space prior to arriving I wasn't aware of that. The restaurant is located in Caesars directly across from the Colosseum. However, it ended up working out wonderfully. We were a group of 30 and the waitresses took superb care of us! The three of them were constantly making sure everyone had drinks and that the food was replenished accordingly. With the pre-set group menu we had the sliders, nachos, fire wings, pigs in a blanket and shrimp. Everyone loved the food, I heard various comments that it was all excellent.   The management staff was great as well, very helpful and nice. Everyone took such great care of us!

XX-rWBd1smDfVp3qEusXSQ.text: I didn't enjoy much of the food here. This place is huge, and quite empty. Regardless, we sat down because I love Ramsay.   Maybe because I'm not a burger fan to start with, but the lamb burger our waitress recommended to me was very lamby(heavy lamb smell) with a bunch of blue cheese which was making the whole burger even heavier.   The crab cake(?) I forgot the original name, but this crab thing was simply imitation crab in an oily bun... Disappointed   Also,we ordered the deviled eggs since I saw reviews on yelp: the taste was quite blunt. Nothing special and I don't really recommend.   The only highlight was the fries and sticky tofu pudding.   I would stay away from this place if you are a Ramsay fan, and go to the Ramsay steak house.

bdy9jFtqbzg-dTI2Hp6ROA.text: Service was horrible.  The food was less than mediocre.  "Salted pretzel sticks " no salt. We pointed that out and they showed us the salt on the bottom of this dish. #epicfail. They came to our table cold. Pretzel bread is not good cold. Three short unsalted sticks $10. Skip it. The dip lacked flavor.  The waiter was rude and put down our drink choice.  The Reuben was dry had maybe one tablespoon of kraut on it and less cheese. The waiter was really put off when I asked for cheese for it. Then he brings some poor slices of not even the same cheese that was on it.  He didn't tell us the options for the entrees. When I asked for a replacement of the cardboard tasting chips he told me "no" and just I ship do have asked up front.

veplmxjNWrOKDDHl133RsQ.text: I love the atmosphere and the beer selection. Refreshing cocktails and fresh fish. Definitely coming back. Cheers!

bMvb7OWpJi-MBVdLXANg0A.text: Had zero plans to eat lunch here while out shopping inside Caesar's Palace.  But whatever it was that led me here - hunger, tired feet, FATE - I'm so glad it did.  This was hands-down my favorite lunch out of all the places we tried on vacation.  First of all, I loved the decor of the restuarant.  You really felt this is what a real English pub would look like.  It could be an Americanized version for all I know, but I still liked it.  Our service was great.  Very friendly wait staff.  There were water spots on my husband's fork, which isn't even that big of a deal, but our waiter noticed it (without us pointing it out first) and replaced it right away.  I thought that was a very nice, above-and-beyond touch.  I started off with a very delicious cocktail called Goodbye Blue Sky, which was blueberry vodka, Chambord, sparkling wine and fresh lemon and blueberries.  So refreshing.  I hardly ever finish my cocktail at any place I go, but this one could have easily begat a second one as much as I loved it.  We decided to pass on appetizers as we didn't really want to stuff ourselves for lunch (knowing we had a very large dinner ahead of us later).  I debated on what to order because so many things sounded delicious.  Shepherd's Pie, Chicken Pot Pie, even considered ordering several apps as my entree (Scotch Egg - yum!).  Finally decided to go classic English pub and ordered the Fish and Chips.  This was without a doubt the best fish and chips I've ever eaten.  Three lovely pieces of beautifully battered white fish - the texture was spot on (crispy and light), fish cooked to perfection.  Served with a side of mushy peas, which were also very tasty.  They were minty, although I didn't taste too much of it.  If I could complain about anything, I'd say the fries were nothing special.  The weren't horrible by any means, but for $30 you may expect something hand-cut at the very least.  Everytime we see a Sticky Toffee Pudding for dessert, we have to try it.  For something not chocolately, this bread pudding is surprisingly good.  Warm, with a rich caramelly drizzle atop a delicious sweet cream ice cream.  It's like a comfort dessert - you leave feeling wrapped in a warm blanket, cozy and comfy.  Perfect ending to a fantastic meal.  The only thing I wasn't keen on was the price of the food.  Now, I can eat expensive food, and have no problem paying for it.  But let's be honest - this was not an upscale 5-star restaurant.  It's a pub with above average food.  It's not overly gourmet or made with luxury ingredients.  I'd say you're paying for the Gordon Ramsey name for the most part.  Don't get me wrong cuz the food was spectacular, but it could definitely handle being slightly cheaper.  Lunch food shouldn't cost over $100 for two people.

6R3jMxlC_oFhR4wXz1LvhA.text: Went on 12/28/14 at 8:30 pm. They were out of salmon, prime rib, short ribs, and NY strip. Fish and chips...fish was like a cold brick and fries were just like burger king's. They have a mini pie sampler that used to come in a cute wooden carrier and last night they just plopped them on a plate and brought them to us. Took 2 hours and $500 for 8 people to eat. Go somewhere else.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. $29 fish and chips

0tcg5omOFhO_-uCXWnw0Kg.text: Great food and service! t.vs were a plus, we are able to watch the game and enjoy our food. Chris P. , our server was prompt and quick with food service. Will come back again!

kvWTF1FU7PDnDvd7ZDZTVQ.text: I haven't dined at any Gordon Ramsey places and if this is any indication, I'll take a pass.   The service and decor was fine enough, but their food is so overpriced and not so good. Their charcuterie appetizer was so lacking in flavor and their pates were hard as a rock.  So disappointed. One only highlight of the meal was the pretzels with very spicy mustard.   The fish n chips were ok (better be for $27) and their chicken curry (wish this was better explained by the waiter) wasn't what I had expected.   For a pub too, what a standard and boring beer draft menu. At least bring in Fullers! Sheesh.   Skip this place and head to Central, Caesars 24 hr restaurant, located in the lobby.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken curry

BNG_IgaXOXnqCs6nusAt6Q.text: Excellent service and awesome food!!! This is a MUST place to visit!! Gordon Ramsey inspires me and so does his whole staff! I go to this establishment everytime I'm in Vegas... The desserts are heavenly...love ALL of them. The Shepherd's pie is my favorite dish, my daughters is the Fish  n' Chips!! IF there is a line....WAIT!! Its WORTH the wait!!! Enjoy~

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fish n&#39; Chips
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shephards Pie

5AlDNz_To_5jcHR9FpgxYA.text: Very disappointed.  This rating is based on an overall experience.    My son who is 12 years old is a huge Gordon Ramsey fan.  So we decided to eat at one of Ramsey's restaurants and we were deeply disappointed.   The food here was okay.  My son appreciates food and loves to cook. He ordered the short ribs. My husband ordered the recommended fish and chips.  For the price it was descent but  would never order again.  Please see attached picture.  2 pieces of fish. You would think the presentation would be better at a Gordon Ramsey's restaurant.  My other son and myself ordered the burger.  bland bland bland..  nothing special.   My son said the short ribs were okay ..  he has had better.    We do not mind spending the money when it is a great or even a good dining experience and tasty food.  This was disappointing not only for the parents but for my sons!! We spent approximately $150.00 on lunch and we were still hungry.   We didn't order the desert. I was afraid it would be horrible.   A tip for the restaurant - you need to assign less tables to a waitress or put more staff.  For a restaurant like Gordon Ramsey's we expect that waters are to be immediately refilled and the waitress to check up on a table not only when he/she  takes the order but throughout the experience.  I had to flag her down to ask for more ketchup and tarter sauce. A customer doesn't need to flag a waitress down.   Although we still left a tip because my husband is generous, I wanted to leave zero.    Unfortunately, we won't be back- not sure if we will eat at another Gordon Ramsey's restaurant.  Disappointing that's all I can say.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States

f8ceoAd5kedFjGZd-rvahg.text: Had a really tasty unplanned lunch here yesterday. We were just kinda walking around the area and decided to stop. I had the white bean hummus as an app and it was so good! For lunch I had the pesto chicken sandwich which was incredible. Seriously so good. My husband had the steak pie which was also good but very salty. Kinda like a pot roast in a pie. Another friend I was with had a burger and I was drooling looking at it, JEALOUS of her fresh, perfectly cooked medium sandwich. Maybe next time I'll try that....

fYeteLlsFpYSfXZWVZi8vg.text: Definitely had a five-star experience tonight. First, the food was fantastic. My wife and I shared the salmon dinner Brussels sprouts and lobster rolls for an appetizer. All of the food was prepared perfectly and tasted great. It was a bit crowded. But we did not complain even still our server I anise offered us a free dessert. In Addition to that Anise was an excellent server with a lot of attention to detail. Overall I thought that the quality of food for the price was an excellent value.  HOT TIP: this place does get pretty crowded so I highly recommend booking the reservation using OpenTable. When you arrive even if there's a line go right up to the front and ask the hostess to check you in which she will do it right away.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. I really like wedge salads. This one came with hard boiled  egg which I don&#39;t prefer
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Salmon was cooked to perfection
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The brussels sprouts were delicious

rT6wuFf1xw-Ui7mh7Y_b_Q.text: Everything was great from the moment I arrived. The hostesses, wait staff etc are very friendly and helpful. I was there for Happy Hour and had some Pigs in Blankets and Truffle Fries which were very good and tasty. I checked in with Yelp so received a free Sticky Toffee Pudding with ice cream for dessert.  I will definitely be back!

RuqzQfyVndc7srRgKejOaw.text: After walking and shopping through the Forum shops we got hungry, since the buffet line had a two hr wait we left and found this place! And I was sooo glad we did. My husband and I were seated right away and got the very best server, Heather. She was friendly and knew the menu, gave recommendations. She was great, she made us feel welcomed and glad to answer all of our questions. Now to the food, we decided to just get starters and drinks. We ordered the calamari, trust me this isn't "when you're here you're family" calamari, it's fresh and fried to perfection!!!  It's tender and juicy and that dill dip is an awesome addition! We also ordered the shrimp and lobster roll, WOW, fresh, buttery, crunchy, light! It was all kinds of awesome! We had the Pineapple Express drink and the Blackberry cocktail!! That cocktail was so good, I can't wait to go back and order again!

5tiNJIBpq8Qh3udMO65-jQ.text: Had the Lab Burger, Truffle Frys and Their Pan Cake. Awesome meal and great taste. It was crowded, busy and loud... but with 4 kids we were ok as it was expected. We did enjoy our dinner and spent 2 hours there between chatting, eating and laughing. Looks like many were staying by the hosts table awaiting for a table, so reservation after 5pm till 9pm is probably a good idea.

yWDgcH2piW9mRylhZWibKw.text: Ordered the Bacon burger- bacon was burnt... Informed the server about it, he said he would bring out some more bacon for me... ok... More burnt bacon arrived at the table, the kind that if picked up would break into pieces on its own.   Come on Gordon, get your pub in order

mPqdKvQm3OXSksig7_hnHg.text: Ok we came back first time since 2013. It's really not conducive to locals visiting restaurants on the strip as we now pay for parking (we did valet) and still seems strip restaurants don't care about locals business.   We went early on 12/21/16 at 530pm were sat right away and waiter came over with a bottle of water to fill out glasses.   I have never seen a bottle just explode and come apart like this one did, I had water all over my leg and shirt and the table was flooded. Luckily the waiter did not get sliced.   We were moved to another table as the floor was also soaked. Waiter apologized about five times and so did the lady assisting him. We saw them talking to the manager as well after.   Food was very good we both had the Hell's Kitchen burger and truffle fries with one drink each. Service was spot on throughout and food was a solid four.   What is amazing is the manager never bothered to come over and you would think one drink would be comped but nothing at all. Absolutely no customer service from the manager. I had cold water all over me and granted it was just water but we had to move tables and nothing was done by the manager.   Honestly there is no reason to drive and pay for parking to get better service closer to home by places that want locals business.   Gordon Ramsey really needs to get better management here, we had issues the first time we came and it seems management is the weak part of this operation.   Food and waiter were very good so if you are close it's worth it but it's really not worth driving as a local when our business is not appreciated by management.   Updated review from April 1 2017  Absolutely fantastic experience all around. We were seated promptly at our reservation and the food and service were terrific. I forgot our waitresses name but she was one of the best we have ever had anywhere. She made a terrific beer recommendation as well as the Prime rib special which was perfect. My wife had the Hells Kitchen burger and it is great. It is obvious management is trying very hard to get things right and it shows. We will be back again soon. We could find no fault with anything and you have to have the sticky toffee pudding for dessert trust me on this.   I can honestly say this was one of the few Strip restaurants that made locals feel welcome. As I said it is obvious that management is working really hard and the issues we had in the past have been fixed.

n-E9iHNWJntp2koX1ogljA.text: Went there during New Years and recently found out through my credit card statement that not only they double charged me but also added extra $20 on my bill on top of the 18% tip. I'm appalled that a well-known restaurant would do something like this. Luckily my American Express card will dispute this charge for me, but I'm just angry that I got swindled from a restaurant of an iconic chef.  Make sure to check your credit card statement to see if they charged you correctly if you ate at this location.

SYvNYi2fj_BfoLi3DAPi9g.text: Such a let down place was so dirty there was no toilet paper in the bathroom but a few pack of wipes on the floor to use!  Only one stall open with a ghetto paper with pencil writing saying out of order.  Over priced food, had to send our salmon back TWICE because it was raw.

QnXqVngkeVmTcUye2gOIKw.text: Got the fish and chips. Half great half blah.   Make a reservation. Place gets busy quickly.   It has an awesome pub feel. Great service!  They recommended the fish and chips. Waitress said it was the most popular dish. They apparently make 2-300 of them daily.   The fish was great. Not oily at all. Had a nice taste as well.   The chips that accompanied the fish were terrible. Soft, soggy and tasteless.  We had a few and left the rest. Waitress never asked us how we felt about them. Clearly they sucked lol  This was my second favorite of the Gordan Ramsay restaurants in Vegas. BurGR was awesome.   Also, side note. We were watching the GSW OKC game 6 playoff game. The place for loud and lively. Nice atmosphere. Nothing like back home but nothing really is. #wethenorth

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fish and chips. Fish great. Chips bad.
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Calamari. It was ok. I&#39;ll pass next time.

s0lzxaLG6IONIdiVIsftnw.text: One of the best food experiences on last trip to Vegas over the Memorial Day weekend.  The food was amazing, started with the Lobster Roll which just melted in your mouth ... truly tasty! ... then had the lamb burger and truffle fries which was matched (by our amazing server Jenny) with a very delicious Pinot Noir.   Wish we had room for dessert because the dessert menu looked incredibly delicious!!  The pub is uniquely decorated and cozy at the same time .... especially loved the Corgi chairs and the British Flag drink & food menus.   What brought it to 5 stars though was our simply awesome server Jenny. She was very attentive, answered all questions, had a great sense of humor & smile :) She was busy and dealt with some not so nice customers but never stopped smiling or keeping up with her nice customers :)  Highly recommend .... and ask for Jenny! :)

VvoKpMPYKI9STkHm6L2szQ.text: The food was fine.  No mistakes, but nothing that really jumped out and made one's mouth really happy.  We tried the short rib nachos.  Filling, but a little short on spice in the short ribs for my tastes.  A beet salad and creamed spinach were both fine.  A burger was large but only average.  Again, no flaws but nothing notable.  All on the pricey side.  We had a comp.  I wouldn't return if I had to pay.

xh_FMG7lUMMkwqaM-nZVlQ.text: We came in for a quick Bloody Mary and ended up hanging out at the bar for a couple of hours. Mike took excellent care of us, and his cocktail creations were out of this world. Next time maybe we'll actually order food...

qnmX-A0GpES3jP_qRyGAbw.text: Has to be one of the best restaurants I've ever been to! The sticky toffee pudding was amazing! I definitely recommend this place

IZPbncLxrLV6PuxZ3ob4Vg.text: This is only our 5th time here, but we absolutely have to come back every time we come to Vegas!!   Love this place!!  And this is the 2nd time we had Ray Ray as our bartender during happy hour!! And he is the Best!!  Top notch service!  Gives us great conversation and makes us want to come back again!!   Oh and the food is AMAZING!!  Happy hour is 2-5....  so sit at the bar and say hi to Ray Ray!

Zd9cFshosvIaGdb9ECFPcg.text: My two friends and I were in Vegas last weekend for a bachelorette party. We went over to do a champagne tasting at Fizz at 5:00 but found out they don't open until 6:00. We decided to get food while we waited. There was no line and the hostess was very welcoming to us. We were seated quickly and had a drink in hand in no time- awesome!  We got the calamari, nachos, and fish and chips to share. All of it was awesome but I have to say, that may have been the best fish and chips I've had in YEARS. We all wish we would have ordered another plate. The calamari was cooked perfectly and the portion was huge. Will definitely be back next time we're in Vegas!

kTT_XSU3kAFYbKq-o0M_nw.text: If Gordon was here today he would have been cussing up a storm.  15 min to have waiter take order and 50 minutes for food to come out.  What the HELL.  Food was so so at best, over priced and bad service equals never again and keep walking.  I would have had faster service and better burger at Smash Burger next door.

2sQlknDvyQOabLnHO0HpuA.text: I had the fish and chips and was disappointed.  The dish was flavorless all the way around.  The decor is lovely.  The service good.  Dinner companions were unimpressed with their dishes.

jTnijR7ZwMoHJKwqc0UP6g.text: In Vegas for business and the only thing I want to do is eat at one of Gordon Ramsey's restaurant. I'm a huge fan and wanted to say I was there and of course get some good food. Well this place did not disappoint any of my expectations. The waiter Rodney was the best and let me ask all kinds of questions about Gordon and made me and my friend feel like we were the only table he had. Great food, great fun and great atmosphere!!!  Thanks so much!!!  If you go be sure to save room for the sticky toffee pudding..... THE BOMB!!

wDQ5_AGmTTs0B6M8_jac3w.text: Late post - Had an amazing experience here.  Keith, our bartender was super attentive and hospitable.  Louie, the General Manager is fantastic!!!! One of the coolest and nicest people you will ever meet on this planet.  Randy, the AGM, works the room and makes sure everyone is happy.  You couldn't ask for a group of nicer and accommodating staff.  The food is on point!  I definitely recommend the Lobster Mac N Cheese.  It is so decadent and tasty it will send you into a food coma, but also soaks up all the alcohol.  Everything we ate was carbalicious and amazing!!!!  Chef Ramsay should be very proud of this outlet because everyone from front of house to back of house is friendly, knowledgable and accommodating.  Highly recommend this place for pre or post show at the colosseum, or just for a great night out!

H3dd2c5LiwdWm9oQg_c8wA.text: I'm surprised... Never been to a snobby english prick restaurant before, but there's a first time for everything.  For perspective, our res was New Year's Day.  Waitress was personable, attentive and very knowledgeable about the menu (coincidentally she LOVED all the expensive stuff on the menu, I guess it is Vegas...).  Aside from the weird, tight, newspaper looking dresses that Gordon frocked them in, the waitstaff seemed on the ball as a whole.    Not sure what was going on in the kitchen though, it took a bit over an hour for our food.  If you haven't seen the menu its a trendy gastropub fare with flashes of England throughout.  I got the Lamb T-bone and it was so damn salty my foot swelled almost immediately.  For some reason, all four of our meals seemed a bit salty to me, I guess it is pretty typical english fare but I was a bit disappointed.  The atmosphere was awash with loud english flair accented by the waitstaff's overly loud garb.    Gordon, I just expected more from you.  If you're gonna make a fish and chips joint, be sure to keep it simple and rely on the pure flavor of the food not overseasoning as compensation.

YC_4TszqJ6wA7kDD_DUZ_A.text: So unless you want a free meal by having hot creamed spinach and beet greens spilled on you (or a friend) I suggest one of the other thousand restaurants in Vegas.   Took forever to get served (even waters/drinks) after getting a late reservation. Food and drinks came out slow. took over 45 minutes to get our food after ordering. When the food finally came out the sides were not ready and my steak was already cooling down. We called the manager over to complain and while he was there apologizing, the creamed spinach side finally came and was accidentally dumped on one of our party. Needless to say dinner "was on them" after that.  The food did not live up to my impression of Gordon Ramsy except in that the kitchen was from hell.  Our waitress tried to be as attentive as possible but this place is a train wreck and I think there are better options around for the money (assuming we had paid)

4wAzW5vUP9RrvtoAfASCmw.text: No, No, No, say it ain't so! I love Gordon Ramsey.  This is just based on the service since we didn't even get a chance to try the food.  Walked in for early lunch on Saturday and restaurant wasn't even 1/2 full, yet no one including the hostess can find a table to put us. True we were a party of 9 but still!  The restaurant was HALF empty!!? wtf? And this IS VEGAS! Your whole staff stood there oblivious what to do.    Starting to wonder of these celebrity chef restaurants are actually worth the hype?? My impression is just another celebrity making a buck off their current fame.  Very disappointing.   I'll still watch Hells Kitchen to see who ended up running this place.

NIvdVkByKlp_QsYXyOmolg.text: We went last night and given it's a Gordon Ramsay restaurant expected a high standard. The food was good. I had the short rib which was great. My wife had a chicken pie and my brother a lamb burger. We all enjoyed our meals. I'm only giving our experience 3 stars for a few reasons. The service was disappointing with our waitress forgetting our fries (she didn't write it down) and not seeming too concerned when we told her there was broken glass under our table. At $60 I would have expected better quality for the Cabernet on the menu. It came out cold and overall was pretty average for a local wine at that price point. I wouldn't be ordering wine there again.

zM_IrBH234g0v9FfcixjSQ.text: To be honest not impressed. Had a wedge salad and called it a night. Paid $15 for a Scooby snack that was not even at half the shot glass.

WAyhf5Z5SsTI9GxtK9jc_w.text: I stopped by here last night for an early dinner with my fiance.  We didn't have reservations and that did not seem to be a problem as we were sat immediately.  Our seats ended up being right near the edge of the casino and near the posted menu which was distracting for me.  Since it was a Sunday the tv's all had football games on them with the sound playing loudly over the restaurant speakers.  While i enjoyed that, i wish the volume would have been a bit softer.  The decor of the restaurant itself is quite cool with one room being divided from another with a wall of kegs and then there was some cool chandeliers and a lounge type area.  I also enjoyed the wooden chargers on the table as well as the silverware of which the bottoms reminded me of the St. George cross. What i didn't enjoy was the outfits of the staff as the hounds-tooth was hideous and i would have to agree with other users who said it made them look cheap and trashy.  For an appetizer my fiance and I started out with the duck confit poutine.  Whenever it first came out I was unable to see any of the duck but I eventually found it lurking in the goodness of the poutine.  My favorite parts of it were the duck and cheese although the fries were nice and crispy except for the ones that sat too long in the duck gravy which ended up being overly sweet for me.  Who would have thought that this Canadian dish would end up on a English pub menu.  For my main course I decided on the shepherds pie.  Whenever it came out I thought that it looked a bit small but I was stuffed by the time I had finished it all.  The base was a mixture of beef and lamb combined with some carrots and peas and then topped with some mashed potatoes.  In the end it was a decent dish as the meat was tender but it did not really wow me at all.  The bottom line for me is that I would probably not come back to the Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grille in the future.  While my meal was ok, there are too many other places nearby that are better and at the same price point or even cheaper.

FvzxUVXq92w46oXzZMO_Pw.text: This is no exaggeration, the best restaurant I have been to in a long time.  The food is incredible, in fact I can never haver another shepherds pie again, because it is all downhill from here, I will never eat food this good again.  Anyone who argues with a Gordon Ramsey recipe should be shot and pissed on.  There is not a clunker on the menu. And if you are lucky enough to have Taylor as your server you will not be disappointed.  Hands down the best service we've had in many many years.

BgfRZbjrkaqeZ2dgX26EMg.text: Was daunted by reviews but had to try it anyway.  This is a nice and seemingly consistent place. The decor is great, the food good, and the bartenders friendly.  It feels like a spot to hang out.  No one is conveyoring you along.    I watched the end of the Heats winning streak at the bar and met a few friendly people.  Even heard a few English accents.  The bangers and mash actually tasted healthy (chicken sausage I think) and had a gourmet flair to it.  Go!  DT

qqGwoZZYPcYxImhm8_9WJg.text: Have been wanting to go here for a very long time!  Watching Gordan on TV all these years, you can't help but wonder how the food and service will really be.  Well, we enjoyed every minute of our experience.  I had a burger, my wife and the fish and chips and had the prawn cocktail as an appetizer.  Every bit of it was great!  Our server Daisy was wonderful, it was busy but she was fantastic, answered questions and gave great food recommendations.  Called for the Manager just to give a compliment and he was very appreciative.  I think all too often people find it easy to complain when their dining experience isn't to their perfection.  Well, tonight for my wife and I it was just that, perfection.   We have a great time. Great tasty good, great atmosphere, great staff.  Thanks for a great night Gordan Ramsay Pub & Grill!  Look forward to getting back there sooner rather than later!

-vebqtU6ehfodjRPd9zvkw.text: We arrived in Vegas on the 22nd. Upon entering the hotel room I immediately noticed a magazine with Gordon Ramsay on the front "Ramsay takes over Vegas" Being a HUGE fan, I read it and got giddy when I found out that not only did Pub & Grill open already, but Burgr was planned to open that very night!! (Turns out it opened earlier in the week, but IT WAS OPEN).    We decided to hit Pub and Grill on Saturday night. Josh was our waiter and I swear he had ESP. Every time we mentioned something we needed POOF there he was with it in hand or said...hey could you use...... I jokingly asked him if the bulldog lamp was wired. Josh was simply amazing. I can't say it enough. I would say he gave us the best service out of all the places we ate at this year. He gets brownie points for remembering my name is Darlene, so many people two minutes later forget and call me Diane, Donna...something with a D.   Ok now for the food. I ordered the Shephard's Pie and my boyfriend ordered the Lamb Burger. The Shephard's Pie was good at first. The mashed potatoes were amazing. However, I quickly discovered I didn't care for lamb, my first time ever trying it. I ate about 1/2 of the dish. I soooo wanted to love it, but just couldn't. My boyfriend loved his lamb burger, said it was in his top 10 of burgers. We ordered dessert, I got the sticky toffee pudding and he got the chocoloate trifle. OH MY GOD!!! The sticky toffee pudding was to die for. I could eat that everyday!! The warm sauce topping the cake with a side of frozen cream was just fantastic. I tried my boyfriend's chocolate trifle and it too was incredible. Layers of chocolate with a brownie on the bottom and served with two little chocolate cookies was very cute.   Pub & Grill is not your typical Pub & Grill.......Gordon Ramsay does it again!!

AwzaCW14_kVxGoHY9UuxPw.text: My son and I happened upon this place hunting dinner last night.  I truly enjoyed my curry.  My son ordered the short ribs.  I noticed he didn't eat much of the meat...very strange for a 17 year old!!  I could tell something wasn't quiet right....  We returned to our hotel and within three hours he became so violently Ill that he ended up in the ER on IV fluids and medications.  The doctor mentioned it was most likely something he ate, And asked when his last meal was.  Apparently the timing is perfect.  No way to prove it, but I fully believe it was this meal.  I hate that we will never go back because the place was cool and our server was wonderful.

zna9K2Txq088OeEjuJUNhw.text: The food was incredible and reasonably priced for being in a hotel on a Vegas strip. The pistachio pesto chicken sandwich was to die for! I expected phenomenal food from such a tv personality like Gordon Ramsey, what I wasn't expecting was our service! Kimberly was incredible! She was so welcoming and funny! We're from Buffalo, NY and she made us feel at home. She even knew we were called the "City of Good Neighbors" and complimented us on how kind we were! We love Kimberly!!!!!! I can't say enough about her and how she is the first person after 4 days of Las Vegas to make us feel so welcomed!

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The family with our awesome waitress Kimberly!

wih4_oYvtR7hxKHuCfMQpQ.text: This is the second time I've come.  I ordered pretzel appetizer and the salad with chicken shrimp and salami. The service was horrible.   The waiter should write the order down. The beer never came. Appetizer came after the meal.  Salad was fair. Drenched in dressing.     Pretzels were best part.   :/

8DbAB1uRN_jAKtS-PVrNuw.text: Why does your food have to be so good, Gordo?  The mini sliders with the applewood smoked bacon, welsh cheddar and garlic aioli were amah-zing!

zq-cEN5Wf0IGC5oHrLvfFQ.text: We came here because we had trouble finding seats to watch a football game in the Vegas area. We found a great table with several large TVs to enjoy the game. The atmosphere here was so fun for NFL playoffs. We had quick and friendly service from our server Rodney, who was knowledgeable about the menu and the Las Vegas area. He told us about the restaurant and kept us entertained. We would definitely come back!

lDBJBlh-DND8Yq0XCU0eAg.text: Great atmosphere and very friendly staff. We were here from Michigan and had a very nice conversation with Randy the manager.  We are in Vegas to celebrate my step daughters 21st birthday. We are fans of Hell's Kitchen and Randy made it possible for us to meet  Chef Scott Cummings one of the Hell's Kitchen winners.  The food was amazing and we only had appetizers.  Randy made our experience very memorable.  We even got photos with Chef Scott.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chef Scott Cummings with Kayla

-RI5pO1gP_-Bcj7ZSqN09w.text: Have so much to write about this place.  We had a very large group about 15 people and they said we couldn't have so many. But they ended up putting tables together so I am happy they could do this.  The food is unbelievably overpriced. That food is not worth the price.  I got to taste a bunch of things from friends.  The food took sooooo long. I was starving. I got a sprite. $4 for a sprite. That is insane.  Then I ordered the Shepard pie. I only got it because it was recommended. I didn't think it was going to just be ground beef and mashed potatoes. That's worth less than 10 dollars and it was $22. Insane!!! It wasn't even that good. It was just okay.  I also tasted the nachos and they were way better than the Shepard pie. Didn't have much cheese but the chips were good at least.  I also tasted one of the burgers and it was the strangest burger I ever had. It wasn't good. It was also $20. None of that was worth it.  I also tasted the cheesecake which was the best thing I had. I loved it but was still overpriced. And I tasted the toffee and it was yummy but not as great as everyone says. I liked the cheesecake a lot better.  Then we had a huge problem with our bill. It took an entire hour so we could get separate bills. Everyone was so upset and just wanted to leave. They kept saying they couldn't split the bills until the manager was called and they finally fixed it. I don't recommend this place at all. Maybe just once to try it but I would never come here again.

lYeMyTa2_tbKM0lOuVmaxQ.text: The food was just ok, really what makes this place so great is the bar staff! The guys in the bar were so much fun to talk to and hang out with that we ended up passing on our table and having our meal right there.  Great selections of beer, they even have their own certified beer expert that lets you try his beer if you ask nicely! The food was just ok, but really its the people that make this place so great. If the manager is reading this please please give your bar staff a raise! They rock!

sSgB9vwUV3MUBUySqJPiKQ.text: We had SO much fun here! We met friends who live nearby for dinner while we were in town for a getaway. We were staying in Nobu, so we had time to kill before they arrived. We sat at the bar for a few coctails. Jose was our bartender. Such a nice guy, as well as very professional and knowledgeable. We wound up going back on our 2nd night to watch the Rangers playoff game (the cigarette smoke in sportsbook is too overwhelming for us non-smokers).  On night 2, we met Gene the bartender, who's just as nice as Jose, and also extremely funny. We had great service and entertainment with Jose and Gene, plus the Rangers managed a win.   Food is very good. Between us both, we tried the shepherd's pie, toad in the hole, lamb burger, and tri-tip sandwich. All delicious! Another fun spot we'll definitely return to when we return to Vegas.

VTY4VzWyqY5ZqNIddZjH-Q.text: Absolutely fantastic! Me and the wife had the bacon burger (I added avocado) medium it was the best I have ever had in my life. The hype is real. Anybody giving bad reviews about this place dont know what they are talking about. I absolutely recommend it.

z-ZYRVqWSuGJ_dSJZdf15g.text: I would have given it more stars, but the prices are way over what they should be.  I suppose since this restaurant is in Ceasars it does just fine, but come on, give people a break.  My sister had soup and paid $15.  I shared the corned beef sandwich.  It was great, and was enough to split.  Our waiter was Scott.  Very nice and good service.

a6oeOQiaKeTvtCIyorNAzQ.text: Sometimes your reputational for demanding excellence can build an expectation for it. For me, Gordon Ramsay's Pub & Grill is a solid "eh" on the scale.   The food was good. Just good. I had the Shepherd's Pie on a recommendation from the server (he preferred that over the other pies) and though the potato and lamb were well cooked they were under-spiced to the point of flavorlessness. Again, not bad and completely inoffensive, but for 26 bucks my rather small portion left me wishing I'd either picked a different dish or different restaurant.  We also ordered a cheese plate to share. The sharp cheddar and goat cheese were quite good, but the English blue cheese tasted & looked like canned cheese with crumbled blue mixed in. The bread was too hard, and there wasn't enough of it. Eventually we were left eating the cheese alone.   Our server was attentive, polite, and quite personable. No issues there at all.  In the end, this becomes a prohibitively pricey option when you factor in the quality.

ylMsfNoGb5jsjEqDdlVkgQ.text: My boyfriend and I had dinner here on our last trip to Vegas. When the hosted greeted us my bf asked her if we could possibly get seated at a booth. She told us that none were available at the moment but that one was just clearing and that if didn't mind waiting 5 minutes, they could clean it for us. We decided to wait. We got a lovely booth at the back of the restaurant.  A waiter came right away to get a drink orders. He was super friendly and very knowledgeable about the menu.  I ordered fish and chips, and my bf got the lamb burger. Both were delicious.  My only complaint was the price. $30 for fish and chips is a bit excessive, even for a Ramsay restaurant.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fish and chips

SY0rRlF9hTCxPu7UivuSzg.text: The service was fantastic. Our server was friendly, funny and professional.   He and some of the other staff made sure that our water and cocktails were never empty.  He did forget that we had ordered an appetizer, but it wasn't a problem because our entrees were served really fast.   I ordered the wedge salad and it was really good. My friend ordered the chicken pot pie. Of course I had a few bites and was shocked at how good it was.    He always orders the really tasty stuff.  I will definitely be visiting again.

ijzdQ2fkz7MkDCXUUC9NQA.text: The wait staff was great but the food was just ok, I expected a bigger menu or something unique, but it had neither and what we did order was just average. Considering it was Vegas the price was better then expected.

s5mvW3UkHfG4rhaL_i4VSA.text: I am so sad about this review! My husband and I are Gordon fans, so we were pretty excited. We started with the routine and shepherds pie. Our order arrived within 5 minutes, which we found to be strange. Our beers hadnt even been served yet. Our waitress came with our drinks and said "Oh, you're food is here already! That was fast!" Obviously she thought it was weird too. The shepherds pie was luke warm at best and the routine was cold. It seemed like it was made ahead of time. I mentioned this to our server. She acted weird about it and pretty much left the table. After 10 minutes, she came back and said, you don't seem happy with your poutine, let me get you a new one. But she didn't bring me a new one. She just brought us the check. She didn't charge us for the fries, but I left the restaurant hungry. Also, the shepherds pie came with a tiny bowl of dried kale, dressing on the side. Anyone who has watched Gordon would know that you never serve kale dry and raw like that. Kale needs to be massaged with oil or dressing in order to get that silky texture you expect in a kale salad. So sad and disappointed!

_9lE5uQZIv9H3bkWWZxlEQ.text: We stopped here for a light dinner.My fiance and I split a burger and fries and it was soooo good. Even the fries were seasoned really well. The atmosphere is pretty neat as well.

SXpqr2zCJ8mgaqL_moHq2w.text: The food was definitely great.  The wife had the lamb burger with goat cheese.  while it had nothing besides the goat cheese on it, I was skeptical as I like a lot of strong flavors.  But it was quite tasty, I was surprised.  I ordered the fish n chips.  That being said I'm not a big fish n chips fan normally because the breading never seems completely done to me.  However the fish n chips was really good.  The batter had just the slightest hint of being not quite crispy all the way through though.  So the 4 stars. But the chips or fries were amazing!!  They are delicious and the size of landscaping timbers!  Someone on here complained about them which I thought was stupid.   It did take about 15 min longer than I thought it should for the kitchen to get our order out though.  We were one of the first ones there and there were several other tables that got their food first.  All in all it was 90 mins start to finish for lunch.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yeah I&#39;m like&#39;n that!  Bottle conditioned just like I make at home.

VIa4HUTWwiyQkrOSxUG4oQ.text: A bit apprehensive given the reviews but we really enjoyed the experience. The place looks great and the food and service will get there with a little time. Love the interior design and the place was packed with a 15 minute wait! We sat at the bar Matt was awesome. Place mats are very English pub looking... Love the plate presentation.  the selection of draft beers is fantastic. they even offer a draft hard apple and pear ciders. the pear was amazing and Matt was happy to let me try a sample of the apple as well.  We started with the duck poutine and the warm pretzels. Pretzels were wonderful and the English mustard was super spicy and delicious. Duck poutine was good but not a lot of confit for the price.  Fish and Chips was a mixed bag. the fish was excellent, cooked perfectly with a great malt vinegar presentation. We did not care for the "Chips" the french fries served witht he Poutine were much better.  Sticky toffee pudding an excellent. Peanut butter and Jelly dessert needed work. If I am in the Forum SHops or going to an event/show at Caeser's I will be back.  Lots of great things on the menu I still want to try.  The dual pricing Regular menu price/Harrah's club member pricing truly INSULTING and fit for a Casino buffet not a world class chef

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States

AoUjNRcWFyZn5RoxO4VPxA.text: Food was amazing and so was the service. I highly recommend it for lunch and drinks. Mini Lobster rolls and deviled eggs are to die for. The place is very well thought out and very comfortable.

gy4fq0fhBHgw3Ihk8bhSLg.text: Came here for dinner with some co-workers who recommended it.  Overall, it was good, but there were definitely some large flaws that pulled down my review to 3 stars.  I arrived a little late (about 10 minutes after the rest of my party) and the waitress seemed instantly offended by my tardiness and decided to be rude to me.  It took her forever to take my order, and she seemed annoyed to speak to me and have to take a second order for the table.    When the food came out, they completely messed up our entire order.  The waitress hadn't ordered the first people in the party's food, so I got my plate and everyone else was waiting around.  The waitress became somewhat more apologetic at that point, but the speed of the service was terrible.  As for the food, I ordered fish and chips.  The fish was really good but the chips were dry and over-salted.  I thought they had a good beer selection as well which I was happy about.   If it wasn't for the poor customer service, I would have given this 4 stars.

QczK8ZGY9umeookGLputMg.text: Not only was the food was delicious, but the service was spectacular. Our server Chris really helped me out with my order and recommended the filet mignon with shrimp instead of just getting the New York steak. I must say I'm glad I listened to him. He also recommended a really good dessert. I forgot what it was called but it was some sort of bread with a scoop of ice cream on top. Overall it was a great experience. We even got greeted the GM. Thumbs up for sure!

TtR7Ts8vyPzpW0APNacczw.text: Love this place! My husband and I went to celebrate his birthday and found the staff and service to be friendly and attentive. We ate simply- French Onion Soup and Sliders, but this was the best Onion Soup and Sliders that we ever had! We will be back!

CqMGR1dSpRFUoy7TDfOppw.text: This is my second visit to Gordon Ramsey Pub & Grill and I have to say it just gets better and better. Tonight I sat at the wood and G served us. He did such a great job entertaining us and keeping us happy. He is the reason I will come back.

zmtqs6RkC4nxWu6ghtuYTw.text: Unbelievable experience. Delicious food.  We went for lunch and I had the "bangers and mash". My wife had the pesto chicken sandwich. All were delicious.   Adam Z. was an amazing server and had spot on recommendations. Ray Ray creates and serves the best drinks. A must stop for anyone visiting Vegas!!!

cmbX0mGDPdvDIN-nLao64g.text: I came for happy hour on a Thursday at 4pm. Delicious! The deviled eggs are so good and so was the lobster and shrimp minirolls on brioche. I am a happy girl! Try the Goodbye Blue Sky cocktail, I'm told its great, as well. Not very strong, sweet, and yummy. I was making a spa day of it at the Qua bath and spa at Caesars and got hungry. So glad I chose this place!

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yum! Calamari, deviled eggs and lobster shrimp mini rolls :)

8sEKonjO6sV4YVx7JC_TXg.text: Came here right before Mariah Carey's July 15th Concert, it's right across the casino! Me and my friend made reservations MONTHS ago as we watch Hell's Kitchen faithfully, so as soon as we knew we were going to Vegas from Chicago, we knew we had to try out this place with hopes of meeting Executive Chef: Scott Commings, winner of Hell's Kitchen. Our server Kimberly knew we were extremely excited and she was very knowledgeable of everything on the menu (even though we knew exactly what he wanted because we looked at the menu so many times before going). She was extremely nice and had ties to Chicago. She was the one of the few people in the entire city of Las Vegas who did not have an attitude! lol, but she was spectacular to have around. Also, two members management were extremely attentive throughout dinner service, did not get their names but they were in suits so I can assume it could've been the GM and Assistant GM. Sidenote: *We were in a rush because we did not want to be late for the concert, we did not tell our server this because we also did not want to rush the experience of being at Gordon Ramsay's restaurant. We ordered truffle fries as our appetizer and the 14 oz. Ribeye and the Salmon entree. The food arrived to our surprise so quickly! First the fries, then the entrees, at our table no less than 15-20 minutes cooked to PERFECTION! We both shared everything and was quite full! Truffle Fries: truffle fries are huge in Chicago and we already knew that we loved them so we definitely wanted to give it a try, the fries were perfectly crispy and the truffle aioli was perfect! I don't usually care for the truffle aioli but this one was delicious! 14 oz Ribeye: Cooked to absolute perfection, our mouths melted, not the steak, our mouths did. That's how delicious this steak was. I've been to plenty of steakhouses before, but when I say that the quality of this beef gave it a flavor like no other paired with perfect seasoning, and seared to perfection. I wanted to cry, that's how good the steak was. Salmon: With salmon, the trick is getting a crispy skin, a lot of times you get salmon from a restaurant that comes with an unnecessary slimy texture. Not here! I feel like I am repeating myself by saying everything was perfect, but it's been a week since I was here and I have not forgotten about it at all. I had to tell the manager how amazing the entire experience was and he served us a English Toffee desert that was poured table side and was scrumptious!!!!! Chef Ramsay, OPEN A RESTAURANT IN CHICAGO! I BEG OF YOU! I personally thank you for this establishment and I 100000% recommend it to anyone traveling to Vegas and to anyone who is a fan of Chef Ramsay's monopoly of cooking shows. This was definitely one of the highlights out of Vegas' amazing options and I will never forgot coming here! I couldn't have had a better eating experience! We even got to meet Scott and take a picture with him!!! - Devin Torkelsen of DevinTorkelsen.com

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Devin Torkelsen, Executive Chef and Winner of Hell&#39;s Kitchen Scott Commings, and Thomas Hollins; Gordon Ramsay Pub &amp; Grill Caesar&#39;s Palace

xLY3lfppzfZZImBfvQTrbw.text: The food was good but the service was very poor.  We were seated immediately but waited about 20 mins before we got a menu.  Several tables of people left before they could be served because they waited so long.  We had hot sticky toffee pudding with ice cream for dessert and it was delivered without a spoon.  We asked for one and waited about 15 mins before we got one, needless to say the ice cream was melted by then.  Seems odd when Gordon is such a stickler for good service.

743LNlaJYlDMXHkqiBbvLw.text: You know when it takes 60 minutes to get your order and it is wrong at a Gordon Ramsey resturant something is definitely F'd.  3 pm on a Sunday. I order a lamb burger medium rare and truffle fries to go. 60 minutes later my order comes out. Burger and regular fries and not to go. The guy next to me at the bar ordered a rueben 5 minutes after I ordered and FINISHED it before I recieved my order. And it was wrong. I really wanted to go Gordon Ramsey on them, but I didn't. flavors were there but for 25 bucks it was not a good experience.... or as I think Gordon would say, "Absolutely F'ing unacceptable!!"

b8ff1rwkL8Hd774ja3JZFw.text: Food, ambience & service were very good but we kinda felt misled because over the phone they said their cocktails and beer were between $5-$7 during the happy hour. But they took $3 off their $15 cocktail and $12 beers. So just be aware of the prices when you go there!

BIZB1hBQ0U3OZuaLGjwBZg.text: Cute Place burger Was GOOD..not at all great very Dry and the bread dry as well fries were very good . Staff was nice food planet Hollywoodish. Cool place to have a beer more novelty than restaurant. . Grab a drink with friends and eat elsewhere.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Keg wall

smrNHtHTPV4Tqu0MEsL5lg.text: For all of the quality control and barking Gordon Ramsay does at others restaurants, he might want to do some of his own house keeping. Even though there was a reservation, they hobbled together three different sized tables and brought stackable chairs, like the kind from a conference center and we still had to wait over 20 minutes to be seated. As if that wasn't enough of a great start, a chair was broken so one of the party members couldn't even lean back and no one rectified it because they were scurrying around sub serving other people. The service was slow AF!!!! The food sat for so long under the heat lamps that the plates were scalding hot, and the bottoms were soaked with liquid from the food and had to be eaten with a knife and fork! The only thing that was quick was them refilling glasses with bottled water ($) for our party of ten. Absolute garbage!!!!

4p38fiXpVB_2vW4rQupz8w.text: I just came in to grab an appetizer, have a drink, wait for a friend to get off work. This place gets pretty packed, but it's well worth it to sit at the bar if you can. The bartenders were nothing short of friendly and entertaining. Gene fixed me up a Goodbye Blue Sky (after I gave him the 'I don' t know what I want to drink' look) and managed to charm and be attentive to each person on the back end of the bar.   I started off with the bacon crumble calamari and I was blown away. I love seafood and I think I've had calamari in every restaurant I've ever been in, but this stuff topped it all. I don't even like marinara or tartar sauce, but Bill the manager happened to walk by and encouraged me to try it. It was fresh, didn't taste a thing like the normal bottled sauces I've tried.   The best part is, the food was so rich and good, I could barely finish an appetizer and 2 drinks solo. Between Gene and Bill's attentiveness, the amazing food and the lively atmosphere, I can say the experience was well worth the higher price tag. But what can you expect from a name restaurant? They're a dime a dozen in this town, but this one will stay special to me.

mJ30TxaQXQYE8rVeDj8rKg.text: The food was just OK. Make sure to make a reservation though it gets busy. Also, it is quiet nosy and the chairs are enormous armchairs and uncomfortable. If you're on a date, maybe request ion a quieter section.   the food was uniquely served on dark cutting boards, which I really liked, but it was just meh. Gordon Ramsey Bugr place is better I think.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Appetizers

AGVQX8OE_cox4WaXqxR_Jw.text: I'm honestly surprised that Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill only has three stars and Gordon Ramsay BurGR has four stars. In my mind it should really be reversed.
