Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill has nice English pub fare that I would be happy to eat any time.   My friend and I split the steak and ale pie, fish and chips, lobster mac and cheese, and truffle fries. All were very pleasing! The steak and ale pie was my favorite - the pie filling was fantastic. I wish I could get my own personal stews to have the same bold yet delicate flavor of steak, mushroom, and ale.   The fish and chips were also satisfying. I am definitely a harsh critic of the batter on the fish (after two years of living in Ireland and eating at my fair share of chippers and pubs) and this one was light and crispy, but still solid. I wish the fish was a bit more seasoned before it was battered, but nothing that couldn't be fixed with some malt vinegar.  The lobster mac and cheese was gorgeous. Exactly the ooey-gooey cheesy consistency I look for in mac and cheese - and filled with lots of lobster chunks and flavor. The truffle fries were also fantastic. The truffle aioli had so many chunks of truffle that I was alternating dipping my fries and fish.  My other two friends ordered the lamb burger and the bangers and mash. Both enjoyed their dishes as well.   Again, we had a very good meal at Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill. I would MUCH rather come back here rather than Gordon Ramsay BurGR any day!

ORLikYgUad8U8FBrkAEccQ.text: I was not very impressed. They sat us at a high top table that had very hard chairs. Not to mention the food is very overpriced and not all that special. It tastes like something that I would get at any other Cafe. Nothing special like I said. I had chicken and it was extremely overpriced. Not worth the money that I paid for my meal, or anyone else's for that matter. But their desserts are really good.

gsncBjczU4oba4itmZzzQg.text: I was optimistic yet cautious after reading other reviews. I had had wonderful experiences at his other restaurants.  IT WAS DELICIOUS.  Our waiter John was great. Started with Scotch egg and Lobster mac n cheese. Hubby got Banger n Mash and I got Lamb burger. I was so sad I could only eat half of the burger cuz I was so full. Sooooo tender and juicy. We ordered the Sticky toffee even though we could only each take a bite.  Recommend the Ramsay tonic cocktail. Delicious and fresh.

AIyJqh_QYhivEKC2nm4zZQ.text: I so looked forward to eating an expertly prepared meal even if it was one of his pubs vs one of Gordon's more $$$$ restaurants. I was very disappointed. We ordered their "speciality" dishes, fish and chips.  The fries obviously came off a warmer not freshly cooked and the fish coating was tough from being on a warmer.   I still enjoy his reality shows but this restaurant not so much.

GI74p4JH-82L7E06WuaWNQ.text: As much as I like watching Gordon Ramsay Hell's Kitchen, Kitchen Nightmare, Master Chef and Master Chef Jr. shows. This place is just as awesome. Though services are slightly not on top. We were a table of 3, two of the appetizer came out while my cousin was still waiting for her French Onion Soup. Apparently, the waiter forgot to take notes so therefore she never got hers. Then after our dinner meal, we ordered desserts. It took another 50 minutes before we get our sticky toffee bun between sipping down our coffee. It was a real long wait. Where's Gordon when you need him to yell at his staff? Totally bad timing. But the waiter was smart and did us a favor by taking out the desserts on the tap on them.   Not so bad, despite the food was super delicious! They probably need to really work on their time management with the kitchen to floor excursion. Otherwise, I definitely wouldn't mind to go back again to try out other dishes! Yippee!!

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cappuccino
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Seared Scallops
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. French Onion Soup

UsoVltPItN3frFyhxZOjFA.text: Duck Confit Poutine was delicious and thankfully not too rich. Fish and chips were good, but the chips were the highlight with a garlic infused ketchup. The Irish Beef Cheek Stew was uber tender, but surprisingly not the best dish of the meal. It's like a fatty and tender version of pot roast without the benefit of the flavor and texture of carrots or onions (and potatoes if you like that kind of thing). The highlight of the meal just may have been the sticky toffee pudding with sweet cream ice cream. Soft, warm, moist and not overly sweet. Next time I hope to dive into the rest of their pub snacks and small plates.

qzR9cL383n7JCX-3MLGoDA.text: The worst service I have ever experienced in vegas. First of all, when I searched open table to find a place to eat it said all times were available for seating so we just walked over without making a reservation. When we arrived they said there was a 30 minute wait. Weird. So we waited. Then we were seated and waited somewhere between 15 and 20 minutes to have a Waitress welcome us... even though I complained to the host after 10 minutes. The service was SO bad. The waitress said it was because everyone sat down at the same time because of "the show."  How long has this place bend around? It's called preparation. You know when there's a show. Staff appropriately. The food was pretty good but it came out before our drinks. Go to BURGR at planet Hollywood. Way more worth it.

2LWhMLBQG5vRJAKSG-juZQ.text: Second time eating there. First time was 2 years ago, food was great. Got bread and butter before meal and the fish and chips were good. Second time was tonight. Expecting same great food but not. No bread and butter now you have to buy it Ordered lobster roll and calamari. Lobster roll was tasteless and calamari salty and soggy. Waiter never came by to check on us and we had to ask other wait staff for help. Didn't even refill our water.  Told them how disappointed we were and they said sorry. Then said we gave you a 20% discount but bill showed 10%. All in all very disappointed. Not what you would expect from a Gordon Ramsey restaurant.

Rhg2tVr6jCmsEAF6q0dVSA.text: The food was nothing less than exquisite, came out promptly, and the staff was friendly and very professional. Highly recommend

9_h6jbN3Liy0mYzqvyAxEw.text: First time here, and I was blown away. Happy hour M-F 2-5 in the bar only. My cousin and I ordered the frog in a hole (pigs in a blanket), nachos (short rib with an amazingly velvety cheddar cheese sauce, best nachos I have EVER had), and pretzels with that same cheese sauce (heaven). Ray Ray was the bartender. We chatted with him the duration of our meal. Very knowledgable and he made us want to come back for sure! Friendly staff and very interesting decor. I will most definitely be back!!! I will dream about those nachos...

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Short rib nachos!! Definitely recommend!!

xFBBPgck3yeugI3vkHrx0g.text: Yeah yeah... so I'm late with a few reviews.. what else is new?   So... we went to dine here over Christmas week.  Jerry Seinfeld had a show we were attending and we just came to this place by chance.  Because we were early enough there was no wait for a table.  And because this is his 3rd restaurant we've been to, we had high expectations, even if it was "a pub."    Starting out, I'd say that the service was chaotic.  No one came to our table after we were sat for a while.  I distinctly remember because I tried to figure out who our server was based on the hustling of servers around us, but not even those servers ever looked at us and said, "Someone will be right with you, we'll have someone bring over waters, nothing." There was NO teamwork at all, just unorganized chaos.   So hubby drank a Boddington's which he can usually get at home for $1.99, and I had a martini.  Drinks were good since we knew what to expect. That is really, the best part of this whole dining experience.  Their menu was lacking at first glance.  Nothing I saw made me wish I could have more than one item...in fact after we'd been sat so long I kind of wish we could of gotten up and gone somewhere else....  But anyway, an English Ale soup and burger later we were at least not starving before the show.  But for counting this as one of our meals in Las Vegas...it was really disappointing.  I'm not giving it one star because the server that did come to us in the end was decent and tried her best.   Would I come back here for any reason?  Oh I think not.  So many places to wine and dine in Las Vegas, are you insane???  In fact... I hear the Oyster Bar calling my name......

meFZY5LBtdTUEuC0eojW9w.text: i can't begin to express how disappointed we were with the meal at GORDON RAMSAY PUB & GRILL.   We were so excited to visit Mr. Ramsay's restaurant, thought we would try a few of them on our holiday. It was a special event for us so we treated ourselves to what we hoped would be a fun and tasty meal.   Our server was absolutely lovely, friendly and funny.   Unfortunately, the hamburgers were awful. Cold, tasteless, the bun (brioche) was hard. It cost so much money and was so dissapointing.

9SHGn0SK3ud1uBEec_aIQA.text: This was my first time at any of the Gordon Ramsay restaurants and I would highly recommend it! The service was fantastic, they made us feel like family. The management was very hospitable and made sure everyone was taken care of. The food was delicious and came out in a timely manner. Our waiter made sure everything came out well and catered to all our needs. If you're in Las Vegas, this is a must on your to-eat list!

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chocolate trifle! Perfect amount of dessert to share.
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Steak &amp; ale pie! The meat was so tender!
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Irish nachos! A great starter

D7UE3kU9gRolzA-RMW_mOA.text: $51 for fish and chips, a beer, and tip. Service was great. Fish and chips was crap. Batter soooo thick. Fries cold. I wish I could yell in Gordon's face like he does to others on TV. Don't waste your time eating here unless you have money to burn.

O4YdaAFN5XJzguThvEZtyA.text: This was the WORST service I have ever experienced in a restaurant. Not only did we wait an hour to be seated. We waited 40 minutes to get a server to come to table for drinks which the Bus Person did give us water.  The table was a coffee table and we could not even sit comfortably at the table.  Then when the steaks arrived they were RAW.  We sent them back only to get over done steaks. The 5 of us were very dissatisfied with this place  and will NEVER return.

eU0hCbr1KPRBVU0asm3xgw.text: We have tried both the Bugr and Steak restaurants from Ramsay in Vegas, but we were disappointed with the Pub and Grille. They ran out of the pub nachos and the calamari ! Chef Ramsay would ever do that... run out of food! It's a pub, we went in for beers and snacks! What happened to the snack? It was 7pm... We tried the fish and chips... The chips were just ordinary French fries, nothing special. I wanted the Ramsay wow factor. I guess 2 of 3 isn't bad...

pMlk8x3LClXYZTy4F0gwtQ.text: We came her for something a bit different. The description of the food and the high prices are the only different things here.   The food is way overpriced for the quality and quantity of what you actually receive. There is so much more value you can get for your money at other nice places on the strip.   I ordered the scallops. I received 4 scallops, surrounded by brussel sprouts. Others at my table ordered the lamb, fish & chips, and chicken. Again, there was nothing that made this food stand out.   Good customer service. Drinks ordered from an iPad. Pretty cool.   The atmosphere is cool and modern. But the food is nothing to write home about.

P0daSLjkoFMROz0S8HXVHg.text: After much excitement we finally decided to dine at GR tonight and the food lived up to our expectations. Not only the food, our server Adam was great! He was jovial and set a fun mood at the table! Totally recommend! Try the mini macs btw.

e4sCXHj6qJPxTrEjCEySUA.text: It's okay. The pub fare is good the restaurant clean and the service good. Just a little pricing for what you get, I suppose we're paying for the name.

D3072Vja0eiZKoAtVxDg2g.text: A little too over priced ,but thats normal for the vegas strip. Lots of better english food places in vegas ,just stay away from the strip.

YywBNCVQgfLlbRd_64EApg.text: Don't bother unless you like rude hostesses, $25 hamburgers, and slow service. This is the perfect example of a celebrity chef cashing in. Food was sub-par and over priced. Run away!   The seating arrangement is terrible. The table looked dirty and the chairs were to short.   I should've gone to Panda Express.

YeGVmD8I5tSJZ1l6N3M0xQ.text: Great Decor and the food was good.  They had all the College Games on their many TVs.  Our server was clearly working a section that was too big for her, but other than that things were fine.

5kl3V6NRc-behBHYpgfAkQ.text: Great stop for reasonable prices.  Started with the deviled egg and pretzel apps. Deviled eggs were great, with a build-your-own presentation. Other people at the table liked them a lot more than me, but I thought they were quite good. The pretzels were good, but far overpriced for a few pieces of bread and mustard. I feel like this should be something every table gets for free. I really wanted to try to duck poutine too, but they were out.  One main reason for giving this 3 stars instead of 4 is that for a pub their beer selection is quite poor. All common bar beers, with just a few common English "pub" beers like Boddingtons and Guinness. Nothing exotic. Nothing unique. As a beer lover I was extremely disappointed with their selection. This should be a feature!  I'm not a big fan of the choices in costume for Pub & Grill or Gordon's "Steak" place. It all comes off as a bit Vegas and cheesy to me. Dressing the servers and hostesses up in stereotypical "English" garb is... it's either shortsighted, or worse, pandering. I can't imagine the people working there enjoy it either.  We all had burgers. Great pate, great buns, great cheese. It was an excellent and simple burger and by far, for me, the highlight. Would like to stop by here again and try some of the other entrees but I'm not sure I could stay away from another burger.

BhPYyx5ckFlgzf8EKZ5Ycw.text: Great place!! We initially went for happy hour but decided against it because the regular menu looked wonderful. Our waiter was an absolute delight. Very attentive & informative. Our salads (chicken, shrimp, avocado, etc.) were so filling and delicious. Our waiter convinced us to get their famous dessert. The toffee cake was one of the best desserts I've ever had (and I don't normally like toffee).

alkhGoeMoVW7r7VvAZHKOA.text: I've given this place 3-4 tries and it continues to disappoint. Honestly think they're not evening trying to be good. I've had Shepherds Pie, sliders, calamari, Brussels sprouts - all terrible.  Fish and chips and burgers are not good either. Two stars as I do like the atmosphere.

J8Y4s4-VOyMB8yduEMuoVQ.text: 1. Gets five stars for doing everything right 2. We bumbled into the place, just looking for a quick bite before the Absinthe circus show, right outside the entrance of Caesar's Palace. We were seated in the back lounge area, a quasi-man cave with flat screen TVs and nice armchairs. Hostess gets five stars for accommodating two Six Foot Five dudes with no reservations 3. Excellent service, drink menu on IPAD, enjoyed the cold Grolsch beers 4. I ordered the chicken and my friend ordered the flat iron steak. small portions all around, but combined with the pretzel stick bread, very filling.  5. Five stars for the bold choice of sauces: tangy cheese for the breadsticks and horseradish for the flat iron steaks. 6. Fantastic experience all around, extra points for the sexy hostess uniforms

wHRzKrvk8rj-tkwbj-sp5w.text: We were pretty disappointed with this place. My burger was quite good, but the fries were only slightly warm (they probably would have been really good had they been hot). The worst thing was the cheesecake my husband ordered. It looked and tasted like it had been plated three days ago and had been sitting in a cooler ever since. If you removed all the outer layers (rather like carving the mold off a block of cheese), the inside was pretty good, but WTF? When you're paying $11 for a piece of cheesecake, you deserve better than that. Our server also needs to look for a different line of work. Waiting tables is clearly not his calling. (Though now that I'm reading others' reviews, it seems that poor wait staff is the norm here.)

WvO2_e0yJcy_IpphSC-r7w.text: As a Vegas local, let me just say that I didn't have huge expectations given this is one of those celebrity restaurants, but I wanted to see how Gordon Ramsay does pub food, so I took my wife for a weekday lunch to this chaos of a place that Caesars Palace is.    The decor with high ceilings and kegs stacked up.....meh, it's just alright.  The service was just fine unlike other reviewers' negative experiences, but I find some of these overly chipper servers' rehearsed theatrical presentation of the menu quite annoying.  It's fucking pub food mate....  The menu was stereotypical pub food, nothing too exciting, but I followed the recommendation from our server and I had lamb burger, medium, and wife had fish and chips.    The food was decent, but it tasted just like I would have imagined it would taste like, nothing more, nothing less.  I've had fish and chips in many Irish and Enlish pubs, and this was fairly ordinary, which is OK with me, but $27 for fish and chips?  really?    Lamb burger was juicy with good lamb flavor, but not anything I'd crave for anytime in the near future.    All in all, I have to say that this place is A-ok.  Would I go back to hellish parking structure of Caesars Palace even if all of us locals know the back way from Dean Martin and pay for food that should cost 1/2 as much?    As GR might say...."no focking way"....

UcNUCLhL8bb-Od6QFUnpqw.text: Love this place...love the vibe,warm colors,cold beer and friendly staff...we like to sit at bar to get a lot of inside scoop of what's hot and what's not on the strip...beleive me,bartenders know all...pub spots are killer as well as the fish and chips,oh and don't forget the truffle fries that absoutly one my favorite dishes ever. Overall-Good Pull

DbEIGGK_EFAXIL3AW98sDw.text: Love this restaurant, tried it for the first time in 2013.  Me and my boyfriend reminisced about our food for a year so we had to come back this year.  Mine was amazing, but a little different than the year before.  My boyfriend however was disappointed, the amazing chips from the year before were very different now.  They were soggy and thin cut and nothing like last years thick crispy chips that made us come back :(

cfhJXzOf-xUiNg-NL89oPw.text: Third try. The food was ok. The deviled eggs were not good. The steak and ale was flavorful however, it was served in a soup crock for $27. Me and my teammate had 2 apps, a meal each and 2 beers each. Left hungry and spent $200. Will not go back ever! Much better options in LV.

aO_hqkuANTiwzD3EqjZEDg.text: My rating is really between a 3.5 and 4.  However --the service pushed up the ranking.    The flavors of the food were quite good --just a little salty.  My recommendation is to ask them to go light on the salt.  The waitress made some great recommendations of the scotch egg, the truffle potatoes, and a special mash potato they had.  The shepard pie was great --with the meat cooked perfectly.  The muscles were quite good.   My friends had a the chicken but thought it was good but salty.  The liquor menu was great --with a terrific selection on tap.  I think I would have enjoyed this place more as a 'pub' with snack foods and drinks.. the dinner was good too... but i'd come back for the pub side.     Our waitress was phenomenal --she was helpful, attentive, and understood it was a special occasion and treated us well. She was funny and truly made the experience fun.

fmQ2zZsYi5hXmu492d3IQg.text: Great service, once again. The food was pretty good. I think I built myself up to expect more of a WOW factor being a big food enthusiast, but I did go to the pub & grill so perhaps I was set the bar too high.. It was very good though, just wasn't blown away. Great service

5Qozrn5BOvPkjc74muAOiA.text: We were so extremely skeptical after last years disappointment at Gordon Ramsey's burger bar but everyone kept insisting that his restaurants are great. So.. For our last night in Vegas we decided to try here.  After a 15 minute wait we were seated and ordered from our lovely server Jennifer. We ordered the mini burgers (6/10) and lollipop chicken for starters. They both came out super quick (within a few minutes) and while the burgers were ok the bone on my chicken was a bit cold which was strange.. I should have taken that as a hint as I bit into my chicken and realised it had a bloody raw taste and when i spat it out.. I looked down to discover that it was indeed raw.. My poor partner had eaten 3 pieces and thought they tasted weird but did not want to spit them out and after looking over at my raw chicken leg, he really wished he had..  Another server brought our mains over in record time also and we showed him the raw chicken for which he was immediately apologetic and said he would speak to the chef and manager.  Our mains we had the New York Strip Steak (7/10) and the Lamb stew shepherds pie. (7/10) Both were good but it was quite difficult to truly enjoy our meals after being so worried eating raw chicken.. I could not wash that taste out of mouth no matter how many gulps of red wine I had!   The server returned to inform us that the chicken would be removed from our bill (I think this is the least they could do because most likely.. We will both be sick on our 14 hour flight back to australia) and apologised once again.  Dessert was the sticky toffee pudding (8/10) and the salted caramel sundae (8/10). Both were delicious.  Unfortunately it was pretty difficult to recover from serving us raw chicken lollipops. The both of us including 2 pints of cider and a 250ml Pinot noir was $140 plus tips.   So will we be coming back? No.. That's a 2/2 fail rate for Gordon Ramsay's restaurant... Such a shame.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shepherds pie
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sticky toffee pudding
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Salted caramel sundae

7jNbIOVHZNI1GxXvF2wDfw.text: I enjoyed this dinner better than expected! Ceasar salad was huge! Me and mom shared it..still had extra.  Mom got lobster mac n cheese..ok..not wonderful..especially for $25. I ordered the Butter Chicken Curry...I love indian food..well surprise! Not pub food but had to order and stuffed myself. Had to share with mom and she loooved it as well. Still had left overs. Ordered dessert and it was yum!  Service was attentive and atmosphere was casual.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dessert

eNWxOq6sVP1C5btJsMAZmw.text: I thought the food would have been good because of Gordon Ramsey being a stickler for detail. The fish and chips were soggy along with the steak fries. If you are looking for a dining experience that was tasteless and expensive then Gordon Ramsey's Pub and Grill is your place. Come on Gordon, Red Robin does a much tastier fish and chip. MESA by Bobby Flay is feet away and the flavors are terrific.

PGDis7GzME0mCdMb_RGvbg.text: Came here to treat my girl to a nice birthday dinner. We both love Gordon Ramsay. I made reservations the day before which was a good idea because the place was packed for a Wednesday night. Our server was great he Checked on us moderately, and was very nice. The food was spot on. We shared the onion soup as not ruin our appetite for our entre'. That soup was so delicious. I wouldn't expect less. My girl got the NY strip steak and I got  the beer braised short rib. I think we would both come back for that short rib alone. It fell apart, literally. The flavor was packed in.  Now, our desert was amazing. We got the sticky toffee pudding, which was free with check in on Yelp. The pudding was delightful. The only reason why I didn't give this place a 5 star review is for the price. I just feel that it's a little bit overpriced.

aBFXdxW-0uH2WrnnOIApZA.text: I wish I could give a place -5 stars!   Spent $300 on drinks and food, and then was ASKED TO LEAVE. I was still not even finished with my wine. In 30 years of dining experience I have never been asked to leave a restaurant until now. I ordered 3 times in 2 and a half hours. WORST experience I have ever had.  Was also served stale wine, when I requested a new bottle, I was served wrong one.  Servers shift changed and a server never came to replace the other one. Even when I went to the MANAGER to ask for another server, I still never got one. I had to get my own server.  Along with this horrible experience, they also put $30 of beer that I didn't order on my bill. After that, finally got a glass of wine after waiting 20 minutes. And then was asked to leave!  For added detail, we were sitting in the BAR AREA. Taking up only 2 seats (me and my husband.)    Don't ever eat here if you actually want to sit and enjoy you food. Bad wine.  So enraged, it inspired me to create a Yelp account!!  If eating at Caesar's Palace is like staying at Caesar's Palace I wouldn't waste my money.   Stay at an MGM hotel like Aria or Vdara. First class resorts. I personally recommend Carbone.   UPDATE: I called to complain and they offered me 1 free drink. Ridiculous. I will be going to corporate with this issue.

VD_j8S3y9xIyMEqoSZ3X7g.text: 3.5 stars for the food 4 for ambience/decor 2 for the service!  Long story short, you can count on less than one finger on the number of times our server came to our table after taking our order--ZERO!  Not sure if a rude server coming frequently with a bad attitude would've been better lol.  But that's ok, didn't want to let him ruin our first meal deal after landing.  Since GR steakhouse and burgers were either sold out from Opentable or too late of a time, this was the next best thing, and I had to get my celebrity chef itch out of the way.  The good:  prime rib: super tender, big chunk, maybe even 16-18 ounces, and not too fatty either.  Yorkshire i've had better  mashed potatoes: ordered another full serving.  the average:  server said the fish and chips were popular, I've had better.  Staying with the server, the bus boy gave us better service, thus he deserved the 15% tip instead, which we gladly gave cash when we left lol.  Our server barely deserved his 5%!  P.S.  took him 10min to get our bill, while he was setting up 2 tables around us....

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States

2er22pf0rgri8IYMDiIzVw.text: Went to Gordon Ramsay's Pub and Grill tonite.  The only thing to say, OMG!  I can't tell you the last time I cleaned my plate at a restaurant. I had the Braised Short Ribs (think back to your childhood and Family Sunday Dinners), it was so good and if it was any more tender, it would have melted into the Cheddar Mashed Potatoes.  If you twist my arm and make me find fault with this meal, the baby carrots were just a tad (and I do mean TAD undercooked).  This meal really was so flavorful and enjoyable.  Hubby had Prime Rib and he said that it was very good and very flavorful as well.  Our waiter John, was so enjoyable and help to make this more than a dinner, it was an event that we thoroughly enjoyed.  I tried to kidnap the Chef, Pastry Chef and John, but couldn't fit everyone in the Mini Cooper.  Rats!  So I guess we'll just have to go back and enjoy everyone's company again!  Thank you All !

x-_oFFYCeLcfHlxfX2mk8Q.text: Popped in for a beer. Great atmosphere & the staff is awesome. Charlie the barman gave me good tips where to visit in Vegas & some hiking locations. Really liked the place

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Nice alcohol menu
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Just popped in for a beer. Staff is friendly &amp; Charlie &amp; Shawn gave a great service.

rPRtC8Ae8ZVhjF2vYirFzA.text: Manager Derek was very helpful in giving us ideas on what to order. I had the Dublin corn beef brisket sandwich on this incredible rustic caraway bread! Best sandwich ever. Don't forget to try the sticky toffee putting really tasty.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States

xTAl8rAJ_G3I-cbVoGsyhQ.text: Great food, Amazing service with Day Scott!!! Lobster Mac and Cheese is a must have!  They are great with children as well.  We will return for sure.

7hOpQM3GXen-J-66jKelkQ.text: reservations recommended and probably won't help to arrive early...appears they seat you exactly at your reservation time or slightly after...expect a long wait if you show up and just add your name...text message when table ready...restaurant opens up to the slot machines of the casino floor...wall of kegs, loud music and people and busy staff....very vivacious restaurant...pub & grill with a great selection of beers, stouts and more...menu items from shepherd's pie and steaks to burgers, salads and sandwiches...anchor steam 20oz $11, but a black butte 20oz $13...thinking black butte for $13 is the far better deal and taking...starting with a bowl of marinated olives $7 to share...sticking to a simple meal and ordering the lamb burger $23, steak & ale pie $25 and a dublin corned beef sandwich $21....the burgers are just as pretty, perfect and tasty as the burgr restaurant...great fries....the steak pie also perfect and tasty....very meaty pot pie with plenty of tender cubed steaks..more meat and less fillers...corned beef sandwich just melts in your mouth...razor thin corned beef slices piled high....simple bread and meat sandwich, but just so excellent in texture and taste....cone of fries to compliment...one beer and simple meal selection roughly $47 total per person after tax and tip...

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. very tasty corned beef sandwich..simple and delicious
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. drinks and check
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. menu 1/17...seems to change

gKDo6UEmqjZrfnbjuEhRFw.text: Great restaurant.  The Hellfire wings are fantastic...full of flavor and just the right amount of spice. Loved the brussel sprouts too. The Hind Leg Mule was the best...different than the typical mule...had a hint of licorice flavor.  I will definitely pay this place another visit.

um2kLWfZ73co9nJsJxSJxg.text: let's see. $21 for a burger and cold fries.  burger ok, fries, not so much. $21 for a "dubliner" - basically 1 layer of fatty corned beef, some sauerkraut and 2 huge pieces of bread, served with cold, stale kettle type chips. no thanks.

IwwYEIBjcnXv8oK5qd6zCQ.text: The calamari was soggy, drinks are very expensive for a pub... the food is expensive quality  is cheap. Not going back.  Vegas restaurants!! Please lower your prices! Ridiculous! It's better to find a restaurant outside the strip... Quality is better price is much cheaper.

3FKiFVv9sCo_4AzSub2YCQ.text: Gordon Ramsay has several restaurants in Vegas, but by Vegas standards, this one is probably my least favorite.  I say Vegas standards, because, in my opinion, you can be more discerning here. There are just so many fantastic restaurants here, and they're all pretty much walking distance from one another.  I've been here twice now. This last time, I was here for a convention, and actually favored going to Mesa Grill, however, the wait was ridiculous, so Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill it was.  I digress, onto the food.  I've had their grilled beef burger as well as their grilled lamb burger. My issue with their burgers is mostly their bun. It could stand being a bit more fresh. It's on the drier, crumbly side. Maybe people just don't order enough burgers here, so their bread doesn't move as fast? For a burger at the $20 mark, it should pretty much be flawless. Their fries are good, and the patties themselves are great.  For a much, much better overall burger, go to Gordon Ramsay BurGR, located inside Planet Hollywood.  Service is spot on, and the interior looks great.  Food: 2 Ambience: 5 Service: 5 Value: 2

LJ-SyspH4ZBrtVQbsowo2Q.text: Everyone in our party liked their food which included the corn beef, sliders, fish and chips, and Shepard's pie.  Even though the food was good, it was nothing exceptional.  The prices are Vegas appropriate.  We had a private room but the overall restaurant atmosphere was good.  It did have a slight dirty bar smell.    The men's restroom was not as fresh as expected for 6pm.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Corn beef

mgRoism3sZCSaQqvLnLI2Q.text: This place is awesome! The Service and Food was perfect! Specially Chris P. Who was our server. Thank you for your kindness! You made us a great memory.

fgEeJvQ_YUbeSCHeuphWJQ.text: Food was amazing! Started with the deviled eggs (you get 5 FYI for sharing) and I got the mixed green salad, pepitas are amazing! Steak was medium rare/perfect! Asparagus are super huge and delicious. Great service, great food

fZ4jm9hoVIHwhY8md717Qw.text: The food was fabulous, let's get that right!!  Had the steak and ale pie, wife had the lobster rolls and daughter had the fried chicken sandwich. Simple meals with a gourmet flair!  And for dessert, wait for it........sticky toffee pudding. My goodness simply delicious!!  Kerry our waitress was awesome. Can't wait to come back!  Oh and don't forget to get the small beer.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States

FFwT3NC7KpksAdCR97wFHQ.text: We had an AWESOME experience that I didn't want our server to go un-noticed. We had an AWESOME asian server named DAVID!!! He was very attentive, sweet and just gave amazing customer service. My husband and I randomly just popped in and had a few appetizers and my hubby ordered a drink called Bye bye blue sky or something like that. I'm not able to drink so I just had water. David, our server had the sweetest surprise and gave the same drink my husband ordered but it was nonalcoholic. David didnt want me to miss out on having fun even though I couldnt drink. ABSOLUTELY amazing!!!   We ordered chicken wings, braised pork sandwich and truffle chips. They were all DELICIOUS!!! Everything about this establishment was a very positive experience!!!

pbgWsVsbf7-ZGWD50GC7gA.text: Everything you could expect from a Ramsey restaurant!  Staff was amazing always available when I needed them. Ate the chicken pesto sandwich which was flavorful and very satisfying. My brother had a lamb burger which was cooked perfectly and ridiculously delicious! Highly recommend this to everyone!

n4j9gVdF_nWDmWo47z_F_w.text: Oh My Goodness! Gordon Ramsey needs to place the same expectations on his restaurants that he does on others.   Service was so slow, we could have walked to the food court and grabbed something before we got drinks. Then another 30 mins to get out food. Good thing we were in good company.   My husband had the Bangers and Mash and he was greatly disappointed in the quality of food.  I had the cheese burger, which looked great but it was very dry.   Needless to say, we won't be coming back and we definitely don't recommend it!!

qPQ3XgAUKFzAOywKnDA1Dg.text: We were incredibly disappointed by this installment from Chef Ramsay and we expected a lot more from a place with his name. It was very crowded, probably about 8 o'clock on a Tuesday night. They were out of at least half of the items on their menu, including basic staples like pies and drinks. Our server failed to tell us ANYTHING and overall was not very pleasant. The food runners were rude and sort of ignored us. The food itself wasn't good- I had a warm chicken sandwich that might have been decent if it wasn't overwhelmed with Gruyere cheese to the point where the bread was soggy and the cheese was all we could taste. The rest of my party was only marginally satisfied with their food. The only good part of the experience was the nice interior. Maybe we came at a bad time, but I wouldn't recommend this place to anybody. It doesn't live up to Ramsay's standards in the slightest.

4wiYsSszfKRRjVNLhiA6kA.text: Beware:  Not as seen on TV.  No exacting standards for perfectly cooked food here.  Appetizers:  Calamari, Toad in a Hole, and Scotch Eggs.  They were all overcooked.  Entree:  Fish & Chips and Shepherd's Pie.  Fish was okay, but the chips were a soggy, greasy mess.  The flavor of the Pie was okay, but the mash potatoes were gummy.  And they had no HP sauce for the pie.  I thought this was supposed to be a British Pub.  Desserts:  Sticky Toffee Pudding and Spotted Dick.  First was not very moist and the latter too rummy.  Definitely not a do-over.  Not a good value and left disappointed.

IGlYj3_a1g3twarZIqpLXQ.text: What a place!   First off I like to start off with the staff they, are freaking awesome. Not only are they very tentative, but they are super friendly, and they provide the necessary accommodations  to make one feel welcome. The decor was pretty cool as well.   The most important thing  that I can generate from this review is the food.   It tastes so fresh and delicious I could just eat a plethora and not get tired of eating here.   I had the braised pork belly. It was so soft, tender and juicy that I wanted more. The seasoning used on this was really delicious.  The pretzel was decent nothing out of this world. (and that all I have to say about that)  For dessert I had the sticky toffee pudding, this was actually my favorite part. It closed my meal all the way around.   I would highly recommend this place prices are a little steep, but still congenial.

mZyl4-QovBY_y9GrZ-HNnw.text: I ate here before and the food I ordered was spot-on. This time, however upon ordering the shepherd's pie (which I also ate last time) I found it to be pretty bland. I will likely think twice before eating here again and if I do I will definitely order a different dish.

wH6Z7nXB91z653lavCC8Cw.text: Had a late dinner with the BF (who is a huge Chef Ramsay fan) after seeing Daniel Tosh at The Mirage this past Saturday.  We shared the lobster rolls, I had the New York strip, and he had the fish & chips. The lobster rolls were so fresh and tangy, I was tempted to order more! My steak was cooked just right and was very moist and flavorful and the roasted asparagus that came with it was perfect. My BF's fish and chips were well seasoned and delicious.  Service was great as well. We were a bit intimidated by what seemed like a line as we approached, but everyone was seated promptly. Our server was attentive and our food came out quickly. The only thing that I didn't like was our table. It was right next to another couple, so close it felt like a double date. I think I was sitting closer to the woman next to me than to my BF. Also, it was very noisy which is expected since it is inside a casino, so we couldn't really talk without raising our voices.   Overall, we had a lovely dinner. I wouldn't recommend coming here for a romantic dinner, but it's great for something more casual.

IOYzPjFO0Pq8hbYM_vgpYw.text: Let me tell you why this place doesn't have more stars...the service!  Plain and simple.  Our server was fairly rude and just going through the motions.  I almost got up and left even before ordering. My whole family (kids included) are HUGE Gordon Ramsay fans.  We couldn't wait to try the food.  Let me say I really wanted the Shepherds pie, but it is only served after 4pm.  My hubby loves a good authentic bangers and mash, so he was set to order.  My son and I decide to share an order of bangers and mash because let's be honest, it was $25!  WOW WOW, OH WOW!  One of the best dishes I have ever had anywhere!  Really!  Oh, let me say, I don't even like sausages of any kind.  But this dish was fabulously delicious.  There were 3 sausages (1 chicken, 1 pork and 1 beef) served over mashed potatoes with an onion gravy.  The onion gravy is the star here.  Ramsay's food did not disappoint!

6gTLZ4CtwVZp7egcKnaaHw.text: Second visit occurred 5-7-2014. Dined for two with reservations which made wait time excellent as well as food delivery time. I enjoyed beet salad,which was best experience. Pretzels were old tasting and dry. Beef sliders dry and over cooked. Deviled egg filling was very dry and not creamy in consistency; however the vinegar on egg white shells were good. We asked waitress if Mr. Ramsay was involved in restaurant operations and we were advised he most certainly is; however, it would be beneath him to consider "amateur" reviews on Yelp. Waitress indicated the people who work at restaurant are best equipped to know what's good versus customers.   First visit occurred on 5-4-2014 with group of six. Service took 2 hours but food seemed better, lamb burger was reported by my table as delicious. I didn't order food but reserved my opportunity 3 days afterward.  I gave this place 2 stars since the waitress' comments suggest there is no place in their business for customer feedback since owner is celebrity chef and has "better things to do with his time than to look at Yelp or hear from amateur food critics."  Place is not worth the expense.

02vk_9R9iv22JBft8KpIxQ.text: We stopped in once for a cocktail during off our of a meeting and then came back later in the week for lunch.  The drinks at the bar were actually quite good.  They took the time and effort to mix them properly and measure for creations.  Good service there.  Lunch was good not exceptional.  It was not packed but service felt a tiny bit slow.  I had the Fish and Chips.  The Fish was awesome.  Large piece, properly coated, crispy and hot.  I also liked the tartar sauce, to me it was better than normal mayonnaise fare. The chips were just OK, would like to have seen something better than average.  The peas on the side were a touch of flare.  Good taste and a bit of authenticity.  I would like to go back and try the Shepard's Pie.  Looked really good.  This is a Vegas restaurant, not one of his Michelin Star efforts.  I was good with it.  Checked off the list.

xJcIL_EyJdMbCpexwuJ8_w.text: The food is great here. The French Onion soup and lamb/beef burgers are fantastic. The manager is a congenial fellow and puts forth an effort to make sure things are running smoothly.  ...BUT...  Unfortunately, I just can't add this to my list of regular strip restaurants. The counter service is just abysmal. They forgot to place my order entirely on my last visit. If you're at Caesars, you're better off at the food court, Spago, or Cheesecake Factory.

0t6Se6591cC8EEj8kEc7FA.text: The Ramsey Pub and Grill almost lived up to our expectations... but as most know the more expensive the place the smaller the portions.  My friend and I thankfully made a reservation for the pretty crowded restaurant and were seated almost immediately.  We were seated in the bar section which was fine, but the seating was unusual - I felt like the seats weren't tall enough for the table.  Aside from that the fish and chips entree was stellar!  I think that possibly the best cooked fish and chips I've ever had.  The batter was light and tasty, perfectly salted and the cod that lay beneath was wonderful.  The tartar sauce was also lovely with the fish.  I couldn't have been happier with my dish.  My friend was a little less satisfied with his meal of the steak and ale pie.  His biggest complaint was that there wasn't enough of it.  I'll agree that the pie was pretty small for the price - but other than that he enjoyed the flavour of the dish.  Perhaps people might be surprised that I rated it a 4/5 but the food was in fact very good.  The service was nice and we enjoyed the experience.  It was a treat to go and I'm happy that we did.

VEna3eBqT8-lpp6fQH1uBA.text: As a fan of Hells Kitchen, Kitchen Nightmares and Master Chef, I had to make a visit to one of his restaurants right? We'lll I picked this one.  I looked at the menu prior to leaving my hotel - and I wanted the "Short rib and cheek sandwich" not realizing that was on the lunch menu. So when I got there, I grabbed a seat at the bar. Looked at the menu and didn't see it, I was totally bummed. We'll I went outside the box and got the lamb burger. It took about 15 minutes for my burger to come out. It was good, but the fries were just regular fries. Not the fries you see in all the Yelp pics and on the Ramsay website.   I was somewhat disappointed - I really wanted the short rib sandwich and the fancy smancy fries. The lamb burger, while it was good, was no where worth $21. Come on Ramsay, I know its Vegas and all, but don't you think $21 for a lamb burger is a bit excessive?   Will I come back? Probably not...

m-zUABD-iKOtX4xqkdcOJA.text: My kids chose to eat here while on a quick stop in through Vegas because they love Gordon! Such a disappointment for the entire family, except my youngest who got the slider style burger. The slider burgers were flavorful and moist. Wish the whole table had ordered this! The calamari was fried beyond recognition, tasted like eating a mouthful of unseasoned breadcrumbs and so chewy they were literally inedible. My husband and I shared fish n chips and it was so salty I couldn't get past more than one bite. The "chips" aka steak fries were soggy and greasy. My picky daughter ordered an $11 side of "skinny" fries and although cooked nicely, they had zero flavor. $130 and we all left starving! My husband and I had dinner reservations the following night at one of his steakhouses and cancelled for fear of overpriced crap food!

xlknf5Gzx_Rc7-wCVnN7rw.text: I grew up in England and felt a twinge of nostalgia when I saw this restaurant.  Accepting that there would be a Caesar's Palace surcharge on top of already over-priced Vegas food, I assumed that Mr. "f***ing make this dish right" Ramsay could provide a decent simulacram of English food.  However, the food was about as English as Excalibur hotel.  If you've actually tasted any English food, please don't go. I miss very little about England, but genuinely good fish & chips + mushy peas is one my favorite things from my childhood.   If you've never tasted mushy peas, this review probably doesn't make sense, but if you have  enjoyed them . . . start planning on that trip to England rather than Vegas, because Ramsay's dish was not even made with the correct peas.  [insert other details about how this place offers weak adaptations of British dishes]  I emailed customer relations, because I am genuinely interested in how Mr. Ramsay could sign his name to those peas: I will update if I hear any sort of authentic response.  PS Service was good: helpful and friendly servers + food seemed made to order, so the individual workers seemed to be doing their best. My criticism solely applies to whomever approved the dishes.

EmTfLj1Te4UQ3jonqi2w_w.text: Completely disappointed. Took entire family here for dinner, got seated way in back in the corner room, waiter totally forgot about us or just plainly didn't care about serving us. Food took extremely long to come out. When we asked for condiments for our food, they came to our table after we finished our dinner, waiter comes and says oh here are your condiments. We let him know we had waited to long and obviously didn't need them anymore, he walks away like no big deal. We had to wave down another server for refills on our drink, but to only get told he was not our waiter and had to find our waiter. Never got the refills. We were a group of 13, this restaurant is lacking in good customer service for large groups. We definitely will never return to this restaurant, and would highly not recommend this restaurant.

sEM0S1mmMWGLqXO0BBgkPw.text: We had the restaurant week lunch with the braised short rib.  The French onion soup was pretty good, but the risotto was extremely undercooked.  It was so chewy that we couldn't eat it.  The undercooked onions also were not peeled.  There was a layer of skin that we had to spit out.  The short rib was larger than I expected and very tender, but also very bland.  The best thing on the plate was the carrots because I actually like raw carrots.  This place is a shame to any chef's name.

woVCnzjqEwyhUKbFLEkUjQ.text: Service was 5 star. The food however wasn't as great. The chicken pub pie was very bland which I would give 1 star. The butter chicken curry was good so i give it 3.5 stars. The price/portion size is what sucks. The portion sizes are very small yet the price is very expensive. If you want to splurge on a meal...PASS on this one.

CRLCvumbV_j9rWuB1WjyTg.text: As a fan of all things Gordon Ramsey, we decided to pop in here for dinner. We went into it wanting to enjoy the experience and have the mind frame of "let's order whatever we want, money doesn't matter". But that didn't last long.   The decor is really cool. It's an awesome cozy place to grab a drink or dinner. Again, if money isn't an issue.    Browsed the drink menu, $15 a pop. Ordered a drink each. I had the Goodbye Blue Sky. It was tasty, yet reminded me of pomegranate flavored Emergen-C. For $15 it should have come in a proper tumbler glass instead of some dinky glass.   Instead of ordering entrees, decided to split 2 appetizers.   A Scotch Egg, and the Pie Sampler. I was expecting the pie sampler to come in decent sized custard dishes. Instead they came out in this weird wooden rack that could have held 5 of these tiny dishes. Had they been the custard dish I was expecting, 3 dishes would have easily filled this.  Instead you are left with this massive wooden rack and these tiny awkward dishes.  Kind of cool presentation, I guess?  But really just stupid, and pretentious.  The steak pie was by far the best tasting. The Shepherd's pie, which the waitress suggested had a strange taste and smelled like dirty socks. The chicken pie was decent, yet comparable to one of those frozen Marie Calendar's pot pies you buy in bulk at Costco.  The Scotch egg however was delicious and perfectly cooked.  All said and done, $80 to not even be full or drunk.

aVWTx_fBayl665lQq6hxMQ.text: I was really excited to try this place because I love Gordon Ramsey. I must say though, this place is overpriced for the quality of food because I can get the same food for less. I had the mini burgers and they were nothing special. They were dry and the meat/bun proportion fell short. My friend had the shepherds pie, while it was good, again it was nothing special, I could have made it myself. Overall  I felt that everything was just meh. We spent 100 for 2 drinks, mini burgers and Sheperds pie, I didn't see the value. Service was good at least.

LKX-i9a-Wf1zPqq3YhBWsA.text: I ate here this last week and I really enjoyed it.  (*extended beer list at bottom)  Beer selection was out of this world. So many unique cool things to try. Menu was very different from anywhere else in town.   Decor is VERY VERY COOL! Very Modern British PUB!  It seemed to me to be simply a very special place that is going to bud into an elite restaurant over this next year, being that it just opened.   I've read some of the other reviews and find some of them quite funny. I don't know about you, but I don't go to a Gordon Ramsay restaurant for the Coke? Or the pepper for that matter. LOL.   The hostesses Maria and Karen, were sweet, one took the info and the other pleasantly showed me to the bar.   I ate the Beef Cheek and Short Rib Sandwich. Hands down the best sandwich I have ever eaten at a restaurant. So tender it melted in my mouth. Good flavors and sauces. It was obviously carefully created by a top chef. The fries were ginormous, but it was fun for a change. Even fry addicts like me enjoy a variation once in a while.   The service was great. Gene took really good care of me. He got my order right away despite having a near full bar. Food came out very fast. Gene seemed sincerely interested in giving me a great experience and frequently checked back. To ask how I liked it. He was quick with the beers and had a smile the whole time.   The bar did seem a bit messy through-out. Piles of napkins and crumbs and what not. But not a big turn off but would expect it to be cleaner.   A manager did stop by (Eva.. Evie..Eve) to kindly check up to make sure everything was good. It was nice because I did not expect it sitting at the bar.   I plan to come back frequently to this place. Seems like a good spot to hang out. Prices all seemed reasonable to me. I will gladly pay more for better product (duh!).   Now good part. They have like 84 beers at this place. I will update it in the future. Here's what I recognized and remember from the beer list:  Innis and Gunn Blue Moon Coorslight Miller Lite Pyrmid Stella Magic 9 Moa Method Boddingtons Guinness Strong Bow Bass  Delerious Tremmens Duvel Chimay (blue and Red) Corona Henry Wienharts Heiniken Heiniken lite John Henry 3 Lik spiker Belhaven Fuli Dogfish head 90 Ballast Point Meantime Coffee something Chocolate Stout

_UE5wDDzJWeRLJRMWt6HkA.text: I was a little disappointed.  The food was good, but overpriced and the service was slow.

RIN0Er_84sETeYAGzVlNWQ.text: This is the second time here and the bar service is impersonal, little eye contact and minimal effort. Unfortunately,we will not be returning.

BdYSQyjtwRA_12B5FZ6M8w.text: My son and I laughed at the bad reviews (especially the one who said she ordered chips and got American fries) but we thought it would be a matter of taste. We love Gordon Ramsay and the Steak restaurant, but I have to say, when I got the bill for $70 at the pub, I did not feel like I just ate a $70 dinner. Son had shepherd's pie, I had fish and chips. It was not presented the way it is in the pictures, so they must have changed something. Nothing was bad. I don't know what I would change, though.

DrqnBk2TiMWsR6iPaaQ7mw.text: You can't sport the name Gordon Ramsay and serve us our entrees an hour after being seated..... Don't even bother speaking to the manager because all he'll do is tell you they can do better and invite  you to come back next time for a "better experience" (no discount btw).....Seriously? There are plenty of great restaurants with better service in Vegas, why should I come back? Ridiculous! Don't waste your time here.

bM8DXlmknaqvgsg_XYSXDA.text: I was very disappointed this last time around.the first time I went it was heavenly from the food to the service everything was top notch, so much so I insisted this time it was one of first stops in Vegas. I was dissapointed from the service to the prime rib, when we pointed out it was too dry to eat she asked if we wanted a Togo bag. We never got a replacement napkin that she had initially dropped .. It never got better.  So sad

t_NQZLJlT4NmEW_WsTWEoQ.text: Before writing this review,  I would just like to state that this is the first time I am writing a restaurant review.  I am picky but not that vocal about it.  If I don'tt like the restaurant I usually suck it up, pay for the meal, and move on.  But honestly,  this was an abomination.  I felt extremely ripped off, disappointed, disgusted and sick so I really think it was necessary that I voice my opinion. I have lost all respect for Chef Ramsay. His restaurant needs to air on his show and shame on him being so harsh to others when he needs to look at himself in the mirror. The hypocrisy.   Here's the way it went down:  We were staying at Caesar's Palace and happened to notice Gordon Ramsay's pub. We got very excited that we would have a chance to try one of his restaurants since we are a fan of Hell's Kitchen and thought we couldn't go wrong.  I usually always check restaurant ratings but I didn't even think twice this time due to chef Ramsay's reputation. Oh how incredibly wrong I was!  First of all, we made reservations for 11 people at 10pm. I couldn't believe that we had to wait to be seated for 20 minutes. I think this is the first time I had to wait when making a reservation.  Furthermore,  there were several open tables and more than enough staff. It wasn't even that busy for a Saturday night so I really couldn't figure out the wait. The thing that I also found baffling was that the hostesses did not seem to be aware of this being and issue and didn't apologize for the wait.   There are two good things I have to say about the restaurants. The decor is okay (love the waiter and hostess apparel!). And our waiter was great. I think he knew how bad the food was and I don't think he will be there very long.   A variety of hotbread was brought out with butter and cheddar sauce about 10 minutes after we ordered.  The bread was good.  The cheddar sauce was terrible.    My husband and I both ordered the corn soup. The soup is supposed to have crab meat. The presentation was nice.   We couldn't find the crab. Our server wasn't informed that they had run out of crab. The waiter offered to switch out the soup with onion soup. That was also bad.  The soup tasted like someone added refined sugar. Totally lacked flavor.  The fish and chips were way too salty and the fish lacked texture and flavor.  The chips/fries were okay.  What the hell is going on with the mooshy peas! Why are they serving baby food to adults at a pub????  The scallops were a little fishy. They were very salty!  Any chef knows that you need little to no salt on scallops. It takes away from the natural flavor. There was a broth on my plate that the scallops were sitting in.  Ew. Small carrots, artichoke and pearl onions were scattered in my plate. Very unattractive dish and I didn't enjoy it at all. I only ate it because I felt really bad about wasting scallops.  The Shepherd's pie was very small and, surprise surprise, it lacked flavor and salt.  Almost forgot to mention it took 45 minutes for our food to come.   Overall,  my friends and I were bummed that we sacrificed a dinner in Vegas for this place. I felt very bad that I'm the one that suggested this place.  McDonalds would have been more satisfying.  None of us will ever go back and I strongly recommend going to one of the many other lovely restaurants in Vegas!

pMtZGLN6PbvyPcdkjj6yPg.text: The braised short rib and beef cheek sandwich was amazing, served with crisp and tasty fries. The toffee cake and sweet cream desert was equally delicious.  The atmosphere was fun and lively, we were visiting the day the royal baby was born and they invited all of the guests to join in the bar for free beers and a toast.

NaBHKcmKDo4wfBiR9cHVUA.text: My husband and I made dinner reservations for Gordon Ramsay's Pub with high expectations.  My God, after watching KN & HK, you'd expect nothing but the best.  Unfortunately, we were sadly disappointed.  We were there at 6:00 on a Monday night for dinner.  The place was nearly empty.  So whom do they sit next to us, when there are dozens of open seats everywhere?  A table of 4 loud drunks.  The server came up to us immediately, but that was the high point of the evening.  We ordered fish & chips and prime rib, both of which also came to us immediately.  My fish was cold, my fries were cold and greasy, my husband's prime rib was nothing special.  His vegetables were cold and mushy; his mashed potatoes cold and tasteless.  When we questioned the server, he said that the fish & chips were made "only" 5-10 minutes before our order.  If he admits to 5-10 minutes, I bet on at least 30.  I thought that Gordon's restaurants always made dinners to order -- at least something as traditional and simple as fish & chips.  How can you screw that up?  Besides that, the place just doesn't feel and look clean.  The silverware is put right on the table, which in our case was covered with sprinkled salt, a sure sign that the table had not been cleaned between diners.  The uniforms of the servers were wrinkled and mismatched.  I'm not sure what look Gordon was seeking, but the servers clearly do not have the same "vision".  When we complained to the manager, he was dismissive and condescending, making sure to inform us that "Gordon had just been there last week and everything was great".  Well maybe great when the boss is around, but with zero or no quality standards when he is not.  Bottom Line: Save your money for fish fries at your local Catholic church during Lent.  Gordon's made enough money from hard-working "no counts" like us.

-kDx-5AUyUXU0n7GB4dWXA.text: Been here twice..food and service are always great...lamb burger was great and I highly recommend the Innis and Gunn beer...the only reason I didn't give it 5 stars was the fries that came with my burger were crap...oily, limp and no flavor...very disappointed with the fries...the lamb burger and beer made up for it

3L9qhJh-xUMzWv0Dv-K7UQ.text: Great dinner! Made reservations for a late dinner and we were seated promptly. We both started with the onion soup which was the best we both have ever had. My wife had the fish and chips which she said were also the best she ever had, I had the beef burger, which was delicious and much better than the burger we had at his burgur restaurant at planet hollywood. Food is not cheap so be prepared but it's a celebrity chef so expect to pay for the name in front.

AqsjCHVFqUSXCTdyIeI40w.text: My wife and I ate here Super Bowl weekend and even got to sit within 20 feet of Gordon Ramsey himself (he was eating dinner w friends). I will admit that our meals could have been alot better, but due to fact I spoke with the General Manager when I got back home to California about our experience Im not going to bash them. He is promising us in April (when we have another scheduled trip) an awesome experience that hes going to take care of.  So I will have to wait and see if my 3star goes to 5star or 1star.

p84dimeF5uhYzpd47aC_2A.text: Lunch my hubby & I both ordered the lamb burger with goat & feta.  The waiter was really nice and helped with giving us suggestions on what's good on the menu.  My hubby was hung over so the waiter suggested for his hangover cure the Irish stew, shepherd pie, or the lamb burger. BRING OR GET A HARRAH's TOTAL REWARDS CARD for a discount on the food.

cvSnKPygQJ2zo4igr4n5jA.text: It's great, we ordered the scallops (I mean, come on, after all the yellings on Hell's kitchen about the scallops, how can you not order the scallops?), the big steak, they were very good. The scallops are super rich, by the time I had the second one, I was  already full. The must try is the dessert - sticky toffee pudding, that's heaven, it's good beyond words.

1YbROZWG8G9nZ0B_58g2Tg.text: I am a big fan of Gordon Ramsey's.   I wasn't aware he had a number of restaruants in Vegas.  My boyfriend and I had lunch there.  He had the split pea soup which he loves that particular soup and he said it was  fantastic.  his only criticism was he would have preferred to have it with more peas.  It was a smooth creamy soup.  That's just him, he likes it more chunky.    I had the clams and mussel  in their shells.   As main courses he had the Double Double  burger.   The burger was cooked perfectly and was juicy and delicious.   I had the Shepard's Pie. It was flavorful and scrumptious.  Everything was reasonably priced for Las Vegas.   I highly recommend eating here.  It's located in Cesear's Palace.

VkL2Bgjf_-0bcrSy9MeROg.text: Chef Gordon Ramsey is amazing for this place. Everything is amazing with a great atmosphere

ucWtdZzip4mdRmiNNS1OYw.text: Never have had such a bad dinner... Went there  to celebrate a birthday everyone's meal was wrong including the Gluten Free one which my aunt got sick ... Waitress was slow and didn't have a clue .. Steak was cold not cooked .. Stay away

Njq9JIz767ps2ZimLKAR7w.text: Came on a Tuesday for Dinner, Ordered the oysters for a starter, super sweet little oysters and cocktail sauce with horseradish in it,  they were the highlight of the meal unfortunately.  I was dissapointed by the current menu, came here last year around the same time and was absolutely blown away by everything and the overall style of the food choices, this year not so much, really narrow options with seriously predictable stuff, it's almost as if I went back in time to when it was first opening and they hadn't quite had time to make up any original dishes so they threw out the ol' classic favorites..  I ordered the scallops, they were ok. Cooked to perfection but nothing else, surprisingly bland! Nothing stunning about them though the portion size was fair. The amazing Girlfriend had the Salmon and it was also bland, almost like they didn't season it, very odd. Friend had the fish and chips. fish was good, batter was excellent, but the "chips" were undercooked!   Prices here were also a disappointment. I payed what?! for That!?   At least the Oysters were good!  Must mention service was excellent, and beer selection was good, some tasty stuff on the drink menu.   Maybe next time...

hqnWGIqeAnpJMwW7T_wgzQ.text: Holy cow what a total disappointment. I'm fairly certain the potatoes are instant, which I have seen this guy blow a gasket over. My risotto was way undercooked and we waited an hour for this disaster. Somebody call Kitchen Nightmares! Oh wait....

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Nice potatoes.

1miyqBp1p7ntRhLqWd5C1A.text: Good sliders but too generate, not cool enough for Chef Ramsey.  Sliders had basted buns and great moist meat.

ySeTUqBQv9EIH7Yfrbzmhw.text: I use to love gordon Ramsey but not anymore. I doubt he would have eaten the pork belly that was a dish comprised of more than 50% fat. My DH had the hanger steak and fries. Hanger steak was tough and fries undercooked. Really undercooked fries To add insult I'm pretty sure we got food poisoning from the hanger steak.  Highlights of the meal were the pear cider and sticky toffee pudding. Service was ok.  Save yourself the grief and eat somewhere else.

2rxd7U_aNuHVZOvtQBa20A.text: Great ambiance and vibes. Perfect for game days and date nights. Quick seating. Noise level is medium. The staff was very friendly and always moving. The GM and house manager were very alert, always smiling, and seemed to communicate with the staff on a consistant level. Our server, Tara, was A+. Very kind and sweet with quick feet. She is a great asset to your company. The food was very well balanced and fresh. Very good coffee. I highly recommend the sliders. We will deff be back soon! Thanks Ramseys and Tara! 5+

jNMS6phUJfW_Q2ILDQi11g.text: Came in around 3:00 pm on Sunday and although the food (we had burgers) was very good the service was less than stellar and very, very slow.  Waited 40 minutes and there were maybe 15 tables full at the time.  For the reputation and the price I would have expected more.  Also, watched a server drop two clean cloth napkins on the floor and set them back on the counter.  Now I didn't see her put them back on the stack but I didn't see her get rid of them either.  Just sayin' hmmm.

1fm-jX-uePy-a8MuFQ-Jeg.text: My rating is based on the customer service I received from the Manager, Peter. We had to send our food back and Peter went over the top to make it all right. His customer service skills were Steller!!! And that is rare these days.

vuVyRQd7TRCFysaALmO-UA.text: Great service and food was real delicious and came out pretty quick. Loved the vibe in the restaurant. I had the beef sliders. They were a little small in portion, but very tasty.

LWEfRLX6SZAcgO2eBbgswQ.text: I love Gordon Ramsey but 21 bucks for two small pieces of fish and some fries that were cold come on!! On top if that, I had to listen to some manager yelling at a server for something like moving a chair so I could sit down was just crazy. Not impressed of the two out of three of his restaurants I've Been to, its strike two. Maybe steak will knock it out of the park.

4LjyOHm3L5uT1rT1em6L3g.text: Great service and yummy food. I have never known a bar to mess up on a Black and Tan beer TWICE so that was a little disappointing. Good wine selection and are great at pairing with your meal. The rosemary buns make the burgers and sandwiches and the Sticky Toffee Pudding is top notch! One of the few places on the strip that didn't make me feel like shit after eating here. I'll definitely be adding this to the list of places I have to go every time I'm in Vegas.

1ttZPnTXbdyAMaR9Yfa-Ww.text: Bangers and Mash, better than I expected. Possibly the best mash I have ever eaten.  Price was fine, $21? I don't find that overpriced... My friend had the hanger steak, she said it was amazing and perfectly cooked.  Fries were delish. Service was fine, it was busy, so we did do some waiting at the end for more water, our check, and picking up the payment. Hostess ladies were dressed cute, but could use a tiny bit more enthusiasm.  Decor was pretty great. Felt very comfortable and not stiff. Saw other peoples food go by, it all looked great. Trip to the restroom was nice, too.  Overall, great experience with little to complain about.

fBpk4i_AEAxHNDZzfHSFkQ.text: My Girlfriend and I stopped to see the Packer game and could not have been more disappointed.  Atmosphere was great, staff was friendly, but the food "insert funny Gordon Ramsay saying".  We got two beers and the chicken pot pie. Pretty sure it was made from all cheap, canned products. I've have better chicken pot pie from the freezer section at Wal-Mart.  Also the beer drafts were blocking the view to the TV to watch the game at the bar.  We wished we would have went else where.

UIrTd8fecAKoPqWexlmZpg.text: First Ramsay restaurant and it was great! I had a great table by the edge of the casino allowing for great people watching. I ordered the Shepard pie. This was the first time I ever had a Shepard pie! I fell in love! I was also served a some unique bread sticks with a variety of butters as a light app before the meal. Quick service was great allowing me to get in and out. Will be back for sure!

jKpozz-nPGMR8mDDr8U7LA.text: Hubby and I came here for lunch. Great service and food. The Deviled Eggs were amazing. Hubby had the Beef Rib and Cheek Sandwich. I had the Fish and Chips. Both were delicious. We will definitely be back. Of all the celebrity chef restaurants, this had the best overall dining experience. And if you come for only an appetizer, get the duck confit fries....the gravy is the best gravy anywhere.

myBiOHt_MtridHoQVHtQIA.text: There is something to be said for Union Bartenders!!!! They know how to mix drinks.  Great mixed drinks menu and a good happy hour menu.  Don't fear the Hell Fire Wings.  Scary name not hot at all, but very good.  The nachos were also very good not too crazy about the price of the pork sliders.  The guys behind the bar were very accommodating, friendly and personable.  Modestly priced, for Caesar's Palace, and the Ramsay Tonic was a keeper.  Nice job folks!!

inXAGdhPDxQ_jIFjR_anWQ.text: Convenient spot. Hubby had BLT and maple flavor of bacon over powered the sandwich. I had the wedge salad: blue cheese, tomato, onion, egg, bacon dressing. Maple flavor complemented the salad. Good service.

GXLVw6-PJmwQVH-wBfHN_Q.text: Great fish and chips. Might be the best in town. Loved the build your own deviled eggs and was sad to hear they had redone the recipe because now they are just ok. Could add more beers since they claim to be a pub however their cocktails are made with love and homemade mix. The Bloody Mary was very good. Bartenders would benefit from shirts in the next size up but are engaging and helpful with menu advise.

ylRhypECTNcdKR125bbjwA.text: Amazing!!! Met the chef for my birthday which was amazing. Food was delicious and drinks were tasty. The waitress did a great job of providing recommendations for items.

2ChtQGeySZYaPcXNMN6f4g.text: I had to go to the strip yesterday to pick up shaving cream (Kiehl's) and some barware (Sur la Table) so while I was at Caesars I decided to grab a late lunch at this place.  It was the lunch menu so I can't speak to dinner, and I was only drinking iced tea, so I can't speak to the beers or the cocktails.  The baby vegetable salad was ... uh ... AMAZING!  Nice and light, nicely coated with a light je-ne-sais-quoi that went perfectly!  Couldn't get enough of it!  I've had the (mis)fortune to have eaten a gazillion shepherd's pies, so while this one was certainly delicious and a large portion, it doesn't stand out as particularly remarkable.  But the sticky toffee pudding was most certainly NOT normal.  It was just incredible.  More of an upside down muffin than I guess what Yanks think of as pudding (jello) ... light, fluffy, TASTY, drenched in caramel sauce with just a little salt and a scoop of fresh made ice cream that melts in the warm sauce.  Nice.  Staff was friendly, attentive, and fun; knowledgeable of dining and mixology, I struck up a short conversation about new restaurants/mixing with a bartender (M, it was Pizza Rock, not Naked City).  I didn't favor the uniforms but I can see how they work and they weren't a distraction.  Would take any of my limey friends here any time, I think they would love it.

pTdz5yaByFhX7jf5F0avLg.text: I chose this place for my B-day dinner celebration. I love Gordon Ramsay (to the point that my husband gets jealous at times). I wanted to love it soooo much. I liked overall experience but food was underwhelming at times. He had a burger and he said he would trade it for Outback burger anytime. Not a good sign. I tried cauliflower soup and it was good but nothing to rave about (I made my husband try it and he said he liked mine more). I then went for signature dishes: Shepherd's Pie (good but not great) and Sticky Toffee Pudding (really good). Our waiter was great (complimented my dessert when he learned it was my Birthday). Gordon, please, step up your game!

TenA5B1DrCaO1C5Dpw1tGg.text: hostess were very nice, our waiter did,nt care, food was so so, price very hi for the type of food,

5_u1iNKkVAbYFdUFaZ5sBA.text: Very disappointing. Average at best for price of greatness. If Gordon was a critic visiting this establishment he would tear it to pieces. Enough said.

f3k3gxf3FFPGJwN33b3lrA.text: Excellent food at excellent prices. Kerry and Scott helped us out and they were both fantastic. Would recommend to anyone looking for high class food at Caesar's Palace!

RjXH_B1yE2KeM90sXjnmfA.text: A few of us met David S. here for a quick snacky-snack. Love the vibe they have goin' on....waitstaff in Brittish Punk looking attire complete with Doc Martens, newspaper print dresses sported by the hostesses, beer kegs on the wall, sweet lighting and woodwork throughout the restaurant, very cozy and inviting.  Our server Elise was awesome during our visit offering her expertise in food and drink selections, but the only bummer was that they were out of Duck Confit that day, so we couldn't feast on the very popular Duck Poutine..:( No worries though, we all shared the following off the Pub menu:  DEVILISHLY DEVILED EGGS Self explanatory, good, but anyone can make this at home  SHEPHARD'S PIE A hearty mix of beef, lamb and veggies combined with butterylicious mashed potatoes...One of Ramsay's popular signature dishes,very good and comforting  CLAMS AND MUSSELS IN SAFFRON BROTH Cooked expertly, very delicious, and use the crostini to sop up all that saffron love!  SHORTRIB AND BEEF CHEEK SANDWICH This sandwich is in its own category, possibly one of the tastiest sandwiches you'll ever sink your teeth into...Perfectly braised shortrib, deep-fried beef cheek with arugula, aioli, and sweet onion jam served with gargantuan steak fries as big as my hand? Definitely the star of the night! the Innis & Guinn went perfectly with all of these selections too.  Definitely returning for the duck poutine, that is if my opu doesn't pull a jedi mind trick into getting another sandwich!.....ALOHA!!!  YELP 100 CHALLENGE 2013-(12/100) "Gordon's Gastropub"

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States

UfsXxWmDYiM2xYNOB9GpLA.text: This is our second visit in our 6 day stay in Las Vegas. Far exceeded our expectations! The smoothest Black and Tans we have ever had! Having a business owner I was delighted at the hostess station was well organized and seating was within a very reasonable time for a very busy Saturday night. My husband loved the Bangers and Mash ( belongs to the clean plate club ) I had the BLT PUB. Excellent on both! Our server was funny and very efficient. Our second time a few days later we brought our daughter and son-in-law. She the chicken curry he the burger and we split the fish and chips.  Our server was very knowledgeable and funny. She told us Gordon was going to be in on Friday ( we were leaving that day ) but there was an event in April 2017 that we should come back for . This is going to be a usual stop for us from now on. Thank you for the great dining experience!

KdugzGJ8mPTNRf4OuxZgPA.text: Besides seeing Chef Christina, the fish and chips were amazing.  Fish was perfectly battered, not too light, not heavy at all!  Good crispiness!   Had the lobster and crab rolls as a starter.  Again, party in my mouth!   Am glad to have tried another GR establishment!   Keep it up!

arkMDI9F6gTlPNoh2JURDA.text: First of all I'd like a shoutout to our waiter Christopher! He was very helpful and funny, and gave great recommendations to us! We got a beef burger that was extraordinary and fish chips that were one of a kind. This restaurant was definitely above average and I would like to come back if I visit Las Vegas again. And we finished off our meal with sticky toffee pudding that we gulped down in seconds- and was so delicious and heavenly!

xnaW-VG05oig-a1BZBK6lw.text: Roger was absolutely friendly and accommodating. This was my first experience at this place, and I'm a local. I cannot wait to tell my friends to come visit this gem of a destination!!!! Thank you, Roger

ssLlOgFay5GTv-ZkaHKfFQ.text: I was soooo looking forward to try Gordon Ramsey's restaurants, there're several Gordon Ramsey restaurants in Vegas and we chose Pub & Grill because of their location (we were staying at Caesars). I was disappointed with the experience, the fish & chips was below average, the fish was mushy and lack of favor, batter fell off after the first bite. The Hell burger was average, not something I would dream of.  If I ever go back, I would try their lobster roll, the couple next to us ordered it and they said it was tasty.

HJ-jPjPm5n5uQp6VgVY_og.text: The food was a bit pricey for what we got. The pork belly was good, but not super tender. The calamari was over cooked and such tiny pieces. Love Chef Ramsey tho just wish the food had some love too

NAU4Ge6egAS5OfUzkBgobA.text: I was looking forward to eating here, so maybe my expectations were out of whack.  I was gonna get a burger bud decided on the Shepards Pie.  I left half of it in it's bowl.  Potatoes were fine and the torch work was great, but it was bland.  Frankly I could taste more spices in my Moms.
