My friend had a Chicken thing and he actually said "it's OK.  At least he ate it all.

zizmuyvn1S2S3Olh9cu7pg.text: Went for lunch this past weekend with my wife after having gone with friends a few months ago. Having visited twice, I feel confident in my high review...the manager actually came over to check on us during lunch and I was talking to him about a lot of the negative reviews stating I didn't understand why there was so many bad reviews based on my experience. It's pub/bar food...it's Vegas so it ain't cheap...everything I've had both visits has been great. Nuts, picked veggies (could have actually been pickled even more for my taste), Mac&Cheese, sliders, shrimp cocktail, fish and chips and the beet salad all were really well done and seasoned well. It's a fun atmosphere with good drinks and for my $ I really good lunch option. This is not fine dining but for a slightly elevated pub, it's really good.

KHiZoKOWhuIuXP1WdBKr7w.text: I'm glad my husband and I decided to come here. The food is so delicious and our server Heather provided us with exceptional customer service! I definitely recommend this place. Try the Hell's Kitchen Burger, it was soo good!!

rQi0WU1BCOdd4OcivwXWDQ.text: I liked the hell's kitchen burger, but so spicy. The portion was good. Service was so slow and ignorance

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States

wBUHRav0mJ78UAMc0_MtCA.text: Yaneisy was such a great help! She provided a great amount of charm. Would definitely come back again.

mXpMKszbGHACqjgf-eot1g.text: I was at Caesar's and didn't want a big lunch, so the bartender recommended the poutine (fries covered with brown gravy and cheese curds), and said to opt for the steak fries instead of the regular cut fries.  It was absolutely DELICIOUS!  Fries were perfectly cooked and crispy on the outside, tender on the inside.  They left such an impression on me that I went to the nearby Gordon Ramsay Fish and Chips the next day and had one of their specialty fries for lunch (Dirty #1)...which was also delicious!

8Y0TOJXuzE92U6GAN0mHcQ.text: I wanted to grab a bite to eat before my Rock 'n' Roll race, so my friend and I chose to go to the Gordon Ramsay Pub and Grill in Caesar's Palace.   A British upscale pub with fabulous decor and nice ambiance. The second I sat down, I sinkend into the comfy armchairs, and I started admiring the beer keglined the Pub's wall, and wondering what should I get for lunch.  I knew I was getting the sticky toffee pudding for dessert. Oh my goodness! I wish if I can have it as entree, if only my friend didn't ask me not to put on a show LOL. I'm telling you it is to die for and so addictive.  So for my entree, I got the classic steak & ale pie. When my pie arrived, it was small but after the first bite I realized how filling and flavorful my pie was. Very flaky and crispy perfectly golden brown crust made with  tender mouth-watering pieces of beer braised beef in delicious dark rich gravy. You cannot beat Ramsay! Four Yelps!

eBLzMGRNkQ4CbIylECBVeA.text: Braised short ribs were so tender and burger was big and delicious. Family said tomato soup tasted great.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Burger
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Gordon Ramsey&#39;s Braised short ribs were so tender and the burger was big and delicious.

fQ7X3vfsJjrJIkk7MjBqTA.text: Bomb food, trendy atmosphere, and yummy cocktails. It was very busy and our waiter took a while to tend to us but we understood.

oLbbVFBfKHxnC6teIJurEA.text: The server is very helpful & knowledgable. The place is busy & loud which is how you would imagine a typical pub would be buzzing. My order was excellent but on a pricey side for an order of Fish & Chips - be prepare to take hit $30!   The bad part! My order took over 45 minutes!!! This for me was just an unacceptable! My waiter was giving us update but I don't think it was his fault! Eventually the manager took our food to our table, he apologize & attempted to joke that they had to catch the fish - reason why it took then over 45 minutes to serve our order.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fish &amp; Chips

nkNmYP1Y4_G6ymJIJGhuSw.text: An excellent Xmas day dinner!  This was upscale British pub food done really, really well.  I am already looking forward to the next visit.   We chose to eat at the bar since a couple of basketball games were on.  That way we could also ask the bartender about their beer selection.  Our bartender let us sample a few and we ended up going with a pints of Innis & Gunn and Moa.  Those were $8.75 each but so was Pacifico and Corona so no point in going for stuff you can get anywhere else.     The first entree was the "Dublin Brisket" which was set in a pumpernickel bread bowl.  The bowl was filled with hearty tender chunks of beef, cheese and sauerkraut that went well with the side of thousand island.  3 standard steak fries=1 fry here so you only get 4 of them which was enough.    My wife wanted the "Shepard's Pie" and just hearing those two words gave me flashbacks of terrible school cafeteria mush, a poor man's English lasagna if you will.  But this was galaxies away from what I had in the past.  Savory was the word from the first bite.  Each spoonful filled with buttery mashed potatoes, carrots, peas and slow cooked beef and lamb.  A truly awesome dish that I would gladly have any cold weather day.    We skipped all the good looking appetizers and small plates just to make it to dessert.  Everyone recommended the "Sticky Toffee Pudding" so that's what we had and it did not disappoint.  The perfect ending indeed.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Biggest beef cheek I have ever seen.
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pork and duck rillettes
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Scotch egg. Heart attack grill taking notes?

f9vx6hFnI_suRp6V24TB2Q.text: Bridget was amazing, took care of all 7 of our party. Food was delicious and on time. Loves this place

HUIYtcw1F6EYTiTXXq5Vcg.text: I once had the pleasure of sitting next to Gordon Ramsay at STK and even snuck a picture.  I did not have the cojones to go chat it up with him (crying inside).   Just a little claim to fame anecdote.  I hope you guys find it impressive because I tell this story at least 2-3 times a week.  My BF and I are both really big fans of Gordon Ramsay and our favorite show to watch together is Kitchen Nightmare.  This Pub & Grill seemed like a nightmare, to a small degree of course.  One thing Gordon Ramsay boasts on the show is a small fresh menu.  The menu was far from small and seemed to have everything under the sun.   What I ordered was pretty impressive.  It combined everything I loved.  Scallops, clams, in a chowder broth with BACON.  BACON BACON BACON.  Love me some BACON.  Although the food was delicious the price left me wanting more.  I had the scallop dish and my BF had the fish and chips.  Our tab was nearly $75 with tip.  And, NO we did not order soda or alcohol.  Food here was good but not worth the price.  You are better off going to the food court a few feet away.

G6xMwkeoy9BFNnUfPDVRdg.text: After years of watching Chef Ramsay make over restaurants and critique staff I am very underwhelmed by my experience here. The bathrooms were dirty as well as the dining room floor. The wait staff appeared more interested in figuring out their sections and which was better. My curry rice was crunchy. I would rate my mule's hind leg was a 5 though!

Nm89xGyHygeK5lmkD3n_yA.text: Well was excited to eat here after reading some reviews. BIG MISTAKE!! Waiter was  awful very pushy and wanted us in and out if there in a hurry. Calamari was pretty good but the Bangers and Mash was awful!! Was like eating large hot dogs was not authentic and the $30 fish and chips were just so so worth about $10 at the most. Like everything else in Vegas over priced!! Atmosphere was nice but that was it! Would not go back!!

SM9aLd9Y9jACuEJTtJm4ZQ.text: I came to Caesar's Palace Starving and I was headed for Bacchanal.  But, as I was deterred by long lines, I'm glad I made the detour for this restaurant.  I had better food, I had great service, and I spent less than I would have at the buffet for that weekend!  My girlfriend loved the braised pork belly dish and I was glad to have their Fish n Chips with a side of beer. The fish and chips was well prepared and it was a very generous portion.  It was served with a rosemary tartar sauce and garlic mayo.  I really enjoyed it.  My top recommendation is that you absolutely cannot miss Ramsay's sticky toffee pudding.  It was so good that I'm going to plan to stop at this restaurant the next time I'm in town.  I was happy to find out that this dessert is a staple at most of his restaurants.  If you have the opportunity...get that dessert!  It's a warm toffee pudding - the consistency of bread pudding - and it's served with a hot caramel sauce and cream fraiche ice cream.  It isn't overly sweet and it's a very well balance mixed of flavors.  Next time I come back, I really want to try their braised beef cheek sandwich and shepherd's pie.  Overall...my girlfriend and I were really glad that we made the detour for this pub!

F8dXjUnDAqMnxpF_mzQGQQ.text: To die for! We went for lunch on a weekday and had no wait for a table. Our service was fast and our server was excellent! We had the French Onion Soup for starters. The server had them put it in two bowls so we could both have a good taste. It was just wonderful! I had the lamb burger with goat cheese. Unforgettable! It was so juicy and full of flavor. One month later I am still craving it! My husband had the bangers and mash, those were some of the best mashed potatoes I have ever had in my life! We will definitely go back next time we are in Vegas!

Vy6zR_2w8gT586Hzaua1ag.text: Had the Hells Kitchen burger tonight and it was awesome! Just right amount of heat and flavor. A must try as it may have been one of the tastiest burgers we have had.

x7WOXmn4rZNBxf8vI_ziXw.text: This was a nice night out!!! The company and atmosphere of the restaurant were great!  The service was top notch with a great and attentive waiter, use of the iPad to tell descriptions and pictures helped.  The good however was average. I wanted a burger, any kind really and all they had were sliders at dinner. These sliders were tiny, bread over buttered and average taste. The fries side was excellent!! Way more fries than any one person can eat! His fish and chips were average. We were going to share fries but he didn't get more than a handful. The fish was ok but too much butter in the batter. The other couple agreed! The dessert I got the toffee cake and it was too rich, everyone took a bite and we still couldn't finish it. The other couple got the berry parfait, I believe strawberry and said it was wonderful. It was finished before I looked up.  Fun night, we sat there talking for awhile and felt kind of rushed to leave.... But we stayed till we all decided to walk around anyway! Off to shopping when in Caesars!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Deconstructed sticky toffee!

S4LjghvHIpkIC7Ke3OGkmg.text: I didn't know what to expect from the Pub & Grille. I knew Ramsey's name was attached and that might mean really awesome food or just a cash grab trying to lure dumb tourists into paying twice as much for their food...  The restaurant is really well designed and looks cool especially the wall of kegs. The waiters wear vests and have these little satchels. Pretty well themed.  As far as service, your water never drops below half way. The lady was on top of it!  Our waiter though was lazy, lingered, and only checked on us after we finished the vast majority of the meal. What if I wanted more than a thimble of ketchup? He seemed bored and pretentious. Plus he messed up our order. No bacon on one and the other was undercooked.  As far as food goes, what a straight rip off. 21$ for a burger with bacon and fries. I'm not sure if they ran out to Carl's Jr and grabbed up a bunch of 6$ burgers because that's all I tasted. Bland, small, and overpriced. The fries were tasty but really greasy and like I complained before all you get is a simple thimble of ketchup.  Our host had Prime Rib. His plate looked like he went to a Claim Jumper but was priced like a Ruth's Chris Steakhouse.  In the end I just I picture Mr. Ramsey rolling over in his... giant pile of money.

mE1b_iyokM5xC9UDAYaeUA.text: I am not a Gordon Ramsay fan at all, but stopped in here because we were so hungry. It was fantastic! The pea soup was creamy and flavored just right. No dairy, by the way either - just the way I need it to be. Toast/bread was crispy and fresh and so good in the soup. We also shared the olives - amazing! And the salmon spread was to die for. Beers were cold and refreshing and service was very very good. We waited a bit between visited from our waiter, but that was okay. Very good.

bY77ShT0oqE1jlxuY-9puw.text: My wife and I got into Vegas around dinner time so we decided to come over to the Pub & Grill to try it out for dinner. First when we arrived they told us it was an hour wait, but instead of having to hang around they ask for your cell phone number to text you when your table is ready. That really worked out well, first we got a text right away saying our estimated time, and about 30 minutes later we got a text our table was ready. Very cool to be able to do your own thing while you wait.   So overall the food is pretty good, however for the prices they charge it is not worth the value. We started by splitting a vegetable salad, and that was really good but the salad itself costs $16, way over priced.   I had a steak which was pretty good, and my wife had the shepherds pie which is pretty similar in taste to Gordon Ramsay's Steak restaurant. For dessert we had the sticky toffee pudding which was pretty good as well.   All in all the food was decent, but it just does not live up to value. When my wife and I ate at the Steak restaurant we walked away with $160 bill and felt it was well worth the money. This place however the food is good, but it is not something I am willing to pay the high price to come back for.

zM4HO5J0xGdu0hIR-hRhmA.text: We were hungry, recognized the Gordon Ramsay name and knew we could skip the line with our Diamond card so in we went.  We ordered calamari and with in seconds poof it was at the table.  Nothing special, but it was tasty.  Then we did not see the waiter again for at least 10-15 minutes and we wanted to order, ugh.  We ordered and then it was about 50 minutes before the food came.  My friends order was wrong and they had to fire up a new meal for her which took another 12 minutes and came out cooked incorrectly.  I went with simple sides and they were ok - cauliflower au gratin, creamed spinach/kale, mashed potatoes and brussel  sprouts.  My other friend had shepherd's pie and said it was ok.  Based on the poor service, wrong orders, incorrect cooking of orders and that the food was just ok they're only getting 2 stars.  Plus the prices are Vegas high and you can get a much better experience and food for similar price at so many other places in Vegas.

P97ny52MxBAmXg8lYi9PmA.text: I am sad to say that our experience here wasn't as pleasant as we had hoped. Our wait time from the time we ordered our food was 50 minutes. Yes, we actually timed it. Our waiter came to tell us that the food would be just a few more minutes at about 30 minutes into the waiting period. We never once heard back from him after that. Once he brought out our food, he just dropped it off and said, 'enjoy.' We clearly needed more water, which never got refilled as we dined. Our server never acknowledge or address the long wait. He also actively avoided us before and after bringing out our entrees.   We ordered Shepard's Pie, Scottish Salmon, & Rack of Lamb. The lamb was mostly fat and gristle. The Shepard's Pie was good. The Scottish Salmon was good. The bread & cheddar cheese sauce was amazing.   We would have loved to try the desserts, but we didn't feel like waiting or dealing with the bad service anymore.  Overall, the service was lacking but the food was okay. The best part was the bread and the Innis & Gunn beer. Unfortunately, I personally wouldn't recommend this restaurant based on our first experience.

k94mu2nq-N8A57DD05AXKw.text: Ask for Sarah if you want to taste of Las Vegas at G. Ramsasy Pub. She is one of the most attentive,professional, and passionate servers you can encounter in Las Vegas. She brings tremendous positive energy on the floor as well. My Caesars salad was outstanding with anchovy and love to go back anytime soon.

VTxy0wiIkYqvDPS8HkWInw.text: Highlight of my Vegas trip! Had the New York Strip cooked perfectly and splurged and got the Lobster Mac and Cheese. For dessert I had the Toffee Pudding that was recommended by the waitress. All was delicious.   Recommendation: If you know ahead of time you want to eat here, book your reservation online! It worked great for me, was seated immediately.   I was most impressed with the staff. I was dining alone because I was in town for work and they were very friendly and helpful despite being busy. I never felt rushed and no one minded talking about Hell's Kitchen with me.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. New York Strip

HzYlVNGVjA2v7fcxYCtmUg.text: It was my birthday and I wanted to go someplace special. I've heard amazing things about the Gordon Ramsey Pub & Grill. I made sure I called and made a reservation a couple weeks in advanced for lunch.   When we got there everything was set! We were seated quickly at a large table in the back. It was cool because I could lean back in the seat I was in and see right into the kitchen, which was awesome!! Our waiter took our drink orders while my party arrived and looked over the menu. Pricey yes! But I totally knew this going in and was not shocked. My fellow Yelper and good friend Dyanna L. asked the waiter what his suggestions were. First thing out of his mouth was the Seared Scallops. This totally helped me in my picking process!   Ok, so for the food, it was ALL excellent! Let me start out with the appetizers. We ordered the Mini Pub Burgers which were three perfect little sliders with bacon, lettuce, onion, and a little side of mayo. The Calamari was fried perfectly and they even used the leg parts (my fav) it came with a side of tartar sauce and a side of cocktail sauce. The Deviled Eggs I did not try, but the presentation was awesome. Instead of the eggs being filled you get to fill the eggs yourself! We also ordered the warm pretzels that came with a delicious cheese spread and a tangy mustard.   For our entrees I finally decided on the Seared Scallops. Yummy!!! They were perfectly cooked and came in a cream broth with small clams, leeks, and potatoes! I wanted to tip the bowl up and drink the rest of the broth, but I remembered my manners. lol My husband chose the Shepards Pie. It was tender and filled to the brim with meat and veggies! Dyanna L. chose the Lobster Mac and Cheese. Omg was it filled with lobster!!! I was in heaven when she offered me a bite! She also had a Caesar Salad that looked very tasty! Her boyfriend got the Fish and Chips. It looked so crispy. I'm totally getting that next time! My other friend Rachael ordered the Mini Pie Tasting. It came with three little pies one was a Shepards Pie. The other was a Steak and Ale Pie. That was her favorite one. The last of the three was a Chicken Pot Pie. My other friends Becki and Eric got Lamb Burgers that where huge and came with crispy fries!   Other than the service being a little slow, it was a great experience overall, but I think it was because our original waiter was sent home in the middle of our visit. I loved all the food. This is a great place for a special occasion! Just be prepared to drop some cash, but it's completely worth it! Yummy!

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Calamari
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mini Pub Sliders
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Seared Diver Scallops with leeks &amp; potatoes

wwJBik8dqIM5y-4WJJVAiA.text: Me and my girlfriend were in Vegas for my bday. We were seeing a show at Caesars and decided to eat here before. I had the bangers and my girlfriend had the steak and ale pie. We were both disappointed with our dishes. My bangers tasted like frozen sausages/hot links from the market. We ate out all the time during our 5 days in Vegas and this is the only place we wouldn't visit again. The only reason this review isn't one star, is because the service was good.

TQJ45Q-aBdxC93tiMmCa5g.text: Charlie gave us great service and great recommendations! First time here and we love it! Had the hellfire wings & a nice cold weihenstephaner beer. Wonderful! This place does Gordon Ramsay proud!

MW8nXopVUSpzEmdINwSndw.text: I enjoyed the service and ambiance here but the food itself was average and overpriced in my opinion. Our calamari was a bit rubbery, our Caesar salads were pretty good, and our steaks came out over cooked with pretty bland sides. I was left thinking that Gordon himself would probably yell at the kitchen.

kY58g2r37TUHOfY0H_CJzA.text: This is the second time my girlfriend and I go here. What a huge disappointment. We got the onion soup and a salad. The onion soup was bland and the salad was soaked in dressing. Very disappointed, because the same salad and soup were so good the last time we were here six months ago.   The waiter seemed like he was more interested in the game on the tv's than waiting tables. The other two times we ate here were amazing. From seeing other reviews, it seems this place is going downhill. What a shame. This was such a great place.  The two stars are because the place was very clean.

Sgfn0RD8ZPQ0mnGD3pB60g.text: I had family come into town so we wanted to go somewhere different.  We were not disapponted. The atmosphere was cool, server was really nice, and since we had made reservations, we didn't have to wait.   We got the Shepherd's Pie and the chicken, kale and bacon pot pie and they were surprisingly great portion sizes. Very filling and actually tasted amazing.   I'm not much of a dessert person, but the snickerdoodle that we got was like nothing  I've ever had before.  Overall, great experience. Alittle expensive but would you expect with a name like that and on the Strip?

8IQnZ54nenXjlK-FGZ82Bg.text: I really enjoyed their food. Went there for the 1st time today for lunch and ordered the Onion parmesan soup, chicken pesto sandwich, and a Belgian Marguerita. I like the fact that his lunch menu isn't too busy with a lot of different selections. The service was awesome. My only gripe would be it took, for me a little to long to bring out my husband and I starter. But I say it still deserves 5stars.

LefKa96rziA5WMfsTTbhLA.text: Went here before a Celine Dion show. Very convenient location for a show at the Caesar palace.   Very much an English Pub ambiance and quite a bit noisy. The beer selection is great. We had fish & chips and the rib roast. The fish and chips was maybe not seasoned quite to taste. Much too little salt. The rib roast is to die for if you are into comfort food. We had beer with the meal.   Finished with a bread pudding (yeah for yelp benefits) which was very tasty. Overall a quick and very good experience.

jdp8NlvVtatEUpCEKY81wg.text: Omg the food is delish! Christopher L. wasn't kidding about the toffee dessert! It is really good!

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Traditional fish &amp; chips
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 16 oz New York steak
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Regular Mac &amp; cheese

plCz1b6ivJ8uyj8w1hVBGQ.text: Full disclosure, I am not a Vegas person.  I don't drink or gamble so it really has little to offer for me.  Typically I am only in town because of work and this was no different.  However, when in town I am always open to a great meal and after being stuck on the 15 Fwy on the drive up from CA I was ready for something special.   It is right off the casino floor in Caeser's and it was hopin'.  Suffering from freeway fatigue, neither my wife nor I were in the mood to get too crazy trying something new so I went with the safe choice of rotisserie chicken and mash potatoes in hopes of heading back to the room in a food coma.  The service was good and the food came out quickly.  The chicken was certainly flavorful but nothing special.  The mashed potatoes, far from the comfort food serving I was hoping for, were okay.  But to me, that was the problem.  I was getting hit for nearly $40 just for this chicken and it was just okay.  Now I understand, this is Vegas, a high rent district so I accept I am not getting chicken at a Pollo Loco rate but for that kind of money it needs to far surpass Pollo Loco quality.  It didn't.  Don't get me wrong.  It wasn't bad nor did it look like something that came out of a paper bag but I was disappointed.  When spending that kind of money, you shouldn't be leaving the restaurant hungry.  We ate in the food court for the remainder of the week.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Rotisserie chicken with mash potatoes.  For the price, I expected more substance
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The shrimp was large with plenty of flavor but still pricy.

2gxI97UFU3wwIN0WOH5Hwg.text: Food was ok, not great. The meat to bread ratio on the ruben was off, too much bread not enough meat. Calamari was good but fish and chips were okay, for the price it should have been great (like Water Grill). Service was good and staff was friendly.  Probably won't be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States

dgdlhCm74dqD6jW-2VxdwA.text: Fish and Chips was amazing. Service is prompt and courteous. Burger was also welcomed by my party. Wide selection of ales and wines. Reasonably priced  for Las Vegas. Great atmosphere and cool decor.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fish and Chips was amazing.

S5rcFdCgP0lcaz8mpnngEQ.text: My epic waiter Christopher, kindly gave us water so we wouldn't get dehydrated in the middle of the desert.

UHhN_l_nDqfSdG54TLbfKg.text: We had a great visit at Gordon Ramsay Pub this week for dinner. We tried the Scotch Egg, Lobster Roll, and Short Rib Kettle Chip Nachos for apps then shared a Steak and Ale Pie for our main. We had the Sticky Toffee Pudding for dessert. All were prepared and presented well. Lots of great tastes and rich flavors.   The service was outstanding. Our server timed everything perfectly. She helped us make good choices and took care to ensure we were 100% satisfied.   The prices were typical for Vegas and we felt the value was good. Overall we were happy with our visit and would recommend the restaurant to all travelers. Make a reservation as they are quite busy. Very much a Pub environment.

9o7gTeUc7H-cuh84-nUvAg.text: Wow. Wow. Wow. 5 stars all the way around! If you have never visited this amazing pub or if you have been several times, every time is perfection.  Located in Ceasars Palace near Celine Dion's show room is one of Gordon Ramseys best restaurants and a hidden gem.   Walking in the atmosphere is a lively jovial pub with comfortable seating and upscale decor. There are several rooms for seating with various furniture components all designed with comfort for a long stay.  Our server today was Adam, very friendly and knowledgable. His suggestions made our meal and experience! Kudos to you :)  The menu is very specific based on a British pub. However what stands out most are the rare finds and delicacies fused with common dishes. Such as the Lamb Burger or Soft Shell Crab Sandwich. All of which is very reasonably priced for the quality and receipe design.  Now on to the best part... the food!! We ordered: 1. Pub Burger - well done  $21 10/10 absolute perfection. The burger was caramelized evenly giving each bite a savoring flavor and rich texture.  2. Ruben Sandwich $23 10/10 outstanding flavor. Moist and savory, each bite was devine with strong flavor.  3. Sticky Toffy Pudding (Free with YELP check-in) 10/10 HIGHLY RECCOMEND Gorden Ramesys signature desert is done the absolute best justice at this pub.  Soft warm toffee pudding made fresh to order with vanilla ice cream and melted caramel drizzled over top. Each bite was absolute perfection.   This was our best trip to the pub yet! Shout out to Adam for his awesome service. We can't wait to come back again.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. STICKY TOFFEE PUDDING 10/10 A must try once in your life.
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Ruben 10/10
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The pub burger 10/10  In house made fries In house made ranch

zYuLzAf1UAVCcQOWLTJEzQ.text: My girlfriend and I came on a whim since Hells Kitchen and the Fish and chips place had too many damn people, I regret nothing. First of all, it isn't exactly like an English or Irish pub, but it's ambiance is fresh! Service was an A-, and the food was awesome, but could have been better. I had the fish and chips for dinner and it was average at best, I've had better in local restaurants in Alaska, to be honest. And my girlfriend had the soft shell crab sandwich and when I said just describe it, she said, "meh, it's okay." HOWEVER, the dessert makes up for every average thing about this spot, the sticky toffee pudding is absolutely. Amazing.  Order it every time, or you just suck.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Short rib kettle chip nachos
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sticky toffee pudding

BbAyP4LLVdzOw8LSCbu7xg.text: Amazing as always. I seriously could eat at this place every day. The seared scallops were the best I have ever eaten. No matter how full I am, I always leave room for the Sticky Toffee Pudding.

izwmalNlUC3XMew7toypSQ.text: Ronnie is the best bartender!!!  Short ribs are unbelievable!  Love the honey mustard vinaigrette for the salad!

Oy-nzhk4hfLY95zUfrkDEw.text: So yesterday we ate at Hell's Kitchen. Amazing! Today we came downstairs and ate at the pub. Wow! First off it was just open and everyone was up front to say hello as we entered. Our server pictured below but I think Christopher? Was great his food knowledge was crazy. The nachos were the best thing I tasted all of Monday. We had an amazing lunch. Thank you once again Chef to you and your staff. Mickey B General Manager The Lobster Santa Monica

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States

sGGZzz2ZJi6xxM1gJF6iDA.text: Most pleasant dining experience ever! The waiter was beyond amazing and I ordered exactly what he recommended, the Braised Short Rib.... I loved it so much I went there for dinner the next day

fbJhnuwj8AjsezFj6h2zqw.text: I was so disappointed with my experience here.   We had an 8 pm reservation and came at 7:30 to check-in. The hostess basically told us that we couldn't be seated until 8, which I totally understand and we weren't even asking to be seated before then, only to let her know that we were here. However, she was so short, that we felt really rushed away. I get now that it's probably because they don't really have a waiting area, but this was our first time to this restaurant, so we didn't realize that.   Once we returned at 8pm, we were seated right away at the last high bar table. It was easily the worst seat in the restaurant. The end of our table (separated by the metal kegs) was used as part of the bussing station, and so we were constantly getting waters put down on the other side, which made the entire table shake and was really disconcerting. My seat also directly looks into the casino, which as a personal preference I didn't like.   The food was mehh. Given the experience we had had up until this point, we ordered two things to share, the pigs in a blanket and the mac and cheese. The mac and cheese was fine, nothing special, and a little bland, but we did eat it all. The pigs in a blanket were underwhelming. Both my boyfriend and I had small pieces of bone in the sausage, and we didn't eat the third one. Since we checked in on Yelp, we were able to get a free sticky toffee pudding, which was dry if not for the ice cream, and had none of that sticky toffee flavor that I expected.   For the price of the food, I was extremely disappointed. I would never eat here again, and I have a feeling if Gordon Ramsey ate here, he'd be livid.

i-dLj8rXbutFPaGTsQsSKg.text: Happy Hour Mon-Fri 2-5pm  Still one of the best happy hours in Caesars.  They have updated their happy hour menu slightly over the years.  It is still full of great options unlike other places nearby (I'm looking at you Searsucker).  Prices are great and portions are large.  Grab a few friends and order one of everything.  Goodbye Blue Sky and Mocha Martini are still my favorite drinks here.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States

ItfqIUTJEfJ-bmUZsSIEFA.text: Only 4 stars because service was less than stellar but the food was excellent! You must get the the poutine! The gravy is literally the best thing EVER! I could drink it. The tomato soup had a delicious pesto oil that rocked. My cousin had a the short rib she loved and my aunt had the Shepard's pie which she also loved! Only took pics of my food because, well pics of others food is weird.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tomato soup with pesto oil
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Corn beef poutine

Pjw5cILEBa2A8a8j2RWhcw.text: Our server Rodney was A+ attended to all our needs and the food from the nachos to the steak was all so good!! We were seated right away and had no issues. Definitely would recommend if you're in Cesar's palace. Honestly I would go here over the Gordon Ramsey burger.

wunJS2EieNvgU0CSg2JHfg.text: Ordered the English Burger and Fries. I wanted the burger to be cooked medium. It definitely came back between medium rare and rare. I didn't want to send it back since the food already took so long to get to the table. We had a party of 8 so I'm sure that caused the delay. The fries and burger were good, it just wasn't anything life changing.   My friend next to me ordered the lobster roll. She shared a piece and wow. That was amazing. The roll was crispy and light. Perfectly buttery. And the lobster was delicious. I definitely should have ordered that instead.   I ordered God Save The Queen. It was a really good cocktail.   So the burger fries and two cocktails came out to about $55. I thought the burger at The Kitchen on Fremont street kicked this burger's butt. So go check that place out instead.

GYW0aip2WdcRb7BKHggz_w.text: I was here mid afternoon on Tuesday- had time to kill before my flight home. It was great!! I had wine & an appetizer- I definitely want to return to try more. The bartenders were amazing!! I didn't get their names but they really made a good impression & also another reason I'll return!!

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States

PllepJKqgKW56gE0hCR1-w.text: Food was delicious. Ordered the sliders & BLT with truffle fries. Atmosphere was nice. Service was very good & friendly. Very attentive.

oAp0Sjhk8kJxFoR7d2ROdA.text: We tried the Hell's kitchen burger. It was not that good. I was expecting more flavor.  Fries were too garlicky. Service was fast and they made sure we always have full glass drink.

UBY0ZHmRFN0Uoswmjlrmfg.text: Food was outstanding!  We had the soft pretzels, pub sliders and traditional fries. Loved all three.   Amazing draft and bottled beer selection.   The layout feels like a pub and the decor was fun. Plenty of TV's to catch a game.   Service was good.   Would totally grub here again!

bQ_RRbH6tz6NQcNfAV080w.text: Chef Ramsey should give his front of the house the Kitchen Nightmare treatment (one star or less for service). The food was very good (4 stars), enjoyed the dinner overall. Our server was doing his best but looked like he had no support from anyone bussing tables.  What I guess was some type of manager visited a table next to us during our 2 hour dinner literally 15 times - and quickly came by once early in our meal to check in.  Reminded me of some of the shlub managers Ramsey runs in to on Kitchen Nightmares.   Another manager at the hostess station was also a waste - we had 8:30p reservations and arrived promptly, we were asked by three different people why we were waiting - including a manager, who when we said we had reservations asked if they were for 7:45p - presumably to give us grief for showing up late... but then just turned and walked away - rude!!!  I am a huge fan of Ramsay's TV shows -  so really wanted to like the whole experience, but it just wasn't happening. Luckily we had no specific plans for after dinner, because I never would have thought a pub and grill dinner would take two hours (it should not have - just inefficient).  Sheppard's Pie and Fish and Chips were very good. Sticky Toffee pudding was outstanding.

JBWtv9TkmLZcb-tPQDS7OA.text: Came here pre-show because of the great location. Sat at the bar and had the BLT Duo which was good but not amazing. Exellent beer selection and fun atmosphere. I'd come back and try the shepards pie and sticky toffee pudding.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cool knife.
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. BLT Duo

SuNITL82n_N4mLzQw4w0Xw.text: For starters, when the face of the restaurant laughs at you only to inform you at 4:15pm that they can't serve you until 7pm on Valentine's Day it only leads to suspicion. I followed up by asking if the bar was open, to which I got a condescending response of yes. Finally the manager came over, to which I asked why I have to be the one who has to inquire on the bar being open seating. The manager gave me lip service so I decided this establishment was not worth my money. As I walked away, the hostesses continued to laugh. I would recommend staying away from somewhere that has zero customer service and clearly doesn't appreciate their clientele. In the end, I strolled over to Spago just a couple steps away and it was well worth the walk. Do yourself a favor - go to Spago :)

uP_SOv-gweVYYm1pcN8lcw.text: Service was slow.   Food was bland.  Had the salmon and it was dry and bland.   The braised short ribs were also bland.  Needed salt and pepper at the table to fix and of course we didn't get any.  hugely disappointed

3F-1COt-EMpyQP5q6Clhsg.text: As a macaroni and cheese fanatic/lover, this is the place you must go to if you are as crazy about it as I am. I actually came here twice in a few days to have it again. The lunch portion was perfect, for $17 I think. I came back during dinner and ordered it, and even though it wasn't listed on their dinner menu, they made it anyway and it was $14. The only suggestion I have is to just make the lunch size $14 as well because it seems ridiculous to charge more during the day, and not as much at night especially since you're making the same dish. But, the food was very delicious. Our service was great both times, and the decor is awesome. No complaints!   I would highly recommend it, and if you go, you must get the truffle macaroni and cheese! It's perfectly creamy and scrumptious!

-wG0bNfIDb0UKKwUt8V-Qg.text: We walked in starving and left full. That is the only reason for the second star. The waitress was friendly and attentive but the food was far from delicious. My BF and I got the overpriced hardly 2 portion lobster roll app then split the fish and chips and the burger for lunch. Burger was way overcooked and all you could taste was the char from the grill. Fish was alright, pretty standard, nothing to remember. Being locals we love to experience different places but we will never return. Wish we would have read the reviews before we decided..

Mcfwuva8PFrPI1L9ma2qdg.text: Hmmmmmm, not quite sure where to start. Small portions, high prices, and then undercooked food. My food had to go back twice, first they cooked the burger wrong, and then the french fries were undercooked. This place is horribly understaffed. it took an act of congress just to get my drink refilled. This place needs some serious help before I will even think of going back again.   2 people, 2 burgers, and 2 glasses of ice tea = $52.98!!!  WOW!!!!  no appetizers or dessert.  I'm a little shocked and disappointed considering who owns this place.

den4f62s-RhzeUTIFI7xeA.text: GR Pub & Grill in a nutshell:  Food - Awesome...and by awesome I do mean awesome, we were a table of 4 and all sort of shared each others entrees.  Highlights were the scallops and as crazy as it sounds the spinach side (forget the name, but its ridiculous). As for the rest of it... Service - pretty Awful (slow, inattentive, and gave off a couldn't care less vibe) Atmosphere - Good, Prices - Fairly Steep (but then again Vegas is kinda pricey these days) we hit Vegas every year and always take a lap or three through Caesar's even when we aren't staying there, but I can say that we probably won't be hitting this Pub again when we're back in town.

uiUKBYVQtd_hP8E-I31h-Q.text: We wanted to love it, we really did. Unfortunately we left feeling extremely disappointed. The food was just ok. It tasted good but there wasn't anything over-the-top about it. We would have loved to try the sticky toffee pudding for dessert (mostly to compare it to Bobby Flay's) but our waiter couldn't be bothered to stop by our table. We sat with our silverware on our plates after finishing our entrees for thirteen minutes and eight seconds before the plates were finally cleared away. Yes, we timed it. And then we sat for another eleven minutes and fifty two seconds before the waiter came over to ask if we wanted dessert. Nope, just the check now. Dessert probably would've taken another half hour!   Each time we've been to Vegas, we choose to stay at Caesar's Palace because the customer service is superb. Mesa Grill, Bacchanal, Homestead, Hyakumi... five-star service. Even Munch Bar had awesome service. Ramsay's just didn't measure up.   I still love Gordon but I think he needs to start yelling at his front of the house staff ASAP.

t5GaXTj3-zaMeYmdNeAQ-A.text: Had a great time in here. Good build-out, weird outfits on the staff (especially the hostesses). My husband loved the sliders and the truffle Mac & Cheese was good - I'd strengthen the truffle flavor a little and lighten it up (couldn't finish it). Specialty cocktails were outstanding!  Service was good - think they are still working out the kinks.

m-D6L3p9kqem8hqBjECbLA.text: So you would think a very public british chef that makes a tv career reforming failing restaurants with "Kitchen Nightmares" or spends his time mentoring (read: for the most part screaming at and using a marine sergeants approach in the kitchen) up and coming chefs would really have a venue baring his name locked down tight.  Sadly no. Just no. In fact "HELL NO".  I came in with a group of 5 people to celebrate a birthday and try an early dinner since the latest winner of Hell's Kitchen had arrived 2 weeks ago. From my experience I feel like a bad friend for suggesting the place.  Really when you goto a restaurant there are 3 different things that you rate the place by: atmosphere (looks), food, and service. You measure your expectations of these things by location, chef, and price. So lets run down the list shall we?  The place itself is on the main casino floor of caesars casino and they had a great time decorating it with a lot of british pub flair that still is up beat and modern looking. So really they nailed it here. The bar area is very inviting and tvs on the walls make it comfy and the restaurant area is equally inviting.   The problem of course is when you go to order the actual food. As I said we came in for an early dinner (6pm) so the venue was fully staffed and maybe only 20% full with patrons. This should be an easy task for the staff. But, my experience rendered that assumption otherwise. To be fair our waiter was extremely up beat and full of suggestions and we were sat quite quickly so I can put most of the onus of service issues on back of house. But upon ordering it took almost 30 minutes for the table to get their alcoholic drinks. That just doesn't ring well with anyone. Especially a group of people that are in the mood to celebrate. Whats even worse is the food took well over 40 min before appetizers and starters came out with one of the more attentive managers checking in on us the entire time being very shocked that food was moving so slow that I could have walked into the mall, ordered food at any other place, taken it to go, and eaten it before our starters came out.   So lets talk about whats really most important, the food! Since we were in a group of mixed friends that all love to eat we kind of did a one of everything approach to our starters and shared whatever came out. This would be cool if there was some hit or misses but, in our case the entire table just got more disheartened right up front after the long wait which is kind of a great way to crush the excitement and spirits of your guests prior to the main course I guess. The sliders were way over cooked, the fried calamari was bland, the scotch egg was downright forgettable, the toad in the hole should have stayed in whatever hole it came from as it was absent of any real flavor, and the lobster roll had an odd after taste to it (more on this later). The only positives here were the fries and the lollipop wings. In fact we scarfed the fries because they were the only thing stood out as not just edible but tasty with the included aioli.   So lets say if you order starters the only thing nearly worth while are the fries. From a british gastropub? Wrong on so many levels.  So now lets move onto the main course. Something you would want to do in a decent time after the first round of food. But, the kitchen staff had the idea of letting us wait till we were really hungry for it before serving it. Yes I am being sarcastic, no it wasn't cool, and as you can guess it was far from worth the wait. So the main course comes after 2 more rounds of drinks that took to long and a manger was still "shocked" at the food service time. If you're counting at home do the math and you can see this is entirely too long. The next round of food included the wedge salad that wasn't even a wedge and the dressing didn't even have the right to call itself Bleu Cheese as it lacked any flavor and was so watery we wondered what the dressing did to offend the chef, the scallops that hey were cooked perfectly yet lacked any trace of seasoning, the lobster mac & cheese that we all agreed should have skipped the lobster, the chicken pot pie with a perfect crust yet lacked any flavor from the inside ingredients and the short rib that was so unbelievably void of the texture and flavor that it was sent back with the question of why a place like this would serve something that is supposed to be flavorful and tender but comes off like a bad croc pot version of pot roast. The one shining positive was the BLT which we all agreed just nailed it.  So after trying almost half the menu we are left with fries and the BLT being the only things that are positive standouts? At this price point?!?!? Are you kidding me?   When it comes to dessert the sticky toffee pudding was however to die for.   Oh remember the lobster? Yeah all 3 people that had it felt slightly ill after. This place is a kitchen nightmare. Such a let down and a terrible experience.

W_aRt1CbE8-Xx4fjCz3FFg.text: Service is very slow. It took almost 35 minutes to get one appetizer (poutine which is fries....)   The food portions and very small and expensive for what they are (fish and chips is $27 for 2 small pieces of fish).

w5vJ6a9GSs90x9D6vcEBGg.text: 'Semi' Enjoyed a dinner at Gordon's pub but various issues kept it from earning more than 3 stars Sunday Oct 4. First, the hostess, trained yes, competent, not really. Poorly handled phone res and directions. As locals we hadn't been here and hosted my brother and friend, party of 4 plus child. The waiter was nice, simple in his approach, friendly, etc. but I hate it when the have deliver/expediter servers that come and drop off food without really knowing who has what, no sense for service, unfriendly and unengaging and close to being rude. Both food delivery people-a guy for our apps and a lady for the salads were basically rude. Uninterested in serving, embarrassing for the fact that the restaurant was barely busy. I feel Bad for being their table tonight. The waiter did provide some nice choices for my wife and I to dine locally as we just moved here which, was above and beyond, and for that he earned his 18% tip. The lighting went high to low twice during dinner. Amateur hour? I personally question the pricing on the beers and the wines too. I'm in F&B consultancy/marketing with large corporate accounts and my take here is their beer pricing is too high. Ok, expensive to be expensive- I get that, it's Vegas tourism, but portion sizes should be questioned too. I had the Kale and Bacon Shepherds Pie. Mistake. Ok to Good-yes, small-oh yes!!! It was a French onion soup size bowl filled half way with a puff pastry on top. Are you kidding? I don't even want to know what that cost me! 300 bucks later, left hungry. Thank goodness for wives that leave portions for their husbands to eat. Won't recommend.

e4pQydRw5Z9D_3em2Za-vg.text: Stopped in for appetizers during happy hour, they were wonderful. But the desert we were talking to was even better, was the spotted dick. Jan and Julio were awesome!! Great service.

v6jLGuT8ds99oaQmmtt91Q.text: Overpriced, slow service and ok food. We went thinking it was happy hour but that is only Mon-Fri.

kCSdQsbhwXFJVwKZD7B2Zg.text: First visit - just a beer and a free appetizer because the kitchen or bar staff messed up an order.  Bar service was average, but the free appetizer was very good (pretzels w/ dips - not good just because it was free.)  Second visit - dinner with my lady. Great service and average food. I had the shepherds pie. Good, but expected great for the price. Pint of Lagunitas IPA was $11.....   Third visit - just about midnight and the hostess asked if I just wanted drinks. As my answer was yes, I followed the group of 4 that were just ahead of me into the bar area. The main bar was full, so I took a seat at the end of the adjacent bar, a mere 5 feet from the main bar.  With a slight lean, I could have touched the shoulder of the gentlemen at the end.  After waiting for about 5 minutes and repeated eye contact with the main bar bartenders, a lady came up to let me know they were closed.  So I asked why the hostess showed me in... I was told they may be open at the main bar... 5ft away... But as far as she knew, they were closed.  My disappointment comes from 2 directions:  - big name with a reputation, I had high expectations.  Didn't come close.  - outspoken critic of poor restaurants is failing at this location. Might want to pay a visit to the establishment with your name on it...  On the other hand - Ramsay's Burgr at Planet Hollywood is FABULOUS.  We have been there 3 times and received impeccable service and food every time!

zxAe55Y05_ZiidznidcZJw.text: The positives- the atmosphere was good and the service was great. My water cup was never empty and I drink a lot of water. Overall, the food was okay but not worth the price and not what I would expect from an establishment with Gordon Ramsay's name.   The appetizer sliders were delicious. My entre salad was just lettuce and pears so it was lacking another component- pecans, blue cheese, something! It was disappointing. I would not recommend that item. My husband got the shepherds pie, which again tasted fine just not worth the price and it was smaller than I expected. We shared the toffee dessert which again was good but still average for a dessert.   We just didn't think it was worth it. We wouldn't go here again. It wasn't bad, except the salad, but we would rather go somewhere else next time.

Y7v90TllcK4zKx29qSfk9g.text: OMG the napkins... They are so awesome. They look like they were cut from a burlap sack, but they feel like silky heaven. Quite possibly the perfect napkin.  Unfortunately, that was the best part.  I went to grab a burger and a beer, something I thought that the "Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill" was perfect for, right? I imagined the chef screaming and belittling his staff until the perfect burger was created. So did the guy next to me.  Both my burger and my new bar neighbor's patties were grossly overcooked. We both asked for mid-rare and received a grey patty that made my heart sink when I saw it.  Here's the rub, and I don't mean delicious BBQ seasoning... it took 30 minutes to arrive and it was $20.  Ok, ok, so it's The Vegas Strip, that can explain the exorbitant price, but 30 minutes for an overcooked, boring, bland and disappointing burger doesn't fly in my world no matter the location.   Save yourself the $20, seriously, Wendy's burgers are better than these.

dtKejSlXFC5T8pjiONoDzg.text: This is an older review from 2016   I took my son when he came to visit me in Vegas to the Pub and Grill. It was ok. Shepard Pie was fine. Appetizers were ok My sons fish and chips were the worst I have ever seen and tried The breeding slipped off the fish and seemed "mushy''.  I will say that when friends and clients would ask where to go I never said Pub and Grill. Plus when it was a request between tow or three restaurants of the same level, Ramsey's Pub was not recommended.

iNJx8V-5Bujx4sFz8z8ppg.text: Great place. Fantastic service and great food. Affordable way to experience food from a world class chef.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Scotch Egg

-SmUBppDnXg1ioNRgMYl8g.text: I went in and the person next to me had this amazing looking burger so I ordered one to go.  Got up to my room and my "take out burger" looked like a McDonald's hamburger, only on a special bun.  When I called to ask if they had two different burgers, dine in and take out, they passed me off to the hostess - who never picked up.  $23.00 not well-spent

RgelBb5bDbd3SOicuDLo3g.text: Simple thing to improve is to clean this place up. If you want people to enjoy a meal it starts with comfort. The chairs are old and worn out. Place is so loud you can't understand your waiter.  Food is good for bar food, but come on Gordon .... get creative

GUiaQebQD4lQgLB_bzLSpA.text: Our group was attending a party when we all realized we were hungry.  Made a last minute reservation for 9 at this "Pub" looking for a more casual atmosphere.  We arrived a bit early and they weren't able to seat us, but they did seat us about 5 minutes after our reservation time.  Its loud in the restaurant, so no need to worry about shouting.  Right after we were seated, 3 additional people joined us.  The restaurant had no problem accommodating the add-ons.  Drink? I tried the Goodbye Blue Sky.  It was way too sweet for me.  Only drank half of it.  Food? Kettle Chip Nachos-so good and so bad for ya.   Calamari-standard Deviled Eggs-good and suprisingly has lump crab; taste is very subtle Hell's Kitchen Burger-Very Good.  This is Spicy!  Ghost Pepper Cheese, Pickled w/Jalapenos, Avocado & Smoked Tomato Aioli.  Was only able to eat half.  Also added the Truffle Fries which were standard.  Our server was great and kept up with our group.  We were having such a great time, we were the last to leave.    Fortunately, you can just shift to the next spot.

SnNJKar7as3UGFCeBaELoQ.text: Sooo good. Don't even question it just get the lamb burger and the lobster Mac and cheese. Food was excellent. Service was excellent and fast! I paid 25$ for lobster roll at Lobster Me but that was a waste compared to the 20$ here for the lobster Mac and cheese. The food is not pricey here. (As per Vegas strip standards lol)

G7qrS0Su685wWi7rP80X6Q.text: Beef Wellington was melt in your mouth perfectly cooked. Demi-glace had great depth. Could have used more! Definitely come back!!

Km0ssa9n6bKvUNiktjBBQA.text: Nog was the best bartender ever love the food and the sticky toffee is amazing!! Must try!!!

60XK0EO9ZKDaL8xvbdoOAg.text: We stopped in for a mid afternoon snack ... the poutine, drinks and service were great! My husband loved the old fashion and the say good bye to blue skies was great.

UJxax_sjy6PLSYhm8tPxIw.text: Mediocre attempt for a Gordon restaurant   Scallops not seared both sides   Sauce too lemony   Deviled eggs. Cranny or fishy tasting for something with lump crab   Bone marrow.  Decent.    Too crispy of bread   Wedge. Really good   Also had different pricing on receipt then menu.  Don't like being put in position of correction

VspNKF-VaWhutwHvcsgbeQ.text: We had a great lunch here before leaving town.   Started with the wings, which were definitely tasty, but nothing out of this world.   For entrees, I had the braised short rib, it was perfectly prepared, and came with some of the best mashed potatoes I had ever tasted. My boyfriend is often less than impressed with restaurant food, and he finished every bite of his steak and ale pie. The taste of it I had was amazing.  I wish I could remember our servers name, because she was excellent.  For a beer, soda, app, and 2 entrees, we spent $100 before tip. Taking into account portion sizes, it wouldn't seem worth it, but the quality was amazing, and we left with very full stomachs.

S4e-8USbDGmATGmE722LaQ.text: I was so excited to try this place with my husband for our anniversary..But, unfortunately we did't have a good time..We ordered shepherd's pie and a regular burger (forgot the name)..they both just tasted ok..I guess our expectation is too high since it carries Ramsay's name.. The waitress we had that night, didn't even refill my water and was asking if we're doing ok while she was walking by..She was more attentive to the rich-looking couple next to us..Boooo... pricey, so-so food and bad service, we definitely won't come back..

ss_VG6ivxtUkFKwFxTSQLA.text: One of the few reasons received four stars instead of five, is because I have it at Gordon Ramsay's steakhouse at Paris.  There are a few items on the menu that are same, such as the fabulous sticky toffee pudding and burnt sugar ice cream.  I find it out on the expensive side for a pub, but restaurants are Caesars are on the pricey side.

aMyekqGH1YuYTKVw19g94Q.text: My boyfriend and I are big fans of this past season of MasterChef Junior so we knew we had to make plans to eat at one of Gordon Ramsay's restaurants in Vegas. We chose the Pub because they had Shepard's Pie and also because it wasn't too fancy.   The restaurant is located inside the Caesar's Palace casino right next to the Forum Shops and the Colosseum. I loved the decor as it really transported you to Great Britain. Our server was great and was quick and friendly. I ordered the Steak and Ale pie and my boyfriend had the Shepard's Pie- we shared a side of Green Beans. Everything was great! The flavors in my dish grew as I continued eating and though the portion doesn't look like much, I was stuffed!! We were so full but our server highly recommended the Sticky Toffee Bread Pudding, which was their specialty and since we were on vacation, we couldn't turn it down. It was delicious! It sounds super sweet, but it actually wasn't. I would definitely recommend it.  We really enjoyed our time here and would love to try some of his other restaurants next time around!

hGS2oyF4Up5XgvzCvBX2Pw.text: This place sucks. Ordered a chicken Caesar salad and the romaine comes from bagged salads. First they forgot the chicken, and instead of making us a new salad, they brought me bits and pieces of chicken in a separate container. After pouring the chicken on top myself, I tried the salad and realized there's no dressing. It just had sprinkled cheese on it. Our waiter suggested that it did have dressing on it but he will get me more. By now I just wanted to shove his face in it to try it, then ask for the bill.

WJWP5SQ73IdPogpUtldGKg.text: I have eaten here twice which is a bit considering I'm never in Vegas.  I brought a group here and got the royal treatment. We were greeted and seated promptly. We were greeted by our server Adam whom was prompt, Courteous, friendly, attentive and made the meal that much more enjoyable. He honored the happy hour for us even though it had been "discontinued" but we had seen it on the menu display outside the restaurant. We were all wanting a quick bite and being I had ordered off of the happy hour menu before and loved it, that is why we decided to go to the Pub.             We ordered truffle fries, pretzels, sliders, pub nachos, and quite a few rounds of beers. The food was awesome and what you would expect from Gordon Ramsey. Your really couldn't beat the price either. I will be going back there many many more times and want to try all of Chef Ramsey's restaurants.

0kUwCEbqhKTy9VsaQVpktA.text: Delicjous food and great service! Our server, Jon, was so great! He refilled our water more than once! Fish and chips were cooked to perfection and the poutine was great! And of course the toffee pudding was delicious af!

SMhPkl_B2lZLc4E4TbLiyQ.text: Came here and had the happy hour burger and toffee pudding. Both were great!!  I would not recommend the happy hour pretzels, as they are not cooked fresh but instead just reheated throughout the day

Ex7CAobSGJ2EDq7KM-Sz0g.text: Fun casual place. Nice bartenders. Great food. If you like sports this is the place to go. But for the rest of us the food and drinks are totally worth it. Get the truffle fries, you won't be disappointed.

_b3m5mnvENPmkzGP3iaVsg.text: My experience here was substandard. While the service was decent the prices on food and drinks were high. This would be excusable if the quality of the food was worthwhile but I had one of the worst fish and chips I've experienced. With it being a featured item, located in Caesars Palace, had 'Pub' in the name and associated with a famous chef I had some hope.   The fries weren't crisp, the fish was small in portion and both the fish and batter tasted off. I had planned to get dessert and a second beer (the suggested pairing for the meal, which was the one solid portion of the meal) but the entree turned me away. The peas compliment to the meal was interesting and I had hoped for something to interest the palate, but it too fell short. It gave hints of something that had once been good but with neglect had turned bland and just yet another in a chain of neglect.   I will avoid this restaurant in the future and be wary of Gordon Ramsey branded restaurants in the future. There are better places within walking distance, avoid.

vJoZ1klroy6sFSJdC4yRTA.text: I dined here in January out of sheer curiosity, given Ramsey's celebrity status. I didn't expect much, but boy, I was I surprised. The lamb Shepherd's pie was excellent, the beer list was great, ambiance was classy, and service was stellar. I couldn't wait to return.   On my recent jaunt, my friend and I are there twice in two days, and again, it couldn't have been better. First, the cocktails were huge and strong and perfectly balanced. The lobster roll appetizer was insane! Best we've had outside of the East Coast. The bread was soft and buttery, and full of tender, sweet hunks of Maine lobster. No skimping.   We also shared a corned beef sandwich that was hands down the best I've ever had thanks to the mouth-watering, well-marbled meat that was not salty at all and the exquisite preparation, with delicious rye bread grilled expertly; luscious, melted cheese; and lip-smacking sauerkraut.   Same for the steak pie, chock full of the most tender cubes of beef in an addictive gravy. The lobster mac and cheese also was a winner, with claw meat on top and strewn with bits of buttery chunks. Asparagus was simply delicious, grilled perfectly and served with a delicate Bernaise sauce on the side.   Service on all trips was top-rate; these people are trained well (no surprise there if you've ever seen one of Ramsey's TV shows). I asked the bartender jokingly if he ever met the man himself, and to my surprise, he said yes, a few times. Apparently Ramsey is quite attentive to his properties and gracious to his employees in real life. Everyone seems to enjoy their job. We also appreciate the fact that we saw plenty of people of color in the front of the house.   The prices might seem steep at first blush, particularly if you're not used to coastal cities, but you do get your money's worth in terms of quality and portion size. I wish Ramsey would open one in San Francisco - I'd be a regular!

Gb5c8ywxhiTjJ8L8AT2pdA.text: Well,  we were in and out in less than 30 minutes. We did have reservations and ordered the classics: dish-n-chips and Shepard's pie. So that was probably under the warming lamps. The mushy peas were cold. Not the way to eat mushy peas.

3r6o7pHJdgw3PSF5f4qVHQ.text: Ate at the bar, great service. Very disappointed with pork belly appetizer. Caesar salad bland and warm with uncut anchovies. Ribeye steak delicious and cooked to perfection however it came way before I finished my salad. I'd give it a 7, I love Ramsay, watch his shows always. Tried to get into HK, no way Jose.

svrfJ9lVXMFZsK6Dd8vLZg.text: This is no limit with this guys culinary skills, from the decor to the crunchy lobster rolls everything looks and tastes amazing. Let us not forget the star of this place the piping hot Shepard's Pie, the piped mash on top had a balance of creamy with texture to them. Once I dug in the lamb came through and it was a delicate balance of veggies and fresh lamb. Please do yourself a favor and if no one else wants to go. Try it alone!!

ifrZwsecVgySGVctzK3Ojw.text: Just went to try this place after attending the Van Morrison concert. The place was busy, but definitely not even 3/4 full. The hostess asked for our name and asked us to wait to be seated, ok no problem.  A few minutes later a waitress called our name and showed us to our table. The table was a high top with stools with no backs. I explained I couldn't sit at such a table due to back issues and asked to be seated at one of the open regular tables...there were plenty. She asked if we had a reservation, which we didn't and she said the lower tables are only for customers with reservations. Again, I explained I have lower back trouble and cannot sit at a high top with a tall stool, where my legs dangle and there isn't a back on the stool. She simply looked at us and said sorry, the lower tables are for those with reservations. With that, we turned and walked away....why are you chasing hungry, paying guests away for something like that??? We ended up at Old Homestead Steakhouse right around the corner and had an awesome 5 star meal and experience, so I guess, all in all, thanks for the subpar customer service because Old Homestead knocked it out of the park!

ZrIFbTlRX558W2tWCwmFyw.text: great food and service!! My friends and I also were able to go to Hells Kitchen - great service and food as well. Love the consistency, please go to one of these!

7H7PGS2SZRmOrfv1lTzvag.text: Any fast foods will be better than here. All the foods and service were the worst. Since we(2) were not much hungry, we ordered a beef wellington and a french onion soup for share. Once the server got our order, her face got changed bad, even though the total price was $70. The soup was soso, but the wellington was disgusting. We were trying to eat the food, but while I was chewing, a sharp wooden thing was stuck to my gum. We talked about our situation to a manager, he never said sorry to us, he just kept saying what is that? or it looks something wooden. We felt so bad about their service, and I want to say "Go if you wanna ruin your day."

1Uz8eznDp57xQdfc6lqpsg.text: Had an amazing time at the restaurant!! Got the Steak and Ale pie and my friend got the smoked bacon burger with truffle fries which we really enjoyed. We were attended to by Heather and she was the absolute greatest and so sweet! Will definitely be coming back!

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States

CMsxxHUOBrs0FA0SXVhKvQ.text: Everything was amazing! I had the prime rib dinner and it was the best Prime rib that I have ever had

N1qriY44w6loL6MPARXNAg.text: Everything was good! We shared a little around the table. The HellFire wings have a wonderful spicy sauce, the heat is just right! The fish and chips were delicious! You cannot go wrong with the Mac and Cheese or the nachos! They do not skimp on the meat or toppings! Great meal and great service!

yU90dJPdVE91ZHaiaB9-hw.text: Sunday afternoon no reservation for 4.  Great TVs, Location, Pub Food. Service was incredibly bad. I think our waiter was going outside to smoke 3x during our meal. Food n drinks came out fast, when we could order it.   Shrimp n Crab roll was very good. I had bangers n mash. Girls had kettle chip nachos.  Cold beer, margaritas and some berry drink.

_GWbuSfa1It0_9Rxvuolow.text: Love the ambiance at this restaurant with the English feel. The restaurant is big so we had no trouble getting seated. The service was good not great but the food was delicious! I got a burger and the other person I was with got the steak and ale pie which he said was super tasty. The sticky toffee pudding dessert we got was a perfect way to finish off the meal, I'd recommend it to anyone who enjoys sweets.

Csn83ghBvGPdlS7NDgnncQ.text: I was to Gordon Ramsay when it first opened for a Yelp event and decided to make a return visit for dinner before the Placido Domingo concert at the Colosseum.  I was seated promptly at a high top table in the bar area close to the railing opened to the casino floor.  I got an iced tea, and I ordered bangers and mash for the main course and chocolate trifle for dessert.  The bangers and mash were OK.  Three small sausages of chicken, beef, and pork served with a modicum of mashed potatoes and with some onion gravy and fried onion sticks.  It was a small portion for a mere $24.  The chocolate trifle was very good--it made the evening.  It was made with both light and dark chocolate and topped with Chantilly cream.  There were two small cookies with the trifle.  It wasn't overly sweet.  Service was OK.  My server was a very pleasant woman.  While she brought my iced tea quickly, she was never back to ask about refills.  A busser was going around refilling water glasses so that was a help.  This is a convenient place to go for dinner when going to the Colosseum but it is Strip pricing plus.  I think another time I'll go to the food court.  There are several options and they'd be much less pricey than this.
