_C1dyhSL8JCB2xsEVpcEvA.text: Not impressed at all with the food or the price or the portion size.  The service, however, was good.  I ordered fish and chips.  Just spent 3 weeks plus in the UK and had fish chips often some excellent and some ok. I thought that ordering it in a restaurant with a big time British name might be special.  Totally wrong.  The portion size was small which was ok because the dish was totally meh.  And it cost $30; way to expensive for nothing special.  My wife got a chicken salad which she liked but also a small portion.  Very disappointed in the meal

P95cqeRJO2zMzfoMRnDKcQ.text: Stopped in for lunch and so glad we did! My husband had steak and ale pie and I ordered pigs in a blanket.  The food was amazing and the beer was  great! There are a lot of choices in Vegas but GR Pub and Grill will not disappoint!

_8ShNNw8YtcT_aTTRf9Kiw.text: First and foremost, this place was at the far back of Caesars Palace. Maybe I didn't expect to do this much walking in Las Vegas but holy moly. We had a reservation and were seated almost immediately. Atmosphere was nice. Very loud though. So loud, in fact, that we had a difficult time hearing the waiter. Plenty of televisions and a decent atmosphere nonetheless. We were a large group and food was delivered in a timely manner. Drinks were kept filled and we were checked on accordingly. The food, while pricey, was good. Burgers all around and a seafood plate. All delicious. All-in-all not a bad place but I think due to price and location being so far inside the building that unless promoted by friends, I don't think we'll visit again. A great experience though and definitely a part of "The Vegas Trip".

8njV_V1U15w_Scqe7u7jBA.text: The food is delicious and our service was great. Rodney was amazing! Save room for dessert, Had to do the the sticky toffee pudding.

paTseca7plk6vEGXrbcRnw.text: We ate here last night . Made our reservation on open table . The food was delicious and plentiful . We chose here because we were traveling with teens and the price point and food choices were better here then Hell's Kitchen . It's noisy ... we didn't care it's a pub and there was excellent people watching from our table . Our server who's name I didn't hear was so kind ! I changed my mind after ordering ( to the horror of my family ) and he was able to accomplish my request without  hesitation and with a smile !! He also made virgin  salted caramel shakes for the teens . I had the wings, truffle fries (yum)and Brussels sprouts . One had the lobster sliders ( delicious) , one had my strip and one had the chicken dinner .  We loved it

QWCsA-UnvN8HVsKrWyBUMA.text: Note: My husband and I sat at the bar Location: Inside Caesar's Palace   We checked in at the counter and just wanted to grab some drinks and their famous sticky toffee pudding (free with Yelp check in) so bar seating would be fine.   We has exceptional service from our bartender Ronnie as soon as we sat down. He was super friendly and energetic and we just had a very good vibe from him. He gave us our beers and kept us entertained. We also had fun chatting with the gentleman next to us.   Our beers were cold and our sticky toffee pudding was amazing. Thanks guys!

HElnlPQKiK8gEuuzMB2ZmA.text: Dear Chef Ramsay, are we not worthy?    Gordon Ramsay's pub features tasty Americanized pub grub.  It's too bad because the British classics are so much better.  The food.  Fish and chips.   Perfectly cooked, moist cod encased in a crisp crust.  Win!  The chips?  Excessively large, like fried baked potatoes.  They are fluffy and delicate in the middle.  Feminine chips!  A good, vegetal but sweet mushy peas complete the dish.  The Sheppard pie, Americanized.  The addition of beef to the traditional lamb mellows flavor.  The dish is no longer rustic and earthy.  The fat and grease (hey, its flavor) in the stew is gone.  It's been  replaced with a buttery potato crust.  Either way, it goes to your butt.  Tasty yes, but it leaves you yearning.  The pork belly roll is total pork heaven although much less fatty than the British counterpart.  Served simply in its own jus with roasted carrots and pea pure.  Done.  Finally, the beef short rib and cheek sandwich; TRY THIS!  Juicy, tender short rib is combined with the sweet goodness of braised beef cheeks.  Served on sourdough, accented by the very earthy flavors from the horseradish aioli, roasted pepper jam and onion marmalade. Win!  Passable selection of British beers that share space with butt wiper and the like.  High Vegas resort prices.  The dining space is contemporary with a Disneyland feel.  It's a pub by decor not by the vibe of the guest you expect from a crowded, boisterous, friendly pub.    If you're wearing a t-shirt that says "I love Las Vegas" go right on in.  This is your kind of place.

kQQ0GG49X55q8kqs9W0IQQ.text: I would give this place zero stars, but that's not an option. The hostess was rude and short. After waiting about 10 minutes, on a non-busy Monday, we finally got water! We ordered cocktails and 20+ minutes later they arrived. Mine tasted like cough syrup. The appetizers arrived quickly, the meal did not. So far we are 35 minutes into this ordeal without our entrees. The food arrived and was "okay". Definitely not amazing and required salt. Do yourself a favor-- STAY AWAY from this place!  Update: I complained and the waitress said "Good news, I was able to comp 5 of your drinks". So, there were 7 of us drinking, so 5 wasn't even a round. Additionally, I was seeking compensation. I wanted to speak to the manager about how awful the whole experience was. The manager didn't even bother to come over!!!!! At this point, I thanked the waitress and asked to speak to the manager. He came over and acted dumbfounded that I didn't care about getting stuff for free, I truly believe a manager should come apologize and get feedback to improve the experience.   This whole place was a disaster.

u3ZsqSEkxCmMmWcIQSz_VQ.text: I went because my boyfriend loves his show and he wanted to go. The service was good but, the menu was expensive. I paid 13 bucks for a pineapple and vodka. I ordered the truffle fries, ultimate burger and lobster mac n cheese.  I didnt like that they didnt have American cheese for my burger but, it was good. The truffle mayo for dipping the fries was good. My only complaint with the food was the lobster mac n cheese. It wasnt what I expected. It was watery and reminded me of stouffers microwave mac n cheese. The manager asked how I liked it and I told him what I thought. I also asked how did they prepare it. He said "well like any other mac n cheese we prepared it over the stove." I thought it would of been baked, which would of molded the cheeses together and gave the top a golden brown. We walked away with a 95 dollar bill. It was good I got to taste it but I wouldn't go back. Another good thing was that he took the mac n cheese off the bill seeing that I only took like two bites. I think that with a full 5 star restaurant you can justify the prices but for a pub, it was way to expensive. I just have to add that I am pissed because I saw a pic of someone's mac n cheese and mine looked nothing like it. They had huge chunks of lobster and what looked like crumbled truffles of cheese on top.

GMDMYtmKGNpu37weZALJqA.text: I loved the Wedge salad.  A different take on the traditional way of bleu cheese, iceberg lettuce and bacon.    This one has a sherry vinaigrette with a little bit of onion strings.   This combo of onion strings, bleu cheese, bacon and the vinaigrette is divine!  We were disappointed in the warm pretzels with cheese sauce, however.    We thought the last time we had it, it had a beer flavor to it.   This time it seemed mild and bland.  Good service, good atmosphere and good food!

znI7aHs-qA2-jcPFsXt9lQ.text: OMG! Where to start!! I am a big fan of Gordon Ramsey and I was so excited to finally come here!We sat at patio for fast service! We had the best service from a big boobie server! Very sexy caliente!  We had the bomb ass nachos that were made with my favorite meat brisket and short ribs! Finger licking good!! We also had chicken wings with blue cheese! Better then BWW!!! Winner winner chicken dinner! This was all happy hour specials!! Last but not least we had The Goodbye Blue sky which had my big sister hasta las chanclas meaning tipsy lol. I in the other hand stayed with my blue moon! Had a great time the service was amazing cant wait to come back soon! Thanks to the server for making my cousins 21st birthday special by singing and giving us a sticky toffee pudding which was to die for!

SaAprlr0Dz2QntOXmynV4g.text: Really good, strong cocktails. We had a great, attentive waitress.  appetizer: The beet salad was good, nothing out of the ordinary for a beet salad, but pretty fresh.  main: PASS on the fish and chips! cod tastes like it's a million years old, and the mushy peas side is so strange, it reminded me of hospital food for those that have trouble swallowing. no idea why it was $28--- decimal sign was probably misplaced, worth 2.80 Side: roasted baby carrots with brussel sprouts was suprisingly tasty for vegetables. well done.  Dessert: sticky toffee pudding with sweet cream ice cream... should've had this for my mine course. yummm

Torr9dkVmJoxofAWcn4Guw.text: I went here this past Friday, and was so disappointed with this place. I had been looking forward to coming here as soon as we decided to go to Las Vegas, and had high expectations that just were not met.   I'll start off with my one and only positive comment about this place the service was pretty good. They waiters were friendly and fairly attentive.   Now to my laundry list of why this place was a major disappointment:  1. The food was mediocre at best, and inedible at worst. I came in and thought "hey I'm at Gordon Ramsey's Pub, I'll have the Fish 'n Chips. I bet they'll be fantastic!". Wrong! It's more like Fish 'n Wedges..flavorless, unseasoned, & cold wedges. The fish was ok, but not  even note worthy. I've had better Fish 'n Chip's at the local Chippy at Brixham harbor..  2. The prices were disproportional to the quality of the food..if you want me to be happy about paying $30 for Fish n Chips, and $5 for a diet Coke it had better be fricken amazing. It wasn't.   3. The decor in that place is tacky, just awful. And the uniforms of the waiters boarders on bizarre. Whoever styled that restaurant has all they style and class of one of the local Las Vegas hookers.

TCVDwSoLagNQtrSK_BAy3A.text: I came in with high expectations. I wasn't completely let down, but this place certainly didn't live up to the hype. Certain things about this restaurant are amazing.  The waitstaff is on-point. They're quick with drinks, friendly, super-high-energy, well-dressed, well-versed on the menu, quick to offer suggestions, and they just go above and beyond to cater to your needs.  The atmosphere is great. It's a perfect setting as a pub. It didn't seem as loud as other reviewers were complaining about.  Where this place is lacking (and I'm so surprised I'm saying this) was the food. I had the fish and chips. While I appreciated the nod toward Gordon Ramsay's heritage, there's really nothing authentic about the dish aside from the minted mushy peas. They tasted just like my grandma's peas (Which led to an awkward conversation with my dining companion when I accidentally let it slip that they tasted like "her peas").  The fish and chips weren't really like anything I've had in England. The batter was soggy inside/under-cooked, and the chips were potato wedges, also undercooked... And completely bland. They hadn't seen a bit of salt.  Other things we tried were excellent, though. The pretzels were great. And the sticky toffee pudding may have been the best thing I've ever put in my mouth in my entire life.  Maybe we just got a bad batch for our entrees, but I kind of hold this restaurant to a higher standard than most. Unfair? Maybe. But it could have been better.

OaUNnDM9JkLfPgFcSGa7LQ.text: Like all other Gordon Ramsay restaurants this place is sure to impress. Every detail is carefully engineered down to the outfits that the bus boys wear. The food is amazing and all of the staff is well educated about it and the amazing wine/beer list. The vibe is upscale/energetic and fun with a british twist. Loved it!

_BNiJ2YUwnojTuH3LSvquw.text: Modern but relaxing pub that features elevated British pub food in a comfortable and lively setting showing sporting events from across the world.The centerpiece of the restaurant is a striking bar with an array of beer taps and a backdrop reminiscent of iconic British telephone booths.  Went with a large group and we enjoyed every single dish we tried: deviled eggs, English ale onion soup, shepherd's pie, a selection of sausages, fish and chips, pub burger, butternut squash soup, pork and duck rillettes, beef check sandwich and their roasted jidori chicken. All dishes were delicious and perfectly cooked - truly can't decide what we loved the best (although I have to admit, these were some of the best fish and chips and shepherds pie I've had to to date).  It was also relatively affordable (although make sure you have the Caesar's rewards card to get the better pricing on the menu). Our waitress was attentive and courteous.  We will surely be going back.

tMa24bL2XhZLSze3xFya8w.text: Since I love his shows and became a fan, you got to try the food to see what all the hype is about! I already had his burgers, so next was some pub food.   The prices are high.. first thing you notice. I got a Shepherd's pie just because it was the least expensive on the menu. ($23)  I had spent a lot of money throughout the night, I didn't want to over spend here too. The servers outfits were soo cool. I loved the chains and pants. They had a rock star look to them.   My server was attentive. I was just finishing up my water, when she stood by waiting until I put it down on the table and right away filled it up! lol. She was not leaving my glass empty. My food was fast and hot. It looks small but once you start digging in, you notice it's more than it looks. It was really good. The meat was juicy and the potatoes had just the right amount of flavor. I was pleased with my dinner.   So for my Pie and tip came to $29 bucks.

YfCUmuE-FYzJEg2YdwxzyQ.text: I was so excited to try a Gordon Ramsay restaurant. And this was tragic.  Food was horrible. Cold. Reminded me of airplane food. T  Beers were $11! And this whole disaster cost me $110 for 2. Tasteless corn beef. Microwave-like steak and ale pie.  The service was good and our waiter was a good guy, but everything else was sooooo bad.  Avoid, avoid.  Applebee's would be MUCH BETTER.  Good luck.

Ur22PMxcMj3NUt6iylM2Fg.text: Meh. The food was good enough but the service and drinks were lousy. We asked twice for our bill and still had to wait more than 2min for it to arrive. The best was busy, but not enough to justify the service, especially not for how much it costs.

BsYGOJ-SzXWX4C5VrwAnNg.text: We're were so excited to try this place as we love Gordon Ramsay.   Unfortunately we left quite disappointed.  Our wait staff was not friendly and made it seem like they had better things to do than to wait on us.     We started with a scotch egg which had great flavor but the egg yolk was hard rather than runny.  My wife ordered the Caesar salad with chicken and the chicken was super dry... If it was Hell's Kitchen I think GR would have thrown the whole plate at a garbage bin across the room.   I ordered the fish and chips... And was awarded with two very small pieces of fish and very soggy fries.   The tartar sauce was really good though.  The best part of the meal was the sticky toffee pudding....   We don't mind paying more $$$ for great food, but I felt like we wasted a lot of money here on mediocre food and poor service.  I hope they were just having an off night.

jgwblyn8ZJbHR0B-VQ6ALA.text: Went as party of three, seated for about 10 mins with no water nor menu, we decided to call the waiter and see what the deal was since the place wasn't that pack. Waiter came up to us with nerves and indescribable expressing in his face, right away he handed us the touch pad menu(drink) and the rest of the menu and said that he was really sorry for the wait around here. It's alright we said, and let him started the explanation for the menu.  We soon decided to order the Shepard pie, braised beef(forgot the full name) and lamb burger(medium with goat cheese). Check around the drink menu I then decided to have a glass of organic apple cider to go with my lamb burger, which turned out to be a perfect pair. Friend ordered the pear cider and was pretty good as well, for $9/glass there were no complains.   After ordering our foods and drinks, my friend noticed that the other tables received their complimentary breads which i thought we have to place an order on but should be giving first thing as seated along with waters, we then call the waiter once again, and he responded to us like he knew exactly what we were going to ask before we even said anything.... that was weird to me, if he knew what we've been waiting, how come we were still seeing tables after tables came in after us getting their breads before we even did. I believe that's when a table got totally left out and poor coordination with the front house. Not to mention there were this suited guy who seemed to be the manager that's warmly welcoming the other tables and have couple eye contacts with me but never crossed his mind that he might want to check on our table and see if there are anything he can help us with.   I've been as a waitress once, I understand the struggle working as one as a start-up and if that's what happened on that day on the guy who served us, I'm more than understandable, but seemed to me, there are really little support by the management around the front house anyway, that's a shame as my first GR's dining experience.  The part with foods were great, all of the orders were wonderful except my lamb burger tasted burned a bit, and it was too dark in the dining room that I wasn't able to identify the surface of the burger before my first bite. As I made my complain to the waiter, he told me this is grilled and can't avoid the burn on top of the surface. I told him I'm fully aware of that but this is just too burned for me to bare. He accepted the plate and turn it back to the kitchen. I have not gotten the order until everyone else finished with their orders, but it was worth the wait, second time's a charmed... I loved everything about that lamb burger and the goat cheese has given the burger even better flavor than it already were.  Shepard pie was satisfying, my boy friend was aiming for this order before we came and was pleased. Braised beef was cooked beautifully and flawless, any more words would be over analyzed.   Overall we've had a great time enjoying ourselves, if only the service can be a little bit more careful. Will return for a second try for sure.

Our waiter, Scott F., was so FABULOUS and very knowledgeable when we asked about the cocktails and he helped pair the perfect cocktail with our entrees.  You have to try this restaurant and ask for our favorite waiter, Scott F...you won't regret it!  :)

yW54Ax890UowOpoAqE02zw.text: Went for lunch mid week, no wait to be seated which is always good. Service was fast and friendly. I ordered a burger medium-well (as my wife wanted a taste and will not eat anything less than well). It was undercooked at medium at the most which was ok by me. Great food great service.

-2qwJcy2v66cotGmxsnnLg.text: We loved everything about it!  The wings and short rib nachos were our favorites. The drinks were on point as well. The only thing I didn't like was the seating. We got sat at a low table with large chairs and I'm only 5'4" so my feet wouldn't touch the floor. I would definitely recommend having drinks and apps here for sure!

Y3iQFzbDusy1-xYoBemryQ.text: Food was pretty good, but our waiter ignored us after he brought out our food. He forgot my husbands drink but we never got the chance to ask about it because he never came back to our table. We had to get another waiter to get him to bring our check. I watched him ask every other table multiple times how they were doing and he never even made eye contact with us. I've been a waitress, and I know he profiled us based on the way we were dressed and decided not to give a shit. Gordon Ramsey would have lost his shit at this abysmal service. Everyone but our waiter was awesome though! Not returning.

TUjQYfmWXz-A_Q2hctCObw.text: We had high expectations when arriving to eat but were quickly disappointed. It was absolutely horrible service. We arrived at 6:30 and did not get our food until around 7:45. Our server was non existent for about 30 min and never checked in on us throughout our meal. Although it was quickly taken care of, the shepherds pie came out cold even after taking over 40 min to receive. I would not recommend this restaurant.

RkCwSII6rg9IT_NsDwNyaw.text: We've been here twice. The first time we came, the service was not good. Not bad but definitely needs to be polished up.But the food was great. We had a trio of the pies to start off and they were delicious. She had the fish and chips which was good but small portion for what you pay for which was a disappointment. I had the Shepards pie and thought was delicious as well. They also had a few craft beer selections which is a bonus for me. For dessert we shared the sticky toffee pudding and it was great. The second outing I had a burger that was way better than the burgers at his other restaurant, BURGR. Overall, the food is delicious. The service at our second outing was actually awesome. So maybe it has gotten better and its there to stay that way. We look forward to going back the next trip to Vegas.

62ePYA_N1yPPigDnTwso-g.text: Customer service was on point. There appetizer were all amazing. We had deviled eggs, wings, the pigs and blanket. The sandwiches we ordered for dinner was awesome as well. Very tasty and filling

zryQ_tljhU0D1eWcNaVyIg.text: I went To this restaurant around May 2015 and it was a very very bad experience. It doesn't live up to my expectation of celebrity chef Gordon Ramsey's reputation. The waiter was rude. I had to wait for about 30 minutes just to get water and another 30 min to get menu. I ordered a steak dish and it took forever to get my food. When the food came, IT WAS OVERCOOKED, LITERALLY BURN! It was not food for people to eat. I won't ever go there again and I recommended anyone not to go there. I wish chef Gordon Ramsey can read this comment and see how bad his restaurant is. I am so upset. I Like the show, but the food suck.

5JXfIlkc2Vs5nRWjDDeYKw.text: Service was good, but....  My chicken pot pie dinner on 11/8/15 before the Celine concert resulted in a nasty bout of food poisoning. That cost me miserable night and a day of my vacation to recover. Portions were small (maybe a blessing in disguise) and overpriced. I would not go back.

fqq4iy7bKgeCQ9-Ki4j4Bw.text: I went there for lunch with a client a couple of days ago. The NY steak was chewy, I returned half of it. We ordered Ice tea twice. The first time the color was very light as if it was water and the second time it came almost black in color. When we complained they apologized saying that the waiter is new and they will tell the chef about the meat.  Pro: great at excuses and apologies. Con: Food sucks.

vEPUEhOvVeRhVrCcUM8vgg.text: Went on opening night dec 18, 2012. It was certainly an event! The food was excellent. I recommend the short rib and cheek sandwich. Get the draft sampler, it's a good deal for a casino restaurant giving you eight 5 oz pours of any drafts available for $15. Also got to see Guy Fieri and Iron Chef Morimoto enjoying the opening night. the service staff was very nice each greeting us with a handshake and welcoming us to opening night. We will be back next time we're visiting vegas.

aExEP0WypaDF9a2h9NUdDw.text: What the what? We had lunch here today and I am so confused by the experience. For a restaurant with this namesake, I expected a much better experience than what we got, especially if it's going to be $120 lunch. After being seating by the hostess we waited for about 10 minutes for our waiter to greet us. Even then, I'm not sure he would have if he hadn't  noticed my girlfriend grab a glass bottle of water from a nearby bucket to at least start to quench our thirst. Then, when he came over, he stole the bottle of water from us, despite the fact we said we were very thirsty and needed lots of water. He seemed surprised and unprepared that we were ready to order, but took our order. "We'll start with the mini lobster roll appetizer and then 2 orders of fish & chips please with an iced tea to drink." He then disappeared again and about one minute (now they're fast?) later our delicious (5 stars) mini lobster rolls showed up via a stranger, not our waiter and were consumed. Our fish & chips came soon after, also delivered by a different stranger, and while not as good as the appetizer the fish and tartar were good (4 stars) the chips were burnt on the outside and raw inside ( NO STARS ).  The waiter never checked on us and we felt inclined to ask the random people delivering food to us for help, which they did for some things. Even telling the waiter that we wanted to order dessert. "Sticky Toffee Pudding" (3 stars) and a double espresso (2 stars). Our bill for lunch was about $110 - we left only a $10 tip which I wish the random strangers would get not our absentee server. I had intended on trying Gordon's BurGr restaurant

1VLIC-tHNfQndSeP5UR5Jw.text: The food was incredible.  Had the deviled eggs and mocha martini.  Brilliant.  Server was nice but took entirely too long to get to our table.  Bonus for bondage drag the servers were wearing.

ZRGyiuyy-FqLV6T2jeF_0Q.text: Nothing on menu sounded tasty. Burgers came out tasting overcooked and like it had been sitting out. Gordon Ramsey would have been pissed at what was sent out.

2diY9mxXidD65KREJSv3VQ.text: Great place to eat and enjoy a few drinks. Nice atmosphere, excellent food and Gene the bartender mixing up some drinks Ive never heard of before. I truly recommend going here to everyone, we do every time we are in Vegas'

GnUlGepF9CwRTDAfdN0QrQ.text: Probably the best British pub food around (and I've been to the UK before) but service is horrific and it's stupidly expensive. Had sliders, French onion soup, chicken pot pie, and fish and chips. Service was slow, entrees came out right after apps, ordered a beer during dinner which came out with the check, etc.

_F789-nTSUlb5lESmqszlw.text: I'm not sure why this place only has three stars it was delicious !! I had the burger and my hubby had the fish and chips. Both where great! We started with the soft pretzel and it was warm and super yummy! I would definitely come back!!

-4dYG7V3rKynUcKeI33BCA.text: I made these reservations a month ago, so excited! Food was good,  ambiance loud,  (expected)our server Ali was awesome.. to many of the other patrons,  not sure why he was annoyed at my questions and not attentive at our table, I tipped 18% which I never do, always 20 or more,  not sure what his problem was with us I don't want to speculate because it's depressing.  Hope you get someone else's section.  Ramsay steak was better, I'll go back to that one and burgr, not here, that's for sure.

ZUY18sxVBn-3-rq_fqRFJw.text: Loved everything about this restaurant! Atmosphere was lovely, our waiter was very engaging. We walked in during happy hour. Happy hour appetizers and drinks were priced right! The nachos were hand made chips with shredded pork and brisket. Corned beef sandwich   was tender and tasty. The lamb burger had an amazing  feta and goat cheese spread. Would love to go back!

GDCB16tD2vQJp-24R-cJ4Q.text: I just had THE WORST MEAL I HAVE EVER HAD in Las Vegas. My wife and I have been here twice before and had good meals, though the last one was nothing to write home about. I brought my father in law here while our wives were dining elsewhere.  Except for the Calamari which were good, everything else was horrible. The chicken wings were meatless (a vegetarian could have eaten them for all the chicken they had). The prime rib was so tough that my father in law sent his back. I nibbled at enough of mine that I didn't send it back, but you could tell it was old, tough, dog food grade meat.  Gordon Ramsay should be ashamed of himself! His next Kitchen Nightmares should be filmed in his own bloody restaurant!  Not only will we not be back at this establishment, but we are far less likely to go to his other restaurants - just in case they've gone downhill in a similar manner to this one.

e_NqTHKmsb-PB3PP7aQ-bQ.text: A few friends and I decided to stop by and try the happy hour.  The food was ok but the prices are ridiculous for the portions.  The beer is still expensive even though it was happy hour.  The cups in which the beer was served were probably 12oz cups, the fries are nothing to write home about, the pretzel sticks only had 3 pretzels.  The wings were great, but, this isn't a place I would return too.

pwvfY-01EUrie0lGfa4I6A.text: The food was like and decent restaurant not what you would expect from a Gordon Ramsey quality restaurant.  Subpar for what we were expecting.

_-UULFC1ghDvTxcV2Wp_zA.text: Food was amazing, price was reasonable, and great, friendly service from Kerry & Scott. Would definitely visit again!

eitxrr3lOQSPVO0oeGjNtQ.text: Went there week of New Years.  We knew it would be very busy but decided to try it out anyway.  Started off by ordering the Ramsay Tonic.  Was very refreshing and had to get a second one.  I ordered the beef pot pie and my fiancee' ordered the chicken pot pie.  My mother and sister ordered scallops.  All of the food tasted very well and it did take awhile to get our food but it was a holiday.  The staff was very friendly and we had to make room for dessert.  Ordered the cherry custard and it tasted very good.  Food and drinks were spot on, service was just  slightly slow due to holiday week.

_Keh_nn_iZZxYgrqfQgK7Q.text: At bar with Ramon, he was F*ing Awesome!!! Great recommendations on dinner and desert. Could not have been happier. If u want great drinks, food and personality sit with Ramon.

sQg7G8nXNYeJluifsSjtFQ.text: Thank goodness British cuisine has gone well beyond the disappointing renditions here. It's a sports bar, with the worst decor and rooms imaginable. Furnishings are deep chairs and an ad hoc selection of tables and other chair types - none of which are for dining.  The men's room had a latrine 'out of order' ... as well as towels strewn all over the bathroom. It was a bit shocking.  The food is unremarkable at best. The 'most popular dishes' are Shepard's pie and fish and chips. Well golly, who would have thought? I had the pie....served truly scalding hot and more like a school lunch version. I also had a few chips...a bit limp and then lamp heated into a old fry. Dear God in Heaven - somebody either straighten this place out, or close it. Such valuable real estate across from Caesars Colosseum deserves so much better. I will never return, and suggest you don't either. I feel so bad for the many nice people who work there.

uv93rs3cBTVmnYKkhrAivg.text: Mediocrity at its finest.  Had grilled Brussels sprouts that sat in watered down maple syrup with diced bacon on top served Luke warm, Luke warm tomato soup in a nice sized bowl and half a piece of barely toasted white bread loaded with pesto and a bit of cheese, hamburger slider also luke warm with warm not hot potato fries.  After watching Gordon Ramsey on numerous tv shows i expected his food to pop, and of course sizzle.  The ambience and wait staff were good.

wVR4Q0cjaMbGhDw3ENE4Tw.text: Three words.....kettle chip nachos, these nachos are the best! Every layer of chip is covered in goodness (my mouth is watering at this very moment) conveniently located smack in the middle of caesars palace casino, it's hard not to walk in and grab a seat at the bar. When my boyfriend and I plan a trip to Vegas, we plan to stop here for those nachos and a fresh cocktail. Not only the nachos are good, but everything is delicious. I mean if Gordon Ramsay owns a restaurant, it better be good right!?

yLVlTqRCK_aUOrNDoGcDvA.text: As a Vegas local, this is my go-to place to bring my out of town guests.   For a celebrity chef restaurant, the prices are VERY fair. $20-30 an entree. Good luck finding that any where else on the strip (to all you people that are complaining about it being overpriced).   The atmosphere is very very cool! Old British pub style with a hint of the Royal Family and a dab of punk rock. Love that the restaurant has an open facade; Ceasars is such a beautiful casino, it's nice that they embraced that. Cool decor with old barrels, chairs decorated with corgis, painting of bulldogs, etc. brings a nice little bit of England to the strip.  I love the food here. I've ordered many things off the menu, and all were fantastic. My favorite is the Scottish Salmon; it is made to perfection. Their bread service is really interesting as well: comes with an array of different types of bread and sticks and delicious dipping sauces - new twist on an old tradition.   The only reason this isn't getting 5 stars is because of the rude hostesses at the front. Attn ladies: I understand you work at one of the busiest casinos on the strip, but don't act like you are doing me a favor by taking my reservation. We had to wait at the main entrance for 5 mins before one of them even asked if I had been helped. They were all too busy chatting to each other to attend to the long line of customers.  Also, the table service here can be a little slow as well. We weren't too bothered by that because the food was so awesome.   Book a reservation online before you get here, it does get quite packed.

VzrURgxKIU46mZth_mEuqA.text: I like this place. Surprised it only has 3 stars. All the food comes out well-executed and tasty, and the drink selection is good. The only reason I can think of why it doesn't have a better Yelp rating is because it is slightly pricey for what it is?  A group of 6 of us came in for 1 hour and spent about $170 on three apps and two rounds of drinks.  Delicious Mac & Cheese, French fries and Slider-thingys. Would come back on an expense account, or with out-of-town friends on a Strip pub crawl!

Y-fGGcpSoFtz7YlFSotDaQ.text: If I could give this place ten stars I would. Look, this restaurant changed my life. I had the top sirloin medium rare with asparagus, it came with a garlic buttery side and also a steak sauce. The food was on a whole nother level. I was upset that i had not been eating like that before. I would love to eat steak everyday now!! Moving on, the customer service was great. Every employee had a smile on their face, our server recommended a beer to go with our dish, it just so happened to be Gordon Ramsay's favorite beer, or so he said, but it was delicious nonetheless. I definitely recommend this place to anyone who wants their tastebuds blown away, over all its a really good experience. I love Gordon.

vL2x6B9tN-vG79qBJqFA6w.text: Came here for a late lunch with my boyfriend and from the host stand to the Management it was a stellar experience. I have dairy allergies and they made sure everything in the kitchen was changed out, my food was delicious. My boyfriend had the Bacon Cheeseburger and it looked fresh and he loved it.  Manny, the manager was fantastic and super personable! Definitely recommend GR Pub!

0BSMhpoPubQRs-MzFzTdaA.text: Walked in to grab a beer and appetizers.  Randy the assistant manager was very nice and courteous.  Jerome was our bartender.  Funny guy.  Bartenders made it feel like a neighborhood bar. Will definitely be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Great grasshopper and great service! Thanks to Jerome and Randy!

DnxaL_2vk-2yajeEgfqOhw.text: Fantastic restaurant, without a doubt. Diligent, timely, and professional wait staff compliment a comfortable atmosphere and incredible food. A MUST go to if hanging around the strip.

BxXYU8hYsGgy8CgqWpobxA.text: Well, I ordered a bacon burger....and they forgot the bacon. Our waitress made herself very scarce so had to wait awhile before actually getting the bacon for the burger. Food was good but not worth $23 for just a burger and fries. Happy hour menu looked meh, wasn't impressed with it at all. Service was bad. I wouldn't bother returning here, too many other good places in Vegas.

KM3LSqUGE-sVwj2BaZG4XQ.text: Thought we would try this place looking at previous reviews but were sorely disappointed. The hostess was so nice and welcoming, but sadly this feeling was short lived when our server took over. He was rather abrupt taking our orders, not once did he smile. Left us for long periods of time, didn't check our drinks once or top us up. He made us feel as though we were an inconvenience just being there, which I have never experienced while dining in Vegas, which I do frequently! I work in customer service and so I was even more annoyed at how we were treated. I will never go back here, food was average, warm not hot, and nothing special - not worth the price. Bangers and mash and a Diet Pepsi - total $40. Sorry to say your server 'Michael W' lost you future business from me and everyone I tell.

r_vUcAlNKYLoVepXIbiUQA.text: I usually make a trip out to Vegas every quarter and each time Gordon Ramsay is on my list everytime. The food at Pub and Grill is nothing short of excellent. Great appetizers, salads, sandwiches and burgers. The potato chip nachos with beef is just incredible. The vibe and aroma is always great and entertaining. Now let's get to the best part of all, the service. From management to waiters, they are always kind, friendly and superior. The core purpose Gordon is always on my list is due to the most amazing, kind, friendly, sincere, and  professional waiter named Yaneisy (aka Jenny). She is nothing short of excellent, and that's even an understatement. What an asset to the Gordon family! Yaneisy, you are amazing! Thank you for your warm hospitality each and everytime. Ask for Jenny next time you are here, it is worth every wait.

i-D2nBdjtylieg-LqVbpcw.text: Went last night for our daughters 23rd Bday, for her 21st we went to Steak at the Paris...she loves to go to his restaurants because they share the Birthday! Food was amazing; seasoning was perfect & very "tasty".  We all agreed we were just as satisfied in the Pub as we couldn't get into Steak. We will definitely be back! Had Lobster Roll, Ceasar salad, Calamari, Short Ribs, Shepards Pie & Steak...OMG Then they surprised her with a candle dessert...on them!

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Happy 23rd Birthday from Gordon Ramsey!

4342nxVYGA5-sJPOXLDqzg.text: We specifically went to get dessert at GR, because we wanted to try his signature Sticky Toffee.   The place is large and had no trouble getting a table on Wednesday night during dinner service.   We liked the look of the restaurant, the kegs mounted on the walls, the wood placemats and unique flatware. Even the crazy costumes the staff wear.   The waiter was obliviously disappointed when we only wanted to order dessert. In fact, he didnt even bring it out, another person did. The server never checked back with us, except to deliver and pick up the check.   The sticky toffee was delicious, it was better than we had at Hells Kitchen, but I still think I prefer it at a pub local to us.   Prices are kinda high, but with a Caesars Rewards card there is a discount.

CbJP-7A2tFcpZlH4hQXlow.text: I feel horrible about this review, but I know that when Mr. Ramsay has his name on the food, he expects it to be amazing. Gordon Ramsay's Pub and Grill was a huge disappointment.  We had chosen to save this place for our last dinner before leaving Las Vegas. We ordered the Maine Lobster and Shrimp Roll Minis, NY strip steak dinner, Ribeye steak dinner, mashed potatoes, and Goodbye Blue Sky (one with and one without alcohol) for drinks. The Maine Lobster and Shrimp Roll Minis were absolutely amazing. The Goodbye Blue Sky is the best drink I've ever had. The mashed potatoes were chunky (which is fine), but they lacked flavor. The asparagus stalks were so big they were very tough, and not edible.  I could not believe the steaks, the ribeye had great texture, but zero in the flavor department. The NY steak was not so great texture wise, and it lacked flavor.  I do need to say the server was totally awesome. He immediately brought the manager to our table upon learning of our disappointment.  We only intended to provide feedback for the manager to give the cook, but the manager promptly dismissed the cost of the steaks. He was very apologetic, and kind. He went as far as offering us complimentary dessert, but we didn't feel right accepting his offer.  The effort to make things right with us was above and beyond, but the food was a big disappointment.

GO1WQpTSBAiB2ilS1nme7w.text: TERRIBLE SERVICE, I had the fish and chips, chips were soggy and luke warm, the mashed peas disgusting, I complained to the management and offered no apology, our waitress must have been assigned 20 tables and I was never able to get any service staff attention.  Avoid this restaurant, very over-hyped, just like the infamous TV chef

BQmoEKhsGj3OqPrNzHgZZw.text: I had the Scottish Salmon. The taste was good but half was cooked nicely and the other half was raw.  The waiter tried to explain that was the way it was suppose to be cook. Very sad experience. I had a hard time keeping my "inner Gordon" in check. I really wanted to slam my fist into the fish and yell "IT'S F-----G RAW!!!!!!" I will try his steak house next time.

KTofaOEC86cll01PxvtFLA.text: Happened upon this while walking through the Ceasar's Palace mall!!  Wow!!!  Awesome staff, very friendly and helpful.  Amazing food, we had fish and chips, Shepard's Pie and a Burger and fries!  It was all really excellent!!  My daughter said her burger was the best burger she had ever had.  Ever!!  High praise from a real burger connoisseur!!!  Said the meat was perfectly cooked, tender,  juicy and flavorful, and that the bun was amazing!!! Great place, we really recommend it!!

yCkoHAF8WJxs0Vhsqv3rSw.text: Honestly the BEST fish and chips I've ever had, including many places on the coast! The waiter was so nice, which is pretty hit and miss in Vegas. My daughter had the lobster rolls,which were delicious also. Wish I would have had room for dessert! The picture is after I had eaten half of it, sorry about that, but just the best, light and flakey fish ever.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. So flakey and delicious!

O6BkiWUATZ67suxVZHOUzA.text: Way overpriced for what you get! Food is not that great and the menu is missing the famous Beef Wellington! The desserts are a real hit though but skip the meal and the drinks! Other Gordon Ramsay restaurants Are better!

nFQ6Vt2N0vRv5tEdIavytA.text: This place was just barely average food wise. Unimpressive 2.5 really. Service was fast and friendly, but if rather have a great meal. Sheppards pie was bland and bangers and mash was tiny. All that yelling on TV about standards was not evident. All in all big disappointment and a waste of money :-(

T8Px1EXpKz_FyPSoMGrccA.text: So yummy!! It deserves every star. You can taste the freshness of every ingredient. Great happy hour menu if you're on a budget. $5-$7. we managed to order every item on the happy hour appetizer menu and it was delicious!! Will be back next time we're in town

mMAcdeI7DRnzcVkkI0HK6g.text: This place was amazing! Everyone was so nice and inviting. I went to many different restaurants during my stay and this one by far was the best. From the hostess to our waiter nothing but excellent service. Keep up the good work

bjl0HshdHod4cRVoKiukSw.text: Ordered the fish and chips.  Two small pieces of fish and regular old french fires -- not even fresh cut, seemed like frozen ones.  All for a whopping $30.  Found out later, there is a Gordon Ramsay's Fish & Chips between the Flamingo and the LINQ at the restaurant area that leads up to the High Roller.  More fish at half the price.  I won't make that mistake again.  The one good thing I can about the pub is they had half-price wings during happy hour and my daughter loved them.  They were not fatty wings.

-_SWyZ4xfjZiv8rOnfRDOA.text: The manager Randall Goldich was extremely nice and professional greeted our table and made us very welcomed.. The food was amazing and I got to meet Scott Cummings the winner of hell's kitchen....We will differently come back...

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States

4As44UE1B-2U38f4dbxmbg.text: #GordonRamsayFail:  Christmas Day,  mid afternoon.  We ordered a medium well done lamb burger and a well done grilled beef burger.   The lamb was served very rare,  maybe barely cooked.  The burger was rare and quite pink.   WTF?  This is a Gordon Ramsay restaurant without anal retentive attention to detail.  Uneffing believable.    And the waiter had a bad attitude.  He obviously didn't want to be there (understandable), however, professionalism is required in every sales industry.  High level customer service delivery is key to stay in business.  That's 2x #GordonRamsayFail in 1 visit.   A completely destroyed first impression.   Positive points: the manager on duty took the poorly prepared food off our bill, offered to make our meal right and a free dessert.  We declined a second food prep and the dessert.   The lobster Mac & Cheese is delicious.   Will I go back?  No.  There is awesome mac and cheese everywhere these days.

hW3dzP712heay3doFiUZeg.text: Something different from the pretentious* upscale restaurants in Caesars Palace.  I was looking for a relaxed atmosphere to just unwind with a beer in casual attire and happened to walk by this place. There was so much I enjoyed about this place, but let me highlight the one thing that really irritated me about this establishment. The hostesses wear the most hideous dresses! So try not to mind the outfits, you may lose your appetite.  Instead of the beer, I ordered the "Goodbye Blue Sky" - so sweet and refreshing and crisp! I also got the soft pretzels, which were how you'd expect soft pretzels to be, and a burger. The service and the drink really gave this place four stars - he constantly checked up on us and helped us charge it to our room in Paris when someone at the concierge made a mistake on the name of the room.  The burger was really dry so minus .5 stars and the hostesses outfits were nauseating so minus another .5 stars. Other than those two things, I can't wait to go back!  *Beijing Noodle No. 9 - c'mon really? Upscale noodles? No no, just upscale price.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States

qQgAEyq55yTsn9cH-dG2vA.text: Loved it. Had the Shephards pie and toffee pudding for dessert.  Be sure to save plenty of room for dessert. I swear it was better than sex

boqp8__Ml2OV17yfMY86rg.text: I did not remember what I ate the last time I was at the pub and was not too excited about eating their again. But it turned out to be one of the most memorable dinner at Caesars Palace during this visit to Las Vegas. I had the braised beef cheeks that melted like butter and paired with Lucky Beer. The service was great and friendly. Can't wait to go back and eat at the restaurant again.

eJ4XXnBvxDaaMHugSDcX2w.text: We started at the bar and ordered the ginger beer drink with Juniper and it was amazing.  Then we ordered the Roasred Carrots and Cauliflower so good.  Then the calamari and the Hells Kitchen Burger which were good. Quick service.  Would deff come back. Our server Scott gave us exemplary service. 10/10

U4m2Jf-6xpreJZl_IHDC2g.text: What a great experience! There was a great variety of food and all 7 of us had amazing dishes. I had the butter chicken curry. So good! The service was great. Scott was amazing. He knew the menu well and was great with suggestions. He provided awesome service. Food came out quick. Thanks Scott!

cNblgcms90C4W7dIJFRJIQ.text: Awesome service by Rodney....check and see if you can't get in his section. He was an amazing waiter and super helpful with drink and food orders! The food was perfect for happy hour and we left happy!

J-v-TUl6tMNMHTIIe6NvXw.text: My first time here was a bit disappointing, but my visit last week was amazing and definitely worth five stars. The fried chicken sandwich is highly recommended!

OXSdVKdTqDyxtYZcKFFMew.text: We came to Vegas for spring break and had the best service at this restaurant!! They were so personable and when they found out we were on spring break they brought us a free dessert that was so delicious! Ask for Rodney - he's the best!

wiLtn9vMMb2CyqTgQW_Y1A.text: When I saw that my brothers chose a famous chef's restaurant for dinner inside Caesars Palace I was excited to try it out. It's actually a pub. After waiting 30-minutes for a table of 7, we were ushered to a table with bar stools! They were cushioned, but when I sat down I sunk into the stool and felt like a toddler in a high chair. The first thing I noticed on the menu were the prices! Holy cow! Very pricey! The 2nd thing I noticed was the menu was limited. I decided to just drink water and my hubby and I split a 14oz steak for $38. It came with asparagus.. That's it! No salad. No soup. I can get a way better meal for the same amount at Berns Steak house here in Tampa. But this is Vegas. We ended up ordering the cheesy cauliflower also. As for the taste, the steak was quite tasty and I did enjoy it. The asparagus was average and the cauliflower was tasty.  Would I come here again? Maybe if I was going to watch a sporting event for drinks and split an appetizer but there are too many other choices in Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Inside Caesars palace

JQh9iczch1puAzYuu4hVdg.text: We only went here because we had friends in town who wanted to. Let me sum it up fast -  Service was slow but very nice. Our server was super sweet....but painfully slow.  Prices were high - $23 for Shephard's pie. Now it was ok but a very small serving. I prefer Ri Ra to this one.   Decor was eh. We had dinner reservations for 7 people. We got seated at a high top with backless seats. Normally I prefer bar seating but when you have dinner reservations I prefer a table. Or at very least a seat with a back. To me it shouted "eat your food and get out".   Food is ok. Definitely not worth the price. We had a filet, Shephard's Pie, Steak and Ale pie, corned beef, truffle fries (Gordon Ramsay - didn't you say something about truffle oil being one of the most pungent, ridiculous ingredients ever known to chef?),  and wings. Everything was edible but would not draw me back.  For this one, yelp is spot on - 3 stars. Don't waste your time and money here unless it's the only place that can seat you.

CkBzKJ1YhLXgAMCMlB3jnA.text: We sat at the bar and were served by friendly bartenders.  We started with a couple of beers and the pretzel sticks that come with cheese dip and mustard.  Very good.  We then split the regular cheeseburger.  Nothing special about that at all.  Yes, it's Vegas inside Ceasars Palace, but $20 for a barely average burger and $11 for a beer is just too much.  I bumped up the rating to be more than 3 stars because the staff and service was really good, and we had fun talking to others at the bar next to us.  Will probably skip this place next time.  If we want to pay this kind of price, we will go across the way to Mesa Grill.

LVeUHCu_6Wv6DNrBRj2eEg.text: OK I'm going to keep this simple -  Food:  OK.  Scotch Egg (yes, just one lonely egg) was decent but served cold, Fish and Chips were average (but $29 for two pieces of fried cod and a handful of fries? REALLY?), braised short rib was quite tasty BUT the risotto it was resting upon was extremely undercooked.  Not al a dente but damn near raw.  Sticky Toffee Pudding was pretty darn good.  Service:  OMG how slow can we go????  Atmosphere:  It's a pub. Really, it's a pub.  Beer:  Selection isn't that great.  About $12 per pint.  Value:  You have got to be joking!  I know that this is a celebrity chef owned establishment on the Strip, but almost $150 before tip for the above mentioned meal (oh, and two beers and one cocktail)?  I mean come on, you can get basically the same thing at many other on-strip pubs for half the price. If the food was exceptional, the price may be justified.  Unfortunately it wasn't.  Bottom Line:  Good but flawed food (the food does prevent a 1-star rating).  Poor service.  Way overpriced - even by strip standards.

sJfOeB-YMeqx71fFWkNJwg.text: Thanks Heather. Awesome service, great food!!  Lamb burger cooked to perfection, Shepherd pie moist and flavorful!  Best selection of veneers on the strip!

6AAdh1UsGKHa-vHbOahXfw.text: I always keep an open mind when trying a new place. Especially having tried Gordon Ramsay Steak and loving it. With that said we were greeted by a cute chatty hostess to show us to our table. I liked the staffs outfits, dark wood decor and barrels stacked to create a wall between the bar and restaurant but I hated our table. The location was fine, but it was a high top with backless stools, I felt like a little kid and never felt comfortable. Request a booth, they look so comfy. We got food menus right away but had to wait for the drink menu, they brought us some water ( which wasn't the tastiest tap water) while we passed the one drink menu iPad around deciding what to drink. Doug was the only one getting a specialty cocktail, the Pub Crawl. It was light and tasty, I'd recommend it, he ended up getting a second one later.  I had my heart set on a Scotch Egg but I noticed it wasn't on the menu, once we finally made our minds up on food I asked our waiter about the Scotch Egg, he said it's on the pub menu and offered to get us one. We waited and waited, when he finally came back, he asked if we were ready to order,  again I asked about the pub menu, he apologized and got us one within a minute. He seemed to discourage us from most things on the pub menu, not sure why? But I ended up getting the Scotch Egg which was very disappointing, it wasn't greasy, had a nice crunch but the sausage was dry and very spicy which overwhelmed the egg and I didn't care for dipping it in the hp sauce. I had one at another gastropub in town and it was tremendously better than Gordon's.  We had also received their free bread service which included 3 different pretzel bites and a rye roll with pots of butter and cheese. Having 4 people at our table I think we should've gotten 2 but we all shared so we could have a bit of everything. They were all very good, I would order it if it wasn't complimentary. One thing we thought was strange was we didn't get bread plates to eat our bread or share the apps. Very messy. When ordering our entrees, Doug was unsure on what to get and tried to get some help from the waiter, but it was one of those scenarios where they say everything is good but push the most expensive choice, not very helpful. Our entrees came not too long after our apps and bread. Crowding our already small table, they never removed the Scotch Egg dish. There was a Pork Belly Roll, the Lamb T-Bone, and 2 of us got the Fish and Chips. We sampled each dish. The Pork belly was very moist and tender but it didn't have much else going on. The lamb was okay but nothing special, I didn't taste any of the mint jus that was suppose to be present, the mustard on the side was strong with horseradish but it was good. The Fish was tender and not greasy with a decent crunch but it wasn't anything special either, I've had better fish and chips at an English pub in town. The "chips" were way too big, not crispy at all, I didn't like them. The mushy peas were really nice and fresh tasting though. I couldn't finish one of fish pieces so asked for it to packed up, I think in higher end places the waiter should box it for you, but maybe that's just me. I had to box it myself.   We couldn't leave with out getting the Sticky Toffee Pudding for dessert. It was really good. Sweet, moist, gooey, some crispy spots all with a side of sweet cream ice cream. Yum. Thus far my impression was poor service, don't waste your time on an entree here (IMO go to his steakhouse instead), seems like a good spot for drinks, small bites/apps, and dessert. I have to say they were nice enough to allow us to hang out for awhile after dinner, they warned us they were closing for a private event so the place cleared out fast around us but let us stay til the last minute before they had to have everything ready. We were also well supplied with water, even though we had already paid and tipped.   For the prices and name on the door, I was disappointed. Gordon, say it ain't so!

0HI7rehoMoC5FU2Udy0_rg.text: I was so disappointed. . . I love Gordon and am a Huge fan of his shows, books, cooking, and yes, was so looking forward to his pub here in Vegas.. But in the form of his words it was pure " S.H.I.T." I am not sorry.. but it was  nothing but just that. Short with the Food and horrible service.. It's like a crowd of ducks quaking and not knowing what to do.  .  . Even the Mater D was horrifying.  The fish was uncooked and over cooked for my Fish and chips. The Potatoes were so thick it's hardly a Chip! RIDICULOUS OVER PRICED NASTINESS!  GORDON WHAT WERE YOU THINKING!!!! This joint needs help~ Seriously Real HELP!  I also, hope you can choose a better outfit for your waitresses ... They are horrifying!!  OH BLAH!!! Maybe i'll be back in 6 months once they have worked out all their Kinks but I will not be having the Fish and chips again... So... Sad... So Heart broken...

Eb0g0vHnyjbwwW7YwaQ8JQ.text: Had steamed mussels and clams, which were good. Toast that came up it was too salty and not much flavor. Service was fine. Casual atmosphere.

6MPY16sXr3t2JUbdSP9Q1Q.text: Nachos, wings, salads, and beer were great. Service was great. Location was nice. A bit pricey for what it is, but it was expected. Didn't come for dinner, just a quick bite to eat in between gambling sessions..  Served our purpose great. The wait was only about 10 minutes and they sent us a text to let us know our table was ready. I'd like to go back and try the lamb burger and steak!

OlXBlFs0oHUZoJ6YHfvlqQ.text: Highly over-rated. Had the fish and chips. Batter was nice, but not crispy enough. They didnt fry the fish long enough. Fries were not traditional and DIDNT work in this dish. Peas were honestly the best part of the dish... eh...

tNhq8J26lZuIM7gkkP9NXQ.text: just to say what a wonderful experience that Randall Goldrich gave me and my wife. We had a terrible experience in  Giadas resturant in vegas but Randall made me, my wife and my wifes brother and his wife made up for it.  He helped me by recommending different options and choices on the menu as well as making us feel at home {my new home away from home}. The food was delicious as well as the service. We were there last Wednesday. Both Mr. Goldrich's professionalism and caring made up for what would have been a forgettable night.Being a fellow New Yorker he tried and succeeded This will definitely be a regular stop on my trips to LasVegas

QuaiEp3NTkjFyvK1jp3oFg.text: the service and food were great. it was disappointing to find out that the hells kitchen winner was NOT working there, apparently she had actually declined the job offer.  either way, i'm a huge gordon ramsay fan and i enjoyed the food!

xT00dC0UnXy92zIjDcEx2A.text: This is our first time here.  Our waiter Scott gave good recommendations and was super friendly!  Pub bites and the drinks here are great for a break after a long day lf walking and shopping!

u6uHTC5nXlvDyb-vE52Caw.text: Sometimes the greatest triumphs are born from disasters, and our visit to Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill at Caesars Palace was no exception. This review's a bit long, but trust me, it really hits its stride around paragraph eight.  My girlfriend and I wandered into the restaurant on Saturday, March 7th, lured in by a sign at the entrance advertising some pretty appealing happy hour deals. The deals were so enticing that we failed to notice the not-so-fine print indicating happy hour only occurred M-F. Oh well.   We approached the host stand and were immediately greeted warmly by Randy Goldich, who we came to find out later is Bar Manager for GRP&G. Randy was a great host and was incredibly accommodating upon learning that my girlfriend was not only vegetarian, but also allergic to wheat. He brought us a gluten-free menu and even gave us happy hour pricing on our Angry Orchard cider/Fireball shot combos (also known as Angry Balls...you gotta try). And that's where things started to fall apart...  I ordered the fish and chips, and the GF ordered the vegetarian blah blah whatever sandwich with gluten free bread. The food didn't arrive until the Angry Balls had already done a number on us, so we were ravenous. As I stuffed my face with fish I couldn't help but notice that my GF's gluten-free bread looked remarkably like...bread. We called our waitress Nini over, and she was incredibly apologetic and immediately took the sandwich back to the kitchen.  As we waited for the sandwich to be fixed, two more ciders were mistakenly delivered to our table (not a complaint), and suddenly it felt like we were in a rotating restaurant. But boy did we make friends with all the staff! We met waiter Marvin, who recently won Caesars employee of the year, and yukked it up with Tom Tom (or was it Ray Ray?), their award winning mixologist. We were practically falling off our stools by the time the replacement sandwich came, but it finally did: a beautiful vegetarian, gluten-free sandwich wrapped in lettuce and filled with...chicken.  By this time I was forced to relinquish my own hand-cut fries (apparently they call them "chips" in Vegas) due to the girlfriend's voracious state, and the potatoes did a good enough job of soaking up the fermented apple juice that we were ready to call it an afternoon. Randy was apparently tied up in the kitchen, so manager Michelle came by the table and let us know that our meal was free. She also sent us off with the correct order in a to-go container, 2 1/2 hours after we had initially arrived for a light lunch.  Less than an hour after leaving the restaurant, I received a call on my cell phone from Randy, who apologized profusely and invited us back for dinner the following night as his guests. I was initially shocked as to how Randy had gotten my number, but then the GF reminded me of my tendency to hand out business cards to everyone I talk to after imbibing a few cocktails.  To say we were shocked at his offer would be an understatement. We're not high-rollers; we're not even the lint in Dean Martin's belly button. But if there was anything that we learned after chatting with our boy Randy, it's that the man takes a genuine vested interest in his customers' happiness. It's not about Yelp reviews or who can tip the most; it's about making every guest feel like they had a remarkable experience. It's an old-school approach to service and building customer relationships that seems to be lost on so many that work in hospitality nowadays. So obviously, we took him up on his offer for dinner.  We returned at 9:30 the following evening and came to figure out that even though Randy's scheduled shift had ended several hours earlier, he made it a point to stay until we were seated and served the meals we ordered. He put us under the tender loving care of waiter Roger, and introduced us to season 12 winner of Hell's Kitchen Scott Commings, who can whip up a meatless wedge salad like you wouldn't believe. Even after we declined dessert, Roger still brought us every single gluten-free dessert option on the menu! It turns out that vanilla ice cream was really the only option that fit the criteria, but we were impressed nonetheless.  After two experiences in two days with GRP&G, I was left with two very distinct lasting impressions: 1) Randy Goldich is a pretty incredible guy, and he and his staff will apparently do whatever it takes to make their guests happy, and 2) this is definitely the most awesome thing that has ever come from dating a gluten-free vegetarian. Because of our experience, we actively look forward to visiting Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill next time we visit Las Vegas.

UMQxG3fwnIPN3iKdLjtP5Q.text: We loved it! We are Vegas locals and went on a Friday afternoon because we wanted to see if we liked this as much as BurGR. I ordered the onion soup and the shepherds pie and my boyfriend ordered the burger and fries. Both of us kept eating way after we were full just because it was so good. The service was fast, really friendly, and helpful with recommendations. The decor is hip and comfortable, and there was no wait at all on the last weekend before Christmas, which was a plus.  The only cons in my opinion were 1) the price of beer, which is typical of restaurants in the casinos on the strip and 2) being seated right beside other patrons lacked privacy and was not seemingly necessary.  I think this restaurant is a great example of what sets an expert like Gordon Ramsay apart from the rest. Everything was clean, organized, friendly, simple to understand, food was made very well, and the experience left us wanting to come back with friends.

TgOrm3Lj4SovyX2qyMtJNg.text: I didn't realize how big this place was until we walked all the way back! I'll just get my one complaint out of the way first: we looked at the menu online on their website for caesars and it was very different from the one we got at the restaurant, the one at the restaurant had way less selection than the one online. Other than that this place was great! The theme is totally perfect with the British pub/ Gordon Ramsay feel and it's great all the way to the servers and hosts outfits and even the silverware is super cute and on theme. The prices were reasonable-ish, I think $24 is a little much for a pot pie but it was delicious! The nachos were also really good, unlike any nachos I've had before because the potato chips were really crisp and fresh and the sweet peppers added a good flavor to it. We also checked in to get the free dessert and it was amazing! Melted in my mouth sooooo good! And last but not at all least our server, Christopher Lee (like count dooku! ) was so great! Very personable, easy going and fun to talk to!! He definitely added a lot to our experience!

gp9CdIprlv6NNduRjtZShg.text: I have now been to the Gordon Ramsay Pub and Grill twice; once on New Years Eve and then again yesterday. My party and I were satisfied on NYE. The waitress was friendly and attentive and the food was incredible. However, my visit yesterday was mediocre at best. We had to ask twice to get out free pretzel/bread basket and it wasn't delivered until well after we received our entrees. Also, the food was not all delivered at the same time. I ordered the fish and chips, which you would think was the fastest to make (compared to the lamb and sliders), but I had to wait three or four minutes for my dish after the others were delivered. There were no complaints about the food, but we felt neglected.  Tips: - Make sure to make reservations on Open Table before hand - If you have Total Rewards make sure to check the TR prices are charged on your bill. Both times I visited full price was charged. They also don't accept Ceasers TR F&B vouchers. - I made the mistake of taking my parents here. The music was very loud, which I don't mind. However, it was difficult for my older parents to hear. - As with most upscale restaurants, unless specified (eg Fish and Chips), the entrees don't include any sides. You have to order them separately.

08vNQ9D6DArnYpd10NOxzw.text: This place SUCKS!! My girlfriend found a 12 inch black hair intertwined in her meal!! I guarantee if Gordon Ramsey got served that plate, he would throw it on the floor and fire someone!! They did replace her entree, but we were thoroughly disgusted and cautious for additional bodily hair garnishes. Get with the quality control program Chef Ramsey! Cheers Mate

0W1Txlw9ISuuEnto4BcHlw.text: Nightmare happy hour 25 popcorn cold for $5 Bacon wrapped datesa ???? Unknown Cold  $5 So small.  Like one slice of bacon !  gr. U should be embarrassed  This would Never pass on your show  Minus 5 stars

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Garbage

MmUa-XlGdMgegPywzLlNaw.text: Wow. all i can say is disaster. overpriced food , small portions.. come on , 3 french fries with the burger? .. could go on about the food, buy why bother.  Service... not much to say there , because there was barely any. sat at bar. yea it was steady but the bartenders where like deer in headlights. not sure what the problem is there or who is to blame.

ApMs8aiL_xi05Vcb2s2blQ.text: These Television eateries never open without a giant corporate backed establishment like a casino. Our wait staff was completely occupied by her uniform not fitting correctly to give great service, glad we only stopped on for drinks and appetizers. Pretzel app was good. Beer selection is nice.

59Gp6IMDbK9oVsky7Db5rg.text: Terrible!!!!!! Hey Gordon, ever hear I salt and pepper?  Bangers and mash..... Bland sausages, bland potatoes.  I was tempted to order a margarita just for the salted rim.  The BLT is pork belly, but tastes like a turkey burger.  Bland yet again.  Not good.  I figured a Brit doing a British pub.... Should be good. Soooooooo far from the truth.  This restaurant needs to be on kitchen nightmares.  Maybe Robert Irvine needs to come in and renovate this crappy food on restaurant impossible.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pork belly BLT!?!? More like pseudo-meat turkey dirt sandwich.
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bland bland bland bangers and mash

FFJhFjG5KjZ3fHLuA6k6FA.text: The hot and salty pretzels were neither.  $11 pints, $30 fish & chips.  Chips tasted microwaved as did the fish which was mushy.  Over priced and under delivered. There are better choices.

_l7DPiR3_Y6tXoqqFdtAig.text: The food and service were impecable! Roger, our server went above and beyond. We had great conversation with him, he was extremely helpful, and he had great club insight! We enjoyed every second of our dinner.

PtIbNfJ-Ey_i3RtdCrhPZQ.text: previously gave a 5 star review to this venue but no longer possible...returned this week to find a restaurant in decline with virtually no redeeming features !!!! We had a reservation for 6pm on Wednesday but on arrival had to stand in line with people without reservations and had to wait to be seated by one of the 3 greeters.......these were young women who seemed to enjoy social chatter between themselves rather than helping the customer Our waiter was average and showed no interest in the fact we were returning customers. Our fish and chips arrived quickly, but as mentioned by others the fish was soggy (certainly no where close to crispy batter) and the chips were similar...portions seemed smaller than before and the food served was simply unacceptable for the cost. we only drank soda and as a result our waiter vanished and only returned with the bill. In my opinion the restaurant was not clean and my wife was surprised ( not in a good way) to find the ladies bathroom out of order we will not be returning but do rec you try Burgr ( That's how it's spelt) for a good GR experience.....this is vastly superior in every area and surprisingly cheaper....a winning combination for us

I3Mea-ZGucduasyAa_PXUg.text: Good restaurant and staff.  Nice option in Vegas if you want to go to Gordon's restaurant and can't get in Hell's Kitchen.  We had various meal options and would rate all 3 (steak, fish entrees) as about an 8 out of 10.

bw-1it-7N6ZyMWklK-X7Ig.text: This is definitely as good as it gets.  It's the whole experience and definitely a Hell's Kitchen adventure since Scott Commings, winner of season #12, is now head chef here.  When we walked by the Pub and Grill at Caesar's Palace, we knew we would return and we did.  We ended up walking back when the restaurant was open for Happy Hour.  That was lucky for us.   The nachos were very different than what you'd expect to receive at a Mexican restaurant.  After all, they should be because this is a Pub.  They were delicious as were the 3oz sliders we ordered from the regular menu.    Not only was the food excellent but so was the service.  Our special treat was a visit to our table from Scott.  He actually took time out of his busy schedule to chat a bit.  What a great restaurant and great experience it was.  Would we return?  Most definitely!

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Nachos and Sliders
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pub inside Caesar&#39;s Palace

dXy8y36bevu6YkP6UJ8qhQ.text: Had an awesome time here. Food was awesome and service was quick. Our server Rodney was the best, he was very knowledgable with the items in the menu.

jGZoHZCbEdy-TUSI3top0A.text: The fish and chips are out of this world.  The servers and staff were amazing and did an excellent job. If you are visiting please put it on your list!!!!

wxtpqPTSJSBzN-7fxMblEg.text: We tried to get a dinner reservation on short notice before the Elton John concert and were turned away. We looked inside the restaurant and there were a half a dozen tables or more available. After we went and had fast food, we came back by an hour later and there were still more than six tables available.We were only a party of 2 and were staying at the Caesar's Palace.

aQlOcW-a1tfiRw9aIbBVHw.text: Don't particularly love this guys shows but I've been dying to try his restaurant because his food always looks phenomenal.  Specifically the fish & chips were a priority to try. I didn't want to go for the smaller faster version at the Linq Promenade. I wanted the full Monty at Caesars. We chose to sit at the bar due to the limited seating options on a Friday night. We were not disappointed at all. The fish was hot, flaky, crunchy deliciousness. The sauce wasn't overly sweet & the chips weren't greasy & had the skins on which I personally love. My only wish would be that they offered other sauces for dipping the fries (but it's not traditional I know). The decor was a modern funky pub like atmosphere. The staffs uniforms were fun too. The staff was very helpful & entertaining. They are all having a good time & it translates to the guests. I would recommend this to anyone seeking proper fish & chips or just a good time.

hp4zt_wYc2jX2cdmB2tqlQ.text: We decided to eat here since my hubby is a big fan of this place.  He comes to Vegas once a year for a convention and this is a frequent stop of his.  My girlfriends and I literally got off a plane, dropped off our luggage and beelined to this place.  We showed up at 10:55 AM and they weren't open yet.  They open at 11, so don't show up early!!!  Once they opened, we were promptly seated and our waiter came to take our orders.  We started off with the pretzel appetizer which is delicious, BTW.  Then I ordered the bangers and mash.  The mash was delicious, but I was not a fan of the sausages.  My friend ordered the fish and chips...and man this was the biggest plate of fish and chips that I've ever seen.  She said it was great, but probably would be best to share.  She didn't even make a dent in it.  Lastly, my other girlfriend got the burger and really enjoyed it.  I think I'll just have to come back and try something different.
