XTwYapjHguZHDgC-Md4PNQ.text: walked in here expecting more since it was a Gordon Ramsey spot... was disappointed none the less.  The only thing I like was the place setting and silverware design.  Beyond that was all down hill..   I got the beer braised rib with creamy barry risotto.. the risotto was the only decent part of this dish... other friends in my group got salads, burgers, and steak but no one seemed happily satisfied with any of their dishes.  Just Pricey Pub Food with no flair or special touches.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Place setting

Vtlw0XQ1PtA42LwAx8ilsg.text: The best burgers and truffle fries in town! Our host server Roger provided high quality and friendly service to our table. My family was delighted to dine at Gordon Ramsay's restaurant due to the amazing food and Roger's kind attendance to our table's inquiries and requests. He was very knowledgeable about the menu and made my family (whom are visiting from out of town) feel right at home. The restaurant was bustling with people enjoying their food and having a good time. Roger has made our experience at the restaurant a warm and welcoming one. We always tell our friends and family how delicious the food is. We will surely return!

IPWhssoizQbc6XOxjBRE3w.text: I've been to this place every single time I go to Vegas and it never disappoints!! Out of all the Gordon Ramsay restaurants there are in Vegas, this one is my favorite.   The service here is amazing. They are always on top of everything you need. Once, they could tell that we were not happy sitting at the high tops and they quickly moved us to a more comfortable area. Whether it is super busy or dead, they will take care of you.   Some things to try if you have never been here are the Kettle chip nachos, Fish and Chips, and their burgers. The corned beef on the kettle chip nachos is so tasty and cooked perfectly. It's hard not to want to eat so many before your meal comes out but you do want to make room for the Fish and Chips! Best Fish and Chips I have ever had in my life!! The cod was super fresh and perfectly breaded; not greasy at all. The tarter sauce that comes with it is amazing too. Their burgers are amazing too! Maybe even better than the ones they serve at Gordon Ramsay Burger. The meat was super juicy and flavorful.

yC25PzDLroA8OUl06nXhEg.text: Great food and excellent service! The lamb burger was delicious and my husband enjoyed the short ribs. I recommend reserving your spot on open table to get seated right away!

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States

MwdzSM45hfeeXc3Hx5KYsg.text: Food is delicious!!! Kettle chip nachos with braised short ribs were our favorite. Our server Rodney is absolutely amazing, very friendly, made great recommendations and is professional. Would definitely come back again and request Rodney as our server.

g_zFYX8N1Di0XuJRk4lXrw.text: Day Scott was extremely helpful. We are sure we are hie favorite high maintenance customers. He served our every request with a smile and laughter. He is a great celery gardener.

IkhZRoFpGkEEXMLgrpAq6Q.text: Nong was the best .toffee pudding was awsome. I would come back again and again. His recommendations were WOOOORTH IT

terANCQtfObe3Qm676D21w.text: During our recent stay in Vegas we visited this restaurant two days in a row. We originally stopped in for Happy Hour to try the truffle fries. Our waiter, Rodney, was so personable that we decided to stay for dinner. We had the prime rib and even though it was a little pricey, it was well worth it. For dessert we had the sticky toffee pudding which was out of this world!!! In fact, the food & service were so good that we went back again today just to have another sticky toffee pudding before catching our flight back to Dallas. :)

H9fltdj9xjLTN9GRWiTVbg.text: Please get the wings and the braised short rib, you won't regret it. Ronnie was phenomenal. Will be back tomorrow for the nachos.

k971n1myHPKggUNed96xgg.text: Come back to Vegas this time and had to check out this place again and the good was good as usual

PXMUQHszp9U5UQGD9JfarA.text: Good beer, good food, good service. Great atmosphere and great desserts. I've actually had better fish and chips at a regular Irish pub.

wfT5HoNRpeAzZDfu_oimlw.text: I wanted to make a good first impression with my girlfriend's dad, so I took him here. Boy am I a genius because one taste of the sticky toffee pudding and he told me I can marry his daughter whenever I want.

lJLOz2cQYlw36VQLiM3TMg.text: Wow! The food here is really worth the wait. There was a line of people waiting and we waited about a half hour for a table. Our server was friendly and welcoming although very hurried.  We decided to start with the deviled eggs and am glad that we did. They are really creamy with nice spice. I will say that I think the are overpriced due to the fact that you only get a few for the price.  I had the fish and chips as I see it on hells kitchen all the time and wanted to try it. It really is delicious.  My partner had a burger and said it was amazing and the bun was really great.   The food runners are great and really attentive as the servers are so busy taking orders.  I think the prices are a bit steep but you are paying for the name and location.   The space is beautiful and has a great pub feel.  We never saw Gordon or got to hear him call some one a " donkey" but had a good time anyway. I deducted one star due to the wait time and feeling a bit rushed after the meal. I know they had people waiting but felt they really wanted your seats right away. Maybe it was because it was a weekend.   If you have the money and time, give it a try.

yAYlpdkJlyGAdLIr7MsqxA.text: Absolutely awful. I would mention our severs name but it was never given. After the first hour of asking for him 3 times just to order drinks, we somehow received a bread basket 1.5 hours later 2 minutes prior to the meal. Never saw our server again... Not for a napkin, not to check in, not for more drinks, and not even to see if we wanted dessert in celebration of my friends birthday. He simply dropped the bill on the table and walked away. As a local- even just as a patron, the service was appalling. On our way out, my friend appropriately made a comment to the hostess in hopes that management would be made aware to which he was given the response "I'm sorry but there's nothing I can do."  Waste of time money space and unfortunately a special occasion. Gordon Ramsay may be a good chef, but his business sense is absolutely pathetic.  Mr Ramsay, you've been CHOPPED!

6QTkDsE3CX3tUIvsg8FGeQ.text: Had dinner when staying at the Caesars. Place was busy, looked god but the barstools were a bit short compared to the table for my taste. Nice choice of beers and english bar-food. The two burgers(lamb and normal) we had were very good and so were the chips. Prices are high, but I guess normal for Vegas.

KiLuMKi2sj0JMCCW8wzmbA.text: We stopped in here late one night to try it out, as we are big fans of Gordon. We ordered the sliders, truffle fries, and of course, the sticky toffee pudding. The sliders were very good and adorable. The fries were perfect and they give you the truffle/ garlic aioli to dip as well as homemade ketchup. Delicious. And dessert- sinful. Soooooo good. Wish I would've ordered my own (sticky toffee pudding), instead of sharing. Lol. Lots and lots of beer on tap, although we didn't have any. Fish & chips too pricey at $30-I just got the fish & chip sandwich at burgr instead. ($16 Very good, but standard). Interesting appetizers but some entrees too fancy for my taste. Pretty place, fun ambiance. I prefer burgr @Planet Hollywood. May return if I am in Cesar's.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sticky toffee pudding!!! Omg!
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Truffle fries
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sliders

6QYH9W6qHGqqfq1CoDlryw.text: Had dinner here pre-Elton John concert.  Started with the cheese plate and a bowl of split pea soup.  Cheese was good, paired well with the chutney and the olives.  The split pea soup was stellar.  Thick, big chunks of ham...but only a piece of bread (which was really good, though) to go with it.  Would have preferred saltines (it's a pub, right?).  For entrees, wife had the fish and chips which was really good, crispy, hot, nice chunks of fish.  Only issue:  asked for "regular" ketchup,for the fries and the waitress said they don't have regular, they add horseradish to it.  Really?  Can't come up off a bottle of ketchup? I had the shepherds pie, which was also really good.  But it was unbelievably hot (oven hot).  Came in a clay pot which maintained the heat.  A little over the top hot.  I have to say, it seems Gordon Ramsey caved to Vegas pressure and made everything overpriced (like almost everything else in Vegas) at least it sure wasn't the prices one would expect for pub food (especially if you've ever been to a pub in England, the difference is huge!)  No salt and pepper on the table.  That's just pretentious.  Bottom line:  good food, loud restaurant, good people watching, way more expensive than it should have been.

o4RQ8xUScidbwsuu6LNTWQ.text: Underwhelmed.  Gave four dishes a try and all of them were mediocre. I had high hopes for thier famous fish and chips, but to my disappontment, it was nothing special.  I've had better elsewhere at 1/3 the cost.  Food was bland, beer was warm and portions were small.    I hate the feeling of spending good money and leaving the restaurnt hungry.    One saving grace for this place was the excellent service of the staff.  Our server was fast, attentive and addressed everyone at our table by our first names.  Impressive.   Too bad I can't say the same for their food.  As Golden Ramsay says... 'Shame'

hQa9GFP5NeEeL8EiCBNF8g.text: One word: Eh. That's how my experience here was. I order the pistachio pesto chicken sand which.. It lacked flavor and was  "warm" at best when I bit into it. The truffle fries were good and I liked the aioli dipping sauce. My mom ordered the fish and chips. The fish was lightly battered and were good sized.. But hers too was just warm. I really like the goodbye blue sky cocktail though. However, with these kind of prices, I was expecting better quality food. Especially since "Gordon Ramsey" put his name on it! (He has nerve yelling at all those hopeful chefs! Lol) definitely skip this place if you are at the Caesars.. We should have just opt'd for the food court. Less money and probably same quality, if not better food!

6B8jSE8l_fYkMzqMrkPN2g.text: Very slow and poor service! The nachos are very good! The fish and chips are overpriced fish and chips. The best thing was the beer!

f31bdWqXOuQdRY7z-ZE5rg.text: Don't waist your time or money. The food is average at best and far too pricy for what you get.  I am very disappointed and will not be going back.

aVDcrT0mkg7x25bd4UYk7Q.text: Was deciding between this place and Bobby Flay's MESA, but decided to come here cause Bobby's menu didn't look very appetizing- probably tiny portions of mexican food, anyways...  So first off there wasn't any room to seat us, apparently most people make a reservation, but it was nice that the girl said she would text us so we could go play the slots while we wait, and I did get a text about 10 minutes later.  We ordered the lobster roll appetizer, it came as one thing, and we asked the waiter to split it and he didn't cut if very well, so it was really hard to share. None of the appetizers looked good for sharing, except the calamari, but i've had enough calamari this year.  So I ordered the lamb burger, kind of a long wait to get the food. We took pictures with the British background while we waited and posted on facebook. It was nice for social media purposes, I guess. We had the bad luck of ending up with a wobbly table and it ended up shaking and spilling water everywhere and the cloth napkins were water-resistant so it was hard to clean up.   The burger itself was pretty good, although it was strange that I couldn't tell if it was beef or lamb- i'm not sure if that's a good or bad thing. The cheese on the burger was good and the fries were good. My boyfriend got the salmon, which was good as well.  Overall, the food is good, but the restaurant itself has some issues with tables and service.

LBmPg97vW0zG5pp3QcGFgA.text: The people working there are very kind and helpful. However, I did not enjoy the beef burger too much. It was pretty bland and dry (just like a fellow yelper said) it was disappointing for a $22 burger. But my boyfriend got the beef pie. And it was yummy and we shared the truffle fries. They really were tasty. So props to that. I just feel like for paying a lot for a burger, it could have tasted a lot better.

PCgJXd6mfYld1CxPEqQgKQ.text: The food here is delicious! A real solid 4.5 out of 5 stars. I loved the shepherd's pie, My mother's Chicken Sandwich was also delicious and the fries were to die for.   However, the service offered is closer to a 2.5 or 3 of 5 stars. They don't really seem to care unless you address them directly and then they are friendly enough. Waitstaff in general is standoffish and tends to gather around and talk in a corner (albeit not loudly).   TL;DR - Food was great; Service could have been better.   Bonus Note On the cleanliness side: As someone who hates public restrooms, the restrooms here are immaculate (as in touch your but to the seat without a protective layer of toilet paper).

q0PktccZcRCT9xgjhrH3hw.text: I sat here at the bar by myself for lunch. I thought the food here was really good for the one dish I tried... Which was the fish and chips. Really tasty and flakey fish and the chips were yummy. I wish there were more mashed/minty peas cuz those were yummy too.    For beer I ordered the Innis and gunn...the bartender asks me after I ordered. "now that's a "pale" ale....is that gonna be ok??" don't talk to me like that... If I order something why would u question me...? Like it felt like he was saying that cuz I was a girl... Whatever.. The beer was awesome and not even hoppy at all which seemed to be what he was implying by his question. I actually went back the next day to the bar to order the same beer again cuz it was so great ... The 2nd bartender when I ordered said "have you had the pale ale variety? That is what we have on tap right now" which was a nicer way of asking without being presumptuous.  Anyway. For an Anglophile like me, I love this place. Reminds me of England and love the British music that plays (queen, the kooks, Franz Ferdinand, Arctic monkeys etc..)  Would like to return for more Innis and Gunn as well as the famous sticky toffee pudding which I was too full to order :(.

t0ez9mQiVEKHL7NZW9762Q.text: I had the fish and chips and for the $30 it wasn't any better than a Red Robin version at $14. Those weren't chips they were sad American steak fries. Waiter was pretty rude and dismissive about our stroller. I'm from the UK and feel like I should have just gone to Gordon's fish and chips where it was 12 bucks for what I paid 30 for.

gL_LQqtvovXQ7XP4mi4IeQ.text: It took 40 minutes to get our burger, Service was horrible.we asked for 16oz beer he brought 20oz.He should ask if that is ok.  Never came to do quality check. I asked Medium burger but I got served well done. We Eye contacted him and he turned his back and left.He did not even come and even give us our bill we had to ask someone else to get our check.

TkEMjAJJ4NBZV3rUN3Lwmg.text: Took my brother in law here for dinner because he is a huge fan of Gordon Ramsay. We made reservations, asked to be by the kitchen, and also mentioned it was a birthday dinner. They didn't relay any of that information when it came time to dine but at least they had our reservation on file.   Service was awful during our visit. My brother in law ordered the Onion soup and they brought it out to him without a spoon. We had to flag down our waiter and ask for the spoon. They were also "conveniently" out of their house wine so we were forced to spend more money on wine with dinner.   When it came time for the bill we had to wait about 10 minutes for him to bring it.   If Gordon Ramsay knew how terrible the service was at this place he might make a visit and set them straight. At no point should the waiter tell me that $17 calamari is justified no matter the quality because we are in Caesars Palace. To be fair, the calamari was decent.   I am only giving 2 stars because of the terrible service. The food was good, not great. I can get better at my local pub for a lot less money.

jbRrlcDWWXF1shghRO9dQQ.text: I'm not much of a Ramsay fan outside of him trashing Amy's Baking Company on the infamous episode of Kitchen Nightmare, but one co-worker I was with on my recent Vegas lives for Ramsay.  She wanted to go to the Pub, BurgR, the Steakhouse, and any other taco stand or dumpling house he might open next week.  I think I can best sum up the experience with a what I liked vs what I didn't like list:  I liked that is was not a stuffy restaurant.  The atmosphere and decor was fun and inviting. I liked the non traditional table I was at with 2 large, cushy chairs on one side, and a couch on the other (you might not like this) I liked the huge beer list. I really liked my lamb chops.  The food got high marks by everyone at the table for quality and prep.  I did not like the drink list on the ipad.  It did lead to some great conversation about if we though we could get away with stealing the Ipad...but, with 4 of us at the table, and only 1 Ipad, it was a rush job to look thru the 100+ beers separate onto different web pages by category.  In the interest of time, I just picked an old, well known favorite vs. something rare or reading up and trying something new.  ...and finally, what killed the experience...the serving size.  Upon looking at all the dinners as they came out, my initial though was, 'they know we did not order of the kiddie menu, right?'  While my lamb chops were great, there was only 4 lil chops for a serious price.  By contrast, Firefly, a well known local tapas restaurant, offers a $10 tapas plate with 2-3 pieces, and while maybe not as awesomely seasoned, it's still very good over there.  My Irish buddy got the Sheppards pie, and while he admitted it might be better than what momma made him...the size of it was seriously laughable.  I was not surprised when I heard he picked up more to eat.  As for that drink Ipad...Our best idea was to list it on Craigslist and sell it for cheap for immediate cash only, with an exchange in the bathroom, and quickly paying the tab in cash...and defiantly not returning to Caesars on this trip.  I'm just saying, if you ever see it on craigslist, don't go buy an Ipad from a guy in the mens room of Ramsay's Pub & Grill, it might some other guy with a clever but flawed idea.

Unhw2aV5Mca5ff9_HpA1PA.text: Recently I found myself in Vegas for one night and could only get a hotel off-strip. I knew I wanted to come to Caesar's to play some craps that night so wanted to kill two birds with one stone. I was actually surprised at the beer selection and service. Sure the waiters wear some downright weird outfits, but were attentive and very nice. We both got the fish and chips and an Innis & Gunn. The fish was a little on the salty side but was actually pretty good. The chips could have been a little crispier, but again were better than expected. With the prices and all of the restaurants in Vegas I likely won't return, but was pleasantly surprised.  I added a star for the bread basket that came out before our meals. It was stocked with soft pretzel rods, cheese dip, and a few other items and was pretty freakin awesome. It was perfect with our beers and would make an awesome appetizer with a few beers at the bar!

uhASriCtugah0ZWk6c4wBg.text: A yummy late night dinner!  Arrived here last night at approximately 9:20pm and was told the wait was 35 minutes for a table.  We gave the waitress our cell phone number and she said she would text us once our table was ready... 50 minutes later, we were seated at our table.  The hostess was rude - hardly looked me in the eye, never smiled, and was completely miserable.  - I'm sure Gordon Ramsey would have thrown a few F-bombs.   My four stars is given to the Traditional Shepard's Pie.  Ohhh baby, it's GOOD.  It's a smaller portion, but don't let that fool you.  This rich, juicy, and savory dish will leave you more than satisfied.  You can tell that the beef in this dish had been marinating in the stock all day.  Needless to say, I ate the entire thing.    You get a little bread basket before your meal that consists of pretzels and a caraway seed roll.  Salted butter and melted cheese are served next to the breads for dipping.    My guest had the fish and chips, which were excellent too.  The "chips" were my favorite.  They are large, one inch potato sticks seasoned with parmesan cheese and salt - fried perfectly.  If you get another dish without chips, I recommend getting a side of these to try, you can't find them cooked like this anywhere else.   The dinner was pricey.  Our bill (two entrees and one soda), was $50.00.  This isn't your 'visit-every-week' pub, but it's definitely worth going to - whether a local or a tourist.  I would say, it might be one of the more unique restaurants on the strip, food wise.    BUT, like I stated before, service needs to be improved.  The hostess made me feel as though she didn't want my business, and I didn't feel very welcomed.  Once I sat down, our waiter was nice, but the hostess ruined the initial experience.

aveH3NnJorAJgAquB-FDtA.text: Pretty good! Had the bangers and mash and was impressed. Only REALLY liked one of the sausage the other two were good though. Service was fantastic and our waiter was amazing!

XWry85co-jzhOLWeXydM5w.text: We came here months ago while on vacation and both tried the Yorkshire Ale Batter Fish & Chips. The fish was crispy and not too greasy inside, chips were great as well. They were big portions, we could of shared one order.   I like the other GR's Steak and BurGR better than this restaurant, but it didn't disappoint.

0JR8032tsdKfEKrPmKoNrg.text: Everything you need and want from a pub! Yep, not a Michelin star restaurant, but then why would you want a pub to be that bloody snotty??? not me!!!! great mixed drinks (ok, not better than The Vesper, but better than any other pub I've been to in the UK). great sliders.

YFUeB1y4dta4aujAim0_fw.text: The staff is very quick to inform that they do not have a children's menu or chicken tenders, snorting that it's "a British pub". They seemed insulted that I'd dared to even ask. I know it's Vegas, but plenty of people have kids there.

VGyp6i-p4WWNgSJBDBZscg.text: We were looking forward to returning to the pub and grill. Our first visit was excellent. This time the fish was greasy and the chips cold. The service was non existent   We won't be back.

4Osr9l8qWKfHkX434SejJw.text: The best lunch thus far in Vegas! Great food and an amazing server! Great beer suggestion and excellent food! The pretzels were unreal! From the moment we walked in the door until we left we were treated amazing! Never had an empty glass and everyone was very friendly! 100% recommend for a lunch!! Try the lobster Mac and cheese huge chunks of lobster in every bite! And the BLT is delicious!!

W_Ot4MeFDJFyWZrgC8pgfQ.text: I don't understand the terrible reviews, it's a pub-and a great one at that! I think people are forgetting what it is-it's not fine dining, it's casual. The atmosphere is fun, and hip and is reflected in the menu. The fish and chips were excellent. Bottom line: I thought their beer selection was the best I've seen in Vegas, the fish and chips were excellent and the atmosphere enhanced my experience.

QBWrH80zt9DlXwEsUiITAg.text: Ok where do i start...when we arrived we were told 25 min wait w/ several tables open. Once we were about to leave mysteriously one or 10 opened up. Th e food took 45 min to come and all we had was mac n cheese and a burger after we asked our waiter. The drink took 10 min to come and didn't look like the photo shown. The cauliflower soup was nothing more than the flavor out of a campbells can...the water was not refilled and when asking the waiter of the black things on my mac that tasted like black olives he said they were truffles and i told him they did not look like the truffles that i had the night before at Gordon Ramsay's steak- phenomenal by the way and all he said was there are different ones but knew nothing about them then asked if i wanted something different....NOT WORTH the MONEY...go to Ramsay's steak much better. Oh the menu outside the resturaunt had mac n cheese and burgers where the one inside didn't so we had to ask for them separately.

RH3PJuBnXy0f2DJWW3IGzg.text: Great Decore and more of the great simple food I Expect from any thing with Gordon's name on it

bdjAzSwkJIiSMCzZUF7K3g.text: Fish and chips for lunch.  'Nuf said.

xYJqA3hBHmyY7ZsmaMQaHA.text: Went here last night to check it out as it just opened 2 nights ago. All i can say is it was a 9 out of 10 experience on every level. From the hostesses to the waiter to the wine and menu selections.  The food was FANTASTIC, and might be the best food I've eaten in Vegas. I got the roasted cauliflower soup and the mixed grill of filet, bacon wrapped prawns and lamb ribs. The sides of brussels sprouts and english pub fries were equally amazing!  Everything was out of the world!!  I'll be going back for sure. Check this "pub" out!!

o0HPbwzzwdGGTDtc615ifA.text: Very good pub food. Had the Pub Spots, Deviled Eggs and Crisps I recommend this place.

JBuYeb9OH1LlAG8H1ealcg.text: Awesome restraunt. The atmosphere and decore are great. Even had to take a pic of the silverware :-) our waitress Brianna was GREAT!! She was very informative of food, beer and desert. I had the bangers and mash and my husband had fish and chips. The flavors of both were amazing. Would highly recommend this place. Great pick of Beers and the waitress even recommended one in which we are now fans of.. We will be back

ZjSALUwFpu3C9nfuWUXkrA.text: Our party of 4 was seated in a timely manner at a nice table (we had a reservation). We ordered drinks and 3 of them were delivered promptly, however it took 3 additional requests for my wife's non-alcoholic drink to be served. Our server was at best the craps. He was arrogant and unconcerned. Three of us ordered the fish and chips. When the meals arrived and we started eating. After the first bite, my wife started making a throaty sound. I looked at her and watched as she pulled a very long blond hair with fish pieces attached from her mouth. Yum!! I looked up and saw our server looking in our direction. He did an immediate "exit stage right" to a hallway. A manager came to our table as the waiter exited the room. He apologized and offered a different meal. Well to make a long story short, dinner wasn't the same. Out of their kindness, her meal was removed from the bill. Our server never once apologized!  GORDON, if you run your life criticizing people, get your property's in order first. SO DISAPPOINTED!! By the way, I gave 2 stars just because the manager noticed and my fish was good. Sorry I don't remember the servers name, but he was a 40's grey haired medium built man.

Eo11V2ADWAOjQGR_AsvQUg.text: Good service even when at full capacity. That's where the good ends. First of all $8 for a bottle of water!  8!  F u Gordon. That's almost as much as my entree, the duck poutine. I would have been better off sticking to water. The poutine was so salty it was inedible. Awful. And few if any curds. Two tiny slivers of dried out duck. Yuk. Do not want.

Wk8dwPnu30K_OjivE4upRg.text: This place isn't bad but is certainly not worth the price. My BF and I originally wanted to eat at Bacchanal but the wait was three hours long since it was Memorial Day. This was just a few feet from there so we decided to try it out since we just ate at Gordon Ramsay's Steak the night before and loved it. The service was great here and the appetizer was delicious (ordered the calamari). For entrees I ordered the bangers and mash and he ordered the fish and chips. Both were the house specials. They were good, nothing special at all though. I've tasted way better fish and chips in SB, SF, Pismo, etc and they weren't $30 like these ones. $30 was a bit ridiculous for fish and chips, but we thought Gordon Ramsay so it must be good. And there was a fish bone in it! Yeah, nothing special at all and portion was so small. My bangers and mash was good, but again, nothing special. I could make something that tasted like that at home for so much cheaper. The dish was $24. Not worth. Aside from that, it took 45 minutes to receive our food. The people next to us who came after us and ordered the fish and chips too got their food like 15 minutes before us. Only thing that was worth was the appetizer. Calamari tasted like bacon. It was delicious. Despite the prices, the server was excellent. I forgot his name but he was attentive. And gave us free sticky toffee bread pudding with ice cream for free for my bf's birthday. It was one of the best desserts I've ever tasted and I'd pay full price for it. Overall, not worth the price. With how much we spent individually we could've just ate at bacchanal and ate as much as we want with many options.

-fyW1CLaxBJbAKAe_xvwnA.text: Just celebrated my birthday with family and friends at Gordon Ramsay's Pub & Grill. My sister wanted to go there and try the Scottish Eggs and it was not on the menu. The waiter was able to get it for her even though the item was being removed from the menu. I tried it, and it was delicious. I ordered the fish and chips and the fish was outstanding. I'm not a big french fry lover and I ended up giving them to my brother-in-law who had the Shepherd's Pie. He said it was very tasty. At the end of the meal, the waiter brought over a Stick Toffee Pudding to celebrate my birthday. YUM! The fresh caramel sauce just clinched it and I can't wait to go back again.

TSg97P9C8bcY2LRCaOGWlQ.text: We actually thought it was pretty hilarious.. the soup we ordered was served first (butternut for me.. french onion for him) and it was fine..not fabulous but good and we were hopeful. Then came the pork .. considering the way Mr. Ramsay goes on and on, screaming and yelling at people about their ineptness in the kitchen it was downright funny. This meat was hard as a rock and completely inedible.  In the waiter's defense I did see him show this meat to the manager..stabbing at it as if to say ...see? and  no they didn't attempt to charge us for it.. they offered to make more but we were leery so alas we left  with our appetites only whetted. Kind of fun atmosphere, and nice waiter.. but oh Gordon how can you justify being so rude when your own cooks don't have it together?

eFL4_MtLpat22akX8IAsXQ.text: although it was a little pricey, this was the best meal I have had in a long time.  I got a simple shepherd's pie and it was perfect, my fiance got the steak and I kept teasing him about having a foodgasm.  They had an amazing variety of beer & wine and the staff was friendly, really loved it and would totally go there again.

1xlYVWhyLedoA0HddOJMOw.text: Very great atmosphere had a wonderful bartender so much that we came back to eat and it was awesome food SPENDY but worth it! Thanks Matt for the homemade Sangria!!

VIIBTixIQb_lC0EJ6hccuQ.text: I am only giving this two stars because the waiter was great. The food was ok, but generally bland and VERY overpriced. My wife got a salad with grilled chicken ($25) and the chicken was cold, left over chicken. The drinks were tiny. Overall, we just felt screwed. We planned to go to his other restaurants during the week, but after this was went elsewhere. I wouldn't waste your money like we did

A4Jzccpvayf_hojNKvYCgQ.text: Anyone break their tooth eating the beet salad?  I was there before the Shania Twain concert and ordered the beet salad that took well over 30 minutes to receive and we sat at the bar for faster service. On my second bite, I bit down on something very hard and realized something went very wrong in my mouth. The waiter, Adam, just happened to be looking at me and asking how was our food. I'm shaking by head NO and pulling the salad out of my mouth to see what was in it and found a very hard object like a rock. Then, I realized it had also broken my molar and ran to the bathroom to see the damage. It was so dark, I couldn't tell but touched the area with my finger and the nerve was exposed and sent me a zap through my body with pain. They called the EMT to write up the incident report, but by now the concert was starting in 5 minutes. We ran to the concert with my mouth in pain and came back to the Pub & Grill after the concert to meet with the EMT again to fill out the paperwork. Even the manager said, it was chewing on a rock and we also found many more smaller pieces in the salad. I had to wait until the next morning to get emergency dental care and found out I would need a crown after the temporary fix in Vegas. I ended up in bed all day with a headache, ruined vacation, missed event, and alot of pain, novocaine, and drilling...no fun!   Long story short, I was supposed to hear from Caesar's within 3 days...never happened! I called them to find out it had been passed on to CCMSI, a law firm who takes care of their injury claims. I was told they mailed me a letter...never got it. I was told they emailed me...never got it until I called again. They never ever asked me for any information or details of the incidence except the simple form of what happened that night and my 2 dental bills. The manager had indicated to keep track of my auto expenses to and from dentist...they had no idea and never asked how much this affected my life. After not hearing from them again for weeks, I kept calling. Finally, two weeks ago the assistant got back on the phone and informed me the supervisor decided they were not honoring the claim because they didn't consider the nut shell or whatever it was to be a "foreign object." I was shocked!!!  All I could think of was if Gordon Ramsay was filming a Hell's Kitchen episode and during the tasting time of judging personally ate the "foreign object", broke his tooth off, and swallowed a piece of his molar, would that be acceptable? I've also reached out to his company in London to NO AVAIL with an email to his press department and a message to his facebook page. They have no other email for coorespondence, except to call a London phone number.   After I called Caesar's again to let them know CCMSI had denied the claim, they offered to just pay my two dental bills for my broken tooth. Really? How about the  lost 4 days of my life, lost work, lost vacation, novocaine-drilling-crown for the rest of my life, auto expenses, not to mention all the pain and time it's taken to deal with CCMSI who has not represented Caesar's well at all. Here's the icing on the cake...there's another review in July, 5 weeks after my incident, with the same report of a shell or foreign object in the beet salad at Pub & Grill and he thought it cracked his tooth, but didn't. He even posted a pic with his review of the "foreign object". You would have thought the rock-like nutshell or whatever it is, would have been taken care of when it happened to me in such a big way. Obviously it hasn't. Now I'm talking with an attorney to get this resolved and I'm not a sue-happy person. Please message me if you've had a similar experience.  Gordon, as a business owner also, if you don't know about this, you should! Your name, personal reputation, Hell's Kitchen, and Food Network's reputation is on the line!! This was my experience from Hell and I wasn't even in the Kitchen!!!

THYItjHPRpzm9tK9k57reQ.text: This is based on happy hour. They don't have the things written down at the bar but we got the pretzels. They were ok. Like ones you heat up at home from the frozen section taste about the same. We got the free toffee pudding from checking in on yelp. Good thing it was free. It was ok. We also got a beer (can't mess up) and a mule that was good but pricey. We came, we saw, we won't go back.

UxYTt2t20Z4t7FiwaJt4Ug.text: Great food and great customer service! Nice eating environment, good prices considering the amazing food.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. I think this was called the ghost pepper burger. Delicious is what I called it.

gJCj0syTgvjJlPOmrrL__Q.text: Tesla was really really awesome!!! She served us the sticky toffee and we were in heaven...its the best dessert ever. You have to try it when come to Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill Caesars Las Vegas..YUMMY!

3W92fwV9sfO5QQ-c8Q-4rw.text: Came in with a party of 3 and all of us were really let down. First, They were out of the shepard's pie which was annoying. Also, service was very slow. It took about 35 minutes for our food to come out and the waitress only checked on us when we ordered and when the food came out. I had to flag her down several times and it was very annoying to wave like a lunatic to get her attention because she would never make eye contact.   We got the pot pie, steak pie, and salmon. No one in my party was impressed. My pot pie tasted like one I could buy frozen at the grocery.   On the plus side, my smores milkshake was delicious and a good price in comparison to other alcoholic shakes in the area and the bread pudding which was free with check-in was delicious!

Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Campfire smores milkshake, pot pie, and salmon.

DOozZFGbFNjuZxaWBpoexg.text: Very disappointed! Stop here for lunch. After reading the menu I was excited to try the BLT with marinated tomatoes and housemade aioli. The bacon was cold and probably cooked in a large batch hours earlier. The aioli was plain mayo, ordered on side and tasted it.Tomatoes were not marinated just fresh tomatoes. When I inquired about these two missing items the waiter brought me new tomatoes drizzled with olive oil and sprinkled with chives, really? For all the yelling and tantrums Gordon throws about sh@# food at other establishments he really needs to rescue his own restaurant. My husband had the fish and chips,  their signature dish, nothing special, cold fries greasy fish and no flavor at all. My advise eat in the food court adjacent to the pub and save yourself $100.00. I would have enjoyed losing this money on slots way more.

E7nTzrCJxzHtPLEalYODhw.text: this is located inside Caesar's palace hotel and casino. Great setup great food and great service. I enjoyed the soft crab sandwich. I opted for the French fries instead of kettle chips. I really don't care for kettle chips in general. Along with glass of Stella Artois this made for tasty lunch. For dessert I enjoyed the sticky toffee pudding. It was a nice relaxing lunch.

44TxA7LFEjNPCf3oDz4TQA.text: Delicious food and a we got a free sticky toffee pudding for dessert just for checking into Yelp!

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Delicious potpie! Came with a pretzel and small kale salad

38VErMItvrF7NoMRXO3rOA.text: Four stars the fish and chips are fresh, crisp and moist. The 2 filets of fried cod come sitting on a bed of steak fries with a side of authentic English smashed peas. The fries are seasoned well come with in house made ketchup, house made fresh tarter sauce and imported Sarso's malt vinegar. I think it's high priced for Fish and chips with the price tag of $30.00 but we are in a casino with a full bar and the famous Gordon Ramsey stamp on everything so it's fitting. With yelp check in you get a free dessert. Toffee dessert with scoop of delicious vanilla bean ice cream.

eCmEO6w-U0BxA5M1Qe84yA.text: Great food, better service 10/10 would come again. I ordered the lobster and shrimp roll, mussels with fries, 24 oz rib eye and black forest mushroom. Paradise city beer tale definitely would recommend. We came cause the buffet was too long of a wait, but luckily this place had no wait and made up for our expectations.

NDNEwULk3nnnqxnedyBb5Q.text: What a great place. That 2-5 Mon-Fri special was a great place for me while my husband was attending  a seminar. Airreon was  Awesome  bartender and very friendly. Imagine the surprise when he knew my name.....and I had only been there once before. Food was really good. Met some great people at this place. Cannot wait to go back.

oQa1dUx0ajmScITIIJGpRw.text: Took a date here a few weeks ago when I was in town. Everything was absolutely wonderful.  The waiter was polite, informative, and just an all around pleasure. The food was amazing. I've been looking for a decent steak and ale pie since my trip to London and not only after 10 years did I find one but it surpassed the ones in London by far.  Just an all around great time

ZSqM5NS9qOnYyw7F658aSg.text: Sat 8/6 This Place just gets better and better!  I was meeting friends from San Diego, They wanted a really good place to eat so I recommended Gordon Ramseys!  We've always ate at the bar, but now we had to get a table. I normally opt for a bar spot, since I am a good tipper and bartenders normally take care of my drinks. I was a little nervous because of the a few reviews on poor service, but we had the opposite experience here. ( This is why I don't add much into Negative reviews)  The night before we just had a party that Gordon Ramsey attended, so we were excited for another trip to GRPG!  The place was pretty busy, so I was hoping the service would be good. We were sat down right away in the back and our wait was named Adam. Actually we had two waiters and both their names was Adam.  We got our drinks and started off with the Short rib nachos. These nachos were actually better than the last time I was here and those were off the hook!  I had the Bacon Burger and my wife had the pulled Pork sandwich. My friend had the fish and chips - recommended by Adam.  My bacon Burger came and was well done like I asked. It came with a cone of fries, and to my surprise there was a lot more fries than I expected.  Fish and chips- My friends plate was huge and the fish was very fresh tasting. He is a big seafood eater and was happy with both the taste and the size. He stated the batter was perfect. Not a little fish overwhelmed by 10 pounds of fried batter. These were giant fish pieces.  My wives pulled pork sandwich was actually a little larger than she was expecting. She could only eat half. This plate comes with homemade chips as well. She has tried pulled pork sandwiches at some of the best places in Vegas and rate this the best. She likes it more than the Guy Fieri pulled pork sandwich, which I think is one of the best in Vegas.  Bangers and Mash: which consisted of chicken, beef & pork english sausages w/ mash potatoes, sauerkraut & onion gravy. My friends wife cleared this plate in no time. She ordered it without Sauerkraut (Which is a crime in most states) She stated that this was a very good dish as well and wasn't greasy like some sausages are.  We had a lot of drinks, between the Belgium Margs, Good Bye Blue Sky, Pub Crawl- wow were were feeling good after our meal. Drinks were 15 dollars a pop which is about right for a strip restaurant.   Both Waiters names Adam were great and met our every needs. They let us have a good time and knew the meaning of the service industry! We will be back in Nov for sure!!  Silly Tip that might only interest me: If your getting a to-go box, they are awesome and are like little Tupperware boxes. Can be easily reused :)

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Look at these Shortrib Nachos! Loaded with meat!
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. I had the Bacon Burger. Cooked just the way I like it- Well done. A ton of fries too and they are well done as well! Perfection!!!!
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. We had a great time and the food was amazing! Fish and Chips, Bacon Burger, Pulled Pork Sandwich! Bangers and mash too!

UrtPAiqLEDVbBSEaHTK6gA.text: For fear of being scolded by Mr. Ramsay I will avoid any negatives. Maybe.   I just got done attending a function at Caesars and was craving a burger, I'm talking pregnancy cravings here, enter Gordon Ramsay's Pub and Grill. I sat in the bar area was immediately greeted by a server who fired off the specials and took my drink order. I went looking for the burgers on the pub menu and very surprised when I saw that there are only four burgers offered. I'm assuming he keeps the rest of these juicy treats at his other place.   On recommendation from the server I went the Hell's Kitchen Burger. This spicy slab of beef comes topped with Ghost Pepper cheese, pickled jalapenos, avocado and a smoked tomato aioli. I love spice, flavor spice, not the "light your hair on fire", but the responsible and reserved use of heat when cooking. This burger was all that and more, the beef was cooked to a perfect medium, slightly pink and very juicy, so very food porny. The ghost pepper cheese had a slow burn and after a while it began to take hold, but not enough for me to stop. The smoked tomato aioli, pickled jalapenos and avocado were a flavor bomb of happiness that helped cool down my mouth with each bite. Seriously, call me a burger whore because I was all over this thing.   The fries were good, but basic and I didn't really finish them, but the burger portion size was plenty big and filled me up fairly quick. The main thing that did bother me was my seat, I felt I was sinking the whole time and had to keep adjusting my seat and/or style of sitting. This was a minor thing, but after a while it became annoying. I would have probably ordered another drink and allowed my food to settle, but I just couldn't get comfortable.    $22 for a burger? I'm not surprised you ballsy MOFO, but I'm even more surprised you could back it up.

Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hells Kitchen Burger.
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States

3sChp14TK5OQnYVI3DPaKg.text: Christian the bar tender is the bomb! He delivered Excellent customer service, was very attentive and had great personality. Made our dinner that much better! Would definitely come back :) oh and the food.. delish!

bU67u2mh2avBfRwc83wMBA.text: The bartending staff is great. My favorite appetizer was the sriracha deviled eggs. We had the butter chicken and lobster Mac for dinner which were both good. We'll be back next time we're in Vegas.

1xpyFeoZUY_0oKi-VI2khw.text: The service here is awesome and the food is incredible! The servers delivered the food quickly and were so kind and hospitable. Really impressed!!!!

YB2AaNB9PDxocqEpOfFm3Q.text: So wanted to try this for a long time... finally here.   Hostess got us seated right away. One plus.  Took a while for waiter to get our orders. Maybe 10 minutes. Well, place was busy so just waited patiently. It's fine.  Food came out in about 30 minutes. Not bad.   I ordered the Hells  burger: well, meh. Kinda bland. Meat was juicy but unfortunately flavor-less (is that even a word?) The fries were kinda chewy. Wasn't sure if I should be happy or sad. Was it meant to be??? McDonalds fries are crispy or crunchy. My wife liked the chewy fries. I found it ok.  Son and wife ordered the soft shell crab sandwich. That was GOOD. I finished my wife's sandwich. No left overs here.  Expected to be WOWED at least.  I'd say I'm a bit underwhelmed. Willing to give it another shot next time.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hell&#39;s Kitchen burger
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Soft shell crab sandwich

qeaE_bmuCiWH2u3qMVXHJw.text: The food was good but the service was a little slow. Once we had our drinks our server didn't come back until we put our card on the table. Food...We loved the Shepherds pie but were a little disappointed in the lobster Mac & cheese. It was good but not amazing!  The veggies were fresh and yummy. The truffle fries were really good. The salad side was good but very small (which is why it's a side). The beer was cold!  Good experience.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Side salad (fresh and good but very small)
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Truffle Fries
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster Mac &amp; Cheese

TYMpV-WGmkjs2Hq1dy6I9A.text: For a restaurant that is off the reputation of Gordon Ramsay I really expected more the burgers are okay they look like Smart & Final patties the beers and the drinks are super expensive and not worth it their fries and truffle fries definitely don't taste fresh won't return and don't recommend it

k9D88ABKliR-bS_6Qmn9Dg.text: Great food! I enjoyed a small side salad and the beef and ale pie! It was delicious! I wanted beef but not a whole steak. The dish satisfied my taste for steak 110%!! Also kudos to great service staff: Travis and Chris. They were awesome!!

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States

abybfjQwqLUGtM1FfJtLKQ.text: Pleasant experience. I had really high expectations because it was a "Gordon Ramsay" eatery. I ordered the butter chicken, I watched Gordon's video of it and I thought man that looks amazing. However, here it lacked flavor. The chicken was perfectly cooked, tender and fresh. However the sauce itself was bland, the rice was however cooked well and they did a great job with it. The truffle fries came out cold, we mentioned this to our server and it was changed promptly. The food was brought out in a reasonable time. The desert however omg, it was amazing! The toffee pudding? Cake? Toffee something! It was just mind blowing. The ice cream pairs really well with the warm Desert.

nGP288noRprKSjewk4QtyQ.text: We stopped here on a whim after walking around Caesar's Place. Located on the main floor of the casino toward the forum shoppes, you can expect a mix of British favorites and pub food. Oir server was very prompt and gladly recommended dishes. I ordered the butter chicken curry. The pulled chicken was a bit spicy and came with doughy naan and jasmine rice... a perfect amount of each. Definitely would recommend this one. Tre truffle fries were also really good and came with two types of dipping sauce. The others in the group enjoyed the lobster roles and shepherd's Pie... all tasty and fairly large portions.   Overall I would recommend if searching for a lower key restaurant in the area.

DmcRqloyFMUM-ppxg_YGiQ.text: We had the bacon burger with fries, shrimp cocktail and cesar salad. Burger n fries were delish! The shrimp cocktail was ok. Cesar dressing was very bland. So all in all it's ok. Not great, not terrible. So for the price I would look elsewhere.

uZbNSItqKDhvyol-OMRFKw.text: This Sticky Truffle!! I feel like God himself made this! Literally a piece of heaven on earth!

jxUpsdfVIcvGaxurxdTA2A.text: Sat at the bar with conference crew around 8 or 9pm. It was busy for table service.   Good service. We took most of the bar area and the severs were really nice getting around us. Very polite. Drinks and truffle fries, nachos, all good. Steak was surprisingly good.   Sticky toffee pudding is lighter than the traditional style but equally sweet!

-RI0lFFMFNtAo5mqSByiCA.text: Ramsay would barf if he ate at this place with his name on it. I got a simple over-priced burger ($23) and fries served on a wooden platter. I couldn't help but wonder how well they could possible clean that wooden platter? The burger was just okay and the fries were just warm - not close to hot. Ramsay would probably have thrown the fries at the waiter. The place feels really dingy, just not clean. The leather-like placemats were quite shabby and well past their prime. The place is adjacent to the slot machines, with no glass to separate you from the smell of stale, smoky air. Overall, a major disappointment not worthy of the Ramsay name.

b4eTn3ZuX_-e7PJ87iv1rg.text: Loved this restaurant. Great energy and excellent service. Awesome cocktails and are happy we made the choice to eat here. Loved the lobster shrimp rolls- to die for!  Their burger was amazing as well. We didn't have any other main entrees but what we did have, we loved. This is my 2nd time to dine here and I loved it. Well done, Gordon Ramsay and team!

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster and Shrimp rolls!  Divine
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Some of the cocktails. Delicious!
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Delicious. The Mule&#39;s Hind Leg

6skgaC6y3GB1S-zVOn-2fQ.text: My party and I originally wanted to go to Gordon Ramsey's Steakhouse but we couldn't get a reservation til about 4 hours later and we were hungry so decided to go to the pub & grill which was less crowded (20 min wait). So we were seated and a gentleman brought us waters. It's kind of dim inside. We proceeded to order:  Truffle Fries - $12 Nachos - $16 Butter Chicken Curry - $28 Fish & Chips - $30 Prime Rib (Special of the Night) - $55  The prime rib's flavor and texture were very good. I don't think they offer it all the time since it was a special. I also enjoyed the truffle fries and nachos smothered in short ribs, cheddar cheese & sour cream. The chicken curry seasoning was a bit strong for me and the fish&chips were alright. Kind of pricey for 2 pieces of fish but then again it is Vegas. Overall, good food & service.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The front.
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Food Menu
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Alcohol Menu

0iOyAqCCh9yxSVYs_Wo60Q.text: My wife and I wanted a nice place to have a drink and, no I don't watch his show. I hate reality television. Gordan Ramsay's Pub and Grill was really nice, great food and a fun experience. Ronnis, our bartender really helped make the experience there so much more enjoyable.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States

teX-4cJbNylMMHo1rCAXAg.text: Great lunch - nice and chill on our last day in Vegas and Rodney was very attentive and helpful. The soft shell crab burger was amazing and he recommended the sticky toffee pudding which is something I'll dream about for the rest of my life.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The mini pub burgers were so good!

5tyhszkCa220aLH6l-eOhQ.text: Dinner here was smashing great fun. Friendly service with a super attentive server lady wearing the cutest dress. I ordered shepherds pie which was so hot. I wish they told me to wait for to cool down. Mini burgers were paired up well with truffle fries. The bacon with cheese burger came with some fries, too. I liked the fries here and so did the baby. I ate with a great family and definitely enjoyed my drunk self at this pub. I checked in for my free dessert with the best vanilla ice-cream.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States

7nq35wVIien44k8F94T_oQ.text: Great food and experience!! Everyone was so friendly. This is my second time here and sitting at the bar. David was our bartender great personality and even remembered my sister and my names from the first time in. Suggested the pesto chicken sandwich and now I get it every time .. soooo good. Bloody Mary's are on point here too. Thanks for a great service and suggestions!!

TiQoYT8kf7pC05bkv6Dr-g.text: Wonderful fish and chips, done perfect, crispy, non greasy crust, light flavorful fish , with fat fries. Love the atmosphere and classy staff, expensive but it is in Cesar's Palace,

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States

wcJel32mi_oH38smDMNVmw.text: After three days of making circles inside Caesar palace It is clear that this is the best place for great food and atmosphere.   First visit was first day and food was good, service is always great here , and absolutely clean spotless , but you don't completely appreciate this place until day three. There were nice places in between with beautiful space and excellent service, including Hell's Kitchen, the food was just ok and expensive, but here everything was great !! And not just main dish, I mean every appetizer, every bite was great, thank you guys !   Very welcoming, service is excellent, food is excellent, price is very affordable.   We enjoyed everything but the wings deserve a mention, best glaze ever !  For steak lovers , the right answer is ribeye.

Dtqvdt8-bgI-7tl4vMLf1g.text: I got the beef wellington, roasted mushrooms, scallops, caramel pudding. All delicious and defined met my expectations. Many complain about service on their comments which I can understand because it is a bit slow (mostly in the beginning), but not too slow. You have to come here expecting to drop a load of money on everything though because just a beer itself is $11.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States

8clCBEitmChtqyr_K7MlAw.text: This was our second trip to our most coveted food destination on our Vegas vacation. We had to have one last go round here at the Pub and Grill for some signature Ramsay fare before we headed to the airport.   We were nothing but satisfied in our sequel venture. Our waiter Rodney was extremely helpful and added his own flair and input to the experience. He made us feel incredibly welcome and at home at our favorite eatery in Vegas.   Thank you to all the staff for the incredible food and we would be more than willing to hop back on the plane just for the Sticky Toffee Pudding!

milT-nG0vRVFynRi7lIExw.text: Chris P. was a great waiter! Fast and helpful! The beer war cold and nice! We order the fish and chips and tasted delicious!

m1D_ijPhEnYSS-cbwF1tSg.text: Came here for lunch and Rodney was our server. Everything was AWESOME! Gordon would be proud. We got the poutine appetizer (what could be wrong with gravy and cheese on fries in pic), the Shepard's pie, very good and the lamb burger which my boyfriend devoured.   The star of the show was the sticky toffee pudding. Holy moly, order that. I was too busy eating to take pictures of anything else.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States

9eEjKg0aXfjA-i5q5cDpAA.text: I had high expectations coming into this restaurant. Gordon Ramsay puts his name in front of a restaurant, it better be !#&@% amazing. That's probably Ramsay's motto. This dining experience was during Memorial Day Weekend.  What I did expect was that prices would be high, they were but for a fine dining experience they were typical of a Vegas restaurant. We had the crisp pork belly and brussel sprouts for appetizers. They were both pretty good.  The lamb shank I had for the main course was good and massive, I had a hard time finishing the meal. Eating the lamb shank by itself can become a bit bland, definitely need a light side to go with it.  Service was a little slow, the server seemed tired. It was Memorial day weekend so I understand how busy it can get.

g-CeS3daRg1uFuPIxdFelQ.text: Probably the worst Gordon Ramey restaurant I have ever been to! And I have visited quite a few from LA and in Vegas.   I would rather Uber and go eat at Gordon Ramsey BurgR restaurant at Planet Hollywood than eat here. Their burgers and fries were mediocre. The London -style pub atmosphere looks appealing and eye-pleasing but for taste and quality I was quite disappointed with this Gordon Ramsay establishment.   Yuck.

lkQpeoN9kx8W4iZUJbGM8w.text: I dined for lunch on a Saturday. I was seated at the bar, and unfortunately I wasn't in the mood for beer as they had a great selection of brews on tap. The bartender was quick to take my order and the wait staff were very friendly and appeared very much into providing a great experience.  I ordered the squash soup and it was serviceable but that's as much as I can say for it. It lacked the complexity I've had with squash soup at Mesa, Paley's Place, etc. Just a dollop of sour cream on top and served with garlic bread, so any crunch and extra flavor came from the bread.  I was truly looking forward to the sticky toffee pudding, as I LOVE sticky toffee pudding. The pudding part was perfect, a lovely dense cake. But the "toffee" lacked much flavor other than being sweet. I'm used to the toffee being much more, er, toffee-flavored. Also, the server brought it to me without a spoon and had to go look for one after pouring the toffee syrup over the cake. Ah, well, that will save me lots of calories in the future. If it had been as good as the ones I am used to, I would be dining here every meal while in Vegas. I'm happy others were pleased by it, but for me it was a complete disappointment.  This was my second time at a Gordon Ramsay restaurant and both have been disappointing, just lacking in much flavor and everything could use a dash of salt.

1BbISxeVZQgrP1mt4n2Zdg.text: Service was on point and knowledgeable. I made a seat reservation, but arrived early and was seated. Had the pork belly which was amazing along with the sticky toffee pudding.

35XDhE_TONwEgzAO1i3NKw.text: Our group of 6 was well taken care of during lunch. Our table had the lamb burger, shepard's pie, and ham sandwich as recommended by our waiter.  Great recommendations. We also had the mac and cheese and fish and chips which were good if that's what you're in the mood for. Drink menu on the ipad is a bit slow, especially since there's only one for 6 peeps.  Gotta give the waiters credit for slipping on them skinny jeans.

jizRw86QRdQvOEkM0kHl7Q.text: Prime rib was amazing. Came with Yorkshire pudding, brussle sprouts carrots and mash potatoes. Everything was fresh, well seasoned and cooked to perfection.

Bp2crl3_K4FRY6-LhkH5lA.text: Hmmm I think my entire food experience in Vegas is SALTY. Please Vegas chefs, cut down on the salt! I did enjoy my food here but it was definitely on the salty side. They start you off pretzel bread and some butter and cheese sauce. I didn't love that cheese sauce but bread was good. We ordered the kumamoto to start. Oysters itself were not bad, but definitely could use a better sauce. I ordered the sliders as my entree and the hubs ordered the shepherd's pie. I actually loved my sliders. I thought it was pretty tasty especially with the mayo based sauce. I didn't even ask for ketchup. The shepherd's pie looks small but is a lot of food and quite tasty as well with tender meat and delicious mashed potatoes. We decided to go all out and get dessert. The sticky toffee pudding looked really good in the picture. We were not disappointed. In fact it really made our meal quite enjoyable. Service there was good as well. In fact, Vegas overall provided excellent service.

eQAQ9yZt9A1rYMgwGO4PEA.text: Being in the restaurant industry at Caesars Palace, new restaurants have become common as of late, but Gordon Ramsey's newest endeavor has proven to be a gem among the rest. The environment was highly inviting and comfortable, a very beautiful modern restaurant with a British flair, not only in the decor but in the menu as well. The staff executed every stage of service flawlessly, with full knowledge of menus items and beverages. The iPad presentation of beverages and deserts added an extra interactive touch to service. The appetizers, bread service, beverages and entrees arrived with impeccable timing and were some of the most beautiful dishes I have seen. The overall experience was nothing short of what you'd expect from Chef Ramsey!

j5Ng2U_cI67Y3rW0S47yCg.text: Went here to eat on 8-13-13 and the website said business casual dress attire and I guess not everyone read that, people had hats on and tank tops, the waiter we had did not come to the table for 5 minutes and did not bring our drink order at all, good they did not charge us for it. Food was ok not worth the price, so if you want to say you ate at a Gordon Ramsey's restaurant, go but if you do not care do not waste the money, over priced food for the quality.

SY_1FaIgLcaBY5p5Up2Tfw.text: The food was pricey but excellent! We went for simple, classic pub foods- Hubs had the fish & chips, I had the shepard's pie- both were incredible.

A-0mqp3CMyH55rfSaPUI6Q.text: Horrible service. The scallops were great along with the pear cider. He handed the check to my husband as he took our dinner plates. He didn't ask if we wanted coffee or dessert and didn't give us a chance to ask for it. Felt kicked out and would discurage anyone from going.

arvNU46e9fhRUwGx1w9GXQ.text: We tried the Pub and Grill on our latest adventure and loved it!  Not sure why all the bad reviews here.  We were greeted and given a table right away, 11 pm on a Friday night.  Our server came by, got a drink order while we looked over the menu.  I ordered the Beet Salad and my fiance got the Burger.  Both were absolutely delicious!  We also got the sticky toffee pudding for dessert and loved it.  We had a great experience here and would not hesitate to come back again.  Discounted pricing for Total Rewards members is nice also.  As were were seated near the bar, we were able to see ESPN and catch all the scores.  Check it out, you'll be glad you did.

VBz-i1V0MlRLsbXP9qNrdw.text: REALLY disappointing... I ordered the fish and chips (I love fish and chips) and they were bland and boring. They also give you such a small amount of food that you'll still be hungry after you've spent $30 on something that tastes like something denny's could have pulled off. Maybe he should focus on his restaurants a little more instead of his TV shows. I would definitely not recommend this place! I had higher expectations and it was a big let down.

7yzq1YpdOVdgMmXgmrGfyg.text: Liked the atmosphere but  that as about it. I am not a big portion guy but thought the size of my order didn't match the price that came with it.  Overall nobody at our table was impressed and luckily me and my bro were buying or the two old guys with us would still be complaining. Big fan of Mr. Ramsay but my experience at this place was less than what I was expecting.

mryIMjRDEEpta7DbgpRhqg.text: There was a huge line at Hash House A Go Go, so we wondered over and decided to try Ramsey's.  The fish and chips were a real let down, and my brothers pot pie was child sized. My uncle and dad weren't impressed either. We won't be back. Wolf Gang Pucks in the MGM is stellar (try there).

JLjth-cWUDS1-_YSnTPovw.text: Was excited to be going to a Chef Ramsey restaurant since we are huge fans of his show.   Wasn't that impressed.   Started out good with super friendly wait staff, but when we had to ask three separate servers for more cocktail sauce we started to get disappointed.  We were going to go see Rod Stewart last night, so were kind of distracted.  The server recommended prime rib since they offer that on show night.  When she said it was market price and $48, I think we really didn't hear that part.   Expecting an enormous slab of meat with lots of potatoes and veggies, we were surprised to get an average size of meat and two small discs of potato along with 8 asparagus sprigs.   Granted it tasted good, but not $48 good.   No salad or soup offered as part of the meal or even bread.  To top it off, our friends ordered Shepard Pie and it was so small we thought it was out mashed potatoes!   They said it was extremely tasteless and were extremely disappointed.  I'm only giving 2 stars because the ambience was nice and the dessert was the best part of the meal.  Oh yea, calamari was just ok.   Not a great impression Chef Ramsey.

bIe-4YvG7w2-U25mYkJA9g.text: Me and my lady went there for dinner on New Years Eve and found it to be to our liking! The staff was helpful and friendly. We split a short rib (& cheek) sandwich, a beet salad, and a pint of New Castle on tap. It's loud because it's open and faces the Forum Casino at Caesars Palace. It's a fun place and I can't wait to go back!

ReJXfAtK3WIJD1bndd4ODg.text: Was at Caesar's on business...finished up about lunch time and ducked into this place for a bite to eat. Ordered the sliders and a caesar salad. Both items were tasty enough, but they also had issues.   Not that there is a lot of leeway on a small piece of ground meat, but the sliders were medium well or well done. Waitress didn't ask, so I would assume they'd come medium...no such luck. I mentioned this to the waitress, and she replied that she would "tell the chef". That was the end of the subject. No offer to take it back and refire, take it off the check or at least apologize. FAIL.   The caesar salad was good, but drowning in dressing. Ordered without the anchovies, and it came with them, as I found out by accident when I ate them. FAIL.   Joined the Caesar's loyalty club to save a couple bucks too, and they didn't apply correct pricing on the check. FAIL. After pointing this out, they finally corrected the bill.  Out the door, $35 for less than a quarter pound of burger with cheese and a caesar dressing salad with lettuce. Pretty embarassing, IMHO.   *Memo to Gordon: This place won't last long, serving mediocre and poorly prepared food. Service and preparation of the food was sadly lacking...basically a disorganized and lacking establishment. Let's just say I'm not eager to bet another $35 that it was just a "bad day". Despite this, I'm trying Gordon Ramsay Steak tonight...I PRAY that it's up to snuff. Otherwise, this guy is DONE with Ramsay restaurants. This was a Kitchen Nightmare for sure. Maybe you need to check up on your shops more often!

5NDTYZ_dxvUsai2V_gTJww.text: Had the salmon served on braised cabbage flavored with bacon.  It was fabulous!  Had to go back and have it again before I left Las Vegas.

0kzm8O8eIz_5XvYKGFJYdw.text: We visited Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill (inside Caesars Palace) on the first night of a business trip in Vegas.  I was prepared to be unimpressed, but the celebrity stamp on a fairly affordable restaurant specializing in the chef's country of origin was interesting enough to give it a shot. Also, the people I was with wanted to eat there.   I had an Innis & Gunn stout with the black truffle macaroni and cheese, which was EXCELLENT, and I've had macaroni and cheese in a billion places. The Scotch egg and salt and vinegar crisps (calling them that doesn't make them feel any more English than regular potato chips do, but I get it) appetizers were pretty spot-on... not amazing, but good drinking food.   Drink, meal, and tip landed just over $40. Good on you, Gordon Ramsay, for not charging the hell out of people for food that doesn't really justify its price tag. It's sort of a foreign dining experience--I won't call it authentic, but dark, pub-like, with living room-style chairs that were awkwardly low versus the height of the table. Fun and easily satisfying for groups and drinkers.  The service was mediocre that night; our waiter disappeared for long stretches, I had to ask for a water refill; it wasn't the worst service I've had, but it didn't warrant a hefty tip.  A couple days later, we stopped in again (The connected Forum Shoppes made us all tired... from all the shopping) for drinks. The bartender recommended cocktails from the menu, discussed each at length, and was super charming and attentive, even discussing other local restaurant recommendations and letting me sample a bit of a drink I asked about.  If you love English food (and I'm not sure anyone does), this place is doing it right enough to give it a shot.

YZtSnuYtRhiicUo0G4ZJWg.text: As a huge fan of Kitchen Nightmares, we were really excited to try Mr Ramsay's Pub in Ceasar's. So in his honor I am going to give a brutally honest review. There was definitely some excellence, the fish in the fish and chips were amazing, not sure any fried cod is worth $30, but that's just me. The "chips" were meh, slightly soggy potato wedges. The Hellfire Lollipop wings were tasty but a little tough skinned, overcooked. Our appetizer fries were tasty. My husband, a huge fan of Gordon, was hoping to have his mind blown by the shepherds pie. He said it was solid, rich, good, not quite amazing. My daughter ordered the Ceasar salad, it was barely mediocre. Something about capers sitting on a romaine leaf is just kind of weird and looked a little like mouse poo. For dessert we shared the Sticky Toffee Pudding and is was absolutely perfect. Probably one of the best desserts I have ever had. Our service was also great, attentive and friendly. Not sure if we will go again, but if we do I would order the overpriced cod again and definitely the same dessert!

5EvhMa6HO_PNW914D_Q2tg.text: We ate at Gordon Ramsey's Burgr earlier in the day and had the BEST service and BEST meal so our party decided to try the grill and pub for dinner... Service was HORRIBLE the waiter took one of our drinks to refill and never came back with it, I had to ask 2 diff servers for ketchup and by the time they brought it my fries were cold. The food was decent but not really what you would expect for Gordon's name attached to it. Oh and both my water glass and my friends were empty thru the dinner and never refilled or asked to be refilled. The waiter was no where to be found and it wasn't even that crowded. We dined there today, on a Sunday evening around 6-7pm. Oh and forgot to mention, they added a 18% gratuity for our group of 7, which we wouldn't have minded paying had we got 18% service! Overall we were all very disappointed and would not recommend this place however I would recommend his Burgr restaurant if your looking for a good burger and great service.

Xl2t9UjhPAGnM_c3A5hQ2g.text: Got into Vegas late on a Saturday. We were staying at Caesars so we wanted something quick so we tried Gordon Ramsey Pub. We had to wait about 15 minutes so we played some slots and sat down quickly. The hostesses were dressed like street walkers and the waiter's uniforms looked cheap and poorly designed. (It doesn't matter for the food, just the ambiance.) The tables, chairs, and multiple painted keg wall decor were all odd. Service took a long time but, Saturday night in Vegas. The margaritas were fantastic! We got burgers. I thought mine was OK as far as burgers go but my husband thought the tomato, lettuce and brioche bun were "off". He would definitely not return. I would in a pinch but only then. Disappointed, as we had high hopes in the Gordon Ramsey name.

Ht5ObKvlcP85YaT6BR4Eaw.text: LOVE this place. As soon as we sat down the bartender took care of us. The beer selection was great. Bartender that helped us was RAY RAY. He was amazing and made the whole experience awesome. We planned to have 1 drink each but ended up wih a lot more. Favorite bar in ceasars. Amazing service. Thank u ray ray Will be back again!!!

tpULoUZn1yPpjnaJmcAXmQ.text: This place brought back memories of my very first Elite event. It also brought back a bar set very high when it comes to food, service, atmosphere and everything that you should expect when dining in a Gordon Ramsay restaurant.  We had a 2pm reservation for fellow Elite Allison's birthday. She went with lunch for the group because it could be quite spendy depending on what you get. Well worth it for a celebration in my opinion.  Between our group we had fish and chips, lobster mac and cheese, scallops, the pot pie trio, and a couple burgers. Also, deviled eggs, pretzel bread, and Caesar salad for starters. I was lucky enough to try the majority of this stuff, and what stood out the most was: 1. The scallops. Not even a scallop fan but these melted like butter in your mouth. I would think Chef Ramsay was standing over the cook calling him a bloody donkey to make sure they were correct. 2. The lobster mac. HUGE chunks of lobster and a cheese that didn't overtake the flavor, but wasn't too bland either. 3. The deviled eggs. You stuff them yourself, and they have bacon. Need I say more?  Everything was delicious and I would order everything again. That says a lot.  The negatives, not much but they should have complimentary bread. When a burger cost $20-25, you could start with a little something. 2. The service was EH. Our first initial guy Chris, was great. But he left mid lunch and our next guy wasn't nearly as attentive or funny. He did not seem to enjoy his job as much. I wish we had have given the tip to Chris before he bounced, he earned it. The hostess were also a little snooty. Like hello, you are pretty, you're working for a famous chef, and you get to wear a cute dress to work- SMILE it won't hurt.   The positives outweigh the negatives by far which is why this is still a 4 star review. Until next time.
