jnoMrQGzFZcTO6B8Q3nicQ.text: Best experience ever! Exceeded all my expectations! Perfectly seared scallops. These weren't on the menu tonight but Alexander had them made just for me. Well worth the trip. A must go to for everyone traveling to Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Not on the menu tonight but made especially for me by Alexander!

26uTFkzxH05A9hbyfxA3Fg.text: If you are interested in an expensive night in the bathroom, give this place a shot. Disappointed and sick.

fpeXb6q-FcvM6BVKiMW74w.text: Gordon Ramsay's Pub was exactly what I expected, great food! I had the Scottish Salmon and my husband had the butter curry chicken. The curry chicken was cooked to perfection and tasted delicious. My salmon was amazing. Interestingly the skin was fried crisp and had a great flavor. I usually don't eat the skin, but this was amazing. The only thing that was unpleasant was that the restaurant was very packed, busy and noisy. The wait staff were still on top of everything. Great experience and will visit again since I am a local.

a09nCDR9zQY7qm-2Mxfinw.text: So sorry to talk about this but the food was cold . Service really bad. I called for the manager but they were to busy to help! I thought Gordon Ramsey was a professional. He should take a look at this place!

bdBfRVmIZ4Cn4RuZbes1XQ.text: I knew I wanted to eat at a Gordon Ramsay eatery when I went to Vegas. This dude is a beast and I watch most of his shows. So naturally, I would want to try out one of his restaurants. This place happened to be a 30 second walk from the Colosseum, as I was going to see Celine Dion afterwards. So, my boyfriend and I decided to try this place out. It's definitely pricier than BurGR over at Planet Holleywood, but not as expensive as Steak.   I would consider myself lucky after reading some reviews that wait time to be seated and for food to come out can be upwards of 60+ minutes. We did not have a reservation for that Friday night at 6 PM, but luckily the wait was just around 25 minutes. It took about 15-25 minutes for our food to come out. I was expecting much longer than that. The couple that sat down next to us waited much longer, though. It was probably about 30-40 minutes. We kept hearing them say "Why is it taking so long? What's with this hold up? *checks watch every 10 minutes*  The menu here is quite expensive for dishes that seem so simple to make. Lobster mac n' cheese for $25? Yikes. Yes, lobster is expensive, but honestly, I can probably make triple the amount for double the price.   [[Chicken, Kale & Bacon Pot Pie, $23]] For $23, I would expect a huge pot pie. Nope. It came out in this small bowl. I finished the thing in 10 minutes... It was good, yes, but nothing amazing or mind blowing.  [[Grilled Lamb Burger, $21]] My boyfriend ordered this, and he thought it was very flavorful and perfectly seasoned. The burger came with fries on the side, but $21 isn't worth it.    [[Truffle Chips, $12]] Basically some fries with truffle oil and a sprinkle of cheese on it. The fries itself wasn't too memorable, but the sauce it came with on the side was delicious.   Service here is pretty good; our server was attentive and asked us every so often how everything was going.   Would I dine here again? No. Prices are a tad outrageous (obviously, since it's Vegas, but c'mon now). Even if I was filthy rich I wouldn't. You're just not getting bang for your buck by eating here. You're just paying for the name.

-mdSwvz-s5UJrC4rMNJM_Q.text: Good food and service. I started with a scotch egg - done to perfection with soft yolk. Then went on to the shepherds pie with a side of awesome Brussels with bacon. Almost forgot mention the Ramsay gin and tonic which is really good if you like cucumber - which I do. In summary, recommended!

41Ftkd6X0OcsTACKwrbdJQ.text: I ordered the lamb burger.  The burger was great.  I asked to have the buns toasted and even inquired if they do double toasting, he said no but they toast.  And ill ordered truffle fries.  The buns were not roasted and half the fries were cold.  I was bummed.

k2m__EPLXz8D8d4vAYZ4sA.text: The food and service were fantastic, the portion size on the fish and chips happened to be to big and felt a shame to leave so much on the plate, especially because it was so good, my wife had the lamb burger and liked it.   will go back for sure

0uE432CVo3jqUpMYy49edg.text: Let me start: You will not be greeted with a smile nor a hello. The hostess will simply ask your name and tell you they will call you once you table is ready. ThT call/text is just a notification that a table will be up soon, and you're just waiting on a server. I get it, you're busy. Still doesn't excuse a rude hostess with a shitty attitude. The decor is nice and I loved the kegs on the walls. It was really unique! Onto the food, it was shit. Absolutely no flavor in anything. My New York steak had no seasonings, not even salt or pepper. The sauce it came with was delicious. It was warm and gave the steak a bit of flavor. Their house steak was just plain weird. My mothers salmon was ok. My sisters burger was the same as the steak, no seasoning. I'm not sure how anyone can leave here feeling happy with their crappy food, and even crappier service. Even the waitress,  who first brought us water, did not even says hello or look us in the eye. Honestly, the whole attitude of the staff seemed like they did not want to be there. Come by, take a picture of the kegs and leave.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States

eehphPiHxT70mtEKF7zD7w.text: Always a favorite. I am no stranger to fine dining and prime rib, best damn prime rib I have ever had and it's at a pub and bar. If there was a complaint to be had at all the mashed potatoes could use a little more flavoring but still... so good, it's wrong

EPbXzXW7efOTuU0T8ttx8g.text: I went with a group of 8 people. Everyone was disappointed. The food was bland and very expensive. I order the $45 ribeye and it was just average. Because there are no sides with the steak (or any meal) the waiter suggested I ordered one. I paid $11 for slimy mushrooms. My husband ordered the Shepherds Pie for $25. It was very small and lacked flavor.   I'm so disappointed that we spent $129 for a dinner that was only average. Each person at our table had the same feeling. I won't return.

Zr7GOqMRAGgfflCMii91Pw.text: Came here for lunch. No house bread during lunch but prices are the same as dinner.  Had the shepherds pie and fish and chips. The shepherds pie is like a beef stew under a bed of mashed potatoes. It tasted exactly how it sounds. I was underwhelmed.  Fish and chips were good but not the best I've had. The fish was light and crispy. The fries were plain and boring.  The sticky toffee pudding was good but the one at Gordon Ramsay Steak is way better. Even our server said so.  After a mind blowing meal from Gordon Ramsay Steak, this place really underwhelmed. Nothing tasted bad but everything was just average.  Make sure you have a Total Rewards card for better prices on most dishes.

FO-z8lMWYgOBzp5TeiVOQA.text: Had dinner here with our friend. This place was DARK, like we could barely see each other dark. The service was whatever, nothing great.  BF just had an appetizer of Toad in a...something? I don't see it on the menu. It was a sausage wrapped in puff pastry, served with a super spicy mustard and onion gravy. The sausage was pretty good, the onion gravy was delish, the mustard was way, way, way hot.  I had Fish & Chips - very under seasoned. The fries were good, but obviously old, they were pretty mushy. The tarragon tarter sauce was tasty, as was the house made ketchup.  My friend had the Shepard's Pie and he thought it was great.  Overall, I thought it was just an okay meal. It wouldn't be on my list of places to try again, but in a pinch, it got the job done.

2GAWkjPWw56r-E5ShyrQlQ.text: First time in a Gordon Ramsay restaurant.. were huge fans and always wanted to go but anyway . This is definitely the more affordable of his establishments and has a great menu to select from. The lobster rolls were ah-may-zing !!! It was everything we were expecting and more!! Can't wait to try his steakhouse next . :)

OhMCIMBqDpzP3k4sNpzxxA.text: Amazing Super Bowl viewing party! The manager Randy made the evening. Spent allot of time trying to find a seat for us and was incredibly accommodating for us last minute. We even won a prize helmet at the halftime raffle. It was allot of fun and we'll be back next February. Great drinks. Thanks Randy!!!!

STbWaCIkmxb0vWVDpjhsMg.text: Excellent service and food. Had the pub burger and toffee for dessert. Burger was juicy and very tasty. The dessert was the icing on the cake so to speak.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pub burger

W9UrD05TMV_MCDydzmZisw.text: My last stop on my Gordon Ramsey restaurant adventure, and I'm ending it at the Pub. It has a great look. Very laid back just like an English pub. More of a relaxed atmosphere where you just kick back and relax with a drink and unwind.   I came for lunch and was seated right away. Again great service. Very attentive server. Explains to me everything about the pub, and drinks they have as well as the food. Now I'm a big Chef Ramsey fan and I've seen his dishes at the pub on his shows that he did in Europe and I was extremely excited to finally get to try it.   I had his signature Shepard's pie. OMG! Amazing! The beef and lamb stew with the creamy potato layer on top was fantastic. The meet was very very tender and had so much flavor. I also tried his signature fish and chips. By far the best fish and chips I've had! Big tender flaky fish fried to perfection with a light crispy batter. The crunch on the outside was great. The batter was thin and lots of fish on the inside! Amazing! The fries were just as good. Any time you get fresh cut fries it's always good! For dessert again I got his signature sticky toffee pudding. This one is similar to his steak restaurant. Served hot but with out the brown butter ice cream like the the steakhouse restaurant. Came with a vanilla ice cream.   I had an amazing time at all 3 of his restaurants in Vegas. The food is amazing, he really knows his food and it shows. I'm definitely a bigger fan now!

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sticky toffee pudding!
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fish n chips are DA BOMB!
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Amazing Shepard&#39;s pie!

rWgc8dfZwB0CVtM6_Wzzsw.text: I was totally disappointed with the food. The burger was cooked properly and served cold as were the fries. The lobster mac n cheese wasn't as good as the stuff from a box. And the sticky toffee pudding just didn't have any toffee flavor. For all the tv shows that Gordon Ramsay does it is mind boggling that any restaurant with his name would be so mediocre.

Gxh1Io7CPZqYV89MmpL71g.text: By far my best restaurant experience. Prices are very good for being fine dining. Everything we had was great! Beef Wellington, seafood grilled platter, crab cake and a chocolate mousse desert.

rrF_Yn7FKI_NjFrK43ZdZg.text: Looking for a quick bite with 4 others in Caeser's, and came across Gordon Ramsey's Pub & Grill.   After a quick wait (~5 minutes), we were seated in a booth in the back of the restaurant. Atmosphere was nice, and what you'd expect from a British pub.   Server was very attentive and provided us with some recommendations/customer favorites. We ended up ordering the Calamari to start, which had just a hint of heat and was the highlight of the night. It was a perfect share for our group, as the portion size was quite big.  For entrees, three of us ordered the Butter Chicken Curry as it was pitched as the famous dish there. All I have to say is "yikes". The dish came with a very small portion of basmati rice, doughy, disgusting naan and bland chicken. It was incredibly underwhelming, particularly for $28. I can only imagine that if Gordon actually tasted this good himself, he'd soon be scraping it into the garbage.  3 stars for a decent tap list and good service. Butter Chicken is microwave-dinner levels of quality, though.

xxAJojz8C0kLaecKVFSvTQ.text: Was a expecting a good dining experience. But no. Food was at best warm. The Fried calamari was soggy. Not at all crispy. We order medium rare steak and gave us well done. Service was bad too. Like they don't care... maybe people are overworked...

ykWgfNN1ZDgOLQuyYUQADw.text: Not only was it Valentine's Day but it's Gordon Ramsay lol.  We decided to have dinner in the lounge area it was perfect for a romantic dinner. We were handed an iPad so we could view the drinks they had available.  I had the HK antioxidant drink it was the perfect combination of fruits and the overall look of the drink was beautiful. For dinner we had steak and roasted chicken and sides of asparagus in some type of cream as well as roasted potatoes. We didn't have to wait a very long time for our dinner to be served and that was impressive considering that it was Valentine's Day and it was dinner time. After dinner was done everything was picked up off the table and we were offered more drinks.  When the check was given to us it was wrong...And if we're paying 400 for dinner, i most definitely expect the check to be right.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States

4v9oGWLtpP-Ml9JmwB9fjA.text: Who's out of chardonnay? Not off to a good start Gordon Ramsay, and you weren't even there!  Also, the beer I wanted,  Old Speckled Hen was not available, but they did generously charge us for it.  In other news the food was very good. I had the butter chicken curry and enjoyed that very much.  Sara's salmon was fabulous... however the chopped salad while huge was a disappointment,  a lot of lettus and not much else. Very pricy for wasy it was,  but it is Vegas, so there's that.

I5crpUHTHEZ4kxvmrEfhGw.text: All the food here is delicious! So much that I even went back to the same restaurant a year later to have dinner.   I highly recommend the beer braised short rib (seasonal item). The dish is really flavorful, the meat separates when you use a fork to cut the meat into smaller pieces.   The truffle fries are great too, a bit oily but so flavorful! The fries don't taste like cheap truffle oil either.

3YFrJazOwEfXOQNIeyijtw.text: My husband had the ghost burger and I had the man burger with truffle fries. The lamb burger was juicy, not at all dry which I was worried it might be. It had curry onions on it and it was pretty bomb. The truffle fries were amazing and didn't even need any of the dipping sauces it came with.

-TJxVvUZlYmAN0hVBl4R1g.text: My husband & I were so excited to try this restaurant, we really love Gordon Ramsay's shows and my husband takes cooking tips from him all of the time. The restaurant was a let down. My tenderloin was fairly dry and you could tell his ribeye wasn't brought to room temperature before cooking (as Ramsay says to do) because of the coloration in the middle. The garnish of asparagus was cooked to the point of complete mush, and the lobster Mac & cheese was not bad but a little bland. I will say the appetizer mini lobster rolls were great & the best thing we ordered. Our total bill for what I just listed came to $164 before tip - OUCH!! Especially for food that wasn't impressive. I would not come here again.

OrgzFYooeXCYkoyZZtbsVQ.text: Over cooked burgers.  Fries were soggy.  Generally disappointing.  Also pretty darn expensive.

TB6ah1wKbNrCki6PlaLF-Q.text: The Gordon Ramsay.... you pay for name. If Don't expect something super special then you be fine. Me and my wife had lobster and shrimp sandwich and fish and chips for lunch and I replace the fries with truffle oil fried. Lobster and shrimp sandwich? 2 bite and it's gone pay $15  and truffle fries and chips for $30? 2 thump size white fish and small size fries. Fried fish was good but truffle oil fried was cold. I mean cold. I asked my waitress to replace the fries for .e and she was very friendly to do so. Bill came out to be $56 with just tap water. I paid for your name this time RAMSAY but, aren't you embarrassed about your food quality?

q_MVaStaAmjtHYPPDCiJeA.text: We had dinner tonight at 8:30 and it was a very bad experience. I ordered a hamburger and a plate of scallops. We waited at least 20 minutes just for those two dishes. We politely asked the waiter about the food delay and he said sarcastically "This isn't fast food this is a restaurant". I felt really offended. I expect more from a restaurant that is owned by a famous chef Gordon Ramsay.

203Km_O9jFkk2QFGFTlKJA.text: Oh my god! DO NOT eat here! Chicken feathers still on our wings! Un-frickin-believable! Shame on you chef for letting food go to a table like that! Horrible!

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States

U-aLaLg-ef0YlbCVUqG-og.text: Here for dinner at 6:30 p.m. on a Friday night, July 4th weekend and we were seated immediately.  A square table for four, we sat in our mismatched, padded high back chairs.  All of us sunk.  Me, a 6' foot tall man, having to arch my arms up to grasp a fork and knife.  I felt worse for the girls.  I used to work with interior designers so all I could think of was, "Who picked out these disfunctional chairs for the restaurant?  Does anyone height check to see that they are suitable to dine in?  Are there some telephone books I can put beneath my bottom so that I can see what's on the table?"    Very important... There are two menus here.  The full dinner menu and the bar snacks/small bites menu.  No matter where you sit in the restaurant (at the bar or not), you can order from the bar menu.  If your server doesn't hand one to you ask for it.  Some of the dishes over lap, but there are others that don't.    Bread Basket - Good.  There were four different breads, including pretzel bread with bacon bits and caraway seed buns with pumpkin seeds on top. A salted butter and a cheese dipping sauce.    Little Piggy Deviled Eggs - Could definitely taste the bacon in the deviled egg spread.  They serve you four egg whites empty and you fill them yourself with however much deviled egg spread you want.  It wasn't whoa crazy crazy, but everyone enjoyed these.    Fresh Fried Potato Chips with Herbs & French Onion Dip - The potato chips were my favorite food of the night!  Light and crispy, perfect for snacking on.  I could've downed the whole bowl of chips myself, but I opted to share.  I think it's $2 more if you'd like them done Salt & Vinegar style.    Fish and Chips/Cod and Chips - Three generously sized pieces served with mushy peas (mushed peas mixed in with whole peas) and fries.  I liked the peas better than the fries, which is sad because usually the potato always wins with me.  The fries were too soft for my liking.    Pan Seared Diver Scallops - My friend loved and devoured these.  4 large scallops with artichoke hearts, carrots and spring garlic.  A light dish for pub food.   Sheperd's Pie - The other friend said this was okay.  No complaints.    Burger - Was okay.  My friend swapped out her fries for the Smashed Fingerling Potatoes at no extra charge.    Smashed Fingerling Potatoes - Wanna enjoy your meal that much more?  Swap out your fries (or some other side) for this.  The fingerling potatoes have much crunch and flavor than the fries.  Cooked with butter, double cream and black truffle!  Mmmm... the truffle.  So rich but so good!  A few notes and thoughts:  If you don't have one, get your Caesar's Players' Club Card before eating here.  Each dish is discounted $1-2 as long as one person in your party has the free players' card.    The restaurant is pricey considering it's "only" pub food.  I know, I'm in Vegas... pay to play.  But $28 fish and chips and a $20 burger?  There was no "wow" factor with any of the major dishes.  Food quality overall is not whoa, but it's solid.    They have a good selection of beers, but I thought they'd have more UK beers on tap.  They didn't even have Smithwick's or Harp on tap or in a bottle.    Our server was nice and brought us all that we needed, but it took awhile to track her down a couple of times because she had too many tables to watch.  The restaurant could probably schedule a couple of extra servers on the weekends.    Overall it's 3.5 stars, with price knocking down the rating.  When it's $180 for four people with three of us having one drink each (and no wine), that's pricey for pub food.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fish &amp; Chips with Peas Two Ways/Mushy Peas.
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shepherd&#39;s Pie.
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pan Seared Diver Scallops.

rMi8GCddJS8Fm4AOcnIfng.text: I cannot express enough how phenomenal my experience was here.   To begin with, the entire restaurant is perfectly designed, down to the outfits worn by the hosts, waiters, bartenders.   But of course the food is the real star. I ordered the fish and chips that was caught that morning, and it was absolutely divine. We also ordered the mushrooms which we could not get enough of. But then we met the top contender, the famous Toffee Pudding.   The toffee pudding was absolutely to die for, and now tops my list of best desserts I've had in my life, and I'm a total foodie. It isn't really pudding at all, but a toffee cake with ice cream and hot toffee sauce. If you are in Vegas, you need to stop here JUST for this dessert.  The drinks are also incredible! I had the mocha cocktail (?) and it was delicious and worth the price.   Finally, the service. Wow, so incredibly kind. They were so helpful as to walk us through a shortcut to our upcoming show in another casino. Overall they were just so friendly and fun that I would go back just to chat with them one more time.   This restaurant really should not have less than 4.5 stars and that's a minimum. You won't regret your visit!

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Literally licking his chops as he eats fish and chips!
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The best dessert of your life!

UuwTfxTORF2YLumF7KOPAg.text: This was our favorite meal while in Vegas!  The fish and chips rival the fish and chip stands in Britain. The rib eye melted in your mouth. And to finish off the amazing meal we had the sticky toffee pudding. So so so good.

x9cuvdlg82vbaW4Jet0bzw.text: Located in the beautiful Caesars Palace, Gordon Ramsey's Pub & Grill is a beautiful and tasty spot that I would definitely recommend visiting!  We were a party of five and we immediately got seated in a beautiful set round table. The whole place has a very British vibe which isn't surprising considering the man who opened it. It felt very comfortable and intimate which I truly loved!  Our server 's name was Sarah and I really have to say she took the experience from a four star to a truly exceptional one! She was knowledgable about both the menu and the specialty drinks. She was so friendly and bubbly and she really went above and beyond to make sure we had an amazing time and that's something I can't praise enough! She made excellent drink recommendations which I am so glad I took! Because of her I tried the most decadent Strawberry Beer! Something I've never had the pleasure of trying. It was presented in a champagne glass and it was not only delicious but visually stunning!  We started with quite a few appetizers; Warm Pretzels, Calamari, Truffle Fries, And Lobster Rolls. ( Don't judge there were five of us and we all shared!)  All the apps were very tasty but the definite stand out were the Lobster Rolls! Big juicy pieces of tender lobster wonderfully paired with a beautiful sauce and some small bits of cucumber for a nice crunch!  For our main dishes two of us got the Brisket Sandwich and the other two of us got the Lamb Burgers.  The Brisket Sandwich was absolutely delicious and absolutely huge!! Like two hands, jaw unhinged huge! I ended up taking my other half home! My fiance really loved the Lamb Burger, I sadly didn't get to taste it because I'm not the biggest fan of Blue Cheese, but both the guys finished theirs in a matter of minutes so it must have been tasty! I really like that all our entrees came with fries. I hate when everything is super pricey and al a carte. This really felt like you got what you paid for.  Lastly we got two orders of the Sticky Toffee Pudding. Please order this. I know you might be so full and you don't think you can make it one more bite but I promise you will be sorry if you don't!  Gordon Ramsay definitely did not disappoint! I can't wait to try some of his other restraints in Vegas!

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Toffee Pudding
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ask for a side of their garlic aioli for your fries! So good!
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Brisket Sandwich

U86CGb6RxjQmdyYLKPr1hQ.text: My husband and I went there on Valentines Day 2018.  We decided to get the Valentine Day special.  My husband's clam chowder soup was cold and both of us had the lobster on risotto. Our lobster was under cooked . I had the arugula salad- which was just that- the greens with a flavorless dressing. We were very disappointed. We chose this restaurant because of its proximity to where Elton John was preforming and we were attending the show. Maybe we should have ordered off the regular menu- this meal was a major disappointment.

RwFCJy8UJ-Bhj5z7vunSSA.text: Bland and mediocre at best. Food was basic, under seasoned, and lacked any complexity of flavor. Honestly, this place is on par with Applebee's for several of dishes.

7MiKFh645q3n5t6doXZLrQ.text: Honestly wasn't too impressed by GR Pub & Grill.  I think when a celebrity chef puts their name on a restaurant, we assume that it should be spectacular but that isn't always the case.  We came by for dinner since the other half is a big fan of Chef Ramsay.  He watches Hell's Kitchen religiously, while I can barely tolerate all the yelling and drama.  I will say that I do like to watch his show Junior Master Chef though...but I digress.  As expected, the place was packed.  Especially since it is located across from the Colosseum, many people (myself included) wanted to eat dinner there before the Mariah Carey concert.  We arrived and were told it would be about a 20 min wait.  That worked out fine and we were seated inside for a table of two.  The ambiance is very pub-like with and I imagine there are actually some pubs like this in England.  Our waiter was just so-so.  We told him that we were in a hurry bc we were going to the concert after dinner.  He didn't really seem to care much and it took longer than expected to get our food.  25 minutes later, our salad and burger finally arrive.      The two items we ordered were just average and we could have gotten the same level of food at any bar and grill: -Pub Chopped Salad ($16):  I will admit that the salad was very fresh and they did give a lot of shrimp and grilled chicken.  The salad also contained ham, sliced apples, chickpeas, cherry tomatoes, white cheddar and pretzel crisps (their version of croutons).  It was supposed to have avocado too but I only found 2 small chunks.  The pretzel crisps was a nice touch which I liked.  -Grilled Beef Burger ($19):  Huge disappointment.  The beef patty was dry and unseasoned.  The only toppings on the burger were two slices of white cheddar.  There wasn't any lettuce or tomato so it made the burger completely lackluster.  A small side of fries accompanied the burger.  Presentation was nice as it came out on a chopping board but that's as far as it goes.  Total tab was $43.  Overall, not worth the hype or anticipation.  You could get a better burger at so many other places and probably for half the price.  The other half said that even Habit Burger was better.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Burger and chop salad in background

7bW_BfNjne_mZBC6i6JkNw.text: Gordon needs to be fired from the kitchen.  We ate here last Friday (party of 6) and felt like we were rushed through the entire evening.  All food items we tasted epwere very mediocre and prices were off the chart.  $30 for the fish and chips and $22 for the burger which was unimaginative and small in size.  Even the beer and wine were overpriced for a pub.  We ate here out of convenience because we were staying in Caesar's but will not return as there are far better places in the Linq area and other hotels across the street.  Gordon must be making a high profit margin on this restaurant.

GKCIR2-59LAXbsr-MyI8yg.text: I am very weary of "celebrity restaurants". We only went here for late night snack and also the hubby wanted to try a Scotch egg. The food was ok but not impressive enough to come here on purpose. Better off going to Earl of Sandwich for late night noshing.

9b6vTK4c5DJ8IgnvTJQJXQ.text: Service was poor. Waiter cleared table of food prior to finishing the meal. Waitress was non-existent and was somewhat rude. Waited over 10 mins for check and rarely saw her after she took my order. Took another 5 for her to pick up the check and return it for signature.   Ordered the madras chicken which was good but very spicy.   I'm guessing if Gordon was here tonight there would be a lot of profanity as the service wouldn't come close to meeting his high standards.

8s8Sz4njcyMkGbHw8Rlnlw.text: Awful. I was shocked. Long wait and sub par food at the very best. I wish I had taken a picture of our food... Chicken Caesar salad was the most pitiful thing I've ever seen... smh

skuTQuc1UQOWuWnnEai8Ww.text: It wasnt that busy but we had to wait for a very long time. The place is nice inside but we got sitted outside. It wasnt pack inside at all. What a waste!! Waitress was very nice so even though the food was really bad and we still gave her good tip. But we will not go back for sure. We waited a very long time for our food and finally we got our food, but Steak was way over cook (almost well done) when we asked for medium rare. The good thing is that she took it back and waived from the bill. We realized we went to the wrong Gorden Ramsey restaurant. We suppose to go to Gorden Ramsey steak in Paris hotel. We were disappointed that this is one of Gorden Ramsey's restaurant because he has high standard for his chef from the show. We didnt enjoy the dinner at all because everything is just so bad.

CVjhOAmdOY7PqpElDBoRgw.text: GR P&G is awesome.  I like to sit at the bar, it's a perfect spot for people watching and great conversation with staff and diners alike.. Everyone is having fun. The extensive (almost overwhelming) on tap selection of beer is always ice cold. The menu has an authentic (with a twist) pub feel. Over several visits, I have had: The Yorkshire Ale battered fish and chips, which were more than fantastic, the amazing, house made, warm Salty pretzels and Mustard, and the best of the best... The Scotch Egg. Can't wait to go back again.

Zm6vwgeXmmyHRRbKCW6UyQ.text: I remembered reading decent reviews about this place, so I stopped by for a quick bite at the bar. Horrible service from the bartender. I had to ask for utensils after my meal showed up, he didn't refill my ice tea until I was finished with my meal (it sat empty for 10 minutes). After I said I was done and he cleared my dishes, I had to wait over five minutes to get his attention so I could ask him for the bill. And the food was almost as bad. Lobster rolls were close to inedible- the menu states: server "on Lemon Poppy Seed Brioche". It was more like a toasted, dried out dinner roll. I love lobster rolls and this was the worst I've ever had.

thM9MuwdmhpX-pq-vyQv7Q.text: A wonderful first experience with Gordon Ramsay's establishments.  The have an excellent selection of beers.  We opened with the scotch egg which was amazing.  I ordered the shepherd's pie which was the best I'd ever had!  Amazingly good.  Finally, we finished with the toffee pudding with ice cream.  Unbelievable!  So good.  Best dessert I can recall having in a long time...  Highly recommended.  The price was not low per se', but it was lower than many Las Vegas restaurants and has better food.  We'll definitely go again!

sUSM6fGsW-iZ0cThniaJ0Q.text: Went there on May 26th, 2013 at 7pm.  There were 3 in our party and we were asked to wait 45 minutes.  When we returned, we were promptly seated.  About 10 minutes later, our waiter showed up for the first time to take drink orders.  By that time, we had already decided what we wanted for dinner.  Another 10 minutes later, the waiter returned with water and took our order.  Our appetizers arrive about 10 minutes later and the food was excellent.    Now for the not-so-excellent part.  After we finished our appetizers, we waited an additional 40 minutes before I started trying to find our waiter and ask him where our food was.  We noticed several other groups of people come in and get their entrees less than 20 minutes after they were seated.  Once I finally found him, he said he would check on it, and returned 5 minutes later with "You food is next up, I just checked".  20 minutes later, I was ready to leave and got up to find our waiter for the bill. I tracked him down again, and reminded him that we'd been there for almost 1.5 hours.  He gave me the look, then disappeared.  Another 5 minutes goes by, and finally our food shows up, right as we were about to bail.  The food was hot, outstanding and completely awesome.  It just took forever to get for some unknown reason, and I don't need to tell you how frustrating it was to watch people come in 10 minutes after you, get the same food you ordered, finish their meal and then leave, all before your food shows up.  Even though it was completely awkward, our waiter did apologize for the delays, but made no effort whatsoever to make it right.  No manager, no reasonable explanation, nothing.  Just a $144 bill.  It took us less than 15 minutes to eat the food that took them more than an hour to prepare.  So, the food was awesome, but the service was absolutely awful.  It was actually like participating in an episode of Hell's Kitchen, wondering if you'll ever actually get the food you ordered.  Except in this case, we got the "pleasure" of paying $144 for "participating" in this rather disappointing episode.  Gordon Ramsey seriously needs to tune this place.  Incredible food coupled with incredibly awful service essentially equals an awful experience.  With so many other awesome choices available for an outstanding dinner, I absolutely cannot recommend this place.  Even though the food was outstanding, we still left disappointed, and no one should pay $144 to come out of a restaurant disappointed.  We ordered:  Corn Soup English Ale Onion Soup Sheppard's Pie Filet Mixed Grill Fish'n Chips  NOTE: The Sheppard's Pie was the best we've had EVER.

lsi_sB9zEErKmGd8PsUfgg.text: Not the best place for me. Cousins from NY come to visit us and going to see Celine Dion show and we reserve here. The interior style restaurant for younger people, not comfortable with small tables like Bar. And they bring the food in big square pieces of wood so imagine that (4 person) not to much space to look where I can put my drink, on the floor?   Menu looks nice with a great variety of different tasty choices but the food is not good. I feel expensive prices if you compare this with the flavor. We ordered appetizer, entree, dessert. And no one said a word about how good it was.

ittJRKQwfdBUIYQUR5xApg.text: The food is really good and the staff are pretty chill. There is a large selection of food and beer. The bartender helped explain some beers so they seem pretty knowledgeable. The decor is pretty cool and the seating arrangements are pretty nice. The take on pub food adds a new experience to this type of food. My favorite is the fish and chips, but the sticky toffee pudding was really really good. As expected, this place is expensive so be prepared to shell out some money. All around a good experience, and I would come back.

hLVV4EFNgk3ycuR1BJ60aQ.text: Simply put..... "Not impressed". Unimpressive menu and we won't be coming back, as there are to many truly better options in this amazing food Mecca.

AljUgFFb7-Sn_L7rkv3zyA.text: Since I've eaten at pubs throughout England I was a bit disappointed.   Obviously,  you are only paying for ramseys name, because if this is how he cooks then he needs a new profession.  We ordered pretzel sticks, bangers n mash, and fish n chips.  I've fried fish that tasted better.  The fries were so limp they should be put down.

_P2Jz-UyLuAnVIlXzVj4mw.text: Not so great !! Over priced food that would probably take you 15 min to make at home. And the waiter and waitresses look like they hate there life work there especially the hostess. Fish n Chips not good and not worth the $30. Lazy dogs fish n chips better.

e3AOTBvvu7zKKOTGvQkCEg.text: We are there for dinner on a Saturday.  It was packed and the place is absolutely huge.  The bartenders are awesome and have great personalities.  We ordered a few sandwiches, apps, etc.  Everything was absolutely delicious with one exception:  the "lollipop wings" were inedible.  Disgusting and dry, in fact.  So, grub it up and enjoy and skip the wings.

9TkwQUVDAb1rl6OW97e4hg.text: What a great experience we had at Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill in Ceasars palace! Our server Yaneisy was awesome and so personable! She recommended food and drinks to us and was spot on! We've been to many places here in Vegas but this is one to for sure to visit ! Oh and the manager Michelle is just as nice and by far has a great staff!  Five star place for sure!!

UYQ7jBC6g2fF38-1RMLhLg.text: I had the Caesar Salad with grilled chicken. The salad was a little short on dressing, otherwise deliscious. The chicken was overlooked and very dry. Very dissapointed.

AR4U8c2jcTDBN99UONpxYg.text: Horrible service,  bar backs serve drinks while others sit and shoot the breeze.  Weird atmosphere...staff that could care less...I guess just like its name sake.

iBkRKq0ebVoNXycesM-nxw.text: I give this fantastic restaurant a five-star the reason why as soon as we walked in they were very nice and polite the waiter explain to us the menu and was very kind he never seem to eager or mad or in a rush to leave he took his time with us and was very polite and nice my husband ordered the lobster mini rolls and he said they were fantastic I took a bite and they were very good I ordered the grilled lamb burger it what very delightful better than any Lamberger I've tasted so far!! We ordered for our two-year-old the mac & cheese I also got a taste of that it was like heaven so creamy and cheesy really good I recommend it highly our experience here was verywonderful i'm definitely coming back to this location again I highly recommend it for everyone to try!! Thank you for such a wonderful experience Gordon Ramsay pub and grill

3091c3Mc0REWp18RIsJCuQ.text: We were in Vegas to celebrate my son's 21st Birthday. We had high hopes as we celebrated another 21st Birthday 2 years earlier and had great experience, so we came back. I had made a reservation for a table of four, two months prior to our visit to Vegas and even specified the Birthday on the reservation. We arrive at the Pub, 8 minutes early and are greeted in a frantic fashion from the hostess staff and are told to move over to the side and wait, as if we were in the way while they seat another party of 4 without a reservation, before us. What was the point of making a reservation? We waited patiently and another hostess comes over and gives is a choice- high top in the bar or wait until a table open ups in the dining area. Again, what was the point of a reservation? Annoyed at this point, we take the high top. Another customer is using one of our bar stools, so I kindly ask her if I can sit in the chair. The hostess should have done this. The server was fine. The food was okay, but the portions were very small and the Prime Rib special for $55 was a complete price gouge- a fatty slice with really silly sized sides of mashed potatoes and carrots. The 8 oz filet served with 3 puny asparagus stalks for $42 was another price gouge. The shepherds pie portion was very small. The roasted chicken was served in a massive plate with massive amounts of chick peas relative to the small size roasted chicken. We prefer smaller portion sizes, but the price here at GR Pub & Grill has increased too much for what we received. We ordered 2 desserts and they were good, not great. Total bill with 2 beers and 1 cocktail, tax and tip exceeded $250. No Birthday mentioning, except from us at the high top table, in the bar area. Poor ambiance to celebrate a Birthday.  Next time in Vegas, we will pass.

HSdBh-cHW1xk68XWpw5Fdw.text: I can't comprehend why there are so many negative reviews. This place is fantastic.  We were given many recommendations to check out Gordon Ramsay's Burger restaurant and loved it so we decided to try his Pub and Grill next.  The food was amazing. Not only some of the best food I've had in Vegas, but some of the best food I've had throughout the county.  The waitstaff was terrific as well. The drinks were also very good,  and also very strong! I will certainly be recommending this restaurant and Gordon Ramsay Burger to all my friends visiting Vegas. You must try it!

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Flat iron steak with bearnaise
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lamb burger
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. These drinks are called Goodbye Blue Sky, very good and very strong!

QEh8jyKxM8uALv6TS6-ZIg.text: Second visit here won me over... This place has some good pub fare.   The first time I came was several years ago when they first opened... I thought the food and service really sucked and I wrote the place off.  Recently I had some friends in town and they wanted to try this place so I reluctantly agreed... So glad I did!  This is English Pub food done well... Nothing particularly adventurous, just very solid fare. The ambience is also a Vegas take on an English Pub... dark and casual... Very simple introverted space... Not much scenery or over the top design.   Had the Kettle chip nachos and Hell's Kitchen burger... All were awesome.  Burger could have used more heat as it's billed as spicy, but the flavors and proportions were great.   Sticky toffee pudding was phenomenal... It's the same signature dessert served at Gordon Ramsay Steak and a must try!

L9ZA9zyr9gnymwscpoGOzg.text: Great customer service from Christopher! Super friendly, welcoming and attentive. Sticky toffee pudding and fish and chips were also amazing!

S9GkpqhF62Ron9i3LG5Izg.text: Excellent Service as usual,   Amazing service by Ramon and  Restaurant Manager Randy  Always a pleasure to eat here

-DPNK9Tq0QpA9e8W1dLcHw.text: This was one of our favorite meals on the whole trip.   They were extremely busy the night we were there but staff were friendly and efficient (well once you get past the hostess desk).   The food was amazing.  We had the deviled eggs as an appetizer and I had the wedge salad.   Fabulous!  Both of my kids had the steak and said it was awesome.   I also had aside of Brussel sprouts and they were to die for!   My husband had the cod.  He said it was just ok but he is hard to please.  Overall a great experience!

80EbFucMKg9cphuEKlIIUA.text: Slow af. Took too long for bills and forgot espresso shots. Still waiting for bills. Still waiting. Still waiting.

v98G5IDRNPJdrV0QN3m6Vg.text: Service suck food was ok will not go back will not recommend this place  food was cooked half way server just stop one time

x5rSOab8Rht--EBJIxDU4A.text: My wife and I finally made it out to one of Gordon's restaurants after years of watching him on TV. We were absolutely amazed at how wonderful the food was. I had the Hell's Kitchen Burger (added bacon) and truffle fries. It was one of the best burgers I've ever had and the fries were delicious, especially when dipped in the truffle aioli or house-made ketchup.   As the food was amazing the service was just as great. Chris Lee was our server and he went above and beyond what we expected. He was professional yet funny and outgoing. He knew when to let my wife and I eat and knew when it was ok to get in a few jokes and socialize. If you go to this restaurant ask for Chris! We will be back again!

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Me, server Chris, and my wife. Our first time making it to one of Gordon&#39;s restaurants!

1jhCpdjHst7zOsqxoQ29GQ.text: Ronnie rules... Great Service, awesome beverages and made this stop perfect. #mydude..

RbTNLmJICTujfFNra_9i_A.text: Pretty cool place to get your grub on. We got the nachos, wings and the lobster mac &cheese. Food came out pretty fast and the service was great. I would definitely come back the next time I come to Vegas.

3BpZoAUtG0VZ7Qq7p_IZCg.text: Afro was an entertaining waiter. He made sure we were well taken care of and food was prompt. I had the chicken curry and it was delicious.

bYa4Et5WH6lif8rInv1jKA.text: So am I honey and I have been to every Gordon Ramsay restaurant that's was the last one we chosen to dine at and it is amazingly good he had the fish and chips fish was amazingly good tender and Flaky cucumber mint yogurt thing that was really disgusting everything else on that plate was great I assumed it was to freshen your breath LOL and myself had the shepherd's pie which came with a little salad absolutely amazing so so so good, I also had a very great drink called Goodbye Blue Sky: made with Stoli blueberry vodka Chambord black raspberry liqueur fresh lemon and blackberries with sparkling wine hands down the best seller here and amazingly tasty working on the 3rd one now,(don't judge,lol)  If you do Yelp check-in as I do you'll also get a check in here for a free sticky toffee pudding dessert Gordon Ramsay's most famous dessert and I recommend it very very highly every one of his restaurants carries it amazing. This place is a little pricey however it is worth it you can't really very from the menu too much as everything is either pre-marinated they only have certain kind of breads they do have vegetarian options and one thing on the dessert menu if you look at my pictures totally made me laugh it's called the spotted dick. Overall love it

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The best

lknHoI4UqS0R7WSQfbBIKA.text: This should be rated ten stars. Gordon Ramsay's restaurants are always so good. The menu is simple, the food is extra flavorful, and yummy, yummy. You can never go wrong at one of his restaurants.  The ambiance is nice, and staff is extra nice, and on their game. Looking into the restaurant you would never guess the place is as large as it is. Don't let it fool you. The rooms seem hidden, and trying to get to the restroom is like following a maze.  This is a really great restaurant. I love it here.

SfIXSZnE2u1Uk5kOJZGpRw.text: Very nice place the fish and chips were the best I have ever had.deviled eggs were so good and calamari the service was above and beyond

zB-7bdTzxWFw116weg2E2g.text: I came here for their happy hour and really enjoyed it. Can't say much about their food (only had their truffle fries) but their service was great.   When I first sat down, the bartender asked me if I was right or left handed, and placed the napkin/coaster on the appropriate side...who does that?! I felt pretty special and appreciated it.  The truffle fries were everything I would hope for and a little more (ketchup and honey mustard sauces really good). Crispy, truffle flavors, and good body of potato.   They had a decent selection of different beers and the bartender was helpful in recommending certain beers if you weren't sure what you wanted.

J89yTFG7VFHsWMRoeY37NA.text: Great drink and meal with Heather out server. Ty!!!  Great snacks and drinks and conversation!

u5PyANecYIecP_B8I89GXg.text: Hit the mark! And lived up to the hype!! We tried the lobster Mac and cheese, get it with a drizzle of truffle oil and it truly becomes amazing! Our server Lisa was very sweet and helpful and Derrick was perfect at checking up to make sure everything was just right!

9x31molwJ_es3dwZgP6O_A.text: We had such a blast here! Our waiter Taylor was the absolute best! He made wonderful recommendations, knew the menu well, and was so personable and fun to talk with. The toffee pudding with the sweet cream ice cream and caramel sauce was absolutely to die for! Kudos to Gordon Ramsay and the team here. We will definitely be back!

qthWkW7_KiACn_zeRDX7aw.text: Not a place to come to if your are indecisive because everything here taste great and our hostess was awesome. She was full of positive energy! Overall the food was delicious and the restaurant decor looked fancy.

iu9BKXnXodZr1iBAW-LQTQ.text: I was alone so i sat at the bar both bartenders were very friendly and kept me company when possible.  However i paid $24 for a smallish salad that had very little taste.  I do realize I'm in Vegas and it's inside Cesar's Palace but come on atleast give me a QUALITY product for that price!

ew6TVh7v5BoqSAf4Vm3pJw.text: Sit with Keith and Cisco at the bar! Great service and obviously, phenomenal food! We are so glad we came in! Make sure you stop here and get the beef Wellington!!!!!

aIAEAry3EWeT3v0ZppHzJw.text: Best place in Vegas! We stopped in for a few drinks and a couple snacks mid day, everything was so good we came back for dinner. The Wellington is out of this world and the short ribs were amazing, the Sticky toffee pudding for desert is the perfect ending to an wonderful experience. The atmosphere is relaxed, fun and inviting. The staff was friendly, attentive and informative. Juice took care of us and we hope to see him again at our next visit.

q6iDW-tNDVwZoURoRiO_Yg.text: Delicious!!!! Belgium margarita is to die for.  You have to try it if you get to try out this resturant for sure.

pwoMYehQbC26E9a_vHU-vw.text: Bad service.  food was mediocre. I ordered the lobster mac n cheese i thought it was macaroni with government cheese lobster was ehh. Maybe I expected more from chef ramsay. Also i only put one star because it wouldn't let me put 0 stars.  Note: I was contacted by the manager and resolved my issue.

W1xYwXVHIi9xuEawliDviQ.text: We searched for a decent restaurant on a Saturday around 7pm. We came across Gordon's restaurant with hopeful expectations. The given wait time was 45 minutes for 5 people. Turned out to be about an hour and 30 minutes.   The experience was overall disappointing. The food took about 35 minutes to come out. One of the burgers were undercooked - came out raw. The waitress only came to the table once, drinks were empty.   Upon sitting I let the host know we had a birthday at the table. She said they have a brownie sundae to celebrate. Sadly the waitress never ordered it.   Terrible experience. Sorry Gordon.

PJfG9jg87za8q_rH8ZbqYQ.text: So disappointed! First visit to GR Pub and Grill was over 3 years ago, the quality of the food was great. It left such an impression on me we decided to stop in this Saturday night Thanksgiving weekend. The service was great however the food was overwhelmingly disappointing. My husband had the steak and ale pie and I had the traditional fish and chips. Fish was just ok and the fries were not fresh fries and were served cold. Steak and Ale pie just ok. For a GR restaurant the bar is set high, plus there is a certain level of expectation. Ill never go back again! Need to pay attention Ramsey. QC needs work!

Cui3a-wffS85veUW23BbuQ.text: Amazing food! We definitely recommend the Rib Eye or the NY STRIP steak! So juicy and perfectly seasoned. Our server Rodney was so knowledgeable, kind, and helped us pick some great food for our first try. 5 stars all the way, if you come to Vegas for the food and good service, this is the place to try.

8cYFgeLSKql6S3hMzDtk_A.text: We ditched the turkey this year and had Thanksgiving dinner here. We enjoyed a variety of items from the tomato soup and poutine to the corned beef sandwich and ribeye. Everything tasted excellent and portions were generous. The corned beef is the best we've had anywhere. We finished off with the sticky toffee pudding. It was just the right size for our family to split. My wife said that she would think fondly of it when she has her next sweet craving. There's no wonder Gordon Ramsay is successful. We look forward to coming back here when we return to Vegas.

SVLEDQboJWgCy9lQC1QfnA.text: I will start out with the good.  The service was very good!  Server John W was very attentive and personable.  The food was a different story!  Over priced and not anything special... especially for the price.  Frozen fries with gravy for the Poutine and the Shepard's Pie was bland.  Dude really?  I know the place goes off his name, but the food should match the hype.  By the way the pork belly was okay.  For $113.00 bill you would think the small portion of food would live up to hype...Not!  By the way I saw the fish and chips...$30 for that is a little amazing.  Good service and subpar food.  The service from the waiter and manager raised my review to 3 stars!

cBYx5pIkd6UQ-rclYOYOlw.text: A great place to dine in!  Friendly and knowledgeable staff.  Our server was Christopher and he is the best.  We ordered Crispy belly pork and burger sliders for appetizers and they were delish!  For our main course, beef braised short rib and that melts in your mouth and chicken, kale and bacon pie and that was surprisingly delicious.  We will be back here again soon!  This was our third time here and they never disappoint!  Staff and food are awesome.

Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. I ordered the beef braised short rib and OMG, it really melts in your mouth!!  Yummy!! Christopher was our server and he&#39;s the best! Be back

lcfa2MUuGWsm9IHKbZ8axg.text: My experience with Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill was unfortunately mixed.  The location (in the heart of Caesar's) and atmosphere are great!  My wife and I had a reservation- celebrating our Anniversary- and were seated promptly.  My wife, being British, was torn between ordering two classics- the Fish & Chips and Shepherds Pie.   The person seated next to us had a delicious looking Fish & Chips so we decided to get the best of both worlds- Fish & Chips as an appetizer and Shepherds Pie as her Entree.  I chose the burger.  The Fish and Chips arrived within just a few minutes, and from first look was disappointed.  The portion was significantly smaller than the table next to us.  We realize all pieces are not the same size and the portion will vary, but I would say ours was at least 50% smaller than our neighbors which was puzzling because I would expect Gordon Ramsey would have strict quality control standards.   Speaking of quality control, the fries were well over-cooked which was another major disappointment.  This was a 5 out of 10.  My wife Shepherds Pie was much better after a disappointing start.  The lamb ensemble and mashed potato had great flavor and was presented well. No complaints here.  9 out of 10.    My burger was pretty good.  8 out of 10.  Waiter, based on lack of personality, gets a 5. He didn't care that our fish looked shortchanged to our neighbor's. He was dull, nonchalant and half asleep.  In short- Your mileage will vary with the Fish and Chips.  Just look through the pictures on yelp and you will see all the different types that you might get.  And be prepared you may get an unusually small portion and a polite explanation "they are all different sizes".

MLRXn3zFgQCxzDKHy66M3Q.text: This is such an awesome place!had the soft she'll crab sandwich and husband had Helps kitchen burger.  Both excellent.  We also had the ultimate bloody Mary.  Soooo  awesome. Rodney,  our waiter was the best. Very attentive and just a real cool guy.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Z-7BFGFBRX4nkm1vB2RBSQ.text: Great food....scotch egg and nachos are amazing!! The bartender Juice looked after us and was very attentive...wonderful experience!

1U-cNLSt2LyPnQ0z8hTILw.text: We came here on a Sunday while NFL games were playing. There were numerous TVs but we ended up seated out of view of most of them. There was a limited view of the Seahawks game which we were hoping to catch some of while we ate lunch. This was probably more based on bad luck and timing than anything as there were plenty of tables with good views of TVs. There is an opportunity to better organize tables and TVs so there's no tables out of view of your favorite game on NFL Sunday's. I ordered the Fish and chips which was fine but very expensive for what I got.  The beer selection was good. We both ordered a flight of different beers so we could try many of them between the two of us.  Overall, the atmosphere is good, but with opportunity to improve. The food is fine. Nothing stuck out as bad, but also nothing stuck out as outstanding. The beer selection is good and probably the best reason I found to pop in here. The cost is high even for Vegas. Our lunch and beer flights ran over $100 for just two adults. I'd probably come back here again for afternoon or evening drinks but might find another place for lunch or dinner.

iuFO8IYp63KKIeccoYDSUg.text: Had a wonderful experience at this restaurant.  Lobster Mac and cheese was incredible.  Pesto chicken and the onion soup was amazing. I can't say enough for the desert sticky toffee pudding "it's like I died and when to heaven after having this desert".  Our server Rodney was super nice and very professional.  Everything on point thank you.

SJbEpWFk0dK8JfYCYsFsmg.text: Great food and Great service! Christian and Nong were great! Had a great conversation along with great service, will definitely make sure to visit again!

gf8hqJ4nDGvYS2Y-WZZf8Q.text: This used to be our favorite place to check out in Vegas.  Unfortunately I was disappointed last week when I introduced three friends to it.  Our calamari ordered never came and two of my friends ordered a cucumber mix juice but were told it cannot be filled all the way if you prefer less ice.  This was their second one which wasn't free by the way.   Terrible representation of Gordon Ramsay's brand.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States

yIaVl0JEYxUjCCFIdXyPxg.text: Got served by a very nice guy named Day Scott, he told us about free dessert by checking in from yelp. Scott is very informative, kind, and attentive!! Thank you so much! We ordered lamb burger, fish&chips, and braised rib beef nachos. All of them are amazong

gn3eTnM5k6bdV1pPRWIn9g.text: This is the absolute best food and best service we have received in Vegas!!!!!  Our server who prefers to go by "Day Scott".....lol.....was attentive, helpful, and personable.    My fiancee and I had the deviled eggs, shrimp cocktail, Reuben sandwich, a mini mac & cheese, and a free sticky pudding which was over and above fantastic!!!  More like heavenly.  You can get a free sticky pudding by checking in to Gordon Ramsey's Pub on your yelp acct!!!!!  Don't miss this fantastic spot in Caesar's Palace!!!!

TUoMeYUm_OFK9n-JdkjvDw.text: Gordon Ramsay's Pub & Grill is a 290-seat restaurant located inside Caesars Palace.  It is a restaurant that brings the British Pub experience to you with the atmosphere as well as the authentic British pub foods that it offers.  Upon walking up to the front entrance of the restaurant, I noticed a bunch of barrels stacked on top of each other.  The decor of the place was pretty cool.  The lighting was very dim and obviously this is a casual restaurant since it is supposed to mimic a British pub.  The pub has 36 different beers on tap as well as another 63 different bottled beers.  I don't drink so this was not a selling point for me.  I was more there for the Gordon Ramsay food and because the winner of Hell's Kitchen for one of the seasons was supposed to be the main chef at this particular restaurant.   The bf and I did not have to make reservations to Pub & Grill and we were glad to find out that there was no wait time.  This was possibly the foreshadowing of what was to come after we were seated.  Pub & Grill does serve a 3-course meal, but since the bf and I had just done the Hell's Kitchen courses at Gordon Ramsay's Steak inside Paris the night before, we decided not to do the courses at Pub & Grill.  We both ordered our own dishes and shared.  We ordered the GRP Lolli-Pop Chicken Wings which came with a stilton blue cheese dip.  You can either order a dozen wings which is $22 or 1/2 dozen wings which is $12.  As you can see from the picture, I felt like we got ripped off.  All we got were luke warm puny looking chicken wings that were overpriced in my opinion.  For $12, you'd expect to at least not be served wings from anorexic chickens.  Is it too much to expect hot food instead of warm?  Ramsay would be fuckin' pissed if he was there.  Next, we ordered the 9 oz Grilled Lamb Burger which consists of caramelized onions with a goats cheese-feta spread & rosemary brioche bun and is served with fries & a house pickle.  The price of this burger was $21.  The waitress couldn't stop raving about how good this burger was and that she highly recommended it.  The Grilled Lamb Burger came out and honestly, there was nothing special about it.  It tasted like any regular lamb burger.  For being pricey, you'd expect it to taste amazing or at least have a wow factor to it.  Nope!  It was a huge disappointment.  We should have demanded our money back and spent it on the burgers at BurGR.  At least they were a little bit cheaper and taste amazing!  The last dish we ordered was the Pan-Seared Diver Scallops which came with steamed clams, leeks, potato-bacon chowder & confit tomatoes.  This dish was $32.  This was another dish that came out luke warm.  For being super expensive, the clams were tiny and the chowder didn't really have much flavor.  It almost tasted as though someone had forgotten to season it.  This was a huge disappointment.  It was definitely not worth the money.  While eating this dish, I bit into a small piece of the clam shell that was mixed into the chowder.    Pub & Grill is Ramsay's worse restaurant in Vegas.  He needs to pay a visit there and make sure that everything is up to his standards.  Being served warm food is not acceptable unless that is how British pub food is served.  If that's the case, I do apologize in advance for talking shit.  Overall, the customer service was alright.  The food is way overpriced and it is not worth it so I don't recommend anyone going here.

Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 9 oz Grilled Lamb Burger
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pan-Seared Diver Scallops

W1hfQsHuGm1N5LkloCkgNA.text: Pricey beers, but I didn't care. My bartenders Gene and Keith were so good that I would have paid $20 for a Guinness. Just a great overall vibe and I got it and I rolled with it. Food all looked good from afar.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Great draft beer selection. The Boddington Pub Ale was fantastic.
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mini Lobster Rolls. Good, but could use less celery

6KW95kzmvAtLM22-ClTutA.text: I'm a Gordon Ramsay fan, love all his shows and his passion for excellence.  He reminds me a bit of myself in my college years striving for perfection over the cast iron grill at Buffalo Wild Wings.  Being a fan I was excited to try this place.  What to order?  this was the hardest question to answer since the ACT.  I wanted a burger but thought I should get out of my comfort zone and try something a bit more British, so I went with the pie sampler.  I thought this was a great idea so I could sample all the taste Gordon has to offer but it backfired a bit because it really is just an appetizer, so I was still a bit hungry afterwards.  Each meat pie was about as good as a meat pie can get, but that's not saying much.  Looking back I should have ordered either a whole pie or the burger, or maybe the sampler and a burger.  My friend had a burger and it looked amazing, I stole some fries when he wasn't looking, very good.  I will be back to try the burger.

KYX58wA9Cax2VqpQ6rCIxQ.text: The food was good, although we sat at a high top and in a very trafficked area by servers who kept bumping into our menus before we ordered, it was so loud we couldn't hear the server when she spoke, and the boy who actually served our food barely could hold a smile and hold any credibility as far as stating for us to enjoy our food.  I cannot add this to a place I would enjoy my next trip. Vegas is expensive and this was definitely not worth my money.

__ibHiM5Av0GA1zc_0zwtA.text: Ate at the bar here while at a conference at Caesars.  I ordered a NY strip steak because I was allowed to spend so much for my meals, LOL.  Dumb idea.  I should know better than to order a steak that is not prime grade.  But nonetheless, it was satisfying.  Nothing special by any means.  The menu is definitely tilted towards an English influence which should be no surprise.  I just wish I would have gotten a burger.  The staff was all very attentive, friendly, and full of interesting characters.  I would definitely go back to eat here.  I would just stick to what the name implies they are best at.  Pub and grill food!

fwuOARDy53-U3gCVhcdFKw.text: We came here for a drink and snack while bar-hopping our way around the casinos. I'll also admit, we came here solely for the pretzels in cheese sauce appetizer we saw on the website!  There's not much to say about our short time here, as we were seated, placed our order, drank and ate when ti came out, then headed out. Service was good and pretty quick given how busy it was, and the food was good, although not overly large in portion serving.  I think the only reason I can't give this four stars (I reserve five stars for places that blow my socks off) is due to the size of our appetizer and that while it was good, it wasn't as good as I was expecting. Don't get me wrong, pretzels with cheddar beer sauce is *AMAZING* and the sauce actually was everything I was hoping it would be, it was just that the pretzels were lacking a bit of something, although I can't say exactly what. Maybe a bit more salt? I felt like I could have just used regular breadsticks instead of the pretzel ones as they just didn't have the pretzel flavour I was expecting.

Fs2_8pQWfGSLfm750bujBQ.text: Went in for lunch at 2PM on Dec. 30.  Most restaurants in the area where swamped with the crowds for New Years, so it immediately scored points for availability.  Sat in the bar area, which is VERY comfortable.  Couches and chairs you'd find in a living room, kid friendly as well.  I had the Lamb Burger, which was AMAZING!  Probably the only thing keeping this from a 5 was that the fries were very bland, and my friends had dessert, and it was a bit underwhelming (but it wasn't the sticky toffee pudding, which I will have next time).  If there was a 4.5, I'd give it that.  Will come back again.

OuXRDplPd-vYbbZUuEupug.text: A friend and I looked forward to checking out and eating at GR Pub & Grill, so we hightailed it there. The decor def fit with the theme of the restaurant. Comfy seating, and kind waitstaff. Now here is where it gets tricky...I asked what their signature dish was and our waitress swore by the fish & chips. My friend ordered that, with the mini pot pies. I ordered chicken Marsala (Brits are known for their Indian food right?), and some lemon shrimp cocktail.  Sorry, the Jasmine rice had hair in it, was obviously old, dried out...the chicken was ok. The only thing lemony about the shrimp was the cut up lemons on the side, nothing special, rather blah. The fish and chips weren't anything to rave about either. His mini pies were supposed to be lamb, chicken, and beef. No chicken came, but he stated it was pretty good. Will I go back? No. Would I recommend a friend? No  After paying for the meal, the waitress kind of left us hanging, as we had to ask another person to get us more drinks. I don't think Gordon Ramsey would be too pleased, not judging by his television shows. Maybe he better come to Vegas and manage his own businesses!

iCOfzQnFl00zN8i04VQbnA.text: Amazing! Everything from the atmosphere, to the people, and of course the food. We had the best waiter and you should ask to be in Christopher's section. He took great care of us and really raise our experience. Thanks Christopher! We didn't know what to expect but when you come here you should come to kick back relax and enjoy. Dont rush, enjoy the experience, it's truly high class.

XWwjOo_GbfGAQZFm2idq0Q.text: Seemed like an ice place, ordered the fish & chips. It was just OK, the fries were not very good. Afterwards I got sick and had diarrhea, thanks Gordon.

BZNpoHTMn13b3Up3i5-yxw.text: We started with the jalapeno bacon mac & cheese, it was pretty good. I ordered the bangers and mash... I had never had it before so I don't have a basis of comparison, but I thought it was amazing. Our waiter was attentive and accommodating. Wish they served ice/cold water without me having to be the annoying person that has to keep asking for ice. Would definitely go back.

YQZcobQdHV1G7y9awdTT_A.text: Went here for late night appies and drinks. Service was great. The drinks were perfection. My bf had the tomato soup and we shared the calamari. The soup was excellent. Unfortunately, calamari was horribly overcooked and taking a bite reduced it to dust in your mouth. It's conveniently located inside Caesar's casino. We'll try it for a meal next time and skip the calamari.

IUJ7TJ4YcdnBCsC2Cvt2HA.text: So here is the real deal review of Mr Ramseys place. First let me tell you in was excited to eat here as I am a fan of Chef Ramseys attention to detail and search for excellence.  So I was expecting great things.   The calamari was light and tasty nice seasoning and sauces were good. We were off to a good start. For a main course I had the new York strip. I ordered it medium and it came medium well. Still it was very good and the sauce was nice. The potatoes that came with it were cold and not seasoned. The other veggies on the plate cold. I tried the chicken pot pie and it was not bad not great.   Dessert was a sundae. Waiter didn't recommend anything. It was average sundae nothing special. I think the place is not bad not great better than an average pub but not what I would have expected from someone so demanding of excellence.

SJBwXSzWZIOiKppYka5Z4Q.text: During our recent trip to Las Vegas, we thought we would try Gordon Ramsay's restaurant.     We had the French Onion Soup, Prime Rib, and Bangers and Mash.   Simple dishes that should be hard to mess up.   From cold soup to fatty prime rib and inefficient wait staff, the experience was horrible... and expensive.    I think perhaps Gordon should stop by and dine at this location - it does no justice to his name, and could benefit from one of his TV "makeovers"

JV3IpPCHJXjWBIJ9AEbEKQ.text: So on a recent trip to Vegas checked out Gordon Ramsay's @CaesarsPalace with a friend. Found out the hard way that the catsup has garlic in it but the truffle fries were good otherwise. Friend had the Lamb Burger and had no complaints about it. I had the 8 oz beef tenderloin. I always get my steak well done and always tell them no pink, butterfly is OK, had to send it back because it came out pink. Second time around it was perfect and very tender. As of this writing the online menu differs from the actual menu, in my case the steak only came with asparagus no potatoes or seasonal vegetables like the online menu states. My friend says three stars I say two based on the steak but I will go with his and give three.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My undone steak

FVybrEIMUgRRms1I5k4PUw.text: This place was very yummy! I was excited to come here because I have been to the other two Gordan Ramsay restaurants in Vegas and wanted to dine at this one as well. I met to co-workers there and it was a nice place to sit and chat since we hadn't seen each other in a while. I loved our waiter. He was really nice and made recommendations for us when I asked. It did take a while to have the food come out but since we were talking a lot we didn't mind.  I started dinner off with a cocktail. I had the spiced cider which was amazinggg. If you like any kind of ciders or if apples are your favorite fruit get this drink. It was very tasty. I also loved that they brought out pretzels and bread as a free appetizer. They give you a roll and three different kinds of pretzels along with a horse radish cheese dip and butter. Amazing and a great touch to the start of the meal. I got the Beef Cheek stew because our waiter said that if you wanted to try something different to eat that. I really enjoyed it. The beef was so so tender, maybe just a bit on the salty side. I was surprised because it wasn't so much of a stew as it was just beef with potatoes and veggies. I still enjoyed it though-I love when my beef is tender. We also got a side of the Yukon potatoes. They were great and went really well with the beef. I would get these as a side again. Then for dessert we had the chocolate dessert. I forget what its called but it has three different kinds of chocolate mousse in between chocolate cake and topped with whipped cream and chocolate caiver. It's served in a mason jar which I thought was cute. It was Delicious! And my favorite part of the meal (of course). I would get this again.  I really liked this restaurant and would go here again. The next time I plan on getting the mini sliders because I noticed a ton of people got them and they looked amazing! I also want to try the French Onion Soup. Excited to go back soon! :)

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dessert.
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tastes like apples! Yumm
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States

tbvQD1WxG3GQe2V8fRKBuA.text: the food is great.  unfortunately the staff is pretty much terrible. Ceasars palace, known for luxury and service. Not here.  My wife and I visited here after being excited to eat at a gordon ramsay restaurant (we are fully aware he has probably never even been in the restaurant)   Food was all great, cocktails were great too. I can get great food and great cocktails at about 100 different places just off the top of my head. All 100 of them also provide service.  Greeting took 10-15, i  wasnt checking my watch because I was trying  to avoid my wife becoming aware of the lengthy wait, not because she is a bitch, because i didnt want her experience going south upon arrival.  cocktails took about 5 minutes.  not terrible, not quick (it was a monday night and not very busy)  Long story short, the service was sluggish at best, the server was friendly and generally acknowledged that things were moving slowly and she apologized. water under the bridge for us. the food made up for it..  Then the manager happened. Not the younger guy who had stopped by our table once to say hello and ensure we were happy. Not him at all, this manager was the old guy, the one wandering around the restaurant not talking  to anyone. the one who spent all his time chatting up the hostesses until....  He turned all of the music off and all of the tv's off 15 minutes till 11. at first I thought this was odd (i thought they closed at 1030) i then remembered that they closed at 11.  wtf? why dont you just tap us on the shoulder and demand we pay before getting the fuck out? the most ironic part is that we would have been gone already if our server wasnt once again totally absent for 15 minutes.   This manager needs to gtfo, wrong business for him, I wont waste my timeor money in any of GR establishments again as well as ceasars palace.   Too many other options out there to operate this way.

sPrurG74ThzPsXPxZrME3A.text: So incredibly disappointed. We've had better truffle fries at our local Cinepolis movie theater, better tomato soup at Panera, and a spicier, more flavorful  burger at Friday's. And then the pain of a $75 dollar bill to top it off.

fCoiB7l0Za9-jY_E-IBu0w.text: I am not sure why this place gets such bad reviews. My husband and I went last August for our anniversary dinner and were more than satisfied with our experience. We had the pub sliders for an appetizer which were delicious and our entrees were equally as good. The real star was the dessert which was a form of strawberry shortcake and it was out of this world. I think one thing people need to understand before going is that this is an "English Pub" so the food is not exactly typical fare for us Americans but still delicious if you are willing to go a little out of your comfort zone.
