B1erxiLay45-gxIIMdVafw.text: Good but pricey.  But since we are at Ceasars what do you expect?  I had the beef pie and it was delicious and my wife had the bang and mash and it was unusual.  Hers was all sausages with mashed potatoes. Great atmosphere and will come back.

0E3OiQLMr-zfNn8P17CuGA.text: Had to experience a Gordon Ramsey restaurant at least once. And the bar did not disappoint. Appetizers were fabulous. Highly recommend the Lobster Roll and the Calamari was outstanding! They have a great spin on a Mule cocktail that is a must try for sure. Ambience with great service made this a fun place to experience.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. A fun stop with friends while in Vegas.
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Mule on their cocktail menu is a must have!
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Got a bag just for brining in our Caesars branded glasses.

ShW9TR9yYVO-TOznRkn1_g.text: After finding a line in almost every place in this hotel, we found this restaurant to have no wait! We came at around 3:30pm and we were able to order off the lunch & happy hour menu, even though it was a holiday!  We ordered a few appetizers off the happy hour menu- truffle fries, onion rings, pub spot, and wings. The truffle fries and onions rings were yummy and crispy. I was happy that I could taste the truffle oil! The pub spot is basically a mini burger which I enjoyed! The wings were a huge portion but a bit dry.   For the menu, I ordered a few small items and when it came, they arranged it all together on a plate for me! It is super thoughtful of them! I had the mini mac n cheese and the brussels sprouts side. Mac n cheese was yummy, I had the garlic flavor. The brussels sprouts were seasoned so well but a little too oily.  Even though this place is quite big, the food comes our relatively fast. My family also enjoyed their meals. The fish and chips ($30) were good, but the portion is tiny for the price.   Overall- friendly service, loud ambiance, and food came out fast. Our waters were constantly refilled, server always checking up on us, and the food was tasty. I would recommend during happy hour if you're looking for a quick bite!

any1TwQP7Jx8kDeJonNzpA.text: We had the best lunch here! It was happy hour, which usually means appetizers etc... I LOVE that! I got a slider for $4, a pigs in a blanket for $3, and truffle fries for $5! In VEGAS that's a steal! Hey also have drink specials and HALF OFF ALL bottles of wine! Their staff was really friendly and knowledgeable of the menu. We were extremely satisfied with GR!

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Mod7m151t7F7cRBddDu1BQ.text: Hi. Having fun with Chris and Christina at the bar!!! They are amazing. Drinks and shrimp cocktails were delicious.

NpM1hzOmNDAIG5M4IRq57g.text: This is the third Ramsay restaurant we've visited and we've never been disappointed. The food and cocktails were excellent, and our server, Heather, was friendly and helpful. She even helped us get a promotion for a free sticky toffee pudding (Gordon's signature dessert)!  The scotch egg was the best I've had anywhere. We also had the calamari and fish & chips, which were delicious -- classic preparations, well executed.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States

v9UQ0QtSeoYzhpQFv8kDLw.text: The most popular dish is the kettle nachos with short-ribs for a reason. We ate the mash potatoes (yum), the sliders with arugula (yum), the mac & cheese (oh yeah, yum!), and creamed spinach (just okay). Got a complimentary toffee pudding bread by checking in with Yelp and seriously, the dessert blew our minds.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Just go for it!
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Again, just go for it!!

Q09vzBk9TFCM6ZhVlqnYvw.text: Poor taste. Had high expectations. The burger was burnt and not seasoned. The deviled eggs were mediocre, lacking a spice and tang. The lobster sandwich and truffle fries were the highlight of it all.  The poutine was terrible. Way too salty and the flavor was just terrible. The service was nice but the food was not the best. I would not recommend coming here. Over priced.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States

J-vtDhgWQddy8MNOxy7Viw.text: Of the many Gordon Ramsay restaurants in Las Vegas, this one had the least exciting menu, but post-Celine hunger pangs meant that proximity to the venue brought me here.  Fortunately, the food was excellent.  I love beef Wellington and it was absolutely perfect here: a tender steak that was medium rare and so tender you could cut it with a spoon and a flaky pastry that was not one bit doughy.  The $57 price tag gave me a little sticker shock but it was worth every penny.  For dessert, the sticky toffee pudding was the perfect ending.  I was not expecting something this great but I guess Chef Ramsay taught this kitchen well.  Service was excellent.

o2e6v19SmbqS1qsI91MfOA.text: Atmosphere: Located in Caesar's Palace, it was pretty busy. We still got a table right away. At the table, there was a tv with March Madness playing. It would have been better if the tv was in a different location as it was tough to watch right next to us. It was relatively loud based on the number of people but you could still talk. The seats were slightly low so your food felt like it was a bit too high to reach.   Food: The food was okay. I have never seen anything with Gordon Ramsay but the food was pretty good. I think his use of pretzel bread in salads and as a side is awesome. They didn't have salt and pepper on the tables and I wish they did.  Service: Our server was cool. He was super mellow and chill. Make sure you check in because you get 1 free desert. Overall, not bad, a bit pricey but worth trying out.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States

iwPc7aNZARomCkL2hN3pkQ.text: I wanted to try the seasonal softshell crab sandwich, but our waiter was very honest and gave us his humble opinion of it. He suggested tht the chicken sandwich is the best thing we will ever eat. I took a bite of it from my friend's plate, and it was yummy! I myself went for the basic salmon toast, but I was surprised how flavorful and delicious it was! Generous amount of salmon, topped w caviar, it was such a nice balance! Our waiter also informed us that we get a free dessert if there are any Yelpers at the table. Helloo, yes!! We got the sticky toffee pudding. Its almost like a warm fresh brownie with vanilla icecream. I have a major sweet tooth, and this dessert made me sing hallelujah. It was so soft and not too sweet. We shared it, but I was so tempted to order another one just for me.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Never skip the dessert menu!
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yumminess in each bite
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster macncheese! This was an appetizer! Quite a heaping amount!

8sM6G_BnMyyUzuY-R3ElsQ.text: Super delicious! Service was good & the atmosphere in the restaurant was tasteful as well.   We ordered a couple of appetizers to share since it was lunchtime & we've really been wanting to try the food here. So we ordered the crispy pork belly, corned beef poutine fries & the mini pub burgers. Yum! The pork belly was super like butter, super tender & packed with flavor. The corned beef poutine fries were the best I've ever had. And the mini pub burgers were so good & fresh!  I would definitely recommend this restaurant it's definitely worth the experience!

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Corned beef poutine
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mini pub burgers
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crispy pork belly

_b8lyFBF9EtylfCTG8x2sQ.text: I ordered the fish and chips and it was probably the best fish in a fish and chips order I've ever had. They were crispy and not soggy at all, however it did kind of seem like the seasoning was missing. The fries were fine, but thick cut fries aren't my favorite so I can't really have an un-biased opinion on those.   My parents ordered a burger and fries and the BLT with kettle chips. Both the kettle chips and regular fries were so, so good! My mom said the BLT was delicious, and my dad loved the burger.   I LOVE soft pretzels and saw people getting them after we had ordered. My dad asked our waiter (who was AMAZING- I believe his name was Adam) about them and he said they were only on the bar menu, but could (and did) get us some. You get three sticks with cheese and a mustard. They were pretty good, not great, but I was just happy that our waiter got them for us.

_ZKJzW509xRdLLjgj2VhKQ.text: This was our first time here. Scott was amazing! Very attentive and on the ball. He gave us great recommendations for food. We started with the Wedge Salad. It was delicious! I had the short rib. True to what Scott said, it was so tender! I savored every bite of that dish! My husband had the burger. He loved it! We finished off with the sticky toffee pudding. This place didn't disappoint. I loved everything we had!

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Short Rib w/Cheddar Mash and Demi Glaze
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cheddar Burger w/Bacon

OmFxXsM0SySFdOhrkZRcbQ.text: The food here far exceeded any expectation I had. We stopped in last minute for a quick birthday dinner, and were seated right away. Our server was extremely friendly, and the food was "melt in your mouth amazing". Would definitely recommend to others!

KJVI3jTOxL0iQrciqalayA.text: If you are seated at one of the tall tables, it means that they do not want you to stay long.  Those are the most uncomfortable stools I've ever had the displeasure of sitting on.  And they're awkward.  I had to pull the stool all the way back and the shimmy it forward.    I ordered the braised short rib.  It started off delicious, but somehow I got bored of it about half way through.  It was tasty, don't get me wrong, but it wasn't the "wow" that I was expecting.  The server was good at making suggestions, and described the dishes thoroughly.    Overall, I was underwhelmed by my experience.

Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Brussels sprouts
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Braised short rib

3LKUuQ-jeadoU3ZzEQPtnQ.text: I love the Gordon Ramsay Burger it's so freaking good I just wish the bread was just a little bit more toasted on the inside that's it other than that pretty close to perfection...french fries are sensational... really good service ...amazing  sticky toffee pudding same as Hell's kitchen same recipe really good.

ChUqy2cirkFZXgcSD39MAw.text: Favorite spot to pop-in & enjoy a meal during our stay at Caesar's Palace.  While it can be crowded (because it's so popular), we never experienced any particularly crazy wait times.  There's a good variety of offerings on the menu, and everything we tried was solid.    Our favorite items were the butter chicken & the truffle fries... Highly recommend!

VI2BpcUwn-ILkUwxLsAyPg.text: Perfection. That was completely unexpected, especially for lunch. I've heard mixed reviews of Mr. Ramsey's other properties, but the experience I had today was second to none. It started with the design/decor of the restaurant, the most delicious food I've ever tasted, and my server, Rodney, was spot on, friendly, professional, knowledgeable and I wish he could train every other server on the planet! Yes, he is that good.  The shrimp cocktail starter literally does not compare to any other I've ever tasted -- the quality of shrimp and light creamy sauce "magic", beef tenderloin cooked to perfection, tender melt-in-your mouth and the peppercorn sauce was the perfect compliment. And then that desert - sticky toffee pudding. Wow. Never had anything like that before. You'll need to try it for yourself, I'm not going to spoil the surprise!  I cannot recommend this restaurant, or Rodney enough. Thank you, Gordon Ramsey, for your vision and culinary expertise that you are sharing with the world. I would like to shake your hand one day to thank you. Health and happiness to you.

JAdXvUN1hJinO7ZPgGvz5w.text: One of my life goals is to eat my way through celebrity chef restaurants in Las Vegas. It didn't happen this year but I was determined to eat at least one.  I'm a huge fan of Hell's Kitchen television and Gordan Ramsey so this was an easy choice. I love when the menu is posted on the outside of the establishment and my mouth was watering before we walked in!   My mother in law always said "Inly go to the restaurant with a full parking lot". Well, this "parking lot" was packed!  And for good reason!  The food was fantastic!  And the atmosphere was full of energy. I'm definitely coming back here!

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. I ordered the soft shell crab sandwich with homemade chips. It&#39;s what got me in the restaurant!
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. We ate the crab deviled eggs so fast I almost didn&#39;t get my camera out fast enough.  I licked the plate.  Sorry not sorry

Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shepherds Pie with Lamb. The mashed potatoes were made with Gruyere cheese!  I wanted to spend the night and order them for breakfast!

WhBkwLKvCXnbV9tjfZ1aBw.text: For as expensive as this place is for pub food, you'd expect much better quality. Especially because there's the name of a world-renowned chef on the building.   I admit that this place wasn't our first choice but after learning that there was a 6 hr total wait to get a seat at Bacchanal, we were starving and looking for something to eat fast.  We were seated almost immediately at the pub and grill.   Service is sub-par, again, I expected a lot more from a Gordon Ramsay branded restaurant.  They seem disorganized and unprofessional at the hostess stand. Our waitress was nice, but that was just about the extent of our decent experience here.   I opted to get the fish and chips since I've heard so many good things about it. $30 for two pieces of fish and some soggy fries.  I was terribly disappointed by this dish, and on top of it, the batter was incredibly salty.  We also had the lamb shank which was bland, the scallops that were super salty, and the ribeye that was not the least bit tender. The only decent thing was the Shepard's pie.  We also had the calamari and the crispy pork belly.  Neither were impressive and I wouldn't recommend ordering either again.    Expensive is what I expect when I come to Vegas, so I'm not mad about the price. I'm just really disappointed that it was fairly pricey and the food quality and service was sub-par.   I wouldn't recommend  this place, there are far better restaurants in Vegas.

D7HDSx1JB0gORbezCsXlsA.text: This place was packed and we got a seat in less than 10 minutes so I was really impressed with that. I ordered the Lamb Burger with lobster mac and cheese. The burger was cooked well-done as I requested and the cheese/toppings tasted so good. I would have liked more flavor in the actual meat because it tasted as if just slapped the meat on the grill and then put the toppings on but I can tell when meat has been seasoned well and marinated which this burger lacked that but overall, I would definitely order it again.  The lobster mac and cheese was a bit creamy, not drying and the tender lobster inside of it went so good with the cheese. I loved everything I ordered even right down to the fries that came with the burger. I came in here with high expectations and I was very satisfied.

s8icoZyQeOMtoII6rHaTxw.text: My party decided to bounce from Alto Bar and walked around to find another spot to hang before heading out for another event.  None of us were really familiar with the layout of Caesars, so we walked around hoping to bump into another bar (like we did with Alto) then low and behold... Gordon Ramsay's Pub and Grill.   And what really pulled us in was when we all came into realization we were right dab smack in the middle of happy hour! WOOHOO!   We were seated on a table for 6 (although there were initially only 4 of us) which was a good thing since we were joined by 2 other people much later.   Half off all draft beer, we all went for 35oz drafts, hellfire wings (10), pigs in a blanket (2) and an order of truffle fries.   So... we're in Vegas, right?! In a pub, nonetheless located in Caesar's Palace which is located on the strip. Needless to say, our expectations are a bit high, but not high enough where we become completely unreasonable, but I have to say there is NO reason why it'd take more than 20 minutes for beer. If we ordered some complicated cocktail mixes, I might lean toward better understanding, but beer!? On tap?! NO.   Our server, Tesla, came by apologizing for the delay. 20 minutes gone and ALL our apps delivered, but still no drinks. Tesla, for a second time, came by apologizing again for the delay on our drinks and that "it's coming right up."   All of us were a disappointed at that. We should have been at least a quarter through our drinks by the time our food got there.   Food was bomb, though. The wings, although called HELLFIRE, weren't spicy at all. There is a kick to it, but the sweet tempered it down a bit. Worth the price at a buck per piece during happy hour. Pigs in a blanket were okay. They are slightly bigger than what I'm used to and I really liked the sausage. There was a different type of seasoning to it vs. the ordinary ones I've had. I liked it. (Not everyone had it, but whoever did didn't really agree with me - she said it tasted more like regular Vienna sausage.) But the truffle fries topped them all. We were all absolute fans of these. The crisp, the crunch, the mushroom topping. This was perfect. We liked it so much we put in 2 more orders.   FOOD: 4.  SERVICE: 2. (Not our server's fault, but there should be NO reason for that 20 minute wait for beer.)   VALUE: 5. (Happy hour menu is a steal!)  PARKING: Located inside Caesar's Palace. Valet or self-park.  OVERALL: 3.75.   I'm confident the beer gaffe was an isolated incident. I'd come back for happy hour should a stop at Caesar's get included on future visits.

Kf9g9hns1moSkD3tlTRtYA.text: Thursday evening and looking for dinner at Ceasar's Palace - Gordon Ramsay Pub & grill is an okay choice.  It's a tough review to do because certain aspects were better than others - but averaging it out I'm sticking with just 3 stars.  NOT to be confused with Hell's Kitchen, located in front of Ceasar's Palace...  The pub is located inside the casino.  Reservations- check! Figuring out the reservations aren't for Hell's Kitchen - unfortunately check! Got there way early and they still seated us - check! Seated promptly- check! They brought out water and menus, and the evening began.  After ordering some sodas and appetizers; then ordered our main meals.  The waitress was very nice and then got several large groups seated around us...  After the food came, she checked in on us  and always made sure we had refills ready for our sodas - then at some point we realized that we had been there for over 2 hours.  By the time we paid and left (and chose not to eat desert here), we were there nearly 2 hrs and 45 minutes.  So while it was enjoyable, it took a long time to get through dinner.  Service was good, but it took a while to pay and get out.  Some of the food was great and other parts were very average.  PS - they have Pepsi products BUT NO Mt. Dew!!!

VyNYwaM439EPAmz_nTqvdw.text: We were suppose to eat at Hells Kitchen, but it was fully booked, so we ended up in Gordan Ramsay Pub and Grill.  The food was pretty good, your typical high end pub and grill. It was a little pricy, but that is expected of a Las Vegas restaurant.  Service was good, servers were friendly, attentive and quick.  We ordered beef wellington, beef poutine, scallops with corn puree and uk beer flights.  Beef wellington: is Gordon Ramsay signature dish, you will see it in a lot of his restaurants and his cook books, and it does not disappoint.  The beef was cooked perfectly, and the pastry was flacky and buttery.  Beef poutine: was a pretty good dish, almost as good as a regular canadian poutine.  UK beer flights:  I was curious about UK beers, so this was my chance to taste different varaties from the country.  Scallops with corn puree:  were cooked perfectly, seasoned just right.  Corn puree complimented the sweetness of the scallops. And they gave a decent amount of scallops.  Overall the experience was good.  Being its my first time eating at a famous chefs restaurant i was impressed by the level detail in the food and service provided.  I would like to try more of Gordon Ramsays other restaurants someday

0dcm5_FrQnxWJK-kEMTP4g.text: I LOVE GORDON RAMSAY!!!! I watch his shows... blah blah blah... we all have the same story.  I've been dying to eat at one of his places so when I was last in Vegas I made it a point to drive onto the strip to eat here. I was SOOO EXCITED! I mean Michelin star Gordon Ramsay! I have a Michelin Star restaurant near me I love and go when I can do my expectations where high!   Leaving the atmosphere and sloppy drunk as out of it as it's Vegas and that's the culture...   I had been looking online and was going back and forth between 2 meals... but I saw one on yelp and I was sold. I sat at the bar as I was alone and sat salivating. I ordered the steak and ale pie! When it arrived I was instantly confused by the veg. It was either not cooked and should have been as I normally eat asparagus and squashes cooked... or they accidentally the wrong things on the wrong plate. (I should have sent it back at that point.)I could have almost over looked that as the Steak and Ale pie was still waiting! THIRD BITE into my haft empty pot pie... I get a glob of fat. The picture doesn't do it justice. Inch squared and haft inch thick. Bigger then any of my actual meat pieces. I've never been so disappointed in a meal. If this was Denny's I would be annoyed. This isn't Denny's and if I'm paying $27 for a haft empty pot pie and uncooked veg I at least expect some meat and flavor in it. When asked how my meal was I shrugged and stated ok. By the end of it I was at "fine and that's the best you are getting out of me".   I got a sticky toffee pudding and had the waitress not been trying so hard to improve my meal and mood by going above and beyond to pour the sauce on it probably would have been amazing. She didn't know I'm not big on sweets so the very sweet sauce was a bit much and I would have only put haft on at most. Still was the best part of my meal. I've never been so unbelievably categorically disappointed in a meal in my life.   This was SUCH a disappointment! I expected better!

3C1-xxk3pTGWYfDJaqRDqw.text: I would give 10 stars to our waiter Rodney! He made our day!  Chef Gordon Ramsey is one of my favorite chefs. I even took his online Masterclass - a Christmas gift from my husband. Always wanted to visit one of his restaurants. Yesterday, on our way from Grand Canyon to California after grueling rim to rim hike we had time till our flight and decided to hang out in Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill.  From the first moment we felt well taken care of by all the staff members, but especially by our waiter Rodney. What a great personality, professionalism, attention to detail and sense of humor :)  We had Caesar's salad which was very fresh, dressing was really tasty and the shavings of parmigiano cheese rounded it up nicely.  I had calamari - my favorite pub's starter. Fresh, nicely seasoned, and cooked to perfection.  Las but not least - Fish & Chips, of course. We think it was the best Fish & Chips we've ever had. Fish was moist and cooked nicely, crust was thin, well seasoned and crispy. Fries were delicious and I loved mashed peas seasoning a lot.  Contrary to the other reviewer we were delighted that water was served without ice :) But we are Europeans...  Thanks to good food and our wonderful waiter Rodney Gordon Ramsey Pub & Grill was the highlight of our long journey home. Thank you!

qlqEUO4YtpK8GZ8v3kSV1A.text: Our server, Taylor, was awesome. Food & service excellent. I didn't have a big appetite, so I went with the mini pub burgers appetizer since a nearby table had them. Bf got Scottish salmon. Both were delish. Food came out fast.  Free sticky toffee pudding with Yelp check in!!! It's huge! Definitely sharable and a great way to end the meal.

CyeTaLZErcQ79f3_2bNH8g.text: I've had several delicious meals at the AC location. So I was excited to hit the bar and grab a few happy hour items and split an entree with my wife at the LV location. We started with the wings and pigs in a blanket. Both were an absolute miss. The wings were traditional, generic and poorly executed buffalo wings. Which was so disappointing because when we go to AC we look forward to splitting a dozen of their wings, which are far from traditional. I would strongly suggest collaborating with the AC location on this item. The pigs in a blanket were edible but I can't think of anything else to say. After I bit of each item we both agreed to cut or losses here and move on. There are too many fantastic options in LV to waste a meal here.     I'm so glad I've gone to the AC location first. If I went to the LV location first, I never would've given AC a chance.

370Goaa9u3EjUrJ2Gcm13w.text: Sorry guys- I don't understand all the hype. Service was very nice and the atmosphere was pretty good, but I was so let down by the food. In the end, the lamb in the burger was lost and it just was not a $21 burger for me. Fries were okay but their ketchup was pretty good. Anyways, I was really looking forward to get blown away, and in the end, I just left disappointed. Maybe next time Ramsay.

0EKkQaVpubWjByR3DGFZBQ.text: This is amazing food and amazing service!  We can't hear for dinner because of its close proximity to a show that we were going to see. It is located in the casino of Ceasar's Palace.   We had chicken wings for an app, a burger and a presto chicken sandwich for main course, and the sticky toffee pudding to end the meal.   The pesto chicken sandwich was to die for. It had so many fresh ingredients.   Normally, we do not get dessert, but we kept seeing that sticky toffee pudding ordered at other tables. With much envy, we decided to order it ourselves. We had no regrets.   I still admit, the price was high, but this does not change my five star rating as I know what we were getting into.

4mG3OSHIVy-BUgox-jTecg.text: I come here often. Probably the best restaurant at Caesars. Easy to get to. Consistently incredible food, excellent service, and great atmosphere. Ronnie, Christian, and Antwon are amazing!!! They are truly on their game. Thank you so much. Looking to returning!

t6XO-BLXFUaIBJbm0H7xeA.text: Stopped for happy hour.   We did wait a while after getting seated for a server.  We also had a very wobbly table.  The drinks were good.  The pretzel sticks were a miss.  Needed some salt and the cheese sauce was very bland.

e-2cr28E2DTRI_6x13H_8g.text: Great food. The one vegetarian option is great. I'm not sure if it changed everyday but it was flavorful. Good bye blue sky is an amazing drink that tastes like sour skittles. Get that one.

HW7tgq1G5oEpza-9oGmpoA.text: On our most recent trip to Las Vegas, we stopped in to have a bite and relax the feet from walking all day and decided to try another Gordon restaurant. We were seated very quickly and was greeted immediately by our server, Yaneisy. She quickly brought us a round of drinks and added a couple of glasses of water. The mad Russian had Mule's Hind Leg and I chose Goodbye Blue Sky. Both drinks were good and refreshing. For food, we had a classic bar menu taste in our mouths and ordered Nachos, deviled eggs, and Fish and Chips. The food came out hot and was well presented. The order of nachos was large and the fish was well cooked. No complaints about either the food or the service. All told, it was a good experience and we wouldn't shy away from coming back. Prices are a little steep, even for Vegas. $30 for fish and chips.... I don't mind spending money on a good meal, but let's keep it reasonable. Two drinks and bar food was $93. The reason for the three stars was not the service or the quality of the food, it's for the value of the whole meal. Seems to me that being in the center of a casino, and a winning brand, ought to make it a volume restaurant, not a place to make a killing on low traffic. We'd come back for sure as we had a nice meal and you won't regret coming here if you're hungry.

xLl_3z0G9IsTVhq-BruViA.text: Never eaten here till now, thought the mobile reservation system was awesome. Works great. Very nice ladies at the podium with a warm welcome.  But the food, I had fish and chips which were great, but my two buds that were with me didn't like their burgers one bit. In fact one didn't even finish his. That bad.   Service was great, even had a few good drinks. It's a little over priced in my opinion. I'm wondering if Gordon is really involved with this restaurant based on the lack of quality. Seems he wouldn't tolerate this. Maybe we feel threw the cracks. Dunno just know we won't be back on this trip.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States

GiTp-yBRjSWliiqQfcDB3A.text: Big fan of Mr. Ramsay's TV shows.  My wife and I figured we'd be sure to get a great meal here.  I asked for a great wait-person and we got one.  Good start.  Bottles of wine marked up 4x retail, that's kind of steep, even for Vegas,  but it's OK if the meal is stellar.  My wife had the tomato soup, which was yummy and came out piping hot, just as she requested.  5 stars there.  The bread on the side was supposed to be a crostini, I guess, but the bread wasn't toasted, just warmed, so the topping and cheeses soaked right into the bread and created a bready mush.  That's just lousy work in the kitchen.  I had a Caesar salad, and our server asked if I liked anchovies, and as a matter of fact I do.  Usually a Caesar is made with tinned anchovies that have been cured.  The anchovies were fresh fish, fileted and lying on top of the salad.  None of the salty, cured taste of tinned anchovies.  The dressing was incredibly bland.  Hey!  There's supposed to be garlic, dried mustard, Worcestershire sauce and spicy goodness in there!  The kitchen made up for the lack of taste by liberally pouring the dressing all over the romaine lettuce.  The bottom leaves were floating in it.  Seriously, the worst Caesar I can remember having anywhere.    Our filet came out just right, and the bearnaise sauce we ordered was very nice.  The asparagus that accompanied the filet was woody.  The stems should have been trimmed up nearly to the tips so that what we ate was just the best, so another bit of sloppy work in the back of the house.  We also ordered mashed potatoes and a side of mushrooms.  The potatoes were good, served nice and warm (not hot enough for my wife who likes these things super-hot).  The mushrooms were nothing special or bad, just standard button mushrooms cut thick and sauteed in butter.    Then we had the sticky toffee pudding for dessert.  Oh, baby, was that good.  Super, super good.  5 stars and then some, so we ended the meal on a very happy note.     Oh yeah, English pub decor as "designed" by a high schooler from Columbus, OH.  Maybe a step up from a TGI Fridays.  Music playing, 80s disco and such, was loud, loud, LOUD.  Loudest restaurant in Vegas.  Hostesses were wearing very unflattering dresses designed to look like the old newsprint that fish and chips were wrapped up in back in the day.  Cute idea, but the dresses were oddly cut so that all of the women looked four months pregnant, and none of them were!  Definitely the worst-dressed hostesses in Vegas.  :-(    So... serious faults from a kitchen (supposedly) set up by Gordon Ramsay.  Half of the dishes would have earned F-bombs on his shows.  The other half were good.  So, three stars.  Would I go there again?  No, there are too many really good places to eat in Vegas.  Live and learn.

Ditjygdhq0xOa6CnE-V2Ug.text: Good late night drink & snacks. Forget dinner.  Pub food not best when so many other choices. Fast service. Needed drink refills.  Salmon over cooked.  Cool Looking  place like hos other restaurants. Pot pie weak.

5YFoeWewvgYjD9eXHEK15g.text: Came into eat earlier tonight with my wife for her birthday and it was such a huge disappointment. We had such high expectations for a place like this and it was horrible. I come from restaurant business of 6 years and my wife was pointing out more things than i was.  First off took us about 10 mins + to wait for our server because he had a problem with another guest.  Second took about 10 mins for our drinks to arrive.  Third the environment and people who worked here looked so lost.  Fourth I'm almost 100% sure i was served ketchup with my calamari. Now this could of been a runner mistake but i doubt it.  So all i had to eat was some fries.  Fifth after eating our food we wait 10+ mins for the bill  Last but not least i told the hostess to note a birthday for my wife and nothing was done.  I should of just gone to Applebee's or Chili's and spent the same amount of money for more food and more drinks and PROBABLY better service.

43GQDlRZOmpBGSf83UCpew.text: Given that this is Chef Ramsay's Resturant, I can't expect anything less than perfection. Fish and chips were out of this world. My friend ordered the burger, which looked amazing.   Nothing better than enjoying great good food and hearing the slot machines go off.   That's Vegas for you!

lqJ72O09Kq2l8GV1IpUguw.text: Chris P. Was THE BEST waiter we have had in a long time! He was extremely personable, made sure everything was to our liking, and our drinks were always filled. One of our last trips to LV, and one if the best meals we have had in a while!

LSkSpTjDpM9glWkAIYGY0A.text: Some additional information on our disastrous service:  The pepper debacle part II: Our waiter came by after I was told the restaurant ran out of pepper and I asked him if maybe I could get some pepper.  He disappeared and a while later I saw him and asked again.  He told me that the dispensers kept getting clogged and that's why they didn't give it to people.  Wait, so did you run out?  Or are the dispensers clogged?  If the dispensers are clogged I'd like to suggest the following... since they are essentially metal creamers with a hinged, unlatched top that has holes, just open, put some in a rammekin and bring some over.    At the end of our meal we had to ask for our check several times.  When it came we gave two credit cards (not uncommon) and asked the bill to be split 60/40.  Our waiter looked at us like he had no clue what that meant and then about ten minutes later came back and said, "So, if I put 91 on one and 71 on the other is that right?"  WHAT?!  This is a very basic math problem.  And, in case math is not your forte, you can use the POS computer or a calculator (or a PENCIL) to figure out that it's $64.80 and $97.20.  Now, we didn't need it to the penny but seriously?

Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. This burger was great but would have been greater with pepper.

gpW-24pa-nkZhFqzbeN4hw.text: A few of us went to this place over the weekend.  Although I don't find British food all that exciting, I had to give this place a try...why not?  The interior and decor were ok.  This is a pub so, it's not a place to take your date.  There's bread service of pretzels with butter and a cheddar spread.  It's about $20-30 per entree, $10+ for sides like English chips - depending on the menu (there's a pub menu and a grill menu).    We wanted to try the duck confit poutine but unfortunately, they weren't available.  Such bad news.  So, we ordered truffle chips, short-rib and cheek sandwich, steak, pork belly, and cornish hen.  For dessert we had peanut butter and jelly, sticky toffee pudding, butterscotch pot de creme and potted triple chocolate trifle.  Nothing exciting about the truffle chips and the steak.  I mean, they were good...just nothing exciting.  Except for maybe, one tidbit about how they cook their chips/fries 3 times: boiled, baked and fried.    CORNISH HEN: It came with veggies and I'm glad I ordered a side of English chips or I would've ended up hungry.  The skin was nice and crisp and full of flavor. 4/5  PORK BELLY: This was my favorite out of all the stuff we ordered. Fatty, crispy and delicious! 5/5  SHORT-RIB AND CHEEK SANDWICH: It was quite tasty.  Reminds me of a dish my mom made called mechado...but in a sandwich. 4/5  PEANUT BUTTER & JELLY: It has a hint of peanut butter and some blackberries.  I'm not a fan. 2/5  STICKY TOFFEE PUDDING: A classic.  It's warm, ooey-gooey and served with a scoop of ice cream and it was just perfect! 5/5  BUTTERSCOTCH POT DE CREME: It's got pumpkin and a hint of nutmeg with pumpkin seeds on top. Reminds me of fall/Thanksgiving. 4/5  TRIPLE CHOCOLATE TRIFLE: I'm a chocoholic so I had to have this. Not the best chocolate dessert I've had but it's good. I finished my dessert without a problem. 4/5  The food was good but the service needs to be improved.  Our food came one at a time and we normally wait until the last person gets her/his food before we all start eating.  A few follow-ups later, the last person got her food and by the time, everyone's food already had gotten cold.  The manager came and talked to us so, our desserts were comped.  It took forever to get drink refills and if you ask for sweetener or anything at all...you might have to wait 30 minutes to get it.  So, overall, I'd give this place 3.5/5 stars.  If I were Gordon Ramsay, I would tell the staff to "f@*% off!"

doSFnkI26d6zbj6-nAs7VA.text: You can easily find this pub & grill when you make your way from the main casino area to the Forum shop in Caesar's Palace. There was quite a line already at 6pm. The ambiance was casual and great for chilling.   This is the second Gordon Ramsay restaurant I've tried. The first one was the GR burger in Planet Hollywood. It doesn't make sense to compare the two as the menu and the dining experience are completely different. I got truffle fries and grilled salmon, which was like a seasonal special dish. The seafood was really bomb to my surprise! Service wise, I have to say that Planet Hollywood does a better job. The staff there are passionate and responsive to your request or questions. Here they are busier and less attentive.   Overall I had a amazing time here. I'm excited to come back next time!

v5BU0ioYtqsZ9LP_tCANJA.text: Went here for lunch at 2pm on a Sunday and had a great meal & experience, contrary to a lot of other reviewers it seems. There was a 15-20 min wait to get in, no big deal, & compared to the 2 hr Bacchanal wait this seemed super minor. Our server (Ricardo I think?) did a great job, was personable, offered great advice, & was knowledgeable of the menu. Zero complaints there. Ambiance was fine, comfy chairs, TVs conveniently placed for sports, with kind of a modern British pub feel/layout.  We started off with the Devilishly Deviled Eggs, which are served with the deviled yolks in a separate bowl, and are amazing.  Super great flavor on the deviled yolks (is that bacon I taste??), great consistency, and an easy way to get some yolk with every bite. Next up were the Welsh Rarebit ham sandwich, and the Short Rib & Cheek sandwich.  Both had excellent flavor, were served hot, and were of more than adequate size.  My gf preferred her short rib/cheek sandwich, while I preferred the taste of the ham/rarebit cheese sauce, but we agreed both were very good.  We subbed out our fries for the mashed potatoes, and neither of us were disappointed.  I also got an imperial pint of Boddingtons, took maybe 7-10 minutes to be delivered (only real service delay), but was frosty cold when it arrived.    We had no issues with waiting for food, service in general, or anything else that several reviewers have mentioned.  I guess this place might struggle for service consistency based on crowd load, and dinner sounds like it is the worst time for issues, but for lunch time, British pub-style comfort food (read: super when hungover), this place completely hit the spot!

Xg6ZlYG_-kc49zQ_wEaTkA.text: We had high expectations but were disappointed. Food was almost cold and just okay!! Sad because we are huge Ramsey fans!

meJYkabI21s-yd44CeLlUg.text: This review for the manager of Gordon Ramsey's restaurant in Caesar Palace Las Vegas. While I will concede some time has passed since we patronized the restaurant . I am unable to forget our pleasant experience . During the mid afternoon of August 17, my husband and I stopped in for appetizers and a few cocktail before going, later that evening to Ruth Chris's for dinner. We were celebrating for our 19th wedding anniversary .  After enjoying appetizers and cocktail, our waitress, while carrying a tray with full  dirty dishes, leftover food & drinks, accidentally spilled the tray and all of its contents on me. My blouse and my purse were soaked and the pain of the dishes falling on me was  excruciating . The waitress was True professional , concern about me and most apologetic. Her manager was another story, it took him nearly 10 min. to come check on my husband and me. He never apologized, he never offered  to pay to have  my blouse cleaned, and instead of writing off our entire bill he simply paid for our cocktail . I was humiliate and embarrassed. Very awful & unprofessional manager !!!

_oqJtMwMI2s9VmY3zabVmw.text: Been here 3 times and it's always a pleasure. This last visit was dinner on New Years Day so seating was tough but luckily,  I'm a Diamond Rewards member at Ceasar's so got it pretty fast so thanks to the kind hostess.  Kimberly,  who served us, was very friendly and accommodating.  She always check on us to see we got everything we need.  Was not that hungry so just had the slider burger with cheese and bacon which is cooked to perfection. The wife had the veal chops which is delicious so only bones was left.  Bill for 3 adults and kids was $211 after Total Rewards discount.  Will definitely come back.

md04aRQJ68laPxUzBJVqzA.text: Just what I would expect from Gordon Ramsay.  This place was awesome, great atmosphere, drinks and good.  My wife and I just stopped in for apps and a drink. I had the onion soup and my wife had the pretzels, both were really good.  The bartender recommended a English beer if never had before that was really good, not something I would've normally ordered.  The   Staff was great.  We are a huge fan of his shoes do it was really cool to finally go to one if his restaurants. I would definitely recommend stopping in here.  The only drawback of any is it is a little pricy but it's worth it.

nXuoHF4vXYjH7QDuNsStHg.text: We came here for our last night in Vegas. The food was OK for the money, but honestly Umami burger or the Counter is equal if not better. I will say that my drink the garden spritz was awesome!   We had the lamb burger and the regular burger. The lamb burger was great, but the other burger had to be sent back, it was supposed to be rare but it came out medium, and we requested truffle oil on our fries, but that didn't happen either. Props does go out to our waitress ( I do not have her name :(, but she lived in Mexico prior) who took care of us, she insisted on returning the burger and fixed the fries. We also had the sticky pudding, which I'd order again and the bread pudding was also yummy.   I guess the one thing that bothers me is that on Kitchen Nightmares you have Mr. Ramsay saving other restaurants, but this our third time at one of his and I have yet to say Wow, you can tell Gordon Ramsay "the dude from TV" owns this place.   The floor to the bathroom was so greasy my husband and I had to hold on while walking. We were joking about the lawsuit that is just waiting to happen. And the men's bathroom was missing toilet paper and when they brought it, it didn't fit the holder. Silly things that are huge lazy oversights from management and are the kind of things that Mr. Ramsay would fix on his TV show.   So, Mr. Ramsay if you or your staff read this, keep in mind that we don't just rate the food. I was a restaurant/bar manager in NYC for 11 years and I totally understand things happen, but if it hadn't been for our waitress, who seemed to be acting out of her experience and not out of her GR P& G training, I would have given you two stars.

oeffiOHESeHEtGxJbY0wGA.text: I live in Las Vegas so I'm used to having some great places to eat. And in my view  one of the best places on the Strip is Gordon Ramsay Steak at the Paris casino. We go there from time to time and we're consistently impressed. It's excellent from the moment you sit down to the minute you leave. We're not all too concerned with price, particularly for a great experience, but it's hard not to notice how expensive Steak is. Still, it's just that good.   This weekend we gave Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill a try at Caesars casino. It's decidedly different. Far more casual than Steak and focused on pub style food. Overall, we had a very good experience but as I recollect it now, I'm not sure it's enough to get us to go back. It's the kind of place that I'd gladly step into if I were strolling through Caesars, perhaps there to shop at the attached mall, but I don't think I'd make a special trip in just to eat there again. It's not that it's bad, not at all. But it's surrounded by a city full of great dining experiences.  To start (and despite some terrible reviews here to the contrary), our server was lovely, vivacious and helpful. She was friendly and attentive. The bar menu, complete with some innovative custom cocktails, tons of beer options, and a serviceable wine list, was presented on an iPad that provides plenty of details and an easy way to sort through to find what you want. We started with two of their own cocktails (I tried "Mother's Ruin," a nice mix of gin, sage liqueur, cucumber and lime), and some oysters, which were tastefully presented on cutting boards with traditional accompaniments. The bread service was a nice array of crusty, warm, house-baked pretzels (three different kinds) and a nice cheese dipping sauce, all very good.   The only hiccup in service was when our mains arrived so quickly that our appetizers hadn't yet been cleared. The servers who delivered them (not our waitress but two other men) seemed flummoxed. Their hands full they sort of just looked at us to move the dishes aside for them. But the table being small, there really was no place to put the spent plates and utensils. A line manager came to help, but he too seemed sort of clueless and overwhelmed. Neither of us thought too much of it and helped as best we could, but it was a strange moment that you'd expect the team was better trained to handle.  Our food was good. I had the beef cheeks, which has the consistency of a pot roast. It was served over some mashed potatoes and roasted onion. The portion was very generous and the dish was tasty, though just a little underseasoned. My wife had the mustard-basted flat iron steak served with an onion puree and Stilton cheese. Good, but underwhelming, she said.  We split sides of smashed fingerling potatoes (which were seasoned with double cream, butter, and black truffle) and creamed spinach with Stilton cheese. Both were very good. The sticky toffee pudding for dessert was excellent.  At the bar that night was Jan'el Witt, the recent winner of Ramsay's television show "Hell's Kitchen." Our waitress told us that she'd begin her reward as the "head chef" of the Pub & Grill in August.   So, in all, that leaves us at about a 3-star rating. A nice evening, a good meal, a fun time. But with so many options in Vegas, I'm not sure we'll be back again to the Pub & Grill. Unlike Gordon Ramsay Steak, which just screams a kind of uniqueness, Pub & Grill is good, but perhaps not special enough to warrant a return trip.

2ZHsWTxtAqYh6DHH3rfrsg.text: Perhaps their slogan should be "We garnish our salt with food".  We all 5 ordered different dishes and all had the same bloated feeling halfway through our meals.  The onion soup was laden with so much salt we couldn't even get through it.  All woke up the next day looking like the Goodyear Blimp - puffy eyes etc. I'm a Brit and sadly his menu didn't even come close to a "pub".  In all fairness, I don't even think he wrote the menu.  Their host staff look as though they have been stuffed into fish and chip wrappers. Completely unflattering dresses. Come on people, a pub should be the easiest restaurant to get right, but you tried too hard and you got this one wrong.

FvHT_SgTesXEbjGBlJNlsA.text: Sadly, I have to give Gordon Ramsay's Pub and Grill at Caesars Palace, Las Vegas, a less than stellar review. I can only muster the kindness to give this restaurant two stars.  I must admit, that were my rating based solely on my latest dining experience there, I would give the restaurant three stars, and, had I based my review solely on my first dining experience there, I would have given four stars.  I'm sure that you will ask, "How does the average of 3 and 4 equal two?"  The answer: disappointment.  This will sound silly, but bear with me.  The reason I returned to P&G after my first visit is also the reason I will not return: potatoes.  Specifically, two potato dishes: the Potato Puree and the Pub Fries.  These were not ordinary mashed potatoes and French fries.  These were a demonstration of what a potato can taste  like if a fine-dining approach is taken when preparing ordinary dishes.  Every now and again you taste a dish and experience it for the first time all over again.  Such was my experience with the fries and mashed potatoes at P&G.  They made me feel that, as a foodstuff, potatoes have much more potential that I had previously imagined.    The key to their french fries was the cooking technique: thick-cut potato planks, steamed, then lightly coated in seasoned flour, then deep-fried, then baked.  The result:  a hearty potato plank with a crispy outer crust that created the perfect seal to keep steam inside.  When you cut into them, you discovered a steamy, flaky potato meat.  These fries did not need any condiments whatsoever, and highlighted how good a potato can taste if treated properly   The mashed potatoes had a beautiful flavor.  The fluffy peaks of this dish were topped off with a drizzle of a chive infused olive oil that exploded in your mouth, filling your entire palette with the aroma of garden-fresh chives.  The key to this explosion was temperature of the potatoes: served piping hot.  On my second visit, I ordered these two side dishes again.  This time, the Pub Fries were plain, old french fries, and slightly soggy at that.  The mashed potatoes were a salty, gluey concoction that someone had tried to repair by thinning it out with copious amounts of cream and butter.  They were served cold.    Other highlights of the evening: arrived at 7:15pm and checked in for my 7:15pm reservation.  The hostess forgot to check me in, and when I made eye-contact with her every time she seated a walk-in customer before me, she quickly looked away and left the podium.  I approached a different hostess and was seated right away.  I ordered the seared scallops: scallops were seared on one side only. They were served in a bland seafood broth, with carrots, and artichoke hearts.  Not flavorful at all.  I ordered an espresso with dessert and it arrived cold.  The chocolate mousse trifle was sensational, though.  At any rate, I believe that what happened to this restaurant is not  so much carelessness on the part of its founder or staff.  It is a reaction to the caliber of the customer.  I spoke to the manager about the food, and he admitted that they had to change some recipes because their customers did not see the value in waiting extra time for french fries to be cooked three ways or for mashed potatoes to be prepared to order.  So, they have turned from their fine-dining philosophy to a food-mill philosophy: crank out orders.  And that is where the disappointment lies.  P&G once provided a fine-dining take on British pub fare.  It now caters to the lowest common denominator and provides tourists a place to grab a quick bite and gain some bragging rights: "I went to Vegas and ate at Gordon Ramsay's.  You know?  That guy from TV?"  Sadly, the Gordon Ramsay on TV is no longer anywhere to be found at P&G.  The Gordon Ramsay on TV preaches fine ingredients,  food prepared to perfection, good seasoning, good service, consistency, and, above all, passion and pride.  Where is the pride to be found when you don't stand by your food, and, instead, you cut corners to ramp up production.  Sorry, that's not fine-dining.  That's a factory.  I'll gladly drop $20 at Applebee's for factory food.  Not $200 at Gordon Ramsay's.

43l22xc1h0QgPBIdW9A1Ag.text: Gordon Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares? Try "You Don't Know From a Nightmare Until You've Sat at Your Own Bar, Gordon Ramsay."  We went to Gordon Ramsay's Pub and Grill this evening to watch the NBA Playoffs. Things started off well enough--we though the fish and chips were a bit greasy and way overpriced, and the french fries tasted burnt, but this was our first time at this restaurant, so we just thought that they were prepared strangely. When someone next to us was served the same dish, we realized that our french fries HAD been burned beyond all recognition.  We were having a fun time with the bartenders--lots of laughing and jokes. However, one of the bar backs, Antoine, followed my girlfriend when she went to the bathroom. Antoine, is a large, menacing character, and she was not comfortable with his aggressive behavior. When she came back from the bathroom, he came out from the back and handed her his phone number. Later, he said, "You better not have thrown that number away. You better call me or you can't ever come in here again."  At the end of the evening, one of the bartenders, Keith, put two drinks in front of us that we did not order, and said, "Try this." We assumed that he wanted us to try a new drink he was working out--we are very familiar with bars, and it wouldn't be the first time that a bartender had asked us to try his drink. I did not care for mine, so I wasn't drinking it. When Antoine came out again, he said, "What's wrong?" I said that I did not like it. Antoine then proceed to PICK UP MY DRINK, DRINK OUT OF THE STRAW, AND PUT THE DRINK BACK IN FRONT OF ME. I sat, mouth agape with incredulity astounded by his presumptuousness, and all I could manage to utter was, "I don't want that." He then took the drink and said, "I can't drink this out here, but I will take it in the back. Thanks for the drink!" I have never seen anything like this. As I type this, I still cannot fathom that a server (or any other human being) would drink out of a stranger's drink. IN WHAT WORLD IS THIS ACCEPTABLE?!?!? Especially in the context of a server and a customer. My head almost exploded. I supposed that it is fortuitous that I was intimidated by Antoine because that spared everyone from me causing a scene.  I called immediately after leaving the restaurant/bar. When I asked to speak to the manager, the hostess who answered the phone said, "Sure! What's your name, Hun?" I am a doctor and a college professor. "Hun?" What year is this?  When I spoke the the manager, there was no greeting on the phone, he just said, "Zeus." It took a few seconds for me to understand that he was actually stating his name, and I wasn't transferred to the wrong number. When I told Zeus the story, his response was, "So, I don't understand--are you saying that Antoine threatened you?" Hopeless--these people are all so hopeless. Zeus assured me that he would take our last two drinks off of the bill and tell the regional manager about Antoine's behavior. I am not really sure how that is an appropriate response to this horrific situation.   So, I guess we won't be returning to Gordon Ramsay's Pub and Grill, because my friend has no interest in calling Antoine--she couldn't afford to pay for all of his drinks all night anyway.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. We didn&#39;t realized that the &#34;chips&#34; weren&#39;t supposed to be charred until we saw people next to us order the same thing.

Gg3ccuQLR8qPEm4thR9UGg.text: Okay. The staff was very friendly. I had the fish and chips on the recommendation of the waitress. For $30 it wasn't that impressive and honestly a little bland. Fun atmosphere, cool pub decor and again a great staff but just not that impressed. You are paying for the name, not the food.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fish and chips

xOzMZsf1uE4bVOYQoZwWzw.text: When you are in Vegas eating out is a chance to have a one of a kind experience, which is why my mom, brother, and I chose this place when walking through Caesar's Palace. Well, clearly we should have kept walking. The service was not good, I don't think our waiter smiled once during the entire meal, and didn't offer any suggestions, and it took a for him forever to even come over and take our drink orders when we first arrived. Come to think of it the service was slow the whole night.  I won't complain about my meal because out of the three it was by far the best. I got the fish and chips and it was really good, and a huge serving. There were three cod fillets and a large helping of fries. The tarter sauce was probably the best I've ever had. That being said my mom ordered the scallops, and the presentation was awful. They brought it out in a large bowl probably three sizes too big for the amount of food that was in it. There were only five scallops sitting in a broth with carrots. No presentation at all, and for the price of that meal with absolutely no side included it was far from worth it.  My brother ordered the lamb burger and fries, and his serving of fries was about half as much as I got, which was a little confusing. The burger had too many flavors that did not mesh well together. The menu selection didn't offer enough choices in terms of meat, there was only once chicken dish. The drink menu was pretty good, but they were all pretty pricey, and for the amount of wine my mom got in her first glass it was not worth the price at all, I think it counted as "half a glass of wine" so it should have been half the price.  The interior was very nice and very "British." Our chairs were arm chairs that you would normally think of for a restaurant but they were very comfortable and made waiting for our food relaxing. All in all I wouldn't go back or recommend it to anyone, there are so many better places to eat on the strip.

SDFmN84IRcDJhfZXU84RVw.text: Not as good as his other local eateries but the same high prices.  Nice ambiance in the heart of Ceasar's palace with pub food and drink.  I don't like paying $30 for fish and chips but, hey, it's a celebrity chef.   Better for the Hell's Kitchen happy hour than dinner.  However, the food is damn good and the service is first class.  Salads, appetizers and sides are all good.

bAgQguoYvwlqvmZ9Q2o0Ow.text: We had the nachos and wings. Both were fairly good. The "goodbye blue sky" was delicious!!

TRWa3G_31-b6J0D6DwnI2A.text: Busy, happening place in Ceasars Palace. I had the pastrami sandwich which was very good. My guest had a burger and they said it was also good. Prices seemed a little high for the quality of the food served, but then again, its Vegas and everything costs a lot. I would eat there again, but would also consider checking out other options too. Its a good place....perhaps not a great place.

7u1Kr-vO32I9BF47I0dhLg.text: Didn't think much of this place.  Staff was generally unfriendly.  It seemed like they all thought they were doing us a favor.  Had high expectations for the food.  It is gordon ramsay so expectations are high.  Had the fish and chips and it was just ok.  For 30 bucks expected more.  Fries were nothing special either.

v8_JcnEoI2pgTG-_7YPKQw.text: The restaurant looked very appealing and the staff was excellent but when I Come to a marque restaurant I want my taste buds to decide if I'd return again; Deviled eggs were good but could be better Pork chops were fine too but they to could bed better  Ice in my ice water would be nice too Kale, that was a first and not terrible in the least  If it were local I may try again but sense I'm just visiting I highly doubt I'd return, to many other places to try my taste buds out on

gxPVjxQPkP1Y4Ap_u0GYgA.text: The Lamb burger was nothing special, honestly had very little taste.  We also had the BLT sandwich which once again was nothing special and way too much lettuce. I've made better at home.  The only thing that stood out was the garlic aioli that came with the fries and the high price.

1mcPYTaHNfNuHrScDWW93w.text: A lot of pomp and circumstance when you walk in.  The staff wear ridiculous outfits and the restaurant has been overdone.  I would have preferred that the time and energy be spent more on the food.  I ordered the a bloody Mary and the pub burger.  The bloody Mary was very good, I will say.  Had a unique flavor and was worth the $10.  For lunch I had the Pub Burger, I ordered it rare and it came well done and was extremely dry and salty.  And if you are a bigger person, the burger is small.  (Worked out for me, but smaller than one would expect for $20).  The fries that came with it were very good, had shavings of cheese on them, I mostly ate the fries and the burger was not so good.  This place was not horrible, but for Vegas, you expect exceptional food, this was not exceptional.  I will say the staff was very nice.  I think Gordon needs to spend some time yelling at himself for putting his name on this place.  I will not go back...maybe for the bloody Mary, but not for the food.

y6xc6p3s2thtTamt9hzj1w.text: Myself and my son enjoyed a great dinner there on Monday, as well as getting to watch some Monday night football...Our server (forgot name) was informative and very attentive, also met the manager, Michelle, she checked on us and was so friendly, awesome attitude!!!!...Overall we had a great time and will definitely be back....

klqdwsSRerhYO9Q-sUNF9w.text: Just had a terrific lunch here. My wife ordered the wings and I ordered the Fish and Chips! Fish was the best I have ever had. My wife loved the wings as well!  Can't wait to go back as we are locals. Our waitress, Brianna (not sure if I spelled that right) was VERY attentive and an absolute delight to talk to. Hope we get her next visit.  Based on our experience here, I recommend this place.

3dpS9fGJGYlK9P-6djhVNA.text: Disappointed!!  35 minute wait, which was what was quoted.  Uncomfortable seating everywhere.  Service was about as bad as it gets.  Looks like Ramsey allowed some kids take over the place.  From sit down time to food delivery was 50 minutes.  That was for a party of 2 on a Monday night @ 9pm.  Requested steak medium well...but it was bleeding upon arrival!  The food tasted good, but just not impressed.  Total bill about $100.  Never again...never.

U8AZSQI1V97q1LHxidvI4g.text: Absolutely phenomenal food. We had a basic all American dish, burgers and pub sandwiches, and Gordon's crew was able to make them some of the best I've ever had!  The wait staff was extremely personable and friendly. The vibe and atmosphere of the restaurant was welcoming and modern.  If ever I am back in Las Vegas, there is not a doubt in my mind that I will eat here again!!

33HZ3gss4vGx095wuUu3aw.text: Had the prime rib here and it was absolutely delicious . Pricy though with drinks and apps . But I would definitely say you would enjoy it. Service was great very nice people that work there.

_mcTugwYv3OF_n2oNs8V8w.text: This place is awesome. Our server Travis was friendly and very knowledgeable about the menu. He always kept checking on us and kept the drinks coming. I Had the wings for appetizer and the Hell's Kitchen burger. Very flavorful and had the right amount of heat. For dessert the toffee bread pudding was very moist and tasty. I recommend you give it a try you won't be disappointed.

J9NTZkCmE27txVlVkq70fQ.text: I was so surprised that enjoyed this meal so much. We had truffle fries for an appetizer and they were good. I had the corn beefed sandwich and it was so YUMMY! I wish I would have tried some dessert but I will be back.

ja2QzSYpbtyOK_U9Lke0Tg.text: Good, yes.  Great, no.  The food didn't produce any big disappointments, but neither did it amaze us.  I had fish and chips and while the fish was moist the batter flaked off in big slabs every time I touched it--I don't know why this happens with some fish and chips but not others.  The chips were a bit soggy, like they had been sitting for some minutes before I got them.  The mushy peas (they're actually called that) were very good, with a unique aftertaste I couldn't put my finger on, but delicious.  My wife's chicken curry was also good with some zip to it, but no better than what she makes at home.  Service was okay but brusque, they were very busy however and I suspect our server was run off her feet.  My biggest objection was the noise, it's impossible to have a conversation over a meal in a place this noisy, but that is common in Las Vegas where they seem to think a deafening racket is required everywhere all the time.  I'd like to try this place again when they aren't so busy, I might enjoy it more.

F33jNjLCyZZX7dRAdcuhCg.text: This was a little bit of a disappointment. The food is very over priced for what it is. We had the fish and chips and lamb burger, both were good but not worth $70.00 and the flavor was nothing out of the normal - I've had similar good with better flavor a for a third of the price. The service was pretty poor as well, I had to ask 3 times for drink refills which can be frustrating when you are spending so much money... If your going just for the experience, just expect to pay more then it's worth. Cool looking restaurant though...

Cpe5y3MQnOSGJH-x0quS5Q.text: A group of us went to here for dinner last night.  The atmosphere was great, but the food portions were ridiculously small.  It was overall a disappointment.

XC-39sC7p6Xpf8ksmkc1oA.text: Amazing!! We are big fans of Hells Kitchen, and were so happy when Scott won! We had to check it out. Soooo good. Scott came out and spoke with us. So friendly and hospitable. If you sit at the bar, ask for Ray Ray and have him make you an "American Werewolf in England". One of the best bartenders I've ever had! The food is fantastic. A must try!

zqMNJPjqAt0vzp5ki399QQ.text: While we love Chef Ramsay, this place is just okay.  Nothing to write home about.  It is in Caesar's Palace and therefore, way way over priced.  My husband had a burger, which again, was okay, but a whopping $19.00.  I had the chicken salad sandwich and it was fine, but I've had better.  We tried the "toad in the hole" appetizer, again, okay.  Rather bland.  It was a very expensive lunch; not worth the money spent and would not recommend trying it.  Finally, I just did not understand the "trendy" atmosphere, with the young women in strange "uniform", if you can call it that.  Yuck.

mlEJp_mhi9dyxlCuceB2sQ.text: It's hard to believe this place is run by the same guy who screams bloody murder when his "TV chefs" don't get it right. We arrived for lunch and (even though the restaurant was only about 1/3 full) were told it would be a 30 min wait for a table. Huh? We decided to sit at the bar which was packed. We watched as arriving diners were told there was a wait for a table even though the tables near us never filled up. While we waited for our food we asked a waitress why we were told the wait was 30 min when there were so many empty tables that didn't fill up while we were there.  She said they (not sure who that is) tries to "stagger" the diners so the kitchen doesn't get overwhelmed. She said she hates it because she doesn't make any money off empty tables. I told her I had a hard time believing a decision like that is left to two very young girls pretending to be hostesses and that a kitchen in Vegas run by a world famous chef can't handle a full dining room. CRAZY! Gordon! Don't be a donkey! If you're going to put your name on a restaurant make sure it embodies your customer satisfaction philosophy. Judging by the reviews this place is not doing that.  BTW The food was just "ok".

lrYjyLxR8YmV4QIXHOoNZA.text: Excellent staff, superb food, and wonderful dining environment!!! Highly recommended!! Will be back for sure. Thank you Peter.

_w5KUkOmcOuwkOWTIsnt4g.text: The Good:  - Tenderloin was excellent. - Sticky toffee pudding was great.  The bad:  - Bangers and Mash. Sausages were bland, rubbery, and the ends were too close together. Stingy portion of barely-warm mash. This is such a simple pub dish, it is a shame it is not done well. Lincolnshire sausages with hearty mash would be so much better.  - No custard option on the sticky toffee pudding. Although good with the ice cream it just feels like the lazy option. Not very authentic for a pub.   The ugly:  - Poor selection of draft beers, especially from the UK and Vegas area microbrews. Mostly standard beers you can get at many bars. The exception is Fullers, and to a lesser extent Boddingtons.  - Everything is seriously overpriced, even for Vegas. Add 50% to what you think is reasonable, and you'll be in the ballpark of what you are going to pay.  - The prices may be justified with fine dining food or service, but you don't get either. You get adequate food and service.   3-3.5 stars seems about right.

LmJuJgsg7h88GXLvesoRrA.text: I expected a decent meal and was pretty disappointed. My date and I ordered cocktails, steaks, mashed potatoes, and creamed spinach/kale. The cocktails were not well balanced, and in fact, mine was so bitter I didn't finish it even though we waited 20 minutes them to arrive. Dinner took 45 minutes to arrive. My medium-rare tenderloin was dry, cold, and tasteless. The waitress stopped by and I mentioned that my steak tasted like it had been sitting. She whisked it away and brought it back proudly announcing that she had them through it back on the grill for me. It was so lack luster I barely ate half. The sides were tasty . Although, the potatoes also came out luke warm. It was by far  the most disappointing meal I had in Vegas.... One would think Gordon Ramsey would be embarrassed to have his name on this restaurant.

htkxuxcHd_3aatlXh-oXWw.text: Food is excellent!!! Awesome service, I will definitely go back again next time I go visit vegas!!!keep it up and maintain  your excellent service!!! Happy camper here!!!!

B8zzioroa_5TOWkoGoGzaQ.text: Had their slider burgers with truffle fries.  Very good.  Would have rated 5 star but was seated at the bar and due to some poorly placed beer taps couldn't see past them to watch the NCAA tourney games on TVs behind  the bar.

Cvx_Is5owIrz-zrkxk7MJg.text: I've actually been to this restaurant twice; once for lunch and once for dinner.  Both experiences were exceptional.  The first time I tried Gordon Ramsay Pub and Grill I was looking for something affordable yet indicative of the reputation of Gordon Ramsay.    I looked the eatery up on the website and decided that a great way to test the waters would be to stop in for lunch.  We had a reservation, but we arrived early.  They sat us right away.  The atmosphere was interesting and industrial.  Large beer kegs lined the walls and pictures of Ramsay scattered the hallway.  There was a punk feel and a deliberately English design with emphasis on reds.    My husband had a burger and I had bangers and mash.  For appetizers we had the soft pretzels and I had the onion soup.  When I tried the English ale onion soup I was furious.  I am a 41 year old woman.  I have been cooking for over 20 years and I managed a commercial cookware store.  I'd like to think I know a thing or two about cooking.  That soup... it was so light.  The cheese on the croutons was so creamy.  My heavy, rich onion soup made with red wine pales in comparison.  The onions were sweet and perfectly caramelized just so slightly.  What a difference.  It occurred to me that that everything I thought I knew about cooking was absolutely 2nd rate.  It also was a portent or the next to come.  Sausages so flavorful and delicate... I was expecting heavy, filling pub food.  I received a delightful surprise.  The wait staff was expedient and attentive.  I was happy with the portions.  I didn't need a take home box at all.      Because of this experience my husband and I went right on Facebook and told everyone what an amazing time we had.  Of course when my cousin was in town for a sales meeting from Boston recently, it gave us the perfect excuse to return.  I spoke of that onion soup all the way there.  I've been searching for that recipe to no avail!  Again we arrived early and again we were seated immediately.  Boy was it busy!  We still had an attentive waitstaff though and my glass was never empty.  Music like Joy Division played and our waiter brought a round of ale.  He asked if we were in a hurry.  We said no and proceeded to work our way through roasted vegetables, smelt, scallops, onion soup, shepherd's pie and sticky toffee pudding.       EVERYTHING was amazing.  It was an experience to savor and although the restaurant was quite busy, we never felt rushed even though we were there for about 2 hours.  The next day I asked my cousin if I could bring some sushi up to her hotel.  She said she was in meetings all day then would fly back to Boston.  I said maybe next time then.  She said next time she comes to Las Vegas we're eating at Gordon Ramsay's again.  Forget sushi!

YkmpePnhYTHmaleOtn8wuQ.text: This place and the people there are amazing every single time. Consistantly great food, amazing personal service. The bartenders gene and keith are amazing. Their knowledge of the industry and their pursuit for perfection is unmatched. Louie is always there with a smile and a handshake. Awesome!!

Qvinl-_wFNeI5nuXJkviZQ.text: Went here last and have to say it was below expectations I think Gordon Ramsey would have. They sat us we ordered an appetizer they brought it out and started giving it to the table next to us. Then we ordered food and again the guy tried to give it to another table. Fish and chips were 30.00.. There was nothing special about it. Won't be back

ZnohHY7aYHk4bXY2oAXfqA.text: My new Husband and I went to Pub & Grill because we LOVE Gordon Ramsay and watch hells kitchen & master chef every season! The waiter, Taylor, was EXTREMLEY helpful to us in picking out the best entree's to have. I had the Grilled Lamb Burger - YUMM! My husband had the Grilled NY Strip - DELISH!  Our server overheard that we had asked for Ranch dressing and instead of leaving me to use the blue cheese that was brought to me - he brought me a number of options one of which included a cheese dip (which anyone who knows me knows I cannot say no to cheese dip)! Everything was amazing - I cant wait to go back one day!

9Prpexcse9OddfwHRbeOjw.text: The only reason I am giving this place 1 star is because we never got to eat.  We put our name down at 6pm and was told it would be a 20 minutes wait. After 30 I asked and was told 10 minutes. At this point everyone behind us had already been seated. We ended up leaving so we could get to our show. At 7 pm an hour after giving our name I received a text that our table was ready. Wish we could have tried the food. This is why living in Vegas we stay away from the Strip. Sorry Gordan Ramsey you really are one of my favorites.

xIfj0O90_J9ifD0R0mpSnA.text: The service was like a Greek tragedy and you hoped the food contained poison so that the evening would end early.   I haven't complained to the manager about service in years, but that changed last night.  While GR's pub food is generally fine, the overall experience was horrible.

a81puMjP6_sW_IV_u14peg.text: Started at the Charlie the bartender greeted us well he recommended three IPA beers that they had to serve I had a dogfish head I highly recommend having one shortly after the rest of my party arrived we sat and had lunch we started off with two appetizers the pretzel sticks were amazing and the deviled eggs was like something I have never tasted they were phenomenal! Lunch came out I had their fish and chips the fish was so soft great taste are server was very attentive great costumer service I will be back soon.

48TEzujRkLbB5SPoYoLhxw.text: Califlower soup: Just okay Fish n Chips: One of the worst I've ever ate and way overpriced Bangers and mash:  Good, but not worth the price for just a few pieces of sausage/mash potatoes/grilled onions. Tourist trap.

eXk9M-20vPoUa3W5mpWpiQ.text: Kitchen Nightmares...  For years we watched Gordon Ramsay sweep into a restaurant, point out the inadequacies of the food and staff, whip everyone into shape and leave the owners and patrons happy. Well Gordon needs to visit his own restaurant. We waited over an hour for our food and when it finally arrived it came to the table in bits and pieces, even though there were only four of us. Two salmon dishes came out first and by the time the other two dishes came out, the salmon was cold. Gone are the days when the server knows who ordered what, now it's like an auction. At this price point, with only 4 diners the food should arrive at the same time and the server should be able to figure out the orders. One member of our group ordered the shepherds pie, it was very hot around the edges but really cold in the middle. This is one of Ramsay's signature dishes and it should have come to the table properly cooked. We sat in a booth and the seats were too low for the table, which was uncomfortable. The white wine glasses were very small, not conducive to enjoying the wine...I felt like a child seated at the big table and given a kids glass of wine. Our server was distracted and appeared overworked. Almost everything at Cesare's Palace is overpriced, as is this restaurant, but we don't mind paying if the food & service is good and the seating comfortable...this restaurant doesn't meet the standard of it's owner. Big disappointment.

3C2IZ1SR6VJ_hNUjbiEAYg.text: Just stopped in for drinks but those drinks were worth a review. I had the Pub Crawl. A ginger and bourbon concoction that was fantastic. Wife had the Blueberry Smash. Awesome and I don't generally even like blueberries. Our bartender Tom even gave us a free drink experiment using basil, ginger and lemon. Don't even remember the liquor base but it doesn't matter. I think we'll be returning this week for dinner because the fish and chips next to us looked and smelled amazing.
