IJy0vzFZWJgkQEqEw96T7A.text: Gordon Ramsay is one of my favorite people ever!!!! So i hate to do this but we were seated right away we put in our drink order ordered our food and we actually got our food before our drinks. When i did get my drink it was horrible i had to send it back and the waitress explained they had new people she brought me another and it was pretty good. The food was a-ok my burger was cooked perfect kinda bland not the pop i was expecting! so all-in-all everything was ok but for $70+$20tip=$90 for two burgers four big french fries and two drinks i shouldve gone to lbs sorry Gordon But i cant wait to try his other resturants Oh and great job on uniforms they are hot!

M5cfzJE0nXihKIHz0Uf3yQ.text: We recently returned to Gordon Ramsey's Pub and Grill and were completely happy with the food and service. It was quite a change from our first disastrous visit!  The restaurant was busy and bustling and we were seated immediately by John. We started with a beer and an appetizer which came promptly.  The service was professional, yet with a pleasant smile, so very welcome. My husband ordered the fish and chips and i the filet with lobster which came out fresh and hot and timely. It was all so delicious and perfectly cooked and presented.  We were delighted - and thoroughly enjoyed every scrumptious morsel!  We finished with a shared dessert and a chocalatey cocktail, a tasty way to end a lovely meal. Thank you Gordon Ramsey staff for coming through!  We'll be back next time we're in Vegas. The fish and chips get a big thumbs up from me too, as the daughter of an English fish and chip shop owner who loves the real thing.

b9M8NH8qBzvp2PY6iDZ4jQ.text: Although the employees are kind, this place is a mess. Poor location and ridiculously expensive. They didn't even have fish and chips on their menu. I think the man himself needs to clean this place up.

70Xlrf9Cd5GyLV57dTtBNg.text: I was invited back to try a meal and am so happy that we went!  From the moment we entered the restaurant, we were treated well.  We ordered mac and cheese, a burger and bangers and mash.  For dessert we had a warm chocolate cake & mousse. Every dish was amazing!!!  I cannot say enough good things about the staff, service and food!  I know I will be back and ensure all my friends and family visit this restaurant while in Vegas.  Thank you to all of the Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill staff for a delicious and memorable experience!

vm2f746QeaRmRXkgEKVKow.text: Good food, good portions.  Granted it is slightly expensive, we'll worth it.  Our table had the red wine braised short rib (probably best dish of the four we ordered), diver scallops, fish and chips, and blt sandwhich.  The short rib was extremely tender and had very food flavor.  Service was excellent as well.

6Y28sPS_glRldcS5CUZIow.text: Met up with a couple of friends to grab a quick dinner.  Just a note - we looked on the Caesar's website in detail at all of their restaurants to find one that wasn't too overpriced since we had a big weekend of eating at nice places in front of us.  I didn't even know Gordon Ramsay had a place in Caesar's, but to my delight, there it was on the list and it had two $$ in front of it, noting it as an average check price of $20 per person.  This was not the case.  An average cost for an entree appears to be about $28.  So I met up with my friends and ordered a dirty martini, which came out perfect.  We ordered our food and started chatting.  We noticed that 30 minutes had gone by and the waiter had not come back and our food had not arrived.  We waved him down and he said he would go check on it.  10 minutes later the food finally came out.  I had ordered the duck confit salad from the appetizer section.  The portion was almost an entree portion, but half the price!  It was delicious and perfectly cooked.  I finished the entire plate and was just full enough.  One of my friends ordered the roasted chicken, which looked like a tiny whole roasted chicken.  I didn't try any of it but he said it was great.  My other friend ordered the flank steak medium, and it came out medium rare.  She also said it was quite delicious.  We ordered the fingerling potatoes as a side, and those were BOMBtastic.  To my surprise, the side of brussel sprouts were okay (i HATE brussel sprouts).  The ambiance was classy, but not stuffy.  I liked it a lot.  It was fun and just the right amount of loud.  The service was fine, other than the food taking forever, but maybe that's just because it's so new they are still trying to work out all the kinks.  It's also a huge plus my duck confit was only $16 and was such a big portion.  I'd go here again and try the fish and chips.  I saw a couple of waiters carrying that by for another table and my mouth began to water.  They looked phenomenal!

xzkR5qGpqjhWTev83wUpQA.text: We had the braised short ribs and the shepherd's pie.  Both were perfectly cooked and amazing.  The service was also friendly and location/ambiance nice.

RmC4HBLWLicM2EalcanTfA.text: Was very excited to eat at a GR place since my whole family watches all his shows and I own several of his cookbooks. Ordered the burger medium it came out raw. However they didn't refire it. They gave a whole new burger. The fried calimari must have been baby squid as the ring size was infinitesimal and all breading. Then the fish for the fish and chips just didn't taste good at all. However the star was the 3 mini pies. Steak and ale, Shepards and chicken pot.

FN700EXUfbN55bjjma_p7g.text: Loved this place! Would have been 5 stars, but unfortunately, the service was a little lacking. Sporadic would be the best word for it. Started with truffle fries and a scotch egg. Both delicious. Grilled lamb for both of us - very buttery and tender, and the couscous with vegetables was a win. I wanted more and more and more. For dessert, hubby had the bread pudding and I had the sticky toffee - BEST sticky toffee I've ever had, and hubs enjoyed the bread pudding. Cocktails are pricey, ($15), but I really enjoyed them. Will definitely be back.

6cxt6lBKfj4unc9FOqatEg.text: My husband and I are huge fans of ramesys  so we were quiet excited to go to his pub and grill. We were worried that everything wouldn't live up to our expectations. the entire experience exceeded our expectations! I order the chicken sandwich and he got the shepherd pie. Both were amazing and we will for sure be back.

h3VCdw3Tq_soQoN-8MqyWA.text: Let me just start by saying that I do not understand the 1 and 2 star ratings. Perhaps there are some disillusioned expectations due to his status as a celebrity chef. Or maybe people are just pickier on the Strip ;)  We went with one of the fixed menu options.  Soup - Cream of Cauliflower. This was excellent. And I say that as some one who normally abhors cauliflower.  The curry oil was a wonderful, warm touch.  Fish and Chips - The batter was delicious and the portion of fish was generous. More then enough food on the plate, I was pleasantly surprised. The chips were some of the best I have ever had. Fresh potatoes and the shaved cheese was super flavorful  Shepherd's Pie - My husband ordered this but of course I had to sneak a bite. Smooth, creamy potatoes. The meat was tender and the vegetables still had a nice flavor to them that was not covered up by the broth from the meat. I am not normally a fan of lamb but this was pretty dang good!  Dessert - Sticky Toffee Pudding. This was my first time trying sticky toffee pudding but I am now a converted fan. I wanted to take a bath in the sauce that was poured all over the cake and the sweet cream ice cream was fantastic.  Peanut Butter & Jelly Cobbler - My husband picked this based on our server's recommendation (the sticky toffee pudding was her first recommendation but she said this was her second choice since we wanted to order different things). This was way different then any cobbler I have ever had. But it wasn't a bad thing! The crumble part tasted kind of like a crumbled up peanut butter cookie and the filling was reminiscent of black berry jam. The jam was not overly sweet so it wasn't overwhelming at all. We actually really liked it.  The service was attentive and informative. Our drinks never got below half before someone came by to refill. I was nervous after seeing so many complaining reviews but again. After going to the restaurant I really have no idea what those reviews are talking about. I would certainly recommend this place to anyone who was visiting or simply wanted to try Gordon Ramsey's food without paying the steak house prices.   We will be trying his Burgr restaurant next!

KPRES4CAgn5pnfQRROtL_w.text: Three stars for the food, but the wait staff did a great job and did their best to make up for my cold food. We went in with high expectations given this is one of Gordon Ramsay's establishments.  There was a mix up in the kitchen so my meal was cool rather than hot. I have to say the flavor was there. I had the prime rib but they forgot to put the beef drippings on the Yorkshire pudding which left me with a partial meal. Mr Ramsay would have had something to say about it for sure. Natalie was a very good waitress and she went above and beyond to make sure I left the restaurant happy. Everyone else in our party was pleased with their meals. I will revisit and update the review based on my next visit. One more chance Ramsay.

uA1gqGcncKdTvC6afzkq1w.text: There are 15 of us here from California and Alaska to see the Elton John Million Dollar Piano concert at Caesars Palace in Las Vegas, Nevada. The concert was nothing shot of incredible by the way, strongly recommend it. We all went to Gordon Ramsay Pub and Grill in Caesars Palace for dinner before the concert. They put us in our own private dining room. Now I watch Gordon Ramsay's TV Kitchen Nightmares and he is always screaming at restaurant owners to keep the menu short and sweet and the importance of outstanding food and customer service. It was reassuring to see that his words are not wasted in his own restaurant. The menu, short and sweet. The staff were exceedingly kind, polite, and accommodating. Even the manager popped in to check on us. The food was very good. I wished I could remember the name of our waiter, but in all the hubbub I forgot, but he was excellent. I too, like Mr. Ramsay, expect good service and good food, I was not disappointed. I highly recommend this restaurant, and the concert if you have interest!

utRVdaxVufYe-Bd9FUN7ZA.text: Amazing food and amazing bar service! My goal is to stop by every time I go to Vegas!

fuYoq3I79KX4Rsw06D4o2A.text: My Los Angelenos, read up!! No service - waited 30 min for water and 20 min for the check, haven't seen the waiter except when taking our order and delivering our food. Manager came when we complained - with water but no apologies like "hey you complained about water so here's your water". Great except we wanted the water 30min ago and now just want the check. I wasn't even that mad because I understood it was busy but that felt like a little slap in the face. So we left upset with a bad experience.   Go somewhere else for the vegas experience because you won't get it here. BTW $18 for 2 small burger sliders.

y4IHD-wp-t3_zzJagbTOEA.text: Came here with high expectations knowing that Chef Ramsey is one of the most talented and well respected chefs in the culinary world. What a huge disappointment! I stood for more than 5 minutes before the hostess even bothered to look up and acknowledge our presence.  When she finally looked up without even greeting us, I asked for a table and she flat out said "45 minutes" in the nastiest most condescending tone while rolling her eyes! It was so disrespectful that we just walked away. As we started to walk away we noticed plenty of empty tables. Won't bother to come back until they lose the bad attitude and poor customer service!

v9MDbiNQW098CyFKKqxvMA.text: We got take out twice from here during our short stay. The burgers were decent but nothing like bugGR, they were really heavy as well, fatty and greasy. The truffle fries didn't seem truffley enough to me. The shepherds pie was good, but it was just ground beef and a side of mashed potatoes. I guess I expected more from a GR restaurant being a huge fan of Masterchef. The waiter was super rude. I placed our order at the bar for take out and my husband stood next to me with our sleeping baby in his arms. The waiter basically yelled at us saying we can't stand there because we had a baby and they would lose their license. First, the baby was in the hallway not at the bar. And second you can just point us to the couch saying we can wait there instead of shooing us away in this extremely rude manner. 5 mins later he came by saying he can take a family picture of us. He did. Then gave us the bill and hovered around so I felt obliged to put a tip - not only is this take out and we didn't really get "service" by this waiter, he was also very rude. Anyway, I wouldn't come back to this restaurant.

gr4H3R4DftwFeLU6rvTAEg.text: Cool decor with fast friendly service.   I had the Steak and Ale Pie, it was good but needed more crust. The existing crust was so thin you couldn't taste it.   I also had the Brussels Sprouts, I sent them back because they were cold and undercooked. The new batch came to my table faster than expected. It was the same as the first batch. I guess that's just the way they make them.   Sticky Toffee dessert, was very good but not great.   I had the hind leg of the mule. It's a cocktail. It had to much lime.

U9gCuSl76LD56KcOdWAXLQ.text: My favorite place in Vegas.  The food is always amazing.  The service is solid and the vibe, despite being in a casino, is really cool.

5PTFy3rD80IQtNPwDARrNw.text: Ordered to-go. Food was extremely slow coming out and when it did was cold. No microwaves in room so had to eat cold food. 2 stars for food flavor.

Ro7AVg58YzIH9lVw7AZRSA.text: Grabbed lunch here with my 8 year old.  She recognized the name and wanted to give it a try.  One word can summarized the whole experience for me - meh.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Brownie Cheesecake Sundae
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pot Pie Sampler
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sliders

1JZqZIq2PCcuHOfkuARffg.text: Lousy food, rude server! Never again! So disappointed Gordon! I know your standards are higher than that!

R0P772TnqE5ZLhek80z2jg.text: Came here for a birthday dinner..food was delicious and service was attentive and friendly...we started with some of the pub bites..smoked salmon toast(my favorite)..mac and cheese and hummus. Then for entree i had to try the bangers and mash was not disappointed..flavorful and hearty!..to finish we the meal we had the Sticky toffee pudding so yummy..not overly sweet. Must try!!..Well def come back and try some other items.

k4yesgQQccD6rSucLlFb4Q.text: Front of the house is TERRIBLE!  I'm surprised Gordon would have his name attached to such a disorganized, rude bunch of staff!  Hopefully the food will change our mind. We are only 20 min past our reservation still waiting!  The hostess wiped her nose with her hand multiple times and did not wash her hands.

pMgG_BidHBJ2taRSYGnEkQ.text: OMG!  Really Gordon?!  Came in last night with a friend and thought I'd go with something simple, as we were anxious to make a show next door at the Bellagio.   Ordered a sandwich and what did I get?  Rotten bread. Not just stale either. Rotten as in mold was growing on it. So nasty.   Can't recommend to anyone if they're not even looking at bread when they put a sandwich together!

utQc4FJn0HuFnNxKEjU32w.text: We had a good experience. Hubby had (very expensive) fish and chips. $29 for two pieces of fish and fries. I had Shepard's Pie ($22) which was delicious.  Great waitstaff and clean restaurant. My only disappointment was the bill: $69 with tip. I have spent less for a 3 course dinner in Vegas and received a comparable, if not better, experience.

JnrhrQCWL2y5-FWxiFxt4g.text: Worse EXPENSIVE meal I've ever had but terrible at any price. $8 Min-mac appetizer, tasteless  $17 Caesar salad had NO flavor, watery "dressing" and knife cut  $21 Corned beef brisket sandwich was stringy and equally tasteless. $36 Scottish Salmon was small, tasteless and came with only 3 small cauliflower florets and again some tasteless green goo.   I eat out very often, and pride myself in having an open mind, a widely varying taste and almost never write reviews good or bad. This awful food experience deserves my time to comment on. I had high hopes for this celebrity chef and walked away with an empty pocket, disappointed and with an unsatisfied stomach. Don't eat here if you like to enjoy your food and have the satisfied feeling that comes from eating a good meal.

OHhOsmpOYfypM1bpnIY38A.text: We received super excellent service. On a scale of 1-10, my girlfriend and I rank probably an 8.5 on the beer knowledge / tasting scale. We sat at the bar, and the bartender could sense our experience based on a couple basic questions he asked about the kind of beer we like.  He was a super star. He provided 3-4 (free) tastings, recommended an excellent Saison, and even opened a British IPA, poured us some, the people beside us some, and himself some, free of charge.  Very friendly upscale experience, and I highly recommend giving this place a try.

HgpdB1rWTk5dBDfc6-aK5w.text: This place was amazing! Really great service and amazing food. Fully impressed with the Bangers and Mash, if that's British cuisine I'm sold! My daughter ordered the bacon cheese burger minus the cheese and she said it was one of the best burgers she's ever had. My husband had the 14oz ribeye and had a chance to taste all three sauces. He said it was a pretty good steak, but Mesa was much better for him and he thought the service was slow. Next time I go I'll try the wedge salad and tomato soup!

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cool place setting, unique cutlery.
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Light ale and the mocha martini...mmmmmm.
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fabulous signature bacon burger no cheese and fries.

glv1f-sa8ZJHW62pYvZgfw.text: The service was great and the interior was nice and cozy, but that was about it. The food wasn't spectacular or anything - you really are paying for the name. We ordered the burgers but sadly we have had better burgers elsewhere for a fraction of the price we paid. To put it simply, they were bland and tasteless. We also had the lobster and shrimp rolls - these were pretty good. If you're looking to enjoy some delicious food, I wouldn't recommend this place. But if you want to eat here for the experience, eyes off the burgers!

UmTI1miARRn8l42_By49Lw.text: Awesome restraunt with cool ambiance. Our waiter, Chris was great and made for a fun experience!

hciB5a3weM892mXqzxmxLQ.text: Went out with friends and ordered 2 rub eye steaks rare and medium rare unfortunately it came out medium rare and well done! The quality of the rib eye was mediocre at best. The devil eggs with crab and bacon tasteless typical of British food ! The curry chicken was spicy but bland and we could have ate at an authentic Indian restaurant. Would not recommend to this horrible place and it's all hype!! The only reason we ate here was the close proximity of Mariah Carey show !!

BuDh8NMP6l9ZoNBHMPux9g.text: In the previous reviews I've written for GR's BurGR, I've mentioned being a fan, a big fan! And my ratings are not just because I'm one. This place is superb!! We had a reservation and were seated immediately, despite the crowd. The service is top notch. My husband ordered a Mocha Martini that was rich and chocolatey. We placed our dinner order and I went to the restroom . By the time I returned all our food had been placed at our respective seats!! Such quick and efficient service. Our server was polite and friendly and made sure we were comfortable all through our visit, which I found lacking at most other places in Las Vegas.  We ordered the Maine lobster and shrimp roll minis as one of our entree, to save space for dessert. It was a well grilled brioche and the lemon- garlic mayo with the seafood was really nice. The butter chicken curry was authentic. It was as Indian as Indian gets! It was served with a flavorful saffron basmati rice , and a fluffy naan bread, with a side of raita ( yoghurt). The bangers and mash was great too!! It nice sized portion with English sausages made of a trio of meats. The gravy went well with the sausages and the creamy mash potatoes. The best part of the meal was the sticky toffee pudding! If you visit this place, you must try it! It's moist , delicious  and served with a sweet cream icecream. The almond brittle melts in your mouth. The server pours the warm toffee over the dish when it's served. It is so, so good!  All in all a wonderful experience even amidst the Vegas chaos!

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mocha Martini
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Butter chicken with Naan , Rice, Raita
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Maine lobster rolls

aGRmqLCsp5hTtVhdkKt-0w.text: The food was just OK. I had a pulled pork sandwich (it is a cold sandwich), and the bacon on it was cold and just tasted like grisly left overs.  It was bereft of seasoning, too.  Our food came out fast however it was challenging getting the staff to provide a refill (it wasn't busy at the time). With all the choices here in Las Vegas, I would not recommend!

6PbReIz9zfY0CwOQ-cd1jQ.text: not only was the waitress gorgeous, but she totally helped me out when i told her my friend was a diabetic! she recommended the deviled eggs and they came out faster than lightening! i had the lamb burger which was heavenly! fantastic service! great food!  mmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmm!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

fXmbSw23wxm8Bee8BtJUKg.text: Went there for my birthday dinner. Had fish and chips, it was too greasy and after 3 hours it still is not sitting well in my stomach . Service wasn't good, had to call the waiter for drink refill. I had a higher expectation of this place. I wouldn't recommend that dish, maybe a different cook would be better. Also, it was $30 for the dish, which wasn't worth the money. A friend ordered lamb burger for $21 and it was much much better, but still it wasn't up to the standard of the name brand.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States

1lD--cPwqggxIzikRHnrMw.text: A little disappointment here. Perhaps because it's Ramsey, and who hasn't watched his show, my expectations were higher than usual.  On the show he is a perfectionist, and expects that from his teams, and yes it's a show, but this resto has his name on it and it was not perfection.  My burger was not overwhelming or juicy or delicious. That's what I expected. The truffle chips were actually my favorite here. We did not order any of the British staples like fish n chips or shepherds pie, and that may have been what all the great reviews were for. All I know is I did some major walking and shopping at the Forum Shops in Ceasars so when I saw Gordon Ramseys pub I walked in. I had such a taste for a great burger which I did not get. After posting this review, a GM did message me and invited me to try them again. I was most impressed as this was not a terrible review at all.  Apparently they care about the food they serve and about what customers think. Cheers to that!

YLjoyBMKMTae3uMEEVY5rQ.text: For a casino restaurant, the place is pretty good. Definitely A-OK. In fact it was surprisingly good because I actually expected it to suck. I ordered the trio sampler of pies that included a chicken pot pie, steak and pie, and shepherd's pie. They were well-cooked, ingredients were of good quality, and was wonderfully seasoned. I don't know why most restaurants underseasoned their food, but it was the perfect amount of salt here.   Unfortunately the prices were INSANELY high and I felt so bad for the wait staff. Their uniform is a cheezy body tube houndstooth patterned dress with some pleather bustier thing. Weird.

i2ViE5-64zEqJcMkaP-Rcw.text: I don't know if it was the time of day we are here or what, but I was very disappointed.  We ate around 9pm on a Friday which shouldn't be late, especially Vegas, but the food was horrible. My fiance got mini burgers which were fine, I got the shepherds pie which was quite frankly awful. It was cold in parts, tasteless overall, and super salty on top. Our friends got the bangers and mash and the short ribs. Both were edible, but nothing you would ever go back for. I was completely underwhelmed and ended up needing to get room service later on because I was hungry since dinner was so bad.  The service was bad, too. Super slow even though there were enough servers for the few tables that were occupied and it felt like the waitress just didn't care.  I expected better from the name and honestly feel that's the only way this place stays in business.  Steer clear unless you only want drinks or a burger.

9R1KFonSUzO3pOnccAuFPQ.text: Easy review:   Point of view: middle class income.  & Local of the Las Vegas area.   Pros:  1. different, not American style food 2. New experience 3. Nice theme and set up 4. Food very hot on arrival  Cons: 1. Overpriced  2. Way overpriced  3. Portions very small for price 4. Slow service, waited 20mins to order. 5. Found bone in meat pie. (Scary, Easily could of choked, thankfully found it.) 6. Not very well lite, very dark.  7. Menu to small 8. Ipad menus would freeze and very slow.  9. Over priced 10. Wanted a steak, but it was 69$!!! Nty!!!  Would I return? No Would I recommend? No  I do recommend Gordon Ramsey's Burger @ planet holleywood. Half the price and flavors are amazing!!!!!! And American style food with amazing fresh different ingredients! Well worth it.   Pub and grill has a long way to go!! Good luck chef.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Caesar salad with anchovies!! Beware strong anchovy taste! Sometime overwhelming. Do not get if you do not like fishy taste!!!
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lamb and beef pie with mash potatoes on tops. Cooked to perfection. Unfortunately a bone. Ruined it. Chef would be very mad...
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Extremely flavorful corn soup. Amazing.

yl9pk8uxLhrf3B-RVyMfeQ.text: Excellent service from Rodney for our party of 8!  The nachos, meat/cheese tray, and wedge salad were awesome!

02fqkfrkFeirJxo9B6i3nQ.text: If it wasn't for the long wait for our food and my lemons for my water I would've loved this place a lot more but I didn't especially when your with a group of girls who are hung the f over.  Came here on Sunday around 1pm because Serendipity was a half hour wait (we should have waited). Got seated ASAP after checking in with waters but it took our waitress forever to get my lemons which she did not bring and it even took a lot longer for our food to come out. Not sure if it was her fault or if the kitchen was backed up but at 1pm the place wasn't busy at all.   I ordered this salmon puree appetizer and it came in a small jar with 6 thick slices of toasted white soft bread. Really good for less than $20 and it was very filling because I only ate about 3 slices of bread. The bread was really good, soft and crispy even when it cooled down it was still really good to eat with the salmon puree or by itself. I really enjoyed it because it reminded me a lot like a lox and bagel without the capers.   My two girlfriends got the lamb burger which they devoured and loved. I didn't get to try it because I don't eat meat but I did get to try the fries that it came with. I love fries so I already knew I would like it but I didn't know I would love it! It wasn't overly salty or oily and it was a thicker slice with the right amount of salt. It was so good just plain and it didn't need the ketchup dip.   Prices are reasonable and it's located in Cesar's hotel right across the casino by the Forum shops. Reasonable prizes and big portions! Just be sure to wait awhile.

yLOlrUKjw3FbiAm5B92RGw.text: Great place for Food,  Loved the unique menus and atmosphere.  I had the Lamb burger.  cooked perfectly medium with goat cheese on top ohhh yeah.  Staff was very efficient but not overwhelming.

ZdLoWVgfsErKhPy90bRsvA.text: Kitchen Nightmare! What a let-down! We had had reservations to come here for a long time, could not wait to try it out. I am a fan of GR and his personal high standards. Unfortunately, every single thing that could have gone wrong here - did. And we are not high maintenance guests. The atmosphere is OK and they had our reservation so things looked alright starting out. It took an eon for the waitress who was on planet Venus all night  to come by and bring us water. We were starving so we ordered right away - the scallops, steak and the soft and salty pretzels to start. We waited and waited and it was busy but not full.  It took forever for anyone to come back around with anything. We got mixed veg side dish brought to us by another waiter. Not our starter. We stated that we had ordered pretzels and then our own server came over and looked like a deer in headlights. I gently reminded her, that she was the one that had recommended them to us and that we had said yes to them as our starter. Sheesh. Then finally, our main courses arrived. Then so did the pretzels which we had lost interest in. 3 tiny sticks for $8 with sickly liquid cheddar and mustard so hot to one's senses it was inedible. And I love hot. The steak was vastly under seasoned. The scallops had a nice sear on them (4 for $32, yipes!)  but the chowder they were on was cold. Terrible thing to serve a chowder cold. The taste was there though. Too much $ for these plates. We had to ask for a steak knife, spoon for the chowder, salt and pepper. Really? No one came around to check on us. To add insult to injury not only were those late, overrated pretzels on the bill, so was the mixed veg starter we never had nor ordered!  Eventually these were taken off the bill after much waiting but I was surprised that a manager had not come by to rectify anything or see what they could do to improve. We paid,  shook our heads and left knowing that the high turn around of customers/tourists  will keep this place afloat but there is no organization here whatsoever, no one seems to give a rat's A$$ and we left a little dumbfounded.  Gordon, you better get back here and have your people retrained!!!  With so many restaurants to choose from for the price, I would look elsewhere. We will not return.

rko9arkywWAwPlJXf98WIQ.text: Decided to give this place a try with my cousin. Upon arrival we were seated quickly. Our server Adam was very nice & helpful which is why I'm giving 3 stars instead of 1. I ordered a burger & let me say my burger was delicious!! However, my fries were super hard as if they were 3 days old!! That was very disappointing because this place isn't cheap! I'd rather have McDonald's fries than these!!!

R_0eKmYlJ-NlDGWO_4lsDg.text: I've only watched Hell's Kitchen a few times, but I'm pretty sure Gordon Ramsay would lose his mind & fire all the employees if he ever visited this location.  But then again, he's probably kicking back somewhere in South London drinking a pint collecting the royalties off this mess.  The staff was terrible, it took 15 minutes to get water I had asked for 3 times.  The shrimp cocktail was good, but it's Las Vegas & a shrimp cocktail.  The whole town pretty much has this dish nailed.  I'd suggest trying one of the other 647480 restaurants within walking distance.

mNzDPmQLDwi-KcdtoGv7zQ.text: We had a great lunch here. Stopped by right before 11am and there were lots of people already waiting for the restaurant to open (good sign!) I had a corned beef sandwich that came with chips (homemade potato chips). Corn beef was excellent, very moist and tender. The rye bread was delicious and perfectly grilled. There were pickled onions and swiss cheese on the sandwich as well. Chips were okay but not my favorite. My husband had fish and chips (french fries) and he enjoyed everything very much. The service was excellent. They have a great beer selection that we will try when we return!

GShxYjAFvLl2lpI66Q-sLA.text: The food here is delicious, this is a newly opened pub located inside Cesar's palace. Priced a bit above average for a normal pub. So they loose a star for that. They were pretty busy the day i ate there, and I felt almost ignored at times by my waiter. I dont need many things, but refills come on. I dont have any thing else bad to say tho, def give it a try if you are around the area. Atmosphere is amazing, decorations are great looking and cutlery was amazing looking and well combined together with plates and glasses.  Try the shepherd's pie its delicious!!

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Back area of restaurant

M6ESsu6P00dbP_PVhkr1vA.text: Absolutely delicious! I had the lobster roll as an appetizer and it was perfect. The bread was outstanding, the flavor was light; it was delightful.  I had the fish and chips as a man course. The fish was airy, and fried to perfection without losing any of the fish's flavor.  For dessert, we split the spotted dic. It still makes me giggle, but that's because I can be childish. ;) The bread pudding was extremely tasty alone, but with the sauce? Fabulous!  I can't eat a lot at once, and this meal didn't get me too full. Each course looked like it would be very dense, but it wasn't.  Our waiter, Ali (I think), was helpful and knowledgeable when we didn't understand what something was or what it was for.

_q88grDKcKtkValStYYc0g.text: Beer is phenomenal, mixed drinks are well-poured, I would consider stepping into a cage and fighting a beastly man over the rights to have some of this food, and a super friendly bar staff and management.  Asked for a special request to get into the kitchen, and although they were hesitant because of how busy they were, they played along with us and eventually allowed us to meet the chef and give him our sincere thanks for a wonderful meal.  Great time, great place, possibly the BEST food I've ever had (which was diverse also), and overall a fast and friendly environment. Would definitely recommend to absolutely anyone for a quick beer or for amazing dining!!!

VcMMcsnzGcMEwCWa7NJjyA.text: Absolutely amazing food, best fish and chips ive ever had. We also got the chicken pesto sandwich, it comes with fresh made chips and was excellent. The Sticky Toffee Pudding for dessert was so delicious as well. Our waitress was so nice and friendly and gave great service.

Bcj7C9d5p3Su5c92W-ndRg.text: This is the second time we went to Ramsay's. We wanted to go twice to be really get a rating for this place. The first time was for dinner. We go the Bangers & Mash and Shepherd's Pie, two items that a pub should be known for. Both were good, but not great. This dishes are both around $25. We also had the English Ale Onion Soup for an appetizer. That was very good.   The second time, we went for lunch and wanted to try the fish & chips. We had Calamari for an appetizer. This was good.  Please don't go by every ones recommendation on the fish & chips. We went there just for that and we both were very disappointed. $30 for fish & chips, they better be good, but they were not. You were given 2 not very big pieces of fish and not very tasty.  Go downtown at the Main Street Station at the 777 brewery that were 100 times better at better then half the cost.  Bottom line, not worth the cost of the items on the menu. Way overrated.  Really disappointed in a place with Ramsay's name on it, Seriously, walk 100 ft to Bobby Flay's Mesa grill in Caesar's to get a great dinner or lunch at pretty much at the same cost. It is not a pub, but his food is so much better and would rate it a 5 over this 2. If you are a Total Rewards person, be sure you tell them for that big $1 off per selection. Both times they did not ask and had to point that put to them when the bill came, even after making a reservation online and noting our Total Rewards number.

CcilYmLdTOQh1yrNSGv7GA.text: I never use this account to leave reviews, but this was just SO BAD. I love Gordon and all his shows, so this was a major disappointment. As we were walking in, we heard a couple sending their food back. My family and I should've taken the hint and left right then.  They don't give you any bread, which for the price of basically $30 a plate I expected some. I got the salmon cooked "medium", but when it came, it was not only half the size of my palm but it was also raw. I felt like I was eating sushi. Not worth the price tag at all. My mom got a hamburger cooked "well done", but when it came, it was bloody and raw. When she sent it back, it came seared on the outside with the inside exactly the same. It was still raw and bloody. She sent it back a second time and told them not to bring it back. My brother got the scallops that were so flavorless he named it the worst he ever had. My dad's chicken was okay, but the mash potatoes he paid 11+ for were completely flavorless.   The only halfway decent thing I had was some French fries that were supposed to be truffle fries but only had salt on them..... Couldn't properly enjoy them though because both my and my mothers ketchup had strange black pieces of god knows what in them.  Honestly save your money and go to mcdonalds if you want some fries.

qciPXO9mXlNU9_-8ys198g.text: I came here in the middle of the afternoon for a drink and a snack. My partner got an amazing drink called the Goodbye Blue Sky. It was complex, mildly sweet, and was properly strong. It was worth the whole 15 dollars they charged for it.  We also ordered a couple snacks of truffle fries and brussel sprouts. We had to wait over 20 minutes to get our food, with no updates. I was frustrated enough that I was getting ready to leave, but then the fries were placed on my table without any apology for the wait. As for the fries they were... Okay but unimpressive. I'd do just as well to get fresh fries from McDonald's. The sprouts were a little better with the balsamic, bacon, and I think apricot... But not amazing.  In short the drink was good, the food took forever and was rather unimpressive.   This is particularly disappointing after having eaten at Burgr for similar pricing and having had such a better experience. Given all the options we have in Vegas I'd skip this one.

bJodZcgHuLXxGBgr-PKiKg.text: Definitely more for tourists. For someone like Gordon Ramsay you would expect much better, even if it is simple pub fare. Fish and chips was okay minus the mushy peas, however the sheperds pie reminded me of runny dog food. Add 2 soft drinks, truffle fries, and tip you are looking at $100.

3HiY3qgfyaB5-uvxtg0xEA.text: Decided to check this place out on our way out. Couldn't have been happier! This place is so awesome. Our food was perfect and we had the sweetest/coolest server ever. I forgot her name, but she was super cute and was from Cuba?   Anyway, this place made me want to try more of Ramsay's spots :) Check it out. You probably won't be disappointed.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bly duo
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tomato soup to start ;)

WRWGWp8s54TE1GnU4FtHvQ.text: Food and service were both good but really nothing to brag about. On recommendation of waiter I had the lamb burger.

6MBAv4sqjlzDCyOTnfGtfg.text: We were on our way to the food court to have a last meal before hitting the road and saw a sign for happy hour so we decided to try it out. SO happy we did! There was only about 10 minutes left for happy hour but the employees were extremely nice and accommodating. The hostess sat us down and went to get the waitress so we'd have enough time to order. The waitress, heather, came out immediately and took our order. We ordered the wings and truffle fries and asked her if she had any other recommendations. She told us to try the nachos, which we did, and it was hands down the best thing we got! Everything we ate was great, but it's been 2 days and I still can't stop thinking about those nachos! 100% will be back next time I'm in Vegas!

za2VQZv8fGNp34urstLCkQ.text: AVOID.  Dinner for four on a Monday night was so loud you could not hear yourself think.  Despite having "open table" reservations, hostess tried to sit us in high chairs without backs.  Older people can't handle that and she should have known better.  We were shown to a regular table when we complained about the chairs.  Waiter mixed up simple order.  Delivered drinks to the wrong people, then delivered the wrong entries to two of the four.  Couldn't get anyone to sort it out despite asking several service people to find our waiter.  I'm sure he apologized when he finally showed up but who could hear him?  Chicken pot pie was ok after finally being delivered, but not worth the money.   Gordon should be ashamed of himself.  Overpriced, lousy decor, way too loud (why play loud music in the background when you can't even hear the person sitting across form you?), mediocre tasting food.    Won't go back.

Oa0rUfuZHxipMsWXmn0L7Q.text: I ordered the lamb burger and my husband ordered the 10oz iron skillet steak. We also ordered the calamari for appetizer and chocolate truffle for desert. The steak was a little burnt and the calamari was not that crispy but the lamb burger and the truffle were amazing. The service was not up to the mark as the drinks and food arrived really late.

flGj1A8eeNLq1C2sbAj6Vw.text: Not sure why this is only three stars.  We stopped in on a lark because I needed a drink after accompanying my wife to the Louis Vuitton store.  Did you know you HAVE to have the matching wallet to go with the bag? I didn't.    We sat at the bar and enjoyed engaging, friendly, fun bartenders. Not cheesy-dumb silly bartenders. Just a couple of dudes who want to tell you about their favorites on the menu and make sure you have a good time. VERY decent beer selection. Hard to believe beer can be so hit and miss in LV.   We grinded on the Hell's Kitchen burger, the wings and some truffle fries.  The burger was very good!  The fries were very good! The wings were very good! We really enjoyed everything.  It's a little pricey, of course, but it's on the Caesar's casino floor. What do you expect.  It won't blow your mind, but it will make you smile.

bOpG4dTqfwjHudH-eY9Lkw.text: For all the hype he does on tv the food was only mediocre! I expected outstanding. The fish and chips were average and the green goop called peas was warm and not to my taste. The service was good and prompt. I've had better at less expensive establishments.

j66ZHLGca7Yv6PcKU5VvEw.text: Great addition to this still bustling casino. Gordon... I figured out where the lamb sauce is!!!  Job well done by all your people.

daSE8iXevyGVyqg6X2ZA1A.text: Gordon, I'm surprised. Was really looking forward to the experience, but overall, kind of disappointed. Good is a bit overpriced, but expected for Vegas.  I had the Bangers and Mash, wife had Prime Rib. Quite frankly, both wee under seasoned. My Banger quite small. :) and the mash was too creamy. Wife's prime rib really needed a bit more seasoning. Horseradish tasted really watered down.  Service was good, though it did take a little longer than expected for the entrees, especially since our appetizer came out super fast. We also had the "DIC" desert. Keep in mind, there's Bourbon in the caramel, so be aware. It was delicious, by far the best part of the Menu.  Overall, for the price we paid two, the Baccanal Buffet would of been a much better value and experience.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. After hours, all lit up.

qs75MrIJGaEuuNqseIKr7w.text: Let me start off by saying the food was fantastic! I ordered the lamb chops and they were cooked to perfection. My only complaint was that the veggies it came with had zero seasoning. No salt/pepper or anything, which I found odd considering the lamb was seasoned very well. My family ordered the Shepherds pie, Hell's Kitchen burger, and chopped salad. Everyone was very pleased with their meals.  My only complain is that it was extremely dark. It was hard to see the menu.   Just like every other restaurant on the strip there was nothing on the menu under $20. You get what you pay for and we were not disappointed!

FC3JbxFHkAGtgN3hdms_Tg.text: Had the fish and chips with mushed peas.  Food and atmosphere is good... just overpriced for bar food.

cvg1Ow73c_4BD1i4VijTXQ.text: It is time for Gordon to come down from the cloud , stop critics others food and bring his own place to order. Stuff not trained, need wait for service and was ignored when asked. Non stop bum kicks from servants to back on my chair. Food was mediocre at least. Lamb burger come with souse already start separating and half of bun was soaked in butter, definitely this one was sitting for some time, before was brought. Seasoning on truffle frys was ok, however frys it self was cooked in cold oil or was sitting for long time. Make it worse, got food poisoning from this experience, almost got to hospital, no other food was consumed after or 3 hours before. So it was only one source for that. Stay away, better food at Burger King, least fresher.

VQuWK0AfvMFgjXXu1vQikg.text: We had a great time at Gordon Ramsay's Pub and Grill.  We came with a large group and our server Alisha was amazing!    I ordered the Salmon which was light and cooked perfectly with crispy skin on top.  My husband order the Steak and Ale Pie he said it was flavorful comfort food.  Our table also ordered the fish and chips, they had a great batter and were light and crispy.  The Shepherd's pie, which is made correctly with lamb and not beef, was tasty and comforting.  The curry chicken was larger than expected and had a good little kick of curry spice.  Lastly we order a couple of the burgers which were cooked perfectly.  The only thing not well liked was the pretzel appetizers, which had an ale cheese that had an unusual but not good taste and a grainy spicy mustard.    Overall we had a great time and will be returning on our next Vegas trip!

h62OQpveCdfexuOl1oZM2w.text: Ok... so a local couple decided to do something different. I say let's go down to the strip.... now mind you I've lived here for 30 years. The idea of going down to the strip for dinner was different back then, but it still seems like an adventure. I say how about fish and chips? Ok. Here we go to.... 18 dollars in valet, 30 dollars each in for fish and chips, 22 dollars in a pint each, and there you go. 100+ for an adventure. Was it worth it?!? Not any time soon, do I miss everything I knew about VEGAS? Yes. Good luck tourists! I too miss having a 20 I could gamble also. The food was good, but not that good! There has become a steep divide of locals and the strip.

7X9bS0_q5LoyejF61XZq0Q.text: Very happy with this pub.  They have a great selection of beer and great food menu.  The service was perfect and we enjoyed ourselves.  We will be back.  Got to have another Bloody Mary too.

MI8KnIbEKC5KnOXBY3BwvA.text: Yummmm The deviled eggs is been tested or hamburger was really good especially with the ghost pepper cheese

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States

mUad3a1FuMVs9GyX4NDnCw.text: First of all we love gordon ramsay! so we had to try anything with his name on it. Went in without anyway wait , service was great, our server "Rodney" he was very attentive and kind ~ Lamb burger was sooo good ~ and my bf ordered the mini burgers which was super delicious too~! I had a great experience!

pfrOQrsEyk2hNlSeGZE5PQ.text: OMG their lobster/shrimp mini sandwiches were perfection. Service was good and the prices were fair. You get what you pay for :)

geitmhMm3W-nKN2W_8HAoQ.text: Disappointing menu, boring, tasteless food, pretentious, snobby atmosphere. We have the feeling this place is going out of business.  We asked for well done meat and it came rare / raw. Then then condiments were thrown on the table like the place is a gag diner with comic attitude,, but it isn't.  No salt and pepper on any tables or bar and the food crys out for it. You'll get attitude if you ask for it, and you just may not get it. Only Pub in the world without Brown Sauce.  Expensive, not worth it.  Surly, hostile bartender obviously flying on tweek or other powder. Nothing here folks. Just tourist-trap attitude, sorry menu, high prices, mediocre quality and shot glass size portions. Well cocktail: $16. Look to spend at least $60 to $70 per person plus drinks and walk out hungry.  5 star reviews are from employees.  Go elsewhere.

rjkDK0TI6JHYZF7LcBteUA.text: I had high hopes for this place, especially since there was a ginormous painting of Gordon Ramsey staring me in the face as I ate.  The food was good; ribs fell right off the bone.  The mac & cheese was tasty, and my wife really liked the French onion soup.  In my opinion, it was slightly overpriced, but we are in Vegas so that's to be expected.    The problem was the service.  There was more staff than patrons, so you'd think the service would be outstanding, but it wasn't.  My wife was three minutes from walking out because we hadn't seen a waiter for 10 minutes after being seated (and it wasn't busy), but the waiter finally showed up.  But he didn't go out of his way to be friendly, and we didn't see much of him for the rest of the night.  He finally came and asked if we wanted our drinks refilled at the end of the night, to which my wife said "just the check," even though we really did want refills (but 15 minutes earlier).    I don't mind paying big bucks for good food, or even decent food and good service, but this was decent food and poor service in a city where there are limitless options.  Needless to say, we won't be back unless Mr. Ramsey can class the joint up a little.

5gdvkIHnjml-vcPD3WW1bQ.text: I really enjoyed this place! We decided on getting a steak and ale pie and a shepherd's pie, which were boh very delicious. I enjoyed the atmosphere of this restaurant a lot. It was a little more expensive than other restaurants on the strip, but it's definitely worth it!

SFDvH3Yr5_0qt4KXMk1dpQ.text: The decor beautiful, the service was friendly and attentive. The food was very delicious and worth the price. The dessert was the best part in my opinion, the sticky toffe pudding is their signature dessert and it was amazing, like nothing I've ever tasted before. Every time I go to vegas now, this will be the restaurant I have to come to before I leave. I'm definitely recommending to everyone and will be back.

4iy_UvPe46fBe_PfNxzwvw.text: My wife would say.. Awesome, delicious... go.  We had the truffle chips "Fries" and the Lollipop Chicken wings for apps, both were great and cooked to perfection.  The wife had the scallops with clams. Said it was very tasty, i don't eat shell fish so I took her word. They looked very good, seared nicely on both sides.  I had the Burger with bacon. It was outstanding, the beef was perfect and the chef knows what Medium means.  Service was great, very attentive and we were seated within a minute of showing up at our reserved time... It was packed on the Friday night.  We gave it 4 stars based only on the price... If you go, you will love it.

h8eCc4W_IlTkv0weig_Zvg.text: The service is exceptional, but the food is only average.  We had the crab deviled eggs & nachos.  The nachos were a disappointment.  The "cheese" was liquid nacho cheese and the chips were stale.

42_HJnSTSFk5uu8_WccDsw.text: Wonderful meal at Gordon Ramsey Pub. Started off with the Onion Soup. One of the best that I have ever had. Next was the Chop Salad. The ingredients were interesting for sure but the avocado dressing brought it all together. The Salmon was my main course and was just as good as the starters. The sauce it was paired with made it very flavorful. The service was on point through out the meal. The restaurant was very clean and not loud, when the atmosphere could make you think different. I would recommend coming back and will for the soup and chopped salad.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sticky Toffee Pudding for desert, recommended by the server.

76FI6BE-x7eqlVdy8dgsYQ.text: As a huge fan of Gordon Ramsay, I jumped at the opportunity to go and experience one of his restaurants myself. I almost wish I hadn't as it has given me a jaded view of one of my culinary heroes.  When we arrived, we were escorted to our seats and immediately brought water by a very warm and welcoming waiter. The menu was very broad and seemingly had something for everyone. For what it was, prices were a little on the high side, but as we are on vacation, we ordered and that's where things began to slip.  My girlfriend and I both opted for the chicken madras, my mum got the bangers and mash and dad went for the fish and chips. We were all waiting in anticipation to finally try some of Ramsay's British pub classics. The wait, however, was sadly much longer than anticipated. We clocked around 35 minutes sitting talking at the table before our food finally arrived. At this point, the waiter dropped the fish and chips all over the floor. Without a word, he cleaned the plate up and went back to the kitchen. We were waiting for 5 more minutes before our allocated waiter even recognised a plate was missing and no apology was given, simply a "at least one made it" when the second dish was delivered.   The food itself was actually delicious from what I had, which is perhaps the only thing keeping this review above 2 stars. The curry had excellent heat and flavour to it and was warm throughout. The bangers and mash were a hit as well, although it should be noted that the sausages are 3 different meats, so if you're not a fan of beef, chicken or pork sausage, I'm sure they would substitute to your preference. As for the fish and chips, it looked good and had crispy batter, however, I had expected it to be more like chip shop style chips from the UK rather than French fries.  I believe this place has potential to be great, but could do with some more training for the wait staff. I hope the next time that Mr Ramsay checks in to this part of his empire that he recognises the need for improvement.

WPN5-Au3bSH_e91YXUkV5Q.text: First of all this review is during the week of CES so it might be a little different when it is not as busy in Vegas.   The decor in the place is pretty unique for this pub & grill. Nicely done. Since it was a busy week, the restaurant is integrated with OpenTable so you can reserve a table without calling in and waiting.   Food wise, I ordered their lamb burger - medium well. It was nicely cooked with the center slightly pink so the burger was nice and tender. The toppings on the burger is flavourful. But the seasoning on the meat seems to be uneven. First bite it feels like it was not seasoned enough, but when I reach the end it seemed a little too salty. Expected them to mix the seasoning in the meat evenly considering it is Ramsy's restaurant.   Service was a little slow but that might have been due to the CES volume of people.   btw they forgot to give me ketchup for the fries... gave me an empty dipping container...

rzXEcrgakBiv6DhG3KEbmA.text: WOW!!! We wanted to go to his higher end restaurant for our anniversary but they were booked full for several days, so we instead made reservations for the Pub. Was not at all disappointed! Told them it was our 10 year anniversary and they were extremely accommodating. The food was nothing short of amazing, and the staff was all so helpful even when the place was packed. Will definitely be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. I had the Tropical Blancmange and my husband had the Sticky Toffee Pudding, which was more like a cake but still delicious!
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beer braised short rib. It was divine!

5m550tBqv2ntSUuHPPLSCg.text: I went to his restaurant here in Las Vegas at the Caesar's Palace.. Mushy peas, A++. British Fish B- (no choice, Cod only). Chips....uh, THEY WERE NOT CHIPS...they were more like American McDonald's FRIES....F---. $30 for a "British Fish and Chips Dinner". Amazingly disappointing. I would NOT recommend it.  Service here, however, was excellent.

s6L2Fy6R_0Ipt4hqc0YiNw.text: Overpriced overrated Overall not that good my food needed salt I was afraid to ask for it

FlzAg30gq_d_fUZfZIDJSQ.text: Items Selected:  Warm Salty Pretzels with Cheese Sauce - Bacon and Parmesan, Green Garlic, and Plain Yorkshire Ale Batter Fish & Chips - Cod with Tartar and Lemon Red Wine Braised Short Rib - Horseradish Mashed Potatoes with Onions, Carrots, Parsnips, Red Wine Jus Trio of Pies - Chicken Pot Pie with Bechamel, Vegetables, Bacon / Steak & Ale Pie with Root Vegetables and Mushrooms / Shepherd's Pie with Root Vegetables and Cheddar Mash Potatoes Sauteed Forest Mushrooms - Poached Farm Egg Spotted DIC - Steamed Bread Pudding with Raisins and Cream Sauce Sticky Toffee Pudding - Sweet Cream Ice Cream  Having come away from a late-2013 visit to Chef Gordon Ramsay's Steakhouse at The Paris quite impressed by both the quality and the brand I knew a visit to casual sibling "Pub & Grill" was only a matter of time - friends and fans of chef's shows and celebrity frequent to visit Sin City.  Housed in Caesars in a sizable space renovated from Bradley Ogden featuring plenty of wood, kegs, television, and Brit-kitsch it was just after noon when I sat down with two old friends and greeted by friendly, though pushy, service orders were expedited to the tune of an appetizer, a side, three mains, and two desserts - high prices and small portions tempered by a Total Rewards card...at least slightly.  Focusing mostly on signatures and favorites present since the menu's inception dining began with three small but lovely seasoned pretzels paired with cheese and mustard for $8 and progressing to plates proper another trio arrived in the $21 trio of small ramekin-pies, all well prepared but only the lamb loaded Shepherd living up to the high standards set by the exemplary golden cod selected by my friend, soggy 'chips' notwithstanding.  Ignoring the shortrib and what I'm told were vastly overseasoned potatoes while wishing some form of seasoning had graced the flavorless mushrooms it was with sweet redemption that desserts both shined, the rustic Sticky Toffee Pudding every bit as good as the fancy version at Steak and the "DIC" a bowl of buttery custard hefty with raisins and aromatics that I'd gladly return for along with a cup of coffee - breakfast, lunch, or dinner.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spotted DIC - Steamed Bread Pudding with Raisins and Cream Sauce
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sticky Toffee Pudding - Sweet Cream Ice Cream
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shepherd&#39;s Pie with Root Vegetables and Cheddar Mash Potatoes

wQdGqBbqYvrgkOxxgkSzKA.text: Went here Sunday night. It was busy, wait was 30 min.  Not too bad.    Once we got seated, we ordered drinks. I got the Garden Smash. Delicious!!!!  As for food, I got the Steak and Ale pie and my friend got a burger and we shared the calamari.  Everything was fantastic!!! The steak was so tender and seasoned perfectly! The crust was so mouth watering! I wanted more crust!  Our server, I think it was Adam, was super nice!  So overall, I loved this place. I will definitely go back the next time I'm in Vegas.

aEtMI-fgInjDPW-zk7qmBw.text: Wow. Pitiful, pitiful meal!  I asked the hostess if I could get a good Veg option and I was told "Absolutely I'm a Veg myself and I eat here all the time."   We sit down and check out the menu. Uhh, no Veg! The waiter comes along and I ask him what options I have and he tells me there isn't much but he would check with the kitchen. He coms back with an offer from the chef to make a salad. Not the greatest option, but I'll take it.  After a half hour or so our food comes out. I got a salad that contained chanterelle mushrooms and spring mix with a vinaigrette on it... that's it. My special salad sucked. It wasn't very special and I ate about a third of it.   My wife had fish and chips and the fries were ok. The batter fell off the fish and was an oily mess and she said the Dog and Duck pub in Austin makes it better... This is supposed to be one of their signature dishes and it was a total fail.  The worst part about it is when you see Gordon on his shows "fixing" restaurants he is always watching what comes back to the dishwasher to see if customers actually finish their meals. Neither one of us came close to finishing ours and no one said anything to us about it...   I guess he doesn't hold his restaurants to the same standards as the failing ones that are on his shows.

TyBzs9i0fl7O4HgDR0M_Pw.text: I always wanted to try one of Gordon's restaurants, so stopped by to have a lunch here. I had the pulled pork and chips,  my wife ordered a burger.   my pulled pork was just OK,  I found the flavor just a little bland.  I mean it was OK, but I've had better at small restaurants at home.  The chips were great, very tasty.  My wife's burger looked great visually.  it was a perfect round bun.   However,  it was not very tasty to me,  to be honest I thought it was a very average burger.  The fries were not that good at all. Sort of like fast food.   over all I was surprised at the food,  I could have had a better lunch at 5 guys.   Perhaps it was just an off day,  but I think it was just a mediocre lunch at a premium price.

-Yd-lH5Ly7jPLrhxYw8Erw.text: The food was excellent however the service was terrible. Yes we were seated quickly and order was taken very promptly, however after that it was a disaster. The place was not even busy took almost 40 minutes to get our food which was only 2 hamburgers. Then we tried to get more drinks took 10 minutes for someone to help us. Food great , service terrible. It would have been more stars if the help working there were on the ball.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The hamburger was great

6z-qac6pZds118OzdITJqg.text: Only went here for drinks and dessert...definitely get the toffee pudding!!!! It is really rich and sweet so be prepared..it's life changing...haha! Oh! Use your total rewards card to get a dollar off.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. So good!!

IXz6Byn0h3PeSNRloMWiOw.text: Loved the service, food and location!  Oh....and I'm all about tableware, cutlery and ambiance.  This place has it all!  Will definitely ensure we go back our next visit!!

303QenMBllKLynUnl6ituw.text: I'm a huge fan of Gordon Ramsay but I do have to say the food was "OK."  What impressed me was much more than the food...the decor, the drink menu, the waiter/waitresses outfits.    The service was extremely slow however we did not have to wait for a table on a Saturday during lunch time in February.  (I think the waiter had tables scattered all over the place and not in one vicinity).  The food was a little pricey but I loved the display of the food, originality, and atmosphere.  From my experience, almost everything in Vegas is pricey (even more than NYC) unless you grab a burger from McDonalds.     The drink and dessert menu was on an Ipad and gave you descriptions of the drink cocktails.  I got a drink that I can't remember the name but it had Guinness Cream, Boddingtons Ale, Jack Daniels Honey and something else...but all I know it was fantastic and I never drink Jack Daniels anything!  The cocktails were $15 each.  My bf got corned beef in a bread bowl that actually looked good (I never eat corn beef). I got the hamburger which was $19, with bacon would have been $23. All the french fries are 4 huge pieces of potato with a garlic seasoning that come with the meals.    I was told Ramsay had checked in the day before with the restaurant and I saw the head chef walking around.  PLENTY of seats, right in the middle of Caesar's.  It's definitely worth checking out and having a more casual meal than a fancy one in LV.  P.S. Huge Beer Menu as well!

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Corn Beef Bread Bowl, Gordon Ramsay Pub &amp; Grill at Caesar&#39;s Palace
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Scuffle, Guinness Cream, Boddingtons Ale, Jack Daniels Honey, Gordon Ramsay Pub &amp; Grill at the Caesar&#39;s Palace.
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Coolest utensils ever, Gordon Ramsay Pub &amp; Grill at the Caesar&#39;s Palace

c0YOtvFqcCYOXZ3sxvgWpg.text: Delicious food, superb service, Moscow mules in copper cups! I had the side which was the lobster mac and cheese and I was stuffed the hubs bangers and mash .  I thought it was going to be trendy but was great!!!

pLqwD5_AhsuXnyhJ7nGUTQ.text: Please go back to the original Fish & Chips!  Was at GR last night and was so disappointed. The fish appeared to be the same but greasy and the 'plank' fries were replaced with a mound of greasy,soft chewy ones and the mushy peas were gone!  The bartenders are a lot of fun but we certainly left hungry.  And the Scottish egg appetizer was not a favorite.  We'll be back so please make the change!

JUxBLSQRsgbEXGTF-qhIkw.text: So the winner of season 11 of Hell's Kitchen will be the head chef of this restaurant. Perhaps that is why the restaurant seems to have hit or miss reviews right now. The show finished filming awhile ago so the new head chef has already been chosen, but they can't be seen at the restaurant since that would give away the ending of the show. Having an absentee head chef certainly can't be helping. Even though overall I had a good dining experience, the restaurant was not without its rough edges.  We showed up around 9pm without reservations, but were able to get seated on the restaurant side almost immediately. They put our party of 5 at a table for 4. There were plenty of other tables, but we were told they had all been reserved. Of course they remained empty the rest of the night (we were there until closing) despite a post show rush right after we arrived. This was annoying, but pretty common for Las Vegas as almost no one charges a reservation no show fee.  Our server was pretty awesome. He was funny and really knew the food. Pretty much everyone working there was great from the hostess to the runners. The one big exception was one particularly sour runner. When she brought our starters I told her I did not have a fork and she snapped "well, then I'll bring you one" at me. She then brought me 3 forks and four knives. I shrugged this off as maybe a poorly executed attempt at humor. Later on, one of our party asked her for more bread, a fairly common request at a restaurant and one that other reviewers made with no difficulties, but she reacted with shock and began to tell us that wasn't allowed. Before she could finish, she cut herself off and said she would let the server know. Maybe she did, but I doubt it since we just saw her go off to the back while our server was elsewhere in the restaurant helping put some smaller tables together for a big group since heaven forbid they actually seat someone at one of the reserved tables that obviously weren't coming. When they brought out our entrees, she didn't bring mine and asked me what I ordered. After I told her she went to get it and plooped it down in front of me before walking away without a word. I guess that's what I get for asking for a fork.  The food was excellent all around, although the menu seemed too small. We later found out that the menu was once nearly twice the size, but they trimmed it down to just the most popular items. In my humble opinion, they went a bit too far with the trimming. The small plates (appetizers) menu now only has 5 choices and 3 of them are cold seafood items. There were 5 seafood items and 8 meat items (actually 7 since the beef cheeks were not available the evening we dined). There may or may not have been an entree sized salad since the menu did not differentiate them. The most expensive salad was only $4 more than the salad I had as a starter so I don't think it was entree size.  For starters I had the Herb Caesar Salad. The server warned that it came with "a lot" of anchovies which I was OK with, but it turns out it just came with one small anchovy. It was a good, if not particularly memorable salad. Another member of our party ordered the smashed potatoes and sauteed asparagus as her starters. They are technically sides, but none of the other starters interested her so she ordered them as starters. I thought the potatoes were good, but the asparagus was just OK for me. Another member of our party ordered the Pub "Spots" which are described as sliders on the menu, but the name "Spots" is a better description. They were very good, but also very small. You could finish the whole plate in 3 bites. We also had two members of our party order soups which they said were delicious, but I didn't get a chance to try.  For entrees, my friend and I each had a shepherd's pie. Since we were both quite hungry we were a little disappointed at how small it looked, but looks can be deceiving. The little pot they are served in is quite deep and there is a decent amount of food in there. I ended up completely satisfied and can say that this was the best shepherd's pie I have ever had. I also got to try the Scottish Salmon, rib eye steak, and the rack of lamb. All three were delicious. The rack of lamb in particular stood out because I love lamb, but am weary about ordering it in restaurants because often the portions are on the small side. The lamb here is a very hearty portion. Of course for dessert I had to try the sticky toffee. It was delicious. I can see why it is Gordon Ramsay's signature dessert. My friend ordered the chocolate trifle. We shared both desserts with the whole table and while the trifle was OK, the sticky toffee disappeared far quicker.  So overall I had a great experience except for the one bitter food runner. I could see myself coming back, but unless they expand that menu a bit I don't think I would come that often.

p8oug3C9tfqAbYS4inDyPQ.text: We received a gift card from our friends to try this restaurant.  I had seen this pub at Caesars and wanted to try it because of Gordon Ramsay.  the reviews didn't look to complimentary, but I still wanted to try.   I thought the restaurant was really good.  We ordered pretzels with dipping sauces for appetizers.  They were good.  Three kinds of favors and two dipping sauces.   My 5-year old son loved the sliders and fries. My wife ordered the signature hamburger, but it was built more for a large man with a hunger for lots of beef.  Just ok for a burger. We also ordered fish and chips and the short rib and cheek sandwich.  The fish was really good.  The short rib and cheek sandwich was awesome.  I put some of the garlic mayo on it and it was a fabulous sandwich.  Large enough to fill you up, tender enough to keep eating ! Don't believe the salty comments.  Nothing was salty, we actually asked for salt and pepper. Staff is excellent.  Fries are not that good.  If these are English fries, they should do them American style.

d-Xnh9eI9tyzxDptZ0dg5g.text: The food ranges from decent to bad.  Do NOT get the lobster roll or the lobster mac n cheese. My friend nearly cracked her tooth on a piece of shell from the roll. I kept encountering small bits of shells in the lobster mac n cheese. The mac n cheese was meh. It was overly salty, watery, and not cheesy. The lobster in it was dry and tasted fishy. I had made a much better Costco take home mac n cheese for $10 that fed 15 people a week prior.  I tried the shepherd pie and it was ok....watery but not bad. I told our waiter about the shells and he seemed offended that I was complaining about my friend almost CRACKING/SPLITTING her tooth from eating a small roll. I had only finished half my mac n cheese so I wanted to take it home to add my own cheese and recreate the entire dish. No point in wasting food when there are starving kids in the world. The server ended up throwing out my food. I assumed he was going to box it up since he asked us if we wanted to box up our food and we said yes, turns out he was only directly addressing two people and unfortunately in our group of 6, I was not one of them. He did offer to remake my food (of course begrudgingly and offended that we were inconveniencing him with the shell-bit food that he accidentally threw out). However we were rushing to make a flight home so I didn't have time for them to remake it. For $22, I could have bought 2 Costco mac n cheeses that tastes insanely better and can feed 24 people.  Just sayin...I should have went to Mesa Grill  :*(

v9zTj5caan2DMrfzzAaLVQ.text: Never been to a real pub that didn't have budweiser.  Suck it Ramsay.

ZMxlrNpQKWZQ3oAJMVQtZg.text: My fish & chips were BLAND although the fish quality was high there just wasn't any flavor. I expected better Ramsey!

djzf9urFvyfjm_8qllmz6g.text: Smack in the center of the casino, the Pub and Grill offers a trendy somewhat cosmopolitan dining experience.  Hip music playing with VERY modern decor.  It is worth mentioning that they used beer kegs as decorations.  That made me laugh.  Our server was great but did NOT have the right mentality for the hospitality business.  I did not mind though.  The Shepard's Pie was extremely tasty!!  I am 1000% (not a typo) sure that I will return when I am in Vegas again.  Bravo Chef Ramsey!! Bravo!!

RCxwCm28Qceuz2qAJCVvng.text: We had a very good experience, booked a reservation through our hotel for lunch last Sunday, good time to go.  Our server was excellent, the food was very good.  I had the seared scallops, delicious.  The pricing was extremely high, even for Vegas standards.  $16 for a cocktail (London calling)? I mean, it was good and all.  My family enjoyed their food and beverages.  I would say thumbs up overall-splurge a little!

Uz0EK_ShVePpkrdGAElEkg.text: I am a big fan of Gordon Ramsay.  Overall, I would say this place is overpriced.  However,  my burger was tasty, and I loved my girlfriends beef shank sandwich, and for that I would definitely go back.

vla_DR91_y0A4dV_xRrBFg.text: I've been to Gordon Ramsey Steak in Paris and it was amazing, so I was excited to try his newest place. Our server, Alexander, was SO nice. He even took us back to the kitchen when I asked if it was really like a 'Kitchen Nightmare' kitchen.    The food was good but I wasn't floored like at his steakhouse. I had the corn soup and diver scallops. My husband had the Shepherd's Pie (it was kind of small.)     Overall it was a good experience and I'd go back to try the burgers but for a truly memorable dining experience, I'd go to his steakhouse.

NJjONkYhL_OK0y_bo5-Jeg.text: Given the restaurant is by the snooty ass Gordon Ramsey, I expected more.  However, I only intended to drink to occupy myself while my out-of-town were gambling.  Somewhat disappoint that the sparkling wine listed on the menu was not the one they were pouring...it was Chateau Ste. Michele, which is a good value but only about $8.00 at CVS and naturally it was $8.00 a glass here.  However, the bartender was cool and topped me off a few times free of charge, but I did order 3 glasses...I would have been smarter buying the bottle from the beginning.  Like I said I don't gamble, and expected my guest to turn up definitely by the time I was on drink #2...sadly they showed up when I completed glass #3 and was about to order #4...however, thankfully, husband intervened and comforted me that we have several bottle of this in our "everyday" wine stock.  So I stopped and like the intelligent person I am said let's order FOOD! to complete the evaluation of this place. I was only thinking of my fellow yelpers, YKWIM?  So all 4 of us shared sliders and fish and chips.  All of it was Ok, but given that Ramsey is such a hardass, I expected more so much more!  The food did not deliver, but still it was decent.  Fresh, but just ordinary.  if I come back, it is only to sit at the bar and have drinks.   PS.  Whoever won Hell's kitchen needs atleast a few more lessons.  Also the outfits of the wait staff are hideous.

11lcdEejd5KauligWGkvdg.text: Total joke. Ramsey BurGr is actually really good not sure how this place is so bad. Definitely the worst spot in ceasars and it's pretty tough to be worse than munchbar. Gordon is a clown and has nothing to do with the place one of the staff members told me he had only been there one time 3 months after they had opened.. total marketing ploy which definitely works. Mammalukes from around the globe are lined up to try this dump. Worst lamb burger ever, onion soup was good, fish and chips had more batter than fish, fries suck. I haven't been for about 3-4 months but I did go twice only because the first time it was so bad I figured it was a fluke. Not a fluke. And I agree with other posters easily the worst uniforms of any vegas restaurant, there were a couple good looking hostesses but that uniform made them look like total pigs.

Mt7K46vr_11_cw6yaXfjBA.text: Very disappointing. Ordered the $30 fish and chips expecting a meal that would reflect Gordon's high standards and his British heritage (I'm also British). It was pathetic. The chips were way too thin, they looked dull and grey (must have used the wrong type of potatoes) and the fish and batter were totally tasteless and if anything left an oily aftertaste. The mushy peas were the best part of the meal but they were only garden peas that someone had halfheartedly squished a bit. Total waste of time and money. Just find a British or Irish pub in Vegas instead of going here.

DDB9OymKGIG5Q4nRt7IRdQ.text: Just okay and pricey for bar food.  A cheeseburger, coffee, beer and fish and chips were $80 with tip.

0K6ifO56T6xdSOy-z8nk_A.text: Having eaten here a few times in the past two years I can say the food is very consistent. The shepherds pie is fantastic as is the fish and chips. Bartenders are great at coming up with just about anything you can ask for. Service was very prompt and quick to refill drinks and provide answers to any questions we had. Just remember this is a pub environment, if you want quiet peaceful dinner go somewhere else. This place can get loud when busy.

xFTjw1qT4RqJe4e4cD0kMA.text: Dry mini burgers, dry and tasteless fish and chips. Stinky bar. Eff this place. Hey Gordon Ramsay I want to yell at you like you yell at all the chefs on that one show. Your pub sucks. You are a fraud.At least the bartenders were good.
