bM6y5orz5jw5xZl0WisUXw.text: As a Vegas local and someone who enjoys finding great spots to frequent, I had not yet tried Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill so decided to give it a try before a show this weekend. Celebrity restaurants in Vegas are definitely hit or miss and while there were aspects of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill that were excellent, the service left something to be desired. First off -- since the service is what is giving this review poor marks let me start out by saying that our server had zero personality and was seldom seen or heard from. Service is the hallmark of a great restaurant, so even with the best food you can mess it up quickly with bad service. Our server should definitely find employment elsewhere. Now, on to the better part of the review - the food. The food was overall good. The short rib was extremely tender and tasty as it should be and it was atop an amazing risotto and the pearl onions were a very nice touch. The cheddar cauliflower was also very nicely done. Sticky toffee pudding is one of my favorite desserts and theirs was amazing. Cocktails were also great. Prices were high for what it is. I don't mind paying and you do expect to overpay on the strip, but this was a bit much. So, up the ante on service and you'd win me back -- not sure I'd give it another try based on what I experienced, however.

_m0v54X_dfj_h4iiqZvB6g.text: This is REALLY sad, because I actually came here a few months ago (back in January) and really enjoyed it then (I would've given it a 4/5 then), but after the experience tonight, I had to lower it :( I'm a HUGE fan of Mr. Ramsay, and when I had first eaten here, I was in love with all the dishes! I had never had fish and chips that good before!  After today, though, I don't know where I'd get those fish and chips again :( I went in today not knowing that just about 4 weeks ago, they changed the menu around and some of the recipes (I asked the waiters/waitresses about it). The fish, which before were perfectly sized, flaky, melt-in-your-mouth goodness, was now giant, thick slabs that were dry and overcooked. The batter, which used to be crispy but flaky to the touch, were now thick and hard. The fries, which used to be thick but crunchy, were now dry and burnt-tasting.  I did have other dishes, but nothing that was better than average. The majority of the dishes I ordered last time were no longer on the menu after the menu change, so nothing to compare (those other dishes were GREAT the first time I visited, though!).  The waiters/waitresses were quite nice though. To be fair, the place probably deserves a 2/5 stars now, but after that overwhelmingly disappointing decision to change the recipes and menu so drastically, I had to give this 1/5...I'm so sad.

9WSSCF11wciIOf42fx9nTg.text: Allow me to begin by saying thank you Mr. Randy Goldich.  Saturday night 2 of my friends and myself decide to eat at Gordon Ramsay Pub and Gril.  The ambiance and food was exemplary.  Yes I said it, my GOD I never had nothing that good not even a home cook meal from grandma house or momma house.  (smile)  However; that nite we had serve that was  not well but the night ended excellent.  2 of us had ceasar salad and the other young lady and the fish chips and it was divine.  Our waiter never check on us or even asked if we wanted any dessert.  Well we called the manager over and we just feel in love with his warmth and sincerity.  He was just a blast in which we could have stayed longer just talking about life and Mr. Gordon restaurant.  Then the bartender came over and grab my hand and we went to the kitchen and thats when I smiled from ear to ear seeing Mr. Scott  from hell kitchen  the man in action.  Oh my is the only thing I could think of at that moment. As if that wasn't enough Mr. Goldich invited us to come back as his guest the next day and it was a perfect fairy tale for us knowing it was our 1 and 2nd time there in vegas.  It was a perfect ending to a 2 day stay in vegas and we owe it to Gordon Ramsay and the staff.  Starting with Mr. Randy Goldich and the perfect hostess Saturday and Sunday nite and my bartenders Sauturday nite and finally to our server on Sunday.  Yes I forgot her name but she was beautiful and nice and absolutely a perfect waitress who take her job seriously.  Thank you to all and please know you made dreams real for three women from Detroit, Mi and Sacramento, Ca.

Ql8zo8JsKYEGh-zVCxzqTQ.text: Effin amazing! The scotch eggs were amazing! The pigs in blankets were truly bangers (pork). The lamb burger.........yep, amazing!!!! The fish an chips......meh. If you're English, you know fish and chips and the yanks can't match it but damn these were good. The sticky toffee pudding was YUMMY!!! Great atmosphere and a wonderful food experience! Irish coffee was made just like home....:no tinned whip cream crap! A wonderful night and the food was......well....:amazing!!!

mboIrdoIJQTG3oFt0YwWHA.text: The fish & chips were to die for! The best I've had since London.  Adam was our server & he was outstanding!  A++++

H7jrcGU9k333zalDIbXG9Q.text: Average is the best description here.  Went for lunch and you would think a salad would be fairly easy to do but it was at best okay.  Ingredients were fresh but the flavor was bland.  Got the Chopped Pub Salad.  On the plus side, for craft beer fans, the beer selection was one of the best in Ceasar's.  Heavy on the English beers but a nice selection of craft beers as well.

GGcbiYLy3EvAVOFmVxzvFA.text: I became a fan of Ramsay's when I watched a bunch of food shows, and wanted to go to his new place when I saw it. The atmosphere was inviting, the waiters and waitresses were nice, and the food was great. We didn't wait long, even with a bit of a lunch rush, and the iPad thing for viewing and picking out drinks and dessert was interesting (a bit confusing at first, but our waitress explained it to me quickly). If I go back and have a friend, I would totally take them to this place for a lunch. The beer-battered fish & chips was a bit sweet for me, but generally good. The chips were cooked well and the smashed peas tasted nice. I had a specialty drink (forgot which one) but it was great as well - enough alcohol to make me happy, not too much to overpower. I may also now be a fan of trifles after the one I had. Perfect amount of chocolate to make it sinful, but not overpowering.   ...also, I want the waiters and waitresses outfits. they're awesome.

2rdZS1fCjOTPTdMk-9KWaA.text: Very good food, but this is Gourmet pub food and very expensive, burgers start at $20.00, average entree $30.00 plus, food was great as it should be for the prices.

xtaE-ht1b6Uy0BG-foB0LA.text: We had some dining gift cards to burn, and went here. The 1/2 pound lamb burger at medium cook was pretty good and the fries were great. Only knocking one star because I could have fared better with a lighter burger as a 1/2 pound is a bit too much for me.

1mKq0vpUi-ym6aVVAONM7w.text: i got the sheperds pie, which i thought it was pretty good, had lots of meat in it. But the best part was the sticky toffee pudding! OMG delicious, best dessert ever!

AkWu_H17JqiUvMM11nOeDg.text: My party were treated terribly here. We ordered a round of drinks which arrived very slowly. Much later we ordered our meal. When we tried to order a second round of drinks (light beer, not liquor) we were told we were too drunk!  When we asked to pay for our drinks and leave they tried to charge for the food which after 40 minutes had still not arrived.  When they finally brought the bill for the drinks only we were attended to by numerous staff, something that had been lacking all night.   So many better places to eat in Vegas. Don't go for the flashy celebrity name. Go somewhere with a good atmosphere and friendly service instead. (And where they don't charge $24 for shepherds pie. Ground beef and mashed potato - seriously?!?)

h19zmWN8EFl12uiPvMhXFw.text: We questioned the hostess twice about our table after being told 15-20 minutes...that was 45 minutes in. We completed our meal including dessert and NEVER got called for our table...AT THE BAR. I even asked the bartender if they are informed when people decide to eat at the bar instead of waiting for a table and was told no, they still would call you. Dinner was mediocre at best. My sliders were over cooked and very dry. My boyfriends scallops were decent but I guess we expected better for the cost. Beers are WAY over priced even for Vegas standards. Their signature dessert was the best part. Bartenders were friendly and personal. We both agree we would not eat here again.

SG9lk7CfXfol0IQj7Sp4VQ.text: Wow! Food was off the charts and the service was spectacular! We started with the fried pie sampler and then split a burger. It came out promptly (we told our server Sara S. that we had to catch a flight) it was out of the world! Also came with a homemade garlic mayo (I personally detest mayo, but could not get enough of it!) We finished the meal with sticky toffee pudding (heavenly). My eyes were rolling in the back of me brains! Not sure why there are so many mixed reviews...we will definitely be back again!

8FIpyV42NjT-aokU4fzlEg.text: Oh Gordon....where to begin. I've looked forward for so long to try this place out and the best way I can explain it is to think about the Price is Right song when people lose on the show......yeah exactly.  We were in Vegas for opening weekend of the tournament and originally had reservations for Gordon's steak house but after conversing with our bartender a couple days prior he mentioned that pub would be better suited for a larger group. We arrived for our reservation after seeing Seinfeld and were seated promptly, after that its ALL DOWNHILL. It took over 20 minutes just to get water! When the server finally came over he looked confused and to be honest a little pretentious.  I would have expected this from his steakhouse but not the pub. Anyway we put in our appetizer order, calamari and shrimp cocktail, which came out in piece meal again not seeing our waiter this entire time. I will say the shrimp cocktail was the best part of the meal (that's why they received a star) but the calamari left something to be desired. Two people in our party ordered the prime rib and after specifically asking the server how it was given the time (it was 10pm) he noted that it was perfectly cooked and good to go, however what they received was a tough gray log. I ordered the tenderloin medium rare and it came out medium....at best, it was definitely more gray then pink. My one friend might have had it right just ordering a chicken sandwich!  All in all, I was very disappointed by this place and can say that I will not be going back. The things that Gordon prides himself on, service and perfectly cooked food, were surely lacking.

Hh1FBr14LTMZRVoEJtg8fA.text: Another outstanding visit to Gordon Ramsay Pub! We were seated immediately despite arriving a few minutes before our reservation time. Our server, Chris, was friendly and professional. My wife is a big, long-time fan of Chef Ramsay and especially Hell's Kitchen, and was excited to catch a glimpse of Chef Christina Wilson, the season 10 winner. A few minutes after being seated, we were treated to a visit by Randy Goldich, who introduced himself and seemed very interested in us and our Las Vegas trip. Randy brought Chef Wilson to the table to meet my wife, which obviously went over great!  I'm in the music business, and we had a great conversation. All of our food and drinks - beginning with the Scotch Egg - were amazing. The fish and chips are truly a masterpiece. Mr. Goldich invited us to return later after our Billy Idol show, and we had a great extended visit. Thumbs up to Chef Ramsay, Randy, Christina, and the whole staff!

rmIwdkYTeZa36_ypCB1aeg.text: I came here initially at the opening for a yelp event with my sister as her plus one.  It was memorable and the food was great.  I just returned since my first visit and unfortunately I can't give a rave review anymore. My sister's onion soup was delicious however at the bottom she found a little plastic surprise.  No good. Then our entrees came. She ordered the fish and chips.  The chips were stale,  not even warm. I had the Shepard' s pie.  Flavor was great however it wasn't heated all the way thru unfortunately.  I really wanted to like this place.  But between the very slow service and mediocre, overpriced food I will not return.  "Damn, such a shame" -Gordon Ramsay

GWlEcpHsAMb7jl1IVY6hoA.text: Another great visit to this pub & grill.  Everytime I come to Vegas I make it a point to come here! Sticky toffee pudding all the way!!!!!!! The burger is really good here, everything is just perfect here.  Service was a bit sloppy this last visit, the waiter we had the first time we visited here was the best, now the service isn't as good and the waitress kept spilling water all over me and my area, she just didn't seem to like life very much, but I didn't care because the food is so good.

0ONFG9OK4eAz4fUiQa6qlA.text: Great bartender -Raul- amazing Moscow mule. Got the short rib and braided cheek sandwich. It was melt in your mouth good. Only down side was long wait for sandwich.  I'd recommend going here.  It's pretty relaxed, great selections.  Everyone seemed to love their food.  Hamburgers were flying off the shelf - but If I am going to have something of Ramsey's I'm not going to get a burger.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Short rib and braised cheek

Awp3E3Nhf5NNPtbLjAOMfQ.text: First, I'm only giving 4 stars due to flavor of burger, as I was giving only 3. For 3 of us at lunch our bill was almost $90.00 .(yes,I'm in Vegas),. Here's what we had , and this was during "Happy Hour" . 2 drinks,2 orders 1/2 wings, pretzel sticks,wedge salad and a $20 bacon burger and truffle fries. Fries were just ok, pretzels we left 1/2. The burger had great flavor and I love burgers or any beef. our server Kerry, she pretty much ignored us. Several times we "flagged" her down. This was at about 3:00 pm , not busy time of day. It was disappointing, with service and everything except burger, so doubt if it will be on our must go place.

oJtML2S4FslMWCMu1oF9UA.text: I've eaten here half a dozen times, hoping that my experience would improve with each visit.  Unfortunately, that wasn't the case.  This is just another overpriced burger joint.  While the $19 Grilled Beef Burger looked tasty, it tasted bland.  Maybe Gordon Ramsay's BURGR at Planet Hollywood is better???

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Grilled Beef Burger (9 oz.)

lQITpQzApCrepLCAa9Q9NA.text: So I was running around Caesars and I saw a huge line out front of this place so I decided to give it a try.  The line was really long and I was by myself so I decided to sit in the lounge.  Everyone seemed to be enjoying themselves, so I figured I was in for a treat..  Well I couldn't have been more wrong.  I guess my server Brianna had a horrible New Years Eve because she was the worst server I've ever experienced in my life.  I asked a few questions about the menu and she didn't know the answers, as well as she seemed even more pissed that I was asking her questions.  I mean, shouldn't the server know the menu well enough to help me figure out what I'm going to like or not like?  Her attitude was similar to a person that just got hit by a bus and then ran over by a steam roller.  If you get this server, RUN away..  She made me so mad I just ended up leaving.  I have no idea why they have horrible people like this working and interacting with customers.  All she did was totally upset me and make it so I'll probably never come back.

VydyeJdRuryGSHBDZOJAUg.text: I love Gordon Ramsay shows and watch them all regularly. Was excited to come to Vegas and dine at one of his restaurants.  Unfortunately it was extremely disappointing. Fish and chips should be easy. Fish was very overcooked, paid extra for truffle fries that were soggy.  Slow service only added to the demise. Perhaps Hollywood is just that, and my expectations are not in line with reality.  Wont come here again....Unfortunately :(

mClxNmZqdCnAhYF1gZaL4A.text: I was very sad with my first experience here. I have always loved Gordon Ramsey. This was a big visit for me it was my 60th birthday. My friends and son surprised me with a reservation here and my son flew in from Los Angeles. All a surprise. Food was ok, nothing to write home about. But what was so disturbing was the customer service by the managers and the waitress It was terrible. They over charged us, and we didn't see it until we payed the bill and that's how we felt they did this cause we had a group of 7 and they thought we would not notice.  It took forever to get someone to give us attention. Management (randy)did not try to do anything to defuse the the situation. It was so bad my son got upset not only because of the charges but it was my birthday, then they called security, instead of fixing the situation they call security but then the check was still wrong and while security ( Michael) was there they agreed, the bill was wrong. The incompetent waitress was to separate the bill five guest on one check two on the other she didn't do that so what happened , they charged the bill completely for seven people with tax and  gratuities when it should've been for only five because the waitress didn't separate the bills. This will be our last visit. We spent over $300 and this is the service you give. I will make sure I pass on this experience.

GdeypRjXJmnmkqf8AerqwA.text: I knew going into a Gordon Ramsey restaurant as a vegetarian that my options would be limited but my Option (1 single entree option) was 4 piles of vegetables dumped on a bowl. There was no effort to make an appetizing option. Yard house offers a full vegan menu so to be charged 28$ for nothing less then a half assed attempt to say they have a "veg friendly" option was sad and disappointing. My husband said his food was fantastic as were our friends but I left hungry. Too bad, as locals it's a nice change of pace to go out on the strip and have dinner but this will not be an establishment we will be returning to.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Gordon Ramsay &#34;vegetarian&#34; option. Peppers, onions, a few mushrooms and jasmine rice. Fail!!

jXyZW2plH_d4uVwVaq5eLA.text: So if you want to spend $25 on two lousy sliders and a domestic beer, this is a place  you should go.  Sliders were very small, dry no flavor, one had too much lettuce the other hardly any.  One with cheese the other I couldn't find any, the bun wasn't fresh.  Very disappointed .

iAFXuAdv7kprJgZ8T9R0nA.text: First up i want to say that everyone that knows me knows that i am n love with Gordon Ramsay, with that said here we go. We go to Vegas every month been trying to decide between his steakhouse, burger or pub. We figured we would do the in between so went with the pub. Just went Dec. 23rd so it wasnt crowded at all. Got seated immediately. First up the tables r too low seats very  uncomfortable. Our waitress took forever just to come over and take our drink order which was just 2 sodas. Very small menu so that made our choices pretty easy. Now mind u its 7:30pm i havent eaten since breakfast bcuz i wanted to make sure i would b able to eat my meal and end it with a great dessert.  Me: Had to go with the fish & chips of course bcuz thats all Gordon talks about, with a very heavy heart i must say i was not I'm pressed a matter of fact i was disappointed none of the dishes were flavorful. The only difference btween this fish & chips and HSalt fish & chips was it wasnt as greasy.Thank God they give u such big potatoe slices bcuz the fish pieces were small.  My daughter: shepards pie n this tiny bowl, which she had to salt and pepper, but she did love it.  My other daughter: braised lamb shank: shallow  bowl/plate the lamb was very tender.   Maybe if the meals came with a soup or salad or if they had some bread or something on the table u wouldnt realize how long it takes the food to come out. Once again we do splurge every few months on a fancy place and i dont mind if the total experience makes me say i cant wait to come back here, that didnt happen.This meal set us back $105.00 and just was very average. We went to the Chocolate Box and had some delicious dessert.  Now, i wont b back here to eat but i will at least try his other spots.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Some of the decor
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fish and chips
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Braised lamb shank

XY42LMhKoXzwtLoku4mvLA.text: A complete Vegas experience. We arrived right at opening and we were seated immediately. The decor was very cool with comfortable chairs and variety from table to table. Our server, Christopher was fantastic, and he and his assistant, Mehdi, were both prompt, full of humor, and very attentive.   Christopher had several recommendation but when my wife and I were both interested in the Fish and Chips, he suggested that we order one with their dessert add on special and share. We agreed and added a mixed green salad.   The salad was big enough for three and was very tasty. The fish and chips were delicious, the beer batter very flavorful and the fish itself was cooked to perfection. More than enough again for two of us and we still had dessert to go.   The sticky toffee pudding to close things out was amazing. Probably the best dessert we have ever tasted and again more than enough for two people to share.   This is Las Vegas and everything was pricey but for the value of the food and the experience and the absolutely amazing service from Christopher and Mehdi, this was probably the best money we have spent so far on our trip.   A fantastic experience and I highly recommend it.

AIEQG-3Xd7m_82eDVdnICQ.text: This is a pub with seriously high quality food.   It's expensive but worth it.  Every item ordered was top notch.  Even desert was worth it.   Eat out front so yo can watch the action of the casino.    Shepard's pie was a star.

Qfa_TfmsXLE_n4jsHNEVXg.text: Ordered some apps at the bar. Too much going on with the food. Nothing made sense nor did it come close to wowing me. The bar smells terrible. The corner by the dishwasher definitely has something going on. Needs a deep cleaning of some sort. Smells like mold and sulfer had a baby. Thank God Mariah just killed it and I was in a good mood.

lGPzNYGVj4HSMQKh1osgUg.text: There wasn't much variety for vegetarians and the food was a bit pricey but that is to be expected when you eat at one of these restaurants on the strip. The food was very good nonetheless and I checked in to get the free sticky toffee pudding. That was probably the best part of my entire meal. It's a fairly decent size and so I had to split it with another person. If you go, make sure to check in because it is awesome! (Also it's one per table)

pgXaN7vU8UvJyPp78GKclA.text: My expectations were high going to a restaurant owned by Gordon Ramsey restaurant, this restaurant exceeded my expectations.  We had Michael who was a fantastic server, very professional, kind and seemed to check on us at the exact right intervals. The water is pretty delicious, and comes in a unique bottle.  The draft beer selection could be better, but you can't go wrong with a Dogfish head IPA.  I would suggest asking your server for food suggestions, they really know what they are talking about, and also if your into splitting your meal with your date it might be a good idea to taste different dishes.   I had the lamb burger which was delicious and I highly recommend you try it.  This is a very unique dining experience and it is a must do if your in Vegas.  A big special thank you to Michael and Randall who made our dinning experience wonderful, you guys are fantastic.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Looking for what to order- drinks? I suggest the 90 min. Dogfish head.

K9eePg2MbHVssD4LQ8dU3A.text: Over priced food that's what you get at this place . Portions were good but 30$ for fish and chips. What a joke.

E08JeTBAtD5yjC2BozDJCw.text: Amazing experience here!! Everyone was so nice -- Especially Heather! She gave us the secret menu and suggested amazing food! Thank you for your kind customer experience! We'll be back again!!!!!

v8fna3ZoBLj3frHRPKcM3w.text: I have dined here twice and love it. I had the steak and ale pie the first visit and nearly licked the dish clean. My companion had the chicken and she loved it. I had a sample of hers and thought it was quite good.  Second visit I had the short rib. Wow wow wow as Gordon would say. So delicious. We also split the calamari app. Was done in a unique way but was excellent. My husband had the bangers and mash. It was very good.  The only thing that I have a gripe about is the prices of the beers. But whatever. If I like my meal, I don't care what it costs. If you are on a budget, perhaps this is not the place for you. Also, if you come here why on earth would you order a burger? You can get a burger anywhere. I read lots of complaints about the burger and the price of it. Duh... No burger should cost $20 and if you come here, why not get something that is not so common?  One downside is the service was on the slower side each time I've been here, but I make reservations and allot 2 hours just so I don't feel rushed. I like to take my time to eat.   Give it a try, look at the menu before you come to make sure it is in your budget and you don't go on yelp later and complain. Also, make reservations, plan accordingly. Order something a bit out of your normal realm too. Complaining about burgers and fish and chips....you people....smh.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Steak and Ale pie

spMoEYBbgS5EntTM03gmxw.text: Food awesome, great service from Heather, great surroundings, fantastic cocktails! I'll come back again.

Qx7NZvYzguLhODOOsFFFwg.text: Food way over priced, burger had no flavor. I like most other Ramsey properties, by this is a typical tourist trap. Table looked worn out, dirty and disgusting. Please see picture. We have higher expectations for what we paid. Would recommend Bobby's Burger Palace which is far better.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Our table, yuck!

g7AkaXYFb95beEW7cqyWgA.text: This is my wife and I go to place when we come up to a show/concert at Caesars Palace. It's usually a good place to go to because the service and food are great. Tonight not so much. We waited 12 minutes for a waiter to come to our table to ask what we wanted to drink. Seriously!!  By the time our waiter came over, I decided I wasn't going to order a drink and just get the bare min. I ordered the classic fish and chips and my wife ordered the butter chicken curry. Food was good, came out unusually fast. The waiter barely made small talk. I think he knew we were both upset about the service.  Being local, we might have to start picking another go to place at Caesars. Disappointed, it's been awhile.  The only thing good about the experience was checking in on Yelp and getting free sticky toffee cake.

cJ4fF_BrLjyO4rUK1dDTNA.text: 2 stars due to the fact the staff was great!  Food was terrible.  What's unbelievable is Gordon Ramsey prides himself on qualify and taste...big fail on both!  Lamb Shank tough as nails, fish and chips bland, onion soup BLAND!  He is just cashing in, but could care less about quality.  What's even more embarrassing (for him) is that this is an English Pub!  Save your cash

L6CM4H6Ns9SU-ecBnXL3dA.text: We had reservations and got sat right away but it took about 10 minutes for any waiter to come to our table. We ordered  appetizers the Buffalo wings and Caesar salad. The wings were great. The salad tasted like it was a salad you buy from a gas station. Not impressed.

da6s3qU4txtOhjUrrFPV6w.text: Well the food was excellent as always but service has gone way down hill.  Staff seemed rushed and were not cordial with guests.  ***My apologies to Louie and the staff at the Pub and Grill.  This previous review was meant for the Gordon Ramsay BurGR.  But I am looking forward to going back to the Pub in the near future as I am sure the food and staff are excellent as they were during my first experience.

M6-j7qbOUCCVuukrBtU7kg.text: I'm such a Gordon Ramsay fan & love watching him tear apart restaurants and egos on Kitchen Nightmares. Pub & Grill was actually my first Ramsay dining experience and it totally hit the spot.  Caesars Palace is a busy place, and Pub & Grill's central location on the casino floor makes this restaurant a really busy place too. On a Tuesday evening around 8p, we were quoted a 45 minute wait for a party of two. Ugh. Too hungry for all that, we scoured the bar for a couple stools and luckily found a spot at the back end. We squeezed-in near the drink pickup station, so it was definitely a busy spot. Even though the restaurant was buzzing, we were promptly helped by both a bartender and server. Overall service was quick & friendly-enough.  The Maine Lobster Roll Minis are super tasty & ideal for sharing since they are plated in pairs. The Shrimp Cocktail's also great - six massive prawns perfectly poached and served with a delicious horseradish-spiked cocktail sauce.  Vegas can get a little stuffy when it comes to dining, so turn to Pub & Grill for a casual, delicious meal.

LArtbigJRo2U4-PQwW_fFQ.text: Incredible Shepard's pie and awesome selection of ales.  Apps are almost a meal in themselves. Also appreciate the low key atmosphere. Friendly staff and great service.

nvWYh5l6yXTr4gxMseO4LA.text: I didn't want to like this place because of all the hype associated with Ramsay and other celeb chefs.  That being said I went anyway and the butter chicken was the best I've ever had.  It was flavored perfectly.  Everything just worked from the spices of the curry to the yogurt to cool it off !  The service was also excellent.  I will definitely return on my next trip to Vegas.

VrCk8WYMrfBkQ6UYUVNH0w.text: Very good service, enough choice in menu, and delicious food. But utensils wasn't clean enough and that's only why I  decided to rate 4 stars, not 5. I would recommend this place. Little pricy but it worth it. No complimentary parking available, short walk from self parking of Caesars Casino (1st hour free and then $12 1 to 2 hours). Better to make reservation, gets busy at dinner time.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Braised Short Rib (very delicious)
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Inside

FyrhPo9y2yOmkd01BY3rNg.text: Yikes, I've been to a Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill before and was excited to be back, but it seems things have gone a bit downhill...   The Scottish Salmon tasted like re-heated below-average wedding caterer salmon. It had no flavor and a level of dryness that could only be achieved if the fish has died, like, multiple times until it reached a zombified state. (This shouldn't be the case if you're paying over $30 for a piece of salmon.)  The Sticky Toffee Pudding was also a bit questionable. When I first had it in 2015, it held its shape and was served with a neat, spherical scoop of ice cream. But this time, the cake portion was super loose and sloppily put together, topped with an amorphous, melty glob of ice cream. I wondered if they had smashed this dessert against the wall before serving it to me.   The Poutine was probably the best item I had this time around. Even though the fries were way too salty and the corned beef strips had the texture of rubber bands, but the fries were nice and crispy, and the cheese and gravy they used were tasty.   However, for a meal costing me over $70 (with no alcoholic drink!), it was not worth it and I probably won't be running back any time soon.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sticky Toffee Pudding: 2015 vs. 2018
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Scottish Salmon - very dry, no flavor, tasted like re-heated leftover
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Corned Beef Poutine - the beef was very rubbery

-Y585rqBEx9s8m50Hh1t-w.text: Really enjoyed dinner tonight. We bar dined and Warner made some great drinks and service was perfect. Also here is a tip, check in on face book and get a free Sticky Toffee Pudding with Ice Cream. You will thank me later.

AYFOzRrSLed-nde-CLLQdQ.text: Yes, I know they specialize in steak and signature dishes, but I decided to go with the English cheddar and bacon burger. It was cooked to a perfect medium. This might be the most flavorful burger I have ever had the pleasure of introducing to my tastebuds. They were accompanied by amazing truffle fries. This burger was perfect and worth the $$. We started with a white cheddar and garlic Mac and cheese appetizer, also delicious. My wife had a delicious flavorful NY strip, also cooked to a perfect medium.  We finished off with his famous sticky toffee pudding, which was simply divine.  Everything about this place was 5 stars. The service was absolutely superb and the food was even better than I imagined it would be. With all the let down restaurants we've experienced in Vegas, this was the perfect turn around for us. I love this place and I will come back every time I'm in Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States

PrFs3uRZOLmFgrRCk2tD4Q.text: We took a staycation at our favorite hotel Ceasers palace last evening and had the pleasure of eating at this fine establishment. Well at first it was supposed to be just some small appetizers and a few drinks before we started gambling. However it all changed once we had a chance to look  at the great menu. They have an awesome hoot hour where you can get some delicious chicken wings with "real blue cheese" and warm pretzels .   Great stuff, now on to the "meat and potatoes" of the menu. My better half enjoyed the fish and chips which were stellar and I had the famous Beef Wellington which didn't disappoint. We topped it off with the Toffee pudding dessert t seal the deal .  Lisa R was our server and she was friendly, suggested items from the menu, fast and always had a smile. Great experience overall for a couple of locals shaking it up mid week  Cheers to the staff , cannot wait to go back!

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beef Wellington

rtI-LRJwkX40u_clL980lg.text: Still catching up on old reviews.  My wife and I were in Las Vegas in February for our anniversary and visited Gordon Ramsay Pub and Grill in Caesars for lunch on February 9th.  We hit the place early, just before the lunch rush so we managed to avoid the crowd.  Nice place, classy atmosphere, and pleasant service staff.  So many things on the menu we would've like to have tried, but my wife chose the Fish and Chips and I got the Shepherd's Pie.  Both were as you'd expect from a Gordon Ramsay establishment....amazing, but pricey (not quite as wallet-breaking as Ramsay's other Vegas venues though).  If you want to try Gordon Ramsay cuisine but don't want to have to mortgage your house to do so, try here!  A great experience.....we'll be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shepherds Pie
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fish and Chips with mushy peas

5QxEKk_H-2nVmQ9Cx4fgLg.text: October 26, 2018 Friday - 5:45 PM for dinner  2 Adults  Atmosphere - 4stars Food - 5 stars Service - 5 stars  Background - I was requested to see if this place would work for the UYE Reno Beer Club.  We were in the area for dinner and our next event for date night is nearby.  Atmosphere - By having a reservation we actually were seated at a booth for four people.  Two people made it nice, we still sat close together.  The place is big and has a lot of little sections but the volume in the place is loud, too loud.  Also a lot of TVs with the World Series game on.  Food   Drink - I had the classic Dogfish 60 Minute IPA on draft, 20 ounce pour.    Appetizer - We ordered the deviled eggs.  Described with sriracha and bacon bits, the sriracha was lacking.  We were expecting it in the egg yolk mixture or a drizzle.  Even without the sriracha the eggs were great.    Dinner - I had the flat iron steak with a side of truffle fries.  The steak was perfectly cooked to medium rare.  The menu did not indicate this but the steak has a little bit of mashed potatoes and a few veggies.  I mean a few, a baby carrot, an okra, and a pearl onion.  Service - Out waiter was good.  The busy boy would never let our waters get even close to be empty.  Future - I could see coming back here.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. flatiron steak with truffle fries
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. my wife’s prime rib
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. flatiron steak close up

dKoiXaZwrOuDiKNtTZgL4A.text: I was really excited watching Gordon Ramsey on Master Chef and Hells Kitchen, to try one of his many restaurants. My girlfriend and I stopped in at Gordon Ramsey's Pub and Grill. We decided on a late lunch bite, something quick to hold us over until later tonite.  We ordered the appetizer, this burger slider item which came in a pair, actually very good other than having slight to none dressing. It would have been better if the dressing complimented the beef, but i hardly tasted it. The bun was a little chewy. We also ordered to share, the fish and chips platter, it wasn't all that bad. I know....how could you mess up fish and chips. It did take forever to come out, maybe 20 minutes after we finished the appetizer. I didn't think it was too complex of a dish to prepare. The batter was crisp, had some flavor,  fish was slightly generous, came with potatoes wedges, and this minty pea dip concoction which I really didn't care for. I'm no Gordon Ramsey, so maybe I just don't know what I'm talking about. I'll try the other dishes in the future and hopefully justify get what I'm paying for. But hey, this is Las Vegas.

mUdWL_Wdm9feg5e1-w6NaA.text: Not our first time at the Pub. Took friends and coworkers.  Our party of 6 was seated promptly and friendly with our reservation.  Drinks were nice, cold and tasty.  A couple of us tried the beef Wellington - and quite honestly - being a Ramsay signature dish (and $60 each) We were disappointed. The meat was barely warm, and a bit dry,  the pastry not flaky. The meat was dry probably because the pastry was super soaked and mushy. The accompanying sauce was very tasty as well as the potatoes.  We also had a couple orders of fish and chips. While the chips were tasty and hot, the fish was flavorless, like the seasoning was missing.  We enjoyed the atmosphere and each other's company.  I do hope this was just an off night - we were there on a Friday at 6:40 - and others that night were not disappointed.

xNbNhWiyl9RLncqGviTADg.text: We came for Gordon Ramsay's take on Beef Wellington but were disappointed in the dry filet mignon although cooked to a good medium rare and the layer of mushrooms was delicious. The lobster Mac and cheese was overpriced given the small portion and very little lobster. Seating is ample and the dress code is casual with nice modern decorations (kegs along the wall are great for pictures).   The server was really attentive although some of his jokes fell flat and made things a bit awkward (like we were helping him with his comedy routine). However, the service from the hostesses was really poor because I arrived 5 minutes early to my reservation as was told to wait for my table to be ready. It turned out that the hostess never checked me in and she only realized after I asked her because I saw at least 5 groups of people behind me get seated and we were the only ones waiting.   I must admit we wanted to try out this restaurant because we are big fans of the Hell's Kitchen TV show so we were expecting this restaurant to be a tourist trap and the experience confirmed it.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States

KIHi95EOjJLwo4ayX0_JXw.text: It's been always my dream as a kid watching Gordon Ramsay's shows to try out his dishes.  I believe food is just half the experience, Our server (Ali) he was half of the reason of my great experience. I loved the service which made me enjoy the food more and more.  I ordered the signature tasting menu  Appetizer/ Scallops (10/10) Amazing sear, and the flavors are just there although it's very simple but it's a blast.  Entree/ Wellington (10/10) Always been craving it from the TV, but once you taste it. You can tell why it was so hard to achieve in Hell's Kitchen. It's perfect. Sauce and cook was on point.  Dessert/ Sticky pudding (6/10) I'm not a fan of a pudding but it's tasty.  Must to visit.

OWanAwAeikPFXb1epFFKVA.text: Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill is located in the Caesar's Palace casino floor between the Forum Towers and Food Court/Forum Shops, opposite end of the Colosseum.   The first time I came here was for cocktails at the bar for "Pub Hour" between 2:00 - 5:00 PM on weekdays.  Pub Hour (their happy hour) includes half off all draft beer and select wine, as well as pub bites under $5.  This was a really good deal, and the bartenders were the bomb, friendly conversations and excellent service.  The second time we came here was for drinks and dinner.  Couldn't decide what to order for a starter, however, the Maine Lobster & Shrimp Rolls came highly recommended.  My "starter" was really good, creamy, delicious.  I'm glad I ordered this.  For my main entree, I had the Braised Short Rib.  The ribs were so soft and tender I didn't need my knife to cut it!  For dessert, I had the Apple Tart, which was accompanied with a caramelized puff pastry and salted caramel ice cream.  It was really delicious, and a nice close to my meal.  I highly recommend these dishes.  Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill is a nice "feel good" place for cocktails at the bar or dinner with friends.  They have a nice selection of craft beers, wines and specialty cocktails.  The bar/pub area has flat screen TV's showcasing a lot of sports games.  Our hosts, waiters and servers were very accommodating, energetic, lively and entertaining .  Will definitely be back next time we're in Las Vegas!

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dessert Menu

mPvG7eCEAbF-IgQvNjn7qA.text: If you want the best Vegas food, pick a Gordon Ramsay restaurant. We've now done Hell's kitchen and this pub and grill and both were phenomenal.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shepherd&#39;s pie and crispy pork belly mmmmm
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Scotch eggs

5YtHupcHogZLT3ROU7QNXg.text: Just okay, at least for me. Our wait was about 15mns to be seated. Our waitress, Stacy may have been new or training, however she was attentive and provide great recommendations and answered our questions. I had the Maine Lobster & Shrimp roll, my friend had the mini burgers and truffle fries. We both ordered the Cereza de Mule, the drink was heavy on the ginger, but very tasty. The fries came our luke warm, Stacy promptly took them back for fresh hot fries with no problem. I would recommend this place to anyone in Caesars Palace, looking to try someone place different and fan of Gordon Ramsey.

Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Maine Lobster &amp; Shrimp Roll(s)
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pub &amp; Grill Menu

49z5TwF2CF5NAztL1RrcOg.text: Really really wanted to be wowed. The beef wellington has been on my bucket list for a very long time. I already had reservations to Hell's Kitchen but the bachelor party group I was with wanted to check this place out. To my surprise they offered the beef wellington, I confirmed with the bartender that it's the legit serving and same as what I would receive at hells kitchen.  I have wanted this dish for so long and have thought about making it myself, so much so that I have watched lot's of Gordon's youtube videos and his Masterclass episode on how to prepare his famous beef wellington. I know the ingredients and what should be encased in the puff pastry and I could be wrong but didn't find parma ham or dijon mustard, both necessary ingredients. I also thought my filet was just slightly overcooked but didn't want to send it back because everyone I was with just got wings so I was already late.  The size is small, compare it to a taller hot pocket, and the plate was huge. Most of the plate was empty space or sauce. I think a smaller plate would make the portion seem larger. When they bring it out to you it's already cut it in half and covered in clovers... I kinda wish I could've cut it open myself. Everything else was good, I liked the drinks and everyone's food looked great. Just was not satisfied with my entree.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beef Wellington

BvZjtp8TwAqGtXCevnzvJA.text: I was pleasantly surprised with the quality of food.  The happy hour menu was a nice sampler of what the pub had to offer.    The burger was juicy, a little pink with the perfect amount of flavor.  The pig in a blanket was a nice size bratwurst wrapped in warm flaky dough. At $1 per wing,  it was a slightly sweet tangy flavor with blue cheese for dipping.    Whopping $25 for the shepherd's pie,  it was a decent size, filling and had a good amount of protein. This is not a cheap meal, if not for happy hour tasting menu.  I took some pictures, and a video of the dessert to add to my review.    To top everything off,  the Yelp check-in offered free toffee pudding.  The pudding was surprisingly moist and the vanilla bean ice cream made it that much tastier. Ending with a free warm toffee pudding was a nice perk.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sheppard&#39;s pie, side of pickled vegetables
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. $15 cocktails
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Happy hour menu

XYVClnQT43BMCCqM8yRZSA.text: We ate here yesterday for my birthday and as usual, Ramsay's food did not disappoint. We have been to Gordon Ramsay Steak prior but never Pub & Grill until yesterday. The first thing I would like to point out is that our server was fantastic. He helped me pick out a beer that I actually enjoyed and gave good feedback on which dishes we should try! I ordered the Beef Wellington which was delicious. We also ordered Calamari for our appetizer and the pickled peppers really made the appetizer taste amazing. Then to top off this amazing experience, we asked a different waitress to take a picture of us standing up for my birthday and she took us to all of the best spots in the restaurant to take our picture and didn't even act like we were invading her time! This place is fantastic and we will definitely be back.

Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beef Wellington

jMxrdUYaovHTb_zrvbhXFg.text: Rodney was awesome, very attentive and made the best recommendations and they were all hits!!!!  I suggest the NY prime cut.  We are coming back for sure. Great meal all around. -RR

StsRHUXR3PBK9EeiKI9raQ.text: We visited this restaurant on two different occasions and were completely impressed both times! You just cannot beat Gordon Ramsay truly phenomenal.   The atmosphere is cozy with dim lighting. I enjoyed sitting close to the open window so I could people watch in the casino.   On the first occasion, we had deviled eggs for an appetizer and the shrimp and lobster rolls with truffle fries. They were outstanding! They look small but I was completely satisfied.   The second occasion, we had the sliders! They were legit the best sliders I ever had. Just wow! We also tried the 16oz New York Strip steak. It was to die for! And the plating was so beautiful! Wouldn't expect anything less from a Gordon Ramsay restaurant.   I checked in and earned a free dessert. Sticky toffee pudding--which I did not think I would enjoy but I sure did! It was delicious! It was absolutely amazing!   So excited to come here in a couple months and try something new!

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 16oz New York Strip steak
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Deviled eggs
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sliders

IEzc6zMagt8ZGaqOem2sxg.text: I know that when I eat on the Strip, it's going to be overpriced. But $30 for Fish n Chips isn't overpriced....its highway robbery.  So I didn't order the Fish n' Chips, but my friend did and said it was "Fine".  I'm sorry, but in my opinion, $30 Fish n Chips should be the best Fish n Chips of my life!  I got the Mini Pub Bacon Burgers.  What a disappointment! The single miniscule slice of bacon barely covered a third of the burger, and I could barely see any of the aioli.  The burger was plain and boring.  I've had better burgers just about everywhere.  As a side I got the calamari.   It was good, but nothing spectacular.  So I give it one star for service, which was wonderful, and one star for drinks, which were delish.  I can't give it any more stars than that.  Will most likely never be back unless I'm going to the Colosseum and every other restaurant at Caesars has shut down.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mini Pub Bacon Burgers... underwhelming.
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Calamari

fH-NPTOBwbGtmO_473DqXw.text: What an awesome meal!  My tenderloin melted in my mouth and the sticky pudding is out of this world!  GM Randy Goldich and Taylor make you feel like you are the most important customer they have! Go to Caesar's Palace and see them both!   You will not regret it!   Our son is a pastry chef at a 5 star restaurant so I know what food should be and customer service !  Thanks Team Gordon Ramsay Caesar's Palace!

bzglNULKBtEvUWu6i4WTTQ.text: Yummy! We has a corn  beef brisket sandwich and a beef pot pie. Sandwich was moist and meat was tender with lots of fries. The beef pie was full of beef chunks in a great tasting sauce. Oh, and the drinks were tasty too. Thanks to our waitress Heather for the recommendations.

_xQ2QP-73ZksTwHsdbMHKA.text: Over rated, over priced for mediocre food and  I have no problem sending money on good quality food. This was not quality.

050OMyoHtk9MyGlT67myHQ.text: I always thought that Gordon Ramsay  was a stickler for getting food out on time. If that is True, then he should probably check-in more with this restaurant.   We had a table of 5 for a 10:15pm reservation. We were seated promptly and had our orders taken. Our soups seemed to come out at a decent time but we didn't get our entrees until at least 50 min after that. In that time I had lost my appetite from waiting so long. The restaurant occupancy was as expected for a Thursday night but not all the tables were taken. Maybe the kitchen was short-staffed, I don't know. I would have given 1 star because you shouldn't lose your appetite while at a restaurant, but my fish and chips were pretty good. However, they were not good enough to make me come back and wait that long (or pay that much again) for them.

htrA-pPBrcptNWSJrqIJwQ.text: Pretty standard gastropub fare - large beer selection, decent food, busy staff who just want to turn your table.  We arrived around 915p on a Tuesday and was told by a snarling hostess that it was 30 minutes.  Not the best start to the evening...but I thought the SMS system was cool - leave a number and they text you when the table is ready.  Got myself a Strongbow cider to go with the bread and pretzel.  Came with butter and some odd cheese sauce that didn't really do any justice to the pretzels.  Still, the caraway seed bread was tasty.  We started with crab salad with pickled radish and corn soup to share.  Crab salad was very good, lots of crab meat - though I wouldn't say the little bits of crab bones/shells were any good for the texture.  Suppose it's hard to get everything when there's that much crab meat.  Corn soup was kind of plain, even with the minced crab in it, and didn't have enough corn kernels to call it corn soup - unless it was pureed...then I just didn't taste it.  Wife had mussels and clams.  Was an enormous pile of them.  She was salivating when I was taking photos, but a few bites in she thought the broth brought out too much of the fishy taste in the shellfish.  Most chefs would use some butter, sake, or wine to cut the fish taste a bit - not here.    Needless to say, she didn't finish the dish.  I ordered the shepards pie.  After watching GR enough on tv, I'd figure I'd try his signature dish out and see what the hype was all about.  One of his biggest peeves about the pies he tries is the amount of grease in the dish.  Well, his kitchen staff must have missed those episodes, because my pie was chalk full of grease.  The meats in the stew itself was nice and tender, albeit a bit bland; but with the mashed potatos soaking up all the grease, the dish got to be really heavy.  Texture wise though, the dish wins 5 stars - creamy mashed, chewy meats, and crunchy vegetables makes for a texture dream.  Waiter asked how things were at the end and we started into some of the things above; but as he was tuning us out the moment his question was finished, we didn't bother to go into much detail.  We had hopes of bringing a visiting friend next week, but in the end, we decided on two things -- not to get a dessert as to prolong the staffs evening, and not returning for another visit.   Good night.

xfDTFNq42RDlYhRGNEg6tA.text: This place has great burgers and service.  This is one of the places that is great to visit when your in LAS VEGAS.  Check it out before you leave.  It's located inside Caesars Palace.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. This place has a great selections of fantastic food and the review from other site gives this place 5 stars

5fmhIt6EZVifHlkhH089kA.text: Well - I only write reviews in 2 instances:  1. the food and/or experience was totally awesome and would warrant a revisit.  or 2. the complete opposite - the food and/or experience was dismal and disappointing.  Sadly GR Pub and Grill was the latter.   I am a huge GR fan and was very excited in trying Mr. Ramsay's inspired menu and experience his detail to service. We arrived around 1:15pm for lunch and waited for a few mins while waitstaff cleared a table.  The restaurant was only about 1/4-1/2 full (at best) and yet we still had to wait about 10mins before a waiter poured our water and asked for drink orders.  I ordered a Dark and Stormy and it was waaaay too heavy on the rum and was not served with lime.  To the server's credit - he was very apologetic - rushed to get me a second one.  #2 Dark and stormy was slightly better (less rum)  but still a sub-standard drink which did NOT warrant the $11 price tag.  Again not served with lime - I had to ask for them.  Not.a.great start.    So I thought 'ok -we are not here for drinks the food should really speak for itself'. We ordered the deviled eggs per the waiter's suggestion plus I LOVE deviled eggs. I was so psyched to see them on the menu.  I have been known to eat 8-10 in one seating but I digress. With all Mr. Ramsay's emphasis on simplicity - it was lost on this dish.  I thought it was interesting mix of flavors on paper but in reality there was too much going on between the vinegar, bacon and cheese.  Weird texture too with the bits of bacon. The worst was that the egg whites were too firm - like they had been sitting in the fridge for too long or were just pulled out and were not given enough time to soften a little. And the yolks simply did not taste fresh.  Perhaps I have been spoiled by farm fresh eggs.  Nevertheless I was disappointed.    Ah but the entree should be better - right?  Nope.  My lamb burger arrived cold.  Cold fries and cold burger. WTF?! Not only did we wait approximately 15-20mins for the entrees to arrive but the my entire meal was cold.  COLD!  Again the waiter was very apologetic and rushed a second burger out to me.  So this one was warmer but sadly it had absolutely No.taste. None. Could not tell it was lamb.  In Mr. Ramsay's words: BLAND!.  It was not seasoned.  I've had better tasting lamb in the local middle eastern restaurant here in Pittsburgh.  I cannot speak to my mother's dish because it contained gluten but she said her heirloom tomato sandwich was quite good.  So there was one bright spot.  Then again she admits that she really does not care about food e.g. tastes, flavors, experience as much as I do.    In conclusion, I had very high expectations for Mr. Ramsay's food and restaurant.  For the prices he charges I should have been WOWed.  Instead I left disappointed and very unhappy.  I do have to mention that the watier was thoughtful enough to offer a 20% employee discount which brought our lunch total to $59.02 but still a pricey sum for a sub-standard-will-not-return-to-lunch.  I would not recommend this place.  Sigh.    Happy Dining, KK Teh

wdB628stt1LlsI6XkCrLRQ.text: Strange - i thought i posted a review of this place a few months ago ...  .As to this particular review, being the romantic, for Valentines Day i gave the girlfriend:  Diamonds ?  uhhhh No Perfume ?  Seriously ? Flowers ?  we've been together 3 years, I've yet to give her a flower so why start now. Candy ?  getting closer  How about two tickets to the Uncorked Dinner with Chef Gordon Ramsay since I think she loves him more than me ?  What can i say, I'm a giver.  So even though it's a special dinner, it is being prepared by the chefs that work at the pub and you figure, it's gotta be there best effort since Chef Ramsay is there riding their ass so i've opted to make this a review of the restaurant and not the event.  briefly, as to the event, they simply cut off a portion of the restaurant for about 60 diners.  Chef Ramsay made the rounds - pics autographs, etc.  My gf was gushing when he came up to our table - i jokingly told the chef he can grab my girls ass when i take the pic.  I gotta admit, the guy is personable - i couldn't resist - asked him about this so-called riff between him and Bobby Flay - to his credit, didn't miss a beat and explained that it's "press-driven" - he likes Bobby, thinks he's a great chef, blah blah blah.  Overall, A nice event.  What about the food ?  All the courses were paired with beers provided by Innis & Gunn  Course one -   Chilled Fennel Soup with Shrimp paired with I&G Original.  If I wasn't told it was fennel soup i never would have guessed fennel was in the soup and I'm a fennel fan !   Smooth, creamy, but it needs ... flava !  The beer was decent.  Course two - Heirloom Tomato. Goat Cheese and Chervil ( paired with Original again )  - believe it or not, the star of the evening - simple fresh the classic flavor explosion.   Course three - Pan seared Diver Scallops, braised artichokes, spring garlic ( paired with Original ) - nice, simple really like the artichokes.  Course four - Grilled Rack of Lamb, olive crushed potatoes, baby zucchini ( paired with I&G Finish ) - again, simple yet full of flavor and the beer was amazing.  The GF had a hard time with the rareness of the lamb - good, more for me !  Course five - Sticky toffee pudding ( matched with Melville fruit beer )  - for this being his "signature" dessert and i've seen rave reviews about it,  I can't lie - didn't care for it.  i actually was surprised what it looked like ( never had before ) - to me it looked and tasted like an upside down bran muffin.  I was expected a little jug of toffee sauce to pour over the muffin and ice cream - i guess not.  I simply didn't understand the dessert.  The beer had a fresh berry flavor to it - not bad, just not sure it complimented the dessert.  Overall, I thought it was a decent effort with the theme being fresh, quality ingredients that were not stifled by seasoning.  Most importantly, the GF was very pleased.  pics attached

u2EIkXQs7JxBkwJFewy9MQ.text: There are so many great restaurants in Vegas, don't waste your time or money here. The waitresses/hostesses' outfits make them look like cheap escorts. The service was slow and our waiter was a jerk. My sister ordered the chicken and he said, "Just so you know, that's the worst thing on the menu." Ummm...ok? He messed up my drink order and took 10 minutes to bring me the right one.   The food was sub-par. The scallops were boring and not filling as they only came with a few veggies, no carbs, so I didn't feel like I had a full meal. My sister's chicken was nothing to rave about and my mom couldn't remember what she ordered, so that tells you something. The only good thing was the bread.

ogGbBtQc6d6tPrz0yxu4cw.text: We had reservations for after a show at the Coliseum. All four of us had the fish and chips which were simply "good".  The rating of two is for the fact that the restaurant is advertised to be open till 11:00p, however when we asked for a dessert menu, we were told that the kitchen closed at 10:30.  Coupled with having to flag down another server to find our server makes this the worst food experience on this trip.

x_enYuqiPOKuKuOtE9tdDw.text: Cruising through Caesar's Palace and came across the Gordon Ramsay Pub.  The place has a great look and very cool Hipster vibe.  At first we popped in for a beer and appetizers.  They had a great selection of micro brews on tap, a good enough reason in itself to stop by.  The deviled eggs and warm pretzel were awesome.  Unfortunately, our meal left a little to be desired.  The fish and chips were average, but plentiful.  They overcooked the first burger and felt it necessary to make a second one. The problem was, they forgot to tell us about the delay.  It was close to 40 minutes before we got our food.  By then, we were a little pissed.  Not a good idea to deliver food late to a Yelper.  Sorry Gordon, I really had high hopes.  But you'll get a chance to redeem yourself.  I'll be back.....

og3sfC4PmBwfY68P9P1iaw.text: I sat at the bar, and enjoyed the food. I ordered the seasonal item which was a salmon with green lentils and chanterelle mushrooms. The salmon was cooked perfectly. It was not dry at all. I thought the price was a little high since the dish was $30, but the pricing tends to be the trend along the Strip. The servers at the bar were attentive and made sure that I had everything that I needed.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. salmon with chanterelle mushroom and lentils

TuYee2B_8V6YSYXNyYaQeA.text: my husband and I had lunch at the pub and had a great time. the bartenders were excellent. our meal was great, I had the lobster mac and cheese, delicious! the atmosphere is very cool. overall, a great choice!

iSTEsk4KwNHUzgKovggnRA.text: Loved everything! Calamari app was delicious! And the shepards pie was perfection! Nom nom nom. Great cocktails too!

Z7GWvymsk7QcfDoIVy-9kg.text: What did I expect from Gordon Ramsey ? Perfection! And thats what I got. Great shepherds pie, great atmosphere and great service. I will most defiantly visit again .

P5mhYybTOjYwTOVRtgzSBg.text: Disappointing. We've been wanting to go here for a while now (we are locals). Mostly because we are Masterchef fans but also because we've been craving beef Wellington. So we gave it a shot today. We got right in on a busy Saturday but our food took quite a while to come out, our appetizer (pretzels) came after our meal, our side of fries didn't come until we reminded our server, our drinks were never refilled, and the food was just ok (except the lamb burger which was awesome). I had the fish and chips. It was good, but not $30 good. Anyway, they were super-slammed and the waiter was apologetic, but we won't be back.

hW5pHZjnOcBTMoT9WOvOFA.text: My husband and I decided at the last minute to celebrate our anniversary at Caesars. We stopped by this pub for a late lunch and to enjoy the happy hour our first day in Vegas. Our waitress was attentive, enthusiastic, and made great recommendations. We had the shrimp cocktail, pub sliders, beer flight, a bloody Mary (a meal in itself!), truffle fries, and the sticky toffee pudding. We enjoyed our late lunch so much, we came back for dinner to celebrate our anniversary, canceling our reservation at another restaurant at Caesars. For dinner, our waiter, Christopher Lee, was fantastic and our food was delivered so fast, we were pleasantly surprised. My compliments to the staff...not only was everything we had delicious, it came to our table piping hot, and we felt so well cared for by the staff. Definitely try the sliders, truffle fries, bloody Marys, fish and chips, and the sticky toffee pudding (save room and make sure to share the pudding!) We will be back the next time we hit Vegas and also plan to check out the steak house at Paris!!! Well done.

U-Ca6uek1U1mWHJTMLAu1A.text: "Meh" is the word of the day for Ramsay's Pub and Grill.   As a beer lover, I was most excited about the beer offerings at Ramsay's Pub and Grill, which was supposed to have 36 beers on tap, and another 63 in bottles. I make a point to seek out new brews where ever I travel. The quantity of the beer selection at Ramsay's Pub was the sole reason my girlfriend and I made the trek for dinner that night.   I was disappointed to find out that they do not have nearly this amount of beers for sale. They still have plenty (about 30-ish), but I was hoping to find something new, or perhaps a hard to find ale from when I used to live in London. If you visit hoping to drink some great craft brews, you will be let down. They stock the usual big brands, nothing special. Unless, of course, our server with-held some secret menu that contained the rest of the beers advertised on the website? I asked about this but was told everything they had was on the menu. :-(  As for the food, it's Vegas prices. High prices, almost too high for what they offer. I had the Steak and Ale pie, which is a staple of hearty pub food in the UK. But at $24, I suppose I expected something more than the underwhelming pie I received. I didn't think I would have to spice up a Gordon Ramsay pie with HP sauce... I've had better from UK chains like Fuller's. My girlfriend had the fish and chips, which were good, but still very expensive ($28) for what it is.   Again, I understand it's Vegas and prices are inflated, but it just seems like too much for the food they offer. They can advertise it as "elevated" pub food, but in the end it's still just pub food and doesn't justify a $75 bill for steak and ale pie, fish and chips, and two drinks (a full draft pint is anywhere from $9-$13).   I originally gave it 2 stars because of high prices, generally underwhelming food, and missing beer. But, the food wasn't bad, just not worth the high prices. The place does, however, have a great vibe. Lots of fun, but I would reconsider dining here again. For the price, there are better options. In fact, hundreds of options! Maybe I'll just grab a brew or cocktail at the bar next time.

uuJ0INatSI5DDsQ6JpCVgA.text: Honestly, if anything, Ramsay gets you over with the details and sauces, just like not so pretty woman hypnotizes you her outrageous accessories. Amazingly creative sauces, freshly baked bread, mouthwatering shrimp salad...  Who mixes beer, horseradish and mayo and sells it for $12? Only a genius! He lures you in with the delicious teasers and then ...boom. Your trout is tasteless, fish and chips Denny's style, shepherd lacks zest... the beef cheek was really good and gentle but that is about it. I was digging for water in the dessert, but honestly out of four dishes, three were not even worth it. My Armenian in-laws could not even finish their dishes nostalgically mentioning that there was much better food half of this price in Bellagio's buffet. Of course, in another life I will totally come back and spend at least $500 on the rest of the menu just to check it out, in case of my punitive reincarnation into this very pretentious Saudi borehole owner.

PIOC7sMl9jQvkOTn7aFgbA.text: A snooty waitress took us all the way back of the restaurant.  Seriously we were watching food runners the whole 45 minutes we waited for a hamburger and poutine.   Our server didnt even check on us until i asked another server to speak to a manager to see where our food was.  Hamburger came out juicy but the poutine had a horrible after taste. I had to return it and ordered lobster mac and cheese where it had big chunks of lobster but came out lukewarm.  The whole experience at this point was horrible but the manager comped us which was nice and im glad he did or i would give negative stars. Popularity of this place is because of mere location Inside ceasers. Meh. If you must go order the burger. They do have happy hour on the weekdays.  All in all not impressed.

z6XtxEosqOeqs5G9Nu0kPA.text: This place was great! My wife and I came for happy hour. Our server, Rodney, was really helpful and even told us a little bit about how sticky toffee pudding is made!   We got everything on the happy hour menu except the pretzels. The sliders were great, truffle fries were out of this world, the pigs in a blanket were done perfectly even though I'm not a huge fan usually. My wife got the brusselsprouts and said they were the best she ever had.  The sticky toffee pudding is a Gordon Ramsay classic, and it did not disappoint. One of the best desserts I've ever had. We hit it up back to back days because it was that good.   Definitely recommend this place! Ask for Rodney too, I generally don't care about the server as much as long as they are good enough, but Rodney really made it special for us.

12BibRzEGuUefIUT1RsKEw.text: My first time in Vegas and I had to eat at a Gordon Ramsay restaurant because I was a huge fan of Hell's Kitchen.  This place was so so good but super pricey. Some menu items were reasonable but it's not a spot you'd come to leisurely enjoy cocktails or food because of how expensive it is. Cocktails were ridiculously expensive.  I loved the decor and mood of the whole place. It was in a hotel, like most of the restaurants.  Next time I'm in Vegas I'd love to try another one of his restaurants.

lxQX6NCp-g-KUaIcnCkzbA.text: I came here for lunch. Service was slow at times it took awhile to place our order and after the first check to see how the food was the server was unseen. The decor was really cool full of beer kegs and barrels. The lightning I felt was a little bit too bright and should be dimmed. What I though was nice was the noise level for being off the main casino it was quiet enough to have a conversation without shouting. As for the food I had the kale salad with grilled chicken added it was good not great the chicken wasn't anything special but the squash added an interesting good flavor to the salad.  For the price and what I received I though it was way over priced and over rated.

jnop3MFBP1PjKh9XmER2sw.text: Quick review: yes a little pricey but duh you're on the strip. Great thing is the food is worth it! Restaurant decor is brilliant! Service was fantastic! Drinks were delish!

sTXaG0BF9H-aPh2N5pjXwA.text: Amazing food we come back every year  Christian was our server and we were so happy with the service  He makes the best drinks !!

nJSlVbCGPvSSR8J3khxY0A.text: Try out Hell's Kitchen, don't waste money here. Steak and deviled eggs were not bad but others were disappointing. Especially the onions soup

wFLn99rrI4ZkzrZrhdDDVg.text: Four stars for happy hour and zero wait time! Can't comment on normal meal hours but definitely recommend for an afternoon/pre-dinner bite.   We got the mini corn dogs, slider, and nachos from the happy hour menu. The corn dogs were SO GOOD (I do love corn dogs so this was even better). I didn't expect so many for the HH item and was pleasantly surprised. Not a fan of the mustard sauce because I dislike mustard but for me, the dogs were fine without them. Love it.   The slider was good as well, although you really do just get a tiny little mini-burger. Paired with the nachos, it almost is enough to build a full meal portion.   Check in for the toffee pudding while it lasts! Comes topped a la mode with a healthy scoop of French Vanilla, and the caramel poured over the top was seriously like the perfect food video ever. We were in a rush, so the server let me to-go most of it after polishing off the ice cream on top.  Very solid choice for a snack, but didn't pay attention to the dinner time pricing so not sure if I'd want to visit for that instead~
