SP9x4w_soF0YEr5NjMi1kQ.text: Amazing place to eat for lunch! Our bartender, Rodney, was phenomenal and very knowledgeable with the menu plus gave us some tips on where to visit around town. Husband said that the Beef Short Ribs was off the hook! Thanks for making our first trip to Vegas memorable. 5* all the way.

lEC3Pk1mr0hWzb2h9LqgMQ.text: I was expecting much better food for a place that has GR's name on it. First of all so expensive for bar food. Paying $15 for two sliders is outrageous.  I orderd the bacon mini burgers aka sliders they showed up cold. Nothing special about them, just a tiny beef patty a single arugula and a bacon.  The burgers at white castle  Taste better than this shit. My bf ordered the chopped salad and the chicken smelled stale. Please do not waste your money here. It's fucking disgusting.  Waste of money. You should be ashamed Gordon Ramsey.

3oXF_V3VBeUdzMvynQnK3g.text: Food taste so good Gordon Ramsay should smack his mama!!!!  I love your show you're an amazing chef!!!  And I love your food even more!!!

IY_VjIm_IaqesYk-wlLx-Q.text: Best pub food, high end quality meals. Yes it's pricey but it's worth it. I had the Maine lobster and shrimp rolls and hubby had the roasted Scottish salmon. Everything was seasoned perfectly.   The service was great as well, very informative staff.

H-VyJrlR2eypsUIXgSXKkQ.text: Really delicious place to grab a meal! I was surprised to see the size of the restaurant. I was expecting something really large and intimidating, but this was more akin to a sports bar/restaurant that's really open to the casino in Caesar's Palace.  I came here for an early dinner  with my husband and we were able to get a table with the tall stools. Service was friendly and helpful, especially when I asked for help picking a beer. We each got a beer, and I decided to go big and get the beef wellington. Absolutely worth the price. Super delicious, rich, and filling!   On a whim I decided to check in on Yelp in between bites and saw that a check-in earns a free sticky toffee pudding! And O-M-G, it was honestly one of the best desserts I've ever had! The cakey part was so moist and hot, and the big scoop of vanilla ice cream was creamy and an excellent complement.   I'd recommend both dishes to anyone, and would definitely return again.

3KJQ1aRxBLmHoFWvT5z7kg.text: My Sister & I stopped by Gordon Ramsay's Pub & Grill to try the "sticky toffee pudding" and gosh we're so glad that we did! It was sooo delicious & made to perfection!! Our server Rodney took good care of us & made it a fun experience! We are definitely coming back before heading home to indulge again!

3DJMLiYXPdVLmp1u3eRp2w.text: Came for a rare night out, this was our first visit to the Pub although I have walked past them hundreds of times leaving work. Sat at the bar and were greeted with menus. The bartender came back after a minute and asked if we were ready, and I asked if they had any of their own beers (I know it's not a brewery, but Wolfgang Puck has his own wine and so figured does it hurt to ask?) to which he replied, "no, we're not a brewery" and walked off. Fine, maybe the guy gets asked that all the time, but as a bartender when people ask me for the fivehundreth time the same question I always hear, I respond in a pleasant way because maybe it's their first time at my bar and it's my entire job to make them feel welcome.   He seemed to change his tone a little when he carded us and saw we were locals. We started with the Lobster Mac n Cheese. $25 for the dish, it was large and visually appealing. The macaroni flavor was the most pronounced of the dish and I kept looking around to see if there was salt I could add to give it something. There were about five or six lumps of lobster, which was alright. Overall nothing impressive. Next the Fish and Chips, and the Scallops. The fish and chips was served with a side of ketchup, tartar and some green mint-like sauce which I still don't know what it is because the food runner didn't explain anything about our dishes, and the one or two times the bartender came by he didn't ask us how everything tasted or offer to explain anything. The fries were steak-fry style and decent. The fish was moist. The tartar sauce was extremely dill-forward, which isn't necessarily a bad thing.  As we were eating I couldn't help but notice the thirty or forty dish towels on the bar floor soaking up what is probably old Caesar's building plumbing faults, but speaking from experience it really is not a good time to have to bartend while you're standing in an inch of water. The management staff should really handle their plumbing issues.   The Scallops were incredible. Perfectly cooked and paired with a sweet corn sauce on the side. The succotash it was served with on the other hand tasted like something I could get in a high school cafeteria. But really, those scallops were probably some of the best I've ever had. $42 I believe for four half-dollar size bites of heaven.   Looking over the dessert menu and two older white ladies came and sat at the bar. The same bartender who had given us blase service suddenly became the most friendly and interesting individual to them, making jokes and formally introducing himself and his co-workers. We left without dessert.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster Mac
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States

thzdCZLZ-V_Iz3ahqHk3vA.text: Overall: loved it this is my second time here and it did not disappoint!   Interior: I like how you can get away with jeans and a T-shirt or a dressy top and heels if you want to dress it up a little.  Entree: Curry w/nan bread and mint yogurt dipping sauce. The meat is so tender and melts in your mouth! If the curry starts to get too intense as you keep going for more the nan bread and mint yogurt dipping sauce will help aid in relief and giving you a more refreshing note!  Desserts:   sticky toffee pudding was Amazing love the texture of the sponge  caramelized vanilla pudding w/ orange zest cookies. I enjoyed it but it was quite boring if the cookie had more orange in there maybe it would've been more exciting! I did however enjoy the creaminess of the brulee.

PdsX3xVfiEVtg_esNptE4g.text: My husband and I went to strictly check out the Sheppard's Pie because we heard it was unreal. Once again, Chef Ramsay did not disappoint! My husband and I shared it (although he could've eaten one by himself) and it was unlike any Sheppard's pie I've ever had. BLOODY DELICIOUS!!!! And hats off to Rodney!!!! He was friendly and offered information about the menu without being overbearing. He checked on us, made sure we were happy with our meal and remembered us when he saw us walking by the pub a few days later. He's a good guy who is an added bonus to any staff. Thanks Chef and thank you Rodney!

TdkUiGQR6rTh5pr_jI3QwQ.text: Enjoy the meal at Ramsay's Pub I had the fish and chips which were excellent. The Cod was cooked just right and I got fries on the side which were hot and crispy.   We sat over by the kitchen and a couple of waiters were arguing about something which I thought was very inappropriate and made me feel uncomfortable.   Aside from that I would recommend this place.

13FaDWCCdnGQ9cf0dsfAEg.text: I loved the vibe at this restaurant, laid back and casual. The interior was great and so was the food. However being a vegetarian my only option was salad according to my server but I'm glad I noticed Mac & cheese as a side and asked if I could just order that as my meal and I'm glad I did because It was delicious! Other Gordon Ramsay restaurants are more vegetarian friendly so maybe skip this one if you're a vegetarian who likes options.   Service was quick and friendly, the only thing I will say is we got quoted a ten minute wait time for our table and once it had been 20 minutes and we noticed people who came after were getting a table before us we asked about the status and they told u there was a mix up and someone else got our table. The issue was rectified right away but I would've preferred if no mix up happened in the first place.

vGiyoexeUPvNZmA8IKpmTQ.text: We had the BEST dining experience thanks to Taylor, he was very attentive, accommodating, kind and helpful! The food was phenomenal!!!! Request Taylor when coming into dine, you won't be disappointed! Thanks for an awesome experience!!

yzUbZSrLBP6U7CPHxGdEpw.text: We had a great meal at the Pub & Grill. The food was amazing! The fish and chips especially were perfect. The batter on the fish was incredible. Heather, our waitress, was awesome and efficient. She knew the menu back to front and was able to tell us about many different dishes. Overall, we had an excellent time.

ev3YYzUzkijw3JXKpsoWcQ.text: This has got to be THE best pub food in the world. Although the menu is pub based, don't let it fool you. This food is incredible. The fish and chips is a good portion size and the fish is not soggy and it is flaky and meaty. The malt vinegar is smooth. The sticky toffee desert is light and very delicious. The service was amazing. The prices are high compared to other pubs but the value is incredible. This place is worth a visit.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States

2vaAjYHq5hkMEIFT6_WgmQ.text: We had the kale chip nachos and it was so good! Love the sauce and the corned beef in it. It was served pretty quickly too! Ronnie was a great bartender too. He made sure we are satisfied customers that's why we are coming back here tomorrow for dinner! Reservation for too done!

M787hb4sPXQ4aVPFghcGIA.text: First time eating here and the food is amazing, and the service is great too! All of the staff is very nice and accommodating, and our waitress Heather took the time to help us pick out our starters and entrees which did not disappoint! We will definately be back the next time we make it to Vegas!

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Short rib!

DuW-pVCjsElmDi9HDYvtng.text: I really hate giving this place only three stars, especially since I'm a Ramsey fan but the speed of receiving your food is horrible! We waited forever and never received an apology, although I do feel that they where understaffed as our waiter seemed to be all over the place. The food here is five stars no doubt, the truffle fries are to die for. I honestly didn't even want to redeem my free Yelp pudding because of the  extra wait it would entail.

yHprocNPYt4asUPgfSDIhw.text: My husband and I had lunch at the pub on 9/25.  We were seated right away. The decor was rich, and seats were very comfortable. However our table was unsteady, my husband couldn't put his feet on the foot of the table because it was shift the table and possible knock over drinks.   Our waitress was on point, she did great recommendations and my drink never went empty. The food, was 100% delicious. Appetizers perfect size and balance to the meals. We had an egg type appetizer, it was flavorful and unique, not something you can get anywhere.        Our burgers of choice was lamb and Hell's Kitchen. I had the Hell's Kitchen burger, first of all the texture was so soft everything melted like butter in your mouth. Perfect cook, perfect amount of ingredients. The mushroom fries are also a good choice.  The best part of our meal was honestly the dessert. Best desert. The signature sticky toffee pudding left me speechless  The price in reflection of food was worth paying for. Beside the wonky table, I can not wait to try the steak house next:)

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States

HfG9RNaq2BZ9ekzWqJYFmg.text: The name Gordon Ramsay instantly evokes the thought that this place must be amazing. While its food selection is more well thought out than most generic bars and pubs for food, it's not the bomb dot com that you might expect from the big name. (Sorry Gordon! I still love watching your youtube cooking videos though).  We came here as our consolation being too late to be seated soon for Bacchanal. The menu was pretty cool with a lot of grill favorites with a unique Ramsay twist. The servers were enthusiastic about the menu and all made reasonable recommendations.   I got the lamb burger and french onion soup. The burger was pretty good I guess but the cheese really overpowered everything. As for the soup, I think it was fine as well. The cheese is good but I didn't come away from it thinking it was amazing or anything. I feel like I could find something like that on par at TGI Fridays or something.

5OOaZRCFQVGZTKdz68cXfA.text: Wish I'd read the reviews before eating here because as usual the Yelp community is right.  Gordon has taken his eye off the ball here.  The restaurant is in average condition.  The cushions in the chairs were like Granny's old house and others have the bottom mesh falling off them.  Service was excruciatingly slow. I don't mind fine dining, but this wasn't the experience.  The noise level from the casino made it difficult to hear the staff when seated up front. The food was good - nothing to blow us away as we'd hoped.  Overpriced given all over experience and expectation built from what Gordon's media brand he's built. We wouldn't return sorry to say.  The biggest surprise was the overall poor condition of the dining room furniture.

sCvZRZSJM_Me2MLSiWXCtw.text: The food here was good. I'm vegetarian so I only had one dish option. This was the veggie pie and it was really good. The toffee pudding was also really good but not many choices overall.

PtfTW242w8K2a1Izc_NRiw.text: We made a reservation for lunch...highly recommend doing that. I had the fish n chips with mashed peas. Who knew mashed peas were so delicious? Fast and friendly service? you bet! Our hostess and waitress were so friendly and accommodating. My food was so good. I'd definitely recommend visiting here. Food was a little on the pricier side but it's Vegas! You expect that.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States

rmJGSVqbHrIuWQ58mYBFeQ.text: This is one of my favorites in vegas restaurant. I got a luck to have special which include scallop appetizer, famous beef wellington and sticky toffee pudding for $80!!! It was an excellent chance to have gordon ramseys famous dishes at once

oYC1u-C91E9O9056shfEzA.text: Went for some late night dining after a great Celine Dion show. Was seated right away and ordered drinks and an appetizer. The appetizer came out pretty quick but the drinks took a while. When they did come out though, they were pretty good. Maybe not worth the almost 20 mins wait, but the atmosphere was still vibrant enough to distract us.   We got the sliders and the Goodbye Blue Sky. The sliders were really good and the arugula added a nice touch to cut through the grease. The Goodbye Blue Sky was very fresh, and the blackberries on top were a great touch and very sweet. We got both the non-alcoholic and alcoholic version. The non-alcoholic was made with ginger ale which was an upgrade from any soda why could have used. The drinks were a bit on the pricey side but this is Vegas and Gordon Ramsey's' restaurant so it makes sense.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Appetizer Sliders
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Goodbye Blue Sky (non-alcoholic on left, alcoholic on right)

JKUT3iZ7h0coi8_VceIF5g.text: We had a wonderful meal ! Service was fantastic also! Daisy our server was outstanding!!!

Hbw_k5eEHWZYbVBXp1jS5w.text: I love it here. The best gourmet burgers you will find on the strip. The shrimp and lobster burger is unique and is full of pure shrimp and lobster...not flour and additives. The chicken burger is delicious and I love their fries. And the creme brulee shake is to die for. I am a local so I come often.  The only reason for the 4 stars instead of 5 is you know coming here there will be at least a 45 minute wait. So be prepared if you go and plan ahead

xLFiqYBni6coBgy8NgcSdg.text: Loved this place. Went to have dinner here after a quick 10 year vow renewal for our friends. Delicious food and amazing service by our server. Oops forgot his name. He kept refilling our soft drinks, water and asked if we wanted more beer. Brought out all our food together and even brought us an extra dessert (yelp check-in). Wait wasn't long and the smell of the truffle intoxicating.   At first I didn't believe the portions were enough (tried ordering more food) but halfway through I was glad I didn't.

s-ypHu_vYd-s6Jzpn0Kd3w.text: We wanted Hell's Kitchen but was told it was a 6 wk wait. So we went to pub and grill a little earlier than planned dinner. I only ordered tiny bites. I had mini bacon burger sliders & lobster rolls.  The lobster rolls were not good at all. Not sure if my expectations should have been high coming from titled pub and grill. I wish I would've ordered fish and chips but $30 for fish and chips for me seemed unnecessary since I had eaten loaded fries a few hours prior. Staff was friendly, got us in quick. I drank so much water I thought I was going to pop. Maybe there will be another time.

KL9YAHKZwuRFbFjsBGAbjQ.text: Definitely not what we had our hopes up for but not a disappointment either. From watching every Ramsay show that has or has ever existed we did have high expecttations when eating at one of his places. I had the french onion soup and a plate of calimari which were both really good; husband ordered the fish and chips and was happy with them but not as good as expected. I tried those peas and I'll just say no thank you to those next time :) Staff was really professional and friendly, we sat at a 2 person table which was a bit uneven so shook with weight on one side and it was overall almost to small with drinks and plates; but had some awesome silverware.

X6P9YbHF3zGuOMmEiKiptw.text: It was good. Not phenomenal, not outstanding, just good.   We dined at Pub & Grill on a Sunday night around 6pm. The ambiance could be improved. The music was much too loud for the setting and made it feel like you were at a loud bar, versus a $250+ meal. The service was for the most part good. The two waiters we had were attentive. No complaints there.   The food was alright. We ordered prime rib, short ribs, lobster rolls, poutine, mushrooms, brussel sprouts, smores shake and the famous sticky toffee pudding. The real stand outs were the desserts. Comparing Pub & Grill to GR's other restaurants, I feel there is much tastier food at Steak and Burgr. This was a comp'd meal for us, and I'm happy we didn't use much of our own money to pay for it.

F0uSJ8kjRkEOyJm26UNXtQ.text: Mediocre at best. Stopped by for happy hour, and the food was not good. I've had better bar food at the pub/bar around the corner from my house. The beer glasses weren't even frothy, and the beers on tap that arrived weren't even cold. Would not recommend, you're better off going to someone off the strip.

b-dMjXm_k4EmuncIkWgllQ.text: Christian and Juice rock the bar!!!  Friendly, knowledgeable and fun.  Highly recommend.

e9miiBkf5bv9CTqbM2z-Og.text: The ambience is perfect- a nice mix of old and modern. The food portions Are generous and flavor profile is on point. The fish and chips I got were amazing. My husband got the bangs gets and mash which was equally awesome! The service is friendly and attentive. Definately will return next time we are in Vegas.

RwtOJIwhr4BWXlS-m3h2IA.text: Short rib and beef cheek sandwich pretty delicious. Not $24 delicious but def still tasty  I would say all in all a good experience with a nice hefty Vegas price tag to go with some scrumptious pub food

WKxCg_7AFQYW9WwmKdNVPg.text: Service was meh....I can't imagine people get anything other than fish and chips because it smelled like fish everywhere wafting into Caesars Palace casino. We had a table looking into the casino which was kinda cool to people watch.  They bring fresh rye bread and pretzel sticks to the table with a cheese dipping sauce. I was disappointed in the sauce due to some sort of horseradish taste to it. I didnt even really get to taste them because before you knew it the food was out at the table.   Ordered fish and chips..you definitely get a good portion of fish which I thought was good.T he potatoes were ok . I prefer smaller fries these were 4 giant ones with a little parm on em. Again all dipping sauces included horseradish. YUCK!    Overall not too impressed ..lets hope the new chef who wins hells kitchen can help. LOL

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fish n chips

Eiql3EZmXSXmvsItsoHs3w.text: I wanted to eat here for some time...but omg that a bad experience. The food was cold, and the service was bad. The NY steak was just cook bad without salt and my wife's fish was cold...never coming back

EVIKCpcP2V-hVL_Zkwdp3A.text: Ate here twice over the last weekend, the second time with a group of friends.   On the first visit I had the Ramsay's Tonic (a decent drink, but a hefty $15 price tag), and the Shepherds Pie. The Shepherds pie was delicious.   For the second meal a friend and I shared the meat plate, which was pretty tasty, just enough for a two person appetizer. I had the bangers and mash, and he had the chicken. The bangers and mash were ok, the gravy was pretty delicious, and fortunately not over-salted. My friend liked the Chicken but didn't finish it. Several other friends showed up and all had the NY steak, which none of them were particularly fond of.   My friend and I had two drinks each, the meat plate, and the two entrees. The total was $141.00...OUCH.  Service was decent both times, but the food is just too expensive to justify eating here. It just wasn't that good. If I'm in Caesars again I'll be eating at MESA for these prices.

inWkwzTQwhZXRLLgYTi-uA.text: The place was a disappointment. The restaurant was very busy and the tables were crammed in too close. I kept getting my chair bumped by customers and waiters.   I started with the English onion soup. It needed salt. Badly!  On the waiters suggestion I got the butter chicken. It was ok, but lacked flavor. The chunks of chicken thighs in it were kind of big and stringy.   My companions had burgers, which were average. You can't really screw those up too bad.   The best thing that we ate were the fries. I'm a French fry snob and am very picky. These fries were great!

s-hkM3H6m2ILGgus5vpzPQ.text: Was so excited to come here as I am a huge fan of Gordon Ramsay. The food was marginal to say the least. Had the Lobster Mac n Cheese and French Onion soup. Both were tasteless and disappointing. I really hope that he reads these as his name is on the restaurant.

mCYKZD-BqcVtSaxz9eWqsQ.text: The food was quality, but overpriced... you are paying for the Gordon Ramsay name and the prime location right in the middle of Caesar's Palace (directly across from the Colosseum). $30 for fish and chips, ha! And as others have said, the service can be slow.  However, there were some positives. I made a reservation via Open Table directly from Yelp for 10 pm for after the Elton John show at the Colosseum. We arrived at 9:30 and were seated right away, even though there was currently an hour wait for the person in front of us. Definitely make a reservation if you plan on going.  As as others have said... OMG the sticky pudding! It is a must, one of the best desserts I have ever eaten. Definitely share with others to avoid sugar overload, just a few bites is enough lol.  If you want to experience a Gordon Ramsay restaurant, go to Burgr at Planet Hollywood. I haven't tried Steak at Paris yet, still trying to justify their prices for a single meal lol.

UUPghsWc4wI9wK8r3_G7WA.text: Sent back 2 burgers both overcooked and dry ,.really just a huge let down. WAS EXPECTING  more . Sad part is i haven't been eating red meat  for quite a few months and then when I want to cheat and get this crap. Sucks big time

PXsk5El7ePxg2T2TQ1ZzfQ.text: Extremely delicious and amazing service! We came on a late Saturday afternoon and were seated right away. The food was very delicious, especially the Hell's Kitchen Burger! I highly recommend it! Though, even more amazing then the food was our spectacular server Rodney. He was so friendly and approachable from the minute he greeted us. He was extremely knowledgeable about the menu and made sure and possible questions we had were answered before we even had to ask! The staff was attentive and very efficient. I highly recommend this place...especially if you get to sit in Rodney's section!!

dKl_5gOnwaaCIX6pKwR7jA.text: I give it a 4. I probably give it 1 star higher because Gordon Ramsay is awesome and my wife and I are huge fans. However, i did expect a little better. . Don't get me wrong, i got the Hell's Kitchen burger and it was good-it just wasn't super spectacular as i would imagine Ramsay's restaurants to be.   I guess what hurt it was a few things. . .the portions are small. the prices were high but i was able to expense it through my company. . . it felt rather cramped inside. . . my server was kind of rude. .. . the other server that was helping other people around me was MUCHH nicer. .   the Pros were : cool decor, the other server actually came to talk to me as well and was very cool to talk to, the food was good. .    i think i'd go again, if not for a break from the huge feasts at the buffets in LV

R8HFtiMnlNy588W4ck6_8w.text: Really pleasant surprise.  We were a little concerned with the 3 star rating to even stop in. We decided to chance it though and were glad we did.  We shared the chopped salad, the tomato soup and the nachos.  The short rib on the chips was awesome, and the soup was really tasty as well.  We sat at the bar and I have to say Ray Ray was one of the nicest most genuine people we have come across in Vegas.  Total asset to the restaurant.  We are so pleased we stopped in. It is a bit pricey,  but not unreasonably so and the quality was there to back it up.  Ignore 3 star rating which I think is because some folks are hoping for food court pricing.  This is a fun, tasty experience.  We will be back.

C9UCuR8Hjf3MVGsLQFt93g.text: Love many of the celebrity chef restaurants in Vegas and Gordon's Pub and Grill did not disappoint, especially the sticky bread pudding for dessert.  Had fish and chips and portions were perfect as well.  The service was quick and attentive. Definitely will return.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States

WHRArfhaC5wVbLcLga4I_w.text: I expected more, I guess? Not really a fan of Gordon Ramsey but I was curious to try his food. I had the lamb burger, it was ok, I've had better. We had lobster rolls as appetizers and it was ok as well, they added a lot of chives and overtook the lobster. My husband had the fish and chips, it was good. I wouldn't go back though? I've tried it out and I'm Good after this. There's a lot more places to try.

Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bar
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fish and chips

Pnifrabhp4_9pO9QajWxrg.text: I had had a negative experience here that I posted in August of 2014 and, was completely impressed with their response to it. The GM contacted me to apologize, explained that he would be working with his staff to rectify my complaints and, offered to have me come back so he could  make my next experience a better one. I was taken a back and thoroughly impressed by this; it says a lot about this business and how they represent themselves.   Almost 6 months since my contact with the GM, I reached out to see if the offer was still on the table. And on March 28 I had an amazing 40th birthday filled with great friends, incredible food, wonderful sevice and a restored, impressive experience at Gordon Ramsey's Pub & Grille! I went with no expectations and told my friends they might send out a special appetizer or dessert, but they went above and beyond my/our expectations! Our server talked about the menu and  answered our questions expertly, the drinks were delicious,  the appetizers and main cooarse were incredible (I suggest the lamb burger!!!!), and the dessert was UNBELIEVABLE; sticky toffee pudding with one of the most delicious house made caramel sauces all of us had ever had! Then to top off our experience we got to meet the winner of Last Year's Hell's Kitchen, Scott Commings! I'm embarrassed  to say I cried, I was so over joyed!  Aside, from all the generous things done for us, I have to say I cannot wait to go back to Gordon Ramsay's Pub & Grille the next time I'm in Vegas. It truly is a great restaurant with traditional pub food that is made expertly with a presentation that sets them apart from many restaurants. You can tell they take pride in every thing they send out. I highly recommend you visiting this restaurant when you are in Vegas, and don't forget to get the on tap Guiness and sticky toffee pudding with house made caramel sauce!

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Scott Commings!
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Amazing lamb burger!
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pistachio crusted chicken sandwich!

5c3YRrm7CsGUUrvdQKyeiQ.text: 4 stars mostly due to the cocktails and beer selection at this Pub.   I am not sure if Chef Gordon realizes what he has going behind the bar but between Adam Rains (also the beverage editor of Las Vegas Food and Beverage Professional magazine) Adam O'Donnell (Voted best bartender in Vegas by Vegas Seven and Bols Bartending Academy) Raul Faria (Host and creator of Mixology Made Simple), Ray Ray, Gene and a few others, this "pub" has created a great cocktail program.   While I have had the pleasure of being served by almost everyone above, I have had the most experience with Adam Rains including on this most recent trip.  Adam is one of the most knowledgeable people I have ever met when it comes to cocktails and spirits in general AND food. I have a feeling that if he had chosen to be a chef he would have been as equally skilled as he is with spirits.  He has a collection of house made infusions and bitters that he uses as tools to create some very unique, next level cocktails but can also make you one of the best classic cocktails you've ever tasted as well. I had one or two cocktails listed on the menu but I was entirely comfortable just asking Adam to shoot from the hip and make me something unique. Every cocktail was a success. I did have the "God Save the Queen" off the menu and it was pretty tasty, everything else was a Rains original I believe. I go here for the cocktails, the food is secondary to me but I have never had a bad experience.   That being said, I have never had anything bad here, it's just everything seems so heavy. I know I know English Pub fare. I'm not flaming the food but we normally just get smaller plates throughout the course of the night at multiple restaurants and would like to see lighter options other than salad. They did  add a couple of lighter option since my last trip, the lobster roll being one of them. It was delicious, light, sweet, savory, one of the best lobster rolls I've had. We also had the wings which were wings and the pub sliders that were pretty good although we were sad to see that they changed the recipe for their deviled eggs though. The last incarnation were the best deviled eggs I've ever eaten.   In the end, it's a great place to grab an early cocktail and a snack as they open at 11am and while I have never had anything truly amazing off the food menu it's definitely worth a stop if you want to try a Ramsay property without spending an arm and a leg or if you want to have an amazing cocktail.

BykRdcxGywNAbI7TAJklnA.text: I ate the steak pie and it was amazing, I ate all of it and my bartender Ronnie was really friendly and offered me a tasting of the wine I was having. He then let me know about the yelp check in and asked a manager to come by to place a free dessert in for me. The manager Bill came over and was smiling and very welcoming. This place is so great and the food is yummy! Dave was cool too. Funny guy.

0znzpVrYDuxtp7W4Dgk4lw.text: Came here after all the hype and was disappointed. Our server never came back to our table to check on us and the fries were overdone. $5 for a glass of soda and because they never came back to the table, never got a refill to make it worth while getting a drink other than warm water. Had to complain to management and they finally brought the check at which time we waited another 10 minutes before the manager came back and took it. The manager was very helpful and a very nice guy. Expected more from Gordon ramsay after he nicks other restaurants for the same things.. The Shepard pie was delicious and very filling..

z5C4GtLZg3TqRZiugqddEg.text: Was gambling with friends and we all wanted to take a break and just relax with some beers.  We were next to GR Pub & Grill, and they had a decent enough beer selection.    I was hungry, so we ordered calamari and a salad for the table to snack on and I ordered the lamb burger.  The calamari and salad were just average and nothing to write home about.  But the lamb burger was fantastic.  The meat just juicy and savory, with just the right amount of gaminess to remind you that you are not eating a basic burger.  The goat cheese melded really well with the burger as well.  The french fries were thin and dull, and got cold pretty quick.    So the lamb burger is a 4.5 star meal, while everything else was 2 stars, so I ended up giving the place 3 stars.  I was also disappointed that the lunch menu only had about 4 sandwich options.

r8P3GqY7U0RmvtG9bq0Jbw.text: This place used to be one of our favorite restaurants, but recently it has taken a horrible dive. They don't serve the pork belly anymore (which used to be incredible), the service is now AWEFUL, and the food is borderline edible in some cases (I'm not joking - out of 6 of us eating only one of us found our food acceptable).  It was so terrible, that I will never step foot in one of Ramsay's restaurants again. You can be a jerk on your show if you are amazing, but Gordon - your restaurant sucks. Knock off the act, quit selling out, and fix your terrible restaurants and the associated business model.

EJbxvRAMl4dMjGkURwazwA.text: The service is amazing. I had a party of five.  We first got pork belly, lobster rolls, jumbo shrimp cocktail. And tomato soup. All of thr apps were gone. Secound course took a little bit long to come to the table. Worth the wait. Fo salmon dish. Braised short ribs. Airline chicken and a bacon burger. And yet again everyone clean the plate. Then for deserts we got mum apple tart, toffee pudding, chocolate trifle and vinalle pudding. Yet again clean plates

OzUQ21-EBV3t4YYWA4qOew.text: The food was great, no complaints.  $11+ for Boddington's draft seems to be out of line, even if I'm paying for a namesake like Gordon

2W62x_B2zWYvzaRkR2tjDg.text: A Gordon Ramsay restaurant never disappoints. Loved the burger and shake, will be back!!

s31hfvDfyBDijFVU-Rpctw.text: Good food good service good tv good water water was wet very good food plates were clean and Gordon Ramsey owns the place so it's good

gOsJheqP10QXReOlhLpFDQ.text: Let me start by saying that I love Gordon Ramsay.  Hell's Kitchen is still one of my favorite reality shows and his steakhouse in Paris (the casino) is one of my absolute favorite restaurants anywhere in the world.  All that said, I was woefully unimpressed with his Pub & Grill in Caesar's.   Given that we love GR, this was initially an easy pick for lunch after it opened in Caesar's.  The menu looked promising, and if it is GR, it has to be good, right?  Sadly, no.  Not even close.     The wife went with the Yorkshire Ale Batter Fish & Chips w/ Mushy Peas ($30) and got a single, small, bland fish patty and what seemed like frozen french fries.  The peas were cold and off-putting in both flavor and texture.  All for the bargain price of $30.  Gotta love Vegas, right?   I ordered the Chicken, Kale, and Bacon Pot Pie ($24) and honestly believe that I've had better chicken pot pie from Marie Callender for 1/4 the price.  There were actually more vegetables than chicken, and it needed salt.  The pastry was dry and flaky, not the least bit buttery, and didn't do much to compensate for the lack of flavor in this dish.  I am so disappointed...even still.  C'mon, GR; you are better than this!   The main thing that salvaged a 2 Star rating was the service and the ambiance.  Our waitress was super fun and really made it feel like we were in a pub in London.  Other than that, and the wishful HOPE that a GR establishment can't possibly be this bad back-to-back, I likely won't give this place another shot...there are, literally, hundreds of other options in Vegas.

A_3IauQO3TJ_LPkhIHvGKA.text: I never really give places two starts, but with here i went in with very high expectations and was completely disappointed. I'm a huge Gordon Ramsey fan iv seen all of his shows, I watch all his YouTube food tutorials, so of course i was so excited to finally eat at one of his restaurants. When we first arrived we were seated immediately which was nice the hostess though did have some what of an attitude which was already a bad start to the experience. It took about 5 minutes then the bus boy came over and served us some waters. About another five or so minutes the waitress finally came around. She recommend appetizers and told us what entrees were the most popular which was nice she was also very friendly.  We ordered the pigs in a blanket for the appetizer. As for the entrees I ordered the 14oz rib eye medium rare with a side of cream of spinach. My boyfriend ordered what was recommend by the waitress which was the shepherds pie, and our friend ordered the braised brisket i believe is what it was called it was also recommended. The appetizer took probably around 30 minutes to come out, it came out about 2 min before our entrees came out. I will say the appetizer was pretty tasty it only came with 3 pieces though so one for every person. When our entrees came out the presentation was pretty good so i was excited to taste mine and everyone's at the table. My steak was cooked perfect and the flavor  was spot on no complaints on the steak. As for the cream of spinach it was okay i felt it lacked a lot of flavor. I'm not a fan of lamb but i did try the shepherds pie it was okay i definitely expected a lot better because it was so highly recommended. As for the braised beef that was probably the worst one it had absolutely no flavor almost tasted as if it was just boiled in plain water. Overall it was just a big disappointment especially for the price we paid i expect a lot better for high end food. I will say the desert we ordered i'm not sure the name but it was by far one of the best things iv ever tasted ever i would return here again only to eat that desert again it was amazing. This was also my birthday dinner so again it was just a horrible way to end our trip to Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Best desert iv ever tasted!
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Braised beef with potato mash
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 14oz rib eye with cream of spinach

SyCI1XgHZuNrOl4IDv9REg.text: We waited 30 minutes to get a drink. When we were finally seated we were told the pub was for dinner only and they were too busy to give us drinks. When we checked in we clearly stated we wanted just drinks. The waitress was horrible, I've never seen such a trashy and rude person in my entire restaurant career, even in the shadier parts of Las Vegas.  Stay away from Ramsay's pub, the idiotic wait staff and hostesses can't wrap their little brains around pouring a beer.

dKSxAviFc0RlI-ZT6g666w.text: I don't like posting negative reviews because I believe the majority of what goes into the culinary arts is subjective since it's weighted so heavily on taste, but my experience here warranted it. We dined here Tuesday night I believe, I ordered the oven-roasted Scottish Salmon with a side of mashed potatoes and my husband ordered the grilled lamb burger. Unfortunately, there was no real flavour in my salmon dish, and the lamb burger came with a block of goat cheese which just dwarfed any other flavors the lamb burger may have had. I'm no expert, but that seems like such an amateur mistake to make, not knowing how to balance flavors.   In addition to that, service was incredibly slow although they did try to make up for this by getting another waiter to get us started with drinks. As an aside, the tap water that they eventually brought to our table had an odd taste. Initially I figured maybe that was what tap water tastes like in Nevada so I didn't think I had cause for complaint, but after a more pleasant experience at another restaurant in Caesar's Palace, I know that this clearly isn't the case.  Calling this place overpriced would be an understatement and what we ordered was so devoid of flavor that this whole experience can, at best, be summed up as spectacularly underwhelming.  I left the restaurant supremely annoyed at the less-than-average dining experience offered at such premium prices. Certainly not worth the 70 bucks for two that they charged, in my opinion.

Pzw44Hw8UnuWiyD2YcEsuQ.text: Stopped in here on a whim! Friendly, laid back atmosphere. Our waitress was EXCELLENT, and our food and drinks were delicious!! Best salmon Ive ever had and my husband LOVED his food too! We can't wait to go back!

J8nDWQ9TC8ohiJ0Cnal_kw.text: Most amazing experience I have ever had!! Not sure what everyones trip is on here. Please don't listen to them they are clearly crazy, dumb and have no pallet or taste buds. #peoplejustlovetocomplainaboutanything  So, don't listen to these looser on here please! The atmosphere was wonderful. The service was incredible! I felt spoiled! Also, the flavor of my food was fantastic! I don't even like tomatoes and I loved my tomato! The lettuce and tomato was so crisp and fresh. The meat itself was flavored perfectly! The music was perfect too. They bent over backwards for us here. I felt like a celebrity. This was the best birthday dinner ever! My food was hot and prompt!! My drinks were always filled and my server sarah my love, omgsh she was a doll! Best service! ( Coming from a server for 17 years) I loved how they put the napkin in your lap, to the to go containers that are beautiful! I wish this restaurant was in so cal! Thank you for a wonderful experience for my first time. I went in thinking highly of this restaurant because I love Gordon Ramsay. And it was beyond better then I imagined!!!! Me and my family are still talking about it and blown away by it all still! Outstanding!!

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Super hot sticky toffee pudding. Party in your mouth!
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cute to go bags

FanNDFDzS5nQqJvReq8sgA.text: I really loved the service Heather gave us, and the food was so good! I got the bacon burger, but the lamb burger is where it's at. Also recommend the truffle fries. It's open seating outlooking Caesars casino. No complaints here

naXstux7FYYo7aI-qc84nA.text: Hit and Miss  My experience had  ups and downs. The decor is cool, the waiter was awesome and the beef Wellington was fantastic (probably not $55 fantastic, but hey it's Vegas).   On the downside: the calamari was tiny and insubstantial, the deviled eggs unimpressive, but the biggest disappointment was the chicken curry dish. If G. Ramsey were to go into one of his Restaurant nightmare charity cases and be served that dish he would have unleashed an expletive laden tirade and screamed, "take it away," all the while going through his retching and gagging histrionics. It doesn't taste bad, it just doesn't taste at all! Unbelievable that anything so devoid of flavor could stay on a menu.   Stick with a Wellington and a glass of Red. You will be full and broke, but not disappointed.

Ch9F63upJfoMebLqAK1g_g.text: Dining at Gordon Ramsey P&B was not just a delicious but also a diving dining experience. With perfectly cooked ribeye steak, salmon, and lamb burger, complimented by a love waiter named Chris P., I had an epiphany of flavorful hospitality that changed my dining life. I want to thank Chris P. Especially for checking in regularly and making sure we had what we needed to craft a wonderful evening, thank you.

JmL_r5j0Wo6rF_1p1R7rkA.text: We came in with no expectations looking for some pub food and drinks.  The service was great.  We got The Dublin Corned Beef Brisket Sandwich and a Fish and Chips - both were excellent.  And as a bonus they had Dogfish 120 Minute IPA, which is a rare find on the West Coast (but I'm sure it will be gone by the time you read this).

lRIyBXPV-WpsWUvDthOvgg.text: Summary:. GO HERE ANYTIME IN VEGAS - Best staff I've encountered, got to meet a celebrity chef, coolest most fun/down to earth vibe in Vegas, and killer food!  I checked out Pub on Thursday for my first Gordon Ramsey dining experience.  We sat down and had Heather as our waitress (and she was amazing!) I asked about Hells Kitchen and Heather told me that one of the former contestants worked there and was there working that night.  Heather went above and beyond and arranged for us to meet Kristin (how cool!!) Kristin comes out to the table and talks to us for a bit and then takes pictures with us!  Everyone was so amazing and helpful all night.   I didn't even mention the food and drinks yet! So there were four of us there and we weren't super hungry so we decided to go for a few different shared plates.  We started out with the nachos - I was thinking "how good can nachos be, and what kind of special twist can you put on nachos..." But at Pub they were amazing - the chips were a different twist and really brought it all together!  Then we had the pigs and a blanket which were hands down the best pigs and a blanket I've ever had!  I want to talk about all of the food I had but it was all just to amazing!  We split a birthday shake at the end which was a great end to a great trip.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. One of the highlights of my Vegas trip! Getting to meet Chef Kristin from Hells Kitchen!!

NtxAHQiqC9BHV4IdwPn5SQ.text: This is a great place to get a quality meal coupled with great service.  I recommend you stop here the next time you are in Vegas.

Gv1BalwKNakXOUBTjIn6yQ.text: Great service at this restaurant. I was in Vegas for a work event and was sitting at the bar by myself. Their bar tender was so attentive and friendly. Recommended the beef Wellington. It was delicious! I loved it and it was a great experience.

1s7edoVbCp4755751_nBhQ.text: This is actually a 3.5 Star Review (come on Yelp you really need to expand our scoring options these days).  I had to choose between rounding down to 3 or up to 4 but I used my city-judging tie breaker and gave them a 4.  I've had my heart set on coming here for a while.  Then I started reading the recent reviews and few had something positive to say. However, I really wanted to judge for myself and give a fair assessment.   All thing a considered during the experience, here is how I landed at 3:  - Upon arriving, greeted by 3 possibly unhappy hostesses? 0 smiles given and a very bland "enjoy your meal" after seating us.    - Hospitality - 0 points - It's non-existent from the entire staff, which I would be making a much bigger deal out of if not for the fact that this is A: A Gordon Ramsay Establishment and well, hospitality isn't his M.O. and B: It's still Vegas where money and beauty trump all other things.    Food - We didn't eat anything bad.  But only the Chicken, Kale and Bacon pot pie stood out as a "wow" item.  Portions are small and it's kind of ridiculous when you consider the cuisine.  I'll pay $12 for truffle fries but you should be able to share them, not ration out a few fries to a table of 4.  Last I checked a 50 pound bag of potatoes was still $11.  Prices - this goes against everything I believe in but I'm going to go ahead and complain about it.  $30 for Fish N Chips Gordon? No one at the table even ordered them and I'm pissed off about this.  Again, noting that the portion on it is barely enough to feed 1 person and you're using Cod, not an expensive fish.    Service - not to be confused with hospitality, which there was none of....they do the job they need to do.  Water was always full, appetizers and entrees came out quickly, no mistakes on the orders.  Our server made no attempt to enhance the experience though.  Made no suggestions, didn't offer dessert which is a shame since I had already picked out what I would have 2 weeks prior and was pretty excited.    Atmosphere - It's a beautiful pub and very swanky.  Being located in Caesars Palace kind of makes that a requirement.  There are certainly a hundred much better options on the Strip but it doesn't mean you shouldn't try this place.  Just taper your expectations and be willing to overpay for what you get.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Maine Lobster and Shrimp Roll Minis were good, but not amongst the best I&#39;ve had and at $18 you expect more than 3oz of meat.

5hthV-K4PnuO1zqG5Yr1_Q.text: Stopped in here for lunch with high expectations considering it's a Gordon Ramsey restaurant. The decor of the restaurant was interesting and my server at the bar was really great.   Unfortunately, the food was horrible. I got the chopped salad and it tasted like something you can get prepackaged at a hospital cafeteria. The lettuce was not fresh-it was wilted under a great deal of dressing. There was one piece of shrimp and 3 cubes of chicken. The meat was definitely not freshly grilled. The croutons were a disappointment as well (all three of them). The salad looked like it was made a week ago. I didn't finish it. And what's worse is how expensive the meal was.   With so many choices of restaurants in Vegas, I would think they would step up their game.

zk0C70ldLg48BY7OASf0LQ.text: Best Irish coffee! Juice and Ramone are awesome!   Great place to watch Sunday football games. Food is good and you can see every tv in the place!

_KXfsF3Ud61pOjs1vuHSLA.text: I don't understand the hype to this place.. Food quality was below average but everything is ridiculously expensive.. I did not mind paying higher price for the food, but super disappointed with food quality.. Probably you can get a better quality food in any casino buffet. This is the place to go if you are full and just want to show off that you ate at Gordon Ramsey's!!

VrBkm8ZzV0HpYFHR--HdTw.text: One of my favourite spots in Vegas! This is a great stop for delicious food that won't break the bank. I admit I first visited because of Gordon Ramsay (who wouldn't? :), but the food is tasty! I've had pub appetizers one visit, and then the salmon for dinner on another - no disappointment here. If you're at a conference at Caesars (like I was), definitely add this in to your lunch repertoire!

uYaxGNN2By_7rUcF07QHcw.text: We stopped in to enjoy a quick happy hour before heading to the airport.   I'm a bit torn on this one.  It was good but nothing special.  We had the bacon wrapped dates and soft pretzels with our pints. The atmosphere is okay, the service is okay, most things were just okay. The dates and pints were the best part of our visit.

pYKZ8Gf6PjLrfKEtzgD20A.text: Food is not that good and way over priced. Fish and Chips $30 for 2 pieces of fish. Fish was runny. Service is horrible.

RlR7L3Px8zfpVnfkLNn5gw.text: Went here with a group of 8 and meal was so so, service was terrible. We saw our waitress twice. Once to order our drinks and meal at the same time (we had enough time to look over both since she didn't come to our table to take our drink order for 20 minutes), and another when we got our bill. The drinks and meals were delivered by runners. We came here an hour before they closed on a Friday night. I had the Fish and Chips paired with an Innis & Gunn, which the menu noted as Ramsay's favorite. I really didn't think it was anything mind blowing. I have been to Burgr (also owned by Ramsay) and I LOVED it. I would probably not eat here again or recommend it only because I expected so much more because of the name attached.

MWR2ov8I3nyw43PX9fjbvg.text: If your going here to get a burger save your money u can get a better burger from Red Robbin  hands down

uQgThi5rA1OgtPhieP_u9w.text: Had the beef and vegetable pot pie and spotted dic for dessert. It was so amazing. I would eat here every day If I could!!!

jdjKclRMDsx28Te1WbTnBA.text: ordered the corn beef sandwich. it was more like a grilled cheese sandwich.  took my group forever to get my food and it was dead.  overpriced and overrated. Gordon you need to do something about this mis managed shot out spot.  woulda rather went to mc donalds. your doing real bad gordon real bad.

B1Hbhl4sOMtKUcyS7suPow.text: High expectations, sadly disappointing. After an hour of waiting for our meal, we flagged down our waiter and inquired as to how much longer until service. He had no immediate answer and appeared to be indifferent.  When our meal was finally delivered, mine was cold and dry. A second attempt did not fair much better. My money and time would have been better spent at the food court. Gordon Ramsey has a brand, and that brand was not represented well. We got our table at 9 pm and did not finish until 1 am. It is a waist of money and time,

fcBoRqahzSJiKN019uFtIg.text: Not really very authentic if you are English. Fish and chips are ok but not great

Ldb9DEAKDJGJvSggFA8q3w.text: I had a quick lunch (the lamb burger was fantastic) and I had perhaps the best service I've ever had. David S. was phenomenon! He even came over with a stool so that my purse wasn't on the ground. Amazing lunch! Thank you!

AxzAPvgHVxDkqNlRGu2ljg.text: Absolutey excellent food! The warm pretzel appetizer is great. Nice selection of beer. Everything is fresh, it's a great environment! Love it!!

kecyhHHwWCBQ6TR41AUgOg.text: Food was good. Service excellent, friendly and responsive.   But if you're English you'd be disappointed if you ordered an English meal because it doesn't taste the same. It's good but just not the same. I ordered bangers and mash and the sausages are not near what english sausages taste like. I also had the Scotch egg and had sticky date pudding for dessert - both were very nice and worth the price - again just not the same.  So in summary excellent menu unless you're an English person looking for a bit if the old country.  One more thing I sat at a table with high back chairs. The chairs were comfortable but it feels too low compared to the height of the table.

6FMlNsQibRr4DFd8Cjpp1A.text: We came in to watch the a Raider game and when we were seated we asked if we could change the channel to watch the game. They changed our tv just for us. Awesome service and very friendly staff. MJ our server was awesome..the food was awesome. Loved the calamari and the wedge salad..Michelle the manager came over to talk with us and she was super friendly and helpful. Coming back every time we are in town.

XbnnvtAwj9XiLlJ3zMhYHA.text: I went here last month for a Valentine's dinner with my husband. The ambience is very british. The service was great. We had to ask for a table in front of a TV so that we can watch a basketball game while we eat dinner. They were very cooperative and sat us after about 10 minute wait which we didn't mind at all. Their bread selection was very good but their french onion soup was very very salty. I understand they are supposed to be served a bit salty, but wow. it was really salty. I enjoyed my fish and chips while my husband drooled over his beef stew. The beef stew is really soft and it'll literally melt in your mouth. Bread pudding is good but it was a flavor I expected. But overall, we enjoyed our dinner. They have great beer selection. Decent price level for it being a restaurant inside a strip hotel.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beef cheek stew
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Duck&amp;Pork appetizer
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Toffee pudding dessert!

fTTUh3g_k2E5C32sObIpLw.text: My group and I made reservations the day before to eat at the Pub and Grill during a lunch break the following day. We arrive to find that our table was given to someone else without a reservation. The hostess gave us an attitude the entire time. Other parties were being seated while we had to wait. We were placed at a low table. We asked for a different table and got attitude again. We stated that a member of our party was pregnant and couldn't even eat comfortably. That is why we made the reservation. We finally got a high table. Hostess kept giving us the stink eye. A member of our party ordered the bacon burger medium well. It was more like raw. It was sent back. Another table sent their burger back for the same reason. I will never return. Bad service and raw burgers = no return service

1WOQ34r1qc9Tteh3yLvbmg.text: This place is very expensive at practicaly 30$ a plate. I ordered the scallops which had no flavor. The portions were small. I ordered a side salad with my meal which would have been alright if they wouldnt have drenched it in lemon juice which was pratically unedible. The service was horrible they left 2 dishes that my family had ordered in the kitchen until we told them they forgot our food. Im personally very dissapointed and personally would never return.

zzd9BlE1gR7jHoLQ_UrTMA.text: OMG.  I've eaten authentic British Pub food, and let me tell you, Chef Gordon Ramsey does not disappoint.  I had the fish and chips which was phenomenal!  My girlfriend had the Corn beef sandwich,  which was definitely the best either of us had ever had. Awesome. Just awesome. Come one,  come all!!!

b7OFty_kmAg5zVhlPhmZPg.text: Food was good staff is friendly but I think pricing is way to high for pub food.

MjOQ3zhbU-kuASWamtOZtA.text: Food was great! Very rich onion soup. However, the high top table seating is the worst! The padding on the stools really sunk in making it hard to sit up straight, not to mention the rungs on that stool were pretty far down so your feet dangle. Very uncomfortable!  Made most of our party miserable. As I said though, food was great! Would come back if we could get a low table.

Q1YkZKIEjA5jUCnvVhFkow.text: Come on - Gordon Ramsay not being good? I don't know how that would be possible.  Now to be fair - this is pub-style food, True to British form, so don't go expecting Americanized flavor-overload. That being said, the flavors were like simple taken up a notch and the spotted dic pudding was fabulous!!! Divine. Best. Ever. If I'm in Vegas again, I'd jump at the chance to eat here again!

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spotted dic bread pudding. To die for!
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mini pub burgers with bacon.

ndB3lvbLEy2QAEGvlN30wg.text: Great bar service! Good drinks and a decent happy hour! Keith at the bar is awesome!!

8-Ve0qQo6MEhdjFvzQkZnA.text: Great happy hour.  Don't miss it at the bar.  The wing sauce has the perfect flavor balance with the right amount of heat. Even when it's super busy like it is now the bar staff still has time to keep smiling and make small talk.  Maybe our favorite place at the casino.

YX1d_WFecPDTFG6QlYATsA.text: Please note:  I am a huge Gordon Ramsay fan. I decided to check out his restaurants to see whether they meet the standards he professes. I think they exceed!  1. Sevice: This is the second of his restaurants I've visited. When I returned for a second go the waitstaff remembered me by name! :-)  They are all wonderfully entertaining and attentive gentlemen! I advocate eating at the bar.  They are talented, too! Describe the flavors you're craving and voila they will make or recommend something delicious.  2. Food: Need I even comment given my caveat? I have had the: Scotch egg, heirloom carrots, Queen Vic Curry crisps & the chocolate triffle.    The heirloom vegetables are amazing, savory and just the right texture.  No floppy, flaccid carrots here!  The triffle is a snowballing surprise.  It is like consuming a chocolate cloud.  The tiny cookies served beside it hold multiple mysteries themselves.  As you can see I did not try an entree. I must share that a side and appetizer or a side and a dessert are plenty filling.  Plus,  I'd already been to BurGR so I wanted to try things that were new to me.    3. Ambiance: Fun and relaxed even on busy evenings. I don't think any sourpusses are allowed in here! Furthermore, I found myself seated beside Englishmen who were endorsing my selections.    Any future Las Vegas trips will include a visit here!

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chocolate Triffle!!!

tfbVDQ0VQy0iNMazOyKCtw.text: Stopped in for drinks and end up having dinner.  We sat up at the bar and had wonderful service, the atmosphere was great and our drinks and food was awesome.  I had the grilled pub burger that to me was the best burger I have had in a while.  My husband had the fish n chips and he said they were really good.  I will certainly go again.  Our bartender was friendly and very attentive.  The Ramsay signature drink if you like cucumber and gin was the bomb.

dc0y0IB5_W1hbqlP_6u34g.text: We called ahead to make reservations around 8 on a Friday night. The soonest available table for 6 people was 9:15 pm.  It was a bit too late for the two little ones so we showed up early in hopes there might be a table.  They offered to seat us in the bar area up front but later on when I passed by the main dining room on the way to the restroom, I saw tons of empty tables. :/ The bar seating is fine for grown ups but tough for little ones due to the height & no backs.  Service was great here. Food was okay. It is pub food & not meant to be high end frou frou. I tried Ramsay's high end restaurant in Hollywood thanks to DineLA. I LOVED the food there.  I got the Hangar steak with fries here at the pub but thought the steak was under seasoned (for my taste). But it had great beef flavor & was tender. Fries were ok.  I tried a bite of our friend's fish of his fish & chips (the fries that came with the burger at our table & my steak were all the same.) While the fish was not super moist, the batter was amazing. I'd get the fish & chips were I ever to return. They give you a lot of food with this plate!  Overall, the food is simple but for the price, lacked a little something....extra. I guess you're just paying for the name Gordon Ramsay.  One other thing to note....this is more a Harrah's thing than Ramsay's thing but photographers go around & take pictures of your table & then mildly try to pressure you to purchase the pictures after they print them. What's funny is they photoshop a picture of a pixie sized Ramsay standing on your table. A bit odd!

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hangar steak &amp; British style chips

v2oB_mlAUMwDY1LGxtPNhQ.text: After dinner...also at at Caesar's shopping forum....we decided to have some more wine and a snack to go with it. We stumbled across this place on our way to the casino and decided to give it a shot since it was Gordon Ramsey's place. The place was packed and very noisy, and there would have been a 20 minute wait if we decided to sit in the dining area. We then decided to sit at the bar where we were free to seat ourselves.  I can't comment on the dishes here, but the "Nachos" we ordered were out of this world. I actually thought they were actual corn nachos, but they were in fact kettle fried potato chips (English style I guess) with a sour cream sauce, melted cheddar cheese, and red chillies on top. All I will say is, it was so so so hard to stop eating them! ...yes, they were that good! Together with a glass of wine or an ice cold beer, this'll make an excellent pub snack.  Service was good and the waitress was friendly and attentive. Definitely a nice buzzing place to get together with friends.

jhotn8osBe1bMscDjw4kGA.text: Came in at the afternoon since the buffet line is long. However the food came out 1 hour after we ordered. Will never return!

TYskMbxpEp2O5_XSbUbUIg.text: Wow! I have never had a Burger that was this amazing, tasty, and delicious.  Sat at the bar here in Ceasars Palace to enjoy the last period of playoff hockey.  Ramon, an awesome bartender who went way out of his way to create an amazing bourbon drink, shared with us some of the cool insider stories that understandably has led to a terrific camaraderie here in the restaurant.  Staff is all pleasant, energetic, friendly and really love what they do. Easy to understand when you hire right and inspire the best.  Ok, enough of the overkill, but seriously this place is a lot of fun. Good British Pub food with the master touch of Gordon Ramsay.  Definitely check it out if you come to Las Vegas and consider sitting at the bar if you're solo or just the two of you.  Awesomeness.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Gordon Ramsay Pub &amp; Grill

evN7Gr9OR7iU-n-x78h57A.text: We wandered into Caesar's Palace hoping to eat at their top rated buffet but found the wait time was 200+ minutes. This was a nice place with a shorter wait and we got to learn how to play roulette in the time during.   We ordered truffle fries as an appetizer. They were delicious! Perfect thing to start off dinner. My husband got the lamb burger and I got the braised short rib. They were both really tasty!   Dinner was about $100 including tip. Not bad for Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Here&#39;s the menu!
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My husband with the truffle fries.
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Braised short rib with risotto.

rMa7jjt-E5RULc1Sg82yMQ.text: Being in Vegas on business and by yourself does have its perks, namely being able to get a seat almost immediately no matter where you want to eat!  Sat at the bar, which has full menu service.  Got a scotch egg for an appetizer, the brown mustard on top definitely opened up the nasal passages, but it had great flavor.  Had to get the fish and chips for my main entree, after all I was in a pub!  I was expecting the fish to be more like I was used to, strips of fish deep fried, and for there to be 4 or so strips.  Instead what I go were two large pieces of fish, cooked to a nice golden brown.  The fish was excellent and not too greasy, the chips on the other hand were a soggy mess.  They came out over cooked for the most part, and with a burnt oily flavor to them.  I was sadly disappointed in them and didn't even finish them all.  The two bartenders behind the bar gave great service, always ensuring I had a full drink and seeing if I needed anything else without being too overbearing.  Overall I would say I will give GR Pub & Grill a second chance, but may just steer clear of the chips the second go around.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fish &#39;n Chips

E7pGB7FDUuSQAEyKRgglDw.text: Came here for dinner last week while I was in LV.  The setup and decor is nice and classy.  I know there were some negative Yelp reviews about the service but our servers were great.  I had the Braised Short Ribs, which are very meaty and cooked pretty well.  It was a big piece of meat, which was good.  The cut of meat was kind of chewy though so disappointed for the price I paid.  Taste wise, the ribs were pretty good.  I left the sides, they weren't that awesome.  I also had some wine and a Guinness beer.   The restaurant was extremely loud so it was hard to hear other people talk.  So overall, I would say this place is very overpriced, the decor is cool, the food is not bad but ok overall.  Bring your wallet, it's Vegas.

FOnQcNWGNXvPlai9Q0CHJg.text: Appetizers - hellfire wings - amazing!!!! Best wings ever   Drinks - God save the queen, VERY VERY GOOD!!  Burgers - dry as hell. Def not worth $19   Mashed potatoes - great texture but under salted   Dessert - steamed bread pudding was awesome!!   Service was quick. Overall decent spot, but was disappointed in the burgers!

8Anlz0t2Q5Q6ITl4vEo0tg.text: 1st time here. Great service, good menu. I had the chicken curry was awesome! The service was well versed in the menu options and very attentive to the large group of 14 we had. Great place for big or small groups. Everyone said their food was great. (Steak, burger, scallops, )

_ZUYs0TsNKozpsPRBRg76w.text: Grabbed a reservation early to eat before the Elton John show. While this was a great idea in theory, it still took 40 minutes to get our food and we ended up eating quickly and dashing out to make the show. It seems the food for other tables came out within 10 minutes of ordering before and after ours hit the table, so maybe ours got caught up in a rush...  Food was average. Had the chicken salad sandwich and fries. There wasn't a lot of chicken salad and it was just okay. The fries were better. The other thing we got was the pub sliders and a side Caesar salad. Each of those were solid but not mind-blowing.  Service was friendly. Seems like it could be a cool place, but just didn't hit all the marks for me.

P1mHzDld7nQ55NBiizdZPA.text: Food was AMAZING! It was our first time and we took a friend visiting from outside of the U.S. and we were so happy for the great experience we had during dinner.   Our server Ali was FANTASTIC, friendly and super knowledgeable! He really knows his stuff. Whatever he recommends is what you should get.   We will for sure be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Talk about delicious!! Had a great time playing tourist.

SsPU_qPp-e2uyaWh-osMqA.text: Had a late night reservation, was seated immediately.  Unfortunately they sat us next to the service station and at one point one of the bus people tried to carry too much away and dropped glasses by us.  Would have been ok had the woman not stand there and start stomping her feet like a 5 year old.  Drinks were delicious.  I had the fish & chips, they were good.  Friend had the pie sampler (realllllly small samples) and had a very wet Caesar Salad.  Drinks were wonderful though.

KlEA6rnZ-6ieu9aTMe_TFw.text: Food is pricy and not good. We ordered the potato and it does not taste good. The drink is okay but it is too expensive and it cost 15

rKRxXIUIZh-KUozkPWUatw.text: This was great.   Really fun atmosphere and the staff was excellent .   Our waiter was attentive and friendly and the food was excellent.  Preferred the fish and chips and the salmon toasts yum for the starter.   The burger was excellent as well.  Pricey but you are in a Strip  hotel after all.    Would recommend and will come again.

SIkh0-rHpV-Gh5tAkS3bJg.text: We came here to take a break from walking and saw their happy hour sign as we walked by. It's located inside of the Caesars Palace. Happy hour is Monday-Friday from 2-5 pm. They had plenty of goodies for only $5: Deviled eggs, sliders, pretzels, truffle fries. The food was pretty decent, especially for the price. You can't beat it! Draft beers started at $5 and $7 a pint. The ambiance is fun, clean and service was great. There's lots of television screens for the sports lovers!
