wqHPwYyIIY5jZNZ-yXn9ug.text: Excellent service and food, I had the bangers and mash with a pint. Food was prepared with care and the atmosphere is lively. I particularly have to compliment the service of Scott F., who provided communicative and excellent service.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States

d5Y9BWrv0C8YWl40IXLr8g.text: Amazing food and amazing service! I had the lamb chops and I finished it all. On a scale of 1 to 10 it was a 12 easy. The meat was seasoned perfectly too. Our server, Tayler, did an excellent job! He was prompt, offered us advice and had witty banter. I would highly recommend to anyone! Thank you!!

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States

smKgsKVPzyq4oB9GWn9MCw.text: I had such a wonderful experience here for our first time. . AFRO! You are so awesome.  Recommend the chicken  curry meal and it was so delicious.  My husband started high with the beef Wellington......OMG! Perfect. Everyone was so gracious and friendly.  We loved it. Thank you so much.

g2eurcJuZqUv7mO7dASo7A.text: I was skeptical about the reviews. I didn't believe a restaurant opened by the legendary Gordon Ramsay can actually have only 3 stars.   I was walking around in the bellagio and i decided to cross the bridge to come here for a late dinner. Since i was a party of one again, i was ushered to the bar to have my dinner.   I ordered a fish and chips, it was supposed to be a "classic favourite" so i assumed it should be good. Boy i couldn't be more wrong. I also ordered a innis and gunn which was supposed to "pair well"  with the fish and chips and was "gordon's" favourite.   The fish and chips came in a bowl shaped plate on a piece of fancy tracing paper. The fish and chips were nicely done. The huge chunks of cod were very very fresh(gotta give it to them) and cooked perfectly. However, without the tartar sauce and the lemon, the fried fish was disgustingly plain, the fried batter came off the fish completely and i was eating fried batter separately from the fish. "the entire plate was so oily, that the USA is deciding to invade the plate" was how i felt after eating this 30 dollar dish.   The innis and gunn did its job, the only 2 reasons why i could think of why it paired so well with the dish is because it washes the grease away from your palate, and if you have enough glasses of this beer, you would probably get drunk enough to forget you had paid 30 bucks for a disgusting, oily plate of cod fish, fried batter and chips.   I was so disappointed by my experience at GR pub and grill i didn't even post it on my facebook. I do not recommend this restaurant for a first date.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. A more accurate description of this dish should be &#34;bland fried batter and cod fish, on a bed of overly greasy fried potatoes&#34;
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Look at all the grease. Gross.
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States

gAjTPj4ZXf01pxxWLG68lg.text: Me & my lady had just gotten out of the Elton John show and were starving, so we walked right over to this Gordon Ramsay pub and grill that is right in front of the colisuem as you get out, we figured it would be good considering how harsh he is on cooks...man....let me tell you, he really needs to make a stop in his own restraunt and slap his cooks around...the food wasn't terrible but for the price, it made it terrible. Very expensive dishes that taste very mediocre in my opinion. There's a nice looking steakhouse literally 25-30 ft from Gordon Ramseys pub n grill, there a lil bit more pricey but the food there looks 10x better, if I could do it again I would've shelled out the dough for a much better meal

9fW9lBuNxgbLSO9cNb0f_g.text: Everything here was delicious!  Especially the crafted cocktail Goodbye Blue Sky!!!  The best cocktail I have ever had.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fried calamari
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hell&#39;s Kitchen Burger
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Truffle chips!!!  Super yummy!

SQ3YBLWWuTXVYijcbwqNyw.text: Over 1300+ reviews with an average 3 stars? =/ I really enjoyed Gordon Ramsay's burger place at Planet Hollywood. I've learned not to always judge a book by its cover so I still decided to give this place a try.   We went to dinner on a Sunday evening. Made reservations around 7:45p and this place was pretty busy.  My boyfriend ordered the Pistachio Pesto Chicken Sandwich-it's a cold sandwich by the way. Also ordered truffle fries. He enjoyed it. I had a bite and it was pretty good.   However.....I ordered an 8 oz burger, the waiter asked if I wanted cheese...I declined. But when the burger arrived....the burger was just a plain bun and the meat. I was thinking...okay...that's odd. Maybe these fancy-smancy restaurants make their burgers like that. It was plain and boring. Yes...I get it. I ordered a "boring dish." But sometimes, a good restaurant can turn the most simple dish into something that will tickle your tastebuds and leave you wanting more.  We decide to ask the waiter what happened to the condiments. Where's the lettuce...tomatoes...onions...etc? He told us we were supposed to order that if we wanted it. -__- ugh. Thanks for your help, waiter. You were such a helpful guy. *insert sarcastic tone here.* So remember..FYI...IF you ever order the burger here, make sure to ask for veggies!!!!! What kind of restaurant don't automatically give you the lettuce to your burger? It's like ordering a chicken pot pie without the chicken.   Also, the price for what we paid was NOT worth the quality of the food. $17 for the pesto chicken sandwich and $18 for a plain ol tasteless hamburger. Disappointing. I'm never coming back here.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken pesto sandwich

Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Plain ol hamburger. They never gave me any veggies. You have to ask for it. Don&#39;t burgers normally comes w/ lettuce &amp; tomatoes?
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 8oz burger with truffle fries.

OPleAOn8ezOQdaN6YDw0yA.text: I am a fan of Gordon Ramsay's television shows, so I was pleased when friends said they wanted to go to dinner at one of his restaurants. Since the group wanted a more casual dining experience, we decided to try the Pub & Grill. Sadly, I was not very impressed.   We had reservations for a Sunday evening. I was disappointed when I saw that we were being seated at a table that was right next to a busy bussing station. It was not comfortable, and it was loud.  The noise made conversation difficult so it felt like we waited a long time for orders to be taken and food to arrive.  Service in general could have been a lot more friendly and attentive.   I had the Shepard's Pie . It was fine, a good sized portion, but not something I would recommend or rush back for. Prices are high, even for for the strip. I think I'd be more likely to overlook food that was just average if the environment had been more comfortable.   I'm still a Gordon Ramsey fan but for me, the Pub is a pass.

SCyxKPeBEIVI4kzy4o_w-g.text: I enjoyed my Gordon Ramsay experience here so much to have it twice New Year's weekend.  I've always walked by it and wanted to try it out.  Both times we sat at the bar without wait and watched the games on the tv's that they had.  Made it convenient to get away from the sportsbook to grab a bite to eat and drink and not miss the game.  The first time we went, we ordered the chicken wings, deviled eggs and sliders.  The chicken wings were pretty tasty and a nice portion.  The deviled eggs were not cut as beautifully as I'm used to, but it didn't sacrifice its' taste, they were still delicious, topped with bacon.  The sliders were pretty good as well.  Not a huge fan of the bun type but the patty, cheese and bacon were a good combination.  The second time we came I had the corned beef brisket sandwich and the butter chicken with rice.  The corned beef brisket was moist and delicious.  I wish it came with fries automatically instead of the kettle chips, but the chips were good as well.  The butter chicken was also a great dish even from a place that doesn't focus on Indian cuisine.  The pita bread was good but I probably would have preferred the butter chicken to have a little more of a punch and spice.  Service was great both times, everyone was very nice and attentive.  Overall, a place with solid food and service.  Would definitely come back in the future.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States

IOGGfyP4NKCMDg6GIqDyaA.text: The decor for the restaurant is really nice. Really like the keg on the side. The place has scores of televisions. The restaurant is a but dark but nice. Mix match seating with living room chairs. Some of the seating sit low. We ordered the devil eggs for appetizer and fish and chips. The deviled eggs just was to much over the top for my liking. They had bacon and cheese in the filling. I do like the concept of putting the filling into your egg. The fish and chips, hubby like the chips as long as they were warm. I have mixed feeling about them. Love the ketchup!!!! The fish was really good along with the tartar sauce and mets vinegar. Oh the peas, ate all of those they were really good.   Service what service??? Yeah okay right maybe next time service will show up......

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Deviled eggs
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fish and chips

-spjcFj6FEgSHjzB31dXHA.text: Horrible, awful...unbelievably ridiculous! My family and I came here on Saturday night excited with high expectations.....to say we were disappointed is an understatement. After 35mins, asking another waitress to track down our waitress and complaining to the runner our food arrived cold, not all six entrees (burgers and chicken sandwiches) were brought out together...and the best part, 1 entree was missing!!!!! Oh, and we were still charged for the missing entree.....only after we complained was the item removed from our bill.  The most annoying part...they automatically charge 18% gratuity for parties of 6 or more.....smh, that explains why we weren't offered any type of apologetic gesture... Our waitress did apologize for the mishap when she brought us the check, but nonetheless....we couldn't wait to leave.   The best part of the evening.....the sweet, attentive older Latina woman who kept refilling our water glasses. Give that lady a raise!

qVSLJPd2h4EFVlus7Z5rPw.text: If i could give this place 0 stars I would. Popular only for the name not the food!  Food - for being Gordon Ramsay's restaurant, it is less than mediocre. Ordered the 8 oz ribeye and 14 oz tenderloin both with the pub steak sauce and both steaks were dry. The steak sauce also wasn't good nor anything like A1 and they didnt offer A1 as an alternative! Steak was probably dryer than the desert. Also the only sode that came with the steaks were 3 pieces of asparagus. The dessert was about the size of my palm.   Price - RIDICULOUSLY OVERPRICED. Both steaks, no matter the size was $40 EACH. Since there was a SEVERE lack of sides, we ordered a side of fries which ended up being $10 for a measly cup of basic fries. The tiny dessert would have been $11  Service - TOOK ALMOST ONE HOUR TO GET OUR FOOD! I was about to walk out of the restaurant. They claimed it was because they were busy and a lot of people ordered steak but there were many empty tables and no one I saw ordered steak.  The server offered free dessert as compensation for the wait but this place still gets a negative review. Seriously not worth the wait. Its a trap!

M5RMl_dRTGT0sfiq34SXMQ.text: Tried Gordon Ramsay Pub and Grill for lunch and it absolutely hit the spot. Delicious dishes and outstanding service. Rodney was fantastic. Sticky Toffee Pudding is a signature dessert worthy of praise. Highly recommend!

Lz_W0bEm1v1Vrrhmemo8yg.text: Great little bar. It's right across from the theatre where Elton John performs so it's a good place to have dinner before the show. They have great happy hour specials and the food is so good. I had one of the best burgers I have ever had here. Can't wait to go back

gud_BlSNUyJrLIw3iZuDZw.text: I was relatively unimpressed with the main course dishes. My friends and I did family style and I tried the lamb burger, fish and chips and the jalapeno mac n cheese. The mac n cheese was phenomenal and I would go just to get it. However, the burger had a strong charcoal taste and the chips were all soggy. The fish had an OK taste. Would give it another try just because it's Gordon Ramsey's restaurant and the mac n cheese was SO good.

eR3aMFKeu8jqkSudTHzWvw.text: I had the best Lamb Burger in this place !! It's my go to item on the menu so far .. simply the best

zkixK7tirWCH3IHhHyBDFQ.text: I absolutely loved this place! Great selection of beers, amazing food, and fun atmosphere!  I'd definitely recommend the kettle chip nachos & the pub chopped salad as they were amazingly delicious. Our server Heather was  knowledgeable and so quick with everything!!  This is a must stop when you're in Vegas!

M3B634tDn-PvcMjdu6OEow.text: My husband and I came here our first day in Vegas on our honeymoon. We love Gordon Ramsay so it was a must. We both ordered burgers, which were amazing and my mixed drink was pretty powerful. My Hell's Kitchen burger wasn't as spicy as I thought it would be. Ghost pepper cheese and jalapenos pack a punch, but it wasn't nearly as hot as I expected.

Zk5rbaJbsvXvTmSsx3eXbg.text: Mediocre and overpriced, even for Vegas. I don't know why Gordan Ramsay is so willing to attach his name to this level of quality.  My friend's steak was ordered medium rare but was delivered looking like a microwaved hamburger. Zero pink and no juices flowing from the steak. It took 10 minutes to track down the waitress who didn't seem surprised and said it looked more like a medium well vs medium rare. If she thinks dark grey is medium well, she probably should look into a different career path. It took 25 minutes to receive a replacement steak, which is ridiculous. They should have taken the next steak off the grill. The manager acted like he was doing us a favor by removing the steak from the bill, despite the fact that it was delivered after every other dish had been cleared from our table.   This was an embarrassing effort from a restaurant with a celebrity name and $100 per head prices for food and a couple drinks. Pass.

tqn27NhCA6ebi7QYPYFy0w.text: Great atmosphere but even greater was our server Alex (Alexander) who's from Myrtle. Alex was honest and attentive and when he comes to Wilm I hope he calls. He's an outstanding member of your team Gordon!

i2XUUYvXy4L3qs2ovOUn0Q.text: First off, we late for our reservation by an hour due to a delay at the airport. When we finally arrived. They were graciously able to accommodate us. Mind you it was a Saturday night during the memorial weekend. It only took a few minutes till our table was ready. Once seated, water was arrived at our table. Looked over the menu, selection was good. Some items looked amazing while others were just good. The drink menu was great.  Our waiter was excellent, very friendly and funny.  We didn't really get a starter besides soup. As at that point haven't not eaten all day we were ready for the main dish. Tried both the onion and and tomato bisque soup. Between those two, the onion was more of a favorite. Our main dishes arrived, portion wise was good. The steak pies was alright, and for the price. It was a bit high. Was a bit to dry for my liking with the pie crust and could use a bit more gravy. The lobster Mac and cheese was great. Really filling. Butter chicken curry was great. Portion was excellent. Kettle chips nachos may have been my favorite our off all the dishes we ordered. It's a starter but could be a main dish. The amount given is great for sharing or for a hungry soul. We also had the sticky toffee pudding which was a great ending to the meal. Served warm with a scoop of vanilla ice cream covered in caramel sauce. I've had it Europe plenty of times and this could compare to it.   Pros: Great drink menu. Friendly staff  Amazing location in cesar palace. Fun group gathering. Great English vibe.  Cons: Overpriced

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sticky toffee pudding
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Kettle chip nachos

ytiKvRN1uyUERBvdyHLb_w.text: We normally have a great experience at Ramsay establishments, but we did not at Pub & Grill.  The wooden placemats with leather trim are beaten up and unsightly. Replace them unless  the worn and dingy look is your goal. I get the Brit pub look, but we are paying Ramsay prices and expect better than average.  The service was horrendously slow. The Beef Wellington was flavorful, but our food temp was tepid, at best. We chose to not to have it redone, as we could not bear the wait. The Mac and Cheese side was very tasty and the awkwardly the best dish of the night.   We skipped the starter so we could save room for our favorite Ramsay dessert, the Sticky Toffee Pudding. I timed it at nearly 15mins to get to the table. The dish and sauce again arrived at room temp. We sent it back and had them take it off the bill.   A well-run establishment would have a management member address our concerns. None did.  What is sad is that the flavors are there, but service is lacking. If Gordon was here, he would be screaming about the food dying in the window.

4o6M_D1Wy-GS5NWuGxMtcg.text: Holy mother of Toffee Pudding!  I had forgotten all about Chef Ramsay's famous sticky toffee pudding until I checked in on yelp and it said "have one for free!".  Even though I was stuffed my heart said "yep, get it".  I'm so glad I did.  We just got 1 for 4 people because we were all so full.  But it just filled my little belly with warm happiness and I was ready for a nap.   I can't even remember what I had for dinner now.   But I know it was chicken and served over rosemary white beans.  And it was also AH-MAZING.    It was a bucketlist item to go to a Chef Ramsay restaurant while in Vegas.  And I'm so glad I made it happen.  I really want to thank the restaurant and yelp for offering the free dessert to check-ins because it encouraged me to try probably the best dessert I've ever had. - and as a baker, I don't say that lightly!

4ZR5OmDQWxRv6Mlxy8mkEA.text: interestingly enough, it was pretty f***ng good!  I'll preface this review by saying I have not watched Gordon Ramsay's show, but have come to know if his rep via social media and news outlets.  Our family had dined at this location two years ago post Celine Dion show, and we looked forward to returning on our most recent Vegas vacation.  NOTE:   Reservations made via Open Table.  Making a res proved to be good idea as the pub was quite busy when my mom and I arrived at five minutes to the hour.   SETTING: The restaurant is located on the casino level, LITERALLY across from the entrance to the Colosseum venue.  I'm sure one could not miss Chef Ramsay's name in bright lights (I'm sure he wouldn't have it any other way).  We checked in and briefly waited on the side for the hostess to show us to our seats.  The pub is simply decorated, and pays homage to its origins by way of a keg wall separating seating sections.    FOOD: Having studied the menu on the website, I knew I wanted to order the Shepard's Pie while my  mom chose the salmon.  We each ordered a cocktail as well; Goodbye Blue Sky for the lady, and the Mules Hind Leg (their version of the Moscow Mule) for myself.  I just loved the Shepard's Pie!  It was a perfectly sized portion and prepared well.  The top layer of potatoes is a bit deceiving of the dish, which is revealed brimming with filling as soon as you breach the surface.  A good dish indeed.  My mom absolutely loved her dinner entree.  She couldn't stop gushing about the salmon being prepared to her liking, as well as the numerous greens and vegetables on her plate.    SERVICE: Very outstanding.  Our server was an extremely nice, polite, and all around friendly guy.  He expertly answered our questions about the menu, and we appreciated his patience while we looked over the menu.  Needless to say, he truly made our evening a truly positive dining experience overall.  BOTTOM LINE: Great service.  Well prepared food.  Good energy.  Thanks Chef.....I'll be back for more Shepard's Pie.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Salmon

mSWLHZ-ui8rLRn9eRXEDDg.text: Whenever you go to Vegas, you have to try some Gordon Ramsay restaurants. My family came here for lunch, and we had a reservation from Opentable, so there was no wait for us. Also, just a heads up, since this is a pub and really close to the casino floor, it can get a bit noisy inside. We skipped ordering appetizers, and headed straight to the entrees. The entrees are pretty pricey here, but that is to be expected with a brand name, such as Gordon Ramsay. For the entree, I went with the English Cheddar and bacon burger. I typically like my burgers medium well, and the burger was cooked to perfection. The patty was very flavorful and had an excellent amount of seasoning. Even the buns were very soft and fluffy. Unfortunately, I forgot to upgrade to the truffle fries, but the regular fries were seasoned well with salt and pepper. They were a perfect golden brown, and had just the right amount of crispiness. Also, don't forget to check-in on Yelp because you get a free sticky toffee pudding! It is a great way to finish off your meal, and also comes with a big scoop of ice cream!

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sticky toffee pudding. Be sure to check in on Yelp to get this for free!
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. French fries!
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. English cheddar burger medium well!

Z0Pv8G7HFIVGxof3OUY6Qg.text: I have been wanting to try Chef Ramsay's food for a while now and being from Boston it made it quite difficult. Finally came to Vegas and had to make a reservation. I couldn't choose between but I made the decision here because the prices were reasonable for everyone.   I came for a specific meal - Beef Wellington. It was amazing. Everything I expected and more. I needed more sauce but the waitress was quick in coming back so I was very pleased. I also got truffle fries and the sticky toffee pudding. The dessert was amazing no complaints about anything here.   My boyfriend got a cheeseburger and it was very tender meat it was probably the most perfect burger I've ever tried! My other friends got the chicken and fish and chips. They said the chicken was very tender until the very end. Fish and chips were not greasy and tasted very crispy and good. The 35oz beers were fun and the guys enjoyed it.   The decor was lovely such a nice pub / steak house feel and it was pretty casual. I love all the photos of chef everywhere to be reminded of a great chef and great food.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fish and chips

F5v_iaH0m-koSLDq57AJoQ.text: Went here because of the affordability. The food was great, roasted tomato soup ( I did find a hard piece of tomato inside tho) the shrimp and lobster roll pub bites ( definitely two bites) and the fish and chips.   The portions for the bites were small as I would expect but for an entree I was really surprised that it was not much bigger. Truly a good bite but there are so many restaurants that give bigger portions for the same price and truly just as good. I get you always pay for the name and being in Las Vegas you pay double but a few more chips or a larger piece of fish should. It be breaking the bank and anyone know the mark ups are usually the alcohol anyway.   The place itself already is seeing wear, chipped paint for example. It was a bit surprising as anyone watching Chef's shows knows he looks at everything.   The staff, very attentive.... too attentive. This is where I took two stars away. Drink the water and they would fill it within seconds, great right? Not really as they would each across the table and pour from a height that I was just waiting for the splash.  I appreciate a quick refill but when in the middle of a conversation it's a bit annoying to have the person stand over you.  Then there was the clearing. Usually a server will wait, notice that the plate hasn't been touched for a few minutes and then ask if you are done. Not so, here the plates were asked to be cleared while eating, literally rushed to finish a bite because the server or the bus person , both were quick to clear, would stand close and wait for the second I was finished.   The restaurant was not busy so why such a rush... end of shift? If you go here sit at the bar, grab a small bite and a drink. It's interesting to see how Chef does his restaurants if you watch his shows. I like the design, the thought down to the uniform but that front of the house is important and as you watch you will see how it is not a Swiss time piece not matter how fancy it looks.

4lYY2itiNDRgRZIB4wi3Dg.text: Food was good! Ordered the Braised Short Rib, Mac and cheese, Brussels sprouts, pot pie, lobster rolls... all was really filling and so good! The waiter named Rodney gave us superb service while we ate there! He gave us a complimentary dessert made from dates but actually tastes like chocolate, yummy! And he's got really cool personality! Nice job!

x1_o2PNBK5iSs3NqBnMUPg.text: If you are looking for a nice pub atmosphere with amazingly scrumptious food look no more!! The staff was pleasant and very attentive. We proceeded to order more than expected and was not disappointed. The lobster rolls were toasted and buttered to perfection. The short rib nachos were heavenly and the Reuben has no words. I am leaving fat and happy!

045N8W0wlMz_INeIuYlAYg.text: I visited this restaurant because I am a fan of Gordon Ramsay. I had also visited 2 of his other restaurants in LV and they were awesome. Unfortunately this one is just ok. I had the kettle chips and they were ok. By the time I finished eating them the chips were mostly soggy. I also tried the shrimp and lobster rolls and they were pretty good. The roll was buttery and crispy. They were pretty small though.   I also tried their Brussel sprouts and they were good. They were crispy and sweet from a balsamic glaze. The portion was good to share with someone else.  The best part of the meal though was the free toffee pudding that came from checking in on yelp. It's kinda sad to think that that is what actually made the whole meal worth it. This dessert is supper tasty! The ice cream cones in an edible chocolate cup.   Would I go back? Meh...maybe to get another dessert.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beef burger
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Toffee pudding...free with yelp check in!
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster and shrimp rolls with a side of Brussels sprouts

nmWEfj3gq0jbYdcrXF2hhA.text: Went there for my birthday while in Vegas, the service was ok at best and the food was mediocre.  I heard many good things about Ramsey's restaurant and how popular they are so gave it a shot.  Got one of the burgers and from seeing his cooking shows I expected something out of this would and got something i would of expected from Dennys ( no offense).  The burger was somewhat dry and the tomatoes they gave me in there were the ends of the tomato (who does that at a fancy restaurant).  Anyway spent almost $100, should of been $40

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States

FaL40YOsFpJfDbpNKSO-1Q.text: I was looking forward to eating at Ramsay's restaurant. Unfortunately the meat was undercooked and the vegetables (carrots) overcooked. The free dessert I got from Yelp was nice. The price is way too expensive for what you get.

jc-ITMA1YLpMsIMdQbORnQ.text: I loved our meal here before Mariah Carey's show! Our food was impeccable, our waiter Alexander was super helpful and patient and the sticky toffee pudding was jaw dropping delicious goodness.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States

t4tAQVpeNTNVTExVJWaANw.text: Starting off this review with a shoutout to ADAM (Afro) our amazing server!! He was super genuine and caring. He gave us great recommendations and even adjusted my order so it would be extra yummy  Lobster and Shrimp Roll - To be honest, the roll is TINY HAHA i guess it really is an appetizer. I thought it would be bigger but it's super good and creamy   Lamb Burger - BOMB!! Get this when you come here. I'm not a fan of goat cheese so I subbed the toppings, added bacon. So good dude and it comes with truffle fries to die for  Fish and Chips - I actually wasn't a fan of this one. The batter is pretty thick and oily. But the fish itself is really good quality!!   Tomato Soup - can't go wrong with tomato soup. It also comes with a garlic bread that is super flavorful!   I really enjoyed my meal here and would recommend anyone staying at Caesars Palace to give it a try. Unfortunately I didn't try any of the brews but I'll be back :)

T3HLTL3XVow90sqatBF_gA.text: The food was really good but our server Scott made the visit even better! Very knowledge and super friendly which means a lot!! Also the bar tender made the beat Old Fashioned, my Husband has been searching for one made correctly and he finally found one!!!! Thanks to everyone here

1Z1n9vVKAR8yaOByr7q4Tg.text: Best server we had all week while in Vegas. Food was amazing. Pricey but worth every penny. Keep up the great work Adam P. My daughter had the burger and said it's the best burger she's ever had.

HMiyPGCxFu3z79FCv4gdNA.text: I truly loved this restaurant! I am a huge fan of all of Ramsay's establishments and this one definitely exceeded my expectations. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful in deciding what me and my best friend should order and they did not disappoint. My best friend ordered the braised short rib and I had the hellfire wings (as pictured below). The food was AMAZING and I rarely ever eat blue cheese at all but the blue cheese with the wings is truly better than the ranch. Also to be a Gordon Ramsay establishment the prices were fairly moderate. Usually when you go in to high celebrity named restaurants the prices are astronomical just due to the celebrity association but I love that Ramsay's restaurants here in Vegas seem to be priced very well especially for the quality of the food you are getting. A huge thank you to this establishment for the amazing food and the ability to show my best friend a good time with good food on her trip away from home. I definitely recommend the wings as an appetizer of even the shrimp and lobster rolls, either one will NOT disappoint.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Braised short rib and hellfire wings
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Full Menu

_GAwAJ_Odvp6RLJLnVGWPg.text: The food here is really amazing, the lobster Mac and cheese was a piece of art, as were the scallops.   Worth the price? Yes.   Decor adds to the fun atmosphere, making it an even better time hanging with friends.   To top it all off, our garcon, Afro, really added humor and liveliness to our table, and really wrapped this whole experience up into one that we will remember as we head back home to the Netherlands.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Scallops
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster Mac and Cheese

ASF-PYW9w2_ker2aWb4PZw.text: We ate here on the 21st and 22nd, 3 days after the opening on the 18th.  Both times we ate at the bar, so can't comment on the restaurant side.  First night we came for drinks and a snack.  We had the Vic Queen Chips and Deviled Eggs.  Both were excellent.  The Chips were very delicate - thinly cut and perfectly fried - served with a side of malt vinegar for dipping.  Just excellent!!  The Deviled Eggs were served in an interesting way.  The egg whites were served separately, sprinkled with parsley, and the yolks were served in a small cup for you to scoop out and put as much as you wanted into the egg whites. The yolks were smashed and mixed with smokey bacon and cheese.   They were by far the best deviled eggs I have ever had.  In all, this experience was 5 star.  The second night we came shortly after 5 PM for the dinner menu.  We again sat at the bar.  They were out of the first beer that I ordered, but offered me a sample of another beer that I might like.  The bartender was very helpful.  We ordered the Fish & Chips.  It took about 25 minutes for us to get our food, which is a little long, but we thought it might be due to a lot of folks ordering right around 5 PM when they start the dinner menu.  I figured if anyone could do fish & chips right it would be Gordon Ramsay - however, I was disappointed in this meal.  It was definitely not the best fish & chips that I had ever had.  The fish was OK, the batter was really good, but the fish was a little dry & tough - like it had been overcooked.  I prefer fish that is more moist and flaky.  A thicker piece of fish would probably have held up better to the cooking.  The potatoes were the biggest disappointment, though.  We expected chips (french fries) what we got were big blocks of potatoes - hand cut in rectangles - which had been boiled and baked and fried into a state of blandness that I would never expect from a Gordon Ramsay product.  They were hard at the ends, like they had been overdone.  They were not seasoned at all - no salt when they were removed from the deep fryer - and no flavor at all.  However, the mushy peas were outstanding!!!  I have never really liked mushy peas - I mean, really, who would like anything called mushy peas?  However, this was a combination of whole baby peas and mushy peas with some seasoning that had me eating the entire portion (a first for me.)  In general the bartenders were very helpful and friendly.  Would have been nice had someone checked on our dinner and let us know the status when we went so long without getting our meal, but that's a small point.  I liked the decorations.  It's pretty noisy with music playing but not so much that we couldn't hear each other or talk to the people next to us.  It was pretty busy for 5 PM.  Probably even busier later on.  I would go again, but not for the Fish & Chips - definitely for the Deviled Eggs though.

FuRp33kq9X46c3XoGZbCwQ.text: Service beyond reproach, cuisine that melts in your mouth.  Thanks Chef Ramsey!

z7hSVS7u7OO3_fZwBeV9vA.text: This is third time I ate here and first time for a review!! As far as the service goes Daisy was exceptional! The food was great... Ordered fish and chips and was best u have ever had! The Goodbye blue sky cocktail was amazing !!! All in all great time and great food!!

EXXoNra2nmyGwWuzuArE5A.text: Had lunch at Gordon's pub.  A little mix up getting the server initially, but the manager? was doing the rounds, got everything rolling quickly.  From then on, service was exceptional.  Managar suggested Innis & Gunn, reading other reviews, does seem they push that beer.  It was quite good.  Had the fish and chips based on Yelp feedback.  Good choice.  I thought the portions might be a bit small, but the dish is really filling, no room for desert.

MF5_OSk7ylU4gOb-iOicIw.text: While waiting for the Celine show we were lucky to grab a spot at the bar. Our bartender, Keith, was very friendly, telling us the pub had only been open for 3 months. I guess the uniforms were supposed to be disco 80's, but I felt sorry for the girls. Our food service was prompt. I expect pub food to be fattening and it was delicious as well. I had the sliders and my husband had a ham and cheese sandwich.  I hope Ramsey keeps his eye on this place to keep it up to par. I've read several poor reviews that I think would get his ire up! Maybe better training of the staff? Our experience was great.

WW9avqbFuIseccTl3g83RA.text: Being a big fan of Gordon Ramsey and his steakhouse, I had high hopes for this place. My wife and I ate there on Christmas Eve.  Very disappointed. We sat on the pub side and we were not even offered to look at the pub menu. It wasn't until we ordered that I realized there was a second menu. We both chose the fish and chips. Greasy thick batter on flavorless fish. Chips were these thick cut and I don't mean steak like fries, I mean these block rectangular potatoes with no seasoning.  If you want fish and chips go to his steakhouse at Paris!!!  Also, the place just opened and Vegas was packed but this place was half empty at 9 pm.  Lousy vibe and music. The only positive were the cocktails.  Much better choices in Vegas.

Xu1lSFIdw_oF_eXEY5pmkA.text: First of all, do not go here if you're looking for a fine dining experience. This is a pub. Expect a high noise level and pub food.  With that said we had an ok evening. Food was good. A bit overpriced, but good. Best was the sticky toffee pudding (highly recommended) and the salmon with a lovely crispy skin.

GgZKAruEp4CMKrbIJSgSuA.text: "Gordon Ramsay would throw this plate across the room", said one of my co-workers after tasting their entree.  I went here on a Wednesday night with two co-workers, while in town for business.  We all decided to order the fish and chips, but there was little consistency between the three plates.  Both of my co-workers received three pieces of fish, that were barely deep fried.  The batter was very soggy with no crisp or crunch you expect with an order of fish and chips. One of the dishes came out missing the lemon wedge and tartar sauce, which was quickly brought upon request.  While mine were cooked longer and actually tasted good, I only received two pieces instead of three.  The 'chips' tasted very much like Burger King's fries, something you don't expect when paying this price.  A friendly waiter could have made this experience better, but ours wasn't very personable.  I wouldn't recommend this restaurant, especially with so many other options in Las Vegas.

tGP9aqdE0h9wJQbHrLsF9g.text: Delicious food! Had steak and ale pie which was savory with hints of rosemary-num! Good seemed authentically British and the service was solid!

7WjVscSS_TnJpC8x5WHSaw.text: Then food is pretty good, but our waiter,Bryan, was not vegetarian friendly. I ordered the Caesar salad without anchovies and he informed me that is the way the salad came. I asked him to not add the anchovies and asked for a different salad dressing. He acted like it was a big deal to change the salad, we won't be going there again on Vegas visits.

C0Afh09jkdoxKTkinHMr3w.text: Was here in February. Interesting place. Staff was great. Beer list extensive and good. Food was good but I was put off by fish and chips at $28. Was not special but was good. Other pricing looked OK. Would I return..probably.

RZgrV_P-eXNQ7KoK4jdkJw.text: Truffle Mac & Cheese was delicious! Little Sliders were tasty - I preferred the ones with chedder verses not. Fries were also good. I'm just have the pan of mac n' cheese if I were to come again.

BQ1vo18E6jfWAfBCZJ9V5Q.text: Gordon Ramsay really needs to stop putting his name on restaurants he does not oversee. I sat at the bar and order the cheek sandwich. I waited a half hour for a sandwich that should have been prepared hours before I even sat down, in a restaurant that was half empty. It never came and I was never checked on. Again I was at the bar.  I'm sure the food would have been fine, but one thing is clear this place is not is a real Gordon Ramsay restaurant.

ryHKR6h0fttjKWHSgo5pJg.text: If you've got money to spend and a less than discriminating palate this is the place for you.  Look, I'm not saying it's bad but for $50 I expect better than bar food.  Just saying.  Fortunately for Gordon Ramsay most people in vegas are traveling on expense accounts.

RJAmRAMBGs3HjoFUZcahYQ.text: This place was OK, nothing more. The service was fine and the pricing of the beers wasn't terrible in comparison to other places in Vegas but we paid $55 including tip for 2 bowls of soup and 2 pints of beer. My draft beer also tasted like cardboard. The soup was OK but totally not what I was expecting. My fault for not checking first but the description could use some editing. The free bread came out after we had finished our soups, which made no sense. Oh well, you live and you learn.

GyuOllCgJfeKZ8Il_KhDDw.text: Husband is a fan of Gordon Ramsay's Hell's Kitchen and I'm a fan of food so we decided to give it a try...the servers were really nice and food was good. 3 stars cuz I think food was over priced...we shared the clams...broth was tasty n clams were tender n portion was decent to share but it was almost $30...i think it was pricey...i got the fish n chips...they used cod fish...crunchy outside flaky fish inside...a bit oily but it is deep fried so what do I expect hehe...without the malt vinegar and the tartar sauce, there is nothing special about it esp since it was $30...that being said...the tartar sauce was really tasty...i was dipping the chips/potato in it it was that good...we also tried the chopped salad with chicken n shrimp...it's supposed to have avocado...so I was looking for it because I love avocado...the server said it has a "alittle" bit smashed at the bottom of the plate...I'm must have been very little cuz I didn't see any...and I couldn't taste any...i just wanted the avocado. It has an upscale pub vibe

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cool table setting n silverware

NgE4OCv8GmWOP1t_TSFjHA.text: The restaurants vibe is very relaxed yet has a high end feel. The decorations are very tasteful and inline with a pub that specializes in micro brews. The waitresses are very friendly and the uniforms are sexy, the hiring criteria is very specific. Waiters are friendly offering their favorites along with an I-Pad for your use to research beers and items on the menu. I had the beef cheek and short rib sandwich. It was cooked nicely with high quality bread and ingredients. I like the fact that you can order a $100 steak or a $20 sandwich! The other nice part is you can have the Ramsey experience dressed casually... a great break from the tables and slot machines.

Ke3yDppv_QKF7AlS5MVuAg.text: The atmosphere was great and ambiance was nice. The service was superb as well. The food was so tasty. I had the bread pudding dessert it was to die for. Steak I had was cooked perfectly and our appetizer, pate, was so delicious.

_57lVx3OT5Sq7eU5ipXRTg.text: A True 3.5. We ordered the Rib Eye Steak, potatoes, and a caesar salad. The food here was really good. The salad dressing was delicious and the lettuce was hand picked. The bread basket is actually 3 mini pretzels, which were delicious and it was a nice change. The potatoes were topped with parmesan and complemented the steak quite well. The steaks were cooked as we had asked and were absolutely delicious. The thing i was not pleased with were the sauces that they have. Everything has a bitter funky taste to it. I am not sure if they are adding mustard or horseradish or what the deal is but when i have ketchup i want it to taste like ketchup. The prices don't really match the ambiance and the decor offered here. This place is more of a bar/grill rather than a steakhouse but you will pay steakhouse prices. It is a nice place to grab a dinner and a beer.

2G1CJvWdzhrUViYzD6ezSg.text: I'm sorry but I don't know how you won Hell's Kitchen Ja'nel...  I have no issues with price (its Vegas so its priced right) but I have a huge issue with how the food was seasoned. Only thing seasoned properly was the duck confit poutine.  Everything else we got needed salt and acid... Or flavor! Only reason you got 2 stars was because of the good service and the duck. One star for each...

MnWNVSv0itlbrfZyQgx0yA.text: Seriously disappointed.  First off, we went during lunch - 1:00pm- they seated us promptly and wait staff was pleasant and timely.  However, we went to order, they informed us they were out of beef.  Beef?  Seriously at 1:00?  They weren't  busy, I see why now.  Then we order beer, it is a pub after all, and they have not beer glasses?  What?  The dishwasher broke?  After a mediocre meal, with high strip prices, I must say, I don't think we will be dining here again....

wKe-W2R6TNRk0mvyK9Y40Q.text: One of the worst meals we've had in Las Vegas in 6 years living here. Onion soup was very bland. Fries tasted like they were from frozen. The shepherds pie was an extremely salty soup with potatoes on top that tasted and felt like instant. And all this was after waiting nearly 45 mins for the food to arrive (after watching two other tables seated after us be served). Would never recommend it to anyone - and am very disappointed with Mr. Ramsey for putting his name on the place.

XE4kqkGAtsjT1Laj8hBDwg.text: terrible service took a long time to get our food plus I ordered sliders and they came out raw then I sent them back and they came out raw AGAIN. this place is trash

MQ7ctiwFRFWzOpZQ9D3bFQ.text: Loved it. The pub chips with onion dip was fantastic as was the cheese dip with pretzel bread. My wife and I split the fish and chips and it was still more food than we could finish. Oh and the fish was battered crispy and melt in your mouth inside. Our server, Ali, was pleasant and knowledgable. He checked often and the service was fantastic all around.

7K1wlI5isLcBfhPrsVbCWw.text: Gean the bartender is hands down the best server/bartender ever!!!! Not only is he kind and courteous but funny as hell!!! Food is great and if you have a chance stop by and have Gean serve you it's worth sitting at the bar... Trust me

SB_D7jt9ZTSaQo3quiVkIQ.text: Well starters this place has a nice atmosphere but the food is crap.  I got the Bangers and Mash was normal sausage and instant mash potato.  Very surprised my wife got the Pub burger meat was extremely bland bacon was over cooked and didn't taste very well French fries where cold. I would save my money and eat at the buffet.

E_6R_gBznRNRI6R0v73Wdg.text: This Ramsey location is very less formal than Ramsey's Steak at the Paris. The food was more on the pub side which is to be expected. Food, drinks and service were all very good. My wife really liked the cucumber cocktail. Disappointed there was no bread basket for the price.

mk_xa4cSvNHgvz0lRv6iGA.text: We took a party of ten into this place, with high expectations based on Ramsay's excellence-demanding TV persona. We left disappointed with the bland food, high prices, and indifferent service.  Between us all, we tried a number of items. After being warned off the chicken salad sandwich by our waiter, we had a couple burgers, a couple tomato soups, a chicken pot pie, an chicken curry dish - by far the best, and a ny strip steak. Rather than go through item by item, suffice to say that the food lacked seasoning, was generally overcooked, and did little to distinguish itself beyond meeting the requirements of what we ordered.   Between the ten of us, with a couple sodas, one beer (nine bucks) and a couple glasses of wine, the total came to three hundred bucks. While this was not intended to be a "highlight" meal for our trip, it was still disappointing.   Finally, I don't know what horrible thing had happened to our waiter prior to his shift, but his attitude reeked of indifference to the happiness/satisfaction of his table. (Although he might have done me a favor warning me off the chicken salad, who knows.) Given other reviews I have read here, our service experience was not unique.

uz9jtYIN6SOSu_UcgdrJWg.text: Had the veal chop... I dont like mushrooms, but this was probably the most amazing thing ive ever eaten. ordered it medium, got it well. No bread so only 4 stars

MKGr3aJaA0pePK_7_fDNjQ.text: You should be able to give this place negative stars!  What a terrible mismanaged establishment.  We arrived at 8:30and were seated promptly but did not receive our meal until after 10:00pm.  Apparently an 8 oz, well done burger takes awhile to cook.  This is what the waitress told us and then we were told by a manager they had a "small" kitchen problem. Upon receiving our meal half the orders had been sitting under the heat lamp so long they felt like they had been prepared yesterday.  We received some replacement "chips" for our Fish N' Chips which were warm but completely uncooked in the center.  The staff offered little assistance and was completely absent.  Seemed like they knew a situation was occurring but neglected to inform our party of 8 or even try to come by our section.  I will never be back here to dine.

QwCTKHsO_40VdYQnWDvRCQ.text: Our service was sub par for the $200 we spent on 4 people. We waited 30 minutes past our predicted seating time- I can understand this, as jostesses have no control over when people get up. But after waiting  a half hour over our wait time, we got no apology from management. Our waiter ignored us for the most part; the most active he was was when he failed to ask our beer sizes and automatically charged us for big beers. Our drinks, apps and food came out at one time- again with no apology from server or manager. I work in the service industry and can be extremely forgiving, but overall the food and service were far below par.

-T6n1Kquo3Skn6XCqyddmw.text: I love the TV shows - but the restaurant was pretty bad.  Got the shepperds pie - was NOT what I expected...  $25 for a cupcake sized meal.  Tasted bland and boring.  And $9 for a bottle of water??  Really, Gordon??  Really???

HcLN_PobqSsXjjAnbvnB8w.text: Good service. Good food. Ate the lamb burger and truffle fries. Get the lamb burger. It is so good!

LvbzgkTXBj-Xk_CbJsGkCQ.text: My husband and I came to Las Vegas for our anniversary and stayed at Cesar's Palace which houses this pub. We had only stopped in during Happy Hour for a couple beers and appetizers, but we now have plans to come back for dinner as well. The food was incredible...I recommend the Toad in a Hole...and the service even better. If David is working you should sit in his section, he is so awesome.

XotmhimcNIusfiu2eXEZSQ.text: Wow..this place has GREAT service AND GREAT food.  I ordered the fish and chips, and they were DELICIOUS.  You can tell that the fish was high quality, and the fries were just amazing.  On top of that...I told my friend I really liked their pens and the server overheard me, and came back with multiple pens and told me to take them home w/ me.  So nice!

XWFxIPeai3YttEghRImBLg.text: Unfortunately i have to leave one star but its not even worth that. I was excited to try this place , now I m excited  to leave and never come back . Took over an hour to get a burger which was way over cooked almost burned (did not ask for well well done) and tasteless along with mayo that tasted more like garlic than real mayo. If you looking to pay top dollars for food that has no taste this is the right place.

mnApamrpUzNJux07bB7qUQ.text: We enjoyed our dinner here. Pretzels and bread was good, salad was ok, Flat Iron Steak was solid, English Chips were great, and the Strawberry tart was outstanding!!! The wife's Fish and Chips were pretty good too! It was a bit touristy, but I liked the atmosphere.

egZ2VKDM-yfW1fCZMO1F2Q.text: Stopped in at Gordon Ramsay's Pub and Grill as a longtime fan of the TV show. It is clear and obvious that chef Ramsay is NOT in the kitchen. Had the Hangar steak and Chips and was severely underwhelmed. Has the chef here ever heard of salt and pepper? The steak was extremely tender, but bland bland bland. The, "chips" werent anything special either. For $40 for a steak i expected much more. Oh well, perhaps his other restaurants do better?

Hu_EbxsnkiosuzCmXZ49uw.text: Food is very good. Atmosphere is well planned. But our waiter was snotty and not friendly at all. Barely spoke as he took our orders, just nodded.

DpSKtmp_mxudFeb9QXHXWw.text: We sat at the bar to ensure attentive service.  Team service was excellent.  Ordered the prime rib, it was cooked to order, and I was pleased.  I previously had the fish and chips here and I was disappointed, but this visit was okay.  I think that this place just performs well enough to get by with over-stimulated vegas visitors.

wwJ14neFIeLkDKG9O4WAdw.text: First experience at a Gordon Ramsay restaurant. Went with the classics - Fish and Chips and Wellington - and they did not disappoint. Thanks to our server Scott for the impeccable service and the tip about the Sticky Toffee Pudding!

H3M60I2p2-xlbUoSuifbXQ.text: We were touring the Cesar's Palaces, and the Cesar Forum Gift Shops. It was lunchtime and we decided to eat at Gordon Ramsey's Pub & Grills. It was own by the Famous TV English Celebrity Chef (American TV). With an Authentic English Pub & Grille Traditions. English Atmospheric Environmental. With a traditional Authentic English Foods Menu and Items by Chief Gordon Ramsey.  It was a has English flare but still comfort open Dining Room and Bar Area. The menu items  prices were average about under $30.   I ordered the Shepherds Meat Pie. The portion size was small, but still well presentable. With a English baked in a hot flare dish. It was tasty and well prepared. Chefs Ramsey's Shepherds Pie is made up of Mash Potatoes, Minced Beef, Carrots, Onions, Garlic, Red Wine, Chicken Broth, Tomato Paste, Cream, Butter, Eggs Yolks, and finally Parmesan Cheese. It taste exactly the way a English Shepherds Pie should taste.   It was a great experiences dining in. We only ate at the Chefs Ramsey's Fish and Chips. I was really excited to get an opportunity to dine in at the Chefs Ramsay's Pub and Grilled too. It good to know what the famous Chief and English Menu has to offer.  Tip: -A great tourist sight seeing attractions. Famous English Celebrity Chief Gordon Ramsey.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shepherd&#39;s Pie
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fish and Chips
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fish and Chips

ZUgYp3d_pAIpLEetpR8mtw.text: Our dinner was more than we expected,  the beef wellington was perfect. The plate looked like it came out of a magazine, the beef was a perfect medium rare and the potatoes were so creamy.  The vegetable were cooked too perfection. The crust surrounding the beef was flaky and not too dry. The lobster mac and cheese came out perfect also, the lobster was not over cooked and the portion of lobster in the dish was perfect. They say you get what you pay for, well with this meal we absolutely got what we paid for. A excellent meal with a perfect price. The waiter Adam was very friendly and did not hover over us, he gave us plenty of time too figure out what we wanted. He answered all our questions and definitely knew what he was talking about. He took the time to make us feel at home and enjoy a wonderful meal. Yes I would recommend that if you are in Vegas stop and see Adam, and hope you feel welcomed as much as he made us feel.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Part of the Valentine Day Special. Look at the hearts on the  bottom,  a very nice addition!!!!
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster Mac and Cheese
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. This is the Beef Wellington

FyHUAbCU6Qn_v_Gd24HvRg.text: Afro was a great server! The poutine was great and cheesy. Cool place to get a bite to eat. There are pictures of Gordon Ramsay everywhere.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States

G4kss5mc2qja90K2O8taXQ.text: It's my first experience at Gordon's place. The food was ok. The truffle fries were good. Nothing over the top to write about.  The two waitresses were very nice . It took a while to get our check. I think we had one in training. :) I can't say I can share anything special about this place. I've read the reviews and I will try again when I'm in the area.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Truffle fries to die for!!!
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States

TJmWL06K0OEHTH3l8IL9vA.text: Having short rib nachos. Hope the cheese is melting. Delayed our entrees fish and chips ( $15 each for fish; hmm what kind of fish were they?) and fries were rather cold. plus pistachio chicken with zucchini bread, it was rather just warmed but the puny thin slice of chicken was too thin for me. It came with kettle chips; I'd pass on this $20 sandwich. They use the chicken on other dishes. Not of value. And the thought of zucchini bread sounded spectacular but it could have tasted better. Having mock tails cause it's happy hours pineapples express and baby here comes the sun!!! Would I come back ???

swMAoxXccz1tL7DLQuvTBQ.text: My husband and I came here for dinner on 5/14. We were seated immediately. We started out with an appetizer, the lobster and shrimp rolls. Delicious! Not overloaded with mayo but just enough where the rolls weren't dry. Good amount of shrimp and lobster. The bread was so warm and soft. It was a tease, my husband and I wanted more but you only get two. For our entrees, I ordered the braised beef pot pie. The meat was so tender and the pie was creamy with veggies and mushroom flavor galore! I love mushrooms! My husband ordered the lamb Shepard pie. It had mashed potatoes on top. The pie itself was creamy and filled with ground lamb and veggies. My husband devoured it and enjoyed it. I normally don't like lamb but I had a little bite and it tasted great! Don't let the size fool you. Small but you will get full and possibly a food coma.  For dessert we had the toffee pudding ( if you check in on yelp, it's free) it was the most delicious dessert I have ever had! My husband and I were very impressed with this restaurant and had a great experience! We will have to try Gordon Ramsay's other restaurants when we return to Las Vegas :)

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The delicious lobster &amp; shrimp rolls!

a17c7KeIIrYKpqw-ZMl5oA.text: I was so excited to try this restaurant in Las Vegas since I'm a big Gordon Ramsay fan. I even reserved a table about two weeks prior to going to Vegas to ensure we had seating since it always looks so busy. I show up about 5 minutes before and they tell us to stand by on the side and wait to be seated. OK we waited a little over 30 minutes to be seated. I understand it's busy but why have reservations if they don't even reserve the table for us.  As we sat down, I thought the decor was nice and the outfits the waiters had on looked pretty awesome. Our waiter's name was Michael. We looked over the menu and asked for recommendations on our main dishes. For starters, we had the French onion soup and I wasn't a bit impressed with it. I took Michael's recommendation and ordered the Braised Shortrib. I didn't like it either, I thought that it would be better. Even the beef burger that we had wasn't as good as the one at Planet Hollywood BURGR Restaurant. Out if all the Gordon Ramsay restaurants his one was the biggest disappointment and I wont be back.

p4RsyUYb8RZ6zNbXuZlYvw.text: Disappointed in the fish n chips after watching him brag on Master Chef for so long.   - Damn!!

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States

xMUnaAEivSJU6oJKzG49Hg.text: Walking around Caesar's Palace and stumbled onto the menu, Shepard's Pie, hubby says we're in! Dinner was amazing! Portions were perfect! Food amazing! I had the salmon ate every bit so yummy! Scott our server did a great job just enough interruption and interaction and very helpful!

1dnxtrvqYcijUwiiT9rwmw.text: Got the chicken, kale, and bacon pie and it was simply DELICIOUS. At first bite the pie was simple in flavor. But after a few seconds of enjoying it, the abundance of flavors exploded and honestly, I don't think I've ever tasted anything with so much variety. Totally recommend  atmosphere at this place is great too! And QUICK service despite it being so busy!

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States

xMXfyzIOIX7ahvY8XRy1lQ.text: My family and I went here at lunch time before our flight home to Canada and after reading some mixed reviews decided to give it a go and am very glad we did. It's a really nice setting inside Caesars, our waitress Michelle was great and couldn't be more helpful. The food was first class and easily the nicest we had in Vegas. Will be back.

1v78s3r3a_lEGqnP3NDs1A.text: So far so good. Just starting to eat. Service was great, food came out fast. To fast if you ask me but....... it wasn't as hot as we care for. But it wasn't bad. The best part of eating here besides the service was the dessert! Well done

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States

dMtJBCfxBxryAxsCHxZWHA.text: Stopped by on a whim, but i am so glad i did!  Went to the bar and had great service by Ronnie!  He gave us great customer service and was incredibly funny. We had the calamari and onion soup. IT WAS INCREDIBLE! I also recommend the UK flight.

Ebk6jN5CHmYQXxh-1tHjVw.text: Wow what an amazing meal and experience.  Definitely worth the time.  They make a mean dirty martini here and all of the meals were amazing.  The short ribs were incredible and sooooo tender.  Give the wings a try also.  They won't disappoint.  Great experience.

snlqjLCltzP7FRWL_5fUvA.text: Popped in for a quick bite during the happy hours ordered the pretzel and wings. Was not impressed with either one. The pretzel was 3 long thick pieces and tasted old. The wings had a sweet and spicy sauce I didn't like. Dined here before for dinner and I remember I didn't like the burgers. Not sure how this place stays busy enough to stay open because most of the people I talked to during the convention I was there for were not impressed either. They all suggested going to Bobby Flays MESA instead but didn't get a chance to.

ziy4MFTEzV6lS5O2NoNr2w.text: Really great for lunch or dinner!!  Love the British menu, table set up, and silverware!  And, of course, the food! Loved:  Lobster Mac and cheese, pot pie, Hell's Kitchen Burger, and trifle dessert Liked: Beer choices Hated:  No longer do they serve the pretzel bread basket as in so many Yelp photos!  Boo!  Our waiter said they stopped doing it, but it's available for purchase at happy hour. The lobster mac  and cheese is a side, but it was perfect as a meal for me.  I do love my comfort food!!  My husband tried both the Hell's Kitchen Burger and beef pot pie on separate meals.  He said both were excellent. The best part was the dessert...to die for!!!  A must!

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Upclose menu
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Menu
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Trifle dessert...amazing!!

MU11_OiZSrjXy3rL6tdhbg.text: I'm a huge Gordon Ramsay fan, so I was really looking forward to visiting Gordon Ramsay Pub and Grill!  We showed up about an hour before they closed, so it wasn't too busy.  The service was generally very good, though it took a little while to get the check.  I ordered the pesto chicken sandwich, which was amazing!  The chicken was cooked perfectly, and the zucchini bread balanced the pesto and roasted red peppers beautifully.  The kettle chips were only okay, and were a little hard for my taste.  I also ordered a side of swiss chard, which was wonderfully rich!  The Goodbye Blue Sky drink was excellent as well.  My husband got the classic fish and chips and absolutely loved the cook and flavor!  We never knew the "mushy peas" could be so good :)  I would highly recommend!

4xxgL8rMdEd4Ybb4kV6N7Q.text: 3 stars, huh.  Could a Ramsay place be only 3 stars?  The Yelp rating says so, are the people right?    $30 for Fish & Chips?  Ridiculous, right?  After all, it's nearly 2x what I've ever paid even though it was super beautiful white fish; 2 smallish pieces with a generous amount of fries, and a very little ramekin filled with fresh peas (and a bit of mint).  The flavor of everything was great even though I didn't have one bite with both fish & coating -- it broke when cutting it.  (3.0 stars due to price)  $18 for Sandwich?   It was terrific, though.  Chicken pesto with roasted peppers, arugula, tomato, caramelized onions.  Cold chicken, but the toasted bread was so good, it made up for it.  British?  (4.5 stars)  $11 dessert?  Sticky Toffee Pudding (available at all Ramsay eateries) is to die for.  Served with sweet cream ice cream and warm caramel poured over before your very eyes.  Mmmmm.  (4.5 stars)  Service was slow to begin with, but when Daisy finally made it over, she was all over my dining partner and I.  Very responsive, fun, and efficient.  (4.5 stars)  It's a really excellent pub, with drafts (Boddington's, $11) but expensive/costly/pricey.  Beautifully constructed, painted (like a pool table), and many different rooms offering a little different feel depending on your desire.  But, it's really expensive.  For that, I came and conquered but may not return.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Happy Hour (good to know!)
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sticky Toffee Pudding
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken Pesto Sandwich

i3qFVQijYfsHGE1kHGXd-w.text: What a terrible experience. We came here 2 years ago and had good food and a great experience. This time around was way different. They have added a bunch of tables and used old conference room chairs that looked like they were pulled out of a storage room. We waited for ever for service and food. I would not recommend this place. There are way too many good places to eat in Vegas to have such a bad reastraunt. Maybe Gordon has spread himself to thin and cannot control the quality.

u85ckr7s-i5LQTWefMyGzg.text: Gordon Ramsay's Pub and Grill never dissapionts. Always our first stop when we come to Vegas. Yet to try something on the menu that I don't like, and my waiter Adam could not have been nicer, or more knowledgeable about everything on the menu. We will be back!

VqL5TV14JHrTTW1peXzFGQ.text: It starts up front. The hostesses were friendly and all smiles. Our waiter , Alexander, was prompt and professional. We ordered the shepherd's pie and airline chicken and we were pleased with the quickness it came out as well as the flavor.  We needed to get in and out to catch The Who concert and everything was perfect.  My second visit and I'll be going back

aMoY09S8SjF60-76eNXHsA.text: The fish and chips are to die for! Definitely was not disappointed. The customer service we received was exceptional as well. Our server was very friendly and the manager Ben was very helpful as well. Can't wait to come back on our next visit to Vegas!

Z8JBpggV-7QVaAmyMPQBLQ.text: Went here for lunch with my boyfriend, since we had other obligations during our stay we couldn't visit a restaurant for dinner so we decided on a Gordon Ramsay restaurant. My boyfriend he is a huge fan of Hell's Kitchen so I picked this place since it was open for lunch. The decor was really fun and it had a British punk vibe. Our server was incredible sweet and nice.  Main lobster roll appetizer - two mini Lobster rolls, kinda felt like what sliders are to hamburgers. Very delicious and buttery.  Fish and chips with mashed peas - my boyfriend loves fish and chips so he ordered this classic. He isn't a huge fan of tartar sauce but really liked the kind served here, it was so fluffy like butter! The mashed peas were a surprise hit for him, since stateside they do not serve mashed peas. they really paired well with the giant pieces of fish.  Rib eye steak - it was good, but a little oversalted for me. I thought about sending it back but it was still decent and I was lazy and didn't want to bother. I was also hungry. The bearnaise sauce was good but too rich to go along. I wish I got a different sauce. It was served simply with asparagus. Not sure if I would pay $45 for it. Eh, I probably should have sent it back.  Sticky toffee pudding - my first time trying this! It was sickly sweet but delicious. The caramel topping had a deep flavor that added to the decadence of the cake. It reminds me of a very moist cake. You can taste the dates in it, but it's well blended, no chunks of dates it's just a well soaked cake. If you have a sweet tooth I wouldn't skip it. Sugar load in the best way!  All in all we had a good experience, I would round to 3.5 stars but rounded down due to my indifference about the steak. Should have been perfectly seasoned for $45,

zLk26YGsJHPuJbKkov_Urg.text: My friend and I visited Ramsey's on a Friday afternoon.  We were walking around Caesar's Palace and started getting hungry and our closest choices were this or the food court.  After glancing at the menu by the front, we decided this was a better option.  It wasn't very busy and we were greeted promptly at the host stand but we opted to sit at the bar.  Our bartender, Matt, was outstanding. He might be the best bartender I've ever had in my entire life!!  He was knowledgeable about the drinks, the menu, and made the best bloody Mary. He was also very friendly and offered a lot of great advice on what to do in the area that would be off the beaten path for the average tourist.    I ordered a chicken pesto sandwich which came with a side of chips.  It was nothing outstanding.  The sandwich actually kept falling apart and I ended up having to eat it with a fork and knife.  It was....edible. Being as Gordon Ramsey has his name on this restaurant, I expected a lot more from the food here.  With all the restaurant options in this area, I doubt I will be returning during my next trip to Vegas.  It's not a bad place but, not worth returning to.

ZPKlrjGxcNjewdb_OC7R9g.text: We were served wings that were severely undercooked. When we pointed this out to the server, he sent the manager over and we showed her the pink chicken wings, she paused and asked if we didn't like them as a response. I explained to her why undercooked chicken is dangerous, especially given I was pregnant. She stated that she could make more. Given the manager doesn't even find an immediate problem with undercooked chicken, I'd rather not eat anything here. I declined the offer to remake and simply asked for our check. Of course I was charged for said undercooked wings. Overall a shitty experience with horrible management.

cyoAyoEae0SqaJxfG-GFLg.text: When we got there, we were seated right away even though we didn't have reservations. The server was friendly and there are lots of choices on the menu.   The server suggested the deviled eggs, so I decided to try some. I've had amazing eggs at other places where they really jazz it up. These were literally just eggs you could make at home with bacon bits sprinkled on top.   We just ate a few hours earlier so I wasn't really feeling a full meal. Thank god because my friend got the short ribs which were bland and lacked any type of appeal. My other friend got the fish and chips which was a big portion and tasted way better in comparison to our dishes. I got the Caesar salad. Let me start by saying I LOVE dressing and am often told I use too much, but there was so much it was so unbearable I had to ask for extra croutons just to finish half of it. The salad was drenched in dressing and wasn't even edible.   We've been to other Gordon Ramsay places and I had my apprehensions reading all the reviews, but with all the other great places to eat on the strip...DO NOT eat here. Save your stomach space and money for something better.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Caesar salad was drenched in dressing and hard to finish
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Deviled eggs. Exactly like you&#39;d make at home with bacon bits on top

MO14E-PAKi-ISHRqpUMftQ.text: The service here is so friendly and upbeat!  My son had the Reuben sandwich and I had the fish n chips.  It was outstanding.  My son finished it off with a toffee desert and can't stop talking about it!  We had a great time.

N1bOXqi3wjz7_hJEOL3vtg.text: I have to be honest this review is painful to write. I've been to many Gordon Ramsay restaurants and watch nearly all of his shows. I've enjoyed all of the restaurants I've been to that are run by Gordon Ramsay. I actually even enjoy this restaurant. I've been to this location three times now and the first two times deserve 5 to even 6 stars if I could. The most recent trip two weeks ago sadly did not live up to my expectations at all. I believe nearly all 7 members of my party did not really enjoy their meal. The appetizer I ordered was fine. The English sausage pigs in a blanket were fine. Then the entrees came and two members of my party including my wife ordered the lamb burger and somehow both came out different. One was a little soggy because of the goat cheese and onions combining and the other was very dry. I ordered the cornbeef brisket sandwich and it was disappointing as well. It had way too much sauerkraut but the cornbeef was very good. The chips that came with the sandwich were absolutely disappointing. I've never had a strange combination of chips. It seemed like a quarter of the chips were fine and the other three quarters were greasy and strange. The chips didn't have crunch and they were more like incredibly wet and soggy with grease. You could tell which chips were bad because they wouldn't snap when you bend them...they actually wouldn't break because they were so soggy. I have to admit I was very disappointed for multiple reasons. The food didn't live up to my previous experiences, we ate there also for a special occasion because it was my cousins birthday, and finally it was based on my suggestion that we eat there. I remember eating a delicious beef cheek sandwich there before and I understand the menu changes based on the season but I can't really suggest going back especially during the winter season again.

xWNJUdlnIx0zfGHBJ3fxeA.text: Unfortunately, my high expectations were not met. I ordered a simple Caesar salad with chicken and it was nasty.  The chicken felt like it was a week old and tasted like dried cardboard - seriously, I couldn't even eat a quarter of it because it was so hard.  The croutons added nothing but the texture of crunch. They had zero flavor.  The lettuce was wilted. The cheese was just giant shaved pieces of Parmesan that, somehow, tasted flavorless.   Overall, very disappointed. Obviously Ramsay doesn't do the cooking, but I would expect something with his name on it to adhere to his high standards. I hope you fly into Vegas and whip this place back into shape, Gordon. I do like the concept and decor otherwise.

wezvVDTnCtgcl_Dl_8gSiw.text: Stopped by here when we noticed they were having Happy Hour. The nice thing is they honor happy hour pricing through out the restaurant, and not just at the bar. We ordered the half order of wings, mini burger, short rib nachos, and the sticky toffee pudding.  $30 for a happy hour meal was pretty awesome. The food was super tasty. I think my favorite was the short rib nachos, because they were made using kettle chips cooked from in house. The sticky toffee pudding was a nice ending touch. I'm obsessed with this dessert now. I'd definitely come back for happy hour next time we are in Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States

xUk0DCwMOLE0UeOV2xRGzw.text: This was a last minute visit because we were undecided on where to eat. Surprisingly we were seated within 5 minutes of putting our name in. The place was packed as were other restaurants inside of Caesars. The menu was interesting and had Gordon Ramsey all over it. Menus like this drive me crazy because there is so much I wanted to try. But due to my indulgence in adult beverages prior to coming here,  I wasn't that hungry...what a shocker,  I know.  I opted for the Sliders and a side of fries. The food came out faster than I thought. It presented very well atop a wooden plank. The sliders were cooked as ordered,  but the fries were a tad cold and soft. I didn't want to send the fries back cuz you know what happens when you do that... Our waiter was awesome and very attentive. My glass was always full. Other than the fries and a pricy menu,  I'd probably give them another shot.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sliders with fries.

TKB6WNEMttmLo6chNhiMIQ.text: Came here with my hubby for lunch on a Wednesday. Seemed pretty packed which was a good sign!  Had some beers to start off with and ordered the Lobster Mini Rolls and Calamari. Both were good but not great. The Calamari had a lot of teeny tiny pieces of fried coating and we were digging to get out the rings and tentacles. It ended up being very heavy and we could barely get through 1/3 of it before getting full. The Lobster Rolls were delicious BUT the bread was too hard and there was too much bread in proportion to the lobster salad so that was a disappointment.  With all the food in Vegas I don't think we'd come back here.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Calamari
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mini Lobster Rolls

MDGnKUG2XMaW2OFT-zxNig.text: I just had to go back one more time! Took my husband this time and it was just fabulous! We had Alise as our server who was so knowledgeable, attentive and funny! Appetizer was lobster and shrimp rolls and they were delicious. My husband had the prime rib special which he loved and I had the chicken curry with rice, mint yogurt and Nan! Off the hook delicious!!!! Ended with the sticky toffee pudding that was absolutely the grand finale! Dont mias going!!!

t14hzcX0k5YNBKpyBQBm5Q.text: My family and I went here for happy hour. We ordered drinks and food, our drinks never came. 15 minutes went by and we still had no drinks. The place was not crowded at all. We reminded the waiter about our drink order. The bartender was EXTREMELY rude to us laughing at us under his breathe.
