I have never experienced something quite like this. With such rude service, we cancelled our drink order. The bartender out did himself by being even more rude to my family! Very disrespectful.   When we asked to speak with the manager it took him over 5-10 minutes to come speak with us. He had an inadequate response.   We ordered simple appetizers, truffle fries and nachos. The fries were not acceptable in any way to serve. There was an excessive amount of oil on the fries (a puddle) even the manager didn't think it was edible.   This is the worst restaurant in ceasers palace. They dont even deserve the one star that I am giving them. The only thing I can do at this point is to steer others away from this restaurant!!  Horrible experience. DO NOT COME HERE. I WILL NOT BE BACK.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States

QceMepIOjGK_lr-7STlh2g.text: Don't even bother coming here unless you're willing to spend $100+ on a party of 4.  I'd give it 3 1/2 stars but I can't so 3 will do..  We got seated right away and I ordered fish n chips for $29 and the fries were nothing special but the fish was perfectly cooked. The calamari was ehh, there wasn't a lot of bread crumbs; it was like eating plain squid but I have no problem with that. The toffee sticky pudding was unbelievably gooooooood. Thanks to our waitress for the recommendation! :-)

pNkE9qnvUJUHoqQsnMQHLw.text: Yummy! I've now been here several times. The staff is so accommodating and are very concerned with making sure you receive the experience you are paying for. Then the food comes, oh my it is amazing! I've tried about half the menu and there isn't anything I wouldn't recommend. The appetizers are great my favorite include: wings, pretzel sticks, truffle fries, lobster rolls!! The entrees I loved were the burgers, fish and chips, and their version of the Ruben sandwich with minty peas! And this last trip we decided to get the bread pudding.... I still have dreams about it..... This is seriously a must have! I haven't had an alcoholic drinks but all of the people I've gone with had the specialty drinks and have raved about how great they are.

sC5yJLwl3jxiLEuv3l9IsA.text: We did a pop in, as we were doing some shopping around the city today. It was after lunch on a Saturday, around 2pm- waited about 2 minutes for a 2 seater. The decor is comfy, and the place was rather busy. Our server( I wish I caught her name.. ) was adorable and super friendly. We waited no time for some water and gave a a chance to see the menu. I wanted something light, as we were planning on gelato at the forum shops. I decided on the wedge salad- I can honestly say, with out taking a piss, it was clearly the best salad I have every eaten. I's scouring the internet as we speak looking for his vinaigrette recipe. My husband had the banger's and mash, and since he is straight out of London, he knows what is a hit and what is a miss. Definite hit. We added a couple pints and I have to say, it was a terrific meal. We had no wait on the food and I think if we had, so what~ Perfect place to people watch. Very Chill ! Go, relax, and don't rush! Enjoy your experience.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The wedge salad- no really, amazing.
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. couple pints down the pub..

3rshXwMmnwoc_cNkLbu7tg.text: Last night - Friday night at about 5.45PM - Chicken Wings and Butternut soup at Gordon Ramsay's restaurant. Not my best by a long shot - The wings although very tasty and cooked through could have spent a tad longer being cooked as the meat was still firm on the bone. I had butternut soup that was tasty but baby food fine - I do prefer a bit of texture. We decided that we had 2 strikes and went to Bobby Flay's Mesa Grill for a great steak.

XNgZFWT_qpqoHgxziIO0Gw.text: First, we walked in and were seated fairly quickly. Our Waitress never came to our table so the waitress working the tables next to ours took our order. It still took at least 10 minutes to even be noticed.  We ordered two orders of the sliders. One we ordered well done. The food took forever to come and when it did they didn't know whose was whose. The food was mediocre to say the lease. I would not go back Ramsey should take a tip from Wolfgang because as a foodie I've never eaten a bad meal at any of Wolfgang's restaurant!

xaE267fxTn_UHyyFIl-Hrg.text: I got the Chicken Curry - It tasted like Hormel canned chili. Not impressed. The menu stated the curry was made with yogurt, though it has a tomato base. It was served with quarter sliced pita bread; curry is usually served with naan flat bread.  Saw three couples sit down and walk out while I dined. Guessing the price was a shock.   This is just another famously named restaurant with average food, overly priced that tourists end up paying for  #touristtrap

8_n9bREpEMRlA4YsiDv_Cw.text: ATTENTION: This restaurant is a Caesars Palace property. It is NOT owned by Gordon Ramsay. Do not expect better quality than you would from the food court or handful of other Caesar owned food spots within Caesars Palace. Gordon Ramsay's influence ended at accepting a check to put his name above the door.   My friend and I didn't believe the restaurant  could be as bad as the reviews claimed. It was worse.  The fish and chips were revolting. I said to my friend, at least the bad reviews usually say the mushy peas are good. FALSE. I managed 2-3 bites of each, as did my friend, before sending it back. The waitress acted like she was doing me a favor by comping it, which was also contingent upon her taking the plates right then. Pretty insulting.  The staff was incompetent and rude. They wandered around clueless of what they should be doing. They would form large packs then break apart and begin wandering again, only to reform the pack in another area.  The sound from the sub woofer which was conveniently located 5 FEET behind my friends chair was an added bonus. We asked that it be turned down. The manager had the waitress tell us "No". For the record my friend and I are guys, we were there to eat, drink and watch the games. When I say the sound was to loud, I'm saying we had to lean in and almost yell to converse.   To add insult to injury my St. Bernadus 12 was served with a plastic cup.  This was par for my overall experience with Caesars. Pathetic.

D7V50NXJMDIocvDxIJ1bdw.text: Came in here last night I've heard great things about this place before but man did they not do a justice! The fish and chips are to die for! The service was really good from beginning to end! If you're a sweet tooth like myself get the sticky toffee for dessert it is one of the best things I've ever tasted!! Can't wait to be back would definitely recommend 10/10

OVEcDVHqPEYCBt8z9lhb-Q.text: I had the pleasure of having lunch at Gordon Ramsay the Pub & Grill. The food was amazing. I ordered the fish and chips.  The cook on the fish was perfect and the chips were also perfect. I don't eat fried foods because most places don't use fresh oil or over cook the food. Not the case here. The flavors of the all the food from fish to the tarter sauce was amazing. The staff is awesome. I did have the pleasure of talking with Louie Maione the GM commending him on the food and service. What a great representative for the resturant. I highly recommend this place. Enjoy

L_Io5HA_f-8jFptzYptk2w.text: Food was not good, we tried the white bait- fried and bland. Mussels and clams were bad, the broth taste like chorizo fluid- no flavor at all. This restaurant is busy b/c it's own my a celebrity chef not for the food.

iyesIvsJPM6H_IyJaZFXRw.text: After reading all of the up and down reviews about this place, I didn't care. I wanted to come here and see for myself. I love pub fare and after being a late fan to his show on tv, it seemed like a natural place to check out. My husband and I arrived on a Friday evening around 7 with no reservations. Hostess said around 30 min but if we found seats at bar to help ourselves and let her know. We did! That's where we are happiest anyway. Keith and Jose and a whole host of others took EXTREMELY good care of us. We ordered several different items from the menu including the scotch egg, fried oysters, and then the pork and duck rillettes. Omg. Everything was incredibly fresh, tasty and delicious in our book. The bartenders knew about different beers I asked about and advised accordingly. (I'm an IPA kind of girl).   They even changed the closest tv to something we requested with no issues.   I've read countless reviews about the service here and food and while I can't account for table service, our bar service was spot on. I would happily come back and keep trying more items on the menu. I know everyone has different experiences but ours was awesome. I hope that if you are reading this review that you take the adventure and go. It was great for us...at the bar...on a Friday night. Thanks to all at GR's P&G!

9Leqq4LHtOkIOcLFJHVzlQ.text: The Yelp review on this place had me feeling worried, but my husband and I were craving beer, and Gordon Ramsay's Pub has a huge selection.  We were pleasantly surprised by the great food here.  As soon as I saw poutine on the menu, I knew I need look no further.  Theirs is served with duck confit, brown gravy, just a little cheese, all on top of thin-cut fries.  It was rich and salty but also fabulous.  I would have licked the bowl if no one else was around.  My husband and daughter ordered different versions of their burger, and both loved them.  We also got a side of Brussels Sprouts.  These were very smoky and a bit overcooked, but otherwise okay.  They have this funny gimmick where your server hands you an iPad so you can view the drink menu.  There are buttons you can tap to place a drink order, only they don't actually work.  Turns out, the order isn't really placed via the iPad; you still have to order your drinks from your server.  Seems like a waste of time and technology to me.  I feel bad for the staff here.  The uniforms are pretty awful.  The men wear outfits that are sort of 1850s-bartender-meets-punk-rocker.  The hostesses wear tight tank dresses in a tacky newsprint pattern.  Still, it's more about the food than anything else, and the food here was very good.  I'd come back for that poutine again for sure.

GQSsXBM4apg1kTyEBAfuxA.text: Our family went today and I was very excited about it! Boy was I wrong! We all ordered burgers, they were awful! So dry. It took more than 25 minutes to get our food. The waitress we had was horrible at her job. We paid over $100 for 4 burgers and 4 drinks (non-alcoholic), not worth it. With Chef Ramseys reputation I figured it would be the best burger ever. Will not recommend to family and friends. "Feeling very disappointed!"

qmuwqybK39P1r7rg0AjVMA.text: Highly recommended for a great place to eat!  We had lunch here and the shrimp and lobster appetizer, white bean hummus, and salmon toast were all unbelievable.   Main courses equally as delicious with tasty desserts and amazing drinks as well.  Service was impeccable and our server Kerry was a delight as she gave us great recommendations of food to try.

3p_no-qkZIXHLRBYFIpQiw.text: I had lunch here yesterday.   While this Date cake/ caramel dessert was very good!!! My burger was just okay.... I have had better hamburgers and was a little disappointed.  It tasted more like a chuck burger and was not that good.  The warm pretzel bread appetizer was good.  THe french fries were better than the hamburger............ I thought this place was known for their burgers so that is why I got one, I ate half of it and didn't really like it that much.  This place is OKAY but not phenomenal.  Wait staff was attentive but sloppy.  After the pretzel appetizer they took both our knives and forks and then brought the entree and no utensils?? Had to wait about ten minutes till he came back to ask him to bring us utensils.

2e_MQZZ8uRDN3G7LF1ugsA.text: It was Friday at 3:45PM. They had a sign out all day about happy hour between 2-5 (Monday - Friday). We told the hostess we were there for happy hour and she sat us. Our server comes and as we are ready to order, she tells us there is no happy hour "because of the holiday" It was July 3rd. We left.

_q3AoxN3TGfXAnABDdf5WQ.text: So going into a restaurant with Gordon Ramswey's name on it, I wonder what he would do if this was a place on his famed Kitchen Nightmares.   First off, let me say the food was good. the only problem I had with the food is that it's very overpriced. I should've gotten a much better meal for what I was shelling out. And the decor and service left something to be desired. I asked for my drink to be served with my meal, and my meal arrived ten minutes before my drink, and I couldn't catch anyone to help me out, to the point where I didn't bother asking for salt, because I didn't want to go through the hassle of trying to grab someone to bring me something that should've been on my table in the first place.  Which brings me to the table: I was seated in an oversized barstool, a ridiculous piece of furniture for even a pub/restaurant, making me wonder if Ramsey really did have anything whatsoever to do with setting up this restaurant.  If you're in Caesar's, don't bother with this place. Go to the Cheescake Factory instead. Better service and much more reasonably priced. And there's already salt on the table!  Ramsey, put this restaurant on your list for you own show!

j5ad1GU8DjJlv0FX7YqaNg.text: In April 2015 my fiance and I celebrated his birthday in Las Vegas. We had a wonderful dinner at Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill.  It was so delicious we returned in 2016.  I had to have the beer - braised short ribs again because they were so delicious.   I wasn't disappointed the first time and the second time was even better.   My fiance had the lamb chops  last year and  this time he enjoyed a juicy steak that was cooked just right.  Both of us also had the awesome lobster mac 'n' cheese and of course the sticky toffee pudding for dessert.   The food was super delicious, but what really keeps us going back is the service.  Manager Randy G. totally rocks when it comes to hospitality.  We had the pleasure of meeting him during our first visit and he actually remembered us when we returned a year later.  In addition, Daisy and Lisa took great care of us making sure we had everything we needed to enjoy our meal.    Thank you Randy, Daisy and Lisa... we'll see you the next time we're in Vegas.

V9WcfT2CGHmRfdHxsNY6UA.text: My friend and I had an excellent experience here. We came for a pit stop before hitting the strip on a Saturday night. There was a long wait for table, but we were able to walk right up to the bar and sit.  I have to say, this was the way to go. The bartenders were our favorite company for the night! Antwone was hands down our favorite. Ladies, I am telling you, if you want a great view for the night, go no further. Antwone is the best view in Vegas. We ordered the chicken chop salad and scotch egg to split and I thought the food was amazing.  The people at the bar were social and fun. The whole vibe was great. But like I said above, the bartenders were really our selling point for this place. I would go back to Ceasars just to visit this Pub again.....

G57cBhBSSlNEIAM_3wdkVg.text: This was my first trip to GRPG and will also be the last.  Service:  Most of the staff walk around clueless and huddle up together for chat time.  Their tone, demeanor, and body language reflected on how much they really didn't liked working there.  There seemed to be no management or supervision at all.  I really don't want disgruntled employees handling my food.  Lots of good people looking for jobs out there...  Food:  I ordered the fish and chips (20+$$$)  2 bites is all it took to realize that this tasted like long john silvers's fast food garbage.  It had no seasoning but it didn't lack the oil it was swamped in...very foul!!  The "chips" were thick rectangular potato wedges that tasted fine but nothing special.  Our waitress didn't seem to care and was not surprised at all, Hmmmm...makes ya wonder.  She seemed to care more about taking the plates away immediately as though my friend and I came there to scam them out of lunch. My friend ordered a rare and expensive beer that was supposed to be served in a special glass, but that didn't happen.  I wonder if they serve wine in shot glasses...after this experience it would not phase me one bit.  This place is a tourist trap using Gordon Ramsay's name and prices but clearly not his standards/quality.  The staff's "costumes" are hideous (maybe that's why they seem so disgruntled).  The noise level of this place is equal to a club, hope ya like to lean in and shout to one another!

Tgk11dah1VVY_VsPTu0vPQ.text: Excellent Hells Kitchen burger. Well priced for Vegas. Pub is well lit and has a great atmosphere. Service was excellent.

JKxzJOz5oIuEIhYHEfcJcw.text: The best British food I've had with tons of flavour and exciting dishes. Seriously the pate board was to die for, along with the spilt pea soup.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Omg seriously the best tasty British food I&#39;ve ever had. &amp;that&#39;s from a Brit. Check out the pate the one to left is unbelievable

UI_EHI0MLUQVZNze6XyH3Q.text: Hands down the best cesar salad ive had in my life.  Heres the plan.  Go to vegas.  Party.  Then the next day in your downtime hour when everyone is trying to nap or veg or whatever you do, go down to Ramsays.  Order yourself a pint.  Order the cesars. Relax and have your mind blown.  The ribeye for 2 was pretty good too.  I dont lie.

SX04d_NGMrjlJ7XOTHwwPQ.text: Chris and kelsey are the business...if you go there and dont get either of them...or the brazillian/mexican beauty...your not doin it right...spend all your money and get white gurl wasted

32_ywXkOK_ioPwr3GfRqEw.text: I am not really supposed to review this, since I've only been here for a Yelp Elite Event, but VEGANS NEED TO KNOW: despite the reputation of British food, they will make accommodations for you here!  One of the servers told me that they actually even have a "Vegan plate of the day"..... probably not on menu, but ask!!!   I had several super tasty cocktails, AMAZING service from KIMBERLY (ask for her, she will treat you RIGHT!), and a very tasty veg plate with crispy fried fingerling potatoes, roasted onions, Brussels sprouts, turnips and a mushy peas.  SO GOOD.  Topped with sprigs of fried thyme.  I loved it.  They also have a great raspberry sorbet for dessert.

uZL3Uo9v5XacPUhq-3CMDg.text: Stopped in for a quick drink with friends and we all ordered the same thing - the goodbye blue sky. It was a really delicious cocktail and I could of had at least 2 more!

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Goodbye Blue Sky

b6YzzQlIvtGO1pBSyzB9-w.text: Let's start with the good, since it won't take me long to cover that part.   The decor is definitely attractive and will peak your curiosity. Looks like a trendy new spot to stop by and hang out by the bar, or give a go at authentic British cuisine.   And we're done with the good. Now let's go into why I felt like I wasted a perfect meal-time (i hate it when that happens...) at Gordon Ramsay's new restaurant.  I literally ate like a rabbit all day just to save my stomach for Gordon Ramsay's. I mean, it's GORDON RAMSAY. The chef who is so angry and critical all the time, that I feel like his restaurant HAS to be good. I was so hungry that any mediocre dish (even fast food) could probably satisfy me, but Gordon Ramsay's Pub & Grill wasn't even close. For someone who markets himself as being a perfectionist in the kitchen, it certainly does not seem he has met his own standards.   I started with the Fried Oysters appetizer. The dish was presented with three oyster shells with two tiny fried bits in each. I literally felt like I was just eating batter. Wasn't much flavoring to it and wasn't anything special.   I followed it with the fish and chips. It wasn't terrible, but I feel like I could've probably found the same level of satisfaction at Long John Silver's. I would honestly rather make a stop at Long John's than pay $26 for that plate again. My date ordered the Braised Pork Belly ($30) and looked like it would be promising, but again, it was rather bland. You can definitely find a much better prepared pork belly elsewhere.   The most exciting part was probably the pretzels as the form of complimentary bread. It was offered with butter and a type of cheese-mustard. I've heard good things about the pudding dessert and that's probably the only thing that would ever weigh my consideration on returning.  My bill ended up being $100, 1 appetizer, 2 main course dishes, and 1 glass of Hennesey. Sadly, I would've been much happier spending that $100 at the Bacchanal Buffet.

zDrd3H0nyRR76dFv6yHNkw.text: Just finished my meal here and I have to say it was pretty good. I ordered mashed potatoes and ended up getting French fries but the fries were so good I'm actually glad it happened. I ordered the beef burger and it was what you'd expect a burger to be. A little too pink for my liking in the middle so I just didn't eat the inside. Over all I would come back to this restaurant or others like it.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Don&#39;t mind the juice on the bottom of my plate. I ate a pepper and then the water went everywhere haha.

ykmllbMqUP3geSz_y27K2g.text: Wow!  I visited last week and was absolutely bowled over!  I wish I could afford to go here more often.  We started with delicious drinks--the Ramsay Tonic was the best gin and tonic I've ever had. How can a gin and tonic be better than another?! Next we had the calamari starter. Perfectly fried and seasoned, and the calamari were fresh and delicious. Coming from Boston, our seafood standards are high.  I had the fish and chips which were fantastic, My fiance had a ribeye steak which was cooked perfectly, and my niece had a steak and vegetable pie. The steak was reportedly not as good as home, but delicious. The steak and vegetable pie was reported to be tasty and flavorful. But oh my gosh, the sticky toffee pudding was a foodgasm!!!    I don't know how others could have had a bad experience here in the same time frame I visited. We ended up going back the next day for cocktails and more calamari, and would have dined there, but couldn't afford it.   The bartender confirmed that Chef Ramsay visits often and inspects to ensure the restaurant is up to his standards. It was fantastic!

JcSPuPrmkgziqhutrUcGdQ.text: I have to note that I never review Vegas restaurants, the quality of food is "suppose" to be good.   I loved our experience here.  We went for lunch, the drinks came out quick  the food was delicious and the service was on point. If you go get dessert!

-tfJ8jmHBjdvgciTi7rOHA.text: I don't really know what's up with the 2 and 3 star reviews on here. I don't know if things changed from that last Yelp Elite event or something, cuz that was all 5 star reviews. What I DO know is that I couldn't be happier with the meal i just had!  There are really clever design elements everywhere you look, from the hand-painted Keg wall to the 70s British punk uniforms for the staff, the distressed effect menus on wood boards, and the hand-hammered silverware that makes you want to buy a castle and tall-back velvet dining chairs just to put that silverware in it. So from an aesthetic standpoint, it does not disappoint at ALL.  The first thing that jumped out at me were the handmade soft pretzels appetizer. I just had to have that. SO good. They're amazing and come on a tray with a spicy, horse-radishy melted cheese and pub mustard. We also shared an order of the craziest (and most delicious) deviled eggs I've ever had. Four egg white halves seasoned with a warm, sparkly vinaigrette, and a bowl of the yolk seasoned with mustard, bacon and herbs.   I ordered Shepherd's pie, because it's one of Gordon's signature dishes, and because I have YET to have a decent Shepherd's pie in this country, though I keep trying. This was the best I've had anywhere. The stew was so rich and flavorful, and the mashed potatoes were perfect, with just the right amount of brown on the peaks. I really wanted Sticky Toffee pudding, but I am STILL way too full. Next time. There will most DEFINITELY be a next time.

1JZnj8QHHl2wEWza-0YWkg.text: Food was excellent, service was fast, and waiter was great! My husband and I walked into this restaurant after landing into Las Vegas. We were seated promptly. I thought we would have to wait a while for our food because the restaurant was packed, but the food came out right away! Big+ because I was tired and hungry. I ordered the Hell's Kitchen burger, which was spicy and awesome. I ordered it well done bc I'm pregnant and I can't have it medium-well like I normally order burgers and steaks (my dr said no pink!). I was a bit worried because every time I have attempted to order something well done it comes back charred, which I absolutely hate. However, this burger was cooked to perfection! It is a bit on the expensive side (we paid $60+ for two burgers and two beverages). I expected it because of Gordon Ramsay's name being attached. It did not disappoint! Will revisit next time we are in Vegas!

2PhYYKaEbqlCRrj4Ej_8dQ.text: WOW!  Amazing and attentive service. Very cool and chill atmosphere. Our server gave us a free drink because (although we didn't ask) her recommended app was not mafist-friendly (people who don't eat mammals... its a real thing, look it up!). My friend's beef main was incredible, I really enjoyed the fish and chips, this was a dining highlight in Las Vegas which should not be missed!

Q068IFLFTcNc_kZrMXFZjg.text: We split a lamb burger and a Caesar salad. Black Butte porter and a red beer went down easy. Nicole steered us towards a delicious, light, and satisfying meal for two.

gaSQ8NM5d-0oHBdJQxOjdg.text: Awesome bartenders, awesome beer selection. The food is very good but a bit pricey. Try the shrimp salad or the sliders.

q3hwfh767OkBBSc3a6o_rw.text: I might go 3 but since this has Gordon's name on it ill make it 2. Frisee salad was underseasoned and bland. Mussels and clams showed up with a bunch of unopened ones. Service was a tad slow. Second time I've been underwhelmed by a ramsay restaurant. Pizza Antica in lafayette ca has better salad and mussels.   Definitely not Hell's Kitchen craziness worthy.

Sowy7RgMexpBDF6Sui2a9g.text: Gordan Ramsey needs to make a visit and yell at someone!! read on to see why!  A local recommended this place as they had the best fish in chips in town, so my husband being a big fan of fish and chips, we thought hey why not?   Well, once we got seated, I looked around that people had pretzal breads at their tables, and I thought, looks good and cant wait to try.   Once we ordered our drinks, and food, there was no mention of bread coming or anything. So I looked at the menu, and did not see it on the menu to order it. We thought, it must come later.  So after about 15 min, we got our drinks, and no bread. Another 15 min, no bread. by this time, we are like WTF? Our waitress did not even come by!! UGH. I am hungry and mad  So 10 more min, she came by and we asked about the bread, and she said, " you have to order it". well by this time, our dinner was coming, and we said no.  Our food finally came. I ordered the Salmon, and I had asked if it was salty, and she said no. well first bite: SALTY!! UGH! Oh and it said it came with garlic chips, so I was expecting FRIES! as the rest of the menu had CHIPS (which are fries). Well you know what they were? SMALL ASS 4 pieces of garlic american chips. So small I didnt even see them!!!   the fish and chips were OKAY, notthing special. I have had much better in Seattle and in dana Point, CA.   So overall:  1. SERVICE: SUCKS! ( water NEVER got refilled) 2. FOOD is WAY TO Overprices for what you get (I can get much better food for the same price in Vegas) 3. FOOD IS OKAY, nothing WOW.  I will never come back here again, and I do not recommend it at all. horrible horrible. Dont waste you time. Vegas is about fun and good food, well this is not one of them.   Gordan Ramsey, sorry  this place is not so good.

JO35i0TzYNSH_v0FeQlhXw.text: The service and the food were beyond my expectations!!!!! I had chicken Caesar salad with anchovies, absolutely amazing, my hubby had fish n chips that were very good!!! Very very happy customer!

eSgcrlMOC6wic94BZ8cf5w.text: So disappointed! I came here expecting good pub food, and good service, after all that's what Mr Ramsay demands of others.   We had a party of 10, and called at 8pm on a Thursday night, they couldn't fit us in until 9.45pm. OK so they're busy - a good sign I thought. We arrived at the appointed time, and there were about 20 people lined up for tables. Our table was ready so we went straight in.  Service was terrible! We struggled to get the attention of a waiter to order drinks, and food. Drinks were slow to come to the table (maybe within 30 mins of sitting down), and the food took over an hour and 15mins to arrive! They got some of the orders wrong too. The place was not full, almost empty by the time we got our food.  Within 5 minutes of our food arriving (by then 11.10pm) they turned the lights down, and down, all the way to almost complete darkness. We were eating in the dark! The waiters were using their iPhones flashlight just to see where they were going. We asked a passing waiter to turn the lights back on, he said he would have to ask his manager - eventually they turned them up a bit.  The food was hit and miss. Fish and Chips - great fish, light fluffy batter, but disappointing chips - giant slabs of potato that were not crunchy or flavorful. It came with "house made tomato sauce" which tasted *exactly* like Heinz Ketchup.  My friends weren't raving about their food either, some was good, some average.  If Gordon was there he would've slammed this place shut until they got their act together.

ecZOQX4XxIXvIdCSc_eQKg.text: I wish I could write a Awesome review but the experience was Terrible. 1/2/13 We had 6:15pm reservations, arrived early and seated at 6:09, from that point it was all down hill off a cliff!  At 6:18 I had to ask one of the 5 waiters/waitresses that had walked by without even looking at us, I had to ask if one of them could help us, and/or who was the server at our table.  We found out that 'Jennifer' was over our table and never did show up and at 6:25pm when 'Kimberly' was assigned to us she comes over apologizes to us, turns to the table beside us to take their order who was just seated, the couple points out that we had been waiting forever and the waitress Kimberly says to her 'it"s ok, I will get them in a minute!'  My wife bless her heart is not one to make a scene stands up with me and I tell the waitress we are leaving for good. Out the door we went, we will not be back, period.  I am a Hugh Gordon Ramsay fan, books, cookware, knives, we have been to dinner at Gordon Ramsay Steak in Vegas, which was excellent. Just for the Gordonites in the crowd.  We left went over to Bobby Flays 'Mesa Grill', was seated in less than 2 minutes, waitress acknowledgement and glass of water on the table in less than 1 minute! Hugh difference, not even close!  Amazing Food and Amazing Service from Mesa Grill!! Saved our evening.  I realize that no may care of even read this review but, it was extremely upsetting to see such a bad performance by the staff of a World Class Chef who I highly admire. The menu is extremely pricy for a pub so save your dollars up and forget the pennies it is not enough!

ozt_pRo1okB_fDL7l-CLSQ.text: I have wanted to visit a Ramsey restaurant for a while now, as  a big fan of all of Gordon Ramsey's shows. The meal and service did not disappoint, I had the battered fish and chips, where the best I have ever had, great cocktails, very friendly staff, very clean restaurants, a great experience and a mist do in Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States

2d2kLmunFDDuCPVWO0JGzQ.text: This is one of those place that you had to try at least once in your lifetime...  Riding on the coat tails of Ramsay's popularity, I came here for dinner one night with my mother.  After a day of high-rolling gambling (nickel slots), I was interested in trying this place out.  We were not in the mood for burgers (that's why we passed on Ramsay's Burgr) and didn't feel like taking out a loan to dine at Ramsay's Steak at the Paris casino.  So being the penny-pincher that I am, I opted for Pub & Grille since a) it was somewhat affordable, b) it was close-by (walking distance from where we were staying), and c) had food items on the menu that we were interested in trying.  Since it was on a weekday, the hostess said that reservations were not necessary but it would be a good idea.  So I made a reservation for 7:00 p.m. and continued with my high-rolling ways until then.  We got there a few minutes before 7:00 p.m. and was a bit surprised that the place was nearly empty.  There were a few patrons sitting in the front for drinks but not many for food.  The dining area was pretty nice; it was fairly dim but not too dark that we couldn't read the menu.  The entire restaurant was spotless and well decorated.  There was this huge poster of Ramsay on the wall just staring at the patrons, which was intimidating yet sort of funny.  Since my mother and I are relatively small eaters, we shared the fish n' chips and a side of braised vegetables.  The fish n' chips were nearly $30 so it better be good!  And it was!  I was probably one of the best fish n' chips I ever had.  The fish was perfectly cooked and flaky and the batter was not heavy/oily at all.  The fish was not overwhelmed by the batter.  The braised vegetables was perfectly cooked; it wasn't mushy and the flavor of each individual vegetable was preserved.  There was a light covering of butter but not too much; it complemented the dish perfectly.  Our server was very nice and attentive; checked on us every so often to make sure our meal was pleasant.  Overall my experience at Pub & Grille was positive.  Both my mother and I agreed that the quality of food was outstanding (agreement between us is very rare!).    Great place to eat if you're tired of buffets!

DhwhdTcK0DbgjaiowqnIZw.text: There was a large group of us and we were given our own private room with our own server. The server went over and beyond to make sure we were happy with everything and recommeneded a few dishes for us to try. We had just landed in Vegas after a long flight and we were pleasantly surprised at how quick the service was. The food I would consider to be pub food, but it was great and just what we needed being so jet lagged.   Will definitely come back the next time I'm in Vegas.

cm8YPIYTmhqQpdG9J8DX8Q.text: Came here with the boyfriend just to try something different. Was pretty busy! Decor was fun and definitely made me want to travel to England haha.  Food-Nothing amazing but the truffle fries were yummy! Sometimes restaurants serve it with too much truffle and what not and makes me sick lol. I would definitely go back and try another dish... I don't remember what I got but it was ok.  Decor-loved! We had a huge booth too and a lot of room.   Service- Amazing! Everyone here had recommendations (even though I didn't try any of it haha) and always made sure we had everything we needed.  Very friendly and fun staff working here.   I would for sure go back and actually try something they recommend... I'll definitely give the food another chance!

LgRwRBgnJTrQHLpu-tADSg.text: Second time here overall, and first time here for dinner.   I was less than impressed. I ordered the Spots (sliders) and the meat was not seasoned at all. It tasted like plain hamburger meat and the oily grease dripped down my hand as I took a bite. Furthermore, there was no sauce on the spot and cheese was no where to be found which made it very dry. :(  The truffle chips were good. It was served with ketchup and a truffle aioli sauce. Now the aioli, I could spread on almost anything and enjoy it. At the same time, condiments shouldn't taste better than the food itself.  Finally, we tried the sticky toffee pudding for dessert. A small container of caramel came on the side so we poured that over the bread-like substance. This dessert has to have been the best part of my dining experience here. Although it could do without the brittle that was placed in the ice cream. The brittle was not sweet and just tasted like nuts. I felt it didn't really belong in this dessert.  The rest of it though was so delicious!!!   This Pub & Grill is an over priced Celebrity restaurant. I don't feel the quality is up to par with other restaurants in Las Vegas that are cheaper. Sorry, not sorry Ramsay.

zgtXBaPznRhkYfaZC6nXEg.text: I am a huge fan of GR food shows and feel, if Pub & Grill were on Kitchen Nightmares, there would be some needed changes.   Perhaps he is just collecting the check and isn't as close to how the restaurant is being run?  While it wasn't a nightmare dining experience, it was disappointing because I know the hell GR puts other restaurants through.  Misses:  French soup was not a soup but an onion stew.  Way overdone on the onions and the bread was burnt on the edges.  Shepherd's Pie had greasy gravy instead of a well-developed flavorful, thick gravy.    The service was fast on delivering the food and drinks but slow on clearing plates, not getting the right entree in front of the right person (that has to be an expected from GR!?) and checking back in, not bringing malt vinegar automatically for fish & chips nor a lime for a vodka and tonic.  Hits:  Atmosphere was fun, if a little loud.  Mini Burger Sliders were small but tasty.  Mashed potatoes on top of the shepherd's pie - so smooth and well executed.  Fish for the fish and chips.  Pretty close to the real thing!  Fairly varied drink/beer list.  Expect the typical LV jacked up prices.  It would have almost been worth it if all had been executed in True GR fashion.

SY6hGcYYgdQvt732uq86Sw.text: We loved it here! Excellent service, amazing tasting food! The decor was modern and very cool. Tables a little close together but that is come to be expected in Vegas. I got the mixed green salad with elegant vegetables and heirloom tomatoes and it was great, very delicious! The white balsamic vinaigrette dressing on it was so good!! We also both got the steak and ale pie (beer braised beef with root vegetables and an amazing flaky perfectly crisp pie crust), and it was FANTASTIC! I can't wait to go back! Finally, at the end of our meal, I like how the manager asked if we enjoyed our food and made everyone feel well-attended. I expect a lot from a restaurant owned by Gordon Ramsay, and this lived up to the hype! Delicious & cool.

il6IvcLezGHuqJRh9ErbPg.text: What I ordered was 5. Which was chicken pistachio sandwich, but the other ones my friends ordered were all okay or average. The burger was too plain and the lobster biscuits were sorta dry.

akW8XqhSWquHNTK4J2-xNg.text: Stopped here after supper to grab some desserts. Awesome place and our waitress, Heather, made it an even better experience!

9ClknrdNKEH73MFeuW0F1Q.text: I had a great experience here during my first night in Vegas. My friend and I shared the pretzels to start and then I got the chopped salad without ham. Everything I ate was delicious! The pretzels and dips were to die for and the salad was perfectly balanced in flavor and felt like a relatively healthy option compared to some of the other things on the menu. My friend really enjoyed her pesto chicken sandwich and fries as well.  The portions were huge so I felt like you weren't ripped off by any stretch considering it was a meal on the strip. Our server was AWESOME too, I wish I had gotten his name. Super friendly and on point, even gave me a refill of my soda in a to go cup which I thought was such a nice touch.  I only knocked one star off because the entrees took SO long to come out considering the place was less than half full....if they figured that out I think the restaurant would definitely deserve a 5* review.

5_vr845OdvXffYBzmZfezA.text: We ate at Ramsey hub Monday night before the concert our service was excellent Daisy was our server very knowledgeable and very attentive I highly suggest this restaurant ,the fish and chips were amazing also the manager Randy Took the time to go to every table to greet guests and to see if they were enjoying their meal top class

2QAKvCf_US33atPUc8DslQ.text: Great lamb burgers. Service was pretty quick despite how busy it was on a holiday week end. I would recommend if you're looking for a good old fashion burger in sin city

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lamb burger and fries

DrF6DRGBGry_Oy4C4EMhdw.text: Overpaid dramatically for a glorified Applebee's meal. I hate giving money to people who don't deserve it. Not good for the money. Not my thing. No sir I would not like another.

s-kNBHyU0Mx4xnDV9TX2Aw.text: 3.5/5 on the speed and quality of the server. He saw two young adults sitting down and thought "oh they won't tip me anything since we're in happy hour." He rather hang out with the older couple with kids, fine better for us. We had the mini corn dogs, wings, and chips with pulled pork. Cocktails were really well made and savory. Would definitely come again. Make sure to go during happy hour otherwise it could rack up !

EmWRwjHRWMZieAnEy4HuJQ.text: My visit to GRPG exceeded any and all expectations I had. Randall keeps a tight ship out there. This is most definitely one of my new stops when I come to Las Vegas!  The calamari were super fresh. I had the burger and my best half had the pastrami, I think. That could have used a little more meat. Don't get me wrong, It was a great tasting sandwich. It wouldn't be a proper visit without a dose of the Sticky toffee pudding. We had a great time. Thank you to Randall and his staff for exceeding my expectations.

qTH26moGbSmbJbQpbR-W5Q.text: I had the pleasure of falling into a food coma after dining in this restaurant. Our waitress was more than helpful and led me in the right direction every step of the way. I got the lamb burger which was delicious and plentiful. We also ordered a side of their infamous wings which definitely hit the spot. Large hearty portions are what you are sure to find. You will definitely not leave hungry. Their bar is stocked and the drinks are made with great professionalism. With all that being said, there are a limited amount of chairs with backs. There are mostly large square cusioned stools which are cool unless you have back issues which will surely leave u uncomfortable and aching during and by the end of your meal. All and all this restaurant will definitely see me again sooner than later.

Z4aE0R63HQiG81E_-105ow.text: I love/hate this place. Been here several times, but the one thing I hate, the one thing I hate bothers me.  EVERY. TIME.  Things I love: The service. Very pleasant service, with a longer memory than my own.  The food.  Classic pub fare. Prepared good.  I like it.  One of the best Scotch egg I've had. Everything else is good.  Not great. Atmosphere.  It's what I think of when I think "pub"  Thing I hate: The beer menu.  A pint isn't 20 oz.  Don't call it a fucking pint if it's not a fucking pint.  Assholes.

yuc82j4Xz3QK7-o3uLkjIQ.text: I was disappointed with my first visit to a Gordon Ramsay restaurant. I should have known better when walking by there was a few customers for lunch. The service was ok, I mean there wasn't a lot of people so it should be expected.   As for the food, I had the lamb burger as the server mentioned it was one of their top sellers. I had it cooked medium rare but should have chosen medium. The patty had a mushy texture that did not appeal to me. The combination of the feta and goat cheese was probably my least favorite of that burger. I only ate a quarter of my burger and couldn't even muster my appetite to eat it all. The only thing positive here is the truffle fries and the sauces that come with it.

1UACQhQykxGLXQ_fu_rY1g.text: Went here last week a few weeks after it officially opened. Saw them doing practice dinners earlier in the week.  Overall, the place wasn't bad, but it wasn't wowing. I actually came here twice. Once for a business dinner, which was good food and great service. We had reservations and were promptly seated. The waiters had interesting uniforms, especially the very well supporting women's dresses. We ended up having 5 instead of 4 halfway through our meal and were very pleased with the flexibility of the staff considering the stature of the restaurant and their relatively business and newness. Props to them for being extremely considerate.  The food was good, for being British. Admittedly, my opinion of British food has never been good or bad. Just mediocre. Gordon Ramsay's name on it makes me have naturally higher expectations. As expected, the menu is relatively small, but very selective.  Since I had higher expectations, I can tell you that the food was good, but I wouldn't say it was amazing. I enjoyed eating here and so did all of the other people that came with me. We had a full course of appetizers, followed by entrees, and desserts.  So, I managed to get a full compliment of what the restaurant had to offer. After this visit, I went back with a few buddies after gambling at Caesar's and we just wanted to get drinks at the bar but they were 'too busy' to seat us so we actually stood at the bar waiting for somewhere to sit. We even had a waitress try to get one of the hostesses to seat us in one of the obviously empty tables, but they refused saying that they were booked. Needless to say, this part of my experience was a bit offsetting. In addition to that, we bartenders were a bit hissy when it came to asking to close the tab, which we found a bit odd. They seemed less than concerned to help us pay them.  Overall, I would say my experience was pretty good and that I would come back, just not for the bar. Only for food/drinks if I have a reservation. Oh, and I loved the Corgi chair that I had been sitting in. I'll post a picture later.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The decor at Gordon Ramsay Pub &amp; Grill. Honestly? I think it&#39;s awesome.

fLBpx0HtRiWG3riBhtnZsw.text: It might sound strange to say it but service was so fast all I could picture was them just scooping food out of precooked trays. The food was okay, nothing to write home about.  It's an overpriced bar and grill with a famous chefs name on it.  It was better than dealing with the crowd at Margaritaville and right across from the concert arena where we were going to see a show.  I wouldn't recommend it but wouldn't advise to stay away.  It was just OK.

TAsUZWR596E6tJR1x8QdKQ.text: Tried it today. Even though it was Christmas day we didn't have to wait.  Ordered the nachos was ok Burger i expected to have a juicy burger. It was dry nothing special about it . I liked the garlic sauce which comes with it.  We ordered the pigs in blanket the worst pigs  Didnt try the other restaurants on the strip and wont think about trying them after this experience. The waitress was nice .

cFFVPy1y9d0FL3EvUYhn8Q.text: Ramsay my boy! You've done it again! Phenomenal! Kerry was on top of everything. I would haven gladly spent over $200 on lunch for two with this level of service and cuisine. I'll be back.

RytoMbQfNweeLnsOXs7owQ.text: The whole experience was beyond amazing.  The service was superb and the food was delicious.   We were immediately welcomed and seated at our table.  Our server Alex, appeared very quickly with a great welcoming attitude.  He was funny and attentive.   Following our order, our drinks came quickly.  Our water glasses were never empty, and this was without us every having to ask.   During the short period while waiting for our food, the  manager, Randy (Randall Goldich) came by and made us very welcome.  He too was very attentive and nice.  Throughout our meal, he continuously came to check up on us and ensure we were having a good time and that there were no problems with anything.   He truly made the meal and experience much more enjoyable. I've been to many many restaurants and have never met a more congenial, friendly, and attentive manager.    As for the food, it was delicious! The scotch egg was paired with an amazing sauce. The lobster Mac and cheese was nice and rich.  The chicken pesto pistaccio sandwich was a great blend of flavor.  The steak and ale pie was super flavorful.  The sticky toffee pudding was extremely good. The pudding was my favorite and highly recommended; especially if you like sweets!  Overall, highly recommended.  We would definitely return for the food and great service. Thanks again Randy for an amazing experience.

3_udl37W6GKlM8lDGqDFzw.text: I visited Gordon Ramsays Pub and Grill for the second time on  a recent trip to Vegas. I must say my experience was amazing. We were greeted by Randi  who seated my husband and myself  at  what was  an intimate booth which surprised us, as the restaurant was extremely  packed. As soon as we sat down I noticed Randi replacing our utensils with another set of clean utensils. He caught me looking at him when he did this and responded to me by saying "Sorry, those weren't shiny enough  ...Talk about someone being on top of their game.  Randi then introduced us to our waiter/server, Taylor. We chitchatted for a few seconds on how our day was and then proceeded to ask him his recommendations. We started with the lobster rolls. I personally LOVE LOVE LOVE lobster, but I have reservations in regards to ordering it in cities that are far from the ocean, however the meat on these rolls were absolutely delicious. One order between my husband and I definitely was not enough.  For our main course I got the Fish and Chips and while my husband ordered the BANGERS & MASH for himself. My meal was extremely tasty. The fish was extremely tender and did not have that oily after taste many other Fish and Chips meals come with. My assume husband enjoyed his meal as well as he did not even offer me a bite of his dinner.  We definitely stuffed our faces during dinner and as embarrassing as this sounds, we did also end up ordering dessert, which was definitely unnecessary but extremely worth it. Their pudding cake is to die for. It is a must when visiting this restaurant. All in all I can honestly say I had a really great experience dining here. The service was way above average. Randi and Taylor are absolute gems and made our experience wonderful.  Taylor made sure our glasses were never empty, our food was hot when it arrived  and continuously asked us if we needed anything else throughout our dining experience.  We are planning another trip with our entire family in the next few weeks to Vegas and we cannot wait to bring everyone back here to experience the awesome food.  5 STARS !!!!!!!

VmjhY71In8izDZiSW3HESw.text: Review delayed by several months so rather than misremember I'll be minimalistic.    We loved the welsh rarebit that came before the meal.  Our waiter (Mike or Michael, IIRC) was excellent.  The food overall was a solid 4.  The drinks were great as well but incredibly expensive; the bottled beer the waiter recommended to my husband was $25!  He said it was good but not THAT good.  I had asked for a cocktail that was sweet but didn't taste too strong; and that's what he got for me (it was $17).  It hit me pretty hard even though it didn't taste strong.  I can't actually remember what my entree was (edited to add:  I think it was scallops?), though I remember dessert was some sort of parfait, and I remember that my husband and I both agreed on the 4 star rating overall.

i5K3Pkt29LXCJD8R9z0eRQ.text: It's sad to see anyone not have a great experience, as we did here on our most recent visit. We had reservations and were seated immediately. There was a line to check in. Thankfully, our table was ready.  I love the modern old pub feel with images of London all around. Gosh, we ordered enough to share and seriously, everything was so good! I had he'd the pork chops with a chunky apple sauce- chops were cooked perfectly. Fish and chips we're not oily and had just the right crunch-the fries are just the way I like them crunchy in the outside and soft on the inside. Braised pork belly- oh yeah a winner. I can't even deep scribe the taste really just that I was so happy eating it. We also had the home made pretzels with the mustard dipping sauce. Great with beer! We shared the toffee pudding and I had to stop myself from finishing it had to share win other, plus I was so stuffed that I didn't want to roll out of there!  The service was excellent and entertaining. I think the waiter knew what he was getting himself into when he first met our party. This was such a great time you can only go in and experience it yourself.  Definitely visiting again on my next trip to Vegas. Love the pups painting at the bar!!!

59w4Sg--0T01yxRHOKystw.text: I am a huge Gordon Ramsay fan! I watch all of his shows. It was cool to walk into his pub and grill. The restaurant is really cool! It was neat to see how every table was different. When I sat down in my chair I felt like I was eating the food from my lap. I'm a tall person and it's hard sitting in a large chair that's at a small table. I really enjoyed the chicken I got and mostly just ate the inside of the sandwich. If you love chips let me tell you there will be plenty to go around!   The service was good!! Yes plenty of TVs to watch the sports.  I am not sure if I would eat at this restaurant again!!

wAF-EnCehBuQeZS0NIbvrQ.text: Had a great time with my parents at the bar!!! We absolutely loved the bartender Maddie and her adorable Irish accent!  The duck poutine and the cheddar popcorn were a great late night snack!! We will definitely be back for dinner!!

aNanZ3k1sQNFCxCb17fUyA.text: Where do I start?? In a word it was AWFUL.....we got the $25 mac & cheese appetizer, which wouldn't be enough food for my 9 year old nephew. I then asked the waiter if the bacon burger was good & his exact words were, "it's a burger". That should have been my first clue not to order this $23 overpriced meal. It was over cooked & small. In N Out Burger would have been MUCH  better at $4 for a double cheeseburger! I HIGHLY recommend avoiding this horrible restaurant.

xhqGBFRcUefS757ohITyOw.text: The fiancee and I checked out Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill on two consecutive evenings, which allowed us to thoroughly explore its cocktail menu as well as sample some food. Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill resides in the space formerly occupied Bradley Ogden, one of the early pioneers of chef-driven restaurants in Las Vegas.  Given what came before in the space, GRP&G and its gastropub cuisine had a tough act to follow.  While GRP&G may tout itself as an English pub, from a design perspective, it looked like anything but.  No matter, since I wasn't there to dissect the interior design.    On the first night, I had the Pub Crawl ($15) made with Knob Creek Bourbon, Domaine de Canton ginger liqueur, fresh lemon, mint & black tea syrup.  Perfectly balanced, nicely sweet, but not overdone, it was a big winner!  On the second night, I left it in the hands of the talented bartenders to craft me something with whiskey, boozy and bitter.  I don't know what they made me, but it was a taste success.  We also had the Duck Confit Poutine ($13/12 for Total Rewards members), which may have seemed out of place at an English pub, but I found it tasty if a bit untraditional. The fries were hot and crispy reminiscent of McDonald's fries in a very good way.  They were topped with a relatively generous amount of nicely tender and moist duck.  Thoughtfully, a flavorful and thankfully not overly salty duck gravy was served on the side allowing you to sauce the dish yourself (and likely preserve the crispiness of the fries).  What seemed to be missing from the dish were the expected cheese curds.  Perhaps they don't use it in their recipe since it wasn't listed on the menu or maybe they didn't add very much and it was simply lost in the dish.  Nevertheless, cheese curds would've added a nice color, textural, and flavor contrast to the poutine.  Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill was an unexpected good time.  However, it was the friendliness, professionalism, and skill of the bartenders in crafting our drinks on both nights that really made it memorable.  If Gene, either of the Adams, and/or Raul are behind the bar, you'll be in very good hands with regards to craft cocktails, great customer service and witty banter.  As for the food, it was good, but not on par with the drinks.  Hopefully, with the newly anointed Hell's Kitchen winner in kitchen, the food will come together more completely and coherently with the rest of the restaurant.  Regardless, GRP&G will be at the top of the list for drinks (definitely) and another go at the food the next time we're in town.

naH1GFyIBzHZcrM5ozdWNg.text: Great service,Great Delishious food! Hostess Jennifer was so sweet and helpful! Will be back for sure!

E1XXZGnniYNjLEloyecV4Q.text: Gordon Ramsey is a nice place to grab dinner with your coworkers and friends. On game nights it gets a little loud with the all the excitement!  The food portions were perfect, and well presented

0Yby5wccc4PvfHpV4dZiRg.text: My girlfriend and I were there a few weeks ago. The server seemed mad that she had to serve us. The portions of food were small and pricey.   There are so many choices in Las Vegas, I would say we will not be going back.  His steak house at The Paris is pretty good. Give that a try.

kIG0DBVJDrsjAKweS764Zg.text: Exactly what we expected from a Gordon Ramsay restaurant, basically perfection.  We had reservations before the Rod Stewart show, and were originally seated at a pub style table with stools.  However, when we asked to be moved to a "real" table with chairs, they were accommodating and moved us without any issues.  Our waiter, and all the servers, were fantastic.  We never had to wait for refills and the food was served promptly.  We started with a calamari appetizer, and it was as good as calamari gets.  We had recently watched an episode of Kitchen Disasters where Ramsay was brutal on the chef that made greasy calamari, but this plate was perfect.  I followed that with the classic - fish and chips - and it was also as good as it gets.  My wife had the chicken Caesar salad, and was not disappointed.   The only negative was the noise level from the casino, but that's expected.  We would not hesitate to eat at the Pub again.

zCNtCWykrd2mKFJ6x79OqA.text: Not bad. The price is on the high side so if I expect to eat a 24.00 burger, there should not be cores in the tomatoes. Who wants to eat tomatoes with the cores in it? Come on Gordon!  Other than that everything else was good.

npI6uzBBE1CC6pAvTdxUXA.text: OMG!!! Were we surprised!!! We stopped in for a quick bite. The service was OUTSTANDING!!! Be sure to be seated with Sarah. I don't know how she does it but she memorized all her patrons names at every table she was serving. Sarah was so complimentary of the restaurant and even commented that one of the dishes our daughter ordered was a dish that Gordan Ramsay himself eats when visiting the restaurant. (Shepard's Pie; which was awesome). Her recommended Gordan Ramsay special Good bye Blue Sky cocktail was soooo good. Her customer service outrageous! We had the Happy Hour Hell's Kitchen wings, Mini-burger and onion rings....The flavors, the tenderness the deliciousness. We have been to several restaurants while here in Las Vegas and the food has been great but nothing compares to the service and the food @ Gordan Ramsay Pub & Grill. We were also celebrating one of our daughters 30th Birthday. They delivered a birthday dessert to us at the table which was unbelievable!!! Did I mention how outstanding Sarah was??? LOL   The service does not stop there. I had to exclaim how amazing Sarah was and how she simply made this restaurant beyond good. The manager Manny Ramirez was just as extraordinary. I am sad that we don't have this restaurant in Toluca Lake, CA. (There is a restaurant for sale on the corner of Rose and Riverside in Toluca Lake, CA....Just Sayin! Oh and if you do open there can you send this staff??!!)  Thanks for the great food and great service. We left wanting more and wanting to come back again!!!!   :)

sD4jGH7QAaOLCW0XJ6fxwA.text: Fancy, clean, great service, good tasting food. The expectations for this place were high. And was I right. Everything tasted very good . Service was fast. I got the chicken wings with truffle fries with the special spicy sauce they prepare thenselves and wow was it good. A must try. Also the bacon burger was delicious.

Everything is professional. I had fish and chip, and my friend had a steak. We also ordered drinks, and it costed us like $100-ish. I dont think I will come back.

EpOHD8m6RoP5WPGxmmtYMg.text: There food was okay. I enjoyed their calamari and the dip that it came with. The service is excellent they always top off your water and when I dropped my fork by the time i picked it up they already had a new one for me. Their cutlery is really cute and had a crusader design. However its not the price you pay for the food. I could get better calamari else where for 8 dollars less. I ordered the bangers and mash and nothing set it apart from any other i had. The plastic they give you to put your leftovers though is really cute. I appreciate good plastic.

He is very knowledgeable of the menu items that was written down on the menu. This is our first time and it is not gonna be the last. Amazing food, amazing server, and amazing venue. I ordered the BLT because I heard it was the only thing on the menu that was good. to be fair it was, but not good enough to justify the price. Gordon Ramsay should yell at himself for how bad this place is.

VMnZ-utDkLDlFcQng3-MBQ.text: Happy hour 2-5, $7 beers and $7 bar snacks. That's a deal for the strip and they were good. Good presentation, the truffle fries were not so great. Poor quality truffle oil. We expected a little more from a bar branded with Ramsay's name, but his steakhouse made up for it, so no worries.

-R4cJnVWvN6hANjy-NjNJw.text: I came into the restaurant about a week ago and I was sat in the lounge area.  At first it was overwhelming, but we had an awesome server who helped us along the way.  Her name was Brianna and I was so impressed by her service that (though I don't typically write reviews unless something went wrong) I decided to write a review.  My wife and I ended up going with a burger which was one of the most delicious burgers I have had in quite sometime.  Then Brianna recommended the Sticky toffee pudding for desert...  I didn't know if I would like it, but she was SPOT ON!!!  Can't wait to go back and I hope I get Brianna as my server again!!!  AMAZING SERVICE AND AMAZING FOOD!!!

l5RrHLXZIcCEKEIin8dtmA.text: Horrible service, the waitress was rude, she didn't even tell us her name, she didn't ask if we were ready to order or ask for our drinks or appetizers. She didn't check on us and never refilled the drinks. The guy waiting the table next to us noticed we were waiting for a long time and came to ask for our order. We order steak, the steak was perfectly cooked. I had medium and my boyfriend medium well.  I had a terrible experience in this hotel, everyone is so rude.

G3IxXWvepocdHxyetY3XXw.text: Awesome place, it was so good! I order the beef tenderloin steak it was perfect and they give us free dessert for my mom's birthday and it was the most amazing dessert, our waitress was excellent, good service and food overall!

eXZSkfvsZWxQeoCw9cbeOQ.text: We had dinner around 5 and we're able to catch the last of happy hour drinks. They were out of a couple tap beers but the food was excellent. The food did take awhile to come out but the woodburned chicken salad with shrimp was definitely work it. The avocado dressing was the shizzle. My boyfriend had the club and he wouldve liked it more if the toast was cooked a little less. It was so toasted that it was cutting the roof of his mouth.

pY9eaqi0SM5LFffb_ix_Cw.text: Good as far as pub food goes and very knowledgeable barkeeps.  You might be waiting a while for a table, but I can see why.

xdgeafdGhPwOCj_4bCeE3w.text: Seriously overpriced. I had the veal chop which was good, but Capitol Grille charges less. My dinner partner had the Shepard's pie which had a muttony taste. I didn't care for it.  Our waiter was a bit of a retard. First he forgot to bring a Pepsi which we needed to fix the horrendous Long Island iced tea we made the mistake of ordering. Then he told us the fountain drinks were completely out.   He spent more time gossiping in the back of the store, and not enough time watching the levels.  Really can't recommend this place.

MuDCEsp8w5vxmhDF4BCM6Q.text: Great drinks and the deviled eggs are to die for. Also tried the kettle nachos and the mini corn dogs which were delicious.

vbgN5MUIr6Y1d6idW--wsg.text: Food was good, only thing is that in our party of 7 they tried to charge us an automatic 18% gratuity when this is not stated on the menu. For most places is when you have an 8 group. Awful experience, even they called security.

VubqYl2AE4m59X_jXkrPPg.text: I came back for a second try and was very pleased with everything the service was great the food was great and Hells Kitchen winner Scott came out and greater our table

XTs0VP9v7w_gZ8Es1egeww.text: Let me preface this review with this: Vegas is really just not my thing, but I was hoping that Gordon Ramsay would be a little "less Vegas" than some of the other restaurants. I was wrong. Everything was over sized, over done, etc. The British theme was overkill, the prices were overkill (completely expected), but I have to say that the service here was excellent. We had an awesome server whose name is escaping me, but he was wonderful. I didn't care too much for the food, but my friends really liked it, so maybe this just wasn't my place. I was content with the fairly extensive wine list, especially for a pub like restaurant. I probably won't be back to Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill but I probably won't be back to Vegas either.

7Dd48AO5FhAlxl1nMaB0NA.text: The good: service was excellent. Prompt, courteous, and friendly. I had the lamb burger and it was really really good.   The not so good: fries were very mediocre. My husband got the truffle fries for an up charge. They were ok but not worth the up charge. His beef burger was good but nothing special. The warm pretzel appetizer we got was cold. I also don't think this meal was a "good value." Way overpriced for what you get. I understand this is Vegas but $22 for a bacon cheeseburger is excessive to me.   I feel bad for making these criticisms because overall the dining experience was good.

-rpZQFoy79NG30e2CvjHfA.text: Hey Gordon, I found restaurant for you to fix!  Surprise you own it.  I had to send back my braised beef short ribs and risotto twice because the risotto was undercooked, somehow the risotto was worse on the second attempt.  Ended up eating nothing.  The manager never even came to the table to apologize.  My friends meals were also underwhelming.  Save your money and go to the food court next door.

IZjwCLqzrkdzfEQCH8i9tQ.text: Came here for a quick bite to eat. We shared the Cesear salad, which was good, but drenched in dressing. We also got the sliders, which were good, but a little dry.   They have  a decent beer selection, good service (even though the waitresses had some funky outfits), and a nice atmosphere. The food is average and a little on the heavy side, but not bad for a quick bite.   If you have a TR card, you get a couple bucks off.

PGMhk6hanepkLjxUZD61yw.text: Like some of the other reviewers I agree with the three stars!  My husband and I ate there the other day and absolutely loved everything we ordered!  This is a place that is fun, great atmosphere, great authentic British food, and top notched staff!  Five star for both of us!!

2fkOS6Kbk0fLyN_NG1VURw.text: 2 stars because the food (once it got there) was delicious.  Had the sliders and the beef cheek stew.    Sliders are served with a whipped aioli and were solid juicy sliders  Beef cheek stew has a decadent jus and the meat was tender as a butcher's heart.    HOWEVER!  Service was absolutely atrocious!  Our server was aloof and did next to nothing.  Obviously the busser hadn't been trained either, because as my buddy is chewing a piece of his steak, the busser comes over and asks if he was all through, while there is still meat on his plate too boot.  Nice beer list and yummy pretzel bread.  I would return and hope for a better service and make a final judgment after that.

Rfcvda4iw4YYeLu3q5zmSg.text: Chose this restaurant because Gordon Ramsey is so damn tough on his show looking for top quality tasty food, so of course I would expect a restaurant to bear his name to be awesome.  What a disappointment, hubs ordered a steak, very pricey, but very flavorless.  I ordered the tomato bisque, while it was tasty, it definitely wasn't worth over $13 for a bowl of soup. Waitress seemed uninterested in her job, only took our order, and gave us our bill.  She wasn't the one to bring our food, and never once checked on us during the meal to see how we were doing.  As my first trip here to vegas, I am going to say that all of these restaurants really are not great, but what do they care? 90% of their business is tourist! their money doesn't come from repeat business.
